original: ye triṣaptāḥ pariyanti viśvā rūpāṇi bibhrataḥ /
analyzed: ye triṣaptāḥ pariyanti viśvā rūpāṇi bibhrataḥ
translated: Those three times seven (rays) which go round, bearing all forms,

original: vācas patir balā teṣāṃ tanvo adya dadhātu me ////
analyzed: vācaḥ patiḥ balā teṣām tanvaḥ adya dadhātu me
translated: may the lord of speech, the strong one, grant me today their bodies.

original: punar ehi vacas pate devena manasā saha /
analyzed: punar ehi vacas pate devena manasā saha
translated: Come back again, O lord of speech, together with the divine mind.

original: vasoṣ pate ni ramaya mayy evāstu mayi śrutam ////
analyzed: vasoḥ pate ni ramaya mayi eva astu mayi śrutam
translated: O lord of wealth, delight in me; let fame be in me alone.

original: ihaivābhi vi tanūbhe ārtnī iva jyayā /
analyzed: iha eva abhi vi tanu ubhe ārtnī iva jyayā
translated: Here only, like two bows with a string, do thou stretch out both thy bodies.

original: vācas patir ni yachatu mayy evāstu mayi śrutam ////
analyzed: vācaḥ patiḥ ni yacchatu mayi eva astu mayi śrutam
translated: May the lord of speech place (them); let fame be in me alone.

original: upahūto vācas patir upāsmān vācaspatir hvayatām /
analyzed: upahūtaḥ vācaḥ patiḥ upa asmān vācaspatiḥ hvayatām
translated: The lord of speech is invoked; may the lord of speech invite us.

original: saṃ śrutena gamemahi mā śrutena vi rādhiṣi ////🔽vidmā śarasya pitaraṃ parjanyaṃ bhūridhāyasam /
analyzed: sam śrutena gamemahi mā śrutena vi rādhiṣi  vidma śarasya pitaram parjanyam bhūri dhāyasam
translated: May we go together with fame; do not be separated from fame.🔽We know the father of the arrow, Parjanya, the one with abundant wealth.

original: vidmo ṣv asya mātaraṃ pṛthivīṃ bhūrivarpasam ////
analyzed: vidma u su asya mātaram pṛthivīm bhūri varpasam
translated: We know his mother, the earth, with abundant power.

original: jyāke pari ṇo namāśmānaṃ tanvaṃ kṛdhi /
analyzed: jyāke pari naḥ nama aśmānam tanvam kṛdhi
translated: O Jyak, make our body pliable, like a stone.

original: vīḍur varīyo 'rātīr apa dveṣāṃsy ā kṛdhi ////
analyzed: vīḍuḥ varīyaḥ rātīḥ apa dveṣāṃsi ā kṛdhi
translated: Make the enemy's missiles more distant, and drive away hostilities.

original: vṛkṣaṃ yad gāvaḥ pariṣasvajānā anusphuraṃ śaraṃ arcanty ṛbhum /
analyzed: vṛkṣam yat gāvaḥ pariṣasvajānāḥ anusphuram śaram arcanti ṛbhum
translated: When the cows, licking, praise the arrow, the resplendent one, around the tree,

original: śarum asmad yāvaya didyum indra ////
analyzed: śarum asmat yāvaya didyum indra
translated: drive away the arrow from us, O Indra, with the thunderbolt.

original: yathā dyāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ cāntas tiṣṭhati tejanam /
analyzed: yathā dyām ca pṛthivīm ca antar tiṣṭhati tejanam
translated: Just as the heat is within you, between heaven and earth,

original: evā rogaṃ cāsrāvaṃ cāntas tiṣṭhatu muñja it ////
analyzed: eva rogam ca āsrāvam ca antar tiṣṭhatu muñjaḥ id

original: vidmā śarasya pitaraṃ parjanyaṃ śatavṛṣṇyaṃ /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram parjanyam śata vṛṣṇyam
translated: We know the father of the arrow, the rain-god of a hundred powers.

original: tenā te tanve śaṃ karaṃ pṛthivyāṃ te niṣecanaṃ bahiṣ ṭe astu bāl iti ////
analyzed: tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti

analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram mitram śata vṛṣṇyam
translated: We know the father of the arrow, Mitra of a hundred powers.

original: tenā te tanve śaṃ karaṃ pṛthivyāṃ te niṣecanaṃ bahiṣ ṭe astu bāl iti ////
analyzed: tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti
translated: By him we make your body well. Let your discharge be outside of you, not within you.

original: vidmā śarasya pitaraṃ varuṇaṃ śatavṛṣṇyaṃ /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram varuṇam śata vṛṣṇyam
translated: We know the father of the arrow, Varuna of a hundred powers.

original: tenā te tanve śaṃ karaṃ pṛthivyāṃ te niṣecanaṃ bahiṣ ṭe astu bāl iti ////
analyzed: tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti
translated: By him we make your body well. Let your discharge be outside of you, not within you.

original: vidmā śarasya pitaraṃ candraṃ śatavṛṣṇyaṃ /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram candram śata vṛṣṇyam
translated: We know the father of the arrow, the moon of a hundred powers.

original: tenā te tanve śaṃ karaṃ pṛthivyāṃ te niṣecanaṃ bahiṣ ṭe astu bāl iti ////
analyzed: tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti
translated: By him we make your body well. Let your discharge be outside of you, not within you.

original: vidmā śarasya pitaraṃ sūryaṃ śatavṛṣṇyaṃ /
analyzed: vidma śarasya pitaram sūryam śata vṛṣṇyam
translated: We know the father of the arrow, the sun of a hundred powers.

original: tenā te tanve śaṃ karaṃ pṛthivyāṃ te niṣecanaṃ bahiṣ ṭe astu bāl iti ////
analyzed: tena te tanve śam karam pṛthivyām te niṣecanam bahis te astu bāl iti
translated: By him we make your body well. Let your discharge be outside of you, not within you.

original: yad āntreṣu gavīnyor yad vastāv adhi saṃśritam /
analyzed: yat āntreṣu gavīnyoḥ yat vastau adhi saṃśritam
translated: What is in the entrails of the cow, what is attached to the caul,

original: evā te mūtraṃ mucyatāṃ bahir bāl iti sarvakam ////
analyzed: eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam
translated: Thus may your urine be released outside, O child, in every way.

original: pra te bhinadmi mehanaṃ vartraṃ veśantyā iva /
analyzed: pra te bhinadmi mehanam vartram veśantyāḥ iva
translated: I break open your penis, like one opening a door.

original: evā te mūtraṃ mucyatāṃ bahir bāl iti sarvakam ////
analyzed: eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam
translated: Thus may your urine be released outside, O child, in every way.

original: viṣitaṃ te vastibilaṃ samudrasyodadher iva /
analyzed: viṣitam te vasti bilam samudrasya udadheḥ iva
translated: Your urethra is expanded, like that of the ocean.

original: evā te mūtraṃ mucyatāṃ bahir bāl iti sarvakam ////
analyzed: eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam
translated: Thus may your urine be released outside, O child, in every way.

original: yatheṣukā parāpatad avasṛṣṭādhi dhanvanaḥ /
analyzed: yathā iṣukā parāpatat avasṛṣṭā adhi dhanvanaḥ
translated: Just as an arrow flies away when released from the bow,

original: evā te mūtraṃ mucyatāṃ bahir bāl iti sarvakam ////🔽ambayo yanty adhvabhir jāmayo adhvarīyatām /
analyzed: eva te mūtram mucyatām bahis bāl iti sarvakam  ambayaḥ yanti adhvabhiḥ jāmayaḥ adhvarīyatām
translated: thus may your urine be released outside, O child, in every way.🔽The sisters go along the paths, the cousins are the officiating priests,

original: pṛñcatīr madhunā payaḥ ////
analyzed: pṛñcatīḥ madhunā payaḥ
translated: bestowing milk mixed with honey.

original: amūr yā upa sūrye yābhir vā sūryaḥ saha /
analyzed: amūḥ yāḥ upa sūrye yābhiḥ vā sūryaḥ saha
translated: Those who are above the sun, or with whom the sun goes together,

original: tā no hinvantv adhvaram ////🔽apo devīr upa hvaye yatra gāvaḥ pibanti naḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram  apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye yatra gāvaḥ pibanti naḥ
translated: may they impel our sacrifice.🔽I invoke the divine waters, where our cows drink,

original: sindhubhyaḥ kartvaṃ haviḥ ////
analyzed: sindhubhyaḥ kartvam haviḥ
translated: the oblation to be offered to the rivers.

original: apsv antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam /🔽apām uta praśastibhir aśvā bhavatha vājino gāvo bhavatha vājinīḥ ////
analyzed: apsu antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam  apām uta praśastibhiḥ aśvāḥ bhavatha vājinaḥ gāvaḥ bhavatha vājinīḥ
translated: In the waters is immortality, in the waters is medicine.🔽By the praises of the waters, be ye horses strong, be ye cows strong.

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana /
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana
translated: Ye are the waters, bestowers of bliss; for strength do ye grant us.

original: mahe raṇāya cakṣase ////
analyzed: mahe raṇāya cakṣase
translated: To the great contest, to behold.

original: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ
translated: Of you, the most auspicious juice, do ye distribute to us here,

original: uśatīr iva mātaraḥ ////
analyzed: uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: As if eager, O mothers.

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha /
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha
translated: To him we come, to whom ye quicken for his enjoyment,

original: āpo janayathā ca naḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ
translated: Do ye generate for us, O waters.

original: īśānā vāryāṇāṃ kṣayantīś carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: īśānāḥ vāryāṇām kṣayantīḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Mistresses of valuable things, flowing to the people,

original: apo yācāmi bheṣajam ////🔽śaṃ no devīr abhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye /
analyzed: apaḥ yācāmi bheṣajam  śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye
translated: I ask the waters for a remedy.🔽May the waters be auspicious to us for sprinkling and for drinking,

original: śaṃ yor abhi sravantu naḥ ////
analyzed: śam yos abhi sravantu naḥ
translated: May they flow to us for refreshment.

original: apsu me somo abravīd antar viśvāni bheṣajā /
analyzed: apsu me somaḥ abravīt antar viśvāni bheṣajā
translated: In the waters, Soma has told me, all the remedies,

original: agniṃ ca viśvaśaṃbhuvam ////
analyzed: agnim ca viśva śaṃbhuvam
translated: And Agni, who is auspicious to all.

original: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajaṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama /
analyzed: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajam varūtham tanve mama
translated: O waters, provide a remedy, a protection for my body,

original: jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe ////🔽śaṃ na āpo dhanvanyāḥ śam u santv anūpyāḥ /
analyzed: jyok ca sūryam dṛśe  śam naḥ āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam u santu anūpyāḥ
translated: And for a long time to see the sun.🔽May the waters of the desert be auspicious to us, and may the marshy ones be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ khanitrimā āpaḥ śam u yāḥ kumbha ābhṛtāḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam u yāḥ kumbhe ābhṛtāḥ
translated: May the waters dug by the spade be auspicious to us, and may those brought in jars be auspicious to us.

original: śivā naḥ santu vārṣikīḥ ////
analyzed: śivāḥ naḥ santu vārṣikīḥ
translated: May the rainy ones be auspicious to us.

original: stuvānam agna ā vaha yātudhānaṃ kimīdinam /
analyzed: stuvānam agne ā vaha yātudhānam kimīdinam
translated: O Agni, bring the one who praises, the demon, the kīmidin.

original: tvaṃ hi deva vandito hantā dasyor babhūvitha ////
analyzed: tvam hi deva vanditaḥ hantā dasyoḥ babhūvitha
translated: For you, O god, when worshipped, have become the slayer of the Dasyu.

original: ājyasya parameṣṭhin jātavedas tanūvaśin /
analyzed: ājyasya parameṣṭhin jātavedaḥ tanū vaśin
translated: O Parameshthin, O Jātavedas, O Tanūvān, of the ghee,

original: agne taulasya prāśāna yātudhānān vi lāpaya ////
analyzed: agne taulasya prāśāna yātudhānān vi lāpaya
translated: O Agni, consume the Yātudhānas with the fire of the scales, scatter them!

original: vi lapantu yātudhānā attriṇo ye kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: vi lapantu yātudhānāḥ attriṇaḥ ye kimīdinaḥ
translated: Let the Yātudhānas, the sorcerers, the Kimīdins, be scattered.

original: athedam agne no havir indraś ca prati haryatam ////
analyzed: atha idam agne naḥ haviḥ indraḥ ca prati haryatam
translated: Then accept this offering of ours, O Agni, and may Indra rejoice in it.

original: agniḥ pūrva ā rabhatāṃ prendro nudatu bāhumān /
analyzed: agniḥ pūrvaḥ ā rabhatām pra indraḥ nudatu bāhumān
translated: Let Agni seize them first, and let Indra drive them away with his arms.

original: bravītu sarvo yātumān ayam asmīty etya ////
analyzed: bravītu sarvaḥ yātumān ayam asmi iti etya
translated: Let every Yātudhāna say, Here I am, and come forward.

original: paśyāma te vīryaṃ jātavedaḥ pra ṇo brūhi yātudhānān nṛcakṣaḥ /
analyzed: paśyāma te vīryam jātavedaḥ pra naḥ brūhi yātudhānān nṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: We see your power, O all-knowing one; proclaim the Yātudhānas to us, O man-seeing one.

original: tvayā sarve paritaptāḥ purastāt ta ā yantu prabruvāṇā upedam ////
analyzed: tvayā sarve paritaptāḥ purastāt te ā yantu prabruvāṇāḥ upa idam
translated: All of them have been scorched by you before; let them come hither, proclaiming (their guilt).

original: ā rabhasva jātavedo 'smākārthāya jajñiṣe /🔽dūto no agne bhūtvā yātudhānān vi lāpaya ////
analyzed: ā rabhasva jātavedaḥ sma akārthāya jajñiṣe  dūtaḥ naḥ agne bhūtvā yātudhānān vi lāpaya
translated: Seize them, O all-knowing one; you were born for our sake.🔽Becoming our messenger, O Agni, scatter the Yātudhānas.

original: tvam agne yātudhānān upabaddhāṃ ihā vaha /
analyzed: tvam agne yātudhānān upabaddhām iha ā vaha
translated: You, O Agni, bring hither the Yātudhānas bound in bonds.

original: athaiṣām indro vajreṇāpi śīrṣāṇi vṛścatu ////
analyzed: atha eṣām indraḥ vajreṇa api śīrṣāṇi vṛścatu
translated: Then let Indra with his thunderbolt crush their heads.

original: idaṃ havir yātudhānān nādī phenam ivā vahat /
analyzed: idam haviḥ yātudhānān nādī phenam iva ā vahat
translated: Let this offering carry away the Yātudhānas like foam.

original: ya idaṃ strī pumān akar iha sa stuvatāṃ janaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ idam strī pumān akaḥ iha sa stuvatām janaḥ
translated: He who has done this, whether woman or man, let that person here be praised.

original: ayaṃ stuvāna āgamad imaṃ sma prati haryata /
analyzed: ayam stuvānaḥ āgamat imam sma prati haryata
translated: This praiser has come; let him be received.

original: bṛhaspate vaśe labdhvāgnīṣomā vi vidhyatam ////
analyzed: bṛhaspate vaśe labdhvā agnīṣomā vi vidhyatam
translated: O Brihaspati, having obtained control over Agni and Soma, pierce them apart.

original: yātudhānasya somapa jahi prajāṃ nayasva ca /
analyzed: yātudhānasya soma pa jahi prajām nayasva ca
translated: O Soma-drinker, slay the offspring of the demon and lead them away.

original: ni stuvānasya pātaya param akṣy utāvaram ////
analyzed: ni stuvānasya pātaya param akṣi uta avaram
translated: Bring down the one who is praised, both the higher and the lower eye.

original: yatraiṣām agne janimāni vettha guhā satām attriṇāṃ jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: yatra eṣām agne janimāni vettha guhā satām attriṇām jātavedaḥ
translated: Where, O Agni, you know the births of these hidden devourers, O all-knower,

original: tāṃs tvaṃ brahmaṇā vāvṛdhāno jahy eṣāṃ śatatarham agne ////
analyzed: tān tvam brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānaḥ jahi eṣām śatatarham agne
translated: you, having grown through the Brahman, destroy them, O Agni, a hundred times over.

original: asmin vasu vasavo dhārayantv indraḥ pūṣā varuṇo mitro agniḥ /
analyzed: asmin vasu vasavaḥ dhārayantu indraḥ pūṣā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: May the Vasus place wealth in him, Indra, Pushan, Varuna, Mitra, Agni.

original: imam ādityā uta viśve ca devā uttarasmin jyotiṣi dhārayantu ////
analyzed: imam ādityāḥ uta viśve ca devāḥ uttarasmin jyotiṣi dhārayantu
translated: May the Adityas and all the gods place him in the highest light.

original: asya devāḥ pradiśi jyotir astu sūryo agnir uta vā hiraṇyam /
analyzed: asya devāḥ pradiśi jyotiḥ astu sūryaḥ agniḥ uta vā hiraṇyam
translated: May this light of his be in the eastern direction, the sun, fire, or gold.

original: sapatnā asmad adhare bhavantūttamaṃ nākam adhi rohayemam ////
analyzed: sapatnāḥ asmat adhare bhavantu uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam
translated: May our enemies be lower than us. May we ascend to the highest heaven.

original: yenendrāya samabharaḥ payāṃsy uttamena brahmaṇā jātavedaḥ /🔽tena tvam agna iha vardhayemaṃ sajātānāṃ śraiṣṭhya ā dhehy enam ////
analyzed: yena indrāya samabharaḥ payāṃsi uttamena brahmaṇā jātavedaḥ  tena tvam agne iha vardhaya imam sajātānām śraiṣṭhye ā dhehi enam
translated: By which, O all-knower, you have collected the vital essences for Indra with the highest Brahman,🔽by that, O Agni, may we here prosper him. Place him in the foremost position among his kinsmen.

original: aiṣāṃ yajñam uta varco dade 'haṃ rāyas poṣam uta cittāny agne /
analyzed: ā eṣām yajñam uta varcaḥ dade ham rāyaḥ poṣam uta cittāni agne
translated: I take away their sacrifice, their splendor, and their prosperity, O Agni, and their thoughts.

original: sapatnā asmad adhare bhavantūttamaṃ nākam adhi rohayemam ////
analyzed: sapatnāḥ asmat adhare bhavantu uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam
translated: May our enemies be lower than us, and may we ascend to the highest heaven.

original: ayaṃ devānām asuro vi rājati vaśā hi satyā varuṇasya rājñaḥ /
analyzed: ayam devānām asuraḥ vi rājati vaśā hi satyā varuṇasya rājñaḥ
translated: This Asura of the gods shines forth, for the true power of King Varuna is under control.

original: tatas pari brahmaṇā śāśadāna ugrasya manyor ud imaṃ nayāmi ////
analyzed: tatas pari brahmaṇā śāśadānaḥ ugrasya manyoḥ ud imam nayāmi
translated: From that, I lead this one up with the Brahman, from the fierce anger of the angry one.

original: namas te rajan varuṇāstu manyave viśvaṃ hy ugra nicikeṣi drugdham /
analyzed: namaḥ te rajan varuṇa astu manyave viśvam hi ugra nicikeṣi drugdham
translated: Homage to you, O king Varuna, and to your wrath, for you, O fierce one, desire to punish all the wicked.

original: sahasram anyān pra suvāmi sākaṃ śataṃ jīvāti śaradas tavāyam ////
analyzed: sahasram anyān pra suvāmi sākam śatam jīvāti śaradaḥ tava ayam
translated: I send away a thousand others together, and may this one live a hundred autumns for you.

original: yad uvakthānṛtam jihvayā vṛjinaṃ bahu /
analyzed: yat uvaktha anṛtam jihvayā vṛjinam bahu
translated: Whatever untruth you have spoken with your tongue, much deceit,

original: rājñas tvā satyadharmaṇo muñcāmi varuṇād aham ////
analyzed: rājñaḥ tvā satya dharmaṇaḥ muñcāmi varuṇāt aham
translated: I release you from King Varuna, whose law is truth.

original: muñcāmi tvā vaiśvānarād arṇavān mahatas pari /
analyzed: muñcāmi tvā vaiśvānarāt arṇavāt mahataḥ pari
translated: I release you from the great ocean of Vaisvānara.

original: sajātān ugrehā vada brahma cāpa cikīhi naḥ ////🔽vaṣaṭ te pūṣann asmint sūtāv aryamā hotā kṛṇotu vedhāḥ /
analyzed: sajātān ugra iha ā vada brahma ca apa cikīhi naḥ  vaṣaṭ te pūṣan asmin sūtau aryamā hotā kṛṇotu vedhāḥ
translated: Speak to your kinsmen, O fierce one, and do what the Brahman tells us.🔽O Pūṣan, I offer this oblation to you in this Soma sacrifice. May the wise Āryaman, the Hotṛ priest,

original: sisratāṃ nāry ṛtaprajātā vi parvāṇi jihatāṃ sūtavā u ////
analyzed: sisratām nārī ṛta prajātā vi parvāṇi jihatām sūtavai u
translated: Let the cow, who has brought forth in accordance with truth, let her joints be loosened, and let her calve, O Sūta.

original: catasro divaḥ pradiśaś catasro bhūmyā uta /
analyzed: catasraḥ divaḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ bhūmyāḥ uta
translated: There are four quarters above the sky and four on the earth,

original: devā garbhaṃ sam airayan taṃ vy ūrṇuvantu sūtave ////
analyzed: devāḥ garbham sam airayan tam vi ūrṇuvantu sūtave
translated: The gods have brought the embryo together; may they open it for delivery.

original: sūṣā vy ūrṇotu vi yoniṃ hāpayāmasi /
analyzed: sūṣā vi ūrṇotu vi yonim hāpayāmasi
translated: The womb may open; we cause the womb to fall away.

original: śrathayā sūṣaṇe tvam ava tvaṃ biṣkale sṛja ////
analyzed: śrathaya sūṣaṇe tvam ava tvam biṣkale sṛja
translated: In the womb, O womb-opener, thou art bound; thou art loosed in the womb-destroyer.

original: neva māṃse na pīvasi neva majjasv āhatam /
analyzed: na iva māṃse na pīvasi na iva majjasu āhatam
translated: Neither in the flesh, nor in the fat, nor in the marrow is it struck.

original: avaitu pṛśni śevalaṃ śune jarāyv attave 'va jarāyu padyatām ////
analyzed: avaitu pṛśni śevalam śune jarāyu attave va jarāyu padyatām
translated: Let the spotted moss know it, for the dog to eat the after-birth; let the after-birth fall away.

original: vi te bhinadmi mehanaṃ vi yoniṃ vi gavīnike /
analyzed: vi te bhinadmi mehanam vi yonim vi gavīnike
translated: I break for thee the testicles, I break the womb, I break the flanks.

original: vi mātaraṃ ca putraṃ ca vi kumāraṃ jarāyuṇāva jarāyu padyatām ////
analyzed: vi mātaram ca putram ca vi kumāram jarāyuṇā ava jarāyu padyatām
translated: I break the mother and the son, I break the infant with the after-birth; let the after-birth fall away.

original: yathā vāto yathā mano yathā patanti pakṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: yathā vātaḥ yathā manaḥ yathā patanti pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: As the wind, as the mind, as the birds fly,

original: evā tvaṃ daśamāsya sākaṃ jarāyuṇā patāva jarāyu padyatām ////
analyzed: eva tvam daśamāsya sākam jarāyuṇā pata ava jarāyu padyatām
translated: so thou, O ten-month-old one, with the after-birth, fall away; let the after-birth fall away.

original: jarāyujaḥ prathama usriyo vṛṣā vātābhrajā stanayann eti vṛṣṭyā /
analyzed: jarāyu jaḥ prathamaḥ usriyaḥ vṛṣā vāta abhra jāḥ stanayan eti vṛṣṭyā
translated: The embryo-born, the first, the strong, the bull, roaring with the wind and the cloud, comes with the rain.

original: sa no mṛḍāti tanva ṛjugo rujan ya ekam ojas tredhā vicakrame ////
analyzed: sa naḥ mṛḍāti tanve ṛju gaḥ rujan yaḥ ekam ojaḥ tredhā vicakrame
translated: He, the straight-going one, crushes our bodies; he who has distributed his one strength in three ways.

original: aṅgeaṅge śociṣā śiśriyāṇaṃ namasyantas tvā haviṣā vidhema /
analyzed: aṅge aṅge śociṣā śiśriyāṇam namasyantaḥ tvā haviṣā vidhema
translated: We will worship thee with reverence and with oblation, entering into every limb with thy radiance.

original: aṅkānt samaṅkān haviṣā vidhema yo agrabhīt parvāsyā grabhītā ////
analyzed: aṅkān samaṅkān haviṣā vidhema yaḥ agrabhīt parvā asyāḥ grabhītā
translated: We will serve with oblation the even-numbered and uneven-numbered ones, he who seized the joints, the seized one of this one.

original: muñca śīrṣaktyā uta kāsa enaṃ paruṣparur āviveśā yo asya /
analyzed: muñca śīrṣaktyāḥ uta kāsaḥ enam paruḥ paruḥ āviveśa ā yaḥ asya
translated: Let loose the head, and let coughing seize him, it has entered bone by bone of this one.

original: yo abhrajā vātajā yaś ca śuṣmo vanaspatīnt sacatāṃ parvatāṃś ca ////
analyzed: yaḥ abhra jāḥ vāta jāḥ yaḥ ca śuṣmaḥ vanaspatīn sacatām parvatān ca
translated: He who is born from the cloud, born from the wind, and who is the storm, let him join with the trees and the mountains.

original: śaṃ me parasmai gātrāya śam astv avarāya me /
analyzed: śam me parasmai gātrāya śam astu avarāya me
translated: Good to me for the upper part of the body, good be to me for the lower part.

original: śaṃ me caturbhyo aṅgebhyaḥ śam astu tanve mama ////
analyzed: śam me caturbhyaḥ aṅgebhyaḥ śam astu tanve mama
translated: Good to me for the four limbs, good be to me for my body.

original: namas te astu vidyute namas te stanayitnave /
analyzed: namaḥ te astu vidyute namaḥ te stanayitnave
translated: Homage to you be for the lightning, homage to you for the thunder.

original: namas te astv aśmane yenā dūḍāśe asyasi ////
analyzed: namaḥ te astu aśmane yena dūḍāśe asyasi
translated: Homage to you be for the stone wherewith you strike the Dūdāśa.

original: namas te pravato napād yatas tapaḥ samūhasi /🔽mṛḍayā nas tanūbhyo mayas tokebhyas kṛdhi ////
analyzed: namaḥ te pravataḥ napāt yatas tapaḥ samūhasi  mṛḍaya naḥ tanūbhyaḥ mayaḥ tokebhyaḥ kṛdhi
translated: Homage to you, O son of the swift one, from whom you gather heat.🔽Be gracious to our bodies, be gracious to our children.

original: pravato napān nama evāstu tubhyaṃ namas te hetaye tapuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ /
analyzed: pravataḥ napāt namaḥ eva astu tubhyam namaḥ te hetaye tapuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ
translated: To the son of the swift one homage be to you alone, homage we offer to your heat and to your dart.

original: vidma te dhāma paramaṃ guhā yat samudre antar nihitāsi nābhiḥ ////
analyzed: vidma te dhāma paramam guhā yat samudre antar nihitā asi nābhiḥ
translated: We know your highest abode, which is hidden in the ocean, you are the navel that is concealed.

original: yāṃ tvā devā asṛjanta viśva iṣuṃ kṛṇvānā asanāya dhṛṣṇum /
analyzed: yām tvā devāḥ asṛjanta viśve iṣum kṛṇvānāḥ asanāya dhṛṣṇum
translated: You whom all the gods created as an arrow, making you bold for the battle.

original: sā no mṛḍa vidathe gṛṇānā tasyai te namo astu devi ////
analyzed: sā naḥ mṛḍa vidathe gṛṇānā tasyai te namaḥ astu devi
translated: Be gracious to us in the assembly, O Goddess, to thee be homage, O Goddess.

original: bhagam asyā varca ādiṣy adhi vṛkṣād iva srajam /
analyzed: bhagam asyāḥ varcaḥ ādiṣi adhi vṛkṣāt iva srajam
translated: I have taken away her good fortune and splendour, as one takes a garland from a tree.

original: mahābudhna iva parvato jyok pitṛṣv āstām ////
analyzed: mahā budhnaḥ iva parvataḥ jyok pitṛṣu āstām
translated: Like a mountain with great foundations, may she long remain with the Fathers.

original: eṣā te rājan kanyā vadhūr ni dhūyatām yama /
analyzed: eṣā te rājan kanyā vadhūḥ ni dhūyatām yama
translated: This maiden, O King, this bride, O Yama, let her be cast forth.

original: sā mātur badhyatāṃ gṛhe 'tho bhrātur atho pituḥ ////
analyzed: sā mātuḥ badhyatām gṛhe bhrātuḥ atha u pituḥ
translated: Let her be bound in her mother's house, and then in her brother's, and then in her father's.

original: eṣā te kulapā rājan tām u te pari dadmasi /
analyzed: eṣā te kulapā rājan tām u te pari dadmasi
translated: This is thy share, O King, I give it to thee.

original: jyok pitṛṣv āsātā ā śīrṣṇaḥ śamopyāt ////
analyzed: jyok pitṛṣu āsātai ā śīrṣṇaḥ śamopyāt
translated: May she long remain with the Fathers, may she be united with her head.

original: asitasya te brahmaṇā kaśyapasya gayasya ca /
analyzed: asitasya te brahmaṇā kaśyapasya gayasya ca
translated: With the Brahman of Asita, with the Gayatri of Kasyapa,

original: antaḥkośam iva jāmayo 'pi nahyāmi te bhagam // //
analyzed: antaḥkośam iva jāmayaḥ pi nahyāmi te bhagam
translated: Like the womb within, I bind thy good fortune, O sister.

original: saṃ saṃ sravantu sindhavaḥ saṃ vātāḥ saṃ patatriṇaḥ /🔽imaṃ yajñaṃ pradivo me juṣantāṃ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi ////
analyzed: sam sam sravantu sindhavaḥ sam vātāḥ sam patatriṇaḥ  imam yajñam pradivaḥ me juṣantām saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi
translated: Let the rivers flow together, let the winds blow together, let the birds fly together.🔽Let the quarters of heaven accept this sacrifice of mine, I offer with a libation that flows together.

original: ihaiva havam ā yāta ma iha saṃsrāvaṇā utemaṃ vardhayatā giraḥ /
analyzed: iha eva havam ā yāta me iha saṃsrāvaṇāḥ uta imam vardhayata giraḥ
translated: Come hither to this invocation of mine, come hither, O you who flow together. Strengthen this my song.

original: ihaitu sarvo yaḥ paśur asmin tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ ////
analyzed: iha etu sarvaḥ yaḥ paśuḥ asmin tiṣṭhatu rayiḥ
translated: Let every animal that is here come hither, let the wealth that is here remain.

original: ye nadīnāṃ saṃsravanty utsāsaḥ sadam akṣitāḥ /
analyzed: ye nadīnām saṃsravanti utsāsaḥ sadam akṣitāḥ
translated: The overflowing waters of the rivers that ever flow,

original: tebhir me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvair dhanaṃ saṃ srāvayāmasi ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvaiḥ dhanam sam srāvayāmasi
translated: With all those drops of mine, we cause wealth to flow together.

original: ye sarpiṣaḥ saṃsravanti kṣīrasya codakasya ca
analyzed: ye sarpiṣaḥ saṃsravanti kṣīrasya ca udakasya ca
translated: Those that flow from clarified butter, from milk, and from water,

original: tebhir me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvair dhanaṃ saṃ srāvayāmasi ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ me sarvaiḥ saṃsrāvaiḥ dhanam sam srāvayāmasi
translated: With all those drops of mine, we cause wealth to flow together.

original: ye 'māvāsyāṃ rātrim udasthur vrājam attriṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye māvāsyām rātrim udasthuḥ vrājam attriṇaḥ
translated: Those who rose up in the night of the new moon, the thieves who eat the food,

original: agnis turīyo yātuhā so asmabhyam adhi bravat ////🔽sīsāyādhy āha varuṇaḥ sīsāyāgnir upāvati /🔽sīsaṃ ma indraḥ prāyachat tad aṅga yātucātanam ////🔽idaṃ viṣkandhaṃ sahata idaṃ bādhate attriṇaḥ /🔽anena viśvā sasahe yā jātāni piśācyāḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ turīyaḥ yātu hā saḥ asmabhyam adhi bravat  sīsāya adhi āha varuṇaḥ sīsāya agniḥ upāvati  sīsam me indraḥ prāyacchat tat aṅga yātu cātanam  idam viṣkandham sahate idam bādhate attriṇaḥ  anena viśvā sasahe yā jātāni piśācyāḥ
translated: May Agni, the fourth, the slayer of the demons, speak for us.

original: yadi no gāṃ haṃsi yady aśvaṃ yadi pūruṣam /🔽taṃ tvā sīsena vidhyāmo yathā no 'so avīrahā ////🔽amūr yā yanti yoṣito hirā lohitavāsasaḥ /🔽abhrātara iva jāmayas tiṣṭhantu hatavarcasaḥ ////🔽tiṣṭhāvare tiṣṭha para uta tvaṃ tiṣṭha madhyame /
analyzed: yadi naḥ gām haṃsi yadi aśvam yadi pūruṣam 🔽tam tvā sīsena vidhyāmaḥ yathā naḥ saḥ a vīra hā 🔽amūḥ yāḥ yanti yoṣitaḥ hirāḥ lohita vāsasaḥ 🔽a bhrātaraḥ iva jāmayaḥ tiṣṭhantu hata varcasaḥ 🔽tiṣṭha avare tiṣṭha pare uta tvam tiṣṭha madhyame

original: kaniṣṭhikā ca tiṣṭhati tiṣṭhād id dhamanir mahī ////
analyzed: kaniṣṭhikā ca tiṣṭhati tiṣṭhāt id dhamaniḥ mahī
translated: And the little finger remains, the artery of the earth remains.

original: śatasya dhamanīnāṃ sahasrasya hirāṇām /
analyzed: śatasya dhamanīnām sahasrasya hirāṇām
translated: Of a hundred arteries, of a thousand veins,

original: asthur in madhyamā imāḥ sākam antā araṃsata ////🔽pari vaḥ sikatāvatī dhanūr bṛhaty akramīt /
analyzed: asthuḥ id madhyamāḥ imāḥ sākam antāḥ araṃsata  pari vaḥ sikatāvatī dhanūḥ bṛhatī akramīt
translated: These middle ones have come together, they have met at the end.🔽The great bow, full of sand, has passed around you all.

original: tiṣṭhatelayatā su kam ////
analyzed: tiṣṭhata ilayata su kam
translated: Stand firm, O body, make a good foundation.

original: nir lakṣmyaṃ lalāmyaṃ nir arātiṃ suvāmasi /
analyzed: niḥ lakṣmyam lalāmyam niḥ arātim suvāmasi
translated: We heal the markless, the spotty, the hateful.

original: atha yā bhadrā tāni naḥ prajāyā arātiṃ nayāmasi ////
analyzed: atha yā bhadrā tāni naḥ prajāyai arātim nayāmasi
translated: And those that are good, we lead away from our offspring.

original: nir araṇiṃ savitā sāviṣak pador nir hastayor varuṇo mitro aryamā /
analyzed: niḥ araṇim savitā sāviṣat padoḥ niḥ hastayoḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Savitar has brought out the fire-stick from the foot, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman from the hands.

original: nir asmabhyam anumatī rarāṇā premāṃ devā asāviṣuḥ saubhagāya ////
analyzed: niḥ asmabhyam anumatiḥ rarāṇā pra imām devāḥ asāviṣuḥ saubhagāya
translated: Anumati, granting us, has brought it out. The gods have brought it forth for our good fortune.

original: yat ta ātmani tanvāṃ ghoram asti yad vā keśeṣu praticakṣaṇe vā /
analyzed: yat te ātmani tanvām ghoram asti yat vā keśeṣu praticakṣaṇe vā
translated: Whatever terrible thing there is in your body, in your limbs, in your hair, or in your appearance,

original: sarvaṃ tad vācāpa hanmo vayaṃ devas tvā savitā sūdayatu ////
analyzed: sarvam tat vācā apa hanmaḥ vayam devaḥ tvā savitā sūdayatu
translated: We will destroy all that with the voice. May the god Savitar purify you.

original: riśyapadīṃ vṛṣadatīṃ goṣedhāṃ vidhamām uta /
analyzed: riśyapadīm vṛṣadatīm go sedhām vidhamām uta
translated: The one with the mark of a hyena, the one who conquers bulls, the one who destroys cows, the one who destroys,

original: vilīḍhyaṃ lalāmyaṃ tā asman nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: vilīḍhyam lalāmyam tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi
translated: The one who licks, the spotty, the hateful, we drive them away from us.

original: mā no vidan vivyādhino mo abhivyādhino vidan /
analyzed: mā naḥ vidan vivyādhinaḥ mā u abhivyādhinaḥ vidan
translated: May they not know us as those who are sick, nor as those who are sick all around.

original: ārāc charavyā asmad viṣūcīr indra pātaya ////
analyzed: ārāt śaravyāḥ asmat viṣūcīḥ indra pātaya
translated: O Indra, from afar, from a distance, from far away, from a distance,

original: viṣvañco asmac charavaḥ patantu ye astā ye cāsyāḥ /
analyzed: viṣvañcaḥ asmat śaravaḥ patantu ye astāḥ ye ca asyāḥ
translated: Let our arrows fly in all directions, those that are here and those that are not.

original: daivīr manuṣyesavo mamāmitrān vi vidhyata ////
analyzed: daivīḥ manuṣyesavaḥ mama amitrān vi vidhyata
translated: The divine and human forces, pierce my enemies for me.

original: yo naḥ svo yo araṇaḥ sajāta uta niṣṭyo yo asmāṃ abhidāsati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ svaḥ yaḥ araṇaḥ sajātaḥ uta niṣṭyaḥ yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: He who is our own, who is hostile, who is a kinsman, and who is a neighbor who attacks us,

original: rudraḥ śaravyayaitān mamāmitrān vi vidhyatu ////
analyzed: rudraḥ śaravyayā etān mama amitrān vi vidhyatu
translated: May Rudra pierce those enemies of mine with his arrowy shafts.

original: yaḥ sapatno yo 'sapatno yaś ca dviṣan chapāti naḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sapatnaḥ yaḥ sapatnaḥ yaḥ ca dviṣan śapāti naḥ
translated: He who is a rival, he who is not a rival, and he who hates us and curses us,

original: devās taṃ sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mamāntaram ////
analyzed: devāḥ tam sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mama antaram
translated: May all the gods crush him, and may the Brahman armor be within me.

original: adārasṛd bhavatu deva somāsmin yajñe maruto mṛḍatā naḥ /
analyzed: a dāra sṛt bhavatu deva soma asmin yajñe marutaḥ mṛḍata naḥ
translated: May the god Soma be without a wound in this sacrifice, O Maruts, be gracious to us.

original: mā no vidad abhibhā mo aśastir mā no vidad vṛjinā dveṣyā yā ////
analyzed: mā naḥ vidat abhibhā mā u aśastiḥ mā naḥ vidat vṛjinā dveṣyā yā
translated: Let not the curse find us, nor the slanderer, let not the treacherous hatred find us.

original: yo adya senyo vadho 'ghāyūnām udīrate /🔽yuvaṃ taṃ mitrāvaruṇāv asmad yāvayataṃ pari ////
analyzed: yaḥ adya senyaḥ vadhaḥ ghāyūnām udīrate  yuvam tam mitrāvaruṇau asmat yāvayatam pari
translated: The battle today that is being raised, the weapon of the wicked,🔽You, Mitra and Varuna, must remove that from us.

original: itaś ca yad amutaś ca yad vadhaṃ varuṇa yāvaya /🔽vi mahac charma yacha varīyo yāvayā vadham ////
analyzed: itas ca yat amutas ca yat vadham varuṇa yāvaya  vi mahat śarma yaccha varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham
translated: And whatever weapon there is from here and from there, O Varuna, you must remove.🔽Grant us great protection, remove the weapon to a safe distance.

original: śāsa itthā mahāṃ asy amitrasāho astṛtaḥ /
analyzed: śāsaḥ itthā mahān asi amitra sāhaḥ astṛtaḥ
translated: He is indeed great here, unconquered, the slayer of enemies.

original: na yasya hanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana ////
analyzed: na yasya hanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana
translated: Whose friend is never slain, nor ever overcome.

original: svastidā viśāṃ patir vṛtrahā vimṛdho vaśī /
analyzed: svasti dāḥ viśām patiḥ vṛtra hā vimṛdhaḥ vaśī
translated: The giver of welfare, the lord of the people, the slayer of Vrtra, the conqueror of enemies, the powerful one,

original: vṛṣendraḥ pura etu naḥ somapā abhayaṃkaraḥ ////
analyzed: vṛṣā indraḥ puras etu naḥ soma pāḥ abhayaṃkaraḥ
translated: The bull-like Indra, may he come before us, the drinker of Soma, the one who brings safety.

original: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yacha pṛtanyataḥ /
analyzed: vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ
translated: O Indra, destroy our enemies, bring down those who fight against us.

original: adhamaṃ gamayā tamo yo asmāṃ abhidāsati ////
analyzed: adhamam gamaya tamaḥ yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Send to the lowest darkness him who threatens us.

original: vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja /🔽vi manyum indra vṛtrahann amitrasyābhidāsataḥ ////
analyzed: vi rakṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja  vi manyum indra vṛtrahan amitrasya abhidāsataḥ
translated: Destroy the Raksases, destroy the enemies, crush the two jaws of Vrtra.🔽Crush the anger, O Indra, O Vrtra-slayer, of the one who threatens the enemy.

original: apendra dviṣato mano 'pa jijyāsato vadham /
analyzed: apa indra dviṣataḥ mano pa jijyāsataḥ vadham
translated: O Indra, drive away the hatred of the one who hates, drive away the weapon of the one who would kill.

original: vi mahac charma yacha varīyo yāvayā vadham ////
analyzed: vi mahat śarma yaccha varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham
translated: Grant us great protection, drive away the more powerful weapon.

original: anu sūryam ud ayatāṃ hṛddyoto harimā ca te /🔽go rohitasya varṇena tena tvā pari dadhmasi ////
analyzed: anu sūryam ud ayatām hṛddyotaḥ harimā ca te  go rohitasya varṇena tena tvā pari dadhmasi
translated: Follow the rising sun, the light in the heart, and your tawny color.🔽By the color of the red cow, by that we surround you.

original: pari tvā rohitair varṇair dīrghāyutvāya dadhmasi /
analyzed: pari tvā rohitaiḥ varṇaiḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya dadhmasi
translated: We surround you with the red colors for long life.

original: yathāyam arapā asad atho aharito bhuvat ////
analyzed: yathā ayam a rapāḥ asat atha u a haritaḥ bhuvat
translated: So that this one may be without disease, and may live without being carried off.

original: yā rohiṇīr devatyā gāvo yā uta rohiṇīḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ rohiṇīḥ devatyāḥ gāvaḥ yāḥ uta rohiṇīḥ
translated: The red cows that belong to the gods, and those that are red,

original: rūpaṃrūpaṃ vayovayas tābhiṣ ṭvā pari dadhmasi ////
analyzed: rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ tābhiḥ tvā pari dadhmasi
translated: Every form, every age, by them we surround you.

original: śukeṣu te harimāṇaṃ ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi /
analyzed: śukeṣu te harimāṇam ropaṇākāsu dadhmasi
translated: We place thy yellowness in parrots, in partridges, and in sparrows.

original: atho hāridraveṣu te harimāṇaṃ ni dadhmasi ////
analyzed: atha u hāridraveṣu te harimāṇam ni dadhmasi
translated: And we place thy yellowness in the yellow-coloured plants.

original: naktaṃjātāsi oṣadhe rāme kṛṣṇe asikni ca /🔽idaṃ rajani rajaya kilāsaṃ palitaṃ ca yat ////
analyzed: naktaṃjātā asi oṣadhe rāme kṛṣṇe asikni ca  idam rajani rajaya kilāsam palitam ca yat
translated: Thou art the herb born at night, O Ramê, O Krishna, O Asîknya.🔽O Night, dye this, the leprosy and the grey hairs.

original: kilāsaṃ ca palitaṃ ca nir ito nāśayā pṛṣat /
analyzed: kilāsam ca palitam ca niḥ itas nāśaya pṛṣat
translated: The leprosy and the grey hairs, drive them away from hence, O speckled one.

original: ā tvā svo viśatāṃ varṇaḥ parā śuklāni pātaya ////
analyzed: ā tvā svaḥ viśatām varṇaḥ parā śuklāni pātaya
translated: Let thy own colour enter into thee; cast off the white ones.

original: asitaṃ te pralayanam āsthānam asitaṃ tava /
analyzed: asitam te pralayanam āsthānam asitam tava
translated: Thy resting-place is black, thy abode is black.

original: asiknī asy oṣadhe nir ito nāśayā pṛṣat ////
analyzed: asiknī asi oṣadhe niḥ itas nāśaya pṛṣat
translated: Thou art the Asîknya herb; drive them away from hence, O speckled one.

original: asthijasya kilāsasya tanūjasya ca yat tvaci /
analyzed: asthi jasya kilāsasya tanū jasya ca yat tvaci
translated: The leprosy of the bones, the leprosy of the skin,

original: dūṣyā kṛtasya brahmaṇā lakṣma śvetam anīnaśam ////
analyzed: dūṣyā kṛtasya brahmaṇā lakṣma śvetam anīnaśam
translated: The Brahmans have made a remedy for the disease, and have destroyed the white mark.

original: suparṇo jātaḥ prathamas tasya tvaṃ pittam āsitha /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ jātaḥ prathamaḥ tasya tvam pittam āsitha
translated: The first to be born was the bird; thou wast his bile.

original: tad āsurī yudhā jitā rūpaṃ cakre vanaspatīn ////
analyzed: tat āsurī yudhā jitā rūpam cakre vanaspatīn
translated: That Asura, conquered in fight, assumed the form of the trees.

original: āsurī cakre prathamedaṃ kilāsabheṣajam idaṃ kilāsanāśanam /
analyzed: āsurī cakre prathamā idam kilāsa bheṣajam idam kilāsa nāśanam
translated: The Asura made this remedy for leprosy in the beginning, this destroyer of leprosy.

original: anīnaśat kilāsaṃ sarūpām akarat tvacam ////
analyzed: anīnaśat kilāsam sarūpām akarat tvacam
translated: He destroyed the leprosy and made the skin whole.

original: sarūpā nāma te mātā sarūpo nāma te pitā /
analyzed: sarūpā nāma te mātā sarūpaḥ nāma te pitā
translated: Thy mother is called Sarûpâ, thy father is called Sarûpa.

original: sarūpakṛt tvam oṣadhe sā sarūpam idaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: sarūpa kṛt tvam oṣadhe sā sarūpam idam kṛdhi
translated: Thou art the maker of like form, O plant; make thou this like form.

original: śyāmā sarūpaṃkaraṇī pṛthivyā adhy udbhṛtā /
analyzed: śyāmā sarūpaṃkaraṇī pṛthivyāḥ adhi udbhṛtā
translated: The dark one, the maker of like form, is raised up above the earth.

original: idam ū ṣu pra sādhaya punā rūpāṇi kalpaya ////
analyzed: idam u su pra sādhaya punar rūpāṇi kalpaya
translated: Here do thou accomplish this, and renew the forms.

original: yad agnir āpo adahat praviśya yatrākṛṇvan dharmadhṛto namāṃsi /
analyzed: yat agniḥ apaḥ adahat praviśya yatra akṛṇvan dharma dhṛtaḥ namāṃsi
translated: When Agni, entering the waters, burned them, and where they made the forms of those who uphold the law,

original: tatra ta āhuḥ paramaṃ janitraṃ sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman ////
analyzed: tatra te āhuḥ paramam janitram sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman
translated: There they call the highest birthplace. Thou, knowing our agreement, O lightning, pass by us.

original: yady arcir yadi vāsi śociḥ śakalyeṣi yadi vā te janitram /
analyzed: yadi arciḥ yadi vā asi śociḥ śakalyeṣi yadi vā te janitram
translated: If thou art a flame, or if thou art a glow, or if thou goest in fragments, or if that is thy birthplace,

original: hrūḍur nāmāsi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman ////
analyzed: hrūḍuḥ nāma asi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman
translated: Thou art named Hrudu, O god of the green one. Thou, knowing our agreement, O lightning, pass by us.

original: yadi śoko yadi vābhiśoko yadi vā rājño varuṇasyāsi putraḥ /
analyzed: yadi śokaḥ yadi vā abhiśokaḥ yadi vā rājñaḥ varuṇasya asi putraḥ
translated: If thou art grief, or if thou art great grief, or if thou art the son of king Varuna,

original: hrūḍur nāmāsi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman ////
analyzed: hrūḍuḥ nāma asi haritasya deva sa naḥ saṃvidvān pari vṛṅgdhi takman
translated: Thou art named Hrudu, O god of the green one. Thou, knowing our agreement, O lightning, pass by us.

original: namaḥ śītāya takmane namo rūrāya śociṣe kṛṇomi /
analyzed: namaḥ śītāya takmane namaḥ rūrāya śociṣe kṛṇomi
translated: I offer homage to the cold lightning, homage to the rough-rayed glow I offer.

original: yo anyedyur ubhayadyur abhyeti tṛtīyakāya namo astu takmane ////
analyzed: yaḥ anyedyus ubhayadyus abhyeti tṛtīyakāya namaḥ astu takmane
translated: To the one who comes on the next day, or on the second day, or on the third day, homage to lightning.

original: āre 'sāv asmad astu hetir devāso asat /
analyzed: āre sau asmat astu hetiḥ devāsaḥ asat
translated: Far away from us, O gods, let that weapon be.

original: āre aśmā yam asyatha ////
analyzed: āre aśmā yam asyatha
translated: The stone which ye have hurled away.

original: sakhāsāv asmabhyam astu rātiḥ sakhendro bhagaḥ /
analyzed: sakhā asau asmabhyam astu rātiḥ sakhā indraḥ bhagaḥ
translated: May that be a friend to us, a gift, a friend, a lord, Bhaga,

original: savitā citrarādhāḥ ////🔽yūyam naḥ pravato napān marutaḥ sūryatvacasaḥ /
analyzed: savitā citra rādhāḥ  yūyam naḥ pravataḥ napāt marutaḥ sūrya tvacasaḥ
translated: Savitar, the giver of wondrous things.🔽You, O Maruts, sons of Pravata, with the sun for your skin,

original: śarma yachatha saprathāḥ ////
analyzed: śarma yacchatha saprathāḥ
translated: Grant us protection that spreads far and wide.

original: suṣūdata mṛḍata mṛḍayā nas tanūbhyo /
analyzed: suṣūdata mṛḍata mṛḍaya naḥ tanūbhyaḥ
translated: Purify yourselves, be gracious, be gracious to our bodies.

original: mayas tokebhyas kṛdhi ////
analyzed: mayaḥ tokebhyaḥ kṛdhi
translated: Make us prosperous with children.

original: amūḥ pāre pṛdākvas triṣaptā nirjarāyavaḥ /🔽tāsām jarāyubhir vayam akṣyāv api vyayāmasy aghāyoḥ paripanthinaḥ ////
analyzed: amūḥ pāre pṛdākvaḥ triṣaptāḥ nirjarāyavaḥ  tāsām jarāyubhiḥ vayam akṣyau api vyayāmasi aghāyoḥ paripanthinaḥ
translated: Those yonder beyond the darkness, thrice-seven, with flowing streams,🔽With their after-births we have filled our eyes, the wicked, the waylayers.

original: viṣūcy etu kṛntatī pinākam iva bibhratī /
analyzed: viṣūcī etu kṛntatī pinākam iva bibhratī
translated: Let her go forth, cutting, bearing the bow,

original: viṣvak punarbhuvā mano 'samṛddhā aghāyavaḥ ////
analyzed: viṣvak punarbhuvā mano samṛddhāḥ aghāyavaḥ
translated: The mind of the one who returns again, the wicked ones have failed.

original: na bahavaḥ sam aśakan nārbhakā abhi dādhṛṣuḥ /🔽veṇor adgā ivābhito 'samṛddhā aghāyavaḥ ////
analyzed: na bahavaḥ sam aśakan na arbhakāḥ abhi dādhṛṣuḥ  veṇoḥ adgāḥ iva abhitas samṛddhāḥ aghāyavaḥ
translated: Many could not do it, the young ones did not dare to attack.🔽Like the horns of a bamboo, the wicked ones have failed.

original: pretaṃ pādau pra sphurataṃ vahataṃ pṛṇato gṛhān /
analyzed: pretam pādau pra sphuratam vahatam pṛṇataḥ gṛhān
translated: Go forth, O feet, step forth, carry the feet to the full houses.

original: indrāny etu prathamājītāmuṣitā puraḥ ////
analyzed: indrānī etu prathamā a jītā a muṣitā puras
translated: Let her go forth, the first to be conquered, the one who has dwelt in the east, belonging to Indra.

original: upa prāgād devo agnī rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ /
analyzed: upa prāgāt devaḥ agniḥ rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ
translated: The god Agni has come forward, the slayer of demons, the remover of sickness.

original: dahann apa dvayāvino yātudhānān kimīdinaḥ ////
analyzed: dahan apa dvayāvinaḥ yātudhānān kimīdinaḥ
translated: Burning up the two-natured demons and the kīdins.

original: prati daha yātudhānān prati deva kimīdinaḥ /🔽pratīcīḥ kṛṣṇavartane saṃ daha yātudhānyaḥ ////🔽yā śaśāpa śapanena yāghaṃ mūram ādadhe /
analyzed: prati daha yātudhānān prati deva kimīdinaḥ  pratīcīḥ kṛṣṇa vartane sam daha yātudhānyaḥ  yā śaśāpa śapanena yā agham mūram ādadhe
translated: Burn up the demons, O god, burn up the kīdins.🔽Burn up the western witches, O dark-turning one.🔽She who curses with a curse, she who lays a spell,

original: yā rasasya haraṇāya jātam ārebhe tokam attu sā ////
analyzed: yā rasasya haraṇāya jātam ārebhe tokam attu sā
translated: She who has set her heart on stealing away the sap, let her eat her own offspring.

original: putram attu yātudhānīḥ svasāram uta naptyam /
analyzed: putram attu yātudhānīḥ svasāram uta naptyam
translated: Let the witches eat their own son, their own sister, and their own granddaughter.

original: adhā mitho vikeśyo vi ghnatāṃ yātudhānyo vi tṛhyantām arāyyaḥ ////
analyzed: adhā mithas vikeśyaḥ vi ghnatām yātudhānyaḥ vi tṛhyantām arāyyaḥ
translated: Let them be mutually hairless, let the witches be destroyed, let the wicked be crushed.

original: abhīvartena maṇinā yenendro abhivavṛdhe /
analyzed: abhīvartena maṇinā yena indraḥ abhivavṛdhe
translated: With the Abhivarta gem, by which Indra prospered,

original: tenāsmān brahmaṇas pate 'bhi rāṣṭrāya vardhaya ////
analyzed: tena asmān brahmaṇas pate bhi rāṣṭrāya vardhaya
translated: By that, O Brahmanaspati, prosper us for the kingdom.

original: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yā no arātayaḥ /
analyzed: abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yāḥ naḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Having overcome our enemies, having overcome those who hate us,

original: abhi pṛtanyantaṃ tiṣṭhābhi yo no durasyati ////
analyzed: abhi pṛtanyantam tiṣṭha abhi yaḥ naḥ durasyati
translated: Stand over the one who is to be conquered, stand over the one who wrongs us.

original: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi ṣomo avīvṛdhat /
analyzed: abhi tvā devaḥ savitā abhi somaḥ avīvṛdhat
translated: The god Savitr has prospered you, Soma has prospered you.

original: abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāny abhīvarto yathāsasi ////
analyzed: abhi tvā viśvā bhūtāni abhīvartaḥ yathā asasi
translated: All beings have prospered you, as you are the Abhivarta.

original: abhīvarto abhibhavaḥ sapatnakṣayaṇo maṇiḥ /
analyzed: abhīvartaḥ abhibhavaḥ sapatna kṣayaṇaḥ maṇiḥ
translated: The Abhivarta gem, the conqueror, the destroyer of enemies,

original: rāṣṭrāya mahyaṃ badhyatāṃ sapatnebhyaḥ parābhuve ////
analyzed: rāṣṭrāya mahyam badhyatām sapatnebhyaḥ parābhuve
translated: For my kingdom, bind him for me, for my enemies, for those who rule over others.

original: ud asau sūryo agād ud idaṃ māmakaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: ud asau sūryaḥ agāt ud idam māmakam vacaḥ
translated: That sun has risen, and so has this word of mine.

original: yathāhaṃ śatruho 'sāny asapatnaḥ sapatnahā ////
analyzed: yathā aham śatru ho sāni asapatnaḥ sapatna hā
translated: So that I may be a slayer of enemies, without a rival, a slayer of rivals.

original: sapatnakṣayaṇo vṛṣābhiraṣṭro viṣāsahiḥ /
analyzed: sapatna kṣayaṇaḥ vṛṣā abhiraṣṭraḥ viṣāsahiḥ
translated: The bull who destroys rivals, the powerful one, the one who conquers poison,

original: yathāham eṣāṃ vīrāṇāṃ virājāni janasya ca ////
analyzed: yathā aham eṣām vīrāṇām virājāni janasya ca
translated: So that I may rule over these heroes and over the people.

original: viśve devā vasavo rakṣatemam utādityā jāgṛta yūyam asmin /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ vasavaḥ rakṣata imam uta ādityāḥ jāgṛta yūyam asmin
translated: May all the gods, the Vasus, protect this one, and may the Adityas, be watchful over him.

original: memaṃ sanābhir uta vānyanābhir memaṃ prāpat pauruṣeyo vadho yaḥ ////
analyzed: mā imam sanābhiḥ uta vā anya nābhiḥ mā imam prāpat pauruṣeyaḥ vadhaḥ yaḥ
translated: Let not this one be struck by a weapon of a fellow clansman or a stranger, let not this one be struck by a human weapon.

original: ye vo devāḥ pitaro ye ca putrāḥ sacetaso me śṛṇutedam uktam /
analyzed: ye vaḥ devāḥ pitaraḥ ye ca putrāḥ sacetasaḥ me śṛṇuta idam uktam
translated: O gods, who are the fathers of you all, and who are the sons, all of you, who are endowed with consciousness, listen to these words of mine.

original: sarvebhyo vaḥ pari dadāmy etaṃ svasty enaṃ jarase vahātha ////
analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ vaḥ pari dadāmi etam svasti enam jarase vahātha
translated: I dedicate this one to you all. Carry him safely to old age.

original: ye devā divi ṣṭha ye pṛthivyāṃ ye antarikṣa oṣadhīṣu paśuṣv apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: ye devāḥ divi ṣṭha ye pṛthivyām ye antarikṣe oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar
translated: Those gods who are in the heaven, on the earth, in the atmosphere, in the plants, in the cattle, in the waters,

original: te kṛṇuta jarasam āyur asmai śatam anyān pari vṛṇaktu mṛtyūn ////
analyzed: te kṛṇuta jarasam āyuḥ asmai śatam anyān pari vṛṇaktu mṛtyūn
translated: Grant him life and old age. Let him pass beyond a hundred deaths.

original: yeṣāṃ prayājā uta vānuyājā hutabhāgā ahutādaś ca devāḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām prayājāḥ uta vā anuyājāḥ huta bhāgāḥ a huta adaḥ ca devāḥ
translated: Those gods who have the fore-sacrifices and the after-sacrifices, who partake of the oblations and who eat what is not offered,

original: yeṣāṃ vaḥ pañca pradiśo vibhaktās tān vo asmai satrasadaḥ kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: yeṣām vaḥ pañca pradiśaḥ vibhaktāḥ tān vaḥ asmai satra sadaḥ kṛṇomi
translated: Whose are the five directions divided, to them, you who sit in the assembly, I make this (offering).

original: āśānām āśāpālebhyaś caturbhyo amṛtebhyaḥ /
analyzed: āśānām āśā pālebhyaḥ caturbhyaḥ amṛtebhyaḥ
translated: To the four immortal guardians of the quarters of the world,

original: idaṃ bhūtasyādhyakṣebhyo vidhema haviṣā vayam ////
analyzed: idam bhūtasya adhyakṣebhyaḥ vidhema haviṣā vayam
translated: To the overseers of the created world, let us offer this oblation.

original: ya āśānām āśāpālāś catvāra sthana devāḥ /
analyzed: ye āśānām āśā pālāḥ catvāraḥ sthana devāḥ
translated: You who are the four guardians of the quarters of the world, O gods,

original: te no nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyo muñcatāṃhasoaṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: te naḥ nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyaḥ muñcata aṃhasaḥ aṃhasaḥ
translated: Deliver us from the noose of misfortune, from sin to sin.

original: asrāmas tvā haviṣā yajāmy aśloṇas tvā ghṛtena juhomi /
analyzed: a srāmaḥ tvā haviṣā yajāmi a śloṇaḥ tvā ghṛtena juhomi
translated: I worship you with oblation, O unblemished one, I offer you ghee, O unbent one.

original: ya āśānām āśāpālas turīyo devaḥ sa naḥ subhūtam eha vakṣat ////
analyzed: yaḥ āśānām āśā pālaḥ turīyaḥ devaḥ sa naḥ subhūtam ā iha vakṣat
translated: The fourth god who is the guardian of the quarters of the world, may he lead us to good fortune.

original: svasti mātra uta pitre no astu svasti gobhyo jagate puruṣebhyaḥ /
analyzed: svasti mātre uta pitre naḥ astu svasti gobhyaḥ jagate puruṣebhyaḥ
translated: May there be well-being for our mother and father, for our cattle, for the people.

original: viśvam subhūtam suvidatraṃ no astu jyog eva dṛśema sūryam ////
analyzed: viśvam subhūtam suvidatram naḥ astu jyok eva dṛśema sūryam
translated: May all be well for us, may we have good friends. May we long behold the sun.

original: idaṃ janāso vidatha mahad brahma vadiṣyati /
analyzed: idam janāsaḥ vidatha mahat brahma vadiṣyati
translated: O people, this great Brahman will be spoken in the assembly.

original: na tat pṛthivyāṃ no divi yena prāṇanti vīrudhaḥ ////
analyzed: na tat pṛthivyām na u divi yena prāṇanti vīrudhaḥ
translated: It is not on the earth, nor in the sky, by which the plants breathe.

original: antarikṣa āsāṃ sthāma śrāntasadām iva /
analyzed: antarikṣe āsām sthāma śrānta sadām iva
translated: It is in the atmosphere, like that of the weary ones.

original: āsthānam asya bhūtasya viduṣ ṭad vedhaso na vā ////
analyzed: āsthānam asya bhūtasya viduḥ tat vedhasaḥ na vā
translated: The wise know that as the abode of this created world, or not.

original: yad rodasī rejamāne bhūmiś ca niratakṣatam /
analyzed: yat rodasī rejamāne bhūmiḥ ca niratakṣatam
translated: What ye, O ye two worlds, have shaken and formed, the earth and what ye have formed,

original: ārdraṃ tad adya sarvadā samudrasyeva śrotyāḥ ////
analyzed: ārdram tat adya sarvadā samudrasya iva śrotyāḥ
translated: That is moist today in all places, like the hearing of the ocean.

original: viśvam anyām abhīvāra tad anyasyām adhi śritam /
analyzed: viśvam anyām abhīvāra tat anyasyām adhi śritam
translated: One is placed upon the other, encompassing the universe.

original: dive ca viśvavedase pṛthivyai cākaraṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: dive ca viśva vedase pṛthivyai ca akaram namaḥ
translated: To the heaven and to the earth, the all-knowing, I offer this homage.

original: hiraṇyavarṇāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakā yāsu jātaḥ savitā yāsv agniḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ yāsu jātaḥ savitā yāsu agniḥ
translated: The golden-hued, pure, purifying waters, in which Savita was born, in which Agni,

original: yā agniṃ garbhaṃ dadhire suvarṇās tā na āpaḥ śaṃ syonā bhavantu ////
analyzed: yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire su varṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu
translated: Those golden waters that conceived Agni as their embryo, may they be auspicious and kindly to us.

original: yāsāṃ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyan janānām /
analyzed: yāsām rājā varuṇaḥ yāti madhye satya anṛte avapaśyan janānām
translated: The waters whose midst the king Varuna traverses, beholding the truth and untruth of men,

original: yā agniṃ garbhaṃ dadhire suvarṇās tā na āpaḥ śaṃ syonā bhavantu ////
analyzed: yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire su varṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu
translated: Those golden waters that conceived Agni as their embryo, may they be auspicious and kindly to us.

original: yāsāṃ devā divi kṛṇvanti bhakṣaṃ yā antarikṣe bahudhā bhavanti /
analyzed: yāsām devāḥ divi kṛṇvanti bhakṣam yāḥ antarikṣe bahudhā bhavanti
translated: The waters which the gods make their food in the sky, which become manifold in the atmosphere,

original: yā agniṃ garbhaṃ dadhire suvarṇās tā na āpaḥ śaṃ syonā bhavantu ////
analyzed: yāḥ agnim garbham dadhire su varṇāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu
translated: Those golden waters that conceived Agni as their embryo, may they be auspicious and kindly to us.

original: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyatāpaḥ śivayā tanvopa spṛśata tvacaṃ me /
analyzed: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me
translated: Look upon me with your auspicious eye, O waters, touch my body with your auspicious limbs,

original: ghṛtaścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakās tā na āpaḥ śaṃ syonā bhavantu ////🔽iyaṃ vīrun madhujātā madhunā tvā khanāmasi /
analyzed: ghṛtaścutaḥ śucayaḥ yāḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ naḥ āpaḥ śam syonāḥ bhavantu  iyam vīrudh madhu jātā madhunā tvā khanāmasi
translated: The pure ones that drip ghee, the purifying ones, may those waters be wholesome and pleasant for us.🔽This plant, born of honey, with honey we dig you up for you.

original: madhor adhi prajātāsi sā no madhumatas kṛdhi ////
analyzed: madhoḥ adhi prajātā asi sā naḥ madhumataḥ kṛdhi
translated: You are born from honey, make us rich in honey.

original: jihvāyā agre madhu me jihvāmūle madhūlakam /
analyzed: jihvāyāḥ agre madhu me jihvā mūle madhūlakam
translated: Honey is at the tip of my tongue, honey is at the root of my tongue.

original: mamed aha kratāv aso mama cittam upāyasi ////
analyzed: mama id aha kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi
translated: You are mine, O mind, you come to me.

original: madhuman me nikramaṇaṃ madhuman me parāyaṇam /
analyzed: madhumat me nikramaṇam madhumat me parāyaṇam
translated: My approach is full of honey, my departure is full of honey.

original: vācā vadāmi madhumad bhūyāsaṃ madhusaṃdṛśaḥ ////
analyzed: vācā vadāmi madhumat bhūyāsam madhu saṃdṛśaḥ
translated: I speak with a voice full of honey, may I become one who sees honey.

original: madhor asmi madhutaro madughān madhumattaraḥ /
analyzed: madhoḥ asmi madhutaraḥ madughāt madhumattaraḥ
translated: I am sweeter than honey, sweeter than the honey-dripping honeycombs.

original: mām it kila tvaṃ vanāḥ śākhāṃ madhumatīm iva ////🔽pari tvā paritatnunekṣuṇāgām avidviṣe /
analyzed: mām id kila tvam vanāḥ śākhām madhumatīm iva  pari tvā paritatnunā ikṣuṇā agām a vidviṣe
translated: You indeed have chosen me, like a branch full of honey.🔽I have come to you with the all-embracing arrow, to the one who is not my enemy.

original: yathā māṃ kaminy aso yathā man nāpagā asaḥ ////🔽yad ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇā hiraṇyaṃ śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ /
analyzed: yathā mām kaminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagā asaḥ  yat ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇāḥ hiraṇyam śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ
translated: So that you may love me, so that you may not go away from me.🔽The gold which the sons of Daksha bound, with a willing heart, to Satani,

original: tat te badnāmy āyuṣe varcase balāya dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya ////
analyzed: tat te badnāmi āyuṣe varcase balāya dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya
translated: that I fasten on you for life, for splendor, for strength, for long life, for a hundred autumns.

original: nainaṃ rakṣāṃsi na piśācāḥ sahante devānām ojaḥ prathamajam hy etat /
analyzed: na enam rakṣāṃsi na piśācāḥ sahante devānām ojaḥ prathama jam hi etat
translated: Neither Rakshasas nor Pisāchas endure it, for this is the first-born strength of the gods.

original: yo bibharti dākṣāyaṇaṃ hiraṇyaṃ sa jīveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ bibharti dākṣāyaṇam hiraṇyam sa jīveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: He who wears the gold of Daksha's son, he makes long life for those who live.

original: apāṃ tejo jyotir ojo balaṃ ca vanaspatīnām uta vīryāṇi /
analyzed: apām tejaḥ jyotiḥ ojaḥ balam ca vanaspatīnām uta vīryāṇi
translated: The splendor of the waters, the light, the strength, and the power of the trees, and the virility,

original: indra ivendriyāṇy adhi dhārayāmo asmin tad dakṣamāṇo bibharad dhiraṇyam ////
analyzed: indraḥ iva indriyāṇi adhi dhārayāmaḥ asmin tat dakṣamāṇaḥ bibharat hiraṇyam
translated: We hold in him, as Indra holds the powers, may he, being powerful, wear the gold.

original: samānāṃ māsām ṛtubhiṣ ṭvā vayaṃ saṃvatsarasya payasā piparmi /
analyzed: samānām māsām ṛtubhiḥ tvā vayam saṃvatsarasya payasā piparmi
translated: Of the twelve months with the seasons, we nourish thee with the sap of the year.

original: indrāgnī viśve devās te 'nu manyantām ahṛṇīyamānāḥ ////
analyzed: indra agnī viśve devāḥ te nu manyantām a hṛṇīyamānāḥ
translated: May Indra, Agni, and all the gods approve of thee, being free from anger.

original: venas tat paśyat paramaṃ guhā yad yatra viśvaṃ bhavaty ekarūpam /
analyzed: venaḥ tat paśyat paramam guhā yat yatra viśvam bhavati eka rūpam
translated: Vena saw that highest mystery, where all becomes of one form.

original: idaṃ pṛśnir aduhaj jāyamānāḥ svarvido abhy anūṣata vrāḥ ////
analyzed: idam pṛśniḥ aduhat jāyamānāḥ svar vidaḥ abhī anūṣata vrāḥ
translated: This speckled one milked it as it was being born; the singers who found the heaven have sung after it.

original: pra tad voced amṛtasya vidvān gandharvo dhāma paramaṃ guhā yat /
analyzed: pra tat vocet amṛtasya vidvān gandharvaḥ dhāma paramam guhā yat
translated: The Gandharva, knowing the immortal, may he declare that highest abode, the mystery,

original: trīṇi padāni nihitā guhāsya yas tāni veda sa pituṣ pitāsat ////
analyzed: trīṇi padāni nihitā guhā asya yaḥ tāni veda sa pituḥ pitā asat
translated: The three steps that are hidden in him, he who knows them becomes the father of his father.

original: sa naḥ pitā janitā sa uta bandhur dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: sa naḥ pitā janitā saḥ uta bandhuḥ dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He is our father, our begetter, and our kinsman, who knows all the abodes and all the worlds.

original: yo devānāṃ nāmadha eka eva taṃ saṃpraśnaṃ bhuvanā yanti sarvā ////
analyzed: yaḥ devānām nāmadhaḥ ekaḥ eva tam saṃpraśnam bhuvanā yanti sarvā
translated: He alone is the name of the gods, to whom all the worlds go for consultation.

original: pari dyāvāpṛthivī sadya āyam upātiṣṭhe prathamajām ṛtasya /
analyzed: pari dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas ā ayam upātiṣṭhe prathama jām ṛtasya
translated: He in a moment encompasses heaven and earth, and stands near the first-born of truth.

original: vācam iva vaktari bhuvaneṣṭhā dhāsyur eṣa nanv eṣo agniḥ ////
analyzed: vācam iva vaktari bhuvaneṣṭhāḥ dhāsyuḥ eṣa nanu eṣaḥ agniḥ
translated: Like speech in the speaker, the supporter of the world, he is the same, this very Agni.

original: pari viśvā bhuvanāny āyam ṛtasya tantuṃ vitataṃ dṛśe kam /
analyzed: pari viśvā bhuvanāni āyam ṛtasya tantum vitatam dṛśe kam
translated: He encompasses all the worlds, to see the spread-out thread of truth,

original: yatra devā amṛtam ānaśānāḥ samāne yonāv adhy airayanta ////
analyzed: yatra devāḥ amṛtam ānaśānāḥ samāne yonau adhi airayanta
translated: Where the gods, attaining immortality, have gone together to the common birthplace.

original: divyo gandharvo bhuvanasya yas patir eka eva namasyo vikṣv īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: divyaḥ gandharvaḥ bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ eva namasyaḥ vikṣu īḍyaḥ
translated: The divine Gandharva, who is the lord of the world, is to be worshipped alone in all places, is to be praised.

original: taṃ tvā yaumi brahmaṇā divya deva namas te astu divi te sadhastham ////
analyzed: tam tvā yaumi brahmaṇā divya deva namaḥ te astu divi te sadhastham
translated: To you, O divine god, I come with prayer. Let there be homage to you. Your abode is in heaven.

original: divi spṛṣṭo yajataḥ sūryatvag avayātā haraso daivyasya /🔽mṛḍāt gandharvo bhuvanasya yas patir eka eva namasyaḥ suśevāḥ ////
analyzed: divi spṛṣṭaḥ yajataḥ sūrya tvac avayātā harasaḥ daivyasya  mṛḍāt gandharvaḥ bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ eva namasyaḥ suśevāḥ
translated: Touched by the sun in heaven, the sacrificer has gone to the divine essence.🔽May the Gandharva, who is the lord of the world, be gracious, to be worshipped alone, very auspicious.

original: anavadyābhiḥ sam u jagma ābhir apsarāsv api gandharva āsīt /
analyzed: anavadyābhiḥ sam u jagme ābhiḥ apsarāsu api gandharvaḥ āsīt
translated: With these faultless ones he has come together. The Gandharva was among the celestial nymphs.

original: samudra āsāṃ sadanaṃ ma āhur yataḥ sadya ā ca parā ca yanti ////
analyzed: samudre āsām sadanam me āhuḥ yatas sadyas ā ca parā ca yanti
translated: The ocean, they say, is their abode, whence they go forth and return again.

original: abhriye didyun nakṣatriye yā viśvāvasuṃ gandharvaṃ sacadhve /
analyzed: abhriye didyut nakṣatriye yāḥ viśvāvasum gandharvam sacadhve
translated: To the lightning in the cloud, to the star-like one, who attend on the Gandharva Viśvāvasu,

original: tābhyo vo devīr nama it kṛṇomi ////🔽yāḥ klandās tamiṣīcayo 'kṣakāmā manomuhaḥ /
analyzed: tābhyaḥ vaḥ devīḥ namaḥ id kṛṇomi  yāḥ klandāḥ tamiṣīcayaḥ kṣakāmāḥ manaḥ muhaḥ
translated: To you goddesses I offer this homage.🔽To the Gandharvas and Apsarases who are fond of dice, who are greedy for the dice, who are eager for the dice,

original: tābhyo gandharvabhyo 'psarābhyo 'karam namaḥ ////
analyzed: tābhyaḥ gandharvabhyaḥ psarābhyaḥ karam namaḥ
translated: To those Gandharvas and Apsarases I offer homage.

original: ado yad avadhāvaty avatkam adhi parvatāt /
analyzed: adaḥ yat avadhāvati avatkam adhi parvatāt
translated: What flows from here, from the cleft in the mountain,

original: tat te kṛṇomi bheṣajaṃ subheṣajaṃ yathāsasi ////
analyzed: tat te kṛṇomi bheṣajam su bheṣajam yathā asasi
translated: I make that a remedy for you, a good remedy, that you may be well.

original: ād aṅgā kuvid aṅga śataṃ yā bheṣajāni te /
analyzed: āt aṅga kuvid aṅga śatam yā bheṣajāni te
translated: Whatsoever of your hundred remedies, O Aṅga, is the best,

original: teṣām asi tvam uttamam anāsrāvam arogaṇam ////🔽nīcaiḥ khananty asurā arusrāṇam idaṃ mahat /
analyzed: teṣām asi tvam uttamam anāsrāvam arogaṇam  nīcais khananti asurāḥ arusrāṇam idam mahat
translated: That is the one without discharge, without disease, that I make for you.🔽The Asuras dig it up from below, this great remedy without discharge.

original: tad āsrāvasya bheṣajaṃ tad u rogam anīnaśat ////
analyzed: tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam anīnaśat
translated: That is the remedy for discharge, that has destroyed disease.

original: upajīkā ud bharanti samudrād adhi bheṣajam /
analyzed: upajīkāḥ ud bharanti samudrāt adhi bheṣajam
translated: From the ocean they bring up the remedy, from the water's edge.

original: tad āsrāvasya bheṣajaṃ tad u rogam aśīśamat ////
analyzed: tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam aśīśamat
translated: That is the remedy for discharge, that has healed the disease.

original: arusrāṇam idaṃ mahat pṛthivyā adhy udbhṛtam /
analyzed: arusrāṇam idam mahat pṛthivyāḥ adhi udbhṛtam
translated: This great remedy without discharge is brought up from the earth.

original: tad āsrāvasya bheṣajaṃ tad u rogam anīnaśat ////
analyzed: tat āsrāvasya bheṣajam tat u rogam anīnaśat
translated: That is the remedy for the discharge, that has destroyed the disease.

original: śaṃ no bhavantv apa oṣadhayaḥ śivāḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ bhavantu apaḥ oṣadhayaḥ śivāḥ
translated: May the waters and plants be auspicious to us, bringing peace.

original: indrasya vajro apa hantu rakṣasa ārād visṛṣṭā iṣavaḥ patantu rakṣasām ////
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ apa hantu rakṣasaḥ ārāt visṛṣṭāḥ iṣavaḥ patantu rakṣasām
translated: May Indra's thunderbolt drive away the demons. May the arrows released from afar fall upon the demons.

original: dīrghāyutvāya bṛhate raṇāyāriṣyanto dakṣamāṇāḥ sadaiva /🔽maṇiṃ viṣkandhadūṣaṇaṃ jaṅgiḍaṃ bibhṛmo vayam ////
analyzed: dīrgha āyu tvāya bṛhate raṇāya a riṣyantaḥ dakṣamāṇāḥ sadā eva  maṇim viṣkandha dūṣaṇam jaṅgiḍam bibhṛmaḥ vayam
translated: For long life, for great joy, always seeking to be free from enemies, striving for strength,🔽We bear the Jangida gem that destroys the Vishkandha demon.

original: jaṅgiḍo jambhād viśarād viṣkandhād abhiśocanāt /
analyzed: jaṅgiḍaḥ jambhāt viśarāt viṣkandhāt abhiśocanāt
translated: Jangida from the jaw, from the Vishara, from the Vishkandha, from the burning fever,

original: maṇiḥ sahasravīryaḥ pari ṇaḥ pātu viśvataḥ ////🔽ayaṃ viṣkandhaṃ sahate 'yaṃ bādhate attriṇaḥ /
analyzed: maṇiḥ sahasra vīryaḥ pari naḥ pātu viśvatas  ayam viṣkandham sahate yam bādhate attriṇaḥ
translated: The gem with a thousand powers, may it protect us from all sides.🔽This one conquers the Vishkandha, this one repels the devourers.

original: ayaṃ no viśvabheṣajo jaṅgiḍaḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: ayam naḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: This Jangida, the universal remedy, may protect us from distress.

original: devair dattena maṇinā jaṅgiḍena mayobhuvā /
analyzed: devaiḥ dattena maṇinā jaṅgiḍena mayobhuvā
translated: With the gem given by the gods, with the delightful Jangida,

original: viṣkandhaṃ sarvā rakṣāṃsi vyāyāme sahāmahe ////
analyzed: viṣkandham sarvā rakṣāṃsi vyāyāme sahāmahe
translated: We overcome the Vishkandha and all the demons in the contest.

original: śaṇaś ca mā jaṅgiḍaś ca viṣkandhād abhi rakṣatām /
analyzed: śaṇaḥ ca mā jaṅgiḍaḥ ca viṣkandhāt abhi rakṣatām
translated: May the Shana and the Jangida protect me from the Vishkandha.

original: araṇyād anya ābhṛtaḥ kṛṣyā anyo rasebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: araṇyāt anyaḥ ābhṛtaḥ kṛṣyāḥ anyaḥ rasebhyaḥ
translated: One is brought from the forest, another from the field, from the juices.

original: kṛtyādūṣir ayaṃ maṇir atho arātidūṣiḥ /
analyzed: kṛtyā dūṣiḥ ayam maṇiḥ atha u arāti dūṣiḥ
translated: This gem is the remover of witchcraft, the remover of hostility,

original: atho sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra ṇa āyuṃṣi tāriṣat ////
analyzed: atha u sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra naḥ āyuṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: And may the victorious Jangida prolong our lives.

original: indra juṣasva pra vahā yāhi śūra haribhyām /
analyzed: indra juṣasva pra vaha ā yāhi śūra haribhyām
translated: O Indra, enjoy, bring forth, come, O hero, with the two bay horses.

original: pibā sutasya mater iha madhoś cakānaś cārur madāya ////
analyzed: pibā sutasya mateḥ iha madhoḥ cakānaḥ cāruḥ madāya
translated: Drink of the thought of the pressed (Soma), here of the sweet, longing for the beautiful for rapture.

original: indra jaṭharaṃ navyo na pṛṇasva madhor divo na /
analyzed: indra jaṭharam navyaḥ na pṛṇasva madhoḥ divaḥ na
translated: O Indra, fill thy belly as a new one, with the honey of heaven, as it were.

original: asya sutasya svar ṇopa tvā madāḥ suvāco aguḥ ////
analyzed: asya sutasya svar na upa tvā madāḥ su vācaḥ aguḥ
translated: The sweet juices have come to thee, O thou of good speech, to the light of this pressed (Soma).

original: indras turāṣāṇ mitro vṛtraṃ yo jaghāna yatīr na /
analyzed: indraḥ turāṣāh mitraḥ vṛtram yaḥ jaghāna yatīḥ na
translated: Indra, the strong, Mitra, he who slew Vrtra, as one who goes,

original: bibheda valaṃ bhṛgur na sasahe śatrūn made somasya ////🔽ā tvā viśantu sutāsa indra pṛṇasva kukṣī viḍḍhi śakra dhiyehy ā naḥ /
analyzed: bibheda valam bhṛguḥ na sasahe śatrūn made somasya  ā tvā viśantu sutāsaḥ indra pṛṇasva kukṣī viṣ śakra dhiyā ihi ā naḥ
translated: pierced the stronghold, as Bhrigu, he endured the foes, in the rapture of Soma.🔽O Indra, let the pressed (Soma) enter into thee; fill thy belly; be bountiful, O mighty one; come to our thoughts.

original: śrudhī havaṃ giro me juṣasvendra svayugbhir matsveha mahe raṇāya ////
analyzed: śrudhi havam giraḥ me juṣasva indra svayugbhiḥ matsva iha mahe raṇāya
translated: Listen to the call, to the songs of mine; be pleased, O Indra, with those who are thy friends; rejoice here for the great joy.

original: indrasya nu pra vocaṃ vīryāṇi yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī /
analyzed: indrasya nu pra vocam vīryāṇi yāni cakāra prathamāni vajrī
translated: I will proclaim the manly deeds which Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, performed in the beginning.

original: ahann ahim anu apas tatarda pra vakṣaṇā abhinat parvatānām ////
analyzed: ahan ahim anu apaḥ tatarda pra vakṣaṇāḥ abhinat parvatānām
translated: He slew the dragon, he cleft the streams; he pierced the flanks of the mountains.

original: ahann ahiṃ parvate śiśriyāṇaṃ tvaṣṭāsmai vajraṃ svaryaṃ tatakṣa /
analyzed: ahan ahim parvate śiśriyāṇam tvaṣṭā asmai vajram svaryam tatakṣa
translated: He slew the dragon lying on the mountain; Tvastr fashioned for him the light-winning thunderbolt.

original: vāśrā iva dhenavaḥ syandamānā añjaḥ samudram ava jagmur āpaḥ ////
analyzed: vāśrāḥ iva dhenavaḥ syandamānāḥ añjas samudram ava jagmuḥ āpaḥ
translated: Like milch cows flowing with milk, the waters have gone straight to the ocean.

original: vṛṣāyamāṇo avṛṇīta somaṃ trikadrukeṣu apibat sutasya /
analyzed: vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ avṛṇīta somam trikadrukeṣu apibat sutasya
translated: The bull, eager, chose the Soma, drank of the pressed (juice) on the Trikakud mountains.

original: ā sāyakaṃ maghavādatta vajram ahann enaṃ prathamajām ahīnām ////
analyzed: ā sāyakam maghavā adatta vajram ahan enam prathama jām ahīnām
translated: Maghavan took up the arrow, the thunderbolt, and smote him, the firstborn of the serpents.

original: samās tvāgna ṛtavo vardhayantu saṃvatsarā ṛṣayo yāni satyā /
analyzed: samāḥ tvā agne ṛtavaḥ vardhayantu saṃvatsarāḥ ṛṣayaḥ yāni satyā
translated: O Agni, may the years, the seasons, increase thee; the Rishis, the Samvatsaras, and the truths.

original: saṃ divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvā ā māhi pradiśaś catasraḥ ////
analyzed: sam divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvāḥ ā māhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: Shine together with the heavenly light; illumine all the four quarters.

original: saṃ cedhyasvāgne pra ca vardhayemam uc ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya /
analyzed: sam ca idhyasva agne pra ca vardhaya imam ud ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya
translated: Be kindled, O Agni, and increase him; rise up and stand for great good fortune.

original: mā te riṣann upasattāro agne brahmāṇas te yaśasaḥ santu mānye ////
analyzed: mā te riṣan upasattāraḥ agne brahmāṇaḥ te yaśasaḥ santu mā anye
translated: Let not thy attendants, O Agni, be harmed; let thy priests be glorious, O most venerable one.

original: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇā ime śivo agne saṃvaraṇe bhavā naḥ /
analyzed: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇāḥ ime śivaḥ agne saṃvaraṇe bhava naḥ
translated: These Brahmans here choose thee, O Agni; be propitious, O Agni, in our abode.

original: sapatnahāgne abhimātijid bhava sve gaye jāgṛhy aprayuchan ////
analyzed: sapatna hā agne abhimāti jit bhava sve gaye jāgṛhi aprayuchan
translated: Be a slayer of foes, O Agni, a conqueror of enemies; be watchful in thy own house, O Agni, not casting off (thy worshippers).

original: kṣatreṇāgne svena saṃ rabhasva mitreṇāgne mitradhā yatasva /
analyzed: kṣatreṇa agne svena sam rabhasva mitreṇa agne mitradhā yatasva
translated: With thy own nobility, O Agni, be united; strive, O Agni, with thy friend, as a friend.

original: sajātānāṃ madhyameṣṭhā rājñām agne vihavyo dīdihīha ////
analyzed: sajātānām madhyameṣṭhāḥ rājñām agne vihavyaḥ dīdihi iha
translated: Be thou the chief in the midst of thy equals, O Agni, the guest of kings, shine here.

original: ati niho ati sṛdho 'ty acittīr ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: ati nihaḥ ati sṛdhaḥ ti acittīḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Over the Nihtas, over the Sridhas, over the thoughtless ones, over the foes,

original: viśvā hy agne duritā tara tvam athāsmabhyaṃ sahavīraṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ////
analyzed: viśvā hi agne duritā tara tvam atha asmabhyam saha vīram rayim dāḥ
translated: Over all evils, O Agni, do thou pass by, and then bestow upon us wealth with brave sons.

original: aghadviṣṭā devajātā vīruc chapathayopanī /
analyzed: agha dviṣṭā deva jātā vīrudh śapathayopanī
translated: The plant, born of the gods, that hates evil, hath been brought to the oath-breaker.

original: āpo malam iva prāṇaikṣīt sarvān mac chapathāṃ adhi ////
analyzed: āpaḥ malam iva prāṇaikṣīt sarvān mat śapathām adhi
translated: The waters have looked upon all my oaths as upon a stain.

original: yaś ca sāpatnaḥ śapatho jāmyāḥ śapathaś ca yaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca sāpatnaḥ śapathaḥ jāmyāḥ śapathaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: The oath of one who has a rival wife, and the oath of a sister-in-law,

original: brahmā yan manyutaḥ śapāt sarvaṃ tan no adhaspadam ////
analyzed: brahmā yat manyutaḥ śapāt sarvam tat naḥ adhaspadam
translated: And the oath which the Brahman hath sworn in anger, all that is beneath our feet.

original: divo mūlam avatataṃ pṛthivyā adhy uttatam /
analyzed: divaḥ mūlam avatatam pṛthivyāḥ adhi uttatam
translated: The root of heaven is stretched out, and above is the earth stretched out.

original: tena sahasrakāṇḍena pari ṇaḥ pāhi viśvataḥ ////
analyzed: tena sahasra kāṇḍena pari naḥ pāhi viśvatas
translated: With that one of a thousand shoots, protect us on every side.

original: pari māṃ pari me prajāṃ pari ṇaḥ pāhi yad dhanam /
analyzed: pari mām pari me prajām pari naḥ pāhi yat dhanam
translated: Protect me, protect my offspring, protect our wealth on every side.

original: arātir no mā tārīn mā nas tāriśur abhimātayaḥ ////
analyzed: arātiḥ naḥ mā tārīt mā naḥ tāriśuḥ abhimātayaḥ
translated: Let not hostility overcome us, let not our own thoughts overcome us.

original: śaptāram etu śapatho yaḥ suhārt tena naḥ saha /
analyzed: śaptāram etu śapathaḥ yaḥ suhārd tena naḥ saha
translated: Let the curse go to the one who curses, let him who is well off go with it.

original: cakṣurmantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīr api śṛṇīmasi ////🔽ud agātāṃ bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake /🔽vi kṣetriyasya muñcatām adhamaṃ pāśam uttamam ////
analyzed: cakṣuḥ mantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇīmasi 🔽ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake 🔽vi kṣetriyasya muñcatām adhamam pāśam uttamam
translated: We crush the back-bones of the evil-hearted one who hath a grudge against the eye of the spell.🔽The two bright ones, the two that shine, the two that are in the sky, the two that are in the waters, the two that are in the plants, the two that are in the trees, the two that are in the birds, the two that are in the cattle, the two that are in men, the two that are in the gods, the two that are in the quarters, the two that are in the world, the two that are in the sacrifice, the two that are in the sacrificial session, the two that are in the oblation, the two that are in the ladle, the two that are in the fire, the two that are in the altar, the two that are in the sacrificial post, the two that are in the sacrificial grass, the two that are in the sacrificial cake, the two that are in the sacrificial animal, the two that are in the sacrificial ladle, the two that are in the sacrificial spoon, the two that are in the sacrificial vessel, the two that are in the sacrificial grass, the two that are in the sacrificial post, the two that are in the sacrificial grass, the two that are in the sacrificial cake, the two that are in the sacrificial animal, the two that are in the sacrificial ladle, the two that are in the sacrificial spoon, the two that are in the sacrificial vessel, the two that are in the sacrificial grass,

original: apeyaṃ rātry uchatv apochantv abhikṛtvarīḥ /
analyzed: apa iyam rātrī uchatu apa ucchantu abhikṛtvarīḥ
translated: Let the unapproachable night drive away the unapproachable, the hostile.

original: vīrut kṣetriyanāśany apa kṣetriyam uchatu ////
analyzed: vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu
translated: Let the plant that destroys the demon of the field drive away the demon of the field.

original: babhror arjunakāṇḍasya yavasya te palālyā tilasya tilapiñjyā /
analyzed: babhroḥ arjuna kāṇḍasya yavasya te palālyā tilasya tila piñjyā
translated: Of the red, of the stalk of the Arjuna tree, of the barley, of thy chaff, of the sesame, of the sesame flour,

original: vīrut kṣetriyanāśany apa kṣetriyam uchatu ////
analyzed: vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu
translated: Let the plant that destroys the demon of the field drive away the demon of the field.

original: namas te lāṅgalebhyo nama īṣāyugebhyaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te lāṅgalebhyaḥ namaḥ īṣā yugebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to your ploughs, homage to your yokes and plough-shafts.
