original: vīrut kṣetriyanāśany apa kṣetriyam uchatu ////
analyzed: vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu
translated: Let the plant that destroys the demon of the field drive away the demon of the field.

original: namaḥ sanisrasākṣebhyo namaḥ saṃdeśyebhyaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ sanisrasa akṣebhyaḥ namaḥ saṃdeśyebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to those with dripping plough-shafts, homage to those with ploughs.

original: namaḥ kṣetrasya pataye vīrut kṣetriyanāśany apa kṣetriyam uchatu ////
analyzed: namaḥ kṣetrasya pataye vīrudh kṣetriya nāśanī apa kṣetriyam uchatu
translated: Homage to the lord of the field, let the plant that destroys the demon of the field drive away the demon of the field.

original: daśavṛkṣa muñcemaṃ rakṣaso grāhyā adhi yainaṃ jagrāha parvasu /
analyzed: daśa vṛkṣa muñca imam rakṣasaḥ grāhyāḥ adhi yā enam jagrāha parvasu
translated: O tree with ten branches, release him from the seizure of the demon, by which he has been seized on the joints.

original: atho enam vanaspate jīvānāṃ lokam un naya ////
analyzed: atha u enam vanaspate jīvānām lokam ud naya
translated: Then, O lord of the forest, lead him to the world of the living.

original: āgād ud agād ayaṃ jīvānāṃ vrātam apy agāt /
analyzed: āgāt ud agāt ayam jīvānām vrātam api agāt
translated: He has come, he has risen up, he has entered the multitude of the living.

original: abhūd u putrāṇāṃ pitā nṛṇāṃ ca bhagavattamaḥ ////
analyzed: abhūt u putrāṇām pitā nṛṇām ca bhagavattamaḥ
translated: He has become the best of the blessed ones, the father of the sons and of men.

original: adhītīr adhy agād ayam adhi jīvapurā agān /
analyzed: adhītīḥ adhi agāt ayam adhi jīva purāḥ agān
translated: He has risen up to the students, he has risen up to the city of the living.

original: śataṃ hy asya bhiṣajaḥ sahasram uta vīrudhaḥ ////
analyzed: śatam hi asya bhiṣajaḥ sahasram uta vīrudhaḥ
translated: For he has a hundred physicians and a thousand plants.

original: devās te cītim avidan brahmāṇa uta vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ te cītim avidan brahmāṇaḥ uta vīrudhaḥ
translated: The gods have found thy healing, and the Brāhmans, and the plants.

original: cītiṃ te viśve devā avidan bhūmyām adhi ////
analyzed: cītim te viśve devāḥ avidan bhūmyām adhi
translated: The All-Gods have found thy healing on the earth.

original: yaś cakāra sa niṣ karat sa eva subhiṣaktamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ cakāra sa niḥ karat saḥ eva subhiṣaktamaḥ
translated: He who hath made it is the healer: he is the best physician.

original: sa eva tubhyaṃ bheṣajāni kṛṇavad bhiṣajā śuciḥ ////🔽kṣetriyāt tvā nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: saḥ eva tubhyam bheṣajāni kṛṇavat bhiṣajā śuciḥ  kṣetriyāt tvā nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: He only shall make medicines for thee, the pure physician.🔽From the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from the treacherous snare, I deliver thee, from Varuna's noose.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from sin by prayer. Propitious to thee be both the heavens and the earth.

original: śaṃ te agniḥ sahādbhir astu śaṃ somaḥ sahauṣadhībhiḥ /
analyzed: śam te agniḥ saha adbhiḥ astu śam somaḥ saha oṣadhībhiḥ
translated: Be Agni with the waters propitious to thee. Be Soma with the plants propitious to thee.

original: evāhaṃ tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Even so do I deliver thee from the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from the treacherous snare, from Varuna's noose.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from sin by prayer. Propitious to thee be both the heavens and the earth.

original: śam te vāto antarikṣe vayo dhāc chaṃ te bhavantu pradiśaś catasraḥ /
analyzed: śam te vātaḥ antarikṣe vayaḥ dhāt śam te bhavantu pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: Be the wind propitious to thee in the atmosphere, and give thee strength. Be the four quarters propitious to thee.

original: evāhaṃ tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Even so do I deliver thee from the field, from Nirrti, from the curse of kinsmen, from the treacherous snare, from Varuna's noose.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from sin by the holy power. Let both the heaven and earth be propitious to thee.

original: imā yā devīḥ pradiśaś catasro vātapatnīr abhi sūryo vicaṣṭe /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ devīḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ vāta patnīḥ abhi sūryaḥ vicaṣṭe
translated: These four goddesses who are the quarters, the wives of the wind, whom the sun looks upon,

original: evāhaṃ tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Even from these, O field, I deliver thee from the Nirrti of the kinsmen, from the curse, from the snare of Varuna.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛnomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////🔽tāsu tvāntar jarasy ā dadhāmi pra yakṣma etu nirṛtiḥ parācaiḥ /
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛnomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām  tāsu tvā antar jarasi ā dadhāmi pra yakṣmaḥ etu nirṛtiḥ parācais
translated: I make thee free from sin by the holy power. Let both the heaven and earth be propitious to thee.🔽In them I place thee within the womb of old age. Let consumption go away with Nirrti to a distance.

original: evāhaṃ tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Even from these, O field, I deliver thee from the Nirrti of the kinsmen, from the curse, from the snare of Varuna.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from sin by the holy power. Let both the heaven and earth be propitious to thee.

original: amukthā yakṣmād duritād avadyād druhaḥ pāśād grāhyāś cod amukthāḥ /
analyzed: amukthāḥ yakṣmāt duritāt avadyāt druhaḥ pāśāt grāhyāḥ ca ud amukthāḥ
translated: Ye have been delivered from consumption, from misfortune, from blame, from the snare of the curse, from the grasp of the Raksases.

original: evāhaṃ tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Even from these, O field, I deliver thee from the Nirrti of the kinsmen, from the curse, from the snare of Varuna.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from sin by the holy power. Let both the heaven and earth be propitious to thee.

original: ahā arātim avidaḥ syonam apy abhūr bhadre sukṛtasya loke /
analyzed: ahāḥ arātim avidaḥ syonam api abhūḥ bhadre sukṛtasya loke
translated: Thou hast found the evil-doer, thou hast become gracious, thou hast become good in the world of the righteous.

original: evāhaṃ tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Thus do I deliver thee, O field, from the hostility of the Nirrti, from the spite of the kinsmen, from the snare of Varuna.

original: anāgasaṃ brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from guilt by the Brahman. May both the heaven and the earth be propitious to thee.

original: sūryam ṛtaṃ tamaso grāhyā adhi devā muñcanto asṛjan nir enasaḥ /
analyzed: sūryam ṛtam tamasaḥ grāhyāḥ adhi devāḥ muñcantaḥ asṛjan niḥ enasaḥ
translated: The gods, delivering the truth from the grasp of darkness, have created it free from sin.

original: evāham tvāṃ kṣetriyān nirṛtyā jāmiśaṃsād druho muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt /
analyzed: eva aham tvām kṣetriyāt nirṛtyāḥ jāmi śaṃsāt druhaḥ muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt
translated: Thus do I deliver thee, O field, from the hostility of the Nirrti, from the spite of the kinsmen, from the snare of Varuna.

original: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: anāgasam brahmaṇā tvā kṛṇomi śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: I make thee free from guilt by the Brahman. May both the heaven and the earth be propitious to thee.

original: dūṣyā dūṣir asi hetyā hetir asi menyā menir asi /
analyzed: dūṣyāḥ dūṣiḥ asi hetyāḥ hetiḥ asi menyāḥ meniḥ asi
translated: Thou art the scorcher of the scorcher, the slayer of the slayer, the punisher of the punisher.

original: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samaṃ krāma ////
analyzed: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma
translated: Attain the better, step over the equal.

original: sraktyo 'si pratisaro 'si pratyabhicaraṇo 'si /
analyzed: sraktyaḥ si pratisaraḥ si pratyabhicaraṇaḥ si
translated: Thou art the garland-wearer, thou art the counter-enchanter, thou art the counter-sorcerer.

original: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samaṃ krāma ////
analyzed: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma
translated: Attain the better, step over the equal.

original: prati tam abhi cara yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ /
analyzed: prati tam abhi cara yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Go forth against him who hates us, whom we hate.

original: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samaṃ krāma ////
analyzed: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma
translated: Attain the better, step over the equal.

original: sūrir asi varcodhā asi tanūpāno 'si /
analyzed: sūriḥ asi varcaḥ dhāḥ asi tanū pānaḥ si
translated: Thou art the wise one, thou art the giver of splendour, thou art the protector of the body.

original: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samaṃ krāma ////
analyzed: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma
translated: Attain the better, step over the equal.

original: śukro 'si bhrājo 'si svar asi jyotir asi /
analyzed: śukraḥ si bhrājaḥ si svar asi jyotiḥ asi
translated: You are the bright one, you are the shining one, you are the heaven, you are the light.

original: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samaṃ krāma ////
analyzed: āpnuhi śreyāṃsam ati samam krāma
translated: Attain the better, step over the equal.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī urv antarikṣaṃ kṣetrasya patny urugāyo 'dbhutaḥ /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī uru antarikṣam kṣetrasya patnī urugāyaḥ dbhutaḥ
translated: Heaven and earth, the vast atmosphere, the wife of the field, the vast wonder-working one,

original: utāntarikṣam uru vātagopaṃ ta iha tapyantāṃ mayi tapyamāne ////
analyzed: uta antarikṣam uru vāta gopam te iha tapyantām mayi tapyamāne
translated: And the atmosphere, vast, with the wind as its guardian, may they torment here for me when I am tormented.

original: idaṃ devāḥ śṛṇuta ye yajñiyā stha bharadvājo mahyam ukthāni śaṃsati /
analyzed: idam devāḥ śṛṇuta ye yajñiyāḥ stha bharadvājaḥ mahyam ukthāni śaṃsati
translated: O gods, listen to this, you who are worthy of sacrifice, Bharadvaja praises hymns for me.

original: pāśe sa baddho durite ni yujyatāṃ yo asmākaṃ mana idaṃ hinasti ////
analyzed: pāśe sa baddhaḥ durite ni yujyatām yaḥ asmākam manaḥ idam hinasti
translated: Let him be bound in a noose, let him be yoked in misfortune, he who harms this mind of ours.

original: idam indra śṛṇuhi somapa yat tvā hṛdā śocatā johavīmi /
analyzed: idam indra śṛṇuhi soma pa yat tvā hṛdā śocatā johavīmi
translated: O Indra, drinker of the Soma, listen to this, what I call upon you with a sorrowful heart.

original: vṛścāmi taṃ kuliśeneva vṛkṣaṃ yo asmākaṃ mana idaṃ hinasti ////
analyzed: vṛścāmi tam kuliśena iva vṛkṣam yaḥ asmākam manaḥ idam hinasti
translated: I cut him down like a tree with an axe, he who harms this mind of ours.

original: aśītibhis tisṛbhiḥ sāmagebhir ādityebhir vasubhir aṅgirobhiḥ /
analyzed: aśītibhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ sāmagebhiḥ ādityebhiḥ vasubhiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ
translated: With the eighty-four singers, the Adityas, the Vasus, and the Angiras,

original: iṣṭāpūrtam avatu naḥ pitṝṇām āmuṃ dade harasā daivyena ////
analyzed: iṣṭāpūrtam avatu naḥ pitṝṇām ā amum dade harasā daivyena
translated: May the fulfillment of our sacrifices protect us, I give him away with the divine thunderbolt.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī anu mā dīdhīthāṃ viśve devāso anu mā rabhadhvam /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī anu mā dīdhīthām viśve devāsaḥ anu mā rabhadhvam
translated: O heaven and earth, be you two mindful of me, O all gods, be you two gracious to me.

original: aṅgirasaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ pāpam ā ṛchatv apakāmasya kartā ////
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ pāpam ā ṛchatu apakāmasya kartā
translated: May the Angirasas, the fathers who love Soma, inflict evil on him who does evil to the one who desires it.

original: atīva yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yo nindiṣat kriyamāṇam /
analyzed: atīva yaḥ marutaḥ manyate naḥ brahma vā yaḥ nindiṣat kriyamāṇam
translated: O Maruts, whoever thinks too much of us, or whoever criticizes the Brahman that is being performed,

original: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣaṃ dyaur abhisaṃtapāti ////
analyzed: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahma dviṣam dyauḥ abhisaṃtapāti
translated: may he have burning and tangled hair. May the sky scorch him who hates the Brahman.

original: sapta prāṇān aṣṭau manyas tāṃs te vṛścāmi brahmaṇā /
analyzed: sapta prāṇān aṣṭau manyo tān te vṛścāmi brahmaṇā
translated: I cut off your seven vital breaths and eight thoughts with Brahman.

original: ayā yamasya sādanam agnidūto araṃkṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: ayāḥ yamasya sādanam agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ
translated: He who goes to Yama's abode, sent by Agni, with a noose around his neck.

original: ā dadhāmi te padaṃ samiddhe jātavedasi /🔽agniḥ śarīraṃ veveṣṭv asuṃ vāg api gachatu ////
analyzed: ā dadhāmi te padam samiddhe jātavedasi  agniḥ śarīram veveṣṭu asum vāc api gacchatu
translated: I place your foot in the well-kindled fire.🔽May Agni wrap your body and your life go to speech.

original: āyurdā agne jarasaṃ vṛṇāno ghṛtapratīko ghṛtapṛṣṭho agne /
analyzed: āyuḥ dāḥ agne jarasam vṛṇānaḥ ghṛta pratīkaḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ agne
translated: O Agni, giver of life, I choose old age, with a face of ghee, with ghee as your back, O Agni.

original: ghṛtaṃ pītvā madhu cāru gavyaṃ piteva putrān abhi rakṣatād imam ////
analyzed: ghṛtam pītvā madhu cāru gavyam pitā iva putrān abhi rakṣatāt imam
translated: Having drunk ghee and sweet honey from a cow, protect this one like a father his sons.

original: pari dhatta dhatta no varcasemam jarāmṛtyuṃ kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ /🔽bṛhaspatiḥ prāyachad vāsa etat somāya rājñe paridhātavā u ////
analyzed: pari dhatta dhatta naḥ varcasā imam jarā mṛtyum kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ  bṛhaspatiḥ prāyacchat vāsaḥ etat somāya rājñe paridhātavai u
translated: Put it on, give it to us for splendor, make this one old in death, with a long life.🔽Brihaspati gave this garment to Soma, the king, to put on.

original: parīdaṃ vāso adhithāḥ svastaye 'bhūr gṛṣṭīnām abhiśastipā u /
analyzed: pari idam vāsaḥ adhithāḥ svastaye bhūḥ gṛṣṭīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u
translated: You have put on this garment for well-being, you have become the protector of the accused from curses.

original: śataṃ ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaś ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva ////
analyzed: śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaḥ ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva
translated: And live a hundred long autumns, and enjoy the increase of wealth.

original: ehy aśmānam ā tiṣṭhāśmā bhavatu te tanūḥ /
analyzed: ehi aśmānam ā tiṣṭha aśmā bhavatu te tanūḥ
translated: Come, stand on the stone. Let the stone be your body.

original: kṛṇvantu viśve devā āyuṣṭe śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: kṛṇvantu viśve devāḥ āyuḥ te śaradaḥ śatam
translated: Let all the gods grant you life for a hundred autumns.

original: yasya te vāsaḥ prathamavāsyaṃ harāmas taṃ tvā viśve 'vantu devāḥ /
analyzed: yasya te vāsaḥ prathama vāsyam harāmaḥ tam tvā viśve vantu devāḥ
translated: The garment which we take away from you, the first garment, may all the gods favor you.

original: taṃ tvā bhrātaraḥ suvṛdhā vardhamānam anu jāyantāṃ bahavaḥ sujātam ////
analyzed: tam tvā bhrātaraḥ su vṛdhāḥ vardhamānam anu jāyantām bahavaḥ su jātam
translated: May many brothers be born after you, prosperous and increasing, well-born.

original: niḥsālāṃ dhṛṣṇuṃ dhiṣaṇam ekavādyām jighatsvam /
analyzed: niḥsālām dhṛṣṇum dhiṣaṇam ekavādyām jighatsvam
translated: The barren, the cruel, the one who has only one child, the hungry,

original: sarvāś caṇḍasya naptyo nāśayāmaḥ sadānvāḥ ////🔽nir vo goṣṭhād ajāmasi nir akṣān nir upānaśāt /
analyzed: sarvāḥ caṇḍasya naptyaḥ nāśayāmaḥ sadānvāḥ  niḥ vaḥ goṣṭhāt ajāmasi niḥ akṣāt niḥ upānaśāt
translated: The granddaughters of the angry one, the ever-wandering ones, we destroy.🔽We drive you out from the cowpen, from the axles, from the resting places.

original: nir vo magundyā duhitaro gṛhebhyaś cātayāmahe ////
analyzed: niḥ vaḥ magundyāḥ duhitaraḥ gṛhebhyaḥ cātayāmahe
translated: We drive away from your houses the daughters of Magundhi.

original: asau yo adharād gṛhas tatra santv arāyyaḥ /
analyzed: asau yaḥ adharāt gṛhaḥ tatra santu arāyyaḥ
translated: That house which is below, there let the wicked ones be.

original: tatra sedir ny ucyatu sarvāś ca yātudhānyaḥ ////🔽bhūtapatir nir ajatv indraś cetaḥ sadānvāḥ /
analyzed: tatra sediḥ ni ucyatu sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ  bhūtapatiḥ niḥ ajatu indraḥ ca itas sadānvāḥ
translated: There let languor be laid down, and all the wandering spirits.🔽May the lord of beings drive away Indra, the ever-wandering ones, the mind.

original: gṛhasya budhna āsīnās tā indro vajreṇādhi tiṣṭhatu ////
analyzed: gṛhasya budhne āsīnāḥ tāḥ indraḥ vajreṇa adhi tiṣṭhatu
translated: Seated in the foundation of the house, may Indra with his thunderbolt rule over them.

original: yadi stha kṣetriyāṇāṃ yadi vā puruṣeṣitāḥ /
analyzed: yadi stha kṣetriyāṇām yadi vā puruṣa iṣitāḥ
translated: If ye are of the Kṣetriyas, or if ye are sent forth by men,

original: yadi stha dasyubhyo jātā naśyatetaḥ sadānvāḥ ////
analyzed: yadi stha dasyubhyaḥ jātāḥ naśyata itas sadānvāḥ
translated: If ye are born of the Dasyus, ye are destroyed, ye evil spirits.

original: pari dhāmāny āsām āśur gāṣṭhām ivāsaram /
analyzed: pari dhāmāni āsām āśuḥ
translated: I have gone round the abodes of these, as a swift horse goes to his stall.

original: ajaiṣaṃ sarvān ājīn vo naśyatetaḥ sadānvāḥ ////
analyzed: ajaiṣam sarvān ājīn vaḥ naśyata itas sadānvāḥ
translated: I have conquered all your contests, ye are destroyed, ye evil spirits.

original: yathā dyauś ca pṛthivī ca na bibhīto na riṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yathā dyauḥ ca pṛthivī ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ
translated: As neither heaven nor earth are afraid, nor are destroyed,

original: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ
translated: So do not be afraid of me, O breath.

original: yathāhaś ca rātrī ca na bibhīto na riṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yathā ahar ca rātrī ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ
translated: As neither day nor night are afraid, nor are destroyed,

original: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ
translated: So do not be afraid of me, O breath.

original: yathā sūryaś ca candraś ca na bibhīto na riṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yathā sūryaḥ ca candraḥ ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ
translated: As neither the sun nor the moon are afraid, nor are destroyed,

original: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ
translated: So do not be afraid of me, O breath.

original: yathā brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca na bibhīto na riṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yathā brahma ca kṣatram ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ
translated: As neither the Brahman nor the Kṣatriya are afraid, nor are destroyed,

original: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ
translated: So do not be afraid of me, O breath.

original: yathā satyaṃ cānṛtaṃ ca na bibhīto na riṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yathā satyam ca anṛtam ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ
translated: As neither truth nor falsehood are afraid, nor are destroyed,

original: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ
translated: So do not be afraid of me, O breath.

original: yathā bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca na bibhīto na riṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yathā bhūtam ca bhavyam ca na bibhītaḥ na riṣyataḥ
translated: As neither the past nor the future are afraid, nor are destroyed,

original: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: evā me prāṇa mā bibheḥ
translated: So do not be afraid of me, O breath.

original: prāṇāpānau mṛtyor mā pātaṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: prāṇa apānau mṛtyoḥ mā pātam svāhā
translated: Inhale and exhale, O breath, do not fall into death, svāhā.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī upaśrutyā mā pātaṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī upaśrutyā mā pātam svāhā
translated: O Heaven and Earth, having listened, protect me, Svâhâ!

original: sūrya cakṣuṣā mā pāhi svāhā ////🔽agne vaiśvānara viśvair mā devaiḥ pāhi svāhā ////
analyzed: sūrya cakṣuṣā mā pāhi svāhā  agne vaiśvānara viśvaiḥ mā devaiḥ pāhi svāhā
translated: O Sun, protect me with thy eye, Svâhâ!🔽O Agni Vaisvânara, protect me with all the gods, Svâhâ!

original: viśvambhara viśvena mā bharasā pāhi svāhā ////🔽ojo 'sy ojo me dāḥ svāhā ///🔽saho 'si saho me dāḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: viśvambhara viśvena mā bharasā pāhi svāhā  ojaḥ si ojaḥ me dāḥ svāhā  sahaḥ si sahaḥ me dāḥ svāhā
translated: O All-supporting, protect me with all my sustenance, Svâhâ!🔽Thou art strength; give me strength, Svâhâ!🔽Thou art vigour; give me vigour, Svâhâ!

original: balam asi balaṃ dāḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: balam asi balam dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art power; give me power, Svâhâ!

original: āyur asy āyur me dāḥ svāha ////
analyzed: āyuḥ asi āyuḥ me dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art life; give me life, Svâhâ!

original: śrotram asi śrotraṃ me dāḥ svāha ////
analyzed: śrotram asi śrotram me dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art the ear; give me the ear, Svâhâ!

original: cakṣur asi cakṣur me dāḥ svāha ////🔽paripāṇam asi paripāṇaṃ me dāḥ svāha ////🔽bhrātṛvyakṣayaṇam asi bhrātṛvyacātanaṃ me dāḥ svāha ////
analyzed: cakṣuḥ asi cakṣuḥ me dāḥ svāhā  paripāṇam asi paripāṇam me dāḥ svāhā  bhrātṛvya kṣayaṇam asi bhrātṛvya cātanam me dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art the eye; give me the eye, Svâhâ!🔽Thou art a guardian; give me a guardian, Svâhâ!🔽Thou art the destroyer of foes; give me the destroyer of foes, Svâhâ!

original: sapatnakṣayaṇam asi sapatnacātanaṃ me dāḥ svāha ////🔽arāyakṣayaṇam asy arāyacātanaṃ me dāḥ svāha ////
analyzed: sapatna kṣayaṇam asi sapatna cātanam me dāḥ svāhā  arāya kṣayaṇam asi arāya cātanam me dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art the destroyer of rivals; give me the destroyer of rivals, Svâhâ!🔽Thou art the destroyer of misfortune; give me the destroyer of misfortune, Svâhâ!

original: piśācakṣayaṇam asi piśācacātanaṃ me dāḥ svāha ////
analyzed: piśāca kṣayaṇam asi piśāca cātanam me dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art the destroyer of evil spirits; give me the destroyer of evil spirits, Svâhâ!

original: sadānvākṣayaṇam asi sadānvācātanaṃ me dāḥ svāha ////
analyzed: sadānvā kṣayaṇam asi sadānvā cātanam me dāḥ svāhā
translated: Thou art the destroyer of the Sadânvâs; give me the destroyer of the Sadânvâs, Svâhâ!

original: agne yat te tapas tena taṃ prati tapa yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: agne yat te tapaḥ tena tam prati tapa yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Agni, with that heat of thine, heat him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: agne yat te haras tena taṃ prati hara yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽agne yat te 'rcis tena taṃ praty arca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽agne yat te śocis tena taṃ prati śoca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: agne yat te haraḥ tena tam prati hara yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  agne yat te rciḥ tena tam prati arca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  agne yat te śociḥ tena tam prati śoca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Agni, with that flame of thine, burn him who hates us and whom we hate.🔽O Agni, with that light of thine, shine upon him who hates us and whom we hate.🔽O Agni, with that radiance of thine, shine forth upon him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: agne yat te tejas tena tam atejasaṃ kṛṇu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽vāyo yat te tapas tena taṃ prati tapa yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: agne yat te tejaḥ tena tam atejasam kṛṇu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  vāyo yat te tapaḥ tena tam prati tapa yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Agni, with that splendour of thine, make him splendourless who hates us and whom we hate.🔽O Vayu, with that heat of thine, heat him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: vāyo yat te haras tena taṃ prati hara yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽vāyo yat te 'rcis tena taṃ praty arca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: vāyo yat te haraḥ tena tam prati hara yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  vāyo yat te rciḥ tena tam prati arca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Vayu, with that flame of thine, burn him who hates us and whom we hate.🔽O Vayu, with that light of thine, shine upon him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: vāyo yat te śocis tena taṃ prati śoca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: vāyo yat te śociḥ tena tam prati śoca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Vayu, with that radiance of thine, shine forth upon him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: vāyo yat te tejas tena tam atejasaṃ kṛṇu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽sūrya yat te tapas tena taṃ prati tapa yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: vāyo yat te tejaḥ tena tam atejasam kṛṇu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  sūrya yat te tapaḥ tena tam prati tapa yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Vayu, with that glow of thine, make him glowless who hates us and whom we hate.🔽Sun, with that heat of thine, heat him against whom thou heatest us.

original: sūrya yat te haras tena taṃ prati hara yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽sūrya yat te 'rcis tena taṃ praty arca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽sūrya yat te śocis tena taṃ prati śoca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: sūrya yat te haraḥ tena tam prati hara yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  sūrya yat te rciḥ tena tam prati arca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  sūrya yat te śociḥ tena tam prati śoca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Sun, with that flame of thine, burn him against whom thou burnest us.🔽Sun, with that light of thine, shine upon him against whom thou shinest.🔽Sun, with that radiance of thine, shine forth against him against whom thou shinest.

original: sūrya yat te tejas tena tam atejasaṃ kṛṇu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽candra yat te tapas tena taṃ prati tapa yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: sūrya yat te tejaḥ tena tam atejasam kṛṇu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  candra yat te tapaḥ tena tam prati tapa yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Sun, with that glow of thine, make him glowless who hates us and whom we hate.🔽Moon, with that heat of thine, heat him against whom thou heatest us.

original: candra yat te haras tena taṃ prati hara yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: candra yat te haraḥ tena tam prati hara yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Moon, with that flame of thine, burn him against whom thou burnest us.

original: candra yat te 'rcis tena taṃ praty arca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽candra yat te śocis tena taṃ prati śoca yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: candra yat te rciḥ tena tam prati arca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  candra yat te śociḥ tena tam prati śoca yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Moon, with that light of yours, shine upon him who hates us, whom we hate.🔽O Moon, with that radiance of yours, burn him who hates us, whom we hate.

original: candra yat te tejas tena tam atejasaṃ kṛṇu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽āpo yad vas tapas tena taṃ prati tapata yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: candra yat te tejaḥ tena tam atejasam kṛṇu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  āpaḥ yat vaḥ tapaḥ tena tam prati tapata yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Moon, with that splendor of yours, make him splendorless who hates us, whom we hate.🔽O Waters, with that heat of yours, heat him who hates us, whom we hate.

original: āpo yad vas haras tena taṃ prati harata yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽āpo yad vas 'rcis tena taṃ prati arcata yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////🔽āpo yad vas śocis tena taṃ prati śocata yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ yat vaḥ haraḥ tena tam prati harata yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  āpaḥ yat vaḥ rciḥ tena tam prati arcata yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ  āpaḥ yat vaḥ śociḥ tena tam prati śocata yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Waters, with that swiftness of yours, carry him off who hates us, whom we hate.🔽O Waters, with that light of yours, shine upon him who hates us, whom we hate.🔽O Waters, with that radiance of yours, burn him who hates us, whom we hate.

original: āpo yad vas tejas tena tam atejasaṃ kṛṇuta yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ yat vaḥ tejaḥ tena tam atejasam kṛṇuta yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: O Waters, with that splendor of yours, make him splendorless who hates us, whom we hate.

original: śerabhaka śerabha punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: śerabhaka śerabha punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: O Shearabha, let your arrows return again to the demons. Let the dart return again to the demons.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who has come to you. Eat your own flesh.

original: śevṛdhaka śevṛdha punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: śevṛdhaka śevṛdha punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: O you who are greedy for food, greedy again let your wanderings go back to you, again let the dart of the goblin go back to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who has come to you. Eat your own flesh.

original: mrokānumroka punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: mroka anumroka punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: O you who are very greedy, very greedy again let your wanderings go back to you, again let the dart of the goblin go back to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who has come to you. Eat your own flesh.

original: sarpānusarpa punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: sarpa anusarpa punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: O you who are creeping, creeping again let your wanderings go back to you, again let the dart of the goblin go back to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who has come to you. Eat your own flesh.

original: jūrṇi punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: jūrṇi punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: O you who are worn out, worn out again let your wanderings go back to you, again let the dart of the goblin go back to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who has come to you. Eat your own flesh.

original: upabde punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: upabde punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: O you who are in the vicinity, in the vicinity again let your wanderings go back to you, again let the dart of the goblin go back to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who has come to you. Eat your own flesh.

original: arjuni punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: arjuni punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: Let your darts return again to you, O ye demons, let your weapon return to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who hath brought you hither, eat your own flesh.

original: bharūji punar vo yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: bharūji punar vaḥ yantu yātavaḥ punar hetiḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: Let your darts return again to you, O ye demons, let your weapon return to you.

original: yasya stha tam atta yo vo prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāny atta ////
analyzed: yasya stha tam atta yaḥ vaḥ prāhait tam atta svā māṃsāni atta
translated: Eat him who is yours, eat him who hath brought you hither, eat your own flesh.

original: śaṃ no devī pṛśniparṇy aśaṃ nirṛtyā akaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ devī pṛśniparṇī a śam nirṛtyai akaḥ
translated: Be thou, O Goddess Prithiparna, a blessing to us, and a curse to Nirrti.

original: ugrā hi kaṇvajambhanī tām abhakṣi sahasvatīm ////
analyzed: ugrā hi kaṇva jambhanī tām abhakṣi sahasvatīm
translated: For thou art fierce, O Prithiparna, the crusher of the Kanya race: I have eaten thee, the mighty one.

original: sahamāneyaṃ prathamā pṛśniparṇy ajāyata /🔽tayāhaṃ durṇāmnāṃ śiro vṛścāmi śakuner iva ////🔽arāyam asṛkpāvānaṃ yaś ca sphātiṃ jihīrṣati /
analyzed: sahamānā iyam prathamā pṛśniparṇī ajāyata  tayā aham durṇāmnām śiraḥ vṛścāmi śakuneḥ iva  arāyam asṛj pāvānam yaḥ ca sphātim jihīrṣati
translated: The first Prithiparna was born, the eater of the Kanya race.🔽With her I cut off the head of the evil-named, as of a bird.🔽The evil-doer, the blood-spiller, he who would rob me of my wealth,

original: garbhādaṃ kaṇvaṃ nāśaya pṛśniparṇi sahasva ca ////
analyzed: garbhādam kaṇvam nāśaya pṛśniparṇi sahasva ca
translated: The Kanya-child, the embryo, O Prithiparna, destroy, and be thou strong.

original: girim enāṃ ā veśaya kaṇvān jīvitayopanān /
analyzed: girim enām ā veśaya kaṇvān jīvita yopanān
translated: Cast her down to the mountain, the Kanya-women who are near to life.

original: tāṃs tvaṃ devi pṛśniparṇy agnir ivānudahann ihi ////
analyzed: tān tvam devi pṛśniparṇi agniḥ iva anudahan ihi
translated: Go thou, O Goddess Prithiparna, and burn them up like fire.

original: parāca enān pra ṇuda kaṇvān jīvitayopanān /
analyzed: parācaḥ enān pra nuda kaṇvān jīvita yopanān
translated: Drive them away, drive off the Kanya-women who are near to life.

original: tamāṃsi yatra gachanti tat kravyādo ajīgamam ////
analyzed: tamāṃsi yatra gachanti tat kravyādaḥ ajīgamam
translated: To the darkness whither they go, thither have I brought the flesh-devourer.

original: eha yantu paśavo ye pareyur vāyur yeṣāṃ sahacāraṃ jujoṣa /🔽tvaṣṭā yeṣāṃ rūpadheyāni vedāsmin tān goṣṭhe savitā ni yachatu ////
analyzed: ā iha yantu paśavaḥ ye pareyuḥ vāyuḥ yeṣām sahacāram jujoṣa  tvaṣṭā yeṣām rūpadheyāni veda asmin tān goṣṭhe savitā ni yacchatu
translated: Let the cattle come hither that have gone away, let the wind be friendly to those that have remained.🔽Let Tvashtar know their forms, let Savitar place them in this pen.

original: imaṃ goṣṭhaṃ paśavaḥ saṃ sravantu bṛhaspatir ā nayatu prajānan /
analyzed: imam goṣṭham paśavaḥ sam sravantu bṛhaspatiḥ ā nayatu prajānan
translated: Let the cattle come together into this pen, let Brihaspati bring them, knowing the way.

original: sinīvālī nayatv āgram eṣām ājagmuṣo anumate ni yacha ////
analyzed: sinīvālī nayatu ā agram eṣām ājagmuṣaḥ anumate ni yaccha
translated: Let Sinivali lead their leader, let Anumati place them that have come.

original: saṃ saṃ sravantu paśavaḥ sam aśvāḥ sam u pūruṣāḥ /
analyzed: sam sam sravantu paśavaḥ sam aśvāḥ sam u pūruṣāḥ
translated: Let the cattle come together, let the horses come together, let the men come together.

original: saṃ dhānyasya yā sphātiḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi ////
analyzed: sam dhānyasya yā sphātiḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi
translated: I offer with the oblation of the Samasrava the abundance of grain.

original: saṃ siñcāmi gavāṃ kṣīram sam ājyena balam rasam /
analyzed: sam siñcāmi gavām kṣīram sam ājyena balam rasam
translated: I mix together the milk of the cows, I mix together the strength and sap with the ghee.

original: saṃsiktā asmākaṃ vīrā dhruvā gāvo mayi gopatau ////
analyzed: saṃsiktāḥ asmākam vīrāḥ dhruvāḥ gāvaḥ mayi gopatau
translated: Our heroes are sprinkled, the cows are firm in me, the lord of the cows.

original: ā harāmi gavāṃ kṣīram āhārṣaṃ dhānyaṃ rasam /
analyzed: ā harāmi gavām kṣīram āhārṣam dhānyam rasam
translated: I bring the milk of the cows, I have brought the sap of the grain.

original: āhṛtā asmākaṃ vīrā ā patnīr idam astakam ////🔽nec chatruḥ prāśaṃ jayāti sahamānābhibhūr asi /🔽prāśaṃ pratiprāśo jahy arasān kṛṇv oṣadhe ////
analyzed: āhṛtāḥ asmākam vīrāḥ ā patnīḥ idam astakam  na id śatruḥ prāśam jayāti sahamāna abhibhūḥ asi  prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe
translated: Our heroes are brought, the wives are brought to this highest place.🔽Let not the enemy prevail over the food, thou art the conqueror, the overcomer.🔽Cast away the food, the counter-food, make the herbs sapless.

original: suparṇas tvānv avindat sūkaras tvākhanan nasā /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ tvā anu avindat sūkaraḥ tvā akhanat nasā
translated: The eagle found thee, the boar dug thee up with his nose.

original: prāśaṃ pratiprāśo jahy arasān kṛṇv oṣadhe ////
analyzed: prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe
translated: Drive out the poison, drive out the counter-poison, make the plant powerless.

original: indro ha cakre tvā bāhāv asurebhya starītave /🔽prāśaṃ pratiprāśo jahy arasān kṛṇv oṣadhe ////🔽pāṭām indro vy āśnād asurebhya starītave /
analyzed: indraḥ ha cakre tvā bāhau asurebhyaḥ starītave  prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe  pāṭām indraḥ vi āśnāt asurebhyaḥ starītave
translated: Indra made thee his arms to wield against the Asuras, O Stainer.🔽Drive out the poison, drive out the counter-poison, make the plant powerless.🔽Indra broke the pot to pieces for the Asuras, O Stainer.

original: prāśaṃ pratiprāśo jahy arasān kṛṇv oṣadhe ////
analyzed: prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe
translated: Drive out the poison, drive out the counter-poison, make the plant powerless.

original: tayāhaṃ śatrūnt sākṣa indraḥ sālāvṛkāṃ iva /
analyzed: tayā aham śatrūn sākṣe indraḥ śālāvṛkān iva
translated: With that I crush my foes as Indra crushed the wolves of Sālā.

original: prāśaṃ pratiprāśo jahy arasān kṛṇv oṣadhe ////
analyzed: prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe
translated: Drive out the poison, drive out the counter-poison, make the plant powerless.

original: rudra jalāṣabheṣaja nīlaśikhaṇḍa karmakṛt /🔽prāśaṃ pratiprāśo jahy arasān kṛṇv oṣadhe ////
analyzed: prāśam pratiprāśaḥ jahi arasān kṛṇu oṣadhe
translated: O Rudra, Jalaṣa, the healer, O thou with blue-crested locks, the worker of deeds,🔽Drive out the poison, drive out the counter-poison, make the plant powerless.

original: tasya prāśaṃ tvaṃ jahi yo na indrābhidāsati /
analyzed: tasya prāśam tvam jahi yaḥ naḥ indra abhidāsati
translated: Drive out the poison of him who hates us, O Indra, and make him powerless.

original: adhi no brūhi śaktibhiḥ prāśi mām uttaraṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: adhi naḥ brūhi śaktibhiḥ prāśi mām uttaram kṛdhi
translated: Speak to us with thy powers, make me the uppermost in the feast.

original: tubhyam eva jariman vardhatām ayam memam anye mṛtyavo hiṃsiṣuḥ śataṃ ye /
analyzed: tubhyam eva jariman vardhatām ayam mā imam anye mṛtyavaḥ hiṃsiṣuḥ śatam ye
translated: Let this one only grow old for thee, O Jarimant, let not the other deaths harm him, the hundred that are here.

original: māteva putraṃ pramanā upasthe mitra enaṃ mitriyāt pātv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: mātā iva putram pramanāḥ upasthe mitraḥ enam mitriyāt pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: As a mother with loving heart in her lap holds her son, so may Mitra deliver him from the foe's destruction.

original: mitra enaṃ varuṇo vā riśādā jarāmṛtyuṃ kṛṇutāṃ saṃvidānau /
analyzed: mitraḥ enam varuṇaḥ vā riśādāḥ jarā mṛtyum kṛṇutām saṃvidānau
translated: May Mitra and Varuna, the enemies' slayers, in accord, make him subject to old age and death.

original: tad agnir hotā vayunāni vidvān viśvā devānāṃ janimā vivakti ////
analyzed: tat agniḥ hotā vayunāni vidvān viśvā devānām janimā vivakti
translated: This is what the priest Agni, knowing the ordinances, declares, the birth of all the gods.

original: tvam īśiṣe paśūnām pārthivānāṃ ye jātā uta vā ye janitrāḥ /
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe paśūnām pārthivānām ye jātāḥ uta vā ye janitrāḥ
translated: You are the lord of the earthly animals, those born and those yet to be born.

original: memaṃ prāṇo hāsīn mo apāno memaṃ mitrā vadhiṣur mo amitrāḥ ////
analyzed: mā imam prāṇaḥ hāsīt mā u apānaḥ mā imam mitrāḥ vadhiṣuḥ mā u amitrāḥ
translated: Let not my in-breathing leave him, let not my out-breathing. Let not the friends slay him, let not the enemies.

original: dyauṣ ṭvā pitā pṛthivī mātā jarāmṛtyuṃ kṛṇutāṃ saṃvidāne /
analyzed: dyauḥ tvā pitā pṛthivī mātā jarā mṛtyum kṛṇutām saṃvidāne
translated: Let your father Dyaus and your mother Prithivī, in accord, make him subject to old age and death.

original: yathā jīvā aditer upasthe prāṇāpānābhyāṃ gupitaḥ śataṃ himāḥ ////
analyzed: yathā jīvāḥ aditeḥ upasthe prāṇa apānābhyām gupitaḥ śatam himāḥ
translated: That he may live a hundred winters, guarded by in-breathing and out-breathing, in the lap of Aditi, the living.

original: imam agne āyuṣe varcase naya priyaṃ reto varuṇa mitra rājan /
analyzed: imam agne āyuṣe varcase naya priyam retaḥ varuṇa mitra rājan
translated: Lead him, O Agni, to long life and splendour. Make him dear, O Varuna, Mitra, king, as seed.

original: mātevāsmā adite śarma yacha viśve devā jaradaṣṭir yathāsat ////
analyzed: mātā iva asmai adite śarma yaccha viśve devāḥ jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asat
translated: Grant him protection, O Aditi, as a mother. May all the gods be with him, that his life may last a hundred winters.

original: pārthivasya rase devā bhagasya tanvo bale /
analyzed: pārthivasya rase devāḥ bhagasya tanvaḥ bale
translated: In the earthly essence, O gods, in the strength of Bhaga's body,

original: āyuṣyam asmā agniḥ sūryo varca ā dhād bṛhaspatiḥ ////
analyzed: āyuṣyam asmai agniḥ sūryaḥ varcaḥ ā dhāt bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: May Agni give him life, may Surya bestow splendour on him, may Brihaspati.

original: āyur asmai dhehi jātavedaḥ prajāṃ tvaṣṭar adhinidhehi asmai /
analyzed: āyuḥ asmai dhehi jātavedaḥ prajām tvaṣṭar adhinidhehi asmai
translated: Bestow life on him, O all-knower. Place offspring in him, O Tvashtar.

original: rāyas poṣaṃ savitar ā suvāsmai śataṃ jīvāti śaradas tavāyam ////
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣam savitar ā suva asmai śatam jīvāti śaradaḥ tava ayam
translated: O Savitar, bring to him the increase of wealth. May he live a hundred autumns for thee.

original: āśīr ṇa ūrjam uta sauprajāstvaṃ dakṣaṃ dhattaṃ draviṇaṃ sacetasau /
analyzed: āśīḥ naḥ ūrjam uta sauprajāstvam dakṣam dhattam draviṇam sacetasau
translated: Grant him blessing, strength, and good offspring, ye two, and power, and riches, ye who are of one mind.

original: jayam kṣetrāṇi sahasāyam indra kṛṇvāno anyān adharānt sapatnān ////
analyzed: jayam kṣetrāṇi sahasā ayam indra kṛṇvānaḥ anyān adharān sapatnān
translated: Having made the fields victorious, O Indra, and our foes lower,

original: indreṇa datto varuṇena śiṣṭo marudbhir ugraḥ prahito no āgan /
analyzed: indreṇa dattaḥ varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ marudbhiḥ ugraḥ prahitaḥ naḥ āgan
translated: Given by Indra, appointed by Varuna, sent by the Maruts, he hath come to us.

original: eṣa vāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe mā kṣudhan mā tṛṣat ////
analyzed: eṣa vām dyāvāpṛthivī upasthe mā kṣudhat mā tṛṣat
translated: On your lap, O Heaven and Earth, let him not hunger, let him not thirst.

original: ūrjam asmā ūrjasvatī dhattaṃ payo asmai payasvatī dhattam /
analyzed: ūrjam asmai ūrjasvatī dhattam payaḥ asmai payasvatī dhattam
translated: Ye two, rich in strength, grant him strength; ye two, rich in milk, grant him milk.

original: ūrjam asmai dyāvapṛthivī adhātāṃ viśve devā maruta ūrjam āpaḥ ////🔽śivābhiṣ ṭe hṛdayaṃ tarpayāmy anamīvo modiṣīṣṭhāḥ suvarcāḥ /
analyzed: ūrjam asmai dyāva pṛthivī adhātām viśve devāḥ marutaḥ ūrjam āpaḥ  śivābhiḥ te hṛdayam tarpayāmi anamīvaḥ modiṣīṣṭhāḥ su varcāḥ
translated: May Heaven and Earth grant him strength; may the All-gods, the Maruts, the waters grant strength.🔽With auspicious (waters) I gratify thy heart; be thou joyful, of good courage, and free from disease.

original: savāsinau pibatāṃ mantham etam aśvino rūpaṃ paridhāya māyām ////
analyzed: sa vāsinau pibatām mantham etam aśvinoḥ rūpam paridhāya māyām
translated: Let the two Asvins, having put on the form and magic power of the Asvins, drink this drink.

original: indra etāṃ sasṛje viddho agra ūrjāṃ svadhām ajarāṃ sā ta eṣā /
analyzed: indraḥ etām sasṛje viddhaḥ agre ūrjām svadhām ajarām sā te eṣā
translated: This strength, this food, this undecaying (food) Indra created in the beginning. It is thine.

original: tayā tvaṃ jīva śaradaḥ suvarcā mā ta ā susrod bhiṣajas te akran ////
analyzed: tayā tvam jīva śaradaḥ su varcāḥ mā te ā susrot bhiṣajaḥ te akran
translated: Therewith live thou a hundred autumns, of good courage. The physicians have made thee free from disease.

original: yathedaṃ bhūmyā adhi tṛṇaṃ vāto mathāyati /
analyzed: yathā idam bhūmyāḥ adhi tṛṇam vātaḥ mathāyati
translated: As the wind smites the grass that grows upon the ground,

original: evā mathnāmi te mano yathā māṃ kāminy aso yathā man nāpagā asaḥ ////
analyzed: eva mathnāmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagā asaḥ
translated: Even so I smite thy mind that thou mayst love me, that thou mayst not leave me, that thou mayst not go away from me.

original: saṃ cen nayātho aśvinā kāminā saṃ ca vakṣathaḥ /
analyzed: sam ced nayāthaḥ aśvinā kāminā sam ca vakṣathaḥ
translated: If ye, O Asvins, lead her to the man who loves her, and bring him to her,

original: saṃ vāṃ bhagāso agmata saṃ cittāni sam u vratā ////
analyzed: sam vām bhagāsaḥ agmata sam cittāni sam u vratā
translated: Your blessings have come together, your thoughts and your purposes are in unison.

original: yat suparṇā vivakṣavo anamīvā vivakṣavaḥ /
analyzed: yat suparṇāḥ vivakṣavaḥ anamīvāḥ vivakṣavaḥ
translated: When the birds of the air, the birds that fly without disease,

original: tatra me gachatād dhavaṃ śalya iva kulmalaṃ yathā ////
analyzed: tatra me gacchatāt dhavam śalyaḥ iva kulmalam yathā
translated: There let my call go forth, as a dart goes forth from the bow.

original: yad antaraṃ tad bāhyaṃ yad bāhyaṃ tad antaram /
analyzed: yat antaram tat bāhyam yat bāhyam tat antaram
translated: What is within is without, what is without is within.

original: kanyānāṃ viśvarūpāṇāṃ mano gṛbhāyauṣadhe ////🔽eyam agan patikāmā janikāmo 'ham āgamam /
analyzed: kanyānām viśva rūpāṇām manaḥ gṛbhāya oṣadhe  ā iyam agan pati kāmā jani kāmaḥ ham āgamam
translated: O plant, seize the mind of the maidens of all forms.🔽She has come, longing for a husband; I have come, longing for a son.

original: aśvaḥ kanikradad yathā bhagenāhaṃ sahāgamam ////
analyzed: aśvaḥ kanikradat yathā bhagena aham saha agamam
translated: As a neighing horse, with Bhaga I have come.

original: indrasya yā mahī dṛṣat krimer viśvasya tarhaṇī /
analyzed: indrasya yā mahī dṛṣad krimeḥ viśvasya tarhaṇī
translated: The great stone of Indra, the slayer of all worms,

original: tayā pinaṣmi saṃ krimīn dṛṣadā khalvāṃ iva ////
analyzed: tayā pinaṣmi sam krimīn dṛṣadā khalvān iva
translated: With that I crush the worms, as with a stone a potsherd.

original: dṛṣṭam adṛṣṭam atṛham atho kurūrum atṛham /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam a dṛṣṭam atṛham atho kurūrum atṛham
translated: I have slain the seen and the unseen, and also the Kurūra worm.

original: algaṇḍūnt sarvān chalunān krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi ////
analyzed: algaṇḍūn sarvān chalunān krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi
translated: All the worms, the Algaṇḍus and the Śalunas, we crush with a spell.

original: algaṇḍūn hanmi mahatā vadhena dūnā adūnā arasā abhūvan /
analyzed: algaṇḍūn hanmi mahatā vadhena dūnāḥ a dūnāḥ arasāḥ abhūvan
translated: I slay the toothless worms with a great slaughter; the discontented and the contented have become powerless.

original: śiṣṭān aśiṣṭān ni tirāmi vācā yathā krimīṇāṃ nakir uchiṣātai ////
analyzed: śiṣṭān a śiṣṭān ni tirāmi vācā yathā krimīṇām nakir uchiṣātai
translated: I drive away the worms with my speech, the good and the bad, so that not one of them may rise up again.

original: anvāntryaṃ śīrṣaṇyam atho pārṣṭeyaṃ krimīn /
analyzed: anvāntryam śīrṣaṇyam atha u pārṣṭeyam krimīn
translated: The worms that are in the entrails, in the head, and in the sides,

original: avaskavaṃ vyadhvaraṃ krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi ////
analyzed: avaskavam vyadhvaram krimīn vacasā jambhayāmasi
translated: The worms that are in the anus and in the privy, we crush with our speech.

original: ye krimayaḥ parvateśu vaneṣv oṣadhīṣu paśuṣv apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: ye krimayaḥ parvateṣu vaneṣu oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar
translated: The worms that are in the mountains, in the woods, in the plants, in the cattle, in the waters within,

original: ye asmākaṃ tanvam āviviśuḥ sarvaṃ tad dhanmi janima krimīṇām ////
analyzed: ye asmākam tanvam āviviśuḥ sarvam tat dhanmi janima krimīṇām
translated: All those that have entered our body, I destroy all that, the whole race of worms.

original: udyann ādityaḥ krimīn hantu nimrocan hantu raśmibhiḥ /
analyzed: udyan ādityaḥ krimīn hantu nimrocan hantu raśmibhiḥ
translated: May the rising sun kill the worms, may it kill them as it shines with its rays.

original: ye antaḥ krimayo gavi ////
analyzed: ye antar krimayaḥ gavi
translated: The worms that are within the cow.

original: viśvarūpaṃ caturakṣaṃ krimiṃ sāraṅgam arjunam /
analyzed: viśva rūpam catur akṣam krimim sāraṅgam arjunam
translated: The worm of various forms, with four eyes, the variegated, the red,

original: śṛṇāmy asya pṛṣṭīr api vṛścāmi yac chiraḥ ////
analyzed: śṛṇāmi asya pṛṣṭīḥ api vṛścāmi yat śiraḥ
translated: I crush its back, I cut off its head.

original: atrivad vaḥ krimayo hanmi kaṇvavaj jamadagnivat /
analyzed: atri vat vaḥ krimayaḥ hanmi kaṇva vat jamadagni vat
translated: Like Atri I slay your worms, like Kanva, like Jamadagni.

original: agastyasya brahmaṇā saṃ pinaṣmy ahaṃ krimīn ////
analyzed: agastyasya brahmaṇā sam pinaṣmi aham krimīn
translated: With the holy power of Agastya I crush the worms.

original: hato rājā krimīṇām utaiṣāṃ sthapatir hataḥ /
analyzed: hataḥ rājā krimīṇām uta eṣām sthapatiḥ hataḥ
translated: Slain is the king of the worms, and their overlord is slain.

original: hato hatamātā krimir hatabhrātā hatasvasā ////
analyzed: hataḥ hata mātā krimiḥ hata bhrātā hata svasā
translated: The worm is slain, whose mother is slain, whose brother is slain, whose sister is slain,

original: hatāso asya veśaso hatāsaḥ pariveśasaḥ /
analyzed: hatāsaḥ asya veśasaḥ hatāsaḥ pariveśasaḥ
translated: Slain are his dwelling-places, slain are his surrounding places.

original: atho ye kṣullakā iva sarve te krimayo hatāḥ ////
analyzed: atho ye kṣullakāḥ iva sarve te krimayaḥ hatāḥ
translated: And all the little ones that are like flies, all these worms are slain.

original: pra te śṛṇāmi śṛṅge yābhyāṃ vitudāyasi /
analyzed: pra te śṛṇāmi śṛṅge yābhyām vitudāyasi
translated: I draw out thy horns with which thou dost gore,

original: bhinādmi te kuṣumbhaṃ yas te viṣadhānaḥ ////
analyzed: bhinādmi te kuṣumbham yaḥ te viṣa dhānaḥ
translated: I break thy tusk which is thy poison-receptacle.

original: akṣībhyāṃ te nāsikābhyāṃ karṇābhyāṃ chubukād adhi /
analyzed: akṣībhyām te nāsikābhyām karṇābhyām chubukāt adhi
translated: From thine eyes, from thy nostrils, from thine ears, from thy jaws,

original: yakṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyaṃ mastiṣkāj jihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te ////🔽grīvābhyas ta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt /
analyzed: yakṣmam śīrṣaṇyam mastiṣkāt jihvāyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te  grīvābhyaḥ te uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyaḥ anūkyāt
translated: From thy head, from thy brain, from thy tongue, I drive away thy pulmonary consumption.🔽From thy neck, from thy shoulders, from thy ribs, from thy hips,

original: yakṣmaṃ doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyāṃ bāhubhyāṃ vi vṛhāmi te ////🔽hṛdayāt te pari klomno halīkṣṇāt pārśvābhyām /
analyzed: yakṣmam doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyām bāhubhyām vi vṛhāmi te  hṛdayāt te pari klomnaḥ halīkṣṇāt pārśvābhyām
translated: From thy loins, from thy shoulders, from thy arms, I drive away thy pulmonary consumption.🔽From thy heart, from thy lungs, from thy spleen, from thy sides,

original: yakṣmaṃ matasnābhyāṃ plīhno yaknas te vi vṛhāmasi ////
analyzed: yakṣmam matasnābhyām plīhnaḥ yaknaḥ te vi vṛhāmasi
translated: From thy kidneys, from thy liver, we drive away thy pulmonary consumption.

original: āntrebhyas te gudābhyo vaniṣṭhor udarād adhi /🔽yakṣmaṃ kukṣibhyām plāśer nābhyā vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: āntrebhyaḥ te gudābhyaḥ vaniṣṭhoḥ udarāt adhi  yakṣmam kukṣibhyām plāśeḥ nābhyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From thy bowels, from thy entrails, from thy rectum, from thy belly,🔽From thy belly, from thy bladder, from thy navel, I drive away thy pulmonary consumption.

original: ūrubhyāṃ te aṣṭhīvadbhyāṃ pārṣṇibhyāṃ prapadābhyām /
analyzed: ūrubhyām te aṣṭhīvadbhyām pārṣṇibhyām prapadābhyām
translated: From thy thighs, from thy knee-bones, from thy ankles, from thy hoofs,

original: yakṣmaṃ bhasadyaṃ śroṇibhyāṃ bhāsadaṃ bhaṃsaso vi vṛhāmi te ////🔽asthibhyas te majjabhyaḥ snāvabhyo dhamanibhyaḥ /🔽yakṣmam pāṇibhyām aṅgulibhyo nakhebhyo vi vṛhāmi te ////🔽aṅgeaṅge lomnilomni yas te parvaṇiparvaṇi /
analyzed: yakṣmam bhasadyam śroṇibhyām bhāsadam bhaṃsasaḥ vi vṛhāmi te  asthibhyaḥ te majjabhyaḥ snāvabhyaḥ dhamanibhyaḥ  yakṣmam pāṇibhyām aṅgulibhyaḥ nakhebhyaḥ vi vṛhāmi te  aṅge aṅge lomni lomni yaḥ te parvaṇi parvaṇi

original: ye grāmyāḥ paśavo viśvarūpā virūpāḥ santo bahudhaikarūpāḥ /
analyzed: ye grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ viśva rūpāḥ virūpāḥ santaḥ bahudhā eka rūpāḥ
translated: Those domestic animals of all forms, though different, being of one form in many ways,

original: vāyuṣ ṭān agre pra mumoktu devaḥ prajāpatiḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ ////
analyzed: vāyuḥ tān agre pra mumoktu devaḥ prajāpatiḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ
translated: May the god Vayu first release them, Prajapati, rejoicing in offspring.

original: prajānantaḥ prati gṛhṇantu pūrve prāṇam aṅgebhyaḥ pary ācarantam /
analyzed: prajānantaḥ prati gṛhṇantu pūrve prāṇam aṅgebhyaḥ pari ācarantam
translated: May the ancient ones accept them, knowing them, the breath that moves around the limbs.

original: divaṃ gacha prati tiṣṭhā śarīraiḥ svargaṃ yāhi pathibhir devayānaiḥ ////
analyzed: divam gacha prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ svargam yāhi pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: Go to heaven, stand firm with your bodies, go to heaven by the paths of the gods.

original: ye bhakṣayanto na vasūny ānṛdhur yān agnayo anvatapyanta dhiṣṇyāḥ /
analyzed: ye bhakṣayantaḥ na vasūni ānṛdhuḥ yān agnayaḥ anvatapyanta dhiṣṇyāḥ
translated: Those who, while eating, did not enjoy the riches, whom the domestic fires followed in sorrow,

original: yā teṣām avayā duriṣṭiḥ sviṣṭiṃ nas tāṃ kṛṇavad viśvakarmā ////
analyzed: yā teṣām avayā duriṣṭiḥ su iṣṭim naḥ tām kṛṇavat viśvakarmā
translated: May that misfortune of theirs, O Visvakarman, make our sacrifice well-performed.

original: yajñapatim ṛṣayaḥ enasāhur nirbhaktaṃ prajā anutapyamānam /
analyzed: yajñapatim ṛṣayaḥ enasā āhuḥ nirbhaktam prajāḥ anutapyamānam
translated: The Rishis have condemned the sacrificer, abandoned by his people, burning with grief.

original: mathavyānt stokān apa yān rarādha saṃ naṣ ṭebhiḥ sṛjatu viśvakarmā ////
analyzed: mathavyān stokān apa yān rarādha sam naḥ tebhiḥ sṛjatu viśvakarmā
translated: The small fires that he has kindled, may Visvakarman unite us with them.

original: adānyānt somapān manyamāno yajñasya vidvānt samaye na dhīraḥ /
analyzed: a dānyān soma pān manyamānaḥ yajñasya vidvān samaye na dhīraḥ
translated: The niggardly, thinking themselves Soma-drinkers, the wise one at the sacrifice's meeting,

original: yad enaś cakṛvān baddha eṣa taṃ viśvakarman pra muñcā svastaye ////
analyzed: yat enaḥ cakṛvān baddhaḥ eṣa tam viśvakarman pra muñca svastaye
translated: The sin that he has committed, bound by that, O Visvakarman, release him for well-being.

original: ghorā ṛṣayo namo astv ebhyaś cakṣur yad eṣāṃ manasaś ca satyam /
analyzed: ghorāḥ ṛṣayaḥ namaḥ astu ebhyaḥ cakṣuḥ yat eṣām manasaḥ ca satyam
translated: To these terrible Rishis be homage, to the truth of their mind and their eye.

original: bṛhaspataye mahiṣa dyumann namo viśvakarman namas te pāhy asmān ////
analyzed: bṛhaspataye mahiṣa dyuman namaḥ viśvakarman namaḥ te pāhi asmān
translated: To Brihaspati, O mighty one, be homage, O all-worker, homage to thee. Protect us.

original: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtir mukhaṃ ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi /
analyzed: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtiḥ mukham ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi
translated: The eye of the sacrifice, the beginning, and the face, with speech, with the ear, with the mind I offer.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ vitataṃ viśvakarmaṇā devā yantu sumanasyamānāḥ ////🔽ā no agne sumatiṃ saṃbhalo gamed imāṃ kumārīṃ saha no bhagena /
analyzed: imam yajñam vitatam viśva karmaṇā devāḥ yantu sumanasyamānāḥ  ā naḥ agne sumatim saṃbhalaḥ gamet imām kumārīm saha naḥ bhagena
translated: Let the gods, well-disposed, come to this sacrifice spread out by Visvakarman.🔽O Agni, let the good will and favour come to us, and this maiden with our good fortune.

original: juṣṭā vareṣu samaneṣu valgur oṣaṃ patyā saubhagam astu asyai ////
analyzed: juṣṭā vareṣu samaneṣu valguḥ oṣam patyā saubhagam astu asyai
translated: Beloved among the suitors, charming in the assemblies, may she have good fortune with her husband.

original: somajuṣṭaṃ brahmajuṣṭam aryamnā saṃbhṛtaṃ bhagam /
analyzed: soma juṣṭam brahma juṣṭam aryamnā saṃbhṛtam bhagam
translated: The good fortune that is dear to Soma, dear to the Brahmans, gathered by the Aryaman,

original: dhātur devasya satyena kṛṇomi pativedanam ////
analyzed: dhātuḥ devasya satyena kṛṇomi pati vedanam
translated: By the truth of the god Dhatr I make the marriage-rite.

original: iyam agne nārī patim videṣṭa somo hi rājā subhagāṃ kṛṇoti /
analyzed: iyam agne nārī patim videṣṭa somaḥ hi rājā subhagām kṛṇoti
translated: This woman, O Agni, let her know her husband. For the good-natured Soma makes her fortunate.

original: suvānā putrān mahiṣī bhavāti gatvā patiṃ subhagā vi rājatu ////
analyzed: suvānā putrān mahiṣī bhavāti gatvā patim subhagā vi rājatu
translated: Having borne sons, let her be a great lady. Having gone to her husband, let her shine forth fortunate.

original: yathākharo maghavaṃś cārur eṣa priyo mṛgāṇāṃ suṣadā babhūva /
analyzed: yathā ākharaḥ maghavan cāruḥ eṣa priyaḥ mṛgāṇām suṣadā babhūva
translated: As the ass, O Maghavan, is a charming, dear beast of burden,

original: evā bhagasya juṣṭeyam astu nārī saṃpriyā patyāvirādhayantī ////
analyzed: eva bhagasya juṣṭā iyam astu nārī saṃpriyā patyā a virādhayantī
translated: So may this woman be dear to Bhaga, pleasing to her husband, not opposing him.

original: bhagasya nāvam ā roha pūrṇām anupadasvatīm /
analyzed: bhagasya nāvam ā roha pūrṇām anupadasvatīm
translated: Mount the boat of Bhaga, full and not to be emptied.

original: tayopapratāraya yo varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ ////
analyzed: tayā upapratāraya yaḥ varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ
translated: By it lead across the groom who is to be desired.

original: ā krandaya dhanapate varam āmanasaṃ kṛṇu /
analyzed: ā krandaya dhana pate varam āmanasam kṛṇu
translated: Make the groom cry, O lord of wealth, make his mind desirous.

original: sarvaṃ pradakṣiṇaṃ kṛṇu yo varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvam pradakṣiṇam kṛṇu yaḥ varaḥ pratikāmyaḥ
translated: Make everything favorable for the groom who is to be desired.

original: idaṃ hiraṇyaṃ gulgulv ayam aukṣo atho bhagaḥ /🔽ete patibhyas tvām aduḥ pratikāmāya vettave //
analyzed: idam hiraṇyam gulgulū ayam aukṣaḥ atha u bhagaḥ  ete patibhyaḥ tvām aduḥ pratikāmāya vettave
translated: This gold, this bdellium, this ox, and also Bhaga,🔽these have given you to the husband, to the one who desires you in return.

original: ā te nayatu savitā nayatu patir yaḥ pratikāmyaḥ /
analyzed: ā te nayatu savitā nayatu patiḥ yaḥ pratikāmyaḥ
translated: May Savitar lead you, may the husband who is to be desired lead you.

original: agnir naḥ śatrūn praty etu vidvān pratidahann abhiśastim arātim /
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ śatrūn prati etu vidvān pratidahan abhiśastim arātim
translated: May Agni, the wise one, come to our enemies, burning, consuming the curse and hostility.

original: sa senāṃ mohayatu pareṣāṃ nirhastāṃś ca kṛṇavaj jātavedāḥ ////
analyzed: sa senām mohayatu pareṣām nirhastān ca kṛṇavat jātavedāḥ
translated: May he confuse the armies of others and make them powerless, O all-knowing one.

original: yūyam ugrā maruta īdṛśe sthābhi preta mṛṇata sahadhvam /
analyzed: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ īdṛśe stha abhi preta mṛṇata sahadhvam
translated: You fierce Maruts, go to such a place, strike, be united.

original: amīmṛṇan vasavo nāthitā ime agnir hy eṣāṃ dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān ////
analyzed: amīmṛṇan vasavaḥ nāthitāḥ ime agniḥ hi eṣām dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān
translated: The Vasus have struck down these who were helpless. Agni is their messenger, may he come wise.

original: amitrasenāṃ maghavann asmān chatrūyatīm abhi /
analyzed: amitra senām maghavan asmān śatrūyatīm abhi
translated: O Maghavan, the hostile army that is hostile to us,

original: yuvaṃ tām indra vṛtrahann agniś ca dahataṃ prati ////
analyzed: yuvam tām indra vṛtrahan agniḥ ca dahatam prati
translated: You two, O Indra, the Vrtra-slayer, and Agni, burn that one back.

original: prasūta indra pravatā haribhyāṃ pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇann etu śatrūn /
analyzed: prasūtaḥ indra pravatā haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇan etu śatrūn
translated: Impelled, O Indra, by the two bays, let thy thunderbolt go forth, crushing the enemies.

original: jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viṣvak satyaṃ kṛṇuhi cittam eṣām ////
analyzed: jahi pratīcaḥ anūcaḥ parācaḥ viṣvak satyam kṛṇuhi cittam eṣām
translated: Destroy the western and northern words, make their hearts true on every side.

original: indra senāṃ mohayāmitrāṇām /
analyzed: indra senām mohaya amitrāṇām
translated: O Indra, confuse the army of the enemies.

original: agner vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūco vi nāśaya ////
analyzed: agneḥ vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūcaḥ vi nāśaya
translated: By the speed of Agni and Vata, scatter them in all directions.

original: indraḥ senāṃ mohayatu maruto ghnantv ojasā /🔽cakṣūṃsy agnir ā dattāṃ punar etu parājitā ////
analyzed: indraḥ senām mohayatu marutaḥ ghnantu ojasā  cakṣūṃsi agniḥ ā dattām punar etu parājitā
translated: May Indra confuse the army, may the Maruts slay with their might.🔽May Agni give them sight, may they return defeated.

original: agnir no dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān pratidahann abhiśastim arātim /
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ dūtaḥ pratyetu vidvān pratidahan abhiśastim arātim
translated: May Agni, the wise messenger, return to us, burning back the curse and hostility.

original: sa cittāni mohayatu pareṣāṃ nirhastāṃś ca kṛṇavaj jātavedāḥ ////
analyzed: sa cittāni mohayatu pareṣām nirhastān ca kṛṇavat jātavedāḥ
translated: May he confuse the minds of the others, and make them handless, O all-knowing one.

original: ayam agnir amūmuhad yāni cittāni vo hṛdi /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ amūmuhat yāni cittāni vaḥ hṛdi
translated: This Agni has confused whatever thoughts are in your heart.

original: vi vo dhamatv okasaḥ pra vo dhamatu sarvataḥ ////
analyzed: vi vaḥ dhamatu okasaḥ pra vaḥ dhamatu sarvatas
translated: May he blow apart your dwellings, may he blow them apart on every side.

original: indra cittāni mohayann arvāṅ ākūtyā cara /
analyzed: indra cittāni mohayan arvāṅ ākūtyā cara
translated: O Indra, confusing their thoughts, move hither with the intention.

original: agner vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūco vi nāśaya ////
analyzed: agneḥ vātasya dhrājyā tān viṣūcaḥ vi nāśaya
translated: By the speed of Agni and Vata, scatter them in all directions.

original: vy ākūtaya eṣām itātho cittāni muhyata /
analyzed: vi ākūtayaḥ eṣām ita atha u cittāni muhyata
translated: Their intentions have departed, their thoughts are confused.

original: atho yad adyaiṣāṃ hṛdi tad eṣāṃ pari nir jahi ////🔽amīṣāṃ cittāni pratimohayantī gṛhāṇāṅgāny apve parehi /
analyzed: atha u yat adya eṣām hṛdi tat eṣām pari niḥ jahi  amīṣām cittāni pratimohayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi
translated: And whatever is in their hearts today, drive that away from them.🔽Confusing the minds of these, O Apva, take away their limbs and depart.

original: abhi prehi nir daha hṛtsu śokair grāhyāmitrāṃs tamasā vidhya śatrūn ////
analyzed: abhi prehi niḥ daha hṛtsu śokaiḥ grāhya amitrān tamasā vidhya śatrūn
translated: Go forth and burn them in their hearts with grief. Strike down the enemies with darkness and pierce the foes.

original: asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām asmān aity abhy ojasā spardhamānā /
analyzed: asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām asmān aiti abhī ojasā spardhamānā
translated: That army of the others, O Maruts, which comes to us, challenging us with might,

original: tām vidhyata tamasāpavratena yathaiṣām anyo anyaṃ na jānāt ////
analyzed: tām vidhyata tamasā apavratena yathā eṣām anyaḥ anyam na jānāt
translated: Pierce it with darkness and with Apvavat, so that one of them may not know another.

original: acikradat svapā iha bhuvad agne vy acasva rodasī urūcī /
analyzed: acikradat su apāḥ iha bhuvat agne vi acasva rodasī urūcī
translated: Here, O Agni, be thou the impeller, the inspirer, the supporter, the protector, the nourisher, the giver of wealth, the lord of the house.

original: yuñjantu tvā maruto viśvavedasa āmuṃ naya namasā rātahavyam ////
analyzed: yuñjantu tvā marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ ā amum naya namasā rāta havyam
translated: Let the Maruts yoke thee, O all-knowing one, lead him who offers worship with reverence.

original: dūre cit santam aruṣāsa indram ā cyāvayantu sakhyāya vipram /
analyzed: dūre cit santam aruṣāsaḥ indram ā cyāvayantu sakhyāya vipram
translated: Even though he be far away, let the red ones bring Indra, the sage, to us for friendship,

original: yad gāyatrīṃ bṛhatīm arkam asmai sautrāmaṇyā dadhṛṣanta devāḥ ////
analyzed: yat gāyatrīm bṛhatīm arkam asmai sautrāmaṇyā dadhṛṣanta devāḥ
translated: When the gods have dared to give him this Gayatri, the great hymn, with the Sautrāmaṇī.

original: adbhyas tvā rāja varuṇo hvayatu somas tvā hvayatu parvatebhyaḥ /
analyzed: adbhyaḥ tvā rāja varuṇaḥ hvayatu somaḥ tvā hvayatu parvatebhyaḥ
translated: Let king Varuna summon thee from the waters, let Soma summon thee from the mountains.

original: indras tvā hvayatu viḍbhya ābhyaḥ śyeno bhūtvā viśa ā patemāḥ ////
analyzed: indraḥ tvā hvayatu viḍbhyaḥ ābhyaḥ śyenaḥ bhūtvā viśaḥ ā pata imāḥ
translated: Let Indra summon thee from these people. Become a hawk and fly down to the people.

original: śyeno havyaṃ nayatv ā parasmād anyakṣetre aparuddhaṃ carantam /
analyzed: śyenaḥ havyam nayatu ā parasmāt anya kṣetre aparuddham carantam
translated: Let the hawk lead the offering away from here, him who roams in another's field, confined.

original: aśvinā panthāṃ kṛṇutāṃ sugaṃ ta imaṃ sajātā abhisaṃviśadhvam ////
analyzed: aśvinā panthām kṛṇutām su gam te imam sajātāḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam
translated: O Asvins, make his path easy for him. You kinsmen, sit down together.

original: hvayantu tvā pratijanāḥ prati mitrā avṛṣata /
analyzed: hvayantu tvā pratijanāḥ prati mitrāḥ avṛṣata
translated: Let the people call you, let the friends have intercourse with you.

original: indrāgnī viśve devās te viśi kṣemam adīdharan ////
analyzed: indra agnī viśve devāḥ te viśi kṣemam adīdharan  /
translated: Indra, Agni, all the gods have established you in your house in peace.

original: yas te havaṃ vivadat sajāto yaś ca niṣṭyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te havam vivadat sajātaḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ
translated: The kinsman who disputes with you for your call, and the stranger,

original: apāñcam indra taṃ kṛtvāthemam ihāva gamaya ////
analyzed: apāñcam indra tam kṛtvā atha imam iha ava gamaya
translated: Having made him go away, O Indra, then bring him here.

original: ā tvā gan rāṣtraṃ saha varcasod ihi prāṅ viśāṃ patir ekarāṭ tvaṃ vi rāja /
analyzed: ā tvā gan rāṣtram saha varcasā ud ihi prāṅ viśām patiḥ eka rāj tvam vi rāja
translated: Let the kingdom and splendor come to you. Go forward. As the sole king of the people, rule.

original: sarvās tvā rājan pradiśo hvayantūpasadyo namasyo bhaveha ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ tvā rājan pradiśaḥ hvayantu upasadyaḥ namasyaḥ bhava iha
translated: All the quarters call you, O king. Be one to be approached and worshipped.

original: tvāṃ viśo vṛṇatāṃ rājyāya tvām imāḥ pradiśaḥ pañca devīḥ /
analyzed: tvām viśaḥ vṛṇatām rājyāya tvām imāḥ pradiśaḥ pañca devīḥ
translated: Let the people choose you for kingship. Let these five divine quarters

original: varṣman rāṣṭrasya kakudi śrayasva tato na ugro vi bhajā vasūni ////
analyzed: varṣman rāṣṭrasya kakudi śrayasva tatas naḥ ugraḥ vi bhaja vasūni
translated: Settle you on the peak of the kingdom's body. From there, O mighty one, distribute the riches.

original: acha tvā yantu havinaḥ sajātā agnir dūto ajiraḥ saṃ carātai /
analyzed: acha tvā yantu havinaḥ sajātāḥ agniḥ dūtaḥ ajiraḥ sam carātai
translated: Let your kinsmen come to you for the sacrifice. Let Agni, the swift messenger, go with them.

original: jāyāḥ putrāḥ sumanaso bhavantu bahuṃ baliṃ prati paśyāsā ugraḥ ////
analyzed: jāyāḥ putrāḥ sumanasaḥ bhavantu bahum balim prati paśyāsai ugraḥ
translated: Let your wives and sons be well-disposed, look upon the great offering, O fierce one.

original: aśvinā tvāgre mitrāvaruṇobhā viśve devā marutas tvā hvayantu /
analyzed: aśvinā tvā agre mitrāvaruṇā ubhā viśve devāḥ marutaḥ tvā hvayantu
translated: May the Ashvins, Mitra, Varuna, all the gods, and the Maruts invoke you.

original: adhā mano vasudeyāya kṛṇuṣva tato na ugro vi bhajā vasūni ////
analyzed: adhā manaḥ vasu deyāya kṛṇuṣva tatas naḥ ugraḥ vi bhaja vasūni
translated: Turn your mind to bestowing wealth, then, O fierce one, distribute the riches among us.

original: ā pra drava paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām /
analyzed: ā pra drava paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ śive te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: Come running from the farthest end of the farthest, may both the auspicious heaven and earth be for you.

original: tad ayaṃ rājā varuṇas tathāha sa tvāyam ahvat sa upedam ehi ////
analyzed: tat ayam rājā varuṇaḥ tathā āha sa tvā ayam ahvat saḥ upa idam ehi
translated: Thus does this king Varuna say, he has called you, come now to this place.

original: indrendra manuṣyāḥ parehi saṃ hy ajñāsthā varuṇaiḥ saṃvidānaḥ /
analyzed: indra indra manuṣyāḥ parehi sam hi ajñāsthāḥ varuṇaiḥ saṃvidānaḥ
translated: O Indra, go to the men, for you are known together with Varuna, in agreement.

original: sa tvāyam ahvat sve sadhasthe sa devān yakṣat sa u kalpayad viśaḥ ////
analyzed: sa tvā ayam ahvat sve sadhasthe sa devān yakṣat saḥ u kalpayat viśaḥ
translated: He has called you to your own abode, he will worship the gods, he will establish the people.

original: pathyā revatīr bahudhā virūpāḥ sarvāḥ saṃgatya varīyas te akran /
analyzed: pathyāḥ revatīḥ bahudhā virūpāḥ sarvāḥ saṃgatya varīyaḥ te akran
translated: The many-formed, varied, auspicious paths, all of them, having come together, have made you better.

original: tās tvā sarvāḥ saṃvidānā hvayantu daśamīm ugraḥ sumanā vaśeha ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvā sarvāḥ saṃvidānāḥ hvayantu daśamīm ugraḥ sumanāḥ vaśā iha
translated: May all of them, in agreement, invoke you, be well-disposed, O fierce one, on the tenth day.

original: āyam agan parṇamaṇir balī balena pramṛṇant sapatnān /
analyzed: ā ayam agan parṇa maṇiḥ balī balena pramṛṇan sapatnān
translated: This powerful Parna jewel has come, crushing enemies with power.

original: ojo devānāṃ paya oṣadhīnāṃ varcasā mā jinvantv aprayāvan ////
analyzed: ojaḥ devānām payaḥ oṣadhīnām varcasā mā jinvantu a prayāvan
translated: The strength of the gods, the sap of the plants, may it invigorate me with radiance, O imperishable one.

original: mayi kṣatraṃ parṇamaṇe mayi dhārayatād rayim /
analyzed: mayi kṣatram parṇa maṇe mayi dhārayatāt rayim
translated: In me let the Kshatriya, in me let the Parna-stone hold wealth.

original: ahaṃ rāṣṭrasyābhīvarge nijo bhūyāsam uttamaḥ ////
analyzed: aham rāṣṭrasya abhīvarge nijaḥ bhūyāsam uttamaḥ
translated: May I be the best, the nearest, to the prosperity of the kingdom.

original: yaṃ nidadhur vanaspatau guhyaṃ devāḥ priyaṃ maṇim /
analyzed: yam nidadhuḥ vanaspatau guhyam devāḥ priyam maṇim
translated: The secret jewel which the gods have placed in the tree, which they love,

original: tam asmabhyaṃ sahāyuṣā devā dadatu bhartave ////
analyzed: tam asmabhyam saha āyuṣā devāḥ dadatu bhartave
translated: May the gods give to us for our support, together with life.

original: somasya parṇaḥ saha ugram āgann indreṇa datto varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: somasya parṇaḥ sahaḥ ugram āgan indreṇa dattaḥ varuṇena śiṣṭaḥ
translated: The Parna-stone of Soma has come with the fierce one, given by Indra, appointed by Varuna.

original: taṃ priyāsaṃ bahu rocamāno dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya ////🔽ā mārukṣat parṇamaṇir mahyā ariṣṭatātaye /
analyzed: tam priyāsam bahu rocamānaḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  ā mā ārukṣat parṇa maṇiḥ mahyai ariṣṭatātaye
translated: May it, much-loved, shining, give to me long life, to a hundred autumns.🔽May the Parna-jewel protect me for my safety and well-being,

original: yathāham uttaro 'sāny aryamṇa uta saṃvidaḥ ////
analyzed: yathā aham uttaraḥ sāni aryamṇaḥ uta saṃvidaḥ
translated: So that I may be superior, and have the favor of Aryaman.

original: ye dhīvāno rathakārāḥ karmārā ye manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye dhīvānaḥ rathakārāḥ karmārāḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The skillful chariot-makers, the blacksmiths, the wise ones,

original: upastīn parṇa mahyaṃ tvaṃ sarvān kṛṇv abhito janān ////
analyzed: upastīn parṇa mahyam tvam sarvān kṛṇu abhitas janān
translated: Make all the people around me obedient to me, O Parna.

original: ye rājāno rājakṛtaḥ sūtā grāmaṇyaś ca ye /🔽upastīn parṇa mahyaṃ tvaṃ sarvān kṛṇv abhito janān ////
analyzed: ye rājānaḥ rāja kṛtaḥ sūtāḥ grāmaṇyaḥ ca ye  upastīn parṇa mahyam tvam sarvān kṛṇu abhitas janān
translated: The kings, the appointed kings, the charioteers, the village chiefs,🔽Make all the people around me obedient to me, O Parna.

original: parṇo 'si tanūpānaḥ sayonir vīro vīreṇa mayā /
analyzed: parṇaḥ si tanū pānaḥ sa yoniḥ vīraḥ vīreṇa mayā
translated: You are the Parna, the protector of the body, the hero with his own womb, by me the hero.

original: saṃvatsarasya tejasā tena badhnāmi tvā maṇe ////
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya tejasā tena badhnāmi tvā maṇe
translated: By the splendor of the year, with that I bind you, O jewel.

original: pumān puṃsaḥ parijāto 'śvatthaḥ khadirād adhi /🔽sa hantu śatrūn māmakān yān ahaṃ dveṣmi ye ca mām ////
analyzed: pumān puṃsaḥ parijātaḥ śvatthaḥ khadirāt adhi  sa hantu śatrūn māmakān yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām
translated: The man is born from man, the holy fig tree from the Khadira.🔽May it slay my enemies, those whom I hate and those who hate me.

original: tān aśvattha niḥ śṛṇīhi śatrūn vaibādhadodhataḥ /
analyzed: tān aśvattha niḥ śṛṇīhi śatrūn vaibādha dodhataḥ
translated: O holy fig tree, crush those enemies, the oppressors, as they oppress me.

original: indreṇa vṛtraghnā medī mitreṇa varuṇena ca ////
analyzed: indreṇa vṛtra ghnā medī mitreṇa varuṇena ca
translated: With Indra, the slayer of Vrtra, with Mitra, with Varuna,

original: yathāśvattha nirabhano 'ntar mahaty arṇave /
analyzed: yathā aśvattha antar mahati arṇave
translated: As the holy fig tree is uninjured in the great ocean,

original: evā tānt sarvān nir bhaṅgdhi yān ahaṃ dveṣmi ye ca mām ////
analyzed: eva tān sarvān niḥ bhaṅgdhi yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām
translated: So crush all of them, those whom I hate and those who hate me.

original: yaḥ sahamānaś carasi sāsahāna iva ṛṣabhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sahamānaḥ carasi sāsahānaḥ iva ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: You who move about conquering, as if conquering, O bull,

original: tenāśvattha tvayā vayaṃ sapatnānt sahiṣīmahi ////
analyzed: tena aśvattha tvayā vayam sapatnān sahiṣīmahi
translated: By you, O holy fig tree, may we conquer our enemies.

original: sinātv enān nirṛtir mṛtyoḥ pāśair amokyaiḥ /
analyzed: sinātu enān nirṛtiḥ mṛtyoḥ pāśaiḥ amokyaiḥ
translated: Let Nirṛti bind them with the unloosening bonds of death,

original: aśvattha śatrūn māmakān yān ahaṃ dveṣmi ye ca mām ////
analyzed: aśvattha śatrūn māmakān yān aham dveṣmi ye ca mām
translated: O holy fig tree, my enemies, those whom I hate and those who hate me.

original: yathāśvattha vānaspatyān ārohan kṛṇuṣe 'dharān /
analyzed: yathā aśvattha vānaspatyān ārohan kṛṇuṣe dharān
translated: As you, O holy fig tree, crush the other trees when you rise up,

original: evā me śatror mūrdhānaṃ viṣvag bhinddhi sahasva ca ////
analyzed: eva me śatroḥ mūrdhānam viṣvak bhinddhi sahasva ca
translated: So crush and conquer the head of my enemy in all directions.

original: te 'dharāñcaḥ pra plavantāṃ chinnā naur iva bandhanāt /
analyzed: te dharāñcaḥ pra plavantām chinnā nauḥ iva bandhanāt
translated: May they sink downwards, like a boat cut from its moorings.

original: na vaibādhapraṇuttānāṃ punar asti nivartanam ////
analyzed: na vaibādha praṇuttānām punar asti nivartanam
translated: For those driven away by the oppressor, there is no return.

original: praiṇān nude manasā pra cittenota brahmaṇā /🔽praiṇān vṛkṣasya śākhayāśvatthasya nudāmahe ////
analyzed: pra enān nude manasā pra cittena uta brahmaṇā  pra enān vṛkṣasya śākhayā aśvatthasya nudāmahe
translated: With my mind, with my thought, and with prayer,🔽with the branch of the tree, with the branch of the holy fig tree, we drive them away.

original: hariṇasya raghuṣyado 'dhi śīrṣaṇi bheṣajam /
analyzed: hariṇasya raghuṣyadaḥ dhi śīrṣaṇi bheṣajam
translated: The swift-moving deer's medicine on the head,

original: sa kṣetriyaṃ viṣāṇayā viṣūcīnam anīnaśat ////
analyzed: sa kṣetriyam viṣāṇayā viṣūcīnam anīnaśat
translated: it has destroyed the disease in the horns, the disease in the body.

original: anu tvā hariṇo vṛṣā padbhiś caturbhir akramīt /
analyzed: anu tvā hariṇaḥ vṛṣā padbhiḥ caturbhiḥ akramīt
translated: The tawny bull has stepped after thee with his four feet,

original: viṣāṇe vi ṣya guṣpitaṃ yad asya kṣetriyaṃ hṛdi ////
analyzed: viṣāṇe vi sya guṣpitam yat asya kṣetriyam hṛdi
translated: the disease that is in the horns, the disease that is in the heart.

original: ado yad avarocate catuṣpakṣam iva chadiḥ /
analyzed: adaḥ yat avarocate catuṣpakṣam iva chadiḥ
translated: What shines forth from here, like a roof with four slopes,

original: tenā te sarvaṃ kṣetriyam aṅgebhyo nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: tena te sarvam kṣetriyam aṅgebhyaḥ nāśayāmasi
translated: with that we drive away all thy disease from thy limbs.
