original: amū ye divi subhage vicṛtau nāma tārake /
analyzed: amū ye divi subhage vicṛtau nāma tārake
translated: Those two in the sky, O auspicious ones, named Vicṛtā and Tārā,

original: vi kṣetriyasya muñcatām adhamaṃ pāśam uttamam ////
analyzed: vi kṣetriyasya muñcatām adhamam pāśam uttamam
translated: may they release thee from the disease, the lower bond and the upper.

original: āpa id vā u bheṣajīr āpo amīvacātanīḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ id vai u bheṣajīḥ āpaḥ amīva cātanīḥ
translated: The waters are indeed the medicines, the waters the removers of disease,

original: āpo viśvasya bheṣajīs tās tvā muñcantu kṣetriyāt ////
analyzed: āpaḥ viśvasya bheṣajīḥ tāḥ tvā muñcantu kṣetriyāt
translated: the waters the healers of all; may they free thee from the disease.

original: yad āsuteḥ kriyamānāyāḥ kṣetriyaṃ tvā vyānaśe /
analyzed: yat āsuteḥ kriyamāṇāyāḥ kṣetriyam tvā vyānaśe
translated: If the disease has spread to thee from the one who is being purified,

original: vedāhaṃ tasya bheṣajaṃ kṣetriyaṃ nāśayāmi tvat ////
analyzed: veda aham tasya bheṣajam kṣetriyam nāśayāmi tvat
translated: I know the remedy for that; I remove the disease from thee.

original: apavāse nakṣatrāṇām apavāsa uṣasām uta /
analyzed: apavāse nakṣatrāṇām apavāse uṣasām uta
translated: I banish the disease of the stars, I banish the disease of the dawns,

original: apāsmat sarvaṃ durbhūtam apa kṣetriyam uchatu ////
analyzed: apa asmat sarvam durbhūtam apa kṣetriyam uchatu
translated: Drive away from us all evil, drive away the witchcraft.

original: ā yātu mitra ṛtubhiḥ kalpamānaḥ saṃveśayan pṛthivīm usriyābhiḥ /
analyzed: ā yātu mitraḥ ṛtubhiḥ kalpamānaḥ saṃveśayan pṛthivīm usriyābhiḥ
translated: May Mitra come to us with the seasons, arranging, making the earth rest on the cows.

original: athāsmabhyam varuṇo vāyur agnir bṛhad rāṣṭraṃ saṃveśyam dadhātu ////
analyzed: atha asmabhyam varuṇaḥ vāyuḥ agniḥ bṛhat rāṣṭram saṃveśyam dadhātu
translated: Then may Varuna, Vayu, and Agni bestow upon us a great kingdom to rest upon.

original: dhātā rātiḥ savitedaṃ juśantām indras tvaṣṭā prati haryantu me vacaḥ /
analyzed: dhātā rātiḥ savitā idam juśantām indraḥ tvaṣṭā prati haryantu me vacaḥ
translated: May Dhatr, Rati, Savitar approve this, may Indra, Tvashtar accept my words.

original: huve devīm aditiṃ śūraputrāṃ sajātānāṃ madhyameṣṭhā yathāsāni ////
analyzed: huve devīm aditim śūra putrām sajātānām madhyameṣṭhāḥ yathā asāni
translated: I invoke the Goddess Aditi, the mother of heroes, to be the chief in the midst of our kinsmen.

original: huve somaṃ savitāraṃ namobhir viśvān ādityāṃ aham uttaratve /
analyzed: huve somam savitāram namobhiḥ viśvān ādityān aham uttara tve
translated: I invoke Soma, Savitar, with salutations, all the Adityas, to be on our side.

original: ayam agnir dīdāyad dīrgham eva sajātair iddho 'pratibruvadbhiḥ ////
analyzed: ayam agniḥ dīdāyat dīrgham eva sajātaiḥ id ha u pratibruvadbhiḥ
translated: May this Agni shine forth for a long time, kindled by my kinsmen who do not contradict (me).

original: ihed asātha na paro gamātheryo gopāḥ puṣṭapatir va ājat /
analyzed: iha id asātha na paras gamātha iryaḥ gopāḥ puṣṭa patiḥ vaḥ ājat
translated: Here you have sat down, do not go away. The guardian who has come, the lord of increase,

original: asmai kāmāyopa kāminīr viśve vo devā upasaṃyantu ////
analyzed: asmai kāmāya upa kāminīḥ viśve vaḥ devāḥ upasaṃyantu
translated: For this desire, O you who are to be desired, may all the gods come together for you.

original: saṃ vo manāṃsi saṃ vratā sam ākūtīr namāmasi /
analyzed: sam vaḥ manāṃsi sam vratā sam ākūtīḥ namāmasi
translated: We bow together your minds, together your vows, together your counsels.

original: amī ye vivratā sthana tān vaḥ saṃ namayāmasi ////
analyzed: amī ye vivratāḥ sthana tān vaḥ sam namayāmasi
translated: Those of you who are divided, we bring together for you.

original: ahaṃ gṛbhṇāmi manasā manāṃsi mama cittam anu cittebhir eta /
analyzed: aham gṛbhṇāmi manasā manāṃsi mama cittam anu cittebhiḥ eta
translated: I grasp with my mind the minds (of men), and with my thoughts their thoughts.

original: mama vaśeṣu hṛdayāni vaḥ kṛṇomi mama yātam anuvartmāna eta ////
analyzed: mama vaśeṣu hṛdayāni vaḥ kṛṇomi mama yātam anuvartmānaḥ eta
translated: I make your hearts subject to me: come ye to me and follow me.

original: karśaphasya viśaphasya dyauḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā /
analyzed: karśaphasya viśaphasya dyauḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā
translated: The father of Karshâphya and Vish-shaphya is Dyaus, the mother is Prithivî.

original: yathābhicakra devās tathāpa kṛṇutā punaḥ ////
analyzed: yathā abhicakra devāḥ tathā apa kṛṇutā punar
translated: As the gods have made him so make him again.

original: aśreṣmāṇo adhārayan tathā tan manunā kṛtam /
analyzed: aśreṣmāṇaḥ adhārayan tathā tat manunā kṛtam
translated: They have set him up, the desirable one, so has Manu done that.

original: kṛṇomi vadhri viṣkandhaṃ muṣkābarho gavām iva ////
analyzed: kṛṇomi vadhri viṣkandham muṣkābarhaḥ gavām iva
translated: I make the impotent one strong, like the hair of the cow.

original: piśaṅge sūtre khṛgalaṃ tad ā badhnanti vedhasaḥ /
analyzed: piśaṅge sūtre khṛgalam tat ā badhnanti vedhasaḥ
translated: On the yellow thread the wise ones tie the cripple.

original: śravasyuṃ śuṣmaṃ kābavaṃ vadhriṃ kṛṇvantu bandhuraḥ ////
analyzed: śravasyum śuṣmam kābavam vadhrim kṛṇvantu bandhuraḥ
translated: Let the cripple make the strong one, the famous one, the son of Kâva, the friend.

original: yenā śravasyavaś caratha devā ivāsuramāyayā /
analyzed: yena śravasyavaḥ caratha devāḥ iva asura māyayā
translated: By which the desirable ones move, as the gods by the magic of the Asuras.

original: śunāṃ kapir iva dūṣaṇo bandhurā kābavasya ca ////
analyzed: śunām kapiḥ iva dūṣaṇaḥ bandhurā kābavasya ca
translated: The monkey of the dogs, the friend of the son of Kâva, the defiler.

original: duṣṭyai hi tvā bhatsyāmi dūṣayiṣyāmi kābavam /
analyzed: duṣṭyai hi tvā dūṣayiṣyāmi kābavam
translated: For I will eat thee for the sake of the defiled one, I will defile the son of Kâva.

original: ud āśavo rathā iva śapathebhiḥ sariṣyatha ////
analyzed: ud āśavaḥ rathāḥ iva śapathebhiḥ sariṣyatha
translated: Ye shall start up like swift chariots by the curses.

original: ekaśataṃ viṣkandhāni viṣṭhitā pṛthivīm anu /
analyzed: ekaśatam viṣkandhāni viṣṭhitā pṛthivīm anu
translated: A hundred and one impotent ones are scattered along the earth.

original: teṣāṃ tvām agre uj jaharur maṇiṃ viṣkandhadūṣaṇam ////🔽prathamā ha vy uvāsa sā dhenur abhavad yame /
analyzed: teṣām tvām agre ud jaharuḥ maṇim viṣkandha dūṣaṇam  prathamā ha vi uvāsa sā dhenuḥ abhavat yame
translated: They first raised thee up as a stone, the remover of the obstruction of the poison.🔽She who first dwelt apart became the cow of Yama.

original: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarāmuttarām samām ////
analyzed: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām uttarām samām
translated: May she yield us milk, may she yield us the highest, the highest year.

original: yāṃ devāḥ pratinandanti rātrim dhenum upāyatīm /
analyzed: yām devāḥ pratinandanti rātrim dhenum upāyatīm
translated: The night which the gods welcome as a cow coming nigh,

original: saṃvatsarasya yā patnī sā no astu sumaṅgalī ////🔽saṃvatsarasya pratimāṃ yāṃ tvā rātry upāsmahe /
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya yā patnī sā naḥ astu su maṅgalī  saṃvatsarasya pratimām yām tvā rātri upāsmahe
translated: may she, the wife of the year, be auspicious to us.🔽The image of the year which we worship in thee, O night,

original: sā na āyuṣmatīṃ prajāṃ rāyas poṣeṇa saṃ sṛja ////
analyzed: sā naḥ āyuṣmatīm prajām rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam sṛja
translated: unite us with long-lived offspring and with the increase of wealth.

original: iyam eva sā yā prathamā vyauchad āsv itarāsu carati praviṣṭā /
analyzed: iyam eva sā yā prathamā vyauchat āsu itarāsu carati praviṣṭā
translated: She who first shone forth, who moves within these (other lights), having entered them,

original: mahānto asyāṃ mahimāno antar vadhūr jigāya navagaj janitrī ////
analyzed: mahāntaḥ asyām mahimānaḥ antar vadhūḥ jigāya navagat janitrī
translated: the great glories are within her; the bride has conquered, the newly-born mother.

original: vānaspatyā grāvāṇo ghoṣam akrata haviṣ kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam /
analyzed: vānaspatyāḥ grāvāṇaḥ ghoṣam akrata haviṣ kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam
translated: The stones of the wood have made a sound, preparing the oblation for the year-old (calf).

original: ekāṣṭake suprajasaḥ suvīrā vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ////
analyzed: ekāṣṭake suprajasaḥ su vīrāḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: May we be prosperous in children and heroes in the Ekastaka, lords of wealth.

original: iḍāyās padaṃ ghṛtavat sarīsṛpaṃ jātavedaḥ prati havyā gṛbhāya /
analyzed: iḍāyāḥ padam ghṛtavat sarīsṛpam jātavedaḥ prati havyā gṛbhāya
translated: The place of Ida, full of ghee, creeping, O all-knower, receive the offerings.

original: ye grāmyāḥ paśavo viśvarūpās teṣāṃ saptānāṃ mayi rantir astu ////
analyzed: ye grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ viśva rūpāḥ teṣām saptānām mayi rantiḥ astu
translated: May there be delight in me, O Night, in the seven of these domestic animals of all forms.

original: ā mā puṣṭe ca poṣe ca rātri devānāṃ sumatau syāma /
analyzed: ā mā puṣṭe ca poṣe ca rātri devānām sumatau syāma
translated: O Night, may we be in the favor of the gods in nourishment and growth.

original: pūrṇā darve parā pata supūrṇā punar ā pata /
analyzed: pūrṇā darve parā pata su pūrṇā punar ā pata
translated: O full ladle, fly away, fly back full again.

original: sarvān yajñānt saṃbhuñjatīṣam ūrjaṃ na ā bhara ////
analyzed: sarvān yajñān saṃbhuñjatī iṣam ūrjam naḥ ā bhara
translated: Enjoying all sacrifices, bring us food and strength.

original: āyam agant saṃvatsaraḥ patir ekāṣṭake tava /
analyzed: ā ayam agan saṃvatsaraḥ patiḥ ekāṣṭake tava
translated: Here has come the year, the lord of your Ekastaka.

original: sā na āyuṣmatīṃ prajāṃ rāyas poṣeṇa saṃ sṛja ////🔽ṛtūn yaja ṛtupatīn ārtavān uta hāyanān /🔽samāḥ saṃvatsarān māsān bhūtasya pataye yaje ////
analyzed: sā naḥ āyuṣmatīm prajām rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam sṛja  ṛtūn yaje ṛtu patīn ārtavān uta hāyanān  samāḥ saṃvatsarān māsān bhūtasya pataye yaje
translated: With it, rich in life, unite us with offspring and the growth of wealth.🔽Worship the seasons, the lords of the seasons, and the half-months and years.🔽Worship the months, the years, and the lord of what was.

original: ṛtubhyaṣ ṭvārtavebhyo mādbhyaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtubhyaḥ tvā ārtavebhyaḥ mādbhyaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ
translated: To the seasons, to the half-seasons, to the months, to the years,

original: dhātre vidhātre samṛdhe bhūtasya pataye yaje ////
analyzed: dhātre vidhātre samṛdhe bhūtasya pataye yaje
translated: to the nurse, to the provider, to prosperity, to the lord of what was, I offer.

original: iḍayā juhvato vayaṃ devān ghṛtavatā yaje /
analyzed: iḍayā juhvataḥ vayam devān ghṛtavatā yaje
translated: With the ladle, offering with ghee, we worship the gods.

original: gṛhān alubhyato vayaṃ saṃ viśemopa gomataḥ ////
analyzed: gṛhān a lubhyataḥ vayam sam viśema upa gomataḥ
translated: Not grudging our homes, may we enter them, rich in cattle and wealth.

original: ekāṣṭakā tapasā tapyamānā jajāna garbhaṃ mahimānam indram /
analyzed: ekāṣṭakā tapasā tapyamānā jajāna garbham mahimānam indram
translated: The Ekastaka, being purified by penance, gave birth to a great son, Indra.

original: tena devā vy asahanta śatrūn hantā dasyūnām abhavac chacīpatiḥ ////
analyzed: tena devāḥ vi asahanta śatrūn hantā dasyūnām abhavat śacīpatiḥ
translated: By him the gods overcame their enemies; he became the slayer of the Dasyus, the lord of power.

original: indraputre somaputre duhitāsi prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: indra putre soma putre duhitā asi prajāpateḥ
translated: You are the daughter of Indra, the son of Soma, of the lord of creatures.

original: kāmān asmākaṃ pūraya prati gṛhṇāhi no haviḥ ////
analyzed: kāmān asmākam pūraya prati gṛhṇāhi naḥ haviḥ
translated: Fulfill our desires, accept our oblation.

original: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kam ajñātayakṣmād uta rājayakṣmāt /
analyzed: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kam a jñāta yakṣmāt uta rājayakṣmāt
translated: I release you with an oblation for life, from unknown consumption and from pulmonary consumption.

original: grāhir jagrāha yady etad enaṃ tasyā indrāgnī pra mumuktam enam ////
analyzed: grāhiḥ jagrāha yadī etat enam tasyāḥ indra agnī pra mumuktam enam
translated: If the seizing one has seized him, from that may Indra and Agni set him free.

original: yadi kṣitāyur yadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyor antikaṃ eva /🔽tam ā harāmi nirṛter upasthād aspārśam enaṃ śataśāradāya ////
analyzed: yadi kṣita āyuḥ yadi vā paretaḥ yadi mṛtyoḥ antikam eva  tam ā harāmi nirṛteḥ upasthāt aspārśam enam śata śāradāya
translated: If his life is on earth or if it has departed, if he is near death,🔽I bring him from the presence of Nirriti. I have touched him for a life of a hundred autumns.

original: sahasrākṣeṇa śatavīryeṇa śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣam enam /
analyzed: sahasra akṣeṇa śata vīryeṇa śata āyuṣā haviṣā ahārṣam enam
translated: With the one of a thousand eyes, of a hundred powers, of a hundred years, I have brought him with an oblation.

original: indro yathainaṃ śarado nayāty ati viśvasya duritasya pāram ////
analyzed: indraḥ yathā enam śaradaḥ nayāti ati viśvasya duritasya pāram
translated: May Indra lead him to the end of a hundred autumns, beyond all misfortune.

original: śataṃ jīva śarado vardhamānaḥ śataṃ hemantān chatam u vasantān /🔽śataṃ te indro agniḥ savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣam enam ////
analyzed: śatam jīva śaradaḥ vardhamānaḥ śatam hemantān śatam u vasantān  śatam te indraḥ agniḥ savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śata āyuṣā haviṣā ahārṣam enam
translated: Live a hundred autumns, prospering; a hundred winters, a hundred springs.🔽For a life of a hundred years, Indra, Agni, Savitar, Brihaspati have brought him with an oblation.

original: pra viśataṃ prāṇāpānāv anaḍvāhāv iva vrajam /
analyzed: pra viśatam prāṇa apānau anaḍvāhau iva vrajam
translated: Enter, O expiration and inspiration, like two oxen the stall.

original: vy anye yantu mṛtyavo yān āhur itarān chatam ////
analyzed: vi anye yantu mṛtyavaḥ yān āhuḥ itarān śatam
translated: Let the other deaths, of which they speak a hundred, go away from here.

original: ihaiva staṃ prāṇāpānau māpa gātam ito yuvam /
analyzed: iha eva stam prāṇa apānau mā apa gātam itas yuvam
translated: Here, O expiration and inspiration, stay ye not, go not away from this place, ye two.

original: śarīram asyāṅgāni jarase vahataṃ punaḥ ////
analyzed: śarīram asya aṅgāni jarase vahatam punar
translated: Carry back again to old age this man's body and his limbs.

original: jarāyai tvā pari dadāmi jarāyai ni dhuvāmi tvā /
analyzed: jarāyai tvā pari dadāmi jarāyai ni dhuvāmi tvā
translated: To old age I give thee, to old age I consign thee.

original: jarā tvā bhadrā neṣṭa vy anye yantu mṛtyavo yān āhur itarān chatam ////
analyzed: jarā tvā bhadrā neṣṭa vi anye yantu mṛtyavaḥ yān āhuḥ itarān śatam
translated: Let old age, O Neshṭar, be gracious to thee. Let the other deaths, of which they speak a hundred, go away from here.

original: abhi tvā jarimāhita gām ukṣaṇam iva rajjvā /
analyzed: abhi tvā jarimā ahita gām ukṣaṇam iva rajjvā
translated: Old age has seized thee, as with a rope they seize an ox or a bull.

original: yas tvā mṛtyur abhyadhatta jāyamānaṃ supāśayā /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā mṛtyuḥ abhyadhatta jāyamānam su pāśayā
translated: The death that seized thee, O man, as thou wast born, with his strong noose,

original: taṃ te satyasya hastābhyām ud amuñcad bṛhaspatiḥ ////
analyzed: tam te satyasya hastābhyām ud amuñcat bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: That Brihaspati hath loosed for thee with the hands of truth.

original: ihaiva dhruvāṃ ni minomi śālāṃ kṣeme tiṣṭhāti ghṛtam ukṣamāṇā /
analyzed: iha eva dhruvām ni minomi śālām kṣeme tiṣṭhāti ghṛtam ukṣamāṇā
translated: Here I firmly fix the house, standing in comfort, with ghee poured forth.

original: tāṃ tvā śāle sarvavīrāḥ suvīrā ariṣṭavīrā upa saṃ carema ////
analyzed: tām tvā śāle sarva vīrāḥ su vīrāḥ ariṣṭa vīrāḥ upa sam carema
translated: O house, may we all approach thee, with good heroes, with brave heroes, with heroes free from misfortune.

original: ihaiva dhruvā prati tiṣṭha śāle 'śvāvatī gomatī sūnṛtāvatī /🔽ūrjasvatī ghṛtavatī payasvaty uc chrayasva mahate saubhagāya ////
analyzed: iha eva dhruvā prati tiṣṭha śāle śvāvatī gomatī sūnṛtāvatī  ūrjasvatī ghṛtavatī payasvatī ud śrayasva mahate saubhagāya
translated: Here, O house, stand firm, full of horses, full of cattle, full of pleasant things.🔽Full of strength, full of ghee, full of milk, rise up for great good fortune.

original: dharuṇy asi śāle bṛhachandāḥ pūtidhānyā /
analyzed: dharuṇī asi śāle bṛhat chandāḥ pūti dhānyā
translated: Thou art firm, O house, of the Brihatî metre, with full store of grain.

original: ā tvā vatso gamed ā kumāra ā dhenavaḥ sāyam āspandamānāḥ ////
analyzed: ā tvā vatsaḥ gamet ā kumāraḥ ā dhenavaḥ sāyam āspandamānāḥ
translated: May the calf come to thee, and the boy, and the milch-cows in the evening lowing.

original: imāṃ śālāṃ savitā vāyur indro bṛhaspatir ni minotu prajānan /
analyzed: imām śālām savitā vāyuḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ni minotu prajānan
translated: May Savitar, Vâyu, Indra, Brihaspati, knowing, set up this hall for us.

original: ukṣantūdnā maruto ghṛtena bhago no rājā ni kṛṣiṃ tanotu ////
analyzed: ukṣantu udnā marutaḥ ghṛtena bhagaḥ naḥ rājā ni kṛṣim tanotu
translated: Let the Maruts sprinkle it with ghee. Let King Bhaga extend our tillage.

original: mānasya patni śaraṇā syonā devī devebhir nimitāsy agre /🔽tṛṇaṃ vasānā sumanā asas tvam athāsmabhyaṃ sahavīraṃ rayiṃ dāḥ ////
analyzed: mānasya patni śaraṇā syonā devī devebhiḥ nimitā asi agre  tṛṇam vasānā sumanāḥ asaḥ tvam atha asmabhyam saha vīram rayim dāḥ
translated: O House, thou art the wife of Manu, a pleasant resting-place. Thou, a Goddess, wast set up by the Gods in the beginning.🔽Clad in grass, be gracious unto us. Then give us wealth with brave sons.

original: ṛtena sthūṇām adhi roha vaṃśogro virājann apa vṛṅkṣva śatrūn /
analyzed: ṛtena sthūṇām adhi roha vaṃśa ugraḥ virājan apa vṛṅkṣva śatrūn
translated: Rise up on the pillar of holy order, with the top-ring of the lofty one. Shine forth, and drive away thine enemies.

original: mā te riṣann upasattāro gṛhāṇāṃ śāle śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ sarvavīrāḥ ////
analyzed: mā te riṣan upasattāraḥ gṛhāṇām śāle śatam jīvema śaradaḥ sarva vīrāḥ
translated: Let not thy household gods be injured. O house, may we live a hundred years with all our heroes.

original: emāṃ kumāras taruṇa ā vatso jagatā saha /🔽emām parisrutaḥ kumbha ā dadhnaḥ kalaśair aguḥ ////🔽pūrṇaṃ nāri pra bhara kumbham etaṃ ghṛtasya dhārām amṛtena saṃbhṛtām /
analyzed: ā imām kumāraḥ taruṇaḥ ā vatsaḥ jagatā saha  ā imām parisrutaḥ kumbhaḥ ā dadhnaḥ kalaśaiḥ aguḥ  pūrṇam nāri pra bhara kumbham etam ghṛtasya dhārām amṛtena saṃbhṛtām
translated: This (house) the boy, the young calf, hath entered with the moving (cows).🔽This (house) the Parivats have entered with the jars, with milk, with curds.🔽O woman, fill this jar full, fill it with the stream of ghee, which is stored with nectar.

original: imāṃ pātṝn amṛtena sam aṅgdhīṣṭāpūrtam abhi rakṣāty enām ////
analyzed: imām pātṝn amṛtena sam aṅgdhi iṣṭāpūrtam abhi rakṣāti enām
translated: Anoint the priests with nectar. Guard this (house) which is to be guarded.

original: imā āpaḥ pra bharāmy ayakṣmā yakṣmanāśanīḥ /🔽gṛhān upa pra sīdāmy amṛtena sahāgninā ////
analyzed: imāḥ āpaḥ pra bharāmi ayakṣmāḥ yakṣma nāśanīḥ  gṛhān upa pra sīdāmi amṛtena saha agninā
translated: I bring hither these waters, which are free from disease, which destroy disease.🔽I settle in the house with immortality and with Agni.

original: yad adaḥ saṃprayatīr ahāv anadatā hate /
analyzed: yat adaḥ saṃprayatīḥ ahau anadata hate
translated: When ye, O waters, flowed together at the slaying of the dragon,

original: tasmād ā nadyo nāma stha tā vo nāmāni sindhavaḥ ////
analyzed: tasmāt ā nadyaḥ nāma stha tā vaḥ nāmāni sindhavaḥ
translated: Therefore are ye called Nadyas; these are your names, O rivers.

original: yat preṣitā varuṇenāc chībham samavalgata /
analyzed: yat preṣitāḥ varuṇenāt śībham samavalgata
translated: When ye were sent forth by Varuna, and quickly flowed together,

original: tad āpnod indro vo yatīs tasmād āpo anu ṣṭhana ////
analyzed: tat āpnot indraḥ vaḥ yatīḥ tasmāt āpaḥ anu sthana
translated: Then Indra overtook you as you flowed; therefore are ye called Apas.

original: apakāmaṃ syandamānā avīvarata vo hi kam /
analyzed: apakāmam syandamānāḥ avīvarata vaḥ hi kam
translated: Flowing as ye desired, ye were stopped by him who desired it not.

original: indro vaḥ śaktibhir devīs tasmād vār nāma vo hitam ////
analyzed: indraḥ vaḥ śaktibhiḥ devīḥ tasmāt vār nāma vaḥ hitam
translated: Indra, O ye goddesses, with his powers; therefore the name Varu is applied to you.

original: ekaḥ vo devo 'py atiṣṭhat syandamānā yathāvaśam /
analyzed: ekaḥ vaḥ devaḥ u pi atiṣṭhat syandamānāḥ yathāvaśam
translated: One god alone stood over you, O ye waters, as ye flowed according to your will.

original: ud āniṣur mahīr iti tasmād udakam ucyate ////
analyzed: ud āniṣuḥ mahīḥ iti tasmāt udakam ucyate
translated: They brought up the great ones; therefore it is called udaka.

original: āpo bhadrā ghṛtam id āpa āsann agnīṣomau bibhraty āpa it tāḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ bhadrāḥ ghṛtam id āpaḥ āsan agnīṣomau bibhrati āpaḥ id tāḥ
translated: The waters were auspicious, ghee was in the waters; Agni and Soma bear those waters.

original: tīvro raso madhupṛcām araṃgama ā mā prāṇena saha varcasā gamet ////
analyzed: tīvraḥ rasaḥ madhu pṛcām araṃgamaḥ ā mā prāṇena saha varcasā gamet
translated: The strong essence of the honey-speaking ones; may it come to me with breath and with splendour.

original: ād it paśyāmy uta vā śṛṇomy ā mā ghoṣo gachati vāṅ māsām /
analyzed: āt id paśyāmi uta vā śṛṇomi ā mā ghoṣaḥ gacchati vāc mā āsām
translated: I see it, or I hear it; the sound comes to me, the speech of the waters.

original: manye bhejāno amṛtasya tarhi hiraṇyavarṇā atṛpaṃ yadā vaḥ ////
analyzed: manye bhejānaḥ amṛtasya tarhi hiraṇya varṇāḥ atṛpam yadā vaḥ
translated: I think, when you were born, O immortal ones, then I satisfied you with the golden-hued (food).

original: idaṃ va āpo hṛdayam ayaṃ vatsa ṛtāvarīḥ /
analyzed: idam vaḥ āpaḥ hṛdayam ayam vatsaḥ ṛtāvarīḥ
translated: This is your heart, O waters, this is your calf, O you who bring truth.

original: ihettham eta śakvarīr yatredaṃ veśayāmi vaḥ ////
analyzed: iha ittham eta śakvarīḥ yatra idam veśayāmi vaḥ
translated: Here, O Shakvari, is where I place you.

original: saṃ vo goṣṭhena suṣadā saṃ rayyā saṃ subhūtyā /
analyzed: sam vaḥ goṣṭhena suṣadā sam rayyā sam su bhūtyā
translated: Be united with our stable, with wealth, with good fortune.

original: aharjātasya yan nāma tenā vaḥ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: ahar jātasya yat nāma tena vaḥ sam sṛjāmasi
translated: With the name of the one born in the day, with that we unite you.

original: saṃ vaḥ sṛjatv aryamā saṃ pūṣā saṃ bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: sam vaḥ sṛjatu aryamā sam pūṣā sam bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: May Aryaman unite you, may Pusan unite you, may Brihaspati unite you.

original: sam indro yo dhanaṃjayo mayi puṣyata yad vasu ////
analyzed: sam indraḥ yaḥ dhanaṃjayaḥ mayi puṣyata yat vasu
translated: May Indra, the conqueror of wealth, unite you. May the wealth that is in me prosper.

original: saṃjagmānā abibhyuṣīr asmin goṣṭhe karīṣiṇīḥ /
analyzed: saṃjagmānāḥ a bibhyuṣīḥ asmin goṣṭhe karīṣiṇīḥ
translated: Having come together, fearless, in this stable, bringing straw,

original: bibhratīḥ somyaṃ madhv anamīvā upetana ////
analyzed: bibhratīḥ somyam madhu anamīvāḥ upetana
translated: Bearing the sweet Soma, free from disease, come hither.

original: ihaiva gāva etaneho śakeva puṣyata /
analyzed: iha eva gāvaḥ etana iha u śakā iva puṣyata
translated: Here, O cows, stay here. Prosper here like Shakva.

original: ihaivota pra jāyadhvaṃ mayi saṃjñānam astu vaḥ ////
analyzed: iha eva uta pra jāyadhvam mayi saṃjñānam astu vaḥ
translated: Here alone be born again. May our meeting be here.

original: śivo vo goṣṭho bhavatu śāriśākeva puṣyata /🔽ihaivota pra jāyadhvaṃ mayā vaḥ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: śivaḥ vaḥ goṣṭhaḥ bhavatu śāriśākā iva puṣyata  iha eva uta pra jāyadhvam mayā vaḥ sam sṛjāmasi
translated: May your stable be auspicious. Prosper like Sharishaka.🔽Here alone be born again. We unite you with me.

original: mayā gāvo gopatinā sacadhvam ayaṃ vo goṣṭha iha poṣayiṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: mayā gāvaḥ gopatinā sacadhvam ayam vaḥ goṣṭhaḥ iha poṣayiṣṇuḥ
translated: With me, the lord of cows, the cows should stay together. This stable of yours should nourish you here.

original: rāyas poṣeṇa bahulā bhavantīr jīvā jīvantīr upa vaḥ sadema ////🔽indram ahaṃ vaṇijaṃ codayāmi sa na aitu puraetā no astu /
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣeṇa bahulāḥ bhavantīḥ jīvāḥ jīvantīḥ upa vaḥ sadema  indram aham vaṇijam codayāmi sa naḥ aitu puraetā naḥ astu
translated: May we, living, enjoy you, abounding in the increase of wealth, living while you live.🔽I urge Indra, the trader, may he come and be our leader.

original: nudann arātiṃ paripanthinaṃ mṛgaṃ sa īśāno dhanadā astu mahyam ////
analyzed: nudan arātim paripanthinam mṛgam saḥ īśānaḥ dhana dāḥ astu mahyam
translated: Driving away the enemy, the lurking danger, may he, as lord, give me wealth.

original: ye panthāno bahavo devayānā antarā dyāvāpṛthivī saṃcaranti /
analyzed: ye panthānaḥ bahavaḥ deva yānāḥ antarā dyāvāpṛthivī saṃcaranti
translated: Those many paths that go to the gods, that pass between heaven and earth,

original: te mā juṣantāṃ payasā ghṛtena yathā krītvā dhanam āharāṇi ////
analyzed: te mā juṣantām payasā ghṛtena yathā krītvā dhanam āharāṇi
translated: may they accept me with milk and ghee, so that having bought (them) I may bring away the wealth.

original: idhmenāgna ichamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṃ tarase balāya /
analyzed: idhmena agne icchamānaḥ ghṛtena juhomi havyam tarase balāya
translated: With fuel, O Agni, longing (for it), I offer oblation with ghee, for strength and vigour.

original: yāvad īśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṃ dhiyaṃ śataseyāya devīm ////
analyzed: yāvat īśe brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ imām dhiyam śata seyāya devīm
translated: As far as I am able, with prayer, I praise this divine thought for a hundred gains.

original: imām agne śaraṇiṃ mīmṛṣo no yam adhvānam agāma dūram /
analyzed: imām agne śaraṇim mīmṛṣaḥ naḥ yam adhvānam agāma dūram
translated: This favour, O Agni, do thou accept from us, the path which we have gone far along.

original: śunaṃ no astu prapaṇo vikrayaś ca pratipaṇaḥ phalinaṃ mā kṛṇotu /
analyzed: śunam naḥ astu prapaṇaḥ vikrayaḥ ca pratipaṇaḥ phalinam mā kṛṇotu
translated: May our trading and selling be successful, and may the exchange bring fruit.

original: idaṃ havyaṃ saṃvidānau juṣethāṃ śunaṃ no astu caritam utthitaṃ ca ////
analyzed: idam havyam saṃvidānau juṣethām śunam naḥ astu caritam utthitam ca
translated: Accept this oblation, ye two who are agreed; may our going and rising be prosperous.

original: yena dhanena prapaṇaṃ carāmi dhanena devā dhanam ichamānaḥ /
analyzed: yena dhanena prapaṇam carāmi dhanena devāḥ dhanam ichamānaḥ
translated: With that wealth with which I trade, with wealth, O gods, seeking wealth,

original: tan me bhūyo bhavatu mā kanīyo 'gne sātaghno devān haviṣā ni ṣedha ////
analyzed: tat me bhūyaḥ bhavatu mā kanīyaḥ gne sāta ghnas devān haviṣā ni sedha
translated: Let that be more to me, not less, O Agni, the slayer of enemies, with oblation restrain the gods.

original: yena dhanena prapaṇaṃ carāmi dhanena devā dhanam ichamānaḥ /
analyzed: yena dhanena prapaṇam carāmi dhanena devāḥ dhanam ichamānaḥ
translated: With the wealth by which I trade in the market, seeking wealth with wealth, the gods,

original: tasmin ma indro rucim ā dadhātu prajāpatiḥ savitā somo agniḥ ////
analyzed: tasmin me indraḥ rucim ā dadhātu prajāpatiḥ savitā somaḥ agniḥ
translated: May Indra bestow splendor on that wealth of mine, Prajapati, Savita, Soma, and Agni.

original: upa tvā namasā vayaṃ hotar vaiśvānara stumaḥ /
analyzed: upa tvā namasā vayam hotar vaiśvānara stumaḥ
translated: To you, O Hotr, O Vaiśvānara, we approach with homage to praise you.

original: sa naḥ prajāsv ātmasu goṣu prāṇeṣu jāgṛhi ////
analyzed: sa naḥ prajāsu ātmasu goṣu prāṇeṣu jāgṛhi
translated: Be watchful over us, our offspring, our souls, our cattle, and our life-breath.

original: viśvāhā te sadam id bharemāśvāyeva tiṣṭhate jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: viśvāhā te sadam id bharema aśvāya iva tiṣṭhate jātavedaḥ
translated: We will always support you, O all-knowing one, as if standing for a horse.

original: rāyas poṣeṇa sam iṣā madanto mā te agne prativeśā riṣāma ////
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma
translated: Rejoicing in the increase of wealth and food, may we not offend against you, O Agni, as your neighbors.

original: prātar agniṃ prātar indram havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā /
analyzed: prātar agnim prātar indram havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā
translated: In the morning we invoke Agni, in the morning Indra, in the morning Mitra-Varuṇa, in the morning the two Aśvins,

original: prātar bhagaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patiṃ prātaḥ somam uta rudraṃ havāmahe ////
analyzed: prātar bhagam pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim prātar somam uta rudram havāmahe
translated: In the morning Bhaga, Pūṣan, the lord of prayer, in the morning Soma, and also Rudra, we invoke.

original: prātarjitaṃ bhagam ugram havāmahe vayaṃ putram aditer yo vidhartā /
analyzed: prātar jitam bhagam ugram havāmahe vayam putram aditeḥ yaḥ vidhartā
translated: In the morning we invoke the victorious Bhaga, the mighty one, the son of Aditi, who is the ordainer.

original: ādhraś cid yaṃ manyamānas turaś cid rājā cid yaṃ bhagaṃ bhakṣīty āha ////
analyzed: ādhraḥ cit yam manyamānaḥ turaḥ cit rājā cit yam bhagam bhakṣi iti āha
translated: Even the slow one, thinking of him, the swift one, even the king, says, I will enjoy that Bhaga.

original: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satyarādho bhagemāṃ dhiyam ud avā dadan naḥ /
analyzed: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satya rādhaḥ bhaga imām dhiyam ud ava dadan naḥ
translated: Bhaga, leader, Bhaga, whose worship is true, Bhaga, grant us this thought.

original: bhaga pra ṇo janaya gobhir aśvair bhaga pra nṛbhir nṛvantaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: bhaga pra naḥ janaya gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ bhaga pra nṛbhiḥ nṛvantaḥ syāma
translated: Bhaga, generate us with cattle and horses, Bhaga, may we be strong with men.

original: utedānīṃ bhagavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām /
analyzed: uta idānīm bhagavantaḥ syāma uta prapitve uta madhye ahnām
translated: And now may we be prosperous, and in the evening, and in the middle of the days,

original: utoditau maghavant sūryasya vayaṃ devānāṃ sumatau syāma ////🔽bhaga eva bhagavāṃ astu devas tenā vayaṃ bhagavantaḥ syāma /
analyzed: uta uditau maghavan sūryasya vayam devānām sumatau syāma  bhagaḥ eva bhagavān astu devaḥ tena vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma
translated: And in the morning, O bountiful one, O sun, may we be in the favor of the gods.🔽Let Bhaga alone be the prosperous god, by him may we be prosperous.

original: taṃ tvā bhaga sarva ij johavīmi sa no bhaga puraetā bhaveha ////
analyzed: tam tvā bhaga sarvaḥ id johavīmi sa naḥ bhaga puraetā bhava iha
translated: I invoke you, Bhaga, all, be you our leader, O Bhaga.

original: sam adhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya /
analyzed: sam adhvarāya uṣasaḥ namanta dadhikrāvā iva śucaye padāya
translated: The dawns bow to the sacrifice, like Dadhikrâvan to the pure place.

original: arvācīnaṃ vasuvidaṃ bhagaṃ me ratham ivāśvā vājina ā vahantu ////🔽aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam uchantu bhadrāḥ /
analyzed: arvācīnam vasu vidam bhagam me ratham iva aśvāḥ vājinaḥ ā vahantu  aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ naḥ uṣāsaḥ vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ
translated: Let them bring me Bhaga, who finds wealth, from the west, like strong horses a chariot.🔽May the blessed dawns rise for us always, rich in horses, rich in cattle, rich in heroes.

original: ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ////
analyzed: ghṛtam duhānāḥ viśvatas prapītāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Pouring ghee from all sides, protect us always with your blessings.

original: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yugā vi tanvate pṛthak /
analyzed: sīrā yuñjanti kavayaḥ yugā vi tanvate pṛthak
translated: The wise yoke the plows, they stretch the yokes apart,

original: dhīrā deveṣu sumnayau ////
analyzed: dhīrāḥ deveṣu sumnayau
translated: the wise, the thoughtful, for the sake of the gods.

original: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanota kṛte yonau vapateha bījam /
analyzed: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanota kṛte yonau vapata iha bījam
translated: Yoke the ploughs, stretch out the yokes, in the prepared furrow sow the seed.

original: virājaḥ śnuṣṭiḥ sabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥ pakvam ā yavan ////
analyzed: virājaḥ śnuṣṭiḥ sabharāḥ asat naḥ nedīyaḥ id sṛṇyaḥ pakvam ā yavan
translated: May the prosperity of the fields be ours, may the reaper be near, may the corn ripen before us.

original: lāṅgalaṃ pavīravat suśīmaṃ somasatsaru /
analyzed: lāṅgalam pavīravat suśīmam soma satsaru
translated: The plough, well-sharpened, with a good share, having a handle made of Soma wood,

original: ud id vapatu gām aviṃ prasthāvad rathavāhanaṃ pībarīṃ ca prapharvyam ////
analyzed: ud id vapatu gām avim prasthāvat rathavāhanam pībarīm ca prapharvyam
translated: May it plough up a cow, a sheep, a chariot with horses, a milch cow, and a mare.

original: indraḥ sītāṃ ni gṛhṇātu tāṃ pūṣābhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: indraḥ sītām ni gṛhṇātu tām pūṣā abhi rakṣatu
translated: May Indra hold the furrow, may Pusan guard it.

original: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarāmuttarāṃ samām ////🔽śunaṃ suphālā vi tudantu bhūmiṃ śunaṃ kīnāśā anu yantu vāhān /
analyzed: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām uttarām samām  śunam su phālāḥ vi tudantu bhūmim śunam kīnāśāḥ anu yantu vāhān
translated: May it yield milk for us, may it yield milk for the next and the next year.🔽May the ploughs strike the ground well, may the ploughmen drive the oxen well.

original: śunāsīrā haviṣā tośamānā supippalā oṣadhīḥ kartam asmai ////🔽śunaṃ vāhāḥ śunaṃ naraḥ śunaṃ kṛṣatu lāṅgalam /
analyzed: śunāsīrā haviṣā tośamānā su pippalāḥ oṣadhīḥ kartam asmai  śunam vāhāḥ śunam naraḥ śunam kṛṣatu lāṅgalam
translated: May the ploughs, O Suna and Siera, being gratified with the oblation, make the plants full of good grains for him.🔽Well be it with the oxen, well be it with the men, well be it with the plough that ploughs the ground.

original: śunaṃ varatrā badhyantāṃ śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya ////
analyzed: śunam varatrāḥ badhyantām śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya
translated: Well be it with the ropes that are bound, well be it with the ploughshare that is lifted up.

original: śunāsīreha sma me juṣethām /
analyzed: śunāsīrā iha sma me juṣethām
translated: O Suna and Siera, be pleased with me.

original: yad divi cakrathuḥ payas tenemām upa siñcatam ////
analyzed: yat divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ tena imām upa siñcatam
translated: With the milk that ye have created in the heaven, therewith sprinkle this (earth).

original: sīte vandāmahe tvārvācī subhage bhava /
analyzed: sīte vandāmahe tvā arvācī subhage bhava
translated: O furrow, we worship thee. Be thou inclined to us, O auspicious one.

original: yathā naḥ sumanā aso yathā naḥ suphalā bhuvaḥ ////
analyzed: yathā naḥ sumanāḥ asaḥ yathā naḥ su phalā bhuvaḥ
translated: That thou mayst be well-disposed to us, and bring us good and plenteous harvests.

original: ghṛtena sītā madhunā samaktā viśvair devair anumatā marudbhiḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtena sītā madhunā samaktā viśvaiḥ devaiḥ anumatā marudbhiḥ
translated: O Sita, anointed with ghee and honey, approved by all the gods and the Maruts,

original: sā naḥ sīte payasābhyāvavṛtsvorjasvatī ghṛtavat pinvamānā ////
analyzed: sā naḥ sīte payasā abhyāvavṛtsva ūrjasvatī ghṛtavat pinvamānā
translated: O Sita, turn to us with milk, full of strength, swelling with ghee.

original: imāṃ khanāmy oṣadhiṃ vīrudhāṃ balavattamām /
analyzed: imām khanāmi oṣadhim vīrudhām balavattamām
translated: I dig up this plant, the strongest of all herbs,

original: yayā sapatnīṃ bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim ////
analyzed: yayā sapatnīm bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim
translated: By which one repels a co-wife, by which one wins a husband.

original: uttānaparṇe subhage devajūte sahasvati /
analyzed: uttāna parṇe subhage deva jūte sahasvati
translated: O Utanaparna, O fortunate one, O divine one, O powerful one,

original: sapatnīṃ me parā ṇuda patiṃ me kevalaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: sapatnīm me parā nuda patim me kevalam kṛdhi
translated: Drive away my co-wife, make my husband solely mine.

original: nahi te nāma jagrāha no asmin ramase patau /
analyzed: nahi te nāma jagrāha na u asmin ramase patau
translated: For she did not accept your name, nor do you delight in this husband.

original: parām eva parāvataṃ sapatnīṃ gamayāmasi ////🔽uttarāham uttara uttared uttarābhyaḥ /
analyzed: parām eva parāvatam sapatnīm gamayāmasi  uttarā aham uttaraḥ uttaret uttarābhyaḥ
translated: We send your co-wife far away, to the farthest distance.🔽I am the superior, the superior of the superior, the superior of the superior ones.

original: adhaḥ sapatnī yā mamādharā sādharābhyaḥ ////
analyzed: adhas sapatnī yā mama adharā sā adharābhyaḥ
translated: May my co-wife be below me, below the lowest of the low.

original: aham asmi sahamānātho tvam asi sāsahiḥ /
analyzed: aham asmi sahamānā atha u tvam asi sāsahiḥ
translated: I am the one who conquers, and you are the conqueror.

original: ubhe sahasvatī bhūtvā sapatnīṃ me sahāvahai ////
analyzed: ubhe sahasvatī bhūtvā sapatnīm me sahāvahai
translated: Becoming both of us powerful, let us conquer my co-wife.

original: abhi te 'dhāṃ sahamānām upa te 'dhāṃ sahīyasīm /
analyzed: abhi te dhām sahamānām upa te dhām sahīyasīm
translated: I approach you, the conqueror, I approach you, the more powerful one.

original: mām anu pra te mano vatsaṃ gaur iva dhāvatu pathā vār iva dhāvatu ////
analyzed: mām anu pra te manaḥ vatsam gauḥ iva dhāvatu pathā vār iva dhāvatu
translated: Let thy mind run after me, as a cow runs after her calf. Let it run after me as water runs (downhill).

original: saṃśitaṃ ma idaṃ brahma saṃśitaṃ vīryaṃ balam /
analyzed: saṃśitam me idam brahma saṃśitam vīryam balam
translated: This my Brahman is sharpened, sharpened is my strength and power.

original: saṃśitaṃ kṣatram ajaram astu jiṣṇur yeṣām asmi purohitaḥ ////
analyzed: saṃśitam kṣatram ajaram astu jiṣṇuḥ yeṣām asmi purohitaḥ
translated: Let the imperishable Kshatriya be sharpened, victorious, for whom I am the Purohita.

original: sam aham eṣāṃ rāṣṭraṃ syāmi sam ojo vīryaṃ balam /
analyzed: sam aham eṣām rāṣṭram syāmi sam ojaḥ vīryam balam
translated: I unite with their kingdom, I unite with their strength, power and vigor.

original: vṛścāmi śatrūṇāṃ bāhūn anena haviṣā aham ////
analyzed: vṛścāmi śatrūṇām bāhūn anena haviṣā aham
translated: I cut off the arms of the enemies with this oblation.

original: nīcaiḥ padyantām adhare bhavantu ye naḥ sūriṃ maghavānaṃ pṛtanyān /
analyzed: nīcais padyantām adhare bhavantu ye naḥ sūrim maghavānam pṛtanyān
translated: Let them fall low, let them be below, those who would harm our generous lord.

original: kṣiṇāmi brahmaṇāmitrān un nayāmi svān aham ////🔽tīkṣṇīyāṃsaḥ paraśor agnes tīkṣṇatarā uta /
analyzed: kṣiṇāmi brahmaṇā amitrān ud nayāmi svān aham  tīkṣṇīyāṃsaḥ paraśoḥ agneḥ tīkṣṇatarāḥ uta
translated: I destroy the enemies with the Brahman, I lead my own people forward.🔽Sharper than the axe, sharper than the fire, sharper than Indra's thunderbolt,

original: indrasya vajrāt tīkṣṇīyāṃso yeṣām asmi purohitaḥ ////
analyzed: indrasya vajrāt tīkṣṇīyāṃsaḥ yeṣām asmi purohitaḥ
translated: are they for whom I am the Purohita.

original: eṣām aham āyudhā saṃ syāmy eṣāṃ rāṣṭraṃ suvīraṃ vardhayāmi /
analyzed: eṣām aham āyudhā sam syāmi eṣām rāṣṭram su vīram vardhayāmi
translated: I unite with their weapons, I increase the kingdom of these with good heroes.

original: eṣām kṣatram ajaram astu jiṣṇv eṣāṃ cittaṃ viśve 'vantu devāḥ ////
analyzed: eṣām kṣatram ajaram astu jiṣṇu eṣām cittam viśve vantu devāḥ
translated: Let their Kshatriya be imperishable and victorious, let all the gods favor their minds.

original: ud dharṣantāṃ maghavan vājināny ud vīrāṇāṃ jayatām etu ghoṣaḥ /
analyzed: ud harṣantām maghavan vājināni ud vīrāṇām jayatām etu ghoṣaḥ
translated: Exalt the horses, O bountiful one, let the shout of the victorious heroes go forth.

original: pṛthag ghoṣā ululayaḥ ketumanta ud īratām /
analyzed: pṛthak ghoṣāḥ ululayaḥ ketumantaḥ ud īratām
translated: Let the separate-voiced, the howling, the bannered ones rise up.

original: devā indrajyeṣṭhā maruto yantu senayā ////🔽pretā jayatā nara ugrā vaḥ santu bāhavaḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ indra jyeṣṭhāḥ marutaḥ yantu senayā  pra ita jayata naraḥ ugrāḥ vaḥ santu bāhavaḥ
translated: Let the gods, with Indra as their chief, the Maruts, go with their host.🔽Go forth, O men, to conquer; let your arms be strong.

original: tīkṣṇeṣavo 'baladhanvano hatogrāyudhā abalān ugrabāhavaḥ ////
analyzed: tīkṣṇa iṣavaḥ baladhanvanaḥ hata ugra āyudhāḥ abalān ugra bāhavaḥ
translated: Let your arrows be sharp, your bows strong, your weapons keen, your arms mighty, and your foes weak.

original: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahmasaṃśite /
analyzed: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahma saṃśite
translated: Released, fly away, O arrow, sharpened by Brahman, to the mark.

original: jaya amitrān pra padyasva jahy eṣāṃ varaṃvaraṃ māmīṣāṃ moci kaś cana ////
analyzed: jaya amitrān pra padyasva jahi eṣām varaṃvaram mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana
translated: Conquer the enemies, go forth, slay their best and best. Let none of them escape.

original: ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ /
analyzed: ayam te yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ yatas jātaḥ arocathāḥ
translated: This is thy natural place of birth, from which thou hast shone forth.

original: taṃ jānann agna ā rohādhā no vardhaya rayim ////
analyzed: tam jānan agne ā roha adhā naḥ vardhaya rayim
translated: Knowing that, O Agni, mount up, and increase our wealth.

original: agne achā vadeha naḥ pratyaṅ naḥ sumanā bhava /
analyzed: agne achā vada iha naḥ pratyaṅ naḥ su manāḥ bhava
translated: O Agni, speak to us, be gracious to us from the front.

original: pra ṇo yacha viśāṃ pate dhanadā asi nas tvam ////
analyzed: pra naḥ yaccha viśām pate dhana dāḥ asi naḥ tvam
translated: Grant us, O lord of the people, thou art the giver of wealth to us.

original: pra ṇo yachatv aryamā pra bhagaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: pra naḥ yacchatu aryamā pra bhagaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: May Aryaman grant to us, may Bhaga, may Brihaspati.

original: pra devīḥ prota sūnṛtā rayiṃ devī dadhātu me ////
analyzed: pra devīḥ pra uta sūnṛtāḥ rayim devī dadhātu me
translated: May the goddesses, may the good words, may the goddess Dhatr bestow wealth on me.

original: somaṃ rājānam avase 'gniṃ gīrbhir havāmahe /
analyzed: somam rājānam avase gnim gīrbhiḥ havāmahe
translated: For help we invoke with our songs Soma the king, Agni,

original: ādityam viṣṇum sūryaṃ brahmāṇaṃ ca bṛhaspatim ////
analyzed: ādityam viṣṇum sūryam brahmāṇam ca bṛhaspatim
translated: The sun, Vishnu, Surya, Brahman, and Brihaspati.

original: tvaṃ no agne agnibhir brahma yajñaṃ vardhaya /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne agnibhiḥ brahma yajñam vardhaya
translated: You, O Agni, with the fires, increase the prayer and sacrifice for us.

original: tvaṃ no deva dātave rayiṃ dānāya codaya ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ deva dātave rayim dānāya codaya
translated: You, O god, urge on the giver to give us wealth.

original: indravāyū ubhāv iha suhaveha havāmahe /
analyzed: indra vāyū ubhau iha su havā iha havāmahe
translated: Indra and Vayu, both of you, swift to listen, we invoke here.

original: yathā naḥ sarva ij janaḥ saṃgatyāṃ sumanā asad dānakāmaś ca no bhuvat ////
analyzed: yathā naḥ sarvaḥ id janaḥ saṃgatyām sumanāḥ asat dāna kāmaḥ ca naḥ bhuvat
translated: That all the people may be well-disposed to us in our assembly, and may be ready to give to us.

original: aryamaṇaṃ bṛhaspatim indraṃ dānāya codaya /
analyzed: aryamaṇam bṛhaspatim indram dānāya codaya
translated: Urge on Aryaman, Brihaspati, Indra to give.

original: vātaṃ viṣṇuṃ sarasvatīṃ savitāraṃ ca vājinam ////
analyzed: vātam viṣṇum sarasvatīm savitāram ca vājinam
translated: Vayu, Vishnu, Sarasvati, and the strong Savitar.

original: vājasya nu prasave saṃ babhūvimemā ca viśvā bhuvanāni antaḥ /
analyzed: vājasya nu prasave sam babhūvima imā ca viśvā bhuvanāni antar
translated: In the impulse of strength, I have become united with these and all the worlds within.

original: utāditsantaṃ dāpayatu prajānan rayiṃ ca naḥ sarvavīraṃ ni yacha ////
analyzed: uta a ditsantam dāpayatu prajānan rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yaccha
translated: And may he who knows give to the willing, and bestow on us wealth with all heroes.

original: duhrām me pañca pradiṣo duhrām urvīr yathābalam /
analyzed: duhrām me pañca pradiṣaḥ duhrām urvīḥ yathābalam
translated: May the five regions yield milk for me, and the vast ones according to their strength.

original: prāpeyaṃ sarvā ākūtīr manasā hṛdayena ca ////
analyzed: prāpeyam sarvāḥ ākūtīḥ manasā hṛdayena ca
translated: May I attain all intentions with my mind and heart.

original: gosaniṃ vācam udeyaṃ varcasā mābhyudihi /
analyzed: go sanim vācam udeyam varcasā mā abhyudihi
translated: May the speech accompanied by cows rise for me with radiance. Do not rise above me.

original: ā rundhāṃ sarvato vāyus tvaṣṭā poṣaṃ dadhātu me ////
analyzed: ā rundhām sarvatas vāyuḥ tvaṣṭā poṣam dadhātu me
translated: May Vayu hold me from all sides. May Tvastr bestow growth on me.

original: ye agnayo apsv antar ye vṛtre ye puruṣe ye aśmasu /
analyzed: ye agnayaḥ apsu antar ye vṛtre ye puruṣe ye aśmasu
translated: Those fires that are in the waters, those that are in Vritra, those that are in men, those that are in the stones,

original: ya āviveśoṣadhīr yo vanaspatīṃs tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: yaḥ āviveśa oṣadhīḥ yaḥ vanaspatīn tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: He who has entered the plants and the trees, to those fires let this be offered.

original: yaḥ some antar yo goṣv antar ya āviṣṭo vayaḥsu yo mṛgeṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ some antar yaḥ goṣu antar yaḥ āviṣṭaḥ vayaḥsu yaḥ mṛgeṣu
translated: He who is within the Soma, within the cows, who has entered the birds and the beasts,

original: ya āviveśa dvipado yas catuṣpadas tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: yaḥ āviveśa dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: who has entered the two-footed and the four-footed, to those fires let this be offered.

original: ya indreṇa sarathaṃ yāti devo vaiśvānara uta viśvadāvyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ indreṇa sa ratham yāti devaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ uta viśvadāvyaḥ
translated: The god who goes with Indra in the chariot, Vaiśvānara, the all-consuming one,

original: yaṃ johavīmi pṛtanāsu sāsahiṃ tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: yam johavīmi pṛtanāsu sāsahim tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: whom I invoke, the conqueror in battles, to those fires let this be offered.

original: yo devo viśvād yam u kāmam āhur yaṃ dātāraṃ pratigṛhṇantam āhuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ devaḥ viśva ad yam u kāmam āhuḥ yam dātāram pratigṛhṇantam āhuḥ
translated: The god whom they call the all-consumer, whom they call the giver and the receiver,

original: yo dhīraḥ śakraḥ paribhūr adābhyas tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: yaḥ dhīraḥ śakraḥ paribhūḥ adābhyaḥ tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: the wise, the powerful, the invincible one, to those fires let this be offered.

original: yaṃ tvā hotāraṃ manasābhi saṃvidus trayodaśa bhauvanāḥ pañca mānavāḥ /🔽varcodhase yaśase sūnṛtāvate tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: yam tvā hotāram manasā abhi saṃviduḥ trayodaśa bhauvanāḥ pañca mānavāḥ  varcaḥ dhase yaśase sūnṛtāvate tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: Whom you, as the Hotṛ priest, they have chosen with their minds, the thirteen Bhūvanas and the five human beings,🔽for the sake of splendor, fame, and truth, to those fires let this be offered.

original: ukṣānnāya vaśānnāya somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase /
analyzed: ukṣa annāya vaśā annāya soma pṛṣṭhāya vedhase
translated: To the one whose food is bulls, whose food is cows, whose back is Soma, the creator,

original: vaiśvānarajyeṣṭhebhyas tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: vaiśvānara jyeṣṭhebhyaḥ tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: to the eldest of the Vaiśvānara fires, to those fires let this be offered.

original: divaṃ pṛthivīm anv antarikṣam ye vidyutam anusaṃcaranti /
analyzed: divam pṛthivīm anu antarikṣam ye vidyutam anusaṃcaranti
translated: Those that move along the lightning, through heaven, earth, and the atmosphere,

original: ye dikṣv antar ye vāte antas tebhyo agnibhyo hutam astv etat ////
analyzed: ye dikṣu antar ye vāte antar tebhyaḥ agnibhyaḥ hutam astu etat
translated: Those that are within the quarters, those that are within the winds, to those fires let this offering be made.

original: hiraṇyapāṇiṃ savitāram indraṃ bṛhaspatiṃ varuṇaṃ mitram agnim /
analyzed: hiraṇya pāṇim savitāram indram bṛhaspatim varuṇam mitram agnim
translated: Savitar with golden hands, Indra, Brihaspati, Varuna, Mitra, Agni,

original: viśvān devān aṅgiraso havāmahe imaṃ kravyādaṃ śamayantv agnim ////
analyzed: viśvān devān aṅgirasaḥ havāmahe imam kravyādam śamayantu agnim
translated: The all-gods, the Angirases, we invoke. Let them appease this flesh-devouring fire.

original: śānto agniḥ kravyāc chāntaḥ puruṣareṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: śāntaḥ agniḥ kravyād śāntaḥ puruṣa reṣaṇaḥ
translated: Pacified is the flesh-devouring fire, pacified is the man-devouring one,

original: atho yo viśvadāvyas taṃ kravyādam aśīśamam ////
analyzed: atho yaḥ viśvadāvyaḥ tam kravyādam aśīśamam
translated: And also the all-devouring one, I have appeased that flesh-devouring one.

original: ye parvatāḥ somapṛṣṭhā āpa uttānaśīvarīḥ /
analyzed: ye parvatāḥ soma pṛṣṭhāḥ āpaḥ uttāna śīvarīḥ
translated: The mountains whose back is Soma, the waters that have Uttaṇa as their lord,

original: vātaḥ parjanya ād agnis te kravyādam aśīśaman ////
analyzed: vātaḥ parjanyaḥ āt agniḥ te kravyādam aśīśaman
translated: The wind, Parjanya, and Agni, they have appeased the flesh-devouring one.

original: hastivarcasaṃ prathatāṃ bṛhad yaśo adityā yat tanvaḥ saṃbabhūva /
analyzed: hasti varcasam prathatām bṛhat yaśaḥ adityāḥ yat tanvaḥ saṃbabhūva
translated: Let the glory that is like the luster of an elephant spread out, the great fame that has arisen from the body of Aditi,

original: tat sarve sam adur mahyam etad viśve devā aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ ////
analyzed: tat sarve sam aduḥ mahyam etat viśve devāḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: May all the gods, Aditi, and those of the same mind as them, grant me all that.

original: mitraś ca varuṇaś cendro rudraś ca cetatu /
analyzed: mitraḥ ca varuṇaḥ ca indraḥ rudraḥ ca cetatu
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Indra, and Rudra be attentive,

original: devāso viśvadhāyasas te māñjantu varcasā ////
analyzed: devāsaḥ viśva dhāyasaḥ te mā añjantu varcasā
translated: May the all-supporting gods anoint me with splendor.

original: yena hastī varcasā saṃbabhūva yena rājā manuṣyesv apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: yena hastī varcasā saṃbabhūva yena rājā manuṣyesu apsu antar
translated: By which the elephant became endowed with splendor, by which the king among men in the waters,

original: yena devā devatām agra āyan tena mām adya varcasāgne varcasvinaṃ kṛṇu ////
analyzed: yena devāḥ deva tām agre āyan tena mām adya varcasā agne varcasvinam kṛṇu
translated: By which the gods attained the rank of gods, by that splendor, O Agni, make me today radiant, O Agni, make me today radiant.

original: yat te varco jātavedo bṛhad bhavaty āhuteḥ /
analyzed: yat te varcaḥ jātavedaḥ bṛhat bhavati āhuteḥ
translated: Whatever great splendor thou hast, O all-knower, from thy oblation,

original: yāvat sūryasya varca āsurasya ca hastinaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat sūryasya varcaḥ āsurasya ca hastinaḥ
translated: As much as the splendor of the sun, of the Asura, of the elephant,

original: tāvan me aśvinā varca ā dhattāṃ puṣkarasrajā ////
analyzed: tāvat me aśvinā varcaḥ ā dhattām puṣkarasrajā
translated: To that extent, O Asvins, grant me splendor, O lotus-garlanded ones.

original: yāvac catasraḥ pradiśaś cakṣur yāvat samaśnute /
analyzed: yāvat catasraḥ pradiśaḥ cakṣuḥ yāvat samaśnute
translated: As far as the four quarters the eye extends, as far as it reaches,

original: tāvat samaitv indriyaṃ mayi tad dhastivarcasam ////
analyzed: tāvat samaitu indriyam mayi tat hasti varcasam
translated: To that extent let the power of that elephant's splendor be united in me.

original: hastī mṛgāṇāṃ suṣadām atiṣṭhāvān babhūva hi /
analyzed: hastī mṛgāṇām suṣadām atiṣṭhāvān babhūva hi
translated: The elephant, the most delightful of animals, has become the most powerful.

original: tasya bhagena varcasābhi ṣiñcāmi mām aham ////
analyzed: tasya bhagena varcasā abhi siñcāmi mām aham
translated: With his splendor and fortune I anoint myself.

original: yena vehad babhūvitha nāśayāmasi tat tvat /
analyzed: yena vehat babhūvitha nāśayāmasi tat tvat
translated: By which thou hast become a wanderer, that we destroy from thee.

original: idaṃ tad anyatra tvad apa dūre ni dadhmasi ////
analyzed: idam tat anyatra tvat apa dūre ni dadhmasi
translated: This we place far away from thee, in another place.

original: ā te yoniṃ garbha etu pumān bāṇa iveṣudhim /
analyzed: ā te yonim garbhaḥ etu pumān bāṇaḥ iva iṣudhim
translated: Let the male embryo enter thy womb, like an arrow into a quiver.

original: ā vīro 'tra jāyatāṃ putras te daśamāsyaḥ ////
analyzed: ā vīro tra jāyatām putraḥ te daśamāsyaḥ
translated: Let a hero be born here, a son for thee, ten months old.

original: pumāṃsaṃ putraṃ janaya taṃ pumān anu jāyatām /
analyzed: pumāṃsam putram janaya tam pumān anu jāyatām
translated: Beget a male child, let a male be born after him.

original: bhavāsi putrāṇāṃ mātā jātānāṃ janayāś ca yān ////
analyzed: bhavāsi putrāṇām mātā jātānām janayāḥ ca yān
translated: You shall be the mother of sons born and of those you will bear.

original: yāni badrāṇi bījāny ṛṣabhā janayanti ca /
analyzed: yāni badrāṇi bījāni ṛṣabhāḥ janayanti ca
translated: The good seeds that the bulls beget,

original: tais tvaṃ putraṃ vindasva sā prasūr dhenukā bhava ////
analyzed: taiḥ tvam putram vindasva sā prasūḥ dhenukā bhava
translated: By them find you a son. Be you a milch cow.

original: kṛṇomi te prājāpatyam ā yoniṃ garbha etu te /
analyzed: kṛṇomi te prājāpatyam ā yonim garbhaḥ etu te
translated: I make for you a womb fit for Prajapati. Let the embryo enter you.

original: vindasva tvaṃ putraṃ nāri yas tubhyaṃ śam asac cham u tasmai tvam bhava ////
analyzed: vindasva tvam putram nāri yaḥ tubhyam śam asat śam u tasmai tvam bhava
translated: Find you a son, O woman, he who shall be good to you, be you good to him.

original: yāsām dyauḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā samudro mūlaṃ vīrudhāṃ babhūva /
analyzed: yāsām dyauḥ pitā pṛthivī mātā samudraḥ mūlam vīrudhām babhūva
translated: Whose father is the sky, whose mother is the earth, whose root is the ocean, the plants have become.

original: tās tvā putravidyāya daivīḥ prāvantv oṣadhayaḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvā putra vidyāya daivīḥ prāvantu oṣadhayaḥ
translated: May those divine plants favour you for the sake of finding a son.

original: payasvatīr oṣadhayaḥ payasvan māmakaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: payasvatīḥ oṣadhayaḥ payasvat māmakam vacaḥ
translated: The plants are full of sap, my speech is full of sap.

original: atho payasvatīnām ā bhare 'haṃ sahasraśaḥ ////
analyzed: atho payasvatīnām ā bhare ham sahasraśas
translated: And of those full of sap I bring a thousand.

original: vedāhaṃ payasvantaṃ cakāra dhānyam bahu /
analyzed: veda aham payasvantam cakāra dhānyam bahu
translated: I know the sapful one, he has made much grain.

original: saṃbhṛtvā nāma yo devas taṃ vayaṃ havāmahe yoyo ayajvano gṛhe ////
analyzed: saṃbhṛtvā nāma yaḥ devaḥ tam vayam havāmahe yaḥ yaḥ ayajvanaḥ gṛhe
translated: The god whose name is Sambhrit, him we invoke, who is in the house of the one who has not sacrificed.

original: imā yāḥ pañca pradiśo mānavīḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ pañca pradiśaḥ mānavīḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: These five regions of men, these five cultivated lands,

original: vṛṣṭe śāpaṃ nadīr iveha sphātiṃ samāvahān ////
analyzed: vṛṣṭe śāpam nadīḥ iva iha sphātim samāvahān
translated: Like rivers in the rain, bring here increase and prosperity.

original: ud utsaṃ śatadhāraṃ sahasradhāram akṣitam /
analyzed: ud utsam śata dhāram sahasra dhāram akṣitam
translated: The spring of a hundred streams, the spring of a thousand streams, the inexhaustible,

original: evāsmākedaṃ dhānyaṃ sahasradhāram akṣitam ////
analyzed: eva asmāka idam dhānyam sahasra dhāram akṣitam
translated: So may this grain of ours be the spring of a thousand streams, the inexhaustible.

original: śatahasta samāhara sahasrahasta saṃ kira /
analyzed: śata hasta samāhara sahasra hasta sam kira
translated: Bring it with a hundred hands, scatter it with a thousand hands.

original: kṛtasya kāryasya ceha sphātiṃ samāvaha ////
analyzed: kṛtasya kāryasya ca iha sphātim samāvaha
translated: Bring here the fullness of the work that has been done.

original: tisro mātrā gandharvāṇāṃ catasro gṛhapatnyāḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ mātrāḥ gandharvāṇām catasraḥ gṛha patnyāḥ
translated: The Gandharvas have three measures, the housewife has four.

original: tāsāṃ yā sphātimattamā tayā tvābhi mṛśāmasi ////
analyzed: tāsām yā sphātimattamā tayā tvā abhi mṛśāmasi
translated: Of those, with the one that is most full we touch you.

original: upohaś ca samūhaś ca kṣattārau te prajāpate /
analyzed: upohaḥ ca samūhaḥ ca kṣattārau te prajāpate
translated: The attendants and the steward are your two doorkeepers, O Prajapati.

original: tāv ihā vahatāṃ sphātiṃ bahuṃ bhūmānam akṣitam ////
analyzed: tau iha ā vahatām sphātim bahum bhūmānam akṣitam
translated: May they bring here much fullness for you, abundant and inexhaustible.

original: uttudas tvot tudatu mā dhṛthāḥ śayane sve /
analyzed: uttudaḥ tvā ud tudatu mā dhṛthāḥ śayane sve
translated: Let the goad prick you, do not lie on your bed.

original: iṣuḥ kāmasya yā bhīmā tayā vidhyāmi tvā hṛdi ////
analyzed: iṣuḥ kāmasya yā bhīmā tayā vidhyāmi tvā hṛdi
translated: With that terrible arrow of love, I will pierce you in the heart.

original: ādhīparṇāṃ kāmaśalyām iṣuṃ saṃkalpakulmalām /
analyzed: ādhīparṇām kāma śalyām iṣum saṃkalpa kulmalām
translated: The arrow of the Gandharva, with the shaft of desire, the barb of resolve,

original: tāṃ susaṃnatāṃ kṛtvā kāmo vidhyatu tvā hṛdi ////
analyzed: tām su saṃnatām kṛtvā kāmaḥ vidhyatu tvā hṛdi
translated: Having made it well-sharpened, may Kama pierce you in the heart.

original: yā plīhānaṃ śoṣayati kāmasyeṣuḥ susaṃnatā /
analyzed: yā plīhānam śoṣayati kāmasya iṣuḥ su saṃnatā
translated: The arrow of love, well-sharpened, that withers the spleen,

original: prācīnapakṣā vyoṣā tayā vidhyāmi tvā hṛdi ////
analyzed: prācīna pakṣā vyoṣā tayā vidhyāmi tvā hṛdi
translated: The two-winged one with the barb, with that I will pierce you in the heart.

original: śucā viddhā vyoṣayā śuṣkāsyābhi sarpa mā /
analyzed: śucā viddhā vyoṣayā śuṣka āsyā abhi sarpa mā
translated: Pierced by the two-winged one with the barb, go forth with a dry mouth.

original: mṛdur nimanyuḥ kevalī priyavādiny anuvratā ////
analyzed: mṛduḥ nimanyuḥ kevalī priya vādinī anuvratā
translated: Gentle, free from anger, devoted, speaking pleasantly, and obedient.

original: ājāmi tvājanyā pari mātur atho pituḥ /
analyzed: ājāmi tvā ajanyā pari mātuḥ atha u pituḥ
translated: I am your brother, born from the mother and the father.

original: yathā mama kratāv aso mama cittam upāyasi ////
analyzed: yathā mama kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi
translated: Just as you obey my will, so you come to my mind.

original: vy asyai mitrāvaruṇau hṛdaś cittāny asyatam /
analyzed: vi asyai mitrāvaruṇau hṛdaḥ cittāni asyatam
translated: May Mitra and Varuna split open her heart and her thoughts.

original: athainām akratuṃ kṛtvā mamaiva kṛṇutaṃ vaśe ////
analyzed: atha enām a kratum kṛtvā mama eva kṛṇutam vaśe
translated: Then, having made her powerless, make her subject to my will.

original: ye 'syāṃ stha prācyāṃ diśi hetayo nāma devās teṣāṃ vo agnir iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ye syām stha prācyām diśi hetayaḥ nāma devāḥ teṣām vaḥ agniḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: You who are in this eastern direction, the gods named Hetas, your arrows are Agni.

original: te no mṛḍata te no 'dhi brūta tebhyo vo namas tebhyo vaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te naḥ mṛḍata te naḥ dhi brūta tebhyaḥ vaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ vaḥ svāhā
translated: Be gracious to us, speak to us for our welfare. To you we offer homage, to you be the Svâhâ!

original: ye 'syāṃ stha dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśy aviṣyavo nāma devās teṣāṃ vaḥ kāma iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ye syām stha dakṣiṇāyām diśi aviṣyavaḥ nāma devāḥ teṣām vaḥ kāmaḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: You who are in this southern direction, the gods named Aviṣyavas, your arrows are Kāma.

original: te no mṛḍata te no 'dhi brūta tebhyo vo namas tebhyo vaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te naḥ mṛḍata te naḥ dhi brūta tebhyaḥ vaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ vaḥ svāhā
translated: Be gracious to us, speak to us for our welfare. To you we offer homage, to you be the Svâhâ!

original: ye 'syāṃ stha pratīcyāṃ diśi vairājā nāma devās teṣāṃ va āpa iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ye syām stha pratīcyām diśi vairājāḥ nāma devāḥ teṣām vaḥ āpaḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: You who are in this western direction, the gods named Vairājas, your arrows are the waters.

original: te no mṛḍata te no 'dhi brūta tebhyo vo namas tebhyo vaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te naḥ mṛḍata te naḥ dhi brūta tebhyaḥ vaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ vaḥ svāhā
translated: Be gracious to us, speak to us for our welfare. To you we offer homage, to you be the Svâhâ!

original: ye 'syāṃ sthodīcyāṃ diśi pravidhyanto nāma devās teṣāṃ vo vāta iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ye syām stha udīcyām diśi pravidhyantaḥ nāma devāḥ teṣām vaḥ vātaḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: Ye who are in this northern quarter, the gods named the Piercers, your arrows are the winds.

original: te no mṛḍata te no 'dhi brūta tebhyo vo namas tebhyo vaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te naḥ mṛḍata te naḥ dhi brūta tebhyaḥ vaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ vaḥ svāhā
translated: Be gentle to us, speak kindly to us. Homage to you, to them! Hail to you, to them!

original: ye 'syāṃ stha dhruvāyāṃ diśi nilimpā nāma devās teṣāṃ va oṣadhīr iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ye syām stha dhruvāyām diśi nilimpāḥ nāma devāḥ teṣām vaḥ oṣadhīḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: Ye who are in this firm quarter, the gods named the Adherers, your arrows are the plants.

original: te no mṛḍata te no 'dhi brūta tebhyo vo namas tebhyo vaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te naḥ mṛḍata te naḥ dhi brūta tebhyaḥ vaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ vaḥ svāhā
translated: Be gentle to us, speak kindly to us. Homage to you, to them! Hail to you, to them!

original: ye 'syāṃ sthordhvāyāṃ diśy avasvanto nāma devās teṣāṃ vo bṛhaspatir iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ye syām stha ūrdhvāyām diśi avasvantaḥ nāma devāḥ teṣām vaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: Ye who are in this upward quarter, the gods named the Possessing Wealth, your arrows are Brihaspati.

original: te no mṛḍata te no 'dhi brūta tebhyo vo namas tebhyo vaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te naḥ mṛḍata te naḥ dhi brūta tebhyaḥ vaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ vaḥ svāhā
translated: Be gentle to us, speak kindly to us. Homage to you, to them! Hail to you, to them!

original: prācī dig agnir adhipatir asito rakṣitādityā iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: prācī diś agniḥ adhipatiḥ asitaḥ rakṣitā ādityāḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: The eastern quarter, Agni is the overlord, the dark one is the guardian, the Adityas are the arrows.

original: tebhyo namo 'dhipatibhyo namo rakṣitṛbhyo nama iṣubhyo nama ebhyo astu /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ namaḥ dhipatibhyaḥ namaḥ rakṣitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ iṣubhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ astu
translated: Homage to them, to the overlords, homage to the guardians, homage to the arrows, homage to them be!

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmas taṃ vo jambhe dadhmaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tam vaḥ jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: We place in your jaws him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: dakṣiṇā dig indro 'dhipatis tiraścirājī rakṣitā pitara iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇā diś indraḥ dhipatiḥ tiraścirājī rakṣitā pitaraḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: The southern quarter, Indra is the overlord, the striped one is the guardian, the fathers are the arrows.

original: tebhyo namo 'dhipatibhyo namo rakṣitṛbhyo nama iṣubhyo nama ebhyo astu /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ namaḥ dhipatibhyaḥ namaḥ rakṣitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ iṣubhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ astu
translated: Homage to them, to the overlords, homage to the protectors, homage to the arrows, homage to them be!

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmas taṃ vo jambhe dadhmaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tam vaḥ jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: We place in your jaws him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: pratīcī dig varuṇo 'dhipatiḥ pṛdākū rakṣitānnam iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: pratīcī diś varuṇaḥ dhipatiḥ pṛdākuḥ rakṣitā annam iṣavaḥ
translated: The western direction, Varuna is the overlord, Pṛdāku is the protector, food is the arrows.

original: tebhyo namo 'dhipatibhyo namo rakṣitṛbhyo nama iṣubhyo nama ebhyo astu /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ namaḥ dhipatibhyaḥ namaḥ rakṣitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ iṣubhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ astu
translated: Homage to them, to the overlords, homage to the protectors, homage to the arrows, homage to them be!

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmas taṃ vo jambhe dadhmaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tam vaḥ jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: We place in your jaws him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: udīcī dik somo 'dhipatiḥ svajo rakṣitāśanir iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: udīcī diś somaḥ dhipatiḥ svajaḥ rakṣitā aśaniḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: The northern direction, Soma is the overlord, Svaja is the protector, the thunderbolt is the arrows.

original: tebhyo namo 'dhipatibhyo namo rakṣitṛbhyo nama iṣubhyo nama ebhyo astu /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ namaḥ dhipatibhyaḥ namaḥ rakṣitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ iṣubhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ astu
translated: Homage to them, to the overlords, homage to the protectors, homage to the arrows, homage to them be!

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmas taṃ vo jambhe dadhmaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tam vaḥ jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: We place in your jaws him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: dhruvā dig viṣṇur adhipatiḥ kalmāṣagrīvo rakṣitā vīrudha iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: dhruvā diś viṣṇuḥ adhipatiḥ kalmāṣa grīvaḥ rakṣitā vīrudhaḥ iṣavaḥ
translated: The firm direction, Vishnu is the overlord, Kalmashaग्रीव is the protector, creepers are the arrows.

original: tebhyo namo 'dhipatibhyo namo rakṣitṛbhyo nama iṣubhyo nama ebhyo astu /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ namaḥ dhipatibhyaḥ namaḥ rakṣitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ iṣubhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ astu
translated: Homage to them, to the overlords, homage to the protectors, homage to the arrows, homage to them be!

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayam dviṣmas taṃ vo jambhe dadhmaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tam vaḥ jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: We place in your jaws him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: ūrdhvā dig bṛhaspatir adhipatiḥ śvitro rakṣitā varṣam iṣavaḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhvā diś bṛhaspatiḥ adhipatiḥ śvitraḥ rakṣitā varṣam iṣavaḥ
translated: The upward direction, Brihaspati is the overlord, the leper is the protector, rain is the arrows.

original: tebhyo namo 'dhipatibhyo namo rakṣitṛbhyo nama iṣubhyo nama ebhyo astu /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ namaḥ dhipatibhyaḥ namaḥ rakṣitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ iṣubhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ astu
translated: To them homage, to the overlords homage, to the protectors homage, to the arrows homage, to them let there be homage.

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmas taṃ vo jambhe dadhmaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tam vaḥ jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: We place in your jaws him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: ekaikayaiṣā sṛṣṭyā saṃ babhūva yatra gā asṛjanta bhūtakṛto viśvarūpāḥ /
analyzed: ekaikayā eṣā sṛṣṭyā sam babhūva yatra gāḥ asṛjanta bhūta kṛtaḥ viśva rūpāḥ
translated: This creation was united with each one, where the cows were created, the creators of beings, of all forms.

original: yatra vijāyate yaminy apartuḥ sā paśūn kṣiṇāti riphatī ruśatī ////
analyzed: yatra vijāyate yaminī apartuḥ sā paśūn kṣiṇāti riphatī ruśatī
translated: Where the untimely one is born, the one who kills the cattle, she destroys the cattle, the one who cuts off, the one who is red.

original: eṣā paśūnt saṃ kṣiṇāti kravyād bhūtvā vyadvarī /
analyzed: eṣā paśūn sam kṣiṇāti kravyād bhūtvā vyadvarī
translated: She destroys the cattle, becoming a flesh-eater, the one who spreads out.

original: utaināṃ brahmaṇe dadyāt tathā syonā śivā syāt ////
analyzed: uta enām brahmaṇe dadyāt tathā syonā śivā syāt
translated: Or one should give her to a brahmin, so that she may be gentle and auspicious.

original: śivā bhava puruṣebhyo gobhyo aśvebhyaḥ śivā /
analyzed: śivā bhava puruṣebhyaḥ gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ śivā
translated: Be auspicious to men, to cows, to horses, be auspicious.

original: śivāsmai sarvasmai kṣetrāya śivā na ihaidhi ////
analyzed: śivā asmai sarvasmai kṣetrāya śivā naḥ iha edhi
translated: Be auspicious to this whole field, be auspicious, come hither.

original: iha puṣṭir iha rasa iha sahasrasātamā bhava /
analyzed: iha puṣṭiḥ iha rasaḥ iha sahasra sātamā bhava
translated: Here is nourishment, here is sap, be most bountiful here with a thousand.

original: paśūn yamini poṣaya ////
analyzed: paśūn yamini poṣaya
translated: O one who kills cattle, nourish the cattle.

original: yatrā suhārdaḥ sukṛto madanti vihāya rogaṃ tanvaḥ svāyāḥ /
analyzed: yatrā suhārdaḥ su kṛtaḥ madanti vihāya rogam tanvaḥ svāyāḥ
translated: Where well-wishing and virtuous ones rejoice, having left behind sickness from their own bodies,

original: taṃ lokaṃ yaminy abhisaṃbabhūva sā no mā hiṃsīt puruṣān paśūṃś ca ////
analyzed: tam lokam yaminī abhisaṃbabhūva sā naḥ mā hiṃsīt puruṣān paśūn ca
translated: To that world the one who leads to Yama has gone. May she not harm us, men and animals.

original: yatrā suhārdāṃ sukṛtām agnihotrahutām yatra lokaḥ /
analyzed: yatra suhārdām su kṛtām agnihotra hutām yatra lokaḥ
translated: Where there is a world of well-wishing and virtuous ones who have offered the Agnihotra,

original: taṃ lokaṃ yaminy abhisaṃbabhūva sā no mā hiṃsīt puruṣān paśūṃś ca ////
analyzed: tam lokam yaminī abhisaṃbabhūva sā naḥ mā hiṃsīt puruṣān paśūn ca
translated: To that world the one who leads to Yama has gone. May she not harm us, men and animals.

original: yad rājāno vibhajanta iṣṭāpūrtasya ṣoḍaśam yamasyāmī sabhāsadaḥ /
analyzed: yat rājānaḥ vibhajante iṣṭāpūrtasya ṣoḍaśam yamasya amī sabhāsadaḥ
translated: What the kings distribute as a sixteenth part of the offerings and fulfilled vows, Yama's companions in the assembly,

original: avis tasmāt pra muñcati dattaḥ śitipāt svadhā ////
analyzed: aviḥ tasmāt pra muñcati dattaḥ śiti pād svadhā
translated: From that the sheep is released, given, the one with sharp hooves, by Svāhā.

original: sarvān kāmān pūrayaty ābhavan prabhavan bhavan /
analyzed: sarvān kāmān pūrayati ābhavan prabhavan bhavan
translated: It fulfills all desires, being, becoming, and existing.

original: ākūtipro 'vir dattaḥ śitipānn nopa dasyati ////
analyzed: ākūtipraḥ viḥ dattaḥ śiti pād nā upa dasyati
translated: The sheep, given with intention, the one with sharp hooves, will not abandon us.

original: yo dadāti śitipādam aviṃ lokena saṃmitam /
analyzed: yaḥ dadāti śiti pādam avim lokena saṃmitam
translated: He who gives a sheep with sharp hooves, measured by the world,

original: sa nākam abhyārohati yatra śulko na kriyate abalena balīyase ////
analyzed: sa nākam abhyārohati yatra śulkaḥ na kriyate abalena balīyase
translated: He ascends to the vault, where the bride-price is not paid by the weak to the strong.

original: pañcāpūpaṃ śitipādam aviṃ lokena saṃmitam /
analyzed: pañca apūpam śiti pādam avim lokena saṃmitam
translated: The sheep with five cakes and sharp hooves, measured by the world,

original: pradātopa jīvati pitṝṇāṃ loke 'kṣitam ////
analyzed: pradātā upa jīvati pitṝṇām loke kṣitam
translated: When given, one lives in the imperishable world of the ancestors.

original: pañcāpūpaṃ śitipādam aviṃ lokena saṃmitam /
analyzed: pañca apūpam śiti pādam avim lokena saṃmitam
translated: The sheep with five cakes and sharp hooves, measured by the world,

original: pradātopa jīvati sūryāmāsayor akṣitam ////
analyzed: pradātā upa jīvati sūryāmāsayoḥ akṣitam
translated: The sun and moon give life to him who gives it.

original: ireva nopa dasyati samudra iva payo mahat /
analyzed: irā iva nā upa dasyati samudraḥ iva payaḥ mahat
translated: Like the ocean does not give up its great waters,

original: devau savāsināv iva śitipān nopa dasyati ////
analyzed: devau sa vāsinau iva śiti pād nā upa dasyati
translated: like the two gods who are clothed in the sky, the two who drink the pure, does not give up.

original: ka idaṃ kasmā adāt kāmaḥ kāmāyādāt /
analyzed: kaḥ idam kasmai adāt kāmaḥ kāmāya adāt
translated: Who gave this? Who gave it to whom? Desire gave to desire.

original: kāmo dātā kāmaḥ pratigrahītā kāmaḥ samudram ā viveśa /
analyzed: kāmaḥ dātā kāmaḥ pratigrahītā kāmaḥ samudram ā viveśa
translated: Desire is the giver, desire is the receiver, desire entered the ocean.

original: kāmena tvā prati gṛhnāmi kāmaitat te ////
analyzed: kāmena tvā prati gṛhnāmi kāma etat te
translated: With desire I receive you, O desire, this is yours.

original: bhūmiṣ ṭvā prati gṛhṇātv antarikṣam idaṃ mahat /🔽māhaṃ prāṇena mātmanā mā prajayā pratigṛhya vi rādhiṣi ////
analyzed: bhūmiḥ tvā prati gṛhṇātu antarikṣam idam mahat  mā aham prāṇena mā ātmanā mā prajayā pratigṛhya vi rādhiṣi
translated: May the earth receive you, and this great sky.🔽May I not be separated from breath, from my own self, from offspring, having received.

original: sahṛdayaṃ sāṃmanasyam avidveṣaṃ kṛṇomi vaḥ /
analyzed: sahṛdayam sāṃmanasyam a vidveṣam kṛṇomi vaḥ
translated: I make you have a friendly heart, a friendly mind, without hatred.

original: anyo anyam abhi haryata vatsaṃ jātam ivāghnyā ////
analyzed: anyaḥ anyam abhi haryata vatsam jātam iva aghnyā
translated: Let one love another, like a cow loves her newly born calf.

original: anuvrataḥ pituḥ putro mātrā bhavatu saṃmanāḥ /
analyzed: anuvrataḥ pituḥ putraḥ mātrā bhavatu saṃmanāḥ
translated: Let the son be obedient to his father, in harmony with his mother.

original: jāyā patye madhumatīṃ vācaṃ vadatu śantivām ////
analyzed: jāyā patye madhumatīm vācam vadatu śantivām
translated: Let the wife speak to her husband sweet and auspicious words.

original: mā bhrātā bhrātaraṃ dvikṣan mā svasāram uta svasā /
analyzed: mā bhrātā bhrātaram dvikṣat mā svasāram uta svasā
translated: Let a brother not hate his brother, nor a sister her sister.

original: samyañcaḥ savratā bhūtvā vācaṃ vadata bhadrayā ////
analyzed: samyañcaḥ savratāḥ bhūtvā vācam vadata bhadrayā
translated: Being in harmony, having the same vows, speak with each other in a good way.

original: yena devā na viyanti no ca vidviṣate mithaḥ /
analyzed: yena devāḥ na viyanti na u ca vidviṣate mithas
translated: By which the gods do not quarrel, nor do they hate each other,

original: tat kṛṇmo brahma vo gṛhe saṃjñānaṃ puruṣebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: tat kṛṇmaḥ brahma vaḥ gṛhe saṃjñānam puruṣebhyaḥ
translated: We make that agreement in your house, for the men.

original: jyāyasvantaś cittino mā vi yauṣṭa saṃrādhayantaḥ sadhurāś carantaḥ /🔽anyo anyasmai valgu vadanta eta sadhrīcīnān vaḥ saṃmanasas krṇomi ////
analyzed: jyāyasvantaḥ cittinaḥ mā vi yauṣṭa saṃrādhayantaḥ sadhurāḥ carantaḥ  anyaḥ anyasmai valgu vadantaḥ eta sadhrīcīnān vaḥ saṃmanasaḥ krṇomi
translated: Rich, thoughtful, do not quarrel, but agree as you go your ways.🔽Speaking kindly to each other, I make you all of one mind.

original: samānī prapā saha vo 'nnabhāgaḥ samāne yoktre saha vo yunajmi /
analyzed: samānī prapā saha vaḥ nna bhāgaḥ samāne yoktre saha vaḥ yunajmi
translated: The drinking place is common to all of you, the sharing of food is common, with a common yoke I yoke you together.

original: samyañco 'gniṃ saparyatārā nābhim ivābhitaḥ ////
analyzed: samyañcaḥ gnim saparyata arāḥ nābhim iva abhitas
translated: Be friendly to the fire, as to the navel, all around.

original: sadhrīcīnān vaḥ saṃmanasas kṛṇomy ekaśnuṣṭīnt saṃvananena sarvān /
analyzed: sadhrīcīnān vaḥ saṃmanasaḥ kṛṇomi eka śnuṣṭīn saṃvananena sarvān
translated: I make you all of one mind, all of you who breathe together, with the agreement.

original: devā ivāmṛtaṃ rakṣamāṇāḥ sāyaṃprātaḥ saumanaso vo astu ////
analyzed: devāḥ iva amṛtam rakṣamāṇāḥ sāyaṃprātar saumanasaḥ vaḥ astu
translated: Like the gods guarding immortality, may you have good will in the evening and in the morning.

original: vi devā jarasāvṛtan vi tvam agne arātyā /
analyzed: vi devāḥ jarasā avṛtan vi tvam agne arātyā
translated: The gods have removed old age, you, O Agni, have removed misfortune.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have removed all evil, I have removed consumption, I have removed it with life.

original: vy ārtyā pavamāno vi śakraḥ pāpakṛtyayā /
analyzed: vi ārtyā pavamānaḥ vi śakraḥ pāpa kṛtyayā
translated: Pavamana has removed misfortune, Shakra has removed evil-doing.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have removed all evil, I have removed consumption, I have removed it with life.

original: vi grāmyāḥ paśava āraṇyair vy āpas tṛṣṇayāsaran /
analyzed: vi grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ āraṇyaiḥ vi āpaḥ tṛṣṇayā asaran
translated: The domestic animals have been separated from the wild ones, the waters have been separated from thirst.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: vī me dyāvāpṛthivī ito vi panthāno diśaṃdiśam /
analyzed: vi me dyāvāpṛthivī itas vi panthānaḥ diśaṃdiśam
translated: May the two worlds, heaven and earth, be separated from me, the paths in every direction.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ yunaktītīdaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ vi yāti /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatum yunakti iti idam viśvam bhuvanam vi yāti
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ yokes the conveyance for his daughter, thereby this whole world moves apart.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: agniḥ prāṇānt saṃ dadhāti candraḥ prāṇena saṃhitaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ prāṇān sam dadhāti candraḥ prāṇena saṃhitaḥ
translated: Agni unites the vital breaths, the moon is united with the vital breath.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: prāṇena viśvatovīryaṃ devāḥ sūryaṃ sam airayan /
analyzed: prāṇena viśvatas vīryam devāḥ sūryam sam airayan
