translated: The gods have united the sun with the vital breath, which is powerful in every way.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: āyuṣmatām āyuṣkṛtāṃ prāṇena jīva mā mṛthāḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣmatām āyuḥ kṛtām prāṇena jīva mā mṛthāḥ
translated: With the life of those who have long life, live with the vital breath, do not die.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: prāṇena prāṇatāṃ prāṇehaiva bhava mā mṛthāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇena prāṇatām prāṇa iha eva bhava mā mṛthāḥ
translated: With the vital breath of those who live by the vital breath, stay right here, do not die.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I have been separated from all evil, from tuberculosis, I have been united with life.

original: ud āyuṣā sam āyuṣod oṣadhīnāṃ rasena /
analyzed: ud āyuṣā sam āyuṣā ud oṣadhīnām rasena
translated: Up with life, with life's sap, up with the essence of the plants,

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I rise with all my evil, with consumption, up with life.

original: ā parjanyasya vṛṣṭyod asthāmāmṛtā vayam /
analyzed: ā parjanyasya vṛṣṭyā ud asthāma amṛtāḥ vayam
translated: Up with the rain of Parjanya, we have risen, we who are immortal.

original: vy ahaṃ sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā ////
analyzed: vi aham sarveṇa pāpmanā vi yakṣmeṇa sam āyuṣā
translated: I rise with all my evil, with consumption, up with life.

original: brahma jajñānaṃ prathamaṃ purastād vi sīmataḥ suruco vena āvaḥ /
analyzed: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt vi sīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ
translated: The Brahman, born first in the beginning, Vena hath disclosed from the boundary, of great radiance.

original: sa budhnyā upamā asya viṣṭhāḥ sataś ca yonim asataś ca vi vaḥ ////
analyzed: sa budhnyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim asataḥ ca vi var
translated: His are the deep, the high, the low, the near, the far, the near and the distant.

original: iyaṃ pitryā rāṣṭry etv agre prathamāya januṣe bhuvaneṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: iyam pitryā rāṣṭrī etu agre prathamāya januṣe bhuvaneṣṭhāḥ
translated: This royal realm of the fathers, this first one, hath come to the first-born, the lord of the world.

original: tasmā etaṃ surucaṃ hvāram ahyaṃ gharmaṃ śrīṇantu prathamāya dhāsyave ////
analyzed: tasmai etam su rucam hvāram ahyam gharmam śrīṇantu prathamāya dhāsyave
translated: To him let them pour the bright, the tawny, the heated, the first to be offered.

original: pra yo jajñe vidvān asya bandhur viśvā devānāṃ janimā vivakti /
analyzed: pra yaḥ jajñe vidvān asya bandhuḥ viśvā devānām janimā vivakti
translated: He who was born, the wise one, the kinsman of this (world), declares the birth of all the gods.

original: brahma brahmaṇa uj jabhāra madhyān nicair uccaiḥ svadhā abhi pra tasthau ////
analyzed: brahma brahmaṇaḥ ud jabhāra madhyāt nicais uccais svadhāḥ abhi pra tasthau
translated: The Brahman hath lifted up the Brahman from the middle, from the low, from the high, it hath stood firm by its own power.

original: sa hi vidaḥ sa pṛthivyā ṛtasthā mahī kṣemaṃ rodasī askabhāyat /
analyzed: sa hi vidaḥ sa pṛthivyāḥ ṛta sthāḥ mahī kṣemam rodasī askabhāyat
translated: For he is the knower, he is the supporter of the earth, the upholder of the two great worlds, the firm one, the secure one.

original: mahān mahī askabhāyad vi jāto dyāṃ sadma pārthivaṃ ca rajaḥ ////🔽sa bhudhnyād āṣṭra januṣo 'bhy agram bṛhaspatir devatā tasya samrāṭ /
analyzed: mahān mahī askabhāyat vi jātaḥ dyām sadma pārthivam ca rajaḥ  sa bhudhnyāt januṣaḥ bhi agram bṛhaspatiḥ devatā tasya samrāj
translated: The great one has firmly established the earth, born, the abode of heaven and the atmospheric region.🔽May he, the son of Bhu and Dhun, the firstborn of Jana, Brihaspati, the overlord, be the deity of that (sacrifice).

original: ahar yac chukraṃ jyotiṣo janiṣṭātha dyumanto vi vasantu viprāḥ ////
analyzed: ahar yat śukram jyotiṣaḥ janiṣṭa atha dyumantaḥ vi vasantu viprāḥ
translated: When the bright light of the day was born, then may the radiant sages be separated.

original: nūnaṃ tad asya kāvyo hinoti maho devasya pūrvyasya dhāma /
analyzed: nūnam tat asya kāvyaḥ hinoti mahaḥ devasya pūrvyasya dhāma
translated: That indeed is his hymn which exalts the great abode of the ancient god.

original: eṣa jajñe bahubhiḥ sākam itthā pūrve ardhe viṣite sasan nu ////
analyzed: eṣa jajñe bahubhiḥ sākam itthā pūrve ardhe viṣite sasan nu
translated: He was born here with many, in the same way as the former (gods) were born in the eastern half.

original: yo 'tharvāṇaṃ pitaraṃ devabandhuṃ bṛhaspatiṃ namasāva ca gachāt /
analyzed: yaḥ tharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum bṛhaspatim namasā ava ca gacchāt
translated: One should go for refuge to Atharvan, the father, the kinsman of the gods, and to Brihaspati with homage.

original: tvaṃ viśveṣāṃ janitā yathāsaḥ kavir devo na dabhāyat svadhāvān ////
analyzed: tvam viśveṣām janitā yathā asaḥ kaviḥ devaḥ na dabhāyat svadhāvān
translated: You are the progenitor of all as such, a self-existent sage, a god, who cannot be deceived.

original: ya ātmadā baladā yasya viśva upāsate praśiṣaṃ yasya devāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ātma dāḥ bala dāḥ yasya viśve upāsate praśiṣam yasya devāḥ
translated: He who is the giver of life, the giver of strength, on whom all depend, whose rule the gods obey,

original: yo 'syeśe dvipado yaś catuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya īśe dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Who rules over this, both the two-footed and the four-footed, to which god shall we offer oblation?

original: yaḥ prāṇato nimiṣato mahitvaiko rājā jagato babhūva /
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇataḥ nimiṣataḥ mahitvā ekaḥ rājā jagataḥ babhūva
translated: He who by his greatness became the sole king of the moving and the unmoving world,

original: yasya chāyāmṛtaṃ yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: yasya chāyā amṛtam yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Whose shadow is immortality, whose shadow is death, to which god shall we offer oblation?

original: yaṃ krandasī avataś caskabhāne bhiyasāne rodasī ahvayethām /
analyzed: yam krandasī avataḥ caskabhāne bhiyasāne rodasī ahvayethām
translated: Whom the two worlds, when established, call upon, when frightened, the two worlds, heaven and earth, call upon.

original: yasyāsau panthā rajaso vimānaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: yasya asau panthāḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Whose path is that, the measure of the atmosphere? To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yasya dyaur urvī pṛthivī ca mahī yasyāda urv antarikṣam /
analyzed: yasya dyauḥ urvī pṛthivī ca mahī yasya adaḥ uru antarikṣam
translated: Whose is the vast heaven and the great earth, whose is the vast atmosphere from the beginning.

original: yasyāsau sūro vitato mahitvā kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: yasya asau sūraḥ vitataḥ mahitvā kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Whose is the sun spread out by his greatness? To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yasya viśve himavanto mahitvā samudre yasya rasām id āhuḥ /
analyzed: yasya viśve himavantaḥ mahitvā samudre yasya rasām id āhuḥ
translated: Whose are all the snowy mountains by his greatness, whose are the waters of the ocean said to be.

original: imāś ca pradiśo yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: imāḥ ca pradiśaḥ yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Whose are these quarters with their arms? To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: āpo agre viśvam āvan garbhaṃ dadhānā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ agre viśvam āvan garbham dadhānāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: The waters, in the beginning, all-containing, bearing the embryo, immortal, knowing truth,

original: yāsu devīṣv adhi deva āsīt kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: yāsu devīṣu adhi devaḥ āsīt kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: In whom the god was, in which goddesses? To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ sam avartatāgre bhūtasya jātaḥ patir eka āsīt /
analyzed: hiraṇya garbhaḥ sam avartata agre bhūtasya jātaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ āsīt
translated: Hiranyagarbha, in the beginning, arose, born the lord of all created beings.

original: sa dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: sa dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: He supports the earth and the sky. To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: āpo vatsaṃ janayantīr garbham agre sam airayan /
analyzed: āpaḥ vatsam janayantīḥ garbham agre sam airayan
translated: The waters, bringing forth the calf, the embryo, in the beginning, have united.

original: tasyota jāyamānasyolba āsīd dhiraṇyayaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: tasya uta jāyamānasya ulbaḥ āsīt hiraṇyayaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: When he was born, his caul was gold. To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: ud itas trayo akraman vyāghraḥ puruṣo vṛkaḥ /🔽hirug ghi yanti sindhavo hirug devo vanaspatir hiruṅ namantu śatravaḥ ////🔽pareṇaitu pathā vṛkaḥ parameṇota taskaraḥ /
analyzed: ud itas trayaḥ akraman vyāghraḥ puruṣaḥ vṛkaḥ  hiruk ghi yanti sindhavaḥ hiruk devaḥ vanaspatiḥ hiruk namantu śatravaḥ  pareṇa etu pathā vṛkaḥ parameṇa uta taskaraḥ
translated: Three have gone forth from here: the tiger, the man, the wolf.🔽The rivers flow with difficulty, the god, the tree, flows with difficulty. With difficulty let the enemies bow down.

original: pareṇa datvatī rajjuḥ pareṇāghāyur arṣatu ////
analyzed: pareṇa datvatī rajjuḥ pareṇa aghāyuḥ arṣatu
translated: Let the wolf go away by the farthest path, let the thief go away by the most distant.🔽Let the rope that binds go away by the farthest, let the evil go away by the most distant.

original: akṣyau ca te mukhaṃ ca te vyāghra jambhayāmasi /
analyzed: akṣyau ca te mukham ca te vyāghra jambhayāmasi
translated: We crush thy eyes and thy mouth, O tiger.

original: āt sarvān viṃśatiṃ nakhān ////
analyzed: āt sarvān viṃśatim nakhān
translated: We crush all thy twenty claws.

original: vyāghraṃ datvatāṃ vayaṃ prathamaṃ jambhayāmasi /
analyzed: vyāghram datvatām vayam prathamam jambhayāmasi
translated: We crush the tiger, the first of the biting ones.

original: ād u ṣṭenam atho ahiṃ yātudhānam atho vṛkam ////
analyzed: āt u stenam atha u ahim yātudhānam atha u vṛkam
translated: Then the thief, then the serpent, then the wolf, the Yātudhāna.

original: yo adya stena āyati sa saṃpiṣṭo apāyati /
analyzed: yaḥ adya stenaḥ āyati sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati
translated: The thief who comes today, crushed, he goes away.

original: pathām apadhvaṃsenaitv indro vajreṇa hantu tam ////
analyzed: pathām apadhvaṃsena etu indraḥ vajreṇa hantu tam
translated: Let him go by the path of destruction. Let Indra with his thunderbolt slay him.

original: mūrṇā mṛgasya dantā apiśīrṇā u pṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: mūrṇāḥ mṛgasya dantāḥ apiśīrṇāḥ u pṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: The teeth of the deer are broken, the ribs are crushed.

original: nimruk te godhā bhavatu nīcāyac chaśayur mṛgaḥ ////
analyzed: nimruc te godhā bhavatu nīcāyat śaśayuḥ mṛgaḥ
translated: Let thy spine be bent, let the hare, the deer, be low-lying.

original: yat saṃyamo na vi yamo vi yamo yan na saṃyamaḥ /
analyzed: yat saṃyamaḥ na vi yamaḥ vi yamaḥ yat na saṃyamaḥ
translated: What is bound is not released, what is released is not bound.

original: indrajāḥ somajā ātharvaṇam asi vyāghrajambhanam ////
analyzed: indra jāḥ soma jāḥ ātharvaṇam asi vyāghra jambhanam
translated: You are born of Indra, born of Soma, born of the Atharvan, born of the tiger's jaw.

original: yāṃ tvā gandharvo akhanad varuṇāya mṛtabhraje /
analyzed: yām tvā gandharvaḥ akhanat varuṇāya mṛta bhraje
translated: The Gandharva who dug you up for Varuna in the battle of the dead,

original: tāṃ tvā vayaṃ khanāmasy oṣadhiṃ śepaharṣaṇīm ////
analyzed: tām tvā vayam khanāmasi oṣadhim śepa harṣaṇīm
translated: We dig you up, O plant, to delight the penis.

original: ud uṣā ud u sūrya ud idaṃ māmakaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: ud uṣāḥ ud u sūryaḥ ud idam māmakam vacaḥ
translated: Up, O Dawn, up, O Sun, up this speech of mine,

original: ud ejatu prajāpatir vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa vājinā ////
analyzed: ud ejatu prajāpatiḥ vṛṣā śuṣmeṇa vājinā
translated: May Prajapati rise up, the bull, with vigor and strength.

original: yathā sma te virohato 'bhitaptam ivānati /
analyzed: yathā sma te virohataḥ bhitaptam iva anati
translated: As if your rising were scorched all around,

original: tatas te śuṣmavattaram iyaṃ kṛṇotv oṣadhiḥ ////
analyzed: tatas te śuṣmavattaram iyam kṛṇotu oṣadhiḥ
translated: May this plant make you even more vigorous than that.

original: uc chuṣmauṣadhīnāṃ sārā ṛṣabhāṇām /
analyzed: ud śuṣma oṣadhīnām sārāḥ ṛṣabhāṇām
translated: The vigor of the plants, the essence of the bulls,

original: saṃ puṃsām indra vṛṣṇyam asmin dhehi tanūvaśin ////
analyzed: sam puṃsām indra vṛṣṇyam asmin dhehi tanū vaśin
translated: O Indra, bestow in this one the strength of the males, O one who controls his body.

original: apāṃ rasaḥ prathamajo 'tho vanaspatīnām /
analyzed: apām rasaḥ prathama jaḥ vanaspatīnām
translated: The essence of the waters, the firstborn, and also of the trees,

original: uta somasya bhrātāsy utārśam asi vṛṣṇyam ////
analyzed: uta somasya bhrātā asi uta arśam asi vṛṣṇyam
translated: And you are the brother of Soma, and you are the strength of the bull.

original: adyāgne adya savitar adya devi sarasvati /
analyzed: adya agne adya savitar adya devi sarasvati
translated: Today, O Agni, today, O Savitar, today, O goddess Sarasvati,

original: adyāsya brahmaṇas pate dhanur ivā tānayā pasaḥ ////
analyzed: adya asya brahmaṇaḥ pate dhanuḥ iva ā tānaya pasaḥ
translated: Today, O Brahmaṇaspati, draw his pain away like a bowstring.

original: āhaṃ tanomi te paso adhi jyām iva dhanvani /
analyzed: ā aham tanomi te pasaḥ adhi jyām iva dhanvani
translated: I draw your pain out of you, like a bowstring on a bow.

original: kramasvarśa iva rohitam anavaglāyatā sadā ////
analyzed: kramasva ṛśaḥ iva rohitam an avaglāyatā sadā
translated: Go, O Rṣi, like a red bull, always without faltering.

original: aśvasyāśvatarasyājasya petvasya ca /
analyzed: aśvasya aśvatarasya ajasya petvasya ca
translated: Of the horse, of the ass, of the goat, and of the ram,

original: atha ṛṣabhasya ye vājās tān asmin dhehi tanūvaśin ////
analyzed: atha ṛṣabhasya ye vājāḥ tān asmin dhehi tanū vaśin
translated: And of the bull, O Tanūvān, place in him those powers.

original: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrād udācarat /
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yaḥ samudrāt udācarat
translated: The thousand-horned bull who hath come forth from the ocean,

original: tenā sahasyenā vayaṃ ni janānt svāpayāmasi ////
analyzed: tena sahasyena vayam ni janān svāpayāmasi
translated: With him, the victorious, we cause the people to fall asleep.

original: na bhūmiṃ vāto ati vāti nāti paśyati kaś cana /
analyzed: na bhūmim vātaḥ ati vāti na ati paśyati kaḥ cana
translated: The wind blows not over the earth, nor does anyone see it.

original: striyaś ca sarvāḥ svāpaya śunaś cendrasakhā caran ////
analyzed: striyaḥ ca sarvāḥ svāpaya śunaḥ ca indra sakhā caran
translated: Make all women and dogs fall asleep, O friend of Indra, as you move about.

original: proṣṭheśayās talpeśayā nārīr yā vahyaśīvarīḥ /
analyzed: proṣṭheśayāḥ talpeśayāḥ nārīḥ yāḥ vahya śīvarīḥ
translated: Those women who lie on the eastern side of the house, on the western side, and those who are outside the house,

original: striyo yāḥ puṇyagandhayas tāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi ////
analyzed: striyaḥ yāḥ puṇya gandhayaḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi
translated: Those women who are fragrant with virtue, we make them all fall asleep.

original: ejadejad ajagrabhaṃ cakṣuḥ prāṇam ajagrabham /
analyzed: ejat ejat ajagrabham cakṣuḥ prāṇam ajagrabham
translated: I have seized the moving, I have seized the eye, I have seized the breath.

original: aṅgāny ajagrabhaṃ sarvā rātrīṇām atiśarvare ////
analyzed: aṅgāni ajagrabham sarvā rātrīṇām atiśarvare
translated: I have seized all the limbs, in the long night of the nights.

original: ya āste yaś carati yaś ca tiṣṭhan vipaśyati /
analyzed: yaḥ āste yaḥ carati yaḥ ca tiṣṭhan vipaśyati
translated: He who sits, he who moves about, he who stands and looks around,

original: teṣāṃ saṃ dadhmo akṣīṇi yathedaṃ harmyaṃ tathā ////
analyzed: teṣām sam dadhmaḥ akṣīṇi yathā idam harmyam tathā
translated: We put their eyes together, just like this house.

original: svaptu mātā svaptu pitā svaptu śvā svaptu viśpatiḥ /
analyzed: svaptu mātā svaptu pitā svaptu śvā svaptu viśpatiḥ
translated: Let the mother sleep, let the father sleep, let the dog sleep, let the master of the house sleep.

original: svapantv asyai jñātayaḥ svaptv ayam abhito janaḥ ////
analyzed: svapantu asyai jñātayaḥ svaptu ayam abhitas janaḥ
translated: Let his relatives sleep, let the people around here sleep.

original: svapna svapnābhikaraṇena sarvaṃ ni svāpayā janam /
analyzed: svapna svapna abhikaraṇena sarvam ni svāpaya janam
translated: With the sleep-like quality of sleep, put the whole people to sleep.

original: otsūryam anyānt svāpayāvyuṣaṃ jāgṛtād aham indra ivāriṣṭo akṣitaḥ ////
analyzed: ā utsūryam anyān svāpaya āvyuṣam jāgṛtāt aham indraḥ iva ariṣṭaḥ akṣitaḥ
translated: Put others to sleep beyond the sun, and let me alone be awake, like Indra, uninjured and imperishable.

original: brāhmaṇo jajñe prathamo daśaśīrṣo daśāsyaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ jajñe prathamaḥ daśa śīrṣaḥ daśa āsyaḥ
translated: The Brahmin was born first, with ten heads and ten faces.

original: sa somaṃ prathamaḥ papau sa cakārārasaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: sa somam prathamaḥ papau sa cakāra arasam viṣam
translated: He first drank the soma, and he made the poison flavorless.

original: yāvatī dyāvāpṛthivī varimṇā yāvat sapta sindhavo vitaṣṭhire /
analyzed: yāvatī dyāvāpṛthivī varimṇā yāvat sapta sindhavaḥ vitaṣṭhire
translated: As far as the sky and earth extend in breadth, as far as the seven rivers are spread out,

original: vācaṃ viṣasya dūṣaṇīṃ tām ito nir avādiṣam ////
analyzed: vācam viṣasya dūṣaṇīm tām itas niḥ avādiṣam
translated: I have uttered here the defiling speech of the poison.

original: suparṇas tvā garutmān viṣa prathamam āvayat /
analyzed: suparṇaḥ tvā garutmān viṣa prathamam āvayat
translated: The eagle Garutman first extracted the poison from you.

original: nāmīmado nārūrupa utāsmā abhavaḥ pituḥ ////
analyzed: na amīmadaḥ na arūrupaḥ uta asmai abhavaḥ pituḥ
translated: You did not tremble, nor did you become rigid, but you became the father's.

original: yas ta āsyat pañcāṅgurir vakrāc cid adhi dhanvanaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te āsyat pañca aṅguriḥ vakrāt cit adhi dhanvanaḥ
translated: The one who pierced you with five fingers from even a crooked bow,

original: apaskambhasya śalyān nir avocam ahaṃ viṣam ////🔽śalyād viṣaṃ nir avocam prāñjanād uta parṇadheḥ /
analyzed: apaskambhasya śalyān niḥ avocam aham viṣam  śalyāt viṣam niḥ avocam prāñjanāt uta parṇadheḥ
translated: I have extracted the poison of the shaft of the bow without a back.🔽I have extracted the poison from the shaft, from the red one, and from the leaf-holder.

original: apāṣṭhāc chṛṅgāt kulmalān nir avocam aham viṣam ////🔽arasas ta iṣo śalyo 'tho te arasaṃ viṣam /
analyzed: apāṣṭhāt śṛṅgāt kulmalāt niḥ avocam aham viṣam  arasaḥ te iṣaḥ śalyaḥ tho te arasam viṣam
translated: From the back of the horn, from the horn-case, I have extracted the poison.🔽Your shaft is flavorless, O arrow, and your poison is flavorless.

original: utārasasya vṛkṣasya dhanuṣ ṭe arasārasam ////
analyzed: uta arasasya vṛkṣasya dhanuḥ te arasa arasam
translated: And the bow of the flavorless tree has a flavorless arrow.

original: ye apīṣan ye adihan ya āsyan ye avāsṛjan /
analyzed: ye apīṣan ye adihan ye āsyan ye avāsṛjan
translated: Those who have ground it, those who have melted it, those who have roasted it, those who have scattered it,

original: sarve te vadhrayaḥ kṛtā vadhrir viṣagiriḥ kṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: sarve te vadhrayaḥ kṛtāḥ vadhriḥ viṣa giriḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: all of them have become lame, the lame one has made the poison-mountain lame.

original: vadhrayas te khanitāro vadhris tvam asy oṣadhe /🔽vadhriḥ sa parvato girir yato jātam idaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: vadhrayaḥ te khanitāraḥ vadhriḥ tvam asi oṣadhe  vadhriḥ sa parvataḥ giriḥ yatas jātam idam viṣam
translated: Lame are the diggers for thee, lame art thou, O plant.🔽Lame is that mountain, that hill, whence this poison hath sprung.

original: vār idam vārayātai varaṇāvatyām adhi /
analyzed: vār idam vārayātai varaṇāvatyām adhi
translated: This water shall drive away the poison on the bank of the Varana.

original: tatrāmṛtasyāsiktaṃ tenā te vāraye viṣam ////
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya āsiktam tena te vāraye viṣam
translated: There the immortal hath been poured; with it I drive away thy poison.

original: arasaṃ prācyaṃ viṣam arasaṃ yad udīcyam /
analyzed: a rasam prācyam viṣam a rasam yat udīcyam
translated: The poison that is in the east is powerless, powerless the poison that is in the north.

original: athedam adharācyaṃ karambheṇa vi kalpate ////
analyzed: atha idam adharācyam karambheṇa vi kalpate
translated: But this poison that is in the south is destroyed by the Karambha.

original: karambhaṃ kṛtvā tiryaṃ pībaspākam udārathim /🔽kṣudhā kila tvā duṣṭano jakṣivānt sa na rūrupaḥ ////
analyzed: karambham kṛtvā tiryam pībaspākam udārathim  kṣudhā kila tvā duṣṭano jakṣivān sa na rūrupaḥ
translated: Having made the Karambha thy equal, drink the hot milk, O charioteer.🔽Thou hast eaten, O Ruru, being hungry, but thou hast not been satisfied.

original: vi te madaṃ madāvati śaram iva pātayāmasi /🔽pra tvā carum iva yeṣantaṃ vacasā sthāpayāmasi ////
analyzed: vi te madam madāvati śaram iva pātayāmasi  pra tvā carum iva yeṣantam vacasā sthāpayāmasi
translated: We make thy intoxication fall from thee, O thou who art intoxicated, as a shaft.🔽We make thee stand, as one who totters, with a staff, with a word.

original: pari grāmam ivācitaṃ vacasā sthāpayāmasi /
analyzed: pari grāmam iva ācitam vacasā sthāpayāmasi
translated: We make thee stand, as one who totters, with a word, as if thou wert a village enclosed.

original: tiṣṭhā vṛkṣa iva sthāmny abhrikhāte na rūrupaḥ ////
analyzed: tiṣṭha vṛkṣaḥ iva sthāmni abhri khāte na rūrupaḥ
translated: Stand like a tree in the ground, O Ruru, dug in with a spade.

original: pavastais tvā pary akrīṇan dūrśebhir ajinair uta /
analyzed: pavastaiḥ tvā pari akrīṇan dūrśebhiḥ ajinaiḥ uta
translated: With girdles have they girt thee round, with cloths of wool and skins of beasts.

original: prakrīr asi tvam oṣadhe 'bhrikhāte na rūrupaḥ ////
analyzed: prakrīḥ asi tvam oṣadhe bhrikhāte na rūrupaḥ
translated: Thou art the spreading plant, O plant, not subject to the axe in the cleft of the rock.

original: anāptā ye vaḥ prathamā yāni karmāṇi cakrire /
analyzed: an āptāḥ ye vaḥ prathamā yāni karmāṇi cakrire
translated: Those who have not attained to you, the first, the works which they have done,

original: vīrān no atra mā dabhan tad va etat puro dadhe ////
analyzed: vīrān naḥ atra mā dabhan tat vaḥ etat puras dadhe
translated: Do not deceive us here, O heroes, that I have set before you.

original: bhūto bhūteṣu paya ā dadhāti sa bhūtānām adhipatir babhūva /
analyzed: bhūtaḥ bhūteṣu payaḥ ā dadhāti sa bhūtānām adhipatiḥ babhūva
translated: The existent one places milk in existences; he became the lord of existences.

original: tasya mṛtyuś carati rājasūyaṃ sa rājā anu manyatām idaṃ ////🔽abhi prehi māpa vena ugraś cettā sapatnahā /🔽ā tiṣṭha mitravardhana tubhyam devā adhi bruvan ////
analyzed: tasya mṛtyuḥ carati rājasūyam sa rājā anu manyatām idam  abhi prehi mā apa venaḥ ugraḥ cettā sapatna hā  ā tiṣṭha mitra vardhana tubhyam devāḥ adhi bruvan
translated: His death moves around the Rajasuya; may that king approve of this.🔽Go forward, do not be fainthearted; thou art the fierce punisher, the slayer of foes.🔽Stand up, O augmenter of friends; the gods speak to thee from above.

original: ātiṣṭhantaṃ pari viśve abhūṣaṃ chriyaṃ vasānaś carati svarociḥ /
analyzed: ātiṣṭhantam pari viśve abhūṣam chriyam vasānaḥ carati sva rociḥ
translated: I have surrounded him who stands up; he moves in his own light, clothed in glory.

original: mahat tad vṛṣṇo asurasya nāmā viśvarūpo amṛtāni tasthau ////
analyzed: mahat tat vṛṣṇaḥ asurasya nāma ā viśva rūpaḥ amṛtāni tasthau
translated: That is the great name of the bull, the Asura; he stands in the immortal forms of all.

original: vyāghro adhi vaiyāghre vi kramasva diśo mahīḥ /
analyzed: vyāghraḥ adhi vaiyāghre vi kramasva diśaḥ mahīḥ
translated: The tiger in the tiger's lair, spread out in the great quarters;

original: viśas tvā sarvā vāñchantv āpo divyāḥ payasvatīḥ ////
analyzed: viśaḥ tvā sarvāḥ vāñchantu āpaḥ divyāḥ payasvatīḥ
translated: May all the people long for thee; the heavenly waters rich in milk.

original: yā āpo divyāḥ payasā madanty antarikṣa uta vā pṛthivyām /
analyzed: yāḥ āpaḥ divyāḥ payasā madanti antarikṣe uta vā pṛthivyām
translated: Those heavenly waters which rejoice in milk, either in the atmosphere or on the earth,

original: tāsāṃ tvā sarvāsām apām abhi ṣiñcāmi varcasā ////
analyzed: tāsām tvā sarvāsām apām abhi siñcāmi varcasā
translated: Of all those waters I sprinkle thee with radiance.

original: abhi tvā varcasāsicann āpo divyāḥ payasvatīḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā varcasā asican āpaḥ divyāḥ payasvatīḥ
translated: The heavenly waters, rich in milk, have sprinkled thee with their radiance.

original: yathāso mitravardhanas tathā tvā savitā karat ////
analyzed: yathā asaḥ mitra vardhanaḥ tathā tvā savitā karat
translated: May Savitar make thee so, as thou art the increaser of friends.

original: enā vyāghraṃ pariṣasvajānāḥ siṃhaṃ hinvanti mahate saubhagāya /
analyzed: enā vyāghram pariṣasvajānāḥ siṃham hinvanti mahate saubhagāya
translated: These (waters), embracing the tiger, urge the lion on to great prosperity.

original: samudraṃ na subhuvas tasthivāṃsaṃ marmṛjyante dvīpinam apsv antaḥ ////
analyzed: samudram na subhuvaḥ tasthivāṃsam marmṛjyante dvīpinam apsu antar
translated: The good ones make up the ocean, the island in the midst of the waters.

original: ehi jīvaṃ trāyamāṇaṃ parvatasyāsy akṣyam /
analyzed: ehi jīvam trāyamāṇam parvatasya asi akṣyam
translated: Come hither, O thou that givest life, that savest, that art on this mountain, that art the eye.

original: viśvebhir devair dattaṃ paridhir jīvanāya kam ////
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ dattam paridhiḥ jīvanāya kam
translated: Given by all the gods, a fence for the preservation of life.

original: paripāṇaṃ puruṣāṇāṃ paripāṇaṃ gavāṃ asi /
analyzed: paripāṇam puruṣāṇām paripāṇam gavām asi
translated: Thou art the guardian of men, thou art the guardian of cattle.

original: aśvānām arvatām paripāṇāya tasthiṣe ////🔽utāsi paripāṇam yātujambhanam āñjana /
analyzed: aśvānām arvatām paripāṇāya tasthiṣe  uta asi paripāṇam yātu jambhanam āñjana
translated: Thou standest for the protection of horses and steeds.🔽And thou art the guardian, the ointment that destroyeth the Yātudhānas.

original: utāmṛtasya tvaṃ vetthātho asi jīvabhojanam atho haritabheṣajam ////
analyzed: uta amṛtasya tvam vettha atha u asi jīva bhojanam atha u harita bheṣajam
translated: And thou knowest immortality, and art the food of life, and the remedy of the green plants.

original: yasyāñjana prasarpasy aṅgamaṅgam paruṣparuḥ /🔽tato yakṣmaṃ vi bādhasa ugro madhyamaśīr iva ////
analyzed: yasya āñjana prasarpasi aṅgam aṅgam paruḥ paruḥ  tatas yakṣmam vi bādhase ugraḥ madhyamaśīḥ iva
translated: From whatever limb to limb, from whatever part to part,🔽the ointment spreadeth, from thence thou drivest away consumption, as a strong one the middlemost shoot.

original: nainaṃ prāpnoti śapatho na kṛtyā nābhiśocanam /
analyzed: na enam prāpnoti śapathaḥ na kṛtyā na abhiśocanam
translated: No curse, no witchcraft, no consuming fever,

original: nainaṃ viṣkandham aśnute yas tvā bibharty āñjana ////
analyzed: na enam viṣkandham aśnute yaḥ tvā bibharti āñjana
translated: He does not suffer from consumption who bears you, O collyrium.

original: asanmantrād duṣvapnyād duṣkṛtāc chamalād uta /
analyzed: a sat mantrāt duṣvapnyāt duṣkṛtāt śamalāt uta
translated: From evil counsel, from bad dreams, from evil deeds and from misfortune,

original: durhārdaś cakṣuṣo ghorāt tasmān naḥ pāhy āñjana ////
analyzed: durhārdaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ ghorāt tasmāt naḥ pāhi āñjana
translated: And from the evil heart, from the terrible eye, from that, O collyrium, protect us.

original: idaṃ vidvān āñjana satyaṃ vakṣyāmi nānṛtam /
analyzed: idam vidvān āñjana satyam vakṣyāmi na anṛtam
translated: O collyrium, knowing this, I shall speak the truth, not falsehood.

original: saneyam aśvaṃ gām aham ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa ////
analyzed: saneyam aśvam gām aham ātmānam tava pūruṣa
translated: I shall win the horse, the cow, and myself, O your man.

original: trayo dāsā āñjanasya takmā balāsa ād ahiḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ dāsāḥ āñjanasya takmā balāsaḥ āt ahiḥ
translated: The three servants of collyrium are consumption, jaundice, and the serpent.

original: varṣiṣṭhaḥ parvatānāṃ trikakun nāma te pitā ////
analyzed: varṣiṣṭhaḥ parvatānām trikakud nāma te pitā
translated: The highest of the mountains, your father is named Trikakud.

original: yad āñjanaṃ traikakudam jātaṃ himavatas pari /
analyzed: yat āñjanam traikakudam jātam himavataḥ pari
translated: The collyrium that is born around the Himalayas, the Trikakud,

original: yātūṃś ca sarvāñ jambhayat sarvāś ca yātudhānyaḥ ////
analyzed: yātūn ca sarvām jambhayat sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ
translated: May it kill all the demons and all the female demons.

original: yadi vāsi traikakudaṃ yadi yāmunam ucyase /
analyzed: yadi vā asi traikakudam yadi yāmunam ucyase
translated: If you are the Trikakud, if you are called the Yamuna,

original: ubhe te bhadre nāmnī tābhyāṃ naḥ pāhy āñjana ////
analyzed: ubhe te bhadre nāmnī tābhyām naḥ pāhi āñjana
translated: Both of your auspicious names, by them, O collyrium, protect us.

original: vātāj jāto antarikṣād vidyuto jyotiṣas pari /
analyzed: vātāt jātaḥ antarikṣāt vidyutaḥ jyotiṣaḥ pari
translated: Born from the wind, from the atmosphere, from the lightning, from the light,

original: sa no hiraṇyajāḥ śaṅkhaḥ kṛśanaḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ hiraṇya jāḥ śaṅkhaḥ kṛśanaḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May that golden-born conch, the dark one, protect us from misfortune.

original: yo agrato rocanānāṃ samudrād adhi jajñiṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ agratas rocanānām samudrāt adhi jajñiṣe
translated: You who were born in front of the luminous regions, from the ocean,

original: śaṅkhena hatvā rakṣāṃsy attriṇo vi ṣahāmahe ////🔽śaṅkhenāmīvām amatiṃ śaṅkhenota sadānvāḥ /
analyzed: śaṅkhena hatvā rakṣāṃsi attriṇaḥ vi sahāmahe  śaṅkhena amīvām amatim śaṅkhena uta sadānvāḥ
translated: Having killed the Rakshas with the conch, we conquer the devourers.🔽With the conch, we drive away disease and misfortune, with the conch, we drive away the ever-wandering demons.

original: śaṅkho no viśvabheṣajaḥ kṛśanaḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: śaṅkhaḥ naḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ kṛśanaḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May the conch, our universal remedy, protect us from misfortune.

original: divi jātaḥ samudrajaḥ sindhutas pary ābhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: divi jātaḥ samudra jaḥ sindhutaḥ pari ābhṛtaḥ
translated: Born in the sky, born in the ocean, brought forth from the river,

original: sa no hiraṇyajāḥ śaṅkha āyuṣprataraṇo maṇiḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ hiraṇya jāḥ śaṅkhaḥ āyuḥ prataraṇaḥ maṇiḥ
translated: May that golden-born conch, our life-prolonging gem, protect us.

original: samudrāj jāto maṇir vṛtrāj jāto divākaraḥ /
analyzed: samudrāt jātaḥ maṇiḥ vṛtrāt jātaḥ divākaraḥ
translated: The gem is born from the ocean, born from Vrtra, the sun's light.

original: so asmānt sarvataḥ pātu hetyā devāsurebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ asmān sarvatas pātu hetyā deva asurebhyaḥ
translated: May it protect us from all sides, from the curse of the gods and demons.

original: hiraṇyānām eko 'si somāt tvam adhi jajñiṣe /
analyzed: hiraṇyānām ekaḥ si somāt tvam adhi jajñiṣe
translated: You are one of the golden ones, you were born from Soma.

original: rathe tvam asi darśata iṣudhau rocanas tvaṃ pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat ////
analyzed: rathe tvam asi darśate iṣudhau rocanaḥ tvam pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: You are the beautiful one on the chariot, you are the radiant one in the quiver. Lead us to long life.

original: devānām asthi kṛśanaṃ babhūva tad ātmanvac caraty apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: devānām asthi kṛśanam babhūva tat ātmanvat carati apsu antar
translated: The bone of the gods became the conch, it moves with a soul within the waters.

original: tat te badhnāmy āyuṣe varcase balāya dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya kārśanas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: tat te badhnāmi āyuṣe varcase balāya dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya kārśanaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: I bind it on you for life, for splendor, for strength, for long life, for a hundred autumns. May the conch protect you.

original: anaḍvān dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām anaḍvān dādhārorv antarikṣam /
analyzed: anaḍvān dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām anaḍvān dādhāra uru antarikṣam
translated: The bull supports the earth and the sky, the bull supports the atmosphere.

original: anaḍvān dādhāra pradiśaḥ ṣaḍ urvīr anaḍvān viśvaṃ bhuvanam ā viveśa ////
analyzed: anaḍvān dādhāra pradiśaḥ ṣaḍ urvīḥ anaḍvān viśvam bhuvanam ā viveśa
translated: The ox supports the six broad directions, the ox has entered into all the world.

original: anaḍvān indraḥ sa paśubhyo vi caṣṭe trayāṃ chakro vi mimīte adhvanaḥ /
analyzed: anaḍvān indraḥ sa paśubhyaḥ vi caṣṭe trayām śakraḥ vi mimīte adhvanaḥ
translated: Indra, as an ox, looks out upon the cattle; the three-powered one measures out the paths.

original: bhūtaṃ bhaviṣyad bhuvanā duhānaḥ sarvā devānām carati vratāni ////
analyzed: bhūtam bhaviṣyat bhuvanā duhānaḥ sarvā devānām carati vratāni
translated: Suckling the worlds of past, present, and future, he goes through all the rites of the gods.

original: indro jāto manuṣyeṣv antar gharmas taptaś carati śośucānaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ jātaḥ manuṣyeṣu antar gharmaḥ taptaḥ carati śośucānaḥ
translated: Indra, born among men, the heated Gharma moves about shining.

original: suprajāḥ sant sa udāre na sarṣad yo nāśnīyād anaḍuho vijānan ////
analyzed: su prajāḥ san saḥ udāre na sarṣat yaḥ na aśnīyāt anaḍuhaḥ vijānan
translated: Well-born, he should not be surpassed by the generous one who, knowing, would not eat the ox.

original: anaḍvān duhe sukṛtasya loka ainaṃ pyāyayati pavamānaḥ purastāt /
analyzed: anaḍvān duhe sukṛtasya loke ā enam pyāyayati pavamānaḥ purastāt
translated: The ox milks the world of good deeds; the purifying one makes it swell in front.

original: parjanyo dhārā maruta ūdho asya yajñaḥ payo dakṣiṇā doho asya ////
analyzed: parjanyaḥ dhārā marutaḥ ūdhar asya yajñaḥ payaḥ dakṣiṇā dohaḥ asya
translated: Parjanya is its stream, the Maruts its udder; sacrifice is its milk, the sacrificial fee its milking.

original: yasya neśe yajñapatir na yajño nāsya dāteśe na pratigrahītā /
analyzed: yasya na īśe yajñapatiḥ na yajñaḥ na asya dātā īśe na pratigrahītā
translated: He over whom neither the lord of sacrifice nor the sacrifice nor the giver nor the receiver has power,

original: yo viśvajid viśvabhṛd viśvakarmā gharmaṃ no brūta yatamaś catuṣpāt ////
analyzed: yaḥ viśva jit viśva bhṛt viśva karmā gharmam naḥ brūta yatamaḥ catuṣpād
translated: who is all-conquering, all-supporting, all-creating, tell us, O Gharma, which one of the four-footed is he?

original: yena devāḥ svar āruruhur hitvā śarīram amṛtasya nābhim /
analyzed: yena devāḥ svar āruruhuḥ hitvā śarīram amṛtasya nābhim
translated: By whom the gods ascended to heaven, leaving the body, the navel of immortality,

original: tena geṣma sukṛtasya lokaṃ gharmasya vratena tapasā yaśasyavaḥ ////
analyzed: tena geṣma sukṛtasya lokam gharmasya vratena tapasā yaśasyavaḥ
translated: By that we have gone to the world of good deeds, through the vow of Gharma, we who possess glory.

original: indro rūpeṇāgnir vahena prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī virāṭ /
analyzed: indraḥ rūpeṇa agniḥ vahena prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī virāj
translated: Indra in form, Agni in speed, Prajapati in the highest lord, Virata.

original: viśvānare akramata vaiśvānare akramatānaduhy akramata /
analyzed: viśvānare akramata vaiśvānare akramata anaduhi akramata
translated: He went to the all-consuming fire, he went to the all-consuming fire, he went to the milker.

original: so 'dṛṃhayata so 'dhārayata ////
analyzed: saḥ dṛṃhayata saḥ dhārayata
translated: He made it firm, he supported it.

original: madhyam etad anaḍuho yatraiṣa vaha āhitaḥ /
analyzed: madhyam etat anaḍuhaḥ yatra eṣa vahaḥ āhitaḥ
translated: This is the middle of the ox, where this load is placed.

original: etāvad asya prācīnaṃ yāvān pratyaṅ samāhitaḥ ////
analyzed: etāvat asya prācīnam yāvān pratyaṅ samāhitaḥ
translated: This is how much is in front of it, as much as is placed behind.

original: yo vedānaduho dohān saptānupadasvataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ veda anaduhaḥ dohān sapta anupadasvataḥ
translated: He who knows the seven milkings of the milch cow,

original: prajāṃ ca lokaṃ cāpnoti tathā saptaṛṣayo viduḥ ////🔽padbhiḥ sedim avakrāmann irāṃ jaṅghābhir utkhidan /
analyzed: prajām ca lokam ca āpnoti tathā sapta ṛṣayaḥ viduḥ  padbhiḥ sedim avakrāman irām jaṅghābhiḥ utkhidan
translated: he obtains offspring and the world, so do the seven sages know.🔽With his feet he treads on fatigue, with his thighs he throws off hunger.

original: srameṇānaḍvān kīlālaṃ kīnāśaś cābhi gachataḥ ////
analyzed: srameṇa anaḍvān kīlālam kīnāśaḥ ca abhi gacchataḥ
translated: With his sweat the ox goes to the sweet drink, and the hired servant goes to his goal.

original: dvādaśa vā etā rātrīr vratyā āhuḥ prajāpateḥ /
analyzed: dvādaśa vai etāḥ rātrīḥ vratyāḥ āhuḥ prajāpateḥ
translated: They say these twelve nights are the vow of Prajapati.

original: tatropa brahma yo veda tad vā anaḍuho vratam ////
analyzed: tatra upa brahma yaḥ veda tat vai anaḍuhaḥ vratam
translated: One who knows the Brahman there, that is the vow of the ox.

original: duhe sāyaṃ duhe prātar duhe madhyaṃdinaṃ pari /
analyzed: duhe sāyam duhe prātar duhe madhyaṃdinam pari
translated: He milks in the evening, he milks in the morning, he milks around midday.

original: dohā ye asya saṃyanti tān vidmānupadasvataḥ ////
analyzed: dohāḥ ye asya saṃyanti tān vidma anupadasvataḥ
translated: He who knows the milkings that come to him, he milks them following.

original: rohaṇy asi rohaṇy asthnaś chinnasya rohaṇī /
analyzed: rohaṇī asi rohaṇī asthnaḥ chinnasya rohaṇī
translated: Thou art the healer, the healer of the broken bone.

original: rohayedam arundhati ////
analyzed: rohaya idam arundhati
translated: Heal this, O Arundhatî.

original: yat te riṣṭaṃ yat te dyuttam asti peṣṭraṃ ta ātmani /
analyzed: yat te riṣṭam yat te dyuttam asti peṣṭram te ātmani
translated: Whatever is broken or shattered in thee, the crushing in thy body,

original: dhātā tad bhadrayā punaḥ saṃ dadhat paruṣā paruḥ ////
analyzed: dhātā tat bhadrayā punar sam dadhat paruṣā paruḥ
translated: may the Creator again unite it with good fortune, bone with bone.

original: saṃ te majjā majjñā bhavatu sam u te paruṣā paruḥ /
analyzed: sam te majjā majjñā bhavatu sam u te paruṣā paruḥ
translated: Let thy marrow be united with marrow, let thy bone be united with bone.

original: saṃ te māṃsasya visrastaṃ sam asthy api rohatu ////
analyzed: sam te māṃsasya visrastam sam asthi api rohatu
translated: Let thy flesh that is scattered be united, let thy bone grow together.

original: majjā majñā saṃ dhīyatāṃ carmaṇā carma rohatu /
analyzed: majjā majñā sam dhīyatām carmaṇā carma rohatu
translated: Let marrow be united with marrow, let skin be united with skin.

original: asṛk te asthi rohatu māṃsaṃ māṃsena rohatu ////
analyzed: asṛk te asthi rohatu māṃsam māṃsena rohatu
translated: Let thy blood be united with bone, let thy flesh be united with flesh.

original: loma lomnā saṃ kalpayā tvacā saṃ kalpayā tvacam /
analyzed: loma lomnā sam kalpaya tvacā sam kalpaya tvacam
translated: Let hair be united with hair, let skin be united with skin.

original: asṛk te asthi rohatu chinnaṃ saṃ dhehy oṣadhe ////🔽sa ut tiṣṭha prehi pra drava rathaḥ sucakraḥ /
analyzed: asṛk te asthi rohatu chinnam sam dhehi oṣadhe  saḥ ud tiṣṭha prehi pra drava rathaḥ su cakraḥ
translated: Let thy blood be united with bone, heal the broken with a plant.🔽Rise up, go forward, run, the chariot with its well-made wheels,

original: supaviḥ sunābhiḥ prati tiṣṭhordhvaḥ ////
analyzed: su paviḥ su nābhiḥ prati tiṣṭha ūrdhvaḥ
translated: with good axle, good nave, stand firm, erect.

original: yadi kartaṃ patitvā saṃśaśre yadi vāśmā prahṛto jaghāna /
analyzed: yadi kartam patitvā saṃśaśre yadi vā aśmā prahṛtaḥ jaghāna
translated: If a bird has fallen and is injured, or a stone has struck and wounded,

original: ṛbhū rathasyevāṅgāni saṃ dadhat paruṣā paruḥ ////
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ rathasya iva aṅgāni sam dadhat paruṣā paruḥ
translated: uniting the limbs as it were of a chariot, bone with bone.

original: uta devā avahitaṃ devā un nayathā punaḥ /
analyzed: uta devāḥ avahitam devāḥ ud nayathā punar
translated: And the gods, if you have hidden him, the gods must lead him forth again.

original: utāgaś cakruṣaṃ devā devā jīvayathā punaḥ ////
analyzed: uta āgaḥ cakruṣam devāḥ devāḥ jīvayathā punar
translated: And the gods, if you have made him sick, the gods must make him live again.

original: dvāv imau vātau vāta ā sindhor ā parāvataḥ /
analyzed: dvau imau vātau vātaḥ ā sindhoḥ ā parāvataḥ
translated: These two winds blow, one from the river, one from the farther shore.

original: dakṣaṃ te anya āvātu vy anyo vātu yad rapaḥ ////
analyzed: dakṣam te anyaḥ ā vātu vi anyaḥ vātu yat rapaḥ
translated: Let one of them bring you strength, let the other blow away your disease.

original: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajaṃ vi vāta vāhi yad rapaḥ /
analyzed: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajam vi vāta vāhi yat rapaḥ
translated: O wind, blow medicine, blow away whatever disease there is.

original: tvaṃ hi viśvabheṣaja devānāṃ dūta īyase ////
analyzed: tvam hi viśva bheṣaja devānām dūtaḥ īyase
translated: For you are the all-curing one, you go as the messenger of the gods.

original: trāyantām imaṃ devās trāyantāṃ marutāṃ gaṇāḥ /
analyzed: trāyantām imam devāḥ trāyantām marutām gaṇāḥ
translated: May the gods protect this one, may the Maruts' bands protect him,

original: trāyantāṃ viśvā bhūtāni yathāyam arapā asat ////🔽ā tvāgamaṃ śaṃtātibhir atho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ /
analyzed: trāyantām viśvā bhūtāni yathā ayam arapāḥ asat  ā tvā agamam śaṃtātibhiḥ atho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ
translated: May all beings protect him, so that he may be free from disease.🔽I have come to you with the blessings of peace, and with the blessings of freedom from misfortune.

original: dakṣaṃ ta ugram ābhāriṣaṃ parā yakṣmaṃ suvāmi te ////
analyzed: dakṣam te ugram ābhāriṣam parā yakṣmam suvāmi te
translated: I have brought you strong power, I drive away your disease.

original: ayaṃ me hasto bhagavān ayaṃ me bhagavattaraḥ /
analyzed: ayam me hastaḥ bhagavān ayam me bhagavattaraḥ
translated: This hand of mine is blessed, this hand of mine is more blessed.

original: ayaṃ me viśvabheṣajo 'yaṃ śivābhimarśanaḥ ////
analyzed: ayam me viśva bheṣajaḥ yam śiva abhimarśanaḥ
translated: This hand of mine is all-healing, this hand of mine is a kindly touch.

original: hastābhyāṃ daśaśākhābhyāṃ jihvā vācaḥ purogavī /
analyzed: hastābhyām daśa śākhābhyām jihvā vācaḥ purogavī
translated: With the two hands with ten fingers, the tongue the leader of speech,

original: anāmayitnubhyāṃ hastābhyāṃ tābhyāṃ tvābhi mṛśāmasi ////
analyzed: anāmayitnubhyām hastābhyām tābhyām tvā abhi mṛśāmasi
translated: With the two hands that bring health, with them we touch you.

original: ajo hy agner ajaniṣṭa śokāt so apaśyaj janitāram agre /
analyzed: ajaḥ hi agneḥ ajaniṣṭa śokāt saḥ apaśyat janitāram agre
translated: For the goat was born from the flame of Agni. He first beheld his progenitor.

original: tena devā devatām agrā āyan tena rohān ruruhur medhyāsaḥ ////
analyzed: tena devāḥ deva tām agrāḥ āyan tena rohān ruruhuḥ medhyāsaḥ
translated: By him the gods attained the highest godhead. By him the pure ones ascended the worlds.

original: kramadhvam agninā nākam ukhyān hasteṣu bibhrataḥ /
analyzed: kramadhvam agninā nākam ukhyān hasteṣu bibhrataḥ
translated: Mount the vault by Agni, bearing it in your hands.

original: divas pṛṣṭhaṃ svar gatvā miśrā devebhir ādhvam ////
analyzed: divaḥ pṛṣṭham svar gatvā miśrāḥ devebhiḥ ādhvam
translated: Having gone to the back of the sky, the heaven, mix with the gods.

original: pṛṣṭhāt pṛthivyā aham antarikṣam āruham antarikṣād divam āruham /
analyzed: pṛṣṭhāt pṛthivyāḥ aham antarikṣam āruham antarikṣāt divam āruham
translated: From the back of the earth I ascended to the atmosphere. From the atmosphere I ascended to the sky.

original: divo nākasya pṛṣṭhāt svar jyotir agām aham ////
analyzed: divaḥ nākasya pṛṣṭhāt svar jyotiḥ agām aham
translated: From the back of the vault of the sky, I have gone to the heavenly light.

original: svar yanto nāpekṣanta ā dyāṃ rohanti rodasī /
analyzed: svar yantaḥ na apekṣante ā dyām rohanti rodasī
translated: Going to the heaven, they look not away. They ascend the sky and the earth.

original: yajñaṃ ye viśvatodhāraṃ suvidvāṃso vitenire ////
analyzed: yajñam ye viśvatas dhāram su vidvāṃsaḥ vitenire
translated: Those who have spread out the sacrifice, which has streams on all sides, the well-knowing ones.

original: agne prehi prathamo devatānāṃ cakṣur devānām uta mānuṣānām /
analyzed: agne prehi prathamaḥ devatānām cakṣuḥ devānām uta mānuṣānām
translated: O Agni, go first of the gods, the eye of the gods and of men.

original: iyakṣamāṇā bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ svar yantu yajamānāḥ svasti ////
analyzed: iyakṣamāṇāḥ bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ svar yantu yajamānāḥ svasti
translated: Harmonious with the Bhṛgus, striving, may the sacrificers go to the heaven, to well-being.

original: ajam anajmi payasā ghṛtena divyaṃ suparnaṃ payasaṃ bṛhantam /
analyzed: ajam anajmi payasā ghṛtena divyam suparnam payasam bṛhantam
translated: I have set the goat free with milk and ghee, the heavenly bird, the great one full of sap.

original: tena geṣma sukṛtasya lokaṃ svar ārohanto abhi nākam uttamam ////
analyzed: tena geṣma sukṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam
translated: By him may we go to the world of good deeds, ascending the heaven, to the highest vault.

original: pañcaudanaṃ pañcabhir aṅgulibhir darvyoddhara pañcadhaitam odanam /
analyzed: pañca odanam pañcabhiḥ aṅgulibhiḥ darvyā uddhara pañcadhā etam odanam
translated: With five fingers take up the five-portioned rice-pap, and divide this rice-pap into five parts.

original: prācyāṃ diśi śiro ajasya dhehi dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśi dakṣiṇaṃ dhehi pārśvam ////
analyzed: prācyām diśi śiraḥ ajasya dhehi dakṣiṇāyām diśi dakṣiṇam dhehi pārśvam
translated: Place the head of the goat in the eastern quarter, place the right side in the southern quarter.

original: pratīcyāṃ diśi bhasadam asya dhehy uttarasyāṃ diśy uttaraṃ dhehi pārśvam /
analyzed: pratīcyām diśi bhasadam asya dhehi uttarasyām diśi uttaram dhehi pārśvam
translated: Place its entrails in the western quarter, place the left side in the northern quarter.

original: ūrdhvāyāṃ diśy ajasyānūkaṃ dhehi diśi dhruvāyāṃ dhehi pājasyam antarikṣe madhyato madhyam asya ////
analyzed: ūrdhvāyām diśi ajasya anūkam dhehi diśi dhruvāyām dhehi pājasyam antarikṣe madhyatas madhyam asya
translated: Place the goat's shoulder-blade in the upper quarter, place the fat in the firm quarter, place the middle in the middle of the atmosphere.

original: śṛtam ajaṃ śṛtayā prorṇuhi tvacā sarvair aṅgaiḥ saṃbhṛtaṃ viśvarūpam /
analyzed: śṛtam ajam śṛtayā prorṇuhi tvacā sarvaiḥ aṅgaiḥ saṃbhṛtam viśva rūpam
translated: Cover the cooked goat with the cooked skin, complete with all its limbs, of every form.

original: sa ut tisṭheto abhi nākam uttamaṃ padbhiś caturbhiḥ prati tiṣṭha dikṣu ////
analyzed: saḥ ud tisṭha itas abhi nākam uttamam padbhiḥ caturbhiḥ prati tiṣṭha dikṣu
translated: Rise up from here to the highest vault, stand firm in the quarters with thy four feet.

original: samutpatantu pradiśo nabhasvatīḥ sam abhrāṇi vātajūtāni yantu /
analyzed: samutpatantu pradiśaḥ nabhasvatīḥ sam abhrāṇi vāta jūtāni yantu
translated: Let the quarters rise up, full of wind; let the clouds, urged on by the wind, move together.

original: mahaṛṣabhasya nadato nabhasvato vāśrā āpaḥ pṛthivīṃ tarpayantu ////
analyzed: maha ṛṣabhasya nadataḥ nabhasvataḥ vāśrāḥ āpaḥ pṛthivīm tarpayantu
translated: Let the rain-drops from the roaring, windy, great bull satisfy the earth.

original: sam īkṣayantu taviṣāḥ sudānavo 'pāṃ rasā oṣadhībhiḥ sacantām /
analyzed: sam īkṣayantu taviṣāḥ sudānavaḥ u pām rasāḥ oṣadhībhiḥ sacantām
translated: Let the bountiful ones, with their power, look together; let the sap of the waters agree with the plants.

original: varṣasya sargā mahayantu bhūmiṃ pṛthag jāyantām oṣadhayo viśvarūpāḥ ////
analyzed: varṣasya sargāḥ mahayantu bhūmim pṛthak jāyantām oṣadhayaḥ viśva rūpāḥ
translated: Let the showers of rain magnify the earth, and let the plants spring up separately in all their forms.

original: sam īkṣayasva gāyato nabhāṃsy apām vegāsaḥ pṛthag ud vijantām /
analyzed: sam īkṣayasva gāyataḥ nabhāṃsi apām vegāsaḥ pṛthak ud vijantām
translated: Look thou upon the singing clouds of heaven: let the forces of the waters be divided and move apart.

original: varṣasya sargā mahayantu bhūmiṃ pṛthag jāyantām vīrudho viśvarūpāḥ ////
analyzed: varṣasya sargāḥ mahayantu bhūmim pṛthak jāyantām vīrudhaḥ viśva rūpāḥ
translated: Let the showers of rain magnify the earth, and let the plants spring up separately in all their forms.

original: gaṇās tvopa gāyantu mārutāḥ parjanya ghoṣiṇaḥ pṛthak /
analyzed: gaṇāḥ tvā upa gāyantu mārutāḥ parjanya ghoṣiṇaḥ pṛthak
translated: Let the Maruts' bands, the Maruts' troops, the Maruts' companies sing forth to thee, O Marut, who hast the sound of rain.

original: sargā varṣasya varṣato varṣantu pṛthivīm anu ////
analyzed: sargāḥ varṣasya varṣataḥ varṣantu pṛthivīm anu
translated: Let the showers of rain, falling from the rain-cloud, rain upon the earth.

original: ud īrayata marutaḥ samudratas tveṣo arko nabha ut pātayātha /
analyzed: ud īrayata marutaḥ samudrataḥ tveṣaḥ arkaḥ nabhaḥ ud pātayātha
translated: Lift up the rain from the ocean, O Maruts; let the flashing light rise up in the sky.

original: mahaṛṣabhasya nadato nabhasvato vāśrā āpaḥ pṛthivīṃ tarpayantu ////
analyzed: maha ṛṣabhasya nadataḥ nabhasvataḥ vāśrāḥ āpaḥ pṛthivīm tarpayantu
translated: Let the rain-drops, the waters, satisfy the earth, of the great bull that roars and hath the sky for his womb.

original: abhi kranda stanayārdayodadhiṃ bhūmiṃ parjanya payasā sam aṅdhi /🔽tvayā sṛṣṭaṃ bahulam aitu varṣam āśāraiṣī kṛśagur etv astam ////
analyzed: abhi kranda stanaya ardaya udadhim bhūmim parjanya payasā sam aṅdhi  tvayā sṛṣṭam bahulam aitu varṣam āśā raiṣī kṛśaguḥ etu astam
translated: Roar thou aloud, thunder, and swell the ocean: unite the earth with water, O Parjanya.🔽Let rain, sent forth by thee, come in abundance: let the cloud that drops its moisture from the sky depart.

original: saṃ vo 'vantu sudānava utsā ajagarā uta /
analyzed: sam vaḥ vantu sudānavaḥ utsāḥ ajagarāḥ uta
translated: May the bountiful Utsa and Ajagara serpents protect you all.

original: marudbhiḥ pracyutā meghā varṣantu pṛthivīm anu ////
analyzed: marudbhiḥ pracyutāḥ meghāḥ varṣantu pṛthivīm anu
translated: Let the clouds, urged on by the Maruts, rain upon the earth.

original: āśāmāśāṃ vi dyotatāṃ vātā vāntu diśodiśaḥ /
analyzed: āśām āśām vi dyotatām vātāḥ vāntu diśaḥ diśaḥ
translated: Let the winds blow from all directions, illuminating each other.

original: marudbhiḥ pracyutā meghāḥ saṃ yantu pṛthivīm anu ////
analyzed: marudbhiḥ pracyutāḥ meghāḥ sam yantu pṛthivīm anu
translated: May the clouds, driven by the Maruts, gather over the earth.

original: āpo vidyud abhraṃ varṣaṃ saṃ vo 'vantu sudānava utsā ajagarā uta /
analyzed: āpaḥ vidyut abhram varṣam sam vaḥ vantu sudānavaḥ utsāḥ ajagarāḥ uta
translated: May the waters, lightning, clouds, and rain, O bountiful ones, and the Utsa and Ajagara serpents,

original: marudbhiḥ pracyutā meghāḥ prāvantu pṛthivīm anu ////
analyzed: marudbhiḥ pracyutāḥ meghāḥ prāvantu pṛthivīm anu
translated: may the clouds, driven by the Maruts, rain down upon the earth.

original: apām agnis tanūbhiḥ saṃvidāno ya oṣadhīnām adhipā babhūva /
analyzed: apām agniḥ tanūbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ yaḥ oṣadhīnām adhipāḥ babhūva
translated: Agni, in accord with the forms of the waters, who has become the lord of the plants,

original: sa no varṣaṃ vanutāṃ jātavedāḥ prāṇaṃ prajābhyo amṛtaṃ divas pari ////
analyzed: sa naḥ varṣam vanutām jātavedāḥ prāṇam prajābhyaḥ amṛtam divaḥ pari
translated: may he, the all-knower, grant us rain, life and immortality from heaven to the people.

original: prajāpatiḥ salilād ā samudrād āpa īrayann udadhim ardayāti /🔽pra pyāyatāṃ vṛṣṇo aśvasya reto 'rvān etena stanayitnunehi ////
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ salilāt ā samudrāt ā apaḥ īrayan udadhim ardayāti  pra pyāyatām vṛṣṇaḥ aśvasya retaḥ rvān etena stanayitnunā ihi
translated: Prajapati, sending forth the waters from the ocean, agitates the great deep.🔽Let the seed of the strong horse swell, come hither with this thunder.

original: apo niṣiñcann asuraḥ pitā naḥ śvasantu gargarā apāṃ varuṇāva nīcīr apaḥ sṛja /
analyzed: apaḥ niṣiñcan asuraḥ pitā naḥ śvasantu gargarāḥ apām varuṇa ava nīcīḥ apaḥ sṛja
translated: Pouring out the waters, our father the Asura, let the water-pots breathe, O Varuna. Let loose the low-lying waters.

original: vadantu pṛśnibāhavo maṇḍūkā iriṇānu ////
analyzed: vadantu pṛśni bāhavaḥ maṇḍūkāḥ iriṇā anu
translated: Let the frogs with spotted forearms croak in the marshes.

original: saṃvatsaraṃ śaśayānā brāhmaṇā vratacāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: saṃvatsaram śaśayānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vrata cāriṇaḥ
translated: The Brahmins, observing vows, have lain down for a year.

original: vācam parjanyajinvitāṃ pra maṇdūkā avādiṣuḥ ////
analyzed: vācam parjanya jinvitām pra maṇdūkāḥ avādiṣuḥ
translated: The frogs have spoken the speech inspired by Parjanya.

original: upapravada maṇḍūki varṣaṃ ā vada tāduri /
analyzed: upapravada maṇḍūki varṣam ā vada tāduri
translated: Sing forth, O frog, sing forth, O tadpole, sing forth, O fish.

original: madhye hradasya plavasva vigṛhya caturaḥ padaḥ ////
analyzed: madhye hradasya plavasva vigṛhya caturaḥ padaḥ
translated: Leap in the middle of the lake, stretching out your four feet.

original: madhye taduri /
analyzed: R madhye taduri
translated: In the middle of the tadpole.

original: varṣaṃ vanudhvaṃ pitaro marutāṃ mana ichata ////
analyzed: varṣam vanudhvam pitaraḥ marutām manaḥ ichata
translated: Sing forth, O frogs, O fathers, desire the mind of the Maruts.

original: mahāntaṃ kośam ud acābhi ṣiñca savidyutaṃ bhavatu vātu vātaḥ /
analyzed: mahāntam kośam ud aca abhi siñca savidyutam bhavatu vātu vātaḥ
translated: Pour forth the great treasure, let there be lightning, let the wind blow.

original: tanvatāṃ yajñaṃ bahudhā visṛṣṭā ānandinīr oṣadhayo bhavantu ////
analyzed: tanvatām yajñam bahudhā visṛṣṭāḥ ānandinīḥ oṣadhayaḥ bhavantu
translated: Let the scattered sacrificial essence of the moving beings become full of joy, O plants.

original: bṛhann eṣām adhiṣṭhātā antikād iva paśyati /
analyzed: bṛhan eṣām adhiṣṭhātā antikāt iva paśyati
translated: He who is far away sees as if near.

original: ya stāyan manyate carant sarvaṃ devā idaṃ viduḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ stāyan manyate caran sarvam devāḥ idam viduḥ
translated: He who, standing, thinks, and he who moves, all the gods know this.

original: yas tiṣṭhati carati yaś ca vañcati yo nilāyaṃ carati yaḥ prataṅkam /
analyzed: yaḥ tiṣṭhati carati yaḥ ca vañcati yaḥ nilāyam carati yaḥ prataṅkam
translated: He who stands, he who moves, he who deceives, he who moves in a dwelling, he who is in a pit,

original: dvau saṃniṣadya yan mantrayete rājā tad veda varuṇas tṛtīyaḥ ////
analyzed: dvau saṃniṣadya yat mantrayete rājā tat veda varuṇaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Whatever two men, sitting together, consult about, the king knows that, Varuṇa knows as the third.

original: uteyaṃ bhūmir varuṇasya rājña utāsau dyaur bṛhatī dūreantā /
analyzed: uta iyam bhūmiḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ uta asau dyauḥ bṛhatī dūreantā
translated: This earth is indeed the kingdom of king Varuṇa, and that vast sky has distant ends.

original: uto samudrau varuṇasya kukṣī utāsminn alpa udake nilīnaḥ ////
analyzed: uta u samudrau varuṇasya kukṣī uta asmin alpe udake nilīnaḥ
translated: And the two oceans are the womb of Varuṇa, and I am hidden in this small water.

original: uta yo dyām atisarpāt parastān na sa mucyātai varuṇasya rājñaḥ /
analyzed: uta yaḥ dyām atisarpāt parastāt na sa mucyātai varuṇasya rājñaḥ
translated: And he who would go beyond the sky, he is not released from king Varuṇa.

original: diva spaśaḥ pra carantīdam asya sahasrākṣā ati paśyanti bhūmim ////
analyzed: divaḥ spaśaḥ pra caranti idam asya sahasra akṣāḥ ati paśyanti bhūmim
translated: The rays of heaven move along this (earth); a thousand eyes look over this earth.

original: sarvaṃ tad rājā varuṇo vi caṣṭe yad antarā rodasī yat parastāt /
analyzed: sarvam tat rājā varuṇaḥ vi caṣṭe yat antarā rodasī yat parastāt
translated: All that the king Varuna sees, what is between the two worlds and what is beyond.

original: saṃkhyātā asya nimiṣo janānām akṣān iva śvaghnī ni minoti tāni ////
analyzed: saṃkhyātāḥ asya nimiṣaḥ janānām akṣān iva śvaghnī ni minoti tāni
translated: The winking of men is numbered by him; he sets them down like dice.

original: ye te pāśā varuṇa saptasapta tredhā tiṣṭhanti viṣitā ruṣantaḥ /
analyzed: ye te pāśāḥ varuṇa sapta sapta tredhā tiṣṭhanti viṣitāḥ ruṣantaḥ
translated: Those seven times seven snares of thine, O Varuna, which stand threefold, stretched out and angry,

original: chinantu sarve anṛtaṃ vadantaṃ yaḥ satyavādy ati taṃ sṛjantu ////
analyzed: chinantu sarve anṛtam vadantam yaḥ satya vādī ati tam sṛjantu
translated: Let them all seize the liar; let them loose the man who speaks the truth.

original: śatena pāśair abhi dhehi varuṇainaṃ mā te mocy anṛtavāṅ nṛcakṣaḥ /
analyzed: śatena pāśaiḥ abhi dhehi varuṇa enam mā te moci anṛta vāc nṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: Bind him with a hundred fetters, O Varuna; let him not escape thee, the man who speaks falsely, O thou who seest men.

original: āstāṃ jālma udaraṃ śraṃśayitvā kośa ivābandhaḥ parikṛtyamānaḥ ////
analyzed: āstām jālmaḥ udaram śraṃśayitvā kośe iva ābandhaḥ parikṛtyamānaḥ
translated: Let the cripple sit down, having stretched out his belly; let him be bound like a box that is fastened.

original: yaḥ samābhyo varuṇo yo vyābhyo yaḥ saṃdeśyo varuṇo yo videśyo /
analyzed: yaḥ samābhyaḥ varuṇaḥ yaḥ vyābhyaḥ yaḥ saṃdeśyaḥ varuṇaḥ yaḥ videśyaḥ
translated: He who is for the equal, he who is for the unequal, he who is to be sent for, he who is to be sent away,

original: yo daivo varuṇo yaś ca mānuṣaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ daivaḥ varuṇaḥ yaḥ ca mānuṣaḥ
translated: He who is divine, he who is human.

original: tais tvā sarvair abhi ṣyāmi pāśair asāv āmuṣyāyaṇāmuṣyāḥ putra /
analyzed: taiḥ tvā sarvaiḥ abhi syāmi pāśaiḥ asau āmuṣyāyaṇa amuṣyāḥ putra
translated: With all these fetters I shall bind thee, N.N., son of N.N., of N.N.

original: tān u te sarvān anusaṃdiśāmi ////
analyzed: tān u te sarvān anusaṃdiśāmi
translated: I announce them all to thee.

original: īśāṇāṃ tvā bheṣajānām ujjeṣa ā rabhāmahe /
analyzed: īśānām tvā bheṣajānām ujjeṣe ā rabhāmahe
translated: We seize thee, O Varuna, the lord of healing plants, the victorious.

original: cakre sahasravīryam sarvasmā oṣadhe tvā ////
analyzed: cakre sahasra vīryam sarvasmai oṣadhe tvā
translated: I make the thousand-fold strength of all the plants for thee.

original: satyajitaṃ śapathayāvanīṃ sahamānāṃ punaḥsarām /
analyzed: satya jitam śapatha yāvanīm sahamānām punaḥsarām
translated: The victorious, the oath-breaking, the conquering, the regaining,

original: sarvāḥ sam ahvy oṣadhīr ito naḥ pārayād iti ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ sam ahvi oṣadhīḥ itas naḥ pārayāt iti
translated: All the plants I summon here. May she lead us across.

original: yā śaśāpa śapanena yāghaṃ mūram ādadhe /
analyzed: yā śaśāpa śapanena yā agham mūram ādadhe
translated: She who curses with a curse, she who lays a spell on the innocent,

original: yā rasasya haraṇāya jātam ārebhe tokam attu sā ////
analyzed: yā rasasya haraṇāya jātam ārebhe tokam attu sā
translated: She who prepares a charm to take away the sap, may she eat her own offspring.

original: yāṃ te cakrur āme pātre yāṃ cakrur nīlalohite /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ āme pātre yām cakruḥ nīla lohite
translated: She whom they made in an unbaked vessel, she whom they made in a blue-red one,

original: āme māṃse kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakrus tayā kṛtyākṛto jahi ////
analyzed: āme māṃse kṛtyām yām cakruḥ tayā kṛtyā kṛtaḥ jahi
translated: She whom they made a charm in raw flesh, with her destroy the one who has done a charm against us.

original: dauṣvapnyaṃ daurjīvityaṃ rakṣo abhvam arāyyaḥ /
analyzed: dauṣvapnyam daurjīvityam rakṣaḥ abhvam arāyyaḥ
translated: Bad dreams, bad living, demon, monster, evil,

original: durṇāmnīḥ sarvā durvācas tā asman nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: durṇāmnīḥ sarvāḥ durvācaḥ tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi
translated: All bad manners, bad speech, we drive away from us.

original: kṣudhāmāraṃ tṛṣṇāmāram agotām anapatyatām /
analyzed: kṣudhā māram tṛṣṇā māram a go tām an apatya tām
translated: Hunger-sickness, thirst-sickness, barrenness, childlessness,

original: apāmārga tvayā vayaṃ sarvaṃ tad apa mṛjmahe ////
analyzed: apāmārga tvayā vayam sarvam tat apa mṛjmahe
translated: With thee, O Apamarga, we wipe away all that.

original: tṛṣṇāmāraṃ kṣudhāmāraṃ atho akṣaparājayam /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā māram kṣudhā māram atho akṣa parājayam
translated: Thirst-sickness, hunger-sickness, and the defeat of dice,

original: apāmārga tvayā vayaṃ sarvaṃ tad apa mṛjmahe ////
analyzed: apāmārga tvayā vayam sarvam tat apa mṛjmahe
translated: With thee, O Apamarga, we wipe away all that.

original: apāmārga oṣadhīnāṃ sarvāsām eka id vaśī /
analyzed: apāmārgaḥ oṣadhīnām sarvāsām ekaḥ id vaśī
translated: Apamarga is the lord of all the plants,

original: tena te mṛjma āsthitam atha tvam agadaś cara ////
analyzed: tena te mṛjmaḥ āsthitam atha tvam agadaḥ cara
translated: With him we wipe away what is settled in thee, then thou goest about free from sickness.

original: samaṃ jyotiḥ sūryeṇāhnā rātrī samāvatī /
analyzed: samam jyotiḥ sūryeṇa ahnā rātrī samāvatī
translated: The light is equal to the sun, the day and night are equal.

original: kṛṇomi satyam ūtaye 'rasāḥ santu kṛtvarīḥ ////
analyzed: kṛṇomi satyam ūtaye rasāḥ santu kṛtvarīḥ
translated: I make truth for help. Let the sorcerers be powerless.

original: yo devāḥ kṛtyāṃ kṛtvā harād aviduṣo gṛham /
analyzed: yaḥ devāḥ kṛtyām kṛtvā harāt a viduṣaḥ gṛham
translated: O gods, he who, having performed sorcery, goes to the house of one who does not know,

original: vatso dhārur iva mātaraṃ taṃ pratyag upa padyatām ////
analyzed: vatsaḥ dhāruḥ iva mātaram tam pratyak upa padyatām
translated: Let him return to her like a calf to its mother.

original: amā kṛtvā pāpmānaṃ yas tenānyaṃ jighāṃsati /
analyzed: amā kṛtvā pāpmānam yaḥ tena anyam jighāṃsati
translated: He who, having committed sin, wishes to harm another with it,

original: aśmānas tasyāṃ dagdhāyāṃ bahulāḥ phaṭ karikrati ////
analyzed: aśmānaḥ tasyām dagdhāyām bahulāḥ phaṭ karikrati
translated: When that (sin) is burned, let many stones crackle for him.

original: sahasradhāman viśikhān vigrīvāṃ chāyayā tvam /
analyzed: sahasra dhāman viśikhān vigrīvām chāyaya tvam
translated: O you with a thousand abodes, the necks of the arrows, the necks of the enemies,

original: prati sma cakruṣe kṛtyāṃ priyāṃ priyāvate hara ////
analyzed: prati sma cakruṣe kṛtyām priyām priyāvate hara
translated: With your shadow, you turn back the sorcery, the beloved one, to the beloved one, O Hara.

original: anayāham oṣadhyā sarvāḥ kṛtyā adūduṣam /
analyzed: anayā aham oṣadhyā sarvāḥ kṛtyāḥ adūduṣam
translated: With this herb I have expelled all the sorceries,

original: yāṃ kṣetre cakrur yāṃ goṣu yāṃ vā te puruṣeṣu ////
analyzed: yām kṣetre cakruḥ yām goṣu yām vā te puruṣeṣu
translated: Which they performed in the field, which in the cattle, which in your people.

original: yaś cakāra na śaśāka kartuṃ śaśre pādam aṅgurim /
analyzed: yaḥ cakāra na śaśāka kartum śaśre pādam aṅgurim
translated: He who performed (sorcery) but was not able to perform, he howled, his foot and toes,

original: cakāra bhadram asmabhyam ātmane tapanam tu saḥ ////
analyzed: cakāra bhadram asmabhyam ātmane tapanam tu saḥ
translated: He did good for us, but he burned himself.

original: apāmārgo 'pa mārṣṭu kṣetriyaṃ śapathaś ca yaḥ /🔽apāha yātudhānīr apa sarvā arāyyaḥ ////
analyzed: apāmārgaḥ u pa mārṣṭu kṣetriyam śapathaḥ ca yaḥ  apa aha yātudhānīḥ apa sarvāḥ arāyyaḥ
translated: The Apamarga (herb) wipes away the disease of the field and the curse,🔽It drives away the Yatudhani demons and all the evil ones.

original: apamṛjya yātudhānān apa sarvā arāyyaḥ /
analyzed: apamṛjya yātudhānān apa sarvāḥ arāyyaḥ
translated: Having wiped away the Yatudhani demons and all the evil ones,

original: apāmārga tvayā vayaṃ sarvaṃ tad apa mṛjmahe ////
analyzed: apāmārga tvayā vayam sarvam tat apa mṛjmahe
translated: With thee, O Apamarga, we wipe away all that, all evil.

original: uto asy abandhukṛd uto asi nu jāmikṛt /🔽uto kṛtyākṛtaḥ prajāṃ nadam ivā chindhi vārṣikam ////
analyzed: uta u asi abandhu kṛt uta u asi nu jāmi kṛt  uta u kṛtyā kṛtaḥ prajām nadam iva ā chinddhi vārṣikam
translated: And thou art the maker of kinsmen, and thou art the maker of friends.🔽And thou art the destroyer of the witchcraft of those who practise witchcraft, as of a river the dam.

original: brāhmaṇena paryuktāsi kaṇvena nārṣadena /
analyzed: brāhmaṇena paryuktā asi kaṇvena nārṣadena
translated: Thou art appointed by the Brâhmana, by Kanva, by Nârsada.

original: senevaiṣi tviṣīmatī na tatra bhayam asti yatra prāpnoṣy oṣadhe ////
analyzed: senā iva eṣi tviṣīmatī na tatra bhayam asti yatra prāpnoṣi oṣadhe
translated: Like an army thou goest forth, flashing with light. There is no fear there where thou shalt reach, O plant.

original: agram eṣy oṣadhīnāṃ jyotiṣevābhidīpayan /
analyzed: agram eṣi oṣadhīnām jyotiṣā iva abhidīpayan
translated: Thou shalt be the foremost of plants, shining like the light.

original: uta trātāsi pākasyātho hantāsi rakṣasaḥ ////
analyzed: uta trātā asi pākasya atha u hantā asi rakṣasaḥ
translated: And thou art the saviour from decay, and thou art the slayer of the Raksas.

original: yad ado devā asurāṃs tvayāgre nirakurvata /
analyzed: yat adaḥ devāḥ asurān tvayā agre nirakurvata
translated: Since of old the gods, with thee, have driven away the Asuras,

original: tatas tvam adhy oṣadhe 'pāmārgo ajāyathāḥ ////
analyzed: tatas tvam adhi oṣadhe pāmārgaḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: Then from that time, O plant, thou hast sprung up, the Apamarga.

original: vibhindatī śataśākhā vibhindan nāma te pitā /
analyzed: vibhindatī śata śākhā vibhindan nāma te pitā
translated: Thou who hast a hundred branches, breaking through, thy father is called Vibhîdaka.

original: pratyag vi bhindhi tvaṃ taṃ yo asmāṃ abhidāsati ////
analyzed: pratyak vi bhindhi tvam tam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Break thou him who hates us, break him who injures us.

original: asad bhūmyāḥ sam abhavat tad yām eti mahad vyacaḥ /
analyzed: asat bhūmyāḥ sam abhavat tat yām eti mahat vyacaḥ
translated: It hath become the earth's support, that which goeth to the great expanse.

original: tad vai tato vidhūpāyat pratyak kartāram ṛchatu ////
analyzed: tat vai tatas vidhūpāyat pratyak kartāram ṛchatu
translated: From that hath it been driven away: let it return to him who made it.

original: pratyaṅ hi saṃbabhūvitha pratīcīnaphalas tvam /
analyzed: pratyaṅ hi saṃbabhūvitha pratīcīna phalaḥ tvam
translated: Thou hast become the western one, thou whose fruit is turned to the west.

original: sarvān mac chapathām adhi varīyo yāvayā vadham ////
analyzed: sarvān mat śapathām adhi varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham
translated: Drive away the curse from all of us, O most excellent one.

original: śatena mā pari pāhi sahasreṇābhi rakṣā mā /
analyzed: śatena mā pari pāhi sahasreṇa abhi rakṣa mā
translated: Protect me with a hundred, guard me with a thousand.

original: indras te vīrudhāṃ pata ugra ojmānam ā dadhat ////
analyzed: indraḥ te vīrudhām pate ugraḥ ojmānam ā dadhat
translated: May Indra, the lord of plants, bestow strength upon you, O powerful one.

original: ā paśyati prati paśyati parā paśyati paśyati /
analyzed: ā paśyati prati paśyati parā paśyati paśyati
translated: He sees, he sees back, he sees afar, he sees.

original: divam antarikṣam ād bhūmiṃ sarvaṃ tad devi paśyati ////
analyzed: divam antarikṣam āt bhūmim sarvam tat devi paśyati
translated: The sky, the atmosphere, and the earth - all that, O goddess, he sees.

original: tisro divas tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ ṣaṭ cemāḥ pradiśāḥ pṛthak /
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ ṣaḍ ca imāḥ pradiśāḥ pṛthak
translated: Three heavens, three earths, and these six directions separately,

original: tvayāhaṃ sarvā bhūtāni paśyāni devy oṣadhe ////
analyzed: tvayā aham sarvā bhūtāni paśyāni devi oṣadhe
translated: By you, O goddess, I shall see all beings, whether noble or low.

original: divyasya suparṇasya tasya hāsi kanīnikā /
analyzed: divyasya suparṇasya tasya ha asi kanīnikā
translated: Of that divine eagle, you are the pupil.

original: sā bhūmim ā rurohitha vahyaṃ śrāntā vadhūr iva ////
analyzed: sā bhūmim ā rurohitha vahyam śrāntā vadhūḥ iva
translated: You have descended to the earth, like a tired bride.

original: tāṃ me sahasrākṣo devo dakṣiṇe hasta ā dadhat /
analyzed: tām me sahasrākṣaḥ devaḥ dakṣiṇe haste ā dadhat
translated: May the thousand-eyed god place you in my right hand.

original: tayāhaṃ sarvaṃ paśyāmi yaś ca śūdra utāryaḥ ////
analyzed: tayā aham sarvam paśyāmi yaḥ ca śūdraḥ uta āryaḥ
translated: By you, I shall see everything, whether low or noble.

original: āviṣ kṛṇuṣva rūpāni mātmānam apa gūhathāḥ /
analyzed: āvis kṛṇuṣva rūpāni mā ātmānam apa gūhathāḥ
translated: Reveal your forms, do not hide yourself.

original: atho sahasracakṣo tvaṃ prati paśyāḥ kimīdinaḥ ////
analyzed: atha u sahasra cakṣo tvam prati paśyāḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: Then, O thousand-eyed one, look upon the Kimīdins.

original: darśaya mā yātudhānān darśaya yātudhānyaḥ /
analyzed: darśaya mā yātudhānān darśaya yātudhānyaḥ
translated: Reveal the demons, reveal the demonesses.

original: piśācānt sarvān darśayeti tvā rabha oṣadhe ////
analyzed: piśācān sarvān darśaya iti tvā rabhe oṣadhe
translated: Show me all the Pisāchas, O herb, as thou art seized.

original: kaśyapasya cakṣur asi śunyāś ca caturakṣyāḥ /
analyzed: kaśyapasya cakṣuḥ asi śunyāḥ ca catur akṣyāḥ
translated: Thou art the eye of Kaśyapa, and of the four-eyed Śunyat.

original: vīdhre sūryam iva sarpantaṃ mā piśācaṃ tiras karaḥ ////
analyzed: vīdhre sūryam iva sarpantam mā piśācam tiras karaḥ
translated: Do not hide the Pisāca as he creeps like the sun in a cloud.

original: ud agrabhaṃ paripāṇād yātudhānaṃ kimīdinam /
analyzed: ud agrabham paripāṇāt yātudhānam kimīdinam
translated: I have seized the Yātudhāna, the Kimīdin, from the guard.

original: tenāhaṃ sarvaṃ paśyāmy uta śūdram utāryam ////
analyzed: tena aham sarvam paśyāmi uta śūdram uta āryam
translated: By that I see all, even the Śūdra and the Ārya.

original: yo antarikṣeṇa patati divam yaś ca atisarpati /
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣeṇa patati divam yaḥ ca atisarpati
translated: He who flies with the atmosphere, and he who creeps over the sky,

original: bhūmiṃ yo manyate nāthaṃ taṃ piśācam pra darśaya ////
analyzed: bhūmim yaḥ manyate nātham tam piśācam pra darśaya
translated: And he who thinks the earth his protector - show me that Pisāca.

original: ā gāvo agmann uta bhadram akrant sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantv asme /
analyzed: ā gāvaḥ agman uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantu asme
translated: The cows have come and have done well. Let them sit in the cowshed and delight us.

original: prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syur indrāya pūrvīr uṣaso duhānāḥ ////
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ puru rūpāḥ iha syuḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ duhānāḥ
translated: Here let them be rich in offspring and varied forms, yielding abundant dawns to Indra, milking for him.

original: indro yajvane gṛṇate ca śikṣata uped dadāti na svaṃ muṣāyati /
analyzed: indraḥ yajvane gṛṇate ca śikṣate upa id dadāti na svam muṣāyati
translated: Indra helps the sacrificer and the singer; he comes and gives, he does not deceive his own.

original: bhūyobhūyo rayim id asya vardhayann abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum ////
analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas rayim id asya vardhayan abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum
translated: Increasing his wealth again and again, he places the god-adoring one in an unbroken trough.

original: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsām āmitro vyathir ā dadharṣati /
analyzed: na tāḥ naśanti na dabhāti taskaraḥ na āsām āmitraḥ vyathiḥ ā dadharṣati
translated: Neither do they perish, nor does a thief afflict them, nor does an enemy's calamity oppress them.

original: devāṃś ca yābhir yajate dadāti ca jyog it tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha ////
analyzed: devān ca yābhiḥ yajate dadāti ca jyok id tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha
translated: And with those by which he worships and gives to the gods, the lord of the cattle dwells long with them.

original: na tā arvā reṇukakāṭo 'śnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tā abhi /
analyzed: na tāḥ arvā reṇu kakāṭaḥ śnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tāḥ abhi
translated: The dust-heap does not reach those (cows), they do not come near the prepared (food).

original: urugāyam abhayaṃ tasya tā anu gāvo martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ ////
analyzed: uru gāyam abhayam tasya tāḥ anu gāvaḥ martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ
translated: The cows of the sacrificer, the wide-pastured, the fearless ones, wander about.

original: gāvo bhago gāva indro ma ichād gāva somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ /
analyzed: gāvaḥ bhagaḥ gāvaḥ indraḥ me ichāt gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ
translated: The cows are my Bhaga, the cows Indra desires me, the cows are the first food of Soma.

original: imā yā gāvaḥ sa janāsa indra ichāmi hṛdā manasā cid indram ////🔽yūyaṃ gāvo medayatha kṛśaṃ cid aśrīraṃ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ gāvaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ ichāmi hṛdā manasā cit indram  yūyam gāvaḥ medayatha kṛśam cit aśrīram cit kṛṇutha su pratīkam
translated: These cows are the people, I desire Indra with my heart and mind.🔽O cows, you make even the lean one fat, you make even the ugly one beautiful.

original: bhadraṃ gṛhaṃ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu ////
analyzed: bhadram gṛham kṛṇutha bhadra vācaḥ bṛhat vaḥ vayaḥ ucyate sabhāsu
translated: You make the house auspicious, you speak auspicious words. Your great strength is proclaimed in the assemblies.

original: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇe pibantīḥ /
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ
translated: Rich in offspring, shining in good pasture, drinking pure water in a good drinking place,

original: mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo rudrasya hetir vṛṇaktu ////
analyzed: mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu
translated: Let not the thief rule over you, let not the slanderer. Let Rudra's dart pass you by.

original: imam indra vardhaya kṣatriyaṃ me imaṃ viśām ekavṛṣaṃ kṛṇu tvam /
analyzed: imam indra vardhaya kṣatriyam me imam viśām eka vṛṣam kṛṇu tvam
translated: O Indra, prosper this Kshatriya of mine, make him the sole bull of the people.

original: nir amitrān akṣṇuhy asya sarvāṃs tān randhayāsmā ahamuttareṣu ////
analyzed: niḥ amitrān akṣṇuhi asya sarvān tān randhaya asmai ahamuttareṣu
translated: Crush all his enemies, O King, and make them all submit to him.

original: emaṃ bhaja grāme aśveṣu goṣu niṣ ṭaṃ bhaja yo amitro asya /
analyzed: ā imam bhaja grāme aśveṣu goṣu niḥ tam bhaja yaḥ amitraḥ asya
translated: Give him this one in the village, in the horses, in the cows. Give him that one who is his enemy.

original: varṣma kṣatrāṇām ayam astu rājendra śatruṃ randhaya sarvam asmai ////
analyzed: varṣma kṣatrāṇām ayam astu rāja indra śatrum randhaya sarvam asmai
translated: Let him be the highest ruler of the rulers. Make the enemy submit to him in every way.

original: ayam astu dhanapatir dhanānām ayaṃ viśāṃ viśpatir astu rājā /
analyzed: ayam astu dhana patiḥ dhanānām ayam viśām viśpatiḥ astu rājā
translated: Let him be the lord of wealth among the wealthy. Let him be the king, the lord of the people among the people.

original: asminn indra mahi varcāṃsi dhehy avarcasaṃ kṛṇuhi śatrum asya ////
analyzed: asmin indra mahi varcāṃsi dhehi avarcasam kṛṇuhi śatrum asya
translated: O Indra, bestow upon him great splendor, and make his enemy lusterless.

original: asmai dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri vāmaṃ duhāthāṃ gharmadughe iva dhenū /
analyzed: asmai dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri vāmam duhāthām gharma dughe iva dhenū
translated: Let heaven and earth yield him abundant wealth, like two milch cows with warm milk.

original: ayaṃ rājā priya indrasya bhūyāt priyo gavām oṣadhīnāṃ paśūnām ////
analyzed: ayam rājā priyaḥ indrasya bhūyāt priyaḥ gavām oṣadhīnām paśūnām
translated: Let him be dear to Indra, dear to the cows, to the plants, to the cattle.

original: yunajmi ta uttarāvantam indraṃ yena jayanti na parājayante /🔽yas tvā karad ekavṛṣaṃ janānām uta rājñām uttamaṃ mānavānām ////
analyzed: yunajmi te uttarāvantam indram yena jayanti na parājayante  yaḥ tvā karat ekavṛṣam janānām uta rājñām uttamam mānavānām
translated: I yoke that Indra who is victorious, by whom they conquer and are not conquered.🔽You who have made him the sole bull of the people, and the highest king of men.

original: uttaras tvam adhare te sapatnā ye ke ca rājan pratiśatravas te /
analyzed: uttaraḥ tvam adhare te sapatnāḥ ye ke ca rājan pratiśatravaḥ te
translated: You are above, your enemies are below you, whatever enemies you have, O King.

original: ekavṛṣa indrasakhā jigīvāṃ chatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni ////
analyzed: ekavṛṣaḥ indra sakhā jigīvān śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni
translated: The one with the bull, Indra's friend, the conqueror, bring the food of those who are to be conquered.

original: siṃhapratīko viśo addhi sarvā vyāghrapratīko 'va bādhasva śatrūn /🔽ekavṛṣa indrasakhā jigīvāṃ chatrūyatām ā khidā bhojanāni ////
analyzed: siṃha pratīkaḥ viśaḥ addhi sarvāḥ vyāghra pratīkaḥ vaḥ bādhasva śatrūn  ekavṛṣaḥ indra sakhāḥ jigīvān śatrūyatām ā khida bhojanāni
translated: With the form of a lion, eat up all the peoples; with the form of a tiger, drive away the enemies.🔽The one with the bull, Indra's friend, the conqueror, bring the food of those who are to be conquered.

original: agner manve prathamasya pracetasaḥ pāñcajanyasya bahudhā yam indhate /
analyzed: agneḥ manve prathamasya pracetasaḥ pāñcajanyasya bahudhā yam indhate
translated: I think of Agni, the first, the wise, of the five peoples, whom they kindle in many ways.

original: viśoviśaḥ praviśivāṃsam īmahe sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
