analyzed: viśaḥ viśaḥ praviśivāṃsam īmahe sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: We seek him who enters into each people; may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yathā havyaṃ vahasi jātavedo yathā yajñaṃ kalpayasi prajānan /
analyzed: yathā havyam vahasi jātavedaḥ yathā yajñam kalpayasi prajānan
translated: As you carry the oblation, O all-knower, as you arrange the sacrifice, knowing (all),

original: evā devebhyaḥ sumatiṃ na ā vaha sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: eva devebhyaḥ sumatim naḥ ā vaha sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Thus bring to the gods their good will; may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yāmanyāmann upayuktaṃ vahiṣṭhaṃ karmaṅkarmann ābhagam agnim īḍe /
analyzed: yāman yāman upayuktam vahiṣṭham karman karman ābhagam agnim īḍe
translated: I praise Agni, the most useful in every house, the most helpful in every rite, the most bountiful in every task,

original: rakṣohaṇaṃ yajñavṛdhaṃ ghṛtāhutaṃ sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇam yajña vṛdham ghṛta āhutam sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The slayer of demons, the increaser of sacrifice, offered with ghee; may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: sujātaṃ jātavedasam agniṃ vaiśvānaraṃ vibhum /
analyzed: su jātam jātavedasam agnim vaiśvānaram vibhum
translated: Well-born, all-knowing, Agni, the all-pervading Vaiśvānara,

original: havyavāhaṃ havāmahe sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: havyavāham havāmahe sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The bearer of oblations, we invoke; may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yena ṛṣayo balam adyotayan yujā yenāsurāṇām ayuvanta māyāḥ /
analyzed: yena ṛṣayaḥ balam adyotayan yujā yena asurāṇām ayuvanta māyāḥ
translated: By which the Rishis have shone forth with strength today, by which they have taken away the illusions of the Asuras,

original: yenāgninā paṇīn indro jigāya sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yena agninā paṇīn indraḥ jigāya sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: By which fire Indra conquered the Pāṇis, may it deliver us from tribulation.

original: yena devā amṛtam anvavindan yenauṣadhīr madhumatīr akṛṇvan /
analyzed: yena devāḥ amṛtam anvavindan yena oṣadhīḥ madhumatīḥ akṛṇvan
translated: By which the gods found immortality, by which they made the medicinal herbs sweet,

original: yena devāḥ svar ābharant sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yena devāḥ svar ābharan sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: By which the gods brought heaven, may it deliver us from tribulation.

original: yasyedaṃ pradiśi yad virocate yaj jātaṃ janitavyaṃ ca kevalam /
analyzed: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate yat jātam janitavyam ca kevalam
translated: Of whom this shines in the directions, what is born and what is to be born only,

original: staumy agniṃ nāthito johavīmi sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi agnim nāthitaḥ johavīmi sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise Agni, I call out in distress, may it deliver us from tribulation.

original: indrasya manmahe śaśvad id asya manmahe vṛtraghna stomā upa mema āguḥ /
analyzed: indrasya manmahe śaśvat id asya manmahe vṛtra ghnaḥ stomāḥ upa mā ime ā aguḥ
translated: We always think of Indra, we always think of him, the Vṛtra-slayer, the praises have come to me,

original: yo dāśuṣaḥ sukṛto havam eti sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ dāśuṣaḥ su kṛtaḥ havam eti sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: He who comes to the invocation of the generous well-doer, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: ya ugrīṇām ugrabāhur yayur yo dānavānāṃ balam āruroja /
analyzed: yaḥ ugrīṇām ugra bāhuḥ yayuḥ yaḥ dānavānām balam āruroja
translated: He who is the strong one among the strong, the strong-armed, who has mounted the strength of the Dānavas,

original: yena jitāḥ sindhavo yena gāvaḥ sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yena jitāḥ sindhavaḥ yena gāvaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: By whom the rivers were conquered, by whom the cows, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yaś carṣaṇipro vṛṣabhaḥ svarvid yasmai grāvāṇaḥ pravadanti nṛmṇam /
analyzed: yaḥ carṣaṇi praḥ vṛṣabhaḥ svar vid yasmai grāvāṇaḥ pravadanti nṛmṇam
translated: He who is the leader of men, the bull who finds the heaven, for whom the pressing-stones proclaim heroism,

original: yasyādhvaraḥ saptahotā madiṣṭhaḥ sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yasya adhvaraḥ sapta hotā madiṣṭhaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Whose sacrifice, most gladdening, has seven priests, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yasya vaśāsa ṛṣabhāsa ukṣaṇo yasmai mīyante svaravaḥ svarvide /
analyzed: yasya vaśāsaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ yasmai mīyante svaravaḥ svarvide
translated: Whose are the cows, bulls, and oxen, for whom the Svaru is prepared by him who finds the light,

original: yasmai śukraḥ pavate brahmaśumbhitaḥ sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yasmai śukraḥ pavate brahma śumbhitaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: For whom the bright (Soma) flows, purified by prayer, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yasya juṣṭiṃ sominaḥ kāmayante yaṃ havanta iṣumantaṃ gaviṣṭau /
analyzed: yasya juṣṭim sominaḥ kāmayante yam havante iṣumantam gaviṣṭau
translated: Whose favour the Soma-offerers desire, whom they invoke with arrows in the battle for cattle,

original: yasminn arkaḥ śiśriye yasminn ojaḥ sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yasmin arkaḥ śiśriye yasmin ojaḥ sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: In whom the light is placed, in whom strength, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yaḥ prathamaḥ karmakṛtyāya jajñe yasya vīryam prathamasyānubuddham /
analyzed: yaḥ prathamaḥ karma kṛtyāya jajñe yasya vīryam prathamasya anubuddham
translated: Who was first born for the performance of work, whose power the first one (Agni) has understood,

original: yenodyato vajro 'bhyāyatāhiṃ sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yena udyataḥ vajraḥ bhyāyata ahim sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: By whom the uplifted thunderbolt was hurled at the serpent, may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: yaḥ saṃgrāmān nayati saṃ yudhe vaśī yaḥ puṣṭāni saṃsṛjati dvayāni /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃgrāmān nayati sam yudhe vaśī yaḥ puṣṭāni saṃsṛjati dvayāni
translated: Who leads the battles, who, the powerful one, the two kinds of nourishment,

original: staumīndraṃ nāthito johavīmi sa no muñcatv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi indram nāthitaḥ johavīmi sa naḥ muñcatu aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise Indra, I invoke him when in need; may he deliver us from tribulation.

original: vāyoḥ savitur vidathāni manmahe yāv ātmanvad viśatho yau ca rakṣathaḥ /
analyzed: vāyoḥ savituḥ vidathāni manmahe yau ātmanvat viśathaḥ yau ca rakṣathaḥ
translated: We meditate on the ordinances of Vayu and Savitr, who move in their own way and who protect,

original: yau viśvasya paribhū babhūvathus tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau viśvasya paribhū babhūvathuḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: Who have become the overlords of all, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: yayoḥ saṃkhyātā varimā pārhivāni yābhyāṃ rajo yupitam antarikṣe /
analyzed: yayoḥ saṃkhyātā varimā pārhivāni yābhyām rajaḥ yupitam antarikṣe
translated: By whom the extent of the earthly regions is measured, by whom the dust is settled in the atmosphere,

original: yayoḥ prāyaṃ nānv ānaśe kaś cana tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////🔽tava vrate ni viśante janāsas tvayy udite prerate citrabhāno /
analyzed: yayoḥ prāyam na anu ānaśe kaḥ cana tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  tava vrate ni viśante janāsaḥ tvayi udite prerate citrabhāno
translated: By whom no one has ever attained the end, do you two deliver us from tribulation.🔽In your vow the people find rest, in you, O radiant one, when you rise, they move on.

original: yuvaṃ vāyo savitā ca bhuvanāni rakṣathas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yuvam vāyo savitā ca bhuvanāni rakṣathaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You two, Vayu and Savitar, protect the worlds. Do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: apeto vāyo savitā ca duṣkṛtam apa rakṣāṃsi śimidāṃ ca sedhatam /
analyzed: apa itas vāyo savitā ca duṣkṛtam apa rakṣāṃsi śimidām ca sedhatam
translated: Away from us, O Vayu and Savitar, drive away evil, and the Rakshas and the Simidu.

original: saṃ hy ūrjayā sṛjathaḥ saṃ balena tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: sam hi ūrjayā sṛjathaḥ sam balena tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: For you two create with food and with strength. Do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: rayiṃ me poṣaṃ savitota vāyus tanū dakṣam ā suvatāṃ suśevam /
analyzed: rayim me poṣam savitā uta vāyuḥ tanū dakṣam ā suvatām su śevam
translated: May Savitar and Vayu grant me wealth, nourishment, and bodily strength, very gracious.

original: ayakṣmatātiṃ maha iha dhattaṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////🔽pra sumatiṃ savitar vāya ūtaye mahasvantaṃ matsaraṃ mādayāthaḥ /
analyzed: a yakṣmatātim mahaḥ iha dhattam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  pra sumatim savitar vāyo ūtaye mahasvantam matsaram mādayāthaḥ
translated: Do you two bestow here great freedom from disease. Do you two deliver us from tribulation.🔽O Savitar and Vayu, rejoice in the mighty exhilarating drink for the sake of help.

original: arvāg vāmasya pravato ni yachataṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: arvāk vāmasya pravataḥ ni yacchatam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: Do you two bestow upon us the wealth of the good. Do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: upa śreṣṭhā na āśiṣo devayor dhāmann asthiran /
analyzed: upa śreṣṭhāḥ naḥ āśiṣaḥ devayoḥ dhāman asthiran
translated: The best blessings have come to us in the abode of the two gods.

original: staumi devaṃ savitāraṃ ca vāyuṃ tau no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi devam savitāram ca vāyum tau naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise the god Savitar and Vayu. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: manve vāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī subhojasau sacetasau ye aprathethām amitā yojanāni /
analyzed: manve vām dyāvāpṛthivī subhojasau sacetasau ye aprathethām amitā yojanāni
translated: I think of you, O heaven and earth, of good enjoyment, of the same mind, who have extended your immeasurable paths.

original: pratiṣṭhe hy abhavataṃ vasūnāṃ te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: pratiṣṭhe hi abhavatam vasūnām te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: For you have become the foundations of the treasures. May you deliver us from tribulation.

original: pratiṣṭhe hy abhavataṃ vasūnāṃ pravṛddhe devī subhage urūcī /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhe hi abhavatam vasūnām pravṛddhe devī subhage urūcī
translated: For you have become the foundations of the treasures, O mighty, blessed, wide goddesses.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavataṃ me syone te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: O heaven and earth, be propitious to me. May you deliver us from tribulation.

original: asantāpe sutapasau huve 'ham urvī gambhīre kavibhir namasye /
analyzed: a santāpe su tapasau huve ham urvī gambhīre kavibhiḥ namasye
translated: I invoke you, O unheated, well-heated ones, I revere the vast, deep ones with the sages.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavataṃ me syone te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: O heaven and earth, be propitious to me. May you deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye amṛtaṃ bibhṛtho ye havīṃṣi ye srotyā bibhṛtho ye manuṣyān /
analyzed: ye amṛtam bibhṛthaḥ ye havīṃṣi ye srotyāḥ bibhṛthaḥ ye manuṣyān
translated: You who hold the nectar, you who hold the oblations, you who hold the streams, you who hold the humans,

original: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavataṃ me syone te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: O heaven and earth, be propitious to me. May you deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye usriyā bibhṛtho ye vanaspatīn yayor vāṃ viśvā bhuvanāny antaḥ /
analyzed: ye usriyāḥ bibhṛthaḥ ye vanaspatīn yayoḥ vām viśvā bhuvanāni antar
translated: You who hold the cows, you who hold the trees, in whom are all the worlds,

original: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavataṃ me syone te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: O heaven and earth, be propitious to me. May you deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye kīlālena tarpayatho ye ghṛtena yābhyām ṛte na kiṃ cana śaknuvanti /
analyzed: ye kīlālena tarpayathaḥ ye ghṛtena yābhyām ṛte na kim cana śaknuvanti
translated: Ye who satisfy with food and drink, ye who with ghee, without whom nothing can be done,

original: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavataṃ me syone te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī bhavatam me syone te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: Be ye Heaven and Earth a safe asylum for me: deliver us from tribulation.

original: yan medam abhiśocati yenayena vā kṛtaṃ pauruṣeyān na daivāt /
analyzed: yat mā idam abhiśocati yena yena vā kṛtam pauruṣeyāt na daivāt
translated: Whatever here burns me, whatever I have done, whether by human or by divine agency,

original: staumi dyāvāpṛthivī nāthito johavīmi te no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi dyāvāpṛthivī nāthitaḥ johavīmi te naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise Heaven and Earth: in distress I call on them. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: marutāṃ manve adhi me bruvantu premaṃ vājaṃ vājasāte avantu /
analyzed: marutām manve adhi me bruvantu pra imam vājam vājasāte avantu
translated: I think of the Maruts: let them speak to me. Let them aid me in the winning of strength for the sake of strength.

original: āśūn iva suyamān ahva ūtaye te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: āśūn iva su yamān ahve ūtaye te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Like swift horses I call them for help. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: utsam akṣitaṃ vyacanti ye sadā ya āsiñcanti rasam oṣadhīṣu /
analyzed: utsam akṣitam vyacanti ye sadā ye āsiñcanti rasam oṣadhīṣu
translated: They who always open the unfailing spring, they who pour out the juice in the plants,

original: puro dadhe marutaḥ pṛśnimātṝṃs te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: puras dadhe marutaḥ pṛśni mātṝn te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: I place the Maruts, with the dappled mothers, in front. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: payo dhenūnāṃ rasam oṣadhīnāṃ javam arvatāṃ kavayo ya invatha /
analyzed: payaḥ dhenūnām rasam oṣadhīnām javam arvatām kavayaḥ ye invatha
translated: The milk of the milch cows, the juice of the plants, the speed of the horses, ye wise ones, do impel.

original: śagmā bhavantu maruto naḥ syonās te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: śagmāḥ bhavantu marutaḥ naḥ syonāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Be the Maruts kind and gracious to us. Deliver us from tribulation.

original: apaḥ samudrād divam ud vahanti divas pṛthivīm abhi ye sṛjanti /
analyzed: apaḥ samudrāt divam ud vahanti divaḥ pṛthivīm abhi ye sṛjanti
translated: They who carry the waters from the ocean to the sky, they who send them down from the sky to the earth,

original: ye adbhir īśānā marutaś caranti te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: ye adbhiḥ īśānāḥ marutaḥ caranti te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Those Maruts who rule with water, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye kīlālena tarpayanti ye ghṛtena ye vā vayo medasā saṃsṛjanti /
analyzed: ye kīlālena tarpayanti ye ghṛtena ye vā vayaḥ medasā saṃsṛjanti
translated: Those who delight with sweet juice, those with ghee, those who unite me with strength and fat,

original: ye adbhir īśānā maruto varṣayanti te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: ye adbhiḥ īśānāḥ marutaḥ varṣayanti te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Those Maruts who rule with water and cause to rain, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: yadīd idaṃ maruto mārutena yadi devā daivyenedṛg āra /
analyzed: yadi id idam marutaḥ mārutena yadi devāḥ daivyena īdṛś āra
translated: If this is done by the Maruts through the Marut, if by the gods through the divine, such is the arrangement.

original: yūyam īśidhve vasavas tasya niṣkṛtes te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yūyam īśidhve vasavaḥ tasya niṣkṛteḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: You are the lords, O Vasus, of that atonement. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: tigmam anīkam viditaṃ sahasvan mārutaṃ śardhaḥ pṛtanāsūgram /
analyzed: tigmam anīkam viditam sahasvat mārutam śardhaḥ pṛtanāsu ugram
translated: The fierce-countenanced, well-known, invincible Marut host, fierce in battles,

original: staumi maruto nāthito johavīmi te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi marutaḥ nāthitaḥ johavīmi te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise the Maruts, calling out for help. May they deliver us from tribulation.

original: bhavāśarvau manve vāṃ tasya vittaṃ yayor vām idaṃ pradiśi yad virocate /
analyzed: bhavāśarvau manve vām tasya vittam yayoḥ vām idam pradiśi yat virocate
translated: I meditate on you, Bhava and Sharva, I know that wealth of yours by which this shines in the directions,

original: yāv asyeśāthe dvipado yau catuṣpadas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau asya īśāthe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: By which you rule his two-footed and four-footed, may you deliver us from tribulation.

original: yayor abhyabhva uta yad dūre cid yau viditāv iṣubhṛtām asiṣṭhau /
analyzed: yayoḥ abhi abhve uta yat dūre cit yau viditau iṣubhṛtām asiṣṭhau
translated: By which you are near and far, by which you are the most famous of the bowmen,

original: yāv asyeśathe dvipado yau catuṣpadas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: By which you rule his two-footed and four-footed, may you deliver us from tribulation.

original: sahasrākṣau vṛtrahanā huvehaṃ dūregavyūtī stuvann emy ugrau /
analyzed: sahasra akṣau vṛtra hanā huve iham dūregavyūtī stuvan emi ugrau
translated: I invoke the two thousand-eyed, the two Vritra-slayers, the two far-reaching, the two mighty ones, praising them, I come.

original: yāv asyeśathe dvipado yau catuṣpadas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who rule over his two-footed and four-footed creatures, deliver us from affliction.

original: yāv ārebhāthe bahu sākam agre pra ced asrāṣṭram abhibhāṃ janeṣu /
analyzed: yau ārebhāthe bahu sākam agre pra ced asrāṣṭram abhibhām janeṣu
translated: You who have been born together in many places, in the beginning, and have spread out the kingdom among the people,

original: yāv asyeśathe dvipado yau catuṣpadas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who rule over his two-footed and four-footed creatures, deliver us from affliction.

original: yayor vadhān nāpapadyate kaś canāntar deveṣūta mānuṣeṣu /
analyzed: yayoḥ vadhāt na apapadyate kaḥ cana antar deveṣu uta mānuṣeṣu
translated: Over whom no one at all can prevail, among the gods and among humans,

original: yāv asyeśathe dvipado yau catuṣpadas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who rule over his two-footed and four-footed creatures, deliver us from affliction.

original: yaḥ kṛtyākṛn mūlakṛd yātudhāno ni tasmin dhattaṃ vajram ugrau /
analyzed: yaḥ kṛtyā kṛt mūla kṛt yātudhānaḥ ni tasmin dhattam vajram ugrau
translated: Upon whom you two, O mighty ones, place the thunderbolt, the one who commits witchcraft, the one who digs up the roots, the demon,

original: yāv asyeśathe dvipado yau catuṣpadas tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////🔽adhi no brūtaṃ pṛtanāsūgrau saṃ vajreṇa sṛjataṃ yaḥ kimīdī /
analyzed: yau asya īśathe dvipadaḥ yau catuṣpadaḥ tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  adhi naḥ brūtam pṛtanāsu ugrau sam vajreṇa sṛjatam yaḥ kimīdī
translated: You who rule over his two-footed and four-footed creatures, deliver us from affliction.🔽Speak to us in the battles, O mighty ones, hurl with your thunderbolt the one who is a Kimīdin.

original: staumi bhavāśarvau nāthito johavīmi tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi bhavāśarvau nāthitaḥ johavīmi tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise Bhava and Śarva, I call out in distress. You two, deliver us from affliction.

original: manve vāṃ mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvṛdhau sacetasau druhvaṇo yau nudethe /
analyzed: manve vām mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāvṛdhau sacetasau druhvaṇaḥ yau nudethe
translated: I think of you two, O Mitra and Varuṇa, the two who strengthen the truth, the two who drive away the haters,

original: pra satyāvānam avatho bhareṣu tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////🔽sacetasau druhvaṇo yau nudethe pra satyāvānam avatho bhareṣu /
analyzed: pra satyāvānam avathaḥ bhareṣu tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ  sacetasau druhvaṇaḥ yau nudethe pra satyāvānam avathaḥ bhareṣu
translated: Help the truthful one in his battles. Do you two deliver us from tribulation.🔽You two who banish the wicked, who are of the same mind, help the truthful one in his battles.

original: yau gachatho nṛcakṣasau babhruṇā sutaṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau gachathaḥ nṛ cakṣasau babhruṇā sutam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You two who go about, you who look on men, with the brown (horse), (you who go) to the pressed (Soma), do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: yāv aṅgirasam avatho yāv agastiṃ mitrāvaruṇā jamadagnim attrim /
analyzed: yau aṅgirasam avathaḥ yau agastim mitra varuṇā jamadagnim attrim
translated: You two who help Aṅgiras, you who help Agastya, Mitra-Varuṇa, Jamadagni, Atri,

original: yau kaśyapam avatho yau vasiṣṭhaṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau kaśyapam avathaḥ yau vasiṣṭham tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who help Kaśyapa, you who help Vasiṣṭha, do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: yau śyāvāśvam avatho vādhryaśvaṃ mitrāvaruṇā purumīḍham attrim /
analyzed: yau śyāvāśvam avathaḥ vādhryaśvam mitra varuṇā purumīḍham attrim
translated: You who help Śyāvāśva, you who help Vādhryāśva, Mitra-Varuṇa, Purumīḍha, Atri,

original: yau vimadam avatho saptavadhriṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau vimadam avathaḥ saptavadhrim tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who help Vimada, you who help Saptavadhri, do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: yau bharadvājam avatho yau gaviṣṭhiraṃ viśvāmitraṃ varuṇa mitra kutsam /
analyzed: yau bharadvājam avathaḥ yau gaviṣṭhiram viśvāmitram varuṇa mitra kutsam
translated: You who help Bharadvāja, you who help Gaviṣṭhira, Viśvāmitra, Varuṇa, Mitra, Kutsa,

original: yau kakṣīvantam avatho prota kaṇvaṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau kakṣīvantam avathaḥ pra uta kaṇvam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who help Kakṣīvān, you who help Prota-Kaṇva, do you two deliver us from tribulation.

original: yau medhātithim avatho yau triśokaṃ mitrāvaruṇāv uśanām kāvyaṃ yau /
analyzed: yau medhātithim avathaḥ yau triśokam mitrāvaruṇau uśanām kāvyam yau
translated: You who help Medhātithi, you who help Triśaṅka, Mitra-Varuṇa, Uśanas Kāvya, you,

original: yau gotamam avatho prota mugdalaṃ tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yau gotamam avathaḥ pra uta mugdalam tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: You who support Gotama and Mugdala, deliver us from affliction.

original: yayo rathaḥ satyavartma rjuraśmir mithuyā carantam abhiyāti dūṣayan /
analyzed: yayoḥ rathaḥ satya vartma rju raśmiḥ mithuyā carantam abhiyāti dūṣayan
translated: Whose chariot with true course and straight reins approaches the one who moves in pairs, defiling him,

original: staumi mitrāvaruṇau nāthito johavīmi tau no muñcatam aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: staumi mitrāvaruṇau nāthitaḥ johavīmi tau naḥ muñcatam aṃhasaḥ
translated: I praise Mitra and Varuna, I call out for help. May they deliver us from affliction.

original: ahaṃ rudrebhir vasubhiś carāmy aham ādityair uta viśvadevaiḥ /
analyzed: aham rudrebhiḥ vasubhiḥ carāmi aham ādityaiḥ uta viśvadevaiḥ
translated: I wander with the Rudras and Vasus, I with the Adityas and the All-gods.

original: ahaṃ mitrāvarunobhā bibharmy aham indrāgnī aham aśvinobhā ////
analyzed: aham mitrāvarunā ubhā bibharmi aham indra agnī aham aśvinā ubhā
translated: I support both Mitra and Varuna, I Indra and Agni, I both the Ashvins.

original: ahaṃ rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnāṃ cikituṣī prathamā yajñiyānām /🔽tāṃ mā devā vy adadhuḥ purutrā bhūristhātrāṃ bhūry āveśayantaḥ ////
analyzed: aham rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnām cikituṣī prathamā yajñiyānām  tām mā devāḥ vi adadhuḥ purutrā bhūri sthātrām bhūri āveśayantaḥ
translated: I am the sovereign, the gatherer of treasures, the most skillful, the first worthy of sacrifice.🔽The gods have placed me in many places, making me with many abodes very powerful.

original: aham eva svayam idaṃ vadāmi juṣṭaṃ devānām uta mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: aham eva svayam idam vadāmi juṣṭam devānām uta mānuṣāṇām
translated: I myself declare this, pleasing to the gods and to men.

original: yaṃ kāmaye tantam ugraṃ kṛṇomi taṃ brahmāṇaṃ tam ṛṣiṃ taṃ sumedhām ////
analyzed: yam kāmaye tantam ugram kṛṇomi tam brahmāṇam tam ṛṣim tam su medhām
translated: I make him whom I will fierce. Him I make the Brahman, the Rishi, the wise one.

original: mayā so 'nnam atti yo vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇati ya īm śṛṇoty uktam /
analyzed: mayā saḥ annam atti yaḥ vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇati yaḥ īm śṛṇoti uktam
translated: By me he eats food who sees, who breathes, who hears what is said.

original: amantavo māṃ ta upa kṣiyanti śrudhi śruta śruddheyaṃ te vadāmi ////
analyzed: amantavaḥ mām te upa kṣiyanti śrudhi śruta śruddhā iyam te vadāmi
translated: They who are not to be despised wait upon me. Listen, O Hearer, I speak this to thee, O Hearer.

original: ahaṃ rudrāya dhanur ā tanomi brahmadviṣe śarave hantavā u /
analyzed: aham rudrāya dhanuḥ ā tanomi brahma dviṣe śarave hantavai u
translated: I stretch the bow for Rudra, for the arrow that hates prayer, to slay.

original: ahaṃ janāya samadaṃ kṛṇomi aham dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa ////
analyzed: aham janāya samadam kṛṇomi aham dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa
translated: I make the people equal. I have entered heaven and earth.

original: ahaṃ somam āhanasaṃ bibharmy ahaṃ tvaṣṭāram uta pūṣaṇaṃ bhagam /
analyzed: aham somam āhanasam bibharmi aham tvaṣṭāram uta pūṣaṇam bhagam
translated: I bear Soma, the striker, and Tvastr, and Pushan, and Bhaga.

original: ahaṃ dadhāmi draviṇā haviṣmate suprāvyā yajamānāya sunvate ////
analyzed: aham dadhāmi draviṇā haviṣmate suprāvyāḥ yajamānāya sunvate
translated: I bestow wealth on the worshipper, on the presser, who is easy to be served.

original: ahaṃ suve pitaram asya mūrdhan mama yonir apsv antaḥ samudre /
analyzed: aham suve pitaram asya mūrdhan mama yoniḥ apsu antar samudre
translated: I produced this father's head. My womb is in the waters in the ocean.

original: tato vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanāni viśvotāmūṃ dyāṃ varṣmaṇopa spṛśāmi ////
analyzed: tatas vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanāni viśvā uta amūm dyām varṣmaṇā upa spṛśāmi
translated: Thence I extend over all the worlds. I touch this sky with my back.

original: aham eva vātaiva pra vāmy ārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: aham eva vātā eva pra vāmi ārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: I myself, like the wind, move forward, setting in motion all the worlds.

original: paro divā para enā pṛthivyaitāvatī mahimnā saṃ babhūva ////
analyzed: paras divā paras enā pṛthivyā etāvatī mahimnā sam babhūva
translated: Beyond the heaven, beyond this earth, I have become so great in majesty.

original: tvayā manyo saratham ārujanto harṣamāṇā hṛṣitāso marutvan /
analyzed: tvayā manyo sa ratham ārujantaḥ harṣamāṇāḥ hṛṣitāsaḥ marutvan
translated: O Manyu, the Maruts, rejoicing, eager, mounting their chariot with thee,

original: tigmeṣava āyudhā saṃśiśānā upa pra yantu naro agnirūpāḥ ////
analyzed: tigma iṣavaḥ āyudhā saṃśiśānāḥ upa pra yantu naraḥ agni rūpāḥ
translated: sharpening their weapons with keen points, let the men go forward, having the form of Agni.

original: agnir iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīr naḥ sahure hūta edhi /
analyzed: agniḥ iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senā nīḥ naḥ sahure hūtaḥ edhi
translated: Like Agni, O Manyu, be thou impetuous; be thou our general in the battle, O invoked!

original: hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva veda ojo mimāno vi mṛdho nudasva ////🔽sahasva manyo abhimātim asmai rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn /🔽ugraṃ te pājo nanv ā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃ nayāsā ekaja tvam ////
analyzed: hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva vedaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva  sahasva manyo abhimātim asmai rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn  ugram te pājaḥ nanu ā rurudhre vaśī vaśam nayāsai eka ja tvam
translated: To slay the foes, divide the treasure; measuring strength, drive away the enemies.🔽Overcome the violence of the foe for him; crushing, slaying, destroying the enemies, go forward, O Manyu.🔽Thy fierce flame now I restrain; as a master lead thou the subject to subjection, thou who art one.

original: eko bahūnām asi manya īḍitā viśaṃviśam yuddhāya saṃ śiśādhi /
analyzed: ekaḥ bahūnām asi manye īḍitā viśam viśam yuddhāya sam śiśādhi
translated: Thou art one of many, O Manyu, invoked; sharpen each clan for battle.

original: akṛttaruk tvayā yujā vayaṃ dyumantaṃ ghoṣam vijayāya kṛṇmasi ////
analyzed: a kṛtta ruc tvayā yujā vayam dyumantam ghoṣam vijayāya kṛṇmasi
translated: With thee for our ally, O Manyu, we make a loud shout, terrible, for victory.

original: vijeṣakṛd indra ivānavabravo 'smākaṃ manyo adhipā bhaveha /
analyzed: vijeṣa kṛt indraḥ iva anavabravaḥ smākam manyo adhipāḥ bhava iha
translated: Like Indra, the victor, we invoke thee; be thou, O Manyu, our overlord.

original: priyaṃ te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidmā tam utsaṃ yata ābabhūtha ////
analyzed: priyam te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidma tam utsam yatas ābabhūtha
translated: We praise thy dear name, O hero; we know that spring from which thou hast come.

original: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka saho bibharṣi sahabhūta uttaram /
analyzed: ābhūtyā sahajāḥ vajra sāyaka sahaḥ bibharṣi sahabhūtaḥ uttaram
translated: With prosperity, O Manyu, born together, thou bearest the thunderbolt, the weapon, the higher strength.

original: kratvā no manyo saha medy edhi mahādhanasya puruhūta saṃsṛji ////
analyzed: kratvā naḥ manyo saha medī edhi mahā dhanasya puru hūta saṃsṛji
translated: Be thou, O Manyu, with our thoughts, O much-invoked, in the gathering of great wealth.

original: saṃsṛṣṭaṃ dhanam ubhayaṃ samākṛtam asmabhyaṃ dhattāṃ varuṇaś ca manyuḥ /
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭam dhanam ubhayam samākṛtam asmabhyam dhattām varuṇaḥ ca manyuḥ
translated: Let Varuna and Manyu give us wealth, both kinds of wealth united and made equal.

original: bhiyo dadhānā hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāso apa ni layantām ////
analyzed: bhiyaḥ dadhānāḥ hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāsaḥ apa ni layantām
translated: Let the enemies, placing fear in their hearts, be vanquished and driven away.

original: yas te manyo 'vidhad vajra sāyaka saha ojaḥ puṣyati viśvam ānuṣak /
analyzed: yaḥ te manyo vidhat vajra sāyaka sahaḥ ojaḥ puṣyati viśvam ānuṣak
translated: O Manyu, he who has sharpened thy thunderbolt, O dart, who increases his strength in every way,

original: sāhyāma dāsam āryaṃ tvayā yujā vayaṃ sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā ////
analyzed: sāhyāma dāsam āryam tvayā yujā vayam sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā
translated: May we, united with thee, O thou of a thousand powers, conquer the Dāsa and the Ārya by thy thousandfold power.

original: manyur indro manyur evāsa devo manyur hotā varuṇo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: manyuḥ indraḥ manyuḥ eva āsa devaḥ manyuḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Manyu is Indra, Manyu is the divine deity, Manyu is the Hotṛ, Varuna, the all-knower.

original: manyuṃ viśa īḍate mānuṣīr yāḥ pahi no manyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ ////🔽abhīhi manyo tavasas tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn /
analyzed: manyum viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīḥ yāḥ pahi naḥ manyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ  abhīhi manyo tavasaḥ tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn
translated: The human people praise Manyu. O Manyu, be of one mind with us through austerity.🔽Come, O Manyu, stronger than the strong, with austerity as thy companion, slay the enemies.

original: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhā ca viśvā vasūny ā bharā tvaṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: amitra hā vṛtra hā dasyu hā ca viśvā vasūni ā bhara tvam naḥ
translated: Slayer of foes, slayer of Vṛtra, slayer of the Dasyus, bring to us all kinds of wealth.

original: tvaṃ hi manyo abhibhūtyojāḥ svayaṃbhūr bhāmo abhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi manyo abhibhūti ojāḥ svayaṃbhūḥ bhāmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: For thou, O Manyu, art of overpowering might, self-existent, a terrible victor over enemies,

original: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahīyān asmāsv ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi ////
analyzed: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahīyān asmāsu ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi
translated: All-conquering, most powerful, bestow upon us strength in battles.

original: abhāgaḥ sann apa pareto asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya pracetaḥ /
analyzed: a bhāgaḥ san apa paretaḥ asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya pracetaḥ
translated: Though destitute of a share, I have come hither through thy wisdom, O thou of mighty power, O thou of far-reaching thought.

original: taṃ tvā manyo akratur jihīḍāhaṃ svā tanūr baladāvā na ehi ////🔽ayaṃ te asmy upa na ehy arvāṅ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadāvan /🔽manyo vajrinn abhi na ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūṃr uta bodhy āpeḥ ////🔽abhi prehi dakṣiṇato bhavā no 'dhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri /🔽juhomi te dharuṇaṃ madhvo agram ubhāv upāṃśu prathamā pibāva ////🔽apa naḥ śośucad agham agne śuśugdhy ā rayim /🔽apa naḥ śośucad agham ////
analyzed: tam tvā manyo akratuḥ jihīḍa aham svā tanūḥ bala dāvā naḥ ehi  ayam te asmi upa naḥ ehi arvāṅ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśva dāvan  manyo vajrin abhi naḥ ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūṃr uta bodhi āpeḥ  abhi prehi dakṣiṇatas bhava naḥ dhāḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāva bhūri  juhomi te dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram ubhau upāṃśu prathamā pibāva  apa naḥ śośucat agham agne śuśugdhi ā rayim  apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: I, O Manyu, the irresistible, will praise thee: come to me, O thou who givest strength, with thine own body.

original: sukṣetriyā sugātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe /🔽apa naḥ śośucad agham ////🔽pra yad bhandiṣṭha eṣāṃ prāsmākāsaś ca sūrayaḥ /🔽apa naḥ śośucad agham ////🔽pra yat te agne sūrayo jāyemahi pra te vayam /🔽apa naḥ śośucad agham ////🔽pra yad agneḥ sahasvato viśvato yanti bhānavaḥ /🔽apa naḥ śośucad agham ////
analyzed: sukṣetriyā sugātuyā vasūyā ca yajāmahe 🔽apa naḥ śośucat agham 🔽pra yat bhandiṣṭhaḥ eṣām pra asmākāsaḥ ca sūrayaḥ 🔽apa naḥ śośucat agham 🔽pra yat te agne sūrayaḥ jāyemahi pra te vayam 🔽apa naḥ śośucat agham 🔽pra yat agneḥ sahasvataḥ viśvatas yanti bhānavaḥ 🔽apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Here I am: come hither to me. Turn thou to us, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things, O thou who hast all things

original: tvaṃ hi viśvatomukha viśvataḥ paribhūr asi /
analyzed: tvam hi viśvatomukha viśvatas paribhūḥ asi
translated: For thou art he who looks in all directions, thou art the overlord on every side.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham ////
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou remove our sin, O thou who art to be invoked by all men.

original: dviṣo no viśvatomukhāti nāveva pāraya /
analyzed: dviṣaḥ naḥ viśvatomukha ati nāvā iva pāraya
translated: Do thou, O thou who lookest in all directions, carry us over our foes, as in a boat.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham ////
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou remove our sin, O thou who art to be invoked by all men.

original: sa naḥ sindhum iva nāvāti parṣa svastaye /
analyzed: sa naḥ sindhum iva nāvāti parṣa svastaye
translated: Do thou carry us over, as in a boat, to the ocean, to well-being.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham ////
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Do thou remove our sin, O thou who art to be invoked by all men.

original: brahmāsya śīrṣaṃ bṛhad asya pṛṣṭhaṃ vāmadevyam udaram odanasya /
analyzed: brahma asya śīrṣam bṛhat asya pṛṣṭham vāmadevyam udaram odanasya
translated: The Brahman is its head, the Brihat its back, the Vamadevya the belly of the rice-pap.

original: chandāṃsi pakṣau mukham asya satyaṃ viṣṭārī jātas tapaso'dhi yajñaḥ ////
analyzed: chandāṃsi pakṣau mukham asya satyam viṣṭārī jātaḥ tapasā ūdhi yajñaḥ
translated: The metres are its wings, its mouth is truth; the sacrifice, spread out, is born from penance.

original: anasthāḥ pūtāḥ pavanena śuddhāḥ śucayaḥ śucim api yanti lokam /
analyzed: anasthāḥ pūtāḥ pavanena śuddhāḥ śucayaḥ śucim api yanti lokam
translated: They who are not attached, purified, cleansed by penance, go to the pure world, the pure.

original: naiṣāṃ śiśnaṃ pra dahati jātavedāḥ svarge loke bahu straiṇam eṣām ////
analyzed: na eṣām śiśnam pra dahati jātavedāḥ svarge loke bahu straiṇam eṣām
translated: The fire does not burn their penis; in the heavenly world there are many women for them.

original: viṣṭāriṇam odanaṃ ye pacanti nainān avartiḥ sacate kadā cana /
analyzed: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti na enān avartiḥ sacate kadā cana
translated: Those who cook the spread-out rice-pap, misfortune never befalls them at any time.

original: āste yama upa yāti devānt saṃ gandharvair madate somyebhiḥ ////
analyzed: āste yamaḥ upa yāti devān sam gandharvaiḥ madate somyebhiḥ
translated: He who sits there goes to the gods, he rejoices with the Gandharvas who are full of Soma.

original: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti nainān yamaḥ pari muṣṇāti retaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṭāriṇam odanam ye pacanti na enān yamaḥ pari muṣṇāti retaḥ
translated: Yama does not destroy the seed of those who cook the spread-out rice-pap.

original: rathī ha bhūtvā rathayāna īyate pakṣī ha bhūtvāti divaḥ sam eti ////
analyzed: rathī ha bhūtvā rathayānaḥ īyate pakṣī ha bhūtvā ati divaḥ sam eti
translated: Having become a charioteer, he goes by the path of the chariot. Having become a bird, he goes beyond the sky.

original: eṣa yajñānāṃ vitato vahiṣṭho viṣṭāriṇaṃ paktvā divam ā viveśa /
analyzed: eṣa yajñānām vitataḥ vahiṣṭhaḥ viṣṭāriṇam paktvā divam ā viveśa
translated: This is the most extended of sacrifices, the spreader, having cooked, has entered the sky.

original: āṇḍīkaṃ kumudaṃ saṃ tanoti bisaṃ śālūkaṃ śaphako mulālī /
analyzed: āṇḍīkam kumudam sam tanoti bisam śālūkam śaphakaḥ mulālī
translated: He spreads the egg, the lotus, the lotus stalk, the lily, the reed, the root.

original: etās tvā dhārā upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānā upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ ////
analyzed: etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ
translated: May all these streams flow to you, swelling with honey in the world of heaven. May the pools stand around you.

original: ghṛtahradā madhukūlāḥ surodakāḥ kṣīreṇa pūrṇā udakena dadhnā /
analyzed: ghṛta hradāḥ madhu kūlāḥ surā udakāḥ kṣīreṇa pūrṇāḥ udakena dadhnā
translated: With lakes of ghee, banks of honey, and pure water, full of milk, water, and curd.

original: etās tvā dhārā upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānā upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ ////
analyzed: etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ
translated: May all these streams flow to you, swelling with honey in the world of heaven. May the pools stand around you.

original: caturaḥ kumbhāṃś caturdhā dadāmi kṣīreṇa pūrnāṃ udakena dadhnā /
analyzed: caturaḥ kumbhān caturdhā dadāmi kṣīreṇa udakena dadhnā
translated: I give you four jars divided into four parts, full of milk, water, and curd.

original: etās tvā dhārā upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānā upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ ////
analyzed: etāḥ tvā dhārāḥ upa yantu sarvāḥ svarge loke madhumat pinvamānāḥ upa tvā tiṣṭhantu puṣkariṇīḥ samantāḥ
translated: May all these streams flow to you, swelling with honey in the world of heaven. May the pools stand around you.

original: imam odanaṃ ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu viṣṭāriṇaṃ lokajitaṃ svargam /
analyzed: imam odanam ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu viṣṭāriṇam loka jitam svargam
translated: I have placed this rice in the Brahmins, the spreader, the conqueror of worlds, the heavenly.

original: sa me mā kṣeṣṭa svadhayā pinvamāno viśvarūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā me astu ////
analyzed: sa me mā kṣeṣṭa svadhayā pinvamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā me astu
translated: May he, swelling with his own nature, be not hostile to me. May the cow of all forms, yielding whatever is desired, be mine.

original: yam odanaṃ prathamajā ṛtasya prajāpatis tapasā brahmaṇe 'pacat /
analyzed: yam odanam prathama jāḥ ṛtasya prajāpatiḥ tapasā brahmaṇe pacat
translated: The rice-gruel which Prajapati cooked for Brahman with austerity, the firstborn of truth,

original: yo lokānāṃ vidhṛtir nābhireṣāt tenaudanenāti tarāṇi mṛtyum ////
analyzed: yaḥ lokānām vidhṛtiḥ na abhireṣāt tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum
translated: Which is the support of the worlds, the navel, by that rice-gruel may I pass over death.

original: yenātaran bhūtakṛto 'ti mṛtyuṃ yam anvavindan tapasā śrameṇa /
analyzed: yena ataran bhūta kṛtaḥ u ti mṛtyum yam anvavindan tapasā śrameṇa
translated: By which the creators of beings passed over death, which they found through austerity and effort,

original: yaṃ papāca brahmaṇe brahma pūrvaṃ tenaudanenāti tarāṇi mṛtyum ////
analyzed: yam papāca brahmaṇe brahma pūrvam tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum
translated: Which Brahman cooked for Brahman in the beginning, by that rice-gruel may I pass over death.

original: yo dādhāra pṛthivīṃ viśvabhojasaṃ yo antarikṣam āpṛṇād rasena /
analyzed: yaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm viśva bhojasam yaḥ antarikṣam āpṛṇāt rasena
translated: By whom the earth, the support of all, was upheld, by whom the atmosphere was filled with sap,

original: yo astabhnād divam ūrdhvo mahimnā tenaudanenāti tarāṇi mṛtyum ////
analyzed: yaḥ astabhnāt divam ūrdhvaḥ mahimnā tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum
translated: By whom the sky was firmly established with its lofty greatness, by that rice-gruel may I pass over death.

original: yasmān māsā nirmitās triṃśadarāḥ saṃvatsaro yasmān nirmito dvādaśāraḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt māsāḥ nirmitāḥ triṃśat arāḥ saṃvatsaraḥ yasmāt nirmitaḥ dvādaśa araḥ
translated: From whom the months, consisting of thirty parts, were created, from whom the year, consisting of twelve parts, was created,

original: ahorātrā yaṃ pariyanto nāpus tenaudanenāti tarāṇi mṛtyum ////
analyzed: ahar rātrāḥ yam pariyantaḥ na āpuḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum
translated: By whom the days and nights, as they pass by, are not exhausted, by that rice-gruel may I pass over death.

original: yaḥ prāṇadaḥ prāṇadavān babhūva yasmai lokā ghṛtavantaḥ kṣaranti /
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇa daḥ babhūva yasmai lokāḥ ghṛtavantaḥ kṣaranti
translated: By whom the giver of life became the possessor of life, for whom the worlds flow with ghee,

original: jyotiṣmatīḥ pradiśo yasya sarvās tenaudanenāti tarāṇi mṛtyum ////
analyzed: jyotiṣmatīḥ pradiśaḥ yasya sarvāḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum
translated: By that rice which has all the quarters for its light, pass over death.

original: yasmāt pakvād amṛtaṃ saṃbabhūva yo gāyatryā adhipatir babhūva /
analyzed: yasmāt pakvāt amṛtam saṃbabhūva yaḥ gāyatryāḥ adhipatiḥ babhūva
translated: From which the cooked, the immortal, sprang, which was the overlord of the Gayatri,

original: yasmin vedā nihitā viśvarūpās tenaudanenāti tarāṇi mṛtyum ////
analyzed: yasmin vedāḥ nihitāḥ viśva rūpāḥ tena odanena ati tarāṇi mṛtyum
translated: In which the Vedas of all forms are laid up, by that rice pass over death.

original: ava bādhe dviṣantaṃ devapīyuṃ sapatnā ye me 'pa te bhavantu /
analyzed: ava bādhe dviṣantam deva pīyum sapatnāḥ ye me pa te bhavantu
translated: I drive away the hater of the gods, the enemy, may they be destroyed for me.

original: brahmaudanaṃ viśvajitaṃ pacāmi śṛṇvantu me śraddadhānasya devāḥ ////
analyzed: brahmaudanam viśva jitam pacāmi śṛṇvantu me śraddadhānasya devāḥ
translated: I cook the Brahman rice, the all-conquering; may the gods listen to me, the faithful one.

original: tānt satyaujāḥ pra dahatv agnir vaiśvānaro vṛṣā /
analyzed: tān satya ojāḥ pra dahatu agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ vṛṣā
translated: Let the true-strong Agni Vaisvânara, the bull,

original: yo no durasyād dipsāc cātho yo no arātiyāt ////
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ durasyāt dipsāt ca atha u yaḥ naḥ arātiyāt
translated: Burn up for me the hater, the greedy, and those who are my enemies.

original: yo no dipsād adipsato dipsato yaś ca dipsati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dipsāt a dipsataḥ dipsataḥ yaḥ ca dipsati
translated: I who hate, and he who hates me, and he who hates him who hates me,

original: vaiśvānarasya daṃṣṭrayor agner api dadhāmi tam ////🔽ya āgare mṛgayante pratikrośe 'māvāsye /
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya daṃṣṭrayoḥ agneḥ api dadhāmi tam  ye āgare mṛgayante pratikrośe māvāsye
translated: I place him in the jaws of Agni Vaisvânara.🔽Those who seek him in the house, in the opposite direction, on the new moon day,

original: kravyādo anyān dipsataḥ sarvāṃs tānt sahasā sahe ////
analyzed: kravya adaḥ anyān dipsataḥ sarvān tān sahasā sahe
translated: The flesh-eaters, the greedy, all of them, I overcome with force.

original: sahe piśācānt sahasaiṣāṃ draviṇaṃ dade /
analyzed: sahe piśācān sahasā eṣām draviṇam dade
translated: I overcome the pisâchas, I give them their wealth.

original: sarvān durasyato hanmi saṃ ma ākūtir ṛdhyatām ////
analyzed: sarvān durasyataḥ hanmi sam me ākūtiḥ ṛdhyatām
translated: I slay all the haters; may my purpose be accomplished.

original: ye devās tena hāsante sūryeṇa mimate javam /
analyzed: ye devāḥ tena ha āsante sūryeṇa mimate javam
translated: The gods who rejoice in that, they vie with the sun in speed.

original: nadīṣu parvateṣu ye saṃ taiḥ paśubhir vide ////
analyzed: nadīṣu parvateṣu ye sam taiḥ paśubhiḥ vide
translated: Those who are in the rivers and mountains, with those cattle I know.

original: tapano asmi piśācānāṃ vyāghro gomatām iva /
analyzed: tapanaḥ asmi piśācānām vyāghraḥ gomatām iva
translated: I am the tormentor of the Piśācas, like a tiger of those with cattle.

original: śvānaḥ siṃham iva dṛṣṭvā te na vindante nyañcanam ////
analyzed: śvānaḥ siṃham iva dṛṣṭvā te na vindante nyañcanam
translated: Like dogs seeing a lion, they do not find their drinking place.

original: na piśācaiḥ saṃ śaknomi na stenaiḥ na vanargubhiḥ /
analyzed: na piśācaiḥ sam śaknomi na stenaiḥ na vanargubhiḥ
translated: I cannot be harmed by Piśācas, thieves, or forest-robbers.

original: piśācās tasmān naśyanti yam ahaṃ grāmam āviśe ////
analyzed: piśācāḥ tasmāt naśyanti yam aham grāmam āviśe
translated: From that village which I enter, the Piśācas perish.

original: yaṃ grāmam āviśata idam ugraṃ saho mama /
analyzed: yam grāmam āviśataḥ idam ugram sahaḥ mama
translated: To that village which I enter, this fierce power of mine.

original: piśācās tasmān naśyanti na pāpam upa jānate ////🔽ye mā krodhayanti lapitā hastinaṃ maśakā iva /
analyzed: piśācāḥ tasmāt naśyanti na pāpam upa jānate  ye mā krodhayanti lapitāḥ hastinam maśakāḥ iva
translated: From that, the Piśācas perish, they do not know any evil.🔽Those who anger me with their chatter, like gnats a bull.

original: tān ahaṃ manye durhitān jane alpaśayūn iva ////
analyzed: tān aham manye durhitān jane alpa śayūn iva
translated: I think of them as ill-wishers, like those with little wealth among the people.

original: abhi taṃ nirṛtir dhattām aśvam iva aśvābhidhānyā /
analyzed: abhi tam nirṛtiḥ dhattām aśvam iva aśva abhidhānyā
translated: May Nirṛti give him up, like a horse with a horse-whip.

original: malvo yo mahyaṃ krudhyati sa u pāśān na mucyate ////
analyzed: malvaḥ yaḥ mahyam krudhyati saḥ u pāśāt na mucyate
translated: The one who is angry with me, Malva, he is not released from the snares.

original: tvayā pūrvam atharvāṇo jaghnū rakṣāṃsy oṣadhe /
analyzed: tvayā pūrvam atharvāṇaḥ jaghnuḥ rakṣāṃsi oṣadhe
translated: By you, O plant, the Atharvans slew the Rākṣasas in the beginning.

original: tvayā jaghāna kaśyapas tvayā kaṇvo agastyaḥ ////
analyzed: tvayā jaghāna kaśyapaḥ tvayā kaṇvaḥ agastyaḥ
translated: By you Kaśyapa slew, by you Kaṇva, by you Agastya.

original: tvayā vayam apsaraso gandharvāṃs cātayāmahe /
analyzed: tvayā vayam apsarasaḥ gandharvān cātayāmahe
translated: With you we drive away the Apsarases and the Gandharvas.

original: ajaśṛṅgy aja rakṣaḥ sarvān gandhena nāśaya ////
analyzed: ajaśṛṅgi aja rakṣaḥ sarvān gandhena nāśaya
translated: O Ajashringi, drive away the Raksases, destroy all with your smell.

original: nadīṃ yantv apsaraso 'pāṃ tāram avaśvasam /
analyzed: nadīm yantu apsarasaḥ pām tāram avaśvasam
translated: Let the Apsarases go to the river, to the watery Tara, to the swift one.

original: gulgulūḥ pīlā nalady aukṣagandhiḥ pramandanī /
translated: The fragrant Guggula, the fragrant Nala, the fragrant Ousha, the fragrant Pramardini.

original: tat paretāpsarasaḥ pratibuddhā abhūtana ////
analyzed: tat parā ita apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana
translated: There, O Apsarases, return, be awakened, be not deceived.

original: yatrāśvatthā nyagrodhā mahāvṛkṣāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ /
analyzed: yatra aśvatthāḥ nyagrodhāḥ mahā vṛkṣāḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ
translated: Where there are the fig trees, the Nyagrodhas, the great trees with crests,

original: tat paretāpsarasaḥ pratibuddhā abhūtana ////
analyzed: tat parā ita apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana
translated: There, O Apsarases, return, be awakened, be not deceived.

original: yatra vaḥ preṅkhā haritā arjunā uta yatrāghātāḥ karkaryaḥ saṃvadanti /
analyzed: yatra vaḥ preṅkhāḥ haritāḥ arjunāḥ uta yatra āghātāḥ karkaryaḥ saṃvadanti
translated: Where your green and yellow creepers are, and where the Aghātas and Karkaris quarrel,

original: tat paretāpsarasaḥ pratibuddhā abhūtana ////
analyzed: tat parā ita apsarasaḥ pratibuddhāḥ abhūtana
translated: There, O Apsarases, return, be awakened, be not deceived.

original: eyam agann oṣadhīnāṃ vīrudhām vīryāvatī /
analyzed: ā iyam agan oṣadhīnām vīrudhām vīryāvatī
translated: This has come, the most powerful of the plants and herbs.

original: ajaśṛṅgy arāṭakī tīkṣṇaśṛṅgī vyṛṣatu ////
analyzed: aja śṛṅgī arāṭakī tīkṣṇa śṛṅgī vyṛṣatu
translated: O Ajashringi, the thornless one, with sharp thorns, drive away.

original: ānṛtyataḥ śikhaṇḍino gandharvasyāpsarāpateḥ /
analyzed: ānṛtyataḥ śikhaṇḍinaḥ gandharvasya apsarā pateḥ
translated: Of the dancing Shikhandi, the Gandharva, the lord of the Apsarases,

original: bhinadmi muṣkāv api yāmi śepaḥ ////
analyzed: bhinadmi muṣkau api yāmi śepaḥ
translated: I break his testicles and crush his penis.

original: bhīmā indrasya hetayaḥ śataṃ ṛṣṭīr ayasmayīḥ /
analyzed: bhīmāḥ indrasya hetayaḥ śatam ṛṣṭīḥ ayasmayīḥ
translated: The terrible weapons of Indra, the hundred iron spears,

original: tābhir haviradān gandharvān avakādān vyṛṣatu ////
analyzed: tābhiḥ haviḥ adān gandharvān avaka ādān vyṛṣatu
translated: With them drive away the Gandharvas who give oblations, the Avakādins.

original: bhīmā indrasya hetayaḥ śataṃ ṛṣṭīr hiraṇyayīḥ /
analyzed: bhīmāḥ indrasya hetayaḥ śatam ṛṣṭīḥ hiraṇyayīḥ
translated: The weapons of Indra are terrible, a hundred golden spears.

original: tābhir haviradān gandharvān avakādān vyṛṣatu ////
analyzed: tābhiḥ haviḥ adān gandharvān avaka ādān vyṛṣatu
translated: With them, let him drive away the Gandharvas who give oblations, the Avakādins, and the Vṛṣatas.

original: avakādān abhiśocān apsu jyotaya māmakān /
analyzed: avaka ādān abhiśocān apsu jyotaya māmakān
translated: The Avakādins, the Abhisohas, my lights in the waters,

original: piśācānt sarvān oṣadhe pra mṛṇīhi sahasva ca ////
analyzed: piśācān sarvān oṣadhe pra mṛṇīhi sahasva ca
translated: All the Piśācas, O plant, crush and overcome.

original: śvevaikaḥ kapir ivaikaḥ kumāraḥ sarvakeśakaḥ /
analyzed: śvā iva ekaḥ kapiḥ iva ekaḥ kumāraḥ sarva keśakaḥ
translated: Like a dog alone, like a monkey alone, a youth with all his hair,

original: priyo dṛśa iva bhūtvā gandharvaḥ sacate striyas /
analyzed: priyaḥ dṛśaḥ iva bhūtvā gandharvaḥ sacate striyaḥ
translated: Having become like a beloved sight, a Gandharva associates with women.

original: tam ito nāśayāmasi brahmaṇā vīryāvatā ////
analyzed: tam itas nāśayāmasi brahmaṇā vīryāvatā
translated: We drive him away from here with powerful prayer.

original: jāyā id vo apsaraso gandharvāḥ patayo yuyam /
analyzed: jāyāḥ id vaḥ apsarasaḥ gandharvāḥ patayaḥ yuyam
translated: Your wives are the Apsarases, O Gandharvas, your husbands are you.

original: apa dhāvatāmartyā martyān mā sacadhvam ////
analyzed: apa dhāvata amartyāḥ martyān mā sacadhvam
translated: Run away from the mortals, do not associate with mortals.

original: udbhindatīṃ saṃjayantīm apsarāṃ sādhudevinīm /
analyzed: udbhindatīm saṃjayantīm apsarām sādhu devinīm
translated: The Apsaras who bursts forth, who delights, who is virtuous,

original: glahe kṛtāni kṛṇvānām apsarāṃ tām iha huve ////
analyzed: glahe kṛtāni kṛṇvānām apsarām tām iha huve
translated: Who accomplishes the deeds done in the gambling match, I invoke that Apsaras here.

original: vicinvatīm ākirantīm apsarāṃ sādhudevinīm /
analyzed: vicinvatīm ākirantīm apsarām sādhu devinīm
translated: The Apsaras who searches out, who scatters, who is virtuous,

original: glahe kṛtāni gṛhṇānām apsarāṃ tām iha huve ////
analyzed: glahe kṛtāni gṛhṇānām apsarām tām iha huve
translated: Who takes the deeds done in the gambling match, I invoke that Apsaras here.

original: yāyaiḥ parinṛtyaty ādadānā kṛtaṃ glahāt /
analyzed: yā ayaiḥ parinṛtyati ādadānā kṛtam glahāt
translated: By whom she dances around, taking the stake from the gambling match,

original: sā naḥ kṛtāni sīṣatī prahām āpnotu māyayā /
analyzed: sā naḥ kṛtāni sīṣatī prahām āpnotu māyayā
translated: May she, desiring our deeds, attain the stake through her magic power.

original: sā naḥ payasvaty aitu mā no jaiṣur idaṃ dhanam ////
analyzed: sā naḥ payasvatī aitu mā naḥ jaiṣuḥ idam dhanam
translated: May it come to us with milk; let not this wealth of ours be carried off by others.

original: yā akṣeṣu pramodante śucaṃ krodhaṃ ca bibhratī /
analyzed: yāḥ akṣeṣu pramodante śucam krodham ca bibhratī
translated: Those who rejoice in the dice, bearing sorrow and anger,

original: ānandinīṃ pramodinīm apsarāṃ tām iha huve ////
analyzed: ānandinīm pramodinīm apsarām tām iha huve
translated: I invoke here that Apsara, the gladdener and the delighter.

original: sūryasya raśmīn anu yāḥ sañcaranti marīcīr vā yā anusañcaranti /
analyzed: sūryasya raśmīn anu yāḥ sañcaranti marīcīḥ vā yāḥ anusañcaranti
translated: Those who move along the rays of the sun, or along the lightnings,

original: yāsām ṛṣabho dūrato vājinīvānt sadyaḥ sarvān lokān paryeti rakṣan /
analyzed: yāsām ṛṣabhaḥ dūratas vājinīvān sadyas sarvān lokān paryeti rakṣan
translated: Whose bull, powerful, moves quickly, protecting all the worlds from afar,

original: sa na aitu homam imaṃ jusāṇo 'ntarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvān ////
analyzed: sa naḥ aitu homam imam jusāṇaḥ ntarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvān
translated: May he come to enjoy this oblation, the powerful one, together with the atmosphere.

original: antarikṣena saha vājinīvan karkīṃ vatsām iha rakṣa vājin /
analyzed: antarikṣena saha vājinīvan karkīm vatsām iha rakṣa vājin
translated: Together with the atmosphere, O powerful one, protect here the cow Karki.

original: ime te stokā bahulā ehy arvāṅ iyaṃ te karkīha te mano 'stu ////
analyzed: ime te stokāḥ bahulāḥ ehi arvāṅ iyam te karkī iha te mano stu
translated: Here are your many drops; come hitherward. Here be your mind with Karki.

original: antarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvan karkīṃ vatsām iha rakṣa vājin /
analyzed: antarikṣeṇa saha vājinīvan karkīm vatsām iha rakṣa vājin
translated: Together with the atmosphere, O powerful one, protect here the cow Karki.

original: ayaṃ ghāso ayaṃ vraja iha vatsāṃ ni badhnīmaḥ /
analyzed: ayam ghāsaḥ ayam vrajaḥ iha vatsām ni badhnīmaḥ
translated: Here is your fodder, here is your pen; here we tie your calf.

original: yathānāma va īśmahe svāhā ////
analyzed: yathānāma vaḥ īśmahe svāhā
translated: By name we possess you. Svâhâ!

original: pṛthivyām agnaye sam anamant sa ārdhnot /
analyzed: pṛthivyām agnaye sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot
translated: On the earth they bowed to Agni; he prospered.

original: yathā pṛthivyām agnaye samanamann evā mahyaṃ saṃnamaḥ saṃ namantu ////🔽pṛthivī dhenus tasyā agnir vatsaḥ /
analyzed: yathā pṛthivyām agnaye samanaman evā mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu  pṛthivī dhenuḥ tasyāḥ agniḥ vatsaḥ
translated: As they bowed to Agni in the earth, so may they bow to me.🔽The earth is the cow, its calf is Agni.

original: sā me 'gninā vatseneṣam ūrjaṃ kāmaṃ duhām /
analyzed: sā me gninā vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām
translated: May it yield me milk, strength, and the fulfilment of my desire, through its calf Agni.

original: āyuḥ prathamaṃ prajāṃ poṣaṃ rayiṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā
translated: First life, then offspring, nourishment, and wealth, hail!

original: antarikṣe vāyave sam anamant sa ārdhnot /
analyzed: antarikṣe vāyave sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot
translated: They bowed to Vayu in the atmosphere, he prospered.

original: yathāntarikṣe vāyave samanamann evā mahyaṃ saṃnamaḥ saṃ namantu ////
analyzed: yathā antarikṣe vāyave samanaman evā mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu
translated: As they bowed to Vayu in the atmosphere, so may they bow to me.

original: antarikṣaṃ dhenus tasyā vatsaḥ /🔽sā me vāyunā vatseneṣam ūrjaṃ kāmaṃ duhām /
analyzed: antarikṣam dhenuḥ tasyāḥ vatsaḥ  sā me vāyunā vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām
translated: The atmosphere is the cow, its calf is Vayu.🔽May it yield me milk, strength, and the fulfilment of my desire, through its calf Vayu.

original: āyuḥ prathamaṃ prajāṃ poṣaṃ rayiṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā
translated: First life, then offspring, nourishment, and wealth, hail!

original: divyādityāya sam anamant sa ārdhnot /
analyzed: divi ādityāya sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot
translated: They bowed to Aditya in the sky, he prospered.

original: yathā divyādityāya samanamann evā mahyaṃ saṃnamaḥ saṃ namantu ////
analyzed: yathā divi ādityāya samanaman evā mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu
translated: As they bowed to Aditya in the sky, so may they bow to me.

original: dyaur dhenus tasyā ādityo vatsaḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ dhenuḥ tasyāḥ ādityaḥ vatsaḥ
translated: The sky is the cow, its calf is Aditya.

original: sā ma ādityena vatseneṣam ūrjaṃ kāmaṃ duhām /
analyzed: sā me ādityena vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām
translated: May it yield me milk, strength, and the fulfilment of my desire, through its calf Aditya.

original: āyuḥ prathamaṃ prajāṃ poṣaṃ rayiṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: āyuḥ prathamam prajām poṣam rayim svāhā
translated: First life, then offspring, nourishment, and wealth, hail!

original: dikṣu candrāya sam anamant sa ārdhnot /
analyzed: dikṣu candrāya sam anaman saḥ ārdhnot
translated: They bowed to Chandra in the directions, he prospered.

original: yathā dikṣu candrāya samanamann evā mahyaṃ saṃnamaḥ saṃ namantu ////
analyzed: yathā dikṣu candrāya samanaman evā mahyam saṃnamaḥ sam namantu
translated: As the quarters bowed to the moon, so let them bow to me.

original: diśo dhenavas tāsāṃ candro vatsaḥ /
analyzed: diśaḥ dhenavaḥ tāsām candraḥ vatsaḥ
translated: The quarters are the cows, and the moon is their calf.

original: tā me candreṇa vatseneṣam ūrjaṃ kāmaṃ duhām āyuḥ prathamaṃ prajāṃ posaṃ rayiṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: tāḥ me candreṇa vatsena iṣam ūrjam kāmam duhām āyuḥ prathamam prajām posam rayim svāhā
translated: May the moon, as a calf, milk for me from them strength, desire, life first, offspring, nourishing wealth. Svâhâ!

original: agnāv agniś carati praviṣṭa ṛṣīṇām putro abhiśastipā u /
analyzed: agnau agniḥ carati praviṣṭaḥ ṛṣīṇām putraḥ abhiśasti pāḥ u
translated: In Agni moves the Agni, the son of the Rishis, the protector from the curse.

original: namaskāreṇa namasā te juhomi mā devānāṃ mithuyā karma bhāgam ////
analyzed: namaskāreṇa namasā te juhomi mā devānām mithuyā karma bhāgam
translated: With adoration, with homage I offer to thee: let me not share in the sin of the gods.

original: hṛdā pūtam manasā jātavedo viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān /
analyzed: hṛdā pūtam manasā jātavedaḥ viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān
translated: Purified by the heart, O all-knower, by the mind, knowing all the ordinances, O god,

original: saptāsyāni tava jātavedas tebhyo juhomi sa juṣasva havyam ////
analyzed: sapta āsyāni tava jātavedaḥ tebhyaḥ juhomi sa juṣasva havyam
translated: Seven are thy exhalters, O all-knower: to them I offer; accept the offering.

original: ye purastāj juhvati jātavedaḥ prācyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: ye purastāt juhvati jātavedaḥ prācyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer in the east, O all-knower, who threaten us from the eastern quarter,

original: agnim ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: agnim ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: Having gone to Agni, may they be afflicted and turned away. With the counter-missile I strike them back.

original: ye dakṣiṇato juhvati jātavedo dakṣiṇāyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: ye dakṣiṇatas juhvati jātavedaḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer from the south, O all-knower, who threaten us from the southern quarter,

original: yamaṃ ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enā pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: yamam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enā pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: Having gone to Yama, may they be afflicted and turned away. With the counter-missile I strike them back.

original: ye paścāj juhvati jātavedaḥ pratīcyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: ye paścāt juhvati jātavedaḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer from the west, O all-knower, who threaten us from the western quarter,

original: varuṇam ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: varuṇam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: Having gone to Varuna, may they be afflicted and turned away. I strike them back with the counter-charm.

original: ya uttarato juhvati jātaveda udīcyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: ye uttaratas juhvati jātavedaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer from the north, O all-knower, who threaten us from the northern quarter,

original: somam ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: somam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: Having gone to Soma, may they be afflicted and turned away. I strike them back with the counter-charm.

original: ye 'dhastāj juhvati jātaveda udīcyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: ye dhastāt juhvati jātavedaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer from below, O all-knower, who threaten us from the lower quarter,

original: bhūmim ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: bhūmim ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: Having gone to the earth, may they be afflicted and turned away. I strike them back with the counter-charm.

original: ye 'ntarikṣāj juhvati jātavedo vyadhvāyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: ye ntarikṣāt juhvati jātavedaḥ vyadhvāyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer from the atmosphere, O all-knower, who threaten us from the intermediate quarters,

original: vāyum ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////🔽ya upariṣṭāj juhvati jātaveda ūrdhvāyā diśo 'bhidāsanty asmān /
analyzed: vāyum ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi  ye upariṣṭāt juhvati jātavedaḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Having gone to Vayu, may they be afflicted and turned away. I strike them back with the counter-charm.🔽Those who offer from above, O all-knower, who threaten us from the upper quarter,

original: sūryam ṛtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: sūryam ṛtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: Having gone to Surya, may they be afflicted and turned away. I strike them back with the counter-charm.

original: ye diśām antardeśebhyo juhvati jātavedaḥ sarvābhyo digbhyo 'bhidāsanti asmān /
analyzed: ye diśām antardeśebhyaḥ juhvati jātavedaḥ sarvābhyaḥ digbhyaḥ bhidāsanti asmān
translated: Those who offer to the quarters from the intermediate directions, they threaten us from all the quarters.

original: brahma rtvā te parāñco vyathantāṃ pratyag enān pratisareṇa hanmi ////
analyzed: brahma rtvā te parāñcaḥ vyathantām pratyak enān pratisareṇa hanmi
translated: May they, having turned away from the Brahman, be destroyed. I strike them back with the counter-strike.

original: ṛdhaṅmantro yoniṃ ya ābabhūvāmṛtāsur vardhamānaḥ sujanmā /
analyzed: ṛdhak mantraḥ yonim yaḥ ābabhūva amṛta asuḥ vardhamānaḥ su janmā
translated: The successful mantra, having entered the womb, the immortal, growing, well-born,

original: adabdhāsur bhrājamāno 'heva trito dhartā dādhāra trīṇi ////
analyzed: adabdha asuḥ bhrājamānaḥ ha iva tritaḥ dhartā dādhāra trīṇi
translated: The undeceiving immortal, shining like a snake, Trita, the supporter, supports the three.

original: ā yo dharmāṇi prathamaḥ sasāda tato vapūṃṣi kṛṇuṣe purūṇi /
analyzed: ā yaḥ dharmāṇi prathamaḥ sasāda tatas vapūṃṣi kṛṇuṣe purūṇi
translated: He who first sat down in the laws, from him you fashion many forms.

original: dhāsyur yoniṃ prathama ā viveśā yo vācam anuditāṃ ciketa ////
analyzed: dhāsyuḥ yonim prathamaḥ ā viveśa ā yaḥ vācam an uditām ciketa
translated: The supporter first entered the womb, he who understood the unspoken word.

original: yas te śokāya tanvaṃ rireca kṣarad dhiraṇyaṃ śucayo 'nu svāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te śokāya tanvam rireca kṣarat hiraṇyam śucayaḥ nu svāḥ
translated: He who stretched out your body for the sake of sorrow, flowing gold, the pure ones according to their own (nature),

original: atrā dadhete amṛtāni nāmāsme vastrāṇi viśa erayantām ////
analyzed: atra dadhete amṛtāni nāma asme vastrāṇi viśaḥ erayantām
translated: Here they placed the immortal names. May the garments send forth for us.

original: pra yad ete prataraṃ pūrvyaṃ guḥ sadaḥsada ātiṣṭhanto ajuryam /
analyzed: pra yat ete prataram pūrvyam guḥ sadaḥsadaḥ ātiṣṭhantaḥ ajuryam
translated: When these two, approaching the ancient ford, stand in the seat of the imperishable,

original: kaviḥ śuṣasya mātarā rihāṇe jāmyai dhuryaṃ patim erayethām ////
analyzed: kaviḥ śuṣasya mātarā rihāṇe jāmyai dhuryam patim erayethām
translated: The wise one, the mother of Susha, the swift one, you should send the husband to the sister.

original: tad ū ṣu te mahat pṛthujman namaḥ kaviḥ kāvyenā kṛṇomi /
analyzed: tat ū su te mahat pṛthujman namaḥ kaviḥ kāvyena kṛṇomi
translated: That, indeed, to you, O great one of wide path, I offer reverence with the hymn, the wise one with the poem.

original: yat samyañcāv abhiyantāv abhi kṣām atrā mahī rodhacakre vāvṛdhete ////
analyzed: yat samyañcau abhiyantau abhi kṣām atrā mahī rodha cakre vāvṛdhete
translated: When they, the two upright ones, have come together, they have grown great on this earth, on the wheel of the abode.

original: sapta maryādāḥ kavayas tatakṣus tāsām id ekām abhy aṃhuro gāt /
analyzed: sapta maryādāḥ kavayaḥ tatakṣuḥ tāsām id ekām abhī aṃhuraḥ gāt
translated: The sages have fashioned seven boundaries; one of them the swift one has passed over.

original: āyor ha skambha upamasya nīḍe pathāṃ visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau ////
analyzed: āyoḥ ha skambhaḥ upamasya nīḍe pathām visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau
translated: In the lap of the supporting pillar of the firm one, he has stood in the distribution of paths, in the supports.

original: utāmṛtāsur vrata emi kṛnvann asur ātmā tanvas tat sumadguḥ /
analyzed: uta amṛta asuḥ vrate emi kṛnvan asuḥ ātmā tanvaḥ tat sumadguḥ
translated: And as an immortal, I go, performing the vow, the immortal soul, the body, that is well-formed.

original: uta vā śakro ratnaṃ dadhāty ūrjayā vā yat sacate havirdāḥ ////
analyzed: uta vā śakraḥ ratnam dadhāti ūrjayā vā yat sacate haviḥ dāḥ
translated: Or perhaps Shakra bestows the treasure, with which he is associated through strength, the giver of oblations.

original: uta putraḥ pitaraṃ kṣatram īḍe jyeṣṭhaṃ maryādam ahvayant svastaye /
analyzed: uta putraḥ pitaram kṣatram īḍe jyeṣṭham maryādam ahvayan svastaye
translated: And I praise the son, the lord, the eldest, the boundary, calling him for well-being.

original: darśan nu tā varuṇa yās te viṣṭhā āvarvratataḥ kṛṇavo vapūṃṣi ////
analyzed: darśan nu tāḥ varuṇa yāḥ te viṣṭhāḥ āvarvratataḥ kṛṇavaḥ vapūṃṣi
translated: Now, O Varuna, we will make our bodies manifest to you, your who are in the farthest distance.

original: ardham ardhena payasā pṛṇakṣy ardhena śuṣma vardhase amura /🔽aviṃ vṛdhāma śagmiyaṃ sakhāyaṃ varuṇaṃ putram adityā iṣiram /
analyzed: ardham ardhena payasā pṛṇakṣi ardhena śuṣma vardhase amura  avim vṛdhāma śagmiyam sakhāyam varuṇam putram adityāḥ iṣiram
translated: You will fill half with half of the milk; with half you increase your strength, O unvanquished one.🔽We will increase the auspicious friend, the son of Aditi, the swift one, Varuna.

original: kaviśastāny asmai vapūṃṣy avocāma rodasī satyavācā ////
analyzed: kavi śastāni asmai vapūṃṣi avocāma rodasī satya vācā
translated: We have proclaimed to him, to these two worlds, his forms, which are praised by the wise, with true speech.

original: tad id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yato yajña ugras tveṣanṛmṇaḥ /
analyzed: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas yajñaḥ ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ
translated: That indeed is the highest in the worlds, from which the fierce, powerful sacrifice has arisen.

original: sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yad enaṃ madanti viśva ūmāḥ ////🔽vavṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojāḥ śatrur dāsāya bhiyasaṃ dadhāti /
analyzed: sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yat enam madanti viśve ūmāḥ  vavṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasam dadhāti
translated: As soon as he is born he conquers the foes, when all the kindly ones rejoice in him.🔽Growing in strength, with abundant vigour, he causes fear to the foe of the Dāsa.

original: avyanac ca vyanac ca sasni saṃ te navanta prabhṛtā madeṣu ////
analyzed: a vyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāḥ madeṣu
translated: He has roared and he has roared again, O Swift One. They praise thee at the feasts when thou art impetuous.

original: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvir yad ete trir bhavanty ūmāḥ /
analyzed: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ
translated: In thee they place the abundant thought, when these, twice or thrice, become kindly.

original: svadoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛjā sam adaḥ su madhu madhunābhi yodhīḥ ////
analyzed: svadoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja sam adaḥ su madhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ
translated: With the sweet, make the sweet to be sweeter: with the sweet, win thou the prize in the sweet.

original: yadi cin nu tvā dhanā jayantaṃ raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ /
analyzed: yadi cit nu tvā dhanā jayantam raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ
translated: If the sages at all rejoice in thee, O Victorious One, in every battle,

original: ojīyaḥ śuṣmint sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ ////
analyzed: ojīyaḥ śuṣmin sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ
translated: Make thyself stronger, more vigorous, more firm: let not the evil-living, the cheerless ones, overcome thee.

original: tvayā vayaṃ śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyanto yudhenyāni bhūri /
analyzed: tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ yudhenyāni bhūri
translated: Through thee we will shine in battles, beholding the many warlike deeds.

original: codayāmi ta āyudhā vacobhiḥ saṃ te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi ////🔽ni tad dadhiṣe 'vare pare ca yasminn āvithāvasā duroṇe /
analyzed: codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi  ni tat dadhiṣe vare pare ca yasmin āvitha avasā duroṇe
translated: I urge thy weapons with my words: I sharpen thy limbs with prayer.🔽Thou hast established that in the lower and the higher abode, in which thou hast placed thy help.

original: ā sthāpayata mātaraṃ jigatnum ata invata karvarāṇi bhūri ////
analyzed: ā sthāpayata mātaram jigatnum atas invata karvarāṇi bhūri
translated: Establish the mother who moves not, and urge the many strong ones.

original: stuṣva varṣman puruvartmānaṃ sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām /
analyzed: stuṣva varṣman puru vartmānam sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām
translated: Praise the mighty one, the lord of many, the most impetuous, the most victorious of the victorious.

original: ā darśati śavasā bhūryojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānaṃ pṛthivyāḥ ////
analyzed: ā darśati śavasā bhūri ojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ
translated: He shows himself with power, born for greatness, he conquers the measure of the earth.

original: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ kṛṇavad indrāya śūṣam agriyaḥ svarṣāḥ /
analyzed: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ kṛṇavat indrāya śūṣam agriyaḥ svarṣāḥ
translated: May this Brahman, the eldest, self-luminous, make strength for Indra, the son of great Dyaus.

original: maho gotrasya kṣayati svarājā turaś cid viśvam arṇavat tapasvān ////
analyzed: mahaḥ gotrasya kṣayati sva rājā turaḥ cit viśvam arṇavat tapasvān
translated: He rules over the great family's abode, the swift one, all-encompassing, the scorching one.

original: evā mahān bṛhaddivo atharvāvocat svāṃ tanvam indram eva /
analyzed: eva mahān bṛhaddivaḥ atharvā avocat svām tanvam indram eva
translated: Thus the great one, the son of great Dyaus, Atharvan, spoke to his own body, to Indra himself.

original: svasārau mātaribhvarī aripre hinvanti caine śavasā vardhayanti ca ////
analyzed: svasārau mātaribhvarī aripre hinvanti ca ene śavasā vardhayanti ca
translated: His two sisters, the great mothers, the destroyers of enemies, impel him and make him grow with power.

original: mamāgne varco vihaveṣv astu vayaṃ tvendhānās tanvam puṣema /
analyzed: mama agne varcaḥ vihaveṣu astu vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema
translated: May my splendor be in contests, O Agni. We, kindling you, may nourish our bodies.

original: mahyaṃ namantāṃ pradiśaś catasras tvayādhyakṣeṇa pṛtanā jayema ////
analyzed: mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ tvayā adhyakṣeṇa pṛtanāḥ jayema
translated: May the four quarters bow down to me. With you as our leader, may we conquer in battle.

original: agne manyuṃ pratinudan pareṣāṃ tvaṃ no gopāḥ pari pāhi viśvataḥ /
analyzed: agne manyum pratinudan pareṣām tvam naḥ gopāḥ pari pāhi viśvatas
translated: O Agni, repelling the anger of others, protect us from all sides as our guardian.

original: apāñco yantu nivatā durasyavo 'maiṣāṃ cittaṃ prabudhāṃ vi neśat ////
analyzed: apāñcaḥ yantu nivatā durasyavaḥ mā eṣām cittam prabudhām vi neśat
translated: May their evil designs, hard to overcome, be turned away. May he confuse the mind of those who are awake.

original: mama devā vihave santu sarva indravanto maruto viṣṇur agniḥ /
analyzed: mama devāḥ vihave santu sarve indravantaḥ marutaḥ viṣṇuḥ agniḥ
translated: May all the Gods be on my side in the contest, the Maruts with Indra, Vishnu, and Agni.

original: mamāntarikṣam urulokam astu mahyaṃ vātaḥ pavatāṃ kāmāyāsmai ////
analyzed: mama antarikṣam uru lokam astu mahyam vātaḥ pavatām kāmāya asmai
translated: May the wide world of the atmosphere be mine, and the wind blow for me to my desire.

original: mahyaṃ yajantāṃ mama yānīṣṭākūtiḥ satyā manaso me astu /
analyzed: mahyam yajantām mama yāni iṣṭā ākūtiḥ satyā manasaḥ me astu
translated: Let them worship me, let those things be dear to me which I desire. Let my intention be true, let my mind be true.

original: eno mā ni gāṃ katamac canāhaṃ viśve devā abhi rakṣantu meha ////
analyzed: enaḥ mā ni gām katamat cana aham viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu mā iha
translated: Let no sin whatever be laid to my charge. Let all the Gods here protect me.

original: mayi devā draviṇam ā yajantāṃ mayi āśīr astu mayi devahūtiḥ /
analyzed: mayi devāḥ draviṇam ā yajantām mayi āśīḥ astu mayi deva hūtiḥ
translated: Let the Gods bestow wealth on me. Let the blessing be on me. Let the invocation of the Gods be on me.

original: daivāḥ hotāraḥ saniṣan na etad ariṣṭāḥ syāma tanvā suvīrāḥ ////
analyzed: daivāḥ hotāraḥ saniṣan naḥ etat ariṣṭāḥ syāma tanvā su vīrāḥ
translated: O ye divine Hotars, sit ye down here. Let us be free from misfortune, with our bodies and with brave sons.

original: daivīḥ ṣaḍ urvīr uru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsa iha mādayadhvam /
analyzed: daivīḥ ṣaḍ urvīḥ uru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsaḥ iha mādayadhvam
translated: O ye three divine wide ones, grant us wide room. O all ye Gods, rejoice ye here.

original: mā no vidad abhibhā mo aśastir mā no vidad vṛjinā dveṣyā yā ////
analyzed: mā naḥ vidat abhibhā mā u aśastiḥ mā naḥ vidat vṛjinā dveṣyā yā
translated: Let no slander, no evil, no reproach find us. Let no calumny, no hateful enmity find us.

original: tisro devīr mahi naḥ śarma yachata prajāyai nas tanve yac ca puṣṭam /
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ mahi naḥ śarma yacchata prajāyai naḥ tanve yat ca puṣṭam
translated: O ye three divine ones, grant us great protection, for our offspring, for our bodies, and for our increase.

original: mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhir mā radhāma dviṣate soma rājan ////
analyzed: mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhiḥ mā radhāma dviṣate soma rājan
translated: Let us not be deprived of our offspring, nor of our bodies. Let us not fall into the power of the foe, O king Soma.

original: uruvyacā no mahiṣaḥ śarma yachatv asmin have puruhūtaḥ purukṣu /
analyzed: uru vyacāḥ naḥ mahiṣaḥ śarma yacchatu asmin have puru hūtaḥ purukṣu
translated: Let the mighty one, of wide dominion, grant us protection, invoked by many, rich in food, in this invocation.

original: sa naḥ prajāyai haryaśva mṛḍendra mā no rīriṣo mā parā dāḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ prajāyai hari aśva mṛḍa indra mā naḥ rīriṣaḥ mā parā dāḥ
translated: For our offspring, O thou of Bay steeds, be gracious, O Indra; harm us not, give us not up to reproach.

original: dhātā vidhātā bhuvanasya yas patir devaḥ savitābhimātiṣāhaḥ /
analyzed: dhātā vidhātā bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ devaḥ savitā abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: The Ordainer, the Disposer, the Lord of the world, the God Savitar, the conqueror of hostility,

original: ādityā rudrā aśvinobhā devāḥ pāntu yajamānaṃ nirṛthāt ////
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ aśvinā ubhā devāḥ pāntu yajamānam nirṛthāt
