translated: The Adityas, the Rudras, the two Asvins, may the Gods protect the sacrificer from misfortune.

original: ye naḥ sapatnā apa te bhavantv indrāgnibhyām ava bādhāmaha enān /
analyzed: ye naḥ sapatnāḥ apa te bhavantu indra agnibhyām ava bādhāmahe enān
translated: Those who are our enemies, may they be subdued; with Indra and Agni we crush them down.

original: ādityā rudrā uparispṛśo no ugraṃ cettāram adhirājam akrata ////
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ uparispṛśaḥ naḥ ugram cettāram adhirājam akrata
translated: The Adityas, the Rudras, the high-reaching ones, have made him a mighty protector, a supreme king.

original: arvāñcam indram amuto havāmahe yo gojid dhanajid aśvajid yaḥ /
analyzed: arvāñcam indram amutas havāmahe yaḥ go jit dhana jit aśva jit yaḥ
translated: From yonder world we invoke hitherward Indra, who wins kine, who wins wealth, who wins horses.

original: imaṃ no yajñaṃ vihave śṛṇotv asmākam abhūr haryaśva medī ////
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam vihave śṛṇotu asmākam abhūḥ hari aśva medī
translated: May he listen to this our sacrifice in the assembly; he has become, O thou of Bay steeds, a benefactor to us.

original: yo giriṣv ajāyathā vīrudhāṃ balavattamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ giriṣu ajāyathāḥ vīrudhām balavattamaḥ
translated: He who was born among the mountains, the most powerful of plants,

original: kuṣṭhehi takmanāśana takmānaṃ nāśayann itaḥ ////
analyzed: kuṣṭhehi takma nāśana takmānam nāśayan itas
translated: O Kushtha, the destroyer of consumption, drive away consumption from here.

original: suparṇasuvane girau jātaṃ himavatas pari /
analyzed: suparṇa suvane girau jātam himavataḥ pari
translated: Born on the mountain Suparna-suvana, on the borders of the Himalayas,

original: dhanair abhi śrutvā yanti vidur hi takmanāśanam ////
analyzed: dhanaiḥ abhi śrutvā yanti viduḥ hi takma nāśanam
translated: The rich ones go, having heard of it, for they know the destroyer of consumption.

original: aśvattho devasadanas tṛtīyasyām ito divi /
analyzed: aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi
translated: The holy fig tree is the abode of the gods, in the third heaven from here,

original: tatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇaṃ devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata ////
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata
translated: There the gods obtained the healing of immortality, the healing of Kushtha.

original: hiraṇyayī naur acarad dhiraṇyabandhanā divi /
analyzed: hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi
translated: The golden ship sailed, bound with gold in the sky.

original: tatrāmṛtasya puṣpaṃ devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata ////
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya puṣpam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata
translated: There the gods obtained the flower of immortality, the healing of Kushtha.

original: hiraṇyayāḥ panthāna āsann aritrāṇi hiraṇyayā /
analyzed: hiraṇyayāḥ panthānaḥ āsan aritrāṇi hiraṇyayā
translated: The paths were golden, the ploughs were golden.

original: nāvo hiraṇyayīr āsan yābhiḥ kuṣṭhaṃ nirāvahan ////
analyzed: nāvaḥ hiraṇyayīḥ āsan yābhiḥ kuṣṭham nirāvahan
translated: The ships were of gold, with which they carried away Kushtha.

original: imaṃ me kuṣṭha pūruṣaṃ tam ā vaha taṃ niṣ kuru /
analyzed: imam me kuṣṭha pūruṣam tam ā vaha tam niḥ kuru
translated: O Kushtha, bring this man to me, lead him forth, set him free.

original: tam u me agadaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: tam u me agadam kṛdhi
translated: Make him well for me.

original: devebhyo adhi jāto 'si somasyāsi sakhā hitaḥ /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ adhi jātaḥ si somasya asi sakhā hitaḥ
translated: You were born from the gods, you are a friend of Soma, well-placed.

original: sa prāṇāya vyānāya cakṣuṣe me asmai mṛḍa ////
analyzed: sa prāṇāya vyānāya cakṣuṣe me asmai mṛḍa
translated: Be gracious to my in-breath, through-breath, and eye, to this one.

original: udaṅ jāto himavataḥ sa prācyāṃ nīyase janam /
analyzed: udaṅ jātaḥ himavataḥ sa prācyām nīyase janam
translated: Born in the north from the Himalayas, you are led to the people in the east.

original: tatra kuṣṭhasya nāmāny uttamāni vi bhejire ////
analyzed: tatra kuṣṭhasya nāmāni uttamāni vi bhejire
translated: There they assigned the best names to Kushtha.

original: uttamo nāma kuṣṭhasy uttamo nāma te pitā /
analyzed: uttamaḥ nāma kuṣṭhasi uttamaḥ nāma te pitā
translated: Kushtha is the best of names, your father is the best of names.

original: yakṣmaṃ ca sarvaṃ nāśaya takmānaṃ cārasaṃ kṛdhi ////🔽śīrṣāmayam upahatyām akṣyos tanvo rapaḥ /
analyzed: yakṣmam ca sarvam nāśaya takmānam ca arasam kṛdhi  śīrṣa āmayam upahatyām akṣyoḥ tanvaḥ rapaḥ
translated: Destroy all consumption for me, and make Taksham free from disease.🔽The disease of the head, the affliction of the eyes, the evil in the body,

original: kuṣṭhas tat sarvaṃ niṣ karad daivaṃ samaha vṛṣṇyam ////
analyzed: kuṣṭhaḥ tat sarvam niḥ karat daivam samaha vṛṣṇyam
translated: Kushtha shall drive all that away, and make me strong and powerful.

original: rātrī mātā nabhaḥ pitāryamā te pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: rātrī mātā nabhaḥ pitā aryamā te pitāmahaḥ
translated: Night is thy mother, the sky thy father, Aryaman thy grandfather.

original: silācī nāma vā asi sā devānām asi svasā ////
analyzed: silācī nāma vai asi sā devānām asi svasā
translated: Thou art called Silachi, and thou art the sister of the gods.

original: yas tvā pibati jīvati trāyase puruṣaṃ tvam /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā pibati jīvati trāyase puruṣam tvam
translated: He who drinks thee lives, thou savest a man.

original: bhartrī hi śaśvatām asi janānāṃ ca nyañcanī ////
analyzed: bhartrī hi śaśvatām asi janānām ca nyañcanī
translated: For thou art the supporter of all, and the bestower of food on men.

original: vṛkṣaṃvṛkṣam ā rohasi vṛṣaṇyantīva kanyalā /
analyzed: vṛkṣam vṛkṣam ā rohasi vṛṣaṇyantī iva kanyalā
translated: Thou mountest every tree, like a wanton girl.

original: jayantī pratyātiṣṭhantī sparaṇī nāma vā asi ////
analyzed: jayantī pratyātiṣṭhantī sparaṇī nāma vai asi
translated: Thou art called Sparani, victorious, advancing, and returning.

original: yad daṇḍena yad iṣvā yad vārur harasā kṛtam /
analyzed: yat daṇḍena yat iṣvā yat vā aruḥ harasā kṛtam
translated: Whatever is done by the rod, by the bow, by the axe, by the knife,

original: tasya tvam asi niṣkṛtiḥ semaṃ niṣ kṛdhi pūruṣam ////
analyzed: tasya tvam asi niṣkṛtiḥ sā imam niḥ kṛdhi pūruṣam
translated: thou art the expiation of that. Expatiate this man.

original: bhadrāt plakṣān nis tiṣṭhasy aśvatthāt khadirād dhavāt /
analyzed: bhadrāt plakṣāt niḥ tiṣṭhasi aśvatthāt khadirāt dhavāt
translated: Thou comest forth from the auspicious Plakṣa, from the Aśvattha, from the Khadira, from the Dhava,

original: bhadrān nyagrodhāt parṇāt sā na ehy arundhati ////
analyzed: bhadrāt nyagrodhāt parṇāt sā naḥ ehi arundhati
translated: from the auspicious Nyagrodha, from the Parṇa tree. Come hither, O Arundhatī.

original: hiraṇyavarṇe subhage sūryavarṇe vapuṣṭame /
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇe subhage sūrya varṇe vapuṣṭame
translated: O thou of golden hue, of auspicious form, of the colour of the sun, most beautiful,

original: rutaṃ gachāsi niṣkṛte niṣkṛtir nāma vā asi ////
analyzed: rutam gacchāsi niṣkṛte niṣkṛtiḥ nāma vai asi
translated: thou goest to the sound, O thou that art purified. Thou art called Niṣkṛti.

original: hiraṇyavarṇe subhage śuṣme lomaśavakṣane /🔽apām asi svasā lākṣe vāto hātmā babhūva te ////
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇe subhage śuṣme lomaśa vakṣane  apām asi svasā lākṣe vātaḥ ha ātmā babhūva te
translated: O thou of golden hue, of auspicious form, of tawny hair, with shaggy breasts,🔽thou art the sister of the waters. The wind is thy brother.

original: silācī nāma kānīno 'jababhru pitā tava /
analyzed: silācī nāma kānīnaḥ jababhru pitā tava
translated: Silachi is thy maiden name, and thy father is called Aja-babhru.

original: aśvo yamasya yaḥ śyāvas tasya hāsnāsy ukṣitā ////
analyzed: aśvaḥ yamasya yaḥ śyāvaḥ tasya hāsnā asi ukṣitā
translated: The black horse of Yama, his bit is anointed.

original: aśvasyāsnaḥ saṃpatitā sā vṛkṣāṃ abhi siṣyade /
analyzed: aśvasya asnaḥ saṃpatitā sā abhi siṣyade
translated: The bit of the horse, when it fell, went forth to the trees.

original: sarā patatriṇī bhūtvā sā na ehy arundhati ////
analyzed: sarā patatriṇī bhūtvā sā naḥ ehi arundhati
translated: Becoming a winged bird, come hither, O Arundhatî.

original: brahma jajñānaṃ prathamaṃ purastād vi sīmataḥ suruco vena āvaḥ /
analyzed: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt vi sīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ
translated: The Brahman, the first-born, whom Vena brought forth from the region of the sky, from the surface, with his bright rays,

original: sa budhnyā upamā asya viṣṭhāḥ sataś ca yonim asataś ca vi vaḥ ////
analyzed: sa budhnyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim asataḥ ca vi var
translated: His forms are deep, his birth is in the abode of the existent and the non-existent.

original: anāptā ye vaḥ prathamā yāni karmāṇi cakrire /
analyzed: an āptāḥ ye vaḥ prathamā yāni karmāṇi cakrire
translated: Those who have not attained you, who have performed your first deeds,

original: vīrān no atra mā dabhan tad va etat puro dadhe ////
analyzed: vīrān naḥ atra mā dabhan tat vaḥ etat puras dadhe
translated: Do not deceive us here, O heroes, that I have set before you.

original: sahasradhāra eva te sam asvaran divo nāke madhujihvā asaścataḥ /
analyzed: sahasra dhāre eva te sam asvaran divaḥ nāke madhu jihvāḥ asaścataḥ
translated: The thousand-streamed ones have resounded for you in the vault of the sky, with honey-tongues, not decaying.

original: tasya spaśo na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ padepade pāśinaḥ santi setave ////
analyzed: tasya spaśaḥ na ni miṣanti bhūrṇayaḥ pade pade pāśinaḥ santi setave
translated: His impetuous messengers do not close their eyes, in every place there are snares for the one to be bound.

original: pary ū ṣu pra dhanvā vājasātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: pari u su pra dhanva vāja sātaye pari vṛtrāṇi sakṣaṇiḥ
translated: Rush forward to the winning of booty, to overcome the enemies, O powerful one.

original: dviṣas tad adhy arṇaveneyase sanisraso nāmāsi trayodaśo māsa indrasya gṛhaḥ ////
analyzed: dviṣaḥ tat adhi arṇavena īyase sanisrasaḥ nāma asi trayodaśaḥ māsaḥ indrasya gṛhaḥ
translated: For that you strive in the ocean, for the sake of the enemy. Your name is Sanisrasa, you are the thirteenth month, the abode of Indra.

original: nv etenārātsīr asau svāhā /
analyzed: nu etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā
translated: Do you delight in this, O yonder one, svâhâ.

original: tigmāyudhau tigmahetī suśevau somārudrāv iha su mṛḍataṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ
translated: O ye whose weapons and whose darts are sharp, O ye who are very gracious, O Soma and Rudra, be ye propitious here to us.

original: avaitenārātsīr asau svāhā /
analyzed: ava etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā
translated: Drive away with that, O ye two, him yonder. All hail!

original: tigmāyudhau tigmahetī suśevau somārudrāv iha su mṛḍataṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ
translated: O ye whose weapons and whose darts are sharp, O ye who are very gracious, O Soma and Rudra, be ye propitious here to us.

original: apaitenārātsīr asau svāhā /
analyzed: apa etena arātsīḥ asau svāhā
translated: Drive away with that, O ye two, him yonder. All hail!

original: tigmāyudhau tigmahetī suśevau somārudrāv iha su mṛḍataṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ
translated: O ye whose weapons and whose darts are sharp, O ye who are very gracious, O Soma and Rudra, be ye propitious here to us.

original: mumuktam asmān duritād avadyāj juṣethām yajñam amṛtam asmāsu dhattam ////
analyzed: mumuktam asmān duritāt avadyāt juṣethām yajñam amṛtam asmāsu dhattam
translated: Deliver us from sin and blame. Accept the sacrifice. Bestow upon us immortality.

original: cakṣuṣo hete manaso hete brahmaṇo hete tapasaś ca hete /
analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ hete manasaḥ hete brahmaṇaḥ hete tapasaḥ ca hete
translated: For the eye's sake, for the mind's sake, for the Brahman's sake, for the penance's sake.

original: menyā menir asy amenayas te santu ye 'smāṃ abhyaghāyanti ////
analyzed: menyāḥ meniḥ asi a menayaḥ te santu ye smām abhyaghāyanti
translated: The curse is his curse. Let those who have injured us be without curse.

original: yo 'smāṃś cakṣuṣā manasā cittyākūtyā ca yo aghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: yaḥ smān cakṣuṣā manasā citti ākūtyā ca yaḥ aghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: He who has looked upon us with the eye, with the mind, with the thought, with the intention, who has wished us evil,

original: tvaṃ tān agne menyāmenīn kṛṇu svāhā ////
analyzed: tvam tān agne menyā a menīn kṛṇu svāhā
translated: Make those, O Agni, who are without curse, by the curse. All hail!

original: indrasya gṛho 'si /
analyzed: indrasya gṛhaḥ si
translated: Thou art the house of Indra.

original: taṃ tvā pra padye taṃ tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarvapūruṣaḥ sarvātmā sarvatanūḥ saha yan me 'sti tena ////
analyzed: tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me sti tena
translated: To thee I go for refuge, in thee I find shelter, all-rich, all-manly, all-souled, all-bodied, with what I have.

original: indrasya śarmāsi /
analyzed: indrasya śarma asi
translated: Thou art the protection of Indra.

original: taṃ tvā pra padye taṃ tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarvapūruṣaḥ sarvātmā sarvatanūḥ saha yan me 'sti tena ////
analyzed: tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me sti tena
translated: I enter thee, O thou that art all, that hast all men, that hast all souls, that hast all bodies, together with whatever I have.

original: indrasya varmāsi /
analyzed: indrasya varmā asi
translated: Thou art the armour of Indra.

original: taṃ tvā pra padye taṃ tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarvapūruṣaḥ sarvātmā sarvatanūḥ saha yan me 'sti tena ////
analyzed: tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me sti tena
translated: I enter thee, O thou that art all, that hast all men, that hast all souls, that hast all bodies, together with whatever I have.

original: indrasya varūtham asi /
analyzed: indrasya varūtham asi
translated: Thou art the protection of Indra.

original: taṃ tvā pra padye taṃ tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarvapūruṣaḥ sarvātmā sarvatanūḥ saha yan me 'sti tena ////🔽ā no bhara mā pari ṣṭhā arāte mā no rakṣīr dakṣiṇāṃ nīyamānām /
analyzed: tam tvā pra padye tam tvā pra viśāmi sarvaguḥ sarva pūruṣaḥ sarva ātmā sarva tanūḥ saha yat me sti tena  ā naḥ bhara mā pari sthāḥ arāte mā naḥ rakṣīḥ dakṣiṇām nīyamānām
translated: I enter thee, O thou that art all, that hast all men, that hast all souls, that hast all bodies, together with whatever I have.🔽Bring to us, O thou that art not to be overcome, do not pass by; do not injure us as we are led away to the south.

original: namo vīrtsāyā asamṛddhaye namo astv arātaye ////
analyzed: namaḥ vīrtsāyai asamṛddhaye namaḥ astu arātaye
translated: Homage to Vīrtsā, to the unsuccessful one, homage be to the spiteful one.

original: yam arāte purodhatse puruṣaṃ parirāpiṇam /
analyzed: yam arāte purodhatse puruṣam parirāpiṇam
translated: O spiteful one, to the man whom thou hast placed in front, the one who is to be pitied,

original: namas te tasmai kṛṇmo mā vaniṃ vyathayīr mama ////
analyzed: namaḥ te tasmai kṛṇmaḥ mā vanim vyathayīḥ mama
translated: to him we offer homage. Do not destroy my portion.

original: pra ṇo vanir devakṛtā divā naktaṃ ca kalpatām /🔽arātim anupremo vayaṃ namo astv arātaye ////
analyzed: pra naḥ vaniḥ deva kṛtā divā naktam ca kalpatām  arātim anupremaḥ vayam namaḥ astu arātaye
translated: May our portion, made by the gods, be ready for us by day and by night.🔽We will follow the spiteful one. Homage be to the spiteful one.

original: sarasvatīm anumatiṃ bhagaṃ yanto havāmahe /
analyzed: sarasvatīm anumatim bhagam yantaḥ havāmahe
translated: Following Sarasvatī, Anumati, and Bhaga, we invoke them.

original: vācam juṣṭāṃ madhumatīm avādiṣaṃ devānāṃ devahūtiṣu ////
analyzed: vācam juṣṭām madhumatīm avādiṣam devānām deva hūtiṣu
translated: I have spoken a word agreeable and sweet, in the invocations of the gods.

original: yaṃ yācāmy ahaṃ vācā sarasvatyā manoyujā /
analyzed: yam yācāmi aham vācā sarasvatyā manaḥ yujā
translated: Whom I ask with speech, yoked with the mind of Sarasvatī,

original: śraddhā tam adya vindatu dattā somena babhruṇā ////
analyzed: śraddhā tam adya vindatu dattā somena babhruṇā
translated: May faith find him today, given by Soma the brown.

original: mā vaniṃ mā vācaṃ no vīrtsīr ubhāv indrāgnī ā bharatāṃ no vasūni /
analyzed: mā vanim mā vācam naḥ vīrtsīḥ ubhau indra agnī ā bharatām naḥ vasūni
translated: Do not destroy our desire or our speech. Bring us wealth, O Indra and Agni, the two who bestow.

original: sarve no adya ditsanto 'rātiṃ prati haryata ////
analyzed: sarve naḥ adya ditsantaḥ rātim prati haryata
translated: All of you today, being generous, rejoice in hostility.

original: paro 'pehy asamṛddhe vi te hetiṃ nayāmasi /
analyzed: parā u pehi asamṛddhe vi te hetim nayāmasi
translated: Go away, O unsuccessful one! We remove your weapon.

original: veda tvāhaṃ nimīvantīṃ nitudantīm arāte ////
analyzed: veda tvā aham nimīvantīm nitudantīm arāte
translated: I know you, O Nimiṣantī, O Nitudantī, O Arātī.

original: uta nagnā bobhuvatī svapnayā sacase janam /
analyzed: uta nagnā bobhuvatī svapnayā sacase janam
translated: And naked, you wander about, accompanying people with sleep.

original: arāte cittaṃ vīrtsanty ākūtiṃ puruṣasya ca ////
analyzed: arāte cittam vīrtsantī ākūtim puruṣasya ca
translated: O Arātī, you distort the mind and the intention of a man.

original: yā mahatī mahonmānā viśvā āśā vyānaśe /
analyzed: yā mahatī mahā unmānā viśvāḥ āśāḥ vyānaśe
translated: She who is great, of great power, who has spread out over all the quarters,

original: tasyai hiraṇyakeśyai nirṛtyā akaraṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: tasyai hiraṇya keśyai nirṛtyai akaram namaḥ
translated: To her, to Hiraṇyakeśī, to Nirṛti, I have made an offering.

original: hiraṇyavarṇā subhagā hiraṇyakaśipur mahī /
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇā subhagā hiraṇya kaśipuḥ mahī
translated: Golden-colored, fortunate, with a golden plate, the great one,

original: tasyai hiraṇyadrāpaye 'rātyā akaraṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: tasyai hiraṇya drāpaye rātyai akaram namaḥ
translated: To her, to Hiraṇyadrāpayā, to Arātī, I have made an offering.

original: vaikaṅkatenedhmena devebhya ājyaṃ vaha /
analyzed: vaikaṅkatena idhmena devebhyaḥ ājyam vaha
translated: With the sacrificial grass of the Vaikaṅkata tree, carry the ghee to the gods.

original: agne tāṃ iha mādaya sarva ā yantu me havam ////🔽indrā yāhi me havam idaṃ kariṣyāmi tac chṛṇu /
analyzed: agne tām iha mādaya sarve ā yantu me havam  indra ā yāhi me havam idam kariṣyāmi tat śṛṇu
translated: O Agni, delight her here. Let all come to my invocation.🔽O Indra, come to my invocation. Listen to this I will do.

original: ima aindrā atisarā ākūtiṃ saṃ namantu me /
analyzed: ime aindrāḥ atisarāḥ ākūtim sam namantu me
translated: Let these Atisaras belonging to Indra turn my intention towards them.

original: tebhiḥ śakema vīryaṃ jātavedas tanūvaśin ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ śakema vīryam jātavedaḥ tanū vaśin
translated: By them, O all-knowing one, may we be able to accomplish our task, O one who controls his own body.

original: yad asāv amuto devā adevaḥ saṃścikīrṣati /
analyzed: yat asau amutas devāḥ adevaḥ saṃścikīrṣati
translated: Whatever that godless one plans to do against us from there,

original: mā tasyāgnir havyaṃ vākṣīd dhavaṃ devā asya mopa gur mamaiva havam etana ////
analyzed: mā tasya agniḥ havyam vākṣīt havam devāḥ asya mā upa guḥ mama eva havam etana
translated: may Agni not accept his oblation, may the gods not favor his call, may they come to my call alone.

original: ati dhāvatātisarā indrasya vacasā hata /
analyzed: ati dhāvata atisarāḥ indrasya vacasā hata
translated: Run past them, O Atisaras, struck down by the word of Indra.

original: aviṃ vṛka iva mathnīta sa vo jīvan mā moci prāṇam asyāpi nahyata ////
analyzed: avim vṛkaḥ iva mathnīta sa vaḥ jīvan mā moci prāṇam asya api nahyata
translated: Crush him like a wolf crushes a sheep. Let him not escape you alive. Bind his breath.

original: yam amī purodadhire brahmāṇam apabhūtaye /
analyzed: yam amī purodadhire brahmāṇam apabhūtaye
translated: The Brahmins who have placed him in front for the sake of destruction,

original: indra sa te adhaspadaṃ taṃ praty asyāmi mṛtyave ////
analyzed: indra sa te adhaspadam tam prati asyāmi mṛtyave
translated: O Indra, I turn him back to death for you.

original: yadi preyur devapurā brahma varmāṇi cakrire /🔽tanūpānaṃ paripāṇaṃ kṛṇvānā yad upocire sarvaṃ tad arasaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: yadi preyuḥ deva purā brahma varmāṇi cakrire  tanū pānam paripāṇam kṛṇvānāḥ yat upocire sarvam tat arasam kṛdhi
translated: If they have gone to the cities of the gods and made Brahmic armor,🔽making a protection for the body, whatever they have said, make all that ineffective.

original: yān asāv atisarāṃś cakāra kṛṇavac ca yān /
analyzed: yān asau atisarān cakāra kṛṇavat ca yān
translated: The Atisaras that he has made and the ones that he will make,

original: tvaṃ tān indra vṛtrahan pratīcaḥ punar ā kṛdhi yathāmuṃ tṛṇahāṃ janam ////
analyzed: tvam tān indra vṛtrahan pratīcaḥ punar ā kṛdhi yathā amum tṛṇahām janam
translated: O Indra, slayer of Vrtra, drive them back again, so that I may crush this people as with grass.

original: yathendra udvācanaṃ labdhvā cakre adhaspadam /
analyzed: yathā indraḥ udvācanam labdhvā cakre adhaspadam
translated: As Indra, having obtained the Udvācana, made them his footstool,

original: kṛṇve 'ham adharān tathā amūñ chaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ ////🔽atrainān indra vṛtrahann ugro marmaṇi vidhya /
analyzed: kṛṇve ham adharān tathā amūm śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ  atra enān indra vṛtrahan ugraḥ marmaṇi vidhya
translated: So do I make these my footstool for all the eternal years.🔽Here, O Indra, slayer of Vrtra, strike them with thy fierce dart in the vital parts.

original: atraivainān abhi tiṣṭhendra medy ahaṃ tava /
analyzed: atra eva enān abhi tiṣṭha indra medī aham tava
translated: Here, O Indra, do thou crush them. I am thy servant, O Indra.

original: anu tvendrā rabhāmahe syāma sumatau tava ////🔽dive svāhā ////
analyzed: anu tvā indra ā rabhāmahe syāma sumatau tava  dive svāhā
translated: We follow thee, O Indra, may we be in thy favour.🔽To heaven hail!

original: pṛthivyai svāhā ////🔽antarikṣāya svāhā ////
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā  antarikṣāya svāhā
translated: To earth hail!🔽To the atmosphere hail!

original: antarikṣāya svāhā ////🔽dive svāhā ////
analyzed: antarikṣāya svāhā  dive svāhā
translated: To the atmosphere hail!🔽To heaven hail!

original: pṛthivyai svāhā ////
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā
translated: To earth hail!

original: sūryo me cakṣur vātaḥ prāṇo 'ntarikṣam ātmā pṛthivī śarīram /
analyzed: sūryaḥ me cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇaḥ ntarikṣam ātmā pṛthivī śarīram
translated: The sun is my eye, the wind my breath, the atmosphere my body, the earth my body.

original: astṛto nāmāham ayam asmi sa ātmānaṃ ni dadhe dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ gopīthāya ////
analyzed: astṛtaḥ nāma aham ayam asmi saḥ ātmānam ni dadhe dyāvāpṛthivībhyām gopīthāya
translated: I am named Asrit. I have placed myself for protection in heaven and earth.

original: ud āyur ud balam ut kṛtam ut kṛtyām un manīṣām ud indriyam /
analyzed: ud āyuḥ ud balam ud kṛtam ud kṛtyām ud manīṣām ud indriyam
translated: Upward life, upward strength, upward vigour, upward the healing charm, upward the mind, upward the power.

original: āyuṣkṛd āyuṣpatnī svadhāvantau gopā me staṃ gopāyataṃ mā /
analyzed: āyuḥ kṛt āyuḥ patnī svadhāvantau gopāḥ me stam gopāyatam mā
translated: Life-giving, life-supporting, of your own accord, protect me, protect my body.

original: ātmasadau me staṃ mā mā hiṃsiṣṭam ////
analyzed: ātma sadau me stam mā mā hiṃsiṣṭam
translated: Protect my two feet, do not injure me.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo mā prācyā diśo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā prācyāḥ diśaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the eastern direction.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo mā dakṣiṇāyā diśo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the southern direction.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo mā pratīcyā diśo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the western direction.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo modīcyā diśo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā udīcyāḥ diśaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the northern direction.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo mā dhruvāyā diśo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the stable direction.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo mordhvāyā diśo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the upward direction.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: aśmavarma me 'si yo mā diśām antardeśebhyo 'ghāyur abhidāsāt /
analyzed: aśma varma me si yaḥ mā diśām antardeśebhyaḥ ghāyuḥ abhidāsāt
translated: You are my armor of stone against the one who would harm me from the intermediate directions.

original: etat sa ṛchāt ////
analyzed: etat saḥ ṛchāt
translated: Let him receive it.

original: bṛhatā mana upa hvaye mātariśvanā prāṇāpānau /
analyzed: bṛhatā manaḥ upa hvaye mātariśvanā prāṇa apānau
translated: I invoke the mind with the Brihatī, the in-breath and out-breath with the Maruts.

original: sūryāc cakṣur antarikṣāc chrotraṃ pṛthivyāḥ śarīram /
analyzed: sūryāt cakṣuḥ antarikṣāt śrotram pṛthivyāḥ śarīram
translated: The eye from the sun, the ear from the atmosphere, the body from the earth.

original: sarasvatyā vācam upa hvayāmahe manoyujā ////
analyzed: sarasvatyāḥ vācam upa hvayāmahe manaḥ yujā
translated: We invoke speech with Sarasvatī, yoked with the mind.

original: kathaṃ mahe asurāyābravīr iha kathaṃ pitre haraye tveṣanṛmṇaḥ /
analyzed: katham mahe asurāya abravīḥ iha katham pitre haraye tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ
translated: How hast thou spoken here to the great Asura? How, O tawny-hued one, to the father, to Hari, whose valour is terrible?

original: pṛśniṃ varuṇa dakṣiṇāṃ dadāvān punarmagha tvaṃ manasācikitsīḥ ////
analyzed: pṛśnim varuṇa dakṣiṇām dadāvān punarmagha tvam manasā acikitsīḥ
translated: O Varuna, the giver of the speckled (cow) as a gift, thou, O Punarmâgha, hast reflected in thy mind.

original: na kāmena punarmagho bhavāmi saṃ cakṣe kaṃ pṛśnim etām upāje /
analyzed: na kāmena punarmaghaḥ bhavāmi sam cakṣe kam pṛśnim etām upāje
translated: I will not be Punarmâgha through desire. I look upon whom I shall give this speckled (cow).

original: kena nu tvam atharvan kāvyena kena jātenāsi jātavedāḥ ////
analyzed: kena nu tvam atharvan kāvyena kena jātena asi jātavedāḥ
translated: By what art thou, O Atharvan, by what wisdom? By what birth art thou Jâtavedas?

original: satyam ahaṃ gabhīraḥ kāvyena satyaṃ jātenāsmi jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: satyam aham gabhīraḥ kāvyena satyam jātena asmi jātavedāḥ
translated: By truth, I am profound in wisdom. By truth I am Jâtavedas.

original: na me dāso nāryo mahitvā vrataṃ mīmāya yad ahaṃ dhariṣye ////
analyzed: na me dāsaḥ na aryaḥ mahitvā vratam mīmāya yat aham dhariṣye
translated: Neither a slave nor a man through greatness of power shall transgress the vow which I shall keep.

original: na tvad anyaḥ kavitaro na medhayā dhīrataro varuṇa svadhāvan /
analyzed: na tvat anyaḥ kavitaraḥ na medhayā dhīrataraḥ varuṇa svadhāvan
translated: None is more wise than thou, O Varuna, by wisdom, none is more firm than thou, O self-existent one.

original: tvaṃ tā viśvā bhuvanāni vettha sa cin nu tvaj jano māyī bibhāya ////
analyzed: tvam tā viśvā bhuvanāni vettha sa cit nu tvat janaḥ māyī bibhāya
translated: Thou knowest all these worlds. Even he who is thy wondrous people fears thee.

original: tvaṃ hy aṅga varuṇa svadhāvan viśvā vettha janima supraṇīte /
analyzed: tvam hi aṅga varuṇa svadhāvan viśvā vettha janima su praṇīte
translated: For thou, O Varuna, O self-existent one, knowest all generations, O thou who leadest well.

original: kiṃ rajasa enā paro anyad asty enā kiṃ pareṇāvaram amura ////
analyzed: kim rajasaḥ enā paras anyat asti enā kim pareṇa avaram amura
translated: What is beyond this region? What is beyond that? What is below this? What is above that?

original: ekaṃ rajasa enā paro anyad asty enā para ekena durṇaśaṃ cid arvāk /
analyzed: ekam rajasaḥ enā paras anyat asti enā paras ekena durṇaśam cit arvāk
translated: One thing is beyond this region. There is another beyond that. By one (thing) even the hard to conquer (is conquered).

original: tat te vidvān varuṇa pra bravīmy adhovacasaḥ paṇayo bhavantu nīcair dāsā upa sarpantu bhūmim ////
analyzed: tat te vidvān varuṇa pra bravīmi adhovacasaḥ paṇayaḥ bhavantu nīcais dāsāḥ upa sarpantu bhūmim
translated: That, O Varuna, knowing this, I declare to thee: let the Panyas be of low speech; let the slaves creep low to the ground.

original: tvaṃ hy aṅga varuṇa bravīṣi punarmagheṣv avadyāni bhūri /🔽mo ṣu paṇīṃr abhy etāvato bhūn mā tvā vocann arādhasaṃ janāsaḥ ////
analyzed: tvam hi aṅga varuṇa bravīṣi punarmagheṣu avadyāni bhūri  mā u su paṇīn abhī etāvataḥ bhūt mā tvā vocan arādhasam janāsaḥ
translated: For thou, O Varuna, dost indeed speak many blameworthy things among the wealthy.🔽Be not thou more Panya than these: let not the people call thee one who worships not.

original: mā mā vocann arādhasaṃ janāsaḥ punas te pṛśniṃ jaritar dadāmi /
analyzed: mā mā vocan arādhasam janāsaḥ punar te pṛśnim jaritar dadāmi
translated: Let not the people call me one who worships not. Again I give thee the dappled one, O singer.

original: stotraṃ me viśvam ā yāhi śacībhir antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu ////
analyzed: stotram me viśvam ā yāhi śacībhiḥ antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu
translated: Come with all thy powers to my praise, within all the human habitations.

original: ā te stotrāṇy udyatāni yantv antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu /
analyzed: ā te stotrāṇi udyatāni yantu antar viśvāsu mānuṣīṣu dikṣu
translated: Let the praises that are raised to thee come within all the human habitations.

original: dehi nu me yan me adatto asi yujyo me saptapadaḥ sakhāsi ////
analyzed: dehi nu me yat me a dattaḥ asi yujyaḥ me sapta padaḥ sakhā asi
translated: Give me what thou hast not given me: thou art my companion, my friend of seven steps.

original: samā nau bandhur varuṇa samā jā vedāhaṃ tad yan nāv eṣā samā jā /
analyzed: samā nau bandhuḥ varuṇa samā jāḥ veda aham tat yat nau eṣā samā jā
translated: Our kinship, O Varuna, is the same: I know that this is the same for both of us.

original: dadāmi tad yat te adatto asmi yujyas te saptapadaḥ sakhāsmi ////
analyzed: dadāmi tat yat te a dattaḥ asmi yujyaḥ te sapta padaḥ sakhā asmi
translated: I give thee what I have not given thee: I am thy companion of seven steps.

original: devo devāya gṛṇate vayodhā vipro viprāya stuvate sumedhāḥ /
analyzed: devaḥ devāya gṛṇate vayaḥ dhāḥ vipraḥ viprāya stuvate sumedhāḥ
translated: The god, the supporter of life, to the singing god, the wise one, to the singing sage, the very intelligent one, to the one who praises.

original: ajījano hi varuṇa svadhāvann atharvāṇaṃ pitaraṃ devabandhum /
analyzed: ajījanaḥ hi varuṇa svadhāvan atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum
translated: For thou, O Varuna, self-ruling, hast begotten Atharvan, thy father, kinsman of the gods.

original: tasmā u rādhaḥ kṛṇuhi supraśastaṃ sakhā no asi paramaṃ ca bandhuḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai u rādhaḥ kṛṇuhi su praśastam sakhā naḥ asi paramam ca bandhuḥ
translated: Bestow on him a gift that shall be highly prized: thou art our friend, our nearest kinsman.

original: samiddho adya manuṣo duroṇe devo devān yajasi jātavedaḥ /🔽ā ca vaha mitramahaś cikitvān tvaṃ dūtaḥ kavir asi pracetāḥ ////
analyzed: samiddhaḥ adya manuṣaḥ duroṇe devaḥ devān yajasi jātavedaḥ  ā ca vaha mitra mahas cikitvān tvam dūtaḥ kaviḥ asi pracetāḥ
translated: This day, O God, in the house of Manu, enkindled, thou, O all-knower, worshippest the Gods.🔽And bring them hither, thou who knowest, O thou who art to be glorified by the Vasus: thou art the envoy, the wise, the far-seeing.

original: tanūnapāt patha ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjant svadayā sujihva /
analyzed: tanūnapāt pathaḥ ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadaya sujihva
translated: O Tanûnapât, with honey, with thy sweetness, anoint the paths of sacrifice, O thou of pleasant tongue.

original: manmāni dhībhir uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā ca kṛṇuhy adhvaram naḥ ////
analyzed: manmāni dhībhiḥ uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā ca kṛṇuhi adhvaram naḥ
translated: Inspiring our thoughts, and making ready the sacrifice, make thou our worship acceptable to the Gods.

original: ājuhvāna īḍyo bandyaś cā yāhy agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: ājuhvānaḥ īḍyaḥ bandyaḥ ca ā yāhi agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: To be invoked, to be adored, to be praised, go thou, O Agni, in unison with the Vasus.

original: tvaṃ devānām asi yahva hotā sa enān yakṣīṣito yajīyān ////
analyzed: tvam devānām asi yahva hotā saḥ enān yakṣi iṣitaḥ yajīyān
translated: Thou art the young Hotar of the Gods: worship them for us, thou who art to be invoked, most wise.

original: prācīnaṃ barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyā vastor asyā vṛjyate agre ahnām /
analyzed: prācīnam barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ vastoḥ asyāḥ vṛjyate agre ahnām
translated: The ancient grass of sacrifice is spread out in the direction of the earth, in front of this dwelling, in the beginning of the days.

original: vy u prathate vitaraṃ varīyo devebhyo aditaye syonam ////
analyzed: vi u prathate vitaram varīyaḥ devebhyaḥ aditaye syonam
translated: It spreadeth out, wide, far and wide, most delightful, to the Gods, to Aditi, most gracious.

original: vyacasvatīr urviyā vi śrayantāṃ patibhyo na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ /
analyzed: vyacasvatīḥ urviyā vi śrayantām patibhyaḥ na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
translated: Let the spacious ones, extending with their breadth, be spread out, like women decking themselves for their lords.

original: devīr dvāro bṛhatīr viśvaminvā devebhyo bhavata suprāyaṇāḥ ////
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ bṛhatīḥ viśvaminvāḥ devebhyaḥ bhavata su prāyaṇāḥ
translated: O divine doors, vast, all-encompassing, be easy of access for the gods.

original: ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ ni yonau /
analyzed: ā yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatām ni yonau
translated: The two dawns, Susvaya and Yajata, who are close to each other, let them sit in the womb, in the seat.

original: divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī surukme adhi śriyaṃ śukrapiśaṃ dadhāne ////
analyzed: divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī su rukme adhi śriyam śukrapiśam dadhāne
translated: The two divine maidens, vast, with beautiful rays, who bestow the bright and variegated glory.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā suvācā mimānā yajñaṃ manuṣo yajadhyai /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā su vācā mimānā yajñam manuṣaḥ yajadhyai
translated: The two divine Hotars, the first with good speech, who are measuring the sacrifice for Manu to worship,

original: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnaṃ jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā ////
analyzed: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnam jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā
translated: Who urge the priests in the assemblies, who point out the light that is in the east, in the directions.

original: ā no yajñaṃ bhāratī tūyam etv iḍā manuṣvad iha cetayantī /
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam bhāratī tūyam etu iḍā manuṣvat iha cetayantī
translated: May Bharati come quickly to our sacrifice, may Ida, who acts like Manu, think here.

original: tisro devīr barhir edaṃ syonaṃ sarasvatīḥ svapasaḥ sadantām ////
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam syonam sarasvatīḥ su apasaḥ sadantām
translated: May the three goddesses, Sarasvati, with their own powers, sit on this pleasant sacrificial grass.

original: ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpair apiṃśad bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpaiḥ apiṃśat bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who has fashioned these two, heaven and earth, the two mothers, with forms, all the worlds,

original: tam adya hotar iṣito yajīyān devaṃ tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān ////
analyzed: tam adya hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān devam tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān
translated: To him, O Hotar, today, urged on, most worthy of worship, knowing, serve here the god Tvastr.

original: upāvasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānāṃ pātha ṛtuthā havīṃṣi /
analyzed: upa avasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānām pāthaḥ ṛtuthā havīṃṣi
translated: Pouring out, uniting with yourself, offer the oblations to the gods in due season.

original: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devo agniḥ svadantu havyaṃ madhunā ghṛtena ////
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devaḥ agniḥ svadantu havyam madhunā ghṛtena
translated: May the tree, the oblator, the god Agni, make the offering taste sweet with honey and ghee.

original: sadyo jāto vy amimīta yajñam agnir devānām abhavat purogāḥ /
analyzed: sadyas jātaḥ vi amimīta yajñam agniḥ devānām abhavat purogāḥ
translated: As soon as born he meted out the sacrifice: Agni became the leader of the Gods.

original: asya hotuḥ praśiṣy ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtaṃ havir adantu devāḥ ////
analyzed: asya hotuḥ praśiṣi ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtam haviḥ adantu devāḥ
translated: In the instruction of this Hotri, in the word of holy order, let the Gods eat the oblation offered with Svâhâ.

original: dadir hi mahyaṃ varuṇo divaḥ kavir vacobhir ugrair ni riṇāmi te viṣam /
analyzed: dadiḥ hi mahyam varuṇaḥ divaḥ kaviḥ vacobhiḥ ugraiḥ ni riṇāmi te viṣam
translated: For Varuna the giver hath given me, the sage of heaven: with mighty words I draw out thy poison.

original: khātam akhātam uta saktam agrabham ireva dhanvan ni jajāsa te viṣam ////
analyzed: khātam a khātam uta saktam agrabham irā iva dhanvan ni jajāsa te viṣam
translated: I have seized the dug-out and the undug-out, and that which is concealed: like a river in the desert hath thy poison sprung forth.

original: yat te apodakaṃ viṣaṃ tat ta etāsv agrabham /
analyzed: yat te apodakam viṣam tat te etāsu agrabham
translated: The poison which is in thy feet, that have I seized in these (waters).

original: gṛhṇāmi te madhyamam uttamaṃ rasam utāvamam bhiyasā neśad ād u te ////🔽vṛṣā me ravo nabhasā na tanyatur ugreṇa te vacasā bādha ād u te /
analyzed: gṛhṇāmi te madhyamam uttamam rasam uta avamam bhiyasā neśat āt u te  vṛṣā me ravaḥ nabhasā na tanyatuḥ ugreṇa te vacasā bādhaḥ āt u te
translated: I seize thy middle, thy highest, and thy lowest juice: through fear of thee let it not go forth.🔽My roar is like a bull's, like the thunder in the sky: with thy terrible word drive it away from thee.

original: ahaṃ tam asya nṛbhir agrabham rasaṃ tamasa iva jyotir ud etu sūryaḥ ////
analyzed: aham tam asya nṛbhiḥ agrabham rasam tamasaḥ iva jyotiḥ ud etu sūryaḥ
translated: I have seized this juice of thine with men: like light from darkness let the sun rise up.

original: cakṣuṣā te cakṣur hanmi viṣeṇa hanmi te viṣam /
analyzed: cakṣuṣā te cakṣuḥ hanmi viṣeṇa hanmi te viṣam
translated: With thine eye I destroy thine eye: with poison I destroy thy poison.

original: ahe mriyasva mā jīvīḥ pratyag abhy etu tvā viṣam ////
analyzed: ahe mriyasva mā jīvīḥ pratyak abhī etu tvā viṣam
translated: O snake, die, do not live: let poison turn against thyself.

original: kairāta pṛśna upatṛṇya babhra ā me śṛṇutāsitā alīkāḥ /
analyzed: kairāta pṛśne upatṛṇya babhro ā me śṛṇuta asitāḥ alīkāḥ
translated: O spotted snake of the Kirâtas, O brown one, listen to me, O black one, O false one.

original: mā me sakhyuḥ stāmānam api ṣṭhātāśrāvayanto ni viṣe ramadhvam ////
analyzed: mā me sakhyuḥ stāmānam api sthāta āśrāvayantaḥ ni viṣe ramadhvam
translated: Let not the hatred of my friend come nigh me. Listen, and find delight in the poison.

original: asitasya taimātasya babhror apodakasya ca /
analyzed: asitasya taimātasya babhroḥ apodakasya ca
translated: Of Asita, of Taimāta, of Bhabhra, of Apodakas,

original: sātrāsāhasyāhaṃ manyor ava jyām iva dhanvano vi muñcāmi rathāṃ iva ////
analyzed: sātrāsāhasya aham manyoḥ ava jyām iva dhanvanaḥ vi muñcāmi iva
translated: Of Satrāsas, of Manjyuka, I loosen the bowstring as 'twere from the bow, as the car-pole from the chariot.

original: āligī ca viligī ca pitā ca matā ca /
analyzed: āligī ca viligī ca pitā ca matā ca
translated: The Aligi, the Viligi, the father, the mother,

original: vidma vaḥ sarvato bandhv arasāḥ kiṃ kariṣyatha ////
analyzed: vidma vaḥ sarvatas bandhū arasāḥ kim kariṣyatha
translated: We know you all, O relatives. Without strength, what will you do?

original: urugūlāyā duhitā jātā dāsy asiknyā /
analyzed: urugūlāyāḥ duhitā jātā dāsī asiknyā
translated: The daughter of Urugula, born a slave in Asnikya,

original: prataṅkaṃ dadruṣīṇāṃ sarvāsām arasam viṣam ////
analyzed: prataṅkam dadruṣīṇām sarvāsām arasam viṣam
translated: The panic of all the Dārusīs, the poison of all is without strength.

original: karṇā śvāvit tad abravīd girer avacarantikā /
analyzed: karṇā śvāvidh tat abravīt gireḥ avacarantikā
translated: Karna, the bitch, said this, wandering about the mountain,

original: yāḥ kāś cemāḥ khanitrimās tāsām arasatamaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: yāḥ kāḥ ca imāḥ khanitrimāḥ tāsām arasatamam viṣam
translated: Whatever of these there are that dig, their poison is the weakest of all.

original: tābuvaṃ na tābuvaṃ na ghet tvam asi tābuvam /
analyzed: tābuvam na tābuvam na gha id tvam asi tābuvam
translated: Tabuvam, not Tabuvam, surely you are Tabuvam.

original: tābuvenārasaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: viṣam
translated: With Tabuvam the poison is without strength.

original: tastuvaṃ na tastuvaṃ na ghet tvam asi tastuvam /
analyzed: tastuvam na tastuvam na gha id tvam asi tastuvam
translated: Tastuvam, not Tastuvam, surely you are Tastuvam.

original: tastuvenārasaṃ viṣam ////🔽suparṇas tvānv avindat sūkaras tvākhanan nasā /
analyzed: tastuvena arasam viṣam  suparṇaḥ tvā anu avindat sūkaraḥ tvā akhanat nasā
translated: With Tastuvam the poison is without strength.🔽The eagle found you, the boar dug you up with his nose.

original: dipsauṣadhe tvaṃ dipsantam ava kṛtyākṛtaṃ jahi ////
analyzed: dipsa auṣadhe tvam dipsantam ava kṛtyā kṛtam jahi
translated: O Dīpsausadha, you destroy the one who plots against you, the one who has done witchcraft.

original: ava jahi yātudhānān ava kṛtyākṛtaṃ jahi /
analyzed: ava jahi yātudhānān ava kṛtyā kṛtam jahi
translated: Destroy the sorcerers, destroy the sorcerer's work.

original: atho yo asmān dipsati tam u tvaṃ jahy oṣadhe ////
analyzed: atha u yaḥ asmān dipsati tam u tvam jahi oṣadhe
translated: And him also who hates us, O plant, do thou destroy.

original: riśyasyeva parīśāsaṃ parikṛtya pari tvacaḥ /
analyzed: riśyasya iva parīśāsam parikṛtya pari tvacaḥ
translated: As one who searches out a thief, having gone round the outer skin,

original: kṛtyāṃ kṛtyākṛte devā niṣkam iva prati muñcata ////
analyzed: kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte devāḥ niṣkam iva prati muñcata
translated: The spell, O Gods, cast off as a bracelet, cast off the spell of him who works a spell.

original: punaḥ kṛtyāṃ kṛtyākṛte hastagṛhya parā ṇaya /
analyzed: punar kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte hasta gṛhya parā naya
translated: The spell, O ye who work a spell, take up again, and lead it away.

original: samakṣam asmā ā dhehi yathā kṛtyākṛtam hanat ////
analyzed: samakṣam asmai ā dhehi yathā kṛtyākṛtam hanat
translated: Place it before him that he may slay the sorcerer.

original: kṛtyāḥ santu kṛtyākṛte śapathaḥ śapathīyate /
analyzed: kṛtyāḥ santu kṛtyā kṛte śapathaḥ śapathīyate
translated: Let the spells be for him who works a spell, let the curse be for him who curses.

original: sukho ratha iva vartatāṃ kṛtyā kṛtyākṛtaṃ punaḥ ////
analyzed: sukhaḥ rathaḥ iva vartatām kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar
translated: Let the spell, like a well-made chariot, turn back again to the sorcerer.

original: yadi strī yadi vā pumān kṛtyāṃ cakāra pāpmane /
analyzed: yadi strī yadi vā pumān kṛtyām cakāra pāpmane
translated: If a woman or a man has wrought a spell for evil,

original: tām u tasmai nayāmasy aśvam ivāśvābhidhānyā ////
analyzed: tām u tasmai nayāmasi aśvam iva aśvābhidhānyā
translated: We lead it back to him again, as one leads a horse with the bridle.

original: yadi vāsi devakṛtā yadi vā puruṣaiḥ kṛtā /
analyzed: yadi vā asi deva kṛtā yadi vā puruṣaiḥ kṛtā
translated: If thou art made by the Gods, or if thou art made by men,

original: tāṃ tvā punar ṇayāmasīndreṇa sayujā vayam ////
analyzed: tām tvā punar nayāmasi indreṇa sayujā vayam
translated: We lead thee back again with Indra as our ally.

original: agne pṛtanāṣāṭ pṛtanāḥ sahasva /🔽punaḥ kṛtyāṃ kṛtyākṛte pratiharaṇena harāmasi ////
analyzed: agne pṛtanāṣāh pṛtanāḥ sahasva  punar kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛte pratiharaṇena harāmasi
translated: O Agni, conqueror in battle, conquer in battle.🔽We drive back the spell with the counter-spell to him who works a spell.

original: kṛtavyadhani vidhya taṃ yaś cakāra tam ij jahi /
analyzed: kṛtavyadhani vidhya tam yaḥ cakāra tam id jahi
translated: Pierce him who has pierced thee, slay him who has wrought the spell.

original: na tvām acakruṣe vayaṃ vadhāya saṃ śiśīmahi ////
analyzed: na tvām a cakruṣe vayam vadhāya sam śiśīmahi
translated: We have not sharpened thee for slaughter, we have sharpened thee for healing.

original: putra iva pitaraṃ gacha svaja ivābhiṣṭhito daśa /
analyzed: putraḥ iva pitaram gacha svajaḥ iva abhiṣṭhitaḥ daśa
translated: Go to him as a son to his father, as a brother to his sister.

original: bandham ivāvakrāmī gacha kṛtye kṛtyākṛtaṃ punaḥ ////
analyzed: bandham iva avakrāmī gacha kṛtye kṛtyā kṛtam punar
translated: As one who enters a house, go to the one who has performed the rite, O rite.

original: ud eṇīva vāraṇy abhiskandaṃ mṛgīva /
analyzed: ud eṇī iva vā araṇī abhiskandam mṛgī iva
translated: As a doe to the forest, as a hind to the mountain,

original: kṛtyā kartāram ṛchatu ////
analyzed: kṛtyā kartāram ṛchatu
translated: let the rite fall upon the one who has performed the rite.

original: iṣvā ṛjīyaḥ patatu dyāvāpṛthivī taṃ prati /
analyzed: iṣvāḥ ṛjīyaḥ patatu dyāvāpṛthivī tam prati
translated: Let the arrow fly straight from heaven and earth against him.

original: sā taṃ mṛgam iva gṛhṇātu kṛtyā kṛtyākṛtaṃ punaḥ ////
analyzed: sā tam mṛgam iva gṛhṇātu kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar
translated: Let it seize him like a deer, O rite, the one who has performed the rite.

original: agnir ivaitu pratikūlam anukūlam ivodakam /
analyzed: agniḥ iva etu pratikūlam anukūlam iva udakam
translated: Let it go against him like fire going against the wind, like water going with the wind.

original: sukho ratha iva vartatāṃ kṛtyā kṛtyākṛtaṃ punaḥ ////
analyzed: sukhaḥ rathaḥ iva vartatām kṛtyā kṛtyā kṛtam punar
translated: Let it turn against him like a well-oiled chariot, O rite, the one who has performed the rite.

original: ekā ca me daśa ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: ekā ca me daśa ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: One and ten, O plant, are my expellers.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: O thou of true birth and true protection, make my honey sweeter than honey.

original: dve ca me viṃśatiś ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: dve ca me viṃśatiḥ ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: Two and twenty, O plant, are my expellers.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: O thou of true birth and true protection, make my honey sweeter than honey.

original: tisraś ca me triṃśac ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: tisraḥ ca me triṃśat ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: Three and thirty, O plant, are my expellers.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: O thou of true birth and true protection, make my honey sweeter than honey.

original: catasraś ca me catvāriṃśac ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: catasraḥ ca me catvāriṃśat ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And four and forty are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: pañca ca me pañcāśac ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: pañca ca me pañcāśat ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And five and fifty are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: ṣaṭ ca me ṣaṣṭiś ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: ṣaṭ ca me ṣaṣṭiḥ ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And six and sixty are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: sapta ca me saptatiś ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: sapta ca me saptatiḥ ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And seven and seventy are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: aṣṭa ca me 'śītiś ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: aṣṭa ca me śītiḥ ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And eight and eighty are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: nava ca me navatiś ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: nava ca me navatiḥ ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And nine and ninety are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: daśa ca me śataṃ ca me 'pavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: daśa ca me śatam ca me pavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And ten and a hundred are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: Born of truth, O thou of true protection, make my honey sweet with honey.

original: śataṃ ca me sahasraṃ cāpavaktāra oṣadhe /
analyzed: śatam ca me sahasram ca apavaktāraḥ oṣadhe
translated: And a hundred and a thousand are my expellers, O Plant.

original: ṛtajāta ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛta jāte ṛtāvari madhu me madhulā karaḥ
translated: O you born of truth, O you who guard the truth, make sweet for me, O you who are sweet.

original: yady ekavṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadī eka vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are one-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi dvivṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi dvi vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are two-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi trivṛso 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi trivṛsaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are three-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi caturvṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi catur vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are four-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi pañcavṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi pañca vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are five-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi ṣaḍvṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi ṣaṣ vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are six-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi saptavṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi sapta vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are seven-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yady aṣṭavṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadī aṣṭa vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are eight-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yadi navavṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////🔽yadi daśavṛṣo 'si sṛjāraso 'si ////
analyzed: yadi nava vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si  yadi daśa vṛṣaḥ si sṛja arasaḥ si
translated: If you are nine-bull, you are the juice that flows.🔽If you are ten-bull, you are the juice that flows.

original: yady ekādaśo 'si so 'podako 'si ////
analyzed: yadī ekādaśaḥ si saḥ u podakaḥ si
translated: If you are eleven, you are the one with feet.

original: te 'vadan prathamā brahmakilbiṣe 'kūpāraḥ salilo mātariśvā /
analyzed: te vadan prathamāḥ brahma kilbiṣe kūpāraḥ salilaḥ mātariśvā
translated: They spoke first about the sin against Brahman: Akupāra, Salila, and Mātarīśvā.

original: vīḍuharās tapa ugraṃ mayobhūr āpo devīḥ prathamajā ṛtasya ////
analyzed: vīḍu harāḥ tapaḥ ugram mayaḥ bhūḥ āpaḥ devīḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya
translated: The cloud-harvesters, the fierce heat, the purifying waters, the divine waters, the firstborn of truth.

original: somo rājā prathamo brahmajāyāṃ punaḥ prāyachad ahṛṇīyamānaḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ rājā prathamaḥ brahma jāyām punar prāyacchat a hṛṇīyamānaḥ
translated: King Soma first returned the Brahman's wife, not grudgingly.

original: anvartitā varuṇo mitra āsīd agnir hotā hastagṛhyā nināya ////
analyzed: anvartitā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ āsīt agniḥ hotā hasta gṛhya ā nināya
translated: Varuṇa and Mitra followed, Agni the Hotar took her by the hand and led her away.

original: hastenaiva grāhya ādhir asyā brahmajāyeti ced avocat /
analyzed: hastena eva grāhyaḥ ādhiḥ asyāḥ brahma jāyā iti ced avocat
translated: If he says, The wife of the Brahman is to be taken by the hand,

original: na dūtāya praheyā tastha eṣā tathā rāṣṭraṃ gupitaṃ kṣatriyasya ////🔽yām āhus tārakaiṣā vikeśīti duchunāṃ grāmam avapadyamānām /
analyzed: na dūtāya praheyā tasthe eṣā tathā rāṣṭram gupitam kṣatriyasya  yām āhuḥ tārakā eṣā vikeśī iti duchunām grāmam avapadyamānām
translated: It is not to be sent by a messenger, it is to be taken by the king himself.🔽The wife of the Brahman, whom they call the one with the loose hair, the one with disheveled hair, the one who falls upon the village of the wicked,

original: sā brahmajāyā vi dunoti rāṣṭraṃ yatra prāpādi śaśa ulkuṣīmān ////
analyzed: sā brahma jāyā vi dunoti rāṣṭram yatra prāpādi śaśaḥ ulkuṣīmān
translated: Disturbs the kingdom of the king, where the rabbit with a lump on its head has been introduced.

original: brahmacārī carati veviṣad viṣaḥ sa devānāṃ bhavaty ekam aṅgam /
analyzed: brahmacārī carati veviṣat viṣaḥ sa devānām bhavati ekam aṅgam
translated: The celibate one moves about in his own house, he becomes one of the limbs of the gods.

original: tena jāyām anv avindad bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītāṃ juhvaṃ na devāḥ ////
analyzed: tena jāyām anu avindat bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītām juhvam na devāḥ
translated: By him Brihaspati found his wife, whom the gods led away with Soma, whom the gods took away.

original: devā vā etasyām avadanta pūrve saptaṛṣayas tapasā ye niṣeduḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ vai etasyām avadanta pūrve sapta ṛṣayaḥ tapasā ye niṣeduḥ
translated: The gods spoke on this subject, the seven Rishis of old, who sat down through austerity.

original: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasyāpanītā durdhāṃ dadhāti parame vyoman ////
analyzed: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasya apanītā durdhām dadhāti parame vyoman
translated: The terrible wife of the Brahman is taken away, she places the difficult to bear in the highest heaven.

original: ye garbhā avapadyante jagad yac cāpalupyate /
analyzed: ye garbhāḥ avapadyante jagat yat ca apalupyate
translated: Those embryos that are aborted, that which is destroyed in the world,

original: vīrā ye tṛhyante mitho brahmajāyā hinasti tān ////
analyzed: vīrāḥ ye tṛhyante mithas brahma jāyā hinasti tān
translated: Those heroes who are tormented by each other, the wife of the Brahman destroys them.

original: uta yat patayo daśa striyāḥ pūrve abrāhmaṇāḥ /
analyzed: uta yat patayaḥ daśa striyāḥ pūrve a brāhmaṇāḥ
translated: And those ten husbands of the woman before, who were not Brahmans,

original: brahmā ced dhastam agrahīt sa eva patir ekadhā ////
analyzed: brahmā ced hastam agrahīt saḥ eva patiḥ ekadhā
translated: If the Brahman takes her hand, he alone is her husband in one way.

original: brāhmaṇa eva patir na rājanyo na vaiśyaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ eva patiḥ na rājanyaḥ na vaiśyaḥ
translated: The husband is only a Brahmin, not a Kshatriya or a Vaishya.

original: tat sūryaḥ prabruvann eti pañcabhyo mānavebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: tat sūryaḥ prabruvan eti pañcabhyaḥ mānavebhyaḥ
translated: The sun proclaims this to the five human beings.

original: punar vai devā adaduḥ punar manuṣyā adaduḥ /
analyzed: punar vai devāḥ adaduḥ punar manuṣyāḥ adaduḥ
translated: The gods have given back, the men have given back.

original: rājānaḥ satyaṃ gṛhṇānā brahmajāyāṃ punar daduḥ ////
analyzed: rājānaḥ satyam gṛhṇānāḥ brahma jāyām punar daduḥ
translated: The kings, taking an oath, have given back the Brahmin's wife.

original: punardāya brahmajāyāṃ kṛtvā devair nikilbiṣam /
analyzed: punar dāya brahma jāyām kṛtvā devaiḥ nikilbiṣam
translated: Having given back the Brahmin's wife, the gods have made atonement.

original: ūrjaṃ pṛthivyā bhaktvorugāyam upāsate ////
analyzed: ūrjam pṛthivyāḥ bhaktvā urugāyam upāsate
translated: Having obtained strength from the earth, they serve the one with broad hips.

original: nāsya jāyā śatavāhī kalyāṇī talpam ā śaye /
analyzed: na asya jāyā śatavāhī kalyāṇī talpam ā śaye
translated: His hundred-carrying beautiful wife does not lie on the bed,

original: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahmajāyācittyā ////
analyzed: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā
translated: In the kingdom where the Brahmin's wife is seized by force.

original: na vikarṇaḥ pṛthuśirās tasmin veśmani jāyate /
analyzed: na vikarṇaḥ pṛthu śirāḥ tasmin veśmani jāyate
translated: In that house, a one-eared, flat-headed child is not born,

original: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahmajāyācittyā ////
analyzed: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā
translated: In the kingdom where the Brahmin's wife is seized by force.

original: nāsya kṣattā niṣkagrīvaḥ sūnānām ety agrataḥ /
analyzed: na asya kṣattā niṣka grīvaḥ sūnānām eti agratas
translated: His doorkeeper, with a golden neck, does not come in front of the slaughterhouses,

original: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahmajāyācittyā ////
analyzed: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā
translated: In the kingdom where the Brahmin's wife is seized by force.

original: nāsya śvetaḥ kṛṣṇakarṇo dhuri yukto mahīyate /
analyzed: na asya śvetaḥ kṛṣṇa karṇaḥ dhuri yuktaḥ mahīyate
translated: His white horse with black ears is not honored in the yoke,

original: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahmajāyācittyā ////
analyzed: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā
translated: In the kingdom where the Brahmin's wife is seized by force.

original: nāsya kṣetre puṣkariṇī nāṇḍīkaṃ jāyate bisam /
analyzed: na asya kṣetre puṣkariṇī na āṇḍīkam jāyate bisam
translated: In his field, a lotus with a stalk does not grow,

original: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahmajāyācittyā ////
analyzed: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā
translated: In that kingdom where the wife of a Brāhman is kept confined,

original: nāsmai pṛśniṃ vi duhanti ye 'syā doham upāsate /
analyzed: na asmai pṛśnim vi duhanti ye syāḥ doham upāsate
translated: They do not milk the dappled cow for him who attends upon her udder.

original: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahmajāyācittyā ////
analyzed: yasmin rāṣṭre nirudhyate brahma jāyā acittyā
translated: In that kingdom where the wife of a Brāhman is kept confined,

original: nāsya dhenuḥ kalyāṇī nānaḍvānt sahate dhuram /
analyzed: na asya dhenuḥ kalyāṇī na anaḍvān sahate dhuram
translated: His auspicious cow will not yield milk, nor will his bull bear the yoke.

original: vijānir yatra brahmaṇo rātriṃ vasati pāpayā ////
analyzed: vijāniḥ yatra brahmaṇaḥ rātrim vasati pāpayā
translated: Where the Brāhman's wife spends the night in misery,

original: naitāṃ te devā adadus tubhyaṃ nṛpate attave /
analyzed: na etām te devāḥ adaduḥ tubhyam nṛpate attave
translated: The gods have not given her to you, O king, to eat.

original: mā brāhmaṇasya rājanya gāṃ jighatso anādyām ////
analyzed: mā brāhmaṇasya rājanya gām jighatsaḥ anādyām
translated: Do not, O king, let hunger drive you to eat the Brāhman's cow that is not to be eaten.

original: akṣadrugdho rājanyaḥ pāpa ātmaparājitaḥ /
analyzed: akṣa drugdhaḥ rājanyaḥ pāpaḥ ātma parājitaḥ
translated: The Rājanya who is envious of dice, sinful, defeated by his own self,

original: sa brāhmaṇasya gām adyād adya jīvāni mā śvaḥ ////
analyzed: sa brāhmaṇasya gām adyāt adya jīvāni mā śvas
translated: May he eat the Brāhman's cow, today I live, not tomorrow.

original: āviṣṭitāghaviṣā pṛdākūr iva carmaṇā /
analyzed: āviṣṭitā agha viṣā pṛdākūḥ iva carmaṇā
translated: Covered with the poison of sin, like a snake with its skin,

original: sā brāhmaṇasya rājanya tṛṣṭaiṣā gaur anādyā ////
analyzed: sā brāhmaṇasya rājanya tṛṣṭā eṣā gauḥ anādyā
translated: That cow of the Brāhman, O Rājanya, is to be avoided, not to be eaten.

original: nir vai kṣatraṃ nayati hanti varco 'gnir ivārabdho vi dunoti sarvam /
analyzed: niḥ vai kṣatram nayati hanti varcaḥ gniḥ iva ārabdhaḥ vi dunoti sarvam
translated: The Kṣatriya leads it away, it destroys his splendor, like a kindled fire it burns up everything.

original: yo brāhmaṇaṃ manyate annam eva sa viṣasya pibati taimātasya ////
analyzed: yaḥ brāhmaṇam manyate annam eva sa viṣasya pibati taimātasya
translated: He who thinks the Brāhman is just food, he drinks the poison of the Timira plant.

original: ya enaṃ hanti mṛduṃ manyamāno devapīyur dhanakāmo na cittāt /
analyzed: yaḥ enam hanti mṛdum manyamānaḥ deva pīyuḥ dhana kāmaḥ na cittāt
translated: He who kills him, thinking him weak, the god-despiser, greedy for wealth, not from the heart,

original: saṃ tasyendro hṛdaye 'gnim indhe ubhe enaṃ dviṣṭo nabhasī carantam ////
analyzed: sam tasya indraḥ hṛdaye gnim indhe ubhe enam dviṣṭaḥ nabhasī carantam
translated: Indra kindles fire in his heart, both the hated worlds move him about.

original: na brāhmaṇo hiṃsitavyo 'gniḥ priyatanor iva /
analyzed: na brāhmaṇaḥ hiṃsitavyaḥ gniḥ priya tanoḥ iva
translated: For a brahmin should not be harmed, like a fire that is dear to the body.

original: somo hy asya dāyāda indro asyābhiśastipāḥ ////
analyzed: somaḥ hi asya dāyādaḥ indraḥ asya abhiśasti pāḥ
translated: For Soma is his heir, and Indra is his protector from curses.

original: śatāpāṣṭhāṃ ni girati tāṃ na śaknoti niḥkhidam /
analyzed: śata apāṣṭhām ni girati tām na śaknoti niḥkhidam
translated: He bites a hundred-knotted rope, but cannot bite it through.

original: annaṃ yo brahmaṇām malvaḥ svādv admīti manyate ////
analyzed: annam yaḥ brahmaṇām malvaḥ svādu admi iti manyate
translated: The food of brahmins, the lump, he thinks is sweet to eat.

original: jihvā jyā bhavati kulmalaṃ vāṅ nāḍīkā dantās tapasābhidigdhāḥ /
analyzed: jihvā jyā bhavati kulmalam vāc nāḍīkāḥ dantāḥ tapasā abhidigdhāḥ
translated: The tongue becomes the bowstring, the voice the bow, the teeth sharpened by austerity.

original: tebhir brahmā vidhyati devapīyūn hṛdbalair dhanurbhir devajūtaiḥ ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ brahmā vidhyati deva pīyūn hṛd balaiḥ dhanurbhiḥ deva jūtaiḥ
translated: With those, the brahmin pierces the divine drinks, with heart-strong, god-appointed bows.

original: tīkṣṇeṣavo brāhmaṇā hetimanto yām asyanti śaravyāṃ na sā mṛṣā /
analyzed: tīkṣṇa iṣavaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ hetimantaḥ yām asyanti śaravyām na sā mṛṣā
translated: The brahmins, with sharp arrows and spells, whatever arrow they shoot, it is not in vain.

original: anuhāya tapasā manyunā cota durād ava bhindanty enam ////
analyzed: anuhāya tapasā manyunā ca uta durāt ava bhindanti enam
translated: Blowing with austerity and anger, they break him from afar.

original: ye sahasram arājann āsan daśaśatā uta /🔽te brāhmaṇasya gāṃ jagdhvā vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan ////
analyzed: ye sahasram arājan āsan daśaśatāḥ uta  te brāhmaṇasya gām jagdhvā vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan
translated: Those who were a thousand, O king, and ten times a hundred,🔽the Vaitahavyas were defeated after eating the brahmin's cow.

original: gaur eva tān hanyamānā vaitahavyāṃ avātirat /
analyzed: gauḥ eva tān hanyamānā vaitahavyām avātirat
translated: The cow itself, being killed, saved the Vaitahavyas,

original: ye kesaraprābandhāyāś caramājām apeciran ////
analyzed: ye kesaraprābandhāyāḥ carama ajām apeciran
translated: who desired the last-born calf of the one with the mane.

original: ekaśataṃ tā janatā yā bhūmir vyadhūnuta /
analyzed: ekaśatam tāḥ janatāḥ yāḥ bhūmiḥ vyadhūnuta
translated: The hundred and one people who shook the earth,

original: prajāṃ hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyaṃ parābhavan ////
analyzed: prajām hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyam parābhavan
translated: Having harmed the Brahmana woman, they were defeated and became incapable.

original: devapīyuś carati martyeṣu garagīrṇo bhavaty asthibhūyān /
analyzed: deva pīyuḥ carati martyeṣu gara gīrṇaḥ bhavati asthi bhūyān
translated: The one who practices deceit towards the gods moves among mortals, bitten by poison, becoming full of bones.

original: yo brāhmaṇaṃ devabandhuṃ hinasti na sa pitṛyāṇam apy eti lokam ////
analyzed: yaḥ brāhmaṇam deva bandhum hinasti na sa pitṛyāṇam api eti lokam
translated: He who harms a Brahmana, a relative of the gods, does not go even to the world of the ancestors.

original: agnir vai naḥ padavāyaḥ somo dāyāda ucyate /
analyzed: agniḥ vai naḥ padavāyaḥ somaḥ dāyādaḥ ucyate
translated: Agni is said to be our foot-soldier, Soma our heir.

original: hantābhiśastendras tathā tad vedhaso viduḥ ////
analyzed: hantā abhiśastā indraḥ tathā tat vedhasaḥ viduḥ
translated: The slayer of the accused is Indra, so do the wise know.

original: iṣur iva digdhā nṛpate pṛdākūr iva gopate /
analyzed: iṣuḥ iva digdhā nṛpate pṛdākūḥ iva gopate
translated: O king, like an anointed arrow, like a snake, O lord of the people.

original: sā brāhmaṇasyeṣur ghorā tayā vidhyati pīyataḥ ////
analyzed: sā brāhmaṇasya iṣuḥ ghorā tayā vidhyati pīyataḥ
translated: That is the terrible arrow of the Brahmana, with which he pierces the guilty.

original: atimātram avardhanta nod iva divam aspṛśan /
analyzed: atimātram avardhanta na ud iva divam aspṛśan
translated: They grew excessively, as if they touched the sky.

original: bhṛguṃ hiṃsitvā sṛñjayā vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan ////
analyzed: bhṛgum hiṃsitvā sṛñjayāḥ vaitahavyāḥ parābhavan
translated: Having harmed Bhrigu, the Vaitahavyas of the Srinjayas were defeated.

original: ye bṛhatsāmānam āṅgirasam ārpayan brāhmaṇaṃ janāḥ /
analyzed: ye bṛhatsāmānam āṅgirasam ārpayan brāhmaṇam janāḥ
translated: Those people who imposed the Brihat-saman on the son of Angiras, the Brahmana.

original: petvas teṣām ubhayādam avis tokāny āvayat ////
analyzed: petvaḥ teṣām ubhayādam aviḥ tokāni āvayat
translated: Their offspring were destroyed on both sides by the one who was to be fed.

original: ye brāhmaṇaṃ pratyaṣṭhīvan ye vāsmiñ chulkam īṣire /
analyzed: ye brāhmaṇam pratyaṣṭhīvan ye vā asmin śulkam īṣire
translated: Those who opposed the Brahmana, those who offered a bride-price for him,

original: asnas te madhye kulyāyāḥ keśān khādanta āsate ////
analyzed: asnaḥ te madhye kulyāyāḥ keśān khādantaḥ āsate
translated: In the middle of the ditch, they sit eating the hair.

original: brahmagavī pacyamānā yāvat sābhi vijaṅgahe /
analyzed: brahma gavī pacyamānā yāvat sā abhi vijaṅgahe
translated: When the Brahmana's cow is slaughtered, as long as it is being cooked,

original: tejo rāṣṭrasya nir hanti na vīro jāyate vṛṣā ////
analyzed: tejaḥ rāṣṭrasya niḥ hanti na vīraḥ jāyate vṛṣā
translated: It destroys the splendour of the kingdom, and no heroic bull is born.

original: krūram asyā āśasanaṃ tṛṣṭaṃ piśitam asyate /
analyzed: krūram asyāḥ āśasanam tṛṣṭam piśitam asyate
translated: Her entrails are cruel, her flesh is sharp.

original: kṣīraṃ yad asyāḥ pīyate tad vai pitṛṣu kilbiṣam ////
analyzed: kṣīram yat asyāḥ pīyate tat vai pitṛṣu kilbiṣam
translated: The milk that is drunk from her, that is a sin against the fathers.

original: ugro rājā manyamāno brāhmaṇaṃ yo jighatsati /
analyzed: ugraḥ rājā manyamānaḥ brāhmaṇam yaḥ jighatsati
translated: The king who, thinking himself mighty, wishes to harm a Brahmana,

original: parā tat sicyate rāṣṭraṃ brāhmaṇo yatra jīyate ////
analyzed: parā tat sicyate rāṣṭram brāhmaṇaḥ yatra jīyate
translated: Upon him that sin falls, upon the kingdom where a Brahmana is defeated.

original: aṣṭāpadī caturakṣī catuḥśrotrā caturhanuḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭāpadī catur akṣī catur śrotrā catur hanuḥ
translated: She, becoming eight-footed, four-eyed, four-eared, four-jawed,

original: dvyāsyā dvijihvā bhūtvā sā rāṣṭram ava dhūnute brahmajyasya ////
analyzed: dvi āsyā dvi jihvā bhūtvā sā rāṣṭram ava dhūnute brahmajyasya
translated: Two-faced, two-tongued, shakes the kingdom of him who eats Brahmana's food.

original: tad vai rāṣṭram ā sravati nāvaṃ bhinnām ivodakam /
analyzed: tat vai rāṣṭram ā sravati nāvam bhinnām iva udakam
translated: That kingdom leaks out like a broken boat in the water.

original: brahmāṇaṃ yatra hiṃsanti tad rāṣṭraṃ hanti duchunā ////
analyzed: brahmāṇam yatra hiṃsanti tat rāṣṭram hanti duchunā
translated: That kingdom is destroyed by misfortune where they harm the Brahmana.

original: taṃ vṛkṣā apa sedhanti chāyāṃ no mopa gā iti /
analyzed: tam vṛkṣāḥ apa sedhanti chāyām naḥ mā upa gāḥ iti
translated: The trees drive him away, saying, Do not come into our shade.

original: yo brāhmaṇasya sad dhanam abhi nārada manyate ////
analyzed: yaḥ brāhmaṇasya sat dhanam abhi nārada manyate
translated: He who, Narada, thinks to seize the good wealth of a Brahmana.

original: viṣam etad devakṛtaṃ rājā varuṇo 'bravīt /
analyzed: viṣam etat deva kṛtam rājā varuṇaḥ bravīt
translated: This is the poison made by the gods, which King Varuna has declared.

original: na brāhmaṇasya gāṃ jagdhvā rāstre jāgāra kaś cana ////
analyzed: na brāhmaṇasya gām jagdhvā rāstre jāgāra kaḥ cana
translated: No one has ever slept in a kingdom after eating a Brahmana's cow.

original: navaiva tā navatayo yā bhūmir vyadhūnuta /
analyzed: nava eva tāḥ navatayaḥ yāḥ bhūmiḥ vyadhūnuta
translated: The ninefold path which the nine have spread out,

original: prajāṃ hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyaṃ parābhavan ////
analyzed: prajām hiṃsitvā brāhmaṇīm asaṃbhavyam parābhavan
translated: Having injured a Brahmana woman, they have become incapable of intercourse.

original: yām mṛtāyānubadhnanti kūdyaṃ padayopanīm /
analyzed: yām mṛtāya anubadhnanti kūdyam pada yopanīm
translated: The hair of the head and beard which they attach to a dead body,

original: tad vai brahmajya te devā upastaraṇam abruvan ////
analyzed: tat vai brahmajya te devāḥ upastaraṇam abruvan
translated: The gods have declared that to be the covering for one who has eaten Brahma.

original: aśrūṇi kṛpamānasya yāni jītasya vāvṛtuḥ /
analyzed: aśrūṇi kṛpamānasya yāni jītasya vāvṛtuḥ
translated: The tears which flow from the eyes of one who is weeping and defeated,

original: taṃ vai brahmajya te devā apāṃ bhāgam adhārayan ////
analyzed: tam vai brahmajya te devāḥ apām bhāgam adhārayan
translated: The gods have appointed that to be the share of water for one who has eaten Brahma.

original: yena mṛtaṃ snapayanti śmaśrūṇi yenondate /
analyzed: yena mṛtam snapayanti śmaśrūṇi yena undate
translated: By which they sprinkle the dead body and by which they anoint the beard,

original: taṃ vai brahmajya te devā apāṃ bhāgam adhārayan ////
analyzed: tam vai brahmajya te devāḥ apām bhāgam adhārayan
translated: The gods have appointed that to be the share of water for one who has eaten Brahma.

original: na varṣaṃ maitrāvaruṇaṃ brahmajyam abhi varṣati /
analyzed: na varṣam maitrāvaruṇam brahmajyam abhi varṣati
translated: The rain does not fall on one who has eaten Brahma, on one who is hostile to Mitra and Varuna.

original: nāsmai samitiḥ kalpate na mitraṃ nayate vaśam ////
analyzed: na asmai samitiḥ kalpate na mitram nayate vaśam
translated: No assembly is formed for him, no friend leads him to submission.

original: uccairghoṣo dundubhiḥ satvanāyan vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛta usṛiyābhiḥ /🔽vācaṃ kṣuṇuvāno damayant sapatnānt siṃha iva jeṣyann abhi taṃstanīhi ////
analyzed: uccairghoṣaḥ dundubhiḥ satvanāyan vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛtaḥ usṛiyābhiḥ  vācam kṣuṇuvānaḥ damayan sapatnān siṃhaḥ iva jeṣyan abhi taṃstanīhi
translated: The loud-sounding drum, the leader of beings, made of wood, collected with efforts,🔽Stretching out speech, subduing enemies, like a lion about to conquer them, beat it!

original: siṃha ivāstānīd druvayo vibaddho 'bhikrandann ṛṣabho vāsitām iva /
analyzed: siṃhaḥ iva astānīt druvayaḥ vibaddhaḥ bhikrandan ṛṣabhaḥ vāśitām iva
translated: Standing like a lion, fastened with straps, roaring like a bull to a cow,

original: vṛṣā tvaṃ vadhrayas te sapatnā aindras te śuṣmo abhimātiṣāhaḥ ////
analyzed: vṛṣā tvam vadhrayaḥ te sapatnāḥ aindraḥ te śuṣmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: Thou art a bull; thy rivals are lame. Thy strength, O Indra, is victorious over enemies.

original: vṛṣeva yūthe sahasā vidāno gavyann abhi ruva saṃdhanājit /
analyzed: vṛṣā iva yūthe sahasā vidānaḥ gavyan abhi ruva saṃdhanājit
translated: Like a bull in the herd, with violence destroying, bellowing, winning booty in the battles.

original: śucā vidhya hṛdayaṃ pareṣāṃ hitvā grāmān pracyutā yantu śatravaḥ ////
analyzed: śucā vidhya hṛdayam pareṣām hitvā grāmān pracyutāḥ yantu śatravaḥ
translated: Pierce with grief the heart of the enemies; let the foes, leaving the villages, go away, defeated.

original: saṃjayan pṛtanā ūrdhvamāyur gṛhyā gṛhṇāno bahudhā vi cakṣva /
analyzed: saṃjayan pṛtanāḥ ūrdhva māyuḥ gṛhyā gṛhṇānaḥ bahudhā vi cakṣva
translated: Uniting the armies, taking up the upward life, grasping in many ways, look around.

original: daivīṃ vācaṃ dundubha ā gurasva vedhāḥ śatrūṇām upa bharasva vedaḥ ////
analyzed: daivīm vācam dundubhe ā gurasva vedhāḥ śatrūṇām upa bharasva vedaḥ
translated: Sound the divine speech, O Dundubhi; be the creator; bring the Veda to the enemies.

original: dundubher vācaṃ prayatāṃ vadantīm āśṛṇvatī nāthitā ghoṣabuddhā /
analyzed: dundubheḥ vācam prayatām vadantīm āśṛṇvatī nāthitā ghoṣa buddhā
translated: Hearing the speech of the Dundubhi, speaking with effort, called by the sound,

original: nārī putraṃ dhāvatu hastagṛhyāmitrī bhītā samare vadhānām ////🔽pūrvo dundubhe pra vadāsi vācaṃ bhūmyāḥ pṛṣṭhe vada rocamānaḥ /🔽amitrasenām abhijañjabhāno dyumad vada dundubhe sūnṛtāvat ////
analyzed: nārī putram dhāvatu hasta gṛhya āmitrī bhītā samare vadhānām  pūrvaḥ dundubhe pra vadāsi vācam bhūmyāḥ pṛṣṭhe vada rocamānaḥ  amitra senām abhijañjabhānaḥ dyumat vada dundubhe sūnṛtāvat
translated: Let the woman run with her son, holding his hand; let the enemy, frightened, go away in the battle, defeated.🔽First, O Dundubhi, thou utterest thy voice; speak on the back of the earth, shining.🔽Shaking the army of the enemies, speak gloriously, O Dundubhi, with pleasant sound.

original: antareme nabhasī ghoṣo astu pṛthak te dhvanayo yantu śībham /
analyzed: antarā ime nabhasī ghoṣaḥ astu pṛthak te dhvanayaḥ yantu śībham
translated: Let there be sound between the two firmaments; let your sounds go separately quickly.

original: abhi kranda stanayotpipānaḥ ślokakṛn mitratūryāya svardhī ////
analyzed: abhi kranda stanaya utpipānaḥ śloka kṛt mitra tūryāya svardhī
translated: Roar forth, swelling with milk, the maker of songs, for the victory of friends.

original: dhībhiḥ kṛtaḥ pra vadāti vācam ud dharṣaya satvanām āyudhāni /
analyzed: dhībhiḥ kṛtaḥ pra vadāti vācam ud dharṣaya satvanām āyudhāni
translated: He, made by the thoughts, utters speech, and stirs up the weapons of the strong.

original: indramedī satvano ni hvayasva mitrair amitrāṃ ava jaṅghanīhi ////🔽saṃkrandanaḥ pravado dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ pravedakṛd bahudhā grāmaghoṣī /
analyzed: indra medī satvanaḥ ni hvayasva mitraiḥ amitrān ava jaṅghanīhi  saṃkrandanaḥ pravadaḥ dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ praveda kṛt bahudhā grāma ghoṣī
translated: Summon the strong ones who are devoted to Indra; with your friends crush the enemies.🔽The one who roars, the one who speaks, the one who fights with courage, the one who proclaims in many ways, the one who proclaims in the villages,

original: śriyo vanvano vayunāni vidvān kīrtim bahubhyo vi hara dvirāje ////
analyzed: śriyaḥ vayunāni vidvān kīrtim bahubhyaḥ vi hara dvi rāje
translated: The one who wins glory, knowing the ways, distribute fame among many, O king.

original: śreyaḥketo vasujit sahīyānt saṃgrāmajit saṃśito brahmaṇāsi /
analyzed: śreyaḥ keto vasu jit sahīyān saṃgrāma jit saṃśitaḥ brahmaṇā asi
translated: The one with the banner of what is best, the one who conquers wealth, the one who goes further, the one who conquers in battle, the one who is sharpened by prayer,

original: aṃśūn iva grāvādhiṣavaṇe adrir gavyan dundubhe'dhi nṛtya vedaḥ ////
analyzed: aṃśūn iva grāvā adhiṣavaṇe adriḥ gavyan dundubhe idhi nṛtya vedaḥ
translated: Like the stone pressing the wool in the press, O drum, when milking the cow, dance and sing.

original: śatrūṣāṇ nīṣād abhimātiṣāho gaveṣaṇaḥ sahamāna udbhit /
analyzed: śatrūṣāh nīṣāh abhimātiṣāhaḥ gaveṣaṇaḥ sahamānaḥ udbhid
translated: The one who protects from enemies, the one who conquers hostility, the one who seeks cattle, the one who endures, the one who rises up,

original: vāgvīva mantraṃ pra bharasva vācam sāṃgrāmajityāyeṣam ud vadeha ////🔽acyutacyut samado gamiṣṭho mṛdho jetā puraetāyodhyaḥ /
analyzed: vāgvī iva mantram pra bharasva vācam sāṃgrāmajityāya iṣam ud vada iha  acyuta cyut samadaḥ gamiṣṭhaḥ mṛdhaḥ jetā puraetā āyodhyaḥ
translated: Bring forth speech like a thought, speak the speech for the sake of victory in battle.🔽The one who moves without falling, the one who moves with intoxication, the one who goes most, the one who conquers enemies, the one who goes in front, the one who fights,

original: indreṇa gupto vidathā nicikyad dhṛddyotano dviṣatāṃ yāhi śībham ////
analyzed: indreṇa guptaḥ vidathā nicikyat dhṛd dyotanaḥ dviṣatām yāhi śībham
translated: Protected by Indra, observing the sacrifices, the one who illuminates the heart, go quickly to the enemies.

original: vihṛdayaṃ vaimanasyaṃ vadāmitreṣu dundubhe /
analyzed: vihṛdayam vaimanasyam vada amitreṣu dundubhe
translated: Disheartening, dispirited, O Dundubhi, among our enemies,

original: vidveṣaṃ kaśmaśaṃ bhayam amitreṣu ni dadhmasy ava enān dundubhe jahi ////
analyzed: vidveṣam kaśmaśam bhayam amitreṣu ni dadhmasi ava enān dundubhe jahi
translated: Enmity, strife, and fear, we place among our foes. O Dundubhi, crush them down.

original: udvepamānā manasā cakṣuṣā hṛdayena ca /
analyzed: udvepamānāḥ manasā cakṣuṣā hṛdayena ca
translated: Trembling in mind, in eye, and in heart,

original: dhāvantu bibhyato 'mitrāḥ pratrāsenājye hute ////🔽vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛta usriyābhir viśvagotryaḥ /
analyzed: dhāvantu bibhyataḥ mitrāḥ pratrāsena ājye hute  vānaspatyaḥ saṃbhṛtaḥ usriyābhiḥ viśva gotryaḥ
