translated: Let the frightened enemies flee, when the oblation of terror is offered.🔽Born of the tree, collected with the cows, of all clans,

original: pratrāsam amitrebhyo vadājyenābhighāritaḥ ////
analyzed: pratrāsam amitrebhyaḥ vada ājyena abhighāritaḥ
translated: Let terror to the enemies speak, anointed with clarified butter.

original: yathā mṛgāḥ saṃvijanta āraṇyāḥ puruṣād adhi /
analyzed: yathā mṛgāḥ saṃvijante āraṇyāḥ puruṣāt adhi
translated: As the wild beasts tremble before a man,

original: eva tvaṃ dundubhe 'mitrān abhi kranda pra trāsayātho cittāni mohaya ////
analyzed: eva tvam dundubhe mitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya
translated: So, O Dundubhi, cry out to the enemies, terrify them, and confound their minds.

original: yathā vṛkād ajāvayo dhāvanti bahu bibhyatīḥ /
analyzed: yathā vṛkāt aja avayaḥ dhāvanti bahu bibhyatīḥ
translated: As the young goats and sheep flee in fright from the wolf,

original: eva tvaṃ dundubhe 'mitrān abhi kranda pra trāsayātho cittāni mohaya ////
analyzed: eva tvam dundubhe mitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya
translated: So, O Dundubhi, cry out to the enemies, terrify them, and confound their minds.

original: yathā śyenāt patatriṇaḥ saṃvijante ahardivi siṃhasya stanathor yathā /
analyzed: yathā śyenāt patatriṇaḥ saṃvijante ahardivi siṃhasya stanathoḥ yathā
translated: As the birds tremble in the sky from the hawk, as from the lion's roar,

original: eva tvaṃ dundubhe 'mitrān abhi kranda pra trāsayātho cittāni mohaya ////
analyzed: eva tvam dundubhe mitrān abhi kranda pra trāsaya atho cittāni mohaya
translated: So, O Dundubhi, cry out to the enemies, terrify them, and confound their minds.

original: parāmitrān dundubhinā hariṇasyājinena ca /
analyzed: parā amitrān dundubhinā hariṇasya ajinena ca
translated: With the drum and the skin of the antelope, the enemies.

original: sarve devā atitrasan ye saṃgrāmasyeṣate ////
analyzed: sarve devāḥ atitrasan ye
translated: All the gods were terrified, those who desired the battle.

original: yair indraḥ prakrīḍate padghoṣaiś chāyayā saha /
analyzed: yaiḥ indraḥ prakrīḍate pad ghoṣaiḥ chāyayā saha
translated: With which Indra plays, the thunderbolts, with the shadow.

original: tair amitrās trasantu no 'mī ye yanty anīkaśaḥ ////
analyzed: taiḥ amitrāḥ trasantu naḥ mī ye yanti anīkaśas
translated: With those may our enemies be terrified, those who march in battle array.

original: jyāghoṣā dundubhayo 'bhi krośantu yā diśaḥ /
analyzed: jyā ghoṣāḥ dundubhayaḥ bhi krośantu yāḥ diśaḥ
translated: Let the twang of the bowstrings and the drums resound in all directions.

original: senāḥ parājitā yatīr amitrāṇām anīkaśaḥ ////
analyzed: senāḥ parājitāḥ yatīḥ amitrāṇām anīkaśas
translated: The defeated armies of the enemies, marching in battle array.

original: āditya cakṣur ā datsva marīcayo 'nu dhāvata /
analyzed: āditya cakṣuḥ ā datsva marīcayaḥ nu dhāvata
translated: O Āditya, grant the eye, let the rays run after.

original: patsaṅginīr ā sajantu vigate bāhuvīrye ////
analyzed: patsaṅginīḥ ā sajantu vigate bāhu vīrye
translated: Let the clinging wives be united, in the separation of the strength of arms.

original: yūyam ugrā marutaḥ pṛśnimātara indreṇa yujā pra mṛnīta śatrūn /
analyzed: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ indreṇa yujā pra mṛnīta śatrūn
translated: You fierce Maruts, born of Pṛśni, united with Indra, crush the enemies.

original: somo rājā varuṇo rājā mahādeva uta mṛtyur indraḥ ////
analyzed: somaḥ rājā varuṇaḥ rājā mahādevaḥ uta mṛtyuḥ indraḥ
translated: Soma the king, Varuṇa the king, Mahādeva and also Death, Indra.

original: etā devasenāḥ sūryaketavaḥ sacetasaḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ deva senāḥ sūrya ketavaḥ sacetasaḥ
translated: These divine armies, with the sun as their banner, united in mind,

original: amitrān no jayantu svāhā ////🔽agnis takmānam apa bādhatām itaḥ somo grāvā varuṇaḥ pūtadakṣāḥ /
analyzed: amitrān naḥ jayantu svāhā  agniḥ takmānam apa bādhatām itas somaḥ grāvā varuṇaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ
translated: May they conquer our enemies, svāhā.🔽May Agni drive away consumption from here, Soma, the pressing-stone, Varuṇa of pure power,

original: vedir barhiḥ samidhaḥ śośucānā apa dveṣāṃsy amuyā bhavantu ////
analyzed: vediḥ barhiḥ samidhaḥ śośucānāḥ apa dveṣāṃsi amuyā bhavantu
translated: The altar, the sacrificial grass, the burning kindling-sticks. May the hatreds be removed by the Amīvīya hymn.

original: ayaṃ yo viśvān haritān kṛṇoṣy ucchocayann agnir ivābhidunvan /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ viśvān haritān kṛṇoṣi ucchocayan agniḥ iva abhidunvan
translated: This Agni who burns up all the green plants, spreading and spreading,

original: adhā hi takmann araso hi bhūyā adhā nyaṅṅ adharān vā parehi ////
analyzed: adhā hi takman arasaḥ hi bhūyāḥ adhā nyaṅ adharān vā parehi
translated: Now, O lightning, be powerless, now go down or away to a lower place.

original: yaḥ paruṣaḥ pāruṣeyo 'vadhvaṃsa ivāruṇaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ paruṣaḥ pāruṣeyaḥ vadhvaṃsaḥ iva aruṇaḥ
translated: The one who is rough, the one who is rough, who rushes like a red one,

original: takmānaṃ viśvadhāvīryādharāñcaṃ parā suvā ////
analyzed: takmānam viśvadhā vīrya adharāñcam parā suva
translated: The lightning, with all his powers, drive away to a lower place.

original: adharāñcam pra hiṇomi namaḥ kṛtvā takmane /
analyzed: adharāñcam pra hiṇomi namaḥ kṛtvā takmane
translated: To a lower place I send it, having paid homage to the lightning.

original: śakambharasya muṣṭihā punar etu mahāvṛṣān ////
analyzed: śakambharasya muṣṭi hā punar etu mahāvṛṣān
translated: May it return again to the great bulls, the holder of the thunderbolt.

original: oko asya mūjavanta oko asya mahāvṛṣāḥ /
analyzed: okaḥ asya mūjavantaḥ okaḥ asya mahāvṛṣāḥ
translated: His abode is powerful, his abode is the great bull.

original: yāvaj jātas takmaṃs tāvān asi balhikeṣu nyocaraḥ ////🔽takman vyāla vi gada vyaṅga bhūri yāvaya /
analyzed: yāvat jātaḥ takman tāvān asi balhikeṣu nyocaraḥ  takman vyāla vi gada vyaṅga bhūri yāvaya
translated: As much as you are born, O lightning, so much are you a wanderer among the Balhikas.🔽O lightning, O serpent, go away, O disease, O many-colored one, drive away.

original: dāsīṃ niṣṭakvarīm icha tām vajreṇa sam arpaya ////
analyzed: dāsīm niṣṭakvarīm icha tām vajreṇa sam arpaya
translated: Seek out the slave girl who is a chatterbox, and crush her with your thunderbolt.

original: takman mūjavato gacha balhikān vā parastarām /
analyzed: takman mūjavataḥ gacha balhikān vā parastarām
translated: O lightning, go to the powerful or to the Balhikas even further away.

original: śūdrām icha prapharvyaṃ tāṃ takman vīva dhūnuhi ////
analyzed: śūdrām icha prapharvyam tām takman vi iva dhūnuhi
translated: Seek out the Shudra woman, the wanton one, and shake her, O lightning.

original: mahāvṛṣān mūjavato bandhv addhi paretya /
analyzed: mahāvṛṣān mūjavataḥ bandhū addhi paretya
translated: Return to the great bulls, the powerful ones, and eat.

original: praitāni takmane brūmo anyakṣetrāṇi vā imā ////
analyzed: pra etāni takmane brūmaḥ anya kṣetrāṇi vai imā
translated: We announce these offerings to the lightning, or to other fields.

original: anyakṣetre na ramase vaśī san mṛḍayāsi naḥ /
analyzed: anya kṣetre na ramase vaśī san mṛḍayāsi naḥ
translated: Though you are not delighted in other fields, being the controller, you favor us.

original: abhūd u prārthas takmā sa gamiṣyati balhikān ////
analyzed: abhūt u prārthaḥ takmā sa gamiṣyati balhikān
translated: The disease has become manifest; it will go to the worthless ones.

original: yat tvaṃ śīto 'tho rūraḥ saha kāsāvepayaḥ /
analyzed: yat tvam rūraḥ saha kāsā avepayaḥ
translated: When you are cold and also have a cough and trembling,

original: bhīmās te takman hetayas tābhiḥ sma pari vṛṅgdhi naḥ ////
analyzed: bhīmāḥ te takman hetayaḥ tābhiḥ sma pari vṛṅgdhi naḥ
translated: O Takman, your darts are terrible; with them do thou surround those who hate us.

original: mā smaitānt sakhīn kuruthā balāsaṃ kāsam udyugam /
analyzed: mā sma etān sakhīn kuruthāḥ balāsam kāsam udyugam
translated: Do not make these your friends: the disease, the cough, and the shivering.

original: mā smāto'rvāṅ aiḥ punas tat tvā takmann upa bruve ////
analyzed: mā smā atas urvāṅ aiḥ punar tat tvā takman upa bruve
translated: Do not come back from there; that I tell thee, O Takman.

original: takman bhrātrā balāsena svasrā kāsikayā saha /
analyzed: takman bhrātrā balāsena svasrā kāsikayā saha
translated: O Takman, with thy brother Bala, with thy sister Kasi,

original: pāpmā bhrātṛvyeṇa saha gachāmum araṇaṃ janam ////
analyzed: pāpmā bhrātṛvyeṇa saha gaccha amum araṇam janam
translated: With the evil spirit, with the enemy, go to that wretched people.

original: tṛtīyakaṃ vitṛtīyaṃ sadandim uta śāradam /
analyzed: tṛtīyakam vitṛtīyam sadandim uta śāradam
translated: The third, the thirdless, the one with a club, and the autumnal,

original: takmānaṃ śītaṃ rūraṃ graiṣmaṃ nāśaya vārṣikam ////
analyzed: takmānam śītam rūram graiṣmam nāśaya vārṣikam
translated: The cold, the red, the Takman, the winter, and the rainy, I destroy.

original: gandhāribhyo mūjavadbhyo 'ṅgebhyo magadhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: gandhāribhyaḥ mūjavadbhyaḥ ṅgebhyaḥ magadhebhyaḥ
translated: From the Gandhari, the Mujavat, the Anga, and the Magadha,

original: praiṣyan janam iva śevadhiṃ takmānaṃ pari dadmasi ////
analyzed: praiṣyan janam iva śevadhim takmānam pari dadmasi
translated: As one sends away a servant, so we cast away the Takman, like a worn-out vessel, to the people.

original: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī /
analyzed: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī
translated: The heaven and earth are bound for me, the goddess Sarasvati is bound.

original: otau ma indraś cāgniś ca krimiṃ jambhayatām iti ////
analyzed: otau me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca krimim jambhayatām iti
translated: May Indra and Agni bind the worm for me, so that he may be destroyed.

original: asyendra kumārasya krimīn dhanapate jahi /
analyzed: asya indra kumārasya krimīn dhana pate jahi
translated: O Indra, slay the worms of this prince. O Lord of wealth, destroy them.

original: hatā viśvā arātaya ugreṇa vacasā mama ////
analyzed: hatāḥ viśvāḥ arātayaḥ ugreṇa vacasā mama
translated: All the evil spirits are destroyed by the fierce words of mine.

original: yo akṣyau parisarpati yo nāse parisarpati /
analyzed: yaḥ akṣyau parisarpati yaḥ nāse parisarpati
translated: The one that creeps around the eyes, the one that creeps around the nose,

original: datāṃ yo madhyaṃ gachati taṃ krimiṃ jambhayāmasi ////
analyzed: datām yaḥ madhyam gacchati tam krimim jambhayāmasi
translated: The one that goes to the middle of the teeth, we crush that worm.

original: sarūpau dvau virūpau dvau kṛṣṇau dvau rohitau dvau /🔽babhruś ca babhrukarṇaś ca gṛdhraḥ kokaś ca te hatāḥ ////
analyzed: sarūpau dvau virūpau dvau kṛṣṇau dvau rohitau dvau  babhruḥ ca babhru karṇaḥ ca gṛdhraḥ kokaḥ ca te hatāḥ
translated: Two with similar forms, two with different forms, two black, two red,🔽The brown one and the brown-eared one, the vulture and the crow, they are destroyed.

original: ye krimayaḥ śitikakṣā ye kṛṣṇāḥ śitibāhavaḥ /
analyzed: ye krimayaḥ śiti kakṣāḥ ye kṛṣṇāḥ śiti bāhavaḥ
translated: The worms that have white flanks, the black ones with white arms,

original: ye ke ca viśvarūpās tān krimīn jambhayāmasi ////
analyzed: ye ke ca viśva rūpāḥ tān krimīn jambhayāmasi
translated: And all those of various forms, we crush those worms.

original: ut purastāt sūrya eti viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā /🔽dṛṣṭāṃś ca ghnann adṛṣṭāṃś ca sarvāṃś ca pramṛṇan krimīn ////
analyzed: ud purastāt sūryaḥ eti viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā  dṛṣṭān ca ghnan a dṛṣṭān ca sarvān ca pramṛṇan krimīn
translated: The sun rises from the east, seen by all, destroying the unseen.🔽Destroying the seen and the unseen, and crushing all the worms.

original: yevāṣāsaḥ kaṣkaṣāsa ejatkāḥ śipavitnukāḥ /
analyzed: yevāṣāsaḥ kaṣkaṣāsaḥ ejatkāḥ śipavitnukāḥ
translated: The ones that hiss, the ones that scrape, the ones that move, the ones that are scattered,

original: dṛṣṭaś ca hanyatāṃ krimir utādṛṣṭaś ca hanyatām ////
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ ca hanyatām krimiḥ uta adṛṣṭaḥ ca hanyatām
translated: Let the seen worm be destroyed, and let the unseen one be destroyed.

original: hato yevāṣaḥ krimīṇāṃ hato nadanimota /
analyzed: hataḥ yevāṣaḥ krimīṇām hataḥ nadanimā uta
translated: The hissing worms are destroyed, the roaring ones are destroyed.

original: sarvān ni maṣmaṣākaraṃ dṛṣadā khalvāṃ iva ////
analyzed: sarvān ni maṣmaṣā akaram dṛṣadā khalvān iva
translated: I have crushed all of them, like a stone on a grindstone.

original: triśīrṣāṇaṃ trikakudaṃ krimiṃ sāraṅgam arjunam /
analyzed: tri śīrṣāṇam tri kakudam krimim sāraṅgam arjunam
translated: The three-headed, three-backed worm, the variegated, the dark-colored one,

original: śṛṇāmy asya pṛṣṭīr api vṛścāmi yac chiraḥ ////
analyzed: śṛṇāmi asya pṛṣṭīḥ api vṛścāmi yat śiraḥ
translated: I crush his ribs, I crush his head.

original: atrivad vaḥ krimayo hanmi kaṇvavaj jamadagnivat /
analyzed: atri vat vaḥ krimayaḥ hanmi kaṇva vat jamadagni vat
translated: Like Atri I slay your worms, like Kanva, like Jamadagni.

original: agastyasya brahmaṇā saṃ pinaṣmy ahaṃ krimīn ////
analyzed: agastyasya brahmaṇā sam pinaṣmi aham krimīn
translated: With the Brahman of Agastya I crush the worms.

original: hato rājā krimīṇām utaiṣāṃ sthapatir hataḥ /
analyzed: hataḥ rājā krimīṇām uta eṣām sthapatiḥ hataḥ
translated: Slain is the king of the worms, and their overlord is slain.

original: hato hatamātā krimir hatabhrātā hatasvasā ////
analyzed: hataḥ hata mātā krimiḥ hata bhrātā hata svasā
translated: Slain is the worm with a slain mother, slain brother, slain sister.

original: hatāso asya veśaso hatāsaḥ pariveśasaḥ /
analyzed: hatāsaḥ asya veśasaḥ hatāsaḥ pariveśasaḥ
translated: Slain are his relatives, slain are his kinsmen.

original: atho ye kṣullakā iva sarve te krimayo hatāḥ ////
analyzed: atho ye kṣullakāḥ iva sarve te krimayaḥ hatāḥ
translated: And those that are like small ones, all those worms are slain.

original: sarveṣāṃ ca krimīṇāṃ sarvāsāṃ ca krimīnām /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca krimīṇām sarvāsām ca krimīnām
translated: Of all the worms and all the worm-like creatures,

original: bhinadmy aśmanā śiro dahāmy agninā mukham ////
analyzed: bhinadmi aśmanā śiraḥ dahāmi agninā mukham
translated: I crush the head with a stone, I burn the mouth with fire.

original: savitā prasavānām adhipatiḥ sa māvatu /
analyzed: savitā prasavānām adhipatiḥ sa mā avatu
translated: May Savitar, the overlord of instigations, protect me.

original: asmin brahmaṇy asmin karmaṇy asyāṃ purodhāyām asyām pratiṣṭhāyām asyāṃ /
analyzed: asmin brahmaṇi asmin karmaṇi asyām purodhāyām asyām pratiṣṭhāyām asyām
translated: In this prayer, in this rite, in this priesthood, in this establishment, in this

original: cittyām asyām ākūtyām asyām āśiṣy asyāṃ devahūtyāṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: cittyām asyām ākūtyām asyām āśiṣi asyām deva hūtyām svāhā
translated: inspiration, in this intention, in this hope, in this invocation of the gods, svāhā.

original: agnir vanaspatīnām adhipatiḥ sa māvatu /
analyzed: agniḥ vanaspatīnām adhipatiḥ sa mā avatu
translated: May Agni, the overlord of the trees, protect me.

original: asmin brahmaṇy asmin karmaṇy asyāṃ purodhāyām asyāṃ pratiṣṭhāyām asyāṃ /
analyzed: asmin brahmaṇi asmin karmaṇi asyām purodhāyām asyām pratiṣṭhāyām asyām

analyzed: śepaḥ garbhasya retaḥ dhāḥ sarau parṇam iva ā dadhat

original: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī bhūtānāṃ garbham ādadhe /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe
translated: Just as this great earth held the embryo of beings,

analyzed: eva ā dadhāmi te garbham tasmai tvām avase huve
translated: so I place the embryo in you. For that purpose, I invoke you for help.

original: garbhaṃ dhehi sinīvāli garbhaṃ dhehi sarasvati /
analyzed: garbham dhehi sinīvāli garbham dhehi sarasvati
translated: Place the embryo, O Sinivāli, place the embryo, O Sarasvatī.

original: garbhaṃ te aśvinobhā dhattāṃ puṣkarasrajā ////
analyzed: garbham te aśvinā ubhā ā dhattām puṣkarasrajā
translated: May the two Ashvins, wearing garlands of lotuses, place the embryo in you.

original: garbhaṃ te mitrāvaruṇau garbham devo bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: garbham te mitrāvaruṇau garbham devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ

translated: may Indra and Agni, may the creator Dhatr place the embryo in you.

original: viṣṇur yoniṃ kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yonim kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu
translated: May Viṣṇu prepare the womb, may Tvaṣṭar fashion the forms.

original: ā siñcatu prajāpatir dhātā garbhaṃ dadhātu te ////
analyzed: ā siñcatu prajāpatiḥ dhātā garbham dadhātu te
translated: May Prajāpati pour in, may the creator place the embryo in you.

original: yad veda rājā varuṇo yad vā devī sarasvatī /
analyzed: yat veda rājā varuṇaḥ yat vā devī sarasvatī
translated: What Varuna the king knows, what the goddess Sarasvatī knows,

original: yad indro vṛtrahā veda tad garbhakaraṇaṃ piba ////
analyzed: yat indraḥ vṛtra hā veda tat garbha karaṇam piba
translated: what Indra the Vr̥itra-slayer knows, drink that which causes conception.

original: garbho asy oṣadhīnāṃ garbho vanaspatīnām /🔽garbho viśvasya bhūtasya so agne garbham eha dhāḥ ////
analyzed: garbhaḥ asi oṣadhīnām garbhaḥ vanaspatīnām  garbhaḥ viśvasya bhūtasya saḥ agne garbham ā iha dhāḥ
translated: You are the embryo of the plants, the embryo of the trees.🔽You are the embryo of all that has been. O Agni, place the embryo here.

original: adhi skanda vīrayasva garbham ā dhehi yonyām /
analyzed: adhi skanda vīrayasva garbham ā dhehi yonyām
translated: Descend, be strong, place the embryo in the womb.

original: vṛṣāsi vṛṣṇyāvan prajāyai tvā nayāmasi ////
analyzed: vṛṣā asi vṛṣṇyāvan prajāyai tvā nayāmasi
translated: You are a bull, full of strength, for offspring we lead you forth.

original: vi jihīṣva bārhatsāme garbhas te yonim ā śayām /
analyzed: vi jihīṣva bārhatsāme garbhaḥ te yonim ā śayām
translated: Stretch out, O you of the Brhat-sāman, the embryo shall lie in your womb.

original: aduṣ ṭe devāḥ putraṃ somapā ubhayāvinam ////
analyzed: aduḥ te devāḥ putram soma pāḥ ubhayāvinam
translated: The gods have not given you a son who drinks Soma, who goes both ways.

original: dhātaḥ śreṣṭhena rūpeṇāsyā nāryā gavīnyoḥ /
analyzed: dhātar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ
translated: O Dhatr, with your best form, into this woman, these two cows,

original: pumāṃsaṃ putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave ////
analyzed: pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave
translated: place a male child, so that she may give birth in the tenth month.

original: tvaṣṭaḥ śreṣṭhena rūpeṇāsyā nāryā gavīnyoḥ /
analyzed: tvaṣṭar śreṣṭhena rūpeṇa asyāḥ nāryāḥ gavīnyoḥ

original: pumāṃsaṃ putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave ////

translated: place a male child, so that she may give birth in the tenth month.

translated: O Prajāpati, with your best form, into this woman, these two cows,

original: pumāṃsaṃ putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave ////
analyzed: pumāṃsam putram ā dhehi daśame māsi sūtave
translated: place a male child, so that she may give birth in the tenth month.

analyzed: yajūṃṣi yajñe samidhaḥ svāhā agniḥ pravidvān iha vaḥ yunaktu
translated: The Yajus formulas in the sacrifice, the kindling sticks, svāhā! May Agni, the wise one, yoke you here.

original: yunaktu devaḥ savitā prajānann asmin yajñe mahiṣaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: yunaktu devaḥ savitā prajānan asmin yajñe mahiṣaḥ svāhā
translated: May the wise god Savitr, the great one, yoke (you), svāhā!

analyzed: indraḥ ukthāmadāni asmin yajñe pravidvān yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā
translated: May Indra, the wise one, yoke (you) in this sacrifice, the well-yoked ones, svāhā!

analyzed: chandāṃsi yajñe marutaḥ svāhā mātā iva putram pipṛta iha yuktāḥ
translated: The metres, the Maruts, the Svāhā-offerings in the sacrifice, are yoked here, nourishing like a mother her son.

original: eyam agan barhiṣā prokṣaṇībhir yajñaṃ tanvānāditiḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: ā iyam agan barhiṣā prokṣaṇībhiḥ yajñam tanvānā aditiḥ svāhā
translated: Aditi has come with the sacrificial grass and sprinkling water, spreading the sacrifice, with Svāhā.

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yunaktu bahudhā tapāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā
translated: May Viṣṇu yoke the many austerities in this well-yoked sacrifice, with Svāhā.

original: tvaṣṭā yunaktu bahudhā nu rūpā asmin yajñe yunaktu suyujaḥ svāhā ////

translated: May Tvaṣṭṛ yoke the many forms in this well-yoked sacrifice, with Svāhā.

analyzed: bhagaḥ yunaktu āśiṣaḥ nu asmai asmin yajñe pravidvān yunaktu su yujaḥ svāhā
translated: May Bhaga yoke the blessings for us in this sacrifice, knowing well, with well-yoked Svāhā.

original: somo yunaktu bahudhā payāṃsy asmin yajñe suyujaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: somaḥ yunaktu bahudhā payāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā
translated: May Soma yoke the many juices in this well-yoked sacrifice, with Svāhā.

original: indro yunaktu bahudhā payāṃsy asmin yajñe suyujaḥ svāhā ////🔽aśvinā brahmaṇā yātam arvāñcau vaṣaṭkāreṇa yajñaṃ vardhayantau /
analyzed: indraḥ yunaktu bahudhā payāṃsi asmin yajñe su yujaḥ svāhā  aśvinā brahmaṇā yātam arvāñcau vaṣaṭkāreṇa yajñam vardhayantau
translated: May Indra yoke the many juices in this well-yoked sacrifice, with Svāhā.🔽O Aśvins, come with the Brahman, increasing the sacrifice with the Vaṣaṭ-kāra,

original: bṛhaspate brahmaṇā yāhy arvāṅ yajño ayaṃ svar idaṃ yajamānāya svāhā ////
analyzed: bṛhaspate brahmaṇā yāhi arvāṅ yajñaḥ ayam svar idam yajamānāya svāhā
translated: O Bṛhaspati, come with the Brahman, this sacrifice, this heaven, to the sacrificer, with Svāhā.

original: ūrdhvā asya samidho bhavanty ūrdhvā śukrā śocīṣy agneḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhvāḥ asya samidhaḥ bhavanti ūrdhvā śukrā śocīṣī agneḥ
translated: His kindling-sticks are upwards, upwards his pure, bright flames.

original: dyumattamā supratīkaḥ sasūnus tanūnapād asuro bhūripāṇiḥ ////
analyzed: dyumattamā su pratīkaḥ sa sūnuḥ tanūnapāt asuraḥ bhūri pāṇiḥ
translated: Most radiant, of fair countenance, with offspring, Tanūnapāt, the Asura, with wide hands.

original: devo deveṣu devaḥ patho anakti madhvā ghṛtena ////
analyzed: devaḥ deveṣu devaḥ pathaḥ anakti madhvā ghṛtena
translated: The god among the gods, the god anoints the paths with honey and ghee.

original: madhvā yajñam nakṣati praiṇāno narāśaṃso agniḥ sukṛd devaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ ////🔽achāyam eti śavasā ghṛtā cid īdāno vahnir namasā ////
analyzed: madhvā yajñam nakṣati praiṇānaḥ narāśaṃsaḥ agniḥ su kṛt devaḥ savitā viśva vāraḥ  achā ayam eti śavasā ghṛtā cit īdānaḥ vahniḥ namasā
translated: With honey he will enjoy the sacrifice, being urged on, Narāśaṁsa, the good god Agni, Savitr, the bestower of all boons.🔽He comes to this (sacrifice) with might, even with ghee, the bearer, Agni, with homage.

original: agniḥ sruco adhvareṣu prayakṣu sa yakṣad asya mahimānam agneḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ srucaḥ adhvareṣu prayakṣu sa yakṣat asya mahimānam agneḥ
translated: Agni, in sacrifices, in the oblations, he shall serve the greatness of Agni.

original: tarī mandrāsu prayakṣu vasavaś cātiṣṭhan vasudhātaraś ca ////
analyzed: tarī mandrāsu prayakṣu vasavaḥ ca atiṣṭhan vasu dhātaraḥ ca
translated: The Mandra, the Vasus, and the Vasudhataras have stood in the oblations.

original: dvāro devīr anv asya viśve vrataṃ rakṣanti viśvahā ////
analyzed: dvāraḥ devīḥ anu asya viśve vratam rakṣanti viśvahā
translated: The divine doors, all of them, guard his vow for all time.

original: uruvyacasāgner dhāmnā patyamāne /🔽ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktemaṃ yajñam avatām adhvaram naḥ ////
analyzed: uru vyacasā agneḥ dhāmnā patyamāne  ā yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā imam yajñam avatām adhvaram naḥ
translated: With wide expanse, with Agni's abode, they are shining.🔽The two, eager to serve, worship at his side. May Dawn and Night favour this sacrifice of ours, this our holy service.

original: daivā hotāra ūrdhvam adhvaraṃ no 'gner jihvayābhi gṛnata gṛnatā naḥ sviṣṭaye /
analyzed: daivāḥ hotāraḥ ūrdhvam adhvaram naḥ gneḥ jihvayā abhi gṛnata gṛnata naḥ su iṣṭaye
translated: The divine Hotars, lift up our sacrifice, sing to it with Agni's tongue, sing to it for our well-being.

original: tisro devīr barhir edaṃ sadantām iḍā sarasvatī mahī bhāratī gṛṇānā ////🔽tan nas turīpam adbhutaṃ purukṣu /
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam sadantām iḍā sarasvatī mahī bhāratī gṛṇānā  tat naḥ turīpam adbhutam purukṣu
translated: seated on this sacred grass, sing praises.🔽That wondrous food of ours, O Tvaṣṭar,

original: deva tvaṣṭā rāyas poṣaṃ vi ṣya nābhim asya ////
analyzed: deva tvaṣṭā rāyaḥ poṣam vi sya nābhim asya
translated: may the all-knowing one, the lord of wealth, extend the navel of this (earth).

original: vanaspate 'va sṛjā rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: vanaspate vaḥ sṛja rarāṇaḥ
translated: O lord of the forest, let loose, rejoicing,

original: tmanā devebhyo agnir havyaṃ śamitā svadayatu ////
analyzed: tmanā devebhyaḥ agniḥ havyam śamitā svadayatu
translated: may Agni, the purifier, make the offering acceptable to the gods.

original: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, O all-knowing one, make it acceptable.

original: indrāya yajñaṃ viśve devā havir idaṃ juṣantām ////
analyzed: indrāya yajñam viśve devāḥ haviḥ idam juṣantām
translated: May the All-gods rejoice in this oblation for Indra.

original: nava prāṇān navabhiḥ saṃ mimīte dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya /
analyzed: nava prāṇān navabhiḥ sam mimīte dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya
translated: He measures the nine breaths with the nine (verses), for long life, for a hundred autumns.

original: harite trīṇi rajate trīṇy ayasi trīṇi tapasāviṣṭitāni ////
analyzed: harite trīṇi rajate trīṇi ayasi trīṇi tapasā āviṣṭitāni
translated: Three in the green, three in the silver, three in the iron, purified by penance.

original: agniḥ sūryaś candramā bhūmir āpo dyaur antarikṣaṃ pradiśo diśaś ca /
analyzed: agniḥ sūryaḥ candramāḥ bhūmiḥ āpaḥ dyauḥ antarikṣam pradiśaḥ diśaḥ ca
translated: Agni, the sun, the moon, the earth, the waters, the sky, the atmosphere, the intermediate directions and the directions,

original: ārtavā ṛtubhiḥ saṃvidānā anena mā trivṛtā pārayantu ////
analyzed: ārtavāḥ ṛtubhiḥ saṃvidānāḥ anena mā trivṛtā pārayantu
translated: the seasons, in agreement with the (sacrificial) seasons, may they lead me across with this threefold (rite).

original: trayaḥ poṣās trivṛti śrayantām anaktu pūṣā payasā ghṛtena /
analyzed: trayaḥ poṣāḥ trivṛti śrayantām anaktu pūṣā payasā ghṛtena
translated: May the three nourishments rest in the threefold (rite). May Pūṣan anoint (us) with milk and ghee.

original: annasya bhūmā puruṣasya bhūmā bhūmā paśūnāṃ ta iha śrayantām ////
analyzed: annasya bhūmā puruṣasya bhūmā bhūmā paśūnām te iha śrayantām
translated: The abundance of food, the abundance of men, the abundance of cattle, may they rest here with you.

original: imam ādityā vasunā sam ukṣatemam agne vardhaya vavṛdhānaḥ /
analyzed: imam ādityāḥ vasunā sam ukṣata imam agne vardhaya vavṛdhānaḥ
translated: This one the Âdityas sprinkle with their treasure: this one, O Agni, prosper as thou growest.

original: imam indra saṃ sṛja vīryeṇāsmin trivṛc chrayatāṃ poṣayiṣṇu ////
analyzed: imam indra sam sṛja vīryeṇa asmin trivṛt śrayatām poṣayiṣṇu
translated: This one, O Indra, make to prosper with thy vigour: in this one let the threefold plant grow up, the nourishing.

original: bhūmiṣ ṭvā pātu haritena viśvabhṛd agniḥ pipartv ayasā sajoṣāḥ /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ tvā pātu haritena viśva bhṛt agniḥ pipartu ayasā sajoṣāḥ
translated: Let the earth protect thee with the green one, let Agni feed thee with iron in unison.

original: vīrudbhiṣ ṭe arjunaṃ saṃvidānaṃ dakṣaṃ dadhātu sumanasyamānam ////
analyzed: vīrudbhiḥ te arjunam saṃvidānam dakṣam dadhātu sumanasyamānam
translated: Let the plants give thee the green one in agreement, let them make thee strong, well-disposed.

original: tredhā jātam janmanedaṃ hiraṇyam agner ekaṃ priyatamaṃ babhūva somasyaikaṃ hiṃsitasya parāpatat /
analyzed: tredhā jātam janmanā idam hiraṇyam agneḥ ekam priyatamam babhūva somasya ekam hiṃsitasya parāpatat
translated: This gold, born threefold, became one most dear to Agni, one fell down from the injured Soma.

original: apām ekaṃ vedhasāṃ reta āhus tat te hiraṇyaṃ trivṛd astv āyuṣe ////
analyzed: apām ekam vedhasām retaḥ āhuḥ tat te hiraṇyam trivṛt astu āyuṣe
translated: They say one belongs to the waters, the creators' seed. Let that gold of thine be threefold for thy life.

original: tryāyuṣaṃ jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tryāyuṣam /
analyzed: tri āyuṣam jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tri āyuṣam
translated: The threefold life of Jamadagni, the threefold life of Kasyapa,

original: tredhāmṛtasya cakṣaṇaṃ trīṇy āyūṃṣi te 'karam ////
analyzed: tredhā amṛtasya cakṣaṇam trīṇi āyūṃṣi te karam
translated: The threefold watch of immortality, three lives have I made for thee.

original: trayaḥ suparṇās trivṛtā yad āyann ekākṣaram abhisaṃbhūya śakrāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ suparṇāḥ trivṛtā yat āyan eka akṣaram abhisaṃbhūya śakrāḥ
translated: The three Suparnas, the three-powered, when they came together to the one syllable, the Shakers,

original: praty auhan mṛtyum amṛtena sākam antardadhānā duritāni viśvā ////
analyzed: prati auhat mṛtyum amṛtena sākam antardadhānāḥ duritāni viśvā
translated: They carried away death with immortality, concealing all evils.

original: divas tvā pātu haritaṃ madhyāt tvā pātv arjunam /
analyzed: divaḥ tvā pātu haritam madhyāt tvā pātu arjunam
translated: Let the green one from the sky protect thee, let the green one from the middle protect thee,

original: bhūmyā ayasmayaṃ pātu prāgād devapurā ayam ////
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ ayasmayam pātu prāgāt deva purā ayam
translated: May this iron (weapon) protect thee from the earth, from the east, from the city of the gods.

original: imās tisro devapurās tās tvā rakṣantu sarvataḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ tisraḥ deva purāḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu sarvatas
translated: These are the three cities of the gods; may they protect thee on every side.

original: tās tvaṃ bibhrad varcasvy uttaro dviṣatāṃ bhava ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvam bibhrat varcasvī uttaraḥ dviṣatām bhava
translated: Bearing them, be resplendent and superior to thy enemies.

original: puraṃ devānām amṛtaṃ hiraṇyam ya ābedhe prathamo devo agre /
analyzed: puram devānām amṛtam hiraṇyam yaḥ ābedhe prathamaḥ devaḥ agre
translated: The golden city of the gods, the immortal, which the first god fashioned in the beginning,

original: tasmai namo daśa prācīḥ kṛṇomy anu manyatāṃ trivṛd ābadhe me ////
analyzed: tasmai namaḥ daśa prācīḥ kṛṇomi anu manyatām trivṛt ābadhe me
translated: to him I offer ten eastwards; may the three-versed one approve my fashioning.

original: ā tvā cṛtatv aryamā pūṣā bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā cṛtatu aryamā pūṣā bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: May Aryaman, Pusan, and Brihaspati fashion thee.

original: aharjātasya yan nāma tena tvāti cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: ahar jātasya yat nāma tena tvā ati cṛtāmasi
translated: With the name of him who was born in the day, we fashion thee beyond.

original: ṛtubhiṣ ṭvārtavair āyuṣe varcase tvā /
analyzed: ṛtubhiḥ tvā ārtavaiḥ āyuṣe varcase tvā
translated: With the seasons and the seasonal (verses), for life, for splendour, for thee,

original: saṃvatsarasya tejasā tena saṃhanu kṛṇmasi ////🔽ghṛtād ulluptam madhunā samaktaṃ bhūmidṛṃham acyutam pārayiṣṇu /
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya tejasā tena saṃhanu kṛṇmasi  ghṛtāt ulluptam madhunā samaktam bhūmidṛṃham acyutam pārayiṣṇu
translated: with the brilliance of the year, therewith I make the jaw firm.🔽Scraped from the ghee, anointed with honey, firm on the earth, unshaken, capable of bearing,

original: bhindat sapatnān adharāṃś ca kṛṇvad ā mā roha mahate saubhagāya ////
analyzed: bhindat sapatnān adharān ca kṛṇvat ā mā roha mahate saubhagāya
translated: breaking enemies and making them low, rise up for great good fortune.

original: purastād yukto vaha jātavedo 'gne viddhi kriyamāṇam yathedam /
analyzed: purastāt yuktaḥ vaha jātavedaḥ gne viddhi kriyamāṇam yathā idam
translated: O Jātavedas, yoked in front, carry (the oblation); O Agni, know how this is being done.

original: tvaṃ bhiṣag bheṣajasyāsi kartā tvayā gām aśvaṃ puruṣaṃ sanema ////
analyzed: tvam bhiṣaj bheṣajasya asi kartā tvayā gām aśvam puruṣam sanema
translated: Thou art the physician, the maker of medicine; by thee may we obtain cattle, horses, men.

original: tathā tad agne kṛṇu jātavedo viśvebhir devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ /
analyzed: tathā tat agne kṛṇu jātavedaḥ viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ
translated: So do thou, O Agni, O all-knower, make it, in agreement with all the gods,

original: yo no dideva yatamo jaghāsa yathā so asya paridhiṣ patāti ////
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dideva yatamaḥ jaghāsa yathā saḥ asya paridhiḥ patāti
translated: Whoever has devoured it, whatever one has eaten, that he may escape from his grasp.

original: yathā so asya paridhiṣ patāti tathā tad agne kṛṇu jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: yathā saḥ asya paridhiḥ patāti tathā tat agne kṛṇu jātavedaḥ
translated: As he may escape from his grasp, so do thou, O Agni, O all-knower, make it,

original: viśvebhir devair saha saṃvidānaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ
translated: In agreement with all the gods.

original: akṣyau ni vidhya hṛdayaṃ ni vidhya jihvāṃ ni tṛnddhi pra dato mṛṇīhi /
analyzed: akṣyau ni vidhya hṛdayam ni vidhya jihvām ni tṛnddhi pra dataḥ mṛṇīhi
translated: Pierce his eyes, pierce his heart, cut out his tongue, crush his teeth.

original: piśāco asya yatamo jaghāsāgne yaviṣṭha prati śṛṇīhi ////
analyzed: piśācaḥ asya yatamaḥ jaghāsa agne yaviṣṭha prati śṛṇīhi
translated: Whatever piśāca has devoured of him, O Agni, most youthful, destroy it.

original: yad asya hṛtaṃ vihṛtaṃ yat parābhṛtam ātmano jagdhaṃ yatamat piśācaiḥ /
analyzed: yat asya hṛtam vihṛtam yat parābhṛtam ātmanaḥ jagdham yatamat piśācaiḥ
translated: Whatever of his has been stolen, carried away, taken away, eaten by the piśācas,

original: tad agne vidvān punar ā bhara tvaṃ śarīre māṃsam asum erayāmaḥ ////
analyzed: tat agne vidvān punar ā bhara tvam śarīre māṃsam asum erayāmaḥ
translated: That, O Agni, knowing, bring back again. We put flesh and life into his body.

original: āme supakve śabale vipakve yo mā piśāco aśane dadambha /
analyzed: āme su pakve śabale vipakve yaḥ mā piśācaḥ aśane dadambha
translated: In raw, well-cooked, speckled, half-cooked food, whatever piśāca has seized me in eating,

original: tad ātmanā prajayā piśācā vi yātayantām agado 'yam astu ////
analyzed: tat ātmanā prajayā piśācāḥ vi yātayantām agadaḥ yam astu
translated: May the piśācas, with their own selves and offspring, be scattered. Let this one be free from disease.

original: kṣire mā manthe yatamo dadambhākṛṣṭapacye aśane dhānye yaḥ /
analyzed: kṣire mā manthe yatamaḥ dadambha akṛṣṭapacye aśane dhānye yaḥ
translated: Whatever has seized me in milk, in curds, in food cooked by plowing, in grain,

original: tad ātmanā prajayā piśācā vi yātayantām agado 'yam astu ////
analyzed: tat ātmanā prajayā piśācāḥ vi yātayantām agadaḥ yam astu
translated: Let the Piśācas, with their own selves and their offspring, destroy it. Let this man be free from disease.

original: apāṃ mā pāne yatamo dadambha kravyād yātūnām śayane śayānam /
analyzed: apām mā pāne yatamaḥ dadambha kravyād yātūnām śayane śayānam
translated: Whatever one has done in the drinking of water, lying down on the bed of flesh-eating demons,

original: tad ātmanā prajayā piśācā vi yātayantām agado 'yam astu ////
analyzed: tat ātmanā prajayā piśācāḥ vi yātayantām agadaḥ yam astu
translated: Let the Piśācas, with their own selves and their offspring, destroy it. Let this man be free from disease.

original: divā mā naktaṃ yatamo dadambha kravyād yātūnām śayane śayānam /
analyzed: divā mā naktam yatamaḥ dadambha kravyād yātūnām śayane śayānam
translated: Whatever one has done by day or night, lying down on the bed of flesh-eating demons,

original: tad ātmanā prajayā piśācā vi yātayantām agado 'yam astu ////
analyzed: tat ātmanā prajayā piśācāḥ vi yātayantām agadaḥ yam astu
translated: Let the Piśācas, with their own selves and their offspring, destroy it. Let this man be free from disease.

original: kravyādam agne rudhiraṃ piśācaṃ manohanaṃ jahi jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: kravya adam agne rudhiram piśācam manaḥ hanam jahi jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, burn the flesh-eating demon, the blood-sucking Piśāca, the mind-stealing one, O all-knower.

original: tam indro vājī vajreṇa hantu chinattu somaḥ śiro asya dhṛṣṇuḥ ////🔽sanād agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ /
analyzed: tam indraḥ vājī vajreṇa hantu chinattu somaḥ śiraḥ asya dhṛṣṇuḥ  sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ
translated: Let the powerful Indra slay him with his thunderbolt, let Soma, the bold one, cut off his head.🔽From of old, O Agni, thou crushest the demons; the Rakṣas have not conquered thee in battles.

original: sahamūrān anu daha kravyādo mā te hetyā mukṣata daivyāyāḥ ////
analyzed: sahamūrān anu daha kravyādaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ
translated: Burn the flesh-eaters along with the strong ones; let not thy divine dart escape the flesh-eater.

original: samāhara jātavedo yad dhṛtaṃ yat parābhṛtam /🔽gātrāṇy asya vardhantām aṃśur ivā pyāyatām ayam ////
analyzed: samāhara jātavedaḥ yat dhṛtam yat parābhṛtam  gātrāṇi asya vardhantām aṃśuḥ iva ā pyāyatām ayam
translated: O all-knower, collect what has been taken away and what has been carried off.🔽Let his limbs grow, let him swell like a shoot.

original: somasyeva jātavedo aṃśur ā pyāyatām ayam /
analyzed: somasya iva jātavedaḥ aṃśuḥ ā pyāyatām ayam
translated: O all-knower, let him swell like a shoot of Soma.

original: agne virapśinaṃ medhyam ayakṣmaṃ kṛṇu jīvatu ////
analyzed: agne virapśinam medhyam ayakṣmam kṛṇu jīvatu
translated: O Agni, make him free from consumption, fit for sacrifice, free from disease, let him live.

original: etās te agne samidhaḥ piśācajambhanīḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ piśāca jambhanīḥ
translated: These are your kindling sticks, O Agni, that crush the Piśāca demons.

original: tās tvaṃ juṣasva prati cainā gṛhāṇa jātavedaḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvam juṣasva prati ca enāḥ gṛhāṇa jātavedaḥ
translated: Accept them, O all-knowing one, and take them back to yourself.

original: tārṣṭāghīr agne samidhaḥ prati gṛhṇāhy arciṣā /
analyzed: tārṣṭāghīḥ agne samidhaḥ prati gṛhṇāhi arciṣā
translated: O Agni, accept the kindling sticks that crush the Tṛṣṭā demons with your flame.

original: jahātu kravyād rūpaṃ yo asya māṃsaṃ jihīrṣati ////
analyzed: jahātu kravyād rūpam yaḥ asya māṃsam jihīrṣati
translated: Let him who desires to eat its flesh abandon the form of a flesh-eater.

original: āvatas ta āvataḥ parāvatas ta āvataḥ /
analyzed: āvataḥ te āvataḥ parāvataḥ te āvataḥ
translated: From the near, from the far, from the very far, from here,

original: ihaiva bhava mā nu gā mā pūrvān anu gāḥ pitṝn asuṃ badhnāmi te dṛḍham ////
analyzed: iha eva bhava mā nu gāḥ mā pūrvān anu gāḥ pitṝn asum badhnāmi te dṛḍham
translated: stay here, do not go away, do not follow the ancestors. I firmly bind you to life.

original: yat tvābhiceruḥ puruṣaḥ svo yad araṇo janaḥ /
analyzed: yat tvā abhiceruḥ puruṣaḥ svaḥ yat araṇaḥ janaḥ
translated: If a man or a stranger has wronged you,

original: unmocanapramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te ////
analyzed: unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te
translated: I speak to you with my voice both the unbinding and the releasing.

original: yad dudrohitha śepiṣe striyai puṃse acittyā /
analyzed: yat dudrohitha śepiṣe striyai puṃse acittyā
translated: If you have offended a sleeping woman or a thoughtless man,

original: unmocanapramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te ////
analyzed: unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te
translated: I speak to you with my voice both the unbinding and the releasing.

original: yat enaso mātṛkṛtāc cheṣe pitṛkṛtāc ca yat /
analyzed: yat enasaḥ mātṛ kṛtāt śeṣe pitṛ kṛtāt ca yat
translated: If you have any remainder from the sin committed by your mother or by your father,

original: unmocanapramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te ////
analyzed: unmocana pramocane ubhe vācā vadāmi te
translated: I speak to you with my voice both the unbinding and the releasing.

original: yat te mātā yat te pitā jamir bhrātā ca sarjataḥ /
analyzed: yat te mātā yat te pitā jamiḥ bhrātā ca sarjataḥ
translated: Whatever your mother, your father, your sister, or your brother have released,

original: pratyak sevasva bheṣajaṃ jaradaṣṭiṃ kṛṇomi tvā ////
analyzed: pratyak sevasva bheṣajam jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā
translated: I make thee young again.

original: ihaidhi puruṣa sarveṇa manasā saha /
analyzed: iha edhi puruṣa sarveṇa manasā saha
translated: Come hither, O man, with all thy mind.

original: dūtau yamasya mānu gā adhi jīvapurā ihi ////
analyzed: dūtau yamasya mā anu gāḥ adhi jīva purā ihi
translated: Go to the two messengers of Yama, go to the city of the living.

original: anuhūtaḥ punar ehi vidvān udayanaṃ pathaḥ /
analyzed: anuhūtaḥ punar ehi vidvān udayanam pathaḥ
translated: Summoned again, come back, knowing the way of rising up.

original: ārohaṇam ākramaṇaṃ jīvatojīvato 'yanam ////
analyzed: ārohaṇam ākramaṇam jīvataḥ jīvataḥ yanam
translated: The ascent, the approach, the going of the living to the living.

original: mā bibher na mariṣyasi jaradaṣṭiṃ kṛṇomi tvā /🔽nir avocam ahaṃ yakṣmam aṅgebhyo aṅgajvaraṃ tava ////
analyzed: mā bibheḥ na mariṣyasi jaradaṣṭim kṛṇomi tvā  niḥ avocam aham yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ aṅga jvaram tava
translated: Do not be afraid, thou shalt not die, I make thee young again.🔽I have uttered the consumption from thy limbs, the fever of the limbs.

original: aṅgabhedo aṅgajvaro yaś ca te hṛdayāmayaḥ /
analyzed: aṅga bhedaḥ aṅga jvaraḥ yaḥ ca te hṛdaya āmayaḥ
translated: The limb-breaking, the limb-fever, and the heart-disease that is in thee,

original: yakṣmaḥ śyena iva prāpaptad vacā sāḍhaḥ parastarām ////
analyzed: yakṣmaḥ śyenaḥ iva prāpaptat vacā sāḍhaḥ parastarām
translated: The consumption has flown away like a hawk, the speech has flown farther away.

original: ṛṣī bodhapratībodhāv asvapno yaś ca jāgṛviḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣī bodha pratībodhau asvapnaḥ yaḥ ca jāgṛviḥ
translated: The Rishis, the awakener and the awakener, and he who is not asleep but watchful,

original: tau te prāṇasya goptārau divā naktaṃ ca jāgṛtām ////
analyzed: tau te prāṇasya goptārau divā naktam ca jāgṛtām
translated: May they, the guardians of thy breath, watch by day and by night.

original: ayam agnir upasadya iha sūrya ud etu te /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ upasadyaḥ iha sūryaḥ ud etu te
translated: This Agni has approached, here let the sun rise for thee.

original: udehi mṛtyor gambhīrāt kṛṣṇāc cit tamasas pari ////
analyzed: udehi mṛtyoḥ gambhīrāt kṛṣṇāt cit tamasaḥ pari
translated: Rise up from the deep of death, from the black darkness around.

original: namo yamāya namo astu mṛtyave namaḥ pitṛbhya uta ye nayanti /
analyzed: namaḥ yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave namaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ uta ye nayanti
translated: Homage to Yama, homage be to Death, homage to the Fathers who lead.

original: utpāraṇasya yo veda tam agniṃ puro dadhe 'smā ariṣṭatātaye ////
analyzed: utpāraṇasya yaḥ veda tam agnim puras dadhe smaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: He who knows the release of Agni, him I place in front for his safety.

original: aitu prāṇa aitu mana aitu cakṣur atho balam /
analyzed: aitu prāṇa aitu manaḥ aitu cakṣuḥ atha u balam
translated: Let the breath come, let the mind come, let the eye come, and let strength come.

original: śarīram asya sam vidāṃ tat padbhyāṃ prati tiṣṭhatu ////
analyzed: śarīram asya sam tat padbhyām prati tiṣṭhatu
translated: Let the body of this one be united with the limbs. Let it stand firm on its feet.

original: prāṇenāgne cakṣuṣā saṃ sṛjemaṃ sam īraya tanvā saṃ balena /🔽vetthāmṛtasya mā nu gān mā nu bhūmigṛho bhuvat ////
analyzed: prāṇena agne cakṣuṣā sam sṛja imam sam īraya tanvā sam balena  vettha amṛtasya mā nu gāt mā nu bhūmi gṛhaḥ bhuvat
translated: With breath, O Agni, and with eye, unite him, and let him rise with body and with strength.🔽Know thou the immortal, let not the house of the earth be for thee.

original: mā te prāṇa upa dasan mo apāno 'pi dhāyi te /
analyzed: mā te prāṇaḥ upa dasat mā u apānaḥ pi dhāyi te
translated: Let not thy breath fail thee, let not thy expiration fail thee.

original: sūryas tvādhipatir mṛtyor udāyachatu raśmibhiḥ ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ tvā adhipatiḥ mṛtyoḥ udāyacchatu raśmibhiḥ
translated: Let Surya, the lord, deliver thee from death with his rays.

original: iyam antar vadati jihvā baddhā paniṣpadā /
analyzed: iyam antar vadati jihvā baddhā paniṣpadā
translated: This tongue speaks within, bound, with its feet cut off.

original: tvayā yakṣmam nir avocaṃ śataṃ ropīś ca takmanaḥ ////
analyzed: tvayā yakṣmam niḥ avocam śatam ropīḥ ca takmanaḥ
translated: With thee I have uttered consumption, a hundred thorns, and fever.

original: ayaṃ lokaḥ priyatamo devānām aparājitaḥ /
analyzed: ayam lokaḥ priyatamaḥ devānām aparājitaḥ
translated: This world is the most beloved of the gods, the unconquered.

original: yasmai tvam iha mṛtyave diṣṭaḥ puruṣa jajñiṣe /
analyzed: yasmai tvam iha mṛtyave diṣṭaḥ puruṣa jajñiṣe
translated: To whom thou hast been appointed here, O man, to die, when thou wast born.

original: sa ca tvānu hvayāmasi mā purā jaraso mṛthāḥ ////
analyzed: sa ca tvā anu hvayāmasi mā purā jarasaḥ mṛthāḥ
translated: And we call thee to us, that thou mayst not die before old age.

original: yāṃ te cakrur āme pātre yāṃ cakrur miśradhānye /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ āme pātre yām cakruḥ miśra dhānye
translated: What they have done in a raw vessel, what they have done in mixed grain,

original: āme māṃse kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: āme māṃse kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in raw flesh, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te cakruḥ kṛkavākāv aje vā yāṃ kurīriṇi /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ kṛkavākau aje vā yām kurīriṇi
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the two Kṛkavākas, or in the goat, or in the Kūrīriṇi,

original: avyāṃ te kṛtyāṃ yām cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: avyām te kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the ewe, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te cakrur ekaśaphe paśūnām ubhayādati /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ ekaśaphe paśūnām ubhayādati
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the one-hoofed animals, or in the two-hoofed,

original: gardabhe kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: gardabhe kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the ass, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te cakrur amūlāyāṃ valagaṃ vā narācyām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ amūlāyām valagam vā narācyām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the rootless plant, or in the man-hating,

original: kṣetre te kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: kṣetre te kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in thy field, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te cakrur gārhapatye pūrvāgnāv uta duścitaḥ /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ gārhapatye pūrva agnau uta duścitaḥ
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the Gārhapatya, or in the eastern fire, or in the ill-made,

original: śālāyāṃ kṛtyāṃ yām cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: śālāyām kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in thy hall, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te cakruḥ sabhāyāṃ yām cakrur adhidevane /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ sabhāyām yām cakruḥ adhidevane
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the assembly, or in the gambling house,

original: akṣeṣu kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: akṣeṣu kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the dice, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te cakruḥ senāyāṃ yāṃ cakrur iṣvāyudhe /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ senāyām yām cakruḥ iṣu āyudhe
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the army, or in the weapon,

original: dundubhau kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: dundubhau kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they wrought in the drum, I drive it back again to them.

original: yāṃ te kṛtyām kūpe 'vadadhuḥ śmaśāne vā nicakhnuḥ /
analyzed: yām te kṛtyām kūpe vadadhuḥ śmaśāne vā nicakhnuḥ
translated: The witchcraft that they have buried in a pit for thee, or dug up in the burial-ground,

original: sadmani kṛtyām yāṃ cakruḥ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: sadmani kṛtyām yām cakruḥ punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they have wrought in thy house, that I draw back to them again.

original: yāṃ te cakruḥ puruṣāsthe agnau saṃkasuke ca yām /
analyzed: yām te cakruḥ puruṣa asthe agnau saṃkasuke ca yām
translated: The witchcraft that they have wrought in thy bones, in the fire, in the Sankusuka,

original: mrokaṃ nirdāhaṃ kravyādaṃ punaḥ prati harāmi tām ////
analyzed: mrokam nirdāham kravyādam punar prati harāmi tām
translated: The witchcraft that they have wrought in thy flesh, in thy blood, in thy body, that I draw back to them again.

original: apathenā jabhāraināṃ tāṃ pathetaḥ pra hiṇmasi /
analyzed: a pathena jabhāra enām tām pathā itas pra hiṇmasi
translated: By an unlawful way she has brought this on thee; from that way we drive it off.

original: adhīro maryādhīrebhyaḥ saṃ jabhārācittyā ////
analyzed: adhīraḥ marya adhīrebhyaḥ sam jabhāra acittyā
translated: The unsteady one has brought it on the steady ones, the unthought one on the thoughtful.

original: yaś cakāra na śaśāka kartuṃ śaśre pādam aṅgurim /
analyzed: yaḥ cakāra na śaśāka kartum śaśre pādam aṅgurim
translated: He who has done it, but has not been able to do it, has cried out, has cut off a foot, a finger,

original: cakāra bhadram asmabhyam abhago bhagavadbhyaḥ ////
analyzed: cakāra bhadram asmabhyam abhagaḥ bhagavadbhyaḥ
translated: He has done well for us, the luckless one for the lucky ones.

original: kṛtyākṛtaṃ valaginaṃ mūlinaṃ śapatheyyam /
analyzed: kṛtyā kṛtam valaginam mūlinam śapatheyyam
translated: The witchcraft-wrought, the spell-bound, the rooted, the oath-bound,

original: indras taṃ hantu mahatā vadhenāgnir vidhyatv astayā ////
analyzed: indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena agniḥ vidhyatu astayā
translated: May Indra slay him with great slaughter, may Agni pierce him with his dart.

original: doṣo gāya bṛhad gāya dyumad dhehi /
analyzed: doṣaḥ gāya bṛhat gāya dyumat dhehi
translated: Sing forth, O Dosagaya, sing forth, O Brihadgaya, sing forth, O Dyumnagaya.

original: ātharvaṇa stuhi devaṃ savitāram ////
analyzed: ātharvaṇa stuhi devam savitāram
translated: Praise the god Savitar, O Atharvana.

original: tam u ṣṭuhi yo antaḥ sindhau sūnuḥ /
analyzed: tam u stuhi yaḥ antar sindhau sūnuḥ
translated: Praise him who is the son within the river,

original: satyasya yuvānam adroghavācaṃ suśevam ////
analyzed: satyasya yuvānam adrogha vācam su śevam
translated: The young one of truth, of guileless speech, of fair favour.

original: sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sāviṣad amṛtāni bhūri /
analyzed: sa gha naḥ devaḥ savitā sāviṣat amṛtāni bhūri
translated: May that god Savitar grant us wide room, many immortal blessings,

original: ubhe suṣṭutī sugātave ////
analyzed: ubhe suṣṭutī sugātave
translated: Both hymns are well sung for easy understanding.

original: indrāya somam ṛtvijaḥ sunotā ca dhāvata /
analyzed: indrāya somam ṛtvijaḥ sunota ca dhāvata
translated: For Indra, the priests, press the Soma and run.

original: stotur yo vacaḥ śṛṇavad dhavaṃ ca me ////🔽ā yaṃ viśantīndavo vayo na vṛkṣam andhasaḥ /
analyzed: stotuḥ yaḥ vacaḥ śṛṇavat havam ca me  ā yam viśanti indavaḥ vayaḥ na vṛkṣam andhasaḥ
translated: He who listens to the singer's words and my call.🔽Into whom the Soma juices enter, as the life-breath enters the tree, O you who have a beautiful tongue.

original: virapśin vi mṛdho jahi rakṣasvinīḥ ////
analyzed: virapśin vi mṛdhaḥ jahi rakṣasvinīḥ
translated: Destroy the enemies, the Rākṣasas.

original: sunotā somapāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe /
analyzed: sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe
translated: Press the Soma for the Soma-drinker, Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: yuvā jeteśānaḥ sa puruṣṭutaḥ ////
analyzed: yuvā jetā īśānaḥ sa puruṣṭutaḥ
translated: The young one, the lord, the conqueror, he who is praised by many.

original: pātaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇāditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ /
analyzed: pātam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ
translated: May Indra-Pūṣan, Aditi, the Maruts protect us.

original: apāṃ napāt sindhavaḥ sapta pātana pātu no viṣṇur uta dyauḥ ////
analyzed: apām napāt sindhavaḥ sapta pātana pātu naḥ viṣṇuḥ uta dyauḥ
translated: May the waters' lord, the seven rivers protect us. May Viṣṇu and the sky protect us.

original: pātāṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī abhiṣṭaye pātu grāvā pātu somo no aṃhasaḥ /
analyzed: pātām naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī abhiṣṭaye pātu grāvā pātu somaḥ naḥ aṃhasaḥ
translated: May Dyaus and Pṛthivī protect us for help. May the stone, may Soma protect us from distress.

original: pātu no devī subhagā sarasvatī pātv agniḥ śivā ye asya pāyavaḥ ////
analyzed: pātu naḥ devī subhagā sarasvatī pātu agniḥ śivāḥ ye asya pāyavaḥ
translated: May the blessed goddess Sarasvatī protect us. May Agni, the auspicious ones who are his attendants, protect us.

original: pātām no devāśvinā śubhas patī uṣāsānaktota na uruṣyatām /
analyzed: pātām naḥ deva aśvinā śubhas patī uṣāsānaktā uta naḥ uruṣyatām
translated: May the two gods Aśvins, lords of splendor, and dawn and night protect us.

original: apāṃ napād abhihrutī gayasya cid deva tvaṣṭar vardhaya sarvatātaye ////
analyzed: apām napāt abhihrutī gayasya cit deva tvaṣṭar vardhaya sarvatātaye
translated: May Tvaṣṭar, the waters' lord, the swift one, even of Gayas's sacrifice, O god, make all prosper for our support.

original: tvaṣṭā me daivyaṃ vacaḥ parjanyo brahmaṇas patiḥ /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā me daivyam vacaḥ parjanyaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: Tvaṣṭar, the divine speech, Parjanya, the lord of prayer,

original: putrair bhrātṛbhir aditir nu pātu no duṣṭaraṃ trāyamāṇaṃ sahaḥ ////
analyzed: putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ aditiḥ nu pātu naḥ duṣṭaram trāyamāṇam sahaḥ
translated: May Aditi with her sons and brothers protect us, invincible, saving might.

original: aṃśo bhago varuṇo mitro aryamāditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ /
analyzed: aṃśaḥ bhagaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā aditiḥ pāntu marutaḥ
translated: May Amsha, Bhaga, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Aditi, the Maruts protect us.

original: apa tasya dveṣo gamed abhihruto yāvayac chatrum antitam ////
analyzed: apa tasya dveṣaḥ gamet abhihrutaḥ yāvayat śatrum anti tam
translated: May his hatred pass away, averted, may he drive away the hostile one who is near.

original: dhiye sam aśvinā prāvataṃ na uruṣyā ṇa urujmann aprayuchan /
analyzed: dhiye sam aśvinā prāvatam naḥ uruṣyā naḥ uru jman aprayuchan
translated: O Asvins, help our thought. Protect us, O ye of wide paths, not deserting us.

original: dyauṣ pitar yāvaya duchunā yā ////
analyzed: dyauḥ pitar yāvaya duchunā yā
translated: O father Dyaus, drive away evil.

original: ud enam uttaraṃ nayāgne ghṛtenāhuta /
analyzed: ud enam uttaram naya agne ghṛtena āhuta
translated: Carry him up, O Agni, offered with ghee, to the highest.

original: sam enaṃ varcasā sṛja prajayā ca bahuṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: sam enam varcasā sṛja prajayā ca bahum kṛdhi
translated: Fill him with splendour, make him rich in offspring.

original: indremaṃ prataraṃ kṛdhi sajātānām asad vaśī /
analyzed: indra imam prataram kṛdhi sajātānām asat vaśī
translated: Make him victorious, O Indra, let him be the lord of his equals.

original: rāyas poṣeṇa saṃ sṛja jīvātave jarase naya ////
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam sṛja jīvātave jarase naya
translated: Join him with the increase of wealth, lead him to life and old age.

original: yasya kṛṇmo havir gṛhe tam agne vardhayā tvam /
analyzed: yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe tam agne vardhaya tvam
translated: Him in whose house we make an oblation, him, O Agni, do thou increase.

original: tasmai somo adhi bravad ayaṃ ca brahmaṇas patiḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat ayam ca brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: May Soma and this Brahmanaspati favour him.

original: yo 'smān brahmaṇas pate 'devo abhimanyate /
analyzed: yaḥ smān brahmaṇas pate devaḥ abhimanyate
translated: O Brahmanaspati, him who hates us, O god,

original: sarvaṃ tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate ////
analyzed: sarvam tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate
translated: thou makest him all a prey to me, to the sacrificer who presses (Soma).

original: yo naḥ soma suśaṃsino duḥśaṃsa ādideśati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ soma su śaṃsinaḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ ādideśati
translated: O Soma, him who, O well-praised one, hates us, the ill-praised one,

original: vajreṇāsya mukhe jahi sa saṃpiṣṭo apāyati ////
analyzed: vajreṇa asya mukhe jahi sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati
translated: With thy thunderbolt crush his mouth, and he, crushed together, goes away.

original: yo naḥ somābhidāsati sanābhir yaś ca niṣṭyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ soma abhidāsati sanābhiḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ
translated: He who hates us, O Soma, whether a kinsman or a stranger,

original: apa tasya balaṃ tira mahīva dyaur vadhatmanā ////
analyzed: apa tasya balam tira mahī iva dyauḥ vadhatmanā
translated: Crush his strength, O mighty one, as the heaven crushes the earth with its blow.

original: yena somāditiḥ pathā mitrā vā yanty adruhaḥ /
analyzed: yena soma aditiḥ pathā mitrāḥ vā yanti adruhaḥ
translated: By the path, O Soma, by which Aditi, or the guileless friends, go,

original: tenā no 'vasā gahi ////
analyzed: tena naḥ vasā gahi
translated: By that (path) come to us with help.

original: yena soma sāhantyāsurān randhayāsi naḥ /
analyzed: yena soma sāhantyā asurān randhayāsi naḥ
translated: By which, O Soma, thou hast overcome the Asuras and hast granted us (victory),

original: tenā no adhi vocata ////
analyzed: tena naḥ adhi vocata
translated: By that (path) do thou favour us.

original: yena devā asurāṇām ojāṃsy avṛṇīdhvam /
analyzed: yena devāḥ asurāṇām ojāṃsi avṛṇīdhvam
translated: By which, O gods, ye have chosen the powers of the Asuras,

original: tenā naḥ śarma yachata ////
analyzed: tena naḥ śarma yacchata
translated: By that (path) grant us protection.

original: yathā vṛkṣaṃ libujā samantaṃ pariṣasvaje /
analyzed: yathā vṛkṣam libujā samantam pariṣasvaje
translated: As the libuja creeper embraces a tree on all sides,

original: evā pari ṣvajasva māṃ yathā māṃ kāminy aso yathā man nāpagā asaḥ ////
analyzed: eva pari svajasva mām yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagā asaḥ
translated: So embrace me, that I may love thee, that I may not leave thee.

original: yathā suparṇaḥ prapatan pakṣau nihanti bhūmyām /
analyzed: yathā suparṇaḥ prapatan pakṣau nihanti bhūmyām
translated: As a bird flying strikes its wings on the ground,

original: evā ni hanmi te mano yathā māṃ kāminy aso yathā man nāpagā asaḥ ////
analyzed: eva ni hanmi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagā asaḥ
translated: So I strike thy mind, that thou mayst love me, that thou mayst not leave me.

original: yatheme dyāvāpṛthivī sadyaḥ paryeti sūryaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ime dyāvāpṛthivī sadyas paryeti sūryaḥ
translated: As the sun suddenly encircles these two, heaven and earth,

original: evā pary emi te mano yathā māṃ kāminy aso yathā man nāpagā asaḥ ////
analyzed: eva pari emi te manaḥ yathā mām kāminī asaḥ yathā mat na āpagā asaḥ
translated: So I encircle thy mind, that thou mayst love me, that thou mayst not leave me.

original: vāñcha me tanvaṃ pādau vāñchākṣyau vāñcha sakthyau /
analyzed: vāñcha me tanvam pādau vāñcha akṣyau vāñcha sakthyau
translated: Desire my body, desire my feet, desire my thighs, desire my shanks.

original: akṣyau vṛṣaṇyantyāḥ keśā māṃ te kāmena śuṣyantu ////
analyzed: akṣyau vṛṣaṇyantyāḥ keśāḥ mām te kāmena śuṣyantu
translated: Let the eyes of the one who desires me, let the hair, dry up through love for me.

original: mama tvā doṣaṇiśriṣaṃ kṛṇomi hṛdayaśriṣam /
analyzed: mama tvā doṣaṇiśriṣam kṛṇomi hṛdaya śriṣam
translated: I make you dependent on my hips, dependent on my heart.

original: yathā mama kratāv aso mama cittam upāyasi ////
analyzed: yathā mama kratau asaḥ mama cittam upāyasi
translated: So that you may be obedient to my will, and come under my control.

original: yāsāṃ nābhir ārehaṇaṃ hṛdi saṃvananaṃ kṛtam gāvo ghṛtasya mātaro 'mūṃ saṃ vānayantu me ////
analyzed: yāsām nābhiḥ ārehaṇam hṛdi saṃvananam kṛtam gāvaḥ ghṛtasya mātaraḥ mūm sam vānayantu me
translated: Whose navel is the place of meeting, whose heart is the place of love, may the cows, the mothers of ghee, bring her to me for love.

original: pṛthivyai śrotrāya vanaspatibhyo 'gnaye 'dhipataye svāhā ////
analyzed: pṛthivyai śrotrāya vanaspatibhyaḥ gnaye dhipataye svāhā
translated: To earth, to hearing, to the trees, to Agni as overlord, hail!

original: prāṇāyāntarikṣāya vayobhyo vāyave 'dhipataye svāhā ////
analyzed: prāṇāya antarikṣāya vayobhyaḥ vāyave dhipataye svāhā
translated: To breath, to the atmosphere, to birds, to Vayu as overlord, hail!

original: dive cakṣuṣe nakṣatrebhyaḥ sūryāyādhipataye svāhā ////
analyzed: dive cakṣuṣe nakṣatrebhyaḥ sūryāya adhipataye svāhā
translated: To heaven, to sight, to the stars, to Surya as overlord, hail!

original: śamīm aśvattha ārūḍhas tatra puṃsuvanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: śamīm aśvatthaḥ ārūḍhaḥ tatra puṃsuvanam kṛtam
translated: The Ashvattha tree has climbed the Shami tree, there the male-making rite was performed.

original: tad vai putrasya vedanaṃ tat strīṣv ā bharāmasi ////
analyzed: tat vai putrasya vedanam tat strīṣu ā bharāmasi
translated: That is the knowledge of a son, that we bring forth in women.

original: puṃsi vai reto bhavati tat striyām anu ṣicyate /
analyzed: puṃsi vai retaḥ bhavati tat striyām anu sicyate
translated: The seed is indeed in the male, it is poured into the female.

original: tad vai putrasya vedanaṃ tat prajāpatir abravīt ////
analyzed: tat vai putrasya vedanam tat prajāpatiḥ abravīt
translated: That is the knowledge of a son, that Prajapati has declared.

original: prajāpatir anumatiḥ sinīvāly acīkḷpat /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ sinīvālī acīkḷpat
translated: Prajapati, Anumati, and Sinivali have arranged it.

original: straiṣūyam anyatra dadhat pumāṃsam u dadhat iha ////
analyzed: straiṣūyam anyatra dadhat pumāṃsam u dadhat iha
translated: Placing envy elsewhere, placing a male here.

original: pari dyām iva sūryo 'hīnāṃ janimāgamam /
analyzed: pari dyām iva sūryaḥ hīnām janimā agamam
translated: I have come to the birth of the Ahīna sacrifice, as the sun to the sky.

original: rātrī jagad ivānyad dhaṃsāt tenā te vāraye viṣam ////
analyzed: rātrī jagat iva anyat haṃsāt tena te vāraye viṣam
translated: As night to the moving world, with that I ward off your poison.

original: yad brahmabhir yad ṛṣibhir yad devair viditaṃ purā /
analyzed: yat brahmabhiḥ yat ṛṣibhiḥ yat devaiḥ viditam purā
translated: What was known in the past by the Brahmins, the seers, and the gods,

original: yad bhūtaṃ bhavyam āsanvat tenā te vāraye viṣam ////
analyzed: yat bhūtam bhavyam āsanvat tena te vāraye viṣam
translated: What is past, present, and future, with that I ward off your poison.

original: madhvā pṛñce nadyaḥ parvatā girayo madhu /
analyzed: madhvā pṛñce nadyaḥ parvatāḥ girayaḥ madhu
translated: The rivers are anointed with honey, the mountains and the hills with honey.

original: madhu paruṣṇī śīpālā śam āsne astu śaṃ hṛde ////
analyzed: madhu paruṣṇī śīpālā śam āsne astu śam hṛde
translated: May the honey of the Śīpālā Paruṣṇī be for your good, and for your heart's good.

original: namo devavadhebhyo namo rājavadhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ deva vadhebhyaḥ namaḥ rāja vadhebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to the killers of gods, homage to the killers of kings.

original: atho ye viśyānāṃ vadhās tebhyo mṛtyo namo 'stu te ////
analyzed: atho ye viśyānām vadhāḥ tebhyaḥ mṛtyo namaḥ stu te
translated: And homage to you, O Death, for the killers of the common people.

original: namas te adhivākāya parāvākāya te namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te adhivākāya parāvākāya te namaḥ
translated: Homage to your overseer, homage to your overseer.

original: sumatyai mṛtyo te namo durmatyai te idaṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: sumatyai mṛtyo te namaḥ durmatyai te idam namaḥ
translated: Homage to your good will, O Death, homage to your bad will.

original: namas te yātudhānebhyo namas te bheṣajebhyaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te yātudhānebhyaḥ namaḥ te bheṣajebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to your demons, homage to your medicines.

original: namas te mṛtyo mūlebhyo brāhmaṇebhya idaṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: namaḥ te mṛtyo mūlebhyaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ idam namaḥ
translated: Homage to you, O Death, for your root-Brahmins.

original: asthisraṃsaṃ parusraṃsam āsthitam hṛdayāmayam /
analyzed: asthi sraṃsam paru sraṃsam āsthitam hṛdaya āmayam
translated: The dislocation of bones, the dislocation of joints, the heart disease,

original: balāsaṃ sarvaṃ nāśayāṅgeṣṭhā yaś ca parvasu ////🔽nir balāsaṃ balāsinaḥ kṣiṇomi muṣkaraṃ yathā /🔽chinadmy asya bandhanaṃ mūlam urvārvā iva ////
analyzed: balāsam sarvam nāśaya aṅgeṣṭhāḥ yaḥ ca parvasu  niḥ balāsam balāsinaḥ kṣiṇomi muṣkaram yathā  chinadmi asya bandhanam mūlam urvārvā iva
translated: And all the humours that are in the joints.🔽I drive away the humours, as one drives away a mouse,🔽I cut the bonds of this one, as one cuts the root of a plant.

original: nir balāsetaḥ pra patāśuṅgaḥ śiśuko yathā /
analyzed: niḥ balāsa itas pra pata aśuṅgaḥ śiśukaḥ yathā
translated: From this one I drive away the humours, as a spark of fire, as a young child.

original: atho ita iva hāyano 'pa drāhy avīrahā ////
analyzed: atha u itas iva hāyana u pa drāhi a vīra hā
translated: And as one who is old, so may he quickly go away, not slaying the hero.

original: uttamo asy oṣadhīnāṃ tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ /
analyzed: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ
translated: Thou art the best of plants, to thee the trees are subject.

original: upastir astu so 'smākaṃ yo asmāṃ abhidāsati ////
analyzed: upastiḥ astu saḥ smākam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Let him be subject to us who hates us.

original: sabandhuś cāsabandhuś ca yo asmāṃ abhidāsati /
analyzed: sabandhuḥ ca a sabandhuḥ ca yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Whether he be related or unrelated to us who hates us,

original: teṣāṃ sā vṛkṣāṇām ivāhaṃ bhūyāsam uttamaḥ ////
analyzed: teṣām sā vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ
translated: May I be like the trees among them, the best.

original: yathā soma oṣadhīnām uttamo haviṣāṃ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ oṣadhīnām uttamaḥ haviṣām kṛtaḥ
translated: As Soma is made the best of the plants, the oblations,

original: talāśā vṛkṣāṇām ivāhaṃ bhūyāsam uttamaḥ ////
analyzed: talāśāḥ vṛkṣāṇām iva aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ
translated: As Tālaśā is among the trees, so may I be the best.

original: ābayo anābayo rasas ta ugra ābayo /
analyzed: ābayo anābayo rasaḥ te ugraḥ ābayo
translated: The strong juice, O Abayo and Anābayo, is yours.

original: ā te karambham admasi ////
analyzed: ā te karambham admasi
translated: We eat your food.

original: vihahlo nāma te pitā madāvatī nāma te mātā /
analyzed: vihahlaḥ nāma te pitā madāvatī nāma te mātā
translated: Vihahla is the name of your father, Madāvatī is the name of your mother.

original: sa hina tvam asi yas tvam ātmānam āvayaḥ ////
analyzed: sa hina tvam asi yaḥ tvam ātmānam āvayaḥ
translated: You are indeed the one who has saved yourself.

original: tauvilike 'velayāvāyam ailaba ailayīt /
analyzed: tauvilike velayā ava ayam ailabaḥ ailayīt
translated: Tauvilīka, Avayā, this one has made Ailab Ailayit.

original: babhruś ca babhrukarṇaś cāpehi nir āla ////
analyzed: babhruḥ ca babhru karṇaḥ ca apehi niḥ āla
translated: And Babhru and Babhrukarna, go out, O Nirala,

original: alasālāsi pūrva silāñjālāsy uttarā /
analyzed: alasālā asi silāñjālā asi uttarā
translated: O Alasa, you are the eastern one, O Silañjala, you are the northern one.

original: nīlāgalasāla ////
analyzed: nīlāgalasāla
translated: O Nilagala, O Alasa,

original: yatheyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānāṃ garbham ādadhe /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī bhūtānām garbham ādadhe
translated: Just as this great earth held the embryo of beings,

original: evā te dhriyatāṃ garbho anu sūtuṃ savitave ////
analyzed: eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave
translated: So may your embryo be held for the sake of giving birth to Savita.

original: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāremān vanaspatīn /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra imān vanaspatīn
translated: Just as this great earth supports these forest trees,

original: evā te dhriyatāṃ garbho anu sūtuṃ savitave ////
analyzed: eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave
translated: So may your embryo be held for the sake of giving birth to Savita.

original: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāra parvatān girīn /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra parvatān girīn
translated: Just as this great earth supports the mountains and hills,

original: evā te dhriyatāṃ garbho anu sūtuṃ savitave ////
analyzed: eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave
translated: So may your embryo be held for the sake of giving birth to Savita.

original: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāra viṣṭhitaṃ jagat /
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra viṣṭhitam jagat
translated: Just as this great earth supports the world that is spread out,

original: evā te dhriyatāṃ garbho anu sūtuṃ savitave ////
analyzed: eva te dhriyatām garbhaḥ anu sūtum savitave
translated: So may your embryo be held for the sake of giving birth to Savita.

original: īrṣyāyā dhrājiṃ prathamāṃ prathamasyā utāparām /
analyzed: īrṣyāyāḥ dhrājim prathamām prathamasyāḥ uta aparām
translated: The first and the second of the flights of envy,

original: agniṃ hṛdayyaṃ śokaṃ taṃ te nir vāpayāmasi ////🔽yathā bhūmir mṛtamanā mṛtān mṛtamanastarā /
analyzed: agnim hṛdayyam śokam tam te niḥ vāpayāmasi  yathā bhūmiḥ mṛta manāḥ mṛtāt mṛtamanastarā
translated: The grief in the heart, that fire, we drive away from you.🔽Just as the earth is mortal-minded towards the dead, and the dead are more mortal-minded than the dead,

original: yathota mamruṣo mana everṣyor mṛtaṃ manaḥ ////
analyzed: yathā uta mamruṣaḥ manaḥ eva īrṣyoḥ mṛtam manaḥ
translated: Just as the mind of one who has lost a child, so is the mind of an envious person dead.

original: ado yat te hṛdi śritaṃ manaskaṃ patayiṣṇukam /
analyzed: adaḥ yat te hṛdi śritam manaskam patayiṣṇukam
translated: That which is in thy heart, that which is in thy mind, that which is inclined to fly away,

original: tatas ta īrṣyāṃ muñcāmi nir ūṣmāṇaṃ dṛter iva ////
analyzed: tatas te īrṣyām muñcāmi niḥ ūṣmāṇam dṛteḥ iva
translated: From that I loose thy jealousy, as from a burning house one who is without heat.

original: punantu mā devajanāḥ punantu manavo dhiyā /
analyzed: punantu mā deva janāḥ punantu manavaḥ dhiyā
translated: May the hosts of the gods purify me, may the thoughts purify me with their thought.

original: punantu viśvā bhūtāni pavamānaḥ punātu mā ////
analyzed: punantu viśvā bhūtāni pavamānaḥ punātu mā
translated: May all beings purify me, may Pavamana purify me.

original: pavamānaḥ punātu mā kratve dakṣāya jīvase /
analyzed: pavamānaḥ punātu mā kratve dakṣāya jīvase
translated: May Pavamana purify me for insight, for power, for life,

original: atho ariṣṭatātaye ////
analyzed: atha u ariṣṭatātaye
translated: And also for freedom from misfortune.

original: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca /
analyzed: ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca
translated: With both, O god Savitar, with the purifying and with the impulse,

original: asmān punīhi cakṣase ////
analyzed: asmān punīhi cakṣase
translated: Do thou purify me for the beholding.

original: agner ivāsya dahata eti śuṣmiṇa uteva matto vilapann apāyati /
analyzed: agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ eti śuṣmiṇaḥ uta iva mattaḥ vilapan apāyati
translated: He goes like one burning with fire, the strong one, as if intoxicated, he goes away lamenting.

original: anyam asmad ichatu kaṃ cid avratas tapurvadhāya namo astu takmane ////
analyzed: anyam asmat icchatu kam cit avrataḥ tapuḥ vadhāya namaḥ astu takmane
translated: Let him seek another than us, some one who is not devoted to the slaying of the sinner. Homage be to Takman.

original: namo rudrāya namo astu takmane namo rājñe varuṇāya tviṣīmate /
analyzed: namaḥ rudrāya namaḥ astu takmane namaḥ rājñe varuṇāya tviṣīmate
translated: Homage to Rudra, homage to Takman, homage to the radiant king Varuna.

original: namo dive namaḥ pṛthivyai nama oṣadhībhyaḥ ////
analyzed: namaḥ dive namaḥ pṛthivyai namaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ
translated: Homage to heaven, homage to earth, homage to the plants.

original: ayaṃ yo abhiśocayiṣṇur viśvā rūpāṇi haritā kṛṇoṣi /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ abhiśocayiṣṇuḥ viśvā rūpāṇi haritā kṛṇoṣi
translated: This one who is inclined to burn, who assumes all forms, the green one,

original: tasmai te 'ruṇāya babhrave namaḥ kṛṇomi vanyāya takmane ////
analyzed: tasmai te ruṇāya babhrave namaḥ kṛṇomi vanyāya takmane
translated: To that red, tawny one of yours, to the wild Takman, I offer homage.

original: imā yās tisraḥ pṛthivīs tāsāṃ ha bhūmir uttamā /🔽tāsām adhi tvaco ahaṃ bheṣajaṃ sam u jagrabham ////
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ tāsām ha bhūmiḥ uttamā  tāsām adhi tvacaḥ aham bheṣajam sam u jagrabham
translated: These three earths which are here, of them the earth is the highest.🔽On the skin of these I have taken the best medicine.

original: śreṣṭham asi bheṣajānāṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ vīrudhānām /
analyzed: śreṣṭham asi bheṣajānām vasiṣṭham vīrudhānām
translated: You are the best of medicines, the most excellent of plants.

original: somo bhaga iva yāmeṣu deveṣu varuṇo yathā ////
analyzed: somaḥ bhagaḥ iva yāmeṣu deveṣu varuṇaḥ yathā
translated: Like Soma among the Yamas, like Varuna among the gods.

original: revatīr anādhṛṣaḥ siṣāsavaḥ siṣāsatha /
analyzed: revatīḥ anādhṛṣaḥ siṣāsavaḥ siṣāsatha
translated: You rich ones, unconquered, thirsty, do you wish to drink.

original: uta stha keśadṛmhaṇīr atho ha keśavardhanīḥ ////
analyzed: uta stha keśa dṛmhaṇīḥ atha u ha keśa vardhanīḥ
translated: And you are the hair-loosening ones, and also the hair-growing ones.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ niyānaṃ harayaḥ suparṇā apo vasānā divam ut patanti /
analyzed: kṛṣṇam niyānam harayaḥ suparṇāḥ apaḥ vasānāḥ divam ud patanti
translated: The dark-hued birds, the tawny-winged, clothed in water, fly up to the sky.

original: ta āvavṛtrant sadanād ṛtasyād id ghṛtena pṛthivīṃ vy ūduḥ ////🔽payasvatīḥ kṛṇuthāpa oṣadhīḥ śivā yad ejathā maruto rukmavakṣasaḥ /
analyzed: te āvavṛtran sadanāt ṛtasya āt id ghṛtena pṛthivīm vi ūduḥ  payasvatīḥ kṛṇutha apaḥ oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ yat ejatha marutaḥ rukma vakṣasaḥ
translated: They have turned back from the seat of truth, and have filled the earth with ghee.🔽Make the plants rich in milk and wholesome, when you go, O Maruts, with golden breasts.

original: ūrjaṃ ca tatra sumatiṃ ca pinvata yatrā naro marutaḥ siñcathā madhu ////
analyzed: ūrjam ca tatra sumatim ca pinvata yatra naraḥ marutaḥ siñcatha madhu
translated: There, where you sprinkle honey, O men, O Maruts, increase the strength and favor.

original: udapruto marutas tāṃ iyarta vṛṣṭir yā viśvā nivatas pṛṇāti /
analyzed: uda prutaḥ marutaḥ tām iyarta vṛṣṭiḥ yā viśvāḥ nivataḥ pṛṇāti
translated: O Maruts, the swift ones, let that rain come, which fills all the hollows.

original: ejāti glahā kanyeva tunnairuṃ tundānā patyeva jāyā ////
analyzed: ejāti glahā kanyā iva tunnā erum tundānā patyā iva jāyā
translated: The loud one goes like a maiden, with the sound of the lute, with the sound of the drum, like a wife to her husband.

original: sasruṣīs tad apaso divā naktaṃ ca sasruṣīḥ /
analyzed: sasruṣīḥ tat apasaḥ divā naktam ca sasruṣīḥ
translated: The spinning ones, the spinning ones by day and night,

original: vareṇyakratur aham apo devīr upa hvaye ////🔽otā āpaḥ karmaṇyā muñcantv itaḥ praṇītaye /
analyzed: vareṇya kratuḥ aham apaḥ devīḥ upa hvaye  otāḥ āpaḥ karmaṇyāḥ muñcantu itas praṇītaye
translated: I call upon the divine waters, the most excellent oblation.🔽The waters that are set in motion, that are fit for work, let them loose from here for guidance.

original: sadyaḥ kṛṇvantv etave ////
analyzed: sadyas kṛṇvantu etave
translated: Let them quickly make it ready for use.

original: devasya savituḥ save karma kṛṇvantu mānuṣāḥ /
analyzed: devasya savituḥ save karma kṛṇvantu mānuṣāḥ
translated: Let men perform their work at the impulse of the god Savitar.

original: śaṃ no bhavantv apa oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ bhavantu apaḥ oṣadhīḥ śivāḥ
translated: Be auspicious to us, O waters, and herbs.

original: himavataḥ pra sravanti sindhau samaha saṅgamaḥ /
analyzed: himavataḥ pra sravanti sindhau samaha saṅgamaḥ
translated: From the Himalayas they flow, their meeting is in the river.

original: āpo ha mahyaṃ tad devīr dadan hṛddyotabheṣajam ////
analyzed: āpaḥ ha mahyam tat devīḥ dadan hṛddyota bheṣajam
translated: That heart-illuminating remedy, O divine waters, do ye grant to me.

original: yan me akṣyor ādidyota pārṣṇyoḥ prapadoś ca yat /
analyzed: yat me akṣyoḥ ādidyota pārṣṇyoḥ prapadoḥ ca yat
translated: Whatever has been injured in my eyes, in my heels and toes,

original: āpas tat sarvaṃ niṣ karan bhiṣajāṃ subhiṣaktamāḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ tat sarvam niḥ karan bhiṣajām su bhiṣaktamāḥ
translated: The waters have made all that well again, the best of physicians.

original: sindhupatnīḥ sindhurājñīḥ sarvā yā nadya sthana /
analyzed: sindhu patnīḥ sindhu rājñīḥ sarvāḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ sthana
translated: Ye whose lord is the river, ye whose king is the river, all ye rivers that are here,

original: datta nas tasya bheṣajaṃ tenā vo bhunajāmahai ////
analyzed: datta naḥ tasya bheṣajam tena vaḥ bhunajāmahai
translated: Grant us that remedy, and by it may we enjoy you.

original: pañca ca yāḥ pañcāśac ca saṃyanti manyā abhi /
analyzed: pañca ca yāḥ pañcāśat ca saṃyanti manyāḥ abhi
translated: And those five-and-fifty which come together, the veins of the neck,

original: itas tāḥ sarvā naśyantu vākā apacitām iva ////
analyzed: itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva
translated: From here let all of them perish, like the words of an unheeded one.

original: sapta ca yāḥ saptatiś ca saṃyanti graivyā abhi /
analyzed: sapta ca yāḥ saptatiḥ ca saṃyanti graivyāḥ abhi
translated: And those seven-and-seventy which come together, the veins of the neck,

original: itas tāḥ sarvā naśyantu vākā apacitām iva ////
analyzed: itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva
translated: From here let all of them perish, like the words of an unheeded one.

original: nava ca yā navatiś ca saṃyanti skandhyā abhi /
analyzed: nava ca yāḥ navatiḥ ca saṃyanti skandhyāḥ abhi
translated: And the nine and the ninety which come together in the skandhya,

original: itas tāḥ sarvā naśyantu vākā apacitām iva ////
analyzed: itas tāḥ sarvāḥ naśyantu vākāḥ apacitām iva
translated: From here may all of them perish, like the words of an unheeded one.

original: ava mā pāpmant sṛja vaśī san mṛdayāsi naḥ /
analyzed: ava mā pāpman sṛja vaśī san mṛdayāsi naḥ
translated: Do not release evil upon us, being the lord, be gracious to us.

original: ā mā bhadrasya loke pāpman dhehy avihrutam ////
analyzed: ā mā bhadrasya loke pāpman dhehi a vihrutam
translated: O evil, place me unhindered in the world of the good.

original: yo naḥ pāpman na jahāsi tam u tvā jahimo vayam /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ pāpman na jahāsi tam u tvā jahimaḥ vayam
translated: O evil, we destroy you whom you do not abandon.

original: pathām anu vyāvartane 'nyaṃ pāpmānu padyatām ////
analyzed: pathām anu vyāvartane nyam pāpmā anu padyatām
translated: On the turning back of paths, may evil befall another.

original: anyatrāsman ny ucyatu sahasrākṣo amartyaḥ /
