analyzed: anyatra asmat ni ucyatu sahasra akṣaḥ amartyaḥ
translated: May the thousand-eyed immortal speak of us elsewhere.

original: yaṃ dveṣāma tam ṛchatu yam u dviṣmas tam ij jahi ////
analyzed: yam dveṣāma tam ṛchatu yam u dviṣmaḥ tam id jahi
translated: Let it strike him whom we hate, kill him whom we hate.

original: devāḥ kapota iṣito yad ichan dūto nirṛtyā idam ājagāma /
analyzed: devāḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ yat ichan dūtaḥ nirṛtyāḥ idam ājagāma
translated: O gods, the dove sent by Nirrti, desiring this, has come here as a messenger.

original: tasmā arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtiṃ śaṃ no astu dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade ////🔽śivaḥ kapota iṣito no astv anāgā devāḥ śakuno gṛhaṃ naḥ /🔽agnir hi vipro juṣatām havir naḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī no vṛṇaktu ////
analyzed: tasmai arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtim śam naḥ astu dvipade śam catuṣpade  śivaḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ naḥ astu anāgāḥ devāḥ śakunaḥ gṛham naḥ  agniḥ hi vipraḥ juṣatām haviḥ naḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī naḥ vṛṇaktu
translated: To him let us offer praise, let us make atonement. May we have well-being for our bipeds and quadrupeds.🔽May the dove sent by us be auspicious to us, O gods, may the bird come to our house without harm.🔽For Agni, the priest, delights in our offering. May the missile flying around us spare us.

original: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhāty asmān āṣṭrī padaṃ kṛṇute agnidhāne /
analyzed: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhāti asmān āṣṭrī padam kṛṇute agnidhāne
translated: The flying missile does not deceive us. The female eagle makes a place in the fire-altar.

original: śivo gobhya uta puruṣebhyo no astu mā no devā iha hiṃsīt kapota ////🔽ṛcā kapotaṃ nudata praṇodam iṣaṃ madantaḥ pari gāṃ nayāmaḥ /
analyzed: śivaḥ gobhyaḥ uta puruṣebhyaḥ naḥ astu mā naḥ devāḥ iha hiṃsīt kapota  ṛcā kapotam nudata praṇodam iṣam madantaḥ pari gām nayāmaḥ
translated: May Śiva be to us from the cows and from the men. Let not the god here harm the dove.🔽With a verse, drive away the dove, the disturber. Rejoicing in food, we lead the cow around.

original: saṃlobhayanto duritā padāni hitvā na ūrjaṃ pra padāt pathiṣṭhaḥ ////
analyzed: saṃlobhayantaḥ duritā padāni hitvā naḥ ūrjam pra padāt
translated: Alluring away the feet of evil, leaving, he has stepped on strength, the most frequented path.

original: parīme 'gnim arṣata parīme gām aneṣata /
analyzed: pari ime gnim pari ime gām aneṣata
translated: These have flowed around the fire, these have led the cow around.

original: deveṣv akrata śravaḥ ka imāṃ ā dadharṣati ////
analyzed: deveṣu akrata śravaḥ kaḥ imān ā dadharṣati
translated: They have made fame among the gods. Who will dare to attack these?

original: yaḥ prathamaḥ pravatam āsasāda bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśānaḥ /🔽yo 'syeśe dvipado yaś catuṣpadas tasmai yamāya namo astu mṛtyave ////
analyzed: yaḥ prathamaḥ pravatam āsasāda bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśānaḥ  yaḥ sya īśe dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave
translated: He who first has occupied the path, looking along the path for many,🔽to whom belongs this man and this beast, to that Yama, to Death, let us pay homage.

original: amūn hetiḥ patatriṇī ny etu yad ulūko vadati mogham etat /
analyzed: amūn hetiḥ patatriṇī ni etu yat ulūkaḥ vadati mogham etat
translated: Let the flying dart come down upon them, what the owl speaks is in vain.

original: yad vā kapota padam agnau kṛṇoti ////
analyzed: yat vā kapota padam agnau kṛṇoti
translated: Or what the dove does in the fire.

original: yau te dūtau nirṛta idam eto 'prahitau prahitau vā gṛhaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: yau te dūtau nirṛte idam prahitau prahitau vā gṛham naḥ
translated: Those two, O Nirrti, who come to us as messengers, unbidden or bidden to our house,

original: kapotolūkābhyām apadaṃ tad astu ////
analyzed: kapota ulūkābhyām a padam tat astu
translated: let that be a footless place for the dove and the owl.

original: avairahatyāyedam ā papatyāt suvīratāyā idam ā sasadyāt /
analyzed: a vaira hatyāya idam ā papatyāt su vīra tāyai idam ā sasadyāt
translated: Let him come to this for the sake of non-violence, let him sit down to this for the sake of good heroes.

original: parāṅ eva parā vada parācīm anu saṃvatam /
analyzed: parāṅ eva parā vada parācīm anu saṃvatam
translated: Speak away, speak away to the farthest distance, to the farthest year.

original: yathā yamasya tvā gṛhe 'rasaṃ praticākaśān ābhūkaṃ praticākaśān ////
analyzed: yathā yamasya tvā gṛhe rasam praticākaśān ābhūkam praticākaśān
translated: As they have looked at you in Yama's house, as they have looked at you in the house of the one who is not a kinsman.

original: devā imaṃ madhunā saṃyutaṃ yavaṃ sarasvatyām adhi maṇāv acarkṛṣuḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ imam madhunā saṃyutam yavam sarasvatyām adhi maṇau acarkṛṣuḥ
translated: The gods have plowed this barley, mixed with honey, on the Sarasvati, in the pot.

original: indra āsīt sīrapatiḥ śatakratuḥ kīnāśā āsan marutaḥ sudānavaḥ ////
analyzed: indraḥ āsīt sīra patiḥ śatakratuḥ kīnāśāḥ āsan marutaḥ sudānavaḥ
translated: Indra was the lord of the plow, the performer of a hundred sacrifices; the Maruts, the givers of good gifts, were the plowmen.

original: yas te mado 'vakeśo vikeśo yenābhihasyaṃ puruṣaṃ kṛṇoṣi /
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ vakeśaḥ vikeśaḥ yena abhihasyam puruṣam kṛṇoṣi
translated: That intoxication of yours, the disheveled, the unkempt, by which you make a man laugh,

original: ārāt tvad anyā vanāni vṛkṣi tvaṃ śami śatavalśā vi roha ////
analyzed: ārāt tvat anyā vanāni vṛkṣi tvam śami śata valśā vi roha
translated: you cut off other trees from afar. You, O Sami tree, grow with a hundred branches.

original: bṛhatpalāśe subhage varṣavṛddha ṛtāvari /
analyzed: bṛhat palāśe subhage varṣa vṛddhe ṛtāvari
translated: O you with large leaves, O you who are fortunate, O you who grow with the rain, O you who are truthful,

original: māteva putrebhyo mṛḍa keśebhyaḥ śami ////🔽āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asadan mātaram puraḥ /
analyzed: mātā iva putrebhyaḥ mṛḍa keśebhyaḥ śami  ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras
translated: be kind to the hair, O Sami tree, as a mother to her children.🔽This variegated bull has come, has sat down in front of his mother,

original: pitaram ca prayant svaḥ ////
analyzed: pitaram ca prayan svar
translated: and has gone to his father, to the heaven.

original: antaś carati rocanā asya prāṇād apānataḥ /
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānataḥ
translated: He moves within the light, from his in-breath and out-breath.

original: vy akhyan mahiṣaḥ svaḥ ////
analyzed: vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ svar
translated: The great bull has opened the heaven.

original: triṃśad dhāmā vi rājati vāk pataṅgo aśiśriyat /
analyzed: triṃśat dhāmā vi rājati vāc pataṅgaḥ aśiśriyat
translated: The thirty-fold abode shines forth. Speech has taken to the flying bird.

original: prati vastor ahar dyubhiḥ ////
analyzed: prati vastoḥ ahar dyubhiḥ
translated: In return for the day, for the lights.

original: antardāve juhuta sv etad yātudhānakṣayaṇaṃ ghṛtena /
analyzed: antardāve juhuta su etat yātudhāna kṣayaṇam ghṛtena
translated: In the inner forest you offer this, the destruction of the demons, with ghee.

original: ārād rakṣāṃsi prati daha tvam agne na no gṛhāṇām upa tītapāsi ////
analyzed: ārāt rakṣāṃsi prati daha tvam agne na naḥ gṛhāṇām upa tītapāsi
translated: From afar burn the demons, O Agni, do not burn our houses, do not burn our pastures.

original: rudro vo grīvā aśarait piśācāḥ pṛṣṭīr vo 'pi śṛṇātu yātudhānāḥ /🔽vīrud vo viśvatovīryā yamena sam ajīgamat ////
analyzed: rudraḥ vaḥ grīvāḥ aśarait piśācāḥ pṛṣṭīḥ vaḥ pi śṛṇātu yātudhānāḥ  vīrudh vaḥ viśvatas vīryā yamena sam ajīgamat
translated: Rudra has pierced your necks, O demons, may the Piśācas tear out your backs, O demons.🔽May the Virūpākṣas, having all kinds of power, have come together with Yama.

original: abhayaṃ mitrāvaruṇāv ihāstu no 'rciṣāttriṇo nudataṃ pratīcaḥ /
analyzed: abhayam mitrāvaruṇau iha astu naḥ rciṣā attriṇaḥ nudatam pratīcaḥ
translated: May there be safety for us here, O Mitra and Varuṇa, drive away the burning coals, drive away the demons.

original: mā jñātāraṃ mā pratiṣṭhāṃ vidanta mitho vighnānā upa yantu mṛtyum ////
analyzed: mā jñātāram mā pratiṣṭhām vidanta mithas vighnānāḥ upa yantu mṛtyum
translated: May they not find the knower, may they not find the support, may they go to death, the demons, in mutual destruction.

original: yasyedam ā rajo yujas tuje janā navaṃ svaḥ /
analyzed: yasya idam ā rajaḥ yujaḥ tuje janāḥ navam svar
translated: Whose is this realm, whose is this new light, to which the people are yoked in thought?

original: indrasya rantyaṃ bṛhat ////
analyzed: indrasya rantyam bṛhat
translated: It is Indra's delightful, great (realm).

original: nādhṛṣa ā dadhṛṣate dhṛṣāṇo dhṛṣitaḥ śavaḥ /
analyzed: na ādhṛṣe ā dadhṛṣate dhṛṣāṇaḥ dhṛṣitaḥ śavaḥ
translated: The daring one does not dare to dare the daring one's power,

original: purā yathā vyathiḥ śrava indrasya nādhṛṣe śavaḥ ////
analyzed: purā yathā vyathiḥ śravaḥ indrasya na ādhṛṣe śavaḥ
translated: as Indra's daring power does not dare to dare the distress before (it arises).

original: sa no dadātu tāṃ rayim uruṃ piśaṅgasaṃdṛśam /
analyzed: sa naḥ dadātu tām rayim urum piśaṅga saṃdṛśam
translated: May he grant us that wealth, vast, appearing yellow,

original: indraḥ patis tuviṣṭamo janeṣv ā ////
analyzed: indraḥ patiḥ tuviṣṭamaḥ janeṣu ā
translated: Indra, the most powerful lord among the people.

original: prāgnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām /
analyzed: pra agnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
translated: Send forth a voice to Agni, to the bull of the people.

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us across the enemies.

original: yo rakṣāṃsi nijūrvaty agnis tigmena śociṣā /
analyzed: yaḥ rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati agniḥ tigmena śociṣā
translated: Agni who hurls away the Rakshasas with his sharp flame,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatas tiro dhanvātirocate /
analyzed: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvataḥ tiras dhanva atirocate
translated: He who shines beyond the farthest distance, beyond the ridge of the sky,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati
translated: He who looks on all the worlds and who looks on them together,

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: yo asya pāre rajasaḥ śukro agnir ajāyata /🔽sa naḥ parṣad ati dviṣaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ asya pāre rajasaḥ śukraḥ agniḥ ajāyata  sa naḥ parṣat ati dviṣaḥ
translated: The bright Agni who was born beyond that region of his,🔽May he lead us beyond our foes.

original: vaiśvānaro na ūtaya ā pra yātu parāvataḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ ūtaye ā pra yātu parāvataḥ
translated: Vaisvânara, come to our aid from the farthest distance,

original: agnir naḥ suṣṭutīr upa ////
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ suṣṭutīḥ upa
translated: May Agni come to our praises.

original: vaiśvānaro na āgamad imaṃ yajñaṃ sajūr upa /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ āgamat imam yajñam sajūs upa
translated: Vaisvânara has come to this our sacrifice, to the common property,

original: agnir uktheṣv aṃhasu ////
analyzed: agniḥ uktheṣu aṃhaḥsu
translated: Agni in the hymns, in the troubles.

original: vaiśvānaro 'ṅgirasāṃ stomam ukthaṃ ca cākḷpat /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ ṅgirasām stomam uktham ca cākḷpat
translated: Vaisvânara has appointed the Angirases' hymn and praise,

original: aiṣu dyumnaṃ svar yamat ////
analyzed: ā eṣu dyumnam svar yamat
translated: May he bestow on them splendour and heaven.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣas patim /
analyzed: ṛtāvānam vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣaḥ patim
translated: The righteous Vaisvânara, the lord of the light of holy order,

original: ajasraṃ gharmam īmahe ////
analyzed: ajasram gharmam īmahe
translated: We implore the imperishable heat.

original: sa viśvā prati cākḷpa ṛtūṃr ut sṛjate vaśī /
analyzed: sa viśvā prati cākḷpe ṛtūṃr ud sṛjate vaśī
translated: He has appointed all the seasons, the powerful one sends forth the seasons,

original: yajñasya vaya uttiran ////
analyzed: yajñasya vayaḥ uttiran
translated: Passing over the parts of the sacrifice.

original: agniḥ pareṣu dhāmasu kāmo bhūtasya bhavyasya /
analyzed: agniḥ pareṣu dhāmasu kāmaḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya
translated: Agni is the desire of the past and future being in the farthest abodes,

original: samrād eko vi rājati ////
analyzed: ekaḥ vi rājati
translated: He shines alone as sovereign.

original: upa prāgāt sahasrākṣo yuktvā śapatho ratham /
analyzed: upa prāgāt sahasra akṣaḥ yuktvā śapathaḥ ratham
translated: The thousand-eyed one has come forward, yoking the oath as his chariot,

original: śaptāram anvichan mama vṛka ivāvimato gṛham ////🔽pari ṇo vṛṅgdhi śapatha hradam agnir ivā dahan /
analyzed: śaptāram anvicchan mama vṛkaḥ iva a vimataḥ gṛham  pari naḥ vṛṅgdhi śapatha hradam agniḥ iva ā dahan
translated: Seeking the one who has sworn against me, like a wolf uncontained in the house.🔽O oath, surround us, burning like a fire in a lake.

original: śaptāram atra no jahi divo vṛkṣam ivāśaniḥ ////
analyzed: śaptāram atra naḥ jahi divaḥ vṛkṣam iva aśaniḥ
translated: Strike down the one who has sworn against us here, like lightning strikes a tree from the sky.

original: yo naḥ śapād aśapataḥ śapato yaś ca naḥ śapāt /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ śapāt a śapataḥ śapataḥ yaḥ ca naḥ śapāt
translated: The one who has sworn against us who have not sworn, and the one who has sworn against us who have sworn,

original: śune peṣṭram ivāvakṣāmaṃ taṃ praty asyāmi mṛtyave ////
analyzed: śune peṣṭram iva avakṣāmam tam prati asyāmi mṛtyave
translated: I hurl him back at death, like a dog at a clod.

original: siṃhe vyāghra uta yā pṛdākau tviṣir agnau brāhmaṇe sūrye yā /
analyzed: siṃhe vyāghre uta yā pṛdākau tviṣiḥ agnau brāhmaṇe sūrye yā
translated: The splendor that is in the lion, the tiger, the serpent, the fire, the Brahmin, the sun,

original: indraṃ yā devī subhagā jajāna sā na aitu varcasā saṃvidānā ////
analyzed: indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā
translated: The goddess who gave birth to the fortunate Indra, may she come to us, agreeing, with radiance.

original: yā hastini dvīpini yā hiraṇye tviṣir apsu goṣu yā puruṣeṣu /
analyzed: yā hastini dvīpini yā hiraṇye tviṣiḥ apsu goṣu yā puruṣeṣu
translated: The splendor that is in the elephant, the leopard, the gold, the waters, the cows, the men,

original: indraṃ yā devī subhagā jajāna sā na aitu varcasā saṃvidānā ////
analyzed: indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā naḥ aitu varcasā saṃvidānā
translated: The goddess who gave birth to the fortunate Indra, may she come to us, agreeing, with radiance.

original: rathe akṣeṣv ṛṣabhasya vāje vāte parjanye varuṇasya śuṣme /
analyzed: rathe akṣeṣu ṛṣabhasya vāje vāte parjanye varuṇasya śuṣme
translated: In the chariot, in the wheels, in the bull's strength, in the wind, in the rain, in Varuna's might,

original: indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā na aitu varcasā saṃvidānā ////
analyzed: indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā na aitu varcasā saṃvidānā
translated: The goddess who gave birth to the fortunate Indra, may she come to us, agreeing, with radiance.

original: rājanye dundubhāv āyatāyām aśvasya vāje puruṣasya māyau /
analyzed: rājanye dundubhau āyatāyām aśvasya vāje puruṣasya māyau
translated: In the long-drawn sound of the kettledrum, in the strength of the horse, in the skill of man,

original: indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā na aitu varcasā samvidānā ////
analyzed: indram yā devī subhagā jajāna sā na aitu varcasā samvidānā
translated: The Goddess who has brought forth the fortunate Indra, may she come to us, agreeing with us in glory.

original: yaśo havir vardhatām indrajūtaṃ sahasravīryaṃ subhṛtaṃ sahaskṛtam /
analyzed: yaśaḥ haviḥ vardhatām indra jūtam sahasra vīryam su bhṛtam sahaskṛtam
translated: May the glorious offering, impelled by Indra, increase in strength, well-prepared, a thousandfold, a thousand-maker.

original: prasarsrāṇam anu dīrghāya cakṣase haviṣmantaṃ mā vardhaya jyeṣṭhatātaye ////
analyzed: prasarsrāṇam anu dīrghāya cakṣase haviṣmantam mā vardhaya jyeṣṭhatātaye
translated: Following the far-reaching sight, may it increase the one who offers sacrifice for the sake of the highest rank.

original: achā na indraṃ yaśasaṃ yaśobhir yaśasvinaṃ namasānā vidhema /
analyzed: achā naḥ indram yaśasam yaśobhiḥ yaśasvinam namasānāḥ vidhema
translated: Let us honor with homage the glorious Indra with glories, the glorious one with glories.

original: sa no rāsva rāṣṭram indrajūtaṃ tasya te rātau yaśasaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: sa naḥ rāsva rāṣṭram indra jūtam tasya te rātau yaśasaḥ syāma
translated: Grant us a kingdom, O Indra, impelled by Indra. In the enjoyment of that, may we be glorious.

original: yaśā indro yaśā agnir yaśāḥ somo ajāyata /
analyzed: yaśāḥ indraḥ yaśāḥ agniḥ yaśāḥ somaḥ ajāyata
translated: Glorious is Indra, glorious is Agni, glorious was Soma born.

original: yaśā viśvasya bhūtasya aham asmi yaśastamaḥ ////
analyzed: yaśāḥ viśvasya bhūtasya aham asmi yaśastamaḥ
translated: Glorious am I among all beings, the most glorious.

original: abhayaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī ihāstu no 'bhayaṃ somaḥ savitā naḥ kṛṇotu /
analyzed: abhayam dyāvāpṛthivī iha astu naḥ bhayam somaḥ savitā naḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May heaven and earth be a refuge to us here. May Soma and Savitar make us safe.

original: abhayaṃ no 'stūrv antarikṣaṃ saptaṛṣīṇāṃ ca haviṣābhayaṃ no astu ////
analyzed: abhayam naḥ stu uru antarikṣam sapta ṛṣīṇām ca haviṣā abhayam naḥ astu
translated: May the wide atmosphere be a refuge to us. May the seven Rishis' oblation make us safe.

original: asmai grāmāya pradiśaś catasra ūrjaṃ subhūtaṃ svasti savitā naḥ kṛṇotu /
analyzed: asmai grāmāya pradiśaḥ catasraḥ ūrjam subhūtam svasti savitā naḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Savitar make all prosperity and well-being for this village and the four quarters.

original: aśatrv indro abhayaṃ naḥ kṛṇotv anyatra rājñām abhi yātu manyuḥ ////
analyzed: a śatru indraḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu anyatra rājñām abhi yātu manyuḥ
translated: May Indra, no enemy, make us free from fear: let the king's wrath fall elsewhere than on us.

original: anamitraṃ no adharād anamitraṃ na uttarāt /
analyzed: anamitram naḥ adharāt anamitram naḥ uttarāt
translated: No enemy to us from below, no enemy to us from above,

original: indrānamitraṃ naḥ paścād anamitraṃ puras kṛdhi ////
analyzed: indra anamitram naḥ paścāt anamitram puras kṛdhi
translated: No enemy to us from behind, no enemy to us from the front, O Indra, make thou.

original: manase cetase dhiya ākūtaya uta cittaye /
analyzed: manase cetase dhiye ākūtaye uta cittaye
translated: To the mind, to thought, to the intellect, to the will, and to the heart,

original: matyai śrutāya cakṣase vidhema haviṣā vayam ////
analyzed: matyai śrutāya cakṣase vidhema haviṣā vayam
translated: To the understanding, to fame, and to sight, let us offer with oblation.

original: apānāya vyānāya prāṇāya bhūridhāyase /
analyzed: apānāya vyānāya prāṇāya bhūri dhāyase
translated: To the out-breath, to the through-breath, to the in-breath, to the giver of plenty,

original: sarasvatyā uruvyace vidhema haviṣā vayam ////
analyzed: sarasvatyai uruvyace vidhema haviṣā vayam
translated: To Sarasvatî, the far-extending, let us offer with oblation.

original: mā no hāsiṣur ṛṣayo daivyā ye tanūpā ye nas tanvas tanūjāḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ hāsiṣuḥ ṛṣayaḥ daivyāḥ ye tanū pāḥ ye naḥ tanvaḥ tanū jāḥ
translated: Let not the Rishis, the divine, who guard our bodies, who are born with our bodies,

original: amartyā martyāṃ abhi naḥ sacadhvam āyur dhatta prataraṃ jīvase naḥ ////
analyzed: amartyāḥ martyām abhi naḥ sacadhvam āyuḥ dhatta prataram jīvase naḥ
translated: The immortal ones, forsake us, the mortal ones. Be with us. Give us life, give us a refuge that we may live.

original: ava jyām iva dhanvano manyuṃ tanomi te hṛdaḥ /
analyzed: ava jyām iva dhanvanaḥ manyum tanomi te hṛdaḥ
translated: I draw away thy wrath from thy heart, as one draws the bowstring from the bow,

original: yathā saṃmanasau bhūtvā sakhāyāv iva sacāvahai ////🔽sakhāyāv iva sacāvahā ava manyuṃ tanomi te /
analyzed: yathā saṃmanasau bhūtvā sakhāyau iva sacāvahai  sakhāyau iva sacāvahai ava manyum tanomi te
translated: That we may be of one mind, and dwell together as friends.🔽As friends we will dwell together. I draw away thy wrath.

original: adhas te aśmano manyum upāsyāmasi yo guruḥ ////
analyzed: adhas te aśmanaḥ manyum upāsyāmasi yaḥ guruḥ
translated: We lay thy heavy wrath beneath thy feet, O Stone.

original: abhi tiṣṭhāmi te manyuṃ pārṣṇyā prapadena ca /
analyzed: abhi tiṣṭhāmi te manyum pārṣṇyā prapadena ca
translated: I overcome thy wrath with my heel and with my foot.

original: yathāvaśo na vādiṣo mama cittam upāyasi ////
analyzed: yathā avaśaḥ na vādiṣaḥ mama cittam upāyasi
translated: That thou mayst not speak as thou wilt, but obey my will.

original: ayaṃ darbho vimanyukaḥ svāya cāraṇāya ca /
analyzed: ayam darbhaḥ vimanyukaḥ svāya cāraṇāya ca
translated: This Darbha is the destroyer of wrath, for thy own and for others.

original: manyor vimanyukasyāyaṃ manyuśamana ucyate ////
analyzed: manyoḥ vimanyukasya ayam manyuśamanaḥ ucyate
translated: This is called the pacification of wrath of the wrathful one.

original: ayaṃ yo bhūrimūlaḥ samudram avatiṣṭhati /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ bhūri mūlaḥ samudram avatiṣṭhati
translated: This one that stands firm with many roots in the ocean,

original: darbhaḥ pṛthivyā utthito manyuśamana ucyate ////
analyzed: darbhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ utthitaḥ manyu śamanaḥ ucyate
translated: the Darbha that rises from the earth, is called the pacification of wrath.

original: vi te hanavyāṃ śaraṇiṃ vi te mukhyāṃ nayāmasi /
analyzed: vi te hanavyām śaraṇim vi te mukhyām nayāmasi
translated: We remove thy hidden and manifest pain,

original: yathāvaśo na vādiṣo mama cittam upāyasi ////
analyzed: yathā avaśaḥ na vādiṣaḥ mama cittam upāyasi
translated: that thou mayst not speak as thou wilt, but obey my will.

original: asthād dyaur asthāt pṛthivy asthād viśvam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: asthāt dyauḥ asthāt pṛthivī asthāt viśvam idam jagat
translated: The heaven hath stood firm, the earth hath stood firm, this whole world hath stood firm.

original: asthur vṛkṣā ūrdhvasvapnās tiṣṭhād rogo ayaṃ tava ////
analyzed: asthuḥ vṛkṣāḥ ūrdhva svapnāḥ tiṣṭhāt rogaḥ ayam tava
translated: The trees have stood firm with their tops turned upward; stand firm, O disease, of this man.

original: śataṃ yā bheṣajāni te sahasraṃ saṃgatāni ca /
analyzed: śatam yā bheṣajāni te sahasram saṃgatāni ca
translated: The hundred remedies that are thine, and the thousand that are combined,

original: śreṣṭham āsrāvabheṣajaṃ vasiṣṭhaṃ roganāśanam ////
analyzed: śreṣṭham āsrāva bheṣajam vasiṣṭham roga nāśanam
translated: the best of remedies for discharges, the most excellent for destroying disease.

original: rudrasya mūtram asy amṛtasya nābhiḥ /
analyzed: rudrasya mūtram asi amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translated: Thou art the urine of Rudra, the navel of immortality.

original: viṣāṇakā nāma vā asi pitṝṇāṃ mūlād utthitā vātīkṛtanāśanī ////
analyzed: viṣāṇakā nāma vai asi pitṝṇām mūlāt utthitā vātīkṛta nāśanī
translated: Thou art called Visanaka, the root of the Pitrs, rising from the root, the destroyer of flatulence.

original: paro 'pehi manaspāpa kim aśastāni śaṃsasi /
analyzed: parā u pehi manaspāpa kim aśastāni śaṃsasi
translated: Go away, O evil-minded one, why do you speak what is not good?

original: parehi na tvā kāmaye vṛkṣāṃ vanāni saṃ cara gṛheṣu goṣu me manaḥ ////
analyzed: parehi na tvā kāmaye vanāni sam cara gṛheṣu goṣu me manaḥ
translated: Go away, I do not desire you. Roam among the trees and forests. My mind is among the houses and cows.

original: avaśasā niḥśasā yat parāśasopārima jāgrato yat svapantaḥ /
analyzed: avaśasā niḥśasā yat parāśasā upārima jāgrataḥ yat svapantaḥ
translated: Whatever we have done with ill-will, with hatred, with contempt, while awake or sleeping,

original: agnir viśvāny apa duṣkṛtāny ajuṣṭāny āre asmad dadhātu ////
analyzed: agniḥ viśvāni apa duṣkṛtāni a juṣṭāni āre asmat dadhātu
translated: May Agni remove all those evil deeds and displeasures far away from us.

original: yad indra brahmaṇas pate 'pi mṛṣā carāmasi /
analyzed: yat indra brahmaṇas pate pi mṛṣā carāmasi
translated: Whatever, O Indra, O Lord of prayer, we do amiss,

original: pracetā na āṅgiraso duritāt pātv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: pracetāḥ naḥ āṅgirasaḥ duritāt pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May Prachetas, the son of Angiras, protect us from evil and distress.

original: yo na jīvo 'si na mṛto devānām amṛtagarbho 'si svapna /
analyzed: yaḥ na jīvaḥ si na mṛtaḥ devānām amṛta garbhaḥ si svapna
translated: You who are neither alive nor dead, you are the immortal embryo of the gods, O sleep.

original: varuṇānī te mātā yamaḥ pitārarur nāmāsi ////
analyzed: varuṇānī te mātā yamaḥ pitā araruḥ nāma asi
translated: Varuni is your mother, Yama is your father, and your name is Arura.

original: vidma te svapna janitraṃ devajāmīnāṃ putro 'si yamasya karaṇaḥ /
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram deva jāmīnām putraḥ si yamasya karaṇaḥ
translated: We know your origin, O sleep. You are the son of the divine Jamadagni, the instrument of Yama.

original: antako 'si mṛtyur asi taṃ tvā svapna tathā saṃ vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi ////
analyzed: antakaḥ si mṛtyuḥ asi tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi
translated: You are the destroyer, you are death. We know you thus, O sleep. Protect us from bad dreams.

original: yathā kalāṃ yathā śaphaṃ yatharṇaṃ saṃnayanti /
analyzed: yathā kalām yathā śapham yathā ṛṇam saṃnayanti
translated: Just as they settle a debt, a fine, a penalty,

original: evā duṣvapnyaṃ sarvaṃ dviṣate saṃ nayāmasi ////
analyzed: eva duṣvapnyam sarvam dviṣate sam nayāmasi
translated: So we settle all bad dreams upon the enemy.

original: agniḥ prātaḥsavane pātv asmān vaiśvānaro viśvakṛd viśvaśaṃbhūḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ prātaḥsavane pātu asmān vaiśvānaraḥ viśva kṛt viśva śaṃbhūḥ
translated: May Agni, Vaiśvānara, the creator of all, the supporter of all, protect us at the morning pressing.

original: sa naḥ pāvako draviṇe dadhātv āyuṣmantaḥ sahabhakṣāḥ syāma ////
analyzed: sa naḥ pāvakaḥ draviṇe dadhātu āyuṣmantaḥ sahabhakṣāḥ syāma
translated: May he, the purifier, bestow wealth upon us. May we be long-lived, partaking of the sacrificial food together.

original: viśve devā maruta indro asmān asmin dvitīye savane na jahyuḥ /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ marutaḥ indraḥ asmān asmin dvitīye savane na jahyuḥ
translated: May the All-gods, the Maruts, Indra, not forsake us at this second pressing.

original: āyuṣmantaḥ priyam eṣāṃ vadanto vayaṃ devānāṃ sumatau syāma ////
analyzed: āyuṣmantaḥ priyam eṣām vadantaḥ vayam devānām sumatau syāma
translated: May we, speaking what is agreeable to them, be in the favor of the gods.

original: idaṃ tṛtīyaṃ savanaṃ kavīnām ṛtena ye camasam airayanta /
analyzed: idam tṛtīyam savanam kavīnām ṛtena ye camasam airayanta
translated: This is the third pressing of the sages, by whom the cup was made to move with order.

original: te saudhanvanāḥ svar ānaśānāḥ sviṣṭiṃ no abhi vasyo nayantu ////
analyzed: te saudhanvanāḥ svar ānaśānāḥ su iṣṭim naḥ abhi vasyaḥ nayantu
translated: May they, the sons of Sudhanvan, attaining heaven, lead us to prosperity and bliss.

original: śyeno 'si gāyatrachandā anu tvā rabhe /
analyzed: śyenaḥ si gāyatra chandāḥ anu tvā rabhe
translated: Thou art the hawk, the Gāyatrī metre. I grasp thee.

original: svasti mā saṃ vahāsya yajñasyodṛci svāhā ////
analyzed: svasti mā sam vaha asya yajñasya udṛci svāhā
translated: Carry me safely to the end of this sacrifice. Svāhā!

original: ṛbhur asi jagachandā anu tvā rabhe /
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ asi jaga chandāḥ anu tvā rabhe
translated: Thou art the strong one, the Jagatī metre. I grasp thee.

original: svasti mā saṃ vahāsya yajñasyodṛci svāhā ////
analyzed: svasti mā sam vaha asya yajñasya udṛci svāhā
translated: Carry me safely to the end of this sacrifice. Svāhā!

original: vṛṣāsi triṣṭupchandā anu tvā rabhe /
analyzed: vṛṣā asi triṣṭubh chandāḥ anu tvā rabhe
translated: Thou art the bull, the Triṣṭubh metre. I grasp thee.

original: svasti mā saṃ vahāsya yajñasyodṛci svāhā ////
analyzed: svasti mā sam vaha asya yajñasya udṛci svāhā
translated: Carry me safely to the end of this sacrifice. Svāhā!

original: nahi te agne tanvaḥ krūram ānaṃśa martyaḥ /
analyzed: nahi te agne tanvaḥ krūram ānaṃśa martyaḥ
translated: O Agni, the mortal man cannot injure thy limbs,

original: kapir babhasti tejanaṃ svaṃ jarāyu gaur iva ////🔽meṣa iva vai saṃ ca vi corv acyase yad uttaradrāv uparaś ca khādataḥ /🔽śīrṣṇā śiro 'psasāpso ardayann aṃśūn babhasti haritebhir āsabhiḥ ////
analyzed: kapiḥ babhasti tejanam svam jarāyu gauḥ iva  meṣaḥ iva vai sam ca vi ca uru acyase yat uttara drau uparaḥ ca khādataḥ  śīrṣṇā śiraḥ psasā apsaḥ ardayan aṃśūn babhasti haritebhiḥ āsabhiḥ
translated: The monkey bears his own heat, like a cow her caul.🔽Like a ram, O Urvasi, you move about, when you go above and eat from below.🔽With your head you crush the head, with your moisture the moisture; with your green limbs you bear the fibres.

original: suparṇā vācam akratopa dyavy ākhare kṛṣṇā iṣirā anartiṣuḥ /
analyzed: suparṇāḥ vācam akrata upa dyavi ākhare kṛṣṇāḥ iṣirāḥ anartiṣuḥ
translated: The birds have raised their voice to heaven; in the black hole the nimble ones have danced.

original: ni yan niyanti uparasya niṣkṛtiṃ purū reto dadhire sūryaśritaḥ ////🔽hataṃ tardaṃ samaṅkam ākhum aśvinā chintaṃ śiro api pṛṣṭīḥ śṛṇītam /
analyzed: ni yat niyanti uparasya niṣkṛtim purū retaḥ dadhire sūrya śritaḥ  hatam tardam samaṅkam ākhum aśvinā chintam śiraḥ api pṛṣṭīḥ śṛṇītam
translated: When they bind the destruction of the lower one, many have stored up seed in the sun's abode.🔽The Aṣvins have slain the mole, the gopher, the mouse; they have cut off its head and crushed its ribs.

original: yavān ned adān api nahyataṃ mukham athābhayaṃ kṛṇutaṃ dhānyāya ////
analyzed: yavān na id adān api nahyatam mukham atha abhayam kṛṇutam dhānyāya
translated: They have not given it barley; they have tied its mouth; then have they made it harmless for the corn.

original: tarda hai pataṅga hai jabhya hā upakvasa /
analyzed: tarda hai pataṅga hai jabhya hā upakvasa
translated: O mole, O flying one, O gopher, O upkvas,

original: brahmevāsaṃsthitaṃ havir anadanta imān yavān ahiṃsanto apodita ////
analyzed: brahma iva asaṃsthitam haviḥ a nadantaḥ imān yavān a hiṃsantaḥ apodita
translated: like a priest who has not finished the oblation, without speaking, have you eaten these barley grains, without being noticed?

original: tardāpate vaghāpate tṛṣṭajambhā ā śṛṇota me /
analyzed: tardā pate vaghā pate tṛṣṭa jambhāḥ ā śṛṇota me
translated: O lord of moles, O lord of gophers, O you with sharp fangs, listen to me.

original: ya āraṇyā vyadvarā ye ke ca stha vyadvarās tānt sarvān jambhayāmasi ////
analyzed: ye āraṇyāḥ vyadvarāḥ ye ke ca stha vyadvarāḥ tān sarvān jambhayāmasi
translated: Those wild ones, those that are scattered, all of them we crush to pieces.

original: vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅ somo ati drutaḥ /
analyzed: vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅ somaḥ ati drutaḥ
translated: Purified by the wind, by the filter, Soma flows back to the west,

original: indrasya yujaḥ sakhā ////
analyzed: indrasya yujaḥ sakhā
translated: A friend yoked to Indra.

original: āpo asmān mātaraḥ sūdayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu /
analyzed: āpaḥ asmān mātaraḥ sūdayantu ghṛtena naḥ ghṛta pvaḥ punantu
translated: May the waters, the mothers, purify us. May they, who deserve ghee, purify us with ghee.

original: viśvaṃ hi ripraṃ pravahanti devīr ud id ābhyaḥ śucir ā pūta emi ////
analyzed: viśvam hi ripram pravahanti devīḥ ud id ābhyaḥ śuciḥ ā pūtaḥ emi
translated: For the divine waters carry away all impurity. Pure and cleansed, I rise up from them.

original: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane 'bhidrohaṃ manuṣyāś caranti /
analyzed: yat kim ca idam varuṇa daivye jane bhidroham manuṣyāḥ caranti
translated: Whatever sin we have committed, O Varuṇa, in the divine people, or whatever men have done,

original: acittyā cet tava dharma yuyopima mā nas tasmād enaso deva rīriṣaḥ ////🔽ut sūryo diva eti puro rakṣāṃsi nijūrvan /
analyzed: acittyā ced tava dharma yuyopima mā naḥ tasmāt enasaḥ deva rīriṣaḥ  ud sūryaḥ divaḥ eti puras rakṣāṃsi nijūrvan
translated: If we have transgressed your law, O sinless one, do not afflict us with that sin, O god.🔽The sun rises in the east, driving away the demons from the sky,

original: ādityaḥ parvatebhyo viśvadṛṣṭo adṛṣṭahā ////
analyzed: ādityaḥ parvatebhyaḥ viśva dṛṣṭaḥ adṛṣṭa hā
translated: The sun, seen by all, the destroyer of the unseen, from the mountains.

original: ni gāvo goṣṭhe asadan ni mṛgāso avikṣata /
analyzed: ni gāvaḥ goṣṭhe asadan ni mṛgāsaḥ avikṣata
translated: The cows have sat down in the stable, the deer have settled down.

original: ny ūrmayo nadīnaṃ ny adṛṣṭā alipsata ////
analyzed: ni ūrmayaḥ nadīnam ni adṛṣṭāḥ alipsata
translated: The unseen waves have settled down in the river, the unseen have been caught.

original: āyurdadaṃ vipaścitaṃ śrutāṃ kaṇvasya vīrudham /
analyzed: āyurdadam vipaścitam śrutām kaṇvasya vīrudham
translated: The life-giving, wise, famous plant of Kaṇva,

original: ābhāriṣaṃ viśvabheṣajīm asyādṛṣṭān ni śamayat ////
analyzed: ābhāriṣam viśva bheṣajīm asya adṛṣṭān ni śamayat
translated: I have brought, the all-healing, to destroy the unseen.

original: dyauś ca ma idaṃ pṛthivī ca pracetasau śukro bṛhan dakṣiṇayā pipartu /
analyzed: dyauḥ ca me idam pṛthivī ca pracetasau śukraḥ bṛhan dakṣiṇayā pipartu
translated: May the sky and this earth, the wise ones, Shukra and Brihat, with the sacrificial fee, favor me.

original: anu svadhā cikitāṃ somo agnir vāyur naḥ pātu savitā bhagaś ca ////
analyzed: anu svadhā cikitām somaḥ agniḥ vāyuḥ naḥ pātu savitā bhagaḥ ca
translated: Let Soma, Agni, and Vayu, and Savitar and Bhaga protect us according to their nature.

original: punaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ātmā na aitu punaś cakṣuḥ punar asur na aitu /
analyzed: punar prāṇaḥ punar ātmā naḥ aitu punar cakṣuḥ punar asuḥ naḥ aitu
translated: Let the breath return, let the life return, let the eye return, let the spirit return.

original: vaiśvānaro no adabdhas tanūpā antas tiṣṭhāti duritāni viśvā ////
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ adabdhaḥ tanū pāḥ antar tiṣṭhāti duritāni viśvā
translated: May the undeceiving Vaiśvānara, the protector of our bodies, stand in the midst of all evils.

original: saṃ varcasā payasā saṃ tanūbhir aganmahi manasā saṃ śivena /
analyzed: sam varcasā payasā sam tanūbhiḥ aganmahi manasā sam śivena
translated: We have come together in splendor, in milk, in bodies, in auspicious mind.

original: tvaṣṭā no atra varīyaḥ kṛṇotv anu no mārṣṭu tanvo yad viriṣṭam ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭā naḥ atra varīyaḥ kṛṇotu anu naḥ mārṣṭu tanvaḥ yat viriṣṭam
translated: May Tvaṣṭar make an excellent choice for us here, may he smooth out for us whatever is defective in our bodies.

original: idaṃ tad yuja uttaram indraṃ śumbhāmy aṣṭaye /
analyzed: idam tat yujaḥ uttaram indram śumbhāmi aṣṭaye
translated: This is the excellent yoke, I adorn Indra for the sake of prosperity.

original: asya kṣatraṃ śriyaṃ mahīṃ vṛṣṭir iva vardhayā tṛṇam ////
analyzed: asya kṣatram śriyam mahīm vṛṣṭiḥ iva vardhaya tṛṇam
translated: May he increase his lordship, glory, and greatness like rain increases grass.

original: asmai kṣatram agnīṣomāv asmai dhārayataṃ rayim /
analyzed: asmai kṣatram agnīṣomau asmai dhārayatam rayim
translated: For him, O Agni and Soma, create lordship, for him sustain wealth.

original: imaṃ rāṣṭrasyābhīvarge kṛṇutam yuja uttaram ////
analyzed: imam rāṣṭrasya abhīvarge kṛṇutam yujaḥ uttaram
translated: Make him the excellent yoke for the prosperity of this kingdom.

original: sabandhuś cāsabandhuś ca yo asmāṃ abhidāsati /
analyzed: sabandhuḥ ca a sabandhuḥ ca yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Whether he be a friend or a stranger who attacks us,

original: sarvaṃ taṃ randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate ////
analyzed: sarvam tam randhayāsi me yajamānāya sunvate
translated: make him all powerless for the sacrificer who presses out the Soma.

original: ye panthāno bahavo devayānā antarā dyāvāpṛthivī saṃcaranti /
analyzed: ye panthānaḥ bahavaḥ deva yānāḥ antarā dyāvāpṛthivī saṃcaranti
translated: Those many paths that go to the gods, that pass between heaven and earth,

original: teṣām ajyāniṃ yatamo vahāti tasmai mā devāḥ pari datteha sarve ////
analyzed: teṣām ajyānim yatamaḥ vahāti tasmai mā devāḥ pari datta iha sarve
translated: To him, O Gods, to whomsoever of you they offer the unfailing (sacrifice), to him do ye all give me over.

original: grīṣmo hemantaḥ śiśiro vasantaḥ śarad varṣāḥ svite no dadhāta /
analyzed: grīṣmaḥ hemantaḥ śiśiraḥ vasantaḥ śarad varṣāḥ svite naḥ dadhāta
translated: Let the summer, the winter, the cold season, the spring, the autumn, the rains, grant us (prosperity).

original: ā no goṣu bhajatā prajāyāṃ nivāta id vaḥ śaraṇe syāma ////
analyzed: ā naḥ goṣu bhajata prajāyām nivāte id vaḥ śaraṇe syāma
translated: Do ye distribute (your gifts) among our cattle and our offspring. In your shelter, O ye that are to be worshipped, may we be.

original: idāvatsarāya parivatsarāya saṃvatsarāya kṛṇutā bṛhan namaḥ /
analyzed: idāvatsarāya parivatsarāya saṃvatsarāya kṛṇuta bṛhat namaḥ
translated: To the year that has passed, to the year that is coming, to the year that is present, offer great adoration.

original: teṣāṃ vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre sau manase syāma ////🔽mā no devā ahir vadhīt satokānt sahapuruṣān /
analyzed: teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre sau manase syāma  mā naḥ devāḥ ahiḥ vadhīt sa tokān saha puruṣān
translated: May we be in the gracious favour, in the most gracious favour of those who are to be worshipped.🔽Let not the serpent, O ye Gods, slay us with our children and our men.

original: samyataṃ na vi ṣparad vyāttaṃ na saṃ yaman namo devajanebhyaḥ /
analyzed: samyatam na vi sparat vyāttam na sam yaman namaḥ deva janebhyaḥ
translated: Let not the bound (serpent) burst asunder, let not the unclosed (serpent) close (its jaws). Homage to the clans of the Gods.

original: namo 'stv asitāya namas tiraścirājaye /
analyzed: namaḥ stu asitāya namaḥ tiraścirājaye
translated: Homage to the black one, homage to the one with stripes across.

original: svajāya babhrave namo namo devajanebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: svajāya babhrave namaḥ namaḥ deva janebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to the brown one born of ourselves. Homage to the clans of the Gods.

original: saṃ te hanmi datā dataḥ sam u te hanvā hanū /
analyzed: sam te hanmi datā dataḥ sam u te hanvā hanū
translated: I crush thy tooth against the tooth, I crush thy jaw against the jaw.

original: saṃ te jihvayā jihvāṃ sam v āsnāha āsyam ////
analyzed: sam te jihvayā jihvām sam u āsnā ahe āsyam
translated: I crush thy tongue against the tongue, I crush thy mouth against the mouth.

original: idam id vā u bheṣajam idaṃ rudrasya bheṣajam /
analyzed: idam id vai u bheṣajam idam rudrasya bheṣajam
translated: This indeed is the medicine, this is Rudra's medicine,

original: yeneṣum ekatejanāṃ śataśalyām apabravat ////
analyzed: yena iṣum eka tejanām śata śalyām apabravat
translated: By which he drove away the shaft, the one-edged, the hundred-edged.

original: jālāṣeṇābhi ṣiñcata jālāṣeṇopa siñcata /
analyzed: jālāṣeṇa abhi siñcata jālāṣeṇa upa siñcata
translated: Sprinkle with bitumen, sprinkle with bitumen.

original: jālāṣam ugraṃ bheṣajaṃ tena no mṛḍa jīvase ////🔽śaṃ ca no mayaś ca no mā ca naḥ kiṃ canāmamat /
analyzed: jālāṣam ugram bheṣajam tena naḥ mṛḍa jīvase  śam ca naḥ mayaḥ ca naḥ mā ca naḥ kim cana amamat
translated: Bitumen is a fierce medicine, with it be gracious to us for life.🔽Be gracious to us, be kind to us, and let nothing be displeasing to us.

original: kṣamā rapo viśvaṃ no astu bheṣajaṃ sarvaṃ no astu bheṣajam ////
analyzed: kṣamā rapaḥ viśvam naḥ astu bheṣajam sarvam naḥ astu bheṣajam
translated: Be forgiveness, be all a remedy for us, be all a remedy for us.

original: yaśasaṃ mendro maghavān kṛṇotu yaśasaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime /
analyzed: yaśasam mā indraḥ maghavān kṛṇotu yaśasam dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime
translated: May the glorious Indra make me glorious, may these two glorious heavens and earth,

original: yaśasaṃ mā devaḥ savitā kṛṇotu priyo dātur dakṣiṇāyā iha syām ////
analyzed: yaśasam mā devaḥ savitā kṛṇotu priyaḥ dātuḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ iha syām
translated: May the god Savitar make me glorious. Here may I be dear to the giver of the sacrificial gift.

original: yathendro dyāvāpṛthivyor yaśasvān yathāpa oṣadhīṣu yaśasvatīḥ /
analyzed: yathā indraḥ dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ yaśasvān yathā āpaḥ oṣadhīṣu yaśasvatīḥ
translated: As Indra is glorious in heaven and earth, as the waters are glorious among the plants,

original: evā viśveṣu deveṣu vayaṃ sarveṣu yaśasaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: eva viśveṣu deveṣu vayam sarveṣu yaśasaḥ syāma
translated: Even so may we be glorious among all the gods, among all.

original: yaśā indro yaśā agnir yaśāḥ somo ajāyata /
analyzed: yaśāḥ indraḥ yaśāḥ agniḥ yaśāḥ somaḥ ajāyata
translated: Glorious is Indra, glorious is Agni, glorious was Soma born.

original: yaśā viśvasya bhūtasyāham asmi yaśastamaḥ ////🔽anaḍudbhyas tvaṃ prathamaṃ dhenubhyas tvam arundhati /
analyzed: yaśāḥ viśvasya bhūtasya aham asmi yaśastamaḥ  anaḍudbhyaḥ tvam prathamam dhenubhyaḥ tvam arundhati
translated: Most glorious of all that is, I am.🔽First from the bulls, from the cows, from thee, O Arundhati,

original: adhenave vayase śarma yacha catuṣpade ////
analyzed: a dhenave vayase śarma yaccha catuṣpade
translated: Grant shelter to the bird that hath no shelter, to the four-footed one.

original: śarma yachatv oṣadhiḥ saha devīr arundhatī /
analyzed: śarma yacchatu oṣadhiḥ saha devīḥ arundhatī
translated: Let the plant grant shelter, together with the goddess Arundhati.

original: karat payasvantaṃ goṣṭham ayakṣmāṃ uta pūruṣān ////
analyzed: karat payasvantam goṣṭham ayakṣmān uta pūruṣān
translated: Make the cow-pen rich in milk and the men free from disease.

original: viśvarūpāṃ subhagām achāvadāmi jīvalām /
analyzed: viśva rūpām subhagām achāvadāmi jīvalām
translated: I call upon the all-formed, the fortunate, the living one.

original: sā no rudrasyāstāṃ hetiṃ dūraṃ nayatu gobhyaḥ ////
analyzed: sā naḥ rudrasya astām hetim dūram nayatu gobhyaḥ
translated: May she carry far away from the cows the dart of Rudra.

original: ayam ā yāty aryamā purastād viṣitastupaḥ /🔽asyā ichann agruvai patim uta jāyām ajānaye ////
analyzed: ayam ā yāti aryamā purastāt viṣita stupaḥ  asyai icchan agruvai patim uta jāyām a jānaye
translated: Here comes Aryaman in front, with a raised thunderbolt,🔽Desiring this maiden for a husband, and a wife for the son.

original: aśramad iyam aryamann anyāsāṃ samanaṃ yatī /
analyzed: aśramat iyam aryaman anyāsām samanam yatī
translated: This one, O Aryaman, has gone away, going to the marriage of others.

original: aṅgo nv aryamann asyā anyāḥ samanam āyati ////
analyzed: aṅga u nu aryaman asyāḥ anyāḥ samanam āyati
translated: But, O Aryaman, let this one come to the marriage of others.

original: dhātā dādhāra pṛthivīm dhātā dyām uta sūryam /
analyzed: dhātā dādhāra pṛthivīm dhātā dyām uta sūryam
translated: Dhatr supported the earth, Dhatr the sky and the sun.

original: dhātāsyā agruvai patim dadhātu pratikāmyam ////
analyzed: dhātā asyai agruvai patim dadhātu pratikāmyam
translated: May Dhatr give this maiden a husband according to her desire.

original: mahyam āpo madhumad erayantāṃ mahyaṃ sūro abharaj jyotiṣe kam /
analyzed: mahyam āpaḥ madhumat erayantām mahyam sūraḥ abharat jyotiṣe kam
translated: May the waters bring me sweet things, may Surya bring me light.

original: mahyaṃ devā uta viśve tapojā mahyaṃ devaḥ savitā vyaco dhāt ////
analyzed: mahyam devāḥ uta viśve tapaḥ jāḥ mahyam devaḥ savitā vyacaḥ dhāt
translated: May the gods born of heat, and the god Savitar, give me space.

original: ahaṃ viveca pṛthivīm uta dyām aham ṛtūṃr ajanayaṃ sapta sākam /
analyzed: aham viveca pṛthivīm uta dyām aham ṛtūṃr ajanayam sapta sākam
translated: I have divided the earth and the sky, I have produced the seven seasons together.

original: ahaṃ satyam anṛtaṃ yad vadāmy ahaṃ daivīṃ pari vācam viśaś ca ////
analyzed: aham satyam anṛtam yat vadāmi aham daivīm pari vācam viśaḥ ca
translated: I speak the truth and the falsehood, I have the divine speech and the human.

original: ahaṃ jajāna pṛthivīm uta dyām aham ṛtūṃr ajanayaṃ sapta sindhūn /
analyzed: aham jajāna pṛthivīm uta dyām aham ṛtūṃr ajanayam sapta sindhūn
translated: I brought forth the earth and the sky, I produced the seven rivers and the seasons.

original: ahaṃ satvam anṛtaṃ yad vadāmi yo agnīṣomāv ajuṣe sakhāyā ////
analyzed: aham satvam anṛtam yat vadāmi yaḥ agnīṣomau ajuṣe sakhāyā
translated: I am the truth, and what I say is not false, he who delights in Agni and Soma as friends.

original: vaiśvānaro raśmibhir naḥ punātu vātaḥ prāṇeneṣiro nabhobhiḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ raśmibhiḥ naḥ punātu vātaḥ prāṇena iṣiraḥ nabhobhiḥ
translated: May Vaisvānara purify us with his rays, Vāta with his breath and the wind with his clouds.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī payasā payasvatī ṛtāvarī yajñiye na punītām ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī payasā payasvatī ṛtāvarī yajñiye na punītām
translated: May the two mighty ones, Dyaus and Pṛthivī, rich in milk, purifying, worthy of sacrifice, purify us.

original: vaiśvānarīṃ sūnṛtām ā rabhadhvaṃ yasyā āśās tanvo vītapṛṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānarīm sūnṛtām ā rabhadhvam yasyāḥ āśāḥ tanvaḥ vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ
translated: Take hold of the grace of Vaisvānara, whose backs are wide, whose sides are spacious.

original: tayā gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādeṣu vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīnām ////
analyzed: tayā gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādeṣu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīnām
translated: By that (grace) may we, singing, be at the feasts the lords of wealth.

original: vaiśvānarīṃ varcasa ā rabhadhvaṃ śuddhā bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānarīm varcase ā rabhadhvam śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: Take hold of the splendor of Vaisvānara, being pure, bright, and shining.

original: iheḍayā sadhamādaṃ madanto jyok paśyema sūryam uccarantam ////
analyzed: iha iḍayā sadhamādam madantaḥ jyok paśyema sūryam uccarantam
translated: Here, rejoicing in the feast with our hearts, may we long behold the rising sun.

original: yat te devī nirṛtir ābabandha dāma grīvāsv avimokyaṃ yat /
analyzed: yat te devī nirṛtiḥ ābabandha dāma grīvāsu avimokyam yat
translated: Whatever bond of thine, O goddess Nirṛti, thou hast bound round his neck that cannot be loosed,

original: tat te vi ṣyāmy āyuṣe varcase balāyādomadam annam addhi prasūtaḥ ////
analyzed: tat te vi syāmi āyuṣe varcase balāya adomadam annam addhi prasūtaḥ
translated: that I unloose for his life, his splendor, his strength. Eat food, set free, without disease.

original: namo 'stu te nirṛte tigmatejo 'yasmayān vi cṛtā bandhapāśān /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te nirṛte tigma tejaḥ yasmayān vi cṛta bandha pāśān
translated: Homage to thee, O Nirṛti, of sharp flame. Unloose the fetters of iron that are fastened.

original: yamo mahyam punar it tvām dadāti tasmai yamāya namo astu mṛtyave ////
analyzed: yamaḥ mahyam punar id tvām dadāti tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave
translated: Yama again gives thee to me: to that Yama be homage, to Death.

original: ayasmaye drupade bedhiṣa ihābhihito mṛtyubhir ye sahasram /
analyzed: ayasmaye drupade bedhiṣe iha abhihitaḥ mṛtyubhiḥ ye sahasram
translated: To the iron pillar I bind thee here, announced by the deaths that are a thousand in number.

original: yamena tvaṃ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāna uttamaṃ nākam adhi rohayemam ////🔽saṃsam id yuvase vṛṣann agne viśvāny arya ā /
analyzed: yamena tvam pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam  saṃsam id yuvase vṛṣan agne viśvāni aryaḥ ā
translated: In accord with Yama and the Fathers, raise thou this one to the highest vault of heaven.🔽In unison, O bull, O Agni, thou winnest all things for us.

original: iḍas pade sam idhyase sa no vasūny ā bhara ////
analyzed: iḍaḥ pade sam idhyase sa naḥ vasūni ā bhara
translated: Thou art enkindled in the place of worship: bring thou to us the treasures of the good.

original: saṃ jānīdhvaṃ saṃ pṛcyadhvaṃ saṃ vo manāṃsi jānatām /
analyzed: sam jānīdhvam sam pṛcyadhvam sam vaḥ manāṃsi jānatām
translated: Be ye in unison, be ye united: let your minds be in unison together.

original: devā bhāgaṃ yathā pūrve samjānānā upāsate ////
analyzed: devāḥ bhāgam yathā pūrve samjānānāḥ upāsate
translated: As the former Gods, in unison, worshipped the share (of the sacrifice), even so do ye.

original: samāno mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānaṃ vrataṃ saha cittam eṣām /
analyzed: samānaḥ mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānam vratam saha cittam eṣām
translated: The prayer is the same, the assembly is the same, the vow is the same, the thought of these is the same.

original: samānena vo haviṣā juhomi samānaṃ ceto abhisaṃviśadhvam ////🔽samānī va ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ /🔽samānam astu vo manaḥ yathā vaḥ susahāsati ////
analyzed: samānena vaḥ haviṣā juhomi samānam cetaḥ abhisaṃviśadhvam  samānī vaḥ ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ  samānam astu vaḥ manaḥ yathā vaḥ su sahā asati
translated: With the same oblation I offer to you: unite your thoughts in the same (object).🔽One and the same is your purpose, one and the same your hearts.🔽Let your mind be in unison, that ye may rejoice together.

original: ava manyur avāyatāva bāhū manoyujā /
analyzed: ava manyuḥ avāyata ava bāhū manaḥ yujā
translated: Let anger depart, let the arms depart, joined with the mind.

original: parāśara tvaṃ teṣām parāñcaṃ śuṣmam ardayādhā no rayim ā kṛdhi ////
analyzed: parāśara tvam teṣām parāñcam śuṣmam ardaya adha naḥ rayim ā kṛdhi
translated: O Parāśara, crush their far-reaching vigour: bring thou to us riches and make them ours.

original: nirhastebhyo nairhastam yaṃ devāḥ śarum asyatha /
analyzed: nirhastebhyaḥ nairhastam yam devāḥ śarum asyatha
translated: The weapon which the Gods have forged for those who have no weapons,

original: vṛścāmi śatrūṇāṃ bāhūn anena haviṣā 'ham ////
analyzed: vṛścāmi śatrūṇām bāhūn anena haviṣā ham
translated: With this oblation I cut off the arms of my enemies.

original: indraś cakāra prathamaṃ nairhastam asurebhyaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ cakāra prathamam nairhastam asurebhyaḥ
translated: Indra first forged the weapon for the Asuras,

original: jayantu satvāno mama sthireṇendreṇa medinā ////
analyzed: jayantu satvānaḥ mama sthireṇa indreṇa medinā
translated: May my heroes be victorious, with firm and bountiful Indra.

original: nirhastaḥ śatrur abhidāsann astu ye senābhir yudham āyanty asmān /
analyzed: nirhastaḥ śatruḥ abhidāsan astu ye senābhiḥ yudham āyanti asmān
translated: Let the enemy be weaponless and powerless who assails us, who comes against us with armies to fight.

original: sam arpayendra mahatā vadhena drātv eṣām aghahāro vividdhaḥ ////
analyzed: sam arpaya indra mahatā vadhena drātu eṣām agha hāraḥ vividdhaḥ
translated: Crush them with great slaughter, O Indra; let the slayer of the wicked flee from them.

original: ātanvānā āyachanto 'syanto ye ca dhāvatha /
analyzed: ātanvānāḥ āyacchantaḥ syantaḥ ye ca dhāvatha
translated: Those who stretch out, those who aim, those who shoot, and those who run,

original: nirhastāḥ śatravaḥ sthanendro vo 'dya parāśarīt ////
analyzed: nirhastāḥ śatravaḥ sthana indraḥ vaḥ dya parāśarīt
translated: Let the enemies be weaponless and powerless; let Indra crush them today.

original: nirhastāḥ santu śatravo 'ṅgaiṣāṃ mlāpayāmasi /
analyzed: nirhastāḥ santu śatravaḥ ṅga eṣām mlāpayāmasi
translated: Let the enemies be weaponless; let us weaken their limbs.

original: athaiṣām indra vedāṃsi śataśo vi bhajāmahai ////
analyzed: atha eṣām indra vedāṃsi śataśas vi bhajāmahai
translated: Then, O Indra, let us divide their possessions into hundreds.

original: pari vartmāni sarvata indraḥ pūṣā ca sasratuḥ /🔽muhyantv adyāmūḥ senā amitrāṇāṃ parastarām ////
analyzed: pari vartmāni sarvatas indraḥ pūṣā ca sasratuḥ  muhyantu adya amūḥ senāḥ amitrāṇām parastarām
translated: Indra and Pusan have gone around all the paths.🔽Let the armies of the enemies be confused today, even more confused.

original: mūḍhā amitrāś caratāśīrṣāṇa ivāhayaḥ /
analyzed: mūḍhāḥ amitrāḥ carata a śīrṣāṇaḥ iva ahayaḥ
translated: The enemies are confused, moving about like headless snakes.

original: teṣāṃ vo agnimūḍhānām indro hantu varaṃvaram ////
analyzed: teṣām vaḥ agni mūḍhānām indraḥ hantu varaṃvaram
translated: Among them, O Indra, let the best of the confused be slain by Agni.

original: aiṣu nahya vṛṣājinaṃ hariṇasya bhiyaṃ kṛdhi /🔽parāṅ amitra eṣatv arvācī gaur upeṣatu ////
analyzed: ā eṣu nahya vṛṣā ajinam hariṇasya bhiyam kṛdhi  parāṅ amitraḥ eṣatu arvācī gauḥ upeṣatu
translated: In these, O bull, make the deer's hide soft.🔽Let the enemy go away, and let the cow come near.

original: āyam agant savitā kṣureṇoṣṇena vāya udakenehi /
analyzed: ā ayam agan savitā kṣureṇa uṣṇena vāyo udakena ihi
translated: Savitar has come with the razor, with the hot water, with the water. Come hither.

original: ādityā rudrā vasava undantu sacetasaḥ somasya rājño vapata pracetasaḥ ////
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ undantu sacetasaḥ somasya rājñaḥ vapata pracetasaḥ
translated: May the Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, of one mind, pour out the beard of Soma, the king, the wise.

original: aditiḥ śmaśru vapatv āpa undantu varcasā /
analyzed: aditiḥ śmaśru vapatu āpaḥ undantu varcasā
translated: May Aditi shave the beard, may the waters moisten with radiance.

original: cikitsatu prajāpatir dīrghāyutvāya cakṣase ////
analyzed: cikitsatu prajāpatiḥ dīrgha āyu tvāya cakṣase
translated: May Prajapati heal for long life and sight.

original: yenāvapat savitā kṣureṇa somasya rājño varuṇasya vidvān /
analyzed: yena avapat savitā kṣureṇa somasya rājñaḥ varuṇasya vidvān
translated: With what razor Savitar shaved, knowing the king Soma and Varuna,

original: tena brahmāṇo vapatedam asya gomān aśvavān ayam astu prajāvān ////
analyzed: tena brahmāṇaḥ vapata idam asya gomān aśvavān ayam astu prajāvān
translated: With that the Brahmans shave this (man's beard). May he be rich in cattle, in horses, in offspring.

original: girāv aragarāṭeṣu hiranye goṣu yad yaśaḥ /🔽surāyāṃ sicyamānāyāṃ kīlāle madhu tan mayi ////
analyzed: girau aragarāṭeṣu hiranye goṣu yat yaśaḥ  surāyām sicyamānāyām kīlāle madhu tat mayi
translated: The glory that is in the mountains, in the Araragatas, in gold, in cattle,🔽The honey that is in the Soma when it is pressed, in the beer, in the scum, may that be in me.

original: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā madhunāṅktaṃ śubhas patī /
analyzed: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā madhunā aṅktam śubhaḥ patī
translated: O Asvins, lords of splendour, anoint me with the honey of the reed,

original: yathā bhargasvatīṃ vācam āvadāni janāṃ anu ////
analyzed: yathā bhargasvatīm vācam āvadāni janān anu
translated: That I may utter speech that is full of light among the people.

original: mayi varco atho yaśo 'tho yajñasya yat payaḥ /
analyzed: mayi varcaḥ atha u yaśaḥ tha u yajñasya yat payaḥ
translated: In me be splendour and glory, and the sap of sacrifice.

original: tan mayi prajāpatir divi dyām iva dṛṃhatu ////
analyzed: tat mayi prajāpatiḥ divi dyām iva dṛṃhatu
translated: May Prajapati settle that in me as Dyaus settles Diti.

original: yathā māṃsam yathā surā yathākṣā adhidevane /🔽yathā puṃso vṛṣaṇyata striyāṃ nihanyate manaḥ /
analyzed: yathā māṃsam yathā surā yathā akṣāḥ adhidevane  yathā puṃsaḥ vṛṣaṇyataḥ striyām nihanyate manaḥ
translated: As flesh, as wine, as dice at play,

original: evā te aghnye mano 'dhi vatse ni hanyatām ////
analyzed: eva te aghnye manaḥ dhi vatse ni hanyatām
translated: As a man's mind is fixed upon a woman, so is thy mind, O cow, fixed upon the calf.

original: yathā hastī hastinyāḥ padena padam udyuje /🔽yathā puṃso vṛṣaṇyata striyāṃ nihanyate manaḥ /
analyzed: yathā hastī hastinyāḥ padena padam  yathā puṃsaḥ vṛṣaṇyataḥ striyām nihanyate manaḥ
translated: As an elephant is fixed upon the footprint of an elephant,

original: evā te aghnye mano 'dhi vatse ni hanyatām ////
analyzed: eva te aghnye manaḥ dhi vatse ni hanyatām
translated: As a man's mind is fixed upon a woman, so is thy mind, O cow, fixed upon the calf.

original: yathā pradhir yathopadhir yathā nabhyaṃ pradhāv adhi /🔽yathā puṃso vṛṣaṇyata striyāṃ nihanyate manaḥ /
analyzed: yathā pradhiḥ yathā upadhiḥ yathā nabhyam pradhau adhi  yathā puṃsaḥ vṛṣaṇyataḥ striyām nihanyate manaḥ
translated: As the outer rim, as the inner rim, as the nave is fixed upon the spokes,

original: evā te aghnye mano 'dhi vatse ni hanyatām ////🔽yad annam admi bahudhā virūpaṃ hiraṇyam aśvam uta gām ajām avim /
analyzed: eva te aghnye manaḥ dhi vatse ni hanyatām  yat annam admi bahudhā virūpam hiraṇyam aśvam uta gām ajām avim
translated: As a man's mind is fixed upon a woman, so is thy mind, O cow, fixed upon the calf.🔽Whatever food I eat in various forms, gold, horse, cow, goat, sheep,

original: yad eva kiṃ ca pratijagrahāham agniṣ ṭad dhotā suhutaṃ kṛnotu ////
analyzed: yat eva kim ca pratijagraha aham agniḥ tat hotā su hutam kṛnotu
translated: Whatever I have accepted, may the priest Agni make that well-offered for me.

original: yan mā hutam ahutam ājagāma dattaṃ pitṛbhir anumataṃ manuṣyaiḥ /
analyzed: yat mā hutam a hutam ājagāma dattam pitṛbhiḥ anumatam manuṣyaiḥ
translated: Whatever oblation has come to me, unoffered, given by the fathers, approved by men,

original: yasmān me mana ud iva rārajīty agniṣ ṭad dhotā suhutaṃ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: yasmāt me manaḥ ud iva rāraji iti agniḥ tat hotā su hutam kṛṇotu
translated: From which my mind seems to be lifted up, may the priest Agni make that well-offered for me.

original: yad annam admy anṛtena devā dāsyann adāsyann uta saṃgṛṇāmi /
analyzed: yat annam admi anṛtena devāḥ dāsyan a dāsyan uta saṃgṛṇāmi
translated: Whatever food I eat, O Gods, through untruth, whether I am about to give or not to give,

original: vaiśvānarasya mahato mahimnā śivaṃ mahyaṃ madhumad astv annam ////
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya mahataḥ mahimnā śivam mahyam madhumat astu annam
translated: By the great might of Vaiśvānara, may my food be auspicious and sweet to me.

original: yathāsitaḥ prathayate vaśām anu vapūṃṣi kṛṇvann asurasya māyayā /
analyzed: yathā asitaḥ prathayate vaśām anu vapūṃṣi kṛṇvan asurasya māyayā
translated: As the black (bird) spreads out after the female, forming forms by the magic of the Asura,

original: evā te śepaḥ sahasāyam arko 'ṅgenāṅgaṃ saṃsamakaṃ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: eva te śepaḥ sahasā ayam arkaḥ ṅgena aṅgam saṃsamakam kṛṇotu
translated: So may thy penis, O swift one, be made equal limb by limb with thy body.

original: yathā pasas tāyādaraṃ vātena sthūlabhaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yathā pasaḥ tāyā ādaram vātena sthūlabham kṛtam
translated: As the skin of the wild boar was made by the wind,

original: yāvat parasvataḥ pasas tāvat te vardhatāṃ pasaḥ ////
analyzed: yāvat parasvataḥ pasaḥ tāvat te vardhatām pasaḥ
translated: As great as is the skin of the wild boar, so great may thy skin increase.

original: yāvadaṅgīnaṃ pārasvataṃ hāstinaṃ gārdabham ca yat /
analyzed: yāvadaṅgīnam pārasvatam hāstinam gārdabham ca yat
translated: As much as is the skin of the antelope, the elephant, the horse, and the ass,

original: yāvad aśvasya vājinas tāvat te vardhatāṃ pasaḥ ////
analyzed: yāvat aśvasya vājinaḥ tāvat te vardhatām pasaḥ
translated: As much as is the skin of the swift horse, so much may thy skin increase.

original: eha yātu varuṇaḥ somo agnir bṛhaspatir vasubhir eha yātu /
analyzed: ā iha yātu varuṇaḥ somaḥ agniḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vasubhiḥ ā iha yātu
translated: Here let Varuna come, Soma, Agni, Brihaspati come with the Vasus.

original: asya śriyam upasaṃyāta sarva ugrasya cettuḥ saṃmanasaḥ sajātāḥ ////
analyzed: asya śriyam upasaṃyāta sarve ugrasya cettuḥ saṃmanasaḥ sajātāḥ
translated: Let all the kinsmen of this mighty conqueror come together with one mind to his glory.

original: yo vaḥ śuṣmo hṛdayeṣv antar ākūtir yā vo manasi praviṣṭā /
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śuṣmaḥ hṛdayeṣu antar ākūtiḥ yā vaḥ manasi praviṣṭā
translated: Whatever longing is in your hearts, whatever inspiration has entered your minds,

original: tānt sīvayāmi haviṣā ghṛtena mayi sajātā ramatir vo astu ////
analyzed: tān sīvayāmi haviṣā ghṛtena mayi sajātā ramatiḥ vaḥ astu
translated: I sew them together with sacrificial ghee. Let there be joy in your kinsmen for me.

original: ihaiva sta māpa yātādhy asmat pūṣā parastād apatham vaḥ kṛṇotu /
analyzed: iha eva sta mā apa yāta adhi asmat pūṣā parastāt apatham vaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: Let not the gods go far away from us. Let Pusan make a path for you on the other side.

original: vāstoṣ patir anu vo johavītu mayi sajātā ramatiḥ vo astu ////
analyzed: vāstoḥ patiḥ anu vaḥ johavītu mayi sajātā ramatiḥ vaḥ astu
translated: Let the lord of the house call you back. Let there be harmony among you, my kinsmen.

original: saṃ vaḥ pṛcyantāṃ tanvaḥ saṃ manāṃsi sam u vratā /
analyzed: sam vaḥ pṛcyantām tanvaḥ sam manāṃsi sam u vratā
translated: May your bodies be united, may your minds be united, and may your vows be united.

original: sam vo 'yam brahmaṇas patir bhagaḥ saṃ vo ajīgamat ////
analyzed: sam vaḥ yam brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ bhagaḥ sam vaḥ ajīgamat
translated: May this Brahmanaspati, this Bhaga, unite you all.

original: samjñapanaṃ vo manaso 'tho samjñapanam hṛdaḥ /
analyzed: samjñapanam vaḥ manasaḥ samjñapanam hṛdaḥ
translated: The thought-unification of your minds, and the thought-unification of your hearts,

original: atho bhagasya yac chrāntaṃ tena saṃjñapayāmi vaḥ ////
analyzed: atha u bhagasya yat śrāntam tena saṃjñapayāmi vaḥ
translated: and what is exhausted of your fortune, by that I unify you all.

original: yathādityā vasubhiḥ sambabhūvur marudbhir ugrā ahṛṇīyamānāḥ /
analyzed: yathā ādityāḥ vasubhiḥ sambabhūvuḥ marudbhiḥ ugrāḥ a hṛṇīyamānāḥ
translated: As the Adityas were united with the Vasus, as the fierce ones were united with the Maruts,

original: evā triṇāmann ahṛṇīyamāna imān janānt saṃmanasas kṛdhīha ////
analyzed: eva tri nāman a hṛṇīyamānaḥ imān janān saṃmanasaḥ kṛdhī iha
translated: thus, O three-named one, being united, make these people of one mind here.

original: nir amuṃ nuda okasaḥ sapatno yaḥ pṛtanyati /🔽nairbādhyena haviṣendra enaṃ parāśarīt ////
analyzed: niḥ amum nude okasaḥ sapatnaḥ yaḥ pṛtanyati  nairbādhyena haviṣā indraḥ enam parāśarīt
translated: Drive him away from his home, the enemy who attacks.🔽With the oblation of the Nirbāhya, Indra has driven him away.

original: paramāṃ taṃ parāvatam indro nudatu vṛtrahā /
analyzed: paramām tam parāvatam indraḥ nudatu vṛtrahā
translated: Let Indra, the slayer of Vṛtra, drive him to the farthest distance,

original: yato na punar āyati śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ ////
analyzed: yatas na punar āyati śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ
translated: from which he shall not return for all the endless years.

original: etu tisraḥ parāvata etu pañca janāṃ ati /
analyzed: etu tisraḥ parāvataḥ etu pañca janān ati
translated: Let him go to the three farthest distances, let him go beyond the five peoples.

original: etu tisro 'ti rocanā yato na punar āyati /
analyzed: etu tisraḥ ti rocanā yatas na punar āyati
translated: Let the three luminous realms come to him, from which he shall not return,

original: śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyo yāvat sūryo asad divi ////
analyzed: śaśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ yāvat sūryaḥ asat divi
translated: For all the eternal years, as long as the sun shall rise in the sky.

original: ya enaṃ pariṣīdanti samādadhati cakṣase /🔽saṃpreddho agnir jihvābhir ud etu hṛdayād adhi ////
analyzed: ye enam pariṣīdanti samādadhati cakṣase  saṃpreddhaḥ agniḥ jihvābhiḥ ud etu hṛdayāt adhi
translated: Those who sit around him, who place him in the fire for the sake of sight,🔽May the well-kindled fire rise up with its tongues from the heart.

original: agneḥ sāmtapanasyāham āyuṣe padam ā rabhe /
analyzed: agneḥ sāmtapanasya aham āyuṣe padam ā rabhe
translated: I take hold of the place of Agni's life-giving heat for the sake of life.

original: addhātir yasya paśyati dhūmam udyantam āsyataḥ ////
analyzed: addhātiḥ yasya paśyati dhūmam udyantam āsyataḥ
translated: He whose life-breath sees the rising smoke from his mouth.

original: yo asya samidhaṃ veda kṣatriyeṇa samāhitām /🔽nābhihvāre padaṃ ni dadhāti sa mṛtyave ////
analyzed: yaḥ asya samidham veda kṣatriyeṇa samāhitām  na abhihvāre padam ni dadhāti sa mṛtyave
translated: He who knows his kindling stick, which is placed by the Kshatriya,🔽Does not place his foot in the abyss, he is not subject to death.

original: nainaṃ ghnanti paryāyiṇo na sannāṃ ava gachati /
analyzed: na enam ghnanti paryāyiṇaḥ na sannām ava gacchati
translated: The changing [seasons] do not kill him, he does not fall into a pit.

original: agner yaḥ kṣatriyo vidvān nāma gṛhnāti āyuṣe ////
analyzed: agneḥ yaḥ kṣatriyaḥ vidvān nāma gṛhnāti āyuṣe
translated: The Kshatriya who knows Agni's name takes it for the sake of life.

original: asthād dyaur asthāt pṛthivy asthād viśvam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: asthāt dyauḥ asthāt pṛthivī asthāt viśvam idam jagat
translated: The sky has stood firm, the earth has stood firm, this whole world has stood firm.

original: āsthāne parvatā asthu sthāmny aśvāṃ atiṣṭhipam ////🔽ya udānat parāyaṇaṃ ya udānaṇ nyāyanam /
analyzed: āsthāne parvatāḥ asthuḥ sthāmni aśvām atiṣṭhipam  yaḥ udānat parāyaṇam yaḥ udānat nyāyanam
translated: The mountains have stood firm in the standing place, I have placed the horses in the standing place.🔽I invoke him who is the upward-going, the downward-going,

original: āvartanam nivartanaṃ yo gopā api taṃ huve ////
analyzed: āvartanam nivartanam yaḥ gopāḥ api tam huve
translated: The returning, the turning back, the guardian.

original: jātavedo ni vartaya śataṃ te santv āvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: jātavedaḥ ni vartaya śatam te santu āvṛtaḥ
translated: O Jātavedas, turn back, may there be a hundred returns for you.

original: sahasraṃ ta upāvṛtas tābhir naḥ punar ā kṛdhi ////
analyzed: sahasram te upāvṛtaḥ tābhiḥ naḥ punar ā kṛdhi
translated: With those a thousand have surrounded thee: with them make him live again for us.

original: tena bhūtena haviṣāyam ā pyāyatāṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: tena bhūtena haviṣā ayam ā pyāyatām punar
translated: With that same being, that oblation, let him swell again.

original: jāyām yām asmā āvākṣus tām rasenābhi vardhatām ////
analyzed: jāyām yām asmai āvākṣuḥ tām rasena abhi vardhatām
translated: The wife whom they have chosen for him, let her grow great with offspring.

original: abhi vardhatāṃ payasābhi rāṣṭreṇa vardhatām /
analyzed: abhi vardhatām payasā abhi rāṣṭreṇa vardhatām
translated: Let her grow great with milk, let her grow great with the kingdom,

original: rayyā sahasravarcasemau stām anupakṣitau ////
analyzed: rayyā sahasra varcasā imau stām an upakṣitau
translated: With wealth a thousandfold in splendour: let these two be free from sorrow.

original: tvaṣṭā jāyām ajanayat tvaṣṭāsyai tvāṃ patim /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā jāyām ajanayat tvaṣṭā asyai tvām patim
translated: Tvastr begat the wife: Tvastr hath made thee her husband.

original: tvaṣṭā sahasram āyuṃṣi dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu vām ////🔽ayaṃ no nabhasas patiḥ saṃsphāno abhi rakṣatu /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā sahasram āyuṃṣi dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu vām  ayam naḥ nabhasaḥ patiḥ saṃsphānaḥ abhi rakṣatu
translated: May Tvastr grant you life a thousand years, and long life also.🔽May this lord of the sky, the gladdener, protect us well.

original: asamātim gṛheṣu naḥ ////🔽tvaṃ no nabhasas pate ūrjaṃ gṛhesu dhāraya /
analyzed: asamātim gṛheṣu naḥ  tvam naḥ nabhasaḥ pate ūrjam gṛhesu dhāraya
translated: May he grant us complete protection in our houses.🔽Thou, O lord of the sky, in our houses, support us with food.

original: ā puṣṭam etv ā vasu ////
analyzed: ā puṣṭam etu ā vasu
translated: Let increase of wealth and treasure come to us.

original: deva saṃsphāna sahasrāpoṣasyeśiṣe /
analyzed: deva saṃsphāna sahasrāpoṣasya īśiṣe
translated: O god, gladdener, thou art the lord of a thousandfold increase.

original: tasya no rāsva tasya no dhehi tasya te bhaktivāmsaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: tasya naḥ rāsva tasya naḥ dhehi tasya te bhaktivāmsaḥ syāma
translated: Of that grant us a portion, of that bestow on us: may we be devoted to thee.

original: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā bhūtāvacākaśat /
analyzed: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā bhūtā avacākaśat
translated: He flieth in the sky, looking down on all existing things.

original: śuno divyasya yan mahas tenā te haviṣā vidhema ////
analyzed: śunaḥ divyasya yat mahaḥ tena te haviṣā vidhema
translated: With that oblation of thine, O divine Sun, may we worship thee.

original: ye trayaḥ kālakāñjā divi devā iva śritāḥ /
analyzed: ye trayaḥ kālakāñjāḥ divi devāḥ iva śritāḥ
translated: Those three, the Kalakankhas, who are seated in the sky like gods,

original: tānt sarvān ahva ūtaye 'smā ariṣṭatātaye ////
analyzed: tān sarvān ahve ūtaye smaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: All of them I call to help us, to give us security from injury.

original: apsu te janma divi te sadhasthaṃ samudre antar mahimā te pṛthivyām /
analyzed: apsu te janma divi te sadhastham samudre antar mahimā te pṛthivyām
translated: In the waters is thy birth, in the sky thy abode, thy greatness is in the ocean and on the earth.

original: śuno divyasya yan mahas tenā te haviṣā vidhema ////🔽yantāsi yachase hastāv apa rakṣāṃsi sedhasi /
analyzed: śunaḥ divyasya yat mahaḥ tena te haviṣā vidhema  yantāsi yacchase hastau apa rakṣāṃsi sedhasi
translated: With this oblation of thine, we will worship thee, the greatness of the divine dog.🔽Thou art the leader, thou leadest with thy hands, thou drivest away the Raksases.

original: prajāṃ dhanaṃ ca gṛhṇānaḥ parihasto abhūd ayam ////
analyzed: prajām dhanam ca gṛhṇānaḥ parihastaḥ abhūt ayam
translated: Taking offspring and wealth, this Pariharsa has become (our friend).

original: parihasta vi dhāraya yoniṃ garbhāya dhātave /
analyzed: parihasta vi dhāraya yonim garbhāya dhātave
translated: Pariharsa, support the womb for the embryo to be conceived.

original: maryāde putram ā dhehi taṃ tvam ā gamayāgame ////
analyzed: maryāde putram ā dhehi tam tvam ā gamaya āgame
translated: Place the son in the boundary, thou lead him to us, lead him to us.

original: yaṃ parihastam abibhar aditiḥ putrakāmyā /
analyzed: yam parihastam abibhar aditiḥ putra kāmyā
translated: The Pariharsa which Aditi held, longing for a son,

original: tvaṣṭā tam asyā ā badhnād yathā putraṃ janād ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭā tam asyai ā badhnāt yathā putram janāt
translated: Tvashtri bound it to her, that she might have a son from the people.

original: āgachata āgatasya nāma gṛhṇāmy āyataḥ /
analyzed: āgacchataḥ āgatasya nāma gṛhṇāmi āyataḥ
translated: I take the name of the come hither, of the come hither, of the come hither.

original: indrasya vṛtraghno vanve vāsavasya śatakratoḥ ////
analyzed: indrasya vṛtra ghnaḥ vanve vāsavasya śatakratoḥ
translated: I win the favour of Indra, the Vrtra-slayer, the wealthy, the performer of a hundred sacrifices.

original: yena sūryāṃ sāvitrīm aśvinohatuḥ pathā /
analyzed: yena sūryām sāvitrīm aśvinā ūhatuḥ pathā
translated: By the path by which the Asvins mounted Surya and Savitri,

original: tena mām abravīd bhago jayām ā vahatād iti ////
analyzed: tena mām abravīt bhagaḥ jayām ā vahatāt iti
translated: By that path Bhaga has told me to bring Jaya to me.

original: yas te 'ṅkuśo vasudāno bṛhann indra hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te ṅkuśaḥ vasu dānaḥ bṛhan indra hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: Thy goad, O Indra, which giveth wealth, which is great, golden,

original: tenā janiyate jāyāṃ mahyaṃ dhehi śacīpate ////
analyzed: tena ā janiyate jāyām mahyam dhehi śacīpate
translated: Therefore, O Lord of Strength, bestow a wife upon me.

original: apacitaḥ pra patata suparṇo vasater iva /
analyzed: apacitaḥ pra patata suparṇaḥ vasateḥ iva
translated: The emaciated one flies away like a bird from its nest.

original: sūryaḥ kṛṇotu bheṣajaṃ candramā vo 'pochatu ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ kṛṇotu bheṣajam candramāḥ vaḥ pochatu
translated: May Surya make the remedy, may the Moon protect you.

original: eny ekā śyeny ekā kṛṣṇaikā rohiṇī dve /
analyzed: enī ekā śyenī ekā kṛṣṇā ekā rohiṇī dve
translated: One is a female eagle, one is black, two are red.

original: sarvāsām agrabhaṃ nāmāvīraghnīr apetana ////
analyzed: sarvāsām agrabham nāma a vīra ghnīḥ apetana
translated: I have seized the name of all of them. May the non-heroic ones depart.

original: asūtikā rāmāyaṇy apacit pra patiṣyati /
analyzed: a sūtikā rāmāyaṇī apacit pra patiṣyati
translated: The emaciated one will fly away, the one who has not given birth, the one who is not a Rama.

original: glaur itaḥ pra patiṣyati sa galunto naśiṣyati ////
analyzed: glauḥ itas pra patiṣyati sa galuntaḥ naśiṣyati
translated: The pale one will fly away from here. It will perish, having been cut in two.

original: vīhi svām āhutiṃ juṣāno manasā svāhā manasā yad idaṃ juhomi ////
analyzed: vīhi svām āhutim juṣānaḥ manasā svāhā manasā yat idam juhomi
translated: Go and enjoy your own oblation with your mind, svāhā. With my mind I offer this.

original: yasyās ta āsani ghore juhomy eṣāṃ baddhānām avasarjanāya kam /
analyzed: yasyāḥ te āsani ghore juhomi eṣām baddhānām avasarjanāya kam
translated: To whom I offer in the terrible lightning of these bound ones for their release.

original: bhūmir iti tvābhipramanvate janā nirṛtir iti tvāhaṃ pari veda sarvataḥ ////
analyzed: bhūmiḥ iti tvā abhipramanvate janāḥ nirṛtiḥ iti tvā aham pari veda sarvatas
translated: People think of you as Bhumi. I know you as Nirriti on all sides.

original: bhūte haviṣmatī bhavaiṣa te bhāgo yo asmāsu /
analyzed: bhūte haviṣmatī bhava eṣa te bhāgaḥ yaḥ asmāsu
translated: Be present with the oblation, this is your share that is in us.

original: muñcemān amūn enasaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: muñca imān amūn enasaḥ svāhā
translated: Release these from that sin, svāhā.

original: evo ṣv asman nirṛte 'nehā tvam ayasmayān vi cṛtā bandhapāśān /
analyzed: eva u su asmat nirṛte na iha ā iha tvam ayasmayān vi cṛta bandha pāśān
translated: O Nirriti, loosen these iron fetters and bonds for us.

original: yamo mahyaṃ punar it tvāṃ dadāti tasmai yamāya namo astu mṛtyave ////
analyzed: yamaḥ mahyam punar id tvām dadāti tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mṛtyave
translated: Yama again gives you to me. Homage to that Yama, to Death.

original: ayasmaye drupade bedhiṣa ihābhihito mṛtyubhir ye sahasram /
analyzed: ayasmaye drupade bedhiṣe iha abhihitaḥ mṛtyubhiḥ ye sahasram
translated: To the iron pillar I bind here, announced by the deaths that are a thousand in number.

original: yamena tvaṃ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāna uttamaṃ nākam adhi rohayemam ////
analyzed: yamena tvam pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam
translated: You, in agreement with Yama and the Fathers, raise this one to the highest heaven.

original: varaṇo vārayātā ayaṃ devo vanaspatiḥ /
analyzed: varaṇaḥ vārayātai ayam devaḥ vanaspatiḥ
translated: Varana, the repeller, this god, the lord of the forest,

original: yakṣmo yo asminn āviṣṭas tam u devā avīvaran ////
analyzed: yakṣmaḥ yaḥ asmin āviṣṭaḥ tam u devāḥ avīvaran
translated: the consumption that has entered this one, the gods have repelled.

original: indrasya vacasā vayaṃ mitrasya varuṇasya ca /
analyzed: indrasya vacasā vayam mitrasya varuṇasya ca
translated: By the word of Indra, of Mitra, of Varuna,

original: devānāṃ sarveṣāṃ vācā yakṣmaṃ te vārayāmahe ////
analyzed: devānām sarveṣām vācā yakṣmam te vārayāmahe
translated: by the word of all the gods, we repel your consumption.

original: yathā vṛtra imā āpas tastambha viśvadhā yatīḥ /
analyzed: yathā vṛtraḥ imāḥ āpaḥ tastambha viśvadhā yatīḥ
translated: Just as Vritra stopped these waters flowing in all directions,

original: evā te agninā yakṣmaṃ vaiśvānareṇa vāraye ////
analyzed: eva te agninā yakṣmam vaiśvānareṇa vāraye
translated: so I repel your consumption with Agni, with Vaisvānara.

original: vṛṣendrasya vṛṣā divo vṛsā pṛthivyā ayam /
analyzed: vṛṣā indrasya vṛṣā divaḥ vṛsā pṛthivyāḥ ayam
translated: You are the bull of Indra, the bull of heaven, the bull of earth,

original: vṛṣā viśvasya bhūtasya tvam ekavṛṣo bhava ////
analyzed: vṛṣā viśvasya bhūtasya tvam eka vṛṣaḥ bhava
translated: you are the one bull of all that exists.

original: samudra īśe sravatām agniḥ pṛthivyā vaśī /
analyzed: samudraḥ īśe sravatām agniḥ pṛthivyāḥ vaśī
translated: The ocean is the lord of the flowing waters, Agni is the lord of the earth,

original: candramā nakṣatrāṇām īśe tvam ekavṛṣo bhava ////
analyzed: candramāḥ nakṣatrāṇām īśe tvam eka vṛṣaḥ bhava
translated: the moon is the lord of the stars, you are the one bull.

original: samrāḍ asy asurāṇāṃ kakun manuṣyānām /
analyzed: samrāj asi asurāṇām kakud manuṣyānām
translated: You are the emperor of the Asuras, the peak of humans,

original: devānām ardhabhāg asi tvam ekavṛṣo bhava ////
analyzed: devānām ardha bhāj asi tvam eka vṛṣaḥ bhava
translated: You are the partaker of half the offerings of the gods. Be the sole bull.

original: ā tvāhārṣam antar abhūr dhruvas tiṣṭhāvicācalat /
analyzed: ā tvā ahārṣam antar abhūḥ dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha a vicācalat
translated: I have brought you here. Be firm and immovable.

original: viśas tvā sarvā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭram adhi bhraśat ////
analyzed: viśaḥ tvā sarvāḥ vāñchantu mā tvat rāṣṭram adhi bhraśat
translated: May all the people desire you. Let not your kingdom be destroyed.

original: ihaivaidhi māpa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvata ivāvicācalat /🔽indra iveha dhruvas tiṣṭheha rāṣṭram u dhāraya ////
analyzed: iha eva edhi mā apa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvataḥ iva a vicācalat  indraḥ iva iha dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha iha rāṣṭram u dhāraya
translated: Be here only. Do not fall away. Be immovable like a mountain.🔽Stand firm here like Indra. Here uphold the kingdom.

original: indra etam adīdharat dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣā /
analyzed: indraḥ etam adīdharat dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā
translated: Indra has established this, the firm one, with firm oblation.

original: tasmai somo adhi bravad ayaṃ ca brahmaṇas patiḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat ayam ca brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: To him may Soma and this Brahmanaspati speak firmly.

original: dhruvā dyaur dhruvā pṛthivī dhruvaṃ viśvam idaṃ jagat /
analyzed: dhruvā dyauḥ dhruvā pṛthivī dhruvam viśvam idam jagat
translated: Firm is the sky, firm is the earth, firm is this whole world.

original: dhruvāsaḥ parvatā ime dhruvo rājā viśām ayam ////
analyzed: dhruvāsaḥ parvatāḥ ime dhruvaḥ rājā viśām ayam
translated: Firm are these mountains. Firm is this king of the people.

original: dhruvaṃ te rājā varuṇo dhruvam devo bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: dhruvam te rājā varuṇaḥ dhruvam devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Firm is your king Varuna, firm is the god Brihaspati.

original: dhruvaṃ ta indraś cāgniś ca rāṣṭraṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvam ////
analyzed: dhruvam te indraḥ ca agniḥ ca rāṣṭram dhārayatām dhruvam
translated: Firm is your kingdom. May Indra and Agni uphold it firmly.

original: dhruvo 'cyutaḥ pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn chatrūyato 'dharān pādayasva /
analyzed: dhruvo cyutaḥ pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn śatrūyataḥ dharān pādayasva
translated: Firm and unmoving, crush your enemies. Lay low those who hate you.

original: sarvā diśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ sadhrīcīr dhruvāya te samitiḥ kalpatām iha ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ diśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ sadhrīcīḥ dhruvāya te samitiḥ kalpatām iha
translated: May all the quarters, with the east, be of one mind. May your assembly be firm here for you.

original: idaṃ yat preṇyaḥ śiro dattaṃ somena vṛṣṇyam /
analyzed: idam yat preṇyaḥ śiraḥ dattam somena vṛṣṇyam
