translated: This head of yours, which is dear, which has been given to Soma, which is mighty,

original: tataḥ pari prajātena hārdiṃ te śocayāmasi ////
analyzed: tatas pari prajātena hārdim te śocayāmasi
translated: From that, with the one that has arisen, we inflame your heart.

original: śocayāmasi te hārdiṃ śocayāmasi te manaḥ /
analyzed: śocayāmasi te hārdim śocayāmasi te manaḥ
translated: We inflame your heart, we inflame your mind.

original: vātaṃ dhūma iva sadhryaṅ mām evānv etu ye manaḥ ////
analyzed: vātam dhūmaḥ iva sadhryak mām eva anu etu ye manaḥ
translated: Like smoke to the wind, let your mind come to me alone.

original: mahyaṃ tvā mitrāvaruṇau mahyaṃ devī sarasvatī /
analyzed: mahyam tvā mitrāvaruṇau mahyam devī sarasvatī
translated: To me you, O Mitra and Varuna, to me the goddess Sarasvati,

original: mahyaṃ tvā madhyaṃ bhūmyā ubhāv antau sam asyatām ////
analyzed: mahyam tvā madhyam bhūmyāḥ ubhau antau sam asyatām
translated: To me you, O middle of the earth, let both ends join together.

original: yāṃ te rudra iṣum āsyad aṅgebhyo hṛdayāya ca /
analyzed: yām te rudraḥ iṣum āsyat aṅgebhyaḥ hṛdayāya ca
translated: The arrow which Rudra shot at your limbs and heart,

original: idaṃ tām adya tvad vayaṃ viṣūcīṃ vi vṛhāmasi ////
analyzed: idam tām adya tvat vayam viṣūcīm vi vṛhāmasi
translated: That arrow of yours we now draw out from you in all directions.

original: yās te śataṃ dhamanayo 'ṅgāny anu viṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te śatam dhamanayaḥ ṅgāni anu viṣṭhitāḥ
translated: The hundred channels that are spread out through your limbs,

original: tāsāṃ te sarvāsām vayaṃ nir viṣāṇi hvayāmasi ////
analyzed: tāsām te sarvāsām vayam niḥ viṣāṇi hvayāmasi
translated: From all of them we summon out the poisons.

original: namas te rudrāsyate namaḥ pratihitāyai /
analyzed: namaḥ te rudra asyate namaḥ pratihitāyai
translated: Homage to you, O Rudra, when you aim, homage to the shot,

original: namo visṛjyamānāyai namo nipatitāyai ////
analyzed: namaḥ visṛjyamānāyai namaḥ nipatitāyai
translated: Homage to the released, homage to the fallen.

original: imaṃ yavam aṣṭāyogaiḥ ṣadyogebhir acarkṛṣuḥ /
analyzed: imam yavam aṣṭāyogaiḥ ṣadyogebhiḥ acarkṛṣuḥ
translated: This barley they have ploughed with eight yokes and six yokes.

original: tenā te tanvo rapo 'pācīnam apa vyaye ////
analyzed: tena te tanvaḥ rapaḥ pācīnam apa vyaye
translated: With that we drive away from your limbs the evil that has arisen.

original: nyag vāto vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ /
analyzed: nyak vātaḥ vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ
translated: The wind blows downward, the sun shines downward,

original: nīcīnam aghnyā duhe nyag bhavatu te rapaḥ ////
analyzed: nīcīnam aghnyā duhe nyak bhavatu te rapaḥ
translated: Let the low-lying cow yield milk for you; let your disease be bent downward.

original: āpa id vā u bheṣajīr āpo amīvacātanīḥ /
analyzed: āpaḥ id vai u bheṣajīḥ āpaḥ amīva cātanīḥ
translated: The waters are indeed the medicines, the waters the removers of disease.

original: āpo viśvasya bheṣajīs tās te kṛṇvantu bheṣajam ////
analyzed: āpaḥ viśvasya bheṣajīḥ tāḥ te kṛṇvantu bheṣajam
translated: The waters are the medicine for all; may they make a remedy for you.

original: vātaraṃhā bhava vājin yujamāna indrasya yāhi prasave manojavāḥ /
analyzed: vāta raṃhāḥ bhava vājin yujamānaḥ indrasya yāhi prasave manaḥ javāḥ
translated: Be a wind-queller, O steed, when yoked, go in the impulse of Indra, swift as thought.

original: yuñjantu tvā maruto viśvavedasa ā te tvastā patsu javaṃ dadhātu ////
analyzed: yuñjantu tvā marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ ā te tvastā patsu javam dadhātu
translated: May the Maruts, all-knowing, yoke thee; may the Adhvaryus bestow speed upon thy feet.

original: javas te arvan nihito guhā yaḥ śyene vāte uta yo 'carat parīttaḥ /🔽tena tvaṃ vājin balavān balenājiṃ jaya samane parayiṣṇuḥ ////
analyzed: javaḥ te arvan nihitaḥ guhā yaḥ śyene vāte uta yaḥ carat parīttaḥ  tena tvam vājin balavān balena ājim jaya samane parayiṣṇuḥ
translated: The speed that is set in thee, O steed, hidden away, which hath gone to the falcon and the wind, enclosed.🔽By that speed, O steed, strong with strength, win the race, victorious in the contest.

original: tanūṣ ṭe vājin tanvaṃ nayantī vāmam asmabhyaṃ dhāvatu śarma tubhyam /
analyzed: tanūḥ te vājin tanvam nayantī vāmam asmabhyam dhāvatu śarma tubhyam
translated: May thy body, O steed, lead thy body, may it run to us for our welfare. May it bring thee bliss.

original: ahruto maho dharuṇāya devo divīva jyotiḥ svam ā mimīyāt ////
analyzed: ahrutaḥ mahaḥ dharuṇāya devaḥ divi iva jyotiḥ svam ā mimīyāt
translated: Unerring, great, a support, a god, may he measure out his own light in the heaven, as in the heaven.

original: yamo mṛtyur aghamāro nirṛtho babhruḥ śarvo 'stā nīlaśikhaṇḍaḥ /
analyzed: yamaḥ mṛtyuḥ agha māraḥ nirṛthaḥ babhruḥ stā nīla śikhaṇḍaḥ
translated: Yama, Death, the evil-doer, Nirṛhi, Babhru, Śarva, Asta, Nīlaśikhaṇḍa,

original: devajanāḥ senayottasthivāṃsas te asmākaṃ pari vṛñjantu vīrān ////
analyzed: deva janāḥ senayā uttasthivāṃsaḥ te asmākam pari vṛñjantu vīrān
translated: The divine people, having risen with their armies, may they spare our heroes.

original: manasā homair harasā ghṛtena śarvāyāstra uta rājñe bhavāya /
analyzed: manasā homaiḥ harasā ghṛtena śarvāya astre uta rājñe bhavāya
translated: With mental oblations, with the fat, with the ghee, to Sarva, to the King Bhava,

original: namasyebhyo nama ebhyaḥ kṛṇomy anyatrāsmad aghaviṣā nayantu ////
analyzed: namasyebhyaḥ namaḥ ebhyaḥ kṛṇomi anyatra asmat agha viṣāḥ nayantu
translated: To these I pay homage, to these I offer reverence. Carry away the poison of our sins to some other place.

original: trāyadhvaṃ no aghaviṣābhyo vadhād viśve devā maruto viśvavedasaḥ /
analyzed: trāyadhvam naḥ agha viṣābhyaḥ vadhāt viśve devāḥ marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ
translated: Protect us from the poison of sins, from the blow, O all ye gods, O Maruts, who know all.

original: agnīṣomā varuṇaḥ pūtadakṣā vātāparjanyayoḥ sumatau syāma ////
analyzed: agnīṣomāḥ varuṇaḥ pūta dakṣāḥ vātāparjanyayoḥ sumatau syāma
translated: May we enjoy the good grace of Agni and Soma, of Varuna of pure power, of Vata and Parjanya.

original: saṃ vo manāṃsi saṃ vratā sam ākūtīr namāmasi /
analyzed: sam vaḥ manāṃsi sam vratā sam ākūtīḥ namāmasi
translated: We bow to your minds, to your vows, to your intentions, we bow.

original: amī ye vivratā sthana tān vaḥ saṃ namayāmasi ////🔽ahaṃ gṛbhṇāmi manasā manāṃsi mama cittam anu cittebhir eta /
analyzed: amī ye vivratāḥ sthana tān vaḥ sam namayāmasi  aham gṛbhṇāmi manasā manāṃsi mama cittam anu cittebhiḥ eta
translated: Those of you who are divided, we bring together for you.🔽I grasp the minds with the mind, my thought with their thoughts.

original: mama vaśeṣu hṛdayāni vaḥ kṛṇomi mama yātam anuvartmāna eta ////
analyzed: mama vaśeṣu hṛdayāni vaḥ kṛṇomi mama yātam anuvartmānaḥ eta
translated: I make your hearts subject to me. Come to me, follow me.

original: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī /
analyzed: ote me dyāvāpṛthivī otā devī sarasvatī
translated: The heaven and the earth are subject to me, the goddess Sarasvati is subject.

original: otau ma indraś cāgniś ca rdhyāsmedaṃ sarasvati ////
analyzed: otau me indraḥ ca agniḥ ca ṛdhyā asma idam sarasvati
translated: Indra and Agni are subject to me. May we prosper in this, O Sarasvati.

original: aśvattho devasadanas tṛtīyasyām ito divi /
analyzed: aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi
translated: The holy fig tree is the abode of the gods, in the third heaven from here.

original: tatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata ////
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata
translated: There the gods have obtained the healing Kushtha of the immortal.

original: hiraṇyayī naur acarad dhiraṇyabandhanā divi /
analyzed: hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi
translated: A golden ship sailed, bound with gold, in the sky.

original: tatrāmṛtasya puṣpaṃ devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata ////
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya puṣpam devāḥ kuṣṭham avanvata
translated: There the gods followed the flower of nectar, the herb.

original: garbho asy oṣadhīnāṃ garbho himavatām uta /
analyzed: garbhaḥ asi oṣadhīnām garbhaḥ himavatām uta
translated: You are the embryo of the plants, and the embryo of the Himalayas.

original: garbho viśvasya bhūtasyemaṃ me agadaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: garbhaḥ viśvasya bhūtasya imam me agadam kṛdhi
translated: Be the embryo of all that exists, make this one free from disease for me.

original: yā oṣadhayaḥ somarājñīr bahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhayaḥ soma rājñīḥ bahvīḥ śata vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: O many herbs with Soma as your king, with a hundred different kinds of knowledge,

original: bṛhaspatiprasūtās tā no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: may they, impelled by Brihaspati, free us from misfortune.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyād atho varuṇyād uta /
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta
translated: May they free me from the curse, and also from Varuna's noose,

original: atho yamasya paḍvīśād viśvasmād devakilbiṣāt ////
analyzed: atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt
translated: and from Yama's fetters, and from all offenses against the gods.

original: yac cakṣuṣā manasā yac ca vācopārima jāgrato yat svapantaḥ /
analyzed: yat cakṣuṣā manasā yat ca vācā upārima jāgrataḥ yat svapantaḥ
translated: Whatever we have done with our eyes, mind, or speech, whether awake or asleep,

original: somas tāni svadhayā naḥ punātu ////
analyzed: somaḥ tāni svadhayā naḥ punātu
translated: may Soma purify those for us with his own power.

original: abhibhūr yajño abhibhūr agnir abhibhūḥ somo abhibhūr indraḥ /
analyzed: abhibhūḥ yajñaḥ abhibhūḥ agniḥ abhibhūḥ somaḥ abhibhūḥ indraḥ
translated: The sacrifice is all-conquering, Agni is all-conquering, Soma is all-conquering, Indra is all-conquering.

original: abhy ahaṃ viśvāḥ pṛtanā yathāsāny evā vidhemāgnihotrā idaṃ haviḥ ////
analyzed: abhi aham viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ yathā asāni eva vidhema agni hotrā idam haviḥ
translated: May I be victorious over all battles. Let us offer this oblation.

original: svadhāstu mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā prajāvat kṣatraṃ madhuneha pinvatam /
analyzed: svadhā astu mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā prajāvat kṣatram madhunā iha pinvatam
translated: O Mitra-Varuna, may you, the wise ones, increase the princely power with offspring and honey here.

original: bādhethāṃ dūraṃ nirṛtiṃ parācaiḥ kṛtaṃ cid enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat ////
analyzed: bādhethām dūram nirṛtim parācais kṛtam cit enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat
translated: Drive away misfortune far away, even what has been done, free us from that.

original: imaṃ vīram anu harṣadhvam ugram indraṃ sakhāyo anu saṃ rabhadhvam /
analyzed: imam vīram anu harṣadhvam ugram indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam
translated: Rejoice in this hero, the mighty Indra, O friends, be ye eager to follow him.

original: grāmajitaṃ gojitaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā ////
analyzed: grāma jitam go jitam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā
translated: The conqueror of villages, the conqueror of cattle, the one with the thunderbolt in his arm, the one who conquers in battle, the one who crushes with his strength.

original: indro jayāti na parā jayātā adhirājo rājasu rājayātai /
analyzed: indraḥ jayāti na parā jayātai adhirājaḥ rājasu rājayātai
translated: Indra shall conquer, not be conquered. Let him rule as the supreme king among kings.

original: carkṛtya īḍyo vandyaś copasadyo namasyś bhaveha ////
analyzed: carkṛtyaḥ īḍyaḥ vandyaḥ ca upasadyaḥ namasyuḥ bhava iha
translated: Be one who is to be served, praised, worshipped, approached, and saluted.

original: tvam indrādhirājaḥ śravasyus tvaṃ bhūr abhibhūtir janānām /
analyzed: tvam indra adhirājaḥ śravasyuḥ tvam bhūḥ abhibhūtiḥ janānām
translated: You, O Indra, are the supreme king, desirous of glory, you are the overlord of the people.

original: tvaṃ daivīr viśa imā vi rājāyuṣmat kṣatram ajaraṃ te astu ////
analyzed: tvam daivīḥ viśaḥ imāḥ vi rāja āyuṣmat kṣatram ajaram te astu
translated: Let your divine clans rule over these. Let your imperishable kingdom be long-lived.

original: prācyā diśas tvam indrāsi rājotodīcyā diśo vṛtrahan chatruho 'si /
analyzed: prācyāḥ diśaḥ tvam indra asi rājā uta udīcyāḥ diśaḥ vṛtrahan śatru ho si
translated: You are the king of the eastern direction, O Indra. You are the slayer of enemies of the northern direction, O Indra.

original: yatra yanti srotyās taj jitaṃ te dakṣiṇato vṛṣabha eṣi havyaḥ ////
analyzed: yatra yanti srotyāḥ tat jitam te dakṣiṇatas vṛṣabhaḥ eṣi havyaḥ
translated: Wherever the streams flow, that is conquered by you. You go to the south as the sacrificial oblation, O bull.

original: abhi tvendra varimataḥ purā tvāṃhūraṇād dhuve /
analyzed: abhi tvā indra varimataḥ purā tvā aṃhūraṇāt dhuve
translated: To you, O Indra, who are rich in gifts, before you are invoked,

original: hvayāmy ugraṃ cettāraṃ puruṇāmānam ekajam ////
analyzed: hvayāmi ugram cettāram puruṇāmānam ekajam
translated: I invoke the fierce leader, the one with many names, the only one.

original: yo adya senyo vadho jighāṃsan na udīrate /
analyzed: yaḥ adya senyaḥ vadhaḥ jighāṃsan naḥ udīrate
translated: Whoever today comes forth with the deadly weapon of the army, intending to kill us,

original: indrasya tatra bāhū samantaṃ pari dadmaḥ ////
analyzed: indrasya tatra bāhū samantam pari dadmaḥ
translated: There we place Indra's two arms all around.

original: pari dadma indrasya bāhū samantaṃ trātus trāyatāṃ naḥ /
analyzed: pari dadmaḥ indrasya bāhū samantam trātuḥ trāyatām naḥ
translated: We place ourselves within the arms of Indra, may the protector protect us on every side.

original: deva savitaḥ soma rājant sumanasaṃ mā kṛṇu svastaye ////
analyzed: deva savitar soma rājan sumanasam mā kṛṇu svastaye
translated: O god Savitar, O Soma, O king, make my mind well-disposed for my welfare.

original: devā aduḥ sūryo dyaur adāt pṛthivy adāt /
analyzed: devāḥ aduḥ sūryaḥ dyauḥ adāt pṛthivī adāt
translated: The gods have given, the sun has given, the sky has given, the earth has given.

original: tisraḥ sarasvatir aduḥ sacittā viṣadūṣaṇam ////
analyzed: tisraḥ sarasvatiḥ aduḥ sa cittāḥ viṣa dūṣaṇam
translated: The three Sarasvatis have given the antidote to poison with their united minds.

original: yad vo devā upajīkā āsiñcan dhanvany udakam /
analyzed: yat vaḥ devāḥ upajīkāḥ āsiñcan dhanvani udakam
translated: The water which the gods have poured out on the dry river-bed,

original: tena devaprasūtenedaṃ dūṣayatā viṣam ////🔽asurāṇāṃ duhitāsi sā devānām asi svasā /
analyzed: tena deva prasūtena idam dūṣayatā viṣam  asurāṇām duhitā asi sā devānām asi svasā
translated: By that which is sent forth by the gods, destroy this poison.🔽You are the daughter of the Asuras, you are the sister of the gods.

original: divas pṛthivyāḥ saṃbhūtā sā cakarthārasaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ saṃbhūtā sā cakartha arasam viṣam
translated: Born from the sky and the earth, you have made the poison ineffective.

original: ā vṛṣāyasva śvasihi vardhasva prathayasva ca /
analyzed: ā vṛṣāyasva śvasihi vardhasva prathayasva ca
translated: Grow strong, breathe, increase, and spread.

original: yathāṅgaṃ vardhatāṃ śepas tena yoṣitam ij jahi ////
analyzed: yathā aṅgam vardhatām śepaḥ tena yoṣitam id jahi
translated: Let the penis grow according to its place, and with that conquer the woman.

original: yena kṛṣaṃ vājayanti yena hinvanty āturam /
analyzed: yena kṛṣam vājayanti yena hinvanti āturam
translated: By which they stimulate the plough, by which they urge the sick one,

original: tenāsya brahmaṇas pate dhanur ivā tānayā pasaḥ ////
analyzed: tena asya brahmaṇaḥ pate dhanuḥ iva ā tānaya pasaḥ
translated: By that, O lord of prayer, draw his pain like a bowstring.

original: āhaṃ tanomi te paso adhi jyām iva dhanvani /
analyzed: ā aham tanomi te pasaḥ adhi jyām iva dhanvani
translated: I draw your pain upon you like a bowstring on a bow.

original: kramasva ṛṣa iva rohitam anavaglāyatā sadā ////
analyzed: kramasva ṛṣaḥ iva rohitam an avaglāyatā sadā
translated: Go, O man, like a bull, always without faltering.

original: yathāyaṃ vāho aśvinā samaiti saṃ ca vartate /
analyzed: yathā ayam vāhaḥ aśvinā samaiti sam ca vartate
translated: As this horse, O ye Asvins, goes forward and turns back again,

original: evā mām abhi te manaḥ samaitu saṃ ca vartatām ////🔽āhaṃ khidāmi te mano rājāśvaḥ pṛṣṭyām iva /
analyzed: eva mām abhi te manaḥ samaitu sam ca vartatām  ā aham khidāmi te manaḥ rāja aśvaḥ pṛṣṭyām iva
translated: Even so let thy heart turn to me and come to me again.🔽I draw thy heart to me as a king draws his chariot horse along the pole.

original: reṣmachinnam yathā tṛṇaṃ mayi te veṣṭatāṃ manaḥ ////
analyzed: reṣma chinnam yathā tṛṇam mayi te veṣṭatām manaḥ
translated: Let thy heart turn to me as a rope of grass is turned when it is cut.

original: āñjanasya madughasya kuṣṭhasya naladasya ca /
analyzed: āñjanasya madughasya kuṣṭhasya naladasya ca
translated: Of ointment, of the honey-plant, of the kuṣṭha and the nalada,

original: turo bhagasya hastābhyām anurodhanam ud bhare ////
analyzed: turaḥ bhagasya hastābhyām anurodhanam ud bhare
translated: I take the favour of Bhaga with both hands.

original: saṃdānaṃ vo bṛhaspatiḥ saṃdānaṃ savitā karat /
analyzed: saṃdānam vaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ saṃdānam savitā karat
translated: May Brhaspati give you the bond, may Savitar make the bond.

original: saṃdānaṃ mitro aryamā saṃdānaṃ bhago aśvinā ////
analyzed: saṃdānam mitraḥ aryamā saṃdānam bhagaḥ aśvinā
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, the Asvins make the bond.

original: sam paramānt sam avamān atho saṃ dyāmi madhyamān /
analyzed: sam paramān sam avamān atha u sam dyāmi madhyamān
translated: I bind together the highest, the lowest, and the middlings.

original: indras tān pary ahār dāmnā tān agne saṃ dyā tvam ////
analyzed: indraḥ tān pari ahār dāmnā tān agne sam dya tvam
translated: Indra hath bound them with a bond: bind them together, O Agni.

original: amī ye yudham āyanti ketūn kṛtvānīkaśaḥ /
analyzed: amī ye yudham āyanti ketūn kṛtvā anīkaśas
translated: Those who come hither to the fight, making their banners and their troops,

original: indras tān pary ahār dāmna tān agne saṃ dyā tvam ////
analyzed: indraḥ tān pari ahār dāmnaḥ tān agne sam dya tvam
translated: Indra hath bound them with a bond: bind them together, O Agni.

original: ādānena saṃdānenāmitrān ā dyāmasi /
analyzed: ādānena saṃdānena amitrān ā dyāmasi
translated: With the bond and the binding we bind our enemies.

original: apānā ye caiṣāṃ prāṇā asunāsūnt sam achidan ////
analyzed: apānāḥ ye ca eṣām prāṇāḥ asunā asūn sam achidan
translated: They have cut off the breath of life and the out-breath of those who hate us.

original: idam ādānam akaraṃ tapasendreṇa saṃśitam /
analyzed: idam ādānam akaram tapasā indreṇa saṃśitam
translated: This seizing, sharpened by the lord of penance, I have performed.

original: amitrā ye 'tra naḥ santi tān agna ā dyā tvam ////
analyzed: amitrāḥ ye tra naḥ santi tān agne ā dya tvam
translated: Those enemies who are here for us, O Agni, burn them up.

original: ainān dyatām indrāgnī somo rājā ca medinau /
analyzed: ā enān dyatām indra agnī somaḥ rājā ca medinau
translated: Let them be burned up, O Indra and Agni, and Soma, the two kings of the earth.

original: indro marutvān ādānam amitrebhyaḥ kṛṇotu naḥ ////
analyzed: indraḥ marutvān ādānam amitrebhyaḥ kṛṇotu naḥ
translated: May Indra with the Maruts make this seizing for us against our enemies.

original: yathā mano manasketaiḥ parāpataty āśumat /
analyzed: yathā manaḥ manasketaiḥ parāpatati āśumat
translated: Just as the mind flies away swiftly with the thoughts,

original: evā tvaṃ kāse pra pata manaso 'nu pravāyyam ////
analyzed: eva tvam kāse pra pata manasaḥ nu pravāyyam
translated: so do you fly away, O cough, following the wind.

original: yathā bāṇaḥ susaṃśitaḥ parāpataty āśumat /
analyzed: yathā bāṇaḥ su saṃśitaḥ parāpatati āśumat
translated: Just as a well-sharpened arrow flies away swiftly,

original: evā tvaṃ kāse pra pata pṛthivyā anu saṃvatam ////
analyzed: eva tvam kāse pra pata pṛthivyāḥ anu saṃvatam
translated: so do you fly away, O cough, following the earth.

original: yathā sūryasya raśmayaḥ parāpatanty āśumat /
analyzed: yathā sūryasya raśmayaḥ parāpatanti āśumat
translated: Just as the rays of the sun fly away swiftly,

original: evā tvaṃ kāse pra pata samudrasyānu vikṣaram ////🔽āyane te parāyane dūrvā rohantu puṣpiṇīḥ /
analyzed: eva tvam kāse pra pata samudrasya anu vikṣaram  āyane te parāyane dūrvāḥ rohantu puṣpiṇīḥ
translated: so do you fly away, O cough, following the overflowing ocean.🔽Let flowering Dūrvā grass grow for you in your coming and going.

original: utso vā tatra jāyatām hrado vā puṇḍarīkavān ////
analyzed: utsaḥ vā tatra jāyatām hradaḥ vā puṇḍarīkavān
translated: Or let a spring or a lake with lotuses be born there.

original: apām idaṃ nyayanaṃ samudrasya niveśanam /🔽madhye hradasya no gṛhāḥ parācīnā mukhā kṛdhi ////
analyzed: apām idam nyayanam samudrasya niveśanam  madhye hradasya naḥ gṛhāḥ parācīnā mukhā kṛdhi
translated: This is the descent of the waters, the abode of the ocean.🔽Make our houses in the middle of the lake with their doors facing away.

original: himasya tvā jarāyuṇā śāle pari vyayāmasi /
analyzed: himasya tvā jarāyuṇā śāle pari vyayāmasi
translated: With the caul of snow we envelop you, O house.

original: śītahradā hi no bhuvo 'gniṣ kṛṇotu bheṣajam ////
analyzed: śīta hradā hi naḥ bhuvaḥ gniḥ kṛṇotu bheṣajam
translated: For the waters are our cool reservoirs. May Agni make for us a remedy.

original: viśvajit trāyamāṇāyai mā pari dehi /
analyzed: viśva jit trāyamāṇāyai mā pari dehi
translated: O Viśvajit, give to Trāyamānā.

original: trāyamāṇe dvipāc ca sarvaṃ no rakṣa catuṣpāḍ yac ca naḥ svam ////
analyzed: trāyamāṇe dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam
translated: O Trāyamānā, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: trāyamāṇe viśvajite mā pari dehi /
analyzed: trāyamāṇe viśva jite mā pari dehi
translated: O Trāyamānā, give to Viśvajit.

original: viśvajid dvipāc ca sarvaṃ no rakṣa catuṣpāḍ yac ca naḥ svam ////
analyzed: viśva jit dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam
translated: O Viśvajit, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: viśvajit kalyāṇyai mā pari dehi /
analyzed: viśva jit kalyāṇyai mā pari dehi
translated: O Viśvajit, give to Kalyāṇī.

original: kalyāṇi dvipāc ca sarvaṃ no rakṣa catuṣpāḍ yac ca naḥ svam ////
analyzed: kalyāṇi dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam
translated: O Kalyāṇī, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: kalyāṇi sarvavide mā pari dehi /
analyzed: kalyāṇi sarva vide mā pari dehi
translated: O Kalyāṇī, give to Sarva-vid.

original: sarvavid dvipāc ca sarvaṃ no rakṣa catuṣpāḍ yac ca naḥ svam ////
analyzed: sarva vid dvi pād ca sarvam naḥ rakṣa catuṣpād yat ca naḥ svam
translated: O Sarva-vid, protect all our two-footed and four-footed, and what is our own.

original: tvaṃ no medhe prathamā gobhir aśvebhir ā gahi /
analyzed: tvam naḥ medhe prathamā gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ ā gahi
translated: O Medhā, come to us first with cattle and horses.

original: tvaṃ sūryasya raśmibhis tvam no asi yajñiyā ////
analyzed: tvam sūryasya raśmibhiḥ tvam naḥ asi yajñiyā
translated: You are with the rays of the sun, you are our worthy sacrifice.

original: medhām ahaṃ prathamāṃ brahmaṇvatīṃ brahmajūtām ṛṣiṣṭutām /
analyzed: medhām aham prathamām brahmaṇvatīm brahma jūtām ṛṣiṣṭutām
translated: I invoke the first Medhā, full of Brahman, impelled by Brahman, praised by the seers,

original: prapītāṃ brahmacāribhir devānām avase huve ////
analyzed: prapītām brahmacāribhiḥ devānām avase huve
translated: drunk by the students of Brahman, for the sake of the gods.

original: yāṃ medhām ṛbhavo vidur yāṃ medhām asurā viduḥ /
analyzed: yām medhām ṛbhavaḥ viduḥ yām medhām asurāḥ viduḥ
translated: The Medhā that the Ṛbhus know, the Medhā that the Asuras know,

original: ṛṣayo bhadrāṃ medhāṃ yāṃ vidus tāṃ mayy ā veśayāmasi ////
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ bhadrām medhām yām viduḥ tām mayi ā veśayāmasi
translated: The sages know that auspicious wisdom; we place it in me.

original: yām ṛṣayo bhūtakṛto medhāṃ medhāvino viduḥ /
analyzed: yām ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ medhām medhāvinaḥ viduḥ
translated: The wisdom which the sages, the creators of beings, who possess wisdom, know,

original: tayā mām adya medhayāgne medhāvinaṃ kṛṇu ////
analyzed: tayā mām adya medhayā agne medhāvinam kṛṇu
translated: With that wisdom, O Agni, make me wise today.

original: medhāṃ sāyaṃ medhāṃ prātar medhāṃ madhyandinaṃ pari /
analyzed: medhām sāyam medhām prātar medhām madhyandinam pari
translated: Wisdom in the evening, wisdom in the morning, wisdom at midday,

original: medhāṃ sūryasya raśmibhir vacasā veśayāmahe ////
analyzed: medhām sūryasya raśmibhiḥ vacasā veśayāmahe
translated: With the rays of the sun, with speech, we place wisdom.

original: pippalī kṣiptabheṣajy utātividdhabheṣajī /
analyzed: pippalī kṣipta bheṣajī uta atividdha bheṣajī
translated: The long pepper is the medicine for what has been cast out, and the medicine for what has been deeply pierced.

original: tāṃ devāḥ sam akalpayann iyaṃ jīvitavā alam ////
analyzed: tām devāḥ sam akalpayan iyam jīvitavai alam
translated: The gods have prepared it, saying, This is sufficient for life.

original: pippalyaḥ sam avadantāyatīr jananād adhi /
analyzed: pippalyaḥ sam avadanta āyatīḥ jananāt adhi
translated: The long peppers have spoken, coming from the womb of birth:

original: yaṃ jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ ////
analyzed: yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ
translated: The man whom we shall find alive will not perish.

original: asurās tvā ny akhanan devās tvod avapan punaḥ /
analyzed: asurāḥ tvā ni akhanan devāḥ tvā ud avapan punar
translated: The Asuras dug you out, the gods again planted you.

original: vātīkṛtasya bheṣajīm atho kṣiptasya bheṣajīm ////
analyzed: vātīkṛtasya bheṣajīm atha u kṣiptasya bheṣajīm
translated: The medicine for what has been vomited, and the medicine for what has been cast out.

original: pratno hi kam īḍyo adhvareṣu sanāc ca hotā navyaś ca satsi /
analyzed: pratnaḥ hi kam īḍyaḥ adhvareṣu sanāt ca hotā navyaḥ ca satsi
translated: For you are the ancient one, to be praised at sacrifices; from of old you are the Hotar, and you sit as the new one.

original: svām cāgne tanvaṃ piprāyasvāsmabhyaṃ ca saubhagam ā yajasva ////
analyzed: svām ca agne tanvam piprāyasva asmabhyam ca saubhagam ā yajasva
translated: And, O Agni, nourish your own body, and bring us good fortune through sacrifice.

original: jyeṣṭhaghnyāṃ jāto vicṛtor yamasya mūlabarhaṇāt pari pāhy enam /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaghnyām jātaḥ vicṛtoḥ yamasya mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam
translated: Born of the slayer of the eldest, of Yama, the root-cutter, protect him from that.

original: aty enam neṣad duritāni viśvā dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya ////
analyzed: ati enam neṣat duritāni viśvā dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya
translated: May it lead him beyond all evils, for long life, for a hundred autumns.

original: vyāghre 'hny ajaniṣṭa vīro nakṣatrajā jāyamānaḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: vyāghre hni ajaniṣṭa vīraḥ nakṣatra jāḥ jāyamānaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: On the day of the tiger, the hero was born, born from the stars, the well-born hero.

original: sa mā vadhīt pitaraṃ vardhamāno mā mātaraṃ pra minīj janitrīm ////
analyzed: sa mā vadhīt pitaram vardhamānaḥ mā mātaram pra minīt janitrīm
translated: May he not kill his father as he grows, may he not deceive his mother, his own mother.

original: imam me agne puruṣam mumugdhy ayaṃ yo baddhaḥ suyato lālapīti /
analyzed: imam me agne puruṣam mumugdhi ayam yaḥ baddhaḥ su yataḥ lālapīti
translated: Release this man for me, O Agni, this one who is bound, well-restrained, and whimpers.

original: ato 'dhi te kṛṇavad bhāgadheyaṃ yadānunmadito 'sati ////
analyzed: atas hi te kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam yadā an unmaditaḥ sati
translated: From here may he make your portion, when you are not intoxicated.

original: agniṣ ṭe ni śamayatu yadi te mana udyutam /
analyzed: agniḥ te ni śamayatu yadi te manaḥ udyutam
translated: May Agni calm you if your mind is excited.

original: kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajaṃ yathānunmadito 'sasi ////
analyzed: kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam yathā an unmaditaḥ sasi
translated: I, the wise one, make a remedy so that you may not be intoxicated.

original: devainasād unmaditam unmattam rakṣasas pari /
analyzed: deva enasāt unmaditam unmattam rakṣasaḥ pari
translated: From divine guilt, from intoxication, from the Raksas that has surrounded you,

original: kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajaṃ yadānunmadito 'sati ////
analyzed: kṛṇomi vidvān bheṣajam sati
translated: I, the wise one, make a remedy so that you may not be intoxicated.

original: punas tvā dur apsarasaḥ punar indraḥ punar bhagaḥ /
analyzed: punar tvā duḥ apsarasaḥ punar indraḥ punar bhagaḥ
translated: The Apsarases have brought you back, Indra has brought you back, Bhaga has brought you back.

original: punas tvā dur viśve devā yathānunmadito 'sasi ////
analyzed: punar tvā duḥ viśve devāḥ yathā an unmaditaḥ sasi
translated: The All-gods have brought you back so that you may not be intoxicated.

original: mā jyeṣṭhaṃ vadhīd ayam agna eṣām mūlabarhaṇāt pari pāhy enam /
analyzed: mā jyeṣṭham vadhīt ayam agne eṣām mūla barhaṇāt pari pāhi enam
translated: Let not this Agni slay the eldest of these. From the cutting of the root, guard him well.

original: sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan tubhyaṃ devā anu jānantu viśve ////
analyzed: sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan tubhyam devāḥ anu jānantu viśve
translated: Knowing, untie the snares of the one who seizes. Let all the gods approve of you.

original: un muñca pāśāṃs tvam agna eṣāṃ trayas tribhir utsitā yebhir āsan /
analyzed: ud muñca pāśān tvam agne eṣām trayaḥ tribhiḥ utsitāḥ yebhiḥ āsan
translated: Untie the snares of these, O Agni, the three that were set by the three.

original: sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan pitāputrau mātaraṃ muñca sarvān ////
analyzed: sa grāhyāḥ pāśān vi cṛta prajānan pitāputrau mātaram muñca sarvān
translated: Knowing, untie the snares of the one who seizes. Release the father, the son, and the mother, all of them.

original: yebhiḥ pāśaiḥ parivitto vibaddho 'ṅgeaṅga ārpita utsitaś ca /
analyzed: yebhiḥ pāśaiḥ parivittaḥ vibaddhaḥ ṅgeaṅgaḥ ārpitaḥ utsitaḥ ca
translated: By which snares the one who is surrounded, bound, fastened limb to limb, and set up,

original: vi te mucyantaṃ vimuco hi santi bhrūṇaghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva ////
analyzed: vi te mucyantam vimucaḥ hi santi bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva
translated: May your bonds be loosened, for they are bonds of release. O Pūṣan, the slayer of the unborn, wipe away your evils.

original: trite devā amṛjataitad enas trita enan manuṣyeṣu mamṛje /
analyzed: trite devāḥ amṛjata etat enaḥ trite enat manuṣyeṣu mamṛje
translated: The gods wiped away this sin on Trita. Trita wiped it away among men.

original: tato yadi tvā grāhir ānaśe tāṃ te devā brahmaṇā nāśayantu ////
analyzed: tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu
translated: If the one who seizes has seized you from there, may the gods destroy that for you with the Brahman.

original: marīcīr dhūmān pra viśānu pāpmann udārān gachota vā nīhārān /
analyzed: marīcīḥ dhūmān pra viśa anu pāpman udārān gacha uta vā nīhārān
translated: Go along the rays, the smoke, O sin, or go along the mists.

original: nadīnaṃ phenāṃ anu tān vi naśya bhrūṇaghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva ////
analyzed: nadīnam phenām anu tān vi naśya bhrūṇa ghni pūṣan duritāni mṛkṣva
translated: Go along the froth of the rivers. Be lost among them. O Pūṣan, the slayer of the unborn, wipe away your evils.

original: dvādaśadhā nihitaṃ tritasyāpamṛṣṭam manuṣyainasāni /
analyzed: dvādaśadhā nihitam tritasya apamṛṣṭam manuṣya enasāni
translated: The twelvefold, the threefold, the wiped away, the human sins, of Trita,

original: tato yadi tvā grāhir ānaśe tāṃ te devā brahmaṇā nāśayantu ////
analyzed: tatas yadi tvā grāhiḥ ānaśe tām te devāḥ brahmaṇā nāśayantu
translated: If a crocodile has seized you, may the gods destroy it for you with the Brahman.

original: yad devā devaheḍanaṃ devāsaś cakṛma vayam /
analyzed: yat devāḥ deva heḍanam devāsaḥ cakṛma vayam
translated: Whatever offence against the gods we have committed, O gods,

original: ādityās tasmān no yuyam ṛtasya ṛtena muñcata ////
analyzed: ādityāḥ tasmāt naḥ yuyam ṛtasya ṛtena muñcata
translated: From that, O Ādityas, do you deliver us with the truth and the law.

original: ṛtasya ṛtenādityā yajatrā muñcateha naḥ /
analyzed: ṛtasya ṛtena ādityāḥ yajatrāḥ muñcata iha naḥ
translated: With the truth and the law, O Ādityas, O holy ones, deliver us here,

original: yajñaṃ yad yajñavāhasaḥ śikṣanto nopaśekima ////
analyzed: yajñam yat yajña vāhasaḥ śikṣantaḥ na upaśekima
translated: If, desiring the sacrifice, the bearers of the sacrifice have not approached us.

original: medasvatā yajamānāḥ srucājyāni juhvataḥ /
analyzed: medasvatā yajamānāḥ srucā ājyāni juhvataḥ
translated: The sacrificers, rich in fat, offering the oblations of the ladle,

original: akāmā viśve vo devāḥ śikṣanto nopa śekima ////
analyzed: akāmāḥ viśve vaḥ devāḥ śikṣantaḥ na upa śekima
translated: All you gods, desiring, have not approached us.

original: yad vidvāṃso yad avidvāṃsa enāṃsi cakṛmā vayam /
analyzed: yat vidvāṃsaḥ yat a vidvāṃsaḥ enāṃsi cakṛma vayam
translated: Whatever offences we have committed, knowingly or unknowingly,

original: yūyaṃ nas tasmān muñcata viśve devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ ////
analyzed: yūyam naḥ tasmāt muñcata viśve devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ
translated: From that, O all you gods of one mind, deliver us.

original: yadi jāgrad yadi svapann ena enasyo 'karam /
analyzed: yadi jāgrat yadi svapan enaḥ enasya u karam
translated: If I have committed a sin while awake or while sleeping,

original: bhūtaṃ mā tasmād bhavyaṃ ca drupadād iva muñcatām ////
analyzed: bhūtam mā tasmāt bhavyam ca drupadāt iva muñcatām
translated: May the past and the future deliver me from it as from a snare.

original: drupadād iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snātvā malād iva /
analyzed: drupadāt iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snātvā malāt iva
translated: Delivering me as from a snare, sweating as if from dirt,

original: pūtaṃ pavitreṇevājyaṃ viśve śumbhantu mainasaḥ ////
analyzed: pūtam pavitreṇa iva ājyam viśve śumbhantu mā enasaḥ
translated: May all the thoughts purify me as if clarified butter with the purifier.

original: yad yāmaṃ cakrur nikhananto agre kārṣīvaṇā annavido na vidyayā /
analyzed: yat yāmam cakruḥ nikhanantaḥ agre kārṣīvaṇāḥ anna vidaḥ na vidyayā
translated: What they did in the beginning, digging the year, the foresters, knowing food, not by knowledge,

original: vaivasvate rājani taj juhomy atha yajñiyaṃ madhumad astu no 'nnam ////
analyzed: vaivasvate rājani tat juhomi atha yajñiyam madhumat astu naḥ nnam
translated: In king Vivasvat I offer that. Then may our food be fit for sacrifice and sweet with honey.

original: vaivasvataḥ kṛṇavad bhāgadheyaṃ madhubhāgo madhunā saṃ sṛjāti /🔽mātur yad ena iṣitaṃ na āgan yad vā pitā 'parāddho jihīde ////
analyzed: vaivasvataḥ kṛṇavat bhāgadheyam madhu bhāgaḥ madhunā sam sṛjāti  mātuḥ yat enaḥ iṣitam naḥ āgan yat vā pitā parāddhaḥ jihīde
translated: May Vivasvat make the portion. The honey-share unites with honey.🔽If the mother's will has come to us, or if the father has sinned and is angry,

original: yadīdaṃ mātur yadi pitur naḥ pari bhrātuḥ putrāc cetasa ena āgan /
analyzed: yadi idam mātuḥ yadi pituḥ naḥ pari bhrātuḥ putrāt cetasaḥ enaḥ āgan
translated: If this has come to us from the mother, or from the father, or from the brother, or from the son, or from the mind,

original: yāvanto asmān pitaraḥ sacante teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ śivo astu manyuḥ ////
analyzed: yāvantaḥ asmān pitaraḥ sacante teṣām sarveṣām śivaḥ astu manyuḥ
translated: As many as our fathers follow us, may the anger of all of them be propitious to us.

original: apamityam apratīttaṃ yad asmi yamasya yena balinā carāmi /
analyzed: apamityam apratīttam yat asmi yamasya yena balinā carāmi
translated: As much as I am unmeasured and unrecognised, by what tribute I go with Yama,

original: idaṃ tad agne anṛṇo bhavāmi tvaṃ pāśān vicṛtaṃ vettha sarvān ////
analyzed: idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi tvam pāśān vicṛtam vettha sarvān
translated: Here, O Agni, may I become free from debt. You know all the bonds to be untied.

original: ihaiva santaḥ prati dadma enaj jīvā jīvebhyo ni harāma enat /
analyzed: iha eva santaḥ prati dadmaḥ enat jīvāḥ jīvebhyaḥ ni harāmaḥ enat
translated: Here present, we return this. We take it away from the living for the living.

original: apamitya dhānyaṃ yaj jaghasāham idaṃ tad agne anṛṇo bhavāmi ////
analyzed: apamitya dhānyam yat jaghasa aham idam tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi
translated: The unmeasured grain that I have eaten, here, O Agni, may I become free from debt.

original: anṛṇā asminn anṛṇāḥ parasmin tṛtīye loke anṛṇāḥ syāma /
analyzed: anṛṇāḥ asmin anṛṇāḥ parasmin tṛtīye loke anṛṇāḥ syāma
translated: Free from debt in this world, free from debt in the other, in the third world may we be free from debt.

original: ye devayānāḥ pitṛyāṇaś ca lokāḥ sarvān patho anṛṇā ā kṣiyema ////
analyzed: ye deva yānāḥ pitṛyāṇaḥ ca lokāḥ sarvān pathaḥ anṛṇāḥ ā kṣiyema
translated: May we dwell on all the paths, free from debt, on the worlds of the gods and the worlds of the fathers.

original: yad dhastābhyāṃ cakṛma kilbiṣāṇy akṣāṇāṃ gatnum upalipsamānāḥ /
analyzed: yat hastābhyām cakṛma kilbiṣāṇi akṣāṇām gatnum upalipsamānāḥ
translated: Whatever sins we have committed with our hands, seeking the course of the dice,

original: ugraṃpaśye ugrajitau tad adyāpsarasāv anu dattām ṛṇaṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: ugraṃpaśye ugrajitau tat adya apsarasau anu dattām ṛṇam naḥ
translated: Today, O fierce-seeing ones, may the two fierce-conquering Apsarases forgive our debt.

original: ugraṃpaśye rāṣṭrabhṛt kilbiṣāṇi yad akṣavṛttam anu dattam na etat /
analyzed: ugraṃpaśye rāṣṭrabhṛt kilbiṣāṇi yat akṣa vṛttam anu dattam naḥ etat
translated: O fierce-seeing ones, the sins of the king-supporting one, whatever debt has been given in the course of the dice,

original: ṛṇān no na ṛṇam ertsamāno yamasya loke adhirajjur āyat ////
analyzed: ṛṇāt naḥ naḥ ṛṇam ertsamānaḥ yamasya loke adhirajjuḥ āyat
translated: Not seeking to take back our debt, may we not be led by the noose of Yama in the world of Yama.

original: yasmā ṛṇaṃ yasya jāyām upaimi yaṃ yācamāno abhyaimi devāḥ /
analyzed: yasmai ṛṇam yasya jāyām upaimi yam yācamānaḥ abhyaimi devāḥ
translated: To whomsoever I go for a wife, from whom I borrow, to whom I go begging, O gods,

original: te vācaṃ vādiṣur mottarāṃ mad devapatnī apsarasāv adhītam ////
analyzed: te vācam vādiṣuḥ mā uttarām mat deva patnī apsarasau adhītam
translated: May those two divine Apsarases speak this most excellent speech to me, O learned one.

original: yad adīvyann ṛṇam ahaṃ kṛṇomy adāsyann agne uta saṃgṛṇāmi /
analyzed: yat a dīvyan ṛṇam aham kṛṇomi a dāsyan agne uta saṃgṛṇāmi
translated: Whatever debt I incur while gambling, O Agni, whatever I remember while not intending to pay,

original: vaiśvānaro no adhipā vasiṣṭha ud in nayāti sukṛtasya lokam ////
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ ud id nayāti sukṛtasya lokam
translated: May Vaisvānara, our lord, the most excellent one, lead us to the world of the righteous.

original: vaiśvānarāya prati vedayāmi yadi ṛṇaṃ saṃgaro devatāsu /
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya prati vedayāmi yadi ṛṇam saṃgaraḥ devatāsu
translated: I announce to Vaisvānara, if there is a debt to be collected among the gods.

original: sa etān pāśān vicṛtam veda sarvān atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: saḥ etān pāśān vicṛtam veda sarvān atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: May he, who knows how to untie all these bonds, be with us when the food is cooked.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ pavitā mā punātu yat saṃgaram abhidhāvāmy āśām /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ pavitā mā punātu yat saṃgaram abhidhāvāmi āśām
translated: May Vaisvānara, the purifier, purify me, when I run to the place of hope,

original: anājānan manasā yācamāno yat tatraino apa tat suvāmi ////
analyzed: an ājānan manasā yācamānaḥ yat tatra enaḥ apa tat suvāmi
translated: not knowing, asking with the mind, whatever sin there is, that I remove from here.

original: yad antarikṣaṃ pṛthivīm uta dyām yan mātaraṃ pitaraṃ vā jihiṃsima /
analyzed: yat antarikṣam pṛthivīm uta dyām yat mātaram pitaram vā jihiṃsima
translated: If we have harmed the atmosphere, the earth, or the sky, or our mother or father,

original: ayaṃ tasmād gārhapatyo no agnir ud in nayāti sukṛtasya lokam ////🔽bhūmir mātāditir no janitraṃ bhrātāntarikṣam abhiśastyā naḥ /
analyzed: ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti sukṛtasya lokam  bhūmiḥ mātā aditiḥ naḥ janitram bhrātā antarikṣam abhiśastyāḥ naḥ
translated: from that may this our domestic fire carry us up to the world of the virtuous.🔽Earth is our mother, Aditi our birth-place, the atmosphere is our brother, may it spare us.

original: dyaur naḥ pitā pitryāc chaṃ bhavāti jāmim ṛtvā māva patsi lokāt ////
analyzed: dyauḥ naḥ pitā pitryāt śam bhavāti jāmim ṛtvā mā ava patsi lokāt
translated: May our father heaven be auspicious to us from the paternal (quarter), having gone to our sister, may I not fall from the world.

original: yatrā suhārdaḥ sukṛto madanti vihāya rogaṃ tanvaḥ svāyāḥ /
analyzed: yatrā suhārdaḥ su kṛtaḥ madanti vihāya rogam tanvaḥ svāyāḥ
translated: Where the well-wishing, the virtuous rejoice, having left disease from their own bodies,

original: aślonā aṅgair ahrutāḥ svarge tatra paśyema pitarau ca putrān ////
analyzed: aślonāḥ aṅgaiḥ ahrutāḥ svarge tatra paśyema pitarau ca putrān
translated: without crooked limbs, without lameness, in heaven, there may we see our parents and our children.

original: viṣāṇā pāśān vi ṣyādhy asmad ya uttamā adhamā vāruṇā ye /
analyzed: viṣāṇā pāśān vi syādhi asmat ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye
translated: Untie the bonds, the upper and the lower, that are of Varuna, from us.

original: duṣvapnyaṃ duritaṃ ni ṣvāsmad atha gachema sukṛtasya lokam ////
analyzed: duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema sukṛtasya lokam
translated: Drive away from us evil dreams and misfortune, and then may we go to the world of the virtuous.

original: yad dāruṇi badhyase yac ca rajjvāṃ yad bhūmyāṃ badhyase yac ca vācā /
analyzed: yat dāruṇi badhyase yat ca rajjvām yat bhūmyām badhyase yat ca vācā
translated: If you are bound by wood or by rope, if you are bound by earth or by speech,

original: ayaṃ tasmād gārhapatyo no agnir ud in nayāti sukṛtasya lokam ////
analyzed: ayam tasmāt gārhapatyaḥ naḥ agniḥ ud id nayāti sukṛtasya lokam
translated: Therefore this our Gārhapatya Agni leads us up to the world of the righteous.

original: ud agātāṃ bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake /🔽prehāmṛtasya yachatāṃ praitu baddhakamocanam ////
analyzed: ud agātām bhagavatī vicṛtau nāma tārake  preha amṛtasya yat śatām praitu baddhaka mocanam
translated: The two blessed ones have risen up, the two stars named Vicarī.🔽May they grant us the gift of immortality. Let the release of the bound go forth.

original: vi jihīṣva lokam kṛṇu bandhān muñcāsi baddhakam /
analyzed: vi jihīṣva lokam kṛṇu bandhān muñcāsi baddhakam
translated: Open the way, make room. You release the bound.

original: yonyā iva pracyuto garbhaḥ pathaḥ sarvāṃ anu kṣiya ////
analyzed: yonyāḥ iva pracyutaḥ garbhaḥ pathaḥ sarvān anu kṣiya
translated: Like a child fallen from the womb, go along all the paths.

original: etaṃ bhāgaṃ pari dadāmi vidvān viśvakarman prathamajā ṛtasya /
analyzed: etam bhāgam pari dadāmi vidvān viśvakarman prathama jāḥ ṛtasya
translated: This portion I offer, knowing it, O Viśvakarman, the firstborn of order.

original: asmābhir dattaṃ jarasaḥ parastād achinnaṃ tantum anu saṃ tarema ////
analyzed: asmābhiḥ dattam jarasaḥ parastāt a chinnam tantum anu sam tarema
translated: Given by us, beyond old age, may we cross over the unbroken thread.

original: tataṃ tantum anv eke taranti yeṣāṃ dattaṃ pitryam āyanena /
analyzed: tatam tantum anu eke taranti yeṣām dattam pitryam āyanena
translated: Some cross over the extended thread, those to whom the paternal portion is given by inheritance.

original: abandhv eke dadataḥ prayachanto dātuṃ cec chikṣānt sa svarga eva ////
analyzed: a bandhu eke dadataḥ prayacchantaḥ dātum ced śikṣān sa svargaḥ eva
translated: Some, not related, give and offer, if they learn to give, they are indeed in heaven.

original: anvārabhethām anusaṃrabhethām etaṃ lokaṃ śraddadhānāḥ sacante /
analyzed: anvārabhethām anusaṃrabhethām etam lokam śraddadhānāḥ sacante
translated: You should follow each other, you should support each other. Those who have faith follow this world.

original: yad vāṃ pakvaṃ pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye dampatī saṃ śrayethām ////
analyzed: yat vām pakvam pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye dampatī sam śrayethām
translated: For the protection of what is cooked and enclosed in the fire, the husband and wife should unite together.

original: yajñam yantaṃ manasā bṛhantam anvārohāmi tapasā sayoniḥ /
analyzed: yajñam yantam manasā bṛhantam anvārohāmi tapasā sa yoniḥ
translated: I ascend with the mind, with the navel, with the heat, with the sacrifice, with the great one, with the penance, with the womb.

original: upahūtā agne jarasaḥ parastāt tṛtīye nāke sadhamādaṃ madema ////
analyzed: upahūtāḥ agne jarasaḥ parastāt tṛtīye nāke sadhamādam madema
translated: Invited, O Agni, beyond old age, in the third firmament, may we rejoice in the feast.

original: śuddhāḥ pūtā yoṣito yajñiyā imā brahmaṇāṃ hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi /
analyzed: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi
translated: Pure, purified, these women, worthy of sacrifice, I place separately in the hands of the Brahmins.

original: yatkāma idaṃ abhiṣiñcāmi vo 'haṃ indro marutvānt sa dadātu tan me ////
analyzed: yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ haṃ indraḥ marutvān sa dadātu tat me
translated: Whatever desire I sprinkle you with here, may Indra with the Maruts grant that to me.

original: etaṃ sadhasthāḥ pari vo dadāmi yaṃ śevadhim āvahāj jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: etam sadhasthāḥ pari vaḥ dadāmi yam śevadhim āvahāt jātavedaḥ
translated: I give this to you, O dwellers together, whom Jātavedas shall bring as a welcome guest.

original: anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti taṃ sma jānīta parame vyoman ////
analyzed: anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti tam sma jānīta parame vyoman
translated: The sacrificer shall follow, in peace. Remember him in the highest heaven.

original: jānīta smainaṃ parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthā vida lokam atra /
analyzed: jānīta sma enam parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthāḥ vida lokam atra
translated: Remember him in the highest heaven, O gods, the dwellers together, find the world here.

original: anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svastīṣṭāpūrtaṃ sma kṛṇutāvir asmai ////
analyzed: anvāgantā yajamānaḥ svasti iṣṭāpūrtam sma kṛṇuta āvis asmai
translated: The sacrificer shall follow, in peace. Perform the Iṣṭa and Pūrta for him, and make him manifest.

original: devāḥ pitaraḥ pitaro devāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ pitaraḥ devāḥ
translated: The gods are the fathers, the fathers are the gods.

original: yo asmi so asmi ////
analyzed: yaḥ asmi saḥ asmi
translated: I am he who I am.

original: sa pacāmi sa dadāmi /
analyzed: sa pacāmi sa dadāmi
translated: I cook, I give.

original: sa yaje sa dattān mā yūṣam ////
analyzed: sa yaje sa dattāt mā yūṣam
translated: I sacrifice, I have given, do not eat me.

original: nāke rājan prati tiṣṭha tatraitat prati tiṣṭhatu /
analyzed: nāke rājan prati tiṣṭha tatra etat prati tiṣṭhatu
translated: O king, stand in the firmament, there let this stand.

original: viddhi pūrtasya no rājant sa deva sumanā bhava ////
analyzed: viddhi pūrtasya naḥ rājan sa deva su manāḥ bhava
translated: Know that we are the fulfiller of your vow, O king, be well-disposed towards us, O god.

original: divo nu mām bṛhato antarikṣād apāṃ stoko abhy apaptad rasena /
analyzed: divaḥ nu mām bṛhataḥ antarikṣāt apām stokaḥ abhī apaptat rasena
translated: The drop of water has fallen upon me from the vast sky, with the sap of the waters.

original: sam indriyena payasāham agne chandobhir yajñaiḥ sukṛtāṃ kṛtena ////
analyzed: sam indriyena payasā aham agne chandobhiḥ yajñaiḥ su kṛtām kṛtena
translated: With the power of the mind, O Agni, with the metres, with the sacrifices, with the well-done deeds, I have fallen.

original: yadi vṛkṣād abhyapaptat phalaṃ tad yady antarikṣāt sa u vāyur eva /
analyzed: yadi vṛkṣāt abhyapaptat phalam tat yadi antarikṣāt saḥ u vāyuḥ eva
translated: If the fruit has fallen from the tree, that is; if from the atmosphere, that is indeed the wind.

original: yatrāspṛkṣat tanvo yac ca vāsasa āpo nudantu nirṛtiṃ parācaiḥ ////
analyzed: yatra aspṛkṣat tanvaḥ yat ca vāsasaḥ āpaḥ nudantu nirṛtim parācais
translated: Where it has touched the body or the clothes, may the waters carry away misfortune far away.

original: abhyañjanaṃ surabhi sā samṛddhir hiraṇyaṃ varcas tad u pūtrimam eva /
analyzed: abhyañjanam surabhi sā samṛddhiḥ hiraṇyam varcaḥ tat u pūtrimam eva
translated: The anointing is fragrant, that is prosperity; the gold is splendor, that is indeed the offspring.

original: sarvā pavitrā vitatādhy asmat tan mā tārīn nirṛtir mo arātiḥ ////
analyzed: sarvā pavitrā vitatā adhi asmat tat mā tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ
translated: May all the spread-out sacred grass be above us; may misfortune and hostility not overcome us.

original: vanaspate vīḍvaṅgo hi bhūyā asmatsakhā prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ asmad sakhā prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: O tree, be firm-limbed, be our friend, the rescuer, with good heroes.

original: gobhiḥ saṃnaddho asi vīḍayasvāsthātā te jayatu jetvāni ////
analyzed: gobhiḥ saṃnaddhaḥ asi vīḍayasva āsthātā te jayatu jetvāni
translated: You are bound with cows, strengthen yourself; may he who stands by you win the victories.

original: divas pṛthivyāḥ pary oja udbhṛtaṃ vanaspatibhyaḥ pary ābhṛtaṃ sahaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari ojaḥ udbhṛtam vanaspatibhyaḥ pari ābhṛtam sahaḥ
translated: The strength that is collected from the sky and earth, the might that is brought from the trees,

original: apām ojmānaṃ pari gobhir āvṛtam indrasya vajraṃ haviṣā rathaṃ yaja ////
analyzed: apām ojmānam pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam indrasya vajram haviṣā ratham yaja
translated: The strength of the waters, surrounded by cows, Indra's thunderbolt, the chariot, I worship with oblations.

original: indrasyaujo marutām anīkaṃ mitrasya garbho varuṇasya nābhiḥ /
analyzed: indrasya ojaḥ marutām anīkam mitrasya garbhaḥ varuṇasya nābhiḥ
translated: The strength of Indra, the vanguard of the Maruts, the embryo of Mitra, the navel of Varuna,

original: sa imāṃ no havyadātiṃ juṣāṇo deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya ////
analyzed: saḥ imām naḥ havya dātim juṣāṇaḥ deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya
translated: Accepting this offering of ours, O god, receive the oblations on your chariot.

original: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyaṃ purutrā te vanvatāṃ viṣṭhitam jagat /
analyzed: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyam purutrā te vanvatām viṣṭhitam jagat
translated: Bellow forth to the earth and to the sky. In many ways they seek out your established world.

original: sa dundubhe sajūr indreṇa devair dūrād davīyo apa sedha śatrūn ////
analyzed: sa dundubhe sajūs indreṇa devaiḥ dūrāt davīyaḥ apa sedha śatrūn
translated: O Dundubhi, united with Indra and the gods, drive away the enemies from afar.

original: ā krandaya balam ojo na ā dhā abhi ṣṭana duritā bādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: ā krandaya balam ojaḥ naḥ ā dhāḥ abhi stana duritā bādhamānaḥ
translated: Roar forth, bring strength and power to us, neighing, driving away evils.

original: apa sedha dundubhe duchunām ita indrasya muṣṭir asi vīḍayasva ////
analyzed: apa sedha dundubhe duchunām itas indrasya muṣṭiḥ asi vīḍayasva
translated: Drive away, O Dundubhi, the evil-doers from here. You are Indra's fist, make yourself strong.

original: prāmūṃ jayābhīme jayantu ketumad dundubhir vāvadītu /
analyzed: pra amūm jaya abhīme jayantu ketumat dundubhiḥ vāvadītu
translated: May these two victorious ones be victorious, may the bannered Dundubhi resound.

original: sam aśvaparṇāḥ patantu no naro 'smākam indra rathino jayantu ////🔽vidradhasya balāsasya lohitasya vanaspate /
analyzed: sam aśva parṇāḥ patantu naḥ naraḥ smākam indra rathinaḥ jayantu  vidradhasya balāsasya lohitasya vanaspate
translated: May our winged men fly forth, may our charioteers, O Indra, be victorious.🔽O tree, of the abscess, of the inflammation, of the blood,

original: visalpakasyauṣadhe moc chiṣaḥ piśitaṃ cana ////
analyzed: visalpakasya auṣadhe mā ud śiṣaḥ piśitam cana
translated: Of the spreading ulcer, O herb, remove the flesh and the pus.

original: yau te balāsa tiṣṭhataḥ kakṣe muṣkāv apaśritau /
analyzed: yau te balāsa tiṣṭhataḥ kakṣe muṣkau apaśritau
translated: The two which are thy shoulders, O Consumption, which stand close to the armpits,

original: vedāhaṃ tasya bheṣajaṃ cīpudrur abhicakṣaṇam ////
analyzed: veda aham tasya bheṣajam cīpudruḥ abhicakṣaṇam
translated: I know the remedy for that, the healing of the Chiputru.

original: yo aṅgyo yaḥ karṇyo yo akṣyor visalpakaḥ /🔽vi vṛhāmo visalpakaṃ vidradhaṃ hṛdayāmayam /
analyzed: yaḥ aṅgyaḥ yaḥ karṇyaḥ yaḥ akṣyoḥ visalpakaḥ  vi vṛhāmaḥ visalpakam vidradham hṛdaya āmayam
translated: The one in the limbs, the one in the ears, the one in the eyes which is a dart,🔽We draw out the dart, the abscess, the disease of the heart.

original: parā tam ajñātam yakṣmam adharāñcaṃ suvāmasi ////
analyzed: parā tam a jñātam yakṣmam adharāñcam suvāmasi
translated: We heal that unknown consumption, that which goes downward.

original: śakadhūmaṃ nakṣatrāṇi yad rājānam akurvata /
analyzed: śakadhūmam nakṣatrāṇi yat rājānam akurvata
translated: When the stars made Shakadhuma their king,

original: bhadrāham asmai prāyachan idaṃ rāṣṭram asād iti ////
analyzed: bhadrā aham asmai prāyacchan idam rāṣṭram asāt iti
translated: They gave him prosperity, saying, This kingdom shall be yours.

original: bhadrāhaṃ no madhyaṃdine bhadrāhaṃ sāyam astu naḥ /
analyzed: bhadrā aham naḥ madhyaṃdine bhadrā aham sāyam astu naḥ
translated: Prosperity to us at midday, prosperity to us in the evening,

original: bhadrāhaṃ no ahnāṃ prātā rātrī bhadrāham astu naḥ ////
analyzed: bhadrā aham naḥ ahnām prātā rātrī bhadrā aham astu naḥ
translated: Prosperity to us in the mornings of the days, prosperity to us in the night.

original: ahorātrābhyāṃ nakṣatrebhyaḥ suryācandramasābhyām /
analyzed: ahar rātrābhyām nakṣatrebhyaḥ suryācandramasābhyām
translated: From the day and night, from the stars, from the sun and moon,

original: bhadrāham asmabhyaṃ rājan chakadhūma tvaṃ kṛdhi ////🔽yo no bhadrāham akaraḥ sāyaṃ naktam atho divā /
analyzed: bhadrā aham asmabhyam rājan śakadhūma tvam kṛdhi  yaḥ naḥ bhadrā aham akaraḥ sāyam naktam atha u divā
translated: O Shakadhuma, O king, make prosperity for us.🔽To you, O king of the stars, Shakadhuma, we always offer salutations,

original: tasmai te nakṣatrarāja śakadhūma sadā namaḥ ////🔽bhagena mā śāṃśapena sākam indreṇa medinā /
analyzed: tasmai te nakṣatra rāja śakadhūma sadā namaḥ 🔽bhagena mā śāṃśapena sākam indreṇa medinā
translated: To you who have made prosperity for us in the evening, at night, and also by day.

original: kṛṇomi bhaginaṃ māpa drāntv arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: kṛṇomi bhaginam mā apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: I make the sister, let not the evil spirits flee away.

original: yena vṛkṣāṃ abhyabhavo bhagena varcasā saha /
analyzed: yena vṛkṣān abhyabhavaḥ bhagena varcasā saha
translated: By which power you have overcome the trees, O Bhaga, together with splendor,

original: tena mā bhaginaṃ kṛṇv apa drāntv arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: By that make me the sister, let not the evil spirits flee away.

original: yo andho yaḥ punaḥsaro bhago vṛkṣeṣv āhitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ andhaḥ yaḥ punaḥsaraḥ bhagaḥ vṛkṣeṣu āhitaḥ
translated: He who is blind, he who is one-eyed, Bhaga who is placed in the trees,

original: tena mā bhaginaṃ kṛṇv apa drāntv arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: tena mā bhaginam kṛṇu apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: By that make me the sister, let not the evil spirits flee away.

original: rathajitāṃ rāthajiteyīnām apsarasām ayaṃ smaraḥ /
analyzed: ratha jitām rāthajiteyīnām apsarasām ayam smaraḥ
translated: This is the love of the Rāthajitīs, the daughters of Rāthajita, the Apsarases.

original: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu ////
analyzed: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu
translated: O gods, send forth love, let him grieve after me.

original: asau me smaratād iti priyo me smaratād iti /
analyzed: asau me smaratāt iti priyaḥ me smaratāt iti
translated: Let him love me, thinking This is mine, let him love me, thinking This is dear to me.

original: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu ////
analyzed: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu
translated: O gods, send forth love, let him grieve after me.

original: yathā mama smarād asau nāmuṣyāhaṃ kadā cana /
analyzed: yathā mama smarāt asau na amuṣya aham kadā cana
translated: So that he may love me, never to be without me,

original: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu ////
analyzed: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu
translated: O gods, send forth love, let him grieve after me.

original: un mādayata maruta ud antarikṣa mādaya /
analyzed: ud mādayata marutaḥ ud antarikṣa mādaya
translated: Rejoice, O Maruts, rejoice, O atmosphere,

original: agna un mādayā tvam asau mām anu śocatu ////
analyzed: agne ud mādaya tvam asau mām anu śocatu
translated: O Agni, rejoice, let him grieve after me.

original: ni śīrṣato ni pattata ādhyo ni tirāmi te /
analyzed: ni śīrṣataḥ ni pattataḥ ādhyaḥ ni tirāmi te
translated: From the head I drive it away, from the feet I drive it away, from the middle I drive it away.

original: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu ////
analyzed: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu
translated: O gods, send forth love, let him grieve after me.

original: anumate 'nv idaṃ manyasvākute sam idaṃ namaḥ /
analyzed: anumate nu idam manyasva akute sam idam namaḥ
translated: In the approval, in this do thou approve, in the invocation, in this the homage.

original: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu ////
analyzed: devāḥ pra hiṇuta smaram asau mām anu śocatu
translated: O gods, send forth the longing, let him long after me.

original: yad dhāvasi triyojanaṃ pañcayojanam āśvinam /
analyzed: yat dhāvasi tri yojanam pañca yojanam āśvinam
translated: When thou runnest to the Āśvina (place) three leagues or five leagues,

original: tatas tvaṃ punar āyasi putrāṇāṃ no asaḥ pitā ////
analyzed: tatas tvam punar āyasi putrāṇām naḥ asaḥ pitā
translated: Thence thou returnest again, our father, the friend of our sons.

original: yaṃ devāḥ smaram asiñcann apsv antaḥ śośucānaṃ sahādhyā /
analyzed: yam devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha ādhyā
translated: The longing which the gods poured into the waters, glowing, to be thought upon together,

original: taṃ te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā ////
analyzed: tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā
translated: That I torment thee with the law of Varuna.

original: yaṃ viśve devāḥ smaram asiñcann apsv antaḥ śośucānaṃ sahādhyā /
analyzed: yam viśve devāḥ smaram asiñcan apsu antar śośucānam saha ādhyā
translated: The longing which all the gods poured into the waters, glowing, to be thought upon together,

original: taṃ te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā ////
analyzed: tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā
translated: That I torment thee with the law of Varuna.

original: yam indrāṇī smaram asiñcad apsv antaḥ śośucānaṃ sahādhyā /
analyzed: yam indrāṇī smaram asiñcat apsu antar śośucānam saha ādhyā
translated: The longing which Indrani poured into the waters, glowing, to be thought upon together,

original: taṃ te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā ////
analyzed: tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā
translated: That I torment thee with the law of Varuna.

original: yam indrāgnī smaram asiñcatām apsv antaḥ śośucānaṃ sahādhyā /
analyzed: yam indra agnī smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha ādhyā
translated: The longing which Indra and Agni poured into the waters, glowing, to be thought upon together,

original: taṃ te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā ////
analyzed: tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā
translated: That I torment thee with the law of Varuna.

original: yam mitrāvaruṇau smaram asiñcatām apsv antaḥ śośucānaṃ sahādhyā /
analyzed: yam mitrāvaruṇau smaram asiñcatām apsu antar śośucānam saha ādhyā
translated: The longing which Mitra and Varuna poured into the waters, glowing, to be thought upon together,

original: taṃ te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā ////
analyzed: tam te tapāmi varuṇasya dharmaṇā
translated: That I torment thee with the law of Varuna.

original: ya imāṃ devo mekhalām ābabandha yaḥ saṃnanāha ya u no yuyoja /
analyzed: yaḥ imām devaḥ mekhalām ābabandha yaḥ saṃnanāha yaḥ u naḥ yuyoja
translated: The god who fastened this girdle on me, who girded me, who yoked me,

original: yasya devasya praśiṣā carāmaḥ sa pāram ichāt sa u no vi muñcāt ////
analyzed: yasya devasya praśiṣā carāmaḥ sa pāram ichāt saḥ u naḥ vi muñcāt
translated: By the command of what god we live, may he seek the end (of the vow), may he release us from it.

original: āhutāsy abhihuta ṛṣīṇām asy āyudham /
analyzed: āhutā asi abhihutaḥ ṛṣīṇām asi āyudham
translated: You are the weapon of the Rishis, whose mouth is invoked, who are invoked by others.

original: pūrvā vratasya prāśnatī vīraghnī bhava mekhale ////
analyzed: pūrvā vratasya prāśnatī vīra ghnī bhava mekhale
translated: O girdle, be the destroyer of heroes, eating first of the vow.

original: mṛtyor ahaṃ brahmacārī yad asmi niryācan bhūtāt puruṣaṃ yamāya /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ aham brahmacārī yat asmi niryācan bhūtāt puruṣam yamāya
translated: O death, I am a brahmacārin, begging for the sake of the departed ancestor, for Yama.

original: tam ahaṃ brahmaṇā tapasā śrameṇānayainaṃ mekhalayā sināmi ////
analyzed: tam aham brahmaṇā tapasā śrameṇa anayā enam mekhalayā sināmi
translated: By that Brahman, austerity, and effort, I bring him. I bind him with this girdle.

original: śraddhāyā duhitā tapaso 'dhi jātā svasā ṛṣīṇāṃ bhūtakṛtāṃ babhūva /
analyzed: śraddhāyāḥ duhitā tapasaḥ dhi jātā svasā ṛṣīṇām bhūta kṛtām babhūva
translated: The daughter of faith, born from austerity, became the sister of the Rishis, the creators of beings.

original: sā no mekhale matim ā dhehi medhām atho no dhehi tapa indriyaṃ ca ////
analyzed: sā naḥ mekhale matim ā dhehi medhām atha u naḥ dhehi tapaḥ indriyam ca
translated: O girdle, bestow on us thought, wisdom, and also bestow on us austerity and power.

original: yāṃ tvā pūrve bhūtakṛta ṛṣayaḥ paribedhire /
analyzed: yām tvā pūrve bhūta kṛtaḥ ṛṣayaḥ paribedhire
translated: The Rishis, the creators of beings, who girded you in the past,

original: sā tvaṃ pari ṣvajasva māṃ dīrghāyutvāya mekhale ////🔽ayaṃ vajras tarpayatām ṛtasyāvāsya rāṣṭram apa hantu jīvitam /
analyzed: sā tvam pari svajasva mām dīrgha āyu tvāya mekhale  ayam vajraḥ tarpayatām ṛtasya ava asya rāṣṭram apa hantu jīvitam
translated: You, O girdle, embrace me for long life.🔽May this thunderbolt of truth satisfy, may it destroy the life of the enemy's kingdom.

original: śṛṇātu grīvāḥ pra śṛṇātūṣṇihā vṛtrasyeva śacīpatiḥ ////
analyzed: śṛṇātu grīvāḥ pra śṛṇātu uṣṇihāḥ vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ
translated: May it break the neck, may it break the neck bone, like the lord of power (does) Vṛtra's.

original: adharo'dhara uttarebhyo gūḍhaḥ pṛthivyā mot sṛpat /
analyzed: adharodharaḥ uttarebhyaḥ gūḍhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ mā ud sṛpat
translated: The lower one is hidden from the higher ones, the earth from slipping away.

original: vajreṇāvahataḥ śayām ////
analyzed: vajreṇa avahataḥ śayām
translated: With the thunderbolt I strike him down.

original: yo jināti tam anvicha yo jināti tam ij jahi /
analyzed: yaḥ jināti tam anvicha yaḥ jināti tam id jahi
translated: Slay him whom he slays, kill him whom he kills.

original: jinato vajra tvaṃ sīmantam anvañcam anu pātaya ////
analyzed: jinataḥ vajra tvam sīmantam anvañcam anu pātaya
translated: O thunderbolt, drive him away, drive him away, drive him away.

original: yad aśnāmi balaṃ kurva itthaṃ vajram ā dade /
analyzed: yat aśnāmi balam kurve ittham vajram ā dade
translated: When I eat, I gain strength, thus I take up the thunderbolt.

original: skandhān amuṣya śātayan vṛtrasyeva śacīpatiḥ ////
analyzed: skandhān amuṣya śātayan vṛtrasya iva śacīpatiḥ
translated: Breaking the limbs of him, like the lord of power (breaks) Vritra's.

original: yat pibāmi saṃ pibāmi samudra iva saṃpibaḥ /
analyzed: yat pibāmi sam pibāmi samudraḥ iva saṃpibaḥ
translated: When I drink, I drink together, like the ocean I drink together.

original: prāṇān amuṣya saṃpāya saṃ pibāmo amuṃ vayam ////
analyzed: prāṇān amuṣya saṃpāya sam pibāmaḥ amum vayam
translated: The life breaths of him I drink together, we drink together him.

original: yad girāmi saṃ girāmi samudra iva saṃgiraḥ /
analyzed: yat girāmi sam girāmi samudraḥ iva saṃgiraḥ
translated: When I speak, I speak together, like the ocean I speak together.

original: prāṇān amuṣya saṃgīrya saṃ girāmo amum vayam ////
analyzed: prāṇān amuṣya saṃgīrya sam girāmaḥ amum vayam
translated: The life breaths of him I speak together, we speak together him.

original: devī devyām adhi jātā pṛthivyām asy oṣadhe /
analyzed: devī devyām adhi jātā pṛthivyām asi oṣadhe
translated: O goddess, born on the goddess, on the earth, O plant,

original: tāṃ tvā nitatni keśebhyo dṛṃhaṇāya khanāmasi ////
analyzed: tām tvā nitatni keśebhyaḥ dṛṃhaṇāya khanāmasi
translated: we dig thee up for firmness, O Nitatni, for the hair.

original: dṛṃha pratnān janayājātān jātān u varṣīyasas kṛdhi ////
analyzed: dṛṃha pratnān janaya a jātān jātān u varṣīyasaḥ kṛdhi
translated: Make firm the old ones, generate the unborn ones, make the born ones grow still more.

original: yas te keśo 'vapadyate samūlo yaś ca vṛścate /
analyzed: yaḥ te keśaḥ vapadyate sa mūlaḥ yaḥ ca vṛścate
translated: The hair of thine that falleth out, and that which is shaved off at the roots,

original: idaṃ taṃ viśvabheṣajyābhi ṣiñcāmi vīrudhā ////
analyzed: idam tam viśva bheṣajyā abhi siñcāmi vīrudhā
translated: with this all-healing plant I sprinkle it.

original: yāṃ jamadagnir akhanad duhitre keśavardhanīm /
analyzed: yām jamadagniḥ akhanat duhitre keśa vardhanīm
translated: Which Jamadagni dug for his daughter to make her hair grow,

original: tāṃ vītahavya ābharad asitasya gṛhebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: tām vītahavyaḥ ābharat asitasya gṛhebhyaḥ
translated: That Vītahavya brought from the house of Asita.

original: abhīśunā meyā āsan vyāmenānumeyāḥ /
analyzed: abhīśunā meyāḥ āsan vyāmena anumeyāḥ
translated: They are to be measured by the whip, to be guessed by the span.

original: keśā naḍā iva vardhantāṃ śīrṣṇas te asitāḥ pari ////
analyzed: keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari
translated: Let your black hairs grow like reeds from your head.

original: dṛṃha mūlam āgraṃ yacha vi madhyaṃ yāmayauṣadhe /🔽keśā naḍā iva vardhantām śīrṣṇas te asitāḥ pari ////
analyzed: dṛṃha mūlam ā agram yaccha vi madhyam yāmaya auṣadhe  keśāḥ naḍāḥ iva vardhantām śīrṣṇaḥ te asitāḥ pari
translated: Firm the root, raise the top, bend the middle, O plant.🔽Let your black hairs grow like reeds from your head.

original: tvaṃ vīrudhāṃ śreṣṭhatamābhiśrutāsy oṣadhe /
analyzed: tvam vīrudhām śreṣṭhatamā abhiśrutā asi oṣadhe
translated: You, O plant, are most renowned among the plants.

original: imaṃ me adya puruṣaṃ klībam opaśinaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: imam me adya puruṣam klībam opaśinam kṛdhi
translated: Make this man for me today impotent and bald-headed.

original: klībaṃ kṛdhy opaśinam atho kurīriṇaṃ kṛdhi /
analyzed: klībam kṛdhī opaśinam atha u kurīriṇam kṛdhi
translated: Make him impotent and bald-headed, and also make him a eunuch.

original: athāsyendro grāvabhyām ubhe bhinattv āṇḍyau ////
analyzed: atha asya indraḥ grāvabhyām ubhe bhinattu āṇḍyau
translated: Then let Indra with his two thunderbolts split his two testicles.

original: klība klībaṃ tvākaraṃ vadhre vadhriṃ tvākaram arasārasaṃ tvākaram /
analyzed: klība klībam tvā akaram vadhre vadhrim tvā akaram arasa arasam tvā akaram
translated: Impotent, impotent I have made you, eunuch, eunuch I have made you, flavorless I have made you.

original: kurīram asya śīrṣaṇi kumbaṃ cādhinidadhmasi ////
analyzed: kurīram asya śīrṣaṇi kumbam ca adhinidadhmasi
translated: On his head we place a eunuch's cap and a pot.

original: ye te nādyau devakṛte yayos tiṣṭhati vṛṣṇyam /
analyzed: ye te na adyau deva kṛte yayoḥ tiṣṭhati vṛṣṇyam
translated: Those two testicles of yours, made by the gods, in which your virility rests,

original: te te bhinadmi śamyayāmuṣyā adhi muṣkayoḥ ////
analyzed: te te bhinadmi śamyayā amuṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ
translated: I split them with a wedge on the testicles of the one who hates me.

original: yathā naḍam kaśipune striyo bhindanty aśmanā /
analyzed: yathā naḍam kaśipune striyaḥ bhindanti aśmanā
translated: As women with a stone break a reed in a basket,

original: evā bhinadmi te śepo 'muṣyā adhi muṣkayoḥ ////
analyzed: eva bhinadmi te śepaḥ muṣyāḥ adhi muṣkayoḥ
translated: So I break thy penis upon the testicles of so-and-so.

original: nyastikā rurohitha subhagaṃkaraṇī mama /
analyzed: nyastikā rurohitha subhagaṃkaraṇī mama
translated: Thou hast risen, O Nyastika, thou that makest me happy.

original: śataṃ tava pratānās trayastriṃśan nitānāḥ //
analyzed: śatam tava pratānāḥ trayastriṃśat nitānāḥ
translated: A hundred are thy outspreads, thirty-three thy windings.

original: tayā sahasraparṇyā hṛdayaṃ śoṣayāmi te ////🔽śuṣyatu mayi te hṛdayam atho śuṣyatv āsyam /
analyzed: tayā sahasraparṇyā hṛdayam śoṣayāmi te  śuṣyatu mayi te hṛdayam atha u śuṣyatu āsyam
translated: With that one of a thousand leaves I dry up thy heart.🔽Let thy heart dry up in me, let thy mouth dry up.

original: atho ni śuṣya māṃ kāmenātho śuṣkāsyā cara ////🔽saṃvananī samuṣpalā babhru kalyāṇi saṃ nuda /
analyzed: atha u ni śuṣya mām kāmena atha u śuṣka āsyā cara  saṃvananī sa muṣpalā babhru kalyāṇi sam nuda
translated: Then dry up in love for me, then go about with a dry mouth.🔽The infatuator, the remover of obstacles, O tawny auspicious one, drive her and me together.

original: amūṃ ca māṃ ca saṃ nuda samānaṃ hṛdayaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: amūm ca mām ca sam nuda samānam hṛdayam kṛdhi
translated: Drive us together, make our hearts one.

original: yathodakam apapuṣo 'paśuṣyaty āsyam /
analyzed: yathā udakam a papuṣaḥ paśuṣyati āsyam
translated: As the mouth of one who has drunk water dries up,

original: evā ni śuṣya māṃ kāmenātho śuṣkāsyā cara ////
analyzed: eva ni śuṣya mām kāmena atha u śuṣka āsyā cara
translated: So dry up in love for me, then go about with a dry mouth.

original: yathā nakulo vichidya saṃdadhāty ahiṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: yathā nakulaḥ vichidya saṃdadhāti ahim punar
translated: As a mongoose again joins a snake that has been severed,

original: evā kāmasya vichinnaṃ saṃ dhehi vīryāvati ////
analyzed: eva kāmasya vichinnam sam dhehi vīryāvati
translated: So join together what has been severed of love, O thou that art full of strength.

original: yau vyāghrāv avarūdhau jighatsataḥ pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca /
analyzed: yau vyāghrau avarūdhau jighatsataḥ pitaram mātaram ca
translated: Those two tigers that are lying in wait, that are hungry for father and mother,

original: tau dantaṃ brahmaṇas pate śivau kṛṇu jātavedaḥ ////
analyzed: tau dantam brahmaṇaḥ pate śivau kṛṇu jātavedaḥ
translated: Make them, O Brahmanaspati, O Jātavedas, make them auspicious for the tooth.

original: vrīhim attaṃ yavam attam atho māṣam atho tilam /
analyzed: vrīhim attam yavam attam atha u māṣam atha u tilam
translated: Eat the rice, eat the barley, eat the beans, eat the sesame.

original: eṣa vāṃ bhāgo nihito ratnadheyāya dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭaṃ pitaram mātaraṃ ca ////
analyzed: eṣa vām bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ ratna dheyāya dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca
translated: This is your share, laid down for the bestowal of treasure. O teeth, do not injure your father or mother.

original: upahūtau sayujau syonau dantau sumaṅgalau /
analyzed: upahūtau sayujau syonau dantau su maṅgalau
translated: The teeth are invoked, yoked together, tender, auspicious.

original: anyatra vāṃ ghoraṃ tanvaḥ paraitu dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭaṃ pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca ////
analyzed: anyatra vām ghoram tanvaḥ paraitu dantau mā hiṃsiṣṭam pitaram mātaram ca
translated: Let the terrible one go away from your bodies to another place. O teeth, do not injure your father or mother.

original: vāyur enāḥ samākarat tvaṣṭā poṣāya dhriyatām /🔽indra ābhyo adhi bravad rudro bhūmne cikitsatu ////
analyzed: vāyuḥ enāḥ samākarat tvaṣṭā poṣāya dhriyatām  indraḥ ābhyaḥ adhi bravat rudraḥ bhūmne cikitsatu
translated: May Vayu bring them together, may Tvastr hold them for growth.🔽May Indra speak to them for increase, may Rudra cure them for prosperity.

original: lohitena svadhitinā mithunaṃ karṇayoḥ kṛdhi /
analyzed: lohitena svadhitinā mithunam karṇayoḥ kṛdhi
translated: With the red axe make a pair for the ears.

original: akartām aśvinā lakṣma tad astu prajayā bahu ////
analyzed: akartām aśvinā lakṣma tat astu prajayā bahu
translated: May the Asvins make the mark. Let that be abundant with offspring.

original: yathā cakrur devāsurā yathā manuṣyā uta /
analyzed: yathā cakruḥ deva asurāḥ yathā manuṣyāḥ uta
translated: As the gods and demons did, as men also did,

original: evā sahasrapoṣāya kṛṇutaṃ lakṣmāśvinā ////
analyzed: eva sahasra poṣāya kṛṇutam lakṣma aśvinā
translated: So make the mark for a thousandfold increase, O Asvins.

original: uc chrayasva bahur bhava svena mahasā yava /
analyzed: ud śrayasva bahuḥ bhava svena mahasā yava
translated: Rise up, become many, with your own greatness, O barley.

original: mṛṇīhi viśvā pātrāṇi mā tvā divyāśanir vadhīt ////
analyzed: mṛṇīhi viśvā pātrāṇi mā tvā divyā aśaniḥ vadhīt
translated: Fill all the vessels. Let not the heavenly thunderbolt kill you.

original: āśṛṇvantaṃ yavaṃ devaṃ yatra tvāchāvadāmasi /
analyzed: āśṛṇvantam yavam devam yatra tvā achāvadāmasi
translated: To the heard barley, to the god, where we call you.

original: tad uc chrayasva dyaur iva samudra ivaidhy akṣitaḥ ////🔽akṣitās ta upasado 'kṣitāḥ santu rāśayaḥ /
analyzed: tat ud śrayasva dyauḥ iva samudraḥ iva edhi akṣitaḥ  akṣitāḥ te upasadaḥ kṣitāḥ santu rāśayaḥ
translated: Rise up, like the sky, like the ocean, be inexhaustible.🔽The Upavasatha days are inexhaustible, may the heaps be inexhaustible.

original: pṛṇanto akṣitāḥ santv attāraḥ santv akṣitāḥ ////
analyzed: pṛṇantaḥ akṣitāḥ santu attāraḥ santu akṣitāḥ
translated: May the givers be inexhaustible, may the enjoyers be inexhaustible.

original: dhītī vā ye anayan vāco agraṃ manasā vā ye 'vadann ṛtāni /
analyzed: dhītī vā ye anayan vācaḥ agram manasā vā ye vadan ṛtāni
translated: Those who have brought the beginning of speech with thought, or those who have uttered the truths with mind,

original: tṛtīyena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānās turīyeṇāmanvata nāma dhenoḥ ////
analyzed: tṛtīyena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānāḥ turīyeṇa amanvata nāma dhenoḥ
translated: Growing with the third Brahman, with the fourth they have followed the name of the cow.

original: sa veda putraḥ pitaraṃ sa mātaraṃ sa sūnur bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ /
analyzed: sa veda putraḥ pitaram sa mātaram sa sūnuḥ bhuvat sa bhuvat punarmaghaḥ
translated: He knows the father, he is the son, he is the mother, he is the child, he is the one who becomes wealthy again.

original: sa dyām aurṇod antarikṣaṃ svaḥ sa idaṃ viśvam abhavat sa ābharat ////
analyzed: sa dyām aurṇot antarikṣam svar saḥ idam viśvam abhavat saḥ ābharat
translated: He has spun out the sky, the atmosphere, and heaven. He has become all this, he has brought it forth.

original: atharvāṇaṃ pitaraṃ devabandhuṃ mātur garbhaṃ pitur asuṃ yuvānam /
analyzed: atharvāṇam pitaram deva bandhum mātuḥ garbham pituḥ asum yuvānam
translated: Atharvan, the father, the kinsman of the gods, the embryo of the mother, the life of the father, the youth,

original: ya imaṃ yajñam manasā ciketa pra ṇo vocas tam iheha bravaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ
translated: Who has thought of this sacrifice with his mind, speak to us of him here, speak of him here.

original: ayā viṣṭhā janayan karvarāṇi sa hi ghṛṇir urur varāya gātuḥ /
analyzed: ayā viṣṭhā janayan karvarāṇi sa hi ghṛṇiḥ uruḥ varāya gātuḥ
translated: This Viṣṭha, begetting the firm ones, he indeed is the wide path for the generous one.

original: sa pratyudaid dharuṇaṃ madhvo agraṃ svayā tanvā tanvam airayata ////
analyzed: sa pratyudait dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram svayā tanvā tanvam airayata
translated: He has turned back the sweet essence, with his own body he has moved the body.

original: ekayā ca daśabhiś ca suhute dvābhyām iṣṭaye viṃśatyā ca /
analyzed: ekayā ca daśabhiḥ ca su hute dvābhyām iṣṭaye viṃśatyā ca
translated: With one and with ten, well-offered, with two and with twenty for the sake of sacrifice.

original: tisṛbhiś ca vahase triṃśatā ca viyugbhir vāya iha tā vi muñca ////
analyzed: tisṛbhiḥ ca vahase triṃśatā ca viyugbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vi muñca
translated: With three and with thirty, O Vayu, you carry them, here release them with the separated ones.

original: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devās tāni dharmāṇi prathamāny āsan /
analyzed: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan
translated: The gods sacrificed the sacrifice with the sacrifice, those were the first established rules.

original: te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ ////
analyzed: te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ
translated: Those great ones attend on the heavenly world, where the ancient Sadhyas are the gods.

original: yajño babhūva sa ā babhūva sa pra jajñe sa u vāvṛdhe punaḥ /
analyzed: yajñaḥ babhūva saḥ ā babhūva sa pra jajñe saḥ u vāvṛdhe punar
translated: The sacrifice became, it was born, it was born again and grew.

original: sa devānām adhipatir babhūva so asmāsu draviṇam ā dadhātu ////
analyzed: sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva saḥ asmāsu draviṇam ā dadhātu
translated: It became the lord of the gods, may it bestow wealth upon us.

original: yad devā devān haviṣā 'yajantāmartyān manasā martyena /
analyzed: yat devāḥ devān haviṣā yajanta amartyān manasā martyena
translated: When the gods sacrificed the gods with oblation, the immortals with mind, with mortal (oblation).

original: madema tatra parame vyoman paśyema tad uditau sūryasya ////
analyzed: madema tatra parame vyoman paśyema tat uditau sūryasya
translated: May we rejoice there in the highest heaven, may we see that at the rising of the sun.

original: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā yajñaṃ devā atanvata /
analyzed: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā yajñam devāḥ atanvata
translated: When the gods performed the sacrifice with the oblation of man,

original: asti nu tasmād ojīyo yad vihavyenejire ////
analyzed: asti nu tasmāt ojīyaḥ yat vihavyena ījire
translated: Is there anything more powerful than that, by which they went with the oblation of the bird?

original: mugdhā devā uta śunā 'yajantota gor aṅgaiḥ purudhā 'yajanta /
analyzed: mugdhāḥ devāḥ uta śunā yajanta uta goḥ aṅgaiḥ purudhā yajanta
translated: The foolish gods sacrificed with a dog, and in many ways they sacrificed with the limbs of a cow.

original: ya imaṃ yajñaṃ manasā ciketa pra ṇo vocas tam iheha bravaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ imam yajñam manasā ciketa pra naḥ vocaḥ tam iha iha bravaḥ
