translated: He who has thought of this sacrifice with his mind, speak it forth to us, proclaim it here.

original: aditir dyaur aditir antarikṣam aditir mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ /
analyzed: aditiḥ dyauḥ aditiḥ antarikṣam aditiḥ mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ
translated: Aditi is the sky, Aditi is the atmosphere, Aditi is the mother, he is the father, he is the son.

original: viśve devā aditir pañca janā aditir jātam aditir janitvam ////
analyzed: viśve devāḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ aditiḥ jātam aditiḥ janitvam
translated: The All-gods are Aditi, the five peoples, Aditi is the born, Aditi is the generating.

original: mahīm ū ṣu mātaraṃ suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase havāmahe /
analyzed: mahīm u su mātaram suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase havāmahe
translated: We call upon the great mother of good vows, the wife of holy order, for help.

original: tuvikṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīṃ suśarmāṇam aditiṃ supraṇītim ////
analyzed: tuvi kṣatrām a jarantīm urūcīm su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim
translated: The far-reaching, undecaying, wide-ruling Aditi, the well-protected, the well-guided.

original: sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyām anehasaṃ suśarmāṇam aditiṃ supraṇītim /
analyzed: su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim
translated: The earth, the heaven, the unfailing, the well-protected, the well-guided Aditi, the good protector.

original: daivīṃ nāvaṃ svaritrām anāgaso asravantīm ā ruhemā svastaye ////
analyzed: daivīm nāvam su aritrām anāgasaḥ a sravantīm ā ruhema svastaye
translated: We will ascend for our welfare the divine ship, the self-moving, the faultless, the unswerving.

original: vājasya nu prasave mātaraṃ mahīm aditiṃ nāma vacasā karāmahe /
analyzed: vājasya nu prasave mātaram mahīm aditim nāma vacasā karāmahe
translated: We with our speech will praise the great mother, Aditi by name, at the impulse of Vayu.

original: yasyā upastha urv antarikṣaṃ sā naḥ śarma trivarūthaṃ ni yachāt ////
analyzed: yasyāḥ upasthe uru antarikṣam sā naḥ śarma tri varūtham ni yacchāt
translated: In whose lap is the wide atmosphere. May she bestow upon us the threefold protection.

original: diteḥ putrāṇām aditer akāriṣam ava devānāṃ bṛhatām anarmaṇām /
analyzed: diteḥ putrāṇām aditeḥ akāriṣam ava devānām bṛhatām a narmaṇām
translated: I have done the work of the sons of Diti and of Aditi, of the great gods who are not to be deceived.

original: teṣāṃ hi dhāma gabhiṣak samudriyaṃ nainān namasā paro asti kaścana ////
analyzed: teṣām hi dhāma gabhiṣak samudriyam na enān namasā paraḥ asti kaścana
translated: For their abode is the deep, the ocean-like. None is above them by sacrifice.

original: bhadrād adhi śreyaḥ prehi bṛhaspatiḥ puraetā te astu /
analyzed: bhadrāt adhi śreyaḥ prehi bṛhaspatiḥ puraetā te astu
translated: Go from good to better. May Brihaspati be thy leader.

original: athemam asyā vara ā pṛthivyā āreśatruṃ kṛṇuhi sarvavīram ////
analyzed: atha imam asyāḥ vare ā pṛthivyāḥ āreśatrum kṛṇuhi sarva vīram
translated: Now make this one, the enemy of this earth, all-heroic, for him.

original: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: prapathe pathām ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Pūṣan is born at the crossroads of paths, at the crossroads of heaven and the crossroads of earth.

original: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan ////🔽pūṣemā āśā anu veda sarvāḥ so asmāṃ abhayatamena neṣat /
analyzed: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā ca carati prajānan  pūṣā imāḥ āśāḥ anu veda sarvāḥ saḥ asmām abhayatamena neṣat
translated: He moves along both the most beloved abodes, coming and going, knowing.🔽Pūṣan knows all these regions. May he lead us to the safest place.

original: svastidā āghṛṇiḥ sarvavīro 'prayuchan pura etu prajānan ////
analyzed: svasti dāḥ āghṛṇiḥ sarva vīraḥ prayuchan puras etu prajānan
translated: The giver of well-being, the compassionate one, all-heroic, not abandoning, may he, knowing, come in front.

original: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana /
analyzed: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana
translated: O Pūṣan, in your vow may we never be harmed.

original: stotāras ta iha smasi ////
analyzed: stotāraḥ te iha smasi
translated: We are here the praisers of you.

original: pari pūṣā parastād dhastaṃ dadhātu dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: pari pūṣā parastāt hastam dadhātu dakṣiṇam
translated: May Pūṣan place his right hand beyond.

original: punar no naṣṭam ājatu saṃ naṣṭena gamemahi ////
analyzed: punar naḥ naṣṭam ājatu sam naṣṭena gamemahi
translated: May he bring back to us what is lost. May we go with what is lost.

original: yas te stanaḥ śaśayur yo mayobhūr yaḥ sumnayuḥ suhavo yaḥ sudatraḥ /🔽yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayuḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yaḥ sumnayuḥ su havaḥ yaḥ su datraḥ  yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvati tam iha dhātave kaḥ
translated: Your breast that is full of milk, that is pure, that is full of bliss, that is easy to invoke, that is bountiful,🔽By which, O Sarasvatī, you nourish all valuable things, bring that here to be placed.

original: yas te pṛthu stanayitnur ya ṛṣvo daivaḥ ketur viśvam ābhūṣatīdam /
analyzed: yaḥ te pṛthuḥ stanayitnuḥ yaḥ ṛṣvaḥ daivaḥ ketuḥ viśvam ābhūṣati idam
translated: Your vast thunder, your lofty divine banner that fills all this world,

original: mā no vadhīr vidyutā deva sasyaṃ mota vadhī raśmibhiḥ sūryasya ////
analyzed: mā naḥ vadhīḥ vidyutā deva sasyam mā uta vadhīḥ raśmibhiḥ sūryasya
translated: Do not slay our crops with lightning, O God, nor slay them with the rays of the sun.

original: sabhā ca mā samitiś cāvatāṃ prajāpater duhitarau saṃvidāne /
analyzed: sabhā ca mā samitiḥ ca avatām prajāpateḥ duhitarau saṃvidāne
translated: May the Assembly and the Council, the two daughters of Prajapati, protect me, in agreement.

original: yenā saṃgachā upa mā sa śikṣāc cāru vadāni pitaraḥ saṃgateṣu ////
analyzed: yena saṃgacchāḥ upa mā sa śikṣāt cāru vadāni pitaraḥ saṃgateṣu
translated: With whom I shall meet, may he come to me. I shall speak pleasing words, O Fathers, in the assemblies.

original: vidma te sabhe nāma nariṣṭā nāma vā asi /
analyzed: vidma te sabhe nāma nariṣṭā nāma vai asi
translated: We know your name, O Assembly, you are called the Unharmed one.

original: ye te ke ca sabhāsadas te me santu savācasaḥ ////
analyzed: ye te ke ca sabhāsadaḥ te me santu savācasaḥ
translated: May all those who sit in the Assembly be of one voice with me.

original: eṣām ahaṃ samāsīnānāṃ varco vijñānam ā dade /
analyzed: eṣām aham samāsīnānām varcaḥ vijñānam ā dade
translated: I take away the splendor and knowledge of those who are seated here.

original: asyāḥ sarvasyāḥ saṃsado mām indra bhaginaṃ kṛṇu ////
analyzed: asyāḥ sarvasyāḥ saṃsadaḥ mām indra bhaginam kṛṇu
translated: O Indra, make me the most fortunate one of this entire assembly.

original: yad vo manaḥ parāgataṃ yad baddham iha veha vā /
analyzed: yat vaḥ manaḥ parāgatam yat baddham iha vā iha vā
translated: Whatever mind of yours has gone away, bound here or there,

original: tad va ā vartayāmasi mayi vo ramatāṃ manaḥ ////
analyzed: tat vaḥ ā vartayāmasi mayi vaḥ ramatām manaḥ
translated: we bring it back to you. May your mind delight in me.

original: yathā sūryo nakṣatrāṇām udyaṃs tejāṃsy ādade /
analyzed: yathā sūryaḥ nakṣatrāṇām udyan tejāṃsi ādade
translated: Just as the rising sun takes away the light of the stars,

original: evā strīṇāṃ ca puṃsāṃ ca dviṣatāṃ varca ā dade ////
analyzed: eva strīṇām ca puṃsām ca dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade
translated: in the same way I take away the splendor of the women and men who hate me.

original: yāvanto mā sapatnānām āyantaṃ pratipaśyatha /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ mā sapatnānām āyantam pratipaśyatha
translated: As many as see me coming, the enemies,

original: udyant sūrya iva suptānāṃ dviṣatām varca ā dade ////
analyzed: udyan sūryaḥ iva suptānām dviṣatām varcaḥ ā dade
translated: like the rising sun the sleep of those who hate, I take away their splendor.

original: abhi tyaṃ devaṃ savitāram oṇyoḥ kavikratum /
analyzed: abhi tyam devam savitāram oṇyoḥ kavi kratum
translated: I praise that God Savitar, the wise, between the two world-halves,

original: arcāmi satyasavaṃ ratnadhām abhi priyaṃ matim ////🔽urdhvā yasyāmatir bhā adidyutat savīmani /
analyzed: arcāmi satya savam ratna dhām abhi priyam matim  urdhvā yasya amatiḥ bhās adidyutat savīmani
translated: The true-working, the giver of treasure, and the dear thought.🔽Whose high overlordship shines forth in his own power,

original: hiraṇyapāṇir amimīta sukratuḥ kṛpāt svaḥ ////
analyzed: hiraṇya pāṇiḥ amimīta su kratuḥ kṛpāt svar
translated: The wise one, with golden hands, hath measured out the light from the sky.

original: sāvīr hi deva prathamāya pitre varṣmāṇam asmai varimāṇam asmai /
analyzed: sāvīḥ hi deva prathamāya pitre varṣmāṇam asmai varimāṇam asmai
translated: For the first father, O God Savitar, give him greatness, give him room,

original: athāsmabhyaṃ savitar vāryāṇi divodiva ā suvā bhūri paśvaḥ ////
analyzed: atha asmabhyam savitar vāryāṇi divaḥ divaḥ ā suva bhūri paśvaḥ
translated: And, O Savitar, bring us good things from heaven, day by day, in abundance, O you who possess cattle.

original: damūnā devaḥ savitā vareṇyo dadhad ratnaṃ pitṛbhya āyūṃṣi /
analyzed: damūnāḥ devaḥ savitā vareṇyaḥ dadhat ratnam pitṛbhyaḥ āyūṃṣi
translated: The kindly God Savitar, the most excellent, bestowing treasure and life upon the fathers,

original: pibāt somaṃ mamadad enam iṣṭe parijmā cit kramate asya dharmaṇi ////
analyzed: pibāt somam mamadat enam iṣṭe parijmā cit kramate asya dharmaṇi
translated: May he drink the Soma, rejoice in it, when worshipped. Even the ever-wandering one moves in his own law.

original: tāṃ savitaḥ satyasavāṃ sucitrām āhaṃ vṛṇe sumatiṃ viśvavārām /
analyzed: tām savitar satya savām su citrām ā aham vṛṇe sumatim viśva vārām
translated: That most excellent favour of yours, O Savitar, which brings all blessings, I choose, O you of true impulse, which is most wonderful,

original: yām asya kaṇvo aduhat prapīnāṃ sahasradhārāṃ mahiṣo bhagāya ////
analyzed: yām asya kaṇvaḥ aduhat prapīnām sahasra dhārām mahiṣaḥ bhagāya
translated: Which the mighty buffalo Kanya milked for Bhaga, the full one, with a thousand streams.

original: bṛhaspate savitar vardhayainaṃ jyotayainaṃ mahate saubhagāya /
analyzed: bṛhaspate savitar vardhaya enam jyotaya enam mahate saubhagāya
translated: O Brihaspati, O Savitar, increase him, make him shine for great good fortune.

original: saṃśitaṃ cit saṃtaraṃ saṃ śiśādhi viśva enam anu madantu devāḥ ////
analyzed: saṃśitam cit saṃtaram sam śiśādhi viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ
translated: Even the sharpened one, the one who crosses over, sharpen him. Let all the gods rejoice in him.

original: dhātā dadhātu no rayim īśāno jagatas patiḥ /
analyzed: dhātā dadhātu naḥ rayim īśānaḥ jagataḥ patiḥ
translated: May Dhatr, the lord, the ruler of the world, grant us wealth.

original: sa naḥ pūrṇena yachatu ////
analyzed: sa naḥ pūrṇena yacchatu
translated: May he endow us with the full (blessing).

original: dhātā dadhātu dāśuṣe prācīṃ jīvātum akṣitām /
analyzed: dhātā dadhātu dāśuṣe prācīm jīvātum akṣitām
translated: May Dhatr grant the worshipper long life that shall never come to an end.

original: vayam devasya dhīmahi sumatiṃ viśvarādhasaḥ ////
analyzed: vayam devasya dhīmahi sumatim viśva rādhasaḥ
translated: May we attain the favour of the god, the bestower of all boons.

original: dhātā viśvā vāryā dadhātu prajākāmāya dāśuṣe duroṇe /
analyzed: dhātā viśvā vāryā dadhātu prajā kāmāya dāśuṣe duroṇe
translated: May Dhatr bestow all good things in the house of the worshipper who longs for offspring.

original: tasmai devā amṛtaṃ saṃ vyayantu viśve devā aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai devāḥ amṛtam sam vyayantu viśve devāḥ aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: May the gods all together, and Aditi in unison with them, grant him immortality.

original: dhātā rātiḥ savitedaṃ juṣantāṃ prajāpatir nidhipatir no agniḥ /
analyzed: dhātā rātiḥ savitā idam juṣantām prajāpatiḥ nidhi patiḥ naḥ agniḥ
translated: May Dhatr, Rati, Savitar accept this (offering); may Prajapati, the lord of treasures, Agni,

original: tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇo yajamānāya draviṇaṃ dadhātu ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā saṃrarāṇaḥ yajamānāya draviṇam dadhātu
translated: Tvashtar, Vishnu, bestowing offspring, grant wealth to the sacrificer.

original: pra nabhasva pṛthivi bhinddhīdaṃ divyaṃ nabhaḥ /
analyzed: pra nabhasva pṛthivi bhinddhi idam divyam nabhaḥ
translated: Open thyself, O earth, break this the heavenly covering.

original: udno divyasya no dhātar īśāno vi ṣyā dṛtim ////
analyzed: udnaḥ divyasya naḥ dhātar īśānaḥ vi sya dṛtim
translated: O Dhatr, be thou the opener of the heavenly vault.

original: na ghraṃs tatāpa na himo jaghāna pra nabhatāṃ pṛthivī jīradānuḥ /
analyzed: na ghraṃs tatāpa na himaḥ jaghāna pra nabhatām pṛthivī jīra dānuḥ
translated: Neither heat nor cold hath injured it; may the earth, rich in heroes, open itself.

original: āpaś cid asmai ghṛtam it kṣaranti yatra somaḥ sadam it tatra bhadram ////
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asmai ghṛtam id kṣaranti yatra somaḥ sadam id tatra bhadram
translated: Even the waters flow to him as if they were ghee. Where the Soma is, there is bliss.

original: prajāpatir janayati prajā imā dhātā dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ janayati prajāḥ imāḥ dhātā dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ
translated: Prajapati generates these creatures. May the Creator, well-disposed, establish them.

original: saṃjānānāḥ saṃmanasaḥ sayonayo mayi puṣṭaṃ puṣṭapatir dadhātu ////
analyzed: saṃjānānāḥ saṃmanasaḥ sa yonayaḥ mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu
translated: May the Lord of Growth bestow upon me increase, the creatures being of one mind, of one thought, of one origin.

original: anv adya no 'numatir yajñaṃ deveṣu manyatām /
analyzed: anu adya naḥ numatiḥ yajñam deveṣu manyatām
translated: May Anumati today approve our sacrifice among the gods.

original: agniś ca havyavāhano bhavatāṃ dāśuṣe mama ////
analyzed: agniḥ ca havya vāhanaḥ bhavatām dāśuṣe mama
translated: And may Agni, the bearer of oblations, be favourable to me, the worshipper.

original: anv id anumate tvaṃ maṃsase śaṃ ca nas kṛdhi /
analyzed: anu id anumate tvam maṃsase śam ca naḥ kṛdhi
translated: Do thou, O Anumati, approve this, and make us happy.

original: juṣasva havyam āhutaṃ prajāṃ devi rarāsva naḥ ////🔽anu manyatām anumanyamānaḥ prajāvantaṃ rayim akṣīyamāṇam /
analyzed: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ  anu manyatām anumanyamānaḥ prajāvantam rayim a kṣīyamāṇam
translated: Accept the offered oblation, and grant us offspring, O goddess.🔽May he who approves approve our increase of wealth that shall not fail.

original: tasya vayaṃ heḍasi māpi bhūma sumṛḍīke asya sumatau syāma ////
analyzed: tasya vayam heḍasi mā api bhūma su mṛḍīke asya sumatau syāma
translated: May we never incur his displeasure, but enjoy his favour and his loving-kindness.

original: yat te nāma suhavaṃ supraṇīte 'numate anumataṃ sudānu /
analyzed: yat te nāma su havam su praṇīte numate anumatam sudānu
translated: Whatever is thy name, O thou whose impulse is good, O thou who art approved by Anumati, O thou who givest good gifts,

original: tenā no yajñaṃ pipṛhi viśvavāre rayiṃ no dhehi subhage suvīram ////🔽emaṃ yajñam anumatir jagāma sukṣetratāyai suvīratāyai sujātam /
analyzed: tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram  ā imam yajñam anumatiḥ jagāma su kṣetra tāyai su vīra tāyai su jātam
translated: therewith, O thou who art all-powerful, enrich our sacrifice. Grant us wealth, O blessed one, with brave sons.🔽Anumati has come to this sacrifice for the sake of a good field and good brave sons.

original: bhadrā hy asyāḥ pramatir babhūva semam yajñam avatu devagopā ////
analyzed: bhadrā hi asyāḥ pramatiḥ babhūva sā imam yajñam avatu deva gopā
translated: For her good thought has become auspicious. May she, protected by the gods, favour this sacrifice.

original: anumatiḥ sarvam idaṃ babhūva yat tiṣṭhati carati yad u ca viśvam ejati /
analyzed: anumatiḥ sarvam idam babhūva yat tiṣṭhati carati yat u ca viśvam ejati
translated: Anu-matî was all this that is and moves and all that liveth.

original: tasyās te devi sumatau syāmānumate anu hi maṃsase naḥ ////
analyzed: tasyāḥ te devi sumatau syāma anumate anu hi maṃsase naḥ
translated: In her good grace, O Goddess, may we be, O Anu-matî, for thou hast pity on us all.

original: sameta viśve vacasā patiṃ diva eko vibhūr atithir janānām /
analyzed: sameta viśve vacasā patim divaḥ ekaḥ vibhūḥ atithiḥ janānām
translated: All the Gods have come together in one place, the Lord of heaven, the one all-pervading guest of men.

original: sa pūrvyo nūtanam āvivāsat taṃ vartanir anu vāvṛta ekam it puru ////
analyzed: sa pūrvyaḥ nūtanam āvivāsat tam vartaniḥ anu vāvṛte ekam id puru
translated: The ancient one hath entered the new one, and the path hath turned to the one alone.

original: ayaṃ sahasram ā no dṛśe kavīnāṃ matir jyotir vidharmaṇi ////🔽bradhnaḥ samīcīr uṣasaḥ sam airayan /
analyzed: ayam sahasram ā naḥ dṛśe kavīnām matiḥ jyotiḥ vidharmaṇi  bradhnaḥ samīcīḥ uṣasaḥ sam airayan
translated: This thousandfold light of the sages hath appeared to our sight in the path of the law.🔽The sun hath sent forth the rays of the dawn.

original: arepasaḥ sacetasaḥ svasare manyumattamāś cite goḥ ////
analyzed: arepasaḥ sacetasaḥ svasare manyumattamāḥ cite goḥ
translated: The spotless, the wise, the swift, the most wrathful, the mind of the cow.

original: dauṣvapnyam daurjīvityaṃ rakṣo abhvam arāyyaḥ /
analyzed: dauṣvapnyam daurjīvityam rakṣaḥ abhvam arāyyaḥ
translated: Evil dreams, evil living, demon, monster, evil spirit,

original: durṇāmnīḥ sarvā durvācas tā asman nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: durṇāmnīḥ sarvāḥ durvācaḥ tāḥ asmat nāśayāmasi
translated: All evil names, all evil words, we drive away from us.

original: yan na indro akhanad yad agnir viśve devā maruto yat svarkāḥ /
analyzed: yat naḥ indraḥ akhanat yat agniḥ viśve devāḥ marutaḥ yat su arkāḥ
translated: What Indra hath dug out, what Agni, what all the Gods, the Maruts, what the Svadhakas,

original: tad asmabhyaṃ savitā satyadharmā prajāpatir anumatir ni yachāt ////
analyzed: tat asmabhyam savitā satya dharmā prajāpatiḥ anumatiḥ ni yacchāt
translated: That may Savitar, the God of true decrees, Prajâpati, Anu-matî, grant to us.

original: yayor ojasā skabhitā rajāṃsi yau vīryair vīratamā śaviṣṭhā /
analyzed: yayoḥ ojasā skabhitā rajāṃsi yau vīryaiḥ vīratamā śaviṣṭhā
translated: Whose are the powers that have established the regions, who are the most heroic through their manly strength, the strongest,

original: yau patyete apratītau sahobhir viṣṇum agan varuṇaṃ pūrvahūtiḥ ////
analyzed: yau patyete apratītau sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrva hūtiḥ
translated: Those two who stand together with their powers, the first call went to Vishnu and Varuna.

original: yasyedaṃ pradiśi yad virocate pra cānati vi ca caṣṭe śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: yasya idam pradiśi yat virocate pra ca anati vi ca caṣṭe śacībhiḥ
translated: Whose is this that shines in the directions, and looks around with his powers,

original: purā devasya dharmaṇā sahobhir viṣṇum agan varuṇaṃ pūrvahūtiḥ ////
analyzed: purā devasya dharmaṇā sahobhiḥ viṣṇum agan varuṇam pūrva hūtiḥ
translated: Before the god's law with his powers, the first call went to Vishnu and Varuna.

original: viṣṇor nu kaṃ prā vocaṃ vīryāṇi yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ nu kam pra vocam vīryāṇi yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāṃsi
translated: Of Vishnu, whose heroic deeds I will now proclaim, who has measured the earthly expanses,

original: yo askabhāyad uttaraṃ sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇas tredhorugāyaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ askabhāyat uttaram sadhastham vicakramāṇaḥ tredhā urugāyaḥ
translated: Who has established the higher abode, the far-reaching one, the three-versed one.

original: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryāṇi mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: pra tat viṣṇuḥ stavate vīryāṇi mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ
translated: That heroic deed of Vishnu is praised, the terrible beast that roams the mountains,

original: parāvata ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ ////
analyzed: parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ
translated: May he come from afar, from the farthest distance.

original: yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaneṣv adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yasya uruṣu triṣu vikramaneṣu adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: In whose three strides all the worlds are contained,

original: uru viṣṇo vi kramasvoru kṣayāya nas kṛdhi /
analyzed: uru viṣṇo vi kramasva uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi
translated: O Vishnu, stride widely, make wide room for us.

original: ghṛtam ghṛtayone piba prapra yajñapatiṃ tira ////
analyzed: ghṛtam ghṛta yone piba pra pra yajña patim tira
translated: Drink the ghee, O ghee-born one, extend the lord of sacrifice.

original: idaṃ viṣṇur vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padā /
analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ vi cakrame tredhā ni dadhe padā
translated: This Vishnu has strode, he has placed his foot in three places.

original: samūḍham asya paṃsure ////
analyzed: samūḍham asya paṃsure
translated: His dust is collected.

original: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇur gopā adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: With three steps Vishnu has strode, the guardian, the infallible one.

original: ito dharmāṇi dhārayan ////
analyzed: itas dharmāṇi dhārayan
translated: From here, upholding the dharmas...

original: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe
translated: Behold the deeds of Vishnu, from whom the vows are seen.

original: indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā ////
analyzed: indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: The friend of Indra, fit for union...

original: tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padaṃ sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ /
analyzed: tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ
translated: That is the highest abode of Vishnu, which the seers always behold.

original: divīva cakṣur ātatam ////
analyzed: divi iva cakṣuḥ ātatam
translated: Like an eye stretched out in the sky...

original: divo viṣṇa uta pṛthivyā maho viṣṇa uror antarikṣāt /
analyzed: divaḥ viṣṇo uta pṛthivyāḥ mahaḥ viṣṇo uroḥ antarikṣāt
translated: O Vishnu, in the sky, on the earth, in the great expanse of the atmosphere, O Vishnu,

original: hastau pṛṇasva bahubhir vasavyair āprayacha dakṣiṇād ota savyāt ////
analyzed: hastau pṛṇasva bahubhiḥ vasavyaiḥ āprayaccha dakṣiṇāt ā uta savyāt
translated: Fill your hands with many treasures, bestow from the right and the left.

original: iḍaivāsmāṃ anu vastāṃ vratena yasyāḥ pade punate devayantaḥ /
analyzed: iḍā eva asmān anu vastām vratena yasyāḥ pade punate devayantaḥ
translated: May this very earth follow us with her vow, in whose step those who honor the gods purify themselves.

original: ghṛtapadī śakvarī somapṛṣṭhopa yajñam asthita vaiśvadevī ////
analyzed: ghṛtapadī śakvarī soma pṛṣṭhā upa yajñam asthita vaiśvadevī
translated: Having ghee as her foot, the Shakvari, with the back of Soma, she has come to the sacrifice, belonging to all the gods.

original: vedaḥ svastir drughaṇaḥ svastiḥ paraśur vediḥ paraśur naḥ svasti /
analyzed: vedaḥ svastiḥ drughaṇaḥ svastiḥ paraśuḥ vediḥ paraśuḥ naḥ svasti
translated: The Veda is auspicious, Drughana is auspicious, the axe is auspicious, the altar is auspicious for us.

original: haviṣkṛto yajñiyā yajñakāmās te devāso yajñam imaṃ juṣantām ////
analyzed: haviṣkṛtaḥ yajñiyāḥ yajña kāmāḥ te devāsaḥ yajñam imam juṣantām
translated: The ones who prepare the oblations, the worthy of sacrifice, who desire the sacrifice, may those gods accept this sacrifice of ours.

original: agnāviṣṇū mahi tad vāṃ mahitvam pātho ghṛtasya guhyasya nāma /
analyzed: agnāviṣṇū mahi tat vām mahi tvam pāthaḥ ghṛtasya guhyasya nāma
translated: O Agni and Vishnu, that greatness of yours is great, the name of the secret ghee offering.

original: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānau prati vāṃ jihvā ghṛtam ā caraṇyāt ////
analyzed: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānau prati vām jihvā ghṛtam ā caraṇyāt
translated: In every house, holding seven treasures, may your tongue reach out for the ghee.

original: agnāviṣṇū mahi dhāma priyam vāṃ vītho ghṛtasya guhyā juṣāṇau /
analyzed: agnāviṣṇū mahi dhāma priyam vām vīthaḥ ghṛtasya guhyā juṣāṇau
translated: O Agni and Vishnu, the great abode dear to you, the two hidden ones who enjoy the path of ghee,

original: damedame suṣṭutyā vāvṛdhānau prati vāṃ jihvā ghṛtam uc caraṇyāt ////
analyzed: damedame suṣṭutyā vāvṛdhānau prati vām jihvā ghṛtam ud caraṇyāt
translated: increasing in every house through praise, may your tongues lick the ghee that is offered.

original: svāktaṃ me dyāvāpṛthivī svāktaṃ mitro akar ayam /
analyzed: su āktam me dyāvāpṛthivī su āktam mitraḥ akaḥ ayam
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī anoint me, may Mitra anoint me here,

original: svāktaṃ me brahmaṇas patiḥ svāktaṃ savitā karat ////
analyzed: su āktam me brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ su āktam savitā karat
translated: may Brahmanaspati anoint me, may Savitar anoint me.

original: indrotibhir bahulābhir no adya yāvacchreṣṭhābhir maghavan chūra jinva /
analyzed: indra ūtibhiḥ bahulābhiḥ naḥ adya yāvat śreṣṭhābhiḥ maghavan śūra jinva
translated: O Indra, with your abundant and most excellent powers, O mighty one, quicken us today,

original: yo no dveṣṭy adhara sas padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmas tam u prāṇo jahātu ////🔽upa priyaṃ panipnatam yuvānam āhutīvṛdham /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi adhara saḥ padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u prāṇaḥ jahātu  upa priyam panipnatam yuvānam āhutīvṛdham
translated: let him who hates us be below, let the one we hate be deprived of breath.🔽We have come to the dear, well-oiled youth, the increaser of offerings.

original: aganma bibhrato namo dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me ////
analyzed: aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me
translated: Bearing homage, may he make my life long.

original: saṃ mā siñcantu marutaḥ saṃ pūṣā saṃ bṛhaspatiḥ /🔽saṃ māyam agniḥ siñcatu prajayā ca dhanena ca dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me ////
analyzed: sam mā siñcantu marutaḥ sam pūṣā sam bṛhaspatiḥ  sam mā ayam agniḥ siñcatu prajayā ca dhanena ca dīrgham āyuḥ kṛṇotu me
translated: May the Maruts, may Pusan, may Brihaspati pour me together,🔽may Agni pour me together with offspring and wealth. May he make my life long.

original: agne jātān pra ṇudā me sapatnān praty ajātān jātavedo nudasva /
analyzed: agne jātān pra nuda me sapatnān prati a jātān jātavedaḥ nudasva
translated: O Agni, drive away my enemies who are born, and drive back those who are unborn, O all-knower.

original: adhaspadaṃ kṛṇuṣva ye pṛtanyavo 'nāgasas te vayam aditaye syāma ////
analyzed: adhaspadam kṛṇuṣva ye pṛtanyavaḥ nāgasaḥ te vayam aditaye syāma
translated: Make those who are hostile to us to be beneath our feet. May we be sinless before Aditi.

original: prānyānt sapatnānt sahasā sahasva praty ajātān jātavedo nudasva /
analyzed: pra anyān sapatnān sahasā sahasva prati ajātān jātavedaḥ nudasva
translated: Overcome with violence those enemies of ours who are other than us. Drive away those who are unborn, O all-knower.

original: idaṃ rāṣṭraṃ pipṛhi saubhagāya viśva enam anu madantu devāḥ ////
analyzed: idam rāṣṭram pipṛhi saubhagāya viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ
translated: Nourish this kingdom for good fortune. May all the gods rejoice in him.

original: imā yās te śataṃ hirāḥ sahasraṃ dhamanīr uta /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ te śatam hirāḥ sahasram dhamanīḥ uta
translated: Those hundred veins of thine, and also those a thousand,

original: tāsāṃ te sarvāsām aham aśmanā bilam apy adhām ////
analyzed: tāsām te sarvāsām aham aśmanā bilam api adhām
translated: of all of them I have with stone stopped up the cavity.

original: paraṃ yoner avaraṃ te kṛṇomi mā tvā prajābhi bhūn mota sūtuḥ /
analyzed: param yoneḥ avaram te kṛṇomi mā tvā prajā abhi bhūt mā uta sūtuḥ
translated: I make thee lower than the womb. Let neither offspring nor son be thine.

original: asvaṃ tvāprajasaṃ kṛṇomy aśmānaṃ te apidhānam kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: a svam tvā aprajasam kṛṇomi aśmānam te apidhānam kṛṇomi
translated: I make thee barren and without offspring. I make the stone thy covering.

original: akṣyau nau madhusaṃkāśe anīkam nau samañjanam /
analyzed: akṣyau nau madhu saṃkāśe anīkam nau samañjanam
translated: Our eyes are like honey, our faces are well-shaped.

original: antaḥ kṛṣṇuṣva māṃ hṛdi mana in nau sahāsati ////
analyzed: antar kṛṣṇuṣva mām hṛdi manaḥ id nau saha asati
translated: In my heart do thou delight. Let our mind be united.

original: abhi tvā manujātena dadhāmi mama vāsasā /
analyzed: abhi tvā manu jātena dadhāmi mama vāsasā
translated: With my garment I clothe thee, O thou born of Manu.

original: yāthā 'so mama kevalo nānyāsāṃ kīrtayāś cana ////
analyzed: yāthā saḥ mama kevalaḥ na anyāsām kīrtayāḥ cana
translated: Be only mine, and speak not the praises of others.

original: idam khanāmi bheṣajaṃ māṃpaśyam abhirorudam /
analyzed: idam khanāmi bheṣajam māṃpaśyam abhirorudam
translated: I dig this medicine, looking to me, to be laid on the thigh.

original: parāyato nivartanam āyataḥ pratinandanam ////
analyzed: parāyataḥ nivartanam āyataḥ pratinandanam
translated: For one gone away, a return; for one come, a welcome.

original: yenā nicakra āsurīndraṃ devebhyas pari /
analyzed: yena nicakre āsurī indram devebhyaḥ pari
translated: By which thou didst bring Indra, the Asura, to the gods,

original: tenā ni kurve tvām ahaṃ yathā te 'sāni supriyā ////
analyzed: tena ni kurve tvām aham yathā te sāni su priyā
translated: By that I bring thee to myself, that thou mayst be very dear to me.

original: pratīcī somam asi pratīcī uta sūryam /
analyzed: pratīcī somam asi pratīcī uta sūryam
translated: Thou art the western one of Soma, the western one of Sûrya,

original: pratīcī viśvān devān tāṃ tvāchāvadāmasi ////
analyzed: pratīcī viśvān devān tām tvā achāvadāmasi
translated: The western one of all the Gods: we call thee hither to ourselves.

original: ahaṃ vadāmi net tvaṃ sabhāyām aha tvaṃ vada /
analyzed: aham vadāmi na id tvam sabhāyām aha tvam vada
translated: I speak, not thou: in the assembly thou must speak.

original: mamed asas tvaṃ kevalo nānyāsāṃ kīrtayāś cana ////
analyzed: mama id asaḥ tvam kevalaḥ na anyāsām kīrtayāḥ cana
translated: I am the only one: thou must not proclaim the praises of others.

original: yadi vāsi tirojanaṃ yadi vā nadyas tiraḥi /
analyzed: yadi vā asi tirojanam yadi vā nadyaḥ tiras
translated: If thou art beyond the three hills, or beyond the rivers,

original: iyaṃ ha mahyaṃ tvām oṣadhir baddhveva nyānayat ////
analyzed: iyam ha mahyam tvām oṣadhiḥ baddhvā iva nyānayat
translated: This plant of mine shall drag thee hither, as if bound with a rope.

original: divyaṃ suparṇaṃ payasaṃ bṛhantam apāṃ garbhaṃ vṛṣabham oṣadhīnām /
analyzed: divyam suparṇam payasam bṛhantam apām garbham vṛṣabham oṣadhīnām
translated: The heavenly bird, the mighty one full of sap, the waters' germ, the bull of plants,

original: abhīpato vṛṣṭyā tarpayantam ā no goṣṭhe rayiṣṭhāṃ sthāpayāti ////
analyzed: abhīpatas vṛṣṭyā tarpayantam ā naḥ goṣṭhe rayiṣṭhām sthāpayāti
translated: Who satisfies with rain from the sky, him, the best of riches, I establish in our cow-pen.

original: yasya vrataṃ paśavo yanti sarve yasya vrata upatiṣṭhanta āpaḥ /
analyzed: yasya vratam paśavaḥ yanti sarve yasya vrate upatiṣṭhante āpaḥ
translated: Whose are all the cattle that move according to his will, whose is the water that stands still according to his will,

original: yasya vrate puṣṭapatir niviṣṭas taṃ sarasvantam avase havāmahe ////
analyzed: yasya vrate puṣṭa patiḥ niviṣṭaḥ tam sarasvantam avase havāmahe
translated: In whose will the lord of increase is fixed, him Sarasvant we invoke for help.

original: ā pratyañcaṃ dāśuṣe dāśvaṃsaṃ sarasvantaṃ puṣṭapatiṃ rayiṣṭhām /
analyzed: ā pratyañcam dāśuṣe dāśvaṃsam sarasvantam puṣṭa patim rayiṣṭhām
translated: To the western one, to the giver of gifts, to Sarasvant, the lord of increase, the best of riches, to the giver of gifts,

original: rāyas poṣaṃ śravasyuṃ vasānā iha sadanaṃ rayīṇām ////
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣam śravasyum vasānāḥ iha sadanam rayīṇām
translated: Wearing the prosperity of wealth and fame, the abode of riches here.

original: ati dhanvāny aty apas tatarda śyeno nṛcakṣā avasānadarśaḥ /
analyzed: ati dhanvāni ati apaḥ tatarda śyenaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ avasāna darśaḥ
translated: The hawk, looking on men, seeing the end, has passed over the deserts and the waters.

original: taran viśvāny avarā rajaṃsīndreṇa sakhyā śiva ā jagamyāt ////
analyzed: taran viśvāni avarā rajaṃsi indreṇa sakhyā śivaḥ ā jagamyāt
translated: Passing over all the lower regions, may he come to us with Indra as his friend, bringing bliss.

original: śyeno nṛcakṣā divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sahasrapāc chatayonir vayodhāḥ /
analyzed: śyenaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sahasra pād śata yoniḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: The hawk, looking on men, the divine bird, the thousand-feeder, born from a hundred wombs, the giver of life,

original: sa no ni yachād vasu yat parābhṛtam asmākam astu pitṛṣu svadhāvat ////
analyzed: sa naḥ ni yacchāt vasu yat parābhṛtam asmākam astu pitṛṣu svadhāvat
translated: May he grant us the wealth that has been taken away. May we have our own share among the fathers.

original: somārudrā vi vṛhataṃ viṣūcīm amīvā yā no gayam āviveśa /
analyzed: somārudrā vi vṛhatam viṣūcīm amīvā yā naḥ gayam āviveśa
translated: O Soma and Rudra, drive away the evil disease that has entered our house.

original: bādhethāṃ dūraṃ nirṛtim parācaiḥ kṛtaṃ cid enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat ////
analyzed: bādhethām dūram nirṛtim parācais kṛtam cit enaḥ pra mumuktam asmat
translated: Drive away Nirrti far away. Release from us even the committed sin.

original: somārudrā yuvam etāny asmad viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam /
analyzed: somārudrā yuvam etāni asmat viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam
translated: O Soma and Rudra, you two bestow upon us these remedies in all our bodies.

original: ava syataṃ muñcataṃ yan no asat tanūṣu baddhaṃ kṛtam eno asmat ////
analyzed: ava syatam muñcatam yat naḥ asat tanūṣu baddham kṛtam enaḥ asmat
translated: Loosen and release from us what is in our bodies, the sin that we have committed.

original: śivās ta ekā aśivās ta ekāḥ sarvā bibharṣi sumanasyamānaḥ /
analyzed: śivāḥ te ekāḥ aśivāḥ te ekāḥ sarvāḥ bibharṣi sumanasyamānaḥ
translated: Some of them are friendly, some are unfriendly. You bear them all, well-disposed.

original: tisro vāco nihitā antar asmin tāsām ekā vi papātānu ghoṣam ////
analyzed: tisraḥ vācaḥ nihitāḥ antar asmin tāsām ekā vi papāta anu ghoṣam
translated: Three voices are hidden within him. Of them one has flown away, following the sound.

original: ubhā jigyathur na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraś canainayoḥ /
analyzed: ubhā jigyathuḥ na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraḥ cana enayoḥ
translated: You both conquered, but neither was vanquished. Neither of you was vanquished.

original: indraś ca viṣṇo yad apaspṛdhethāṃ tredhā sahasraṃ vi tad airayethām ////
analyzed: indraḥ ca viṣṇo yat apaspṛdhethām tredhā sahasram vi tat airayethām
translated: O Indra and Vishnu, when you contended, you divided the thousand into three parts.

original: janād viśvajanīnāt sindhutas pary ābhṛtam /
analyzed: janāt viśvajanīnāt sindhutaḥ pari ābhṛtam
translated: Brought from the people of all lands, from the river,

original: dūrāt tvā manya udbhṛtam īrṣyāyā nāma bheṣajam ////🔽agner ivāsya dahato dāvasya dahataḥ pṛthak /
analyzed: dūrāt tvā manye udbhṛtam īrṣyāyāḥ nāma bheṣajam  agneḥ iva asya dahataḥ dāvasya dahataḥ pṛthak
translated: From far away, I bring the medicine for the name of envy.🔽Like a fire burning separately, like a forest fire burning,

original: etām etasyerṣyām udrāgnim iva śamaya ////
analyzed: etām etasya īrṣyām udra agnim iva śamaya
translated: I appease this envy of him, like a fire.

original: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā /
analyzed: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā
translated: O Sinivali, of the vast hymn, you who are the sister of the gods,

original: juṣasva havyam āhutaṃ prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ ////
analyzed: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
translated: Enjoy the offered oblation, and grant us offspring, O goddess.

original: yā subāhuḥ svaṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī /
analyzed: yā su bāhuḥ su aṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī
translated: She who has beautiful arms, who is well-born, who is very kind, who has many children,

original: tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana ////
analyzed: tasyai viś patnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana
translated: To that lady of the clan, to Sinivali, offer the oblation.

original: yā viśpatnīndram asi pratīcī sahasrastukābhiyantī devī /
analyzed: yā viśpatnī indram asi pratīcī sahasra stukā abhiyantī devī
translated: O lady of the clan, you are Indra's western companion, a goddess who drives a thousand chariots.

original: viṣṇoḥ patni tubhyaṃ rātā havīṃṣi patiṃ devi rādhase codayasva ////
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ patni tubhyam rātā havīṃṣi patim devi rādhase codayasva
translated: O wife of Vishnu, oblations are offered to you. O goddess, urge your husband to bestow gifts.

original: kuhūṃ devīṃ sukṛtaṃ vidmanāpasam asmin yajñe suhavā johavīmi /
analyzed: kuhūm devīm su kṛtam vidmanā apasam asmin yajñe su havā johavīmi
translated: I invoke with this invocation the well-disposed, well-disposed goddess Kuhu, the one who knows, at this sacrifice.

original: sā no rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ ni yachād dadātu vīram śatadāyam ukthyam ////
analyzed: sā naḥ rayim viśva vāram ni yacchāt dadātu vīram śatadāyam ukthyam
translated: May she bestow upon us wealth with every boon, and give us a son to be praised, lasting a hundred winters.

original: kuhūr devānām amṛtasya patnī havyā no asya haviṣo juṣeta /
analyzed: kuhūḥ devānām amṛtasya patnī havyā naḥ asya haviṣaḥ juṣeta
translated: Kuhu, the wife of the immortal gods, may she accept our offering of this oblation.

original: śṛnotu yajñam uśatī no adya rāyas poṣaṃ cikituṣī dadhātu ////
analyzed: śṛnotu yajñam uśatī naḥ adya rāyaḥ poṣam cikituṣī dadhātu
translated: May she, eager for sacrifice, hear our sacrifice today, and may she, the wise one, bestow increase of wealth.

original: rākām ahaṃ suhavā suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā /
analyzed: rākām aham su havā suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā
translated: I invoke with good praise the very approachable Raka. May the fortunate one listen to us and be aware of herself.

original: sīvyatv apaḥ sūcyāchidyamānayā dadātu vīraṃ śatadāyam ukthyam ////
analyzed: sīvyatu apaḥ sūcyā a chidyamānayā dadātu vīram śatadāyam ukthyam
translated: May she sew the waters with a needle that is not cut. May she give a son to be praised, lasting a hundred winters.

original: yās te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśaso yābhir dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni /
analyzed: yāḥ te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśasaḥ yābhiḥ dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni
translated: O Raka, your very good-natured and beautiful thoughts, by which you give wealth to the worshipper,

original: tābhir no adya sumanā upāgahi sahasrāpoṣam subhage rarāṇā ////🔽devānāṃ patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye /
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ adya sumanāḥ upāgahi sahasrāpoṣam subhage rarāṇā  devānām patnīḥ uśatīḥ avantu naḥ prāvantu naḥ tujaye vājasātaye
translated: with those, being well-disposed towards us today, come to us, O fortunate one, bestowing a thousandfold increase.🔽May the eager wives of the gods protect us, may they favor us for victory and gaining strength,

original: yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yachantu ////
analyzed: yāḥ pārthivāsaḥ yāḥ apām api vrate tāḥ naḥ devīḥ su havāḥ śarma yacchantu
translated: the ones who are on earth and the ones who are in the abode of the waters. May those goddesses, who are very approachable, grant us protection.

original: uta gnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy agnāyy aśvinī rāṭ /
analyzed: uta gnāḥ vyantu deva patnīḥ indrāṇī agnāyī aśvinī rāj
translated: And may the wives of the gods, the Gnas, be favorable: Indrani, Agnari, Asvini the queen,

original: ā rodasī varunānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīr ya ṛtur janīnām ////
analyzed: ā rodasī varunānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīḥ yaḥ ṛtuḥ janīnām
translated: may the two heavens and earth listen, and may the goddess Varuani, the one who is in the season of the women, be favorable.

original: yathā vṛkṣam aśanir viśvāhā hanty aprati /
analyzed: yathā vṛkṣam aśaniḥ viśvāhā hanti aprati
translated: As the thunderbolt, day after day, smites the tree, irresistible,

original: evāham adya kitavān akṣair badhyāsam aprati ////
analyzed: eva aham adya kitavān akṣaiḥ badhyāsam aprati
translated: Even so will I slay the gamblers today with dice, irresistible.

original: turāṇām aturāṇāṃ viśām avarjuṣīṇām /
analyzed: turāṇām a turāṇām viśām a varjuṣīṇām
translated: Of the victorious and the vanquished, of the people who have done me wrong,

original: samaitu viśvato bhago antarhastaṃ kṛtaṃ mama ////
analyzed: samaitu viśvatas bhagaḥ antar hastam kṛtam mama
translated: May good fortune come to me from all sides, may it be in my hand that which is done.

original: īḍe agniṃ svāvasuṃ namobhir iha prasakto vi cayat kṛtaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: īḍe agnim svāvasum namobhiḥ iha prasaktaḥ vi cayat kṛtam naḥ
translated: I praise Agni, the possessor of good wealth, with salutations, here attached, may he remove what is done for us.

original: rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇaṃ marutāṃ stomam ṛdhyām ////
analyzed: rathaiḥ iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇam marutām stomam ṛdhyām
translated: Like chariots, I carry him who bestows strength, may I accomplish the praise of the Maruts in a clockwise direction.

original: vayaṃ jayema tvayā yujā vṛtam asmākam aṃśam ud ava bharebhare /
analyzed: vayam jayema tvayā yujā vṛtam asmākam aṃśam ud ava bharebhare
translated: May we be victorious, united with you, in every battle, may you bring us our share in every contest.

original: asmabhyam indra varīyaḥ sugaṃ kṛdhi pra śatrūṇāṃ maghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja ////
analyzed: asmabhyam indra varīyaḥ sugam kṛdhi pra śatrūṇām maghavan vṛṣṇyā ruja
translated: O Indra, make an easy path for us, O bountiful one, crush the strength of our enemies.

original: ajaiṣaṃ tvā saṃlikhitam ajaiṣam uta saṃrudham /
analyzed: ajaiṣam tvā saṃlikhitam ajaiṣam uta saṃrudham
translated: I have conquered you when you were united, I have conquered you when you were restrained.

original: aviṃ vṛko yathā mathad evā mathnāmi te kṛtam ////
analyzed: avim vṛkaḥ yathā mathat eva mathnāmi te kṛtam
translated: Just as a wolf crushes a sheep, so I crush your deed.

original: uta prahām atidīvā jayati kṛtam iva śvaghnī vi cinoti kāle /
analyzed: uta prahām atidīvāḥ jayati kṛtam iva śvaghnī vi cinoti kāle
translated: And the one who conquers by overreaching, like a she-wolf tearing apart what is done in time.🔽He who desires the gods, but does not withhold wealth,

original: yo devakāmo na dhanam ruṇaddhi sam it taṃ rāyaḥ sṛjati svadhābhiḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ deva kāmaḥ na dhanam ruṇaddhi sam id tam rāyaḥ sṛjati svadhābhiḥ
translated: Him the Rāyas, by their own powers, set free.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena vā kṣudhaṃ puruhūta viśve /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena vā kṣudham puruhūta viśve
translated: With cows may we pass over evil want, and with barley hunger, O ye All-Gods, O ye invoked of many.

original: vayaṃ rājasu prathamā dhanāny ariṣṭāso vṛjanībhir jayema ////
analyzed: vayam rājasu prathamā dhanāni ariṣṭāsaḥ vṛjanībhiḥ jayema
translated: May we be foremost among kings in winning wealth, and with our bands be ever victorious.

original: kṛtaṃ me dakṣiṇe haste jayo me savya āhitaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtam me dakṣiṇe haste jayaḥ me savye āhitaḥ
translated: Victory is placed in my right hand, and success is laid in my left.

original: gojid bhūyāsam aśvajid dhanaṃjayo hiraṇyajit ////
analyzed: go jit bhūyāsam aśva jit dhanaṃjayaḥ hiraṇya jit
translated: May I win kine, may I win horses, may I win wealth, may I win gold.

original: akṣāḥ phalavatīm dyuvaṃ datta gāṃ kṣīriṇīm iva /
analyzed: akṣāḥ phalavatīm dyuvam datta gām kṣīriṇīm iva
translated: The dice have given me a fruitful heaven, as 'twere a milch cow yielding milk.

original: saṃ mā kṛtasya dhārayā dhanuḥ snāvneva nahyata ////
analyzed: sam mā kṛtasya dhārayā dhanuḥ snāvnā iva nahyata
translated: Bind me with the string of my work, as with a strap the bow.

original: bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghayoḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghayoḥ
translated: May Brhaspati protect us from the rearward, from below and from above, from the sinner.

original: indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyo varīyaḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varīyaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the front and from the centre, as a friend ever grant security to our friends.

original: saṃjñānaṃ naḥ svebhiḥ saṃjñānam araṇebhiḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñānam naḥ svebhiḥ saṃjñānam araṇebhiḥ
translated: May we be united with our own, united with our kinsmen.

original: saṃjñānam aśvinā yuvam ihāsmāsu ni yachatam ////
analyzed: saṃjñānam aśvinā yuvam iha asmāsu ni yacchatam
translated: Ye two, O Asvins, bestow upon us union.

original: saṃ jānāmahai manasā saṃ cikitvā mā yuṣmahi manasā daivyena /
analyzed: sam jānāmahai manasā sam cikitvā mā yuṣmahi manasā daivyena
translated: Let us agree in heart and will, let us not disagree in heart and will of the divine one.

original: mā ghoṣā ut sthur bahule vinirhate meṣuḥ paptad indrasyāhany āgate ////
analyzed: mā ghoṣāḥ ud sthuḥ bahule vinirhate mā iṣuḥ paptat indrasya ahani āgate
translated: Let not the loud voices rise up in many a place, let the ram fall down when Indra's day of slaughter cometh.

original: amutrabhūyād adhi yad yamasya bṛhaspate abhiśaster amuñcaḥ /
analyzed: amutrabhūyāt adhi yat yamasya bṛhaspate abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ
translated: When thou, O Brihaspati, didst deliver from the curse of Yama, him who was here below,

original: praty auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmad devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ ////
analyzed: prati auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmat devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ
translated: The Asvins and the physicians of the gods, O Agni, have removed death from us by their power.

original: saṃ krāmataṃ mā jahītaṃ śarīraṃ prāṇāpānau te sayujāv iha stām /
analyzed: sam krāmatam mā jahītam śarīram prāṇa apānau te sayujau iha stām
translated: Come together, do not abandon this body. Let thy expiration and inspiration be united here.

original: śataṃ jīva śarado vardhamāno 'gniṣ ṭe gopā adhipā vasiṣṭhaḥ ////
analyzed: śatam jīva śaradaḥ vardhamānaḥ gniḥ te gopāḥ adhipāḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Live a hundred winters, increasing in strength. Agni, thy best protector, shall be thy best protector.

original: āyur yat te atihitaṃ parācair apānaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ā tāv itām /
analyzed: āyuḥ yat te atihitam parācais apānaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ā tau itām
translated: The life that was taken away from thee by the far-extending (disease), let expiration and inspiration return to it.

original: agniṣ ṭad āhār nirṛter upasthāt tad ātmani punar ā veśayāmi te ////
analyzed: agniḥ tat āhār nirṛteḥ upasthāt tat ātmani punar ā veśayāmi te
translated: Agni has brought it from the presence of destruction. I place it again in thy body.

original: memaṃ prāṇo hāsīn mo apāno 'vahāya parā gāt /
analyzed: mā imam prāṇaḥ hāsīt mā u apānaḥ vahāya parā gāt
translated: Let not expiration forsake this one, let not inspiration leave him and depart.

original: saptarṣibhya enaṃ pari dadāmi te enaṃ svasti jarase vahantu ////
analyzed: saptarṣibhyaḥ enam pari dadāmi te enam svasti jarase vahantu
translated: I entrust him to the seven Rishis. May they carry him in safety to old age.

original: pra viṣataṃ prāṇāpānāv anaḍvāhāv iva vrajam /
analyzed: pra viṣatam prāṇa apānau anaḍvāhau iva vrajam
translated: Go forth, O expiration and inspiration, like two oxen to the stable.

original: ayaṃ jarimnaḥ śevadhir ariṣṭa iha vardhatām ////
analyzed: ayam jarimnaḥ śevadhiḥ ariṣṭaḥ iha vardhatām
translated: May this one, the abode of old age, increase here without disease.

original: ā te prāṇaṃ suvāmasi parā yakṣmaṃ suvāmi te /
analyzed: ā te prāṇam suvāmasi parā yakṣmam suvāmi te
translated: I send forth thy expiration. I send forth thy inspiration.

original: āyur no viśvato dadhad ayam agnir vareṇyaḥ ////
analyzed: āyuḥ naḥ viśvatas dadhat ayam agniḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: May this Agni, most excellent, bestow life on us from all sides.

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari rohanto nākam uttamam /
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari rohantaḥ nākam uttamam
translated: Rising up from the darkness around, we ascend to the highest vault,

original: devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam ////
analyzed: devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: To the god Sūrya, the light most excellent, we have come to the gods.

original: ṛcaṃ sāma yajāmahe yābhyāṃ karmāṇi kurvate /
analyzed: ṛcam sāma yajāmahe yābhyām karmāṇi kurvate
translated: We worship the Ṛc and Sāman, by which they perform the rites,

original: ete sadasi rājato yajñaṃ deveṣu yachataḥ ////
analyzed: ete sadasi rājataḥ yajñam deveṣu yacchataḥ
translated: These two in the seat of the king offer the sacrifice to the gods.

original: ṛcaṃ sāma yad aprākṣaṃ havir ojo yajur balam /
analyzed: ṛcam sāma yat aprākṣam haviḥ ojaḥ yajuḥ balam
translated: The Ṛc, Sāman, which I have asked about, the oblation, strength, Yajuṣ, power,

original: eṣa mā tasmān mā hiṃsīd vedaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ śacīpate ////
analyzed: eṣa mā tasmāt mā hiṃsīt vedaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ śacīpate
translated: May this Veda, O lord of power, when questioned, do me no harm.

original: ye te panthāno 'va divo yebhir viśvam airayaḥ /
analyzed: ye te panthānaḥ vaḥ divaḥ yebhiḥ viśvam airayaḥ
translated: Those paths of yours which are from the sky, by which you lead all things,

original: tebhiḥ sumnayā dhehi no vaso ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ sumnayā dhehi naḥ vaso
translated: By them, O Vasu, grant us happiness.

original: tiraścirājer asitāt pṛdākoḥ pari saṃbhṛtam /
analyzed: tiraścirājeḥ asitāt pṛdākoḥ pari saṃbhṛtam
translated: Gathered from the dark, from the striped, from the sidelong-moving serpent,

original: tat kaṅkaparvaṇo viṣam iyaṃ vīrud anīnaśat ////
analyzed: tat kaṅkaparvaṇaḥ viṣam iyam vīrudh anīnaśat
translated: This plant has destroyed the poison of the one with the neck of a heron.

original: iyaṃ vīrun madhujātā madhuścun madhulā madhūḥ /
analyzed: iyam vīrudh madhu jātā madhuścut madhulā madhūḥ
translated: This plant, born of honey, dripping honey, sweeter than honey, more honeyed than honey,

original: sā vihrutasya bheṣajy atho maśakajambhanī ////
analyzed: sā vihrutasya bheṣajī atha u maśaka jambhanī
translated: Is a remedy for the one who is afflicted, and also destroys the pain of the mosquito.

original: yato daṣṭaṃ yato dhītaṃ tatas te nir hvayāmasi /
analyzed: yatas daṣṭam yatas dhītam tatas te niḥ hvayāmasi
translated: From wherever you were bitten, from wherever you were stung, from there

original: arbhasya tṛpradaṃśino maśakasyārasaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: arbhasya tṛ pradaṃśinaḥ maśakasya arasam viṣam
translated: We drive out your poison, of the young one with three fangs, of the mosquito, of the one with no poison.

original: ayaṃ yo vakro viparur vyaṅgo mukhāni vakrā vṛjinā kṛṇoṣi /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ vakraḥ viparuḥ vyaṅgaḥ mukhāni vakrā vṛjinā kṛṇoṣi
translated: You who are crooked, twisted, crippled, who make faces crooked and twisted,

original: tāni tvaṃ brahmaṇas pate iṣīkām iva saṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: tāni tvam brahmaṇaḥ pate iṣīkām iva sam namaḥ
translated: You, O Lord of prayer, bend them like a reed.

original: arasasya śarkoṭasya nīcīnasyopasarpataḥ /
analyzed: a rasasya śarkoṭasya nīcīnasya upasarpataḥ
translated: Of the tasteless, the maggot, the low-crawling one that approaches,

original: viṣaṃ hy asyādiṣy atho enam ajījabham ////
analyzed: viṣam hi asya adiṣi atha u enam ajījabham
translated: His poison is indeed here, then he has overcome it.

original: na te bāhvor balam asti na śīrṣe nota madhyataḥ /
analyzed: na te bāhvoḥ balam asti na śīrṣe na uta madhyataḥ
translated: You have no strength in your arms, in your head, nor in your middle.

original: atha kiṃ pāpayā 'muyā puche bibharṣy arbhakam ////
analyzed: atha kim pāpayā muyā puche bibharṣi arbhakam
translated: Then what is the use of this wicked tail, O child, that you carry?

original: adanti tvā pipīlikā vi vṛścanti mayūryaḥ /
analyzed: adanti tvā pipīlikāḥ vi vṛścanti mayūryaḥ
translated: Ants eat you, sparrows tear you apart.

original: sarve bhala bravātha śārkoṭam arasaṃ viṣam ////
analyzed: sarve bhala bravātha śārkoṭam a rasam viṣam
translated: All of you, speak well of the maggot, the tasteless poison.

original: ya ubhābhyāṃ praharasi puchena cāsyena ca /
analyzed: yaḥ ubhābhyām praharasi puchena ca āsyena ca
translated: He who strikes with both, with his tail and with his mouth,

original: āsye na te viṣaṃ kim u te puchadhāv asat ////
analyzed: āsye na te viṣam kim u te puchadhau asat
translated: Why is there no poison in your mouth, is there poison in your tail?

original: yad āśasā vadato me vicukṣubhe yad yācamānasya carato janāṃ anu /
analyzed: yat āśasā vadataḥ me vicukṣubhe yat yācamānasya carataḥ janān anu
translated: If my mouth quivers when I speak with desire, if I am agitated when begging and wandering among people,

original: yad ātmani tanvo me viriṣṭaṃ sarasvatī tad ā pṛṇad ghṛtena ////
analyzed: yat ātmani tanvaḥ me viriṣṭam sarasvatī tat ā pṛṇat ghṛtena
translated: If anything is disordered in my body, may Sarasvatī fill it with ghee.

original: sapta kṣaranti siśave marutvate pitre putrāso apy avīvṛtann ṛtāni /
analyzed: sapta kṣaranti siśave marutvate pitre putrāsaḥ api avīvṛtan ṛtāni
translated: The seven flow to the young one accompanied by Maruts, the sons have turned to the father's truths.

original: ubhe id asyobhe asya rājata ubhe yatete ubhe asya puṣyataḥ ////
analyzed: ubhe id asya ubhe asya rājataḥ ubhe yatete ubhe asya puṣyataḥ
translated: Both of these are his, both of these are his king, both of these are engaged, both of these are his nourishment.

original: indrāvaruṇā sutapāv imaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ pibataṃ madyaṃ dhṛtavratau /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā suta pau imam sutam somam pibatam madyam dhṛtavratau
translated: Indra and Varuna, you who purify the Soma, drink this pressed Soma, the intoxicating drink, you who are firm in your vows.

original: yuvo ratho adhvaro devavītaye prati svasaram upa yātu pītaye ////
analyzed: yuvoḥ rathaḥ adhvaraḥ deva vītaye prati svasaram upa yātu pītaye
translated: Your chariot, O gods, is the sacrificial session. May it come to your own home to drink.

original: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām /
analyzed: indrāvaruṇāḥ madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
translated: O Indra and Varuna, you who are powerful, enjoy the most sweet and strong Soma, O powerful ones.

original: idaṃ vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām ////
analyzed: idam vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayethām
translated: This Soma has been pressed for you two. Sit on this sacrificial grass and rejoice.

original: yo naḥ śapād aśapataḥ śapato yaś ca naḥ śapāt /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ śapāt a śapataḥ śapataḥ yaḥ ca naḥ śapāt
translated: He who curses us when we do not curse, and he who curses us when we do curse,

original: vṛkṣa iva vidyutā hata ā mūlād anu śuṣyatu ////
analyzed: vṛkṣaḥ iva vidyutā hataḥ ā mūlāt anu śuṣyatu
translated: Like a tree struck by lightning, may he wither away from the root.

original: ūrjaṃ bibhrad vasuvaniḥ sumedhā aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa /
analyzed: ūrjam bibhrat vasu vaniḥ sumedhāḥ aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa
translated: Bearing strength, finding wealth, of good thoughts, with a harmless, friendly eye,

original: gṛhān aimi sumanā vandamāno ramadhvam mā bibhīta mat ////
analyzed: gṛhān aimi sumanāḥ vandamānaḥ ramadhvam mā bibhīta mat
translated: I come to the houses, well-disposed, paying homage. Rejoice, do not be afraid of me.

original: ime gṛhā mayobhuva ūrjasvantaḥ payasvantaḥ /
analyzed: ime gṛhāḥ mayobhuvaḥ ūrjasvantaḥ payasvantaḥ
translated: These houses are full of joy, full of strength, full of milk.

original: pūrṇā vāmena tiṣṭhantas te no jānantv āyataḥ ////
analyzed: pūrṇāḥ vāmena tiṣṭhantaḥ te naḥ jānantu āyataḥ
translated: Filled with good things, may they know us as we go our way.

original: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanaso bahuḥ /
analyzed: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanasaḥ bahuḥ
translated: In which he goes when away, in which there is much joy,

original: gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te no jānantv āyataḥ ////
analyzed: gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te naḥ jānantu āyataḥ
translated: We invoke the houses. May they know us as we go our way.

original: upahūtā bhūridhanāḥ sakhāyaḥ svādusaṃmudaḥ /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ bhūri dhanāḥ sakhāyaḥ svādu saṃmudaḥ
translated: The friends who are invoked, possessing much wealth, who have sweet communion,

original: akṣudhyā atṛṣyā sta gṛhā māsmad bibhītana ////
analyzed: akṣudhyāḥ atṛṣyāḥ sta gṛhāḥ mā asmat bibhītana
translated: Do not be afraid of us, O house, of hunger and thirst.

original: upahūtā iha gāva upahūtā ajāvayaḥ /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ iha gāvaḥ upahūtāḥ aja avayaḥ
translated: The cows are invited here, the goats and sheep are invited.

original: atho annasya kīlāla upahūto gṛheṣu ////
analyzed: atha u annasya kīlālaḥ upahūtaḥ gṛheṣu
translated: And the essence of food is invited in the houses.

original: sūnṛtāvantaḥ subhagā irāvanto hasāmudāḥ /
analyzed: sūnṛtāvantaḥ subhagāḥ irāvantaḥ hasāmudāḥ
translated: Full of joy, auspicious, full of food, laughing,

original: atṛṣyā akṣudhyā sta gṛhā māsmad bibhītana ////
analyzed: atṛṣyāḥ akṣudhyāḥ sta gṛhāḥ mā asmat bibhītana
translated: Do not be afraid of us, O house, of hunger and thirst.

original: ihaiva sta mānu gāta viśvā rūpāṇi puṣyata /
analyzed: iha eva sta mā anu gāta viśvā rūpāṇi puṣyata
translated: Stay here alone, O house, nourish all forms.

original: aiṣyāmi bhadreṇā saha bhūyāṃso bhavatā mayā ////
analyzed: aiṣyāmi bhadreṇa saha bhūyāṃsaḥ bhavata mayā
translated: I will come with good fortune, may we be more prosperous than you.

original: yad agne tapasā tapa upatapyāmahe tapaḥ /
analyzed: yat agne tapasā tapaḥ upatapyāmahe tapaḥ
translated: O Agni, when we torment ourselves with austerity, tormenting ourselves with austerity,

original: priyāḥ śrutasya bhūyāsmāyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ ////
analyzed: priyāḥ śrutasya bhūyāsma āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ
translated: May we be dear to the heard, long-lived, and wise.

original: agne tapas tapyāmaha upa tapyāmahe tapaḥ /
analyzed: agne tapaḥ tapyāmahe upa tapyāmahe tapaḥ
translated: O Agni, we torment ourselves with austerity, we torment ourselves with austerity.

original: śrutāni śṛṇvantaḥ vayam āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ ////
analyzed: śrutāni śṛṇvantaḥ vayam āyuṣmantaḥ sumedhasaḥ
translated: Listening to the heard, we are long-lived and wise.

original: ayam agniḥ satpatir vṛddhavṛṣṇo rathīva pattīn ajayat purohitaḥ /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ sat patiḥ vṛddha vṛṣṇaḥ rathī iva pattīn ajayat purohitaḥ
translated: This Agni, the lord of the good, the powerful, like a charioteer, has conquered the foot soldiers as the priest.

original: nābhā pṛthivyāṃ nihito davidyutad adhaspadaṃ kṛṇutāṃ ye pṛtanyavaḥ ////
analyzed: nābhā pṛthivyām nihitaḥ davidyutat adhaspadam kṛṇutām ye pṛtanyavaḥ
translated: Placed in the middle of the earth, he shines forth. He makes those who are hostile to us inferior.

original: pṛtanājitaṃ sahamānam agnim ukthyair havāmahe paramāt sadhasthāt /
analyzed: pṛtanā jitam sahamānam agnim ukthyaiḥ havāmahe paramāt sadhasthāt
translated: We invoke Agni, the conqueror of armies, the victorious, with hymns from the highest abode.

original: sa naḥ parṣad ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmad devo 'ti duritāny agniḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣat ati durgāṇi viśvā kṣāmat devaḥ u ti duritāni agniḥ
translated: May he lead us beyond all difficulties, may the god Agni, may the god lead us beyond all misfortunes.

original: idaṃ yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakunir abhiniṣpatann apīpatat /
analyzed: idam yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ abhiniṣpatan apīpatat
translated: This when the black bird flew down and fell,

original: āpo mā tasmāt sarvasmād duritāt pāntv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ mā tasmāt sarvasmāt duritāt pāntu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May the waters protect me from all that evil, from distress.

original: idaṃ yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakunir avāmṛkṣan nirṛte te mukhena /
analyzed: idam yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakuniḥ avāmṛkṣat nirṛte te mukhena
translated: This when the black bird touched with its mouth, O Nirriti,

original: agnir mā tasmād enaso gārhapatyaḥ pra muñcatu ////
analyzed: agniḥ mā tasmāt enasaḥ gārhapatyaḥ pra muñcatu
translated: May Agni, the domestic fire, deliver me from that sin.

original: pratīcīnaphalo hi tvam apāmārga rurohitha /
analyzed: pratīcīna phalaḥ hi tvam apāmārga rurohitha
translated: For you, O Apamarga, have grown with fruit turned towards the west.

original: sarvān mac chapathām adhi varīyo yavayā itaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvān mat śapathām adhi varīyaḥ yavaya itas
translated: From all the curses that are on me, carry me away to a better place.

original: yad duṣkṛtaṃ yac chamalaṃ yad vā cerima pāpayā /
analyzed: yat duṣkṛtam yat śamalam yat vā cerima pāpayā
translated: Whatever evil we have done, whatever impurity, or if we have done anything wicked,

original: tvayā tad viśvatomukhāpāmārgāpa mṛjmahe ////
analyzed: tvayā tat viśvatomukha apāmārga apa mṛjmahe
translated: With you, O Apamarga, with a face in every direction, we purify ourselves from all that.

original: śyāvadatā kunakhinā baṇḍena yat sahāsima /
analyzed: śyāva datā kunakhinā baṇḍena yat saha āsima
translated: If we have laughed with a dark-toothed, deformed, or impotent person,

original: apāmārga tvayā vayaṃ sarvaṃ tad apa mṛjmahe ////
analyzed: apāmārga tvayā vayam sarvam tat apa mṛjmahe
translated: With you, O Apamarga, we purify ourselves from all that.

original: yady antarikṣe yadi vāta āsa yadi vṛkṣeṣu yadi volapeṣu /
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vāte āsa yadi vṛkṣeṣu yadi vā ulapeṣu
translated: If it is in the atmosphere, or in the wind, or in the trees, or in the bushes,

original: yad aśravan paśava udyamānaṃ tad brāhmaṇaṃ punar asmān upaitu ////
analyzed: yat aśravan paśavaḥ udyamānam tat brāhmaṇam punar asmān upaitu
translated: If the animals have heard it being raised, may that Brahmana come back to us again.

original: punar maitv indriyaṃ punar ātmā draviṇaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: punar mā aitu indriyam punar ātmā draviṇam brāhmaṇam ca
translated: Let the vital power return, let the soul return, let the wealth and the Brāhmaṇa return.

original: punar agnayo dhiṣṇyā yathāsthāma kalpayantām ihaiva ////
analyzed: punar agnayaḥ dhiṣṇyāḥ yathāsthāma kalpayantām iha eva
translated: Let the sacred fires be re-established in their proper places here itself.

original: sarasvati vrateṣu te divyeṣu devi dhāmasu /
analyzed: sarasvati vrateṣu te divyeṣu devi dhāmasu
translated: O Sarasvatī, in your divine observances and abodes, O goddess,

original: juṣasva havyam āhutaṃ prajām devi rarāsva naḥ ////
analyzed: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi rarāsva naḥ
translated: Accept the offered oblation, and grant us offspring, O goddess.

original: idaṃ te havyaṃ ghṛtavat sarasvatīdaṃ pitṝṇāṃ havir āsyaṃ yat /
analyzed: idam te havyam ghṛtavat sarasvati idam pitṝṇām haviḥ āsyam yat
translated: This oblation of yours, O Sarasvatī, is full of ghee. This is the mouth of the ancestors' oblation.

original: imāni ta uditā śamtamāni tebhir vayaṃ madhumantaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: imāni te uditā śamtamāni tebhiḥ vayam madhumantaḥ syāma
translated: These are your most peaceful offerings. By them may we be full of sweetness.

original: śivā naḥ śaṃtamā bhava sumṛḍīkā sarasvati /
analyzed: śivā naḥ śaṃtamā bhava su mṛḍīkā sarasvati
translated: Be auspicious and most peaceful to us, O Sarasvatī, be very gracious.

original: mā te yuyoma saṃdṛśaḥ ////🔽śaṃ no vāto vātu śaṃ nas tapatu sūryaḥ /
analyzed: mā te yuyoma saṃdṛśaḥ  śam naḥ vātaḥ vātu śam naḥ tapatu sūryaḥ
translated: May we not be deprived of your sight.🔽May the wind blow auspiciously for us. May the sun shine auspiciously for us.

original: ahāni śaṃ bhavantu naḥ śaṃ rātrī prati dhīyatāṃ /
analyzed: ahāni śam bhavantu naḥ śam rātrī prati dhīyatām
translated: May the days be auspicious for us. May the night be well-disposed towards us.

original: śaṃ uṣā no vy uchatu ////
analyzed: śam uṣāḥ naḥ vi uchatu
translated: May the dawn shine auspiciously for us.

original: yat kiṃ cāsau manasā yac ca vācā yajñair juhoti haviṣā yajuṣā /
analyzed: yat kim ca asau manasā yat ca vācā yajñaiḥ juhoti haviṣā yajuṣā
translated: Whatever he offers in his mind, in speech, with sacrifices, with oblations, with Yajus formulas,

original: tan mṛtyunā nirṛtiḥ saṃvidānā purā satyād āhutiṃ hantv asya ////
analyzed: tat mṛtyunā nirṛtiḥ saṃvidānā purā satyāt āhutim hantu asya
translated: May Death, in agreement with Nirṛti, destroy his offering before it becomes true.

original: yātudhānā nirṛtir ād u rakṣas te asya ghnantv anṛtena satyam /
analyzed: yātudhānāḥ nirṛtiḥ āt u rakṣaḥ te asya ghnantu anṛtena satyam
translated: May the demons, Nirṛti, and the Rākṣasas destroy his truth with untruth.

original: indreṣitā devā ājam asya mathnantu mā tat saṃ pādi yad asau juhoti ////
analyzed: indra iṣitāḥ devāḥ ājam asya mathnantu mā tat sam pādi yat asau juhoti
translated: Let the gods, urged on by Indra, crush his goat; let not that be accomplished which he offers.

original: ajirādhirājau śyenau saṃpātināv iva /🔽ājyaṃ pṛtanyato hatāṃ yo naḥ kaścābhyaghāyati ////
analyzed: ajira adhirājau śyenau saṃpātinau iva  ājyam pṛtanyataḥ hatām yaḥ naḥ kaḥ ca abhyaghāyati
translated: The two swift ones, the two kings, the two hawks that fly together,🔽The two that are hostile to the goat, have struck it down, whoever injures us.

original: apāñcau ta ubhau bāhū api nahyāmy āsyam /
analyzed: apāñcau te ubhau bāhū api nahyāmi āsyam
translated: I bind fast your two arms, I bind fast your mouth,

original: agner devasya manyunā tena te 'vadhiṣaṃ haviḥ ////
analyzed: agneḥ devasya manyunā tena te vadhiṣam haviḥ
translated: With the wrath of the god Agni, with that I crush your offering.

original: api nahyāmi te bāhū api nahyāmy āsyam /🔽agner ghorasya manyunā tena 'vadhiṣaṃ haviḥ ////
analyzed: api nahyāmi te bāhū api nahyāmi āsyam  agneḥ ghorasya manyunā tena vadhiṣam haviḥ
translated: I bind fast your arms, I bind fast your mouth,🔽With the terrible wrath of Agni, with that I crush your offering.

original: pari tvāgne puraṃ vayaṃ vipraṃ sahasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi
translated: We will think upon Agni, the sage, the conqueror, as a fort,

original: dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ divedive hantāraṃ bhaṅgurāvataḥ ////
analyzed: dhṛṣat varṇam dive dive hantāram bhaṅgurāvataḥ
translated: The one of fiery colour, day by day, the destroyer of the unsteady.

original: ut tiṣṭhatāva paśyatendrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata ava paśyata indrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam
translated: Rise up and look upon Indra's proper share;

original: yadi śrātam juhotana yady aśrātaṃ mamattana ////
analyzed: yadi śrātam juhotana yadi a śrātam mamattana
translated: If it is cooked, offer it; if it is not cooked, rejoice in it.

original: śrātam havir o ṣv indra pra yāhi jagāma sūro adhvano vi madhyam /
analyzed: śrātam haviḥ ā u su indra pra yāhi jagāma sūraḥ adhvanaḥ vi madhyam
translated: The cooked oblation, O Indra, come forward; the sun has gone to the middle of the path.

original: pari tvāsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapā na vrājapatim carantam ////
analyzed: pari tvā āsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapāḥ na vrājapatim carantam
translated: Your friends sit around you with their treasures, like herdsmen around the lord of the pasture who moves.

original: śrātaṃ manya ūdhani śrātam agnau suśṛtaṃ manye tad ṛtaṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: śrātam manye ūdhani śrātam agnau su śṛtam manye tat ṛtam navīyaḥ
translated: Cooked on the udder, cooked in the fire, I think that well-cooked, that truth is ever new.

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ pibendra vajrin purukṛj juṣāṇaḥ ////
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ piba indra vajrin puru kṛt juṣāṇaḥ
translated: Drink, O Indra, the curds of the midday pressing, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O bountiful one, rejoicing.

original: samiddho agnir vṛṣaṇā rathī divas tapto gharmo duhyate vām iṣe madhu /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ vṛṣaṇā rathī divaḥ taptaḥ gharmaḥ duhyate vām iṣe madhu
translated: The fire is kindled, O bulls, the chariot of heaven, the heated caldron is milked for you for food and honey.

original: vayaṃ hi vāṃ purudamāso aśvinā havāmahe sadhamādeṣu kāravaḥ ////
analyzed: vayam hi vām puru damāsaḥ aśvinā havāmahe sadhamādeṣu kāravaḥ
translated: For we, O Aśvins, the Purudamas, the singers, invoke you at the feasts of the righteous.

original: samiddho agnir aśvinā tapto vāṃ gharma ā gatam /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ aśvinā taptaḥ vām gharmaḥ ā gatam
translated: The fire is kindled, O Aśvins, the heated caldron invites you.

original: duhyante nūnaṃ vṛṣaṇeha dhenavo dasrā madanti vedhasaḥ ////
analyzed: duhyante nūnam vṛṣaṇā iha dhenavaḥ dasrā madanti vedhasaḥ
translated: The milch-cows are now being milked for you, O bulls, the wondrous ones rejoice, the creators.

original: ivāhākṛtaḥ śucir deveṣu yajño yo aśvinoś camaso devapānaḥ /
analyzed: iva aha akṛtaḥ śuciḥ deveṣu yajñaḥ yaḥ aśvinoḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ
translated: The sacrifice to the Aśvins, unerring, pure among the gods, the caldron of the Aśvins, the drink of the gods,

original: tam u viśve amṛtāso juṣāṇā gandharvasya praty āsnā rihanti ////
analyzed: tam u viśve amṛtāsaḥ juṣāṇāḥ gandharvasya prati āsnā rihanti
translated: That, being accepted by all the immortal ones, they kiss in return for the Gandharva's embrace.

original: yad usriyāsv āhutaṃ ghṛtaṃ payo 'yaṃ sa vām aśvinā bhāga ā gatam /
analyzed: yat usriyāsu āhutam ghṛtam payaḥ yam sa vām aśvinā bhāgaḥ ā gatam
translated: The ghee and milk that is offered to the cows, this is your share, O Aśvins, come to it.

original: mādhvī dhartārā vidathasya satpatī taptaṃ gharmaṃ pibatam divaḥ ////
analyzed: mādhvī dhartārā vidathasya sat patī taptam gharmam pibatam divaḥ
translated: The sweet-natured ones, the supporters, the lords of the assembly, drink the heated caldron of heaven.

original: tapto vāṃ gharmo nakṣatu svahotā pra vām adhvaryuś caratu payasvān /🔽madhor dugdhasyāśvinā tanāyā vītaṃ pātaṃ payasa usriyāyāḥ ////
analyzed: taptaḥ vām gharmaḥ nakṣatu sva hotā pra vām adhvaryuḥ caratu payasvān  madhoḥ dugdhasya aśvinā tanāyāḥ vītam pātam payasaḥ usriyāyāḥ
translated: Let your heated caldron be fulfilled, O ye two, let your own priest move, let your Adhvaryu move, full of sap.🔽Drink of the milk of the cow, O ye two Asvins, of the milk of the cow, of the milk of the cow.

original: upa drava payasā godhug oṣam ā gharme siñca paya usriyāyāḥ /
analyzed: upa drava payasā go duh oṣam ā gharme siñca payaḥ usriyāyāḥ
translated: Come, O milker, with the milk of the milch cow, pour the milk of the cow into the hot caldron.

original: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nuprayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati ////🔽upa hvaye sudughāṃ dhenum etāṃ suhasto godhug uta dohad enām /
analyzed: vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ nu prayāṇam uṣasaḥ vi rājati  upa hvaye su dughām dhenum etām su hastaḥ go duh uta dohat enām
translated: Savitar, the most adorable, has disclosed the vault, he shines forth in the onward course of the dawns.🔽I invoke this well-milking cow, let the skilful milker milk her well.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ savaṃ savitā sāviṣan no 'bhīddho gharmas tad u ṣu pra vocat ////
analyzed: śreṣṭham savam savitā sāviṣat naḥ bhīddhaḥ gharmaḥ tat u su pra vocat
translated: Savitar has caused her to yield the best milk for us; the hot caldron has boiled, that too he has declared.

original: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasupatnī vasūnāṃ vatsam ichantī manasā nyāgan /
analyzed: hiṅkṛṇvatī vasu patnī vasūnām vatsam icchantī manasā nyāgan
translated: The one who makes the sound, the wife of the treasures, desiring the calf, has come with her mind.

original: duhām aśvibhyāṃ payo aghnyeyaṃ sā vardhatāṃ mahate saubhagāya ////🔽juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṃ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān /
analyzed: duhām aśvibhyām payaḥ aghnyā iyam sā vardhatām mahate saubhagāya  juṣṭaḥ damūnāḥ atithiḥ duroṇe imam naḥ yajñam upa yāhi vidvān
translated: This cow yields milk for the two Asvins; may she increase for great good fortune.🔽O Agni, the beloved, the dwelling guest, come to this our sacrifice, knowing it well.

original: viśvā agne abhiyujo vihatya śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni ////
analyzed: viśvāḥ agne abhiyujaḥ vihatya śatrūyatām ā bhara bhojanāni
translated: Having destroyed all hostilities, O Agni, bring us the means of sustenance from the enemies.

original: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu /
analyzed: agne śardha mahate saubhagāya tava dyumnāni uttamāni santu
translated: O Agni, strive for great good fortune; let thy glories be the highest.

original: saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṃsi ////
analyzed: sam jāspatyam suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭha mahāṃsi
translated: Make easy for us to win the lordship of our home, and overcome the mighty works of those who hate us.

original: sūyavasād bhagavatī hi bhūyā adhā vayaṃ bhagavantaḥ syāma /
analyzed: sūyavasāt bhagavatī hi bhūyāḥ adha vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma
translated: Be thou, O Bhaga, the bestower of good pasture, and may we also be possessors of Bhaga.

original: addhi tṛṇam aghnye viśvadānīṃ piba śuddham udakam ācarantī ////
analyzed: addhi tṛṇam aghnye viśvadānīm piba śuddham udakam ācarantī
translated: Eat grass, O milch-cow, at all seasons, and drink pure water as thou passest along.

original: apacitāṃ lohinīnāṃ kṛṣṇā māteti śuśruma /
analyzed: apacitām lohinīnām kṛṣṇā mātā iti śuśruma
translated: We have heard that the raw, the red, and the black are the mothers of the (evil) spirits.

original: muner devasya mūlena sarvā vidhyāmi tā aham ////
analyzed: muneḥ devasya mūlena sarvāḥ vidhyāmi tāḥ aham
translated: With the root of the sage's plant I pierce them all.

original: vidhyāmy āsāṃ prathamāṃ vidhyāmi uta madhyamām /
analyzed: vidhyāmi āsām prathamām vidhyāmi uta madhyamām
translated: I pierce the first of these, I pierce also the middle one,

original: idaṃ jaghanyām āsām ā chinadmi stukām iva ////
analyzed: idam jaghanyām āsām ā chinadmi stukām iva
translated: I cut off the last of these as one cuts off a clod of earth.

original: tvāṣṭreṇāhaṃ vacasā vi ta īrṣyām amīmadam /
analyzed: tvāṣṭreṇa aham vacasā vi te īrṣyām amīmadam
translated: With Tvashtar's word I have dispelled thy jealousy,

original: atho yo manyuṣ ṭe pate tam u te śamayāmasi ////🔽vratena tvaṃ vratapate samakto viśvāhā sumanā dīdihīha /
analyzed: atha u yaḥ manyuḥ te pate tam u te śamayāmasi  vratena tvam vrata pate samaktaḥ viśvāhā sumanāḥ dīdihi iha
translated: And the wrath that is in thee, O lord, that also we appease.🔽By the vow, O lord of vows, art thou bound, be thou well-disposed to all men here, and shine.

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ jātavedaḥ samiddhaṃ prajāvanta upa sadema sarve ////
analyzed: tam tvā vayam jātavedaḥ samiddham prajāvantaḥ upa sadema sarve
translated: To thee, O all-knowing one, kindled, may we all come with offspring.

original: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇe pibantīḥ /
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ sūyavase ruśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ
translated: The tawny ones, rich in corn, with offspring, drinking pure water at a good drinking-place,

original: mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo rudrasya hetir vṛṇaktu ////
analyzed: mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu
translated: Let not the thief rule over you, nor the slanderer. May the dart of Rudra avoid you all.

original: padajñā stha ramatayaḥ saṃhitā viśvanāmnīḥ /
analyzed: pada jñāḥ stha ramatayaḥ saṃhitāḥ viśva nāmnīḥ
translated: You are the knowers of the foot, the delights, the collections, all-named.

original: upa mā devīr devebhir eta /
analyzed: upa mā devīḥ devebhiḥ eta
translated: Come to me, O goddesses, with the gods.

original: imaṃ goṣṭham idaṃ sado ghṛtenāsmānt sam ukṣata ////🔽ā susrasaḥ susraso asatībhyo asattarāḥ /🔽sehor arasatarā havaṇād vikledīyasīḥ ////
analyzed: imam goṣṭham idam sadaḥ ghṛtena asmān sam ukṣata  ā susrasaḥ susrasaḥ asatībhyaḥ asattarāḥ  sehoḥ a rasatarāḥ havaṇāt vikledīyasīḥ
translated: Anoint us with ghee in this cowpen, this assembly.🔽Flow, O Susrasa, flow, more inauspicious than the inauspicious.🔽More tasteless than the tasteless, more melting than the melting.

original: yā graivyā apacito 'tho yā upapakṣyāḥ /🔽vijāmni yā apacitaḥ svayaṃsrasaḥ ////
analyzed: yāḥ graivyāḥ apacitaḥ yāḥ upapakṣyāḥ  vijāmni yāḥ apacitaḥ svayaṃsrasaḥ
translated: Those which are on the neck, emaciated, and those which are on the wings,🔽Those which are on the body, emaciated, flow by themselves.

original: yaḥ kīkasāḥ praśṛṇāti talīdyam avatiṣṭhati /
analyzed: yaḥ kīkasāḥ praśṛṇāti talīdyam avatiṣṭhati
translated: He who breaks the ribs, who stands supporting the joints,

original: nir hās taṃ sarvaṃ jāyānyam yaḥ kaś ca kakudi śritaḥ ////
analyzed: niḥ ha āḥ tam sarvam jāyānyam yaḥ kaḥ ca kakudi śritaḥ
translated: All that is alien to the wife, whatever is on the top.

original: pakṣī jāyānyaḥ patati sa ā viśati pūruṣam /
analyzed: pakṣī jāyānyaḥ patati saḥ ā viśati pūruṣam
translated: The alien bird flies and enters the man.

original: tad akṣitasya bheṣajam ubhayoḥ sukṣatasya ca ////
analyzed: tat akṣitasya bheṣajam ubhayoḥ su kṣatasya ca
translated: That is the remedy for the unwounded, for both the slightly and the severely wounded.

original: vidma vai te jāyānya jānaṃ yato jāyānya jāyase /
analyzed: vidma vai te jāyānya jānam yatas jāyānya jāyase
translated: We know your alien wife, O alien, from where you are born as an alien wife.

original: kathaṃ ha tatra tvam hano yasya kṛṇmo havir gṛhe ////
analyzed: katham ha tatra tvam hanaḥ yasya kṛṇmaḥ haviḥ gṛhe
translated: How then do you harm there, in whose house we make an offering?

original: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām /
analyzed: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtra hā śūra samare vasūnām
translated: Boldly drink the Soma in the pot, O Indra, slayer of Vrtra, O hero, in battle for treasures.

original: mādhyandine savana ā vṛṣasva rayiṣṭhāno rayim asmāsu dhehi ////
analyzed: mādhyandine savane ā vṛṣasva rayiṣṭhānaḥ rayim asmāsu dhehi
translated: At the midday pressing, be strong, O thou who art richest in wealth: bestow wealth upon us.

original: sāṃtapanā idaṃ havir marutas taj jujuṣṭana /
analyzed: sāṃtapanāḥ idam haviḥ marutaḥ tat jujuṣṭana
translated: O Sāntapanas, O Maruts, accept this oblation.

original: asmākotī riśādasaḥ ////
analyzed: asmākā ūtī riśādasaḥ
translated: Ours be ye, O ye destroyers of the foe.

original: yo no marto maruto durhṛṇāyus tiraś cittāni vasavo jighāṃsati /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ martaḥ marutaḥ durhṛṇāyuḥ tiras cittāni vasavaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: The mortal who is hard of heart against us, O Maruts, O Vasus, who would injure our thoughts,

original: druhaḥ pāśān prati muñcatāṃ sas tapiṣṭhena tapasā hantanā tam ////
analyzed: druhaḥ pāśān prati muñcatām saḥ tapiṣṭhena tapasā hantana tam
translated: Let him be entangled in the noose of the foe: with your most burning heat destroy him.

original: samvatsarīṇā marutaḥ svarkā urukṣayāḥ sagaṇā mānuṣāsaḥ /
analyzed: samvatsarīṇāḥ marutaḥ su arkāḥ uru kṣayāḥ sa gaṇāḥ mānuṣāsaḥ
translated: The Maruts, who dwell for a year, O ye who are to be worshipped, who have wide homes, who are in companies, who are with men,

original: te asmat pāśān pra muñcantv enasas sāṃtapanā matsarā mādayiṣṇavaḥ ////
analyzed: te asmat pāśān pra muñcantu enasaḥ sāṃtapanāḥ matsarāḥ mādayiṣṇavaḥ
