translated: Let them loose the bonds of us from this sin, the Sāntapanas, the envious, who delight in carouse.

original: vi te muñcāmi raśanāṃ vi yoktraṃ vi niyojanam /
analyzed: vi te muñcāmi raśanām vi yoktram vi niyojanam
translated: I loose for thee the rein, the yoke, the fastening.

original: ihaiva tvam ajasra edhy agne ////
analyzed: iha eva tvam ajasraḥ edhi agne
translated: Here only, O ever-present Agni, be thou kindled.

original: asmai kṣatrāṇi dhārayantam agne yunajmi tvā brahmaṇā daivyena /
analyzed: asmai kṣatrāṇi dhārayantam agne yunajmi tvā brahmaṇā daivyena
translated: I yoke thee, O Agni, with the divine Brahman, supporting the powers of this (sacrificer).

original: dīdihy asmabhyaṃ draviṇeha bhadraṃ premaṃ voco havirdām devatāsu ////
analyzed: dīdihi asmabhyam draviṇā iha bhadram pra imam vocaḥ haviḥ dām devatāsu
translated: Shine upon us, bestow wealth upon us here: speak this to the gods, O giver of oblations.

original: yat te devā akṛṇvan bhāgadheyam amāvāsye saṃvasanto mahitvā /
analyzed: yat te devāḥ akṛṇvan bhāgadheyam amāvāsye saṃvasantaḥ mahitvā
translated: That portion which the gods, dwelling together through greatness, have assigned to thee on the new moon day,

original: tenā no yajñaṃ pipṛhi viśvavāre rayiṃ no dhehi subhage suvīram ////
analyzed: tena naḥ yajñam pipṛhi viśva vāre rayim naḥ dhehi subhage su vīram
translated: Therefore, O all-powerful one, fill our sacrifice, O blessed one, grant us wealth with brave sons.

original: aham evāsmy amāvāsyā mām ā vasanti sukṛto mayīme /
analyzed: aham eva asmi amāvāsyā mām ā vasanti su kṛtaḥ mayi ime
translated: I am indeed the new moon. The virtuous ones dwell in me.

original: mayi devā ubhaye sādyāś cendrajyeṣṭhāḥ sam agachanta sarve ////
analyzed: mayi devāḥ ubhaye sādyāḥ ca indra jyeṣṭhāḥ sam agacchanta sarve
translated: In me all the gods, both the Sadhyas and those led by Indra, have come together.

original: āgan rātrī saṅgamanī vasūnām ūrjaṃ puṣṭaṃ vasv āveśayantī /
analyzed: āgan rātrī saṅgamanī vasūnām ūrjam puṣṭam vasū āveśayantī
translated: Night has come, bringing together the treasures, bestowing strength, nourishment, and wealth.

original: amāvāsyāyai haviṣa vidhemorjaṃ duhānā payasā na āgan ////
analyzed: amāvāsyāyai haviṣe vidhema ūrjam duhānā payasā naḥ āgan
translated: Let us offer oblations to the new moon, which has come to us with milk, yielding strength.

original: amāvāsye na tvad etāny anyo viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūr jajāna /
analyzed: amāvāsye na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūḥ jajāna
translated: O New Moon, none other than you has produced all these forms.

original: yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayo rayiṇām ////
analyzed: yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayiṇām
translated: Whatever desires we have in offering to you, may that be ours. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: paurṇamāsī jigāya /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī jigāya
translated: The full moon has conquered.

original: tasyāṃ devaiḥ saṃvasanto mahitvā nākasya pṛṣṭhe sam iṣā madema ////
analyzed: tasyām devaiḥ saṃvasantaḥ mahitvā nākasya pṛṣṭhe sam iṣā madema
translated: Dwelling with the gods in its greatness, may we rejoice in the height of heaven.

original: vṛṣabhaṃ vājinaṃ vayaṃ paurṇamāsaṃ yajāmahe /
analyzed: vṛṣabham vājinam vayam paurṇamāsam yajāmahe
translated: We worship the powerful bull, the full moon.

original: sa no dadātv akṣitāṃ rayim anupadasvatīm ////
analyzed: sa naḥ dadātu a kṣitām rayim anupadasvatīm
translated: May it grant us inexhaustible wealth that never fails.

original: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūr jajāna /
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi paribhūḥ jajāna
translated: O Prajapati, none other than you has produced all these forms.

original: yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ////
analyzed: yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Whatever desires we have in offering to you, may that be ours. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: paurṇamāsī prathamā yajñiyāsīd ahnāṃ rātrīṇām atiśarvareṣu /
analyzed: paurṇamāsī prathamā yajñiyā āsīt ahnām rātrīṇām atiśarvareṣu
translated: The full moon was the first to be worthy of sacrifice among the days and nights, in the long nights of winter.

original: ye tvām yajñair yajñiye ardhayanty amī te nāke sukṛtaḥ praviṣṭāḥ ////
analyzed: ye tvām yajñaiḥ yajñiye ardhayanti amī te nāke su kṛtaḥ praviṣṭāḥ
translated: Those who honor you with sacrifices, O worthy one, have entered your vault, O well-made one.

original: pūrvāparaṃ carato mayayaitau śiśū krīḍantau pari yāto 'rṇavam /
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ rṇavam
translated: These two move back and forth in their own power, like two children playing around the ocean.

original: viśvānyo bhuvanā vicaṣṭa ṛtūṃr anyo vidadhaj jāyase navaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyase navaḥ
translated: One observes all the worlds, the other, establishing the seasons, is born anew.

original: navonavo bhavasi jāyamāno 'hnāṃ ketur uṣasām eṣy agram /
analyzed: navaḥ navaḥ bhavasi jāyamānaḥ hnām ketuḥ uṣasām eṣi agram
translated: You are born anew, becoming new, the banner of the days, the first to come of the dawns.

original: bhāgaṃ devebhyo vi dadhāsy āyan pra candramas tirase dhīrgham āyuḥ ////
analyzed: bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāsi āyan pra candramaḥ tirase dhīrgham āyuḥ
translated: Going, you distribute a share to the gods, and the moon extends your life for a long time.

original: somasyāmśo yudhāṃ pate 'nūno nāma vā asi /
analyzed: somasya amśas yudhām pate nūnar nāma vai asi
translated: You are a part of Soma, O lord of warriors, you are called Anūna.

original: anūnam darśa mā kṛdhi prajayā ca dhanena ca ////
analyzed: anūnam darśa mā kṛdhi prajayā ca dhanena ca
translated: Make me, O Darsha, complete in offspring and wealth.

original: darśo 'si darśato 'si samagro 'si samantaḥ /
analyzed: darśaḥ si darśataḥ si samagraḥ si samantaḥ
translated: You are Darsha, you are Darshata, you are Samgra, you are Samanta.

original: samagraḥ samanto bhūyāsaṃ gobhir aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhir gṛhair dhanena ////
analyzed: samagraḥ samantaḥ bhūyāsam gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ gṛhaiḥ dhanena
translated: May I be complete in cattle, horses, offspring, animals, houses, and wealth.

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmas tasya tvaṃ prāṇenā pyāyasva /
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ tasya tvam prāṇena ā pyāyasva
translated: With the breath of him whom we hate, and who hates us, be thou satisfied.

original: ā vayaṃ pyāsiṣīmahi gobhir aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhir gṛhair dhanena ////
analyzed: ā vayam pyāsiṣīmahi gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ prajayā paśubhiḥ gṛhaiḥ dhanena
translated: May we be satisfied with cattle, with horses, with offspring, with beasts, with houses, with wealth.

original: yaṃ devā aṃśum āpyāyayanti yam akṣitam akṣitā bhakṣayanti /
analyzed: yam devāḥ aṃśum āpyāyayanti yam akṣitam akṣitāḥ bhakṣayanti
translated: The shoot which the gods make to swell, which they, the imperishable, enjoy imperishably,

original: tenāsmān indro varuṇo bṛhaspatir ā pyāyayantu bhuvanasya gopāḥ ////
analyzed: tena asmān indraḥ varuṇaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ā pyāyayantu bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: May Indra, Varuṇa, and Brhaspati, the guardians of the world, make us swell with that.

original: abhy arcata suṣṭutiṃ gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta /
analyzed: abhī arcata suṣṭutim gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta
translated: Worship the praise, the race for cattle. Bestow on us good treasures.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavantām ////
analyzed: imam yajñam nayata devatāḥ naḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ madhumat pavantām
translated: Lead this sacrifice of ours to the gods. Let the streams of ghee, rich in honey, flow.

original: mayy agre agniṃ gṛhṇāmi saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena /
analyzed: mayi agre agnim gṛhṇāmi saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena
translated: In me first I take Agni with the Kshatra, with splendour, with strength.

original: mayi prajāṃ mayy āyur dadhāmi svāhā mayy agnim ////
analyzed: mayi prajām mayi āyuḥ dadhāmi svāhā mayi agnim
translated: In me I place offspring, in me life. Svāhā in me Agni.

original: ihaivāgne adhy dhārayā rayim mā tvā ni kran pūrvacittā nikāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: iha eva agne adhi dhāraya rayim mā tvā ni kran pūrva cittāḥ nikāriṇaḥ
translated: Here, O Agni, do thou hold fast wealth. Let not the spiteful enemies overcome thee.

original: kṣatreṇāgne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatāṃ te aniṣṭṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: kṣatreṇa agne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatām te a niṣṭṛtaḥ
translated: With the Kshatra, O Agni, let there be easy access for thee. Let thy attendant increase thee, the unwearied.

original: anv agnir uṣasām agram akhyad anv ahāni prathamo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni hath announced the front of the dawns, Agni, first of all, the days.

original: anu sūrya uṣaso anu raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa ////
analyzed: anu sūryaḥ uṣasaḥ anu raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa
translated: He has entered after the sun, the dawns, the rays, after heaven and earth.

original: praty agnir uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni has proclaimed the foremost of the dawns, Jātavedas first of the days.

original: prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna ////🔽ghṛtaṃ te agne divye sadhasthe ghṛtena tvāṃ manur adyā sam indhe /
analyzed: prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna  ghṛtam te agne divye sadhasthe ghṛtena tvām manuḥ adyā sam indhe
translated: He has extended in many ways after the rays of the sun, after heaven and earth.🔽O Agni, your ghee in the heavenly abode, with ghee Manu today kindles you.

original: ghṛtaṃ te devīr naptya ā vahantu ghṛtaṃ tubhyaṃ duhratāṃ gāvo agne ////
analyzed: ghṛtam te devīḥ naptyaḥ ā vahantu ghṛtam tubhyam duhratām gāvaḥ agne
translated: Let the divine granddaughters bring you ghee, O Agni, let the cows milk ghee for you.

original: apsu te rājan varuṇa gṛho hiraṇyayo mitaḥ /
analyzed: apsu te rājan varuṇa gṛhaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ mitaḥ
translated: In the waters, O king Varuna, is your golden measured house.

original: tato dhṛtavrato rājā sarvā dhāmāni muñcatu ////
analyzed: tatas dhṛtavrataḥ rājā sarvā dhāmāni muñcatu
translated: From there may the king who is firm in his vows release all the beings.

original: dāmnodāmno rājann ito varuṇa muñca naḥ /
analyzed: dāmnaḥ dāmnaḥ rājan itas varuṇa muñca naḥ
translated: From every bond, O king, from here, O Varuna, release us.

original: yad āpo aghnyā iti varuṇeti yad ūcima tato varuṇa muñca naḥ ////
analyzed: yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti yat ūcima tatas varuṇa muñca naḥ
translated: If we have said 'the waters are inviolable' and 'Varuna', from that, O Varuna, release us.

original: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ vi madhyamaṃ śrathāya /
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamam śrathāya
translated: Loosen the highest bond of Varuna from us, loosen the lowest, loosen the middle one.

original: adhā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma ////
analyzed: adha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma
translated: Then may we, O Āditya, in your vow, be free from guilt for Aditi.

original: prāsmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān ya uttamā adhamā vāruṇā ye /
analyzed: pra asmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān ye uttamāḥ adhamāḥ vāruṇāḥ ye
translated: Loosen all the bonds of Varuna from us, the highest, the lowest, the Varuna bonds.

original: duṣvapnyaṃ duritaṃ ni ṣvāsmad atha gachema sukṛtasya lokam ////
analyzed: duṣvapnyam duritam ni sva asmat atha gacchema sukṛtasya lokam
translated: Drive away from us evil dreams and misfortune, and then may we go to the world of the virtuous.

original: anādhṛṣyo jātavedā amartyo virāḍ agne kṣatrabhṛd dīdihīha /
analyzed: anādhṛṣyaḥ jātavedāḥ amartyaḥ virāj agne kṣatra bhṛt dīdihi iha
translated: Unassailable, immortal, all-pervading, O Agni, bearer of the sceptre, shine here.

original: viśvā amīvāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣībhiḥ śivābhir adya pari pāhi no gayam ////
analyzed: viśvāḥ amīvāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣībhiḥ śivābhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam
translated: Releasing all diseases from human beings, protect our dwelling today with auspicious (deeds).

original: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojo 'jāyathā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojaḥ jāyathāḥ vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
translated: O Indra, you were born with the lordship, the desirable strength, and the bull-like power of the people.

original: apānudo janam amitrayantam uruṃ devebhyo akṛṇor u lokam ////
analyzed: apānudaḥ janam amitrayantam urum devebhyaḥ akṛṇoḥ u lokam
translated: You have driven away the people who were inimical, and have made a wide space for the gods.

original: mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ /
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagamyāt parasyāḥ
translated: Like a terrible deer roaming in the mountains, may it come from afar from the farthest distance.

original: sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavim indra tigmaṃ vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdho nudasva ////
analyzed: sṛkam saṃśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva
translated: O Indra, having sharpened the spear and the stake, destroy the enemies and drive away the foes.

original: tyam ū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahovānaṃ tarutāraṃ rathānām /
analyzed: tyam u su vājinam deva jūtam sahovānam tarutāram rathānām
translated: We invoke that powerful one, consecrated by the gods, possessing strength, the swift conqueror of chariots,

original: ariṣṭanemiṃ pṛtanājim āśuṃ svastaye tārkṣyam ihā huvema ////🔽trātāram indram avitāram indraṃ havehave suhavaṃ śūram indram /
analyzed: ariṣṭa nemim pṛtanā ājim āśum svastaye tārkṣyam iha ā huvema  trātāram indram avitāram indram havehave su havam śūram indram
translated: the one with unbroken wheels, the swift one in the battle, the son of Tarkshya, for our well-being.🔽We invoke Indra, the protector, Indra, the savior, the heroic Indra, who is to be invoked in every battle.

original: huve nu śakraṃ puruhūtam indraṃ svasti na indro maghavān kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: huve nu śakram puru hūtam indram svasti naḥ indraḥ maghavān kṛṇotu
translated: We invoke Indra, the powerful one, invoked by many, may Indra, the prosperous one, make us prosperous.

original: yo agnau rudro yo apsv antar ya oṣadhīr vīrudha āviveśa /
analyzed: yaḥ agnau rudraḥ yaḥ apsu antar yaḥ oṣadhīḥ vīrudhaḥ āviveśa
translated: The Rudra who is in the fire, who is in the waters, who has entered the plants and trees,

original: ya imāviśvā bhuvanāni cākḷpe tasmai rudrāya namo astv agnaye ////
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni cākṷpe tasmai rudrāya namaḥ astu agnaye
translated: Who has measured out all these existing things, to that Rudra, to Agni, be homage.

original: apehy arir asy arir vā asi viṣe viṣam apṛkthā viṣam id vā apṛkthāḥ /
analyzed: apehi ariḥ asi ariḥ vai asi viṣe viṣam apṛkthāḥ viṣam id vai apṛkthāḥ
translated: Go away, you are an enemy, or you are an enemy. You have separated poison from poison, or poison has separated from you.

original: ahim evābhyapehi taṃ jahi ////
analyzed: ahim eva abhi apehi tam jahi
translated: Go to the serpent, kill him.

original: apo divyā acāyiṣam rasena sam apṛkṣmahi /🔽payasvān agna āgamaṃ tam mā saṃ sṛja varcasā ////
analyzed: apaḥ divyāḥ acāyiṣam rasena sam apṛkṣmahi  payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā
translated: I have brought the heavenly waters, with sap I have anointed myself.🔽I have come, O Agni, with milk. Unite me with radiance.

original: saṃ māgne varcasā sṛja saṃ prajayā sam āyuṣā /
analyzed: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā
translated: Unite me, O Agni, with radiance, with offspring, with life.

original: vidyur me asya devā indro vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ ////🔽idam āpaḥ pra vahatāvadyaṃ ca malaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ  idam āpaḥ pra vahata avadyam ca malam ca yat
translated: May the gods know this of me, may Indra know it with the seers.🔽O waters, carry away this sin and impurity of mine,

original: yac cābhidudrohānṛtaṃ yac ca śepe abhīruṇam ////🔽edho 'sy edhiṣīya samid asi sam edhiṣīya /
analyzed: yat ca abhidudroha anṛtam yat ca śepe abhīruṇam  edhaḥ si edhiṣīya samidh asi sam edhiṣīya
translated: Whatever harm I have done, whatever falsehood I have spoken, whatever I have said in anger.🔽You are fuel, may I prosper. You are kindling, may I prosper.

original: tejo 'si tejo mayi dhehi ////
analyzed: tejaḥ si tejaḥ mayi dhehi
translated: You are radiance, bestow radiance upon me.

original: api vṛśca purāṇavad vratater iva guṣpitam /
analyzed: api vṛśca purāṇa vat vratateḥ iva guṣpitam
translated: Cut it off as of old, as if from a vow, as if from a covering.

original: ojo dāsasya dambhaya ////
analyzed: ojaḥ dāsasya dambhaya
translated: Destroy the strength of the Dāsa.

original: vayaṃ tad asya sambhṛtaṃ vasv indrena vi bhajāmahai /
analyzed: vayam tat asya sambhṛtam vasu indrena vi bhajāmahai
translated: We will divide this gathered wealth of his with Indra.

original: mlāpayāmi bhrajaḥ śibhraṃ varuṇasya vratena te ////
analyzed: mlāpayāmi bhrajaḥ śibhram varuṇasya vratena te
translated: I dim the brightness of the dull, by the vow of Varuna for thee.

original: yathā śepo apāyātai strīṣu cāsad anāvayāḥ /
analyzed: yathā śepaḥ apāyātai strīṣu ca asat anāvayāḥ
translated: As the penis has gone away, and the testicles have become useless among women,

original: avasthasya knadīvataḥ śāṅkurasya nitodinaḥ /
analyzed: avasthasya knadīvataḥ śāṅkurasya nitodinaḥ
translated: Of the one who is standing, the one who is in the reeds, the one who is trembling, the one who is constantly pricking,

original: yad ātatam ava tat tanu yad uttataṃ ni tat tanu ////
analyzed: yat ātatam ava tat tanu yat uttatam ni tat tanu
translated: What is stretched out, make that thin; what is raised up, make that go down.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavāṃ avobhiḥ sumṛḍīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā svavān avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the powerful one, be gracious to us with his favors, the all-knowing one.

original: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ naḥ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: May he drive away hatred, may he make us fearless, may we be the lords of good heroism.

original: sa sutrāmā svavāṃ indro asmad ārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu /
analyzed: sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asmat ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu
translated: May that good protector, the powerful Indra, drive away from us even distant hatred.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma ////
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: May we be in the favor of that adorable one, may we enjoy his good will.

original: indreṇa manyunā vayam abhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ /
analyzed: indreṇa manyunā vayam abhi syāma pṛtanyataḥ
translated: With Indra's wrath we will conquer those who hate us,

original: ghnanto vṛtrāṇy aprati ////
analyzed: ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati
translated: slaying the Vr̥itras who are not to be subdued.

original: dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣāva somaṃ nayāmasi /
analyzed: dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā ava somam nayāmasi
translated: With firm oblation we lead Soma, the firm one,

original: yathā na indraḥ kevalīr viśaḥ saṃmanasas karat ////🔽ud asya śyāvau vithurau gṛdhrau dyām iva petatuḥ /
analyzed: yathā naḥ indraḥ kevalīḥ viśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ karat  ud asya śyāvau vithurau gṛdhrau dyām iva petatuḥ
translated: so that Indra may make the people of one mind with us.🔽His two dark and weak vultures have flown up, as it were, to the sky.

original: ucchocanapraśocanav asyocchocanau hṛdaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchocana praśocanau asya ucchocanau hṛdaḥ
translated: The burning and the burning up of his heart have flown up.

original: aham enāv ud atiṣṭhipaṃ gāvau śrāntasadāv iva /
analyzed: aham enau ud atiṣṭhipam gāvau śrānta sadau iva
translated: I have set these two cows to low, as if they were tired and worn out.

original: kurkurāv iva kūjantāv udavantau vṛkāv iva ////
analyzed: kurkurau iva kūjantau udavantau vṛkau iva
translated: Mooing like curlews, bellowing like wolves.

original: ātodinau nitodināv atho saṃtodināv uta /
analyzed: ātodinau nitodinau atha u saṃtodinau uta
translated: They are to be driven on, they are driven on, and then driven back again.

original: api nahyāmy asya meḍhraṃ ya itaḥ strī pumān jabhāra ////🔽asadan gāvaḥ sadane 'paptad vasatiṃ vayaḥ /
analyzed: api nahyāmi asya meḍhram yaḥ itas strī pumān jabhāra  asadan gāvaḥ sadane paptat vasatim vayaḥ
translated: I bind fast the penis of him who has brought a woman or a man from here.🔽The cows have sat down in the sitting place, the birds have flown to their resting place.

original: āsthāne parvatā asthuḥ sthāmni vṛkkāv atiṣṭhipam ////
analyzed: āsthāne parvatāḥ asthuḥ sthāmni vṛkkau atiṣṭhipam
translated: The mountains have stood in their place, I have set the kidneys in the firm place.

original: yad adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaś cikitvann avṛṇīmahīha /
analyzed: yat adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotar cikitvan avṛṇīmahi iha
translated: Since today, O wise one, we have chosen thee in this sacrifice, O Hotar, in the impulse (of the worshipper),

original: dhruvam ayo dhruvam utā śaviṣṭhaipravidvān yajñam upa yāhi somam ////
analyzed: dhruvam ayaḥ dhruvam uta śaviṣṭhai pravidvān yajñam upa yāhi somam
translated: O firm one, O most powerful one, knowing the way, come to the sacrifice, to the Soma.

original: sam indra no manasā neṣa gobhiḥ saṃ sūribhir harivant saṃ svastyā /
analyzed: sam indra naḥ manasā gobhiḥ sam sūribhiḥ harivan sam svastyā
translated: O Indra, lead us together with our thoughts, with our cattle, O thou who hast beautiful bays, together with our princes, together with our welfare.

original: saṃ brahmaṇā devahitaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāṃ sumatau yajñiyānām ////
analyzed: sam brahmaṇā deva hitam yat asti sam devānām sumatau yajñiyānām
translated: Together with the Brahman which is the gift of the gods, together with the good will of the worshipful gods.

original: yān āvaha uśato deva devāṃs tān preraya sve agne sadhasthe /
analyzed: yān āvahaḥ uśataḥ deva devān tān preraya sve agne sadhasthe
translated: Those gods whom thou hast brought hither, O god, O Agni, send them to their own abode.

original: jakṣivāṃsaḥ papivāṃso madhūny asmai dhatta vasavo vasūni ////
analyzed: jakṣivāṃsaḥ papivāṃsaḥ madhūni asmai dhatta vasavaḥ vasūni
translated: Having eaten and drunk the sweet (Soma), bestow on him, O Vasus, treasures.

original: sugā vo devāḥ sadanā akarma ya ājagma savane mā juṣāṇāḥ /
analyzed: sugā vaḥ devāḥ sadanā akarma ye ājagma savane mā juṣāṇāḥ
translated: O gods, make your seats easy for you who have come to the libation, rejoicing.

original: vahamānā bharamāṇāḥ svā vasūni vasuṃ gharmaṃ divam ā rohatānu ////
analyzed: vahamānāḥ bharamāṇāḥ svā vasūni vasum gharmam divam ā rohata anu
translated: Bearing and carrying your own treasures, ascend to heaven with the radiant one.

original: yajña yajñaṃ gacha yajñapatiṃ gacha /
analyzed: yajña yajñam gacha yajñapatim gacha
translated: O sacrifice, go to the sacrifice, go to the lord of the sacrifice.

original: svāṃ yoniṃ gacha svāhā ////
analyzed: svām yonim gacha svāhā
translated: Go to your own birthplace, svāhā.

original: eṣa te yajño yajñapate sahasūktavākaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa te yajñaḥ yajñapate sahasūktavākaḥ
translated: This is your sacrifice, O lord of the sacrifice, with good words of praise.

original: suvīryaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: su vīryaḥ svāhā
translated: With good heroism, svāhā.

original: vaṣaḍ dhutebhyo vaṣaḍ ahutebhyaḥ /
analyzed: vaṣaṭ dhutebhyaḥ vaṣaṭ ahutebhyaḥ
translated: Vasat to those offered, vasat to those not offered.

original: devā gātuvido gātuṃ vittvā gātum ita ////
analyzed: devāḥ gātu vidaḥ gātum vittvā gātum ita
translated: O gods who know the path, having found the path, go by the path.

original: manasas pata imaṃ no divi deveṣu yajñam /
analyzed: manasaḥ pate imam naḥ divi deveṣu yajñam
translated: O lord of mind, this sacrifice of ours among the gods in heaven,

original: svāhā divi svāhā pṛthivyāṃ svāhāntarikṣe svāhā vāte dhāṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: svāhā divi svāhā pṛthivyām svāhā antarikṣe svāhā vāte dhām svāhā
translated: Svāhā in heaven, svāhā on earth, svāhā in the atmosphere, svāhā in the wind, svāhā.

original: saṃ barhir aktaṃ haviṣā ghṛtena sam indreṇa vasunā saṃ marudbhiḥ /
analyzed: sam barhiḥ aktam haviṣā ghṛtena sam indreṇa vasunā sam marudbhiḥ
translated: Anoint the strewn grass with ghee and oblation, together with Indra, with wealth, together with the Maruts.

original: saṃ devair viśvadevebhir aktam indraṃ gachatu haviḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: sam devaiḥ viśva devebhiḥ aktam indram gacchatu haviḥ svāhā
translated: Anointed together with the gods, with the All-gods, let the oblation go to Indra, svāhā.

original: pari stṛṇīhi pari dhehi vediṃ mā jāmiṃ moṣīr amuyā śayānām /
analyzed: pari stṛṇīhi pari dhehi vedim mā jāmim moṣīḥ amuyā śayānām
translated: Spread around, place the altar, do not destroy the sister lying with her husband.

original: hotṛṣadanam haritaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ niṣkā ete yajamānasya loke ////
analyzed: hotṛṣadanam haritam hiraṇyayam niṣkāḥ ete yajamānasya loke
translated: The green golden seat of the Hotṛ, these are the sacrificial posts in the world of the sacrificer.

original: paryāvarte duṣvapnyāt pāpāt svapnyād abhūtyāḥ /
analyzed: paryāvarte duṣvapnyāt pāpāt svapnyāt abhūtyāḥ
translated: I turn away from evil dreams, from inauspicious dreams, from misfortune.

original: brahmāham antaraṃ kṛṇve parā svapnamukhāḥ śucaḥ ////
analyzed: brahma aham antaram kṛṇve parā svapna mukhāḥ śucaḥ
translated: I, Brahman, make an interval; far away go the faces of dreams and sorrows.

original: yat svapne annam aśnāmi na prātar adhigamyate /
analyzed: yat svapne annam aśnāmi na prātar adhigamyate
translated: Whatever food I eat in a dream, which is not obtained in the morning,

original: sarvaṃ tad astu me śivaṃ nahi tad dṛṣyate divā ////
analyzed: sarvam tat astu me śivam nahi tat dṛṣyate divā
translated: may all that be auspicious to me, for it is not seen in the day.

original: namaskṛtya dyāvāpṛthivībhyām antarikṣāya mṛtyave /
analyzed: namaskṛtya dyāvāpṛthivībhyām antarikṣāya mṛtyave
translated: Having bowed to Heaven and Earth, to the atmosphere and to Death,

original: mekṣāmy ūrdhvas tiṣṭhan mā mā hiṃsiṣur īśvarāḥ ////
analyzed: mekṣāmi ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhat mā mā hiṃsiṣuḥ īśvarāḥ
translated: standing erect, I urinate; may the powerful ones not injure me.

original: ko asyā no druho 'vadyavatyā un neṣyati kṣatriyo vasya ichan /
analyzed: kaḥ asyāḥ naḥ druhaḥ vadyavatyāḥ ud neṣyati kṣatriyaḥ vasyaḥ ichan
translated: Who, desiring prosperity, will lead this one who has offended me and is guilty, the Kshatriya?

original: ko yajñakāmaḥ ka u pūrtikāmaḥ ko deveṣu vanute dīrgham āyuḥ ////
analyzed: kaḥ yajña kāmaḥ kaḥ u pūrti kāmaḥ kaḥ deveṣu vanute dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: Who desires sacrifice, who desires completion, who among the gods wins long life?

original: kaḥ pṛśniṃ dhenuṃ varuṇena dattām atharvane sudughāṃ nityavatsām /
analyzed: kaḥ pṛśnim dhenum varuṇena dattām atharvane su dughām nitya vatsām
translated: Who will lead the dappled cow given by Varuna to Atharvan, the well-milking one with a calf always at her side,

original: bṛhaspatinā sakhyaṃ juṣaṇo yathāvaśaṃ tanvaḥ kalpayāti ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā sakhyam juṣaṇaḥ yathāvaśam tanvaḥ kalpayāti
translated: enjoying the friendship of Brihaspati, and make her body as he wishes?

original: apakrāman pauruṣeyād vṛṇāno daivyaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: apakrāman pauruṣeyāt vṛṇānaḥ daivyam vacaḥ
translated: Departing from human, choosing the divine word,

original: praṇītīr abhyāvartasva viśvebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ saha ////
analyzed: praṇītīḥ abhyāvartasva viśvebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ saha
translated: turn back the offerings with all your friends.

original: yad asmṛti cakṛma kiṃ cid agna upārima caraṇe jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: yat asmṛti cakṛma kim cit agne upārima caraṇe jātavedaḥ
translated: Whatever we have done, O Agni, through forgetfulness, whatever we have done amiss, O all-knower,

original: tataḥ pāhi tvaṃ naḥ pracetaḥ śubhe sakhibhyo amṛtatvam astu naḥ ////
analyzed: tatas pāhi tvam naḥ pracetaḥ śubhe sakhibhyaḥ amṛta tvam astu naḥ
translated: from that, O thou of great wisdom, do thou protect us: may we enjoy the bliss of our friends, and have immortality.

original: ava divas tārayanti sapta sūryasya raśmayaḥ /
analyzed: ava divaḥ tārayanti sapta sūryasya raśmayaḥ
translated: The seven rays of the sun carry down from heaven.

original: āpaḥ samudriyā dhārās tās śalyam asisrasan ////🔽yo na stāyad dipsati yo na āviḥ svo vidvān araṇo vā no agne /
analyzed: āpaḥ samudriyāḥ dhārāḥ tāḥ śalyam asisrasan  yaḥ naḥ stāyat dipsati yaḥ naḥ āvis svaḥ vidvān araṇaḥ vā naḥ agne
translated: The streams of the ocean waters: they have drawn out the dart.🔽He who would injure us, whether he be near or far away, O Agni, whether he be known to us or unknown,

original: pratīcy etv araṇī datvatī tān maiṣām agne vāstu bhūn mo apatyam ////
analyzed: pratīcī etu araṇī datvatī tān mā eṣām agne vāstu bhūt mā u apatyam
translated: may he go away with his weapons turned against himself: let him not have a home in our dwelling, nor offspring.

original: yo naḥ suptān jāgrato vābhidāsāt tiṣṭhato vā carato jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ suptān jāgrataḥ vā abhidāsāt tiṣṭhataḥ vā carataḥ jātavedaḥ
translated: He who would injure us, whether sleeping or waking, whether standing or moving about, O all-knower,

original: vaiśvānareṇa sayujā sajoṣās tān pratīco nir daha jātavedaḥ ////🔽idam ugrāya babhrave namo yo akṣeṣu tanūvaśī /
analyzed: vaiśvānareṇa sayujā sajoṣāḥ tān pratīcaḥ niḥ daha jātavedaḥ  idam ugrāya babhrave namaḥ yaḥ akṣeṣu tanū vaśī
translated: with Vaisvânara, with him who is yoked and of one mind, burn them up, O all-knower, from behind.🔽To him the fierce, the tawny one, who is the controller of the dice, this homage.

original: ghṛtena kaliṃ śikṣāmi sa no mṛḍātīdṛśe ////
analyzed: ghṛtena kalim śikṣāmi sa naḥ mṛḍāti īdṛśe
translated: With ghee I appease the quarrel: may he be appeased for us in this matter.

original: ghṛtam apsarābhyo vaha tvam agne pāṃsūn akṣebhyaḥ sikatā apaś ca /
analyzed: ghṛtam apsarābhyaḥ vaha tvam agne pāṃsūn akṣebhyaḥ sikatāḥ apaḥ ca
translated: Carry the ghee to the Apsarases, O Agni, the dust to the dice, and the sand to the waters.

original: yathābhagaṃ havyadātiṃ juṣāṇā madanti devā ubhayāni havyā ////
analyzed: yathā bhagam havya dātim juṣāṇāḥ madanti devāḥ ubhayāni havyā
translated: The gods, rejoicing in the offering of oblations according to their due portions, enjoy both kinds of offerings.

original: apsarasaḥ sadhamādaṃ madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryaṃ ca /
analyzed: apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca
translated: The Apsarases rejoice in the place of the feast, between the sacrificial post and the sun.

original: tā me hastau saṃ sṛjantu ghṛtena sapatnaṃ me kitavam randhayantu ////🔽ādinavaṃ pratidīvne ghṛtenāsmāṃ abhi kṣara /
analyzed: tāḥ me hastau sam sṛjantu ghṛtena sapatnam me kitavam randhayantu  ādinavam pratidīvne ghṛtena asmān abhi kṣara
translated: May they join my hands together with ghee, and let them deliver my adversary, the gambler, into my hands.🔽The new (die) to the adversary, with ghee sprinkle us.

original: vṛkṣam ivāśanyā jahi yo asmān pratidīvyati ////
analyzed: vṛkṣam iva aśanyā jahi yaḥ asmān pratidīvyati
translated: Strike him who plays against us as with a thunderbolt.

original: yo no dyuve dhanam idaṃ cakāra yo akṣāṇāṃ glahanaṃ śeṣaṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dhanam idam cakāra yaḥ akṣāṇām glahanam śeṣaṇam ca
translated: He who has made this wealth of ours in the game, who has made the dice and the throwing of them,

original: sa no devo havir idaṃ juṣāṇo gandharvebhiḥ sadhamādaṃ madema ////
analyzed: sa naḥ devaḥ haviḥ idam juṣāṇaḥ gandharvebhiḥ sadhamādam madema
translated: may that god, accepting this oblation of ours, rejoice in the place of the feast with the Gandharvas.

original: saṃvasava iti vo nāmadheyam ugraṃpaśyā rāṣṭrabhṛto hy akṣāḥ /
analyzed: saṃvasavaḥ iti vaḥ nāmadheyam ugraṃpaśyāḥ rāṣṭra bhṛtaḥ hi akṣāḥ
translated: Your name is 'the united Vasus,' your appearance is terrible, for you are the supporters of the kingdom, O dice.

original: tebhyo va indavo haviṣā vidhema vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ vaḥ indavaḥ haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: To you, O drops, let us offer oblation. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: devān yan nāthito huve brahmacaryaṃ yad ūṣima /🔽akṣān yad babhrūn ālabhe te no mṛḍantv īdṛśe ////
analyzed: devān yat nāthitaḥ huve brahmacaryam yat ūṣima  akṣān yat babhrūn ālabhe te naḥ mṛḍantu īdṛśe
translated: When I call upon the gods for help, when I have dwelt in the Brahmacharya state,🔽when I have offered the brown dice, may they be gracious to me in this matter.

original: agna indraś ca dāśuṣe hato vṛtrāṇy aprati /
analyzed: agne indraḥ ca dāśuṣe hataḥ vṛtrāṇi aprati
translated: O Agni and Indra, for the worshipper, ye have slain the foes, ye have overcome the enemies.

original: ubhā hi vṛtrahantamā ////
analyzed: ubhā hi vṛtra hantamā
translated: For ye are both the most mighty in slaying the foes.

original: yābhyām ajayant svar agra eva yāv ātasthatur bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yābhyām ajayan svar agre eva yau ātasthatuḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: By whom they conquered heaven in the beginning, who have established all the worlds,

original: pra carṣaṇīvṛṣaṇā vajrabāhū agnim indram vṛtrahaṇā huve 'ham ////
analyzed: pra carṣaṇīvṛṣaṇā vajrabāhū agnim indram vṛtra haṇā huve ham
translated: I call upon the two mighty ones, the two powerful ones, the two with thunder in their arms, Indra and Agni, the two slayers of Vrtra.

original: upa tvā devo agramīc camasena bṛhaspatiḥ /🔽indra gīrbhir na ā viśa yajamānāya sunvate ////
analyzed: upa tvā devaḥ agramīt camasena bṛhaspatiḥ  indra gīrbhiḥ naḥ ā viśa yajamānāya sunvate
translated: The god Brihaspati has come to you with a cup,🔽O Indra, come to us with the praises, to the sacrificer who presses the Soma.

original: indrasya kukṣir asi somadhāna ātmā devānām uta mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: indrasya kukṣiḥ asi soma dhānaḥ ātmā devānām uta mānuṣāṇām
translated: You are the belly of Indra, the vessel of Soma, the soul of the gods and of humans.

original: iha prajā janaya yās ta āsu yā anyatreha tās te ramantām ////
analyzed: iha prajāḥ janaya yāḥ te āsu yāḥ anyatra iha tāḥ te ramantām
translated: Here generate offspring, those that are in them and those that are elsewhere, may they delight in you here.

original: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahivrate /
analyzed: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahi vrate
translated: The two purifying ones, heaven and earth, with the most beneficial and vast rule,

original: āpaḥ sapta susruvur devīs tā no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ sapta susruvuḥ devīḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The seven divine streams have flowed forth; may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyād atho varuṇyād uta /
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta
translated: May they deliver me from the curse, and from Varuna's noose,

original: atho yamasya paḍvīśād viśvasmād devakilbiṣāt ////
analyzed: atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt viśvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt
translated: And from Yama's fetter, from all offense against the gods.

original: tṛṣṭike tṛṣṭavandana ud amūṃ chindhi tṛṣṭike /
analyzed: tṛṣṭike tṛṣṭa vandana ud amūm chinddhi tṛṣṭike
translated: O Tṛṣṭikā, Tṛṣṭavandana, cut her off with your Tṛṣṭikā,

original: yathā kṛtadviṣṭāso 'muṣmai śepyāvate ////
analyzed: yathā kṛta dviṣṭāsaḥ muṣmai śepyāvate
translated: So that those who have done this enmity may be cut off for him who hates.

original: tṛṣṭāsi tṛṣṭikā viṣā viṣātaky asi /
analyzed: tṛṣṭā asi tṛṣṭikā viṣā viṣātakī asi
translated: You are Tṛṣṭikā, Tṛṣṭikā, you are poison, you are a deadly poison,

original: parivṛktā yathāsasy ṛṣabhasya vaśeva ////
analyzed: parivṛktā yathā asasi ṛṣabhasya vaśā iva
translated: Like a cow that has been castrated, like a bull's testicles.

original: ā te dade vakṣaṇābhya ā te 'haṃ hṛdayād dade /
analyzed: ā te dade vakṣaṇābhyaḥ ā te ham hṛdayāt dade
translated: I take it from your flanks, I take it from your heart.

original: ā te mukhasya saṅkāśāt sarvaṃ te varca ā dade ////🔽preto yantu vyādhyaḥ prānudhyāḥ pro aśastayaḥ /
analyzed: ā te mukhasya saṅkāśāt sarvam te varcaḥ ā dade  pra itas yantu vyādhyaḥ pra anudhyāḥ pra u aśastayaḥ
translated: I take away all your splendor from the face of you.🔽Let the diseases go away, let the grudges go away, let the curses go away.

original: agnī rakṣasvinīr hantu somo hantu durasyatīḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ rakṣasvinīḥ hantu somaḥ hantu durasyatīḥ
translated: Let Agni kill the Rakshasas, let Soma kill the evil-doers.

original: pra patetaḥ pāpi lakṣmi naśyetaḥ prāmutaḥ pata /
analyzed: pra pata itas pāpi lakṣmi naśya itas pra amutas pata
translated: Fall away from here, O evil fortune, perish from here, fall away from here.

original: ayasmayenāṅkena dviṣate tvā sajāmasi ////
analyzed: ayasmayena aṅkena dviṣate tvā sajāmasi
translated: With an iron hook we bind you to the enemy.

original: yā mā lakṣmīḥ patayālūr ajuṣṭābhicaskanda vandaneva vṛkṣam /
analyzed: yā mā lakṣmīḥ patayālūḥ ajuṣṭā abhicaskanda vandanā iva vṛkṣam
translated: The inauspicious fortune that has come upon me, like a bird flying from a tree,

original: anyatrāsmat savitas tām ito dhā hiraṇyahasto vasu no rarāṇaḥ ////
analyzed: anyatra asmat savitar tām itas dhāḥ hiraṇya hastaḥ vasu naḥ rarāṇaḥ
translated: O Savitar, throw that away from here, with a golden hand, bestowing wealth upon us.

original: ekaśataṃ lakṣmyo martyasya sākaṃ tanvā januṣo 'dhi jātāḥ /
analyzed: ekaśatam lakṣmyaḥ martyasya sākam tanvā januṣaḥ dhi jātāḥ
translated: One hundred and one fortunes are born together with the body of a mortal.

original: tāsāṃ pāpiṣṭhā nir itaḥ pra hiṇmaḥ śivā asmabhyaṃ jātavedo niyacha ////
analyzed: tāsām pāpiṣṭhāḥ niḥ itas pra hiṇmaḥ śivāḥ asmabhyam jātavedaḥ niyaccha
translated: Of those, the most evil we banish from here. O Jātavedas, bestow upon us the auspicious ones.

original: etā enā vyākaraṃ khile gā viṣṭhitā iva /
analyzed: etāḥ enāḥ vyākaram khile gāḥ viṣṭhitāḥ iva
translated: I have spread out these (fortunes) on the bare ground, like cows scattered (in a pasture).

original: ramantāṃ puṇyā lakṣmīr yāḥ pāpīs tā anīnaśam ////
analyzed: ramantām puṇyāḥ lakṣmīḥ yāḥ pāpīḥ tāḥ anīnaśam
translated: Let the auspicious ones rejoice. I have destroyed the inauspicious ones.

original: namo rūrāya cyavanāya nodanāya dhṛṣṇave /
analyzed: namaḥ rūrāya cyavanāya nodanāya dhṛṣṇave
translated: Homage to the lame, to the falling, to the driving, to the daring.

original: namaḥ śītāya pūrvakāmakṛtvane ////
analyzed: namaḥ śītāya pūrva kāma kṛtvane
translated: Homage to the cold, to the one who acts according to the ancient desire.

original: yo anyedyur ubhayadyur abhyetīmaṃ maṇḍūkam /
analyzed: yaḥ anyedyus ubhayadyus abhyeti imam maṇḍūkam
translated: He who comes on the next day or the following day, this frog,

original: abhy etv avrataḥ ////
analyzed: abhī etu avrataḥ
translated: Come hither, thou who art free from vows.

original: ā mandrair indra haribhir yāhi mayūraromabhiḥ /
analyzed: ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ yāhi mayūra romabhiḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with thy cheerful bays, with manes of peacock feathers.

original: mā tvā ke cid vi yaman viṃ na pāśino 'ti dhanveva tāṃ ihi ////
analyzed: mā tvā ke cit vi yaman vim na pāśinaḥ ti dhanvā iva tām ihi
translated: Let none restrain thee, as if thou wert a thief. Go past them as if they were a desert.

original: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somas tvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām /
analyzed: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām
translated: I cover thy vital parts with armour. Let king Soma anoint thee with immortality.

original: uror varīyo varuṇas te kṛṇotu jayantaṃ tvānu devā madantu ////
analyzed: uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ madantu
translated: May Varuna make thy breast wider. Let the gods rejoice in thee as thou art victorious.

original: antakāya mṛtyave namaḥ prānā apānā iha te ramantām /
analyzed: antakāya mṛtyave namaḥ prānāḥ apānāḥ iha te ramantām
translated: Homage to the death-bringer, to Death. Let thy in-breathings and out-breathings delight thee here.

original: ihāyam astu puruṣaḥ sahāsunā sūryasya bhāge amṛtasya loke ////
analyzed: iha ayam astu puruṣaḥ saha asunā sūryasya bhāge amṛtasya loke
translated: Here let this man be with his own life, in the portion of the sun, in the world of immortality.

original: ud enaṃ bhago agrabhīd ud enaṃ somo aṃśumān /
analyzed: ud enam bhagaḥ agrabhīt ud enam somaḥ aṃśumān
translated: Bhaga hath lifted him up, Soma with rays hath lifted him up.

original: ud enaṃ maruto devā ud indrāgnī svastaye ////
analyzed: ud enam marutaḥ devāḥ ud indra agnī svastaye
translated: The Maruts, the gods, have lifted him up, Indra and Agni for his welfare.

original: iha te 'sur iha prāṇa ihāyur iha te manaḥ /
analyzed: iha te suḥ iha prāṇaḥ iha āyuḥ iha te manaḥ
translated: Here is thy life, here thy breath, here thy life, here thy mind.

original: ut tvā nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyo daivyā vacā bharāmasi ////
analyzed: ud tvā nirṛtyāḥ pāśebhyaḥ daivyā vacāḥ bharāmasi
translated: From the bonds of Nirrti we lift thee up with a divine hymn.

original: ut krāmātaḥ puruṣa māva patthā mṛtyoḥ paḍvīṣam avamuñcamānaḥ /
analyzed: ud krāma atas puruṣa mā ava patthāḥ mṛtyoḥ paḍvīṣam avamuñcamānaḥ
translated: Rise up from here, O man, do not fall. Loosing the noose of Death,

original: mā chitthā asmāl lokād agneḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśaḥ ////
analyzed: mā chitthāḥ asmāt lokāt agneḥ sūryasya saṃdṛśaḥ
translated: Do not fall away from this world, from the sight of Agni and Surya.

original: tubhyaṃ vātaḥ pavatāṃ mātariśvā tubhyaṃ varṣantv amṛtāny āpaḥ /
analyzed: tubhyam vātaḥ pavatām mātariśvā tubhyam varṣantu amṛtāni āpaḥ
translated: Let the wind Vata blow for thee, let the waters rain down nectar for thee.

original: sūryas te tanve śaṃ tapāti tvām mṛtyur dayatāṃ mā pra meṣṭhāḥ ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ te tanve śam tapāti tvām mṛtyuḥ dayatām mā pra meṣṭhāḥ
translated: Let the sun shine peace for thy body. Be merciful to me, O Death, do not destroy me.

original: udyānaṃ te puruṣa nāvayānaṃ jīvātuṃ te dakṣatātiṃ kṛnomi /
analyzed: udyānam te puruṣa na avayānam jīvātum te dakṣatātim kṛnomi
translated: Thy going out, thy coming in, O man, I make for thee a way to life and strength.

original: ā hi rohemam amṛtaṃ sukhaṃ ratham atha jirvir vidatham ā vadāsi ////
analyzed: ā hi roha imam amṛtam sukham ratham atha jirviḥ vidatham ā vadāsi
translated: Then the bird speaks in the assembly, Let us ascend this chariot of immortality, of happiness.

original: mā te manas tatra gān mā tiro bhūn mā jīvebhyaḥ pra mado mānu gāḥ pitṝn /
analyzed: mā te manaḥ tatra gāt mā tiras bhūt mā jīvebhyaḥ pra madaḥ mā anu gāḥ pitṝn
translated: Let not thy mind go there, let it not be hidden. Do not go to the Fathers, O man, from the living, to the delight.

original: viśve devā abhi rakṣantu tveha ////
analyzed: viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu tvā iha
translated: Let all the gods protect thee here.

original: mā gatānām ā dīdhīthā ye nayanti parāvatam /
analyzed: mā gatānām ā dīdhīthāḥ ye nayanti parāvatam
translated: Do not think of those who have gone away, who lead thee far away.

original: ā roha tamaso jyotir ehy ā te hastau rabhāmahe ////
analyzed: ā roha tamasaḥ jyotiḥ ehi ā te hastau rabhāmahe
translated: Come up from darkness to the light. We seize thy hands.

original: śyāmaś ca tvā mā śabalaś ca preṣitau yamasya yau pathirakṣī śvānau /🔽arvāṅ ehi mā vi dīdhyo mātra tiṣṭhaḥ parāṅmanāḥ ////
analyzed: śyāmaḥ ca tvā mā śabalaḥ ca preṣitau yamasya yau pathirakṣī śvānau  arvāṅ ehi mā vi dīdhyaḥ mā atra tiṣṭhaḥ parāc manāḥ
translated: The dark one and the speckled one, the two dogs of Yama who guard the path, have sent thee.🔽Come hither. Do not be anxious. Do not stand here with thy mind turned away.

original: maitaṃ panthām anu gā bhīma eṣa yena pūrvaṃ neyatha taṃ bravīmi /
analyzed: mā etam panthām anu gāḥ bhīmaḥ eṣa yena pūrvam na iyatha tam bravīmi
translated: Do not follow this path, O terrible one, which those who have gone before thee have taken. I tell thee this.

original: tama etat puruṣa mā pra patthā bhayaṃ parastād abhayaṃ te arvāk ////
analyzed: tamaḥ etat puruṣa mā pra patthāḥ bhayam parastāt abhayam te arvāk
translated: O man, do not fall into that. Fear is beyond you, fear is not on this side of you.

original: rakṣantu tvāgnayo ye apsv antā rakṣatu tvā manuṣyā yam indhate /
analyzed: rakṣantu tvā agnayaḥ ye apsu antar rakṣatu tvā manuṣyāḥ yam indhate
translated: May the fires that are in the waters protect you. May the men who kindle you protect you.

original: vaiśvānaro rakṣatu jātavedā divyas tvā mā pra dhāg vidyutā saha ////
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ rakṣatu jātavedāḥ divyaḥ tvā mā pra dhāk vidyutā saha
translated: May Vaiśvānara Jātavedas protect you. May the heavenly one not lead you away with lightning.

original: mā tvā kravyād abhi maṃstārāt saṃkasukāc cara rakṣatu tvā dyau rakṣatu /
analyzed: mā tvā kravyād abhi maṃsta ārāt saṃkasukāt cara rakṣatu tvā dyauḥ rakṣatu
translated: May the flesh-eater not think of you from afar. Move from the crevice. May heaven protect you.

original: pṛthivī sūryaś ca tvā rakṣatāṃ candramāś ca /
analyzed: pṛthivī sūryaḥ ca tvā rakṣatām candramāḥ ca
translated: May the earth protect you. May the sun protect you. May the moon protect you.

original: antarikṣaṃ rakṣatu devahetyāḥ ////
analyzed: antarikṣam rakṣatu deva hetyāḥ
translated: May the atmosphere protect you. May the divine call protect you.

original: bodhaś ca tvā pratibodhaś ca rakṣatām asvapnaś ca tvānavadrāṇaś ca rakṣatām /
analyzed: bodhaḥ ca tvā pratibodhaḥ ca rakṣatām asvapnaḥ ca tvā anavadrāṇaḥ ca rakṣatām
translated: May the awakener and the awakener protect you. May the non-sleeping and the non-wandering protect you.

original: gopāyaṃś ca tvā jāgṛviś ca rakṣatām ////
analyzed: gopāyan ca tvā jāgṛviḥ ca rakṣatām
translated: May the protector and the watchful protect you.

original: te tvā rakṣantu te tvā gopāyantu tebhyo namas tebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: te tvā rakṣantu te tvā gopāyantu tebhyaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: May they protect you. May they guard you. Homage to them. To them svāhā.

original: jīvebhyas tvā samude vāyur indro dhātā dadhātu savitā trāyamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: jīvebhyaḥ tvā sa mude vāyuḥ indraḥ dhātā dadhātu savitā trāyamāṇaḥ
translated: For the living ones, may Vāyu, Indra, the supporter, Savitr, the protector, establish you.

original: mā tvā prāṇo balaṃ hāsīd asuṃ te 'nu hvayāmasi ////
analyzed: mā tvā prāṇaḥ balam hāsīt asum te nu hvayāmasi
translated: May your breath not take away your strength. We invoke your life.

original: mā tvā jambhaḥ saṃhanur mā tamo vidan mā jihvā barhis pramayuḥ kathā syāḥ /
analyzed: mā tvā jambhaḥ saṃhanuḥ mā tamaḥ vidat mā jihvā barhiḥ pramayuḥ kathā syāḥ
translated: Let not the jaw, let not the darkness find thee. Let not the tongue, the sacrificial grass, be thy destruction.

original: ut tvādityā vasavo bharantūd indrāgnī svastaye ////
analyzed: ud tvā ādityāḥ vasavaḥ bharantu ud indra agnī svastaye
translated: Let the Adityas, the Vasus, and Indra-Agni raise thee up for well-being.

original: ut tvā dyaur ut pṛthivy ut prajāpatir agrabhīt /
analyzed: ud tvā dyauḥ ud pṛthivī ud prajāpatiḥ agrabhīt
translated: The sky, the earth, and Prajapati have raised thee up.

original: ut tvā mṛtyor oṣadhayaḥ somarājñīr apīparan ////
analyzed: ud tvā mṛtyoḥ oṣadhayaḥ soma rājñīḥ apīparan
translated: The plants, with Soma as their king, have brought thee out of death.

original: ayaṃ devā ihaivāstv ayaṃ māmutra gād itaḥ /
analyzed: ayam devāḥ iha eva astu ayam mā amutra gāt itas
translated: Let this one stay here, O gods, let this one go from hence to yonder world.

original: imaṃ sahasravīryeṇa mṛtyor ut pārayāmasi ////
analyzed: imam sahasra vīryeṇa mṛtyoḥ ud pārayāmasi
translated: With a thousandfold vigour we deliver this one from death.

original: ut tvā mṛtyor apīparaṃ saṃ dhamantu vayodhasaḥ /
analyzed: ud tvā mṛtyoḥ apīparam sam dhamantu vayodhasaḥ
translated: The life-giving ones have brought thee out of death. Let them blow thee up.

original: mā tvā vyastakeśyo mā tvāgharudo rudan ////
analyzed: mā tvā vyasta keśyaḥ mā tvā agharudaḥ rudan
translated: Let not the women with dishevelled hair, let not the weeping child weep over thee.

original: āhārṣam avidaṃ tvā punar āgāḥ punarṇavaḥ /
analyzed: āhārṣam avidam tvā punar āgāḥ punarṇavaḥ
translated: I have brought thee, I have found thee. Thou hast come again, renewed.

original: sarvāṅga sarvaṃ te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuś ca te 'vidam ////
analyzed: sarva aṅga sarvam te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuḥ ca te vidam
translated: I have found all thy limbs, all thy sight, all thy life.

original: vy avāt te jyotir abhūd apa tvat tamo akramīt /🔽apa tvan mṛtyuṃ nirṛtim apa yakṣmaṃ ni dadhmasi ////
analyzed: vi avāt te jyotiḥ abhūt apa tvat tamaḥ akramīt  apa tvat mṛtyum nirṛtim apa yakṣmam ni dadhmasi
translated: Thy light hath shone forth, the darkness hath passed away from thee.🔽We place away from thee death, destruction, and consumption.

original: ā rabhasvemām amṛtasya śnuṣṭim achidyamānā jaradaṣṭir astu te /
analyzed: ā rabhasva imām amṛtasya śnuṣṭim a chidyamānā jaradaṣṭiḥ astu te
translated: Take hold of this share of immortality. Let thy teeth be undecaying.

original: asuṃ ta āyuḥ punar ā bharāmi rajas tamo mopa gā mā pra meṣṭhāḥ ////🔽jīvatāṃ jyotir abhyehy arvāṅ ā tvā harāmi śataśāradāya /
analyzed: asum te āyuḥ punar ā bharāmi rajaḥ tamaḥ mā upa gāḥ mā pra meṣṭhāḥ  jīvatām jyotiḥ abhyehi arvāṅ ā tvā harāmi śata śāradāya
translated: I bring back to you your life, your breath. Do not go to the darkness of the realm. Do not leave me.🔽Come hither to the light of the living. I bring you back for a hundred autumns.

original: avamuñcan mṛtyupāśān aśastiṃ drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ te dadhāmi ////
analyzed: avamuñcan mṛtyu pāśān aśastim drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram te dadhāmi
translated: Loosening the bonds of death, the curse, I give you life that shall last long.

original: vātāt te prānam avidaṃ sūryāc cakṣur ahaṃ tava /
analyzed: vātāt te prānam avidam sūryāt cakṣuḥ aham tava
translated: From the wind I have gained your breath, from the sun your eye.

original: yat te manas tvayi tad dhārayāmi saṃ vitsvāṅgair vada jihvayālapan ////
analyzed: yat te manaḥ tvayi tat dhārayāmi sam vitsva aṅgaiḥ vada jihvayā a lapan
translated: Your mind that is in you, that I keep. Be united with your limbs. Speak with your tongue.

original: prāṇena tvā dvipadāṃ catuṣpadām agnim iva jātam abhi saṃ dhamāmi /
analyzed: prāṇena tvā dvipadām catuṣpadām agnim iva jātam abhi sam dhamāmi
translated: With the breath of you, two-footed and four-footed, I warm you up like a born fire.

original: namas te mṛtyo cakṣuṣe namaḥ prāṇāya te 'karam ////
analyzed: namaḥ te mṛtyo cakṣuṣe namaḥ prāṇāya te karam
translated: Homage to your eye, O Death, homage to your breath. I have paid it.

original: ayaṃ jīvatu mā mṛtemaṃ sam īrayāmasi /
analyzed: ayam jīvatu mā mṛta imam sam īrayāmasi
translated: Let him live. Let him not die. We unite him.

original: kṛṇomy asmai bheṣajaṃ mṛtyo mā puruṣaṃ vadhīḥ ////
analyzed: kṛṇomi asmai bheṣajam mṛtyo mā puruṣam vadhīḥ
translated: I make this medicine for him. Do not kill the man, O Death.

original: jīvalāṃ naghāriṣāṃ jīvantīm oṣadhīm aham /
analyzed: jīvalām naghāriṣām jīvantīm oṣadhīm aham
translated: The living, life-giving plant, the healing herb,

original: trāyamāṇāṃ sahamānāṃ sahasvatīm iha huve 'smā ariṣṭatātaye ////
analyzed: trāyamāṇām sahamānām sahasvatīm iha huve smaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: the saviour, the conqueror, the victorious, I invoke here for his safety.

original: adhi brūhi mā rabhathāḥ sṛjemaṃ tavaiva sant sarvahāyāḥ ihāstu /
analyzed: adhi brūhi mā rabhathāḥ sṛja imam tava eva san sarva hāyāḥ iha astu
translated: Speak over him. Do not seize him. Let him go. Let all the strong ones be here for you.

original: bhavāśarvau mṛḍataṃ śarma yachatam apasidhya duritaṃ dhattam āyuḥ ////
analyzed: bhavāśarvau mṛḍatam śarma yacchatam apasidhya duritam dhattam āyuḥ
translated: Bhava and Sarva, be gracious, grant protection, avert misfortune, grant life.

original: asmai mṛtyo adhi brūhīmaṃ dayasvod ito 'yam etu /
analyzed: asmai mṛtyo adhi brūhi imam dayasva ud itas yam etu
translated: To this one, O Death, speak, have mercy on him, let him go forth from here.

original: ariṣṭaḥ sarvāṅgaḥ suśruj jarasā śatahāyana ātmanā bhujam aśnutām ////
analyzed: ariṣṭaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ su śrut jarasā śata hāyanaḥ ātmanā bhujam aśnutām
translated: Let him be unharmed, with all his limbs, well-hearing, a hundred years old through old age, may he enjoy his life through his own self.

original: devānāṃ hetiḥ pari tvā vṛṇaktu pārayāmi tvā rajasa ut tvā mṛtyor apīparam /
analyzed: devānām hetiḥ pari tvā vṛṇaktu pārayāmi tvā rajasaḥ ud tvā mṛtyoḥ apīparam
translated: May the dart of the gods choose thee. I lead thee across the realm. I have brought thee out from death.

original: ārād agniṃ kravyādaṃ nirūhaṃ jīvātave te paridhiṃ dadhāmi ////
analyzed: ārāt agnim kravya adam nirūham jīvātave te paridhim dadhāmi
translated: From afar I place around thee a fence, Agni the devourer, to keep thee safe.

original: yat te niyānaṃ rajasaṃ mṛtyo anavadharṣyam /
analyzed: yat te niyānam rajasam mṛtyo anavadharṣyam
translated: Thy path through the realm of death, O Death, which is not to be transgressed,

original: patha imaṃ tasmād rakṣanto brahmāsmai varma kṛṇmasi ////
analyzed: pathaḥ imam tasmāt rakṣantaḥ brahma asmai varma kṛṇmasi
translated: from that we guard him, we Brahmans make this armour for him.

original: kṛṇomi te prāṇāpānau jarāṃ mṛtyuṃ dīrgham āyuḥ svasti /
analyzed: kṛṇomi te prāṇa apānau jarām mṛtyum dīrgham āyuḥ svasti
translated: I make for thee the in-breathing and the out-breathing, old age and death, long life and well-being.

original: vaivasvatena prahitān yamadūtāṃś carato 'pa sedhāmi sarvān ////
analyzed: vaivasvatena prahitān yama dūtān carataḥ u sedhāmi sarvān
translated: The messengers of Yama, sent by Vaivasvata, I drive away from all sides.

original: ārād arātiṃ nirṛtiṃ paro grāhiṃ kravyādaḥ piśācān /
analyzed: ārāt arātim nirṛtim paras grāhim kravya adaḥ piśācān
translated: From afar I drive away hostility, destruction, the grasping demon, the flesh-devouring goblin,

original: rakṣo yat sarvaṃ durbhūtaṃ tat tama ivāpa hanmasi ////
analyzed: rakṣaḥ yat sarvam durbhūtam tat tamaḥ iva apa hanmasi
translated: the Rakshas, and whatever else is evil, as if it were darkness, we strike it down.

original: agneṣ ṭa prānam amṛtād āyuṣmato vanve jātavedasaḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ te prānam amṛtāt āyuṣmataḥ vanve jātavedasaḥ
translated: I seek the breath of Agni, of the immortal, of the long-lived one, of the all-knowing one,

original: yathā na riṣyā amṛtaḥ sajūr asas tat te kṛṇomi tad u te sam ṛdhyatām ////
analyzed: yathā na riṣyāḥ amṛtaḥ sajūs asaḥ tat te kṛṇomi tat u te sam ṛdhyatām
translated: so that I may not be harmed, may live immortal, may be united with my relatives. I do this for you. May it be successful for you.

original: śive te stāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī asaṃtāpe abhiśriyau /
analyzed: śive te stām dyāvāpṛthivī a saṃtāpe abhiśriyau
translated: May heaven and earth be auspicious to you, not scorching, your two coverings.

original: śaṃ te sūrya ā tapatu śaṃ vāto vātu te hṛde /
analyzed: śam te sūryaḥ ā tapatu śam vātaḥ vātu te hṛde
translated: May the sun shine auspiciously on you. May the wind blow auspiciously in your heart.

original: śivā abhi kṣarantu tvāpo divyāḥ payasvatīḥ ////
analyzed: śivāḥ abhi kṣarantu tvā apaḥ divyāḥ payasvatīḥ
translated: May the auspicious heavenly waters full of milk flow to you.

original: śivās te santv oṣadhaya ut tvāhārṣam adharasyā uttarāṃ pṛthivīm abhi /
analyzed: śivāḥ te santu oṣadhayaḥ ud tvā ahārṣam adharasyāḥ uttarām pṛthivīm abhi
translated: May the plants be auspicious to you. I have lifted you up from the lower to the higher earth.

original: tatra tvādityau rakṣatāṃ sūryācandramasāv ubhā ////
analyzed: tatra tu ādityau rakṣatām sūryācandramasau ubhā
translated: There may the two Adityas protect you, the sun and the moon, both of them.

original: yat te vāsaḥ paridhānaṃ yāṃ nīviṃ kṛṇuṣe tvam /
analyzed: yat te vāsaḥ paridhānam yām nīvim kṛṇuṣe tvam
translated: The garment that you wear, the girdle that you fasten,

original: śivaṃ te tanve tat kṛṇmaḥ saṃsparśe 'drūkṣṇam astu te ////
analyzed: śivam te tanve tat kṛṇmaḥ saṃsparśe drūkṣṇam astu te
translated: we make that auspicious for your body. May it be soft to the touch.

original: yat kṣureṇa marcayatā sutejasā vaptā vapasi keśaśmaśru /🔽śubhaṃ mukhaṃ mā na āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ ////
analyzed: yat kṣureṇa marcayatā su tejasā vaptā vapasi keśa śmaśru  śubham mukham mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ
translated: When with the sharp, well-sharpened razor the barber shaves your hair and beard,🔽do not deprive us of our life, O auspicious one.

original: śivau te stāṃ vrīhiyavāv abalāsāv adomadhau /
analyzed: śivau te stām vrīhi yavau a balāsau adomadhau
translated: May your rice and barley be auspicious, free from disease, without husks and sweet.

original: etau yakṣmaṃ vi bādhete etau muñcato aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: etau yakṣmam vi bādhete etau muñcataḥ aṃhasaḥ
translated: These two drive away disease, these two release from calamity.

original: yad aśnāsi yat pibasi dhānyaṃ kṛṣyāḥ payaḥ /
analyzed: yat aśnāsi yat pibasi dhānyam kṛṣyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Whatever you eat, whatever you drink, the grain from the field, the milk,

original: yad ādyaṃ yad anādyaṃ sarvaṃ te annam aviṣaṃ kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: yat ādyam yat anādyam sarvam te annam aviṣam kṛṇomi
translated: Whatever is the first, whatever is the last, I make all your food free from poison for you.

original: ahne ca tvā rātraye cobhābhyāṃ pari dadmasi /
analyzed: ahne ca tvā rātraye ca ubhābhyām pari dadmasi
translated: To the day and to the night, to both of them we entrust you.

original: arāyebhyo jighatsubhya imaṃ me pari rakṣata ////
analyzed: arāyebhyaḥ jighatsubhyaḥ imam me pari rakṣata
translated: From the spiteful ones who hunger, from them protect this one of mine.

original: śataṃ te 'yutaṃ hāyanān dve yuge trīṇi catvāri kṛṇmaḥ /
analyzed: śatam te yutam hāyanān dve yuge trīṇi catvāri kṛṇmaḥ
translated: We make for you a hundred, a myriad, two ages, three, four.

original: indrāgnī viśve devās te 'nu manyantām ahṛṇīyamānāḥ ////
analyzed: indra agnī viśve devāḥ te nu manyantām a hṛṇīyamānāḥ
translated: May Indra, Agni, and all the gods approve of you, being free from anger.

original: śarade tvā hemantāya vasantāya grīṣmāya pari dadmasi /
analyzed: śarade tvā hemantāya vasantāya grīṣmāya pari dadmasi
translated: To the autumn, to the winter, to the spring, to the summer we entrust you.

original: varṣāṇi tubhyaṃ syonāni yeṣu vardhanta oṣadhīḥ ////
analyzed: varṣāṇi tubhyam syonāni yeṣu vardhante oṣadhīḥ
translated: The pleasant rains for you, in which the plants grow.

original: mṛtyur īśe dvipadāṃ mṛtyur īśe catuṣpadām /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ īśe dvipadām mṛtyuḥ īśe catuṣpadām
translated: Death rules over bipeds, death rules over quadrupeds.

original: tasmāt tvāṃ mṛtyor gopater ud bharāmi sa mā bibheḥ ////
analyzed: tasmāt tvām mṛtyoḥ go pateḥ ud bharāmi sa mā bibheḥ
translated: From you, O death, the lord of cattle, I lift up. Do not be afraid of me.

original: so 'riṣṭa na mariṣyasi na mariṣyasi mā bibheḥ /
analyzed: saḥ riṣṭa na mariṣyasi na mariṣyasi mā bibheḥ
translated: You will not perish, you will not perish, do not be afraid.

original: na vai tatra mriyante no yanti adhamaṃ tamaḥ ////
analyzed: na vai tatra mriyante na u yanti adhamam tamaḥ
translated: For there they do not die, they do not go to the lowest darkness.

original: sarvo vai tatra jīvati gaur aśvaḥ puruṣaḥ paśuḥ /
analyzed: sarvaḥ vai tatra jīvati gauḥ aśvaḥ puruṣaḥ paśuḥ
translated: There all lives, the cow, the horse, the man, the animal.

original: yatredaṃ brahma kriyate paridhir jīvanāya kam ////
analyzed: yatra idam brahma kriyate paridhiḥ jīvanāya kam
translated: Where this Brahman is made for the sake of living a long life.

original: pari tvā pātu samānebhyo 'bhicārāt sabandhubhyaḥ /
analyzed: pari tvā pātu samānebhyaḥ bhicārāt sabandhubhyaḥ
translated: May it protect you from your equals, from witchcraft, from your relatives.

original: amamrir bhavāmṛto 'tijīvo mā te hāsiṣur asavaḥ śarīram ////
analyzed: amamriḥ bhava amṛtaḥ tijīvaḥ mā te hāsiṣuḥ asavaḥ śarīram
translated: Be immortal, live longer than life, let not your breaths leave your body.

original: ye mṛtyava ekaśataṃ yā nāṣṭrā atitāryāḥ /
analyzed: ye mṛtyavaḥ eka śatam yāḥ nāṣṭrāḥ atitāryāḥ
translated: The one hundred and one forms of death, the dangers to be overcome,

original: muñcantu tasmāt tvāṃ devā agner vaiśvānarād adhi ////
analyzed: muñcantu tasmāt tvām devāḥ agneḥ vaiśvānarāt adhi
translated: May the gods deliver you from them, from Agni Vaisvānara.

original: agneḥ śarīram asi pārayiṣṇu rakṣohāsi sapatnahā /
analyzed: agneḥ śarīram asi pārayiṣṇu rakṣaḥ hā asi sapatna hā
translated: You are the body of Agni, the protector, the slayer of demons, the destroyer of enemies.

original: atho amīvacātanaḥ pūtudrur nāma bheṣajam //// 🔽rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinam ā jigharmi mitraṃ prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma /
analyzed: atha u amīva cātanaḥ pūtudruḥ nāma bheṣajam  rakṣaḥ haṇam vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upa yāmi śarma
translated: And also the remover of disease, the medicine called Pūtudru.🔽I warm the powerful slayer of demons, I go for refuge to the widest friend.

original: śiśāno agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa no divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam ////🔽ayodaṃṣṭro arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ /
analyzed: śiśānaḥ agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam  ayaḥ daṃṣṭraḥ arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ
translated: Agni, sharpened by the sacrifices, may he protect us day and night from danger.🔽With your iron teeth, O all-knowing one, touch the demons with your flame, when kindled.

original: ā jihvayā mūradevān rabhasva kravyādo vṛṣṭvāpi dhatsvāsan ////
analyzed: ā jihvayā mūradevān rabhasva kravyādaḥ vṛṣṭvā api dhatsva āsan
translated: Seize the Mūladevas with your tongue, O flesh-eater, and burn the wicked.

original: ubhobhayāvinn upa dhehi daṃṣṭrau hiṃsraḥ śiśāno 'varaṃ paraṃ ca /
analyzed: ubhā ubhayāvin upa dhehi daṃṣṭrau hiṃsraḥ śiśānaḥ varam param ca
translated: Sharpen both your teeth, O destroyer, sharpened, fierce, below and above.

original: utāntarikṣe pari yāhy agne jambhaiḥ saṃ dhehy abhi yātudhānān ////
analyzed: uta antarikṣe pari yāhi agne jambhaiḥ sam dhehi abhi yātudhānān
translated: And, O Agni, as thou goest around in the atmosphere, with thy jaws crush the Yātudhānas.

original: agne tvacaṃ yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsrāśanir harasā hantv enam /
analyzed: agne tvacam yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsra aśaniḥ harasā hantu enam
translated: Break thou the skin of the Yātudhāna, O Agni; let the fierce thunderbolt with its flame slay him.

original: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyāt kraviṣṇur vi cinotv enam ////
analyzed: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyād kraviṣṇuḥ vi cinotu enam
translated: Cut thou his joints, O Jātavedas; let the flesh-eating, flesh-devouring one tear him in pieces.

original: yatredānīṃ paśyasi jātavedas tiṣṭhantam agna uta vā carantam /
analyzed: yatra idānīm paśyasi jātavedaḥ tiṣṭhantam agne uta vā carantam
translated: Where now thou seest him, O Jātavedas, O Agni, standing or moving about,

original: utāntarikṣe patantaṃ yātudhānaṃ tam astā vidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ ////
analyzed: uta antarikṣe patantam yātudhānam tam astā vidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ
translated: Or the Yātudhāna flying in the atmosphere, sharpen thy dart and pierce him.

original: yajñair iṣūḥ saṃnamamāno agne ivācā śalyāṃ aśanibhir dihānaḥ /🔽tābhir vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīco bāhūn prati bhaṅgdhy eṣām ////
analyzed: yajñaiḥ iṣūḥ saṃnamamānaḥ agne iva acā śalyām aśanibhiḥ dihānaḥ  tābhiḥ vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīcaḥ bāhūn prati bhaṅgdhi eṣām
translated: Sharpening thy arrows with sacrifices, O Agni, anointing thy shafts with thy flames,🔽With them pierce the Yātudhānas in their hearts; break their arms behind them.

original: utārabdhānt spṛnuhi jātaveda utārebhāṇāṃ ṛṣṭibhir yātudhānān /
analyzed: uta ārabdhān spṛnuhi jātavedaḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ yātudhānān
translated: And, O Jātavedas, crush those that are already crushed; and with thy spears crush the Yātudhānas that are to be crushed.

original: agne pūrvo ni jahi śośucāna āmādaḥ kṣviṅkās tam adantv enīḥ ////🔽iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ so agne yātudhāno ya idaṃ kṛṇoti /
analyzed: agne pūrvaḥ ni jahi śośucānaḥ āmādaḥ kṣviṅkāḥ tam adantu enīḥ 🔽iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ saḥ agne yātudhānaḥ yaḥ idam kṛṇoti
translated: Slay him first, O Agni, burning, let the raw-devouring dogs with spots eat him.

original: tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛcakṣasaś cakṣuṣe randhayainam ////
analyzed: tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛ cakṣasaḥ cakṣuṣe randhaya enam
translated: Seize him with fuel, O youngest one, and deliver him to the eye of the men-beholding one.

original: tīkṣṇenāgne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñaṃ prāñcaṃ vasubhyaḥ pra ṇaya pracetaḥ /
analyzed: tīkṣṇena agne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñam prāñcam vasubhyaḥ pra naya pracetaḥ
translated: With your sharp eye, O Agni, protect the sacrifice, and lead it forward to the Vasus, O wise one.

original: hiṃsraṃ rakṣāṃsy abhi śośucānaṃ mā tvā dabhan yātudhānā nṛcakṣaḥ ////
analyzed: hiṃsram rakṣāṃsi abhi śośucānam mā tvā dabhan yātudhānāḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: Let the Raksases not deceive you, O men-beholding one, as you burn fiercely against the Raksases.

original: nṛcakṣā rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi prati śṛṇīhy agrā /🔽tasyāgne pṛṣṭīr harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlaṃ yātudhānasya vṛśca ////
analyzed: nṛ cakṣāḥ rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi prati śṛṇīhi agrā  tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca
translated: Look around, O men-beholding one, upon the Raksases in the dwellings. Destroy three of their heads.🔽O Agni, crush their backs with your flame. Cut off in three places the root of the Yātudhāna.

original: trir yātudhānaḥ prasitiṃ ta etv ṛtaṃ yo agne anṛtena hanti /
analyzed: tris yātudhānaḥ prasitim te etu ṛtam yaḥ agne anṛtena hanti
translated: Let the Yātudhāna go three times to the noose, he who, O Agni, strikes with falsehood the one who speaks the truth.

original: tam arciṣā sphūrjayan jātavedaḥ samakṣam enam gṛṇate ni yuṅgdhi ////
analyzed: tam arciṣā sphūrjayan jātavedaḥ samakṣam enam gṛṇate ni yuṅgdhi
translated: O all-knower, impel him with your flame, and bind him in front of the singer.

original: yad agne adya mithunā śapāto yad vācas tṛṣṭaṃ janayanta rebhāḥ /
analyzed: yat agne adya mithunā śapātaḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ
translated: Whatever, O Agni, the pairs have cursed today, or the Ribus have generated with their angry words,

original: manyor manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān ////
analyzed: manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān
translated: The arrow is born from the mind and the heart. With that pierce the Yātudhānas in their hearts.

original: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parāgne rakṣo harasā śṛṇīhi /
analyzed: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā śṛṇīhi
translated: Crush the Yātudhānas with your heat, O Agni, crush the Raksas with your flame.

original: parārciṣā mūradevān chṛṇīhi parāsutṛpaḥ śośucataḥ śṛṇīhi ////
analyzed: parā arciṣā mūradevān śṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ śośucataḥ śṛṇīhi
translated: With thy highest flame destroy the demon-gods, destroy the burning ones with thy most deadly heat.

original: parādya devā vṛjinaṃ śṛṇantu pratyag enaṃ śapathā yantu sṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: parā adya devāḥ vṛjinam śṛṇantu pratyak enam śapathāḥ yantu sṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Let the gods cast off the sinner to a distance; let the curses uttered against him go back.

original: vācāstenaṃ śarava ṛchantu marman viśvasyaitu prasitiṃ yātudhānaḥ ////🔽yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yo aśvyena paśunā yātudhānaḥ /
analyzed: vācāstenam śaravaḥ ṛchantu marman viśvasya aitu prasitim yātudhānaḥ  yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yaḥ aśvyena paśunā yātudhānaḥ
translated: Let his vital parts be pierced by the words of the curse; let the demon go to the destruction of all.🔽He who is smeared with the blood of human beings, he who is a demon with the blood of a horse,

original: yo aghnyāyā bharati kṣīram agne teṣāṃ śīrṣāṇi harasāpi vṛśca ////🔽viṣaṃ gavāṃ yātudhānā bharantām ā vṛścantām aditaye durevāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ aghnyāyāḥ bharati kṣīram agne teṣām śīrṣāṇi harasā api vṛśca  viṣam gavām yātudhānāḥ bharantām ā vṛścantām aditaye durevāḥ
translated: He who milks the cow that should not be milked, O Agni, crush their heads with thy flame.🔽Let the demons bear away the poison of the cows; let the evil spirits be cut off from Aditi.

original: paraiṇān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnāṃ jayantām ////
analyzed: parā eṇān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnām jayantām
translated: Let the god Savitar give them to a distance; let them be defeated in the contest with the plants.

original: saṃvatsarīṇaṃ paya usriyāyās tasya māśīd yātudhāno nṛcakṣaḥ /🔽pīyūṣam agne yatamas titṛpsāt taṃ pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marmaṇi ////
analyzed: saṃvatsarīṇam payaḥ usriyāyāḥ tasya mā aśīt yātudhānaḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ  pīyūṣam agne yatamaḥ titṛpsāt tam pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marmaṇi
translated: The milk of the cow that is a year old, let not the demon with human eyes drink of it.🔽O Agni, with thy flame pierce to the vitals him who would fain satisfy himself with thy sweet juice.

original: sanād agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ /
analyzed: sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ
translated: From of old, O Agni, thou crushest the demons; the Rakshas have not conquered thee in the battles.

original: sahamūrān anu daha kravyādo mā te hetyā mukṣata daivyāyāḥ ////
analyzed: sahamūrān anu daha kravyādaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ
translated: Burn up the flesh-eaters along with the Mūras; let not the dart of the divine one strike thee.

original: tvaṃ no agne adharād udaktas tvaṃ paścād uta rakṣā purastāt /
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne adharāt udaktas tvam paścāt uta rakṣa purastāt
translated: From below, O Agni, from above, from behind, and from the front, protect us.

original: prati tye te ajarāsas tapiṣṭhā aghaśaṃsaṃ śośucato dahantu ////🔽paścāt purastād adharād utottarāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhy agne /
analyzed: prati tye te ajarāsaḥ tapiṣṭhāḥ agha śaṃsam śośucataḥ dahantu  paścāt purastāt adharāt uta uttarāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhi agne
translated: Let thy most burning, undecaying flames burn up the evil-doer, the scorcher.🔽From behind, from the front, from below, and from above, O Agni, the sage, protect us with thy wisdom.

original: sakhā sakhāyam ajaro jarimne agne martāṃ amartyas tvaṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: sakhā sakhāyam ajaraḥ jarimne agne martām amartyaḥ tvam naḥ  /
translated: Be thou, O Agni, to thy friend, the immortal one, to the mortal one, a friend, O immortal one.

original: tad agne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujo yena paśyasi yātudhānān /
analyzed: tat agne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujaḥ yena paśyasi yātudhānān
translated: O Agni, the singer, place that eye in thee, whereby thou seest the sorcerers.

original: atharvavaj jyotiṣā daivyena satyaṃ dhūrvantam acitaṃ nyoṣa ////
analyzed: atharva vat jyotiṣā daivyena satyam dhūrvantam acitam nyoṣa
translated: With the divine light of the Atharvan, carry away the lying, wicked one, as with a hook.

original: pari tvāgne puraṃ vayaṃ vipraṃ sahasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi
translated: We will place thee, O Agni, the sage, the warrior, in the citadel, the wise one,

original: dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ divedive hantāraṃ bhaṅgurāvataḥ ////
analyzed: dhṛṣat varṇam dive dive hantāram bhaṅgurāvataḥ
translated: The tawny-coloured one, day by day, the destroyer of the unsteady one.

original: viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati sma rakṣaso jahi /🔽agne tigmena śociṣā tapuragrābhir arcibhiḥ ////
analyzed: viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati sma rakṣasaḥ jahi  agne tigmena śociṣā tapuḥ agrābhiḥ arcibhiḥ
translated: With poison, O unsteady one, strike down the Rākṣasas.🔽O Agni, with thy sharp flame, with thy most impetuous flames.

original: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty agnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā /
analyzed: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ āvis viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā
translated: Agni shines with great light, he makes all things manifest through his greatness.

original: prādevīr māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣobhyo vinikṣe ////
analyzed: pra adevīḥ māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅge rakṣobhyaḥ vinikṣe
translated: He endures the godless and far-reaching illusions, he sharpens his horns to strike down the Rakshasas.

original: ye te śṛṅge ajare jātavedas tigmahetī brahmasaṃśite /
analyzed: ye te śṛṅge ajare jātavedaḥ tigma hetī brahma saṃśite
translated: O all-knowing one, your horns that are ageless, with sharp weapons, sharpened by prayer,

original: tābhyāṃ durhārdam abhidāsantaṃ kimīdinaṃ /
analyzed: tābhyām durhārdam abhidāsantam kimīdinam
translated: With them strike down the evil-hearted, the Kīdā king,

original: pratyañcam arciṣā jātavedo vi nikṣva ////
analyzed: pratyañcam arciṣā jātavedaḥ vi nikṣva
translated: Turn him back with your flame, O all-knowing one, strike him down!

original: agnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukraśocir amartyaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukra śociḥ amartyaḥ
translated: Agni drives away the Rakshasas with his bright flame, the immortal one,

original: śuciḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ ////
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvakaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: The pure, purifying one, to be praised.

original: indrāsomā tapataṃ rakṣa ubjataṃ ny arpayataṃ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: indrāsomā tapatam rakṣaḥ ubjatam ni arpayatam vṛṣaṇā tamaḥ vṛdhaḥ
translated: O Indra and Soma, scorch the Rakshasas, crush them, O mighty ones, destroy the darkness-increasing ones.

original: parā śṛṇītam acito ny oṣataṃ hataṃ nudethāṃ ni śiśītam attriṇaḥ ////
analyzed: parā śṛṇītam acitaḥ ni oṣatam hatam nudethām ni śiśītam attriṇaḥ
translated: Destroy the wicked ones, crush them down, drive away the slain, cool down the flesh-eaters!

original: indrāsomā sam aghaśaṃsam abhy aghaṃ tapur yayastu carur agnimāṃ iva /
analyzed: indrāsomā sam agha śaṃsam abhī agham tapuḥ yayastu caruḥ agni mān iva
translated: O Indra and Soma, strike down the evil-doer, burn him up like one who has fire in his mouth.

original: brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattam anavāyaṃ kimīdine ////
analyzed: brahma dviṣe kravya ade ghora cakṣase dveṣaḥ dhattam anavāyam kimīdine
translated: Give hatred to the one who hates the Veda, the flesh-eater with a terrible eye, to the Kīdā king who is not to be overcome.

original: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antar anārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam /
analyzed: indrāsomā duṣkṛtaḥ vavre antar an ārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam
translated: O Indra and Soma, pierce the evil-doer into the darkness that has no support,

original: yato naiṣāṃ punar ekaś canodayat tad vām astu sahase manyumac chavaḥ ////
analyzed: yatas na eṣām punar ekaḥ cana udayat tat vām astu sahase manyumat śavaḥ
translated: From which not even one of them may rise again. Let that be your strength, O you two who have anger for your might!

original: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divo vadhaṃ saṃ pṛthivyā aghaśaṃsāya tarhaṇam /
analyzed: indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ vadham sam pṛthivyāḥ agha śaṃsāya tarhaṇam
translated: Indra and Soma, hurl your weapon from the sky, and from the earth a dart against the wicked man.

original: ut takṣataṃ parvatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṃ nijūrvathaḥ ////
analyzed: ud takṣatam svaryam parvatebhyaḥ yena rakṣaḥ vāvṛdhānam nijūrvathaḥ
translated: Sharpen the thunderbolt from out the mountains, wherewith ye drive away the waxen Raksas.

original: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divas pary agnitaptebhir yuvam aśmahanmabhiḥ /
analyzed: indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ pari agni taptebhiḥ yuvam aśma hanmabhiḥ
translated: Indra and Soma, roll your bolt around the sky, ye with your stones that burn like fire, that crush to pieces.

original: tapurvadhebhir ajarebhir attriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṃ yantu nisvaram ////
analyzed: tapuḥ vadhebhiḥ ajarebhiḥ attriṇaḥ ni parśāne vidhyatam yantu nisvaram
translated: With your consuming, everlasting weapons, pierce through the greedy demons to the vitals. Let them go forth with a whizzing sound.

original: indrāsomā pari vāṃ bhūtu viśvata iyaṃ matiḥ kakṣyāśveva vājinā /
analyzed: indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvatas iyam matiḥ kakṣyā aśvā iva vājinā
translated: Indra and Soma, may this thought of ours, like a well-harnessed horse, go round about you both.

original: yāṃ vāṃ hotrāṃ parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatī iva jinvatam ////
analyzed: yām vām hotrām parihinomi medhayā imā brahmāṇi nṛpatī iva jinvatam
translated: The worship which I offer to you for your exaltation, accept ye, as two princes accept the prayers of the people.

original: prati smarethāṃ tujayadbhir evair hataṃ druho rakṣaso bhaṅgurāvataḥ /
analyzed: prati smarethām tujayadbhiḥ evaiḥ hatam druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ
translated: Remember ye the victory-winning deeds of old, the Raksas, the wicked, the unsteady one, whom ye slew.

original: indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sugaṃ bhūd yo mā kadā cid abhidāsati druhuḥ ////
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūt yaḥ mā kadā cit abhidāsati druhuḥ
translated: Indra and Soma, let not the wicked man find ease who ever injures and reviles me.

original: yo mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhir vacobhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhiḥ vacobhiḥ
translated: He who with evil thoughts and with untruthful words reviles me as I go my way with food to eat,

original: āpa iva kāśinā samgṛbhītā asann astv asataḥ indra vaktā ////
analyzed: āpaḥ iva kāśinā samgṛbhītāḥ asan astu asataḥ indra vaktā
translated: Let him, O Indra, be as one who hath no tongue, as one who hath no hands to grasp the water-jar.

original: ye pākaśaṃsaṃ viharanta evair ye vā bhadraṃ dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ /
analyzed: ye pāka śaṃsam viharante evaiḥ ye vā bhadram dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ
translated: Those who, with their own nature, disturb the sacrifice, or who defile the good with their own nature,

original: ahaye vā tān pradadātu soma ā vā dadhātu nirṛter upaṣṭhe ////
analyzed: ahaye vā tān pradadātu somaḥ ā vā dadhātu nirṛteḥ upaṣṭhe
translated: May Soma give them to the snake, or may he place them on the lap of Nirriti.

original: yo no rasaṃ dipsati pitvo agne aśvānāṃ gavāṃ yas tanūnām /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ rasam dipsati pitvaḥ agne aśvānām gavām yaḥ tanūnām
translated: O Agni, he who would injure our sap, whether it be of horses, cows, or our bodies,

original: ripu stena steyakṛd dabhram etu ni ṣa hīyatāṃ tanvā tanā ca ////
analyzed: ripuḥ stenaḥ steya kṛt dabhram etu ni sa hīyatām tanvā tanā ca
translated: May the enemy, the thief, the stealer, go to ruin. May he be separated from his body and his offspring.

original: paraḥ so astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīr adho astu viśvāḥ /
analyzed: paras saḥ astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ adhas astu viśvāḥ
translated: May he be far away from us, both in body and in offspring. May he be under all the three earths.

original: prati śuṣyatu yaśo asya devā yo mā divā dipsati yaś ca naktam ////
