original: sa tau pra veda sa u tau ciketa yāv asyāḥ stanau sahasradhārāv akṣitau /
analyzed: sa tau pra veda saḥ u tau ciketa yau asyāḥ stanau sahasra dhārau akṣitau
translated: He knows those two, he understands those two, the two inexhaustible thousand-streamed breasts of hers.

original: ūrjaṃ duhāte anapasphurantau ////
analyzed: ūrjam duhāte an apasphurantau
translated: They yield strength, not dripping away.

original: hiṅkarikratī bṛhatī vayodhā uccairghoṣābhyeti yā vratam /
analyzed: hiṅkarikratī bṛhatī vayaḥ dhāḥ uccairghoṣā abhyeti yā vratam
translated: The loud-sounding one, the great one who supports life, who goes to the vow, with the sound of him-kara-kri.

original: trīn gharmān abhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyuṃ payate payobhiḥ ////
analyzed: trīn gharmān abhi vāvaśānā mimāti māyum payate payobhiḥ
translated: For three summers, lowing, she milks out her life-sap, the cow, with her milk.

original: yām āpīnām upasīdanty āpaḥ śākvarā vṛṣabhā ye svarājaḥ /
analyzed: yām āpīnām upasīdanti āpaḥ śākvarāḥ vṛṣabhāḥ ye sva rājaḥ
translated: The waters which the Shakra-like bulls, the self-ruling ones, approach when they are swollen,

original: te varṣanti te varṣayanti tadvide kāmam ūrjam āpaḥ ////
analyzed: te varṣanti te varṣayanti tad vide kāmam ūrjam āpaḥ
translated: they rain, they cause to rain, for one who knows that, the desired strength, the waters.

original: stanayitnus te vāk prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmaṃ kṣipasi bhūmyām adhi /
analyzed: stanayitnuḥ te vāc prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmam kṣipasi bhūmyām adhi
translated: Thy voice, O Prajapati, is the thunder; thou castest forth strength, the bull, upon the earth.

original: agner vātān madhukaśā hi jajñe marutām ugrā naptiḥ ////
analyzed: agneḥ vātāt madhu kaśā hi jajñe marutām ugrā naptiḥ
translated: The sweet-voiced one was born from the winds of Agni, the fierce granddaughter of the Maruts.

original: yathā somaḥ prātaḥsavane aśvinor bhavati priyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ prātaḥsavane aśvinoḥ bhavati priyaḥ
translated: As Soma becomes dear to the Ashvins at the morning pressing,

original: evā me aśvinā varca ātmani dhriyatām ////
analyzed: eva me aśvinā varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām
translated: so, O Ashvins, may splendour be established in my soul.

original: yathā somo dvitīye savana indrāgnyor bhavati priyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ dvitīye savane indra agnyoḥ bhavati priyaḥ
translated: As Soma becomes dear to Indra and Agni at the second pressing,

original: evā ma indrāgnī varca ātmani dhriyatām ////
analyzed: eva me indra agnī varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām
translated: so, O Indra and Agni, may splendour be established in my soul.

original: yathā somas tṛtīye savana ṛbhūṇāṃ bhavati priyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā somaḥ tṛtīye savane ṛbhūṇām bhavati priyaḥ
translated: As Soma becomes dear to the Ribhus at the third pressing,

original: evā ma ṛbhavo varca ātmani dhriyatām ////
analyzed: eva me ṛbhavaḥ varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām
translated: so, O Ribhus, may splendour be established in my soul.

original: madhu janiṣīya madhu vaṃsiṣīya /🔽payasvān agna āgamaṃ taṃ mā saṃ sṛja varcasā ////
analyzed: madhu janiṣīya madhu vaṃsiṣīya  payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā
translated: Be sweet to generate, be sweet to win.🔽I have come, O Agni, with milk; unite me with splendour.

original: saṃ māgne varcasā sṛja saṃ prajayā sam āyuṣā /
analyzed: sam mā agne varcasā sṛja sam prajayā sam āyuṣā
translated: Unite me, O Agni, with splendour, unite me with offspring, unite me with life.

original: vidyur me asya devā indro vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ ////
analyzed: vidyuḥ me asya devāḥ indraḥ vidyāt saha ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: May the gods know this of me, may Indra know it with the Rishis.

original: yathā madhu madhukṛtaḥ saṃbharanti madhāv adhi /
analyzed: yathā madhu madhukṛtaḥ saṃbharanti madhau adhi
translated: As the honey-makers collect honey on honey,

original: evā me aśvinā varca ātmani dhriyatām ////
analyzed: eva me aśvinā varcaḥ ātmani dhriyatām
translated: so, O Asvins, may my radiance be established in my soul.

original: yathā makṣāḥ idaṃ madhu nyañjanti madhāv adhi /
analyzed: yathā makṣāḥ idam madhu nyañjanti madhau adhi
translated: As the bees besmear this honey on honey,

original: evā me aśvinā varcas tejo balam ojaś ca dhriyatām ////
analyzed: eva me aśvinā varcaḥ tejaḥ balam ojaḥ ca dhriyatām
translated: so, O Asvins, may my radiance, splendor, strength, and vigor be established in me.

original: yad giriṣu parvateṣu goṣv aśveṣu yan madhu /
analyzed: yat giriṣu parvateṣu goṣu aśveṣu yat madhu
translated: The honey that is in the mountains, in the hills, in the cows, in the horses,

original: surāyāṃ sicyamānāyāṃ yat tatra madhu tan mayi ////
analyzed: surāyām sicyamānāyām yat tatra madhu tat mayi
translated: the honey that is in the Soma being pressed, may that honey be in me.

original: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā madhunāṅktaṃ śubhas patī /
analyzed: aśvinā sāragheṇa mā madhunā aṅktam śubhaḥ patī
translated: O Asvins, lords of splendor, anoint me with honey from the Sāragha plant,

original: yathā varcasvatīṃ vācam āvadāni janāṃ anu ////
analyzed: yathā varcasvatīm vācam āvadāni janān anu
translated: so that I may utter radiant speech among the people.

original: stanayitnus te vāk prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmaṃ kṣipasi bhūmyāṃ divi /
analyzed: stanayitnuḥ te vāc prajāpate vṛṣā śuṣmam kṣipasi bhūmyām divi
translated: O Prajapati, your voice is the thunder, you cast forth strength on the earth and in the sky.

original: tāṃ paśava upa jīvanti sarve teno seṣam ūrjaṃ piparti ////
analyzed: tām paśavaḥ upa jīvanti sarve tena u sā iṣam ūrjam piparti
translated: All the creatures depend on that, by it he nourishes the remaining food.

original: pṛthivī daṇḍo 'ntarikṣaṃ garbho dyauḥ kaśā vidyut prakaśo hiraṇyayo binduḥ ////
analyzed: pṛthivī daṇḍaḥ ntarikṣam garbhaḥ dyauḥ kaśā vidyut prakaśaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ binduḥ
translated: The earth is the staff, the atmosphere is the womb, the sky is the whip, the lightning is the light, the golden drop.

original: yo vai kaśāyāḥ sapta madhūni veda madhumān bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ vai kaśāyāḥ sapta madhūni veda madhumān bhavati
translated: One who knows the seven honey-like things of the whip becomes rich in honey.

original: brāhmaṇaś ca rājā ca dhenuś cānaḍvāṃś ca vrīhiś ca yavaś ca madhu saptamam ////
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ ca rājā ca dhenuḥ ca anaḍvān ca vrīhiḥ ca yavaḥ ca madhu saptamam
translated: The Brāhmaṇa, the king, the cow, the ox, the rice, the barley, and honey as the seventh.

original: madhumān bhavati madhumad asyāhāryaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: madhumān bhavati madhumat asya āhāryam bhavati
translated: He becomes possessed of honey, his food becomes possessed of honey.

original: madhumato lokān jayati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: madhumataḥ lokān jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He wins the worlds possessed of honey, who knows thus.

original: yad vīdhre stanayati prajāpatir eva tat prajābhyaḥ prādur bhavati /
analyzed: yat vīdhre stanayati prajāpatiḥ eva tat prajābhyaḥ prādur bhavati
translated: When it thunders in the clouds, then Prajāpati appears for the creatures.

original: tasmāt prācīnopavītas tiṣṭhe prajāpate 'nu mā budhyasveti /
analyzed: tasmāt prācīna upavītaḥ tiṣṭhe prajāpate nu mā budhyasva iti
translated: Therefore, wearing the sacred thread over the right shoulder, he should stand, saying, 'O Prajāpati, be aware of me.'

original: anv enaṃ prajā anu prajāpatir budhyate ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: anu enam prajāḥ anu prajāpatiḥ budhyate yaḥ evam veda
translated: Prajāpati becomes aware of him, who knows thus.

original: sapatnahanam ṛṣabhaṃ ghṛtena kāmaṃ śikṣāmi haviṣājyena /
analyzed: sapatna hanam ṛṣabham ghṛtena kāmam śikṣāmi haviṣā ājyena
translated: The enemy-slayer, the bull, I instruct with ghee, with sacrificial food, with clarified butter, according to my desire.

original: nīcaiḥ sapatnān mama padaya tvam abhiṣṭuto mahatā vīryeṇa ////
analyzed: nīcaiḥ sapatnān mama tvam abhiṣṭutaḥ mahatā vīryeṇa
translated: With great strength, when praised, make my enemies lie low.

original: yan me manaso na priyaṃ cakṣuṣo yan me babhasti nābhinandati /🔽tad duṣvapnyaṃ prati muñcāmi sapatne kāmaṃ stutvod ahaṃ bhideyam ////
analyzed: yat me manasaḥ na priyam cakṣuṣaḥ yat me babhasti na abhinandati  tat duṣvapnyam prati muñcāmi sapatne kāmam stutvā ud aham bhideyam
translated: Whatever is not pleasing to my mind, whatever does not delight my eye,🔽I release that evil dream upon my enemy. Having praised my desire, I would break it.

original: duṣvapnyaṃ kāma duritaṃ ca kamāprajastām asvagatām avartim /
analyzed: duṣvapnyam kāma duritam ca kama aprajastām avartim
translated: O desire, I release upon my enemy the evil dream, the evil deed, the childlessness, the misfortune, the misfortune that has come.

original: ugra īśānaḥ prati muñca tasmin yo asmabhyam aṃhūraṇā cikitsāt ////
analyzed: ugraḥ īśānaḥ prati muñca tasmin yaḥ asmabhyam aṃhūraṇā cikitsāt
translated: O fierce one, O lord, release him in that place, who seeks to harm us.

original: nudasva kāma pra ṇudasva kāmāvartiṃ yantu mama ye sapatnāḥ /
analyzed: nudasva kāma pra nudasva kāma avartim yantu mama ye sapatnāḥ
translated: Drive away, O Kāma, drive away the desires of those who are my enemies, let them go to destruction.

original: teṣāṃ nuttānām adhamā tamāṃsy agne vāstūni nir daha tvam ////
analyzed: teṣām nuttānām adhamā tamāṃsi agne vāstūni niḥ daha tvam
translated: Of those who are driven away, O Agni, burn the lowest darkness and the abodes.

original: sā te kāma duhitā dhenur ucyate yām āhur vācaṃ kavayo virājam /
analyzed: sā te kāma duhitā dhenuḥ ucyate yām āhuḥ vācam kavayaḥ virājam
translated: O Kāma, that daughter of yours is called a cow, which the wise call speech, the supreme.

original: tayā sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pary enān prāṇaḥ paśavo jīvanaṃ vṛṇaktu ////
analyzed: tayā sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pari enān prāṇaḥ paśavaḥ jīvanam vṛṇaktu
translated: With that, O Kāma, drive away my enemies, let vital breath, cattle and life drive them away.

original: kāmasyendrasya varuṇasya rājño viṣṇor balena savituḥ savena /
analyzed: kāmasya indrasya varuṇasya rājñaḥ viṣṇoḥ balena savituḥ savena
translated: By the power of Kāma, Indra, the king Varuna, Vishnu, the impulse of Savita,

original: agner hotreṇa pra ṇude sapatnāṃ chambīva nāvam udakeṣu dhīraḥ ////
analyzed: agneḥ hotreṇa pra nude sapatnām chambī iva nāvam udakeṣu dhīraḥ
translated: By the Hotr of Agni, I drive away the enemies, like a skillful man drives a boat in the water.

original: adhyakṣo vājī mama kāma ugraḥ kṛṇotu mahyam asapatnam eva /
analyzed: adhyakṣaḥ vājī mama kāmaḥ ugraḥ kṛṇotu mahyam asapatnam eva
translated: The powerful, fierce Kāma, the overseer, let him make me free from enemies.

original: viśve devā mama nāthaṃ bhavantu sarve devā havam ā yantu ma imam ////
analyzed: viśve devāḥ mama nātham bhavantu sarve devāḥ havam ā yantu me imam
translated: May all the gods be my protectors, may all the gods come to this invocation of mine.

original: idam ājyaṃ ghṛtavaj juṣāṇāḥ kāmajyeṣṭhā iha mādayadhvam /
analyzed: idam ājyam ghṛtavat juṣāṇāḥ kāma jyeṣṭhāḥ iha mādayadhvam
translated: Accepting this clarified butter, full of ghee, O Kāma, rejoice here,

original: kṛṇvanto mahyam asapatnam eva ////
analyzed: kṛṇvantaḥ mahyam asapatnam eva
translated: making me free from enemies.

original: indrāgnī kāma sarathaṃ hi bhūtvā nīcaiḥ sapatnān mama pādayāthaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī kāma sa ratham hi bhūtvā nīcaiḥ sapatnān mama pādayāthaḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, O Kāma, having become a swift chariot, trample down my enemies.

original: teṣāṃ pannānām adhamā tamāṃsy agne vāstūny anunirdaha tvam ////
analyzed: teṣām pannānām adhamā tamāṃsi agne vāstūni anunirdaha tvam
translated: Burn up the lowest of their dwellings, O Agni, the darkest of their dark places.

original: jahi tvam kāma mama ye sapatnā andhā tamāṃsy ava pādayainān /
analyzed: jahi tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ andhā tamāṃsi ava pādaya enān
translated: Kill, O Kāma, my enemies. Cast them down into the darkest darkness.

original: nirindriyā arasāḥ santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamac canāhaḥ ////
analyzed: nirindriyāḥ arasāḥ santu sarve mā te jīviṣuḥ katamat cana ahar
translated: Let them all be powerless and lifeless. Let none of them live even for a day.

original: avadhīt kāmo mama ye sapatnā uruṃ lokam akaran mahyam edhatum /
analyzed: avadhīt kāmaḥ mama ye sapatnāḥ urum lokam akarat mahyam edhatum
translated: Kāma has killed my enemies. He has made a wide world for me to prosper.

original: mahyaṃ namantāṃ pradiśaś catasro mahyaṃ ṣaḍ urvīr ghṛtam ā vahantu ////
analyzed: mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ mahyam ṣaḍ urvīḥ ghṛtam ā vahantu
translated: Let the four quarters bow down to me. Let them bring me ghee, the six expanses.

original: te 'dharāñcaḥ pra plavantāṃ chinnā naur iva bandhanāt /
analyzed: te dharāñcaḥ pra plavantām chinnā nauḥ iva bandhanāt
translated: Let them fall headlong, like a ship cut from its moorings.

original: na sāyakapraṇuttānāṃ punar asti nivartanam ////
analyzed: na sāyaka praṇuttānām punar asti nivartanam
translated: There is no turning back for those driven away by the arrow.

original: agnir yava indro yavaḥ somo yavaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ yavaḥ indraḥ yavaḥ somaḥ yavaḥ
translated: Agni is the grain, Indra is the grain, Soma is the grain.

original: yavayāvāno devā yavayantv enam ////
analyzed: yava yāvānaḥ devāḥ yavayantu enam
translated: May the gods who are the grains drive him away.

original: asarvavīraś caratu praṇutto dveṣyo mitrānāṃ parivargyaḥ svānām /
analyzed: a sarva vīraḥ caratu praṇuttaḥ dveṣyaḥ mitrānām parivargyaḥ svānām
translated: Let him wander about, deprived of all his men, rejected, hateful to friends, an outcast from his own people.

original: uta pṛthivyām ava syanti vidyuta ugro vo devaḥ pra mṛṇat sapatnān ////
analyzed: uta pṛthivyām ava syanti vidyutaḥ ugraḥ vaḥ devaḥ pra mṛṇat sapatnān
translated: Let the lightning flash upon the earth. Let your fierce god crush your enemies.

original: cyutā ceyaṃ bṛhaty acyutā ca vidyud bibharti stanayitnūṃś ca sarvān /
analyzed: cyutā ca iyam bṛhatī acyutā ca vidyut bibharti stanayitnūn ca sarvān
translated: This great cloud, though falling, is not falling, and bears all the lightning and thunderbolts.

original: udyann ādityo draviṇena tejasā nīcaiḥ sapatnān nudatāṃ me sahasvān ////
analyzed: udyan ādityaḥ draviṇena tejasā nīcaiḥ sapatnān nudatām me sahasvān
translated: May the rising sun, with wealth and splendor, drive away my enemies and make me invincible.

original: yat te kāma śarma trivarūtham udbhu brahma varma vitatam anativyādhyaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yat te kāma śarma tri varūtham udbhu brahma varma vitatam an ativyādhyam kṛtam
translated: Whatever, O Kāma, is your shelter with three ramparts, your Brahman-armor spread out, invincible,

original: tena sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pary enān prāṇaḥ paśavo jīvanaṃ vṛṇaktu ////
analyzed: tena sapatnān pari vṛṅgdhi ye mama pari enān prāṇaḥ paśavaḥ jīvanam vṛṇaktu
translated: with that drive away my enemies. May my vital breath, cattle, and life choose them around.

original: yena devā asurān prāṇudanta yenendro dasyūn adhamaṃ tamo nināya /
analyzed: yena devāḥ asurān prāṇudanta yena indraḥ dasyūn adhamam tamaḥ nināya
translated: By which the gods drove away the Asuras, by which Indra drove the Dasyus to the lowest darkness,

original: tena tvaṃ kāma mama ye sapatnās tān asmāl lokāt pra ṇudasva dūram ////
analyzed: tena tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ tān asmāt lokāt pra nudasva dūram
translated: by that, O Kāma, drive those enemies of mine far away from this world.

original: yathā devā asurān prāṇudanta yathendro dasyūn adhamaṃ tamo babādhe /
analyzed: yathā devāḥ asurān prāṇudanta yathā indraḥ dasyūn adhamam tamaḥ babādhe
translated: As the gods drove away the Asuras, as Indra smote the Dasyus to the lowest darkness,

original: tathā tvaṃ kāma mama ye sapatnās tān asmāl lokāt pra ṇudasva dūram ////
analyzed: tathā tvam kāma mama ye sapatnāḥ tān asmāt lokāt pra nudasva dūram
translated: so, O Kāma, drive those enemies of mine far away from this world.

original: kāmo jajñe prathamo nainaṃ devā āpuḥ pitaro na martyāḥ /
analyzed: kāmaḥ jajñe prathamaḥ na enam devāḥ āpuḥ pitaraḥ na martyāḥ
translated: Kāma was born first. Neither gods, nor fathers, nor mortals obtained him.

original: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahāṃs tasmai te kāma nama it kṛnomi ////
analyzed: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛnomi
translated: Then you are greater, all-supporting, great. To you, O Kāma, I offer this homage.

original: yāvatī dyāvāpṛthivī varimṇā yāvad āpaḥ siṣyadur yāvad agniḥ /
analyzed: yāvatī dyāvāpṛthivī varimṇā yāvat āpaḥ siṣyaduḥ yāvat agniḥ
translated: As far as heaven and earth extend in breadth, as far as the waters have flowed, as far as Agni,

original: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahāṃs tasmai te kāma nama it kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi
translated: From that thou art greater, all-sustaining, great. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this homage.

original: yāvatīr diśaḥ pradiśo viṣūcīr yāvatīr āśā abhicakṣaṇā divaḥ /
analyzed: yāvatīḥ diśaḥ pradiśaḥ viṣūcīḥ yāvatīḥ āśāḥ abhicakṣaṇāḥ divaḥ
translated: As far as the directions, the intermediate directions, the zenith and nadir, as far as the regions of heaven,

original: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahāṃs tasmai te kāma nama it kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi
translated: From that thou art greater, all-sustaining, great. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this homage.

original: yāvatīr bhṛṅgā jatvaḥ kurūravo yāvatīr vaghā vṛkṣasarpyo babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yāvatīḥ bhṛṅgāḥ jatvaḥ kurūravaḥ yāvatīḥ vaghāḥ vṛkṣasarpyaḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: As far as the bees, the birds, the Kurūravas, as far as the snakes that creep in the trees,

original: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahāṃs tasmai te kāma nama it kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi
translated: From that thou art greater, all-sustaining, great. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this homage.

original: jyāyān nimiṣato 'si tiṣṭhato jyāyānt samudrād asi kāma manyo /
analyzed: jyāyān nimiṣataḥ si tiṣṭhataḥ jyāyān samudrāt asi kāma manyo
translated: Thou art greater than the blinking and standing, greater than the ocean, O Kāma, O Manyu.

original: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahāṃs tasmai te kāma nama it kṛnomi ////
analyzed: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛnomi
translated: From that thou art greater, all-sustaining, great. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this homage.

original: na vai vātaś cana kāmam āpnoti nāgniḥ sūryo nota candramāḥ /
analyzed: na vai vātaḥ cana kāmam āpnoti na agniḥ sūryaḥ na uta candramāḥ
translated: The wind never attains its desire, nor Agni, nor Sūrya, nor the moon.

original: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahāṃs tasmai te kāma nama it kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: tatas tvam asi jyāyān viśvahā mahān tasmai te kāma namaḥ id kṛṇomi
translated: From that thou art greater, all-sustaining, great. To thee, O Kāma, I offer this homage.

original: yās te śivās tanvaḥ kāma bhadrā yābhiḥ satyaṃ bhavati yad vṛṇiṣe /
analyzed: yāḥ te śivāḥ tanvaḥ kāma bhadrāḥ yābhiḥ satyam bhavati yat vṛṇiṣe
translated: O Kāma, whatever auspicious and auspicious forms you have, by which you become true when you choose,

original: tābhiṣ ṭvam asmāṃ abhisaṃviśasvānyatra pāpīr apa veśayā dhiyaḥ ////
analyzed: tābhiḥ tvam asmām abhisaṃviśasva anyatra pāpīḥ apa veśaya dhiyaḥ
translated: with them do you enter into us. Drive away the evil thoughts to another place.

original: upamitāṃ pratimitām atho parimitām uta /🔽śālāyā viśvavārāyā naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: upamitām pratimitām atha u parimitām uta  śālāyāḥ viśva vārāyāḥ naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi
translated: The measured, the counter-measured, and also the measured around,🔽the fastenings of the house that has all desires, we loosen.

original: yat te naddhaṃ viśvavāre pāśo granthiś ca yaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yat te naddham viśva vāre pāśaḥ granthiḥ ca yaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Whatever fastening you have, O all-prosperous one, the noose and the knot that is made,

original: bṛhaspatir ivāhaṃ balaṃ vācā vi sraṃsayāmi tat ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ iva aham balam vācā vi sraṃsayāmi tat
translated: like Brihaspati, I loosen that power with speech.

original: ā yayāma saṃ babarha granthīṃś cakāra te dṛḍhān /
analyzed: ā yayāma sam babarha granthīn cakāra te dṛḍhān
translated: He who has brought you, has firmly set the knots,

original: parūṃṣi vidvāṃ chastevendreṇa vi cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: parūṃṣi vidvān śastā iva indreṇa vi cṛtāmasi
translated: the parts, as if with a sharp knife. We loosen them with Indra.

original: vaṃśānāṃ te nahanānāṃ prāṇāhasya tṛṇasya ca /
analyzed: vaṃśānām te nahanānām prāṇāhasya tṛṇasya ca
translated: Of your bamboos, your fastenings, your life-breath, and your grass,

original: pakṣāṇāṃ viśvavāre te naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: pakṣāṇām viśva vāre te naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi
translated: the wings, O all-prosperous one, we loosen your fastenings.

original: saṃdaṃśānāṃ paladānāṃ pariṣvañjalyasya ca /🔽idaṃ mānasya patnyā naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: saṃdaṃśānām paladānām pariṣvañjalyasya ca  idam mānasya patnyāḥ naddhāni vi cṛtāmasi
translated: Of your tongs, your trays, and your ladle,🔽of this wife of the measurer, we loosen the fastenings.

original: yāni te 'ntaḥ śikyāny ābedhū raṇyāya kam /
analyzed: yāni te ntar śikyāni ābedhuḥ raṇyāya kam
translated: The pegs that you have driven in for the sake of the forest,

original: pra te tāni cṛtāmasi śivā mānasya patni na uddhitā tanve bhava ////
analyzed: pra te tāni cṛtāmasi śivā mānasya patni naḥ uddhitā tanve bhava
translated: We loosen those bonds of thine, O auspicious one, O wife of Manasyu, that they may not rise up and injure thy body.

original: havirdhānam agniśālaṃ patnīnāṃ sadanaṃ sadaḥ /
analyzed: havirdhānam agni śālam patnīnām sadanam sadaḥ
translated: The sacrificial shed, the fire-chamber, the seat of the wives, the assembly,

original: sado devānām asi devi śāle ////
analyzed: sadaḥ devānām asi devi śāle
translated: thou art the assembly of the gods, O goddess, O house.

original: akṣum opaśaṃ vitataṃ sahasrākṣaṃ viṣūvati /
analyzed: akṣum opaśam vitatam sahasra akṣam viṣūvati
translated: The axle, the prop, the thousand-eyed one, we loosen that is stretched across.

original: avanaddham abhihitaṃ brahmaṇā vi cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: avanaddham abhihitam brahmaṇā vi cṛtāmasi
translated: The fastened, the announced, we loosen with prayer.

original: yas tvā śāle pratigṛhṇāti yena cāsi mitā tvam /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā śāle pratigṛhṇāti yena ca asi mitā tvam
translated: He who receives thee, O house, and by whom thou art measured,

original: ubhau mānasya patni tau jīvatāṃ jaradaṣṭī ////🔽amutrainam ā gachatād dṛḍhā naddhā pariṣkṛtā /
analyzed: ubhau mānasya patni tau jīvatām jaradaṣṭī  amutra enam ā gacchatāt dṛḍhā naddhā pariṣkṛtā
translated: both of them, O wife of Manasyu, may they live long, with teeth firm.🔽Let him come hither to thee, firmly fastened, well-bound, well-finished,

original: yasyās te vicṛtāmasy aṅgamaṅgaṃ paruṣparuḥ ////
analyzed: yasyāḥ te vicṛtāmasi aṅgam aṅgam paruḥ paruḥ
translated: whose limbs and joints we loosen, O house.

original: yas tvā śāle nimimāya saṃjabhāra vanaspatīn /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā śāle nimimāya saṃjabhāra vanaspatīn
translated: He who fashioned thee, O house, and gathered together the trees,

original: prajāyai cakre tvā śāle parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ ////
analyzed: prajāyai cakre tvā śāle parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ
translated: the Supreme Lord, the Lord of creatures, made thee, O house, for offspring.

original: namas tasmai namo dātre śālāpataye ca kṛṇmaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ tasmai namaḥ dātre śālā pataye ca kṛṇmaḥ
translated: To him we offer homage, and to the giver, and to the lord of the house we pay reverence.

original: namo 'gnaye pracarate puruṣāya ca te namaḥ ////
analyzed: namaḥ gnaye pracarate puruṣāya ca te namaḥ
translated: Homage to Agni, who moves about, and to the man, to thee homage.

original: gobhyo aśvebhyo namo yac chālāyāṃ vijāyate /
analyzed: gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ namaḥ yat śālāyām vijāyate
translated: Homage to the cows and horses, that which is born in the house,

original: vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśāṃś cṛtāmasi ////
analyzed: vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśān cṛtāmasi
translated: in the house that brings forth offspring, we loosen thy bonds for thee.

original: agnim antaś chādayasi puruṣān paśubhiḥ saha /
analyzed: agnim antar chādayasi puruṣān paśubhiḥ saha
translated: Thou dost cover the fire within, and men together with their cattle.

original: vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśāṃś cṛtāmasi ////🔽antarā dyāṃ ca pṛthivīṃ ca yad vyacas tena śālāṃ prati gṛhṇāmi ta imām /
analyzed: vijāvati prajāvati vi te pāśān cṛtāmasi  antarā dyām ca pṛthivīm ca yat vyacaḥ tena śālām prati gṛhṇāmi te imām
translated: In the prosperous, in the prolific, we loosen thy bonds for thee.🔽The space that is between the sky and the earth, with that I take possession of this house for thee.

original: yad antarikṣaṃ rajaso vimānaṃ tat kṛṇve 'ham udaraṃ śevadhibhyaḥ /
analyzed: yat antarikṣam rajasaḥ vimānam tat kṛṇve ham udaram śevadhibhyaḥ
translated: The atmosphere that is the measure of the region, that I make a belly for the household gods.

original: tena śālāṃ prati gṛhṇāmi tasmai ////
analyzed: tena śālām prati gṛhṇāmi tasmai
translated: With that I take possession of this house for thee.

original: ūrjasvatī payasvatī pṛthivyāṃ nimitā mitā /
analyzed: ūrjasvatī payasvatī pṛthivyām nimitā mitā
translated: Rich in nourishment, rich in milk, set in the earth, measured, and marked.

original: viśvānnaṃ bibhratī śāle mā hiṃsīḥ pratigṛhṇataḥ ////🔽tṛṇair āvṛtā paladān vasānā rātrīva śālā jagato niveśanī /
analyzed: viśva annam bibhratī śāle mā hiṃsīḥ pratigṛhṇataḥ  tṛṇaiḥ āvṛtā paladān vasānā rātrī iva śālāḥ jagataḥ niveśanī
translated: Bearing all food, O house, do not injure him who receives thee.🔽Covered with grass, clothed in dust, like a house the night, the resting-place of the moving world.

original: mitā pṛthivyāṃ tiṣṭhasi hastinīva padvatī ////
analyzed: mitā pṛthivyām tiṣṭhasi hastinī iva padvatī
translated: Measured on the earth thou standest, like a female elephant with four feet.

original: iṭasya te vi cṛtāmy apinaddham aporṇuvan /
analyzed: iṭasya te vi cṛtāmi apinaddham aporṇuvan
translated: I loosen the fastening of thy roof, I open what was closed.

original: varuṇena samubjitāṃ mitraḥ prātar vy ubjatu ////
analyzed: varuṇena samubjitām mitraḥ prātar vi ubjatu
translated: May Mitra in the morning open thee, who art closed by Varuna.

original: brahmaṇā śālāṃ nimitāṃ kavibhir nimitāṃ mitām /
analyzed: brahmaṇā śālām nimitām kavibhiḥ nimitām mitām
translated: The house that is measured by prayer, that is measured by the wise,

original: indrāgnī rakṣatāṃ śālām amṛtau somyaṃ sadaḥ ////
analyzed: indra agnī rakṣatām śālām amṛtau somyam sadaḥ
translated: May Indra and Agni, the immortal ones, guard the house, the seat of the Soma.

original: kulāye 'dhi kulāyaṃ kośe kośaḥ samubjitaḥ /
analyzed: kulāye dhi kulāyam kośe kośaḥ samubjitaḥ
translated: In the nest is the nest, the case in the case is closed.

original: tatra marto vi jāyate yasmād viśvaṃ prajāyate ////
analyzed: tatra martaḥ vi jāyate yasmāt viśvam prajāyate
translated: In it a mortal is born, from whom everything is born.

original: yā dvipakṣā catuṣpakṣā ṣaṭpakṣā yā nimīyate /
analyzed: yā dvi pakṣā catuṣpakṣā ṣaṣ pakṣā yā nimīyate
translated: She who is woven with two wings, four wings, six wings,

original: aṣṭāpakṣāṃ daśapakṣāṃ śālāṃ mānasya patnīm agnir garbha ivā śaye ////
analyzed: aṣṭāpakṣām daśa pakṣām śālām mānasya patnīm agniḥ garbhe iva ā śaye
translated: I lie with Agni as a child in the womb of the house with eight wings and ten wings.

original: pratīcīṃ tvā pratīcīnaḥ śāle praimy ahiṃsatīm /
analyzed: pratīcīm tvā pratīcīnaḥ śāle praimi a hiṃsatīm
translated: I approach you, O house, from the west, unharmed,

original: agnir hy antar āpaś ca ṛtasya prathamā dvāḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ hi antar āpaḥ ca ṛtasya prathamā dvār
translated: For Agni is within and the waters are the first doors of truth.

original: imā āpaḥ pra bharāmy ayakṣmā yakṣmanāśanīḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ āpaḥ pra bharāmi ayakṣmāḥ yakṣma nāśanīḥ
translated: I bring these waters, free from consumption, destroying consumption.

original: gṛhān upa pra sīdāmy amṛtena sahāgninā ////
analyzed: gṛhān upa pra sīdāmi amṛtena saha agninā
translated: I sit down in the house with the immortal Agni.

original: mā naḥ pāśaṃ prati muco gurur bhāro laghur bhava /
analyzed: mā naḥ pāśam prati mucaḥ guruḥ bhāraḥ laghuḥ bhava
translated: Do not release the noose upon us, heavy is the burden, let it be light.

original: vadhūm iva tvā śāle yatrakāmaṃ bharāmasi ////🔽prācyā diśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////🔽dakṣiṇāyā diśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: vadhūm iva tvā śāle yatrakāmam bharāmasi  prācyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ  dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: O house, we carry you wherever we wish, like a bride.🔽To the house in the eastern direction, homage to the greatness, svāhā to the gods worthy of svāhā.🔽To the house in the southern direction, homage to the greatness, svāhā to the gods worthy of svāhā.

original: pratīcyā diśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: To the house in the western direction, homage to the greatness, svāhā to the gods worthy of svāhā.

original: udīcyā diśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////🔽dhruvāyā diśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////🔽ūrdhvāyā diśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: udīcyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ  dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ  ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: To the hall of the northern direction, homage to the greatness, hail to the gods who deserve oblations.🔽To the hall of the firm direction, homage to the greatness, hail to the gods who deserve oblations.🔽To the hall of the upward direction, homage to the greatness, hail to the gods who deserve oblations.

original: diśodiśaḥ śālāyā namo mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: diśaḥ diśaḥ śālāyāḥ namaḥ mahimne svāhā devebhyaḥ svāhyebhyaḥ
translated: To the hall of the intermediate directions, homage to the greatness, hail to the gods who deserve oblations.

original: sāhasras tveṣa ṛṣabhaḥ payasvān viśvā rūpāṇi vakṣaṇāsu bibhrat /
analyzed: sāhasraḥ tveṣaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ payasvān viśvā rūpāṇi vakṣaṇāsu bibhrat
translated: The thousand-fold bull, shining, full of milk, bearing all forms in his flanks,

original: bhadraṃ dātre yajamānāya śīkṣan bārhaspatya usriyas tantum ātān ////
analyzed: bhadram dātre yajamānāya śīkṣan bārhaspatyaḥ usriyaḥ tantum ātān
translated: benefiting the giver, the sacrificer, instructing, the bull of Brihaspati, may he extend the thread of life.

original: apāṃ yo agne pratimā babhūva prabhūḥ sarvasmai pṛthivīva devī /
analyzed: apām yaḥ agne pratimā babhūva prabhūḥ sarvasmai pṛthivī iva devī
translated: He who became the image of the waters, the lord of all, like the goddess earth,

original: pitā vatsānāṃ patir aghnyānāṃ sāhasre poṣe api naḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: pitā vatsānām patiḥ aghnyānām sāhasre poṣe api naḥ kṛṇotu
translated: the father of the calves, the lord of the cows, may he grant us a thousandfold nourishment.

original: pumān antarvānt sthaviraḥ payasvān vasoḥ kabandhaṃ ṛṣabho bibharti /
analyzed: pumān antarvān sthaviraḥ payasvān vasoḥ kabandham ṛṣabhaḥ bibharti
translated: The male, the inner one, the old one, full of milk, the bull bears the lump of wealth.

original: tam indrāya pathibhir devayānair hutam agnir vahatu jātavedāḥ ////
analyzed: tam indrāya pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ hutam agniḥ vahatu jātavedāḥ
translated: May Agni, the all-knower, carry that offering to Indra by the paths that go to the gods.

original: pitā vatsānāṃ patir aghnyānāṃ atho pitā mahatāṃ gargarāṇām /
analyzed: pitā vatsānām patiḥ aghnyānām atha u pitā mahatām gargarāṇām
translated: Father of the calves, lord of the cows, and also father of the great reservoirs.

original: vatso jarāyu pratidhuk pīyūṣa āmikṣā ghṛtaṃ tad v asya retaḥ ////
analyzed: vatsaḥ jarāyu pratidhuk pīyūṣaḥ āmikṣā ghṛtam tat u asya retaḥ
translated: The calf, the after-birth, the udder, the whey, the curds, the ghee, that is his seed.

original: devānāṃ bhāga upanāha eṣo 'pāṃ rasa oṣadhīnāṃ ghṛtasya /🔽somasya bhakṣam avṛṇīta śakro bṛhann adrir abhavad yac charīram ////
analyzed: devānām bhāgaḥ upanāhaḥ eṣa u pām rasaḥ oṣadhīnām ghṛtasya  somasya bhakṣam avṛṇīta śakraḥ bṛhan adriḥ abhavat yat śarīram
translated: This is the share of the gods, the lump, the essence of the waters, of the plants, of ghee.🔽Shakra chose the food of Soma, the great mountain became his body.

original: somena pūrṇaṃ kalaśaṃ bibharṣi tvastā rupāṇāṃ janitā paśūnām /
analyzed: somena pūrṇam kalaśam bibharṣi tvastā rupāṇām janitā paśūnām
translated: You bear a jar full of Soma, you are the creator of forms, the begetter of cattle.

original: śivās te santu prajanva iha yā imā ny asmabhyaṃ svadhite yacha yā amūḥ ////
analyzed: śivāḥ te santu prajanvaḥ iha yāḥ imāḥ ni asmabhyam svadhite yaccha yāḥ amūḥ
translated: May these your sharp-edged ones here be auspicious to us, O axe, give us those yonder.

original: ājaṃ bibharti ghṛtam asya retaḥ sāhasraḥ poṣas tam u yajñam āhuḥ /
analyzed: ājam bibharti ghṛtam asya retaḥ sāhasraḥ poṣaḥ tam u yajñam āhuḥ
translated: It bears the new-born calf, ghee is its seed, a thousandfold nourishment, that they call the sacrifice.

original: indrasya rūpam ṛṣabho vasānaḥ so asmān devāḥ śiva aitu dattaḥ ////
analyzed: indrasya rūpam ṛṣabhaḥ vasānaḥ saḥ asmān devāḥ śivaḥ aitu dattaḥ
translated: The bull is the form of Indra, wearing it, may the god come to us, given, for our welfare.

original: indrasyaujo varuṇasya bāhū aśvinor aṃsau marutām iyaṃ kakut /
analyzed: indrasya ojaḥ varuṇasya bāhū aśvinoḥ aṃsau marutām iyam kakud
translated: The strength of Indra, the arms of Varuna, the shoulders of the Ashvins, this hump of the Maruts.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ saṃbhṛtam etam āhur ye dhīrāsaḥ kavayo ye manīṣiṇaḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatim saṃbhṛtam etam āhuḥ ye dhīrāsaḥ kavayaḥ ye manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise, the sages, the thoughtful ones call this Brihaspati, who is collected.

original: daivīr viśaḥ payasvān ā tanoṣi tvām indraṃ tvāṃ sarasvantam āhuḥ /
analyzed: daivīḥ viśaḥ payasvān ā tanoṣi tvām indram tvām sarasvantam āhuḥ
translated: The divine people, the rich, extend thee. Thee they call Indra, thee Sarasvat.

original: sahasraṃ sa ekamukhā dadāti yo brāhmaṇa ṛṣabham ājuhoti ////
analyzed: sahasram saḥ eka mukhāḥ dadāti yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṛṣabham ājuhoti
translated: He who offers the bull to the Brahman Rishi gives a thousand (cows) with his own hand.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ savitā te vayo dadhau tvaṣṭur vāyoḥ pary ātmā ta ābhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ savitā te vayaḥ dadhau tvaṣṭuḥ vāyoḥ pari ātmā te ābhṛtaḥ
translated: Brihaspati, Savitar, have set thy life in thee. Tvashtar's and Vayu's self have been bestowed on thee.

original: antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiṣ ṭe dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām ////
analyzed: antarikṣe manasā tvā juhomi barhiḥ te dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe stām
translated: In the mid-air I offer thee with my mind. Let both the earth and heaven be thy strewing grass.

original: ya indra iva deveṣu goṣv eti vivāvadat /
analyzed: yaḥ indraḥ iva deveṣu goṣu eti vivāvadat
translated: He who, like Indra among the Gods, goes to the cattle, speaking proudly,

original: tasya ṛṣabhasyāṅgāni brahmā saṃ stautu bhadrayā ////
analyzed: tasya ṛṣabhasya aṅgāni brahmā sam stautu bhadrayā
translated: Let the Brahman with auspicious speech praise the limbs of that bull.

original: pārśve āstām anumatyā bhagasyāstām anūvṛjau /
analyzed: pārśve āstām anumatyāḥ bhagasya āstām anūvṛjau
translated: The sides were of Anumati, the flanks of Bhaga.

original: aṣṭhīvantāv abravīn mitro mamaitau kevalāv iti ////
analyzed: aṣṭhīvantau abravīt mitraḥ mama etau kevalau iti
translated: The knee-bones, said Mitra, are mine alone.

original: bhasad āsīd ādityānāṃ śroṇī āstāṃ bṛhaspateḥ /
analyzed: bhasad āsīt ādityānām śroṇī āstām bṛhaspateḥ
translated: The haunch was of the Âdityas, the hips of Brihaspati.

original: puchaṃ vātasya devasya tena dhūnoty oṣadhīḥ ////
analyzed: pucham vātasya devasya tena dhūnoti oṣadhīḥ
translated: The tail is of the God Vâta: therewith he shakes the plants.

original: gudā āsant sinīvālyāḥ sūryāyās tvacam abruvan /
analyzed: gudāḥ āsan sinīvālyāḥ sūryāyāḥ tvacam abruvan
translated: The bowels were of Sinîvâlî: they said to Sûryâ, 'Be thou the hide.'

original: utthātur abruvan pada ṛṣabhaṃ yad akalpayan ////
analyzed: utthātuḥ abruvan pade ṛṣabham yat akalpayan
translated: They said to Urdhva, 'The place which thou hast assigned to the bull.'

original: kroḍa āsīj jāmiśaṃsasya somasya klaśo dhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kroḍaḥ āsīt jāmi śaṃsasya somasya klaśaḥ dhṛtaḥ
translated: The breast was of the kinsman's share: the Soma's jar was held.

original: devāḥ saṃgatya yat sarva ṛṣabhaṃ vyakalpayan ////🔽te kuṣṭhikāḥ saramāyai kurmebhyo adadhuḥ śaphān /
analyzed: devāḥ saṃgatya yat sarve ṛṣabham vyakalpayan  te kuṣṭhikāḥ saramāyai kurmebhyaḥ adadhuḥ śaphān
translated: When the gods assembled and made him the bull of all.🔽They gave the hooves to Saramā, the claws to the tortoises.

original: ūbadhyam asya kītebhyaḥ śvavartebhyo adhārayan ////
analyzed: ūbadhyam asya kītebhyaḥ śvavartebhyaḥ adhārayan
translated: They placed his hump for the worms, the shoulder-blades for the dogs.

original: śṛṅgābhyāṃ rakṣa ṛṣaty avartim hanti cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: śṛṅgābhyām rakṣaḥ ṛṣati avartim hanti cakṣuṣā
translated: With his horns he wards off danger, with his eyes he destroys misfortune.

original: śṛṇoti bhadraṃ karṇābhyāṃ gavāṃ yaḥ patir aghnyaḥ ////
analyzed: śṛṇoti bhadram karṇābhyām gavām yaḥ patiḥ aghnyaḥ
translated: With his ears he hears what is good, he who is the lord of the cows, the bull.

original: śatayājaṃ sa yajate nainaṃ dunvanty agnayaḥ /
analyzed: śata yājam sa yajate na enam dunvanti agnayaḥ
translated: He who offers the bull to the Brahmins performs a hundred sacrifices, the fires do not afflict him.

original: jinvanti viśve taṃ devā yo brāhmaṇa ṛṣabham ājuhoti ////
analyzed: jinvanti viśve tam devāḥ yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ ṛṣabham ājuhoti
translated: All the gods invigorate him who offers the bull to the Brahmins.

original: brāhmaṇebhya ṛṣabhaṃ dattvā varīyaḥ kṛṇute manaḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ ṛṣabham dattvā varīyaḥ kṛṇute manaḥ
translated: Having given the bull to the Brahmins, he makes his mind more excellent.

original: puṣṭiṃ so aghnyānāṃ sve goṣṭhe 'va paśyate ////
analyzed: puṣṭim saḥ aghnyānām sve goṣṭhe paśyate
translated: He sees in his own cowpen the prosperity of the cattle.

original: gāvaḥ santu prajāḥ santv atho astu tanūbalam /
analyzed: gāvaḥ santu prajāḥ santu atha u astu tanū balam
translated: Let there be cows, let there be offspring, and let there be strength in our bodies.

original: tat sarvam anu manyantāṃ devā ṛṣabhadāyine ////
analyzed: tat sarvam anu manyantām devāḥ ṛṣabha dāyine
translated: May all the gods approve of this for the one who gives the bull.

original: ayaṃ pipāna indra id rayiṃ dadhātu cetanīm /
analyzed: ayam pipānaḥ indraḥ id rayim dadhātu cetanīm
translated: May this Indra, when he drinks, bestow wealth and intelligence.

original: ayaṃ dhenuṃ sudughāṃ nityavatsāṃ vaśaṃ duhāṃ vipaścitaṃ paro divaḥ ////
analyzed: ayam dhenum sudughām nitya vatsām vaśam duhām vipaścitam paras divaḥ
translated: May he, the wise one, from the highest heaven, milk the cow who always has a calf, the cow who yields much milk.

original: piśaṅgarūpo nabhaso vayodhā aindraḥ śuṣmo viśvarūpo na āgan /
analyzed: piśaṅga rūpaḥ nabhasaḥ vayodhāḥ aindraḥ śuṣmaḥ viśva rūpaḥ naḥ āgan
translated: The golden-hued one, the supporter of the sky, the mighty one of Indra, of all forms, has come to us.

original: āyur asmabhyaṃ dadhat prajāṃ ca rāyaś ca poṣair abhi naḥ sacatām ////
analyzed: āyuḥ asmabhyam dadhat prajām ca rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacatām
translated: Granting us life and offspring, may he attend on us with the increase of wealth.

original: upehopaparcanāsmin goṣṭha upa pṛñca naḥ /
analyzed: upa iha upaparcana asmin goṣṭhe upa pṛñca naḥ
translated: Come hither, O ye who sprinkle, sprinkle in this cow-pen for us.

original: upa ṛṣabhasya yad reta upendra tava vīryam ////
analyzed: upa ṛṣabhasya yat retaḥ upa indra tava vīryam
translated: The seed of the bull, the power of Indra, come hither.

original: etaṃ vo yuvānaṃ prati dadhmo atra tena krīḍantīś carata vaśāṃ anu /
analyzed: etam vaḥ yuvānam prati dadhmaḥ atra tena krīḍantīḥ carata vaśām anu
translated: We place this young one before you; with him sporting, go along the path of the cows.

original: mā no hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgā rāyaś ca poṣair abhi naḥ sacadhvam ////
analyzed: mā naḥ hāsiṣṭa januṣā subhāgāḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam  /
translated: Do not forsake us with your good fortune, but come to us with wealth and increase of offspring.

original: ā nayaitam ā rabhasva sukṛtāṃ lokam api gachatu prajānan /
analyzed: ā naya etam ā rabhasva sukṛtām lokam api gacchatu prajānan
translated: Lead him hither, seize him; may he go to the world of the virtuous, knowing the way.

original: tīrtvā tamāṃsi bahudhā mahānty ajo nākam ā kramatāṃ tṛtīyam ////
analyzed: tīrtvā tamāṃsi bahudhā mahānti ajaḥ nākam ā kramatām tṛtīyam
translated: Having passed through the many great dark regions, may the goat ascend the third heaven.

original: indrāya bhāgaṃ pari tvā nayāmy asmin yajñe yajamānāya sūrim /
analyzed: indrāya bhāgam pari tvā nayāmi asmin yajñe yajamānāya sūrim
translated: I lead you as a share to Indra, a lord to the sacrificer in this sacrifice.

original: ye no dviṣanty anu tān rabhasvānāgaso yajamānasya vīrāḥ ////
analyzed: ye naḥ dviṣanti anu tān rabhasva anāgasaḥ yajamānasya vīrāḥ
translated: Seize those who hate us; the heroes of the guiltless sacrificer.

original: pra pado 'va nenigdhi duścaritaṃ yac cacāra śuddhaiḥ śaphair ā kramatāṃ prajānan /
analyzed: pra padaḥ vaḥ nenigdhi duścaritam yat cacāra śuddhaiḥ śaphaiḥ ā kramatām prajānan
translated: Remove the foot-print, the evil deed that he has done; let him go forward with pure hoofs, knowing the way.

original: tīrtvā tamāṃsi bahudhā vipaśyann ajo nākam ā kramatāṃ tṛtīyam ////🔽anuchya śyāmena tvacam etāṃ viśastar yathāparv asinā mābhi maṃsthāḥ /
analyzed: tīrtvā tamāṃsi bahudhā vipaśyan ajaḥ nākam ā kramatām tṛtīyam  anuchya śyāmena tvacam etām viśastar yathāparva asinā mā abhi maṃsthāḥ
translated: Having crossed over the many kinds of darkness, seeing clearly, may the goat ascend the third heaven.🔽O surgeon, cut this skin of the dark one along the joints with your knife, do not strike me.

original: mābhi druhaḥ paruśaḥ kalpayainaṃ tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayainam ////
analyzed: mā abhi druhaḥ paruśaḥ kalpaya enam tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śraya enam
translated: Do not make it rough and harmful to him. Place him on the third heaven, settle him there.

original: ṛcā kumbhīm adhy agnau śrayāmy ā siñcodakam ava dhehy enam /
analyzed: ṛcā kumbhīm adhi agnau śrayāmi ā siñca udakam ava dhehi enam
translated: With a verse I place the cauldron on the fire. I pour water. Cover it.

original: paryādhattāgninā śamitāraḥ śṛto gachatu sukṛtāṃ yatra lokaḥ ////
analyzed: paryādhatta agninā śamitāraḥ śṛtaḥ gacchatu sukṛtām yatra lokaḥ
translated: Cover it with fire, O immolators. Let the cooked one go to the world of the virtuous.

original: ut krāmātaḥ pari ced ataptas taptāc caror adhi nākaṃ tṛtīyam /🔽agner agnir adhi saṃ babhūvitha jyotiṣmantam abhi lokaṃ jayaitam ////
analyzed: ud krāma atas pari ced a taptaḥ taptāt caroḥ adhi nākam tṛtīyam  agneḥ agniḥ adhi sam babhūvitha jyotiṣmantam abhi lokam jaya etam
translated: If you rise from here, unheated, from the heated pan, to the third heaven,🔽you have become the fire of Agni. Conquer this world full of light.

original: ajo agnir ajam u jyotir āhur ajaṃ jīvatā brahmaṇe deyam āhuḥ /
analyzed: ajaḥ agniḥ ajam u jyotiḥ āhuḥ ajam jīvatā brahmaṇe deyam āhuḥ
translated: The goat is Agni. They call the goat the light. They say the goat, when alive, should be given to the Brahman.

original: ajas tamāṃsy apa hanti dūram asmiṃl loke śraddadhānena dattaḥ ////
analyzed: ajaḥ tamāṃsi apa hanti dūram asmin loke śraddadhānena dattaḥ
translated: The goat drives away the darkness far away. Given by one who has faith in this world, it is given.

original: pañcaudanaḥ pañcadhā vi kramatām ākraṃsyamānas trīṇi jyotīṃṣi /
analyzed: pañca odanaḥ pañcadhā vi kramatām ākraṃsyamānaḥ trīṇi jyotīṃṣi
translated: The five-boiled one should go forth in five ways, being sprinkled, to the three lights.

original: ījānānāṃ sukṛtāṃ prehi madhyaṃ tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva ////
analyzed: ījānānām su kṛtām prehi madhyam tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva
translated: Go to the middle of those who have sacrificed well, settle in the third heaven above.

original: ajā roha sukṛtāṃ yatra lokaḥ śarabho na catto 'ti durgāny eṣaḥ /
analyzed: aja ā roha su kṛtām yatra lokaḥ śarabhaḥ na durgāni eṣaḥ
translated: Climb the goat, to the world of those who have done good deeds, this one, like a sharabha, has passed over the difficult paths.

original: pañcaudano brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ sa dātāraṃ tṛptyā tarpayāti ////
analyzed: pañca odanaḥ brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ sa dātāram tṛptyā tarpayāti
translated: The five-platter, when given to the Brahman, satisfies the giver with satisfaction.

original: ajas trināke tridive tripṛṣṭhe nākasya pṛṣṭhe dadivāṃsaṃ dadhāti /
analyzed: ajaḥ tri nāke tridive tri pṛṣṭhe nākasya pṛṣṭhe dadivāṃsam dadhāti
translated: The goat, on the three-peaked, three-day, on the back of the sky, places the one who gives.

original: pañcaudano brahmaṇe dīyamāno viśvarūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughāsy ekā ////
analyzed: pañca odanaḥ brahmaṇe dīyamānaḥ viśva rūpā dhenuḥ kāmadughā asi ekā  /
translated: The five-platter, when given to the Brahman, is a cow of all forms, a single wish-fulfilling cow.

original: etad vo jyotiḥ pitaras tṛtīyaṃ pañcaudanaṃ brahmaṇe 'jaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: etat vaḥ jyotiḥ pitaraḥ tṛtīyam pañca odanam brahmaṇe jam dadāti
translated: This is your third light, O Fathers, he gives the five-platter goat to the Brahman.

original: ajas tamāṃsy apa hanti dūram asmiṃl loke śraddadhānena dattaḥ ////
analyzed: ajaḥ tamāṃsi apa hanti dūram asmin loke śraddadhānena dattaḥ
translated: The goat, when given by one who has faith in this world, drives away the darkness far away.

original: ījānānāṃ sukṛtāṃ lokam īpsan pañcaudanaṃ brahmaṇe 'jaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: ījānānām sukṛtām lokam īpsan pañca odanam brahmaṇe jam dadāti
translated: Desiring the world of those who have sacrificed well, he gives the five-platter goat to the Brahman.

original: sa vyāptim abhi lokaṃ jayaitaṃ śivo 'smabhyaṃ pratigṛhīto astu ////
analyzed: sa vyāptim abhi lokam jaya etam śivaḥ smabhyam pratigṛhītaḥ astu
translated: May he conquer this world, which is pervaded by him, may he be accepted by us as auspicious.

original: ajo hy agner ajaniṣṭa śokād vipro viprasya sahaso vipaścit /
analyzed: ajaḥ hi agneḥ ajaniṣṭa śokāt vipraḥ viprasya sahasaḥ vipaścit
translated: The goat was born from the grief of Agni, the sage, the wise one, from the sage Sahas.

original: iṣṭaṃ pūrtam abhipūrtaṃ vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ tad devā ṛtuśaḥ kalpayantu ////
analyzed: iṣṭam pūrtam abhipūrtam vaṣaṭkṛtam tat devāḥ ṛtuśas kalpayantu
translated: The desired, the fulfilled, the fulfilled beyond, the Vashat-performed - may the gods arrange that in due season.

original: amotaṃ vāso dadyād dhiraṇyam api dakṣiṇām /
analyzed: amā ūtam vāsaḥ dadyāt hiraṇyam api dakṣiṇām
translated: One should give a garment not yet worn, and also gold as a fee.

original: tathā lokānt sam āpnoti ye divyā ye ca pārthivāḥ ////
analyzed: tathā lokān sam āpnoti ye divyāḥ ye ca pārthivāḥ
translated: Thus one attains the worlds, both the heavenly and the earthly.

original: etās tvājopa yantu dhārāḥ somyā devīr ghṛtapṛṣṭhā madhuścutaḥ /
analyzed: etāḥ tvā aja upa yantu dhārāḥ somyāḥ devīḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhāḥ madhuścutaḥ
translated: May these streams of Soma, divine, with ghee on their backs and dripping honey, come to you, O goat.

original: stabhān pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ nākasya pṛṣṭhe 'dhi saptaraśmau ////
analyzed: stabhān pṛthivīm uta dyām nākasya pṛṣṭhe dhi sapta raśmau
translated: Support the earth and the sky on the back of the vault, on the seven-rayed (sun).

original: ajo 'sy aja svargo 'si tvayā lokam aṅgirasaḥ prājānan /
analyzed: ajaḥ si aja svargaḥ si tvayā lokam aṅgirasaḥ prājānan
translated: You are the goat, O goat, you are heaven. By you the Angiras knew the world.

original: taṃ lokaṃ puṇyaṃ pra jñeṣam ////
analyzed: tam lokam puṇyam pra jñeṣam
translated: May I know that blessed world.

original: yenā sahasraṃ vahasi yenāgne sarvavedasam /
analyzed: yena sahasram vahasi yena agne sarvavedasam
translated: By which you carry a thousand, by which, O Agni, all wealth,

original: tenemaṃ yajñaṃ no vaha svar deveṣu gantave ////
analyzed: tena imam yajñam naḥ vaha svar deveṣu gantave
translated: By that carry this sacrifice of ours to the heaven to go to the gods.

original: ajaḥ pakvaḥ svarge loke dadhāti pañcaudano nirṛtiṃ bādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: ajaḥ pakvaḥ svarge loke dadhāti pañca odanaḥ nirṛtim bādhamānaḥ
translated: The cooked goat places (us) in the heavenly world, the five-platter (oblation) repelling misfortune.

original: tena lokānt sūryavato jayema ////
analyzed: tena lokān sūryavataḥ jayema
translated: By that may we conquer the worlds that have the sun.

original: yaṃ brāhmaṇe nidadhe yaṃ ca vikṣu yā vipruṣa odanānām ajasya /
analyzed: yam brāhmaṇe nidadhe yam ca vikṣu yāḥ vipruṣaḥ odanānām ajasya
translated: What you have placed in the Brahmana, what in the people, what drops of the goat's rice there are,

original: sarvaṃ tad agne sukṛtasya loke jānītān naḥ saṃgamane pathīnām ////
analyzed: sarvam tat agne sukṛtasya loke jānītāt naḥ saṃgamane pathīnām
translated: May all that, O Agni, know in the world of the righteous, and us at the meeting of the paths.

original: ajo vā idam agne vy akramata tasyora iyam abhavad dyauḥ pṛṣṭiham /
analyzed: ajaḥ vai idam agne vi akramata tasya uraḥ iyam abhavat dyauḥ pṛṣṭiham
translated: The goat, O Agni, has stepped upon this (earth), its back is the sky,

original: antarikṣaṃ madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī ////
analyzed: antarikṣam madhyam diśaḥ pārśve samudrau kukṣī
translated: the middle air, the sides the quarters, the two oceans the belly.

original: satyaṃ ca rtaṃ ca cakṣuṣī viśvaṃ satyaṃ śraddhā prāṇo virāṭ śiraḥ /
analyzed: satyam ca ṛtam ca cakṣuṣī viśvam satyam śraddhā prāṇaḥ virāj śiraḥ
translated: Truth and right are its eyes, the universe is its truth, faith its breath, the Virâg its head.

original: eṣa vā aparimito yajño yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ ////
analyzed: eṣa vai aparimitaḥ yajñaḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This is the unlimited sacrifice, to wit, the goat with five uddered (cow) as sacrificial fee.

original: aparimitam eva yajñam āpnoty aparimitaṃ lokam ava runddhe /
analyzed: aparimitam eva yajñam āpnoti aparimitam lokam ava runddhe
translated: He obtains the unlimited sacrifice, he wins the unlimited world.

original: yo 'jaṃ pañcaudanaṃ dakṣiṇājyotiṣaṃ dadāti ////
analyzed: yaḥ jam pañca odanam dakṣiṇā jyotiṣam dadāti
translated: He who gives the goat with five uddered (cow) as sacrificial fee, the light of the sacrificial fee,

original: nāsyāsthīni bhindyān na majjño nir dhayet /
analyzed: na asya asthīni bhindyāt na majjñaḥ niḥ dhayet
translated: he should not break its bones, nor should he crush its marrow.

original: sarvam enaṃ samādāyedamidaṃ pra veśayet ////
analyzed: sarvam enam samādāya idam idam pra veśayet
translated: Taking it all together, he should put it into this (earth).

original: idamidam evāsya rūpaṃ bhavati tenainaṃ saṃ gamayati /
analyzed: idam idam eva asya rūpam bhavati tena enam sam gamayati
translated: This is its form; with it he unites it.

original: iṣaṃ maha ūrjam asmai duhe yo 'jaṃ pañcaudanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣaṃ dadāti ////
analyzed: iṣam mahaḥ ūrjam asmai duhe yaḥ jam pañca odanam dakṣiṇā jyotiṣam dadāti
translated: He who gives the goat with five uddered (cow) as sacrificial fee, the light of the sacrificial fee,

original: pañca rukmā pañca navāni vastrā pañcāsmai dhenavaḥ kāmadughā bhavanti /
analyzed: pañca rukmā pañca navāni vastrā pañca asmai dhenavaḥ kāmadughāḥ bhavanti
translated: he obtains five pieces of gold, five new garments, five milch cows which yield all that is desired.

original: yo 'jaṃ pañcaudanaṃ dakṣiṇājyotiṣaṃ dadāti ////
analyzed: yaḥ jam pañca odanam dakṣiṇā jyotiṣam dadāti
translated: He who gives the goat with five uddered (cow) as sacrificial fee, the light of the sacrificial fee,

original: pañca rukmā jyotir asmai bhavanti varma vāsāṃsi tanve bhavanti /
analyzed: pañca rukmāḥ jyotiḥ asmai bhavanti varma vāsāṃsi tanve bhavanti
translated: Five golden ornaments are his light. Armor and garments are for his body.

original: svargaṃ lokam aśnute yo 'jaṃ pañcaudanaṃ dakṣiṇājyotiṣam dadāti ////
analyzed: svargam lokam aśnute yaḥ jam pañca odanam dakṣiṇā jyotiṣam dadāti
translated: He attains the heavenly world who gives a goat with five portions of food and light as a sacrificial fee.

original: yā pūrvaṃ patiṃ vittvā 'thānyaṃ vindate 'param /
analyzed: yā pūrvam patim vittvā thā anyam vindate param
translated: She who, having known one husband, then finds another, a second husband,

original: pañcaudanaṃ ca tāv ajaṃ dadāto na vi yoṣataḥ ////
analyzed: pañca odanam ca tau ajam dadātaḥ na vi yoṣataḥ
translated: They, giving a goat with five portions of food, do not separate.

original: samānaloko bhavati punarbhuvāparaḥ patiḥ /
analyzed: samāna lokaḥ bhavati punarbhuvā aparaḥ patiḥ
translated: The second husband becomes of the same world as the first wife.

original: yo 'jaṃ pañcaudanam dakṣiṇājyotiṣaṃ dadāti ////🔽anupūrvavatsāṃ dhenum anaḍvāham upabarhaṇam /
analyzed: yaḥ jam pañca odanam dakṣiṇā jyotiṣam dadāti  anupūrva vatsām dhenum anaḍvāham upabarhaṇam
translated: He who gives a goat with five portions of food and light as a sacrificial fee.🔽Having given a cow with a calf that follows her, a bull, a pillow,

original: vāso hiraṇyaṃ dattvā te yanti divam uttamām ////
analyzed: vāsaḥ hiraṇyam dattvā te yanti divam uttamām
translated: Clothes and gold, they go to the highest heaven.

original: ātmānaṃ pitaraṃ putraṃ pautraṃ pitāmaham /
analyzed: ātmānam pitaram putram pautram pitāmaham
translated: The self, the father, the son, the grandson, the great-grandson,

original: jāyāṃ janitrīṃ mātaraṃ ye priyās tān upa hvaye ////
analyzed: jāyām janitrīm mātaram ye priyāḥ tān upa hvaye
translated: The wife, the mother who gave birth, the mother, those who are dear, I invite them all.

original: yo vai naidāghaṃ nāma rtuṃ veda /
analyzed: yaḥ vai naidāgham nāma ṛtum veda
translated: He who knows the season named the rainy season,

original: eṣa vai naidāgho nāma rtur yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai naidāghaḥ nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This is the season named the rainy season, namely the goat with five portions of food.

original: nir evāpriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyaṃ dahati bhavaty ātmanā /
analyzed: niḥ eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam dahati bhavati ātmanā
translated: He burns away the splendor of the hated enemy. He becomes prosperous himself.

original: yo vai kurvantaṃ nāma rtuṃ veda /
analyzed: yaḥ vai kurvantam nāma ṛtum veda
translated: He who knows the season named the doing,

original: kurvatīṃkurvatīm evāpriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyaṃ ā datte /
analyzed: kurvatīm kurvatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte
translated: She who is making, she who is making, the prosperity of the enemy, of the foe, does he bestow.

original: eṣa vai kurvan nāma rtur yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai kurvan nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the season called 'making', to wit, the five-platter goat.

original: yo vai saṃyantaṃ nāma rtuṃ veda /
analyzed: yaḥ vai saṃyantam nāma ṛtum veda
translated: He who knows the season called 'coming together'.

original: saṃyatīṃsaṃyatīm evāpriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyaṃ ā datte /
analyzed: saṃyatīm saṃyatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte
translated: Coming together, coming together, the prosperity of the enemy, of the foe, does he bestow.

original: eṣa vai saṃyan nāma rtur yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai saṃyat nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the season called 'coming together', to wit, the five-platter goat.

original: yo vai pinvantaṃ nāma rtum veda /
analyzed: yaḥ vai pinvantam nāma ṛtum veda
translated: He who knows the season called 'swelling'.

original: pinvatīṃpinvatīm evāpriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyaṃ ā datte /
analyzed: pinvatīm pinvatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte
translated: Swelling, swelling, the prosperity of the enemy, of the foe, does he bestow.

original: eṣa vai pinvan nāma rtur yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai pinvan nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the season called 'swelling', to wit, the five-platter goat.

original: yo vā udyantaṃ nāma rtuṃ veda /
analyzed: yaḥ vai udyantam nāma ṛtum veda
translated: He who knows the season called 'rising'.

original: udyatīṃudyatīm evāpriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyaṃ ā datte /
analyzed: udyatīm udyatīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte
translated: Rising, rising, the prosperity of the enemy, of the foe, does he bestow.

original: eṣa vā udyann nāma rtur yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai udyan nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the season called 'rising', to wit, the five-platter goat.

original: yo vā abhibhuvaṃ nāma rtuṃ veda /
analyzed: yaḥ vai abhibhuvam nāma rtum veda
translated: He who knows the season called 'overpowering'.

original: abhibhavantīmabhibhavantīm evāpriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyaṃ ā datte /
analyzed: abhibhavantīm abhibhavantīm eva apriyasya bhrātṛvyasya śriyam ā datte
translated: Overpowering, overpowering, the prosperity of the enemy, of the foe, does he bestow.

original: eṣa vā abhibhūr nāma rtur yad ajaḥ pañcaudanaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai abhibhūḥ nāma rtuḥ yat ajaḥ pañca odanaḥ
translated: This, indeed, is the season called 'overpowering', to wit, the five-platter goat.

original: ajaṃ ca pacata pañca caudanān /
analyzed: ajam ca pacata pañca ca odanān
translated: Cook the goat and the five platters.

original: sarvā diśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ sadhrīcīḥ sāntardeśāḥ prati gṛhnantu ta etam ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ diśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ sadhrīcīḥ sa antardeśāḥ prati gṛhnantu te etam
translated: May all the quarters, with the east, and the intermediate quarters, accept him.

original: tās te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etaṃ tābhya ājyaṃ havir idaṃ juhomi ////
analyzed: tāḥ te rakṣantu tava tubhyam etam tābhyaḥ ājyam haviḥ idam juhomi
translated: May they protect him for you, for you he is. To them I offer this oblation of ghee.

original: yo vidyād brahma pratyakṣaṃ parūṃṣi yasya saṃbhārā ṛco yasyānūkyam ////
analyzed: yaḥ vidyāt brahma pratyakṣam parūṃṣi yasya saṃbhārāḥ ṛcaḥ yasya anūkyam
translated: He who knows Brahman directly, whose limbs are the sacrificial requisites, whose back is the Ṛg Veda,

original: sāmāni yasya lomāni yajur hṛdayam ucyate paristaraṇam id dhaviḥ ////
analyzed: sāmāni yasya lomāni yajuḥ hṛdayam ucyate paristaraṇam id haviḥ
translated: whose hair is the Sāman chants, whose heart is said to be the Yajur Veda, whose strewing is the sacrificial offering,

original: yad vā atithipatir atithīn pratipaśyati devayajanaṃ prekṣate ////
analyzed: yat vai atithi patiḥ atithīn pratipaśyati devayajanam prekṣate
translated: when the host of guests sees the guests, he sees the sacrificial ground.

original: yad abhivadati dīkṣām upaiti yad udakaṃ yācaty apaḥ pra ṇayati ////
analyzed: yat abhivadati dīkṣām upaiti yat udakam yācati apaḥ pra nayati
translated: When he greets them, he enters the initiation. When he asks for water, he carries the water forward.

original: yā eva yajña āpaḥ praṇīyante tā eva tāḥ ////
analyzed: yāḥ eva yajñe āpaḥ praṇīyante tāḥ eva tāḥ
translated: The water that is carried forward in the sacrifice, those are those (waters).

original: yat tarpaṇam āharanti ya evāgnīṣomīyaḥ paśur badhyate sa eva saḥ ////🔽yad āvasathān kalpayanti sadohavirdhānāny eva tat kalpayanti ////
analyzed: yat tarpaṇam āharanti yaḥ eva agnīṣomīyaḥ paśuḥ badhyate saḥ eva saḥ  yat āvasathān kalpayanti sadaḥ havirdhānāni eva tat kalpayanti
translated: When they bring the libation, that is the same as the animal to be offered to Agni and Soma.🔽When they prepare the dwelling places, they prepare the sacrificial hall and the Havirdhāna shed.

original: yad upastṛṇanti barhir eva tat ////
analyzed: yat upastṛṇanti barhiḥ eva tat
translated: When they spread the grass, that is the same as the sacrificial grass.

original: yad upariśayanam āharanti svargam eva tena lokam ava runddhe ////
analyzed: yat upariśayanam āharanti svargam eva tena lokam ava runddhe
translated: When they bring the upper bed, by that he wins the heavenly world.

original: yat kaśipūpabarhaṇam āharanti paridhaya eva te ////🔽yad āñjanābhyañjanam āharanty ājyam eva tat ////
analyzed: yat kaśipu upabarhaṇam āharanti paridhayaḥ eva te  yat āñjana abhyañjanam āharanti ājyam eva tat
translated: The cakes and curds which they bring are the enclosing sticks.🔽The collyrium and ointment which they bring are the clarified butter.🔽The food which they bring before the serving is the two cakes.

original: yat purā pariveṣāt svādam āharanti purodāśāv eva tau ////🔽yad aśanakṛtaṃ hvayanti haviṣkṛtam eva tad dhvayanti ////🔽ye vrīhayo yavā nirupyante 'ṃśava eva te ////
analyzed: yat purā pariveṣāt svādam āharanti purodāśau eva tau  yat aśana kṛtam hvayanti haviṣkṛtam eva tat dhvayanti  ye vrīhayaḥ yavāḥ nirupyante ṃśavaḥ eva te
translated: When they invite the food-maker, they invite the maker of the oblation.🔽The rice and barley which are offered are the portions.🔽The mortar and pestle are the pressing stones.

original: yāny ulūkhalamusalāni grāvāṇa eva te ////🔽śūrpaṃ pavitraṃ tuṣā ṛjīṣābhiṣavaṇīr āpaḥ ////
analyzed: yāni ulūkhala musalāni grāvāṇaḥ eva te  śūrpam pavitram tuṣāḥ ṛjīṣa abhiṣavaṇīḥ āpaḥ
translated: The winnowing basket is the strainer, the husks are the chaff, the water is for sprinkling.

original: srug darvir nekṣaṇam āyavanaṃ droṇakalaśāḥ kumbhyo vāyavyāni pātrāṇīyam eva kṛṣṇājinam //// 🔽yajamānabrāhmaṇaṃ vā etad atithipatiḥ kurute yad āhāryāṇi prekṣata idaṃ iti ////
analyzed: sruc darviḥ nekṣaṇam āyavanam droṇakalaśāḥ kumbhyaḥ vāyavyāni pātrāṇi iyam eva kṛṣṇājinam  yajamāna brāhmaṇam vai etat atithi patiḥ kurute yat āhāryāṇi prekṣate idam bhūyāḥ iti
translated: The ladle is the spoon, the funnel is the hole, the Dronakalasa and Kumbhi are the Vayu vessels, and the black antelope skin is this (earth).🔽The host of the sacrificer does what is to be done for the guest, when he looks at the things to be brought, saying 'This is it.'

original: yad āha bhūya ud dhareti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsaṃ kurute ////🔽upa harati havīṃṣy ā sādayati ////
analyzed: yat āha bhūyaḥ ud hara iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute  upa harati havīṃṣi ā sādayati
translated: When he says 'Bring more,' he thereby makes the breath more abundant.🔽He brings the oblations and places them.

original: teṣām āsannānām atithir ātman juhoti ////
analyzed: teṣām āsannānām atithiḥ ātman juhoti
translated: Of those which are near, the guest offers in himself.

original: srucā hastena prāṇe yūpe srukkāreṇa vaṣaṭkāreṇa ////
analyzed: srucā hastena prāṇe yūpe srukkāreṇa vaṣaṭkāreṇa
translated: with the ladle in the hand, on the post of the vital airs, with the Sruk-call, with the Vasat-call.

original: ete vai priyāś cāpriyāś ca rtvijaḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ gamayanti yad atithayaḥ ////
analyzed: ete vai priyāḥ ca apriyāḥ ca ṛtvijaḥ svargam lokam gamayanti yat atithayaḥ
translated: These, indeed, are the dear and the hateful priests who lead one to the world of heaven, namely, guests.

original: sa ya evaṃ vidvān na dviṣann aśnīyān na dviṣato 'nnam aśnīyān na mīmāṃsitasya na mīmāṃsamānasya ////
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān na dviṣan aśnīyāt na dviṣataḥ annam aśnīyāt na mīmāṃsitasya na mīmāṃsamānasya
translated: He who, knowing this, should not eat while hating, nor eat the food of one who hates, nor of one who is being examined, nor of one who is examining,

original: sarvo vā eṣa jagdhapāpmā yasyānnam aśnanti ////
analyzed: sarvaḥ vai eṣa jagdha pāpmā yasya annam aśnanti
translated: for all whose food is eaten, his sins are eaten.

original: sarvo vā eso 'jagdhapāpmā yasyānnam nāśnanti ////
analyzed: sarvaḥ vai eṣaḥ jagdha pāpmā yasya annam na aśnanti
translated: For all whose food is not eaten, his sins are not eaten.

original: sarvadā vā eṣa yuktagrāvārdrapavitro vitatādhvara āhṛtayajñakratur ya upaharati ////🔽prājāpatyo vā etasya yajño vitato ya upaharati ////
analyzed: sarvadā vai eṣa yukta grāvā ārdra pavitraḥ vitata adhvaraḥ āhṛta yajña kratuḥ yaḥ upaharati  prājāpatyaḥ vai etasya yajñaḥ vitataḥ yaḥ upaharati
translated: For he who entertains is always yoked, with his strainer wet, his sacrifice spread out, his sacrificial rite brought.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.

original: prajāpater vā eṣa vikramān anuvikramate ya upaharati ////
analyzed: prajāpateḥ vai eṣa vikramān anuvikramate yaḥ upaharati
translated: For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.

original: yo 'tithīnāṃ sa āhavanīyo yo veśmani sa gārhapatyo yasmin pacanti sa dakṣiṇāgniḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ tithīnām saḥ āhavanīyaḥ yaḥ veśmani sa gārhapatyaḥ yasmin pacanti sa dakṣiṇāgniḥ
translated: For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.

original: iṣṭaṃ ca vā eṣa pūrtaṃ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvo 'tither aśnāti ////
analyzed: iṣṭam ca vai eṣa pūrtam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ titheḥ aśnāti
translated: For him who entertains, the sacrifice is spread out to Prajapati.🔽For him who entertains, the sacrifice is

original: payaś ca vā eṣa rasaṃ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvo 'tither aśnāti ////
analyzed: payaḥ ca vai eṣa rasam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ titheḥ aśnāti
translated: He who eats before the guest eats the milk and the sap of the house.

original: ūrjāṃ ca vā eṣa sphātiṃ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvo 'tither aśnāti ////🔽prajāṃ vā eṣa paśūṃś ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvo 'tither aśnāti ////🔽kīrtiṃ vā eṣa yaśaś ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvo 'tither aśnāti ////
analyzed: ūrjām ca vai eṣa sphātim ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ titheḥ aśnāti  prajām vai eṣa paśūn ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ titheḥ aśnāti  kīrtim vai eṣa yaśaḥ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ titheḥ aśnāti
translated: He who eats before the guest eats the strength and the abundance of the house.🔽He who eats before the guest eats the offspring and the cattle of the house.🔽He who eats before the guest eats the fame and the glory of the house.

original: śriyaṃ vā eṣa saṃvidaṃ ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvo 'tither aśnāti ////
analyzed: śriyam vai eṣa saṃvidam ca gṛhāṇām aśnāti yaḥ pūrvaḥ titheḥ aśnāti
translated: He who eats before the guest eats the prosperity and the agreement of the house.

original: eṣa vā atithir yac chrotriyas tasmāt pūrvo nāśnīyāt ////
analyzed: eṣa vai atithiḥ yat śrotriyaḥ tasmāt pūrvaḥ na aśnīyāt
translated: The guest is one who is learned in the Vedas; therefore one should not eat before him.

original: aśitāvaty atithāv aśnīyād yajñasya sātmatvāya yajñasyāvichedāya tad vratam ////
analyzed: aśitāvati atithau aśnīyāt yajñasya sātma tvāya yajñasya a vicchedāya tat vratam
translated: One should eat after the guests have eaten, for the completeness and the continuity of the sacrifice. This is the rule.

original: etad vā u svādīyo yad adhigavaṃ kṣīraṃ vā māṃsaṃ vā tad eva nāśnīyāt ////
analyzed: etat vai u svādīyaḥ yat adhigavam kṣīram vā māṃsam vā tat eva na aśnīyāt
translated: This is indeed the most delicious, namely, milk or meat from a cow. One should not eat that.

original: sa ya evaṃ vidvān kṣīram upasicyopaharati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān kṣīram upasicya upaharati
translated: He who, knowing this, pours milk and offers it,

original: yāvad agniṣṭomeneṣṭvā susamṛddhenāvarunddhe tāvad enenāva runddhe ////
analyzed: yāvat agniṣṭomena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe
translated: to that extent he wins by this what one wins by performing the Agniṣṭoma sacrifice well-performed and well-completed.

original: sa ya evaṃ vidvānt sarpir upasicyopaharati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān sarpiḥ upasicya upaharati
translated: He who, knowing thus, offers clarified butter,

original: yāvad atirātreṇeṣṭvā susamṛddhenāvarunddhe tāvad enenāva runddhe ////
analyzed: yāvat atirātreṇa iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe
translated: to the extent that one obtains by performing the Atirâtra sacrifice with all its accessories, to that extent does he obtain by this (offering).

original: sa ya evaṃ vidvān madhūpasicyopaharati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān madhu upasicya upaharati
translated: He who, knowing thus, offers honey,

original: yāvad sattrasadyeneṣṭvā susamṛddhenāvarunddhe tāvad enenāva runddhe ////
analyzed: yāvat sattrasadyena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe
translated: to the extent that one obtains by performing the Sattrasadya sacrifice with all its accessories, to that extent does he obtain by this (offering).

original: sa ya evaṃ vidvān māṃsam upasicyopaharati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān māṃsam upasicya upaharati
translated: He who, knowing thus, offers meat,

original: yāvad dvādaśāheneṣṭvā susamṛddhenāvarunddhe tāvad enenāva runddhe ////
analyzed: yāvat dvādaśa ahena iṣṭvā su samṛddhena avarunddhe tāvat enena ava runddhe
translated: to the extent that one obtains by performing the twelve-day sacrifice with all its accessories, to that extent does he obtain by this (offering).

original: sa ya evaṃ vidvān udakam upasicyopaharati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam vidvān udakam upasicya upaharati
translated: He who, knowing thus, offers water,

original: prajānāṃ prajananāya gachati pratiṣṭhāṃ priyaḥ prajānāṃ bhavati ya evaṃ vidvān upasicyopaharati ////
analyzed: prajānām prajananāya gacchati pratiṣṭhām priyaḥ prajānām bhavati yaḥ evam vidvān upasicya upaharati
translated: goes for the propagation of offspring; he becomes dear to the people, who, knowing thus, offers (these things).

original: tasmā uṣā hiṅ kṛṇoti savitā pra stauti /
analyzed: tasmai uṣāḥ hiṅ kṛṇoti savitā pra stauti
translated: To him Ushas (Dawn) utters the syllable 'Him'; Savitri sings the Prastava;

original: bṛhaspatir ūrjayod gāyati tvaṣṭā puṣṭyā prati harati viśve devā nidhanam ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ ūrjayā ud gāyati tvaṣṭā puṣṭyā prati harati viśve devāḥ nidhanam
translated: Brihaspati with strength sings the Udgitha; Tvastr with growth responds; the Visve devâh (All-gods) form the Nidhana.

original: nidhanaṃ bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnāṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes the end, the prosperity, the offspring, and the cattle of those who know this.

original: tasmā udyant sūryo hiṅ kṛṇoti saṃgavaḥ pra stauti /
analyzed: tasmai udyan sūryaḥ hiṅ kṛṇoti saṃgavaḥ pra stauti
translated: To him the rising sun makes the sound 'him'; the morning twilight sings the praise;

original: madhyandina ud gāyaty aparāhṇaḥ prati haraty astaṃyan nidhanam /
analyzed: madhyandinaḥ ud gāyati aparāhṇaḥ prati harati a staṃyan nidhanam
translated: the midday the chant; the afternoon the response; the setting sun the final oblation.

original: nidhanaṃ bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnāṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////🔽tasmā abhro bhavan hiṅ kṛṇoti stanayan pra stauti /
analyzed: nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda  tasmai abhraḥ bhavan hiṅ kṛṇoti stanayan pra stauti
translated: He who knows thus obtains the final oblation of prosperity, offspring, and cattle.🔽To him the cloud, becoming, makes the sound 'him'; thundering, it sings the praise;

original: vidyotamānaḥ prati harati varṣann ud gāyaty udgṛhṇan nidhanam /
analyzed: vidyotamānaḥ prati harati varṣan ud gāyati udgṛhṇan nidhanam
translated: flashing, it responds; raining, it chants; taking up, it makes the final oblation.

original: nidhanaṃ bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnāṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////🔽atithīn prati paśyati hiṅ kṛṇoty abhi vadati pra stauty udakam yācaty ud gāyati /
analyzed: nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda  atithīn prati paśyati hiṅ kṛṇoti abhi vadati pra stauti udakam yācati ud gāyati
translated: He who knows thus obtains the final oblation of prosperity, offspring, and cattle.🔽When he sees guests, he makes the sound 'him'; when he addresses them, he sings the praise;

original: upa harati prati haraty ucchiṣṭaṃ nidhanam /
analyzed: upa harati prati harati ucchiṣṭam nidhanam
translated: when he asks for water, he chants; when he offers it, he responds; the leftovers are the final oblation.

original: nidhanaṃ bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnāṃ bhavati ya evam veda ////
analyzed: nidhanam bhūtyāḥ prajāyāḥ paśūnām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus obtains the final oblation of prosperity, offspring, and cattle.

original: yat kṣattāraṃ hvayaty ā śrāvayaty eva tat ////
analyzed: yat kṣattāram hvayati ā śrāvayati eva tat
translated: When he calls the doorkeeper, he causes him to listen.

original: yat pratiśṛṇoti pratyāśrāvayaty eva tat ////
analyzed: yat pratiśṛṇoti pratyāśrāvayati eva tat
translated: When he responds, he causes him to respond in return.

original: yat pariveṣṭāraḥ pātrahastāḥ pūrve cāpare ca prapadyante camasādhvaryava eva te ////
analyzed: yat pariveṣṭāraḥ pātra hastāḥ pūrve ca apare ca prapadyante camasādhvaryavaḥ eva te
translated: The attendants who go round with vessels in their hands, on the east and on the west, are the Chamasādhvaryus.

original: teṣāṃ na kaś canāhotā ////🔽yad vā atithipatir atithīn pariviṣya gṛhān upodaity avabhṛtham eva tad upāvaiti ////
analyzed: teṣām na kaḥ cana a hotā  yat vai atithi patiḥ atithīn pariviṣya gṛhān upodaiti avabhṛtham eva tat upāvaiti
translated: Of them none is the Hotri.🔽When the host, having served the guests, goes to his house, he goes to the Avabhṛtha.

original: yat sabhāgayati dakṣiṇāḥ sabhāgayati yad anutiṣṭhata udavasyaty eva tat ////
analyzed: yat sabhāgayati dakṣiṇāḥ sabhāgayati yat anutiṣṭhate udavasyati eva tat
translated: When he distributes the shares, he distributes the sacrificial fee; when he attends on them, he attends on the Udavasānīya.

original: sa upahūtaḥ pṛthivyāṃ bhakṣayaty upahūtas tasmin yat pṛthivyāṃ viśvarūpam ////🔽sa upahūto 'ntarikṣe bhakṣayaty upahūtas tasmin yad divi viśvarūpam ////🔽sa upahūto divi bhakṣayaty upahūtas tasmin yad divi viśvarūpam ////
analyzed: saḥ upahūtaḥ pṛthivyām bhakṣayati upahūtaḥ tasmin yat pṛthivyām viśva rūpam  saḥ upahūtaḥ ntarikṣe bhakṣayati upahūtaḥ tasmin yat divi viśva rūpam  saḥ upahūtaḥ divi bhakṣayati upahūtaḥ tasmin yat divi viśva rūpam
translated: He, being invited, eats on the earth; he is invited to what has all forms on the earth.🔽He, being invited, eats in the atmosphere; he is invited to what has all forms in the sky.🔽He, being invited, eats in the sky; he is invited to what has all forms in the sky.

original: sa upahūto deveṣu bhakṣayaty upahūtas tasmin yad divi viśvarūpam ////
analyzed: saḥ upahūtaḥ deveṣu bhakṣayati upahūtaḥ tasmin yat divi viśva rūpam
translated: He, being invited, eats among the gods; he is invited to what has all forms in the sky.

original: sa upahūto lokeṣu bhakṣayaty upahūtas tasmin yad divi viśvarūpam ////
analyzed: saḥ upahūtaḥ lokeṣu bhakṣayati upahūtaḥ tasmin yat divi viśva rūpam
translated: He, being invited, eats among the worlds; he is invited to what has all forms in the sky.

original: sa upahūta upahūtaḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ upahūtaḥ upahūtaḥ
translated: He, being invited, is invited.

original: āpnotīmaṃ lokam āpnoty amum ////
analyzed: āpnoti imam lokam āpnoti amum
translated: He obtains this world, he obtains the other world.

original: jyotiṣmato lokān jayati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: jyotiṣmataḥ lokān jayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus conquers the worlds of the luminous ones.

original: prajāpatiś ca parameṣṭhī ca śṛṅge indraḥ śiro agnir lalāṭaṃ yamaḥ kṛkāṭam ////
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ca parameṣṭhī ca śṛṅge indraḥ śiraḥ agniḥ lalāṭam yamaḥ kṛkāṭam
translated: Prajapati and Parameshthi are the horns, Indra is the head, Agni is the forehead, Yama is the neck.

original: somo rājā mastiṣko dyaur uttarahanuḥ pṛthivy adharahanuḥ ////
analyzed: somaḥ rājā mastiṣkaḥ dyauḥ uttara hanuḥ pṛthivī adhara hanuḥ
translated: Soma the king is the brain, the sky is the upper jaw, the earth is the lower jaw.

original: vidyuj jihvā maruto dantā revatir grīvāḥ kṛttikā skandhā gharmo vahaḥ ////🔽viśvaṃ vāyuḥ svargo lokaḥ kṛṣṇadraṃ vidharaṇī niveṣyaḥ ////
analyzed: vidyut jihvā marutaḥ dantāḥ revatiḥ grīvāḥ kṛttikā skandhāḥ gharmaḥ vahaḥ  viśvam vāyuḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ kṛṣṇadram vidharaṇī niveṣyaḥ
translated: Lightning is the tongue, the Maruts are the teeth, Revati is the neck, the Krittikas are the shoulders, the hot-rayed one is the back.🔽The universe is the wind, the heavenly world is the black skin, the earth is the womb, the womb is the navel.

original: śyenaḥ kroto 'ntarikṣaṃ pājasyaṃ bṛhaspatiḥ kakud bṛhatīḥ kīkasāḥ ////
analyzed: śyenaḥ krotaḥ ntarikṣam pājasyam bṛhaspatiḥ kakud bṛhatīḥ kīkasāḥ
translated: The hawk is the form, the atmosphere is the paśya, Brihaspati is the hump, the Brihatī verses are the ribs.

original: devānāṃ patnīḥ pṛṣṭaya upasadaḥ parśavaḥ ////
analyzed: devānām patnīḥ pṛṣṭayaḥ upasadaḥ parśavaḥ
translated: The wives of the gods are the ribs, the Upasads are the ribs.

original: mitraś ca varuṇaś cāṃsau tvaṣṭā cāryamā ca doṣaṇī mahādevo bāhū ////
analyzed: mitraḥ ca varuṇaḥ ca aṃsau tvaṣṭā ca aryamā ca doṣaṇī mahādevaḥ bāhū
translated: Mitra and Varuna are the flanks, Tvastr and Aryaman are the forelegs, Mahadeva are the arms.

original: indrāṇī bhasad vāyuḥ puchaṃ pavamāno bālāḥ ////
analyzed: indrāṇī bhasad vāyuḥ pucham pavamānaḥ bālāḥ
translated: Indrani is the tail, Vayu is the tail, Pavamana are the hairs of the tail.

original: brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca śroṇī balam ūrū ////
