translated: The gods who dwell in the sky, who dwell in the atmosphere, and those who are on this earth,

original: tebhyas tvaṃ dhukṣva sarvadā kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ tvam dhukṣva sarvadā kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: For them always milk out milk, ghee, and honey.

original: yat te śiro yat te mukhaṃ yau karṇau ye ca te hanū /
analyzed: yat te śiraḥ yat te mukham yau karṇau ye ca te hanū
translated: Your head, your mouth, your ears, and your jaws,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: May they milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and honey.

original: yau ta oṣṭhau ye nāsike ye śṛṅge ye ca te 'kṣiṇī /
analyzed: yau te oṣṭhau ye nāsike ye śṛṅge ye ca te kṣiṇī
translated: Your lips, your nostrils, your horns, and your eyes,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: May they milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and honey.

original: yat te klomā yad dhṛdayaṃ purītat sahakaṇṭhikā /
analyzed: yat te klomā yat hṛdayam purītat sahakaṇṭhikā
translated: Your lungs, your heart, your liver, and your gullet,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: May they milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and honey.

original: yat te yakṛd ye matasne yad āntram yāś ca te gudāḥ /
analyzed: yat te yakṛt ye matasne yat āntram yāḥ ca te gudāḥ
translated: Thy liver, thy fat, thy intestines, and thy bowels,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and also honey.

original: yas te plāśir yo vaniṣṭhur yau kukṣī yac ca carma te /
analyzed: yaḥ te plāśiḥ yaḥ vaniṣṭhuḥ yau kukṣī yat ca carma te
translated: Thy bladder, thy rectum, thy two kidneys, and thy hide,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and also honey.

original: yat te majjā yad asthi yan maṃsaṃ yac ca lohitam /
analyzed: yat te majjā yat asthi yat maṃsam yat ca lohitam
translated: Thy marrow, thy bones, thy flesh, and thy blood,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and also honey.

original: yau te bāhū ye doṣaṇī yāv aṃsau yā ca te kakut /
analyzed: yau te bāhū ye doṣaṇī yau aṃsau yā ca te kakud
translated: Thy two arms, thy two forearms, thy two shoulders, and thy neck,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and also honey.

original: yās te grīvā ye skandhā yāḥ pṛṣṭīr yāś ca parśavaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te grīvāḥ ye skandhāḥ yāḥ pṛṣṭīḥ yāḥ ca parśavaḥ
translated: Thy two neck bones, thy two shoulder blades, thy two ribs, and thy two flanks,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and also honey.

original: yau ta urū aṣṭhīvantau ye śroṇī yā ca te bhasat /
analyzed: yau te urū aṣṭhīvantau ye śroṇī yā ca te bhasad
translated: Thy two thighs, thy two knee bones, thy two hips, and thy anus,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk out curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and also honey.

original: yat te puchaṃ ye te bālā yad ūdho ye ca te stanāḥ /
analyzed: yat te pucham ye te bālāḥ yat ūdhar ye ca te stanāḥ
translated: Thy tail, thy hair, thy udder, and thy teats,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and honey.

original: yās te jaṅghāḥ yāḥ kuṣṭhikā ṛcharā ye ca te śaphāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te jaṅghāḥ yāḥ kuṣṭhikāḥ ṛcharāḥ ye ca te śaphāḥ
translated: Your shanks, your fetlocks, your knees, and your hooves,

original: āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Let them milk curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and honey.

original: yat te carma śataudane yāni lomāny aghnye /🔽āmikṣāṃ duhratāṃ dātre kṣīraṃ sarpir atho madhu ////
analyzed: yat te carma śata odane yāni lomāni aghnye  āmikṣām duhratām dātre kṣīram sarpiḥ atha u madhu
translated: Your hide, O hundred-platter, your hairs, O cow to be slaughtered,🔽Let them milk curds for the giver, milk, ghee, and honey.

original: kroḍau te stāṃ purodāśāv ājyenābhighāritau /
analyzed: kroḍau te stām purodāśau ājyena abhighāritau
translated: Let your two breasts be the cakes, anointed with ghee,

original: tau pakṣau devi kṛtvā sā paktāraṃ divaṃ vaha ////
analyzed: tau pakṣau devi kṛtvā sā paktāram divam vaha
translated: Having made those your wings, O goddess, carry the cook to heaven.

original: ulūkhale musale yaś ca carmaṇi yo vā śūrpe taṇḍulaḥ kaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ulūkhale musale yaḥ ca carmaṇi yaḥ vā śūrpe taṇḍulaḥ kaṇaḥ
translated: The grain in the mortar, the pestle, the hide, or the winnowing basket,

original: yaṃ vā vāto mātariśvā pavamāno mamāthāgniṣ ṭad dhotā suhutaṃ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: yam vā vātaḥ mātariśvā pavamānaḥ mamātha agniḥ tat hotā su hutam kṛṇotu
translated: Or which the wind, the all-pervading wind, or the purifying wind has shaken, may Agni, the priest, make that well-offered.

original: apo devīr madhumatīr ghṛtaścuto brahmaṇāṃ hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi /
analyzed: apaḥ devīḥ madhumatīḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi
translated: I place in the hands of the Brahmins the divine waters, which are full of honey and ghee, separately.

original: yatkāma idam abhiṣiñcāmi vo 'haṃ tan me sarvaṃ saṃ padyatāṃ vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ////
analyzed: yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ ham tat me sarvam sam padyatām vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Whatever desire I sprinkle upon you, may all that be fulfilled for me. May we be the lords of wealth.

original: namas te jāyamānāyai jātāyā uta te namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te jāyamānāyai jātāyai uta te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you as you are being born, and also salutations to you as you are born.

original: bālebhyaḥ śaphebhyo rūpāyāghnye te namaḥ ////
analyzed: bālebhyaḥ śaphebhyaḥ rūpāya aghnye te namaḥ
translated: To the young calves, to the hooves, to the cow of form, to you, homage!

original: yo vidyāt sapta pravataḥ sapta vidyāt parāvataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vidyāt sapta pravataḥ sapta vidyāt parāvataḥ
translated: He who knows the seven forward and the seven backward,

original: śiro yajñasya yo vidyāt sa vaśāṃ prati gṛhṇīyāt ////
analyzed: śiraḥ yajñasya yaḥ vidyāt sa vaśām prati gṛhṇīyāt
translated: who knows the head of the sacrifice, he may accept the cow.

original: vedāhaṃ sapta pravataḥ sapta veda parāvataḥ /
analyzed: veda aham sapta pravataḥ sapta veda parāvataḥ
translated: I know the seven forward and the seven backward,

original: śiro yajñasyāhaṃ veda somaṃ cāsyāṃ vicakṣaṇam ////
analyzed: śiraḥ yajñasya aham veda somam ca asyām vicakṣaṇam
translated: I know the head of the sacrifice and the discerning Soma within it.

original: yayā dyaur yayā pṛthivī yayāpo gupitā imāḥ /
analyzed: yayā dyauḥ yayā pṛthivī yayā apaḥ gupitāḥ imāḥ
translated: By which the sky, by which the earth, by which these waters are covered,

original: vaśāṃ sahasradhārāṃ brahmaṇāchāvadāmasi ////
analyzed: vaśām sahasra dhārām brahmaṇā achāvadāmasi
translated: we praise with prayer the cow with a thousand streams.

original: śataṃ kaṃsāḥ śataṃ dogdhāraḥ śataṃ goptāro adhi pṛṣṭhe asyāḥ /
analyzed: śatam kaṃsāḥ śatam dogdhāraḥ śatam goptāraḥ adhi pṛṣṭhe asyāḥ
translated: A hundred are the pans, a hundred are the milkers, a hundred are the protectors on her back.

original: ye devās tasyāṃ prāṇanti te vaśāṃ vidur ekadhā ////
analyzed: ye devāḥ tasyām prāṇanti te vaśām viduḥ ekadhā
translated: The gods who breathe in her, they know the cow in one way.

original: yajñapadīrākṣīrā svadhāprāṇā mahīlukā /
analyzed: svadhā prāṇā mahīlukā
translated: The cow whose feet are the sacrifices, whose milk is the Veda, whose breath is the Svadha, who is great,

original: vaśā parjanyapatnī devāṃ apy eti brahmaṇā ////
analyzed: vaśā parjanya patnī devān api eti brahmaṇā
translated: the cow, the wife of Parjanya, goes to the gods with prayer.

original: anu tvāgniḥ prāviśad anu somo vaśe tvā /🔽ūdhas te bhadre parjanyo vidyutas te stanā vaśe ////
analyzed: anu tvā agniḥ prāviśat anu somaḥ vaśe tvā  ūdhar te bhadre parjanyaḥ vidyutaḥ te stanāḥ vaśe
translated: Agni has entered into you, Soma has entered into the cow.🔽Parjanya is your udder, O auspicious one, the lightning is your teats, O cow.

original: apas tvaṃ dhukṣe prathamā urvarā aparā vaśe /
analyzed: apaḥ tvam dhukṣe prathamāḥ urvarāḥ aparāḥ vaśe
translated: You milk the waters first, the fields later, O cow.

original: tṛtīyaṃ rāṣṭraṃ dhukṣe 'nnaṃ kṣīraṃ vaśe tvam ////
analyzed: tṛtīyam rāṣṭram dhukṣe nnam kṣīram vaśe tvam
translated: The third kingdom milked food, milk, and you, O Vasha.

original: yad ādityair hūyamānopātiṣṭha ṛtavari /
analyzed: yat ādityaiḥ hūyamānā upātiṣṭhe ṛtavari
translated: When you, O one rich in truth, stood near, being offered by the Adityas,

original: indraḥ sahasraṃ pātrānt somaṃ tvāpāyayad vaśe ////
analyzed: indraḥ sahasram pātrān somam tvā apāyayat vaśe
translated: Indra made you drink a thousand vessels of Soma, O Vasha.

original: yad anūcīndram air āt tvā ṛṣabho 'hvayat /
analyzed: yat anūci indram aiḥ āt tvā ṛṣabhaḥ hvayat
translated: When the bull called you, following Indra,

original: tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīraṃ kruddho 'harad vaśe ////
analyzed: tasmāt te vṛtrahā payaḥ kṣīram kruddhaḥ harat vaśe
translated: From that, O slayer of Vritra, angrily took away your milk, your milk, O Vasha.

original: yat te kruddho dhanapatir ā kṣīram aharad vaśe /
analyzed: yat te kruddhaḥ dhanapatiḥ ā kṣīram aharat vaśe
translated: When the lord of wealth angrily took away your milk, O Vasha,

original: idaṃ tad adya nākas triṣu pātreṣu rakṣati ////
analyzed: idam tat adya nākaḥ triṣu pātreṣu rakṣati
translated: That he now protects in the three vessels in the sky.

original: triṣu pātreṣu taṃ somam ā devy aharad vaśā /
analyzed: triṣu pātreṣu tam somam ā devī aharat vaśā
translated: The goddess Vasha took that Soma in the three vessels,

original: atharvā yatra dīkṣito barhiṣy āsta hiraṇyaye ////
analyzed: atharvā yatra dīkṣitaḥ barhiṣi āsta hiraṇyaye
translated: Where the initiated Atharvan sat on the golden sacrificial grass.

original: saṃ hi somenāgata sam u sarveṇa padvatā /
analyzed: sam hi somena agata sam u sarveṇa padvatā
translated: When she came with Soma, and with all that moves on feet,

original: vaśā samudram adhy aṣṭhad gandharvaiḥ kalibhiḥ saha ////
analyzed: vaśā samudram adhi aṣṭhat gandharvaiḥ kalibhiḥ saha
translated: Vasha stood in the ocean together with the Gandharvas and Kali.

original: saṃ hi vātenāgata sam u sarvaiḥ patatribhiḥ /
analyzed: sam hi vātena agata sam u sarvaiḥ patatribhiḥ
translated: When she came with the wind, and with all that flies,

original: vaśā samudre prānṛtyad ṛcaḥ sāmāni bibhratī ////
analyzed: vaśā samudre prānṛtyat ṛcaḥ sāmāni bibhratī
translated: Vasha danced in the ocean, bearing the Rig and Sama hymns.

original: saṃ hi sūryeṇāgata sam u sarveṇa cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: sam hi sūryeṇa agata sam u sarveṇa cakṣuṣā
translated: When she came with the sun, and with all the eye,

original: vaśā samudram aty akhyad bhadrā jyotīṃṣi bibhratī ////
analyzed: vaśā samudram ati akhyat bhadrā jyotīṃṣi bibhratī
translated: The barren cow has passed over the ocean, bearing auspicious lights.

original: abhīvṛtā hiraṇyena yad atiṣṭha ṛtāvari /
analyzed: abhīvṛtā hiraṇyena yat atiṣṭhaḥ ṛtāvari
translated: When you stood there, O truthful one, covered with gold,

original: aśvaḥ samudro bhūtvādhy askandad vaśe tvā ////
analyzed: aśvaḥ samudraḥ bhūtvā adhi askandat vaśe tvā
translated: The horse, becoming the ocean, leaped over you, O barren one.

original: tad bhadrāḥ sam agachanta vaśā deṣṭry atho svadhā /
analyzed: tat bhadrāḥ sam agachanta vaśā deṣṭrī atha u svadhā
translated: There the auspicious ones came together, the barren cow, the seer, and also the oblation.

original: atharvā yatra dīkṣito barhiṣy āsta hiraṇyaye ////
analyzed: atharvā yatra dīkṣitaḥ barhiṣi āsta hiraṇyaye
translated: Where the initiated Atharvan sat on the sacrificial grass of gold.

original: vaśā mātā rājanyasya vaśā mātā svadhe tava /
analyzed: vaśā mātā rājanyasya vaśā mātā svadhe tava
translated: The barren cow is the mother of the Kshatriya, the barren cow is the mother of the oblation for you.

original: vaśāyā yajña āyudhaṃ tataś cittam ajāyata ////
analyzed: vaśāyāḥ yajñaḥ āyudham tatas cittam ajāyata
translated: From the barren cow's sacrificial implements, from that the mind was born.

original: ūrdhvo bindur ud acarad brahmaṇaḥ kakudād adhi /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ binduḥ ud acarat brahmaṇaḥ kakudāt adhi
translated: The upward drop moved forth from the peak of Brahman.

original: tatas tvaṃ jajñiṣe vaśe tato hotājāyata ////
analyzed: tatas tvam jajñiṣe vaśe tatas hotā ajāyata
translated: From that you were born, O barren cow, from that the Hotar priest was born.

original: āsnas te gāthā abhavann uṣṇihābhyo balaṃ vaśe /🔽pājasyāj jajñe yajña stanebhyo raśmayas tava ////
analyzed: āsnaḥ te gāthāḥ abhavan uṣṇihābhyaḥ balam vaśe  pājasyāt jajñe yajña stanebhyaḥ raśmayaḥ tava
translated: Your songs became the Gathas, strength in the barren cow from the Usnih verses.🔽From the Pajasy rite the sacrifice was born, your rays from the breasts.

original: īrmābhyām ayanaṃ jātaṃ sakthibhyāṃ ca vaśe tava /
analyzed: īrmābhyām ayanam jātam sakthibhyām ca vaśe tava
translated: The path was born from your thighs and hips, O barren cow.

original: āntrebhyo jajñire atrā udarād adhi vīrudhaḥ ////
analyzed: āntrebhyaḥ jajñire atrāḥ udarāt adhi vīrudhaḥ
translated: From the entrails the plants were born, from the belly the herbs.

original: yad udaraṃ varuṇasyānuprāviśathā vaśe /
analyzed: yat udaram varuṇasya anuprāviśathāḥ vaśe
translated: When you entered the belly of Varuna, O barren cow,

original: tatas tvā brahmod ahvayat sa hi netram avet tava ////
analyzed: tatas tvā brahmā ud ahvayat sa hi netram avet tava
translated: Then Brahmā invoked you, for he knew your eye.

original: sarve garbhād avepanta jāyamānād asūsvaḥ /
analyzed: sarve garbhāt avepanta jāyamānāt asūsvaḥ
translated: All trembled from the womb, from the one being born in its own home.

original: sasūva hi tām āhu vaśeti brahmabhiḥ kḷptaḥ sa hy asyā bandhuḥ ////
analyzed: sasūva hi tām āhuḥ vaśā iti brahmabhiḥ kḷptaḥ sa hi asyāḥ bandhuḥ
translated: For she indeed gave birth to that which they call the cow. Formed by the Brahmins, for she is its kinsman.

original: yudha ekaḥ saṃ sṛjati yo asyā eka id vaśī /
analyzed: yudhaḥ ekaḥ sam sṛjati yaḥ asyāḥ ekaḥ id vaśī
translated: Alone, he who is one of her, creates. He who is one, indeed, is her lord.

original: tarāṃsi yajñā abhavan tarasāṃ cakṣur abhavad vaśā ////
analyzed: tarāṃsi yajñāḥ abhavan tarasām cakṣuḥ abhavat vaśā
translated: The sacrifices became the limbs, the cow became the eye.

original: vaśā yajñaṃ praty agṛhṇād vaśā sūryam adhārayat /
analyzed: vaśā yajñam prati agṛhṇāt vaśā sūryam adhārayat
translated: The cow seized the sacrifice, the cow held up the sun.

original: vaśāyām antar aviśad odano brahmaṇā saha ////
analyzed: vaśāyām antar aviśat odanaḥ brahmaṇā saha
translated: The rice entered into the cow, together with the Brahman.

original: vaśām evāmṛtam āhur vaśāṃ mṛtyum upāsate /
analyzed: vaśām eva amṛtam āhuḥ vaśām mṛtyum upāsate
translated: They call the cow indeed immortality. They worship the cow as death.

original: vaśedaṃ sarvam abhavad devā manuṣyā asurāḥ pitara ṛṣayaḥ ////
analyzed: vaśā idam sarvam abhavat devāḥ manuṣyāḥ asurāḥ pitaraḥ ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The cow became all this: gods, men, demons, fathers, seers.

original: ya evaṃ vidyāt sa vaśāṃ prati gṛhṇīyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidyāt sa vaśām prati gṛhṇīyāt
translated: One who knows thus should accept the cow.

original: tathā hi yajñaḥ sarvapād duhe dātre 'napasphuran ////
analyzed: tathā hi yajñaḥ sarva pād duhe dātre na apasphuran
translated: For thus the sacrifice, with all its feet, yields milk to the giver, without fail.

original: tisro jihvā varuṇasyāntar dīdyaty āsani /
analyzed: tisraḥ jihvāḥ varuṇasya antar dīdyati āsani
translated: Three tongues of Varuna blaze within the lightning.

original: tāsāṃ yā madhye rājati sā vaśā duṣpratigrahā ////
analyzed: tāsām yā madhye rājati sā vaśā duṣpratigrahā
translated: Of them, the one that shines in the middle is the cow, difficult to accept.

original: caturdhā reto abhavad vaśāyāḥ /
analyzed: caturdhā retaḥ abhavat vaśāyāḥ
translated: The cow's seed became fourfold.

original: āpas turīyam amṛtaṃ turīyaṃ yajñas turīyaṃ paśavas turīyam ////
analyzed: āpaḥ turīyam amṛtam turīyam yajñaḥ turīyam paśavaḥ turīyam
translated: Water is the fourth, nectar is the fourth, sacrifice is the fourth, cattle are the fourth.

original: vaśā dyaur vaśā pṛthivī vaśā viṣṇuḥ prajāpatiḥ /🔽vaśāyā dugdham apibant sādhyā vasavaś ca ye ////
analyzed: vaśā dyauḥ vaśā pṛthivī vaśā viṣṇuḥ prajāpatiḥ  vaśāyāḥ dugdham apiban sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye
translated: The cow is the sky, the cow is the earth, the cow is Vishnu, the lord of creatures.🔽The Sadhyas and the Vasus drank the milk of the cow.

original: vaśāyā dugdhaṃ pītvā sādhyā vasavaś ca ye /
analyzed: vaśāyāḥ dugdham pītvā sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye
translated: Having drunk the milk of the cow, the Sadhyas and the Vasus,

original: te vai bradhnasya viṣṭapi payo asyā upāsate ////
analyzed: te vai bradhnasya viṣṭapi payaḥ asyāḥ upāsate
translated: They indeed attend upon the milk of this world-ridge of the sun.

original: somam enām eke duhre ghṛtam eka upāsate /
analyzed: somam enām eke duhre ghṛtam eke upāsate
translated: Some milk her for Soma, some attend upon her as ghee.

original: ya evaṃ viduṣe vaśāṃ dadus te gatās tridivaṃ divaḥ ////
analyzed: ye evam viduṣe vaśām daduḥ te gatāḥ tridivam divaḥ
translated: Those who have given a cow to the wise have gone to the three worlds of heaven.

original: brāhmaṇebhyo vaśāṃ dattvā sarvāṃl lokānt sam aśnute /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ vaśām dattvā sarvān lokān sam aśnute
translated: Having given a cow to the Brahmins, one enjoys all the worlds.

original: ṛtaṃ hy asyām ārpitam api brahmātho tapaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛtam hi asyām ā arpitam api brahma atha u tapaḥ
translated: For truth is placed in her, and also Brahman and austerity.

original: vaśāṃ devā upa jīvanti vaśāṃ manuṣyā uta /
analyzed: vaśām devāḥ upa jīvanti vaśām manuṣyāḥ uta
translated: The gods live on the cow, and also men.

original: vaśedaṃ sarvam abhavad yāvat sūryo vipaśyati ////
analyzed: vaśā idam sarvam abhavat yāvat sūryaḥ vipaśyati
translated: This whole world has become the cow, as far as the sun sees.

original: agne jāyasvāditir nāthiteyaṃ brahmaudanaṃ pacati putrakāmā /
analyzed: agne jāyasva aditiḥ nāthitā iyam brahmaudanam pacati putra kāmā
translated: O Agni, be born, this Aditi is invoked, she cooks the Brahman's rice for one desiring sons.

original: saptaṛṣayo bhūtakṛtas te tvā manthantu prajayā saheha ////
analyzed: sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ te tvā manthantu prajayā saha iha
translated: May the seven sages, the creators of beings, churn you here together with offspring.

original: kṛṇuta dhūmaṃ vṛṣaṇaḥ sakhāyo 'droghāvitā vācam acha /
analyzed: kṛṇuta dhūmam vṛṣaṇaḥ sakhāyaḥ droghāvitāḥ vācam acha
translated: Make smoke, O ye strong ones, O friends, with the guileless thought, direct your speech.

original: ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devā asahanta dasyūn ////
analyzed: ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāh su vīraḥ yena devāḥ asahanta dasyūn
translated: This Agni is the conqueror of battles, the good hero, by whom the gods overcame the Dasyus.

original: agne 'janiṣṭhā mahate vīryāya brahmaudanāya paktave jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: agne janiṣṭhāḥ mahate vīryāya brahmaudanāya paktave jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, thou hast been born for great strength, for the Brahmana's rice to be cooked, O all-knower.

original: saptaṛṣayo bhūtakṛtas te tvājījanann asyai rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yacha ////
analyzed: sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ te tvā ajījanan asyai rayim sarva vīram ni yaccha
translated: The seven Rishis, the creators of beings, they have begotten thee. Place here wealth with all heroes.

original: samiddho agne samidhā sam idhyasva vidvān devān yajñiyāṃ eha vakṣaḥ /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne samidhā sam idhyasva vidvān devān yajñiyān ā iha vakṣaḥ
translated: O Agni, kindled, be kindled with the kindling-stick, knowing the gods who are worthy of sacrifice, come hither.

original: tebhyo haviḥ śrapayaṃ jātaveda uttamaṃ nākam adhi rohayemam ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ haviḥ śrapayan jātavedaḥ uttamam nākam adhi rohaya imam
translated: To them, O all-knower, while the offering is being cooked, raise this one to the highest vault.

original: tredhā bhāgo nihito yaḥ purā vo devānāṃ pitṝṇāṃ martyānām /
analyzed: tredhā bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yaḥ purā vaḥ devānām pitṝṇām martyānām
translated: The portion that was formerly divided into three parts for you, for the gods, the fathers, and mortals,

original: aṃśāṃ jānīdhvaṃ vi bhajāmi tān vo yo devānāṃ sa imāṃ pārayāti ////
analyzed: aṃśām jānīdhvam vi bhajāmi tān vaḥ yaḥ devānām saḥ imām pārayāti
translated: Know your shares, I divide them for you. He who belongs to the gods, he leads this one across.

original: agne sahasvān abhibhūr abhīd asi nīco ny ubja dviṣataḥ sapatnān /
analyzed: agne sahasvān abhibhūḥ abhi id asi nīcaḥ ni ubja dviṣataḥ sapatnān
translated: O Agni, thou hast come as the conqueror, as the overcomer. Bend down the low ones, the enemies, the rivals.

original: iyaṃ mātrā mīyamānā mitā ca sajātāṃs te balihṛtaḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: iyam mātrā mīyamānā mitā ca sajātān te bali hṛtaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: Let this mother, being measured and measured out, make thy kinsmen pay tribute to thee.

original: sākaṃ sajātaiḥ payasā sahaidhy ud ubjaināṃ mahate vīryāya /
analyzed: sākam sajātaiḥ payasā saha edhi ud ubja enām mahate vīryāya
translated: Rise together with thy kinsmen, be kindled with milk, raise her up for great strength.

original: ūrdhvo nākasyādhi roha viṣṭapaṃ svargo loka iti yaṃ vadanti ////
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ nākasya adhi roha viṣṭapam svargaḥ lokaḥ iti yam vadanti
translated: Rise up to the height of the vault of the sky, to the world which they call heaven.

original: iyaṃ mahī prati gṛhṇātu carma pṛthivī devī sumanasyamānā /
analyzed: iyam mahī prati gṛhṇātu carma pṛthivī devī sumanasyamānā
translated: May this earth receive the skin, may the goddess Pṛthivī be well-disposed.

original: atha gachema sukṛtasya lokam ////
analyzed: atha gacchema sukṛtasya lokam
translated: Then may we go to the world of good deeds.

original: etau grāvāṇau sayujā yuṅdhi carmaṇi nirbindhy aṃśūn yajamānāya sādhu /
analyzed: etau grāvāṇau sayujā yuṅdhi carmaṇi nirbindhi aṃśūn yajamānāya sādhu
translated: Yoke these two pressing-stones together on the skin, press out the Soma-juice for the sacrificer, O good one.

original: avaghnatī ni jahi ya imāṃ pṛtanyava ūrdhvaṃ prajām udbharanty ud ūha ////
analyzed: avaghnatī ni jahi ye imām pṛtanyavaḥ ūrdhvam prajām udbharantī ud ūha
translated: Drive away those who would injure this (earth), those who would raise up the people upwards, drive them away.

original: gṛhāṇa grāvāṇau sakṛtau vīra hasta ā te devā yajñiyā yajñam aguḥ /
analyzed: gṛhāṇa grāvāṇau sakṛtau vīra haste ā te devāḥ yajñiyāḥ yajñam aguḥ
translated: O hero, take the two pressing-stones, once-formed, in your hand. The divine sacrificers have come to your sacrifice.

original: trayo varā yatamāṃs tvaṃ vṛṇīṣe tās te samṛddhīr iha rādhayāmi ////
analyzed: trayaḥ varāḥ yatamān tvam vṛṇīṣe tāḥ te samṛddhīḥ iha rādhayāmi
translated: The three boons which you choose, I grant you all of them here.

original: iyaṃ te dhītir idam u te janitraṃ gṛhṇātu tvām aditiḥ śūraputrā /
analyzed: iyam te dhītiḥ idam u te janitram gṛhṇātu tvām aditiḥ śūra putrā
translated: This is your thought, this is your birthplace. May Aditi, the mother of brave sons, receive you.

original: parā punīhi ya imāṃ pṛtanyavo 'syai rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yacha ////
analyzed: parā punīhi ye imām pṛtanyavaḥ syai rayim sarva vīram ni yaccha
translated: Purify yourself. Place wealth with all heroes in her who would injure this (earth).

original: upaśvase druvaye sīdatā yūyaṃ vi vicyadhvaṃ yajñiyāsas tuṣaiḥ /
analyzed: upaśvase druvaye sīdata yūyam vi vicyadhvam yajñiyāsaḥ tuṣaiḥ
translated: Breathe upon (the Soma), be firm, sit down together. You who are worthy of sacrifice, be scattered with the husks.

original: śriyā samānān ati sarvānt syāmādhaspadaṃ dviṣatas pādayāmi ////
analyzed: śriyā samānān ati sarvān syāma adhaspadam dviṣataḥ pādayāmi
translated: May we surpass all our equals in prosperity. I place the foot of the haters below.

original: parehi nāri punar ehi kṣipram apāṃ tvā goṣṭho adhy arukṣad bharāya /
analyzed: parehi nāri punar ehi kṣipram apām tvā goṣṭhaḥ adhi arukṣat bharāya
translated: Go away, woman, and come back quickly. The cow-pen has risen up for you to carry the water.

original: tāsāṃ gṛhṇītād yatamā yajñiyā asan vibhājya dhīrītarā jahītāt ////
analyzed: tāsām gṛhṇītāt yatamāḥ yajñiyāḥ asan vibhājya dhīrītarā jahītāt
translated: From among them, take those that are most suitable for the sacrifice. Having divided them, take away the others.

original: emā agur yoṣitaḥ śumbhamānā ut tiṣṭha nāri tavasaṃ rabhasva /
analyzed: ā imāḥ aguḥ yoṣitaḥ śumbhamānāḥ ud tiṣṭha nāri tavasam rabhasva
translated: These women have come, adorning themselves. Rise up, woman, be strong and vigorous.

original: supatnī patyā prajayā prajāvaty ā tvāgan yajñaḥ prati kumbhaṃ gṛbhāya ////
analyzed: su patnī patyā prajayā prajāvatī ā tvā agan yajñaḥ prati kumbham gṛbhāya
translated: Be a good wife with husband, offspring, and abundant progeny. Let the sacrifice come to you. Take hold of the pot.

original: ūrjo bhāgo nihito yaḥ purā va ṛṣipraśiṣṭāpa ā bharaitāḥ /
analyzed: ūrjaḥ bhāgaḥ nihitaḥ yaḥ purā vaḥ ṛṣi praśiṣṭa apaḥ ā bhara etāḥ
translated: The share of strength that was deposited here before, bring it, instructed by the seers.

original: ayaṃ yajño gātuvin nāthavit prajāvid ugraḥ paśuvid vīravid vo astu ////
analyzed: ayam yajñaḥ gātu vid nātha vid prajā vid ugraḥ paśu vid vīra vid vaḥ astu
translated: Let this sacrifice of yours be one that finds a way, one that finds a protector, one that finds offspring, one that finds cattle, one that finds heroes.

original: agne carur yajñiyas tvādhy arukṣac chucis tapiṣṭhas tapasā tapainam /
analyzed: agne caruḥ yajñiyaḥ tvā adhi arukṣat śuciḥ tapiṣṭhaḥ tapasā tapa enam
translated: O Agni, the sacrificial oblation has risen up for you. Purify it, most radiant one, with your heat.

original: ārṣeyā daivā abhisaṃgatya bhāgam imaṃ tapiṣṭhā ṛtubhis tapantu ////
analyzed: ārṣeyāḥ daivāḥ abhisaṃgatya bhāgam imam tapiṣṭhāḥ ṛtubhiḥ tapantu
translated: Having assembled, let the divine seers, instructed by the seers, heat this share with the most radiant heat.

original: śuddhāḥ pūtā yoṣito yajñiyā imā āpaś carum ava sarpantu śubhrāḥ /
analyzed: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ carum ava sarpantu śubhrāḥ
translated: These pure, purified, worthy women, and these bright waters, let them glide over the oblation.

original: aduḥ prajāṃ bahulāṃ paśūn naḥ paktaudanasya sukṛtām etu lokam ////
analyzed: aduḥ prajām bahulām paśūn naḥ paktā odanasya su kṛtām etu lokam
translated: Give us offspring and abundant cattle. Let the well-cooked rice oblation go to the world of the virtuous.

original: brahmaṇā śuddhā uta pūtā ghṛtena somasyāṃśavas taṇḍulā yajñiyā ime /
analyzed: brahmaṇā śuddhāḥ uta pūtāḥ ghṛtena somasya aṃśavaḥ taṇḍulāḥ yajñiyāḥ ime
translated: Purified by Brahman, cleansed with ghee, these grains of Soma, fit for sacrifice,

original: apaḥ pra viśata prati gṛhṇātu vaś carur imaṃ paktvā sukṛtām eta lokam ////
analyzed: apaḥ pra viśata prati gṛhṇātu vaḥ caruḥ imam paktvā su kṛtām eta lokam
translated: Enter the waters. Let the cooked oblation accept you. Having cooked this, go to the world of the virtuous.

original: uruḥ prathasva mahatā mahimnā sahasrapṛṣṭhaḥ sukṛtasya loke /
analyzed: uruḥ prathasva mahatā mahimnā sahasra pṛṣṭhaḥ sukṛtasya loke
translated: Be vast, spread with great majesty, with a thousand backs in the world of the virtuous.

original: pitāmahāḥ pitaraḥ prajopajāhaṃ paktā pañcadaśas te asmi ////
analyzed: pitāmahāḥ pitaraḥ prajā upajā aham paktā pañcadaśaḥ te asmi
translated: Grandfathers, fathers, I am the sacrificer, the fifteenfold one among you.

original: sahasrapṛṣṭhaḥ śatadhāro akṣito brahmaudano devayānaḥ svargaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra pṛṣṭhaḥ śata dhāraḥ akṣitaḥ brahmaudanaḥ deva yānaḥ svar gaḥ
translated: With a thousand backs, a hundred streams, inexhaustible, the Brahmic rice, the heavenly path to the gods,

original: amūṃs ta ā dadhāmi prajayā reṣayainān balihārāya mṛḍatān mahyam eva ////
analyzed: amūn te ā dadhāmi prajayā reṣaya enān bali hārāya mṛḍatāt mahyam eva
translated: I place you in that world. Delight them with offspring. Be gracious to me for the sake of the oblation.

original: udehi vediṃ prajayā vardhayaināṃ nudasva rakṣaḥ prataraṃ dhehy enām /
analyzed: udehi vedim prajayā vardhaya enām nudasva rakṣaḥ prataram dhehi enām
translated: Rise up, make this altar grow with offspring. Drive away the Raksases. Make it pass over.

original: śriyā samānān ati sarvānt syāmādhaspadaṃ dviṣatas pādayāmi ////
analyzed: śriyā samānān ati sarvān syāma adhaspadam dviṣataḥ pādayāmi
translated: May we surpass all our equals in prosperity. I cast down the foot of the hateful one below.

original: abhyāvartasva paśubhiḥ sahaināṃ pratyaṅṅ enāṃ devatābhiḥ sahaidhi /
analyzed: abhyāvartasva paśubhiḥ saha enām pratyaṅ enām devatābhiḥ saha edhi
translated: Turn back with the cattle. Come to this one facing the east with the deities.

original: mā tvā prāpac chapatho mābhicāraḥ sve kṣetre anamīvā vi rāja ////
analyzed: mā tvā prāpat śapathaḥ mā abhicāraḥ sve kṣetre anamīvā vi rāja
translated: Let not the curse nor the sorcery reach you. Rule in your own field free from disease.

original: ṛtena taṣṭā manasā hitaiṣā brahmaudanasya vihitā vedir agre /
analyzed: ṛtena taṣṭā manasā hitā eṣā brahmaudanasya vihitā vediḥ agre
translated: This altar, fashioned by truth, by mind, for the sake of welfare, is prepared for the Brahmic rice.

original: aṃsadhrīṃ śuddhām upa dhehi nāri tatraudanaṃ sādaya daivānām ////
analyzed: aṃsadhrīm śuddhām upa dhehi nāri tatra odanam sādaya daivānām
translated: O woman, place it on the shoulder-blade, pure, and there place the rice for the gods.

original: aditer hastāṃ srucam etāṃ dvitīyāṃ saptaṛṣayo bhūtakṛto yām akṛṇvan /
analyzed: aditeḥ hastām srucam etām dvitīyām sapta ṛṣayaḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ yām akṛṇvan
translated: This ladle, the second, fashioned by the seven sages, the creators of beings, from the hands of Aditi,

original: sā gātrāṇi viduṣy odanasya darvir vedyām adhy enaṃ cinotu ////🔽śṛtaṃ tvā havyam upa sīdantu daivā niḥsṛpyāgneḥ punar enān pra sīda /
analyzed: sā gātrāṇi viduṣī odanasya darviḥ vedyām adhi enam cinotu  śṛtam tvā havyam upa sīdantu daivāḥ niḥsṛpya agneḥ punar enān pra sīda
translated: May that ladle, penetrating the limbs of the rice, be placed upon the altar.🔽Let the gods sit down to your cooked oblation. Having emerged from the fire, return to them again.

original: somena pūto jaṭhare sīda brahmaṇām ārṣeyās te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ ////
analyzed: somena pūtaḥ jaṭhare sīda brahmaṇām ārṣeyāḥ te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ
translated: Purified by the Soma, sit in the stomach. May the descendants of the Rishis, your eaters, not injure you.

original: soma rājant saṃjñānam ā vapaibhyaḥ subrāhmaṇā yatame tvopasīdān /🔽ṛṣīn ārṣeyāṃs tapaso 'dhi jātān brahmaudane suhavā johavīmi ////
analyzed: soma rājan saṃjñānam ā vapa ebhyaḥ su brāhmaṇāḥ yatame tvā upasīdān  ṛṣīn ārṣeyān tapasaḥ dhi jātān brahmaudane su havā johavīmi
translated: O Soma, the king, distribute the recognition to these, to the best of the Brahmins who have approached you.🔽I invoke with the Brahmic rice the Rishis, the descendants of the Rishis, born from austerity, the easy to invoke ones.

original: śuddhāḥ pūtā yoṣito yajñiyā imā brahmaṇāṃ hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi /
analyzed: śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ yoṣitaḥ yajñiyāḥ imāḥ brahmaṇām hasteṣu prapṛthak sādayāmi
translated: These pure, purified, sacrificial women I place separately in the hands of the Brahmins.

original: yatkāma idam abhiṣiñcāmi vo 'ham indro marutvānt sa dadād idaṃ me ////
analyzed: yad kāmaḥ idam abhiṣiñcāmi vaḥ ham indraḥ marutvān sa dadāt idam me
translated: For whatever desire I sprinkle this upon you, may Indra with the Maruts grant this to me.

original: idaṃ me jyotir amṛtaṃ hiraṇyaṃ pakvaṃ kṣetrāt kāmadughā ma eṣā /
analyzed: idam me jyotiḥ amṛtam hiraṇyam pakvam kṣetrāt kāmadughā me eṣā
translated: This is my immortal light, my gold, my ripe corn, this is my wish-granting cow from the field.

original: idaṃ dhanaṃ ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu kṛṇve panthāṃ pitṛṣu yaḥ svargaḥ ////
analyzed: idam dhanam ni dadhe brāhmaṇeṣu kṛṇve panthām pitṛṣu yaḥ svar gaḥ
translated: I place this wealth in the Brahmanas, I make the path for the fathers which is heaven.

original: agnau tuṣān ā vapa jātavedasi paraḥ kambūkāṃ apa mṛḍḍhi dūram /
analyzed: agnau tuṣān ā vapa jātavedasi paras kambūkām apa mṛḍḍhi dūram
translated: In the fire, O all-knower, cast the husks, drive away the chaff far away.

original: etaṃ śuśruma gṛharājasya bhāgam atho vidma nirṛter bhāgadheyam ////
analyzed: etam śuśruma gṛha rājasya bhāgam atha u vidma nirṛteḥ bhāgadheyam
translated: We have heard this to be the share of the king of the house, and we know the share of Nirriti.

original: śrāmyataḥ pacato viddhi sunvataḥ panthāṃ svargam adhi rohayainam /
analyzed: śrāmyataḥ pacataḥ viddhi sunvataḥ panthām svargam adhi rohaya enam
translated: Know the path of him who toils, who cooks, who presses out the Soma, and make him ascend to heaven.

original: yena rohāt param āpadya yad vaya uttamaṃ nākaṃ paramaṃ vyoma //// 🔽babhrer adhvaryo mukham etad vi mṛḍḍhy ājyāya lokaṃ kṛṇuhi pravidvān /
analyzed: yena rohāt param āpadya yat vayaḥ uttamam nākam paramam vyoma  babhreḥ adhvaryo mukham etat vi mṛḍḍhi ājyāya lokam kṛṇuhi pravidvān
translated: By which he may ascend to the highest, to the best, to the highest vault.🔽O Adhvaryu, be kind to this face of the sacrificer, make a place for the ghee, being wise.

original: ghṛtena gātrānu sarvā vi mṛḍḍhi kṛṇve panthāṃ pitṛṣu yaḥ svargaḥ ////🔽babhre rakṣaḥ samadam ā vapaibhyo 'brāhmaṇā yatame tvopasīdān /
analyzed: ghṛtena gātrā anu sarvā vi mṛḍḍhi kṛṇve panthām pitṛṣu yaḥ svar gaḥ  babhre rakṣaḥ samadam ā vapa ebhyaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ yatame tvā upasīdān
translated: Be kind to all his limbs with ghee, I make the path for the fathers which is heaven.🔽O Raksas, cast away the quarrel among these, the non-Brahmanas who have come to you.

original: purīṣiṇaḥ prathamānāḥ purastād ārṣeyās te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ ////
analyzed: purīṣiṇaḥ prathamānāḥ purastāt ārṣeyāḥ te mā riṣan prāśitāraḥ
translated: The first, the spreading ones, who are in front, may they, the descendants of the Rishis, who eat, not harm me.

original: ārṣeyeṣu ni dadha odana tvā nānārṣeyāṇām apy asty atra /
analyzed: ārṣeyeṣu ni dadhe odana tvā na anārṣeyāṇām api asti atra
translated: In the offerings of the Rishis I place thee, O cooked rice; to the non-Rishis also belongs a share herein.

original: agnir me goptā marutaś ca sarve viśve devā abhi rakṣantu pakvam ////
analyzed: agniḥ me goptā marutaḥ ca sarve viśve devāḥ abhi rakṣantu pakvam
translated: May Agni be my protector, and all the Maruts, may all the gods guard the cooked (food).

original: yajñaṃ duhānaṃ sadam it prapīnaṃ pumāṃsaṃ dhenuṃ sadanaṃ rayīṇām /
analyzed: yajñam duhānam sadam id prapīnam pumāṃsam dhenum sadanam rayīṇām
translated: Milking the sacrifice, ever abundant, the male, the milch cow, the seat of riches,

original: prajāmṛtatvam uta dīrgham āyū rāyaś ca poṣair upa tvā sadema ////
analyzed: prajā amṛta tvam uta dīrgham āyuḥ rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ upa tvā sadema
translated: May we approach thee with offspring, immortality, and long life, and with the nourishments of wealth.

original: vṛṣabho 'si svarga ṛṣīn ārṣeyān gacha /
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ u si svarga ṛṣīn ārṣeyān gacha
translated: Thou art the bull; go to the Rishis and the descendants of Rishis.

original: sukṛtāṃ loke sīda tatra nau saṃskṛtam ////
analyzed: sukṛtām loke sīda tatra nau saṃskṛtam
translated: Go to the world of the virtuous; there is our well-prepared (food).

original: samācinuṣvānusaṃprayāhy agne pathaḥ kalpaya devayānān /
analyzed: samācinuṣva anusaṃprayāhi agne pathaḥ kalpaya deva yānān
translated: Arrange the paths, O Agni, the paths to the gods; follow and pile up.

original: etaiḥ sukṛtair anu gachema yajñaṃ nāke tiṣṭhantam adhi saptaraśmau ////
analyzed: etaiḥ su kṛtaiḥ anu gacchema yajñam nāke tiṣṭhantam adhi sapta raśmau
translated: With these good deeds may we follow the sacrifice standing in the sky on the seven-rayed (sun).

original: yena devā jyotiṣā dyām udāyan brahmaudanaṃ paktvā sukṛtasya lokam /
analyzed: yena devāḥ jyotiṣā dyām udāyan brahmaudanam paktvā sukṛtasya lokam
translated: By which light the gods went up to the sky, having cooked the Brahma-rice, to the world of the virtuous,

original: tena geṣma sukṛtasya lokaṃ svar ārohanto abhi nākam uttamam ////
analyzed: tena geṣma sukṛtasya lokam svar ārohantaḥ abhi nākam uttamam
translated: By that (light) may we go to the world of the virtuous, ascending the heaven, to the highest vault.

original: bhavāśarvau mṛḍataṃ mābhi yātaṃ bhūtapatī paśupatī namo vām /
analyzed: bhavāśarvau mṛḍatam mā abhi yātam bhūtapatī paśupatī namaḥ vām
translated: Bhava and Sarva, be gracious, do not afflict us; lords of beings, lords of cattle, homage to you.

original: pratihitām āyatāṃ mā vi srāṣṭaṃ mā no hiṃsiṣṭaṃ dvipado mā catuṣpadaḥ ////
analyzed: pratihitām āyatām mā vi srāṣṭam mā naḥ hiṃsiṣṭam dvipadaḥ mā catuṣpadaḥ
translated: Do not let loose the long-drawn arrow aimed at us. Do not injure our two-footed or four-footed (creatures).

original: śune kroṣṭre mā śarīrāṇi kartam aliklavebhyo gṛdhrebhyo ye ca kṛṣṇā aviṣyavaḥ /
analyzed: śune kroṣṭre mā śarīrāṇi kartam aliklavebhyaḥ gṛdhrebhyaḥ ye ca kṛṣṇāḥ aviṣyavaḥ
translated: Make our bodies not for the dog, the jackal, nor for the ravens, nor for the black and voracious birds.

original: makṣikās te paśupate vayāṃsi te vighase mā vidanta ////
analyzed: makṣikāḥ te paśupate vayāṃsi te vighase mā vidanta
translated: May the flies and the birds not find thee for the oblation, O Lord of Beasts.

original: krandāya te prāṇāya yāś ca te bhava ropayaḥ /
analyzed: krandāya te prāṇāya yāḥ ca te bhava ropayaḥ
translated: To thy cry, to thy breath, and to thy destructive powers, O Bhava,

original: namas te rudra kṛṇmaḥ sahasrākṣāyāmartya ////🔽purastāt te namaḥ kṛṇma uttarād adharād uta /
analyzed: namaḥ te rudra kṛṇmaḥ sahasra akṣāya amartya  purastāt te namaḥ kṛṇmaḥ uttarāt adharāt uta
translated: we offer thee homage, O Rudra, to the thousand-eyed immortal.🔽We offer thee homage from the east, from the north, from the south,

original: abhīvargād divas pary antarikṣāya te namaḥ ////
analyzed: abhīvargāt divaḥ pari antarikṣāya te namaḥ
translated: from above, from the sky, and from the atmosphere, to thee.

original: mukhāya te paśupate yāni cakṣūṃṣi te bhava /
analyzed: mukhāya te paśupate yāni cakṣūṃṣi te bhava
translated: To thy mouth, O Lord of Beasts, and to thy eyes, O Bhava,

original: tvace rūpāya saṃdṛśe pratīcīnāya te namaḥ ////
analyzed: tvace rūpāya saṃdṛśe pratīcīnāya te namaḥ
translated: to thy skin, to thy form, to thy appearance, to the western (quarter), to thee we offer homage.

original: aṅgebhyas ta udarāya jihvāyā āsyāya te /
analyzed: aṅgebhyaḥ te udarāya jihvāyai āsyāya te
translated: To thy limbs, to thy belly, to thy tongue, to thy mouth,

original: dadbhyo gandhāya te namaḥ ////
analyzed: dadbhyaḥ gandhāya te namaḥ
translated: to thy teeth, to thy smell, to thee we offer homage.

original: astrā nīlaśikhaṇḍena sahasrākṣeṇa vājinā /
analyzed: astrā nīla śikhaṇḍena sahasra akṣeṇa vājinā
translated: With the weapon of the blue-crested, thousand-eyed, swift,

original: rudreṇārdhakaghātinā tena mā sam arāmahi ////
analyzed: rudreṇa ardhaka ghātinā tena mā sam arāmahi
translated: Rudra, the half-killer, may we not contend with him.

original: sa no bhavaḥ pari vṛṇaktu viśvata āpa ivāgniḥ pari vṛṇaktu no bhavaḥ /
analyzed: sa naḥ bhavaḥ pari vṛṇaktu viśvatas āpaḥ iva agniḥ pari vṛṇaktu naḥ bhavaḥ
translated: May Bhava protect us on every side, as the waters or Agni protect us. May Bhava protect us.

original: mā no 'bhi māṃsta namo astv asmai ////
analyzed: mā naḥ bhi māṃsta namaḥ astu asmai
translated: Let him not look on us with anger. Let there be homage to him.

original: catur namo aṣṭakṛtvo bhavāya daśa kṛtvaḥ paśupate namas te /
analyzed: catuḥ namaḥ aṣṭa kṛtvas bhavāya daśa kṛtvas paśupate namaḥ te
translated: Four times eight times homage to Bhava, ten times homage to thee, O Lord of Beasts.

original: taveme pañca paśavo vibhaktā gāvo aśvāḥ puruṣā ajāvayaḥ ////
analyzed: tava ime pañca paśavaḥ vibhaktāḥ gāvaḥ aśvāḥ puruṣāḥ aja avayaḥ
translated: In thee are divided these five kinds of animals, cows, horses, men, goats, and sheep.

original: tava catasraḥ pradiśas tava dyaus tava pṛthivī tavedam ugrorv antarikṣam /
analyzed: tava catasraḥ pradiśaḥ tava dyauḥ tava pṛthivī tava idam ugra uru antarikṣam
translated: To thee are the four quarters, to thee the sky, to thee the earth, to thee this wide-spread atmosphere.

original: tavedaṃ sarvam ātmanvad yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu //// 🔽uruḥ kośo vasudhānas tavāyaṃ yasminn imā viśvā bhuvanāny antaḥ /
analyzed: tava idam sarvam ātmanvat yat prāṇat pṛthivīm anu  uruḥ kośaḥ vasu dhānaḥ tava ayam yasmin imā viśvā bhuvanāni antar
translated: To thee belongs all this world that breathes and moves upon the earth.🔽This is thy wide-spread womb, O Lord of Beasts, in which are contained all these existing things.

original: sa no mṛḍa paśupate namas te paraḥ kroṣṭāro abhibhāḥ śvānaḥ paro yantv agharudo vikeśyaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ mṛḍa paśupate namaḥ te paras kroṣṭāraḥ abhibhāḥ śvānaḥ paras yantu agharudaḥ vikeśyaḥ
translated: Be gracious to us, O Lord of Beasts, homage to thee. Far away be the jackals, the dogs, far away the howling bitches.

original: dhanur bibharṣi haritaṃ hiraṇyayaṃ sahasraghniṃ śatavadhaṃ śikhaṇḍin /🔽rudrasyeṣuś carati devahetis tasyai namo yatamasyāṃ diśītaḥ ////
analyzed: dhanuḥ bibharṣi haritam hiraṇyayam sahasraghnim śata vadham śikhaṇḍin  rudrasya iṣuḥ carati deva hetiḥ tasyai namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas
translated: Thou bearest a green bow, made of gold, slaying a hundred, slaying a thousand, O thou of the peacock's plume.🔽Rudra's arrow goes forth, the weapon of the gods. To it be homage, wherever it may be.

original: yo 'bhiyāto nilayate tvāṃ rudra nicikīrṣati /
analyzed: yaḥ bhiyātaḥ nilayate tvām rudra nicikīrṣati
translated: He who, O Rudra, approaches thee with hostile intent,

original: paścād anuprayuṅkṣe taṃ viddhasya padanīr iva ////
analyzed: paścāt anuprayuṅkṣe tam viddhasya padanīḥ iva
translated: I will follow him afterwards, like the footsteps of one who has been pierced.

original: bhavārudrau sayujā saṃvidānāv ubhāv ugrau carato vīryāya /
analyzed: bhavārudrau sayujā saṃvidānau ubhau ugrau carataḥ vīryāya
translated: Bhavarudra, yoked together, in agreement, both fierce, move for strength.

original: tābhyāṃ namo yatamasyāṃ diśītaḥ ////
analyzed: tābhyām namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas
translated: To them, wherever they are in this direction, I offer salutations.

original: namas te astv āyate namo astu parāyate /
analyzed: namaḥ te astu āyate namaḥ astu parāyate
translated: Salutations to you when you go away, salutations to you when you return.

original: namas te rudra tiṣṭhata āsīnāyota te namaḥ ////
analyzed: namaḥ te rudra tiṣṭhate āsīnāya uta te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, O Rudra, when you stand, and salutations to you when you sit.

original: namaḥ sāyaṃ namaḥ prātar namo rātryā namo divā /
analyzed: namaḥ sāyam namaḥ prātar namaḥ rātryā namaḥ divā
translated: Salutations in the evening, salutations in the morning, salutations by night, salutations by day.

original: bhavāya ca śarvāya cobhābhyām akaraṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: bhavāya ca śarvāya ca ubhābhyām akaram namaḥ
translated: To Bhava and to Sharva, to both of them I offer salutations.

original: sahasrākṣam atipaśyaṃ purastād rudram asyantaṃ bahudhā vipaścitam /
analyzed: sahasra akṣam atipaśyam purastāt rudram asyantam bahudhā vipaścitam
translated: The thousand-eyed one, the overseer, in front, Rudra, the one who shoots in many ways, the wise one.

original: mopārāma jihvayeyamānam ////
analyzed: mā upārāma jihvayā iyamānam
translated: Do not approach him, lest he burn you with his tongue.

original: śyāvāśvaṃ kṛṣṇam asitaṃ mṛṇantaṃ bhīmaṃ rathaṃ keśinaḥ pādayantam /
analyzed: śyāva aśvam kṛṣṇam asitam mṛṇantam bhīmam ratham keśinaḥ pādayantam
translated: The dark horse, the black one, the grim one, the one who destroys, the terrible chariot of Keshi, the one who sets it in motion.

original: pūrve pratīmo namo astv asmai ////
analyzed: pūrve pratīmaḥ namaḥ astu asmai
translated: We remember him first, salutations to him.

original: mā no 'bhi srā matyaṃ devahetiṃ mā naḥ krudhaḥ paśupate namas te /
analyzed: mā naḥ bhi srāḥ matyam deva hetim mā naḥ krudhaḥ paśupate namaḥ te
translated: Do not shoot at us the weapon of the gods, do not be angry with us, O lord of cattle, salutations to you.

original: anyatrāsmad divyāṃ śākhāṃ vi dhūnu ////
analyzed: anyatra asmat divyām śākhām vi dhūnu
translated: Shake the heavenly branch away from us.

original: mā no hiṃsīr adhi no brūhi pari ṇo vṛṅdhi mā krudhaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ hiṃsīḥ adhi naḥ brūhi pari naḥ vṛṅdhi mā krudhaḥ
translated: Do not harm us, speak to us, surround us, do not be angry.

original: mā tvayā sam arāmahi ////
analyzed: mā tvayā sam arāmahi
translated: Let us not offend against you.

original: mā no goṣu puruṣeṣu mā gṛdho no ajāviṣu /
analyzed: mā naḥ goṣu puruṣeṣu mā gṛdhaḥ naḥ aja aviṣu
translated: Do not be greedy for our cattle, our men, our goats and sheep.

original: anyatrogra vi vartaya piyārūṇāṃ prajāṃ jahi ////
analyzed: anyatra ugra vi vartaya piyārūṇām prajām jahi
translated: Turn away elsewhere, O fierce one, destroy the offspring of the Piyārūns.

original: yasya takmā kāsikā hetir ekam aśvasyeva vṛṣaṇaḥ kranda eti /
analyzed: yasya takmā kāsikā hetiḥ ekam aśvasya iva vṛṣaṇaḥ krandaḥ eti
translated: Whose cough, like the roar of a strong horse, goes forth alone,

original: abhipūrvaṃ nirṇayate namo astv asmai ////
analyzed: abhipūrvam nirṇayate namaḥ astu asmai
translated: He goes forth. Let there be homage to him.

original: yo 'ntarikṣe tiṣṭhati viṣṭabhito 'yajvanaḥ pramṛṇan devapīyūn /
analyzed: yaḥ ntarikṣe tiṣṭhati viṣṭabhitaḥ yajvanaḥ pramṛṇan deva pīyūn
translated: He who stands in the firmament, supported, destroying the non-sacrificing, the eaters of the gods,

original: tasmai namo daśabhiḥ śakvarībhiḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai namaḥ daśabhiḥ śakvarībhiḥ
translated: To him homage with the ten Śakvari (verses).

original: tubhyam āraṇyāḥ paśavo mṛgā vane hitā haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunā vayāṃsi /
analyzed: tubhyam āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ vane hitāḥ haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunāḥ vayāṃsi
translated: To you belong the wild animals, the deer dwelling in the forest, the geese, the birds, the birds of prey.

original: tava yakṣaṃ paśupate apsv antas tubhyaṃ kṣaranti divyā āpo vṛdhe ////
analyzed: tava yakṣam paśupate apsu antar tubhyam kṣaranti divyāḥ āpaḥ vṛdhe
translated: Your Yakṣa, O lord of cattle, is in the waters. For your increase the heavenly waters flow.

original: śiṃśumārā ajagarāḥ purīkayā jaṣā matsyā rajasā yebhyo asyasi /
analyzed: śiṃśumārāḥ ajagarāḥ purīkayāḥ jaṣāḥ matsyāḥ rajasāḥ yebhyaḥ asyasi
translated: The porpoises, the pythons, the porcupines, the fish, those that move in the dust, for whom you sharpen (the arrow),

original: na te dūraṃ na pariṣṭhāsti te bhava sadyaḥ sarvāṃ pari paśyasi bhūmiṃ pūrvasmād dhaṃsy uttarasmint samudre ////
analyzed: na te dūram na pariṣṭhā asti te bhava sadyas sarvām pari paśyasi bhūmim pūrvasmāt haṃsi uttarasmin samudre
translated: For you there is no distance, no remoteness. You, O Bhava, see all the earth at once, from the eastern to the western ocean.

original: mā no rudra takmanā mā viṣeṇa mā naḥ saṃ srā divyenāgninā /
analyzed: mā naḥ rudra takmanā mā viṣeṇa mā naḥ sam srāḥ divyena agninā
translated: Do not strike us, O Rudra, with lightning or poison, do not burn us with your heavenly fire.

original: anyatrāsmad vidyutaṃ pātayaitām ////
analyzed: anyatra asmat vidyutam pātaya etām
translated: Elsewhere than this, O Bhava, cast down our lightning.

original: bhavo divo bhava īśe pṛthivyā bhava ā papra urv antarikṣam /
analyzed: bhavaḥ divaḥ bhavaḥ īśe pṛthivyāḥ bhavaḥ ā papre uru antarikṣam
translated: Be thou the lord of heaven, the lord of earth, the lord of the wide atmosphere.

original: tasyai namo yatamasyāṃ diśītaḥ ////
analyzed: tasyai namaḥ yatamasyām diśi itas
translated: To him be homage in whatever direction he may be.

original: bhava rājan yajamānāya mṛḍa paśūnāṃ hi paśupatir babhūtha /
analyzed: bhava rājan yajamānāya mṛḍa paśūnām hi paśupatiḥ babhūtha
translated: Be gracious, O king Bhava, to the sacrificer, for thou hast become the lord of cattle.

original: yaḥ śraddadhāti santi devā iti catuṣpade dvipade 'sya mṛḍa ////
analyzed: yaḥ śraddadhāti santi devāḥ iti catuṣpade dvipade sya mṛḍa
translated: Be gracious to his four-footed and two-footed (cattle), to him who believes that there are gods.

original: mā no mahāntam uta mā no arbhakaṃ mā no vahantam uta mā no vakṣyataḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ mahāntam uta mā naḥ arbhakam mā naḥ vahantam uta mā naḥ vakṣyataḥ
translated: Harm not our great one, harm not our infant, harm not our carrier, harm not our rider.

original: mā no hiṃsīḥ pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca svāṃ tanvaṃ rudra mā rīriṣo naḥ ////
analyzed: mā naḥ hiṃsīḥ pitaram mātaram ca svām tanvam rudra mā rīriṣaḥ naḥ
translated: Harm not our father, harm not our mother, harm not thy own body, O Rudra, harm not us.

original: rudrasyailabakārebhyo 'saṃsūktagilebhyaḥ /
analyzed: rudrasya ailabakārebhyaḥ saṃsūktagilebhyaḥ
translated: To Rudra's Elabaka hounds, that swallow without chewing,

original: idaṃ mahāsyebhyaḥ śvabhyo akaraṃ namaḥ ////🔽namas te ghoṣiṇībhyo namas te keśinībhyaḥ /
analyzed: idam mahā āsyebhyaḥ śvabhyaḥ akaram namaḥ  namaḥ te ghoṣiṇībhyaḥ namaḥ te keśinībhyaḥ
translated: To those great-mouthed dogs I offer this homage.🔽Homage to you, the barkers, homage to you, the mane-holders.

original: namo namaskṛtābhyo namaḥ saṃbhuñjatībhyaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ namaskṛtābhyaḥ namaḥ saṃbhuñjatībhyaḥ
translated: Homage to those that are bowed to, homage to those that are enjoyed.

original: namas te deva senābhyaḥ svasti no abhayaṃ ca naḥ ////
analyzed: namaḥ te deva senābhyaḥ svasti naḥ abhayam ca naḥ
translated: Homage to your divine armies, to us be welfare and security.

original: tasyaudanasya bṛhaspatiḥ śiro brahma mukham ////
analyzed: tasya odanasya bṛhaspatiḥ śiraḥ brahma mukham
translated: The head of that rice-pap is Brihaspati, the mouth is the Brahman.

original: dyāvāpṛthivī śrotre sūryācandramasāv akṣiṇī saptaṛṣayaḥ prāṇāpānāḥ ////
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī śrotre sūryācandramasau akṣiṇī sapta ṛṣayaḥ prāṇa apānāḥ
translated: Heaven and earth are the ears, the sun and moon are the eyes, the seven sages are the in-breath and out-breath.

original: cakṣur musalaṃ kāma ulūkhalam ////
analyzed: cakṣuḥ musalam kāmaḥ ulūkhalam
translated: The eye is the pestle, desire is the mortar.

original: ditiḥ śūrpam aditiḥ śūrpagrāhī vāto 'pāvinak ////🔽aśvāḥ kaṇā gāvas taṇḍulā maśakās tuṣāḥ ////
analyzed: ditiḥ śūrpam aditiḥ śūrpa grāhī vātā u pāvinak  aśvāḥ kaṇāḥ gāvaḥ taṇḍulāḥ maśakāḥ tuṣāḥ
translated: Diti is the winnowing basket, Aditi is the winnower, the wind is the winnower.🔽Horses are the grains, cows are the rice grains, flies are the husks.

original: kabru phalīkaraṇāḥ śaro 'bhram ////
analyzed: kabru phalīkaraṇāḥ śaraḥ bhram
translated: The Kabru is the chaff, the arrow is the cloud.

original: śyāmam ayo 'sya māṃsāni lohitam asya lohitam ////🔽trapu bhasma haritaṃ varṇaḥ puṣkaram asya gandhaḥ ////
analyzed: śyāmam ayaḥ sya māṃsāni lohitam asya lohitam  trapu bhasma haritam varṇaḥ puṣkaram asya gandhaḥ
translated: The black iron is his flesh, the red is his blood.🔽The tin is the ash, the green color is the lotus, his smell.

original: khalaḥ pātraṃ sphyāv aṃsāv īṣe anūkye ////
analyzed: khalaḥ pātram sphyau aṃsau īṣe anūkye
translated: The trough is the vessel, the two shoulders are the two shafts, the two flanks are the two yoking poles.

original: āntrāṇi jatravo gudā varatrāḥ ////
analyzed: āntrāṇi jatravaḥ gudāḥ varatrāḥ
translated: The entrails are the girths, the anus is the thong.

original: iyam eva pṛthivī kumbhī bhavati rādhyamānasyaudanasya dyaur apidhānam ////
analyzed: iyam eva pṛthivī kumbhī bhavati rādhyamānasya odanasya dyauḥ apidhānam
translated: This very earth is the cauldron for the cooked rice, the sky is the lid.

original: sītāḥ parśavaḥ sikatā ūbadhyam ////🔽ṛtaṃ hastāvanejanaṃ kulyopasecanam ////
analyzed: sītāḥ parśavaḥ sikatāḥ ūbadhyam  ṛtam hasta avanejanam kulyā upasecanam
translated: The ditches are the ribs, the sand is the filling.🔽Truth is the hand-washing water, the Kulyā is the sprinkling water.

original: ṛcā kumbhy adhihitārtvijyena preṣitā ////
analyzed: ṛcā kumbhī adhihitā ārtvijyena preṣitā
translated: It is placed in the pot with the Ṛc, sent forth with the office of the priest.

original: brahmaṇā parigṛhītā sāmnā paryūḍhā ////
analyzed: brahmaṇā parigṛhītā sāmnā paryūḍhā
translated: It is taken around with the Brahman, covered with the Sāman.

original: bṛhad āyavanaṃ rathantaraṃ darviḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhat āyavanam rathantaram darviḥ
translated: The Bṛhat is the fireplace, the Rathantara is the ladle.

original: ṛtavaḥ paktāra ārtavāḥ sam indhate ////
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ paktāraḥ ārtavāḥ sam indhate
translated: The seasons, the digesting ones, the half-seasons kindle him.

original: caruṃ pañcabilam ukhaṃ gharmo 'bhīndhe //// note CORRIGENDA ed / ŚPP
analyzed: carum pañca bilam ukham gharmaḥ bhīndhe
translated: The cauldron, five-holed, the hot water pot, the heat kindles him.

original: odanena yajñavataḥ sarve lokāḥ samāpyāḥ ////
analyzed: odanena yajñavataḥ sarve lokāḥ samāpyāḥ
translated: By the cooked rice all the worlds are to be attained by one who has the sacrifice.

original: yasmint samudro dyaur bhūmis trayo 'varaparaṃ śritāḥ ////
analyzed: yasmin samudraḥ dyauḥ bhūmiḥ trayaḥ vara param śritāḥ
translated: In whom the ocean, the sky, the earth, the three are contained above and below.

original: yasya devā akalpantocchiṣṭe ṣaḍ aśītayaḥ ////
analyzed: yasya devāḥ akalpanta ucchiṣṭe ṣaṭ aśītayaḥ
translated: In whose leavings the gods, sixty-eight in number, are dependent.

original: taṃ tvaudanasya pṛchāmi yo asya mahimā mahān ////
analyzed: tam tvā odanasya pṛcchāmi yaḥ asya mahimā mahān
translated: I ask you about that, O cooked rice, what is its great greatness?

original: sa ya odanasya mahimānaṃ vidyāt ////
analyzed: sa yaḥ odanasya mahimānam vidyāt
translated: One who would know the greatness of the cooked rice

original: nālpa iti brūyān nānupasecana iti nedaṃ ca kiṃ ceti ////
analyzed: na alpaḥ iti brūyāt na anupasecanaḥ iti na idam ca kim ca iti
translated: should not say it is small or it is without sauce or this and that.

original: yāvad dātābhimanasyeta tan nāti vadet ////
analyzed: yāvat dātā abhimanasyeta tat na ati vadet
translated: One should not speak beyond what the giver would think.

original: brahmavādino vadanti parāñcam odanaṃ iti ////
analyzed: brahma vādinaḥ vadanti parāñcam odanam iti
translated: The theologians say, The cooked rice is beyond.

original: tvam odanaṃ tvām iti ////
analyzed: tvam odanam tvām odanaḥ iti
translated: You are the cooked rice, you are the cooked rice.

original: parāñcaṃ cainaṃ prāśīḥ prāṇās tvā hāsyantīty enam āha ////
analyzed: parāñcam ca enam prāśīḥ prāṇāḥ tvā hāsyanti iti enam āha
translated: You have eaten the cooked rice that is beyond. Your vital breaths will leave you, he says to him.

original: pratyañcaṃ cainaṃ prāśīr apānās tvā hāsyantīty enam āha ////
analyzed: pratyañcam ca enam prāśīḥ apānāḥ tvā hāsyanti iti enam āha
translated: You have eaten the cooked rice that is in front. Your out-breathings will leave you, he says to him.

original: naivāham odanaṃ na mām odanaḥ ////
analyzed: na eva aham odanam na mām odanaḥ
translated: Neither am I the cooked rice, nor is the cooked rice me.

original: odana evaudanaṃ prāśīt ////
analyzed: odanaḥ eva odanam prāśīt
translated: The cooked rice has eaten the cooked rice.

original: a tataś cainam anyena śīrṣṇā prāśīr yena caitaṃ pūrva ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyena śīrṣṇā prāśīḥ yena ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan
translated: Then you should eat it with another head than with which the ancient seers ate it.

original: b jyeṣṭhatas te prajā mariṣyatīty enam āha /
analyzed: jyeṣṭhatas te prajā mariṣyati iti enam āha
translated: He says to him, 'Your offspring will die in the prime of life.'

original: c taṃ vā ahaṃ nārvāñcaṃ na parāñcaṃ na pratyañcam /
analyzed: tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam
translated: I did not eat it with a head turned towards it, nor with one turned away from it, nor with one turned towards it and away from it.

original: d bṛhaspatinā śīrṣṇā /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā śīrṣṇā
translated: With the head of Brihaspati.

original: e tenainaṃ prāśiṣaṃ tenainam ajīgamam /
analyzed: tena enam prāśiṣam tena enam ajīgamam
translated: With that I ate it, with that I conquered it.

original: f eṣa vā odanaḥ sarvāṅgaḥ sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ
translated: This rice is whole-limbed, whole-jointed, whole-bodied.

original: g sarvāṅga eva sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ saṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus becomes whole-limbed, whole-jointed, whole-bodied.

original: a tataś cainam anyābhyāṃ śrotrābhyāṃ prāśīr yābhyāṃ caitaṃ pūrva ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyābhyām śrotrābhyām prāśīḥ yābhyām ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan
translated: Then you should eat it with other ears than with which the ancient seers ate it.

original: b badhiro bhaviṣyasīty enam āha /
analyzed: badhiraḥ bhaviṣyasi iti enam āha
translated: He says to him, 'You will become deaf.'

original: c taṃ vā ahaṃ nārvāñcaṃ na parāñcaṃ na pratyañcam /
analyzed: tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam
translated: I did not eat it with ears turned towards it, nor with ones turned away from it, nor with ones turned towards it and away from it.

original: d dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ śrotrābhyām /🔽e tābhyām enaṃ prāśiṣaṃ tābhyām enam ajīgamam /
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivībhyām śrotrābhyām  tābhyām enam prāśiṣam tābhyām enam ajīgamam
translated: With the ears of heaven and earth.🔽With those I ate it, with those I conquered it.

original: f eṣa vā odanaḥ sarvāṅgaḥ sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ
translated: This rice is whole-limbed, whole-jointed, whole-bodied.

original: g sarvāṅga eva sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ saṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes whole-bodied, with all his limbs, with all his body, who knows thus.

original: a tataś cainam anyābhyām akṣībhyāṃ prāśīr yābhyāṃ caitaṃ pūrva ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyābhyām akṣībhyām prāśīḥ yābhyām ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan
translated: Then he should eat it with two other eyes, with which the seers of old ate it.

original: b andho bhaviṣyasīty enam āha /
analyzed: andhaḥ bhaviṣyasi iti enam āha
translated: He says to him, You will become blind.

original: c taṃ vā ahaṃ nārvāñcaṃ na parāñcaṃ na pratyañcam /
analyzed: tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam
translated: I did not eat him facing east, west, or north.

original: d sūryācandramasābhyām akṣībhyām /
analyzed: sūryācandramasābhyām akṣībhyām
translated: With the eyes of the sun and moon.

original: e tābhyām enaṃ prāśiṣaṃ tābhyām enam ajīgamam /
analyzed: tābhyām enam prāśiṣam tābhyām enam ajīgamam
translated: With those two I ate him, with those two I conquered him.

original: f eṣa vā odanaḥ sarvāṅgaḥ sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ
translated: This rice is whole-bodied, with all its limbs, with all its body.

original: g sarvāṅga eva sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ saṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes whole-bodied, with all his limbs, with all his body, who knows thus.

original: a tataś cainam anyena mukhena prāśīr yena caitaṃ pūrva ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyena mukhena prāśīḥ yena ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan
translated: Then he should eat it with another mouth, with which the seers of old ate it.

original: b mukhatas te prajā mariṣyatīty enam āha /
analyzed: mukhataḥ te prajā mariṣyati iti enam āha
translated: He says to him, Your offspring will die in the mouth.

original: c taṃ vā ahaṃ nārvāñcaṃ na parāñcaṃ na pratyañcam /
analyzed: tam vai aham na arvāñcam na parāñcam na pratyañcam
translated: I did not eat him facing east, west, or north.

original: d brahmaṇā mukhena /
analyzed: brahmaṇā mukhena
translated: With the mouth of Brahman.

original: e tenainaṃ prāśiṣaṃ tenainam ajīgamam /
analyzed: tena enam prāśiṣam tena enam ajīgamam
translated: With that I ate him, with that I conquered him.

original: f eṣa vā odanaḥ sarvāṅgaḥ sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ /
analyzed: eṣa vai odanaḥ sarva aṅgaḥ sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ
translated: This rice is whole-bodied, with all its limbs, with all its body.

original: g sarvāṅga eva sarvaparuḥ sarvatanūḥ saṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: sarva aṅgaḥ eva sarva paruḥ sarva tanūḥ sam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes whole-bodied, with all his limbs, with all his body, who knows thus.

original: a tataś cainam anyayā jihvayā prāśīr yayā caitaṃ pūrva ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan /
analyzed: tatas ca enam anyayā jihvayā prāśīḥ yayā ca etam pūrve ṛṣayaḥ prāśnan
translated: Then eat it with another tongue, with that by which the seers of old ate it.

original: b jihvā te mariṣyatīty enam āha /
analyzed: jihvā te mariṣyati iti enam āha
translated: He says to him, Your tongue will die.

original: a etad vai bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ yad odanaḥ ////
analyzed: etat vai bradhnasya viṣṭapam yat odanaḥ
translated: This rice cake is indeed the expansion of the sun.

original: a bradhnaloko bhavati bradhnasya viṣṭapi śrayate ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: bradhna lokaḥ bhavati bradhnasya viṣṭapi śrayate yaḥ evam veda
translated: One becomes the world of the sun, one is established in the expansion of the sun, who knows this.

original: a etasmād vā odanāt trayastriṃśataṃ lokān nir amimīta prajāpatiḥ ////
analyzed: etasmāt vai odanāt trayastriṃśatam lokān niḥ amimīta prajāpatiḥ
translated: From this rice cake, indeed, Prajapati measured out thirty-three worlds.

original: a teṣāṃ prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata ////
analyzed: teṣām prajñānāya yajñam asṛjata
translated: For the knowledge of them, he created the sacrifice.

original: a sa ya evaṃ viduṣa upadraṣṭā bhavati prāṇaṃ ruṇaddhi //// 🔽a na ca prāṇaṃ ruṇaddhi sarvajyāniṃ jīyate ////
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam viduṣaḥ upadraṣṭā bhavati prāṇam ruṇaddhi  na ca prāṇam ruṇaddhi sarva jyānim jīyate
translated: He who thus knows, and is a spectator, restrains the breath.🔽He does not restrain the breath, he conquers all diseases.

original: a na ca sarvajyāniṃ jīyate purainaṃ jarasaḥ prāṇo jahāti //// 🔽prāṇāya namo yasya sarvam idaṃ vaśe /
analyzed: na ca sarva jyānim jīyate purā enam jarasaḥ prāṇaḥ jahāti  / prāṇāya namaḥ yasya sarvam idam vaśe
translated: He does not conquer all diseases, old age does not abandon his breath.🔽Homage to the breath, in whose control is all this.

original: yo bhūtaḥ sarvasyeśvaro yasmint sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam ////
analyzed: yaḥ bhūtaḥ sarvasya īśvaraḥ yasmin sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: He who is the lord of all, in whom all is established.

original: namas te prāṇa krandāya namas te stanayitnave /
analyzed: namaḥ te prāṇa krandāya namaḥ te stanayitnave
translated: Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, as the roaring one! Homage to thee as the thunderer!

original: namas te prāṇa vidyute namas te prāṇa varṣate ////
analyzed: namaḥ te prāṇa vidyute namaḥ te prāṇa varṣate
translated: Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, as the lightning! Homage to thee as the rainer!

original: yat prāṇa stanayitnunābhikrandaty oṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: yat prāṇaḥ stanayitnunā abhikrandati oṣadhīḥ
translated: When Prāṇa roars with the thunder, the plants

original: pra vīyante garbhān dadhate 'tho bahvīr vi jāyante ////
analyzed: pra vīyante garbhān dadhate bahvīḥ vi jāyante
translated: are impregnated, conceive, and many are born.

original: yat prāṇa ṛtāv āgate 'bhikrandaty oṣadhīḥ /
analyzed: yat prāṇe ṛtau āgate bhikrandati oṣadhīḥ
translated: When Prāṇa roars at the coming of the season, the plants

original: sarvaṃ tadā pra modate yat kiṃ ca bhūmyām adhi ////
analyzed: sarvam tadā pra modate yat kim ca bhūmyām adhi
translated: rejoice, and all that is on the earth is glad.

original: yadā prāṇo abhyavarṣīd varṣeṇa pṛthivīṃ mahīm /
analyzed: yadā prāṇaḥ abhyavarṣīt varṣeṇa pṛthivīm mahīm
translated: When Prāṇa rained down rain on the great earth,

original: paśavas tat pra modante maho vai no bhaviṣyati ////
analyzed: paśavaḥ tat pra modante mahaḥ vai naḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: the cattle rejoiced, thinking, 'Great will be our food.'

original: abhivṛṣṭā oṣadhayaḥ prāṇena sam avādiran /
analyzed: abhivṛṣṭāḥ oṣadhayaḥ prāṇena sam avādiran
translated: The plants, sprinkled with rain, rejoiced with Prāṇa,

original: āyur vai naḥ prātītaraḥ sarvā naḥ surabhīr akaḥ ////
analyzed: āyuḥ vai naḥ prātītaraḥ sarvāḥ naḥ surabhīḥ akaḥ
translated: and Prāṇa gave us life and made all things fragrant for us.

original: namas te astv āyate namo astu parāyate /
analyzed: namaḥ te astu āyate namaḥ astu parāyate
translated: Homage to thee when thou goest away! Homage to thee when thou comest back!

original: namas te prāṇa tiṣṭhata āsīnāyota te namaḥ ////🔽namas te prāṇa prāṇate namo astv apānate /
analyzed: namaḥ te prāṇa tiṣṭhate āsīnāya uta te namaḥ  namaḥ te prāṇa prāṇate namaḥ astu apānate
translated: Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, when thou standest! Homage to thee when thou art seated!🔽Homage to thee, O Prāṇa, when thou art exhaled! Homage to thee when thou art inhaled!

original: parācīnāya te namaḥ pratīcīnāya te namaḥ sarvasmai ta idaṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: parācīnāya te namaḥ pratīcīnāya te namaḥ sarvasmai te idam namaḥ
translated: Homage to thee when thou goest away! Homage to thee when thou comest back! Homage to all of thee! To all of thee this homage!

original: yā te prāṇa priyā tanūr yo te prāṇa preyasī /
analyzed: yā te prāṇa priyā tanūḥ yā u te prāṇa preyasī
translated: That dear body of yours, O Prāṇa, that dear body of yours, O Prāṇa,

original: atho yad bheṣajaṃ tava tasya no dhehi jīvase ////
analyzed: atha u yat bheṣajam tava tasya naḥ dhehi jīvase
translated: And also that medicine of yours, bestow that upon us for life.

original: prāṇaḥ prajā anu vaste pitā putram iva priyam /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ prajāḥ anu vaste pitā putram iva priyam
translated: Prāṇa clothes the people, like a father his dear son.

original: prāṇo ha sarvasyeśvaro yac ca prāṇati yac ca na ////
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha sarvasya īśvaraḥ yat ca prāṇati yat ca na
translated: Prāṇa is the lord of all, of what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: prāṇo mṛtyuḥ prāṇas takmā prāṇaṃ devā upāsate /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ mṛtyuḥ prāṇaḥ takmā prāṇam devāḥ upāsate
translated: Prāṇa is death, Prāṇa is Takmā, the gods worship Prāṇa.

original: prāṇo ha satyavādinam uttame loka ā dadhat ////
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha satya vādinam uttame loke ā dadhat
translated: Prāṇa has placed the truthful one in the highest world.

original: prāṇo virāṭ prāṇo deṣṭrī prāṇaṃ sarva upāsate /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ virāj prāṇaḥ deṣṭrī prāṇam sarve upāsate
translated: Prāṇa is the Virāṭ, Prāṇa is the guide, all worship Prāṇa.

original: prāṇo ha sūryaś candramāḥ prāṇam āhuḥ prajāpatim ////🔽prāṇāpānau vrīhiyavāv anaḍvān prāṇa ucyate /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ha sūryaḥ candramāḥ prāṇam āhuḥ prajāpatim  prāṇa apānau vrīhi yavau anaḍvān prāṇaḥ ucyate
translated: Prāṇa is the sun, Prāṇa is the moon, they call Prāṇa Prajāpati.🔽Prāṇa and Apāna are Vṛihi and Yava, the ox is said to be Prāṇa.

original: yave ha prāṇa āhito 'pāno vrīhir ucyate ////
analyzed: yave ha prāṇaḥ āhitaḥ pānaḥ vrīhiḥ ucyate
translated: Prāṇa is placed in the Yava, Apāna is said to be Vṛihi.

original: apānati prāṇati puruṣo garbhe antarā /
analyzed: apānati prāṇati puruṣaḥ garbhe antarā
translated: Prāṇa and Apāna are the man in the womb.

original: yadā tvaṃ prāṇa jinvasy atha sa jāyate punaḥ ////
analyzed: yadā tvam prāṇa jinvasi atha sa jāyate punar
translated: When you, O Prāṇa, quicken him, then he is born again.

original: prāṇam āhur mātariśvānaṃ vāto ha prāṇa ucyate /
analyzed: prāṇam āhuḥ mātariśvānam vātaḥ ha prāṇaḥ ucyate
translated: They call Prāṇa the wind, Vāta is said to be Prāṇa.

original: prāṇe ha bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ ca prāṇe sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam ////
analyzed: prāṇe ha bhūtam bhavyam ca prāṇe sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: In Prāṇa is the past and the future, in Prāṇa everything is established.

original: ātharvaṇīr āṅgirasīr daivīr manuṣyajā uta /
analyzed: ātharvaṇīḥ āṅgirasīḥ daivīḥ manuṣya jāḥ uta
translated: The Atharvanic, the Angirasic, the divine, and those born among men,

original: oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante yadā tvaṃ prāṇa jinvasi ////
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante yadā tvam prāṇa jinvasi
translated: The plants are born when you, O Prāṇa, quicken them.

original: yadā prāṇo abhyavarṣīd varṣeṇa pṛthivīṃ mahīm /
analyzed: yadā prāṇaḥ abhyavarṣīt varṣeṇa pṛthivīm mahīm
translated: When Prāṇa has rained down rain upon the great earth,

original: oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante 'tho yāḥ kāś ca vīrudhaḥ ////
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ pra jāyante thaḥ yāḥ kāḥ ca vīrudhaḥ
translated: The plants are born, and also all the herbs.

original: yas te prāṇedaṃ veda yasmiṃś cāsi pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te prāṇa idam veda yasmin ca asi pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He who knows this of your Prāṇa, and in whom you are established,

original: sarve tasmai baliṃ harān amuṣmiṃl loka uttame ////
analyzed: sarve tasmai balim harān amuṣmin loke uttame
translated: To him let all bring tribute in that highest world yonder.

original: yathā prāṇa balihṛtas tubhyaṃ sarvāḥ prajā imāḥ /
analyzed: yathā prāṇa bali hṛtaḥ tubhyam sarvāḥ prajāḥ imāḥ
translated: As all these creatures bring tribute to you, O Prāṇa,

original: evā tasmai baliṃ harān yas tvā śṛṇavat suśravaḥ ////
analyzed: eva tasmai balim harān yaḥ tvā śṛṇavat su śravaḥ
translated: Even to him let them bring tribute who hears you, O good hearer.

original: antar garbhaś carati devatāsv ābhūto bhūtaḥ sa u jāyate punaḥ /
analyzed: antar garbhaḥ carati devatāsu ābhūtaḥ bhūtaḥ saḥ u jāyate punar
translated: The unborn moves within the deities as an embryo; having become born, he is born again.

original: sa bhūto bhavyaṃ bhaviṣyat pitā putraṃ pra viveśā śacībhiḥ ////
analyzed: sa bhūtaḥ bhavyam bhaviṣyat pitā putram pra viveśa śacībhiḥ
translated: Having become, he enters the future, the future's future, the father his son with his powers.

original: ekaṃ pādaṃ not khidati salilād dhaṃsa uccaran /
analyzed: ekam pādam na ud khidati salilāt haṃsaḥ uccaran
translated: The goose, rising from the water, does not move one foot.

original: yad aṅga sa tam utkhiden naivādya na śvaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yat aṅga sa tam utkhidet na eva adya na śvas syāt
translated: If he were to move that foot, there would be neither today nor tomorrow.

original: na rātrī nāhaḥ syān na vy uchet kadā cana ////
analyzed: na rātrī na ahar syāt na vi uchet kadā cana
translated: There would be neither night nor day; it would never dawn.

original: aṣṭācakraṃ vartata ekanemi sahasrākṣaraṃ pra puro ni paścā /
analyzed: aṣṭācakram vartate eka nemi sahasra akṣaram pra puras ni paścā
translated: The eight-wheeled one moves with a single rim, with a thousand spokes, in front and behind.

original: ardhena viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ jajāna yad asyārdhaṃ katamaḥ sa ketuḥ ////
analyzed: ardhena viśvam bhuvanam jajāna yat asya ardham katamaḥ sa ketuḥ
translated: With half he created the entire world. What is his other half? What is its sign?

original: yo asya viśvajanmana īśe viśvasya ceṣṭataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ asya viśva janmanaḥ īśe viśvasya ceṣṭataḥ
translated: He who is the lord of all his births and of all his activities,

original: anyeṣu kṣipradhanvane tasmai prāṇa namo 'stu te ////
analyzed: anyeṣu kṣipra dhanvane tasmai prāṇa namaḥ stu te
translated: To him, the swift-bowed one among others, O Prāṇa, homage to you!

original: yo asya sarvajanmana īśe sarvasya ceṣṭataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ asya sarva janmanaḥ īśe sarvasya ceṣṭataḥ
translated: He who is the lord of all his births and of all his activities,

original: atandro brahmaṇā dhīraḥ prāṇo mānu tiṣṭhatu ////🔽ūrdhvaḥ supteṣu jāgāra nanu tiryaṅ ni padyate /
analyzed: atandraḥ brahmaṇā dhīraḥ prāṇaḥ mā anu tiṣṭhatu  ūrdhvaḥ supteṣu jāgāra nanu tiryaṅ ni padyate
translated: May Prāṇa, the diligent one supported by Brahman, remain with us.🔽He who sleeps above, who is awake when all are asleep, who lies down sideways,

original: na suptam asya supteṣv anu śuśrāva kaś cana ////
analyzed: na suptam asya supteṣu anu śuśrāva kaḥ cana
translated: No one has heard him sleeping among the sleeping.

original: prāṇa mā mat paryāvṛto na mad anyo bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: prāṇa mā mat paryāvṛtaḥ na mat anyaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: O Prāṇa, do not turn away from me, do not become different from me.

original: apāṃ garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi ////
analyzed: apām garbham iva jīvase prāṇa badhnāmi tvā mayi
translated: Like the embryo of the waters, O Prāṇa, I bind you to me for life.

original: brahmacārīṣṇaṃś carati rodasī ubhe tasmin devāḥ saṃmanaso bhavanti /
analyzed: brahmacārīṣṇan carati rodasī ubhe tasmin devāḥ saṃmanasaḥ bhavanti
translated: The celibate one moves about in both worlds. In him the gods have a common mind.

original: sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ divaṃ ca sa ācāryaṃ tapasā piparti ////
analyzed: sa dādhāra pṛthivīm divam ca saḥ ācāryam tapasā piparti
translated: He supports the earth and the sky. He nourishes the teacher with austerities.

original: brahmacāriṇaṃ pitaro devajanāḥ pṛthag devā anusaṃyanti sarve /
analyzed: brahmacāriṇam pitaraḥ deva janāḥ pṛthak devāḥ anusaṃyanti sarve
translated: The Pitrs, the people of the gods, all the separate gods follow the celibate one.

original: gandharvā enam anv āyan trayastriṃśat triśatāḥ ṣaṭsahasrāḥ sarvānt sa devāṃs tapasā piparti ////
analyzed: gandharvāḥ enam anu āyan trayastriṃśat tri śatāḥ ṣaṣ sahasrāḥ sarvān sa devān tapasā piparti
translated: The Gandharvas have followed him, thirty-three hundred and six thousand. He, by his austerity, nourishes all the gods.

original: ācārya upanayamāno brahmacāriṇaṃ kṛṇute garbham antaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ upanayamānaḥ brahmacāriṇam kṛṇute garbham antar
translated: The teacher, leading the one who is to be initiated, makes the embryo within him.

original: taṃ rātrīs tisra udare bibharti taṃ jātaṃ draṣṭum abhisaṃyanti devāḥ ////
analyzed: tam rātrīḥ tisraḥ udare bibharti tam jātam draṣṭum abhisaṃyanti devāḥ
translated: He carries him in his belly for three nights. The gods come together to see him when he is born.

original: iyaṃ samit pṛthivī dyaur dvitīyotāntarikṣaṃ samidhā pṛṇāti /
analyzed: iyam samidh pṛthivī dyauḥ dvitīyā uta antarikṣam samidhā pṛṇāti
translated: This earth is the kindling, the second is the sky. He fills the kindling with the atmosphere.

original: brahmacārī samidhā mekhalayā śrameṇa lokāṃs tapasā piparti ////
analyzed: brahmacārī samidhā mekhalayā śrameṇa lokān tapasā piparti
translated: The student, with the girdle as kindling, by toil, by austerity, nourishes the worlds.

original: pūrvo jāto brahmaṇo brahmacārī gharmaṃ vasānas tapasod atiṣṭhat /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ jātaḥ brahmaṇaḥ brahmacārī gharmam vasānaḥ tapasā ud atiṣṭhat
translated: The student was born first, clothed in heat, from Brahman, he arose from austerity.

original: tasmāj jātaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brahma jyeṣṭhaṃ devāś ca sarve amṛtena sākam ////
analyzed: tasmāt jātam brāhmaṇam brahma jyeṣṭham devāḥ ca sarve amṛtena sākam
translated: From him was born the Brahman, Brahman's eldest son, and all the gods together with immortality.

original: brahmacāry eti samidhā samiddhaḥ kārṣṇaṃ vasāno dīkṣito dīrghaśmaśruḥ /
analyzed: brahmacārī eti samidhā samiddhaḥ kārṣṇam vasānaḥ dīkṣitaḥ dīrgha śmaśruḥ
translated: The student goes forth, kindled by the kindling, clothed in black, initiated, with long beard.

original: sa sadya eti pūrvasmād uttaraṃ samudraṃ lokānt saṃgṛbhya muhur ācarikrat ////
analyzed: sa sadyas eti pūrvasmāt uttaram samudram lokān saṃgṛbhya muhur ācarikrat
translated: He goes straightway from the east to the west ocean, taking the worlds with him, and returns again and again.

original: brahmacārī janayan brahmāpo lokaṃ prajāpatiṃ parameṣṭhinaṃ virājam /
analyzed: brahmacārī janayan brahma apaḥ lokam prajāpatim parameṣṭhinam virājam
translated: The celibate one, generating Brahmā, the world, Prajāpati, the supreme lord, and Virāj,

original: garbho bhūtvāmṛtasya yonāv indro ha bhūtvāsurāṃs tatarha ////
analyzed: garbhaḥ bhūtvā amṛtasya yonau indraḥ ha bhūtvā surān tatarha
translated: having become the embryo in the womb of immortality, Indra, having become, satisfied the demons.

original: ācāryas tatakṣa nabhasī ubhe ime urvī gambhīre pṛthivīṃ divaṃ ca /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ tatakṣa nabhasī ubhe ime urvī gambhīre pṛthivīm divam ca
translated: The teacher fashioned these two vast, deep, and extensive heavens, the earth and the sky.

original: te rakṣati tapasā brahmacārī tasmin devāḥ saṃmanaso bhavanti ////
analyzed: te rakṣati tapasā brahmacārī tasmin devāḥ saṃmanasaḥ bhavanti
translated: The celibate one protects them with austerity; in them the gods have a common mind.

original: imāṃ bhūmiṃ pṛthivīṃ brahmacārī bhikṣām ā jabhāra prathamo divaṃ ca /
analyzed: imām bhūmim pṛthivīm brahmacārī bhikṣām ā jabhāra prathamaḥ divam ca
translated: The celibate one brought this earth, this world, and the sky as alms for the first time.

original: te kṛtvā samidhāv upāste tayor ārpitā bhuvanāni viśvā ////
analyzed: te kṛtvā samidhau upāste tayoḥ ā arpitā bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: Having made them, he worships them; in them are placed all the worlds.

original: arvāg anyaḥ paro anyo divas pṛṣṭhād guhā nidhī nihitau brāhmaṇasya /
analyzed: arvāk anyaḥ paras anyaḥ divaḥ pṛṣṭhāt guhā nidhī nihitau brāhmaṇasya
