translated: One is below, the other is above, the two treasures are hidden in the back of the sky of the Brāhmaṇa.

original: tau rakṣati tapasā brahmacārī tat kevalaṃ kṛṇute brahma vidvān ////
analyzed: tau rakṣati tapasā brahmacārī tat kevalam kṛṇute brahma vidvān
translated: The celibate one protects them with austerity; the knower of Brahman makes them alone.

original: arvāg anya ito anyaḥ pṛthivyā agnī sameto nabhasī antareme /
analyzed: arvāk anyaḥ itas anyaḥ pṛthivyāḥ agnī sametaḥ nabhasī antarā ime
translated: One is below this, the other is above the earth; the two fires are united in the two midspaces.

original: tayoḥ śrayante raśmayo 'dhi dṛḍhās tān ā tiṣṭhati tapasā brahmacārī ////
analyzed: tayoḥ śrayante raśmayaḥ dhi dṛḍhāḥ tān ā tiṣṭhati tapasā brahmacārī
translated: The firm rays rest on them; the celibate one stands on them with austerity.

original: abhikrandan stanayann aruṇaḥ śitiṅgo bṛhac chepo 'nu bhūmau jabhāra /
analyzed: abhikrandan stanayan aruṇaḥ śitiṅgaḥ bṛhat śepaḥ nu bhūmau jabhāra
translated: The red one with the white back, roaring, thundering, the great one, has brought down rain on the earth.

original: brahmacārī siñcati sānau retaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tena jīvanti pradiśaś catasraḥ ////
analyzed: brahmacārī siñcati sānau retaḥ pṛthivyām tena jīvanti pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: The celibate one pours seed on the slope of the earth, by that the four quarters of the world live.

original: agnau sūrye candramasi mātariśvan brahmacāry apsu samidham ā dadhāti /
analyzed: agnau sūrye candramasi mātariśvan brahmacārī apsu samidham ā dadhāti
translated: The celibate one places the sacred fuel in the fire, in the sun, in the moon, in the wind, in the waters.

original: tāsām arcīṃṣi pṛthag abhre caranti tāsām ājyaṃ puruṣo varṣam āpaḥ ////
analyzed: tāsām arcīṃṣi pṛthak abhre caranti tāsām ājyam puruṣaḥ varṣam āpaḥ
translated: Their flames move separately in the clouds, their clarified butter is the man, the rain is the waters.

original: ācāryo mṛtyur varuṇaḥ soma oṣadhayaḥ payaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ mṛtyuḥ varuṇaḥ somaḥ oṣadhayaḥ payaḥ
translated: The teacher is death, Varuna is the moon, the plants are the milk.

original: jīmūtā āsant satvānas tair idaṃ svar ābhṛtam ////
analyzed: jīmūtāḥ āsan satvānaḥ taiḥ idam svar ābhṛtam
translated: The clouds are the beings, by them this heaven was brought.

original: amā ghṛtaṃ kṛṇute kevalam ācāryo bhūtvā varuṇaḥ /
analyzed: amā ghṛtam kṛṇute kevalam ācāryaḥ bhūtvā varuṇaḥ
translated: Varuna, having become the teacher, makes the pure ghee alone.

original: yadyad aichat prajāpatau tad brahmacārī prāyachat svān mitro adhy ātmanaḥ ////
analyzed: yat yat aichat prajāpatau tat brahmacārī prāyacchat svāt mitraḥ adhi ātmanaḥ
translated: Whatever he desired in Prajapati, the celibate one gave it from his own self, his friend.

original: ācāryo brahmacārī brahmacārī prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ brahmacārī brahmacārī prajāpatiḥ
translated: The teacher is the celibate, the celibate is Prajapati.

original: prajāpatir vi rājati virāḍ indro 'bhavad vaśī ////
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ vi rājati virāj indraḥ bhavat vaśī
translated: Prajapati shines forth, Virāj became the powerful Indra.

original: brahmacaryeṇa tapasā rājā rāṣṭraṃ vi rakṣati /
analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa tapasā rājā rāṣṭram vi rakṣati
translated: By celibacy and austerity, the king protects the kingdom.

original: ācāryo brahmacaryeṇa brahmacāriṇam ichate ////
analyzed: ācāryaḥ brahmacaryeṇa brahmacāriṇam ichate
translated: The teacher desires the celibate by celibacy.

original: brahmacaryeṇa kanyā yuvānaṃ vindate patim /
analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa kanyā yuvānam vindate patim
translated: By Brahmacharya a maiden obtains a young husband.

original: anaḍvān brahmacaryeṇāśvo ghāsaṃ jigīṣati ////
analyzed: anaḍvān brahmacaryeṇa aśvaḥ ghāsam jigīṣati
translated: By Brahmacharya a bull seeks to win food.

original: brahmacaryeṇa tapasā devā mṛtyum apāghnata /
analyzed: brahmacaryeṇa tapasā devāḥ mṛtyum apāghnata
translated: By Brahmacharya and austerity the gods destroyed death.

original: indro ha brahmacaryeṇa devebhyaḥ svar ābharat ////
analyzed: indraḥ ha brahmacaryeṇa devebhyaḥ svar ābharat
translated: Indra by Brahmacharya brought heaven to the gods.

original: oṣadhayo bhūtabhavyam ahorātre vanaspatiḥ /
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ bhūta bhavyam ahar rātre vanaspatiḥ
translated: The herbs, the past and future, the day and night, the trees,

original: saṃvatsaraḥ saha ṛtubhis te jātā brahmacāriṇaḥ ////
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ saha ṛtubhiḥ te jātāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: The year together with the seasons, they were born as Brahmachārins.

original: pārthivā divyāḥ paśava āraṇyā grāmyāś ca ye /
analyzed: pārthivāḥ divyāḥ paśavaḥ āraṇyāḥ grāmyāḥ ca ye
translated: The earthly, the heavenly, the wild, the domestic animals,

original: apakṣāḥ pakṣiṇaś ca ye te jātā brahmacāriṇaḥ ////
analyzed: apakṣāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ ca ye te jātāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: And the wingless and winged ones, they were born as Brahmachārins.

original: pṛthak sarve prājāpatyāḥ prāṇān ātmasu bibhrati /
analyzed: pṛthak sarve prājāpatyāḥ prāṇān ātmasu bibhrati
translated: All of them, the offspring of Prajāpati, bear life within themselves.

original: tānt sarvān brahma rakṣati brahmacāriṇy ābhṛtam ////
analyzed: tān sarvān brahma rakṣati brahmacāriṇi ābhṛtam
translated: Brahma protects them all, brought by the Brahmachārin.

original: devānām etat pariṣūtam anabhyārūḍhaṃ carati rocamānam /🔽tasmāj jātaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brahma jyeṣṭhaṃ devāś ca sarve amṛtena sākam ////
analyzed: devānām etat pariṣūtam an abhyārūḍham carati rocamānam  tasmāt jātam brāhmaṇam brahma jyeṣṭham devāḥ ca sarve amṛtena sākam
translated: This is the offspring of the gods, it moves unapproached, shining.🔽From it was born the Brahman, the eldest, and all the gods together with immortality.

original: brahmacārī brahma bhrājad bibharti tasmin devā adhi viśve samotāḥ /
analyzed: brahmacārī brahma bhrājat bibharti tasmin devāḥ adhi viśve samotāḥ
translated: The Brahmachārin bears the shining Brahman, in it all the gods are united.

original: prāṇāpānau janayann ād vyānaṃ vācaṃ mano hṛdayaṃ brahma medhām ////
analyzed: prāṇa apānau janayan āt vyānam vācam manaḥ hṛdayam brahma medhām
translated: Generating the exhalation and inhalation, the upward and the speech, the mind, the heart, the Brahman, the intelligence,

original: cakṣuḥ śrotraṃ yaśo asmāsu dhehy annaṃ reto lohitam udaram ////
analyzed: cakṣuḥ śrotram yaśaḥ asmāsu dhehi annam retaḥ lohitam udaram
translated: The eye, the ear, the fame, bestow upon us food, semen, blood, the belly,

original: tāni kalpan brahmacārī salilasya pṛṣṭhe tapo 'tiṣṭhat tapyamānaḥ samudre /
analyzed: tāni kalpan brahmacārī salilasya pṛṣṭhe tapo tiṣṭhat tapyamānaḥ samudre
translated: Having created these, the celibate one stood on the back of the water, performing austerities, being tormented in the ocean.

original: sa snāto babhruḥ piṅgalaḥ pṛthivyāṃ bahu rocate ////
analyzed: sa snātaḥ babhruḥ piṅgalaḥ pṛthivyām bahu rocate
translated: That bathed one, the tawny one, the reddish-brown one, shines much on the earth.

original: agniṃ brūmo vanaspatīn oṣadhīr uta vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: agnim brūmaḥ vanaspatīn oṣadhīḥ uta vīrudhaḥ
translated: We speak to Agni, to the trees, to the plants and herbs.

original: indraṃ bṛhaspatiṃ sūryaṃ te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: indram bṛhaspatim sūryam te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: To Indra, to Brihaspati, to Surya - may they release us from this calamity.

original: brūmo rājānaṃ varuṇaṃ mitraṃ viṣṇum atho bhagam /
analyzed: brūmaḥ rājānam varuṇam mitram viṣṇum atha u bhagam
translated: We speak to King Varuna, to Mitra, to Vishnu, and to Bhaga.

original: aṃśaṃ vivasvantaṃ brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: aṃśam vivasvantam brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: We speak to Amsha, to Vivasvat - may they release us from this calamity.

original: brūmo devaṃ savitāraṃ dhātāram uta pūṣaṇam /
analyzed: brūmaḥ devam savitāram dhātāram uta pūṣaṇam
translated: We speak to the god Savita, to the creator, and to Pushan.

original: tvaṣṭāram agriyaṃ brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭāram agriyam brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: We speak to Tvashtra, the eldest - may they release us from this calamity.

original: gandharvāpsaraso brūmo aśvinā brahmaṇaspatim /
analyzed: gandharva apsarasaḥ brūmaḥ aśvinā brahmaṇaspatim
translated: We speak to the Gandharvas and the Apsaras, to the Ashvins, to Brahma's lord.

original: aryamā nāma yo devas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: aryamā nāma yaḥ devaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The god whose name is Aryama - may they release us from this calamity.

original: ahorātre idaṃ brūmaḥ sūryācandramasāv ubhā /
analyzed: ahorātre idam brūmaḥ sūryācandramasau ubhā
translated: We speak to these, the day and night, to both the sun and the moon.

original: viśvān ādityān brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvān ādityān brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: We address the All-Gods; may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: vātaṃ brūmaḥ parjanyam antarikṣam atho diśaḥ /
analyzed: vātam brūmaḥ parjanyam antarikṣam atha u diśaḥ
translated: We address Vata, Parjanya, the atmosphere, and also the quarters,

original: āśāś ca sarvā brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: āśāḥ ca sarvāḥ brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: And all the regions; may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyād ahorātre atho uṣāḥ /
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt ahorātre atha u uṣāḥ
translated: May day and night deliver me from the curse, and also the dawn,

original: somo mā devo muñcatu yam āhuś candramā iti ////
analyzed: somaḥ mā devaḥ muñcatu yam āhuḥ candramāḥ iti
translated: And may the god Soma deliver me, whom they call the moon.

original: pārthivā divyāḥ paśava āraṇyā uta ye mṛgāḥ /
analyzed: pārthivāḥ divyāḥ paśavaḥ āraṇyāḥ uta ye mṛgāḥ
translated: The earthly, the heavenly, the wild animals, and the beasts,

original: śakuntān pakṣiṇo brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: śakuntān pakṣiṇaḥ brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: We address the birds and the winged creatures; may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: bhavāśarvāv idaṃ brūmo rudraṃ paśupatiś ca yaḥ /
analyzed: bhavāśarvau idam brūmaḥ rudram paśupatiḥ ca yaḥ
translated: We address Bhava and Sarva, and Rudra and Pasupati,

original: iṣūr yā eṣāṃ saṃvidma tā naḥ santu sadā śivāḥ ////
analyzed: iṣūḥ yāḥ eṣām saṃvidma tāḥ naḥ santu sadā śivāḥ
translated: May their arrows that we know be always auspicious to us.

original: divaṃ brūmo nakṣatrāṇi bhūmiṃ yakṣāṇi parvatān /
analyzed: divam brūmaḥ nakṣatrāṇi bhūmim yakṣāṇi parvatān
translated: We address the heaven, the stars, the earth, the Yakshas, the mountains,

original: samudrā nadyo veśantās te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: samudrāḥ nadyaḥ veśantāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The oceans, rivers, and lakes; may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: saptaṛṣīn vā idaṃ brūmo 'po devīḥ prajāpatim /
analyzed: sapta ṛṣīn vai idam brūmaḥ u parā u devīḥ prajāpatim
translated: We address the seven Rishis, the divine waters, and Prajapati,

original: pitṝn yamaśreṣṭhān brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ///
analyzed: pitṝn yama śreṣṭhān brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: We address the ancestors, best of the righteous; may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: ye devā diviṣado antarikṣasadaś ca ye /
analyzed: ye devāḥ diviṣadaḥ antarikṣa sadaḥ ca ye
translated: The gods who dwell in the sky and in the atmosphere,

original: pṛthivyāṃ śakrā ye śritās te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: pṛthivyām śakrāḥ ye śritāḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Those Shakra-like ones who are on earth, may they release us from calamity.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavo divi devā atharvāṇaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ divi devāḥ atharvāṇaḥ
translated: The Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, the gods in heaven, the Atharvans,

original: aṅgiraso manīṣiṇas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The wise Angirasas, may they release us from calamity.

original: yajñaṃ brūmo yajamānam ṛcaḥ sāmāni bheṣajā /
analyzed: yajñam brūmaḥ yajamānam ṛcaḥ sāmāni bheṣajā
translated: We invoke the sacrifice, the sacrificer, the healing Rig-Veda hymns,

original: yajūṃṣi hotrā brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: yajūṃṣi hotrā brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The Yajur-Veda, and the Hotra, may they release us from calamity.

original: pañca rājyāni vīrudhāṃ somaśreṣṭhāni brūmaḥ /
analyzed: pañca rājyāni vīrudhām soma śreṣṭhāni brūmaḥ
translated: We invoke the five kingdoms of plants, with Soma as the best,

original: darbho bhaṅgo yavaḥ sahas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: darbhaḥ bhaṅgaḥ yavaḥ sahaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Darbha grass, broken grain, barley, and sesame, may they release us from calamity.

original: arāyān brūmo rakṣāṃsi sarpān puṇyajanān pitṝn /
analyzed: arāyān brūmaḥ rakṣāṃsi sarpān puṇyajanān pitṝn
translated: We invoke the evil spirits, the Rakshasas, the snakes, the meritorious ancestors,

original: mṛtyūn ekaśataṃ brūmas te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: mṛtyūn eka śatam brūmaḥ te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: And the one hundred and one kinds of death, may they release us from calamity.

original: ṛtūn brūma ṛtupatīn ārtavān uta hāyanān /
analyzed: ṛtūn brūmaḥ ṛtu patīn ārtavān uta hāyanān
translated: We invoke the seasons, the lords of the seasons, the half-seasons, and the years,

original: samāḥ saṃvatsarān māsāṃs te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: samāḥ saṃvatsarān māsān te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: The years, the months, and the fortnights, may they release us from calamity.

original: eta devā dakṣiṇataḥ paścāt prāñca udeta /
analyzed: eta devāḥ dakṣiṇatas paścāt prāñcaḥ udeta
translated: O gods, come from the south, from the west, from the east,

original: purastād uttarāc chakrā viśve devāḥ sametya te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: purastāt uttarāt śakrāḥ viśve devāḥ sametya te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: From the north, O Shakra, all the gods, having assembled, may they release us from calamity.

original: viśvān devān idaṃ brūmaḥ satyasandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: viśvān devān idam brūmaḥ satya sandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: We invoke all the gods, those who are bound by truth, those who increase truth,

original: viśvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: With all the wives together, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: sarvān devān idaṃ brūmaḥ satyasandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: sarvān devān idam brūmaḥ satya sandhān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: We address all the gods here, those who are bound by truth and increase truth,

original: sarvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvābhiḥ patnībhiḥ saha te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: With all the wives together, may they deliver us from tribulation.

original: bhūtaṃ brūmo bhūtapatiṃ bhūtānām uta yo vaśī /
analyzed: bhūtam brūmaḥ bhūtapatim bhūtānām uta yaḥ vaśī
translated: We speak of the existent, the lord of the existent, and also he who is the powerful one among the existent beings,

original: bhūtāni sarvā saṃgatya te no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: bhūtāni sarvā saṃgatya te naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May all the existent beings, having assembled, deliver us from tribulation.

original: yā devīḥ pañca pradiśo ye devā dvādaśa ṛtavaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ devīḥ pañca pradiśaḥ ye devāḥ dvādaśa ṛtavaḥ
translated: The five goddesses of the directions, the twelve gods of the seasons,

original: saṃvatsarasya ye daṃṣṭrās te naḥ santu sadā śivāḥ ////
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya ye daṃṣṭrāḥ te naḥ santu sadā śivāḥ
translated: And the fangs of the year, may they always be auspicious to us.

original: yan mātalī rathakrītam amṛtaṃ veda bheṣajam /
analyzed: yat mātalī ratha krītam amṛtam veda bheṣajam
translated: The immortal medicine that Matali knows, bought with a chariot,

original: tad indro apsu prāveśayat tad āpo datta bheṣajam ////
analyzed: tat indraḥ apsu prāveśayat tat āpaḥ datta bheṣajam
translated: That Indra placed in the waters. May the waters give that medicine to us.

original: ucchiṣṭe nāma rūpaṃ cocchiṣṭe loka āhitaḥ /
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe nāma rūpam ca ucchiṣṭe lokaḥ āhitaḥ
translated: In the remnants, name and form are placed, and the world is established in the remnants.

original: ucchiṣṭa indraś cāgniś ca viśvam antaḥ samāhitam ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭaḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca viśvam antar samāhitam
translated: In the remnants, Indra and Agni are established, and all things are contained within.

original: ucchiṣṭe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaṃ bhūtaṃ samāhitam /
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe dyāvāpṛthivī viśvam bhūtam samāhitam
translated: In the remnants, heaven and earth, and all existing things are contained.

original: āpaḥ samudra ucchiṣṭe candramā vāta āhitaḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ samudre ucchiṣṭe candramāḥ vāte āhitaḥ
translated: In the remnants, the waters, the ocean, the moon, and the wind are established.

original: sann ucchiṣṭe asaṃś cobhau mṛtyur vājaḥ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: san ucchiṣṭe asan ca ubhau mṛtyuḥ vājaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: In the remnants, both the existent and the non-existent are established, as well as death, strength, and Prajapati.

original: laukyā ucchiṣṭa āyattā vraś ca draś cāpi śrīr mayi ////
analyzed: laukyāḥ ucchiṣṭe āyattāḥ ca draḥ ca api śrīḥ mayi
translated: The worldly prosperity depends on the leavings, and the Vrash and Drash are also in me.

original: dṛḍho dṛṃha sthiro nyo brahma viśvasṛjo daśa /
analyzed: dṛḍhaḥ dṛṃha sthiraḥ nyaḥ brahma viśva sṛjaḥ daśa
translated: Firm, steady, stable, the ten creators of the universe are in the Brahman.

original: nābhim iva sarvataś cakram ucchiṣṭe devatāḥ śritāḥ ////
analyzed: nābhim iva sarvatas cakram ucchiṣṭe devatāḥ śritāḥ
translated: Like the spokes in the nave, the deities are dependent on the leavings, from all sides.

original: ṛk sāma yajur ucchiṣṭa udgīthaḥ prastutaṃ stutam /
analyzed: ṛk sāma yajuḥ ucchiṣṭaḥ udgīthaḥ prastutam stutam
translated: The Rik, Saman, Yajus are in the leavings, the Udgitha, the Prastuta, the Sthuta.

original: hiṅkāra ucchiṣṭe svaraḥ sāmno meḍiś ca tan mayi ////
analyzed: hiṅkāraḥ ucchiṣṭe svaraḥ sāmnaḥ mā iḍiḥ ca tat mayi
translated: The Hinkara, the Svaras, the Medha of the Saman are in the leavings, and that is in me.

original: aindrāgnaṃ pāvamānaṃ mahānāmnīr mahāvratam /
analyzed: aindrāgnam pāvamānam mahānāmnīḥ mahāvratam
translated: The Aindragna, the Pavamana, the Mahanamni, the Mahavrata,

original: ucchiṣṭe yajñasyāṅgāny antar garbha iva mātari ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe yajñasya aṅgāni antar garbhe iva mātari
translated: The limbs of the sacrifice are in the leavings, like an embryo in the mother.

original: rājasūyaṃ vājapeyam agniṣṭomaṣ tad adhvaraḥ /
analyzed: rājasūyam vājapeyam agniṣṭomaḥ tat adhvaraḥ
translated: The Rajasuya, the Vajapeya, the Agnishtoma, that sacrifice,

original: arkāśvamedhāv ucchiṣṭe jīvabarhir madintamaḥ ////
analyzed: arka aśvamedhau ucchiṣṭe jīva barhiḥ madintamaḥ
translated: The Ashvamedha, the Sautrāmaṇi, the Jīva-barhis, the most delightful, are in the leavings.

original: agnyādheyam atho dīkṣā kāmapraś chandasā saha /
analyzed: agnyādheyam atha u dīkṣā kāmapraḥ chandasā saha
translated: The Agnyādheya, the initiation, the Kāmaprasha, together with the Chandas,

original: utsannā yajñāḥ satrāṇy ucchiṣṭe 'dhi samāhitāḥ ////
analyzed: utsannāḥ yajñāḥ satrāṇi ucchiṣṭe dhi samāhitāḥ
translated: The discontinued sacrifices, the Sattras, are concentrated on the leavings.

original: agnihotraṃ ca śraddhā ca vaṣaṭkāro vrataṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: agnihotram ca śraddhā ca vaṣaṭkāraḥ vratam tapaḥ
translated: The Agnihotra, the faith, the Vashatkara, the vow, the austerity,

original: dakṣiṇeṣṭaṃ pūrtaṃ cocchiṣṭe 'dhi samāhitāḥ ////
analyzed: dakṣiṇā iṣṭam pūrtam ca ucchiṣṭe dhi samāhitāḥ
translated: The Dakshineshta, the Pūrta, are concentrated on the leavings.

original: ekarātro dvirātraḥ sadyaḥkrīḥ prakrīr ukthyaḥ /
analyzed: eka rātraḥ dvi rātraḥ sadyaḥkrīḥ prakrīḥ ukthyaḥ
translated: The Ekāratra, the Dvirātra, the Sadyaḥkrī, the Prakīr, the Ukthya,

original: otaṃ nihitam ucchiṣṭe yajñasyāṇūni vidyayā ////
analyzed: otam nihitam ucchiṣṭe yajñasya aṇūni vidyayā
translated: The subtle parts of the sacrifice, woven and placed in the leavings, by knowledge.

original: catūrātraḥ pañcarātraḥ ṣaḍrātraś cobhayaḥ saha /
analyzed: catur rātraḥ pañca rātraḥ ṣaṣ rātraḥ ca ubhayaḥ saha
translated: The four-night, five-night, and six-night sacrifices, both together,

original: ṣoḍaśī saptarātraś cocchiṣṭāj jajñire sarve ye yajñā amṛte hitāḥ ////
analyzed: ṣoḍaśī saptarātraḥ ca ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve ye yajñāḥ amṛte hitāḥ
translated: The Sodashi and the seven-night sacrifice, all the sacrifices that are established in immortality, were born from the leavings.

original: pratīhāro nidhanaṃ viśvajic cābhijic ca yaḥ /
analyzed: pratīhāraḥ nidhanam viśvajit ca abhijit ca yaḥ
translated: The doorkeeper, the conclusion, the Vishvajit, and the Abhijit,

original: sāhnātirātrāv ucchiṣṭe dvādaśāho 'pi tan mayi ////
analyzed: sa ahnā atirātrau ucchiṣṭe tat mayi
translated: The Sahna and Atirâtra, the twelve-day sacrifice, are also in the leavings.

original: sūnṛtā saṃnatiḥ kṣemaḥ svadhorjāmṛtaṃ sahaḥ /
analyzed: sūnṛtā saṃnatiḥ kṣemaḥ svadhā ūrjā amṛtam sahaḥ
translated: Truth, humility, peace, self-control, food, immortality, and strength,

original: ucchiṣṭe sarve pratyañcaḥ kāmāḥ kāmena tātṛpuḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe sarve pratyañcaḥ kāmāḥ kāmena tātṛpuḥ
translated: All desires, turned towards the leavings, were satisfied by desire.

original: nava bhūmīḥ samudrā ucchiṣṭe 'dhi śritā divaḥ /
analyzed: nava bhūmīḥ samudrāḥ ucchiṣṭe dhi śritāḥ divaḥ
translated: The nine worlds and oceans are established in the leavings above the sky.

original: ā sūryo bhāty ucchiṣṭe 'horātre api tan mayi ////🔽upahavyaṃ viṣūvantaṃ ye ca yajñā guhā hitāḥ /
analyzed: ā sūryaḥ bhāti ucchiṣṭe horātre api tat mayi  upahavyam viṣūvantam ye ca yajñāḥ guhā hitāḥ
translated: The sun shines in the leavings, the day and night are also in me.🔽The Upâhvaya, the Visûvânt, and the sacrifices that are hidden,

original: bibharti bhartā viśvasyocchiṣṭo janituḥ pitā ////
analyzed: bibharti bhartā viśvasya ucchiṣṭaḥ janituḥ pitā
translated: The leavings, the supporter, supports the supporter of all, the father of the generator.

original: pitā janitur ucchiṣṭo 'soḥ pautraḥ pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: pitā janituḥ pautraḥ pitāmahaḥ
translated: The leavings are the father of the generator, the grandson of the immortal grandfather.

original: sa kṣiyati viśvasyeśāno vṛṣā bhūmyām atighnyaḥ ////
analyzed: sa kṣiyati viśvasya īśānaḥ vṛṣā bhūmyām atighnyaḥ
translated: He rules over all as the powerful lord, the most deadly on earth.

original: ṛtaṃ satyaṃ tapo rāṣṭraṃ śramo dharmaś ca karma ca /
analyzed: ṛtam satyam tapaḥ rāṣṭram śramaḥ dharmaḥ ca karma ca
translated: Truth, righteousness, austerity, kingdom, labor, duty, and action,

original: bhūtaṃ bhaviṣyad ucchiṣṭe vīryaṃ lakṣmīr balaṃ bale ////🔽samṛddhir oja ākūtiḥ kṣatraṃ rāṣṭraṃ ṣaḍ urvyaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtam bhaviṣyat ucchiṣṭe vīryam lakṣmīḥ balam bale  samṛddhiḥ ojaḥ ākūtiḥ kṣatram rāṣṭram ṣaḍ urvyaḥ
translated: The past and future are in the remnants, power, prosperity, strength,🔽wealth, vigor, intention, kingdom, nation, the six expanses,

original: saṃvatsaro 'dhy ucchiṣṭa iḍā praiṣā grahā haviḥ ////
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ dhi ucchiṣṭaḥ iḍā praiṣāḥ grahāḥ haviḥ
translated: the year is above the remnants, the Ida, the Praisa, the cups, the oblation,

original: caturhotāra āpriyaś cāturmāsyāni nīvidaḥ /
analyzed: caturhotāraḥ āpriyaḥ cāturmāsyāni nīvidaḥ
translated: the four Hotars, the Aprinas, the Chaturmasyas, the Nividas,

original: ucchiṣṭe yajñā hotrāḥ paśubandhās tad iṣṭayaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe yajñāḥ hotrāḥ paśubandhāḥ tat iṣṭayaḥ
translated: the sacrifices, the Hotras, the animal bonds, those Ishtis are in the remnants,

original: ardhamāsāś ca māsāś cārtavā ṛtubhiḥ saha /
analyzed: ardha māsāḥ ca māsāḥ ca ārtavāḥ ṛtubhiḥ saha
translated: the half-months, the months, the seasons with the seasons,

original: ucchiṣṭe ghoṣiṇīr āpa stanayitnuḥ śrutir mahī ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭe ghoṣiṇīḥ āpaḥ stanayitnuḥ śrutiḥ mahī
translated: the roaring waters, the thunder, the great heard are in the remnants,🔽the gravel, the sand, the stones, the herbs, the creepers, the grass,

original: śarkarāḥ sikatā aśmāna oṣadhayo vīrudhas tṛṇā /🔽abhrāṇi vidyuto varṣam ucchiṣṭe saṃśritā śritā ////
analyzed: śarkarāḥ sikatāḥ aśmānaḥ oṣadhayaḥ vīrudhaḥ tṛṇā  abhrāṇi vidyutaḥ varṣam ucchiṣṭe saṃśritā śritā
translated: the clouds, the lightning, the rain are in the remnants, the dependent ones,

original: rāddhiḥ prāptiḥ samāptir vyāptir maha edhatuḥ /
analyzed: rāddhiḥ prāptiḥ samāptiḥ vyāptiḥ mahaḥ edhatuḥ
translated: the attainment, the acquisition, the completion, the pervasion, the great increase,

original: atyāptir ucchiṣṭe bhūtiś cāhitā nihitā hitā ////
analyzed: atyāptiḥ ucchiṣṭe bhūtiḥ ca ahitā nihitā hitā
translated: the over-attainment, the prosperity in the remnants, the offered, the placed, the beneficial,

original: yac ca prāṇati prāṇena yac ca paśyati cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: yat ca prāṇati prāṇena yat ca paśyati cakṣuṣā
translated: what breathes with breath, what sees with the eye,

original: ucchiṣṭāj jajñire sarve divi devā diviśritaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ
translated: all are born from the remnants, the gods in heaven, the heaven-dwellers,

original: ṛcaḥ sāmāni chandāṃsi purāṇaṃ yajuṣā saha /
analyzed: ṛcaḥ sāmāni chandāṃsi purāṇam yajuṣā saha
translated: the Rig verses, the Samans, the meters, the Purana together with the Yajus,

original: ucchiṣṭāj jajñire sarve divi devā diviśritaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ
translated: All the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven, were born from the remnants.

original: prāṇāpānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiś ca kṣitiś ca yā /
analyzed: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā
translated: Prana and apana, sight and hearing, imperishability and destructibility,

original: ucchiṣṭāj jajñire sarve divi devā diviśritaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ
translated: All the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven, were born from the remnants.

original: ānandā modāḥ pramudo 'bhīmodamudaś ca ye /
analyzed: ānandāḥ modāḥ pramudaḥ bhīma uda mudaḥ ca ye
translated: The joys, the delights, the great delights, the exultations, the raptures,

original: ucchiṣṭāj jajñire sarve divi devā diviśritaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ
translated: All the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven, were born from the remnants.

original: devāḥ pitaro manuṣyā gandharvāpsarasaś ca ye /
analyzed: devāḥ pitaraḥ manuṣyāḥ gandharva apsarasaḥ ca ye
translated: The gods, the ancestors, the humans, the gandharvas and the apsaras,

original: ucchiṣṭāj jajñire sarve divi devā diviśritaḥ ////
analyzed: ucchiṣṭāt jajñire sarve divi devāḥ
translated: All the gods in heaven, the gods who rest in heaven, were born from the remnants.

original: yan manyur jāyām āvahat saṃkalpasya gṛhād adhi /
analyzed: yat manyuḥ jāyām āvahat saṃkalpasya gṛhāt adhi
translated: When Manyu brought his wife from the house of Sankalpa,

original: ka āsaṃ janyāḥ ke varāḥ ka u jyeṣṭhavaro 'bhavat ////
analyzed: kaḥ āsam janyāḥ ke varāḥ kaḥ u jyeṣṭha varaḥ bhavat
translated: Who were the guests, who were the chosen ones, who became the chief guest?

original: tapaś caivāstāṃ karma cāntar mahaty arṇave /
analyzed: tapaḥ ca eva āstām karma ca antar mahati arṇave
translated: Penance and action were in the great ocean.

original: ta āsaṃ janyās te varā brahma jyeṣṭhavaro 'bhavat ////
analyzed: te āsam janyāḥ te varāḥ brahma jyeṣṭha varaḥ bhavat
translated: They were the guests, they were the chosen ones, Brahman became the chief guest.

original: daśa sākam ajāyanta devā devebhyaḥ purā /
analyzed: daśa sākam ajāyanta devāḥ devebhyaḥ purā
translated: Ten gods were born together from the gods in the past.

original: yo vai tān vidyāt pratyakṣaṃ sa vā adya mahad vadet ////
analyzed: yaḥ vai tān vidyāt pratyakṣam sa vai adya mahat vadet
translated: He who knows them directly, he could speak great words today.

original: prāṇāpānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiś ca kṣitiś ca yā /
analyzed: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā
translated: Prana and apana, sight and hearing, imperishability and destructibility,

original: vyānodānau vāṅ manas te vā ākūtim āvahan ////
analyzed: vyāna udānau vāc manaḥ te vai ākūtim āvahan
translated: Vyana and Udana, speech and mind, have brought thee this intention.

original: ajātā āsann ṛtavo 'tho dhātā bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: a jātāḥ āsan ṛtavaḥ thaḥ dhātā bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: The seasons were unborn, then Dhatr and Brihaspati,

original: indrāgnī aśvinā tarhi kaṃ te jyeṣṭham upāsata ////
analyzed: indra agnī aśvinā tarhi kam te jyeṣṭham upāsata
translated: Then Indra, Agni, and the Asvins, who then worshipped thee as the eldest?

original: tapaś caivāstāṃ karma cāntar mahaty arṇave /
analyzed: tapaḥ ca eva āstām karma ca antar mahati arṇave
translated: Penance and work were in the great ocean,

original: tapo ha jajñe karmaṇas tat te jyeṣṭham upāsata ////
analyzed: tapaḥ ha jajñe karmaṇaḥ tat te jyeṣṭham upāsata
translated: From penance was born work, that they worship as the eldest.

original: yeta āsīd bhūmiḥ pūrvā yām addhātaya id viduḥ /
analyzed: yā itas āsīt bhūmiḥ pūrvā yām addhātayaḥ id viduḥ
translated: That which was the earth before, which they know as the middle,

original: yo vai tāṃ vidyān nāmathā sa manyeta purāṇavit ////
analyzed: yaḥ vai tām vidyāt na amathā sa manyeta purāṇa vid
translated: If one knows that, he might think himself an ancient knower.

original: kuta indraḥ kutaḥ somaḥ kuto agnir ajāyata /
analyzed: kutas indraḥ kutas somaḥ kutas agniḥ ajāyata
translated: From where did Indra come, from where Soma, from where was Agni born?

original: kutas tvaṣṭā sam abhavat kuto dhātājāyata ////
analyzed: kutas tvaṣṭā sam abhavat kutas dhātā ajāyata
translated: From where did Tvastr come into being, from where was Dhatr born?

original: indrād indraḥ somāt somo agner agnir ajāyata /
analyzed: indrāt indraḥ somāt somaḥ agneḥ agniḥ ajāyata
translated: From Indra came Indra, from Soma Soma was born, from Agni Agni was born.

original: tvaṣṭā ha jajñe tvaṣṭur dhātur dhātājāyata ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭā ha jajñe tvaṣṭuḥ dhātuḥ dhātā ajāyata
translated: Tvastr was born from Tvastr, from Dhatr Dhatr was born.

original: ye ta āsan daśa jātā devā devebhyaḥ purā /
analyzed: ye te āsan daśa jātāḥ devāḥ devebhyaḥ purā
translated: Those ten gods who were born before the gods,

original: putrebhyo lokaṃ dattvā kasmiṃs te loka āsate ////
analyzed: putrebhyaḥ lokam dattvā kasmin te loke āsate  /
translated: Having given the world to their sons, in what world do they dwell?

original: yadā keśān asthi snāva māṃsaṃ majjānam ābharat /
analyzed: yadā keśān asthi snāva māṃsam majjānam ābharat
translated: When he brought together hair, bone, sinew, flesh, and marrow,

original: śarīraṃ kṛtvā pādavat kaṃ lokam anu prāviśat ////🔽kutaḥ keśān kutaḥ snāva kuto asthīny ābharat /
analyzed: śarīram kṛtvā pāda vat kam lokam anu prāviśat  kutas keśān kutas snāva kutas asthīni ābharat
translated: Having made the body, with feet, into what part of the world did he enter?🔽From where did he bring the hair, from where the sinews, from where the bones?

original: aṅgā parvāṇi majjānaṃ ko māṃsaṃ kuta ābharat ////
analyzed: aṅgā parvāṇi majjānam kaḥ māṃsam kutas ābharat
translated: The limbs, the joints, the marrow, who brought the flesh, and from where?

original: saṃsico nāma te devā ye saṃbhārānt samabharan /
analyzed: saṃsicaḥ nāma te devāḥ ye saṃbhārān samabharan
translated: Those gods named the Mixers, who mixed the components,

original: sarvaṃ saṃsicya martyaṃ devāḥ puruṣam āviśan ////
analyzed: sarvam saṃsicya martyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan
translated: having mixed everything mortal, the gods entered the human being.

original: ūrū pādāv aṣṭhīvantau śiro hastāv atho mukham /
analyzed: ūrū pādau aṣṭhīvantau śiraḥ hastau atho mukham
translated: The thighs, the feet, the knee-bones, the head, the hands, and also the mouth,

original: pṛṣṭīr barjahye pārśve kas tat sam adadhād ṛṣiḥ ////
analyzed: pṛṣṭīḥ barjahye pārśve kaḥ tat sam adadhāt ṛṣiḥ
translated: the ribs, the shoulder-blades, the sides, what sage put them together?

original: śiro hastāv atho mukhaṃ jihvāṃ grīvāś ca kīkasāḥ /
analyzed: śiraḥ hastau atho mukham jihvām grīvāḥ ca kīkasāḥ
translated: The head, the hands, and also the mouth, the tongue, the neck, and the cheeks,

original: tvacā prāvṛtya sarvaṃ tat saṃdhā sam adadhān mahī ////
analyzed: tvacā prāvṛtya sarvam tat saṃdhā sam adadhāt mahī
translated: having covered all that with skin, the great one put them together with joints.

original: yat tac charīram aśayat saṃdhayā saṃhitaṃ mahat /
analyzed: yat tat śarīram aśayat saṃdhayā saṃhitam mahat
translated: That great body which lay there, put together with joints,

original: yenedam adya rocate ko asmin varṇam ābharat ////
analyzed: yena idam adya rocate kaḥ asmin varṇam ābharat
translated: by what did it shine today? Who brought the color into it?

original: sarve devā upāśikṣan tad ajānād vadhūḥ satī /
analyzed: sarve devāḥ upāśikṣan tat ajānāt vadhūḥ satī
translated: All the gods attended to it, the young wife knew it,

original: īśā vaśasya yā jāyā sāsmin varṇam ābharat ////
analyzed: īśā vaśasya yā jāyā sā asmin varṇam ābharat
translated: the wife of the lord of the house, she brought the color into it.

original: yadā tvaṣṭā vyatṛṇat pitā tvaṣṭur ya uttaraḥ /
analyzed: yadā tvaṣṭā vyatṛṇat pitā tvaṣṭuḥ yaḥ uttaraḥ
translated: When Tvastr cut it apart, the father of the one beyond Tvastr,

original: gṛhaṃ kṛtvā martyaṃ devāḥ puruṣam āviśan ////
analyzed: gṛham kṛtvā martyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan
translated: Having made the mortal world their home, the gods entered the human body.

original: svapno vai tandrīr nirṛtiḥ pāpmāno nāma devatāḥ /
analyzed: svapnaḥ vai tandrīḥ nirṛtiḥ pāpmānaḥ nāma devatāḥ
translated: Sleep, laziness, misfortune, and the deities named sin,

original: jarā khālatyaṃ pālityaṃ śarīram anu prāviśan ////
analyzed: jarā khālatyam pālityam śarīram anu prāviśan
translated: Old age, baldness, graying of hair entered the body.

original: steyaṃ duṣkṛtaṃ vṛjinaṃ satyaṃ yajño yaśo bṛhat /
analyzed: steyam duṣkṛtam vṛjinam satyam yajñaḥ yaśaḥ bṛhat
translated: Theft, evil deeds, wickedness, truth, sacrifice, great fame,

original: balaṃ ca kṣatram ojaś ca śarīram anu prāviśan ////
analyzed: balam ca kṣatram ojaḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan
translated: Power, nobility, and vigor entered the body.

original: bhūtiś ca vā abhūtiś ca rātayo 'rātayaś ca yāḥ /
analyzed: bhūtiḥ ca vai abhūtiḥ ca rātayaḥ rātayaḥ ca yāḥ
translated: Prosperity and adversity, the favors and disfavors,

original: kṣudhaś ca sarvās tṛṣṇāś ca śarīram anu prāviśan ////🔽nindāś ca vā anindāś ca yac ca hanteti neti ca /
analyzed: kṣudhaḥ ca sarvāḥ tṛṣṇāḥ ca śarīram anu prāviśan  nindāḥ ca vai anindāḥ ca yat ca hantā iti na iti ca
translated: All kinds of hunger and thirst entered the body.🔽Blame and praise, and what is to be killed and not to be killed,

original: śarīraṃ śraddhā dakṣiṇāśraddhā cānu prāviśan ////
analyzed: śarīram śraddhā dakṣiṇā aśraddhā ca anu prāviśan
translated: Faith and lack of faith entered the body.

original: vidyāś ca vā avidyāś ca yac cānyad upadeśyam /
analyzed: vidyāḥ ca vai avidyāḥ ca yat ca anyat upadeśyam
translated: Knowledge and ignorance, and whatever else is to be taught,

original: śarīraṃ brahma prāviśad ṛcaḥ sāmātho yajuḥ ////
analyzed: śarīram brahma prāviśat ṛcaḥ sāma atha u yajuḥ
translated: Brahma entered the body, as did the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.

original: ānandā modāḥ pramudo 'bhīmodamudaś ca ye /
analyzed: ānandāḥ modāḥ pramudaḥ bhīma uda mudaḥ ca ye
translated: Joy, delight, great joy, excessive joy, and all kinds of joy,

original: haso nariṣṭā nṛttāni śarīram anu prāviśan ////
analyzed: hasaḥ nariṣṭāḥ nṛttāni śarīram anu prāviśan
translated: Laughter, misfortune, and dances entered the body.

original: ālāpāś ca pralāpāś cābhīlāpalapaś ca ye /
analyzed: ālāpāḥ ca pralāpāḥ ca abhīlāpa lapaḥ ca ye
translated: Chattering, prattle, excessive prattle, and all kinds of prattle,

original: śarīraṃ sarve prāviśann āyujaḥ prayujo yujaḥ ////
analyzed: śarīram sarve prāviśan āyujaḥ prayujaḥ yujaḥ
translated: All the vital airs entered the body, the active, the employed, the yoked.

original: prāṇāpānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiś ca kṣitiś ca yā /
analyzed: prāṇa apānau cakṣuḥ śrotram akṣitiḥ ca kṣitiḥ ca yā
translated: The in-breath and the out-breath, the eye and the ear, that which is imperishable and that which is perishable,

original: vyānodānau vāṅ manaḥ śarīreṇa ta īyante ////
analyzed: vyāna udānau vāc manaḥ śarīreṇa te īyante
translated: The upward and the downward breaths, speech and mind, they go with the body.

original: āśiṣaś ca praśiṣaś ca saṃśiṣo viśiṣaś ca yāḥ /
analyzed: āśiṣaḥ ca praśiṣaḥ ca saṃśiṣaḥ viśiṣaḥ ca yāḥ
translated: The blessings, the directions, the resolutions, the distinctions,

original: cittāni sarve saṃkalpāḥ śarīram anu prāviśan ////
analyzed: cittāni sarve saṃkalpāḥ śarīram anu prāviśan
translated: All the intentions and resolutions entered the body.

original: āsteyīś ca vāsteyīś ca tvaraṇāḥ kṛpaṇāś ca yāḥ /
analyzed: āsteyīḥ ca vāsteyīḥ ca tvaraṇāḥ kṛpaṇāḥ ca yāḥ
translated: The dwelling ones, the dwelling everywhere, the swift ones, the pitiable ones,

original: guhyāḥ śukrā sthūlā apas tā bībhatsāv asādayan ////
analyzed: guhyāḥ śukrāḥ sthūlāḥ apaḥ tāḥ bībhatsau asādayan
translated: The secret ones, the white ones, the gross ones, the waters, they made the disgusting one enter.

original: asthi kṛtvā samidhaṃ tad aṣṭāpo asādayan /
analyzed: asthi kṛtvā samidham tat aṣṭau apaḥ asādayan
translated: Having made the bone the fuel, they made the eight waters enter.

original: retaḥ kṛtvājyaṃ devāḥ puruṣam āviśan ////
analyzed: retaḥ kṛtvā ājyam devāḥ puruṣam āviśan
translated: Having made the semen the ghee, the gods entered the man.

original: yā āpo yāś ca devatā yā virāḍ brahmaṇā saha /
analyzed: yāḥ āpaḥ yāḥ ca devatāḥ yā virāj brahmaṇā saha
translated: Those waters and those deities, that Virāj together with Brahman,

original: śarīraṃ brahma prāviśac charīre 'dhi prajāpatiḥ ////
analyzed: śarīram brahma prāviśat śarīre dhi prajāpatiḥ
translated: Brahman entered the body, Prajāpati entered the body.

original: sūryaś cakṣur vātaḥ prāṇaṃ puruṣasya vi bhejire /
analyzed: sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ vātaḥ prāṇam puruṣasya vi bhejire
translated: The sun took away the eye, the wind took away the breath of the man.

original: athāsyetaram ātmānaṃ devāḥ prāyachann agnaye ////
analyzed: atha asya itaram ātmānam devāḥ prāyacchan agnaye
translated: Then the gods gave him his other self to Agni.

original: tasmād vai vidvān puruṣam idaṃ brahmeti manyate /
analyzed: tasmāt vai vidvān puruṣam idam brahma iti manyate
translated: Therefore, indeed, the wise one considers the man thus: This is Brahman.

original: sarvā hy asmin devatā gāvo goṣṭha ivāsate ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ hi asmin devatāḥ gāvaḥ goṣṭhe iva āsate
translated: For in this (body) all the gods dwell, as cows in a cow-pen.

original: prathamena pramāreṇa tredhā viṣvaṅ vi gachati /
analyzed: prathamena pramāreṇa tredhā viṣvaṅ vi gacchati
translated: With the first stroke it goes forth in three directions.

original: ada ekena gachaty ada ekena gachatīhaikena ni ṣevate ////
analyzed: adaḥ ekena gacchati adaḥ ekena gacchati iha ekena ni sevate
translated: With one it goes away, with one it goes away, with one it settles here.

original: apsu stīmāsu vṛddhāsu śarīram antarā hitam /
analyzed: apsu stīmāsu vṛddhāsu śarīram antarā hitam
translated: In the waters, in the swelling waters, the body is placed in between.

original: tasmiṃ chavo 'dhy antarā tasmāc chavo 'dhy ucyate ////
analyzed: tasmin chavaḥ dhi antarā tasmāt śavaḥ dhi ucyate
translated: The corpse is placed in between it, therefore it is called 'in between the corpse'.

original: ye bāhavo yā iṣavo dhanvanāṃ vīryāṇi ca /
analyzed: ye bāhavaḥ yāḥ iṣavaḥ dhanvanām vīryāṇi ca
translated: The arms, the weapons, the powers of the archers,

original: asīn paraśūn āyudhaṃ cittākūtaṃ ca yad dhṛdi /
analyzed: asīn paraśūn āyudham citta ākūtam ca yat hṛdi
translated: the swords, axes, and weapons, and whatever is in the heart, the thoughts and intentions,

original: sarvaṃ tad arbude tvam amitrebhyo dṛśe kurūdārāṃś ca pra darśaya ////
analyzed: sarvam tat arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya
translated: all that, O Arbudi, make visible to us against our enemies, and show the powerful ones.

original: ut tiṣṭhata saṃ nahyadhvaṃ mitrā devajanā yūyam /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata sam nahyadhvam mitrāḥ deva janāḥ yūyam
translated: Rise up, O friends, the people of the gods, bind yourselves together.

original: saṃdṛṣṭā guptā vaḥ santu yā no mitrāṇy arbude ////
analyzed: saṃdṛṣṭāḥ guptāḥ vaḥ santu yā naḥ mitrāṇi arbude
translated: May your seen and unseen friends be protected by us, O Arbudi.

original: ut tiṣṭhatam ā rabhetām ādānasaṃdānābhyām /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhatam ā rabhetām ādāna saṃdānābhyām
translated: Rise up, seize with your seizing and binding.

original: amitrāṇāṃ senā abhi dhattam arbude ////
analyzed: amitrāṇām senāḥ abhi dhattam arbude
translated: Throw down the armies of the enemies, O Arbudi.

original: arbudir nāma yo deva īśānaś ca nyarbudiḥ /
analyzed: arbudiḥ nāma yaḥ devaḥ īśānaḥ ca nyarbudiḥ
translated: The god who is named Arbudi, and the lord Nyarbudi,

original: yābhyām antarikṣam āvṛtam iyaṃ ca pṛthivī mahī /
analyzed: yābhyām antarikṣam āvṛtam iyam ca pṛthivī mahī
translated: by whom the atmosphere and this great earth are surrounded,

original: tābhyām indramedibhyām ahaṃ jitam anv emi senayā ////
analyzed: tābhyām indra medibhyām aham jitam anu emi senayā
translated: With those two victorious armies I follow up the victory.

original: ut tiṣṭha tvaṃ devajanārbude senayā saha /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha tvam deva jana arbude senayā saha
translated: Rise up, you who are born of the people, O Nyagrodha, with your army.

original: bhañjann amitrāṇāṃ senāṃ bhogebhiḥ pari vāraya ////
analyzed: bhañjan amitrāṇām senām bhogebhiḥ pari vāraya
translated: Breaking the armies of the enemies, surround them with your coils.

original: sapta jātān nyarbuda udārāṇāṃ samīkṣayan /
analyzed: sapta jātān nyarbudaḥ udārāṇām samīkṣayan
translated: Looking upon the seven born Nyagrodhas, the excellent ones,

original: tebhiṣ ṭvam ājye hute sarvair ut tiṣṭha senayā ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ tvam ājye hute sarvaiḥ ud tiṣṭha senayā
translated: with all of them, rise up with your army, when the ghee is offered.

original: pratighnānāśrumukhī kṛdhukarṇī ca krośatu /
analyzed: ca krośatu
translated: Let her cry out, with tears on her face, her ears pricked up,

original: vikeśī puruṣe hate radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: vikeśī puruṣe hate radite arbude tava
translated: hair disheveled, when a man is killed, when your Nyagrodha is struck.

original: saṃkarṣantī karūkaraṃ manasā putram ichantī /
analyzed: saṃkarṣantī karūkaram manasā putram ichantī
translated: Striving, with her hands on her hips, longing for her son in her mind,

original: patiṃ bhrātaram āt svān radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: patim bhrātaram āt svān radite arbude tava
translated: for her husband, brother, and her own people, when your Nyagrodha is struck.

original: aliklavā jāṣkamadā gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ /
analyzed: aliklavāḥ jāṣkamadāḥ gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ
translated: Let the vultures, hawks, and birds of prey, with their beaks and talons,

original: dhvāṅkṣāḥ śakunayas tṛpyantv amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: dhvāṅkṣāḥ śakunayaḥ tṛpyantu amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava
translated: be satisfied, looking upon the enemies, when your Nyagrodha is struck.

original: atho sarvaṃ śvāpadaṃ makṣikā tṛpyatu krimiḥ /🔽pauruṣeye 'dhi kuṇape radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: atho sarvam śvāpadam makṣikā tṛpyatu krimiḥ  pauruṣeye dhi kuṇape radite arbude tava  /
translated: And let all the beasts, flies, worms be satisfied,🔽on the human corpse, when your Nyagrodha is struck.

original: ā gṛhṇītaṃ saṃ bṛhataṃ prāṇāpānān nyarbude /
analyzed: ā gṛhṇītam sam bṛhatam prāṇa apānān nyarbude
translated: Take hold of him, embrace him, O Nyagrodha, for the in-breath and out-breath,

original: nivāśā ghoṣāḥ saṃ yantv amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava ////🔽ud vepaya saṃ vijantāṃ bhiyāmitrānt saṃ sṛja /
analyzed: nivāśāḥ ghoṣāḥ sam yantu amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava  ud vepaya sam vijantām bhiyā amitrān sam sṛja
translated: Let the encampments of the enemy be destroyed, as you look on, O Arbudi, when you are enraged.🔽Shake them, scatter them in fear, unite the enemies.

original: urugrāhair bāhvaṅkair vidhyāmitrān nyarbude ////🔽muhyantv eṣāṃ bāhavaś cittākūtaṃ ca yad dhṛdi /
analyzed: uru grāhaiḥ bāhu aṅkaiḥ vidhya amitrān nyarbude  muhyantu eṣām bāhavaḥ citta ākūtam ca yat hṛdi
translated: Pierce the enemies with wide-reaching arms, O Nyarbudi.🔽Let their arms be confused, and whatever plan is in their hearts.

original: maiṣām uc cheṣi kiṃ cana radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: mā eṣām ud śeṣi kim cana radite arbude tava
translated: Let none of them remain, O Arbudi, when you are enraged.

original: pratighnānāḥ saṃ dhāvantūraḥ paṭaurāv āghnānāḥ /
analyzed: pratighnānāḥ sam paṭaurau āghnānāḥ
translated: Striking each other, running about, beating their breasts and arms,

original: aghāriṇīr vikeśyo rudatyaḥ puruṣe hate radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: aghāriṇīḥ vikeśyaḥ rudatyaḥ puruṣe hate radite arbude tava
translated: hair disheveled, weeping, when a man is killed, O Arbudi, when you are enraged.

original: śvanvatīr apsaraso rūpakā utārbude /
analyzed: śvanvatīḥ apsarasaḥ rūpakāḥ uta arbude
translated: The Apsarases with dogs, and the Rūpakas, O Arbudi,

original: antaḥpātre rerihatīṃ riśāṃ durṇihitaiṣiṇīm /
analyzed: antaḥpātre rerihatīm riśām durṇihita eṣiṇīm
translated: Licking in the inner vessel, seeking evil, the Rishis,

original: sarvās tā arbude tvam amitrebhyo dṛśe kurūdārāṃś ca pra darśaya ////🔽khaḍūre 'dhicaṅkramāṃ kharvikāṃ kharvavāsinīm /
analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya  khaḍūre dhicaṅkramām kharvikām kharva vāsinīm
translated: All of them, O Arbudi, make visible to us the enemies, and show us the generous ones.🔽On the gambling board, the one who moves about, the hunchback, the one who wears rags,

original: ya udārā antarhitā gandharvāpsarasaś ca ye /
analyzed: ye udārāḥ antarhitāḥ gandharva apsarasaḥ ca ye
translated: Those who are generous, those who are hidden, the Gandharvas and the Apsarases,

original: sarpā itarajanā rakṣāṃsi ////
analyzed: sarpāḥ itarajanāḥ rakṣāṃsi
translated: The serpents, the other people, the Rakshasas.

original: caturdaṃṣṭrāṃ chyāvadataḥ kumbhamuṣkāṃ asṛṅmukhān /
analyzed: catur daṃṣṭrām śyāva dataḥ kumbha muṣkām asṛj mukhān
translated: The four-tusked ones, the dark-toothed ones, the pot-thighed ones, the blood-faced ones,

original: svabhyasā ye codbhyasāḥ ////
analyzed: su abhyasāḥ ye ca udbhyasāḥ
translated: Those who are born from themselves and those who are born from others.

original: ud vepaya tvam arbude 'mitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ /
analyzed: ud vepaya tvam arbude mitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ
translated: O Arbudi, shake the hostile forces, the hostile arrows.

original: jayaṃś ca jiṣṇuś cāmitrāṃ jayatām indramedinau ////
analyzed: jayan ca jiṣṇuḥ ca amitrām jayatām indra medinau
translated: Jayanta and Jishnu, the conquerors of enemies, Indra and Medini, the victorious ones.

original: prablīno mṛditaḥ śayāṃ hato 'mitro nyarbude /
analyzed: prablīnaḥ mṛditaḥ śayām hataḥ mitraḥ nyarbude
translated: Crushed, defeated, lying down, killed is the enemy in the battle.

original: agnijihvā dhūmaśikhā jayantīr yantu senayā ////🔽tayārbude praṇuttānām indro hantu varaṃvaram /
analyzed: agni jihvāḥ dhūma śikhāḥ jayantīḥ yantu senayā  tayā arbude praṇuttānām indraḥ hantu varaṃvaram
translated: Let the flames of fire, with smoke-like crests, go forth with the army to conquer.🔽O Arbudi, let Indra, the lord of Shachi, strike down the best of the enemies who are driven away by you.

original: amitrāṇāṃ śacīpatir māmīṣāṃ moci kaś cana ////
analyzed: amitrāṇām śacīpatiḥ mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana
translated: Let no one be released from among these enemies.

original: ut kasantu hṛdayāny ūrdhvaḥ prāṇa ud īṣatu /
analyzed: ud kasantu hṛdayāni ūrdhvaḥ prāṇaḥ ud īṣatu
translated: Let their hearts burst open, let the upward breath rise up.

original: śauṣkāsyam anu vartatām amitrān mota mitriṇaḥ ////
analyzed: śauṣkāsyam anu vartatām amitrān mā uta mitriṇaḥ
translated: Let the dry-mouthed one follow the enemies, not the friends.

original: ye ca dhīrā ye cādhīrāḥ parāñco badhirāś ca ye /
analyzed: ye ca dhīrāḥ ye ca adhīrāḥ parāñcaḥ badhirāḥ ca ye
translated: Those who are wise and those who are unwise, those who are far away and those who are deaf,

original: tamasā ye ca tūparā atho bastābhivāsinaḥ /
analyzed: tamasāḥ ye ca tūparāḥ atho basta abhivāsinaḥ
translated: Those who are covered with darkness and those who are clothed in goatskins,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃ arbude tvam amitrebhyo dṛśe kurūdārāṃś ca pra darśaya ////
analyzed: sarvān tām arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya
translated: All of them, O Arbudi, make them visible to the enemies, and show the wicked ones.

original: arbudiś ca triṣandhiś cāmitrān no vi vidhyatām /
analyzed: arbudiḥ ca triṣandhiḥ ca amitrān naḥ vi vidhyatām
translated: Let Arbudi and Trisandhi pierce our enemies.

original: yathaiṣām indra vṛtrahan hanāma śacīpate 'mitrāṇāṃ sahasraśaḥ ////
analyzed: yathā eṣām indra vṛtrahan hanāma śacīpate mitrāṇām sahasraśas
translated: So that, O Indra, the slayer of Vritra, O lord of Shachi, we may slay the enemies by thousands.

original: vanaspatīn vānaspatyān oṣadhīr uta vīrudhaḥ /
analyzed: vanaspatīn vānaspatyān oṣadhīḥ uta vīrudhaḥ
translated: The trees, the forest trees, the herbs, and the creepers,

original: gandharvāpsarasaḥ sarpān devān puṇyajanān pitṝn /
analyzed: gandharva apsarasaḥ sarpān devān puṇyajanān pitṝn
translated: The Gandharvas and Apsarases, the serpents, the gods, the holy men, the fathers,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃ arbude tvam amitrebhyo dṛśe kurūdārāṃś ca pra darśaya ////
analyzed: sarvān tām arbude tvam amitrebhyaḥ dṛśe kuru udārān ca pra darśaya
translated: All of them, O Arbudi, do thou make visible to us against our enemies, and show us the rich and noble ones.

original: īśāṃ vo maruto deva ādityo brahmaṇaspatiḥ /
analyzed: īśām vaḥ marutaḥ devaḥ ādityaḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: The god Aditya, the lord of prayer, the Maruts, O ye,

original: īśāṃ va indraś cāgniś ca dhātā mitraḥ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: īśām vaḥ indraḥ ca agniḥ ca dhātā mitraḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: The lord is Indra and Agni, Dhatr, Mitra, Prajapati,

original: īśāṃ va ṛṣayaś cakrur amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava ////
analyzed: īśām vaḥ ṛṣayaḥ cakruḥ amitreṣu samīkṣayan radite arbude tava
translated: The lord is what the Rishis have made, looking upon the enemies. In the crushing of Arbudi, O ye,

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣām īśānā ut tiṣṭhata saṃ nahyadhvam /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām īśānāḥ ud tiṣṭhata sam nahyadhvam
translated: Of all of them, rise up, be ye harnessed,

original: mitrā devajanā yūyam imaṃ saṃgrāmaṃ saṃjitya yathālokaṃ vi tiṣṭhadhvam ////
analyzed: mitrāḥ deva janāḥ yūyam imam saṃgrāmam saṃjitya yathālokam vi tiṣṭhadhvam
translated: Ye gods, the people, having conquered this battle, stand ye in the world as it was.

original: ut tiṣṭhata saṃ nahyadhvam udārāḥ ketubhiḥ saha /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata sam nahyadhvam udārāḥ ketubhiḥ saha
translated: Rise up, be ye harnessed, with the high ones and the banners.

original: sarpā itarajanā rakṣāṃsy amitrān anu dhāvata ////
analyzed: sarpāḥ itarajanāḥ rakṣāṃsi amitrān anu dhāvata
translated: The serpents, the other people, the Rakshas, the enemies, follow.

original: īśāṃ vo veda rājyaṃ triṣandhe aruṇaiḥ ketubhiḥ saha /
analyzed: īśām vaḥ veda rājyam triṣandhe aruṇaiḥ ketubhiḥ saha
translated: The lord is your knowledge of the kingdom, with the three joints and the red banners.

original: ye antarikṣe ye divi pṛthivyāṃ ye ca mānavāḥ /
analyzed: ye antarikṣe ye divi pṛthivyām ye ca mānavāḥ
translated: Those in the sky, those in heaven, those on earth, and those among men,

original: triṣandhes te cetasi durṇāmāna upāsatām ////
analyzed: triṣandheḥ te cetasi durṇāmānaḥ upāsatām
translated: The three joints are in their mind. Let the ill-named ones attend upon them.

original: ayomukhāḥ sūcīmukhā atho vikaṅkatīmukhāḥ /
analyzed: ayaḥ mukhāḥ sūcī mukhāḥ atha u vikaṅkatī mukhāḥ
translated: Those with iron mouths, needle mouths, and those with mouths like vultures,

original: kravyādo vātaraṃhasa ā sajantv amitrān vajreṇa triṣandhinā ////
analyzed: kravya adaḥ vāta raṃhasaḥ ā sajantu amitrān vajreṇa triṣandhinā
translated: May the flesh-eaters, swift as the wind, attack the enemies with the thunderbolt of three joints.

original: antar dhehi jātaveda āditya kuṇapaṃ bahu /
analyzed: antar dhehi jātavedaḥ āditya kuṇapam bahu
translated: Go inside, O Jātavedas, O Āditya, the many corpses.

original: triṣandher iyaṃ senā suhitāstu me vaśe ////
analyzed: triṣandheḥ iyam senā su hitā astu me vaśe
translated: May this army of Triṣaṃdhi be well-disposed and under my control.

original: ut tiṣṭha tvaṃ devajanārbude senayā saha /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha tvam deva jana arbude senayā saha
translated: Rise up, you who are born of the gods, O Arbudi, with your army.

original: ayaṃ balir va āhutas triṣandher āhutiḥ priyā ////
analyzed: ayam baliḥ vaḥ āhutaḥ triṣandheḥ āhutiḥ priyā
translated: This is your offering, O Triṣaṃdhi, a dear oblation.

original: śitipadī saṃ dyatu śaravyeyaṃ catuṣpadī /
analyzed: śitipadī sam dyatu śaravyā iyam catuṣpadī
translated: May Śitipadī burn in the target, and this four-footed one.

original: kṛtye 'mitrebhyo bhava triṣandheḥ saha senayā ////
analyzed: kṛtye mitrebhyaḥ bhava triṣandheḥ saha senayā
translated: Be in the deed for the enemies, O Triṣaṃdhi, with your army.

original: dhūmākṣī saṃ patatu kṛdhukarṇī ca krośatu /
analyzed: dhūma akṣī sam patatu kṛdhu karṇī ca krośatu
translated: May Dhūmāksī fly up, and Kṛdhukarṇī cry out.

original: triṣandheḥ senayā jite aruṇāḥ santu ketavaḥ ////
analyzed: triṣandheḥ senayā jite aruṇāḥ santu ketavaḥ
translated: With the army of Triṣaṃdhi, may the banners be red.

original: avāyantāṃ pakṣiṇo ye vayāṃsy antarikṣe divi ye caranti /
analyzed: avāyantām pakṣiṇaḥ ye vayāṃsi antarikṣe divi ye caranti
translated: May the birds that fly in the sky and move in the heavens come down.

original: śvāpado makṣikāḥ saṃ rabhantām āmādo gṛdhrāḥ kuṇape radantām ////
analyzed: śvāpadaḥ makṣikāḥ sam rabhantām āmādaḥ gṛdhrāḥ kuṇape radantām
translated: May the beasts of prey and flies gather, and the raw-eating vultures peck at the corpse.

original: yām indreṇa saṃdhāṃ samadhatthā brahmaṇā ca bṛhaspate /
analyzed: yām indreṇa saṃdhām samadhatthāḥ brahmaṇā ca bṛhaspate
translated: The alliance that you made with Indra and with the Brahman, O Brihaspati,

original: tayāham indrasaṃdhayā sarvān devān iha huva ito jayata māmutaḥ ////
analyzed: tayā aham indra saṃdhayā sarvān devān iha huve itas jayata mā amutas
translated: With that Indra-junction I summon all the gods here. Conquer from here, from there, me.

original: bṛhaspatir āṅgirasa ṛṣayo brahmasaṃśitāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ ṛṣayaḥ brahma saṃśitāḥ
translated: Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, the sages purified by Brahman,

original: asurakṣayaṇaṃ vadhaṃ triṣandhiṃ divy āśrayan ////
analyzed: asura kṣayaṇam vadham triṣandhim divi āśrayan
translated: They placed in heaven the destruction of the asuras, the weapon with three joints, the killer.

original: yenāsau gupta āditya ubhāv indraś ca tiṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: yena asau guptaḥ ādityaḥ ubhau indraḥ ca tiṣṭhataḥ
translated: By which the sun is protected, and both Indra and Agni stand,

original: triṣandhiṃ devā abhajantaujase ca balāya ca ////
analyzed: triṣandhim devāḥ abhajanta ojase ca balāya ca
translated: The gods shared the weapon with three joints for strength and power.

original: sarvāṃl lokānt sam ajayan devā āhutyānayā /🔽bṛhaspatir āṅgiraso vajraṃ yam asiñcatāsurakṣayaṇaṃ vadham ////
analyzed: sarvān lokān sam ajayan devāḥ āhutyā anayā  bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ vajram yam asiñcata asura kṣayaṇam vadham
translated: The gods conquered all the worlds with this oblation.🔽Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, poured out the thunderbolt, the weapon that destroys the asuras.

original: bṛhaspatir āṅgiraso vajraṃ yam asiñcatāsurakṣayaṇaṃ vadham /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ vajram yam asiñcata asura kṣayaṇam vadham
translated: Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, poured out the thunderbolt, the weapon that destroys the asuras.

original: tenāham amūṃ senāṃ ni limpāmi bṛhaspate 'mitrān hanmy ojasā ////
analyzed: tena aham amūm senām ni limpāmi bṛhaspate mitrān hanmi ojasā
translated: With that, O Brihaspati, I smear that army, I slay the enemies with might.

original: sarve devā atyāyanti ye aśnanti vaṣaṭkṛtam /
analyzed: sarve devāḥ atyāyanti ye aśnanti vaṣaṭkṛtam
translated: All the gods who eat what is consecrated with Vashat come to this sacrifice.

original: imāṃ juṣadhvam āhutim ito jayata māmutaḥ ////
analyzed: imām juṣadhvam āhutim itas jayata mā amutas
translated: Accept this oblation, conquer from here, from there, me.

original: sarve devā atyāyantu triṣandher āhutiḥ priyā /
analyzed: sarve devāḥ atyāyantu triṣandheḥ āhutiḥ priyā
translated: Let all the gods come, the offering dear to the three-jointed one.

original: saṃdhāṃ mahatīṃ rakṣata yayāgre asurā jitāḥ ////
analyzed: saṃdhām mahatīm rakṣata yayā agre asurāḥ jitāḥ
translated: Protect the great union by which the asuras were conquered first.

original: vāyur amitrāṇām iṣvagrāṇy āñcatu /🔽indra eṣāṃ bāhūn prati bhanaktu mā śakan pratidhām iṣum /
analyzed: vāyuḥ amitrāṇām iṣu agrāṇi āñcatu  indraḥ eṣām bāhūn prati bhanaktu mā śakan pratidhām iṣum
translated: May Vayu bend the sharpest arrows of the enemies.🔽May Indra shatter their arms, may they not be able to hold back the arrow.

original: āditya eṣām astraṃ vi nāśayatu candramā yutām agatasya panthām ////
analyzed: ādityaḥ eṣām astram vi nāśayatu candramāḥ yutām a gatasya panthām
translated: May the sun destroy their weapons, may the moon show the path to the defeated.

original: yadi preyur devapurā brahma varmāṇi cakrire /
analyzed: yadi preyuḥ deva purā brahma varmāṇi cakrire
translated: If they have gone to the cities of the gods and made Brahma their armor,

original: tanūpānaṃ paripāṇaṃ kṛṇvānā yad upocire sarvaṃ tad arasaṃ kṛdhi ////
analyzed: tanū pānam paripāṇam kṛṇvānāḥ yat upocire sarvam tat arasam kṛdhi
translated: when they have made a covering for the body and protection, whatever they have said, make all that ineffective.

original: kravyādānuvartayan mṛtyunā ca purohitam /🔽triṣandhe prehi senayā jayāmitrān pra padyasva ////
analyzed: kravyādā anuvartayan mṛtyunā ca purohitam  triṣandhe prehi senayā jaya amitrān pra padyasva
translated: Following the flesh-eaters, with death as their priest,🔽O Trisandhi, go with your army, conquer the enemies, advance against them.

original: triṣandhe tamasā tvam amitrān pari vāraya /
analyzed: triṣandhe tamasā tvam amitrān pari vāraya
translated: O Trisandhi, with darkness surround the enemies on all sides.

original: pṛṣadājyapraṇuttānāṃ māmīṣāṃ moci kaś cana ////
analyzed: pṛṣadājya praṇuttānām mā amīṣām moci kaḥ cana
translated: Of those driven away by the speckled ghee, let none escape.

original: śitipadī saṃ patatv amitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ /🔽muhyantv adyāmūḥ senā amitrāṇāṃ nyarbude ////
analyzed: śitipadī sam patatu amitrāṇām amūḥ sicaḥ  muhyantu adya amūḥ senāḥ amitrāṇām nyarbude
translated: Let the speckled one fall upon the troops of the enemies.🔽Let the troops of the enemies be confused today, O Nyarbuda.

original: mūḍhā amitrā nyarbude jahy eṣāṃ varaṃvaram /
analyzed: mūḍhāḥ amitrāḥ nyarbude jahi eṣām varaṃvaram
translated: Confuse the enemies, O Nyarbuda, kill their best,

original: anayā jahi senayā ////
analyzed: anayā jahi senayā
translated: with this army.

original: yaś ca kavacī yaś cākavaco 'mitro yaś cājmani /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kavacī yaḥ ca akavacaḥ mitraḥ yaḥ ca ajmani
translated: Whether the enemy has armor or not, whether on the battlefield,

original: jyāpāśaiḥ kavacapāśair ajmanābhihataḥ śayām ////
analyzed: jyā pāśaiḥ kavaca pāśaiḥ ajmanā abhihataḥ śayām
translated: I shall lie down struck down by the bow-strings and the armor-strings and the navel-strings of the chariot.

original: ye varmiṇo ye 'varmāṇo amitrā ye ca varmiṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye varmiṇaḥ ye varmāṇaḥ amitrāḥ ye ca varmiṇaḥ
translated: Those enemies who are armored and those who are unarmored, and those who are armored,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃ arbude hatāṃ chvāno 'dantu bhūmyām ////
analyzed: sarvān tām arbude hatām śvānaḥ dantu bhūmyām
translated: May all of them be slain by Arvuda, and may the dogs devour them on the ground.

original: ye rathino ye arathā asādā ye ca sādinaḥ /
analyzed: ye rathinaḥ ye a rathāḥ a sādāḥ ye ca sādinaḥ
translated: Those who are charioteers and those who are without chariots, those who are seated and those who are mounted,

original: sarvān adantu tān hatān gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvān adantu tān hatān gṛdhrāḥ śyenāḥ patatriṇaḥ
translated: May the vultures, hawks, and birds devour all of them when they are slain.

original: sahasrakuṇapā śetām āmitrī senā samare vadhānām /
analyzed: sahasra kuṇapā śetām āmitrī senā samare vadhānām
translated: May the enemy army lie down with a thousand wounds in battle, to be slaughtered.

original: vividdhā kakajākṛtā ////
analyzed: vividdhā kakajākṛtā
translated: Pierced, with its joints broken.

original: marmāvidhaṃ roruvataṃ suparṇair adantu duścitaṃ mṛditaṃ śayānam /
analyzed: marmāvidham roruvatam suparṇaiḥ adantu duścitam mṛditam śayānam
translated: May the vultures devour the one who is wounded in the vital organs, who is crying out, who is badly wounded, lying down,

original: ya imāṃ pratīcīm āhutim amitro no yuyutsati ////
analyzed: yaḥ imām pratīcīm āhutim amitraḥ naḥ yuyutsati
translated: The enemy who fights against us to the west.

original: yāṃ devā anutiṣṭhanti yasyā nāsti virādhanam /
analyzed: yām devāḥ anutiṣṭhanti yasyāḥ na asti virādhanam
translated: The one whom the gods follow, whom no one can resist,

original: tayendro hantu vṛtrahā vajreṇa triṣandhinā ////
analyzed: tayā indraḥ hantu vṛtrahā vajreṇa triṣandhinā
translated: May Indra, the slayer of Vṛtra, slay him with his three-jointed thunderbolt.

original: satyaṃ bṛhad ṛtam ugraṃ dīkṣā tapo brahma yajñaḥ pṛthivīṃ dhārayanti /
analyzed: satyam bṛhat ṛtam ugram dīkṣā tapaḥ brahma yajñaḥ pṛthivīm dhārayanti
translated: Truth, the great, the eternal, the fierce, the initiation, the austerity, the Brahman, the sacrifice, these sustain the earth.

original: sā no bhūtasya bhavyasya patny uruṃ lokaṃ pṛthivī naḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya patnī urum lokam pṛthivī naḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May she, the wife of the past and the future, may the earth make a wide world for us.

original: asaṃbādhaṃ madhyato mānavānāṃ yasyā udvataḥ pravataḥ samaṃ bahu /
analyzed: asaṃbādham madhyatas mānavānām yasyāḥ udvataḥ pravataḥ samam bahu
translated: Whose middle is unobstructed for men, whose high and low places are many,

original: nānāvīryā oṣadhīr yā bibharti pṛthivī naḥ prathatāṃ rādhyatāṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: nānā vīryāḥ oṣadhīḥ yā bibharti pṛthivī naḥ prathatām rādhyatām naḥ
translated: Which bears various herbs, may the earth extend for us and be favorable to us.

original: yasyāṃ samudra uta sindhur āpo yasyām annaṃ kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yasyām samudraḥ uta sindhuḥ āpaḥ yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ
translated: In whom the ocean, the rivers, and the waters, in whom food and cultivated fields have come into being,

original: yasyām idaṃ jinvati prāṇad ejat sā no bhūmiḥ pūrvapeye dadhātu ////
analyzed: yasyām idam jinvati prāṇat ejat sā naḥ bhūmiḥ pūrvapeye dadhātu
translated: In whom this moving and living world is active, may that earth grant us the first drink.

original: yasyāś catasraḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyā yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ yasyām annam kṛṣṭayaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ
translated: In whom are the four quarters of the earth, in whom food and cultivated fields have come into being,

original: yā bibharti bahudhā prāṇad ejat sā no bhūmir goṣv apy anne dadhātu ////
analyzed: yā bibharti bahudhā prāṇat ejat sā naḥ bhūmiḥ goṣu api anne dadhātu
translated: Which bears in many ways the moving and living world, may that earth grant us cattle and food.

original: yasyāṃ pūrve pūrvajanā vicakrire yasyāṃ devā asurān abhyavartayan /
analyzed: yasyām pūrve pūrva janāḥ vicakrire yasyām devāḥ asurān abhyavartayan
translated: In whom the ancient peoples of old have moved about, in whom the gods have prevailed over the Asuras,

original: gavām aśvānāṃ vayasaś ca viṣṭhā bhagaṃ varcaḥ pṛthivī no dadhātu ////
analyzed: gavām aśvānām vayasaḥ ca viṣṭhā bhagam varcaḥ pṛthivī naḥ dadhātu
translated: In whom are the abodes of cows, horses, and birds, may the earth grant us fortune and splendor.

original: viśvaṃbharā vasudhānī pratiṣṭhā hiraṇyavakṣā jagato niveśanī /
analyzed: viśvaṃbharāḥ vasu dhānī pratiṣṭhā hiraṇya vakṣāḥ jagataḥ niveśanī
translated: The supporter of all, the bestower of wealth, the foundation, with golden breasts, the abode of the world,

original: vaiśvānaraṃ bibhratī bhūmir agnim indraṛṣabhā draviṇe no dadhātu ////
analyzed: vaiśvānaram bibhratī bhūmiḥ agnim indra ṛṣabhā draviṇe naḥ dadhātu
translated: May the earth, bearing the fire Vaisvānara, grant us Indra and bulls in wealth.

original: yāṃ rakṣanty asvapnā viśvadānīṃ devā bhūmiṃ pṛthivīm apramādam /
analyzed: yām rakṣanti asvapnāḥ viśvadānīm devāḥ bhūmim pṛthivīm apramādam
translated: Whom the gods, the sleepless ones, always protect, the earth, the ground, without negligence,

original: sā no madhu priyaṃ duhām atho ukṣatu varcasā ////🔽yārṇave 'dhi salilam agra āsīt yāṃ māyābhir anvacaran manīṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: sā naḥ madhu priyam duhām atha u ukṣatu varcasā  yā arṇave dhi salilam agre āsīt yām māyābhiḥ anvacaran manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: May she yield us honey that is dear, and may she sprinkle us with radiance.🔽She who was in the ocean above the waters in the beginning, whom the wise ones followed with their illusions,

original: yasyā hṛdayaṃ parame vyomant satyenāvṛtam amṛtaṃ pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ hṛdayam parame vyoman satyena āvṛtam amṛtam pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Whose heart is in the highest sky, covered with truth, the immortal of the earth,

original: sā no bhūmis tviṣiṃ balaṃ rāṣṭre dadhātūttame ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ tviṣim balam rāṣṭre dadhātu uttame
translated: May that earth grant us splendor and strength in the highest kingdom.

original: yasyām āpaḥ paricarāḥ samānīr ahorātre apramādaṃ kṣaranti /
analyzed: yasyām āpaḥ paricarāḥ samānīḥ ahorātre apramādam kṣaranti
translated: In whom the waters flow together, day and night flow without negligence,

original: sā no bhūmir bhūridhārā payo duhām atho ukṣatu varcasā ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ bhūri dhārā payaḥ duhām atha u ukṣatu varcasā
translated: May that earth, with many streams, yield milk for us, and may she sprinkle us with radiance.

original: yām aśvināv amimātāṃ viṣṇur yasyāṃ vicakrame /
analyzed: yām aśvinau amimātām viṣṇuḥ yasyām vicakrame
translated: In whom the Ashvins have measured, in whom Vishnu has moved about,

original: indro yāṃ cakra ātmane 'namitrāṃ śacīpatiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ yām cakre ātmane namitrām śacīpatiḥ
translated: In whom Indra, the lord of Shachi, has made for himself a realm without enemies,

original: sā no bhūmir vi sṛjatāṃ mātā putrāya me payaḥ ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ vi sṛjatām mātā putrāya me payaḥ
translated: May that earth grant me, as a mother to her son, milk.

original: girayas te parvatā himavanto 'raṇyaṃ te pṛthivi syonam astu /
analyzed: girayaḥ te parvatāḥ himavantaḥ raṇyam te pṛthivi syonam astu
translated: Your mountains are the snow-covered mountains, O earth, may your forest be a pleasant resting place for us.

original: babhruṃ kṛṣṇāṃ rohiṇīṃ viśvarūpāṃ dhruvāṃ bhūmiṃ pṛthivīm indraguptām /
analyzed: babhrum kṛṣṇām rohiṇīm viśva rūpām dhruvām bhūmim pṛthivīm indra guptām
translated: The tawny, the black, the reddish, the multi-colored, the firm earth, the earth, protected by Indra,

original: ajīto 'hato akṣato 'dhy aṣṭhām pṛthivīm aham ////
analyzed: a jītaḥ hataḥ a kṣataḥ dhi aṣṭhām pṛthivīm aham
translated: I have conquered, I have not been conquered, I have not been injured, I have stood upon the earth.

original: yat te madhyaṃ pṛthivi yac ca nabhyaṃ yās ta ūrjas tanvaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: yat te madhyam pṛthivi yat ca nabhyam yāḥ te ūrjaḥ tanvaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ
translated: Whatever is your middle, O earth, and your navel, and whatever are your vital forces that have come together,

original: tāsu no dhehy abhi naḥ pavasva mātā bhūmiḥ putro ahaṃ pṛthivyāḥ parjanyaḥ pitā sa u naḥ pipartu ////
analyzed: tāsu naḥ dhehi abhi naḥ pavasva mātā bhūmiḥ putraḥ aham pṛthivyāḥ parjanyaḥ pitā saḥ u naḥ pipartu
translated: In them place us, purify us, O mother earth, I am the son of the earth, Parjanya is the father, may he protect us.

original: yasyāṃ vediṃ parigṛhṇanti bhūmyāṃ yasyāṃ yajñaṃ tanvate viśvakarmāṇaḥ /
analyzed: yasyām vedim parigṛhṇanti bhūmyām yasyām yajñam tanvate viśva karmāṇaḥ
translated: In whom they encompass the altar, in whom the all-creating ones spread the sacrifice,

original: yasyāṃ mīyante svaravaḥ pṛthivyām ūrdhvāḥ śukrā āhutyāḥ purastāt /
analyzed: yasyām mīyante svaravaḥ pṛthivyām ūrdhvāḥ śukrāḥ āhutyāḥ purastāt
translated: In whom the sacrificial posts are set up on the earth, the upright bright ones in front of the oblation,

original: sā no bhūmir vardhayad vardhamānā ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ vardhayat vardhamānā
translated: May that earth increase us as we increase.

original: yo no dveṣat pṛthivi yaḥ pṛtanyād yo 'bhidāsān manasā yo vadhena /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dveṣat pṛthivi yaḥ pṛtanyāt yaḥ bhidāsāt manasā yaḥ vadhena
translated: O earth, whoever hates us, whoever is hostile to us, whoever assails us in thought or with violence,

original: taṃ no bhūme randhaya pūrvakṛtvari ////
analyzed: tam naḥ bhūme randhaya pūrva kṛtvari
translated: O earth, who hast done this before, deliver him up to us.

original: tvaj jātās tvayi caranti martyās tvaṃ bibharṣi dvipadas tvaṃ catuṣpadaḥ /
analyzed: tvat jātāḥ tvayi caranti martyāḥ tvam bibharṣi dvipadaḥ tvam catuṣpadaḥ
translated: Mortals are born from you, O earth, and move in you; you support the two-footed and the four-footed.

original: taveme pṛthivi pañca mānavā yebhyo jyotir amṛtaṃ martyebhya udyant sūryo raśmibhir ātanoti ////
analyzed: tava ime pṛthivi pañca mānavāḥ yebhyaḥ jyotiḥ amṛtam martyebhyaḥ udyan sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ ātanoti
translated: These five human beings here on earth, to whom the sun, rising with light and immortality to mortals, extends with its rays,

original: tā naḥ prajāḥ saṃ duhratāṃ samagrā vāco madhu pṛthivi dhehi mahyam ////
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ prajāḥ sam duhratām samagrāḥ vācaḥ madhu pṛthivi dhehi mahyam
translated: May all those creatures yield milk for us, O Earth, grant me sweet words.

original: viśvasvaṃ mātaram oṣadhīnāṃ dhruvāṃ bhūmiṃ pṛthivīṃ dharmaṇā dhṛtām /
analyzed: viśvasvam mātaram oṣadhīnām dhruvām bhūmim pṛthivīm dharmaṇā dhṛtām
translated: The all-sustaining mother of the plants, the firm earth, the earth supported by law,

original: śivāṃ syonām anu carema viśvahā ////
analyzed: śivām syonām anu carema viśvahā
translated: May we always follow her, auspicious and kind.

original: mahat sadhasthaṃ mahatī babhūvitha mahān vega ejathur vepathuṣ ṭe /
analyzed: mahat sadhastham mahatī babhūvitha mahān vegaḥ ejathuḥ vepathuḥ te
translated: You have become great in the great abode, your great force moves with trembling.

original: mahāṃs tvendro rakṣaty apramādam /
analyzed: mahān tvā indraḥ rakṣati apramādam
translated: Great Indra protects you from negligence.

original: sā no bhūme pra rocaya hiraṇyasyeva saṃdṛśi mā no dvikṣata kaś cana ////🔽agnir bhūmyām oṣadhīṣv agnim āpo bibhraty agnir aśmasu /
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūme pra rocaya hiraṇyasya iva saṃdṛśi mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana  agniḥ bhūmyām oṣadhīṣu agnim āpaḥ bibhrati agniḥ aśmasu
translated: O Earth, shine for us, as if in the sight of gold. Let no one hate us.🔽Agni is in the earth, in the plants, the waters bear Agni, Agni is in the stones.

original: agnir antaḥ puruṣeṣu goṣv aśveṣv agnayaḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ antar puruṣeṣu goṣu aśveṣu agnayaḥ
translated: Agni is within men, in cows and horses.

original: agnir diva ā tapaty agner devasyorv antarikṣam /🔽agniṃ martāsa indhate havyavāhaṃ ghṛtapriyam ////
analyzed: agniḥ divaḥ ā tapati agneḥ devasya uru antarikṣam  agnim martāsaḥ indhate havyavāham ghṛta priyam
translated: Agni heats in the sky, the atmosphere is of the god Agni.🔽Mortals kindle Agni, the bearer of oblations, dear to ghee.

original: agnivāsāḥ pṛthivy asitajñūs tviṣīmantaṃ saṃśitaṃ mā kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: agni vāsāḥ pṛthivī asitajñūḥ tviṣīmantam saṃśitam mā kṛṇotu
translated: May Agni, clothed in the earth, with black buttocks, make me sharp and bright.

original: bhūmyāṃ devebhyo dadati yajñaṃ havyam araṃkṛtam /
analyzed: bhūmyām devebhyaḥ dadati yajñam havyam araṃkṛtam
translated: On the earth they offer the sacrifice to the gods, the oblation made ready.

original: bhūmyāṃ manuṣyā jīvanti svadhayānnena martyāḥ /
analyzed: bhūmyām manuṣyāḥ jīvanti svadhayā annena martyāḥ
translated: Men on earth live by their own food, mortals.

original: sā no bhūmiḥ prāṇam āyur dadhātu jaradaṣṭiṃ mā pṛthivī kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ prāṇam āyuḥ dadhātu jaradaṣṭim mā pṛthivī kṛṇotu
translated: May that earth grant us breath and life, may the earth make our vision enduring.

original: yas te gandhaḥ pṛthivi saṃbabhūva yaṃ bibhraty oṣadhayo yam āpaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te gandhaḥ pṛthivi saṃbabhūva yam bibhrati oṣadhayaḥ yam āpaḥ
translated: The fragrance that is in you, O earth, that which the plants bear, that which the waters,

original: yaṃ gandharvā apsarasaś ca bhejire tena mā surabhiṃ kṛṇu mā no dvikṣata kaś cana ////
analyzed: yam gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ca bhejire tena mā surabhim kṛṇu mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana
translated: that which the Gandharvas and the Apsarases enjoy, by that make me fragrant. Let no one hate us.

original: yas te gandhaḥ puṣkaram āviveśa yaṃ saṃjabhruḥ sūryāyā vivāhe /
analyzed: yaḥ te gandhaḥ puṣkaram āviveśa yam saṃjabhruḥ sūryāyāḥ vivāhe
translated: The fragrance that has entered your lotus, which they wove together at the wedding of Sūryā,

original: amartyāḥ pṛthivi gandham agre tena mā surabhiṃ kṛṇu mā no dvikṣata kaś cana ////
analyzed: amartyāḥ pṛthivi gandham agre tena mā surabhim kṛṇu mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana
translated: the fragrance, O immortal earth, in the beginning, by that make me fragrant. Let no one hate us.

original: yas te gandhaḥ puruṣeṣu strīṣu puṃsu bhago ruciḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te gandhaḥ puruṣeṣu strīṣu puṃsu bhagaḥ ruciḥ
translated: The fragrance that is in you, O earth, in men, in women, in men, in good fortune, in love,

original: yo aśveṣu vīreṣu yo mṛgeṣūta hastiṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ aśveṣu vīreṣu yaḥ mṛgeṣu uta hastiṣu
translated: that which is in horses, in heroes, that which is in deer, in elephants,

original: kanyāyāṃ varco yad bhūme tenāsmāṃ api saṃ sṛja mā no dvikṣata kaś cana ////
analyzed: kanyāyām varcaḥ yat bhūme tena asmān api sam sṛja mā naḥ dvikṣata kaḥ cana
translated: the splendor that is in a maiden, O earth, by that unite us also. Let no one hate us.

original: śilā bhūmir aśmā pāṃsuḥ sā bhūmiḥ saṃdhṛtā dhṛtā /
analyzed: śilā bhūmiḥ aśmā pāṃsuḥ sā bhūmiḥ saṃdhṛtā dhṛtā
translated: The rock is earth, the stone is dust, that is earth, supported, held.

original: tasyai hiraṇyavakṣase pṛthivyā akaraṃ namaḥ ////
analyzed: tasyai hiraṇya vakṣase pṛthivyai akaram namaḥ
translated: To her, whose breasts are of gold, I have made obeisance, O earth.

original: yasyāṃ vṛkṣā vānaspatyā dhruvās tiṣṭhanti viśvahā /
analyzed: yasyām vṛkṣāḥ vānaspatyāḥ dhruvāḥ tiṣṭhanti viśvahā
translated: In whom stand firm the trees, the plants, for ever,

original: pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ dhṛtām achāvadāmasi ////
analyzed: pṛthivīm viśva dhāyasam dhṛtām achāvadāmasi
translated: the earth that supports all, we address.

original: udīrāṇā utāsīnās tiṣṭhantaḥ prakrāmantaḥ /
analyzed: udīrāṇāḥ uta āsīnāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ prakrāmantaḥ
translated: Rising, sitting, standing, walking,

original: padbhyāṃ dakṣiṇasavyābhyāṃ mā vyathiṣmahi bhūmyām ////
analyzed: padbhyām dakṣiṇa savyābhyām mā vyathiṣmahi bhūmyām
translated: with our right and left feet, may we not suffer harm on earth.

original: vimṛgvarīṃ pṛthivīm ā vadāmi kṣamāṃ bhūmiṃ brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānām /
analyzed: vimṛgvarīm pṛthivīm ā vadāmi kṣamām bhūmim brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānām
translated: I address the earth, the one who wanders not, the forgiving earth, who grows by the holy power.

original: ūrjaṃ puṣṭaṃ bibhratīm annabhāgaṃ ghṛtaṃ tvābhi ni ṣīdema bhūme ////🔽śuddhā na āpas tanve kṣarantu yo naḥ sedur apriye taṃ ni dadhmaḥ /
analyzed: ūrjam puṣṭam bibhratīm anna bhāgam ghṛtam tvā abhi ni sīdema bhūme  śuddhāḥ naḥ āpaḥ tanve kṣarantu yaḥ naḥ seduḥ apriye tam ni dadhmaḥ
translated: Bearing strength, nourishment, a share of food, O earth, we sit down upon you, with ghee.🔽Let the pure waters flow over my body. We place him who has injured us in what displeases us.

original: pavitreṇa pṛthivi mot punāmi ////
analyzed: pavitreṇa pṛthivi mā ud punāmi
translated: I do not purify you with the purifying filter, O earth.

original: yās te prācīḥ pradiśo yā udīcīr yās te bhūme adharād yāś ca paścāt /
analyzed: yāḥ te prācīḥ pradiśaḥ yāḥ udīcīḥ yāḥ te bhūme adharāt yāḥ ca paścāt
translated: Your eastern and northern directions, O earth, those below and those behind,

original: syonās tā mahyaṃ carate bhavantu mā ni paptaṃ bhuvane śiśriyāṇaḥ ////
analyzed: syonāḥ tāḥ mahyam carate bhavantu mā ni paptam bhuvane śiśriyāṇaḥ
translated: may they be kind to me as I move along. May I not fall, slipping in the world.

original: mā naḥ paścān mā purastān nudiṣṭhā mottarād adharād uta /
analyzed: mā naḥ paścāt mā purastāt nudiṣṭhāḥ mā uttarāt adharāt uta
translated: Do not drive us away from behind, from the front, from above, or from below.

original: svasti bhūme no bhava mā vidan paripanthino varīyo yāvayā vadham ////
analyzed: svasti bhūme naḥ bhava mā vidan paripanthinaḥ varīyaḥ yāvaya vadham
translated: Be auspicious to us, O earth, let not the enemies find a way past you. Drive away the weapon.

original: yāvat te 'bhi vipaśyāmi bhūme sūryeṇa medinā /
analyzed: yāvat te bhi vipaśyāmi bhūme sūryeṇa medinā
translated: As far as I can see with the sun as my eye, O Earth,

original: tāvan me cakṣur mā meṣṭottarāmuttarāṃ samām ////
analyzed: tāvat me cakṣuḥ mā meṣṭa uttarām uttarām samām
translated: may my sight be unimpaired, may it be better and better for me year after year.

original: yac chayānaḥ paryāvarte dakṣiṇaṃ sakhyam abhi bhūme pārśvam uttānās tvā pratīcīṃ yat pṛṣṭībhir adhiśemahe /
analyzed: yat śayānaḥ paryāvarte dakṣiṇam sakhyam abhi bhūme pārśvam uttānāḥ tvā pratīcīm yat pṛṣṭībhiḥ adhiśemahe
