translated: When I turn on my right side while lying down, O Earth, may I not injure that part of yours which is above. When we lie down on our backs, facing you, with our limbs stretched out,

original: mā hiṃsīs tatra no bhūme sarvasya pratiśīvari ////
analyzed: mā hiṃsīḥ tatra naḥ bhūme sarvasya pratiśīvari
translated: do not injure us there, O Earth, for the sake of all who sleep.

original: yat te bhūme vikhanāmi kṣipraṃ tad api rohatu /
analyzed: yat te bhūme vikhanāmi kṣipram tat api rohatu
translated: Whatever I dig out of you, O Earth, may it grow up quickly again.

original: mā te marma vimṛgvari mā te hṛdayam arpipam ////
analyzed: mā te marma vimṛgvari mā te hṛdayam arpipam
translated: Do not injure my vital parts, O Earth, do not pierce my heart.

original: grīṣmas te bhūme varṣāṇi śarad dhemantaḥ śiśiro vasantaḥ /
analyzed: grīṣmaḥ te bhūme varṣāṇi śarad hemantaḥ śiśiraḥ vasantaḥ
translated: Your summer, O Earth, your rainy season, your autumn, your winter, your cold season, your spring,

original: ṛtavas te vihitā hāyanīr ahorātre pṛthivi no duhātām ////
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ te vihitāḥ hāyanīḥ ahorātre pṛthivi naḥ duhātām
translated: may the seasons be arranged for you. May the day and night, O Earth, yield for us.

original: yāpa sarpaṃ vijamānā vimṛgvarī yasyām āsann agnayo ye apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: yā apa sarpam vijamānā vimṛgvarī yasyām āsan agnayaḥ ye apsu antar
translated: The creeping, moving, and wandering one, in whom the fires are placed which are in the waters,

original: parā dasyūn dadatī devapīyūn indraṃ vṛṇānā pṛthivī na vṛtram śakrāya dadhre vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe ////🔽yasyāṃ sadohavirdhāne yūpo yasyāṃ nimīyate /
analyzed: parā dasyūn dadatī deva pīyūn indram vṛṇānā pṛthivī na vṛtram śakrāya dadhre vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe 🔽yasyām sadaḥ havirdhāne yūpaḥ yasyām nimīyate
translated: giving away the Dasyus, the drinkers of the gods' libations, the Earth chose Indra, not Vṛtra, for the powerful, strong bull.

original: brahmāṇo yasyām arcanty ṛgbhiḥ sāmnā yajurvidaḥ yujyante yasyām ṛtvijaḥ somam indrāya pātave ////
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ yasyām arcanti ṛgbhiḥ sāmnā yajuḥ vidaḥ yujyante yasyām ṛtvijaḥ somam indrāya pātave
translated: In whom the priests are engaged, the Soma for Indra to drink,

original: yasyāṃ pūrve bhūtakṛta ṛṣayo gā udānṛcuḥ /
analyzed: yasyām pūrve bhūta kṛtaḥ ṛṣayaḥ gāḥ udānṛcuḥ
translated: In whom the Rishis of old, the creators of beings, sang the cows with the Sattr (sacrifice),

original: sapta satreṇa vedhaso yajñena tapasā saha ////
analyzed: sapta satreṇa vedhasaḥ yajñena tapasā saha
translated: The seven sages with the Sattra, with the sacrifice, with austerity, together,

original: sā no bhūmir ā diśatu yad dhanaṃ kāmayāmahe /
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ ā diśatu yat dhanam kāmayāmahe
translated: May that Earth grant us what wealth we desire.

original: bhago anuprayuṅktām indra etu purogavaḥ ////
analyzed: bhagaḥ anuprayuṅktām indraḥ etu purogavaḥ
translated: May Bhaga be our ally, may Indra go in front.

original: yasyāṃ gāyanti nṛtyanti bhūmyāṃ martyā vyailabāḥ /
analyzed: yasyām gāyanti nṛtyanti bhūmyām martyāḥ vyailabāḥ
translated: In whom mortals, the Ail-people, sing and dance,

original: yudhyante yasyām ākrando yasyām vadati dundubhiḥ /
analyzed: yudhyante yasyām ākrandaḥ yasyām vadati dundubhiḥ
translated: In whom they fight, in whom the cry is raised, in whom the drum speaks,

original: sā no bhūmiḥ pra ṇudatāṃ sapatnān asapatnaṃ mā pṛthivī kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: sā naḥ bhūmiḥ pra nudatām sapatnān asapatnam mā pṛthivī kṛṇotu
translated: May that Earth drive away our enemies. May the Earth make me free from enemies.

original: yasyām annaṃ vrīhiyavau yasyā imāḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: yasyām annam vrīhi yavau yasyāḥ imāḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: In whom food, rice and barley, in whom these five cultivated (lands),

original: bhūmyai parjanyapatnyai namo 'stu varṣamedase ////
analyzed: bhūmyai parjanya patnyai namaḥ stu varṣa medase
translated: Homage to Earth, the wife of Parjanya, to her who gives rain and fatness.

original: yasyāḥ puro devakṛtāḥ kṣetre yasyā vikurvate /
analyzed: yasyāḥ puraḥ deva kṛtāḥ kṣetre yasyāḥ vikurvate
translated: In whose front part the regions made by the gods, in whom they change,

original: prajāpatiḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvagarbhām āśāmāśāṃ raṇyāṃ naḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ pṛthivīm viśva garbhām āśām āśām raṇyām naḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Prajapati make for us the Earth, the womb of all, in every region delightful.

original: nidhiṃ bibhratī bahudhā guhā vasu maṇiṃ hiraṇyaṃ pṛthivī dadātu me /
analyzed: nidhim bibhratī bahudhā guhā vasu maṇim hiraṇyam pṛthivī dadātu me
translated: May the earth, bearing many treasures in her womb, give me the gem, the gold.

original: vasūni no vasudā rāsamānā devī dadhātu sumanasyamānā ////
analyzed: vasūni naḥ vasu dāḥ devī dadhātu sumanasyamānā
translated: May the goddess, bestowing wealth on us, grant us treasures, well-disposed.

original: janaṃ bibhratī bahudhā vivācasaṃ nānādharmāṇaṃ pṛthivī yathaukasam /
analyzed: janam bibhratī bahudhā vivācasam nānā dharmāṇam pṛthivī yathaukasam
translated: Bearing many peoples of different speech, the earth, as their common abode, those of various laws.

original: sahasraṃ dhārā draviṇasya me duhāṃ dhruveva dhenur anapasphurantī ////
analyzed: sahasram dhārāḥ draviṇasya me duhām dhruvā iva dhenuḥ an apasphurantī
translated: May she yield for me a thousand streams of wealth, like a firm cow, never failing.

original: yas te sarpo vṛścikas tṛṣṭadaṃśmā hemantajabdho bhṛmalo guhā śaye /
analyzed: yaḥ te sarpaḥ vṛścikaḥ tṛṣṭa daṃśmā hemanta jabdhaḥ bhṛmalaḥ guhā śaye
translated: The serpent, the scorpion, the stinging insect, that lies concealed, bound by the winter, in the hole,

original: krimir jinvat pṛthivi yadyad ejati prāvṛṣi tan naḥ sarpan mopa sṛpad yac chivaṃ tena no mṛḍa ////
analyzed: krimiḥ jinvat pṛthivi yat yat ejati prāvṛṣi tat naḥ sarpat mā upa sṛpat yat śivam tena naḥ mṛḍa
translated: The worm, O earth, that moves about in the rainy season, may it not approach us as it creeps along. Be gracious to us with what is good.

original: ye te panthāno bahavo janāyanā rathasya vartmānasaś ca yātave /
analyzed: ye te panthānaḥ bahavaḥ janāyanāḥ rathasya vartmā anasaḥ ca yātave
translated: Those many paths of thine, O earth, that lead to men, the ways of the chariot and the course of the mind,

original: yaiḥ saṃcaranty ubhaye bhadrapāpās taṃ panthānaṃ jayemānamitram ataskaraṃ yac chivaṃ tena no mṛḍa ////
analyzed: yaiḥ saṃcaranti ubhaye bhadra pāpāḥ tam panthānam jayema anamitram a taskaram yat śivam tena naḥ mṛḍa
translated: By which the good and the evil go both ways, that path, O earth, which is free from enemies, free from thieves, be gracious to us with what is good.

original: malvaṃ bibhratī gurubhṛd bhadrapāpasya nidhanaṃ titikṣuḥ /
analyzed: malvam bibhratī guru bhṛt bhadra pāpasya nidhanam titikṣuḥ
translated: Bearing the heavy burden, enduring the good and the evil,

original: varāheṇa pṛthivī saṃvidānā sūkarāya vi jihīte mṛgāya ////
analyzed: varāheṇa pṛthivī saṃvidānā sūkarāya vi jihīte mṛgāya
translated: The earth, agreeing with the boar, stretches out for the boar, for the deer.

original: ye ta āraṇyāḥ paśavo mṛgā vane hitāḥ siṃhā vyāghrāḥ puruṣādaś caranti /
analyzed: ye te āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ mṛgāḥ vane hitāḥ siṃhāḥ vyāghrāḥ puruṣa adaḥ caranti
translated: Those wild animals, the deer in the forest, the lions, tigers, and man-eaters that roam,

original: ulaṃ vṛkaṃ pṛthivi duchunām ita ṛkṣīkāṃ rakṣo apa bādhayāsmat ////
analyzed: ulam vṛkam pṛthivi duchunām itas ṛkṣīkām rakṣaḥ apa bādhaya asmat
translated: The wolf, the jackal, the evil-smelling one, the bear, the demon, drive away from us, O earth.

original: ye gandharvā apsaraso ye cārāyāḥ kimīdinaḥ /
analyzed: ye gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ye ca arāyāḥ kimīdinaḥ
translated: The Gandharvas, the Apsaras, the Arāyas, the Kimīdins,

original: piśācānt sarvā rakṣāṃsi tān asmad bhūme yāvaya //// 🔽yāṃ dvipādaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ saṃpatanti haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunā vayāṃsi /
analyzed: piśācān sarvā rakṣāṃsi tān asmat bhūme yāvaya  yām dvipādaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ saṃpatanti haṃsāḥ suparṇāḥ śakunāḥ vayāṃsi
translated: The Piśācas, all the Rākṣasas, drive them away from us, O earth.🔽On whom the two-footed birds fly down, the swans, the Suparṇas, the birds, the sparrows,

original: yasyāṃ vāto mātariśveyate rajāṃsi kṛṇvaṃś cyāvayaṃś ca vṛkṣān /
analyzed: yasyām vātaḥ mātariśvā īyate rajāṃsi kṛṇvan cyāvayan ca vṛkṣān
translated: On whom the wind, the breath of life, moves, making the dust fly and shaking the trees,

original: vātasya pravām upavām anu vāty arciḥ ////
analyzed: vātasya pravām upavām anu vāti arciḥ
translated: Along the wind's course and counter-course the flame moves.

original: yasyāṃ kṛṣṇam aruṇaṃ ca saṃhite ahorātre vihite bhūmyām adhi /
analyzed: yasyām kṛṣṇam aruṇam ca saṃhite ahorātre vihite bhūmyām adhi
translated: On whom the black and the red are joined, the day and the night arranged upon the earth,

original: varṣeṇa bhūmiḥ pṛthivī vṛtāvṛtā sā no dadhātu bhadrayā priye dhāmanidhāmani ////
analyzed: varṣeṇa bhūmiḥ pṛthivī vṛtā āvṛtā sā naḥ dadhātu bhadrayā priye dhāmani dhāmani
translated: The earth, the earth is covered with rain, may it place us in its good abode, in its dear abode.

original: dyauś ca ma idaṃ pṛthivī cāntarikṣaṃ ca me vyacaḥ /
analyzed: dyauḥ ca me idam pṛthivī ca antarikṣam ca me vyacaḥ
translated: May the sky, this earth, and the atmosphere for me,

original: agniḥ sūrya āpo medhāṃ viśve devāś ca saṃ daduḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ sūryaḥ āpaḥ medhām viśve devāḥ ca sam daduḥ
translated: Agni, Sūrya, the waters, and all the gods have bestowed intelligence upon me.

original: aham asmi sahamāna uttaro nāma bhūmyām /
analyzed: aham asmi sahamānaḥ uttaraḥ nāma bhūmyām
translated: I am the one who conquers, named Uttara on earth.

original: abhīṣāḍ asmi viśvāṣāḍ āśāmāśāṃ viṣāsahiḥ ////
analyzed: abhīṣāh asmi viśvāṣāh āśām āśām viṣāsahiḥ
translated: I am the one who conquers all fears, conquering every hope and desire.

original: ado yad devi prathamānā purastād devair uktā vyasarpo mahitvam /
analyzed: adaḥ yat devi prathamānā purastāt devaiḥ uktā vyasarpaḥ mahi tvam
translated: O Goddess, when you first spread out in front, proclaimed by the gods, you extended your greatness.

original: ā tvā subhūtam aviśat tadānīm akalpayathāḥ pradiśaś catasraḥ ////
analyzed: ā tvā subhūtam aviśat tadānīm akalpayathāḥ pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: Then the good fortune entered you, and you established the four directions.

original: ye grāmā yad araṇyaṃ yāḥ sabhā adhi bhūmyām /
analyzed: ye grāmāḥ yat araṇyam yāḥ sabhāḥ adhi bhūmyām
translated: The villages, the forests, the assemblies on earth,

original: ye saṃgrāmāḥ samitayas teṣu cāru vadema te ////
analyzed: ye saṃgrāmāḥ samitayaḥ teṣu cāru vadema te
translated: the battles and gatherings - may we speak charmingly to them all.

original: aśva iva rajo dudhuve vi tān janān ya ākṣiyan pṛthivīṃ yād ajāyata /
analyzed: aśvaḥ iva rajaḥ dudhuve vi tān janān ye ākṣiyan pṛthivīm yāt ajāyata
translated: Like a horse, he has shaken off those people who have looked upon the earth that has been born.

original: mandrāgretvarī bhuvanasya gopā vanaspatīnāṃ gṛbhir oṣadhīnām ////
analyzed: mandrā agrā itvarī bhuvanasya gopāḥ vanaspatīnām gṛbhiḥ oṣadhīnām
translated: The pleasant one, the leader, the guardian of the world, the supporter of the trees and plants.

original: yad vadāmi madhumat tad vadāmi yad īkṣe tad vananti mā /
analyzed: yat vadāmi madhumat tat vadāmi yat īkṣe tat vananti mā
translated: Whatever I say, I say it with sweetness; whatever I see, they praise me.

original: tviṣīmān asmi jūtimān avānyān hanmi dodhataḥ ////
analyzed: tviṣīmān asmi jūtimān ava anyān hanmi dodhataḥ
translated: I am radiant, powerful; I destroy the hostile ones who rush upon me.

original: śantivā surabhiḥ syonā kīlālodhnī payasvatī /
analyzed: śantivā surabhiḥ syonā kīlāla udhnī payasvatī
translated: The one who speaks peace, fragrant, comfortable, with milk flowing like nectar, full of milk.

original: bhūmir adhi bravītu me pṛthivī payasā saha ////
analyzed: bhūmiḥ adhi bravītu me pṛthivī payasā saha
translated: May the earth, along with its milk, speak to me.

original: yām anvaichad dhaviṣā viśvakarmāntar arṇave rajasi praviṣṭām /
analyzed: yām anvaichat haviṣā viśvakarmā antar arṇave rajasi praviṣṭām
translated: Which he sought with oblation, all-creating, entered into the ocean, in the region,

original: bhujiṣyaṃ pātraṃ nihitaṃ guhā yad āvir bhoge abhavan mātṛmadbhyaḥ ////
analyzed: bhujiṣyam pātram nihitam guhā yat āvis bhoge abhavat mātṛmadbhyaḥ
translated: The vessel laid up in the cave, which is to be used, when it became manifest to the mothers in enjoyment.

original: tvam asy āvapanī janānām aditiḥ kāmadughā paprathānā /
analyzed: tvam asi āvapanī janānām aditiḥ kāmadughā paprathānā
translated: Thou art the bestower of offspring to men, Aditi, the wish-granting cow, extending.

original: yat ta ūnaṃ tat ta ā pūrayāti prajāpatiḥ prathamajā ṛtasya ////🔽upasthās te anamīvā ayakṣmā asmabhyaṃ santu pṛthivi prasūtāḥ /
analyzed: yat te ūnam tat te ā pūrayāti prajāpatiḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtasya  upasthāḥ te anamīvāḥ ayakṣmāḥ asmabhyam santu pṛthivi prasūtāḥ
translated: Whatever is deficient in thee, that he fills up for thee, Prajapati, the first-born of truth.🔽Let thy services be free from disease and consumption, born of the earth for us.

original: dīrghaṃ na āyuḥ pratibudhyamānā vayaṃ tubhyaṃ balihṛtaḥ syāma ////
analyzed: dīrgham naḥ āyuḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ vayam tubhyam bali hṛtaḥ syāma
translated: Awaking to a long life, may we be thy tributarys.

original: bhūme mātar ni dhehi mā bhadrayā supratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: bhūme mātar ni dhehi mā bhadrayā su pratiṣṭhitam
translated: O Earth, O Mother, place me well-established with thy favour,

original: saṃvidānā divā kave śriyāṃ mā dhehi bhūtyām ////
analyzed: saṃvidānā divā kave śriyām mā dhehi bhūtyām
translated: In agreement with the wise one of the day. In prosperity place me in abundance.

original: naḍam ā roha na te atra loka idaṃ sīsaṃ bhāgadheyaṃ ta ehi /
analyzed: naḍam ā roha na te atra lokaḥ idam sīsam bhāgadheyam te ehi
translated: Ascend the reed. There is no place for thee here. This is thy portion of the skull. Come hither.

original: yo goṣu yakṣmaḥ puruṣeṣu yakṣmas tena tvaṃ sākam adharāṅ parehi ////
analyzed: yaḥ goṣu yakṣmaḥ puruṣeṣu yakṣmaḥ tena tvam sākam adharāṅ parehi
translated: The wasting disease that is in cattle, the wasting disease that is in men, with that do we send thee away downward.

original: aghaśaṃsaduḥśaṃsābhyāṃ kareṇānukareṇa ca /
analyzed: agha śaṃsa duḥśaṃsābhyām kareṇa anukareṇa ca
translated: With Aghasamsa, Duhsamsa, Karana, and Anukarana,

original: yakṣmaṃ ca sarvaṃ teneto mṛtyuṃ ca nir ajāmasi ////
analyzed: yakṣmam ca sarvam tena itas mṛtyum ca niḥ ajāmasi
translated: And with all wasting disease we drive away from thee death.

original: nir ito mṛtyuṃ nirṛtiṃ nir arātim ajāmasi /
analyzed: niḥ itas mṛtyum nirṛtim niḥ arātim ajāmasi
translated: From hence we drive away Death, Destruction, and hostility.

original: yo no dveṣṭi tam addhy agne akravyād yam u dviṣmas tam u te pra suvāmasi ////
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi tam addhi agne a kravyād yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u te pra suvāmasi
translated: Let him, O Agni, who hates us, be destroyed by thee; him whom we hate, him we deliver up to thee.

original: yady agniḥ kravyād yadi vā vyāghra imaṃ goṣṭhaṃ praviveśānyokāḥ /
analyzed: yadi agniḥ kravyād yadi vā vyāghraḥ imam goṣṭham praviveśa anyokāḥ
translated: If Agni, the devourer, or if some other wolf has entered this our fold,

original: taṃ māṣājyaṃ kṛtvā pra hiṇomi dūraṃ sa gachatv apsuṣado 'py agnīn ////
analyzed: tam māṣa ājyam kṛtvā pra hiṇomi dūram sa gacchatu apsuṣadaḥ pi agnīn
translated: Having made him into a cake of beans, I send him away to a distance. Let him go to the waters and to the fires.

original: yat tvā kruddhāḥ pracakrur manyunā puruṣe mṛte /
analyzed: yat tvā kruddhāḥ pracakruḥ manyunā puruṣe mṛte
translated: If in anger ye have sent forth Agni, when a man is dead, through wrath,

original: sukalpam agne tat tvayā punas tvod dīpayāmasi ////
analyzed: su kalpam agne tat tvayā punar tvā ud dīpayāmasi
translated: That, O Agni, is well-ordered by thee. We kindle thee again.

original: punas tvādityā rudrā vasavaḥ punar brahmā vasunītir agne /
analyzed: punar tvā ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ punar brahmā vasu nītiḥ agne
translated: The Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, again the Brahman, the order of the Vasus, O Agni,

original: punas tvā brahmaṇas patir ādhād dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya ////🔽yo agniḥ kravyāt praviveśa no gṛham imaṃ paśyann itaraṃ jātavedasam /🔽taṃ harāmi pitṛyajñāya dūraṃ sa gharmam indhāṃ parame sadhasthe ////
analyzed: punar tvā brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ ādhāt dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  yaḥ agniḥ kravyād praviveśa naḥ gṛham imam paśyan itaram jātavedasam  tam harāmi pitṛ yajñāya dūram sa gharmam indhām parame sadhasthe
translated: Brahmanaspati has again established thee for long life, for a hundred autumns.🔽The Agni who as a devourer has entered our house, beholding this other all-knower,🔽I carry him away to the sacrifice to the Fathers. Let him kindle the Gharma in the highest abode.

original: kravyādam agniṃ pra hiṇomi dūram yamarājño gachatu ripravāhaḥ /
analyzed: kravya adam agnim pra hiṇomi dūram yama rājñaḥ gacchatu ripra vāhaḥ
translated: I send away to a distance the devouring Agni. Let him go to the king Yama, bearing away the guilt.

original: ihāyam itaro jātavedā devo devebhyo havyaṃ vahatu prajānan ////
analyzed: iha ayam itaraḥ jātavedāḥ devaḥ devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan
translated: Here is the other one, the all-knowing god, let him carry the oblation to the gods, the wise one.

original: kravyādam agnim iṣito harāmi janān dṛṃhantaṃ vajreṇa mṛtyum /
analyzed: kravyādam agnim iṣitaḥ harāmi janān dṛṃhantam vajreṇa mṛtyum
translated: I send away the flesh-eating Agni, the one who hurls the people, death with his thunderbolt.

original: ni taṃ śāsmi gārhapatyena vidvān pitṝṇāṃ loke 'pi bhāgo astu ////
analyzed: ni tam śāsmi gārhapatyena vidvān pitṝṇām loke pi bhāgaḥ astu
translated: I will punish him with the Garhapatya fire, let him have a share in the world of the ancestors.

original: kravyādam agniṃ śaśamānam ukthyaṃ pra hiṇomi pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ /
analyzed: kravyādam agnim śaśamānam ukthyam pra hiṇomi pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ
translated: The flesh-eating Agni, the one who is praised, the one worthy of hymns, I send away on the paths of the ancestors.

original: mā devayānaiḥ punar ā gā atraivaidhi pitṛṣu jāgṛhi tvam ////
analyzed: mā deva yānaiḥ punar ā gāḥ atra eva edhi pitṛṣu jāgṛhi tvam
translated: Do not return by the paths of the gods! Right here, among the ancestors, be you! Be watchful among them!

original: sam indhate saṃkasukaṃ svastaye śuddhā bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ /
analyzed: sam indhate saṃkasukam svastaye śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: They kindle the well-covered one for well-being. Being pure, bright, and purifying,

original: jahāti ripram aty ena eti samiddho agniḥ supunā punāti ////
analyzed: jahāti ripram ati enaḥ eti samiddhaḥ agniḥ supunā punāti
translated: he leaves behind the stain and goes beyond it. The well-kindled Agni purifies well.

original: devo agniḥ saṃkasuko divas pṛṣṭhāny āruhat /
analyzed: devaḥ agniḥ saṃkasukaḥ divaḥ pṛṣṭhāni āruhat
translated: The god Agni, the well-covered one, has ascended the backs of the sky.

original: mucyamāno nir eṇaso 'mog asmāṃ aśastyāḥ ////🔽asmin vayaṃ saṃkasuke agnau riprāṇi mṛjmahe /
analyzed: mucyamānaḥ niḥ eṇasaḥ mok asmān aśastyāḥ  asmin vayam saṃkasuke agnau riprāṇi mṛjmahe
translated: Being released, he is free from sin. May he free us from misfortune.🔽In this well-covered Agni, we purify our stains.

original: abhūma yajñiyāḥ śuddhāḥ pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat ////
analyzed: abhūma yajñiyāḥ śuddhāḥ pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: Having become worthy of sacrifice, pure, may he extend our life spans.

original: saṃkasuko vikasuko nirṛtho yaś ca nisvaraḥ /
analyzed: saṃkasukaḥ vikasukaḥ nirṛthaḥ yaḥ ca nisvaraḥ
translated: The well-covered one, the scattered one, the misfortune, and the one who is soundless,

original: te te yakṣmaṃ savedaso dūrād dūram anīnaśan ////
analyzed: te te yakṣmam sa vedasaḥ dūrāt dūram anīnaśan
translated: They, the knowers of all, have driven away from afar, far away, that wasting disease.

original: yo no aśveṣu vīreṣu yo no goṣv ajāviṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ aśveṣu vīreṣu yaḥ naḥ goṣu aja aviṣu
translated: He who is among our horses, among our heroes, he who is among our cows, among our goats and sheep,

original: kravyādaṃ nir ṇudāmasi yo agnir janayopanaḥ ////🔽anyebhyas tvā puruṣebhyo gobhyo aśvebhyas tvā /
analyzed: kravyādam niḥ nudāmasi yaḥ agniḥ jana yopanaḥ  anyebhyaḥ tvā puruṣebhyaḥ gobhyaḥ aśvebhyaḥ tvā
translated: We drive away the flesh-devouring one who is the life-destroying fire.

original: niḥ kravyādaṃ nudāmasi yo agnir jīvitayopanaḥ ////
analyzed: niḥ kravyādam nudāmasi yaḥ agniḥ jīvita yopanaḥ
translated: We drive away the flesh-devouring one who is the life-destroying fire.

original: yasmin devā amṛjata yasmin manuṣyā uta /🔽tasmin ghṛtastāvo mṛṣṭvā tvam agne divaṃ ruha ////
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ amṛjata yasmin manuṣyāḥ uta  tasmin ghṛta stāvaḥ mṛṣṭvā tvam agne divam ruha
translated: In whom the gods have cleansed themselves, in whom also men,🔽Having cleansed yourself in that, O Agni, ascend to heaven.

original: samiddho agna āhuta sa no mābhyapakramīḥ /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agne āhuta sa naḥ mā abhyapakramīḥ
translated: O Agni, kindled and offered to, do not go away from us.

original: atraiva dīdihi dyavi jyok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe ////
analyzed: atra eva dīdihi dyavi jyok ca sūryam dṛśe
translated: Shine here only in the sky, and for a long time look upon the sun.

original: sīse mṛḍḍhvaṃ naḍe mṛḍḍhvam agnau saṃkasuke ca yat /
analyzed: sīse mṛḍḍhvam naḍe mṛḍḍhvam agnau saṃkasuke ca yat
translated: Be gracious in the lead, be gracious in the reed, in the fire, in the Sankushaka,

original: atho avyāṃ rāmāyāṃ śīrṣaktim upabarhaṇe ////
analyzed: atha u avyām rāmāyām śīrṣaktim upabarhaṇe
translated: And also in the Avya, in the Rama, in the head, in the pillow.

original: sīse malaṃ sādayitvā śīrṣaktim upabarhaṇe /
analyzed: sīse malam sādayitvā śīrṣaktim upabarhaṇe
translated: Having placed the impurity in the lead, in the head, in the pillow,

original: avyām asiknyāṃ mṛṣṭvā śuddhā bhavata yajñiyāḥ ////
analyzed: avyām asiknyām mṛṣṭvā śuddhāḥ bhavata yajñiyāḥ
translated: Having cleansed yourself in the Avya, in the Asakni, become pure and fit for sacrifice.

original: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yas ta eṣa itaro devayānāt /
analyzed: param mṛtyo anu parehi panthām yaḥ te eṣaḥ itaraḥ deva yānāt
translated: Go beyond death, O Death, along the path that is other than the one the gods go.

original: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmīheme vīrā bahavo bhavantu ////
analyzed: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi iha ime vīrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavantu
translated: To thee, O thou that hast eyes and hearest, I speak. Let these many heroes be here.

original: ime jīvā vi mṛtair āvavṛtrann abhūd bhadrā devahutir no adya /
analyzed: ime jīvāḥ vi mṛtaiḥ āvavṛtran abhūt bhadrā deva hutiḥ naḥ adya
translated: These living ones have turned away from the dead. Today our offering to the gods has been auspicious.

original: prāñco agāma nṛtaye hasāya suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema ////
analyzed: prāñcaḥ agāma nṛtaye hasāya su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema
translated: We have gone forward to the dance, to the joy. With good heroes let us speak in the assembly.

original: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu gād aparo artham etam /
analyzed: imam jīvebhyaḥ paridhim dadhāmi mā eṣām nu gāt aparaḥ artham etam
translated: I set this boundary for the living. Let none of them go beyond this to the other world.

original: śataṃ jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīs tiro mṛtyuṃ dadhatām parvatena ////
analyzed: śatam jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ tiras mṛtyum dadhatām parvatena
translated: Living a hundred long years, let them place death far away with a mountain.

original: ā rohatāyur jarasaṃ vṛṇānā anupūrvaṃ yatamānā yati stha /
analyzed: ā rohata āyuḥ jarasam vṛṇānāḥ anupūrvam yatamānāḥ yati stha
translated: Ascend, seeking life and old age, striving in due order, where you are to be.

original: tān vas tvaṣṭā sujanimā sajoṣāḥ sarvam āyur nayatu jīvanāya ////
analyzed: tān vaḥ tvaṣṭā su janimā sajoṣāḥ sarvam āyuḥ nayatu jīvanāya
translated: May Tvastr, well-born, of one mind with you, lead you all to full life for living.

original: yathāhāny anupūrvaṃ bhavanti yatha rtava ṛtubhir yanti sākam /
analyzed: yathā ahāni anupūrvam bhavanti yathā ṛtavaḥ ṛtubhiḥ yanti sākam
translated: As the days follow one another in due order, as the seasons go together with the seasons,

original: yathā na pūrvam aparo jahāty evā dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpayaiṣām ////
analyzed: yathā na pūrvam aparaḥ jahāti eva dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpaya eṣām
translated: As the later one does not abandon the former, O Creator, so order their lives.

original: aśmanvatī rīyate saṃ rabhadhvaṃ vīrayadhvaṃ pra taratā sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam vīrayadhvam pra tarata sakhāyaḥ
translated: The stone-filled one flows. Be ready! Exert yourselves! O friends, cross over!

original: atrā jahīta ye asan durevā anamīvān ut taremābhi vājān ////
analyzed: atra jahīta ye asan durevāḥ anamīvān ud tarema abhi vājān
translated: Leave here those who have evil thoughts. Let us cross over to the good deeds.

original: ut tiṣṭhatā pra taratā sakhāyo 'śmanvatī nadī syandata iyam /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata pra tarata sakhāyaḥ śmanvatī nadī syandate iyam
translated: Rise up, O friends, and cross over; this river with its rocky bottom flows on.

original: atrā jahīta ye asann aśivāḥ śivānt syonān ut taremābhi vājān ////🔽vaiśvadevīṃ varcasā ā rabhadhvaṃ śuddhā bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ /
analyzed: atra jahīta ye asan aśivāḥ śivān syonān ud tarema abhi vājān  vaiśvadevīm varcasā ā rabhadhvam śuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: Here leave behind those who are inauspicious; may we cross over to the auspicious and pleasant riches.🔽Seize the splendor of the All-gods; being pure, bright, and radiant,

original: atikrāmanto duritā padāni śataṃ himāḥ sarvavīrā madema ////
analyzed: atikrāmantaḥ duritā padāni śatam himāḥ sarva vīrāḥ madema
translated: passing over the places of misfortune, may we, all heroes, rejoice for a hundred winters.

original: udīcīnaiḥ pathibhir vāyumadbhir atikrāmanto 'varān parebhiḥ /
analyzed: udīcīnaiḥ pathibhiḥ vāyumadbhiḥ atikrāmantaḥ varān parebhiḥ
translated: By the paths that lead to the north, which are full of wind, passing over the lower ones by the higher ones,

original: triḥ sapta kṛtva ṛṣayaḥ paretā mṛtyuṃ praty auhan padayopanena ////
analyzed: tris sapta kṛtvas ṛṣayaḥ paretāḥ mṛtyum prati auhan pada yopanena
translated: the seers have gone thrice seven times, carrying death away by the path of the feet.

original: mṛtyoḥ padaṃ yopayanta eta drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ padam yopayantaḥ eta drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ
translated: Leading to the place of death, bestowing a long life and a way of escape,

original: āsīnā mṛtyuṃ nudatā sadhasthe 'tha jīvāso vidatham ā vadema //// 🔽imā nārīr avidhavāḥ supatnīr āñjanena sarpiṣā saṃ spṛśantām /
analyzed: āsīnāḥ mṛtyum nudata sadhasthe tha jīvāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema  / imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam spṛśantām
translated: seated, may we drive away death from our abode; then, being alive, may we speak in the assembly.🔽May these women, not widows, with good husbands, touch each other with ointment and ghee.

original: anaśravo anamīvāḥ suratnā ā rohantu janayo yonim agre ////
analyzed: anaśravaḥ anamīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre
translated: Without tears, without sickness, with good treasures, may the wives ascend the husband's place first.

original: vyākaromi haviṣāham etau tau brahmaṇā vy ahaṃ kalpayāmi /
analyzed: vyākaromi haviṣā aham etau tau brahmaṇā vi aham kalpayāmi
translated: I arrange these two with the oblation; with the Brahman I arrange them.

original: svadhāṃ pitṛbhyo ajarāṃ kṛṇomi dīrgheṇāyuṣā sam imānt sṛjāmi ////
analyzed: svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ ajarām kṛṇomi dīrgheṇa āyuṣā sam imān sṛjāmi
translated: I make the imperishable Svadha for the Fathers; I unite these (men) with long life.

original: yo no agniḥ pitaro hṛtsv antar āviveśāmṛto martyeṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ agniḥ pitaraḥ hṛtsu antar āviveśa amṛtaḥ martyeṣu
translated: The immortal Agni who has entered into our hearts, among mortals, among the Fathers,

original: mayy ahaṃ taṃ pari gṛhṇāmi devaṃ mā so asmān dvikṣata mā vayaṃ tam ////
analyzed: mayi aham tam pari gṛhṇāmi devam mā saḥ asmān dvikṣata mā vayam tam
translated: I take him to myself, the God. Let him not hate us, nor we him.

original: apāvṛtya gārhapatyāt kravyādā preta dakṣiṇā /
analyzed: apāvṛtya gārhapatyāt kravyādā preta dakṣiṇā
translated: Turning away from the Gārhapatya, O flesh-eater, go away to the south.

original: priyaṃ pitṛbhya ātmane brahmabhyaḥ kṛṇutā priyam ////
analyzed: priyam pitṛbhyaḥ ātmane brahmabhyaḥ kṛṇuta priyam
translated: Make yourself dear to the Fathers, to the soul, to the Brahmans.

original: dvibhāgadhanam ādāya pra kṣiṇāty avartyā /
analyzed: dvi bhāga dhanam ādāya pra kṣiṇāti avartyā
translated: Taking the wealth of two parts, he turns away from the Avartī.

original: agniḥ putrasya jyeṣṭhasya yaḥ kravyād anirāhitaḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ putrasya jyeṣṭhasya yaḥ kravyād a nirāhitaḥ
translated: Agni, the flesh-eater, who is not restrained, of the eldest son,

original: yat kṛṣate yad vanute yac ca vasnena vindate /
analyzed: yat kṛṣate yat vanute yat ca vasnena vindate
translated: Whatever he ploughs, whatever he cultivates, whatever he obtains by his own strength,

original: sarvaṃ martyasya tan nāsti kravyāc ced anirāhitaḥ ////🔽ayajñiyo hatavarcā bhavati nainena havir attave /
analyzed: sarvam martyasya tat na asti kravyād ced a nirāhitaḥ  a yajñiyaḥ hata varcāḥ bhavati na enena haviḥ attave
translated: All that is not the mortal's if the flesh-eater is not restrained.🔽He becomes unfit for sacrifice, his splendour is destroyed, he is not fit to eat the oblation,

original: chinatti kṛṣyā gor dhanād yaṃ kravyād anuvartate ////
analyzed: chinatti kṛṣyāḥ goḥ dhanāt yam kravyād anuvartate
translated: He cuts off (a man) from cultivation, from cattle, from wealth, whom the flesh-eater follows.

original: muhur gṛdhyaiḥ pra vadaty ārtim martyo nītya /
analyzed: muhur gṛdhyaiḥ pra vadati ārtim martyaḥ nītya
translated: Again and again the mortal speaks of misfortune, he goes to misfortune,

original: kravyād yān agnir antikād anuvidvān vitāvati ////
analyzed: kravyād yān agniḥ antikāt anuvidvān vitāvati
translated: The flesh-eater whom Agni, the all-knowing, follows near.

original: grāhyā gṛhāḥ saṃ sṛjyante striyā yan mriyate patiḥ /
analyzed: grāhyā gṛhāḥ sam sṛjyante striyāḥ yat mriyate patiḥ
translated: The houses are seized when a wife's husband dies.

original: brahmaiva vidvān eṣyo yaḥ kravyādaṃ nirādadhat ////
analyzed: brahmā eva vidvān eṣyaḥ yaḥ kravyādam nirādadhat
translated: Only a learned Brahmin should be invited, who can remove the flesh-eater.

original: yad ripraṃ śamalaṃ cakṛma yac ca duṣkṛtam /
analyzed: yat ripram śamalam cakṛma yat ca duṣkṛtam
translated: Whatever impurity or evil we have done,

original: āpo mā tasmāc chumbhantv agneḥ saṃkasukāc ca yat ////
analyzed: āpaḥ mā tasmāt śumbhantu agneḥ saṃkasukāt ca yat
translated: may the waters cleanse me from that, and from the burning heat of Agni.

original: tā adharād udīcīr āvavṛtran prajānaitīḥ pathibhir devayānaiḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ adharāt udīcīḥ āvavṛtran prajānā etīḥ pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: Those (waters) have turned from below to above, the wise ones by the paths of the gods.

original: parvatasya vṛṣabhasyādhi pṛṣṭhe navāś caranti saritaḥ purāṇīḥ ////
analyzed: parvatasya vṛṣabhasya adhi pṛṣṭhe navāḥ caranti saritaḥ purāṇīḥ
translated: On the back of the mountain bull, the new and the ancient rivers flow.

original: agne akravyān niḥ kravyādaṃ nudā devayajanaṃ vaha ////
analyzed: agne a kravyād niḥ kravyādam nuda devayajanam vaha
translated: O Agni, drive away the flesh-eater, carry the flesh-eater to the sacrificial ground.

original: imaṃ kravyād ā viveśāyaṃ kravyādam anv agāt /
analyzed: imam kravyād ā viveśa ayam kravyādam anu agāt
translated: This one has entered the flesh-eater, this one has followed the flesh-eater.

original: vyāghrau kṛtvā nānānaṃ taṃ harāmi śivāparam ////
analyzed: vyāghrau kṛtvā nānānam tam harāmi śiva aparam
translated: Having made them two tigers, I carry away the one that is auspicious.

original: antardhir devānāṃ paridhir manuṣyāṇām agnir gārhapatya ubhayān antarā śritaḥ ////
analyzed: antardhiḥ devānām paridhiḥ manuṣyāṇām agniḥ gārhapatyaḥ ubhayān antarā śritaḥ
translated: The fire is the screen of the gods, the fence of men, it is placed between both.

original: jīvānām āyuḥ pra tira tvam agne pitṝṇāṃ lokam api gachantu ye mṛtāḥ /
analyzed: jīvānām āyuḥ pra tira tvam agne pitṝṇām lokam api gacchantu ye mṛtāḥ
translated: O Agni, extend the life of the living, and may those who are dead go to the world of the ancestors.

original: sugārhapatyo vitapann arātim uṣāmuṣāṃ śreyasīṃ dhehy asmai ////
analyzed: su gārhapatyaḥ vitapan arātim uṣām uṣām śreyasīm dhehi asmai
translated: O Gārhapatya, spreading out, give this one good homes, better and better.

original: sarvān agne sahamānaḥ sapatnān aiṣām ūrjaṃ rayim asmāsu dhehi ////
analyzed: sarvān agne sahamānaḥ sapatnān ā eṣām ūrjam rayim asmāsu dhehi
translated: O Agni, overcoming all their enemies, bestow upon us their strength and wealth.

original: imam indraṃ vahniṃ paprim anvārabhadhvaṃ sa vo nir vakṣad duritād avadyāt /
analyzed: imam indram vahnim paprim anvārabhadhvam sa vaḥ niḥ vakṣat duritāt avadyāt
translated: Take hold of this Indra, this carrier, this protector. May he lead you out from evil and from blame.

original: tenāpa hata śarum āpatantaṃ tena rudrasya pari pātāstām ////
analyzed: tena apa hata śarum āpatantam tena rudrasya pari pāta astām
translated: By him drive away the dart that flies upon you. By him be ye protected from Rudra's noose.

original: anaḍvāhaṃ plavam anvārabhadhvaṃ sa vo nir vakṣad duritād avadyāt /
analyzed: anaḍvāham plavam anvārabhadhvam sa vaḥ niḥ vakṣat duritāt avadyāt
translated: Take hold of the ox, the raft. May he lead you out from evil and from blame.

original: ā rohata savitur nāvam etāṃ ṣaḍbhir urvībhir amatiṃ tarema ////
analyzed: ā rohata savituḥ nāvam etām ṣaḍbhiḥ urvībhiḥ amatim tarema
translated: Mount this ship of Savitar. By six broad paths may we pass over tribulation.

original: ahorātre anv eṣi bibhrat kṣemyas tiṣṭhan prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: ahorātre anu eṣi bibhrat kṣemyaḥ tiṣṭhan prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: Bearing the day and night, standing firm, a good deliverer, with good men,

original: anāturānt sumanasas talpa bibhraj jyog eva naḥ puruṣagandhir edhi ////
analyzed: anāturān sumanasaḥ talpa bibhrat jyok eva naḥ puruṣa gandhiḥ edhi
translated: Bearing the couch of the healthy and cheerful, be thou for us, O house, a good protector.

original: te devebhya ā vṛścante pāpaṃ jīvanti sarvadā /
analyzed: te devebhyaḥ ā vṛścante pāpam jīvanti sarvadā
translated: They cut themselves off from the gods. They live a sinful life always.

original: kravyād yān agnir antikād aśva ivānuvapate naḍam ////
analyzed: kravyād yān agniḥ antikāt aśvaḥ iva anuvapate naḍam
translated: As a horse tears up a reed, so Agni tears up those who eat raw flesh from near him.

original: ye 'śraddhā dhanakāmyā kravyādā samāsate /
analyzed: ye śraddhā dhana kāmyā kravyādā samāsate
translated: Those who, greedy for wealth, eat raw flesh, and who are without faith,

original: te vā anyeṣāṃ kumbhīṃ paryādadhati sarvadā ////
analyzed: te vai anyeṣām kumbhīm paryādadhati sarvadā
translated: They always put a pot over the fire of others.

original: preva pipatiṣati manasā muhur ā vartate punaḥ /
analyzed: pra iva pipatiṣati manasā muhur ā vartate punar
translated: He falls down as if eager to go, again and again his mind turns back.

original: kravyād yān agnir antikād anuvidvān vitāvati ////
analyzed: kravyād yān agniḥ antikāt anuvidvān vitāvati
translated: Agni, the devourer of raw flesh, who knows the near and the distant, spreads out.

original: aviḥ kṛṣṇā bhāgadheyaṃ paśūnāṃ sīsaṃ kravyād api candraṃ ta āhuḥ /🔽māṣāḥ piṣṭā bhāgadheyaṃ te havyam araṇyānyā gahvaraṃ sacasva ////
analyzed: aviḥ kṛṣṇā bhāgadheyam paśūnām sīsam kravyād api candram te āhuḥ  māṣāḥ piṣṭāḥ bhāgadheyam te havyam araṇyānyāḥ gahvaram sacasva
translated: The black cow is the share of the animals, the skull is the raw flesh eater, and they call that the moon.🔽The ground meal is your share, your oblation, dwell in the deep forest.

original: iṣīkāṃ jaratīm iṣṭvā tilpiñjaṃ daṇḍanaṃ naḍam /
analyzed: iṣīkām jaratīm iṣṭvā tilpiñjam daṇḍanam naḍam
translated: Having worshipped the old reed, the sesame cake, the stick, the reed,

original: tam indra idhmam kṛtvā yamasyāgniṃ nirādadhau ////🔽pratyañcam arkaṃ pratyarpayitvā pravidvān panthāṃ vi hy āviveśa /
analyzed: tam indraḥ idhmam kṛtvā yamasya agnim nirādadhau  pratyañcam arkam pratyarpayitvā pravidvān panthām vi hi āviveśa
translated: Indra having made that the fuel, placed Yama's fire.🔽Having turned back the sun to the west, having entered the path that is well known,

original: parāmīṣām asūn dideśa dīrgheṇāyuṣā sam imānt sṛjāmi ////
analyzed: parā amīṣām asūn dideśa dīrgheṇa āyuṣā sam imān sṛjāmi  /
translated: I direct the life breaths of these to the farthest distance, I unite these with long life.

original: pumān puṃso 'dhi tiṣṭha carmehi tatra hvayasva yatamā priyā te /
analyzed: pumān puṃsaḥ dhi tiṣṭha carma ihi tatra hvayasva yatamā priyā te
translated: Go, man, to the skin of the man, there call to you the one who is dear to you.

original: yāvantāv agre prathamaṃ sameyathus tad vāṃ vayo yamarājye samānam ////
analyzed: yāvantau agre prathamam sameyathuḥ tat vām vayaḥ yama rājye samānam
translated: As much as you two first met together, that is your common life in Yama's kingdom.

original: tāvad vāṃ cakṣus tati vīryāṇi tāvat tejas tatidhā vājināni /
analyzed: tāvat vām cakṣuḥ tati vīryāṇi tāvat tejaḥ tatidhā vājināni
translated: So much is your eye, so much your powers, so much your splendor, so much your strength.

original: agniḥ śarīraṃ sacate yadaidho 'dhā pakvān mithunā saṃ bhavāthaḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ śarīram sacate yadā edhaḥ dhāḥ pakvāt mithunā sam bhavāthaḥ
translated: The body of Agni is the fuel, then, having become ripe, you two shall be united.

original: sam asmiṃl loke sam u devayāne saṃ smā sametaṃ yamarājyeṣu /
analyzed: sam asmin loke sam u deva yāne sam sma sametam yama rājyeṣu
translated: In this world, in the world of the gods, and in the realms of Yama,

original: pūtau pavitrair upa tad dhvayethāṃ yadyad reto adhi vāṃ saṃbabhūva ////
analyzed: pūtau pavitraiḥ upa tat dhvayethām yat yat retaḥ adhi vām saṃbabhūva
translated: you two have come together. By the purifying means, you should enjoy that which has become your seed.

original: āpas putrāso abhi saṃ viśadhvam imaṃ jīvaṃ jīvadhanyāḥ sametya /
analyzed: āpaḥ putrāsaḥ abhi sam viśadhvam imam jīvam jīva dhanyāḥ sametya
translated: O waters, the daughters, come together to this living being, you who are the wealth of life.

original: tāsāṃ bhajadhvam amṛtaṃ yam āhur odanaṃ pacati vāṃ janitrī ////
analyzed: tāsām bhajadhvam amṛtam yam āhuḥ odanam pacati vām janitrī
translated: Of those, enjoy the nectar which they call the sacrificial pap which your mother cooks for you.

original: yaṃ vāṃ pitā pacati yaṃ ca mātā riprān nirmuktyai śamalāc ca vācaḥ /
analyzed: yam vām pitā pacati yam ca mātā riprāt nirmuktyai śamalāt ca vācaḥ
translated: The pap which your father and mother cook for you, to free you from defilement and from evil speech,

original: sa odanaḥ śatadhāraḥ svarga ubhe vy āpa nabhasī mahitvā ////
analyzed: saḥ odanaḥ śata dhāraḥ svar gaḥ ubhe vi āpa nabhasī mahitvā
translated: that pap is the hundred-streamed heaven, surpassing both the sky and the earth in greatness.

original: ubhe nabhasī ubhayāṃś ca lokān ye yajvanām abhijitāḥ svargāḥ /
analyzed: ubhe nabhasī ubhayān ca lokān ye yajvanām abhijitāḥ svargāḥ
translated: Both the sky and both the worlds which are won by the sacrificers, the heavenly worlds,

original: teṣāṃ jyotiṣmān madhumān yo agre tasmin putrair jarasi saṃ śrayethām ////
analyzed: teṣām jyotiṣmān madhumān yaḥ agre tasmin putraiḥ jarasi sam śrayethām
translated: in that most radiant and sweet one which is first, in that you two should take refuge with your sons in old age.

original: prācīṃprācīṃ pradiśam ā rabhethām etaṃ lokaṃ śraddadhānāḥ sacante /
analyzed: prācīm prācīm pradiśam ā rabhethām etam lokam śraddadhānāḥ sacante
translated: You should seize the eastern quarter, full of faith, they follow this world.

original: yad vāṃ pakvaṃ pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye daṃpatī saṃ śrayethām ////
analyzed: yat vām pakvam pariviṣṭam agnau tasya guptaye daṃpatī sam śrayethām
translated: For the protection of that which is cooked and enclosed in the fire, you two, husband and wife, should take refuge together.

original: dakṣiṇāṃ diśam abhi nakṣamāṇau paryāvartethām abhi pātram etat /
analyzed: dakṣiṇām diśam abhi nakṣamāṇau paryāvartethām abhi pātram etat
translated: Turning to the southern quarter, turn hither to this vessel.

original: tasmin vāṃ yamaḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ pakvāya śarma bahulaṃ ni yachāt ////
analyzed: tasmin vām yamaḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ pakvāya śarma bahulam ni yacchāt
translated: In it may Yama, in accord with the Fathers, bestow on you abundant shelter for the cooked (food).

original: pratīcī diśām iyam id varaṃ yasyāṃ somo adhipā mṛḍitā ca /
analyzed: pratīcī diśām iyam id varam yasyām somaḥ adhipāḥ mṛḍitā ca
translated: This is the western quarter of the quarters, the best, in which Soma is the lord and the kind one.

original: tasyāṃ śrayethāṃ sukṛtaḥ sacethām adhā pakvān mithunā saṃ bhavāthaḥ ////
analyzed: tasyām śrayethām su kṛtaḥ sacethām adhā pakvāt mithunā sam bhavāthaḥ
translated: In it may you two rest, as if in a well-done deed. Then, being cooked, may you two become a pair.

original: uttaraṃ rāṣṭraṃ prajayottarāvad diśām udīcī kṛṇavan no agram /
analyzed: uttaram rāṣṭram prajayā uttarāvat diśām udīcī kṛṇavat naḥ agram
translated: May we make the northern kingdom more prosperous than the northern quarter of the quarters.

original: pāṅktaṃ chandaḥ puruṣo babhūva viśvair viśvāṅgaiḥ saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: pāṅktam chandaḥ puruṣaḥ babhūva viśvaiḥ viśva aṅgaiḥ saha sam bhavema  /
translated: The metre is Paṅkti, man has become. May we be united with all the limbs of the universe.

original: dhruveyaṃ virāṇ namo astv asyai śivā putrebhya uta mahyam astu /
analyzed: dhruvā iyam virāj namaḥ astu asyai śivā putrebhyaḥ uta mahyam astu
translated: This firm Virāj, to it be homage. Be kind to the sons and to me also.

original: sā no devy adite viśvavāra irya iva gopā abhi rakṣa pakvam ////
analyzed: sā naḥ devi adite viśva vāre iryaḥ iva gopāḥ abhi rakṣa pakvam
translated: O Goddess Aditi, of all boons, as a guard, protect the cooked (food) as if it were a child.

original: piteva putrān abhi saṃ svajasva naḥ śivā no vātā iha vāntu bhūmau /
analyzed: pitā iva putrān abhi sam svajasva naḥ śivāḥ naḥ vātāḥ iha vāntu bhūmau
translated: As a father embraces his sons, so embrace us. May the winds blow kindly for us on the earth.

original: yam odanaṃ pacato devate iha taṃ nas tapa uta satyaṃ ca vettu ////
analyzed: yam odanam pacataḥ devate iha tam naḥ tapaḥ uta satyam ca vettu
translated: The deity who cooks the rice here, may it know us for truth and penance.

original: yadyad kṛṣṇaḥ śakuna eha gatvā tsaran viṣaktaṃ bila āsasāda /
analyzed: yat yat kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ā iha gatvā tsaran viṣaktam bile āsasāda
translated: Whatever the black bird, going there, has found, wounded and stuck in the hole,

original: yad vā dāsy ārdrahastā samaṅkta ulūkhalaṃ musalaṃ śumbhatāpaḥ ////🔽ayaṃ grāvā pṛthubudhno vayodhāḥ pūtaḥ pavitrair apa hantu rakṣaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā dāsī ārdra hastā samaṅkte ulūkhalam musalam śumbhata apaḥ  ayam grāvā pṛthu budhnaḥ vayodhāḥ pūtaḥ pavitraiḥ apa hantu rakṣaḥ
translated: Or what the maid with wet hands has anointed, let the mortar and pestle be auspicious for us.🔽This stone with a broad base, giving life, purified with the purifiers, let it drive away the Raksas.

original: ā roha carma mahi śarma yacha mā daṃpatī pautram aghaṃ ni gātām ////
analyzed: ā roha carma mahi śarma yaccha mā daṃpatī pautram agham ni gātām
translated: Ascend the skin, grant great protection, let not the married couple suffer misfortune from their grandson.

original: vanaspatiḥ saha devair na āgan rakṣaḥ piśācāṃ apabādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ saha devaiḥ naḥ āgan rakṣaḥ piśācām apabādhamānaḥ
translated: The tree has come with the gods, driving away the Raksas and pisacas.

original: sa uc chrayātai pra vadāti vācaṃ tena lokāṃ abhi sarvān jayema ////
analyzed: saḥ ud śrayātai pra vadāti vācam tena lokān abhi sarvān jayema
translated: It rises up and speaks with a voice, by that may we conquer all the worlds.

original: sapta medhān paśavaḥ pary agṛhṇan ya eṣāṃ jyotiṣmāṃ uta yaś cakarśa /
analyzed: sapta medhān paśavaḥ pari agṛhṇan ye eṣām jyotiṣmān uta yaḥ cakarśa
translated: The cattle have seized the seven kinds of wisdom, he who shines among them and who has power.

original: trayastriṃśad devatās tānt sacante sa naḥ svargam abhi neṣa lokam ////
analyzed: trayastriṃśat devatāḥ tān sacante sa naḥ svargam abhi lokam
translated: The thirty-three gods attend upon him, he will lead us to the heavenly world.

original: svargaṃ lokam abhi no nayāsi saṃ jāyayā saha putraiḥ syāma /
analyzed: svargam lokam abhi naḥ nayāsi sam jāyayā saha putraiḥ syāma
translated: You lead us to the heavenly world, may we be united with our wife and sons.

original: gṛhṇāmi hastam anu maitv atra mā nas tārīn nirṛtir mo arātiḥ ////
analyzed: gṛhṇāmi hastam anu mā etu atra mā naḥ tārīt nirṛtiḥ mā u arātiḥ
translated: I grasp your hand, follow me here, let neither misfortune nor hostility overcome us.

original: grāhiṃ pāpmānam ati tāṃ ayāma tamo vy asya pra vadāsi valgu /
analyzed: grāhim pāpmānam ati tām ayāma tamaḥ vi asya pra vadāsi valgu
translated: We have passed beyond the grasping evil, we have spoken to thee, O darkness, in sweet tones.

original: vānaspatya udyato mā jihiṃsīr mā taṇḍulaṃ vi śarīr devayantam ////
analyzed: vānaspatyaḥ udyataḥ mā jihiṃsīḥ mā taṇḍulam vi śarīḥ devayantam
translated: Do not injure the rice-grain, O wooden mortar, which is devoted to the gods, do not crush it.

original: viśvavyacā ghṛtapṛṣṭho bhaviṣyant sayonir lokam upa yāhy etam /
analyzed: viśva vyacāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyan sa yoniḥ lokam upa yāhi etam
translated: Becoming one with the all-encompassing, with ghee as thy back, go to this world, to thy own birthplace.

original: varṣavṛddham upa yacha śūrpaṃ tuṣaṃ palāvān apa tad vinaktu ////
analyzed: varṣa vṛddham upa yaccha śūrpam tuṣam palāvān apa tat vinaktu
translated: Take up the winnowing basket which grows with the rain; may it remove the chaff and the straw.

original: trayo lokāḥ saṃmitā brāhmaṇena dyaur evāsau pṛthivy antarikṣam /
analyzed: trayaḥ lokāḥ saṃmitāḥ brāhmaṇena dyauḥ eva asau pṛthivī antarikṣam
translated: The three worlds are measured by the Brahman; this one is the heaven, this one is the earth, this one is the atmosphere.

original: aṃśūn gṛbhītvānvārabhethām ā pyāyantāṃ punar ā yantu śūrpam ////
analyzed: aṃśūn gṛbhītvā anvārabhethām ā pyāyantām punar ā yantu śūrpam
translated: Having grasped the shoots, touch them; may they swell again; may they return to the winnowing basket.

original: pṛthag rūpāṇi bahudhā paśūnām ekarūpo bhavasi saṃ samṛddhyā /
analyzed: pṛthak rūpāṇi bahudhā paśūnām eka rūpaḥ bhavasi sam samṛddhyā
translated: The forms of animals are many and various; thou art one in form, for the sake of prosperity.

original: etāṃ tvacaṃ lohinīṃ tāṃ nudasva grāvā śumbhāti malaga iva vastrā ////
analyzed: etām tvacam lohinīm tām nudasva grāvā śumbhāti malagaḥ iva vastrā
translated: Drive away this bloody skin; the stone polishes it like garments.

original: pṛthivīṃ tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi tanūḥ samānī vikṛtā ta eṣā /
analyzed: pṛthivīm tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi tanūḥ samānī vikṛtā te eṣā
translated: I place thee on the earth in the earth; the same body is deformed for thee.

original: yadyad dyuttaṃ likhitam arpaṇena tena mā susror brahmaṇāpi tad vapāmi ////
analyzed: yat yat dyuttam likhitam arpaṇena tena mā susroḥ brahmaṇā api tat vapāmi
translated: Whatever is lost, whatever is written down, whatever is taken away, by that I cut off thy hair with the Brahman of the good-looking one.

original: janitrīva prati haryāsi sūnuṃ saṃ tvā dadhāmi pṛthivīṃ pṛthivyā /
analyzed: janitrī iva prati haryāsi sūnum sam tvā dadhāmi pṛthivīm pṛthivyā
translated: As a mother to her son, so dost thou receive him. I unite thee, the earth, with the earth.

original: ukhā kumbhī vedyāṃ mā vyathiṣṭhā yajñāyudhair ājyenātiṣaktā ////
analyzed: ukhā kumbhī vedyām mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ yajñāyudhaiḥ ājyena atiṣaktā
translated: Do not be disquieted, O cauldron, in the altar, in the pan, with the sacrificial implements, with the ghee, with the oblation.

original: agniḥ pacan rakṣatu tvā purastād indro rakṣatu dakṣiṇato marutvān /
analyzed: agniḥ pacan rakṣatu tvā purastāt indraḥ rakṣatu dakṣiṇatas marutvān
translated: May Agni, cooking, protect thee from the east, may Indra with the Maruts protect thee from the south,

original: varuṇas tvā dṛṃhād dharuṇe pratīcyā uttarāt tvā somaḥ saṃ dadātai ////
analyzed: varuṇaḥ tvā dṛṃhāt dharuṇe pratīcyāḥ uttarāt tvā somaḥ sam dadātai
translated: may Varuna strengthen thee from the west, from the north may Soma give thee over.

original: pūtāḥ pavitraiḥ pavante abhrād divaṃ ca yanti pṛthivīṃ ca lokān /
analyzed: pūtāḥ pavitraiḥ pavante abhrāt divam ca yanti pṛthivīm ca lokān
translated: The pure ones are purified by the strainers, they go from the cloud to the sky and to the earth.

original: tā jīvalā jīvadhanyāḥ pratiṣṭhāḥ pātra āsiktāḥ pary agnir indhām ////
analyzed: tāḥ jīvalāḥ jīva dhanyāḥ pratiṣṭhāḥ pātre āsiktāḥ pari agniḥ indhām
translated: Those living, life-giving, supporting, filled with food, surrounded by fire, are the vessels.

original: ā yanti divaḥ pṛthivīṃ sacante bhūmyāḥ sacante adhy antarikṣam /
analyzed: ā yanti divaḥ pṛthivīm sacante bhūmyāḥ sacante adhi antarikṣam
translated: They come from the sky, they attend on the earth, they attend on the earth, they are above the atmosphere.

original: śuddhāḥ satīs tā u śumbhanta eva tā naḥ svargam abhi lokaṃ nayantu ////
analyzed: śuddhāḥ satīḥ tāḥ u śumbhante eva tāḥ naḥ svargam abhi lokam nayantu
translated: Being pure, they are indeed purified. May they lead us to the world of heaven.

original: uteva prabhvīr uta saṃmitāsa uta śukrāḥ śucayaś cāmṛtāsaḥ /
analyzed: uta iva prabhvīḥ uta saṃmitāsaḥ uta śukrāḥ śucayaḥ ca amṛtāsaḥ
translated: The powerful ones, the equal ones, the bright ones, the pure ones, and the immortal ones.

original: tā odanaṃ daṃpatibhyāṃ praśiṣṭā āpaḥ śikṣantīḥ pacatā sunāthāḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ odanam daṃpatibhyām praśiṣṭāḥ āpaḥ śikṣantīḥ pacata su nāthāḥ
translated: Those waters, commanded by the husband and wife, the well-protected ones, the ones who learn, are cooking the rice.

original: saṃkhyātā stokāḥ pṛthivīṃ sacante prāṇāpānaiḥ saṃmitā oṣadhībhiḥ /
analyzed: saṃkhyātāḥ stokāḥ pṛthivīm sacante prāṇa apānaiḥ saṃmitāḥ oṣadhībhiḥ
translated: The few drops that are measured fill the earth, equal to the in-breath and out-breath, to the plants.

original: asaṃkhyātā opyamānāḥ suvarṇāḥ sarvaṃ vyāpuḥ śucayaḥ śucitvam ////
analyzed: a saṃkhyātāḥ opyamānāḥ su varṇāḥ sarvam vyāpuḥ śucayaḥ śuci tvam
translated: The countless, poured, well-filled drops of gold have filled all with purity, with purity.

original: ud yodhanty abhi valganti taptāḥ phenam asyanti bahulāṃś ca bindūn /
analyzed: ud yodhanti abhi valganti taptāḥ phenam asyanti bahulān ca bindūn
translated: They rise up, they leap, they foam, the heated ones send forth many frothy drops.

original: yoṣeva dṛṣṭvā patim ṛtviyāyaitais taṇḍulair bhavatā sam āpaḥ ////
analyzed: yoṣā iva dṛṣṭvā patim ṛtviyāya etaiḥ taṇḍulaiḥ bhavata sam āpaḥ
translated: Like a woman seeing her husband at the right time, O waters, be united with these rice grains.

original: ut thāpaya sīdato budhna enān adbhir ātmānam abhi saṃ spṛśantām /🔽amāsi pātrair udakaṃ yad etan mitās taṇḍulāḥ pradiśo yadīmāḥ ////
analyzed: ud thāpaya sīdataḥ budhne enān adbhiḥ ātmānam abhi sam spṛśantām  amāsi pātraiḥ udakam yat etat mitāḥ taṇḍulāḥ pradiśaḥ yadi imāḥ
translated: Lift up those that are sinking, touch with water your own selves,🔽the water that is in these vessels, the measured rice grains, these quarters.

original: pra yacha parśuṃ tvarayā harausam ahiṃsanta oṣadhīr dāntu parvan /
analyzed: pra yaccha parśum tvarayā harausam a hiṃsantaḥ oṣadhīḥ dāntu parvan
translated: Throw down the axe, quickly sharpen it, do not injure the plants, let the joints be firm.

original: vāsāṃ somaḥ pari rājyaṃ babhūvāmanyutā no vīrudho bhavantu ////
analyzed: vāsām somaḥ pari rājyam babhūva amanyutāḥ naḥ vīrudhaḥ bhavantu
translated: May Soma rule over the garment, may the plants be free from anger for us.

original: navaṃ barhir odanāya stṛṇīta priyaṃ hṛdaś cakṣuṣo valgv astu /
analyzed: navam barhiḥ odanāya stṛṇīta priyam hṛdaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ valgu astu
translated: Strew fresh grass for the rice, let it be dear to the heart and pleasing to the eye.

original: tasmin devāḥ saha daivīr viśantv imaṃ prāśnantv ṛtubhir niṣadya ////
analyzed: tasmin devāḥ saha daivīḥ viśantu imam pra aśnantu ṛtubhiḥ niṣadya
translated: There let the gods enter with the divine people, let them sit down by the seasons and eat this.

original: vanaspate stīrṇam ā sīda barhir agniṣṭobhaiḥ saṃmito devatābhiḥ /
analyzed: vanaspate stīrṇam ā sīda barhiḥ agniṣṭobhaiḥ saṃmitaḥ devatābhiḥ
translated: O lord of the forest, sit on the strewn grass, measured by the Agniṣṭomas, united with the deities.

original: tvaṣṭreva rūpaṃ sukṛtaṃ svadhityainā ehāḥ pari pātre dadṛśrām ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭrā iva rūpam su kṛtam svadhityā enā ā īhāḥ pari pātre dadṛśrām
translated: Like Tvaṣṭṛ's well-fashioned form, we have seen these two in the pan, the male and female.

original: ṣaṣṭyāṃ śaratsu nidhipā abhīchāt svaḥ pakvenābhy aśnavātai /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭyām śaratsu nidhi pāḥ abhīchāt svar pakvena abhi aśnavātai
translated: For sixty autumns, as the guardian of treasures, he has looked upon the heaven. With the cooked (food) let us enjoy.

original: upainaṃ jīvān pitaraś ca putrā etaṃ svargaṃ gamayāntam agneḥ ////
analyzed: upa enam jīvān pitaraḥ ca putrāḥ etam svargam gamaya antam agneḥ
translated: To him let the living fathers and sons, as he is being led to heaven, follow this Agni.

original: dhartā dhriyasva dharuṇe pṛthivyā acyutaṃ tvā devatāś cyāvayantu /
analyzed: dhartā dhriyasva dharuṇe pṛthivyāḥ acyutam tvā devatāḥ cyāvayantu
translated: O supporter, stand firm on the earth's support. Let the deities unloose thee who art not to be shaken.

original: taṃ tvā daṃpatī jīvantau jīvaputrāv ud vāsayātaḥ pary agnidhānāt ////
analyzed: tam tvā daṃpatī jīvantau jīva putrau ud vāsayātaḥ pari agnidhānāt
translated: You two, the living husband and wife with living sons, should raise him up from the place where the fire is kept.

original: sarvānt samāgā abhijitya lokān yāvantaḥ kāmāḥ sam atītṛpas tān /🔽vi gāhethām āyavanaṃ ca darvir ekasmin pātre adhy ud dharainam ////
analyzed: sarvān samāgāḥ abhijitya lokān yāvantaḥ kāmāḥ sam atītṛpaḥ tān  vi gāhethām āyavanam ca darviḥ ekasmin pātre adhi ud hara enam
translated: Having conquered all the worlds and attained all desires,🔽you two should dig out the hollow and the ladle, and raise him up in one vessel.

original: upa stṛṇīhi prathaya purastād ghṛtena pātram abhi ghārayaitat /
analyzed: upa stṛṇīhi prathaya purastāt ghṛtena pātram abhi ghāraya etat
translated: Spread it out, extend it in front. Besprinkle this vessel with ghee.

original: vāśrevosrā taruṇaṃ stanasyum imaṃ devāso abhihiṅkṛṇota ////
analyzed: vāśrā iva usrā taruṇam stanasyum imam devāsaḥ abhihiṅkṛṇota
translated: Like a cow lowing to her calf, O gods, make him bellow.

original: upāstarīr akaro lokam etam uruḥ prathatām asamaḥ svargaḥ /
analyzed: upāstarīḥ akaraḥ lokam etam uruḥ prathatām asamaḥ svargaḥ
translated: He has made this world to be worshipped. Let heaven be wide and vast, unequalled.

original: tasmiṃ chrayātai mahiṣaḥ suparṇo devā enaṃ devatābhyaḥ pra yachān ////
analyzed: tasmin śrayātai mahiṣaḥ suparṇaḥ devāḥ enam devatābhyaḥ pra yacchān
translated: In that, may the bull, the good bird, the gods, bestow him on the deities.

original: yadyaj jāyā pacati tvat paraḥparaḥ patir vā jāye tvat tiraḥ /
analyzed: yat yat jāyā pacati tvat paras paras patiḥ vā jāye tvat tiras
translated: Whatever the wife cooks, you are beyond that, or the husband is beyond you.

original: saṃ tat sṛjethāṃ saha vāṃ tad astu saṃpādayantau saha lokam ekam ////🔽yāvanto asyāḥ pṛthivīṃ sacante asmat putrāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: sam tat sṛjethām saha vām tat astu saṃpādayantau saha lokam ekam  yāvantaḥ asyāḥ pṛthivīm sacante asmat putrāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ
translated: You two should unite that, and let it be yours. Uniting, you make one world.🔽As many as follow her on this earth, our sons who have come around her,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃ upa pātre hvayethāṃ nābhiṃ jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān ////
analyzed: sarvān tām upa pātre hvayethām nābhim jānānāḥ śiśavaḥ samāyān
translated: you two should call all of them to the vessel, the children knowing the navel, having come together.

original: vasor yā dhārā madhunā prapīnā ghṛtena miśrā amṛtasya nābhayaḥ /
analyzed: vasoḥ yāḥ dhārāḥ madhunā prapīnāḥ ghṛtena miśrāḥ amṛtasya nābhayaḥ
translated: The streams of wealth, filled with honey, mixed with ghee, the navel of immortality,

original: sarvās tā ava rundhe svargaḥ ṣaṣṭyāṃ śaratsu nidhipā abhīchāt ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ ava rundhe svar gaḥ ṣaṣṭyām śaratsu nidhi pāḥ abhīchāt
translated: all of them he holds back. Heaven, in sixty autumns, the lord of treasures has chosen.

original: nidhiṃ nidhipā abhy enam ichād anīśvarā abhitaḥ santu ye 'nye /
analyzed: nidhim nidhi pāḥ abhi enam ichāt anīśvarāḥ abhitas santu ye nye
translated: The lord of treasures has chosen him. Let those who are powerless be around him.

original: asmābhir datto nihitaḥ svargas tribhiḥ kāṇḍais trīnt svargān arukṣat ////
analyzed: asmābhiḥ dattaḥ nihitaḥ svar gaḥ tribhiḥ kāṇḍaiḥ trīn svargān arukṣat
translated: Given by us, heaven is placed. With three sections, he has ascended three heavens.

original: agnī rakṣas tapatu yad videvaṃ kravyād piśāca iha mā pra pāsta /🔽nudāma enam apa rudhmo asmad ādityā enam aṅgirasaḥ sacantām ////
analyzed: agniḥ rakṣaḥ tapatu yat videvam kravyād piśācaḥ iha mā pra pāsta  nudāmaḥ enam apa rudhmaḥ asmat ādityāḥ enam aṅgirasaḥ sacantām
translated: Let the fire burn the Rakshas, whatever is unfriendly, the flesh-devouring demon, let it not approach us here.🔽We drive it away, we shut it out from us. May the Adityas and the Angiras be with us.

original: ādityebhyo aṅgirobhyo madhv idaṃ ghṛtena miśraṃ prati vedayāmi /
analyzed: ādityebhyaḥ aṅgirobhyaḥ madhu idam ghṛtena miśram prati vedayāmi
translated: To the Adityas and the Angiras I offer this honey mixed with ghee.

original: śuddhahastau brāhmaṇasyānihatyaitaṃ svargaṃ sukṛtāv apītam ////
analyzed: śuddha hastau brāhmaṇasya a nihatya etam svargam su kṛtau apītam
translated: With pure hands, without injuring the Brahman, we have drunk this heavenly drink of the righteous.

original: idaṃ prāpam uttamaṃ kāṇḍam asya yasmāl lokāt parameṣṭhī samāpa /
analyzed: idam prāpam uttamam kāṇḍam asya yasmāt lokāt parameṣṭhī samāpa
translated: This is the highest part of him, from which world the Supreme Lord came.

original: ā siñca sarpir ghṛtavat sam aṅgdhy eṣa bhāgo aṅgiraso no atra ////
analyzed: ā siñca sarpiḥ ghṛtavat sam aṅgdhi eṣa bhāgaḥ aṅgirasaḥ naḥ atra
translated: Pour the ghee, like ghee, into it. This is our share here, O Angiras.

original: satyāya ca tapase devatābhyo nidhiṃ śevadhiṃ pari dadma etam /
analyzed: satyāya ca tapase devatābhyaḥ nidhim śevadhim pari dadmaḥ etam
translated: To truth, to penance, to the deities, we give this treasure, this wealth.

original: mā no dyūte 'va gān mā samityāṃ mā smānyasmā ut sṛjatā purā mat ////
analyzed: mā naḥ dyūte gāt mā samityām mā sma anyasmai ud sṛjata purā mat
translated: Do not lead us to gambling or to assembly, do not deliver us to any other than me.

original: ahaṃ pacāmy ahaṃ dadāmi mamed u karman karuṇe 'dhi jāyā /
analyzed: aham pacāmi aham dadāmi mama id u karman karuṇe dhi jāyā
translated: I cook, I give, this work is mine, O Karuna, this wife is mine.

original: kaumāro loko ajaniṣṭa putro 'nvārabhethāṃ vaya uttarāvat ////
analyzed: kaumāraḥ lokaḥ ajaniṣṭa putraḥ nu ārabhethām vayaḥ uttarāvat
translated: The world of the unmarried has been born as a son. You should follow it, as it is better for us.

original: na kilbiṣam atra nādhāro asti na yan mitraiḥ samamamāna eti /
analyzed: na kilbiṣam atra na ādhāraḥ asti na yat mitraiḥ samamamānaḥ eti
translated: There is no sin here, there is no support, when one goes to the equal one with friends.

original: anūnaṃ pātraṃ nihitaṃ na etat paktāraṃ pakvaḥ punar ā viśāti ////
analyzed: anūnam pātram nihitam naḥ etat paktāram pakvaḥ punar ā viśāti
translated: The vessel is not filled to overflowing, the cooked food does not return to the one who cooks it.

original: priyaṃ priyāṇāṃ kṛṇavāma tamas te yantu yatame dviṣanti /
analyzed: priyam priyāṇām kṛṇavāma tamaḥ te yantu yatame dviṣanti
translated: Let us make you dearer than the dear, let them go to him whom they hate.

original: dhenur anaḍvān vayovaya āyad eva pauruṣeyam apa mṛtyuṃ nudantu ////
analyzed: dhenuḥ anaḍvān vayaḥ vayaḥ āyat eva pauruṣeyam apa mṛtyum nudantu
translated: Let the cow, the bull, the young animal, the man, drive away death from you.

original: sam agnayaḥ vidur anyo anyaṃ ya oṣadhīḥ sacate yaś ca sindhūn /
analyzed: sam agnayaḥ viduḥ anyaḥ anyam yaḥ oṣadhīḥ sacate yaḥ ca sindhūn
translated: The fires know each other, those that dwell with the plants and those that dwell with the rivers.

original: yāvanto devā divy ātapanti hiraṇyaṃ jyotiḥ pacato babhūva ////
analyzed: yāvantaḥ devāḥ divi ātapanti hiraṇyam jyotiḥ pacataḥ babhūva  /
translated: As many gods as there are who shine in the sky, gold became the light of the cooked food.

original: eṣā tvacāṃ puruṣe saṃ babhūvānagnāḥ sarve paśavo ye anye /
analyzed: eṣā tvacām puruṣe sam babhūva anagnāḥ sarve paśavaḥ ye anye
translated: This was born in the skin of man, all other animals are without fire.

original: kṣatreṇātmānaṃ pari dhāpayātho 'motaṃ vāso mukham odanasya ////
analyzed: kṣatreṇa ātmānam pari dhāpaya atha u mā ūtam vāsaḥ mukham odanasya
translated: Cover yourselves with the sacrificial essence, the garment that is not woven, the face of the cooked food.

original: yad akṣeṣu vadā yat samityāṃ yad vā vadā anṛtaṃ vittakāmyā /
analyzed: yat akṣeṣu vadāḥ yat samityām yat vā vadāḥ anṛtam vitta kāmyā
translated: What you say at the dice, what you say at the assembly, or what you say falsely out of desire for wealth,

original: samānaṃ tantum abhi samvasānau tasmint sarvaṃ śamalaṃ sādayāthaḥ ////
analyzed: samānam tantum abhi samvasānau tasmin sarvam śamalam sādayāthaḥ
translated: dwelling together on the same thread, settle all your quarrels in that.

original: varṣaṃ vanuṣvāpi gacha devāṃs tvaco dhūmaṃ pary ut pātayāsi /
analyzed: varṣam vanuṣva api gacha devān tvacaḥ dhūmam pari ud pātayāsi
translated: Rain down, go to the gods, you are shaking off the smoke from the skin.

original: viśvavyacā ghṛtapṛṣṭho bhaviṣyant sayonir lokam upa yāhy etam ////
analyzed: viśva vyacāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhaḥ bhaviṣyan sa yoniḥ lokam upa yāhi etam
translated: Becoming one whose back is anointed with ghee, go to this world with your own birthplace.

original: tanvaṃ svargo bahudhā vi cakre yathā vida ātmann anyavarṇām /🔽apājait kṛṣṇāṃ ruśatīṃ punāno yā lohinī tāṃ te agnau juhomi ////
analyzed: tanvam svar gaḥ bahudhā vi cakre yathā vide ātman anya varṇām  apājait kṛṣṇām ruśatīm punānaḥ yā lohinī tām te agnau juhomi
translated: He has made the body of heaven manifold, as in the self of the one who knows, of different colors.🔽He has driven away the black, the tawny, the purified one, the red one, I offer her to you in the fire.

original: prācyai tvā diśe 'gnaye 'dhipataye 'sitāya rakṣitra ādityāyeṣumate /
analyzed: prācyai tvā diśe gnaye dhipataye sitāya rakṣitre ādityāya iṣumate
translated: To the eastern direction, to Agni as the overlord, to the black one as the protector, to the Adityas as the bearers of arrows.

original: etaṃ pari dadmas taṃ no gopāyatāsmākam aitoḥ /
analyzed: etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ
translated: We entrust this to you. May it protect us from here.

original: diṣṭaṃ no atra jarase ni neṣaj jarā mṛtyave pari ṇo dadātv atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: May it lead us to old age here. May old age give us to death. Then may we be together with the cooked one.

original: dakṣiṇāyai tvā diśa indrāyādhipataye tiraścirājaye rakṣitre yamāyeṣumate /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāyai tvā diśe indrāya adhipataye tiraścirājaye rakṣitre yamāya iṣumate
translated: To the southern direction, to Indra as the overlord, to the diagonal one as the protector, to Yama as the bearer of arrows.

original: etaṃ pari dadmas taṃ no gopāyatāsmākam aitoḥ /
analyzed: etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ
translated: We entrust this to you. May it protect us from here.

original: diṣṭaṃ no atra jarase ni neṣaj jarā mṛtyave pari ṇo dadātv atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: May it lead us to old age here. May old age give us to death. Then may we be together with the cooked one.

original: pratīcyai tvā diśe varuṇāyādhipataye pṛdākave rakṣitre 'nnāyeṣumate /
analyzed: pratīcyai tvā diśe varuṇāya adhipataye pṛdākave rakṣitre nnāya iṣumate
translated: To the western direction, to Varuna as the overlord, to the crooked one as the protector, to food as the bearer of arrows.

original: etaṃ pari dadmas taṃ no gopāyatāsmākam aitoḥ /
analyzed: etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ
translated: We entrust this to you. May it protect us from here.

original: diṣṭaṃ no atra jarase ni neṣaj jarā mṛtyave pari ṇo dadātv atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: Lead us to old age, to long life here. Let old age give us to Death. Then may we be united with the cooked (food).

original: udīcyai tvā diśe somāyādhipataye svajāya rakṣitre 'śanyā iṣumatyai /
analyzed: udīcyai tvā diśe somāya adhipataye svajāya rakṣitre śanyai iṣumatyai
translated: To the northern quarter, to Soma as overlord, to Svaja as guardian, to lightning with arrows.

original: etaṃ pari dadmas taṃ no gopāyatāsmākam aitoḥ /
analyzed: etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ
translated: We place him around. May he guard us from this.

original: diṣṭaṃ no atra jarase ni neṣaj jarā mṛtyave pari ṇo dadātv atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: Lead us to old age, to long life here. Let old age give us to Death. Then may we be united with the cooked (food).

original: dhruvāyai tvā diśe viṣṇave 'dhipataye kalmāṣagrīvāya rakṣitra oṣadhībhya iṣumatībhyaḥ /
analyzed: dhruvāyai tvā diśe viṣṇave dhipataye kalmāṣa grīvāya rakṣitre oṣadhībhyaḥ iṣumatībhyaḥ
translated: To the firm quarter, to Vishnu as overlord, to Kalmashapada as guardian, to the plants with arrows.

original: etaṃ pari dadmas taṃ no gopāyatāsmākam aitoḥ /
analyzed: etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ
translated: We place him around. May he guard us from this.

original: diṣṭaṃ no atra jarase ni neṣaj jarā mṛtyave pari ṇo dadātv atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema
translated: Lead us to old age, to long life here. Let old age give us to Death. Then may we be united with the cooked (food).

original: ūrdhvāyai tvā diśe bṛhaspataye 'dhipataye śvitrāya rakṣitre varṣāyeṣumate /
analyzed: ūrdhvāyai tvā diśe bṛhaspataye dhipataye śvitrāya rakṣitre varṣāya iṣumate
translated: To the upward quarter, to Brihaspati as overlord, to the white one as guardian, to rain with arrows.

original: etaṃ pari dadmas taṃ no gopāyatāsmākam aitoḥ /
analyzed: etam pari dadmaḥ tam naḥ gopāyata asmākam aitoḥ
translated: We place him around. May he guard us from this.

original: diṣṭaṃ no atra jarase ni neṣaj jarā mṛtyave pari ṇo dadātv atha pakvena saha saṃ bhavema ////
analyzed: diṣṭam naḥ atra jarase ni neṣat jarā mṛtyave pari naḥ dadātu atha pakvena saha sam bhavema  /
translated: Let fate lead us to old age, let old age give us to death. Then let us be united with the cooked food.

original: dadāmīty eva brūyād anu cainām abhutsata /🔽vaśāṃ brahmabhyo yācadbhyas tat prajāvad apatyavat ////
analyzed: dadāmi iti eva brūyāt anu ca enām abhutsata  vaśām brahmabhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ tat prajāvat apatyavat
translated: He should say I give, and should follow her with his mind.

original: prajayā sa vi krīṇīte paśubhiś copa dasyati /
analyzed: prajayā sa vi krīṇīte paśubhiḥ ca upa dasyati
translated: The cow, along with offspring and progeny, he should give to the Brahmins who ask for her.

original: ya ārṣeyebhyo yācadbhyo devānāṃ gāṃ na ditsati ////🔽kūṭayāsya saṃ śīryante śloṇayā kāṭam ardati /🔽baṇḍayā dahyante gṛhāḥ kāṇayā dīyate svam ////
analyzed: yaḥ ārṣeyebhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ devānām gām na ditsati  kūṭayā asya sam śīryante śloṇayā kāṭam ardati  baṇḍayā dahyante gṛhāḥ kāṇayā dīyate svam
translated: He who does not wish to give the cow of the gods to the Brahmins who ask for her,🔽His house is destroyed by the crooked one, is crushed by the lame one,🔽Is burnt by the crippled one, and his own is given by the one-eyed one.

original: vilohito adhiṣṭhānāc chakno vindati gopatim /
analyzed: vilohitaḥ adhiṣṭhānāt śaknaḥ vindati gopatim
translated: The red one finds the master of the cows from the place where it stands.

original: tathā vaśāyāḥ saṃvidyaṃ duradabhnā hy ucyase ////
analyzed: tathā vaśāyāḥ saṃvid yam duradabhnā hi ucyase
translated: In the same way, the cow is found, and you are called the one who has done a bad deed.

original: pador asyā adhiṣṭhānād viklindur nāma vindati /🔽anāmanāt saṃ śīryante yā mukhenopajighrati ////
analyzed: padoḥ asyāḥ adhiṣṭhānāt viklinduḥ nāma vindati  an āmanāt sam śīryante yāḥ mukhena upajighrati
translated: The one named Viklindur finds the cow from the place where it stands.🔽Those who smell her with their mouths, their houses are destroyed.

original: yo asyāḥ karṇāv āskunoty ā sa deveṣu vṛścate /
analyzed: yaḥ asyāḥ karṇau āskunoti ā sa deveṣu vṛścate
translated: He who pricks her ears is cut off from the gods.

original: lakṣma kurva iti manyate kanīyaḥ kṛṇute svam ////
analyzed: lakṣma kurve iti manyate kanīyaḥ kṛṇute svam
translated: Thinking he makes a mark, he makes his own smaller.

original: yad asyāḥ kasmai cid bhogāya bālān kaś cit prakṛntati /
analyzed: yat asyāḥ kasmai cit bhogāya bālān kaḥ cit prakṛntati
translated: If someone cuts off her teats for the enjoyment of someone else,

original: tataḥ kiśorā mriyante vatsāṃś ca ghātuko vṛkaḥ ////
analyzed: tatas kiśorāḥ mriyante vatsān ca ghātukaḥ vṛkaḥ
translated: then the young ones die, and the wolf kills the calves.

original: yad asyā gopatau satyā loma dhvāṅkṣo ajīhiḍat /
analyzed: yat asyāḥ gopatau satyāḥ loma dhvāṅkṣaḥ ajīhiḍat
translated: If a crow pecks at her hair when she is the wife of a cowherd,

original: tataḥ kumārā mriyante yakṣmo vindaty anāmanāt ////
analyzed: tatas kumārāḥ mriyante yakṣmaḥ vindati anāmanāt
translated: then the young men die, and consumption finds an opening.

original: yad asyāḥ palpūlanaṃ śakṛd dāsī samasyati /
analyzed: yat asyāḥ palpūlanam śakṛt dāsī samasyati
translated: If a servant girl mixes her dung with water for cleaning,

original: tato 'parūpaṃ jāyate tasmād avyeṣyad enasaḥ ////
analyzed: tatas parūpam jāyate tasmāt avyeṣyat enasaḥ
translated: then something different is born, and from that she is to be avoided.

original: jāyamānābhi jāyate devānt sabrāhmaṇān vaśā /
analyzed: jāyamānā abhi jāyate devān sa brāhmaṇān vaśā
translated: When a cow is born, she is born for the gods and Brahmins.

original: tasmād brahmabhyo deyaiṣā tad āhuḥ svasya gopanam ////
analyzed: tasmāt brahmabhyaḥ deyā eṣā tat āhuḥ svasya gopanam
translated: Therefore, she should be given to Brahmins. That is said to be her own protection.

original: ya enāṃ vanim āyanti teṣāṃ devakṛtā vaśā /
analyzed: ye enām vanim āyanti teṣām deva kṛtā vaśā
translated: Those who come to her as a bride, for them the cow is made by the gods.

original: brahmajyeyaṃ tad abruvan ya enāṃ nipriyāyate ////
analyzed: brahmajyeyam tat abruvan yaḥ enām nipriyāyate
translated: They say that is the Brahmins' share, for one who takes her away.

original: ya ārṣeyebhyo yācadbhyo devānāṃ gāṃ na ditsati /
analyzed: yaḥ ārṣeyebhyaḥ yācadbhyaḥ devānām gām na ditsati
translated: He who does not wish to give the cow of the gods to the Rishis who ask for it,

original: ā sa deveṣu vṛścate brāhmaṇānāṃ ca manyave ////
analyzed: ā sa deveṣu vṛścate brāhmaṇānām ca manyave
translated: he is cut off among the gods and in the minds of the Brahmins.

original: yo asya syād vaśābhogo anyām icheta tarhi saḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ asya syāt vaśā bhogaḥ anyām icheta tarhi saḥ
translated: If he who has a cow as his share should desire another, then he

original: hiṃste adattā puruṣaṃ yācitāṃ ca na ditsati ////
analyzed: hiṃste adattā puruṣam yācitām ca na ditsati
translated: harms the man who has not given, and does not wish to give to the supplicant.

original: yathā śevadhir nihito brāhmaṇānāṃ tathā vaśā /
analyzed: yathā śevadhiḥ nihitaḥ brāhmaṇānām tathā vaśā
translated: As a cow is placed for the Brahmanas, so is a barren cow.

original: tām etad achāyanti yasmin kasmiṃś ca jāyate ////
analyzed: tām etat achāyanti yasmin kasmin ca jāyate
translated: They follow that (cow) wherever it is born.

original: svam etad achāyanti yad vaśāṃ brāhmaṇā abhi /
analyzed: svam etat achāyanti yat vaśām brāhmaṇāḥ abhi
translated: They follow their own (cow), when the Brahmanas approach a barren cow.

original: yathainān anyasmin jinīyād evāsyā nirodhanam ////
analyzed: yathā enān anyasmin jinīyāt eva asyāḥ nirodhanam
translated: As if one should conquer it in another, so is its restraint.

original: cared evā traihāyaṇād avijñātagadā satī /
analyzed: caret evā traihāyaṇāt a vijñāta gadā satī
translated: One should move away, after three years, when it is unknown to be sick.

original: vaśāṃ ca vidyān nārada brāhmaṇās tarhy eṣyāḥ ////
analyzed: vaśām ca vidyāt nārada brāhmaṇāḥ tarhi eṣyāḥ
translated: And one should know the barren cow, Narada, the Brahmanas should come then.

original: ya enām avaśām āha devānāṃ nihitaṃ nidhim /
analyzed: yaḥ enām avaśām āha devānām nihitam nidhim
translated: He who says of her that she is not a barren cow, the treasure of the gods,

original: ubhau tasmai bhavāśarvau parikramyeṣum asyataḥ ////
analyzed: ubhau tasmai bhavāśarvau parikramya iṣum asyataḥ
translated: For him both Bhava and Sarva, having gone around, shoot an arrow.

original: yo asyā ūdho na vedātho asyā stanān uta /
analyzed: yaḥ asyāḥ ūdhaḥ na veda atha u asyāḥ stanān uta
translated: He who does not know her udder, nor her teats,

original: ubhayenaivāsmai duhe dātuṃ ced aśakad vaśām ////🔽duradabhnainam ā śaye yācitāṃ ca na ditsati /
analyzed: ubhayena eva asmai duhe dātum ced aśakat vaśām  duradabhnā enam ā śaye yācitām ca na ditsati
translated: With both (hands) he milks for him, if he is able to give the barren cow.🔽He lies down for him who is difficult to appease, and does not wish to give what is asked for.

original: nāsmai kāmāḥ sam ṛdhyante yām adattvā cikīrṣati ////
analyzed: na asmai kāmāḥ sam ṛdhyante yām a dattvā cikīrṣati
translated: His desires are not fulfilled, if he wishes to do without giving.

original: devā vaśām ayācan mukhaṃ kṛtvā brāhmaṇam /
analyzed: devāḥ vaśām ayācan mukham kṛtvā brāhmaṇam
translated: The gods asked for the barren cow, making the Brahmana their mouth.

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣām adadad dheḍaṃ ny eti mānuṣaḥ ////
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām adadat ha iḍam ni eti mānuṣaḥ
translated: Of all of them he gives the he-goat, the human goes down.

original: heḍaṃ paśūnāṃ ny eti brāhmaṇebhyo 'dadad vaśām /
analyzed: heḍam paśūnām ni eti brāhmaṇebhyaḥ dadat vaśām
translated: He goes down with the he-goat of the cattle, who does not give the barren cow to the Brahmanas.

original: devānāṃ nihitaṃ bhāgaṃ martyaś cen nipriyāyate ////
analyzed: devānām nihitam bhāgam martyaḥ ced nipriyāyate
translated: If a mortal should go to them, having taken away the share set apart for the gods.

original: yad anye śataṃ yāceyur brāhmaṇā gopatiṃ vaśām /
analyzed: yat anye śatam yāceyuḥ brāhmaṇāḥ gopatim vaśām
translated: If other Brahmins should ask for a hundred cows from the owner of cows,

original: athaināṃ devā abruvann evaṃ ha viduṣo vaśā ////
analyzed: atha enām devāḥ abruvan evam ha viduṣaḥ vaśā
translated: Then the gods said to the cow, So indeed is the cow for one who knows this.

original: ya evaṃ viduṣe 'dattvāthānyebhyo dadad vaśām /
analyzed: yaḥ evam viduṣe dattvā atha anyebhyaḥ dadat vaśām
translated: If one, having not given to one who knows this, then gives the cow to others,

original: durgā tasmā adhiṣṭhāne pṛthivī sahadevatā ////
analyzed: durgā tasmai adhiṣṭhāne pṛthivī saha devatā
translated: From that cow, the earth with its deities, becomes difficult to approach for him.

original: devā vaśām ayācan yasminn agre ajāyata /
analyzed: devāḥ vaśām ayācan yasmin agre ajāyata
translated: The gods asked for the cow from him in whom she was first born.

original: tām etāṃ vidyān nāradaḥ saha devair ud ājata ////
analyzed: tām etām vidyāt nāradaḥ saha devaiḥ ud ājata
translated: Narada knew this, and she was born together with the gods.

original: anapatyam alpapaśuṃ vaśā kṛṇoti pūruṣam /
analyzed: anapatyam alpa paśum vaśā kṛṇoti pūruṣam
translated: The cow makes a man without children and with few cattle.

original: brāhmaṇaiś ca yācitām athaināṃ nipriyāyate ////
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ ca yācitām atha enām nipriyāyate
translated: And if she is asked for by Brahmins, then he goes to them with a cow.

original: agnīṣomābhyāṃ kāmāya mitrāya varuṇāya ca /
analyzed: agnīṣomābhyām kāmāya mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translated: For Agni, Soma, for desire, for Mitra, and for Varuna,

original: tebhyo yācanti brāhmaṇās teṣv ā vṛścate 'dadat ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ yācanti brāhmaṇāḥ teṣu ā vṛścate dadat
translated: For them the Brahmins ask, and he who does not give to them is cut off.

original: yāvad asyā gopatir nopaśṛṇuyād ṛcaḥ svayam /🔽cared asya tāvad goṣu nāsya śrutvā gṛhe vaset ////
analyzed: yāvat asyāḥ gopatiḥ na upaśṛṇuyāt ṛcaḥ svayam  caret asya tāvat goṣu na asya śrutvā gṛhe vaset
