translated: As long as the owner of the cows does not hear the hymns himself,🔽For that long he should wander among the cows. Having heard them, he should not stay in his house.

original: yo asyā ṛca upaśrutyātha goṣv acīcarat /
analyzed: yaḥ asyāḥ ṛcaḥ upaśrutya atha goṣu acīcarat
translated: If he wanders among the cows after hearing the hymns,

original: āyuś ca tasya bhūtiṃ ca devā vṛścanti hīḍitāḥ ////
analyzed: āyuḥ ca tasya bhūtim ca devāḥ vṛścanti hīḍitāḥ
translated: The gods, being offended, cut off his life and prosperity.

original: vaśā carantī bahudhā devānāṃ nihito nidhiḥ /🔽āviṣ kṛṇuṣva rūpāṇi yadā sthāma jighāṃsati ////
analyzed: vaśā carantī bahudhā devānām nihitaḥ nidhiḥ  āvis kṛṇuṣva rūpāṇi yadā sthāma jighāṃsati
translated: The cow, wandering in many ways, is the treasure laid up of the gods.🔽When she is about to kill the bull, she reveals her forms.

original: āvir ātmānaṃ kṛṇute yadā sthāma jighāṃsati /
analyzed: āvis ātmānam kṛṇute yadā sthāma jighāṃsati
translated: Then she reveals herself when she is about to kill the bull.

original: atho ha brahmabhyo vaśā yāñcyāya kṛṇute manaḥ ////
analyzed: atha u ha brahmabhyaḥ vaśā kṛṇute manaḥ
translated: And then the cow turns her mind to the Brahmans to beg for them.

original: manasā saṃ kalpayati tad devāṃ api gachati /
analyzed: manasā sam kalpayati tat devān api gacchati
translated: With her mind she forms the idea, and then she goes to the gods.

original: tato ha brahmāṇo vaśām upaprayanti yācitum ////
analyzed: tatas ha brahmāṇaḥ vaśām upaprayanti yācitum
translated: Then the Brahmans come to the cow to beg for her.

original: svadhākāreṇa pitṛbhyo yajñena devatābhyaḥ /
analyzed: svadhākāreṇa pitṛbhyaḥ yajñena devatābhyaḥ
translated: By the Svâhâ she goes to the Fathers, by the sacrifice to the deities,

original: dānena rājanyo vaśāyā mātur heḍam na gachati ////
analyzed: dānena rājanyaḥ vaśāyāḥ mātuḥ heḍam na gacchati
translated: By the gift the Râganya does not incur the displeasure of the mother, the cow.

original: vaśā mātā rājanyasya tathā saṃbhūtam agraśaḥ /
analyzed: vaśā mātā rājanyasya tathā saṃbhūtam agraśas
translated: The cow is the mother of the Râganya, and so it is from her that he is born.

original: tasyā āhur anarpaṇaṃ yad brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate ////
analyzed: tasyāḥ āhuḥ an arpaṇam yat brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate
translated: They say that it is not a loss when she is given to the Brahmans.

original: yathājyaṃ pragṛhītam ālumpet sruco agnaye /
analyzed: yathā ājyam pragṛhītam ālumpet srucaḥ agnaye
translated: As one might snatch away the ghee that is held in the ladles for Agni,

original: evā ha brahmabhyo vaśām agnaya ā vṛścate 'dadat ////
analyzed: eva ha brahmabhyaḥ vaśām agnaye ā vṛścate dadat
translated: So does the cow snatch away the Râganya who does not give her to the Brahmans.

original: puroḍāśavatsā sudughā loke 'smā upa tiṣṭhati /🔽sāsmai sarvān kāmān vaśā pradaduṣe duhe ////
analyzed: puroḍāśa vat sā sudughā loke smaḥ upa tiṣṭhati  sā asmai sarvān kāmān vaśā pradaduṣe duhe
translated: The cow, whose calf is the sacrificial cake, yields milk in this world.🔽That cow yields all desires to him who gives her away.

original: sarvān kāmān yamarājye vaśā pradaduṣe duhe /
analyzed: sarvān kāmān yama rājye vaśā pradaduṣe duhe
translated: The cow yields all desires to him who gives her away in Yama's kingdom.

original: athāhur nārakaṃ lokaṃ nirundhānasya yācitām ////
analyzed: atha āhuḥ nārakam lokam nirundhānasya yācitām
translated: Then they say, For one who conceals the solicited cow, he goes to the world of hell.

original: pravīyamānā carati kruddhā gopataye vaśā /🔽vehataṃ mā manyamāno mṛtyoḥ pāśeṣu badhyatām ////
analyzed: pravīyamānā carati kruddhā gopataye vaśā  vehatam mā manyamānaḥ mṛtyoḥ pāśeṣu badhyatām
translated: The cow, when being milked, moves about angrily for the owner.🔽Thinking, It is killed, let him not be bound in the snares of death.

original: yo vehataṃ manyamāno 'mā ca pacate vaśām /
analyzed: yaḥ vehatam manyamānaḥ mā ca pacate vaśām
translated: He who, thinking, It is killed, cooks the cow that is not slaughtered,

original: apy asya putrān pautrāṃś ca yācayate bṛhaspatiḥ ////
analyzed: api asya putrān pautrān ca yācayate bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Even his sons and grandsons does Brihaspati beg.

original: mahad eṣāva tapati carantī goṣu gaur api /
analyzed: mahat eṣā ava tapati carantī goṣu gauḥ api
translated: This great one shines, moving among the cows as a cow. Even so.

original: atho ha gopataye vaśādaduṣe viṣaṃ duhe ////
analyzed: atha u ha gopataye vaśā daduṣe viṣam duhe
translated: Then for the cow-owner who has not harmed the cow, it yields poison.

original: priyaṃ paśūnāṃ bhavati yad brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate /
analyzed: priyam paśūnām bhavati yat brahmabhyaḥ pradīyate
translated: It becomes dear to the cattle when it is given to the Brahmins.

original: atho vaśāyās tat priyaṃ yad devatrā haviḥ syāt ////
analyzed: atha u vaśāyāḥ tat priyam yat devatrā haviḥ syāt
translated: Then that is dear to the cow, if the offering is for the gods.

original: yā vaśā udakalpayan devā yajñād udetya /
analyzed: yāḥ vaśāḥ udakalpayan devāḥ yajñāt udetya
translated: Those cows which the gods appointed to rise up from the sacrifice,

original: tāsāṃ viliptyaṃ bhīmām udākuruta nāradaḥ ////
analyzed: tāsām viliptyam bhīmām udākuruta nāradaḥ
translated: Of them Narada made the most smeared one rise up, the terrible one.

original: tāṃ devā amīmāṃsanta avaśeti /
analyzed: tām devāḥ amīmāṃsanta avaśā iti
translated: The gods pondered over her, saying, She is not a cow.

original: tām abravīn nārada eṣā vaśānāṃ vaśatameti ////
analyzed: tām abravīt nāradaḥ eṣā vaśānām vaśatam eti
translated: Narada said to her, This is the most cow-like of cows.

original: kati nu vaśā nārada yās tvaṃ vettha manuṣyajāḥ /
analyzed: kati nu vaśāḥ nārada yāḥ tvam vettha manuṣya jāḥ
translated: How many cows, O Narada, do you know among men?

original: tās tvā pṛchāmi vidvāṃsaṃ kasyā nāśnīyād abrāhmaṇaḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvā pṛcchāmi vidvāṃsam kasyāḥ na aśnīyāt abrāhmaṇaḥ
translated: We ask you, the wise one, whose (milk) should a non-Brahmin not drink?

original: viliptyā bṛhaspate yā ca sūtavaśā vaśā /
analyzed: viliptyāḥ bṛhaspate yā ca sūta vaśā vaśā
translated: O Brihaspati, the Vilīptī, the Sūtavasā, and the Vāśā,

original: tasyā nāśnīyād abrāhmaṇo ya āśaṃseta bhūtyām ////
analyzed: tasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ yaḥ āśaṃseta bhūtyām
translated: A non-Brahmin should not eat of her, he who hopes for prosperity.

original: namas te astu nāradānuṣṭhu viduṣe vaśā /
analyzed: namaḥ te astu nārada anuṣṭhu viduṣe vaśā
translated: Homage to you, O Narada, the knower of the Vāśā.

original: katamāsāṃ bhīmatamā yām adattvā parābhavet ////
analyzed: katamāsām bhīmatamā yām a dattvā parābhavet
translated: Which of them is the most terrible, not giving which one would be defeated?

original: viliptī yā bṛhaspate 'tho sūtavaśā vaśā /
analyzed: viliptī yā bṛhaspate sūtavaśā vaśā
translated: The Vilīptī, O Brihaspati, and the Sūtavasā, and the Vāśā,

original: tasyā nāśnīyād abrāhmaṇo ya āśaṃseta bhūtyām ////
analyzed: tasyāḥ na aśnīyāt a brāhmaṇaḥ yaḥ āśaṃseta bhūtyām
translated: A non-Brahmin should not eat of her, he who hopes for prosperity.

original: trīṇi vai vaśājātāni viliptī sūtavaśā vaśā /
analyzed: trīṇi vai vaśā jātāni viliptī sūta vaśā vaśā
translated: There are three kinds of Vāśā born, the Vilīptī, the Sūtavasā, and the Vāśā.

original: tāḥ pra yached brahmabhyaḥ so 'nāvraskaḥ prajāpatau ////
analyzed: tāḥ pra yacchet brahmabhyaḥ saḥ na avraskaḥ prajāpatau
translated: One should offer them to the Brahmins, that is the non-offense in Prajāpati.

original: etad vo brāhmaṇā havir iti manvīta yācitaḥ /
analyzed: etat vaḥ brāhmaṇāḥ haviḥ iti manvīta yācitaḥ
translated: One should think, This is your offering, O Brahmins, if asked.

original: vaśāṃ ced enaṃ yāceyur yā bhīmādaduṣo gṛhe ////
analyzed: vaśām ced enam yāceyuḥ yā bhīma adaduṣaḥ gṛhe
translated: If they ask him for a Vāśā, which terrible one in the house of the giver.

original: devā vaśāṃ pary avadan na no 'dād iti hīḍitāḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ vaśām pari avadan na naḥ dāt iti hīḍitāḥ
translated: The gods reproached the Vāśā, saying, She does not give to us.

original: etābhir ṛgbhir bhedaṃ tasmād vai sa parābhavat ////
analyzed: etābhiḥ ṛgbhiḥ bhedam tasmāt vai sa parābhavat
translated: By these verses she was split, therefore she was defeated.

original: utaināṃ bhedo nādadād vaśām indreṇa yācitaḥ /
analyzed: uta enām bhedaḥ na adadāt vaśām indreṇa yācitaḥ
translated: And the splitter did not give the Vāśā, when asked by Indra.

original: tasmāt taṃ devā āgaso 'vṛścann ahamuttare ////
analyzed: tasmāt tam devāḥ āgasaḥ vṛścan aham uttare
translated: Therefore the gods cut him off in the offense, I am the better.

original: ye vaśāyā adānāya vadanti parirāpiṇaḥ /
analyzed: ye vaśāyāḥ a dānāya vadanti parirāpiṇaḥ
translated: Those who speak as slanderers for the non-giving of the Vāśā,

original: indrasya manyave jālmā ā vṛścante acittyā ////
analyzed: indrasya manyave jālmā ā vṛścante acittyā
translated: The deceitful ones cut off the anger of Indra with their evil thoughts.

original: ye gopatiṃ parāṇīyāthāhur mā dadā iti /
analyzed: ye gopatim parāṇīya atha āhuḥ mā dadai iti
translated: Those who, having taken away the lord of cows, then say, Do not give it,

original: rudrasyāstāṃ te hetīṃ pari yanty acittyā ////
analyzed: rudrasya astām te hetīm pari yanti acittyā
translated: They go around Rudra's weapon with their evil thoughts.

original: yadi hutaṃ yady ahutām amā ca pacate vaśām /
analyzed: yadi hutam yadi a hutām amā ca pacate vaśām
translated: If one cooks a barren cow, whether offered or not offered,

original: devānt sabrāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmo lokān nir ṛchati ////
analyzed: devān sa brāhmaṇān ṛtvā jihmaḥ lokān niḥ ṛchati
translated: Having offended the gods and the Brahmins, the crooked one goes out of the worlds.

original: śrameṇa tapasā sṛṣṭā brahmaṇā vittā rte śritā ////
analyzed: śrameṇa tapasā sṛṣṭā brahmaṇā vittā ṛte śritā
translated: Created by penance and austerity, supported by Brahman, found by knowledge.

original: satyenāvṛtā śriyā prāvṛtā yaśasā parīvṛtā ////
analyzed: satyena āvṛtā śriyā prāvṛtā yaśasā parīvṛtā
translated: Surrounded by truth, covered by glory, encompassed by fame.

original: svadhayā parihitā śraddhayā paryūḍhā dīkṣayā guptā yajñe pratiṣṭhitā loko nidhanam ////
analyzed: svadhayā parihitā śraddhayā paryūḍhā dīkṣayā guptā yajñe pratiṣṭhitā lokaḥ nidhanam
translated: Protected by one's own nature, filled with faith, guarded by initiation, established in the sacrifice, the world is the final goal.

original: brahma padavāyaṃ brāhmaṇo 'dhipatiḥ ////
analyzed: brahma padavāyam brāhmaṇaḥ dhipatiḥ
translated: Brahman is the foundation, the Brahmin is the lord.

original: tām ādadānasya brahmagavīṃ jinato brāhmaṇaṃ kṣatriyasya ////🔽apa krāmati sūnṛtā vīryaṃ punyā lakṣmīḥ ////
analyzed: tām ādadānasya brahma gavīm jinataḥ brāhmaṇam kṣatriyasya  apa krāmati sūnṛtā vīryam punyā lakṣmīḥ
translated: For a Kshatriya who takes away that Brahman cow and kills the Brahmin,🔽Truth, heroism, merit, and prosperity depart.

original: ojaś ca tejaś ca sahaś ca balaṃ ca vāk cendriyaṃ ca śrīś ca dharmaś ca ////
analyzed: ojaḥ ca tejaḥ ca sahaḥ ca balam ca vāc ca indriyam ca śrīḥ ca dharmaḥ ca
translated: Vitality, splendor, strength, power, speech, sense, glory, and righteousness -

original: brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca rāṣṭraṃ ca viśaś ca tviṣiś ca yaśaś ca varcaś ca draviṇaṃ ca ////
analyzed: brahma ca kṣatram ca rāṣṭram ca viśaḥ ca tviṣiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca varcaḥ ca draviṇam ca
translated: Brahman, Kshatriya, kingdom, Vaishyas, splendor, fame, glory, wealth,

original: āyuś ca rūpaṃ ca nāma ca kīrtiś ca prāṇaś cāpānaś ca cakṣuś ca śrotraṃ ca ////
analyzed: āyuḥ ca rūpam ca nāma ca kīrtiḥ ca prāṇaḥ ca apānaḥ ca cakṣuḥ ca śrotram ca
translated: life, form, name, fame, inhalation, exhalation, sight, hearing,

original: payaś ca rasaś cānnaṃ cānnādyaṃ ca rtaṃ ca satyaṃ ceṣṭaṃ ca pūrtaṃ ca prajā ca paśavaś ca ////
analyzed: payaḥ ca rasaḥ ca annam ca annādyam ca ṛtam ca satyam ca iṣṭam ca pūrtam ca prajā ca paśavaḥ ca
translated: milk, taste, food, food and drink, truth, righteousness, fulfillment, offspring, cattle,

original: tāni sarvāṇy apa krāmanti brahmagavīm ādadānasya jinato brāhmaṇaṃ kṣatriyasya ////
analyzed: tāni sarvāṇi apa krāmanti brahma gavīm ādadānasya jinataḥ brāhmaṇam kṣatriyasya
translated: all these depart when a Kshatriya takes away a Brahman's cow, when he conquers a Brahman.

original: saiṣā bhīmā brahmagavy aghaviṣā sākṣāt kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā ////
analyzed: sā eṣā bhīmā brahma gavī agha viṣā sākṣāt kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā
translated: This terrible Brahman's cow is poison to sin, it is Death herself, wrapped in a turban.

original: sarvāṇy asyāṃ ghorāṇi sarve ca mṛtyavaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvāṇi asyām ghorāṇi sarve ca mṛtyavaḥ
translated: All horrors are in her, and all deaths.

original: sarvāṇy asyāṃ krūrāṇi sarve puruṣavadhāḥ ////
analyzed: sarvāṇi asyām krūrāṇi sarve puruṣa vadhāḥ
translated: All cruelties are in her, and all murders of men.

original: sā brahmajyaṃ devapīyuṃ brahmagavy ādīyamānā mṛtyoḥ padvīṣa ā dyati ////
analyzed: sā brahmajyam deva pīyum brahma gavī ādīyamānā mṛtyoḥ padvī iṣe ā dyati
translated: When taken away, this Brahman's cow kills the Brahman's sacrificer, the god-despiser, and throws him into the paths of Death.

original: meniḥ śatavadhā hi sā brahmajyasya kṣitir hi sā ////
analyzed: meniḥ śata vadhā hi sā brahmajyasya kṣitiḥ hi sā
translated: For she is a hundredfold snare, she is the ground of the Brahman's sacrificer.

original: tasmād vai brāhmaṇānāṃ gaur durādharṣā vijānatā ////
analyzed: tasmāt vai brāhmaṇānām gauḥ durādharṣā vijānatā
translated: Therefore, a cow of the Brahmanas is hard to overcome, if one knows.

original: vajro dhāvantī vaiśvānara udvītā ////
analyzed: vajraḥ dhāvantī vaiśvānaraḥ udvītā
translated: The thunderbolt is the running, Vaiṣvânara the leaping.

original: hetiḥ śaphān utkhidantī mahādevo 'pekṣamāṇā ////
analyzed: hetiḥ śaphān utkhidantī
translated: The weapon is the shaking off of the hoofs, the great god the looking on.

original: kṣurapavir īkṣamāṇā vāśyamānābhi sphūrjati ////
analyzed: kṣura paviḥ īkṣamāṇā vāśyamānā abhi sphūrjati
translated: The razor-edge is the looking on, the hissing the roaring.

original: mṛtyur hiṅkṛṇvaty ugro devaḥ puchaṃ paryasyantī ////
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ hiṅkṛṇvatī ugraḥ devaḥ pucham paryasyantī
translated: Death is the bellowing, the fierce god the shaking of the tail.

original: sarvajyāniḥ karṇau varīvarjayantī rājayakṣmo mehantī ////🔽menir duhyamānā śīrṣaktir dugdhā ////🔽sedir upatiṣṭhantī mithoyodhaḥ parāmṛṣṭā ////
analyzed: sarva jyāniḥ karṇau varīvarjayantī rājayakṣmaḥ mehantī  meniḥ duhyamānā śīrṣaktiḥ dugdhā  sediḥ upatiṣṭhantī mithoyodhaḥ parāmṛṣṭā
translated: All-destroyer is the rubbing of the ears, the consumptive disease the passing water.🔽The tumour is the milking, the head-disease the milked.🔽The lameness is the standing, the mutual fighting the seizing.

original: śaravyā mukhe 'pinahyamāna ṛtir hanyamānā ////
analyzed: śaravyā mukhe pinahyamānaḥ ṛtiḥ hanyamānā
translated: The arrow is the putting to the mouth, the injury the striking.

original: aghaviṣā nipatantī tamo nipatitā ////
analyzed: agha viṣā nipatantī tamaḥ nipatitā
translated: The poison is the falling, the darkness the fallen.

original: anugachantī prāṇān upa dāsayati brahmagavī brahmajyasya ////
analyzed: anugacchantī prāṇān upa dāsayati brahma gavī brahmajyasya
translated: The cow of prayer, following, makes the sacrificer's life submit to her.

original: vairaṃ vikṛtyamānā pautrādyaṃ vibhājyamānā ////
analyzed: vairam vikṛtyamānā pautra adyam vibhājyamānā
translated: The enmity is the tearing, the division of the grandsons the dividing.

original: devahetir hriyamāṇā vyṛddhir hṛtā ////🔽pāpmādhidhīyamānā pāruṣyam avadhīyamānā ////🔽viṣaṃ prayasyantī takmā prayastā ////
analyzed: deva hetiḥ hriyamāṇā vyṛddhiḥ hṛtā  pāpmā adhidhīyamānā pāruṣyam avadhīyamānā  viṣam prayasyantī takmā prayastā
translated: The weapon of the gods is the carrying off, the failure the carried off.🔽The sin is the putting on, the harshness the putting on.🔽The poison is the striving, the consumption the striven.

original: aghaṃ pracyamānā duṣvapnyaṃ pakvā ////
analyzed: agham pracyamānā duṣvapnyam pakvā
translated: The sin is the cooking, the bad dream the cooked.

original: mūlabarhaṇī paryākriyamāṇā kṣitiḥ paryākṛtā ////
analyzed: mūla barhaṇī paryākriyamāṇā kṣitiḥ paryākṛtā
translated: The earth, when being ploughed, is ploughed.

original: asaṃjñā gandhena śug uddhriyamāṇāśīviṣa uddhṛtā ////
analyzed: asaṃjñā gandhena śuc uddhriyamāṇā āśīviṣaḥ uddhṛtā
translated: The snake, when being drawn out by smell, is drawn out.

original: abhūtir upahriyamāṇā parābhūtir upahṛtā ////
analyzed: abhūtiḥ upahriyamāṇā parābhūtiḥ upahṛtā
translated: The defeat, when being offered, is offered.

original: śarvaḥ kruddhaḥ piśyamānā śimidā piśitā ////🔽avartir aśyamānā nirṛtir aśitā ////
analyzed: śarvaḥ kruddhaḥ piśyamānā śimidā piśitā  avartiḥ aśyamānā nirṛtiḥ aśitā
translated: The flesh, when being chewed, is chewed.🔽The food, when being eaten, is eaten.

original: aśitā lokāc chinatti brahmagavī brahmajyam asmāc cāmuṣmāc ca ////
analyzed: aśitā lokāt chinatti brahma gavī brahmajyam asmāt ca amuṣmāt ca
translated: The cow of Brahman, when eaten, cuts off the sacrificer of Brahman from this world and the next.

original: tasyā āhananaṃ kṛtyā menir āśasanaṃ valaga ūbadhyam ////
analyzed: tasyāḥ āhananam kṛtyā meniḥ āśasanam valagaḥ ūbadhyam
translated: Her striking, witchcraft, malice, sorcery, and the stake are her bonds.

original: asvagatā parihṇutā ////
analyzed: asvagatā parihṇutā
translated: She is ungoing, and is thrown away.

original: agniḥ kravyād bhūtvā brahmagavī brahmajyaṃ praviśyātti ////
analyzed: agniḥ kravyād bhūtvā brahma gavī brahmajyam praviśya atti
translated: Fire, becoming a flesh-eater, enters the sacrificer of Brahman and eats him.

original: sarvāsyāṅgā parvā mūlāni vṛścati ////
analyzed: sarvā asya aṅgā parvā mūlāni vṛścati
translated: She cuts off all his limbs, joints, and roots.

original: chinatty asya pitṛbandhu parā bhāvayati mātṛbandhu ////
analyzed: chinatti asya pitṛ bandhu parā bhāvayati mātṛ bandhu
translated: She cuts off his paternal relatives and destroys his maternal relatives.

original: vivāhāṃ jñātīnt sarvān api kṣāpayati brahmagavī brahmajyasya kṣatriyeṇāpunardīyamānā ////
analyzed: vivāhām jñātīn sarvān api kṣāpayati brahma gavī brahmajyasya kṣatriyeṇa apunardīyamānā
translated: The cow of Brahman, when not given back by a Kshatriya, destroys all the relatives of the sacrificer of Brahman.

original: avāstum enam asvagam aprajasaṃ karoty aparāparaṇo bhavati kṣīyate ////
analyzed: avāstum enam asvagam aprajasam karoti aparāparaṇaḥ bhavati kṣīyate
translated: She makes him homeless, ungoing, and childless. He becomes one who goes nowhere and is destroyed.

original: ya evaṃ viduṣo brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyo gām ādatte //// 🔽kṣipraṃ vai tasyāhanane gṛdhrāḥ kurvata ailabam ////
analyzed: yaḥ evam viduṣaḥ brāhmaṇasya kṣatriyaḥ gām ādatte  kṣipram vai tasya āhanane gṛdhrāḥ kurvate ailabam
translated: If a Kshatriya takes a cow from a Brahmin who knows this,🔽Swiftly vultures make a nest for him.

original: kṣipraṃ vai tasyādahanaṃ pari nṛtyanti keśinīr āghnānāḥ pāṇinorasi kurvāṇāḥ pāpam ailabam ////
analyzed: kṣipram vai tasya ādahanam pari nṛtyanti keśinīḥ āghnānāḥ pāṇinā urasi kurvāṇāḥ pāpam ailabam
translated: Swiftly the dancing girls, beating their breasts, dance around his funeral pyre, making a nest of evil for him.

original: kṣipraṃ vai tasya vāstuṣu vṛkāḥ kurvata ailabam ////
analyzed: kṣipram vai tasya vāstuṣu vṛkāḥ kurvate ailabam
translated: Swiftly wolves make a nest for him in his house.

original: kṣipraṃ vai tasya pṛchanti yat tad idaṃ nu iti ////
analyzed: kṣipram vai tasya pṛcchanti yat tat idam nu iti
translated: Swiftly they ask him, What is this?

original: chindhy ā chindhi pra chindhy api kṣāpaya kṣāpaya ////
analyzed: chindhi ā chindhi pra chindhi api kṣāpaya kṣāpaya
translated: Cut, cut, cut off, cut off, destroy, destroy!

original: ādadānam āṅgirasi brahmajyam upa dāsaya ////
analyzed: ādadānam āṅgirasi brahmajyam upa dāsaya
translated: O descendant of Angiras, bring down the one who seizes the sacrificial fee of a Brahmin!

original: vaiśvadevī hy ucyase kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā ////
analyzed: vaiśvadevī hi ucyase kṛtyā kūlbajam āvṛtā
translated: For you are called the weapon of the Visve Devas, wrapped in a turban.

original: oṣantī samoṣantī brahmaṇo vajraḥ ////
analyzed: oṣantī samoṣantī brahmaṇaḥ vajraḥ
translated: The thunderbolt of the Brahmin, burning, burning together,

original: kṣurapavir mṛtyur bhūtvā vi dhāva tvam ////
analyzed: kṣura paviḥ mṛtyuḥ bhūtvā vi dhāva tvam
translated: Becoming a razor-edged death, run away!

original: ā datse jinatāṃ varca iṣṭaṃ pūrtaṃ cāśiṣaḥ ////
analyzed: ā datse jinatām varcaḥ iṣṭam pūrtam ca āśiṣaḥ
translated: You give the winner glory, desired fulfillment, and blessings.

original: ādāya jītaṃ jītāya loke 'muṣmin pra yachasi ////
analyzed: ādāya jītam jītāya loke muṣmin pra yacchasi
translated: Having won, you bestow what is won upon the winner in that world.

original: aghnye padavīr bhava brāhmaṇasyābhiśastyā ////
analyzed: aghnye padavīḥ bhava brāhmaṇasya abhiśastyā
translated: O cow, be the path for the Brahmin who is cursed!

original: meniḥ śaravyā bhavāghād aghaviṣā bhava ////
analyzed: meniḥ śaravyā bhava aghāt agha viṣā bhava
translated: From the fear of arrows, from the sin of sin, from the poison of poison, be thou harmless to me.

original: aghnye pra śiro jahi brahmajyasya kṛtāgaso devapīyor arādhasaḥ ////
analyzed: aghnye pra śiraḥ jahi brahmajyasya kṛta āgasaḥ deva pīyoḥ arādhasaḥ
translated: O harmless one, strike off the head of him who injures the Brahman, the sinner, the one who has offended the gods, the one who has done wrong.

original: tvayā pramūrṇaṃ mṛditam agnir dahatu duścitam ////
analyzed: tvayā pramūrṇam mṛditam agniḥ dahatu duścitam
translated: What has been torn by thee, what has been crushed, let Agni burn the ill-done.

original: vṛśca pra vṛśca saṃ vṛśca daha pra daha saṃ daha ////
analyzed: vṛśca pra vṛśca sam vṛśca daha pra daha sam daha
translated: Cut, cut off, cut together, burn, burn up, burn together.

original: brahmajyaṃ devy aghnya ā mūlād anusaṃdaha ////
analyzed: brahmajyam devi aghnye ā mūlāt anusaṃdaha
translated: The Brahman-eater, O harmless goddess, burn him from the root, the sinner, the one who has offended the gods, the one who has done wrong.

original: yathāyād yamasādanāt pāpalokān parāvataḥ ////
analyzed: yathā yāt yama sādanāt pāpa lokān parāvataḥ
translated: As he may go away from Yama's abode, from the evil worlds, to the farthest distance,

original: evā tvaṃ devy aghnye brahmajyasya kṛtāgaso devapīyor arādhasaḥ ////
analyzed: eva tvam devi aghnye brahmajyasya kṛta āgasaḥ deva pīyoḥ arādhasaḥ
translated: Even so thou, O harmless goddess, the Brahman-eater, the sinner, the one who has offended the gods, the one who has done wrong,

original: vajreṇa śataparvaṇā tīkṣṇena kṣurabhṛṣṭinā ////
analyzed: vajreṇa śata parvaṇā tīkṣṇena kṣura bhṛṣṭinā
translated: With the hundred-knotted thunderbolt, sharp as a razor's edge,

original: pra skandhān pra śiro jahi ////🔽lomāny asya saṃ chindhi tvacam asya vi veṣṭaya ////
analyzed: pra skandhān pra śiraḥ jahi  lomāni asya sam chinddhi tvacam asya vi veṣṭaya
translated: Cut off his limbs, cut off his head.🔽Cut off his hair, unroll his skin,🔽Tear his flesh, tear out his entrails,

original: māṃsāny asya śātaya snāvāny asya saṃ vṛha ////🔽asthīny asya pīḍaya majjānam asya nir jahi ////
analyzed: māṃsāni asya śātaya snāvāni asya sam vṛha  asthīni asya pīḍaya majjānam asya niḥ jahi
translated: Crush his bones, drive out his marrow.

original: sarvāsyāṅgā parvāṇi vi śrathaya ////
analyzed: sarvā asya aṅgā parvāṇi vi śrathaya
translated: Loosen all his joints and limbs.

original: agnir enaṃ kravyāt pṛthivyā nudatām ud oṣatu vāyur antarikṣān mahato varimṇaḥ ////
analyzed: agniḥ enam kravyād pṛthivyāḥ nudatām ud oṣatu vāyuḥ antarikṣāt mahataḥ varimṇaḥ
translated: May Agni, the devourer, drive him from the earth; may Vayu drive him from the great expanse of the atmosphere.

original: sūrya enaṃ divaḥ pra ṇudatāṃ ny oṣatu //// 🔽udehi vājin yo apsv antar idaṃ rāṣṭraṃ pra viśa sūnṛtāvat /🔽yo rohito viśvam idaṃ jajāna sa tvā rāṣṭrāya subhṛtaṃ bibhartu ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ enam divaḥ pra nudatām ni oṣatu  udehi vājin yaḥ apsu antar idam rāṣṭram pra viśa sūnṛtāvat  yaḥ rohitaḥ viśvam idam jajāna sa tvā rāṣṭrāya su bhṛtam bibhartu
translated: May Surya drive him from the sky; may he be driven away downward.🔽Rise up, O steed, who art in the waters; enter this kingdom, full of joy.🔽The red one who has produced all this, may he support thee well-born for the kingdom.

original: ud vāja ā gan yo apsv antar viśa ā roha tvadyonayo yāḥ /
analyzed: ud vājaḥ ā gan yaḥ apsu antar viśaḥ ā roha tvad yonayaḥ yāḥ
translated: Rise up, O wealth, who art in the waters; ascend the people, whose womb thou art.

original: somaṃ dadhāno 'pa oṣadhīr gāś catuṣpado dvipada ā veśayeha ////
analyzed: somam dadhānā u paḥ oṣadhīḥ gāḥ catuṣpadaḥ dvipadaḥ ā veśaya iha
translated: Bearing Soma, the waters, the plants, and the cattle, both four-footed and two-footed, bring them hither.

original: yūyam ugrā marutaḥ pṛśnimātara indreṇa yujā pra mṛṇīta śatrūn /
analyzed: yūyam ugrāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ indreṇa yujā pra mṛṇīta śatrūn
translated: Ye fierce Maruts, born of different mothers, crush the enemies with Indra as your ally.

original: ā vo rohitaḥ śṛṇavat sudānavas triṣaptāso marutaḥ svādusaṃmudaḥ ////
analyzed: ā vaḥ rohitaḥ śṛṇavat sudānavaḥ triṣaptāsaḥ marutaḥ svādu saṃmudaḥ
translated: May the red one listen to you, O bountiful ones, the Maruts with Trisaptas, with sweet union.

original: ruho ruroha rohita ā ruroha garbho janīnāṃ januṣām upastham /
analyzed: ruhaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ ā ruroha garbhaḥ janīnām januṣām upastham
translated: The red one has risen, has risen up; the embryo has risen up to the lap of the women who bring forth.

original: tābhiḥ saṃrabdham anv avindan ṣaḍ urvīr gātuṃ prapaśyann iha rāṣṭram āhāḥ ////
analyzed: tābhiḥ saṃrabdham anu avindan ṣaḍ urvīḥ gātum prapaśyan iha rāṣṭram āhār
translated: With them he has risen up; they have found him united with the six broad expanses. Looking to the path, he has declared the kingdom here.

original: ā te rāṣṭram iha rohito 'hārṣīd vy āsthan mṛdho abhayaṃ te abhūt /
analyzed: ā te rāṣṭram iha rohitaḥ hārṣīt vi āsthan mṛdhaḥ abhayam te abhūt
translated: The red one has brought thy kingdom hither; the foes are scattered; thou hast become fearless.

original: tasmai te dyāvāpṛthivī revatībhiḥ kāmaṃ duhātām iha śakvarībhiḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai te dyāvāpṛthivī revatībhiḥ kāmam duhātām iha śakvarībhiḥ
translated: For thee may Heaven and Earth, with their abundant treasures, with their Shakvari treasures, here yield the wish.

original: rohito dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna tatra tantuṃ parameṣṭhī tatāna /
analyzed: rohitaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna tatra tantum parameṣṭhī tatāna
translated: The red one hath brought forth Heaven and Earth; there the highest lord hath stretched the thread.

original: tatra śiśriye 'ja ekapādo 'dṛṃhad dyāvāpṛthivī balena ////🔽rohito dyāvāpṛthivī adṛṃhat tena sva stabhitaṃ tena nākaḥ /
analyzed: tatra śiśriye jaḥ eka pādaḥ dṛṃhat dyāvāpṛthivī balena  rohitaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī adṛṃhat tena svar stabhitam tena nākaḥ
translated: There the one-footed sheep hath settled down; with strength he hath established Heaven and Earth.🔽The red one hath established Heaven and Earth; thereby the heaven is fixed, thereby the firmament.

original: tenāntarikṣaṃ vimitā rajāṃsi tena devā amṛtam anv avindan ////
analyzed: tena antarikṣam vimitā rajāṃsi tena devāḥ amṛtam anu avindan
translated: Thereby the regions of the air are measured; thereby the gods have found the immortal.

original: vi rohito amṛśad viśvarūpaṃ samākurvāṇaḥ praruho ruhaś ca /
analyzed: vi rohitaḥ amṛśat viśva rūpam samākurvāṇaḥ praruhaḥ ruhaḥ ca
translated: The red one hath touched the all-formed one, the growing and the grown,

original: divaṃ rūḍhvā mahatā mahimnā saṃ te rāṣṭram anaktu payasā ghṛtena ////
analyzed: divam rūḍhvā mahatā mahimnā sam te rāṣṭram anaktu payasā ghṛtena
translated: having mounted the sky with great majesty. May he anoint thy kingdom with milk and ghee.

original: yās te ruhaḥ praruho yās ta āruho yābhir āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam /
analyzed: yāḥ te ruhaḥ praruhaḥ yāḥ te āruhaḥ yābhiḥ āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam
translated: Thy shoots, thy growing shoots, thy shoots that grow up, wherewith thou fillest heaven and the atmosphere,

original: tāsāṃ brahmaṇā payasā vavṛdhāno viśi rāṣṭre jāgṛhi rohitasya ////
analyzed: tāsām brahmaṇā payasā vavṛdhānaḥ viśi rāṣṭre jāgṛhi rohitasya
translated: increasing with the milk of their holy power, watch thou in the people and the kingdom of the red one.

original: yas te viśas tapasaḥ saṃbabhūvur vatsaṃ gāyatrīm anu tā ihāguḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te viśaḥ tapasaḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ vatsam gāyatrīm anu tāḥ iha aguḥ
translated: Thy people which have sprung from the heat, they have come hither following the calf Gayatri.

original: tās tvā viśantu manasā śivena saṃmātā vatso abhy etu rohitaḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvā viśantu manasā śivena sam mātā vatsaḥ abhī etu rohitaḥ
translated: May they enter thee with a friendly mind. Let the mother and the red calf come to thee.

original: ūrdhvo rohito adhi nāke asthād viśvā rūpāṇi janayan yuvā kaviḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ rohitaḥ adhi nāke asthāt viśvā rūpāṇi janayan yuvā kaviḥ
translated: The red one hath risen up in the sky, the young, the wise, begetting all forms.

original: tigmenāgnir jyotiṣā vi bhāti tṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi ////
analyzed: tigmena agniḥ jyotiṣā vi bhāti tṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi
translated: With his sharp light Agni shines, in the third heaven, in the region, his dear ones.

original: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabho jātavedā ghṛtāhutaḥ somapṛṣṭhaḥ suvīraḥ /
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jātavedāḥ ghṛta āhutaḥ soma pṛṣṭhaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: The thousand-peaked bull, the all-knower, offered with ghee, with Soma for his back, with good heroes,

original: mā mā hāsīn nāthito net tvā jahāni gopoṣaṃ ca me vīrapoṣaṃ ca dhehi ////
analyzed: mā mā hāsīt nāthitaḥ na id tvā jahāni go poṣam ca me vīra poṣam ca dhehi
translated: let him not forsake me when I implore him, let me not forsake him. Give me increase of cattle and increase of heroes.

original: rohito yajñasya janitā mukhaṃ ca rohitāya vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi /
analyzed: rohitaḥ yajñasya janitā mukham ca rohitāya vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi
translated: The red one is the begetter of the sacrifice and its mouth. To the red one I offer with speech, with hearing, with mind.

original: rohitaṃ devā yanti sumanasyamānāḥ sa mā rohaiḥ sāmityai rohayatu ////
analyzed: rohitam devāḥ yanti sumanasyamānāḥ sa mā rohaiḥ sāmityaiḥ rohayatu
translated: The gods go to the red one, well-disposed. May he raise me up with the red ones for prosperity.

original: rohito yajñaṃ vy adadhād viśvakarmaṇe tasmāt tejāṃsy upa memāny āguḥ /
analyzed: rohitaḥ yajñam vi adadhāt viśvakarmaṇe tasmāt tejāṃsi upa mā imāni āguḥ
translated: The red one set the sacrifice in order for Viśvakarman. Therefore these lights have come to me.

original: voceyaṃ te nābhiṃ bhuvanasyādhi majmani ////
analyzed: voceyam te nābhim bhuvanasya adhi majmani
translated: I will tell thee the navel of the world in the middle.

original: ā tvā ruroha bṛhaty uta paṅktir ā kakub varcasā jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā ruroha bṛhatī uta paṅktiḥ ā kakubh varcasā jātavedaḥ
translated: The Brihatī, the Paṅkti, the Kakubh have mounted on thee, O all-knower, for radiance.

original: ā tvā rurohoṣṇihākṣaro vaṣaṭkāra ā tvā ruroha rohito retasā saha ////
analyzed: ā tvā ruroha uṣṇihā akṣaraḥ vaṣaṭkāraḥ ā tvā ruroha rohitaḥ retasā saha
translated: The Uṣṇīkṣa metre with its syllables has mounted thee, the Vaṣaṭ call has mounted thee, the red (horse) has mounted thee with seed.

original: ayaṃ vaste garbhaṃ pṛthivyā divaṃ vaste 'yam antarikṣam /
analyzed: ayam vaste garbham pṛthivyāḥ divam vaste yam antarikṣam
translated: He clothes the embryo of the earth, he clothes the sky, he clothes this atmosphere.

original: ayaṃ bradhnasya viṣṭapi svar lokān vy ānaśe ////
analyzed: ayam bradhnasya viṣṭapi svar lokān vi ānaśe
translated: He has distributed the heavenly worlds in the spread of the sun.

original: vācas pate pṛthivī naḥ syonā syonā yonis talpā naḥ suśevā /
analyzed: vācaḥ pate pṛthivī naḥ syonā syonā yoniḥ talpā naḥ su śevā
translated: O lord of speech, may the earth be kindly to us, may the kindly womb, the hearth, be kindly to us.

original: ihaiva prāṇaḥ sakhye no astu taṃ tvā parameṣṭhin pary agnir āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu ////
analyzed: iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari agniḥ āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu
translated: May our life be here with our friends. O supreme lord, may Agni endow thee with life and splendour.

original: vācas pata ṛtavaḥ pañca ye nau vaiśvakarmaṇāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ /
analyzed: vācaḥ pate ṛtavaḥ pañca ye nau vaiśvakarmaṇāḥ pari ye saṃbabhūvuḥ
translated: O lord of speech, may the five seasons which have been created by Viśvakarman for us,

original: ihaiva prāṇaḥ sakhye no astu taṃ tvā parameṣṭhin pari rohita āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu ////
analyzed: iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari rohitaḥ āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu
translated: May our life be here with our friends. O supreme lord, may the red (horse) endow thee with life and splendour.

original: vācas pate saumanasaṃ manaś ca goṣṭhe no gā janaya yoniṣu prajāḥ /
analyzed: vācaḥ pate saumanasam manaḥ ca goṣṭhe naḥ gāḥ janaya yoniṣu prajāḥ
translated: O lord of speech, create in our cowpen joy and mind, and in the wombs, offspring.

original: ihaiva prāṇaḥ sakhye no astu taṃ tvā parameṣṭhin pary aham āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu ////
analyzed: iha eva prāṇaḥ sakhye naḥ astu tam tvā parameṣṭhin pari aham āyuṣā varcasā dadhātu
translated: May our life be here with our friends. O supreme lord, may I endow thee with life and splendour.

original: pari tvā dhāt savitā devo agnir varcasā mitrāvaruṇāv abhi tvā /
analyzed: pari tvā dhāt savitā devaḥ agniḥ varcasā mitrāvaruṇau abhi tvā
translated: May the god Savitr, Agni, and Mitra-Varuṇa endow thee with splendour.

original: sarvā arātīr avakrāmann ehīdaṃ rāṣṭram akaraḥ sunṛtāvat ////
analyzed: sarvāḥ arātīḥ avakrāman ehi idam rāṣṭram akaraḥ su nṛtāvat
translated: Approaching all enemies, come hither. Thou hast made this kingdom full of good words.

original: yaṃ tvā pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭir vahati rohita /
analyzed: yam tvā pṛṣatī rathe praṣṭiḥ vahati rohita
translated: The spotted one that draws thee on the chariot, the red one,

original: śubhā yāsi riṇann apaḥ ////
analyzed: śubhā yāsi riṇan apaḥ
translated: Thou goest to the waters, O auspicious one.

original: anuvratā rohiṇī rohitasya sūriḥ suvarṇā bṛhatī suvarcāḥ /
analyzed: anuvratā rohiṇī rohitasya sūriḥ su varṇā bṛhatī su varcāḥ
translated: The ruddy one, the follower of the red one, the leader, golden, great, of good radiance,

original: tayā vājān viśvarūpāṃ jayema tayā viśvāḥ pṛtanā abhi ṣyāma ////
analyzed: tayā vājān viśva rūpām jayema tayā viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhi syāma
translated: By her may we win the riches of all forms, by her may we conquer all the battles.

original: idaṃ sado rohiṇī rohitasyāsau panthāḥ pṛṣatī yena yāti /
analyzed: idam sadaḥ rohiṇī rohitasya asau panthāḥ pṛṣatī yena yāti
translated: This is the seat of the ruddy one, the red one, that spotted one by which he goes,

original: tāṃ gandharvāḥ kaśyapā un nayanti tāṃ rakṣanti kavayo 'pramādam ////
analyzed: tām gandharvāḥ kaśyapāḥ ud nayanti tām rakṣanti kavayaḥ pramādam
translated: The Gandharvas, the Kashyapas lead her forth, the wise ones guard her without heedlessness.

original: sūryasyāśvā harayaḥ ketumantaḥ sadā vahanty amṛtāḥ sukhaṃ ratham /
analyzed: sūryasya aśvāḥ harayaḥ ketumantaḥ sadā vahanti amṛtāḥ sukham ratham
translated: The red horses of Surya, the tawny ones, the ones with banners, always draw the immortal, pleasant chariot.

original: ghṛtapāvā rohito bhrājamāno divaṃ devaḥ pṛṣatīm ā viveśa ////
analyzed: ghṛta pāvā rohitaḥ bhrājamānaḥ divam devaḥ pṛṣatīm ā viveśa
translated: The ghee-drinking red one, shining, the god, entered the sky, the spotted one.

original: yo rohito vṛṣabhas tigmaśṛṅgaḥ pary agniṃ pari sūryaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: yaḥ rohitaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ pari agnim pari sūryam babhūva
translated: The red one, the bull, with sharp horns, who has become around the fire, around the sun,

original: yo viṣṭabhnāti pṛthivīṃ divaṃ ca tasmād devā adhi sṛṣṭīḥ sṛjante ////
analyzed: yaḥ viṣṭabhnāti pṛthivīm divam ca tasmāt devāḥ adhi sṛṣṭīḥ sṛjante
translated: Who supports the earth and the sky, from him the gods create the beings.

original: rohito divam āruhan mahataḥ pary arṇavāt /
analyzed: rohitaḥ divam āruhat mahataḥ pari arṇavāt
translated: The red one has ascended the sky from the great ocean.

original: sarvo ruroha rohito ruhaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ ruhaḥ
translated: All the red one has risen, the rising one.

original: vi mimīṣva payasvatīṃ ghṛtācīṃ devānāṃ dhenur anapaspṛg eṣā /
analyzed: vi mimīṣva payasvatīm ghṛtācīm devānām dhenuḥ anapaspṛś eṣā
translated: Do thou, O Agni, extend the stream of ghee, the milch-cow of the gods has not been withheld.

original: indraḥ somaṃ pibatu kṣemo astv agniḥ pra stautu vi mṛdho nudasva ////
analyzed: indraḥ somam pibatu kṣemaḥ astu agniḥ pra stautu vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva
translated: Let Indra drink the Soma, let there be peace, let Agni praise, drive away the enemies.

original: samiddho agniḥ samidhāno ghṛtavṛddho ghṛtāhutaḥ /
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ samidhānaḥ ghṛta vṛddhaḥ ghṛta āhutaḥ
translated: Agni is kindled, well-kindled, increased with ghee, offered with ghee.

original: abhīṣāṭ viśvāṣāḍ agniḥ sapatnān hantu ye mama ////
analyzed: abhīṣāh viśvāṣāh agniḥ sapatnān hantu ye mama
translated: Agni is the protector from all, the destroyer of enemies. May he slay my enemies.

original: hantv enān pra dahatv arir yo naḥ pṛtanyati /🔽kravyādāgninā vayaṃ sapatnān pra dahāmasi ////
analyzed: hantu enān pra dahatu ariḥ yaḥ naḥ pṛtanyati  kravyādā agninā vayam sapatnān pra dahāmasi
translated: Let him slay them, let the enemy burn him who fights against us.🔽With the flesh-eating Agni we burn up our enemies.

original: avācīnān ava jahīndra vajreṇa bāhumān /🔽adhā sapatnān māmakān agnes tejobhir ādiṣi ////
analyzed: avācīnān ava jahi indra vajreṇa bāhumān  adha sapatnān māmakān agneḥ tejobhiḥ ādiṣi
translated: O Indra, with thy thunderbolt, cast down the enemies who are below us.🔽With the flames of Agni I consume my enemies.

original: agne sapatnān adharān pādayāsmad vyathayā sajātam utpipānaṃ bṛhaspate /
analyzed: agne sapatnān adharān pādaya asmat vyathaya sajātam utpipānam bṛhaspate
translated: O Agni, cast down our enemies to the lowest place. O Brihaspati, crush the enemy who thirsts for us.

original: indrāgnī mitrāvaruṇāv adhare padyantām apratimanyūyamānāḥ ////
analyzed: indra agnī mitrāvaruṇau adhare padyantām apratimanyūyamānāḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, O Mitra and Varuna, may they fall lower and lower, not to be pitied.

original: udyaṃs tvaṃ deva sūrya sapatnān ava me jahi /
analyzed: udyan tvam deva sūrya sapatnān ava me jahi
translated: O god Surya, rising, slay my enemies for me.

original: avainān aśmanā jahi te yantv adhamaṃ tamaḥ ////
analyzed: ava enān aśmanā jahi te yantu adhamam tamaḥ
translated: Slay them with the stone, let them go to the lowest darkness.

original: vatso virājo vṛṣabho matīnām ā ruroha śukrapṛṣṭho 'ntarikṣam /
analyzed: vatsaḥ virājaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ matīnām ā ruroha śukra pṛṣṭhaḥ ntarikṣam
translated: The calf of Virāj, the bull of thoughts, with a bright back has ascended the atmosphere.

original: ghṛtenārkam abhy arcanti vatsaṃ brahma santaṃ brahmaṇā vardhayanti ////
analyzed: ghṛtena arkam abhi arcanti vatsam brahma santam brahmaṇā vardhayanti
translated: With ghee they worship the sun, the calf, they exalt with holy power the holy power that exists.

original: divaṃ ca roha pṛthivīṃ ca roha rāṣṭraṃ ca roha draviṇaṃ ca roha /
analyzed: divam ca roha pṛthivīm ca roha rāṣṭram ca roha draviṇam ca roha
translated: Ascend the heaven, ascend the earth, ascend the kingdom, ascend the wealth.

original: prajāṃ ca rohāmṛtaṃ ca roha rohitena tanvaṃ saṃ spṛṣasva ////
analyzed: prajām ca roha amṛtam ca roha rohitena tanvam sam spṛṣasva
translated: Ascend the people, ascend immortality, with the red one touch your body.

original: ye devā rāṣṭrabhṛto 'bhito yanti sūryam /
analyzed: ye devāḥ rāṣṭra bhṛtaḥ bhitas yanti sūryam
translated: The gods who support the kingdom, who go around the sun,

original: taiṣ ṭe rohitaḥ samvidāno rāṣṭraṃ dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ ////
analyzed: taiḥ te rohitaḥ samvidānaḥ rāṣṭram dadhātu sumanasyamānaḥ
translated: with them may the red one, in agreement, grant you the kingdom, well-disposed.

original: ut tvā yajñā brahmapūtā vahanty adhvagato harayas tvā vahanti /
analyzed: ud tvā yajñāḥ brahma pūtāḥ vahanti adhva gataḥ harayaḥ tvā vahanti
translated: The sacrifices, purified by holy power, carry you, the tawny ones carry you to the path.

original: tiraḥ samudram ati rocase 'rṇavam ////
analyzed: tiras samudram ati rocase rṇavam
translated: You shine across the ocean, across the flood.

original: rohite dyāvāpṛthivī adhi śrite vasujiti gojiti saṃdhanājiti /
analyzed: rohite dyāvāpṛthivī adhi śrite vasu jiti go jiti saṃdhanājiti
translated: O red one, you are supported on heaven and earth, in the conquest of wealth, in the conquest of cattle, in the conquest of goods.

original: sahasraṃ yasya janimāni sapta ca voceyaṃ te nābhiṃ bhuvanasyādhi majmani ////
analyzed: sahasram yasya janimāni sapta ca voceyam te nābhim bhuvanasya adhi majmani
translated: I will tell of your navel, of your seven thousand births, in the middle of the world.

original: yaśā yāsi pradiśo diśaś ca yaśāḥ paśūnām uta carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: yaśāḥ yāsi pradiśaḥ diśaḥ ca yaśāḥ paśūnām uta carṣaṇīnām
translated: You who go in glory to the quarters and the directions, in glory of the cattle and of the people,

original: yaśāḥ pṛthivyā adityā upasthe 'haṃ bhūyāsaṃ saviteva cāruḥ ////
analyzed: yaśāḥ pṛthivyāḥ adityāḥ upasthe ham bhūyāsam savitā iva cāruḥ
translated: May I be famous on earth, in the lap of Aditi, as beautiful as Savita.

original: amutra sann iha vetthetaḥ saṃs tāni paśyasi /
analyzed: amutra san iha vettha itas san tāni paśyasi
translated: You know him who is there, or here, or yonder. You see those things.

original: itaḥ paśyanti rocanaṃ divi sūryaṃ vipaścitam ////
analyzed: itas paśyanti rocanam divi sūryam vipaścitam
translated: From here they behold the light, the sun in the sky, the wise one.

original: devo devān marcayasy antaś carasy arṇave /
analyzed: devaḥ devān marcayasi antar carasi arṇave
translated: You, O god, think of the gods. You move within the ocean.

original: samānam agnim indhate taṃ viduḥ kavayaḥ pare ////
analyzed: samānam agnim indhate tam viduḥ kavayaḥ pare
translated: They kindle the common fire. The wise ones know him.

original: avaḥ pareṇa para enāvareṇa padā vatsaṃ bibratī gaur ud asthāt /
analyzed: avas pareṇa paras enā avareṇa padā vatsam bibratī gauḥ ud asthāt
translated: The cow, bearing the calf, rose up, with the lower foot above, and the higher foot below.

original: sā kadrīcī kaṃ svid ardhaṃ parāgāt kva svit sūte nahi yūthe asmin ////
analyzed: sā kadrīcī kam svid ardham parāgāt kva svid sūte nahi yūthe asmin
translated: She went away somewhere, to what place? Where does she give birth, not in this herd?

original: ekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpady aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī /
analyzed: ekapadī dvipadī sā catuṣpadī aṣṭāpadī navapadī babhūvuṣī
translated: She has one foot, two feet, she has four feet, she has eight feet, she has nine feet.

original: sahasrākṣarā bhuvanasya paṅktis tasyāḥ samudrā adhi vi kṣaranti ////
analyzed: sahasra akṣarā bhuvanasya paṅktiḥ tasyāḥ samudrāḥ adhi vi kṣaranti
translated: She has a thousand feet, she is the row of the world. From her the oceans flow forth.

original: ārohan dyām amṛtaḥ prāva me vacaḥ /
analyzed: ārohan dyām amṛtaḥ prāva me vacaḥ
translated: Having ascended the sky, O immortal one, promote my speech.

original: ut tvā yajñā brahmapūtā vahanty adhvagato harayas tvā vahanti ////
analyzed: ud tvā yajñāḥ brahma pūtāḥ vahanti adhva gataḥ harayaḥ tvā vahanti
translated: The sacrifices, purified by prayer, carry you. The tawny ones carry you along the path.

original: veda tat te amartya yat ta ākramaṇaṃ divi /
analyzed: veda tat te amartya yat te ākramaṇam divi
translated: I know that of you, O immortal one, your stepping-place in the sky,

original: yat te sadhasthaṃ parame vyoman ////
analyzed: yat te sadhastham parame vyoman
translated: Your abode in the highest firmament.

original: sūryo dyāṃ sūryaḥ pṛṭhivīṃ sūrya āpo'ti paśyati /
analyzed: sūryaḥ dyām sūryaḥ pṛṭhivīm sūryaḥ āpa iti paśyati
translated: The sun sees the sky, the sun sees the earth, the sun sees the waters.

original: sūryo bhūtasyaikaṃ cakṣur ā ruroha divaṃ mahīm ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ bhūtasya ekam cakṣuḥ ā ruroha divam mahīm
translated: The sun is the one eye of being, it has risen to the sky and to the earth.

original: urvīr āsan paridhayo vedir bhūmir akalpata /
analyzed: urvīḥ āsan paridhayaḥ vediḥ bhūmiḥ akalpata
translated: The boundaries were vast, the earth was made the altar.

original: tatraitāv agnī ādhatta himaṃ ghraṃsaṃ ca rohitaḥ ////
analyzed: tatra etau agnī ādhatta himam ghraṃsam ca rohitaḥ
translated: There the two fires were established, the snow and the hail, by Rohita.

original: himaṃ ghraṃsaṃ cādhāya yūpān kṛtvā parvatān /🔽varṣājyāv agnī ījāte rohitasya svarvidaḥ ////
analyzed: himam ghraṃsam ca ādhāya yūpān kṛtvā parvatān  varṣa ājyau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ
translated: Having placed the snow and the hail, having made the mountains the sacrificial posts,🔽the two fires, rain and ghee, were offered by Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: svarvido rohitasya brahmaṇāgniḥ sam idhyate /
analyzed: svar vidaḥ rohitasya brahmaṇā agniḥ sam idhyate
translated: By the power of Brahman, Agni is kindled by Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: tasmād ghraṃsas tasmād dhimas tasmād yajño 'jāyata ////
analyzed: tasmāt ghraṃsaḥ tasmāt dhimaḥ tasmāt yajñaḥ jāyata
translated: From that the hail, from that the snow, from that the sacrifice was born.

original: brahmaṇāgnī vāvṛdhānau brahmavṛddhau brahmāhutau /
analyzed: brahmaṇā agnī vāvṛdhānau brahma vṛddhau brahma āhutau
translated: By the power of Brahman, the two fires have grown, strengthened by Brahman, offered by Brahman,

original: brahmeddhāv agnī ījāte rohitasya svarvidaḥ ////
analyzed: brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ
translated: kindled by Brahman, the two fires were offered by Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: satye anyaḥ samāhito 'psv anyaḥ sam idhyate /
analyzed: satye anyaḥ samāhitaḥ u psu anyaḥ sam idhyate
translated: One is established in truth, the other is kindled in the waters.

original: brahmeddhāv agnī ījāte rohitasya svarvidaḥ ////
analyzed: brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ
translated: Kindled by Brahman, the two fires were offered by Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: yaṃ vātaḥ pariśumbhati yaṃ vendro brahmaṇaspatiḥ /
analyzed: yam vātaḥ pariśumbhati yam vā indraḥ brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: Whom the wind fans, whom Indra, lord of prayer,

original: brahmeddhāvagnī ījāte rohitasya svarvidaḥ ////
analyzed: brahma iddhau agnī ījāte rohitasya svar vidaḥ
translated: Kindled by Brahman, the two fires were offered by Rohita, the finder of heaven.

original: vediṃ bhūmiṃ kalpayitvā divaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇām /
analyzed: vedim bhūmim kalpayitvā divam kṛtvā dakṣiṇām
translated: Having made the altar the earth, and the south the heaven,

original: ghraṃsaṃ tad agniṃ kṛtvā cakāra viśvam ātmanvad varṣeṇājyena rohitaḥ ////
analyzed: ghraṃsam tat agnim kṛtvā cakāra viśvam ātmanvat varṣeṇa ājyena rohitaḥ
translated: Having made the oblation the fire, he made the universe full of self, with the rain as the clarified butter.

original: varṣam ājam ghraṃso agnir vedir bhūmir akalpata /
analyzed: varṣam ājam ghraṃsaḥ agniḥ vediḥ bhūmiḥ akalpata
translated: The rain is the clarified butter, the oblation is the fire, the altar is the earth.

original: tatraitān parvatān agnir gīrbhir ūrdhvāṃ akalpayat ////
analyzed: tatra etān parvatān agniḥ gīrbhiḥ ūrdhvām akalpayat
translated: There Agni with his songs made the mountains rise upwards.

original: gīrbhir ūrdhvān kalpayitvā rohito bhūmim abravīt /
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ ūrdhvān kalpayitvā rohitaḥ bhūmim abravīt
translated: Having made them rise upwards with his songs, Rohita said to the earth:

original: tvayīdaṃ sarvaṃ jāyatāṃ yad bhūtaṃ yac ca bhāvyam ////
analyzed: tvayi idam sarvam jāyatām yat bhūtam yat ca bhāvyam
translated: Let all this be born in you, what has been and what is to be.

original: sa yajñaḥ prathamo bhūto bhavyo ajāyata /
analyzed: sa yajñaḥ prathamaḥ bhūtaḥ bhavyaḥ ajāyata
translated: That sacrifice, having been born, was born first, and will be born.

original: tasmād dha jajña idaṃ sarvaṃ yat kiṃ cedaṃ virocate rohitena ṛṣiṇābhṛtam ////
analyzed: tasmāt ha jajñe idam sarvam yat kim ca idam virocate rohitena ṛṣiṇā ābhṛtam
translated: From him was born all this that shines, whatever moves, carried by Rohita the seer.

original: yaś ca gāṃ padā sphurati pratyaṅ sūryaṃ ca mehati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca gām padā sphurati pratyaṅ sūryam ca mehati
translated: He who kicks the cow and spits against the sun,

original: tasya vṛścāmi te mūlaṃ na chāyāṃ karavo 'param ////
analyzed: tasya vṛścāmi te mūlam na chāyām karavaḥ param
translated: I cut off thy root, I will not make thee a shadow again.

original: yo mābhichāyam atyeṣi māṃ cāgniṃ cāntarā /
analyzed: yaḥ mā abhichāyam atyeṣi mām ca agnim ca antarā
translated: He who passes over my shadow and between me and the fire,

original: tasya vṛścāmi te mūlaṃ na chāyāṃ karavo 'param ////
analyzed: tasya vṛścāmi te mūlam na chāyām karavaḥ param
translated: I cut off thy root, I will not make thee a shadow again.

original: yo adya deva sūrya tvāṃ ca māṃ cāntarāyati /
analyzed: yaḥ adya deva sūrya tvām ca mām ca antarā ayati
translated: O god Surya, he who today passes between thee and me,

original: duṣvapnyaṃ tasmiṃ chamalaṃ duritāni ca mṛjmahe ////
analyzed: duṣvapnyam tasmin śamalam duritāni ca mṛjmahe
translated: We wipe away evil dreams, misfortune, and calamities from him.

original: mā pra gāma patho vayaṃ mā yajñād indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: mā pra gāma pathaḥ vayam mā yajñāt indra sominaḥ
translated: Let us not go astray from the path, O Indra, from the Soma sacrifice.

original: mānta sthur no arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: mā antar sthuḥ naḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Let not the evil ones remain among us.

original: yo yajñasya prasādhanas tantur deveṣv ātataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yajñasya prasādhanaḥ tantuḥ deveṣu ātataḥ
translated: The thread that is stretched out among the gods, the completion of the sacrifice,

original: tam āhutam aśīmahi ////
analyzed: tam āhutam aśīmahi
translated: we offer to that which is invoked.

original: ud asya ketavo divi śukrā bhrājanta īrate /
analyzed: ud asya ketavaḥ divi śukrāḥ bhrājantaḥ īrate
translated: His bright and shining rays rise up in the sky,

original: ādityasya nṛcakṣaso mahivratasya mīḍhuṣaḥ ////
analyzed: ādityasya nṛ cakṣasaḥ mahi vratasya mīḍhuṣaḥ
translated: the rays of the sun, the seer of men, of great vow, the bountiful one.

original: diśāṃ prajñānāṃ svarayantam arciṣā supakṣam āśuṃ patayantam arṇave /
analyzed: diśām prajñānām svarayantam arciṣā su pakṣam āśum patayantam arṇave
translated: The one who guides the quarters with his light, the well-winged one, flying swiftly over the ocean,

original: stavāma sūryaṃ bhuvanasya gopāṃ yo raśmibhir diśa ābhāti sarvāḥ ////
analyzed: stavāma sūryam bhuvanasya gopām yaḥ raśmibhiḥ diśaḥ ābhāti sarvāḥ
translated: we praise the sun, the protector of the world, who shines with his rays over all the directions.

original: yat prāṅ pratyaṅ svadhayā yāsi śībhaṃ nānārūpe ahanī karṣi māyayā /
analyzed: yat prāṅ pratyaṅ svadhayā yāsi śībham nānārūpe ahanī karṣi māyayā
translated: When you move swiftly to the east and west by your own nature, changing forms day and night through illusion,

original: tad āditya mahi tat te mahi śravo yad eko viśvaṃ pari bhūma jāyase ////
analyzed: tat āditya mahi tat te mahi śravaḥ yat ekaḥ viśvam pari bhūma jāyase
translated: O Aditya, that is your greatness, that is your great fame, that you are born alone to encompass the whole world.

original: vipaścitaṃ taraṇiṃ bhrājamānaṃ vahanti yaṃ haritaḥ sapta bahvīḥ /
analyzed: vipaścitam taraṇim bhrājamānam vahanti yam haritaḥ sapta bahvīḥ
translated: The one who knows the mind, the swift one, the shining one, whom the seven abundant green horses carry,

original: srutād yam attrir divam unnināya taṃ tvā paśyanti pariyāntam ājim ////
analyzed: srutāt yam attriḥ divam unnināya tam tvā paśyanti pariyāntam ājim
translated: whom Atri lifted up to the sky from the flowing (waters), you, they see, going around the racecourse.

original: mā tvā dabhan pariyāntam ājiṃ svasti durgāṃ ati yāhi śībham /
analyzed: mā tvā dabhan pariyāntam ājim svasti durgām ati yāhi śībham
translated: May no evil befall thee as thou goest to the race-course. Pass safely and quickly over the difficult places.

original: divaṃ ca sūrya pṛthivīṃ ca devīm ahorātre vimimāno yad eṣi ////
analyzed: divam ca sūrya pṛthivīm ca devīm ahorātre vimimānaḥ yat eṣi
translated: The heaven and the earth, O Sun, and the goddess Night and Day, as thou goest measuring them.

original: svasti te sūrya carase rathāya yenobhāv antau pariyāsi sadyaḥ /
analyzed: svasti te sūrya carase rathāya yena ubhau antau pariyāsi sadyas
translated: Good luck to thee, O Sun, for the journey of thy chariot, wherewith thou goest round both ends (of the world) in a moment.

original: yaṃ te vahanti harito vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvā yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ ////
analyzed: yam te vahanti haritaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvāḥ yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ
translated: Which thy best green horses, many, a hundred, or if (it be) seven, carry thee.

original: sukhaṃ sūrya ratham aṃśumantaṃ syonaṃ suvahnim adhi tiṣṭha vājinam /
analyzed: sukham sūrya ratham aṃśumantam syonam su vahnim adhi tiṣṭha vājinam
translated: O Sun, happily mount thy chariot, which is furnished with rays, which is pleasant, which is well-constructed, which is strong,

original: yaṃ te vahanti harito vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvā yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ ////
analyzed: yam te vahanti haritaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ śatam aśvāḥ yadi vā sapta bahvīḥ
translated: Which thy best green horses, many, a hundred, or if (it be) seven, carry thee.

original: sapta sūryo harito yātave rathe hiraṇyatvacaso bṛhatīr ayukta /🔽amoci śukro rajasaḥ parastād vidhūya devas tamo divam āruhat ////🔽ut ketunā bṛhatā deva āgann apāvṛk tamo 'bhi jyotir aśrait /
analyzed: sapta sūryaḥ haritaḥ yātave rathe hiraṇya tvacasaḥ bṛhatīḥ ayukta  amoci śukraḥ rajasaḥ parastāt vidhūya devaḥ tamaḥ divam āruhat  ud ketunā bṛhatā devaḥ āgan apāvṛk tamaḥ bhi jyotiḥ aśrait
translated: The Sun hath yoked to his seven-horsed chariot his seven bright, large, golden-hued steeds.🔽The bright god, having shaken off the darkness, hath loosed himself from the region of the sky and ascended to heaven.🔽The god hath come with his great banner; he hath opened the darkness and hath shown the light.

original: divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sa vīro vy akhyad aditeḥ putro bhuvanāni viśvā ////
analyzed: divyaḥ suparṇaḥ sa vīraḥ vi akhyat aditeḥ putraḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: The divine bird, the hero, the son of Aditi, hath spread out over all the worlds.

original: udyan raśmīn ā tanuṣe viśvā rupāṇi puṣyasi /
analyzed: udyan raśmīn ā tanuṣe viśvā rupāṇi puṣyasi
translated: Rising, thou strewest out thy rays; thou cherishest all forms.

original: ubhā samudrau kratunā vi bhāsi sarvāṃl lokān paribhūr bhrājamānaḥ ////
analyzed: ubhā samudrau kratunā vi bhāsi sarvān lokān paribhūḥ bhrājamānaḥ
translated: Thou shinest with sacrifice over both oceans, thou, the all-surpassing, shinest over all the worlds.

original: pūrvāparaṃ carato māyayaitau śiśū krīḍantau pari yāto 'rṇavam /
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyayā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ rṇavam
translated: These two move in the east and west by magic power, these two as children playing have gone round the ocean.

original: viśvānyo bhuvanā vicaṣṭe hairaṇyair anyaṃ harito vahanti ////
analyzed: viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe hairaṇyaiḥ anyam haritaḥ vahanti
translated: One whom all beings look upon, the other the golden-coloured ones bear.

original: divi tvāttrir adhārayat sūryā māsāya kartave /
analyzed: divi tvā atriḥ adhārayat sūrya māsāya kartave
translated: In the sky he has placed the three suns for the month to be made.

original: sa eṣi sudhṛtas tapan viśvā bhūtāvacākaśat ////
analyzed: saḥ eṣi su dhṛtaḥ tapan viśvā bhūtā avacākaśat
translated: He, well-held, moves, shining, looking upon all beings.

original: ubhāv antau sam arṣasi vatsaḥ saṃmātarāv iva /
analyzed: ubhau antau sam arṣasi vatsaḥ sam mātarau iva
translated: Thou meetest both ends, like a calf its two mothers.

original: nanv etad itaḥ purā brahma devā amī viduḥ ////
analyzed: nanu etat itas purā brahma devāḥ amī viduḥ
translated: This indeed the gods have known from before, the Brahman.

original: yat samudram anu śritaṃ tat siṣāsati sūryaḥ /
analyzed: yat samudram anu śritam tat siṣāsati sūryaḥ
translated: What is dependent on the ocean, that the sun desires to conquer.

original: adhvāsya vitato mahān pūrvaś cāparaś ca yaḥ ////
analyzed: adhvā asya vitataḥ mahān pūrvaḥ ca aparaḥ ca yaḥ
translated: His great path is spread out, the one that is east and west.

original: taṃ sam āpnoti jūtibhis tato nāpa cikitsati /
analyzed: tam sam āpnoti jūtibhiḥ tatas na apa cikitsati
translated: He reaches it with his rays, then he does not look back.

original: tenāmṛtasya bhakṣaṃ devānāṃ nāva rundhate ////🔽ud u tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ /
analyzed: tena amṛtasya bhakṣam devānām na ava rundhate  ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ
translated: By that they do not obstruct the gods' share of the nectar.🔽The rays carry upward that god, the all-knower, the sun,

original: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam ////
analyzed: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam
translated: to be seen by all.

original: apa tye tāyavo yathā nakṣatrā yanty aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ
translated: Those rays as they go, like the birds, by the paths,

original: sūrāya viśvacakṣase ////
analyzed: sūrāya viśva cakṣase
translated: To the hero, the all-seeing one.

original: adṛśrann asya ketavo vi raśmayo janāṃ anu /
analyzed: adṛśran asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janān anu
translated: His rays have been seen, his banners have been spread out among the people.

original: bhrājanto agnayo yathā ////🔽taraṇir viśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛd asi sūrya /
analyzed: bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā  taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya
translated: Shining like blazing fires.🔽O swift one, all-seeing, you are the maker of light, O sun.

original: viśvam ā bhāsi rocana ////
analyzed: viśvam ā bhāsi rocana
translated: You illuminate the whole firmament.

original: pratyaṅ devānāṃ viśaḥ pratyaṅṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ /
analyzed: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ
translated: You go to the west of the people of the gods, to the west of the human beings.

original: pratyaṅ viśvaṃ svar dṛśe ////
analyzed: pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe
translated: To the west of the whole heaven to be seen.

original: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janāṃ anu /
analyzed: yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janān anu
translated: O purifier, with that eye of yours, following the swiftly moving people.

original: tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi ////🔽vi dyām eṣi rajas pṛthv ahar mimāno aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: tvam varuṇa paśyasi  vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahar mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ
translated: You, O Varuṇa, behold.🔽You go through the wide air to the sky, measuring the day with your rays.

original: paśyan janmāni sūrya ////
analyzed: paśyan janmāni sūrya
translated: Beholding the births, O sun.

original: sapta tvā harito rathe vahanti deva sūrya /
analyzed: sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya
translated: Seven bay horses harnessed to your chariot carry you, O god, O sun.

original: śociṣkeśaṃ vicakṣaṇam ////
analyzed: śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam
translated: You whose hair is radiant, O all-seeing one.

original: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūro rathasya naptyaḥ /
analyzed: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ
translated: He has yoked the seven pure mares, the granddaughters of the chariot, O sun.

original: tābhir yāti svayuktibhiḥ ////🔽rohito divam āruhat tapasā tapasvī /
analyzed: tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ  rohitaḥ divam āruhat tapasā tapasvī
translated: With them he goes, with those that are well-yoked.🔽The red one has ascended the sky, the one who practices austerity through austerity.

original: sa yonim aiti sa u jāyate punaḥ sa devānām adhipatir babhūva ////
analyzed: sa yonim aiti saḥ u jāyate punar sa devānām adhipatiḥ babhūva
translated: He returns to the womb, and is born again. He became the lord of the gods.

original: yo viśvacarṣaṇir uta viśvatomukho yo viśvataspāṇir uta viśvataspṛthaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvacarṣaṇiḥ uta viśvatomukhaḥ yaḥ viśvataspāṇiḥ uta viśvataspṛthaḥ
translated: He who has all people, and all faces, who has all hands, and all feet,

original: saṃ bāhubhyāṃ bharati saṃ patatrair dyāvāpṛthivī janayan deva ekaḥ ////
analyzed: sam bāhubhyām bharati sam patatraiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī janayan devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: With his two arms he supports, with his two wings, Heaven and Earth, the one God, generating (them).

original: ekapād dvipado bhūyo vi cakrame dvipāt tripādam abhy eti paścāt /
analyzed: eka pād dvi padaḥ bhūyas vi cakrame dvi pād tri pādam abhī eti paścāt
translated: The one-footed one walks on two feet, the two-footed one on three feet from behind.

original: dvipād dha ṣaṭpado bhūyo vi cakrame ta ekapadas tanvaṃ sam āsate ////
analyzed: dvipād ha ṣaṣ padaḥ bhūyas vi cakrame te eka padaḥ tanvam sam āsate
translated: The two-footed one again walks on six feet, they, the one-footed ones, sit down on their bodies.

original: atandro yāsyan harito yad āsthād dve rūpe kṛṇute rocamānaḥ /
analyzed: atandraḥ yāsyan haritaḥ yat āsthāt dve rūpe kṛṇute rocamānaḥ
translated: When the restless one, going, has mounted the two green ones, the shining one makes two forms.

original: ketumān udyant sahamāno rajāṃsi viśvā āditya pravato vi bhāsi ////
analyzed: ketumān udyan sahamānaḥ rajāṃsi viśvā āditya pravataḥ vi bhāsi
translated: The bannered one, rising, overcoming the regions, thou shinest forth, O Āditya, on every side.

original: baṇ mahāṃ asi sūrya baḍ āditya mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: baṭ mahān asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahān asi
translated: O Sun, thou art great; O Āditya, thou art great.

original: mahāṃs te mahato mahimā tvam āditya mahāṃ asi ////
analyzed: mahān te mahataḥ mahimā tvam āditya mahān asi
translated: Great is thy greatness, O great Āditya, thou art great.

original: rocase divi rocase antarikṣe pataṅga pṛthivyāṃ rocase rocase apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: rocase divi rocase antarikṣe pataṅga pṛthivyām rocase rocase apsu antar
translated: Thou shinest in the sky, thou shinest in the atmosphere, O bird, thou shinest on the earth, thou shinest in the waters.

original: ubhā samudrau rucyā vy āpitha devo devāsi mahiṣaḥ svarjit ////
analyzed: ubhā samudrau rucyā vi āpitha devaḥ deva asi mahiṣaḥ svar jit  /
translated: With thy radiance thou hast filled the two great oceans. Thou art the god, O god, the bull, the winner of heaven.

original: arvāṅ parastāt prayato vyadhva āśur vipaścit patayan pataṅgaḥ /
analyzed: arvāṅ parastāt prayataḥ vyadhve āśuḥ vipaścit patayan pataṅgaḥ
translated: From this side and from yonder, from the path of the sacrifice, the swift one, the wise one, flying, the bird,

original: viṣṇur vicittaḥ śavasādhitiṣṭhan pra ketunā sahate viśvam ejat ////
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ vicittaḥ śavasā adhitiṣṭhan pra ketunā sahate viśvam ejat
translated: Viṣṇu, the discerning one, standing with might, with his banner conquers all that moves.

original: citrāś cikitvān mahiṣaḥ suparṇa ārocayan rodasī antarikṣam /
analyzed: citrāḥ cikitvān mahiṣaḥ suparṇaḥ ārocayan rodasī antarikṣam
translated: The wondrous, wise, mighty bird, illuminating the heaven and earth and the atmosphere,

original: ahorātre pari sūryaṃ vasāne prāsya viśvā tirato vīryāṇi ////
analyzed: ahorātre pari sūryam vasāne pra asya viśvā tirataḥ vīryāṇi
translated: The sun, clothed in the day and night, hath spread abroad all his powers on every side.

original: tigmo vibhrājan tanvaṃ śiśāno 'raṃgamāsaḥ pravato rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: tigmaḥ vibhrājan tanvam śiśānaḥ raṃgamāsaḥ pravataḥ rarāṇaḥ
translated: The sharp, shining one, sharpening his body, going to the regions, bestowing the waters,

original: jyotiṣmān pakṣī mahiṣo vayodhā viśvā āsthāt pradiśaḥ kalpamānaḥ ////🔽citraṃ devānām ketur anīkaṃ jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūrya udyan /
analyzed: jyotiṣmān pakṣī mahiṣaḥ vayodhāḥ viśvāḥ āsthāt pradiśaḥ kalpamānaḥ  citram devānām ketuḥ anīkam jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūryaḥ udyan
translated: The luminous bird, the mighty one, the life-giver, hath mounted all the quarters, being prepared.🔽The wondrous banner and host of the gods, the luminous sun rising, the quarters,

original: divākaro 'ti dyumnais tamāṃsi viśvātārīd duritāni śukraḥ ////
analyzed: divākaraḥ ti dyumnaiḥ tamāṃsi viśvā atārīt duritāni śukraḥ
translated: The sun, the light-bringer, with his splendours, hath dispelled the darkness, the pure one all evils.

original: citraṃ devānām ud agād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ /
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ
translated: The wondrous host of the gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.

original: āprād dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca ////
analyzed: āprāt dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca
translated: The sun hath filled the heaven, the earth, and the atmosphere, the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: uccā patantam aruṇaṃ suparṇaṃ madhye divas taraṇiṃ bhrājamānam /
analyzed: uccā patantam aruṇam suparṇam madhye divaḥ taraṇim bhrājamānam
translated: The lofty, red-hued bird that flieth, the swift one shining in the midst of the sky,

original: paśyama tvā savitāraṃ yam āhur ajasraṃ jyotir yad avindad attriḥ ////
analyzed: paśyama tvā savitāram yam āhuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ yat avindat attriḥ
translated: We behold thee whom they call Savitar, the imperishable light which Atri found.

original: divas pṛṣṭhe dhāvamānaṃ suparṇam adityāḥ putraṃ nāthakāma upa yāmi bhītaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛṣṭhe dhāvamānam suparṇam adityāḥ putram nātha kāmaḥ upa yāmi bhītaḥ
translated: I approach the bird who flies on the back of the sky, Aditi's son, seeking a protector, in fear.

original: sa naḥ sūrya pra tira dīrgham āyur mā riṣāma sumatau te syāma ////
analyzed: sa naḥ sūrya pra tira dīrgham āyuḥ mā riṣāma sumatau te syāma
translated: O Surya, extend our life to a thousand years. May we be in your favor, O Surya.

original: sahasrāhṇyaṃ viyatāv asya pakṣau harer haṃsasya patataḥ svargam /
analyzed: sahasrāhṇyam viyatau asya pakṣau hareḥ haṃsasya patataḥ svargam
translated: The two wings of this thousand-year-old bird, the swan of Hari, as it flies to heaven,

original: sa devānt sarvān urasy upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā ////
analyzed: sa devān sarvān urasi upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: Bearing all the gods on its breast, it goes beholding all the worlds.

original: rohitaḥ kālo abhavad rohito 'gre prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: rohitaḥ kālaḥ abhavat rohitaḥ gre prajāpatiḥ
translated: The red one became time, the red one was Prajapati in the beginning.

original: rohito yajñānāṃ mukhaṃ rohitaḥ svar ābharat ////
analyzed: rohitaḥ yajñānām mukham rohitaḥ svar ābharat
translated: The red one is the face of sacrifices, the red one brought heaven.

original: rohito loko abhavad rohito 'ty atapad divam /
analyzed: rohitaḥ lokaḥ abhavat rohitaḥ u ti atapat divam
translated: The red one became the world, the red one heated the sky.

original: rohito raśmibhir bhūmiṃ samudram anu saṃ carat ////
analyzed: rohitaḥ raśmibhiḥ bhūmim samudram anu sam carat
translated: The red one moves along the ocean with its rays.

original: sarvā diśaḥ sam acarad rohito 'dhipatir divaḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ diśaḥ sam acarat rohitaḥ dhipatiḥ divaḥ
translated: The red one, the lord of heaven, has moved to all the directions.

original: divaṃ samudram ād bhūmiṃ sarvaṃ bhūtaṃ vi rakṣati ////
analyzed: divam samudram āt bhūmim sarvam bhūtam vi rakṣati
translated: It protects all beings, heaven, the ocean, and the earth.

original: ārohan chukro bṛhatīr atandro dve rūpe kṛṇute rocamānaḥ /
analyzed: ārohan śukraḥ bṛhatīḥ atandraḥ dve rūpe kṛṇute rocamānaḥ
translated: Ascending, the bright one, tireless, makes two forms, shining.

original: citraś cikitvān mahiṣo vātamāyā yāvato lokān abhi yad vibhāti ////
analyzed: citraḥ cikitvān mahiṣaḥ vāta māyāḥ yāvataḥ lokān abhi yat vibhāti
translated: The variegated one, the wise one, the powerful one, the swift one, shines over as many worlds as there are.

original: abhy anyad eti pary anyad asyate 'horātrābhyāṃ mahiṣaḥ kalpamānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi anyat eti pari anyat asyate horātrābhyām mahiṣaḥ kalpamānaḥ
translated: It goes beyond the other, it moves around the other, the buffalo, being measured by the day and night.

original: sūryaṃ vayaṃ rajasi kṣiyantaṃ gātuvidaṃ havāmahe nādhamānāḥ ////
analyzed: sūryam vayam rajasi kṣiyantam gātu vidam havāmahe nādhamānāḥ
translated: We call upon the sun, who moves in the realm, who knows the way, without being depressed.

original: pṛthivīpro mahiṣo nādhamānasya gātur adabdhacakṣuḥ pari viśvaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: pṛthivīpraḥ mahiṣaḥ nādhamānasya gātuḥ adabdha cakṣuḥ pari viśvam babhūva
translated: The buffalo, the lord of the earth, the way of the one who is not depressed, with undeluded sight, has pervaded everything.

original: viśvaṃ saṃpaśyant suvidatro yajatra idaṃ śṛṇotu yad ahaṃ bravīmi ////
analyzed: viśvam saṃpaśyan suvidatraḥ yajatraḥ idam śṛṇotu yat aham bravīmi
translated: The very generous one, who sees everything, who is worthy of sacrifice, may he listen to this, to what I say.

original: pary asya mahimā pṛthivīṃ samudraṃ jyotiṣā vibhrājan pari dyām antarikṣam /
analyzed: pari asya mahimā pṛthivīm samudram jyotiṣā vibhrājan pari dyām antarikṣam
translated: His greatness has surrounded the earth, the ocean, shining with light, the sky, the atmosphere.

original: sarvaṃ saṃpaśyant suvidatro yajatra idaṃ śṛṇotu yad ahaṃ bravīmi ////🔽abodhy agniḥ samidhā janānāṃ prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣasam /
analyzed: sarvam saṃpaśyan suvidatraḥ yajatraḥ idam śṛṇotu yat aham bravīmi  abodhi agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum iva āyatīm uṣasam
translated: The very generous one, who sees everything, who is worthy of sacrifice, may he listen to this, to what I say.🔽Agni has awakened, kindled by the people, the dawn that comes like a cow.

original: yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha ////
analyzed: yahvāḥ iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha
translated: The young ones, stretching out like the rising sun, the rays go forth to the vault.

original: ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna yo drāpim kṛtvā bhuvanāni vaste /
analyzed: yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna yaḥ drāpim kṛtvā bhuvanāni vaste
translated: He who has produced these heaven and earth, who, having made the garment, covers the worlds,

original: yasmin kṣiyanti pradiśaḥ ṣaḍ urvīr yāḥ pataṅgo anu vicākaśīti /
analyzed: yasmin kṣiyanti pradiśaḥ ṣaḍ urvīḥ yāḥ pataṅgaḥ anu vicākaśīti
translated: In whom the six broad directions rest, the ones the flying bird looks upon.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: yasmād vātā ṛtuthā pavante yasmāt samudrā adhi vikṣaranti /
analyzed: yasmāt vātāḥ ṛtuthā pavante yasmāt samudrāḥ adhi vikṣaranti
translated: From whom the winds blow in their seasons, from whom the oceans overflow,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, throw him down, release the bonds of him who injures the Brahmin.

original: yo mārayati prāṇayati yasmāt prāṇanti bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yaḥ mārayati prāṇayati yasmāt prāṇanti bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who gives life and takes life, from whom all the worlds of life breathe,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, throw him down, release the bonds of him who injures the Brahmin.

original: yaḥ prāṇena dyāvāpṛthivī tarpayaty apānena samudrasya jaṭharaṃ yaḥ piparti /
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇena dyāvāpṛthivī tarpayati apānena samudrasya jaṭharam yaḥ piparti
translated: He who satisfies heaven and earth with his breath, who nourishes the belly of the ocean with his exhalation,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, throw him down, release the bonds of him who injures the Brahmin.

original: yasmin virāṭ parameṣṭhī prajāpatir agnir vaiśvānaraḥ saha paṅktyā śritaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin virāj parameṣṭhī prajāpatiḥ agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ saha paṅktyā śritaḥ
translated: In whom Virāj, Prajāpati, Agni Vaiśvānara, together with Paṅkti, are contained.

original: yaḥ parasya prāṇaṃ paramasya teja ādade /
analyzed: yaḥ parasya prāṇam paramasya tejaḥ ādade
translated: He who took away the breath of the other, the splendor of the highest.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of that angry god, who conquers a learned brāhmaṇa in this way.

original: yasmin ṣaḍ urvīḥ pañca diśo adhiśritāś catasra āpo yajñasya trayo 'kṣarāḥ /
analyzed: yasmin ṣaḍ urvīḥ pañca diśaḥ adhiśritāḥ catasraḥ āpaḥ yajñasya trayaḥ kṣarāḥ
translated: In whom the six expanses, the five directions, the four waters, the three syllables of the sacrifice are contained.

original: yo antarā rodasī kruddhaś cakṣuṣaikṣata /🔽tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇam jināti /
analyzed: yaḥ antarā rodasī kruddhaḥ cakṣuṣā aikṣata  tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: He who, angry, looked with his eye between the two worlds.🔽That is the punishment of that angry god, who conquers a learned brāhmaṇa in this way.

original: yo annādo annapatir babhūva brahmaṇas patir uta yaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ anna ādaḥ anna patiḥ babhūva brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ uta yaḥ
translated: He who became the eater of food, the lord of food, and also the lord of the Veda.

original: bhūto bhaviṣyat bhuvanasya yas patiḥ /
analyzed: bhūtaḥ bhaviṣyat bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ
translated: The existent, the future, the lord of the world.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of that angry god, who conquers a learned brāhmaṇa in this way.

original: ahorātrair vimitaṃ triṃśadaṅgaṃ trayodaśaṃ māsaṃ yo nirmimīte /
analyzed: ahorātraiḥ vimitam triṃśat aṅgam trayodaśam māsam yaḥ nirmimīte
translated: He who measures the month of thirteen parts, with thirty parts, by days and nights.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of that angry god, who conquers a learned brāhmaṇa in this way.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, and drive him away; loose the bonds of him who injures the Brahman.

original: kṛsṇaṃ niyānaṃ harayaḥ suparṇā apo vasānā divam ut patanti /
analyzed: kṛsṇam niyānam harayaḥ suparṇāḥ apaḥ vasānāḥ divam ud patanti
translated: The dark path, the tawny birds of fair wings, clothed in water, fly up to the sky.

original: ta āvavṛtrant sadanād ṛtasya /
analyzed: te āvavṛtran sadanāt ṛtasya
translated: They have turned back from the seat of truth.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of that angry god who injures a Brahman who knows thus.

original: yat te candraṃ kaśyapa rocanāvad yat saṃhitaṃ puṣkalaṃ citrabhānu yasmint sūryā ārpitāḥ sapta sākam /
analyzed: yat te candram kaśyapa rocanāvat yat saṃhitam puṣkalam citra bhānu yasmin sūryāḥ ārpitāḥ sapta sākam
translated: Thy moon, O Kashyapa, that is radiant, that is united, abundant, of varied light, in which the seven suns are together enclosed,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of that angry god who injures a Brahman who knows thus.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, and drive him away; loose the bonds of him who injures the Brahman.

original: bṛhad enam anu vaste purastād rathaṃtaraṃ prati gṛhṇāti paścāt /
analyzed: bṛhat enam anu vaste purastāt rathaṃtaram prati gṛhṇāti paścāt
translated: The Brihat (Saman) covers him from the front, the Rathantara receives him from behind.

original: jyotir vasāne sadam apramādam /
analyzed: jyotiḥ vasāne sadam apramādam
translated: He is ever heedless, clothed in light.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of that angry god who injures a Brahman who knows thus.

original: bṛhad anyataḥ pakṣa āsīd rathaṃtaram anyataḥ sabale sadhrīcī /
analyzed: bṛhat anyatas pakṣaḥ āsīt rathaṃtaram anyatas sabale sadhrīcī
translated: On one side the wing was the Brihat, on the other the Rathantara, with its strength and its swiftness.
