original: yad rohitam ajanayanta devāḥ /
analyzed: yat rohitam ajanayanta devāḥ
translated: That which the gods produced as red,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of the angry god, of him who conquers a learned Brâhmana.

original: sa varuṇaḥ sāyam agnir bhavati sa mitro bhavati prātar udyan /
analyzed: sa varuṇaḥ sāyam agniḥ bhavati sa mitraḥ bhavati prātar udyan
translated: He becomes Varuna in the evening, he becomes Mitra in the morning when he rises.

original: sa savitā bhūtvāntarikṣeṇa yāti sa indro bhūtvā tapati madhyato divam /
analyzed: sa savitā bhūtvā antarikṣeṇa yāti saḥ indraḥ bhūtvā tapati madhyatas divam
translated: He becomes Savitar and travels through the air, he becomes Indra and shines in the middle of the sky.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of the angry god, of him who conquers a learned Brâhmana.

original: sahasrāhṇyaṃ viyatāv asya pakṣau harer haṃsasya patataḥ svargam /
analyzed: sahasrāhṇyam viyatau asya pakṣau hareḥ haṃsasya patataḥ svargam
translated: The two wings of his thousand-year-old bird, the swan, as it flies to heaven,

original: sa devānt sarvān urasy upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: sa devān sarvān urasi upadadya saṃpaśyan yāti bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He, bearing all the gods on his breast, goes beholding all the worlds.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of the angry god, of him who conquers a learned Brâhmana.

original: ayaṃ sa devo apsv antaḥ sahasramūlaḥ paruśāko attriḥ /
analyzed: ayam sa devaḥ apsu antar sahasra mūlaḥ paru śākaḥ attriḥ
translated: This is the god who dwells in the waters, the thousand-rooted, many-branched Attri,

original: ya idaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ jajāna /
analyzed: yaḥ idam viśvam bhuvanam jajāna
translated: Who has produced this whole world.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of the angry god, of him who conquers a learned Brâhmana.

original: śukraṃ vahanti harayo raghuṣyado devaṃ divi varcasā bhrājamānam /
analyzed: śukram vahanti harayaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ devam divi varcasā bhrājamānam
translated: The tawny ones carry the semen, the swift one, the god shining in the sky with radiance.

original: yasyordhvā divaṃ tanvas tapanty arvāṅ suvarṇaiḥ paṭarair vi bhāti /
analyzed: yasya ūrdhvāḥ divam tanvaḥ tapanti arvāṅ su varṇaiḥ paṭaraiḥ vi bhāti
translated: Whose upper forms shine in the sky, and below he shines with golden wings.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of that angry god who conquers a learned brahmin in this way.

original: yenādityān haritaḥ samvahanti yena yajñena bahavo yanti prajānantaḥ /
analyzed: yena ādityān haritaḥ samvahanti yena yajñena bahavaḥ yanti prajānantaḥ
translated: By whom the Adityas and the tawny ones carry, by whom many sacrifices go, known by the people.

original: yad ekaṃ jyotir bahudhā vibhāti /
analyzed: yat ekam jyotiḥ bahudhā vibhāti
translated: Where one light shines in many ways.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of that angry god who conquers a learned brahmin in this way.

original: sapta yuñjanti ratham ekacakram eko aśvo vahati saptanāmā /
analyzed: sapta yuñjanti ratham eka cakram ekaḥ aśvaḥ vahati sapta nāmā
translated: They yoke the seven to a chariot with one wheel, one horse draws it, having the name of seven.

original: trinābhi cakram ajaram anarvaṃ yatremā viśvā bhuvanādhi tasthuḥ /
analyzed: tri nābhi cakram ajaram anarvam yatra imā viśvā bhuvanā adhi tasthuḥ
translated: The wheel with three naves, imperishable and unbreakable, where all these worlds are established.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: That is the punishment of that angry god who conquers a learned brahmin in this way.

original: aṣṭadhā yukto vahati vahnir ugraḥ pitā devānāṃ janitā matīnām /
analyzed: aṣṭadhā yuktaḥ vahati vahniḥ ugraḥ pitā devānām janitā matīnām
translated: The eight-fold yoked fire carries, the fierce one, the father of the gods, the begetter of thoughts.

original: ṛtasya tantuṃ manasā mimānaḥ sarvā diśaḥ pavate mātariśvā /
analyzed: ṛtasya tantum manasā mimānaḥ sarvāḥ diśaḥ pavate mātariśvā
translated: Measuring the thread of truth with the mind, the wind blows to all the quarters.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: saṃyañcaṃ tantuṃ pradiśo 'nu sarvā antar gāyatryām amṛtasya garbhe /
analyzed: saṃyañcam tantum pradiśaḥ nu sarvāḥ antar gāyatryām amṛtasya garbhe
translated: The thread that is spun, in all the directions, within the womb of the immortal Gayatri,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, throw him down, release the bonds of him who injures the Brahman!

original: nimrucas tisro vyuṣo ha tisras trīṇi rajāṃsi divo aṅga tisraḥ /
analyzed: nimrucaḥ tisraḥ vyuṣaḥ ha tisraḥ trīṇi rajāṃsi divaḥ aṅga tisraḥ
translated: Three are the evenings, three the dawns, three the regions of the sky, O Angiras,

original: vidmā te agne tredhā janitraṃ tredhā devānāṃ janimāni vidma /
analyzed: vidma te agne tredhā janitram tredhā devānām janimāni vidma
translated: We know thy threefold birth, O Agni, we know the threefold generations of the gods.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: vi ya aurṇot pṛthivīṃ jāyamāna ā samudram adadhāt antarikṣe /
analyzed: vi yaḥ aurṇot pṛthivīm jāyamānaḥ ā samudram adadhāt antarikṣe
translated: He who, being born, hath filled the earth and hath placed the ocean in the atmosphere,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of the angry god for him who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān ////
analyzed: ud vepaya rohita pra kṣiṇīhi brahmajyasya prati muñca pāśān
translated: Shake him, O Rohita, throw him down, release the bonds of him who injures the Brahman!

original: tvam agne kratubhiḥ ketubhir hito 'rkaḥ samiddha ud arocathā divi /
analyzed: tvam agne kratubhiḥ ketubhiḥ hitaḥ rkaḥ samiddhaḥ ud arocathāḥ divi
translated: Thou, O Agni, by thy rites, by thy ensigns, kindled as light, hast shone in the sky.

original: kim abhy ārcan marutaḥ pṛśnimātaro yad rohitam ajanayanta devāḥ /
analyzed: kim abhī ārcan marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ yat rohitam ajanayanta devāḥ
translated: What have ye, O Maruts, with the dappled mothers, when the gods have generated the red one?

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of that angry god who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ya ātmadā baladā yasya viśva upāsate praśiṣaṃ yasya devāḥ /🔽yo 'syeśe dvipado yaś catuṣpadaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ātma dāḥ bala dāḥ yasya viśve upāsate praśiṣam yasya devāḥ  yaḥ sya īśe dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ
translated: He who is the giver of life, the giver of strength, on whose command all beings depend, on whose command the gods,🔽who rules over this man and that beast,

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: this is the punishment of that angry god who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: ekapād dvipado bhūyo vi cakrame dvipāt tripādam abhy eti paścāt /
analyzed: eka pād dvi padaḥ bhūyas vi cakrame dvi pād tri pādam abhī eti paścāt
translated: The one-footed one has stepped over the two-footed one, the two-footed one approaches the three-footed one from behind.

original: catuṣpāc cakre dvipadām abhisvare saṃpaśyan paṅktim upatiṣṭhamānaḥ /
analyzed: catuṣpād cakre dvipadām abhisvare saṃpaśyan paṅktim upatiṣṭhamānaḥ
translated: The four-footed one has made the two-footed one cry out, looking on, he approaches the five-footed one.

original: tasya devasya kruddhasyaitad āgo ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ jināti /
analyzed: tasya devasya kruddhasya etat āgaḥ yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam brāhmaṇam jināti
translated: This is the punishment of that angry god who injures a learned Brahmin.

original: kṛṣṇāyaḥ putro arjuno rātryā vatso 'jāyata /
analyzed: kṛṣṇāyaḥ putraḥ arjunaḥ rātryāḥ vatsaḥ jāyata
translated: The black one's son, the red one, was born at night, the calf of the night.

original: sa ha dyām adhi rohati ruho ruroha rohitaḥ ////
analyzed: sa ha dyām adhi rohati ruhaḥ ruroha rohitaḥ
translated: He indeed rises up to the sky, the red one has risen up, has ascended.

original: sa eti savitā svar divas pṛṣṭhe 'vacākaśat ////
analyzed: saḥ eti savitā svar divaḥ pṛṣṭhe vacākaśat
translated: He goes, Savitar, to the heaven, he hath looked out upon the back of the sky.

original: raśmibhir nabha ābhṛtaṃ mahendra ety āvṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: raśmibhiḥ nabhaḥ ābhṛtam mahā indraḥ eti āvṛtaḥ
translated: With his rays he hath filled the air, encompassed by the great Indra.

original: sa dhātā sa vidhartā sa vāyur nabha ucchritam ////
analyzed: sa dhātā sa vidhartā sa vāyuḥ nabhaḥ ucchritam
translated: He is the Ordainer, he is the Disposer, he is the wind raised up in the air.

original: so 'ryamā sa varuṇaḥ sa rudraḥ sa mahādevaḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ ryamā sa varuṇaḥ sa rudraḥ sa mahādevaḥ
translated: He is Aryaman, he is Varuna, he is Rudra, he is Mahadeva.

original: so agniḥ sa u sūryaḥ sa u eva mahāyamaḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ agniḥ saḥ u sūryaḥ saḥ u eva mahā yamaḥ
translated: He is Agni, he is Surya, he is indeed the great Yama.

original: taṃ vatsā upa tiṣṭhanty ekaśīrṣāṇo yutā daśa ////
analyzed: tam vatsāḥ upa tiṣṭhanti eka śīrṣāṇaḥ yutāḥ daśa
translated: The young calves attend upon him, of one head, yoked in tens.

original: paścāt prāñca ā tanvanti yad udeti vi bhāsati ////
analyzed: paścāt prāñcaḥ ā tanvanti yat udeti vi bhāsati
translated: From the west they stretch out to the east, as he rises and shines.

original: tasyaiṣa māruto gaṇaḥ sa eti śikyākṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: tasya eṣa mārutaḥ gaṇaḥ saḥ eti śikyā kṛtaḥ
translated: That is his Marut host, he goes forth in the form of a pole.

original: raśmibhir nabha ābhṛtaṃ mahendra ety āvṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: raśmibhiḥ nabhaḥ ābhṛtam mahā indraḥ eti āvṛtaḥ
translated: With his rays he hath filled the air, encompassed by the great Indra.

original: tasyeme nava kośā viṣṭambhā navadhā hitāḥ ////
analyzed: tasya ime nava kośāḥ viṣṭambhāḥ navadhā hitāḥ
translated: His are these nine sheaths, the nine supports are firmly fixed.

original: sa prajābhyo vi paśyati yac ca prāṇati yac ca na ////
analyzed: sa prajābhyaḥ vi paśyati yat ca prāṇati yat ca na
translated: He looks out upon the creatures, on what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: tam idaṃ nigataṃ sahaḥ sa eṣa eka ekavṛd eka eva ////
analyzed: tam idam nigatam sahaḥ saḥ eṣaḥ ekaḥ ekavṛt ekaḥ eva
translated: This is his all-pervading strength, he is the one, the increaser of the one, the one only.

original: ete asmin devā ekavṛto bhavanti ////
analyzed: ete asmin devāḥ ekavṛtaḥ bhavanti
translated: In him these gods become the increaser of the one.

original: kīrtiś ca yaśaś cāmbhaś ca nabhaś ca brāhmaṇavarcasaṃ cānnaṃ cānnādyaṃ ca ////
analyzed: kīrtiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca ambhaḥ ca nabhaḥ ca brāhmaṇa varcasam ca annam ca annādyam ca
translated: Glory and fame, water and sky, Brahmic glory and food and the eating of food.

original: ya etaṃ devam ekavṛtaṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ etam devam ekavṛtam veda
translated: He who knows this God, the One Encompassing,

original: na dvitīyo na tṛtīyaś caturtho nāpy ucyate ////
analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ na tṛtīyaḥ caturthaḥ na api ucyate
translated: There is no second, no third, nor is a fourth mentioned,

original: na pañcamo na ṣaṣṭhaḥ saptamo nāpy ucyate ////
analyzed: na pañcamaḥ na ṣaṣṭhaḥ saptamaḥ na api ucyate
translated: No fifth, no sixth, no seventh is mentioned,

original: nāṣṭamo na navamo daśamo nāpy ucyate ////
analyzed: na aṣṭamaḥ na navamaḥ daśamaḥ na api ucyate
translated: No eighth, no ninth, no tenth is mentioned.

original: sa sarvasmai vi paśyati yac ca prāṇati yac ca na ////
analyzed: sa sarvasmai vi paśyati yat ca prāṇati yat ca na
translated: He sees everything, both what breathes and what does not breathe.

original: tam idaṃ nigataṃ sahaḥ sa eṣa eka ekavṛd eka eva ////
analyzed: tam idam nigatam sahaḥ saḥ eṣaḥ ekaḥ ekavṛt ekaḥ eva
translated: This is the all-pervading strength, it is the One, the Increasing One, the Sole One.

original: sarve asmin devā ekavṛto bhavanti ////
analyzed: sarve asmin devāḥ ekavṛtaḥ bhavanti
translated: All the gods are encompassed in this One.

original: brahma ca tapaś ca kīrtiś ca yaśaś cāmbhaś ca nabhaś ca brāhmaṇavarcasaṃ cānnaṃ cānnādyaṃ ca ////
analyzed: brahma ca tapaḥ ca kīrtiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca ambhaḥ ca nabhaḥ ca brāhmaṇa varcasam ca annam ca annādyam ca
translated: Brahma, austerity, fame, glory, water, space, brahminical splendor, food, and the first food,

original: bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca śraddhā ca ruciś ca svargaś ca svadhā ca ////
analyzed: bhūtam ca bhavyam ca śraddhā ca ruciḥ ca svargaḥ ca svadhā ca
translated: The past and the future, faith, delight, heaven, and oblations,

original: ya etaṃ devam ekavṛtaṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ etam devam ekavṛtam veda
translated: He who knows this God, the One Encompassing,

original: sa eva mṛtyuḥ so 'mṛtaṃ so 'bhvaṃ sa rakṣaḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ eva mṛtyuḥ saḥ mṛtam saḥ bhvam sa rakṣaḥ
translated: He is indeed death, he is immortality, he is the fearful, he is the Rakshasa.

original: sa rudro vasuvanir vasudeye namovāke vaṣaṭkāro 'nu saṃhitaḥ ////
analyzed: sa rudraḥ vasu vaniḥ vasu deye namovāke vaṣaṭkāraḥ nu saṃhitaḥ
translated: He is Rudra, the bestower of wealth, in the bestowal of wealth, he is connected with the invocation of salutations and the exclamation of Vashat.

original: tasyeme sarve yātava upa praśiṣam āsate ////
analyzed: tasya ime sarve yātavaḥ upa praśiṣam āsate
translated: All these creatures of his sit down in his command.

original: tasyāmū sarvā nakṣatrā vaśe candramasā saha ////
analyzed: tasya amū sarvā nakṣatrā vaśe candramasā saha
translated: All those stars, together with the moon, are under her control.

original: sa vā ahno 'jāyata tasmād ahar ajāyata ////
analyzed: sa vai ahnaḥ jāyata tasmāt ahar ajāyata
translated: He was born from the day, therefore the day was born.

original: sa vai rātryā ajāyata tasmād rātrir ajāyata ////🔽sa vā antarikṣād ajāyata tasmād antarikṣam ajāyata ////
analyzed: sa vai rātryāḥ ajāyata tasmāt rātriḥ ajāyata  sa vai antarikṣāt ajāyata tasmāt antarikṣam ajāyata
translated: He was born from the night, therefore the night was born.🔽He was born from the atmosphere, therefore the atmosphere was born.

original: sa vai vāyor ajāyata tasmād vāyur ajāyata ////🔽sa vai divo 'jāyata tasmād dyaur adhi ajāyata ////
analyzed: sa vai vāyoḥ ajāyata tasmāt vāyuḥ ajāyata  sa vai divaḥ jāyata tasmāt dyauḥ adhi ajāyata
translated: He was born from the wind, therefore the wind was born.🔽He was born from the sky, therefore the sky was born above.

original: sa vai digbhyo 'jāyata tasmād diśo 'jāyanta ////
analyzed: sa vai digbhyaḥ jāyata tasmāt diśaḥ jāyanta
translated: He was born from the directions, therefore the directions were born.

original: sa vai bhūmer ajāyata tasmād bhūmir ajāyata ////🔽sa vā agner ajāyata tasmād agnir ajāyata ////
analyzed: sa vai bhūmeḥ ajāyata tasmāt bhūmiḥ ajāyata  sa vai agneḥ ajāyata tasmāt agniḥ ajāyata
translated: He was born from the earth, therefore the earth was born.🔽He was born from the fire, therefore the fire was born.

original: sa vā adbhyo 'jāyata tasmād āpo 'jāyanta ////
analyzed: sa vai adbhyaḥ jāyata tasmāt āpaḥ jāyanta
translated: He was born from the waters, therefore the waters were born.

original: sa vā ṛgbhyo 'jāyata tasmād ṛco 'jāyanta ////🔽sa vai yajñād ajāyata tasmād yajño 'jāyata ////
analyzed: sa vai ṛgbhyaḥ jāyata tasmāt ṛcaḥ jāyanta  sa vai yajñāt ajāyata tasmāt yajñaḥ jāyata
translated: He was born from the Ṛc verses, therefore the Ṛc verses were born.🔽He was born from the sacrifice, therefore the sacrifice was born.

original: sa yajñas tasya yajñaḥ sa yajñasya śiras kṛtam ////
analyzed: sa yajñaḥ tasya yajñaḥ sa yajñasya śiraḥ kṛtam
translated: That sacrifice is his, the sacrifice was made its head.

original: sa stanayati sa vi dyotate sa u aśmānam asyati ////
analyzed: sa stanayati sa vi dyotate saḥ u aśmānam asyati
translated: It thunders, it shines, it hurls the thunderbolt.

original: pāpāya vā bhadrāya vā puruṣāyāsurāya vā ////
analyzed: pāpāya vā bhadrāya vā puruṣāya asurāya vā
translated: For evil or for good, for man or for demon,

original: yad vā kṛṇoṣy oṣadhīr yad vā varṣasi bhadrayā yad vā janyam avīvṛdhaḥ ////
analyzed: yat vā kṛṇoṣi oṣadhīḥ yat vā varṣasi bhadrayā yat vā janyam avīvṛdhaḥ
translated: Whatever thou dost with the plants, whatever thou dost rain with the auspicious, whatever thou hast increased for the people,

original: tāvāṃs te maghavan mahimopo te tanvaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: tāvān te maghavan mahimā upa u te tanvaḥ śatam
translated: So great is thy greatness, O Maghavan, a hundred are thy bodies,

original: upo te badhve baddhāni yadi vāsi nyarbudam ////
analyzed: upa u te badhve baddhāni yadi vā asi nyarbudam
translated: Thy bonds are bound above, if thou art a hundred nayutas,

original: bhūyān indro namurād bhūyān indrāsi mṛtyubhyaḥ ////
analyzed: bhūyān indraḥ namurāt bhūyān indra asi mṛtyubhyaḥ
translated: Greater than Namuci is Indra, greater than death is Indra,

original: bhūyān arātyāḥ śacyāḥ patis tvam indrāsi vibhūḥ prabhūr iti tvopāsmahe vayam ////
analyzed: bhūyān arātyāḥ śacyāḥ patiḥ tvam indra asi vibhūḥ prabhūḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam
translated: Greater than misfortune is the lord of prosperity, thou art Indra, the all-pervading, the powerful, thus we worship thee.

original: namas te astu paśyata paśya mā paśyata ////
analyzed: namaḥ te astu paśyata paśya mā paśyata
translated: Salutations to thee, O seer, look, look, do not look.

original: annādyena yaśasā tejasā brāhmaṇavarcasena ////
analyzed: annādyena yaśasā tejasā brāhmaṇa varcasena
translated: With food, with fame, with splendor, with the luster of a brahmin,

original: ambho amo mahaḥ saha iti tvopāsmahe vayam ////
analyzed: ambhaḥ amaḥ mahaḥ sahaḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam
translated: With water, with freedom, with great strength, thus we worship thee.

original: ambho aruṇaṃ rajataṃ rajaḥ saha iti tvopāsmahe vayam //// 🔽uruḥ pṛthuḥ subhūr bhuva iti tvopāsmahe vayam ////
analyzed: ambhaḥ aruṇam rajatam rajaḥ sahaḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam  uruḥ pṛthuḥ subhūḥ bhuvaḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam
translated: With water, with red dust, with silver dust, with strength, thus we worship thee.🔽Vast, wide, well-being, existence, thus we worship thee.

original: pratho varo vyaco loka iti tvopāsmahe vayam ////
analyzed: prathaḥ varaḥ vyacaḥ lokaḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam
translated: Expansive, excellent, spacious, world, thus we worship thee.

original: bhavadvasur idadvasuḥ saṃyadvasur āyadvasur iti tvopāsmahe vayam ////
analyzed: bhavat vasuḥ idadvasuḥ saṃyat vasuḥ āyat vasuḥ iti tvā upāsmahe vayam
translated: We worship you as Bhava, Vasu, Idvasu, Samyadvāsu, and Ayadvāsu.

original: namas te astu paśyata paśya mā paśyata ////
analyzed: namaḥ te astu paśyata paśya mā paśyata
translated: Homage to you, O seer, look, look at me, look.

original: annādyena yaśasā tejasā brāhmaṇavarcasena ////
analyzed: annādyena yaśasā tejasā brāhmaṇa varcasena
translated: With food, with fame, with splendor, with the luster of a brahmin.

original: satyenottabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇottabhitā dyauḥ /
analyzed: satyena uttabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇa uttabhitā dyauḥ
translated: The earth is upheld by truth, the sky is upheld by the sun.

original: ṛtenādityās tiṣṭhanti divi somo adhi śritaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛtena ādityāḥ tiṣṭhanti divi somaḥ adhi śritaḥ
translated: The Adityas stand by law, Soma is established in the sky.

original: somenādityā balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī /
analyzed: somena ādityāḥ balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī
translated: The Adityas are strong by Soma, the earth is great by Soma.

original: atho nakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe soma āhitaḥ ////
analyzed: atha u nakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe somaḥ āhitaḥ
translated: And Soma is placed in the lap of these stars.

original: somaṃ manyate papivān yat saṃpiṃṣanty oṣadhim /
analyzed: somam manyate papivān yat saṃpiṃṣanti oṣadhim
translated: One who thinks he drinks Soma when they crush the herb,

original: somaṃ yaṃ brahmāṇo vidur na tasyāśnāti pārthivaḥ ////
analyzed: somam yam brahmāṇaḥ viduḥ na tasya aśnāti pārthivaḥ
translated: The earthly one does not eat of the Soma that the Brahmins know.

original: yat tvā soma prapibanti tata ā pyāyase punaḥ /🔽vāyuḥ somasya rakṣitā samānāṃ māsa ākṛtiḥ ////
analyzed: yat tvā soma prapibanti tatas ā pyāyase punar  vāyuḥ somasya rakṣitā samānām māsaḥ ākṛtiḥ
translated: O Soma, when they drink you, then you revive again.🔽Vayu is the protector of Soma, the month is the form of the equal ones.

original: āchadvidhānair gupito bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: āchad vidhānaiḥ gupitaḥ bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ
translated: Protected by the Vedic rules, O Soma, you are guarded by the Brahmanas.

original: grāvṇām ic chṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ ////
analyzed: grāvṇām id śṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ
translated: You stand listening to the pressing stones, the earthly one does not eat of you.

original: cittir ā upabarhaṇaṃ cakṣur ā abhyañjanam /
analyzed: cittiḥ āḥ upabarhaṇam cakṣuḥ āḥ abhyañjanam
translated: The mind is the pillow, the eye is the ointment.

original: dyaur bhūmiḥ kośa āsīd yad ayāt sūryā patim ////
analyzed: dyauḥ bhūmiḥ kośaḥ āsīt yat ayāt sūryā patim
translated: The sky was the sheath, the earth, when she went to her husband, Surya.

original: raibhy āsīd anudeyī nārāśaṃsī nyocanī /
analyzed: raibhī āsīt anudeyī nārāśaṃsī nyocanī
translated: Raibhya was her companion, Narashansi her companion in song.

original: suryāyā bhadram id vāso gāthayati pariṣkṛtā ////
analyzed: suryāyāḥ bhadram id vāsaḥ gāthayati pariṣkṛtā
translated: The well-prepared garment of Surya sings a hymn of good fortune.

original: stomā āsan pratidhayaḥ kurīraṃ chanda opaśaḥ /
analyzed: stomāḥ āsan pratidhayaḥ kurīram chandaḥ opaśaḥ
translated: The hymns were the counter-chants, the metre Opah was the head-dress.

original: sūryāyā aśvinā varāgnir āsīt purogavaḥ ////
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ aśvinā varā agniḥ āsīt purogavaḥ
translated: The Ashvins were the two excellent leaders of Surya's chariot, Agni was the leader.

original: somo vadhūyur abhavad aśvināstām ubhā varā /
analyzed: somaḥ vadhūyuḥ abhavat aśvinā āstām ubhā varā
translated: Soma became the bridegroom, the Ashvins were the two excellent ones.

original: sūryāṃ yat patye śaṃsantīṃ manasā savitādadāt ////
analyzed: sūryām yat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitā adadāt
translated: When Savitar gave Surya to her husband, who praised him with her mind.

original: mano asyā ana āsīd dyaur āsīd uta chadiḥ /
analyzed: manaḥ asyāḥ anaḥ āsīt dyauḥ āsīt uta chadiḥ
translated: Her mind was the yoke, the sky was the covering.

original: śukrāv anaḍvāhāv āstāṃ yad ayāt sūryā patim ////
analyzed: śukrau anaḍvāhau āstām yat ayāt sūryā patim
translated: The two bright oxen were the wheels, when she went to her husband, Surya.

original: ṛksāmābhyām abhihitau gāvau te sāmanāv aitām /🔽śrotre te cakre āstāṃ divi panthāś carācaraḥ ////
analyzed: ṛk sāmābhyām abhihitau gāvau te sāmanau aitām  śrotre te cakre āstām divi panthāḥ cara acaraḥ
translated: The two oxen were designated by the Rik and Saman, the Saman chants came to you as the two oxen.🔽The two ears were your wheels, the path in the sky is the moving and unmoving one.

original: śucī te cakre yātyā vyāno akṣa āhataḥ /🔽ano manasmayaṃ sūryārohat prayatī patim ////
analyzed: śucī te cakre yātyāḥ vyānaḥ akṣaḥ āhataḥ  anaḥ manasmayam sūryā ārohat prayatī patim
translated: The two pure wheels on which you go, the breath is the wheel that is struck by the axle.🔽The mind, thinking of Surya, mounted, going to her husband.

original: sūryāyā vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat /
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat
translated: From the womb of Surya, Savitar sent forth the one who was released.

original: maghāsu hanyante gāvaḥ phalgunīṣu vy uhyate ////
analyzed: maghāsu hanyante gāvaḥ phalgunīṣu vi uhyate
translated: The cows are killed in the Magha asterism, in the Phalguna asterism they are scattered.

original: yad aśvinā pṛchamānāv ayātaṃ tricakreṇa vahatuṃ sūryāyāḥ /
analyzed: yat aśvinā pṛcchamānau ayātam tri cakreṇa vahatum sūryāyāḥ
translated: When, O Asvins, you came, being questioned, with your three-wheeled chariot, to the carrying of Sûryâ,

original: kvaikaṃ cakraṃ vām āsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ ////
analyzed: kva ekam cakram vām āsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ
translated: Where was your one wheel? Where did you stop to look about you?

original: yad ayātaṃ śubhas patī vareyaṃ sūryām upa /
analyzed: yat ayātam śubhaḥ patī vareyam sūryām upa
translated: When you came, O lords of splendour, to the choice of Sûryâ,

original: viśve devā anu tad vām ajānan putraḥ pitaram avṛṇīta pūṣā ////
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu tat vām ajānan putraḥ pitaram avṛṇīta pūṣā
translated: All the Gods knew that matter: Pûshan chose his father as his portion.

original: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇa ṛtuthā viduḥ /
analyzed: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇaḥ ṛtuthā viduḥ
translated: Two wheels are yours, O Sûrya: the priests know them in due season.

original: athaikaṃ cakraṃ yad guhā tad addhātaya id viduḥ ////
analyzed: atha ekam cakram yat guhā tat addhātayaḥ id viduḥ
translated: But the one wheel which is hidden, that the wise know not at all.

original: aryamaṇaṃ yajāmahe subandhuṃ pativedanam /
analyzed: aryamaṇam yajāmahe su bandhum pati vedanam
translated: We worship Aryaman, the good friend, the finder of a husband for a wife.

original: urvārukam iva bandhanāt preto muñcāmi nāmutaḥ ////
analyzed: urvārukam iva bandhanāt pretaḥ muñcāmi na amutas
translated: From the noose, as 'twere, of a strong-necked bull I deliver him, and not to return.

original: preto muñcāmi nāmutaḥ subaddhām amutas karam /
analyzed: pretaḥ muñcāmi na amutas su baddhām amutas karam
translated: From the noose I deliver him, and not to return. I make him well-bound, not to return.

original: yatheyam indra mīḍhvaḥ suputrā subhagāsati ////
analyzed: yathā iyam indra mīḍhvaḥ su putrā subhagā asati
translated: That he may be, O bounteous Indra, a good son and a happy husband to her.

original: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśād yena tvābadhnāt savitā suśevāḥ /
analyzed: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt yena tvā abadhnāt savitā suśevāḥ
translated: I deliver thee from the noose of Varuna, wherewith the kindly Savitar hath bound thee.

original: ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke syonaṃ te astu sahasaṃbhalāyai ////
analyzed: ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke syonam te astu saha saṃbhalāyai
translated: In the womb of holy order, in the world of good deeds, be thou propitious to Sahasrabhala.

original: bhagas tveto nayatu hastagṛhyāśvinā tvā pra vahatāṃ rathena /
analyzed: bhagaḥ tvā itas nayatu hasta gṛhya aśvinā tvā pra vahatām rathena
translated: May Bhaga lead thee hither by the hand. Let the Asvins bear thee on their car.

original: gṛhān gacha gṛhapatnī yathāso vaśinī tvaṃ vidatham ā vadāsi //// 🔽iha priyaṃ prajāyai te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi /
analyzed: gṛhān gacha gṛha patnī yathā asaḥ vaśinī tvam vidatham ā vadāsi  iha priyam prajāyai te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi
translated: Go to the house, be a housewife, as you will, you speak in the assembly.🔽Here let what is dear to your offspring be accomplished for you. In this house, be watchful for the household fire.

original: enā patyā tanvaṃ saṃ spṛśasvātha jirvir vidatham ā vadāsi ////
analyzed: enā patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva atha jirviḥ vidatham ā vadāsi
translated: With this husband, touch your body together, then you will speak in the assembly.

original: ihaiva staṃ mā vi yauṣṭaṃ viśvam āyur vy aśnutam /
analyzed: iha eva stam mā vi viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnutam
translated: Do not be separated here. Fulfill the whole life.

original: krīḍantau putrair naptṛbhir modamānau svastakau ////
analyzed: krīḍantau putraiḥ naptṛbhiḥ modamānau svastakau
translated: Playing with sons and grandsons, rejoicing, with good fortune.

original: pūrvāparaṃ carato māyaitau śiśū krīḍantau pari yāto 'rṇavam /
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyā etau śiśū krīḍantau pari yātaḥ rṇavam
translated: Moving east and west, these two, like children playing, go around the ocean.

original: viśvānyo bhuvanā vicaṣṭa ṛtūṃr anyo vidadhaj jāyase navaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvā anyaḥ bhuvanā vicaṣṭe ṛtūṃr anyaḥ vidadhat jāyase navaḥ
translated: One who observes all the worlds, the other, establishing the seasons, is born anew.

original: navonavo bhavasi jāyamāno 'hnāṃ ketur uṣasām eṣy agram /
analyzed: navaḥ navaḥ bhavasi jāyamānaḥ hnām ketuḥ uṣasām eṣi agram
translated: You are born anew, becoming new, the banner of the days, you come to the forefront of the dawns.

original: bhāgaṃ devebhyo vi dadhāsy āyan pra candramas tirase dīrgham āyuḥ ////
analyzed: bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāsi āyan pra candramaḥ tirase dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: Going, you distribute a share to the gods, and the moon extends your long life.

original: parā dehi śāmulyaṃ brahmabhyo vi bhajā vasu /
analyzed: parā dehi śāmulyam brahmabhyaḥ vi bhaja vasu
translated: Give away the quarrel, distribute the wealth among the Brahmins.

original: kṛtyaiṣā padvatī bhūtvā jāyā viśate patim ////
analyzed: kṛtyā eṣā padvatī bhūtvā jāyā viśate patim
translated: This woman, having become a bird, enters her husband.

original: nīlalohitaṃ bhavati kṛtyāsaktir vy ajyate /
analyzed: nīla lohitam bhavati kṛtyā saktiḥ vi ajyate
translated: It becomes blue-red, the noose of the rite is loosened.

original: edhante asyā jñātayaḥ patir bandheṣu badhyate ////
analyzed: edhante asyāḥ jñātayaḥ patiḥ bandheṣu badhyate
translated: Her relatives prosper, her husband is bound in fetters.

original: aślīlā tanūr bhavati ruśatī pāpayāmuyā /
analyzed: aślīlā tanūḥ bhavati ruśatī pāpayā amuyā
translated: Her body becomes impure, defiled by evil.

original: patir yad vadhvo vāsasaḥ svam aṅgam abhyūrṇute ////
analyzed: patiḥ yat vadhvaḥ vāsasaḥ svam aṅgam abhyūrṇute
translated: When the husband anoints his own body with the garment of the bride.

original: āśasanaṃ viśasanam atho adhivikartanam /
analyzed: āśasanam viśasanam atha u adhivikartanam
translated: Cutting, carving, and then cutting again,

original: sūryāyāḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahmota śumbhati ////
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahmā uta śumbhati
translated: Behold the forms of the sun, those the Brahman priest adorns.

original: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam apāṣṭhavad viṣavan naitad attave /
analyzed: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam apāṣṭhavat viṣavat na etat attave
translated: This is bitter, pungent like a thorn, like poison, it is not to be eaten.

original: sūryāṃ yo brahmā veda sa id vādhūyam arhati ////
analyzed: sūryām yaḥ brahmā veda saḥ id vādhūyam arhati
translated: He who knows the sun as Brahman is indeed worthy of the bride.

original: sa it tat syonaṃ harati brahmā vāsaḥ sumaṅgalam /
analyzed: saḥ id tat syonam harati brahmā vāsaḥ su maṅgalam
translated: The Brahman priest carries that auspicious garment, the prosperous one,

original: prāyaścittiṃ yo adhyeti yena jāyā na riṣyati //// 🔽yuvaṃ bhagaṃ saṃ bharataṃ samṛddham ṛtaṃ vadantāv ṛtodyeṣu /
analyzed: prāyaścittim yaḥ adhyeti yena jāyā na riṣyati  yuvam bhagam sam bharatam samṛddham ṛtam vadantau ṛtodyeṣu
translated: The expiation which he studies, by which the wife is not harmed.🔽You two, O Bhaga, bring him together, prosperous, speaking the truth, in the rites of truth.

original: brahmaṇas pate patim asyai rocaya cāru saṃbhalo vadatu vācam etām ////
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pate patim asyai rocaya cāru saṃbhalaḥ vadatu vācam etām
translated: O lord of prayer, make him shine as the husband of this one, may the auspicious one speak this speech.

original: ihed asātha na paro gamāthemaṃ gāvaḥ prajayā vardhayātha /
analyzed: iha id asātha na paras gamātha imam gāvaḥ prajayā vardhaya atha
translated: Here you have come, do not go away, increase this one with offspring, O cows.

original: śubhaṃ yatīr usriyāḥ somavarcaso viśve devāḥ krann iha vo manāṃsi ////
analyzed: śubham yatīḥ usriyāḥ soma varcasaḥ viśve devāḥ kran iha vaḥ manāṃsi
translated: May the auspicious cows, radiant with Soma, may all the gods rejoice here, may your minds be pleased.

original: imaṃ gāvaḥ prajayā saṃ viśāthāyaṃ devānāṃ na mināti bhāgam /
analyzed: imam gāvaḥ prajayā sam viśātha ayam devānām na mināti bhāgam
translated: In this (world) may the cows unite with offspring and with the people. He does not deprive the gods of their share.

original: asmai vaḥ pūṣā marutaś ca sarve asmai vo dhātā savitā suvāti ////🔽anṛkṣarā ṛjavaḥ santu panthano yebhiḥ sakhāyo yanti no vareyam /
analyzed: asmai vaḥ pūṣā marutaḥ ca sarve asmai vaḥ dhātā savitā suvāti  anṛkṣarāḥ ṛjavaḥ santu panthanaḥ yebhiḥ sakhāyaḥ yanti naḥ vareyam
translated: For you all, O Pusan and the Maruts, for you, O Dhatr and Savitar, may he procure (it).🔽May the paths be free from thorns and straight, by which our friends go to a better place.

original: saṃ bhagena sam aryamṇā saṃ dhātā sṛjatu varcasā ////
analyzed: sam bhagena sam aryamṇā sam dhātā sṛjatu varcasā
translated: May Dhatr unite you with fortune, with nobility, with power.

original: yac ca varco akṣeṣu surāyāṃ ca yad āhitam /
analyzed: yat ca varcaḥ akṣeṣu surāyām ca yat āhitam
translated: Whatever splendour there is in the dice and in the Surâ,

original: yad goṣv aśvinā varcas tenemāṃ varcasāvatam ////
analyzed: yat goṣu aśvinā varcaḥ tena imām varcasā avatam
translated: and whatever splendour there is in the cows, O Asvins, with that splendour do ye endow this (sacrificer).

original: yena mahānaghnyā jaghanam aśvinā yena vā surā /
analyzed: yena mahānaghnyā jaghanam aśvinā yena vā surā
translated: With that wherewith ye slew the great she-wolf, O Asvins, with that wherewith ye slew the Surâ,

original: yenākṣā abhyaṣicyanta tenemāṃ varcasāvatam ////🔽yo anidhmo dīdayad apsv antar yaṃ viprāsa īḍate adhvareṣu /
analyzed: yena akṣāḥ abhyaṣicyanta tena imām varcasā avatam  yaḥ anidhmaḥ dīdayat apsu antar yam viprāsaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu
translated: with that wherewith the dice were anointed, with that splendour do ye endow this (sacrificer).🔽He who shines without fuel in the waters, whom the sages invoke at the sacrifices,

original: apāṃ napān madhumatīr apo dā yābhir indro vāvṛdhe vīryāvān ////
analyzed: apām napāt madhumatīḥ apaḥ dāḥ yābhiḥ indraḥ vāvṛdhe vīryāvān
translated: give the waters to the son of the waters, the sweet waters, by which Indra grew strong and powerful.

original: idam ahaṃ ruśantaṃ grābhaṃ tanūdūṣim apohāmi /
analyzed: idam aham ruśantam grābham tanū dūṣim apohāmi
translated: I drive away this shining seizure, the disease of the body.

original: yo bhadro rocanas tam ud acāmi ////
analyzed: yaḥ bhadraḥ rocanaḥ tam ud acāmi
translated: I draw up the auspicious, the shining one.

original: āsyai brāhmaṇāḥ snapanīr harantv avīraghnīr ud ajantv āpaḥ /
analyzed: ā asyai brāhmaṇāḥ snapanīḥ harantu a vīra ghnīḥ ud ajantu āpaḥ
translated: Let the Brahmans bring to her the bathing waters, which slay no hero; let the waters raise her up.

original: aryamṇo agniṃ pary etu pūṣan pratīkṣante śvaśuro devaraś ca ////
analyzed: aryamṇaḥ agnim pari etu pūṣan pratīkṣante śvaśuraḥ devaraḥ ca
translated: Let Agni be with Aryaman, with Pusan. The father-in-law and the brother-in-law wait.

original: śaṃ te hiraṇyaṃ śam u santv āpaḥ śaṃ methir bhavatu śaṃ yugasya tardma /
analyzed: śam te hiraṇyam śam u santu āpaḥ śam methiḥ bhavatu śam yugasya tardma
translated: Good be to thee the gold, and good be to thee the waters. Good be the altar, good be the end of the yoke.

original: śaṃ ta āpaḥ śatapavitrā bhavantu śam u patyā tanvaṃ saṃ spṛśasva ////
analyzed: śam te āpaḥ śata pavitrāḥ bhavantu śam u patyā tanvam sam spṛśasva
translated: Good be to thee the waters with a hundred purifiers. Good be it to thee to touch thy body with thy husband.

original: khe rathasya khe 'nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato /
analyzed: khe rathasya khe nasaḥ khe yugasya śatakrato
translated: In the chariot's path, in the path of the pole, in the path of the yoke, O thou of a hundred powers,

original: apālām indra triṣ pūtvākṛṇoḥ sūryatvacam ////
analyzed: apālām indra tris pūtvā akṛṇoḥ sūrya tvacam
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast made the sun's skin threefold, having purified it.

original: āśāsānā saumanasaṃ prajāṃ saubhāgyaṃ rayim /
analyzed: āśāsānā saumanasam prajām saubhāgyam rayim
translated: Desiring good will, offspring, good fortune, and wealth,

original: patyur anuvratā bhūtvā saṃ nahyasvāmṛtāya kam ////
analyzed: patyuḥ anuvratā bhūtvā sam nahyasva amṛtāya kam
translated: Becoming obedient to thy husband, bind thyself to the immortal one.

original: yathā sindhur nadīnāṃ sāmrājyaṃ suṣuve vṛṣā /
analyzed: yathā sindhuḥ nadīnām sāmrājyam suṣuve vṛṣā
translated: As the mighty Sindhu begat on the rivers sovereignty,

original: evā tvaṃ samrājñy edhi patyur astaṃ paretya ////🔽samrājñy edhi śvaśureṣu samrājñy uta devṛṣu /
analyzed: eva tvam samrājñī edhi patyuḥ astam paretya  samrājñī edhi śvaśureṣu samrājñī uta devṛṣu
translated: Even so become thou a sovereign lady, O N.N., having gone to thy husband's house.🔽Be a sovereign lady among thy fathers-in-law, be a sovereign lady among the kinsmen.

original: nanānduḥ samrājñy edhi samrājñy uta śvaśrvāḥ ////
analyzed: nanānduḥ samrājñī edhi samrājñī uta śvaśrvāḥ
translated: Be a sovereign lady among thy sisters-in-law, be a sovereign lady among thy aunts.

original: yā akṛntann avayan yāś ca tatnire yā devīr antāṃ abhito 'dadanta /
analyzed: yāḥ akṛntan avayan yāḥ ca tatnire yāḥ devīḥ abhitas dadanta
translated: Those who wove, those who spun, those who spread it out, those goddesses who gave the ends on both sides,

original: tās tvā jarase saṃ vyayantv āyuṣmatīdaṃ pari dhatsva vāsaḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvā jarase sam vyayantu āyuṣmatī idam pari dhatsva vāsaḥ
translated: Let them lead thee to old age; put on this garment, full of life.

original: jīvaṃ rudanti vi nayanty adhvaraṃ dīrghām anu prasitiṃ dīdhyur naraḥ /
analyzed: jīvam rudanti vi nayanti adhvaram dīrghām anu prasitim dīdhyuḥ naraḥ
translated: They weep for the living; they lead the sacrifice away; the men have longed for a long time for the embrace.

original: vāmaṃ pitṛbhyo ya idaṃ samīrire mayaḥ patibhyo janaye pariṣvaje ////🔽syonaṃ dhruvaṃ prajāyai dhārayāmi te 'śmānaṃ devyāḥ pṛthivyā upasthe /
analyzed: vāmam pitṛbhyaḥ ye idam samīrire mayaḥ patibhyaḥ janaye pariṣvaje  syonam dhruvam prajāyai dhārayāmi te śmānam devyāḥ pṛthivyāḥ upasthe
translated: The good to the fathers who have sent this forth; the joy to the lords of the house, the embrace.🔽I place thee, pleasant and firm, for offspring, the stone in the lap of the divine earth.

original: tam ā tiṣṭhānumādyā suvarcā dīrghaṃ ta āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: tam ā tiṣṭha anumādyā su varcāḥ dīrgham te āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu
translated: Mount it, O thou of good thoughts, today; may Savitar make thy life long.

original: yenāgnir asyā bhūmyā hastaṃ jagrāha dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: yena agniḥ asyāḥ bhūmyāḥ hastam jagrāha dakṣiṇam
translated: By which Agni took the right hand of this earth,

original: tena gṛhṇāmi te hastaṃ mā vyathiṣṭhā mayā saha prajayā ca dhanena ca ////
analyzed: tena gṛhṇāmi te hastam mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ mayā saha prajayā ca dhanena ca
translated: By that I take thy hand; be not afraid with me, with offspring and with wealth.

original: devas te savitā hastaṃ gṛhṇātu somo rājā suprajasaṃ kṛṇotu /
analyzed: devaḥ te savitā hastam gṛhṇātu somaḥ rājā suprajasam kṛṇotu
translated: May the god Savitar take thy hand; may Soma, the king, make thee rich in offspring.

original: agniḥ subhagāṃ jatavedāḥ patye patnīṃ jaradaṣṭim kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: agniḥ subhagām jata vedāḥ patye patnīm jaradaṣṭim kṛṇotu
translated: May Agni, the all-knower, make the fortunate wife for the husband, with long life.

original: gṛhṇāmi te saubhagatvāya hastaṃ mayā patyā jaradaṣṭir yathāsaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhṇāmi te saubhaga tvāya hastam mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asaḥ
translated: I take thy hand for good fortune; as thou art with me, with long life,

original: bhago aryamā savitā puraṃdhir mahyaṃ tvādur gārhapatyāya devāḥ ////
analyzed: bhagaḥ aryamā savitā puraṃdhiḥ mahyam tvā aduḥ gārhapatyāya devāḥ
translated: Bhaga, Aryaman, Savitar, the bounteous God, have given her to me for my household's mistress.

original: bhagas te hastam agrahīt savitā hastam agrahīt /
analyzed: bhagaḥ te hastam agrahīt savitā hastam agrahīt
translated: Bhaga hath taken thy hand, Savitar hath taken thy hand.

original: patnī tvam asi dharmaṇāhaṃ gṛhapatis tava ////
analyzed: patnī tvam asi dharmaṇā aham gṛhapatiḥ tava
translated: Thou art the wife of Dharma, I am the lord of the house.

original: mameyam astu poṣyā mahyaṃ tvādād bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: mama iyam astu poṣyā mahyam tvā adāt bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Let her be mine to cherish: Savitar hath given her to me.

original: mayā patyā prajāvati saṃ jīva śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: mayā patyā prajāvati sam jīva śaradaḥ śatam
translated: With me as husband, full of children, live a hundred autumns.

original: tvaṣṭā vāso vy adadhāc chubhe kaṃ bṛhaspateḥ praśiṣā kavīnām /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā vāsaḥ vi adadhāt śubhe kam bṛhaspateḥ praśiṣā kavīnām
translated: Tvashtar hath clothed her in a fair garment, by the direction of Brihaspati, the wise.

original: tenemāṃ nārīṃ savitā bhagaś ca sūryām iva pari dhattāṃ prajayā ////
analyzed: tena imām nārīm savitā bhagaḥ ca sūryām iva pari dhattām prajayā
translated: With this let Surya and Bhaga invest this woman, as with the sun.

original: indrāgnī dyāvāpṛthivī mātariśvā mitrāvaruṇā bhago aśvinobhā /
analyzed: indra agnī dyāvāpṛthivī mātariśvā mitrāvaruṇā bhagaḥ aśvinā ubhā
translated: Indra and Agni, Heaven and Earth, Matarisvan, Mitra, Varuna, Bhaga, the two Asvins,

original: bṛhaspatir maruto brahma soma imāṃ nāriṃ prajayā vardhayantu ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ marutaḥ brahma somaḥ imām nārim prajayā vardhayantu
translated: Brihaspati, the Maruts, Brahman, Soma, let them increase this woman with offspring.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaḥ sūryāyāḥ śīrṣe keśāṃ akalpayat /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaḥ sūryāyāḥ śīrṣe keśān akalpayat
translated: Brihaspati first arranged the hair on Surya's head.

original: tenemām aśvinā nārīṃ patye saṃ śobhayāmasi ////
analyzed: tena imām aśvinā nārīm patye sam śobhayāmasi
translated: With that we adorn this woman for her husband, O Asvins.

original: idaṃ tad rūpaṃ yad avasta yoṣā jāyāṃ jijñāse manasā carantīm /
analyzed: idam tat rūpam yat avasta yoṣā jāyām jijñāse manasā carantīm
translated: This is the form which the woman assumes, when she moves about in mind, desiring to know her husband.

original: tām anv artiṣye sakhibhir navagvaiḥ ka imān vidvān vi cacarta pāśān ////
analyzed: tām anu sakhibhiḥ navagvaiḥ kaḥ imān vidvān vi cacarta pāśān
translated: I will follow her with my friends, the Navagvas. Who, knowing this, has loosed these bonds?

original: ahaṃ vi ṣyāmi mayi rūpam asyā vedad it paśyan manasaḥ kulāyam /
analyzed: aham vi syāmi mayi rūpam asyāḥ vedat id paśyan manasaḥ kulāyam
translated: I will unravel this, the form of her, and see the nest of the mind.

original: na steyam admi manasod amucye svayaṃ śrathnāno varuṇasya pāśān ////
analyzed: na steyam admi manasā ud amucye svayam śrathnānaḥ varuṇasya pāśān
translated: I do not admit theft, I am freed from the mind, loosening the bonds of Varuna myself.

original: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśād yena tvābadhnāt savitā suśevāḥ /
analyzed: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt yena tvā abadhnāt savitā suśevāḥ
translated: I release you from the noose of Varuna, by which the kindly Savita has bound you.

original: uruṃ lokaṃ sugam atra panthāṃ kṛṇomi tubhyaṃ sahapatnyai vadhu ////
analyzed: urum lokam sugam atra panthām kṛṇomi tubhyam saha patnyai vadhu
translated: I make for you, for the wife with her husband, a wide world, an easy path here.

original: ud yachadhvam apa rakṣo hanāthemaṃ nārīṃ sukṛte dadhāta /
analyzed: ud yacchadhvam apa rakṣaḥ hanātha imam nārīm su kṛte dadhāta
translated: Lift up, slay the Rakshas, place this woman in good fortune.

original: dhātā vipaścit patim asyai viveda bhago rājā pura etu prajānan ////
analyzed: dhātā vipaścit patim asyai viveda bhagaḥ rājā puras etu prajānan
translated: The wise Dhatr has found a husband for her. Let Bhaga, the king, come forward, knowing.

original: bhagas tatakṣa caturaḥ pādān bhagas tatakṣa catvāry uṣpalāni /
analyzed: bhagaḥ tatakṣa caturaḥ pādān bhagaḥ tatakṣa catvāri uṣpalāni
translated: Bhaga has fashioned the four feet, Bhaga has fashioned the four hooves.

original: tvaṣṭā pipeśa madhyato 'nu vardhrānt sā no astu sumaṅgalī ////
analyzed: tvaṣṭā pipeśa madhyatas nu vardhrān sā naḥ astu su maṅgalī
translated: Tvastr has fashioned the middle, increasing the girth. May she be auspicious for us.

original: sukiṃśukaṃ vahatuṃ viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyavarṇaṃ suvṛtaṃ sucakram /
analyzed: su kiṃśukam vahatum viśva rūpam hiraṇya varṇam suvṛtam su cakram
translated: The well-formed chariot, of all forms, golden-colored, well-covered, with good wheels,

original: ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokaṃ syonaṃ patibhyo vahatuṃ kṛṇu tvam ////
analyzed: ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokam syonam patibhyaḥ vahatum kṛṇu tvam
translated: Ascend the sun, the world of the immortal. Make yourself a pleasant vehicle for your husbands.

original: abhrātṛghnīṃ varuṇāpaśughnīṃ bṛhaspate /
analyzed: a bhrātṛ ghnīm varuṇa a paśu ghnīm bṛhaspate
translated: Varuṇa, free from killing brothers, free from killing cattle, O Brhaspati,

original: indrāpatighnīm putriṇīm āsmabhyaṃ savitar vaha ////
analyzed: indra a pati ghnīm putriṇīm ā asmabhyam savitar vaha
translated: Free from killing husbands, O Indra, O Savitar, bring to us the one who bears sons.

original: mā hiṃsiṣṭaṃ kumāryaṃ sthūṇe devakṛte pathi /
analyzed: mā hiṃsiṣṭam kumāryam sthūṇe deva kṛte pathi
translated: Do not injure the young girl, the pillar on the path made by the gods.

original: śālāyā devyā dvāraṃ syonaṃ kṛṇmo vadhūpatham ////
analyzed: śālāyāḥ devyāḥ dvāram syonam kṛṇmaḥ vadhū patham
translated: We make the door of the goddess of the house pleasant, the path for the bride.

original: brahmāparaṃ yujyatāṃ brahma pūrvaṃ brahmāntato madhyato brahma sarvataḥ /
analyzed: brahma aparam yujyatām brahma pūrvam brahma antatas madhyatas brahma sarvatas
translated: Let the Brahman be joined to the highest, the Brahman to the lowest, the Brahman at the end, in the middle, the Brahman everywhere.

original: anāvyādhāṃ devapurāṃ prapadya śivā syonā patiloke vi rāja ////
analyzed: an āvyādhām deva purām prapadya śivā syonā pati loke vi rāja
translated: Approaching the divine cities free from injury, be auspicious and pleasant in the world of your husband.

original: tubhyam agre pary avahant sūryāṃ vahatunā saha /🔽sa naḥ patibhyo jāyāṃ dā agne prajayā saha ////
analyzed: tubhyam agre pari avahan sūryām vahatunā saha  sa naḥ patibhyaḥ jāyām dāḥ agne prajayā saha
translated: For you first they beat the sun together with the carrying.🔽May he, O Agni, give us back our wife together with children.

original: punaḥ patnīm agnir adād āyuṣā saha varcasā /
analyzed: punar patnīm agniḥ adāt āyuṣā saha varcasā
translated: Agni has given back the wife together with life and splendor.

original: dīrghāyur asyā yaḥ patir jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ asyāḥ yaḥ patiḥ jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam
translated: Long-lived will be her husband, he will live a hundred autumns.

original: somasya jāyā prathamaṃ gandharvas te 'paraḥ patiḥ /
analyzed: somasya jāyā prathamam gandharvaḥ te paraḥ patiḥ
translated: Soma's wife was the first, a Gandharva was your second husband.

original: tṛtīyo agniṣ ṭe patis turīyas te manuṣyajāḥ ////
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ agniḥ te patiḥ turīyaḥ te manuṣya jāḥ
translated: The third is your husband Agni, the fourth is born from a human.

original: somo dadad gandharvāya gandharvo dadad agnaye /
analyzed: somaḥ dadat gandharvāya gandharvaḥ dadat agnaye
translated: Soma gave to the Gandharva, the Gandharva gave to Agni.

original: rayiṃ ca putrāṃs cādād agnir mahyam atho imām ////
analyzed: rayim ca putrān ca adāt agniḥ mahyam atha u imām
translated: Agni gave me wealth and sons, and also this (woman).

original: ā vām agant sumatir vājinīvasū ny aśvinā hṛtsu kāmā araṃsata /
analyzed: ā vām agan sumatiḥ vājinīvasū ni aśvinā hṛtsu kāmāḥ araṃsata
translated: Your favour has come to you, O ye rich in wealth; the desires in the hearts of the Asvins have been fulfilled.

original: abhūtaṃ gopā mithunā śubhas patī priyā aryamṇo duryāṃ aśīmahi ////
analyzed: abhūtam gopā mithunā śubhaḥ patī priyāḥ aryamṇaḥ duryām aśīmahi
translated: We have come to the house of Aryaman, the two auspicious lords, the pair, the protectors, have become gracious.

original: sā mandasānā manasā śivena rayiṃ dhehi sarvavīraṃ vacasyam /
analyzed: sā mandasānā manasā śivena rayim dhehi sarva vīram vacasyam
translated: Be gracious with a gracious mind, give wealth, prosperity, with many heroes, to be praised.

original: sugaṃ tīrthaṃ suprapāṇaṃ śubhas patī sthāṇuṃ pathiṣṭhām apa durmatiṃ hatam ////
analyzed: su gam tīrtham su prapāṇam śubhaḥ patī sthāṇum pathiṣṭhām apa durmatim hatam
translated: O ye auspicious lords, make the ford easy, the drinking place good, the standing place on the path firm, and destroy evil thoughts.

original: yā oṣadhayo yā nadyo yāni kṣetrāṇi yā vanā /
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhayaḥ yāḥ nadyaḥ yāni kṣetrāṇi yāḥ vanā
translated: Those plants, those rivers, those fields, those woods,

original: tās tvā vadhu prajāvatīṃ patye rakṣantu rakṣasaḥ ////
analyzed: tāḥ tvā vadhu prajāvatīm patye rakṣantu rakṣasaḥ
translated: may they, O young wife, protect you, rich in offspring, from the Raksases, for your husband.

original: emaṃ panthām arukṣāma sugaṃ svastivāhanam /
analyzed: ā imam panthām arukṣāma su gam svasti vāhanam
translated: We have ascended this path, easy, bringing good fortune,

original: yasmin vīro na riṣyaty anyeṣāṃ vindate vasu ////
analyzed: yasmin vīraḥ na riṣyati anyeṣām vindate vasu
translated: on which the hero is not injured, and finds wealth among others.

original: idaṃ su me naraḥ śṛṇuta yayāśiṣā daṃpatī vāmam aśnutaḥ /
analyzed: idam su me naraḥ śṛṇuta yayā āśiṣā daṃpatī vāmam aśnutaḥ
translated: Listen to this of mine, O men, with what blessing the couple obtain what is good.

original: ye gandharvā apsarasaś ca devīr eṣu vānaspatyeṣu ye 'dhi tasthuḥ /
analyzed: ye gandharvāḥ apsarasaḥ ca devīḥ eṣu vānaspatyeṣu ye dhi tasthuḥ
translated: Those Gandharvas and those divine Apsarases who dwell in these trees and plants,

original: syonās te asyai vadhvai bhavantu mā hiṃsiṣur vahatum uhyamānam ////
analyzed: syonāḥ te asyai vadhvai bhavantu mā hiṃsiṣuḥ vahatum uhyamānam
translated: Be gentle to this bride of yours, let them not injure the one who is carried along to the wedding.

original: ye vadhvaś candraṃ vahatuṃ yakṣmā yanti janāṃ anu /
analyzed: ye vadhvaḥ candram vahatum yakṣmāḥ yanti janān anu
translated: Those who, as consumption, follow the people to the wedding of the bride,

original: punas tān yajñiyā devā nayantu yata āgatāḥ ////
analyzed: punar tān yajñiyāḥ devāḥ nayantu yatas āgatāḥ
translated: May the sacrificial gods lead them back again from where they came.

original: mā vidan paripanthino ya āsīdanti daṃpatī /
analyzed: mā vidan paripanthinaḥ ye āsīdanti daṃpatī
translated: Let not the enemies who lie in wait for the pair as they go to their home find them.

original: sugena durgam atītām apa drāntv arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: sugena durgam atītām apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: By a good path may they pass over the difficult one; may the evil spirits flee away.

original: saṃ kāśayāmi vahatuṃ brahmaṇā gṛhair aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa /
analyzed: sam kāśayāmi vahatum brahmaṇā gṛhaiḥ aghoreṇa cakṣuṣā mitriyeṇa
translated: I unite the bride with the wedding by prayer, by the house, by the eye that is harmless, by the friendly one.

original: paryāṇaddhaṃ viśvarūpaṃ yad asti syonaṃ patibhyaḥ savitā tat kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: paryāṇaddham viśva rūpam yat asti syonam patibhyaḥ savitā tat kṛṇotu
translated: May Savitar make her, who is wrapped in all forms, gentle to her husbands.

original: śivā nārīyam astam āgann imaṃ dhātā lokam asyai dideśa /
analyzed: śivā nārī iyam astam āgan imam dhātā lokam asyai dideśa
translated: This woman has come to this house as an auspicious guest; the creator has assigned this world to her.

original: tām aryamā bhago aśvinobhā prajāpatiḥ prajayā vardhayantu ////🔽ātmanvaty urvarā nārīyam āgan tasyāṃ naro vapata bījam asyām /
analyzed: tām aryamā bhagaḥ aśvinā ubhā prajāpatiḥ prajayā vardhayantu  ātmanvatī urvarā nārī iyam āgan tasyām naraḥ vapata bījam asyām
translated: May Aryaman, Bhaga, the two Asvins, and Prajapati increase her with offspring.🔽This woman, who has come to this house, is a fertile field, full of spirit. In her the men sow the seed.

original: sā vaḥ prajāṃ janayad vakṣaṇābhyo bibhratī dugdham ṛṣabhasya retaḥ ////
analyzed: sā vaḥ prajām janayat vakṣaṇābhyaḥ bibhratī dugdham ṛṣabhasya retaḥ
translated: May she, bearing the milk of the bull's seed, generate offspring for you from her bosom.

original: prati tiṣṭha virāḍ asi viṣṇur iveha sarasvati /
analyzed: prati tiṣṭha virāj asi viṣṇuḥ iva iha sarasvati
translated: Stand firm, O Virāj, thou art like Vishnu here, O Sarasvatī.

original: sinīvāli pra jāyatāṃ bhagasya sumatāv asat ////
analyzed: sinīvāli pra jāyatām bhagasya sumatau asat
translated: Let there be offspring, O Sinivāli, and let it be in the good grace of Bhaga.

original: ud va ūrmiḥ śamyā hantv āpo yoktrāṇi muñcata /
analyzed: ud vaḥ ūrmiḥ śamyāḥ hantu āpaḥ yoktrāṇi muñcata
translated: Let the wave be lifted up, let the yoke be loosened, let the waters release the bonds.

original: māduṣkṛtau vyenasāv aghnyāv aśunam āratām ////
analyzed: mā a duṣkṛtau vyenasau aghnyau aśunam āratām
translated: Let not the two innocent ones, the unoffending ones, be slain by the evil-doer.

original: aghoracakṣur apatighnī syonā śagmā suśevā suyamā gṛhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: aghora cakṣuḥ a pati ghnī syonā śagmā su śevā su yamā gṛhebhyaḥ
translated: Be thou, O house, of harmless eye, not slaying the lord, kindly, prosperous, well-disposed, easy to dwell with.

original: vīrasūr devṛkāmā saṃ tvayaidhiṣīmahi sumasyamānā ////
analyzed: vīra sūḥ devṛ kāmā sam tvayā edhiṣīmahi sumasyamānā
translated: Begetting heroes, longing for the gods, may we prosper with thee, being well-disposed.

original: adevṛghny apatighnīhaidhi śivā paśubhyaḥ suyamā suvarcāḥ /
analyzed: a devṛ ghnī a pati ghnī iha edhi śivā paśubhyaḥ su yamā su varcāḥ
translated: Slay not the gods, slay not the lord, be kind to cattle, easy to dwell with, of good countenance.

original: prajāvatī vīrasūr devṛkāmā syonemam agniṃ gārhapatyaṃ saparya ////
analyzed: prajāvatī vīrasūḥ devṛ kāmā syonā imam agnim gārhapatyam saparya
translated: Abounding in offspring, begetting heroes, longing for the gods, O kindly one, honour this Agni, the household Gārhapatya.

original: ut tiṣṭhetaḥ kim ichantīdam āgā ahaṃ tveḍe abhibhūḥ svād gṛhāt /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha itas kim icchantī idam āgāḥ aham tvā īḍe abhibhūḥ svāt gṛhāt
translated: Rise up from here, what seekest thou, coming hither? I am the lord in my own house.

original: śūnyaiṣī nirṛte yājaganthot tiṣṭhārāte pra pata meha raṃsthāḥ ////
analyzed: śūnyaiṣī nirṛte yā ājagantha ud tiṣṭha arāte pra pata mā iha raṃsthāḥ
translated: O Nirṛti, thou goest seeking the empty, rise up, O Rātī, fly away, stay not here.

original: yadā gārhapatyam asaparyait pūrvam agniṃ vadhūr iyam /🔽adhā sarasvatyai nāri pitṛbhyaś ca namas kuru ////
analyzed: yadā gārhapatyam asaparyait pūrvam agnim vadhūḥ iyam  adha sarasvatyai nāri pitṛbhyaḥ ca namaḥ kuru
translated: When she has honoured the Gārhapatya, this young wife, the first Agni,🔽Then pay homage to Sarasvatī and to the Fathers.

original: śarma varmaitad ā harāsyai nāryā upastire /
analyzed: śarma varma etat ā hara asyai nāryai upastire
translated: Bring this shelter, this armour, to this woman as a covering.

original: sinīvāli pra jāyatāṃ bhagasya sumatāv asat ////
analyzed: sinīvāli pra jāyatām bhagasya sumatau asat
translated: Let her be prosperous, O Sinivāli, in the favour of Bhaga.

original: yaṃ balbajaṃ nyasyatha carma copastṛṇīthana /
analyzed: yam balbajam nyasyatha carma ca upastṛṇīthana
translated: The reed which ye have placed, and the hide which ye have spread out,

original: tad ā rohatu suprajā yā kanyā vindate patim ////
analyzed: tat ā rohatu su prajāḥ yā kanyā vindate patim
translated: May the maiden who finds a husband ascend that, and be well-born.

original: upa stṛṇīhi balbajam adhi carmaṇi rohite /
analyzed: upa stṛṇīhi balbajam adhi carmaṇi rohite
translated: Spread out the reed, on the red hide,

original: tatropaviśya suprajā imam agniṃ saparyatu ////
analyzed: tatra upaviśya suprajāḥ imam agnim saparyatu
translated: Having sat there, well-born, let her serve this Agni.

original: ā roha carmopa sīdāgnim eṣa devo hanti rakṣāṃsi sarvā /
analyzed: ā roha carma upa sīda agnim eṣa devaḥ hanti rakṣāṃsi sarvā
translated: Ascend the hide, sit down by the fire, this god destroys all demons.

original: iha prajāṃ janaya patye asmai sujyaiṣṭhyo bhavat putras ta eṣaḥ ////
analyzed: iha prajām janaya patye asmai su jyaiṣṭhyaḥ bhavat putraḥ te eṣaḥ
translated: Here beget offspring for this husband of yours, be a good eldest wife, this son of yours.

original: vi tiṣṭhantāṃ mātur asyā upasthān nānārūpāḥ paśavo jāyamānāḥ /
analyzed: vi tiṣṭhantām mātuḥ asyāḥ upasthāt nānā rūpāḥ paśavaḥ jāyamānāḥ
translated: Let the various forms of cattle, being born, be scattered in the lap of this mother.

original: sumaṅgaly upa sīdemam agniṃ saṃpatnī prati bhūṣeha devān ////
analyzed: su maṅgalī upa sīda imam agnim saṃ patnī prati bhūṣa iha devān
translated: Well-omened, sit down by this fire, as a wife I will adorn myself for the gods here.

original: sumaṅgalī prataraṇī gṛhāṇāṃ suśevā patye śvaśurāya śaṃbhūḥ /
analyzed: su maṅgalī prataraṇī gṛhāṇām su śevā patye śvaśurāya śaṃbhūḥ
translated: Well-omened, leading to prosperity, of the houses, kindly disposed to the husband, to the father-in-law, auspicious,

original: syonā śvaśrvai pra gṛhān viśemān ////🔽syonā bhava śvaśurebhyaḥ syonā patye gṛhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: syonā śvaśrvai pra gṛhān viśa imān  syonā bhava śvaśurebhyaḥ syonā patye gṛhebhyaḥ
translated: Gentle to the mother-in-law, enter these houses.🔽Be gentle to the fathers-in-law, gentle to the husband in the houses.

original: syonāsyai sarvasyai viśe syonā puṣṭāyaiṣāṃ bhava ////
analyzed: syonā asyai sarvasyai viśe syonā puṣṭāya eṣām bhava
translated: Gentle to this entire village, gentle for the prosperity of these people.

original: sumaṅgalīr iyaṃ vadhūr imāṃ sameta paśyata /
analyzed: su maṅgalīḥ iyam vadhūḥ imām sameta paśyata
translated: Look upon this auspicious bride, assembled here.

original: saubhāgyam asyai dattvā daurbhāgyair viparetana ////
analyzed: saubhāgyam asyai dattvā daurbhāgyaiḥ viparetana
translated: Having bestowed good fortune upon her, may misfortune turn away from her.

original: yā durhārdo yuvatayo yāś ceha jaratīr api /
analyzed: yāḥ durhārdaḥ yuvatayaḥ yāḥ ca iha jaratīḥ api
translated: Those young women who are ill-disposed, and those who are old here,

original: varco nv asyai saṃ dattāthāstaṃ viparetana ////
analyzed: varcaḥ nu asyai sam datta atha astam viparetana
translated: Having given her his splendor, may he turn away from them.

original: rukmaprastaraṇaṃ vahyaṃ viśvā rūpāṇi bibhratam /🔽ārohat sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam ////
analyzed: rukma prastaraṇam vahyam viśvā rūpāṇi bibhratam  ārohat sūryā sāvitrī bṛhate saubhagāya kam
translated: The golden-strewn bed, the outer one, bearing all forms,🔽The sun has mounted Savitri for great good fortune.

original: ā roha talpaṃ sumanasyamāneha prajāṃ janaya patye asmai /
analyzed: ā roha talpam sumanasyamānā iha prajām janaya patye asmai
translated: Mount the bed, full of joy, give birth to offspring here for this husband of yours.

original: indrāṇīva subudhā budhyamānā jyotiragrā uṣasaḥ prati jāgarāsi ////
analyzed: indrāṇī iva su budhā budhyamānā jyotiḥ agrāḥ uṣasaḥ prati jāgarāsi
translated: Like a well-awakened woman, like the dawn with light at the forefront, you are awake for the sake of the light.

original: devā agre ny apadyanta patnīḥ sam aspṛśanta tanvas tanūbhiḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ agre ni apadyanta patnīḥ sam aspṛśanta tanvaḥ tanūbhiḥ
translated: The gods first fell down, they touched the wives with their bodies.

original: sūryeva nāri viśvarūpā mahitvā prajāvatī patyā saṃ bhaveha ////
analyzed: sūryā iva nāri viśva rūpā mahitvā prajāvatī patyā sam bhava iha
translated: Like the sun, O woman, with all forms, with greatness, be united with your husband, full of offspring.

original: ut tiṣṭheto viśvāvaso namaseḍāmahe tvā /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha itas viśvāvaso namasā īḍāmahe tvā
translated: Rise up from here, O Vishvavasu, we bow to you.

original: jāmim icha pitṛṣadaṃ nyaktāṃ sa te bhāgo januṣā tasya viddhi ////
analyzed: jāmim icha pitṛṣadam nyaktām sa te bhāgaḥ januṣā tasya viddhi
translated: Seek the sister who sits down, who sits with the fathers. That is your share by birth, know that.

original: apsarasaḥ sadhamādaṃ madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryaṃ ca /
analyzed: apsarasaḥ sadhamādam madanti havirdhānam antarā sūryam ca
translated: The Apsarases rejoice in the common feast, between the sacrificial post and the sun.

original: tās te janitram abhi tāḥ parehi namas te gandharvartunā kṛṇomi ////
analyzed: tāḥ te janitram abhi tāḥ parehi namaḥ te gandharva ṛtunā kṛṇomi
translated: Go to thy birthplace, go to those, I pay thee homage, O Gandharva, with the season.

original: namo gandharvasya namase namo bhāmāya cakṣuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ gandharvasya namase namaḥ bhāmāya cakṣuṣe ca kṛṇmaḥ
translated: Homage to the Gandharva's homage, homage we pay to the radiant eye.

original: viśvāvaso brahmaṇā te namo 'bhi jāyā apsarasaḥ parehi ////
analyzed: viśvāvaso brahmaṇā te namaḥ bhi jāyāḥ apsarasaḥ parehi
translated: O Vishvavasu, with prayer we pay homage to thee: go to thy wife, the Apsarases.

original: rāyā vayaṃ sumanasaḥ syāmod ito gandharvam āvīvṛtāma /
analyzed: rāyā vayam sumanasaḥ syāma ud itas gandharvam āvīvṛtāma
translated: With wealth may we be well-disposed: from hence have we sent away the Gandharva.

original: agant sa devaḥ paramaṃ sadhastham aganma yatra pratiranta āyuḥ ////
analyzed: agan sa devaḥ paramam sadhastham aganma yatra pratirante āyuḥ
translated: The god hath gone to the highest abode: we have gone where they renew life.

original: saṃ pitarāv ṛtviye sṛjethāṃ mātā pitā ca retaso bhavāthaḥ /🔽marya iva yoṣām adhi rohayaināṃ prajāṃ kṛṇvāthām iha puṣyataṃ rayim ////
analyzed: sam pitarau ṛtviye sṛjethām mātā pitā ca retasaḥ bhavāthaḥ  maryaḥ iva yoṣām adhi rohaya enām prajām kṛṇvāthām iha puṣyatam rayim
translated: Ye two, the father and mother, who are to be worshipped, beget the seed: be ye the father and mother.🔽As a man to a woman, so raise her up: beget offspring here, and cherish wealth.

original: tāṃ pūṣaṃ chivatamām erayasva yasyāṃ bījaṃ manuṣyā vapanti /
analyzed: tām pūṣam śivatamām erayasva yasyām bījam manuṣyāḥ vapanti
translated: Send forth that most auspicious Pûshan, in whom men sow the seed.

original: yā na ūrū uśatī viśrayāti yasyām uśantaḥ praharema śepaḥ ////🔽ā rohorum upa dhatsva hastaṃ pari ṣvajasva jāyāṃ sumanasyamānaḥ /
analyzed: yā naḥ ūrū uśatī viśrayāti yasyām uśantaḥ praharema śepaḥ  ā roha ūrum upa dhatsva hastam pari svajasva jāyām sumanasyamānaḥ
translated: In whom the longing one extends her thighs, in whom we long to join our arms.🔽Ascend the thigh: place thy hand: embrace thy wife with a glad heart.

original: prajāṃ kṛṇvāthām iha modamānau dīrghaṃ vām āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: prajām kṛṇvāthām iha modamānau dīrgham vām āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu
translated: Beget offspring here: rejoice together. May Savitar give you long life.

original: ā vāṃ prajāṃ janayatu prajāpatir ahorātrābhyāṃ sam anaktv aryamā /
analyzed: ā vām prajām janayatu prajāpatiḥ ahar rātrābhyām sam anaktu aryamā
translated: May Prajapati beget offspring for you both; may Aryaman anoint you with the days and nights.

original: adurmaṅgalī patilokam ā viśemaṃ śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade ////
analyzed: adurmaṅgalī pati lokam ā viśa imam śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Be auspicious to us, O wife, in the world of your husband, be auspicious to us in the world of your husband.

original: devair dattaṃ manunā sākam etad vādhūyaṃ vāso vadhvaś ca vastram /
analyzed: devaiḥ dattam manunā sākam etat vādhūyam vāsaḥ vadhvaḥ ca vastram
translated: This bridal garment given by the gods together with Manu, and the bride's garment,

original: yo brahmaṇe cikituṣe dadāti sa id rakṣāṃsi talpāni hanti ////
analyzed: yaḥ brahmaṇe cikituṣe dadāti saḥ id rakṣāṃsi hanti
translated: He who gives to the inquiring Brahman, he indeed slays the Raksases and the demons.

original: yaṃ me datto brahmabhāgaṃ vadhūyor vādhūyaṃ vāso vadhvaś ca vastram /
analyzed: yam me dattaḥ brahma bhāgam vadhūyoḥ vādhūyam vāsaḥ vadhvaḥ ca vastram
translated: The bridal garment given to me as my share of the bridal pair, and the bride's garment,

original: yuvaṃ brahmaṇe 'numanyamānau bṛhaspate sākam indraś ca dattam ////
analyzed: yuvam brahmaṇe numanyamānau bṛhaspate sākam indraḥ ca dattam
translated: You two, approving for the Brahman, O Brihaspati, together with Indra, have given.

original: syonād yoner adhi badhyamānau hasāmudau mahasā modamānau /🔽sugū suputrau sugṛhau tarātho jīvāv uṣaso vibhātīḥ ////
analyzed: syonāt yoneḥ adhi badhyamānau hasāmudau mahasā modamānau  sugū su putrau su gṛhau tarāthaḥ jīvau uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: Being bound upon a soft bed, rejoicing with great joy,🔽Having good sons, good houses, you two have crossed over; you two live through the shining dawns.

original: navaṃ vasānaḥ surabhiḥ suvāsā udāgāṃ jīva uṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: navam vasānaḥ surabhiḥ su vāsāḥ udāgām jīvaḥ uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: Wearing a new, fragrant, good garment, I have risen up, alive, through the shining dawns.

original: āṇḍāt patatrīvāmukṣi viśvasmād enasas pari ////
analyzed: āṇḍāt patatrī iva amukṣi viśvasmāt enasaḥ pari
translated: Like a bird flying from the egg, from all sin I am freed.

original: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahivrate /
analyzed: śumbhanī dyāvāpṛthivī antisumne mahi vrate
translated: The auspicious heaven and earth, with the most beneficial great vow,

original: āpaḥ sapta susruvur devīs tā no muñcantv aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ sapta susruvuḥ devīḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: Let the seven divine streams, the waters, set us free from sin.

original: sūryāyai devebhyo mitrāya varuṇāya ca /
analyzed: sūryāyai devebhyaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translated: To Surya, to the gods, to Mitra, to Varuna,

original: ye bhūtasya pracetasas tebhya idam akaraṃ namaḥ ////🔽ya ṛte cid abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhya ātṛdaḥ /
analyzed: ye bhūtasya pracetasaḥ tebhyaḥ idam akaram namaḥ  yaḥ ṛte cit abhiśriṣaḥ purā jatrubhyaḥ ātṛdaḥ
translated: To those who are the wise overseers of being, to them I offer this homage.🔽He who, even from afar, from before the collar-bones, the piercing one,

original: saṃdhātā saṃdhiṃ maghavā purūvasur niṣkartā vihrutaṃ punaḥ ////🔽apāsmat tama uchatu nīlaṃ piśaṅgam uta lohitaṃ yat /
analyzed: saṃdhātā saṃdhim maghavā purūvasuḥ niṣkartā vihrutam punar  apa asmat tamaḥ uchatu nīlam piśaṅgam uta lohitam yat
translated: The bountiful one, the fulfiller of agreements, the maker of what is scattered again,🔽Let the dark, the tawny, and the red that is in us depart.

original: nirdahanī yā pṛṣātaky asmin tāṃ sthāṇāv adhy ā sajāmi ////
analyzed: nirdahanī yā pṛṣātakī asmin tām sthāṇau adhi ā sajāmi
translated: The burning, the speckled, that is in this (body), on the post I lay it down.

original: yāvatīḥ kṛtyā upavāsane yāvanto rājño varuṇasya pāśāḥ /
analyzed: yāvatīḥ kṛtyāḥ upavāsane yāvantaḥ rājñaḥ varuṇasya pāśāḥ
translated: As many spells there are for fasting, as many nooses of the king Varuna,

original: vyṛddhayo yā asamṛddhayo yā asmin tā sthāṇāv adhi sādayāmi ////
analyzed: vyṛddhayaḥ yāḥ asamṛddhayaḥ yāḥ asmin tā sthāṇau adhi sādayāmi
translated: The unsuccessful ones, the unsuccessful ones, that are in this (body), on the post I lay them down.

original: yā me priyatamā tanūḥ sā me bibhāya vāsasaḥ /
analyzed: yā me priyatamā tanūḥ sā me bibhāya vāsasaḥ
translated: My dearest body is afraid of my garment.

original: tasyāgre tvaṃ vanaspate nīviṃ kṛṇuṣva mā vayaṃ riṣāma ////
analyzed: tasya agre tvam vanaspate nīvim kṛṇuṣva mā vayam riṣāma
translated: O tree, make the fold of that (body) first, lest we should be hurt.

original: ye antā yāvatīḥ sico ya otavo ye ca tantavaḥ /
analyzed: ye antāḥ yāvatīḥ sicaḥ ye otavaḥ ye ca tantavaḥ
translated: As many ends, as many fibres, as many warp threads, as many woof threads,

original: vāso yat patnībhir utaṃ tan na syonam upa spṛśāt ////
analyzed: vāsaḥ yat patnībhiḥ utam tat na syonam upa spṛśāt
translated: As the garment was woven by the wives, let it touch me kindly.

original: uśatīḥ kanyalā imāḥ pitṛlokāt patiṃ yatīḥ /
analyzed: uśatīḥ kanyalāḥ imāḥ pitṛ lokāt patim yatīḥ
translated: These young maidens, eager for love, going from the world of the fathers to a husband,

original: ava dīkṣām asṛkṣata svāhā ////
analyzed: ava dīkṣām asṛkṣata svāhā
translated: Have flowed forth to the consecration. Svâhâ!

original: bṛhaspatināvasṛṣṭāṃ viśve devā adhārayan /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan
translated: Released by Brihaspati, the All-Gods have established

original: varco goṣu praviṣṭaṃ yat tenemāṃ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: varcaḥ goṣu praviṣṭam yat tena imām sam sṛjāmasi
translated: The splendour that is in the cows. With that we settle this one.

original: bṛhaspatināvasṛṣṭāṃ viśve devā adhārayan /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan
translated: Released by Brihaspati, the All-Gods have established

original: tejo goṣu praviṣṭaṃ yat tenemāṃ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: tejaḥ goṣu praviṣṭam yat tena imām sam sṛjāmasi
translated: The radiance that is in the cows. With that we settle this one.

original: bṛhaspatināvasṛṣṭāṃ viśve devā adhārayan /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan
translated: Released by Brihaspati, the All-Gods have established

original: bhajo goṣu praviṣṭo yas tenemāṃ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: bhajaḥ goṣu praviṣṭaḥ yaḥ tena imām sam sṛjāmasi
translated: The portion that is in the cows. With that we settle this one.

original: bṛhaspatināvasṛṣṭāṃ viśve devā adhārayan /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan
translated: Released by Brihaspati, the All-Gods have established

original: yaśo goṣu praviṣṭaṃ yat tenemāṃ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: yaśaḥ goṣu praviṣṭam yat tena imām sam sṛjāmasi
translated: The glory that is in the cows. With that we settle this one.

original: bṛhaspatināvasṛṣṭāṃ viśve devā adhārayan /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan
translated: Released by Brihaspati, the All-Gods have established

original: payo goṣu praviṣṭaṃ yat tenemāṃ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: payaḥ goṣu praviṣṭam yat tena imām sam sṛjāmasi
translated: The milk that is in the cows. With that we settle this one.

original: bṛhaspatināvasṛṣṭāṃ viśve devā adhārayan /
analyzed: bṛhaspatinā avasṛṣṭām viśve devāḥ adhārayan
translated: Released by Brihaspati, the All-Gods have established

original: raso goṣu praviṣṭo yas tenemāṃ saṃ sṛjāmasi ////
analyzed: rasaḥ goṣu praviṣṭaḥ yaḥ tena imām sam sṛjāmasi
translated: The sap that is in the cows. With that we settle this one.

original: yadīme keśino janā gṛhe te samanartiṣū rodena kṛṇvanto 'gham /
analyzed: yadi ime keśinaḥ janāḥ gṛhe te samanartiṣuḥ rodena kṛṇvantaḥ gham
translated: If these people, the Kesins, have wailed in your house, crying out their grief,

original: agniṣ ṭvā tasmād enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām ////
analyzed: agniḥ tvā tasmāt enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām
translated: May Agni and Savitar deliver thee from that sin.

original: yadīyaṃ duhitā tava vikeśy arudad gṛhe rodena kṛṇvaty agham /
analyzed: yadī iyam duhitā tava vikeśī arudat gṛhe rodena kṛṇvatī agham
translated: If this daughter of thine, Vikeshá, has wept in the house, weeping and doing wrong,

original: agniṣ ṭvā tasmād enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām ////
analyzed: agniḥ tvā tasmāt enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām
translated: May Agni and Savitar deliver thee from that sin.

original: yaj jāmayo yad yuvatayo gṛhe te samanartiṣū rodena kṛṇvatīr agham /
analyzed: yat jāmayaḥ yat yuvatayaḥ gṛhe te samanartiṣuḥ rodena kṛṇvatīḥ agham
translated: If the sisters-in-law and the young wives in the house have wailed, weeping and doing wrong,

original: agniṣ ṭvā tasmād enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām ////
analyzed: agniḥ tvā tasmāt enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām
translated: May Agni and Savitar deliver thee from that sin.

original: yat te prajāyāṃ paśuṣu yad vā gṛheṣu niṣṭhitam aghakṛdbhir aghaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yat te prajāyām paśuṣu yat vā gṛheṣu niṣṭhitam agha kṛdbhiḥ agham kṛtam
translated: If sin has been committed by the sinful against thy offspring, thy cattle, or what is in thy house,

original: agniṣ ṭvā tasmād enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām ////
analyzed: agniḥ tvā tasmāt enasaḥ savitā ca pra muñcatām
translated: May Agni and Savitar deliver thee from that sin.

original: iyaṃ nāry upa brūte pūlyāny āvapantikā /
analyzed: iyam nārī upa brūte pūlyāni āvapantikā
translated: This woman speaks, the one who spreads the cushions and strews the grass.

original: dīrghāyur astu me patir jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ astu me patiḥ jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May my husband live long, may he live a hundred autumns.

original: ihemāv indra saṃ nuda cakravākeva daṃpatī /
analyzed: iha imau indra sam nuda cakravākā iva daṃpatī
translated: Here, O Indra, drive them together like a pair of ruddy geese.

original: prajayainau svastakau viśvam āyur vy aśnutām ////🔽yad āsandyām upadhāne yad vopavāsane kṛtam /
analyzed: prajayā enau su astakau viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnutām  yat āsandyām upadhāne yat vā upavāsane kṛtam
translated: May they enjoy all life, victorious, with good luck.🔽Whatever was done on the marriage couch, whatever was done on the bed,

original: vivāhe kṛtyāṃ yāṃ cakrur āsnāne tāṃ ni dadhmasi ////
analyzed: vivāhe kṛtyām yām cakruḥ āsnāne tām ni dadhmasi
translated: The witchcraft that was wrought at the marriage bath, that we lay aside.

original: yad duṣkṛtaṃ yac chamalaṃ vivāhe vahatau ca yat /🔽tat saṃbhalasya kambale mṛjmahe duritaṃ vayam ////
analyzed: yat duṣkṛtam yat śamalam vivāhe vahatau ca yat  tat saṃbhalasya kambale mṛjmahe duritam vayam
translated: Whatever sin, whatever impurity there is in marriage and in the carrying of the bride,🔽We wipe away on Sambala's blanket, we wipe away our evil.

original: saṃbhale malaṃ sādayitvā kambale duritaṃ vayam /
analyzed: saṃbhale malam sādayitvā kambale duritam vayam
translated: Having placed impurity on Sambala, having wiped away evil on the blanket,

original: abhūma yajñiyāḥ śuddhāḥ pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat ////
analyzed: abhūma yajñiyāḥ śuddhāḥ pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: We have become pure and fit for sacrifice. May he prolong our lives.

original: kṛtrimaḥ kaṇṭakaḥ śatadan ya eṣaḥ /🔽apāsyāḥ keśyaṃ malam apa śīrṣaṇyaṃ likhāt ////
analyzed: kṛtrimaḥ kaṇṭakaḥ śatadan yaḥ eṣaḥ  apa asyāḥ keśyam malam apa śīrṣaṇyam likhāt
translated: The artificial thorn, the hundred-toothed one, which is this,🔽May it remove the impurity of the hair, may it remove the pain of the head.

original: aṅgādaṅgād vayam asyā apa yakṣmaṃ ni dadhmasi /
analyzed: aṅgāt aṅgāt vayam asyāḥ apa yakṣmam ni dadhmasi
translated: From limb to limb of this one we place the consumption.

original: tan mā prāpat pṛthivīṃ mota devān divaṃ mā prāpad urv antarikṣam /
analyzed: tat mā prāpat pṛthivīm mā uta devān divam mā prāpat uru antarikṣam
translated: May it not reach the earth nor the gods, may it not reach the sky nor the wide atmosphere.

original: apo mā prāpan malam etad agne yamam mā prāpat pitṝṃś ca sarvān ////
analyzed: apaḥ mā prāpat malam etat agne yamam mā prāpat pitṝn ca sarvān
translated: May it not reach the waters, this impurity, O Agni. May it not reach Yama and all the fathers.

original: saṃ tvā nahyāmi payasā pṛthivyāḥ saṃ tvā nahyāmi payasauṣadhīnām /
analyzed: sam tvā nahyāmi payasā pṛthivyāḥ sam tvā nahyāmi payasā oṣadhīnām
translated: I bind you with the milk of the earth, I bind you with the milk of the plants.

original: saṃ tvā nahyāmi prajayā dhanena sā saṃnaddhā sanuhi vājam emam ////
analyzed: sam tvā nahyāmi prajayā dhanena sā saṃnaddhā sanuhi vājam ā imam
translated: I bind you with offspring and wealth. So bound, follow after this prize.

original: amo 'ham asmi sā tvaṃ sāmāham asmy ṛk tvaṃ dyaur ahaṃ pṛthivī tvam /
analyzed: amaḥ ham asmi sā tvam sāma aham asmi ṛc tvam dyauḥ aham pṛthivī tvam
translated: I am the Amo, you are the Sa. I am the Sama, you are the Rik. I am the sky, you are the earth.

original: tāv iha saṃ bhavāva prajām ā janayāvahai ////
analyzed: tau iha sam bhavāva prajām ā janayāvahai
translated: Here may we two beget offspring together.

original: janiyanti nāv agravaḥ putriyanti sudānavaḥ /
analyzed: janiyanti nau agravaḥ putriyanti sudānavaḥ
translated: May they beget us, the most excellent, may they beget us, the most bountiful.

original: ariṣṭāsū sacevahi bṛhate vājasātaye ////🔽ye pitaro vadhūdarśā imaṃ vahatum āgaman /
analyzed: ariṣṭa asū sacevahi bṛhate vājasātaye  ye pitaraḥ vadhū darśāḥ imam vahatum āgaman
translated: May we be united for the sake of great strength.🔽Those ancestors who have come to this wedding, looking at the bride,
