original: te asyai vadhvai saṃpatnyai prajāvac charma yachantu ////
analyzed: te asyai vadhvai saṃ patnyai prajāvat śarma yacchantu
translated: may they grant protection with offspring to this bride, to her husband.

original: yedaṃ pūrvāgan raśanāyamānā prajām asyai draviṇaṃ ceha dattvā /
analyzed: yā idam pūrvā agan raśanāyamānā prajām asyai draviṇam ca iha dattvā
translated: Having given to this one offspring and wealth, as she comes forward, bound by the girdle,

original: tāṃ vahantv agatasyānu panthāṃ virāḍ iyaṃ suprajā aty ajaiṣīt ////
analyzed: tām vahantu a gatasya anu panthām virāj iyam suprajāḥ ati ajaiṣīt
translated: may they lead her along the path of the departed. This Viraj has won abundant offspring.

original: pra budhyasva subudhā budhyamānā dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya /
analyzed: pra budhyasva su budhā budhyamānā dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya
translated: Awaken, O thou of good awakening, as thou awakest, for long life, for a hundred autumns.

original: gṛhān gacha gṛhapatnī yathāso dīrghaṃ ta āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: gṛhān gacha gṛha patnī yathā asaḥ dīrgham te āyuḥ savitā kṛṇotu
translated: Go to the house, O housewife, as thou art, may Savitar make your life long.

original: vrātya āsīd īyamāna eva sa prajāpatiṃ sam airayat ////
analyzed: vrātyaḥ āsīt īyamānaḥ eva sa prajāpatim sam airayat
translated: The Vrātya was indeed moving about. He made Prajāpati move.

original: sa prajāpatiḥ suvarṇam ātmann apaśyat tat prājanayat ////
analyzed: sa prajāpatiḥ suvarṇam ātman apaśyat tat prājanayat
translated: Prajāpati saw gold in himself. He generated it.

original: tad ekam abhavat tal lalāmam abhavat tan mahad abhavat taj jyeṣṭham abhavat tad brahmābhavat tat tapo 'bhavat tat satyam abhavat
analyzed: tat ekam abhavat tat lalāmam abhavat tat mahat abhavat tat jyeṣṭham abhavat tat brahma abhavat tat tapaḥ bhavat tat satyam abhavat
translated: That became one, that became the crest-jewel, that became great, that became the eldest, that became Brahman, that became austerity, that became truth.

original: tena prājāyata ////
analyzed: tena prājāyata
translated: By that he was born.

original: so 'vardhata sa mahān abhavat sa mahādevo 'bhavat ////
analyzed: saḥ vardhata sa mahān abhavat sa mahādevaḥ bhavat
translated: He grew, he became great, he became Mahadeva.

original: sa devānām īśāṃ pary ait sa īśāno 'bhavat ////
analyzed: sa devānām īśām pari ait saḥ īśānaḥ bhavat
translated: He went to the lordship of the gods, he became the lord.

original: sa ekavrātyo 'bhavat sa dhanur ādatta tad evendradhanuḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ eka vrātyaḥ bhavat sa dhanuḥ ādatta tat eva indradhanuḥ
translated: He became the one with the sacrificial fee, he took up the bow, that is Indra's rainbow.

original: nīlam asyodaraṃ lohitaṃ pṛṣṭham ////
analyzed: nīlam asya udaram lohitam pṛṣṭham
translated: His belly is blue, his back is red.

original: nīlenaivāpriyaṃ bhrātṛvyaṃ prorṇoti lohitena dviṣantaṃ vidhyatīti brahmavādino vadanti ////
analyzed: nīlena eva apriyam bhrātṛvyam prorṇoti lohitena dviṣantam vidhyati iti brahma vādinaḥ vadanti
translated: The theologians say, 'With the blue he covers his hated enemy, with the red he pierces the hater.'

original: a sa ud atiṣṭhat sa prācīṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: saḥ ud atiṣṭhat sa prācīm diśam anu vi acalat  /
translated: He arose. He moved along the eastern direction.

original: b taṃ bṛhac ca rathantaraṃ cādityāś ca viśve ca devā anuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam bṛhat ca rathantaram ca ādityāḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ anuvyacalan  /
translated: The Brihat and Rathantara [chants], the Adityas, and the All-gods moved along with him.

original: c bṛhate ca vai sa rathantarāya cādityebhyaś ca viśvebhyaś ca devebhya ā vṛścate ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ vrātyam upavadati /
analyzed: bṛhate ca vai sa rathantarāya ca ādityebhyaḥ ca viśvebhyaḥ ca devebhyaḥ ā vṛścate yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam vrātyam upavadati
translated: He who reviles a Vratya who knows thus, is cut off from the Brihat and Rathantara [chants], from the Adityas and from the All-gods.

original: d bṛhataś ca vai sa rathantarasya cādityānāṃ ca viśveṣāṃ ca devānāṃ priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: bṛhataḥ ca vai sa rathantarasya ca ādityānām ca viśveṣām ca devānām priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he who knows thus becomes the dear abode of the Brhat, the Rathantara, the Adityas, and the All-gods.

original: e tasya prācyāṃ diśi śraddhā puṃścalī mitro māgadho vijñānaṃ vāso 'har uṣṇīṣaṃ rātrī keśā haritau pravartau kalmalir maṇiḥ
analyzed: tasya prācyām diśi śraddhā puṃścalī mitraḥ māgadhaḥ vijñānam vāsaḥ har uṣṇīṣam rātrī keśāḥ haritau pravartau kalmaliḥ maṇiḥ
translated: In the eastern direction of him, faith is the harlot, Mitra is the Magadha, knowledge is the garment, the day is the turban, the night is the hair, the two twilights are the earrings, the sun is the ornament,

original: f bhūtaṃ ca bhaviṣyac ca pariṣkandau mano vipathaṃ mātariśvā ca pavamānaś ca vipathavāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ kīrtiś
analyzed: bhūtam ca bhaviṣyat ca pariṣkandau manaḥ vipatham mātariśvā ca pavamānaḥ ca vipatha vāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ kīrtiḥ  /
translated: the past and the future are the two wings, the mind is the path, Matariśvan and Pavamāna are the path-bearers, the wind is the charioteer, the sun's rays are the whip, fame

original: ca yaśaś ca puraḥsarau /
analyzed: ca yaśaḥ ca puraḥsarau
translated: and glory are the two leaders.

original: g ainaṃ kīrtir gachaty ā yaśo gachati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam kīrtiḥ gacchati ā yaśaḥ gacchati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Fame goes to him, glory goes to him, who knows thus.

original: a sa ud atiṣṭhat sa dakṣiṇāṃ diśam anu vy acalat / 🔽b taṃ yajñāyajñiyaṃ ca vāmadevyaṃ ca yajñaś ca yajamānaś ca paśavaś cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: saḥ ud atiṣṭhat sa dakṣiṇām diśam anu vi acalat  / tam yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca yajñaḥ ca yajamānaḥ ca paśavaḥ ca anuvyacalan  /
translated: He arose. He moved along the southern direction.🔽The Yajñāyajñiya, the Vāmadevya, the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and the cattle moved along after him.

original: c yajñāyajñiyāya ca vai sa vāmadevyāya ca yajñāya ca yajamānāya ca paśubhyaś cā vṛścate ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ vrātyam upavadati
analyzed: yajñāyajñiyāya ca vai sa vāmadevyāya ca yajñāya ca yajamānāya ca paśubhyaḥ ca ā vṛścate yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam vrātyam upavadati
translated: He who speaks ill of a Vratya who knows thus, is cut off from the Yajñāyajñiya, the Vāmadevya, the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and the cattle.

original: d yajñāyajñiyasya ca vai sa vāmadevyasya ca yajñasya ca yajamānasya ca paśūnāṃ ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda / 🔽e tasya dakṣiṇāyāṃ diśy uṣāḥ puṃścalī mantro māgadho vijñānaṃ vāso 'har uṣṇīṣaṃ rātrī keśā haritau pravartau kalmalir maṇiḥ
analyzed: yajñāyajñiyasya ca vai sa vāmadevyasya ca yajñasya ca yajamānasya ca paśūnām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda  tasya dakṣiṇāyām diśi uṣāḥ puṃścalī mantraḥ māgadhaḥ vijñānam vāsaḥ har uṣṇīṣam rātrī keśāḥ haritau pravartau kalmaliḥ maṇiḥ
translated: He who knows thus becomes the dear abode of the Yajñāyajñiya, the Vāmadevya, the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and the cattle.

original: f amāvāsyā ca paurṇamāsī ca pariṣkandau mano vipathaṃ mātariśvā ca pavamānaś ca vipathavāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ
analyzed: amāvāsyā ca paurṇamāsī ca pariṣkandau manaḥ vipatham mātariśvā ca pavamānaḥ ca vipatha vāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ  /
translated: In his southern direction, Uṣā is the harlot, Mantra is the Māgadha, knowledge is the garment, day is the turban, night is the hair, the two twilights are the two earrings, the sun is the necklace, the moon is the crest jewel, the new moon and the full moon are the two bracelets, the mind is the path, Mātariśvan and Pavamāna are the path-bearers, the wind is the charioteer, the sun is the whip,

original: kīrtiś ca yaśaś ca puraḥsarau /
analyzed: kīrtiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca puraḥsarau
translated: and fame and glory are the two leaders.

original: g ainaṃ kīrtir gachaty ā yaśo gachati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam kīrtiḥ gacchati ā yaśaḥ gacchati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Fame goes to him, glory goes to him, who knows thus.

original: a sa ud atiṣṭhat sa pratīcīṃ diśam anu vy acalat / 🔽b taṃ vairūpaṃ ca vairājaṃ cāpaś ca varuṇaś ca rājānuvyacalan /
analyzed: saḥ ud atiṣṭhat sa pratīcīm diśam anu vi acalat  / tam vairūpam ca vairājam ca apaḥ ca varuṇaḥ ca rājā anuvyacalan
translated: He arose. He moved along the western direction.🔽The kings Vairūpa, Vairaja, Āpa, and Varuṇa moved after him.

original: c vairūpāya ca vai sa vairājāya cādbhyaś ca varuṇāya ca rājña ā vṛścate ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ vrātyam upavadati /
analyzed: vairūpāya ca vai sa vairājāya ca adbhyaḥ ca varuṇāya ca rājñe ā vṛścate yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam vrātyam upavadati
translated: He who reviles a Brāhmaṇa knowing thus is cut off from Vairūpa, Vairaja, Āpa, and King Varuṇa.

original: d vairūpasya ca vai sa vairājasya cāpāṃ ca varuṇasya ca rājñaḥ priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: vairūpasya ca vai sa vairājasya ca apām ca varuṇasya ca rājñaḥ priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He who knows thus becomes dear to the abode of the god of love, of the god of wealth, of the waters, and of King Varuna.

original: e tasya pratīcyāṃ diśīrā puṃścalī haso māgadho vijñānaṃ vāso 'har uṣṇīṣaṃ rātrī keśā haritau pravartau kalmalir maṇiḥ /
analyzed: tasya pratīcyām diśi irā puṃścalī hasaḥ māgadhaḥ vijñānam vāsaḥ har uṣṇīṣam rātrī keśāḥ haritau pravartau kalmaliḥ maṇiḥ
translated: In the western direction of him are the two harlots, Hasa and Magadha, the knowledge is the garment, the day is the turban, the night is the hair, the two twilights are the earrings, the sun is the necklace.

original: f ahaś ca rātrī ca pariṣkandau mano vipathaṃ mātariśvā ca pavamānaś ca vipathavāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ kīrtiś ca
analyzed: ahar ca rātrī ca pariṣkandau manaḥ vipatham mātariśvā ca pavamānaḥ ca vipatha vāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ kīrtiḥ ca
translated: The day and the night are the two side-locks, the mind is the path, Matariśvan and Pavamāna are the path-bearers, the wind is the charioteer, the rays are the whip, fame and

original: yaśaś ca puraḥsarau /
analyzed: yaśaḥ ca puraḥsarau
translated: glory are the two leaders.

original: g ainaṃ kīrtir gachaty ā yaśo gachati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam kīrtiḥ gacchati ā yaśaḥ gacchati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Fame goes to him, glory goes to him who knows thus.

original: a sa ud atiṣṭhat sa udīcīṃ diśam anu vy acalat / 🔽b taṃ śyaitaṃ ca naudhasaṃ ca saptarṣayaś ca somaś ca rājānuvyacalan /
analyzed: saḥ ud atiṣṭhat saḥ udīcīm diśam anu vi acalat  / tam śyaitam ca naudhasam ca sapta ṛṣayaḥ ca somaḥ ca rājā anuvyacalan
translated: He arose. He moved along the northern direction.🔽The Śyaita, the Naudhsa, the seven sages, and King Soma followed him.

original: c śyaitāya ca vai sa naudhasāya ca saptarṣibhyaś ca somāya ca rājña ā vṛścate ya evaṃ vidvāṃsaṃ vrātyam upavadati /
analyzed: śyaitāya ca vai sa naudhasāya ca saptarṣibhyaḥ ca somāya ca rājñe ā vṛścate yaḥ evam vidvāṃsam vrātyam upavadati
translated: He who reviles a Vratya who knows thus is cut off from the Śyaita, the Naudhsa, the seven sages, and King Soma.

original: d śyaitasya ca vai sa naudhasasya ca saptarṣīṇāṃ ca somasya ca rājñaḥ priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda /
analyzed: śyaitasya ca vai sa naudhasasya ca saptarṣīṇām ca somasya ca rājñaḥ priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he who knows thus becomes the dear abode of the two, Shyaita and Naudhasa, of the seven Rishis, and of King Soma.

original: e tasyodīcyāṃ diśi vidyut puṃścalī stanayitnur māgadho vijñānaṃ vāso 'har uṣṇīṣaṃ rātrī keśā haritau pravartau kalmalir maṇiḥ
analyzed: tasya udīcyām diśi vidyut puṃścalī stanayitnuḥ māgadhaḥ vijñānam vāsaḥ har uṣṇīṣam rātrī keśāḥ haritau pravartau kalmaliḥ maṇiḥ
translated: To the north of that, in the northern direction, is lightning, the unchaste woman, thunder, the Magadha, knowledge, the garment, the day, the turban, the night, the hair, the two green horses, the two wheels, the sunstone, the jewel.

original: f śrutaṃ ca viśrutaṃ ca pariṣkandau mano vipathaṃ mātariśvā ca pavamānaś ca vipathavāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ
analyzed: śrutam ca viśrutam ca pariṣkandau manaḥ vipatham mātariśvā ca pavamānaḥ ca vipatha vāhau vātaḥ sārathī reṣmā pratodaḥ  /
translated: And Shruta and Vishruta are the two wheels, the mind is the bypath, and Matarihwana and Pavamana are the two bypath-drivers, the wind is the charioteer, the sun's rays are the whip.

original: kīrtiś ca yaśaś ca puraḥsarau /
analyzed: kīrtiḥ ca yaśaḥ ca puraḥsarau
translated: And fame and glory are the two leaders.

original: g ainaṃ kīrtir gachaty ā yaśo gachati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam kīrtiḥ gacchati ā yaśaḥ gacchati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Fame goes to him, glory goes to him, who knows thus.

original: sa saṃvatsaram ūrdhvo 'tiṣṭhat taṃ devā abruvan vrātya kiṃ nu tiṣṭhasīti ////
analyzed: sa saṃvatsaram ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhat tam devāḥ abruvan vrātya kim nu tiṣṭhasi iti
translated: He stood erect for a year. The gods said to him, Vratya, why do you stand?

original: so 'bravīd āsandīṃ me saṃ bharantv iti ////
analyzed: saḥ bravīt āsandīm me sam bharantu iti
translated: He said, Let them bring me a seat.

original: tasmai vrātyāyāsandīṃ sam abharan ////
analyzed: tasmai vrātyāya āsandīm sam abharan
translated: For that Vratya they brought a seat.

original: tasyā grīṣmaś ca vasantaś ca dvau pādāv āstāṃ śarac ca varṣāś ca dvau ////
analyzed: tasyāḥ grīṣmaḥ ca vasantaḥ ca dvau pādau āstām śarad ca varṣāḥ ca dvau
translated: Its two feet were summer and spring, and autumn and the rainy season were the other two.

original: bṛhac ca rathantaraṃ cānūcye āstāṃ yajñāyajñiyaṃ ca vāmadevyaṃ ca tiraścye ////
analyzed: bṛhat ca rathantaram ca anūcye āstām yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca tiraścye
translated: The Brihat and Rathantara (Samans) were the two legs, the Yajñāyajñiya and Vāmadevya the two cross-legs.

original: ṛcaḥ prāñcas tantavo yajūṃṣi tiryañcaḥ ////
analyzed: ṛcaḥ prāñcaḥ tantavaḥ yajūṃṣi tiryañcaḥ
translated: The Ṛc verses were the warp threads, the Yajuṣ formulas the woof.

original: veda āstaraṇaṃ brahmopabarhaṇam ////
analyzed: vedaḥ āstaraṇam brahma upabarhaṇam
translated: The Veda was the covering, the Brahman the pillow.

original: sāmāsāda udgītho 'paśrayaḥ ////
analyzed: sāma āsādaḥ udgītha u paśrayaḥ
translated: The Sāman was the seat, the Udgītha the support.

original: tām āsandīṃ vrātya ārohat ////
analyzed: tām āsandīm vrātyaḥ ārohat
translated: The Vrātya mounted that seat.

original: tasya devajanāḥ pariṣkandā āsant saṃkalpāḥ prahāyyā viśvāni bhūtāny upasadaḥ ////
analyzed: tasya deva janāḥ pariṣkandāḥ āsan saṃkalpāḥ prahāyyāḥ viśvāni bhūtāni upasadaḥ
translated: The divine people were his footstools, the intentions the footrests, all beings the attendants.

original: viśvāny evāsya bhūtāny upasado bhavanti ya evaṃ veda ////🔽a tasmai prācyā diśaḥ /
analyzed: viśvāni eva asya bhūtāni upasadaḥ bhavanti yaḥ evam veda  tasmai prācyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: All beings indeed become his attendants, who knows thus.🔽To him they assigned the two spring months as guards,

original: b vāsantau māsau goptārāv akurvan bṛhac ca rathantaraṃ cānuṣṭhātārau /
analyzed: vāsantau māsau goptārau akurvan bṛhat ca rathantaram ca anuṣṭhātārau
translated: Brihat and Rathantara as supporters.

original: c vāsantāv enaṃ māsau prācyā diśo gopāyato bṛhac ca rathantaraṃ cānu tiṣṭhato ya evaṃ veda //// 🔽a tasmai dakṣiṇāyā diśaḥ /
analyzed: vāsantau enam māsau prācyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ bṛhat ca rathantaram ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda  tasmai dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: The two spring months guard him from the eastern quarter, Brihat and Rathantara support him, who knows thus.🔽To him they assigned the two summer months as guards,

original: b graiṣmau māsau goptārāv akurvan yajñāyajñiyaṃ ca vāmadevyaṃ cānuṣṭhātārau /
analyzed: graiṣmau māsau goptārau akurvan yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca anuṣṭhātārau
translated: the Yajñāyajñiya and Vāmadevya as supporters.

original: c graiṣmāv enaṃ māsau dakṣiṇāyā diśo gopāyato yajñāyajñiyaṃ ca vāmadevyaṃ cānu tiṣṭhato ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: graiṣmau enam māsau dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ yajñāyajñiyam ca vāmadevyam ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: The two summer months he appointed as his guardians from the southern quarter, and the Yajñāyajñiya and Vāmadevya as his supporters.

original: a tasmai pratīcyā diśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmai pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: To him from the western quarter,

original: b vārṣikau māsau goptārāv akurvan vairūpaṃ ca vairājaṃ cānuṣṭhātārau /
analyzed: vārṣikau māsau goptārau akurvan vairūpam ca vairājam ca anuṣṭhātārau
translated: the two rainy months he appointed as guardians, the Vairūpa and Vairaja as supporters.

original: c vārṣikāv enaṃ māsau pratīcyā diśo gopāyato vairūpaṃ ca vairājaṃ cānu tiṣṭhato ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: vārṣikau enam māsau pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ vairūpam ca vairājam ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: The two rainy months guard him from the western quarter, and the Vairūpa and Vairaja support him, who knows thus.

original: a tasmā udīcyā diśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmai udīcyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: To him from the northern quarter,

original: b śāradau māsau goptārāv akurvaṃ chyaitaṃ ca naudhasaṃ cānuṣṭhātārau /
analyzed: śāradau māsau goptārau akurvam śyaitam ca naudhasam ca anuṣṭhātārau
translated: the two autumn months he appointed as guardians, the Śyaita and Naudhāsa as supporters.

original: c śāradāv enaṃ māsāv udīcyā diśo gopāyataḥ śyaitaṃ ca naudhasaṃ cānu tiṣṭhato ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: śāradau enam māsau udīcyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ śyaitam ca naudhasam ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: The two autumn months guard him from the northern quarter, and the Śyaita and Naudhāsa support him, who knows thus.

original: a tasmai dhruvāyā diśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmai dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: To him from the firm quarter,

original: b haimanau māsau goptārāv akurvan bhūmiṃ cāgniṃ cānuṣṭhātārau /
analyzed: haimanau māsau goptārau akurvan bhūmim ca agnim ca anuṣṭhātārau
translated: the two winter months he appointed as guardians, the earth and Agni as supporters.

original: c haimanāv enaṃ māsau dhruvāyā diśo gopāyato bhūmiś cāgniś cānu tiṣṭhato ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: haimanau enam māsau dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ bhūmiḥ ca agniḥ ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: The two winter months guard him from the firm quarter, and the earth and Agni support him, who knows thus.

original: a tasmā ūrdhvāyā diśaḥ /
analyzed: tasmai ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: To him from the upward quarter,

original: b śaiśirau māsau goptārāv akurvan divaṃ cādityaṃ cānuṣṭhātārau /
analyzed: śaiśirau māsau goptārau akurvan divam ca ādityam ca anuṣṭhātārau
translated: They made the two months of spring the protectors, and heaven and the sun the supporters.

original: c śaiśirāv enaṃ māsāv ūrdhvāyā diśo gopāyato dyauś cādityaś cānu tiṣṭhato ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: śaiśirau enam māsau ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ gopāyataḥ dyauḥ ca ādityaḥ ca anu tiṣṭhataḥ yaḥ evam veda
translated: The two months of spring protect him from the northern quarter, and heaven and the sun support him, who knows thus.

original: a tasmai prācyā diśo antardeśād bhavam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai prācyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt bhavam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan
translated: For him they made Bhava the archer the supporter from the intermediate space of the eastern quarter.

original: b bhava enam iṣvāsaḥ prācyā diśo antardeśād anuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān hinasti
analyzed: bhavaḥ enam iṣvāsaḥ prācyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān hinasti  /
translated: Bhava the archer supports him from the intermediate space of the eastern quarter. Neither Sarva nor Bhava nor Isana nor his cattle nor his equals injure him,

original: ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda
translated: who knows thus.

original: a tasmai dakṣiṇāyā diśo antardeśāc charvam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt śarvam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan
translated: For him they made Sarva the archer the supporter from the intermediate space of the southern quarter.

original: b śarva enam iśvāso dakṣiṇāyā diśo antardeśād anuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān hinasti
analyzed: śarvaḥ enam iśvāsaḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān hinasti  /
translated: Sarva the archer supports him from the intermediate space of the southern quarter. Neither Sarva nor Bhava nor Isana nor his cattle nor his equals injure him,

original: ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda
translated: who knows thus.

original: a tasmai pratīcyā diśo antardeśāt paśupatim iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt paśupatim iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan
translated: For him they made Pasupati the archer the supporter from the intermediate space of the western quarter.

original: b paśupatir enam iṣvāsaḥ pratīcyā diśo antardeśād anuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān
analyzed: paśupatiḥ enam iṣvāsaḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān
translated: Pashupati, the archer, attends on him from the intermediate region of the western quarter. Neither Sharva, nor Bhava, nor Isha, nor their cattle, nor their equals

original: hinasti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: hinasti yaḥ evam veda
translated: harm him who knows thus.

original: a tasmā udīcyā diśo antardeśād ugraṃ devam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai udīcyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt ugram devam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan  /
translated: For him they made the fierce god, the archer, the attendant from the intermediate region of the northern quarter.

original: b ugra enaṃ deva iṣvāsa udīcyā diśo antardeśād anuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān hinasti
analyzed: ugraḥ enam devaḥ iṣvāsaḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān hinasti  /
translated: The fierce god, the archer, attends on him from the intermediate region of the northern quarter. Neither Sharva, nor Bhava, nor Isha, nor his cattle, nor his equals

original: ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda
translated: harm him who knows thus.

original: a tasmai dhruvāyā diśo antardeśād rudram iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt rudram iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan
translated: For him they made Rudra, the archer, the attendant from the intermediate region of the firm quarter.

original: b rudra enam iṣvāso dhruvāyā diśo antardeśād anuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān hinasti
analyzed: rudraḥ enam iṣvāsaḥ dhruvāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān hinasti  /
translated: Rudra, the archer, attends on him from the intermediate region of the firm quarter. Neither Sharva, nor Bhava, nor Isha, nor his cattle, nor his equals

original: ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda
translated: harm him who knows thus.

original: a tasmā ūrdhvāyā diśo antardeśān mahādevam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt mahādevam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan
translated: For him they made Mahadeva, the archer, the attendant from the intermediate region of the upward quarter.

original: b mahādeva enam iṣvāsa ūrdhvāyā diśo antardeśād anuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān
analyzed: mahādevaḥ enam iṣvāsaḥ ūrdhvāyāḥ diśaḥ antardeśāt anuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān
translated: Mahadeva follows him from the intermediate space of the northern quarter. Neither Sarva, nor Bhava, nor Isana, nor his cattle, nor his equals,

original: hinasti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: hinasti yaḥ evam veda
translated: injure him who knows thus.

original: a tasmai sarvebhyo antardeśebhya īśānam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan /
analyzed: tasmai sarvebhyaḥ antardeśebhyaḥ īśānam iṣvāsam anuṣṭhātāram akurvan
translated: For him they made Isana the archer the follower from all the intermediate spaces.

original: b īśāna enam iṣvāsaḥ sarvebhyo antardeśebhyo 'nuṣṭhātānu tiṣṭhati nainaṃ śarvo na bhavo neśāno nāsya paśūn na samānān
analyzed: īśānaḥ enam iṣvāsaḥ sarvebhyaḥ antardeśebhyaḥ nuṣṭhātā anu tiṣṭhati na enam śarvaḥ na bhavaḥ na īśānaḥ na asya paśūn na samānān  /
translated: Isana the archer follows him from all the intermediate spaces. Neither Sarva, nor Bhava, nor Isana, nor his cattle, nor his equals,

original: hinasti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: hinasti yaḥ evam veda
translated: injure him who knows thus.

original: a sa dhruvāṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: sa dhruvām diśam anu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the firm quarter.

original: b taṃ bhūmiś cāgniś cauṣadhayaś ca vanaspatayaś ca vānaspatyāś ca vīrudhaś cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam bhūmiḥ ca agniḥ ca oṣadhayaḥ ca vanaspatayaḥ ca vānaspatyāḥ ca vīrudhaḥ ca anuvyacalan  /
translated: Him the earth, and Agni, and the plants, and the trees, and the woody plants, and the creepers followed in moving along.

original: c bhūmeś ca vai so 'gneś cauṣadhīnāṃ ca vanaspatīnāṃ ca vānaspatyānāṃ ca vīrudhāṃ ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: bhūmeḥ ca vai saḥ gneḥ ca oṣadhīnām ca vanaspatīnām ca vānaspatyānām ca vīrudhām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes dear to the earth, and to Agni, and to the plants, and to the trees, and to the woody plants, and to the creepers, who knows thus.

original: a sa ūrdhvāṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: saḥ ūrdhvām diśam anu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the upward quarter.

original: b tam ṛtaṃ ca satyaṃ ca sūryaś ca candraś ca nakṣatrāṇi cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam ṛtam ca satyam ca sūryaḥ ca candraḥ ca nakṣatrāṇi ca anuvyacalan
translated: The truth, the reality, the sun, the moon, and the stars followed him.

original: c ṛtasya ca vai sa satyasya ca sūryasya ca candrasya ca nakṣatrāṇāṃ ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ṛtasya ca vai sa satyasya ca sūryasya ca candrasya ca nakṣatrāṇām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the truth, the reality, the sun, the moon, and the stars, who knows this.

original: a sa uttamāṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: saḥ uttamām diśam anu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the northern direction.

original: b tam ṛcaś ca sāmāni ca yajūṃṣi ca brahma cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam ṛcaḥ ca sāmāni ca yajūṃṣi ca brahma ca anuvyacalan
translated: The Ṛc verses, the Sāman chants, the Yajuṣ formulas, and the Brahman followed him.

original: c ṛcāṃ ca vai sa sāmnāṃ ca yajuṣāṃ ca brahmaṇaś ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ṛcām ca vai sa sāmnām ca yajuṣām ca brahmaṇaḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the Ṛc verses, the Sāman chants, the Yajuṣ formulas, and the Brahman, who knows this.

original: a sa bṛhatīṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: sa bṛhatīm diśam anu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the great direction.

original: b tam itihāsaś ca purāṇaṃ ca gāthāś ca nārāśaṃsīś cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam itihāsaḥ ca purāṇam ca gāthāḥ ca nārāśaṃsīḥ ca anuvyacalan
translated: The Itihāsas, the Purāṇas, the Gāthās, and the Nārāśaṁsīs followed him.

original: c itihāsasya ca vai sa purāṇasya ca gāthānāṃ ca nārāśaṃsīnāṃ ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: itihāsasya ca vai sa purāṇasya ca gāthānām ca nārāśaṃsīnām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the Itihāsas, the Purāṇas, the Gāthās, and the Nārāśaṁsīs, who knows this.

original: a sa paramāṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: sa paramām diśam anu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the highest direction.

original: b tam āhavanīyaś ca gārhapatyaś ca dakṣiṇāgniś ca yajñaś ca yajamānaś ca paśavaś cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam āhavanīyaḥ ca gārhapatyaḥ ca dakṣiṇāgniḥ ca yajñaḥ ca yajamānaḥ ca paśavaḥ ca anuvyacalan  /
translated: The Āhavanīya fire, the Gārhapatya fire, the Dakṣiṇāgni fire, the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and the cattle followed him.

original: c āhavanīyasya ca vai sa gārhapatyasya ca dakṣiṇāgneś ca yajñasya ca yajamānasya ca paśūnāṃ ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ
analyzed: āhavanīyasya ca vai sa gārhapatyasya ca dakṣiṇāgneḥ ca yajñasya ca yajamānasya ca paśūnām ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam
translated: He becomes the dear abode of the Ahavaniya, the Garhapatya, the Dakshina fire, the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and the cattle, who thus knows this.

original: veda ////
analyzed: veda
translated: He becomes the dear abode of the Ahavaniya fire, the Garhapatya fire, the Dakshina fire, the sacrifice, the sacrificer, and the cattle, who knows thus.

original: a so 'nādiṣṭāṃ diśam anu vy acalat /
analyzed: saḥ na ādiṣṭām diśam anu vi acalat
translated: He went away in a direction that was not indicated.

original: b tam ṛtavaś cārtavāś ca lokāś ca laukyāś ca māsāś cārdhamāsāś cāhorātre cānuvyacalan / 🔽c ṛtūnāṃ ca vai sa ārtavānāṃ ca lokānāṃ ca laukyānāṃ ca māsānāṃ cārdhamāsānāṃ cāhorātrayoś ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ
analyzed: tam ṛtavaḥ ca ārtavāḥ ca lokāḥ ca laukyāḥ ca māsāḥ ca ardha māsāḥ ca ahar rātre ca anuvyacalan  / ṛtūnām ca vai saḥ ārtavānām ca lokānām ca laukyānām ca māsānām ca ardha māsānām ca ahar rātrayoḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam
translated: The seasons, the half-seasons, the worlds, the worldly beings, the months, the half-months, and the day and night followed him.

original: veda ////
analyzed: veda
translated: He becomes the dear abode of the seasons, the half-seasons, the worlds, the worldly beings, the months, the half-months, and the day and night, who knows thus.

original: a so 'nāvṛttāṃ diśam anu vy acalat tato nāvartsyann amanyata /
analyzed: saḥ na āvṛttām diśam anu vi acalat tatas na āvartsyan amanyata
translated: He went away in a direction that was not turned back. He thought that he would not return.

original: b taṃ ditiś cāditiś ceḍā cendrāṇī cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam ditiḥ ca aditiḥ ca iḍā ca indrāṇī ca anuvyacalan
translated: Diti, Aditi, Ida, and Indrani followed him.

original: c diteś ca vai so 'diteś ceḍāyāś cendrāṇyāś ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: diteḥ ca vai saḥ diteḥ ca iḍāyāḥ ca indrāṇyāḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes the dear abode of Diti, Aditi, Ida, and Indrani, who knows thus.

original: a sa diśo 'nu vy acalat taṃ virāḍ anu vy acalat sarve ca devāḥ sarvāś ca devatāḥ /
analyzed: sa diśaḥ nu vi acalat tam virāj anu vi acalat sarve ca devāḥ sarvāḥ ca devatāḥ
translated: He went away in the directions. The Viraj followed him, and all the gods and all the deities.

original: b virājaś ca vai sa sarveṣāṃ ca devānāṃ sarvāsāṃ ca devatānāṃ priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: virājaḥ ca vai sa sarveṣām ca devānām sarvāsām ca devatānām priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of all the gods and of all the deities, who knows this.

original: a sa sarvān antardeśān anu vy acalat /
analyzed: sa sarvān antardeśān anu vi acalat
translated: It moved along all the intermediate spaces.

original: b taṃ prajāpatiś ca parameṣṭhī ca pitā ca pitāmahaś cānuvyacalan /
analyzed: tam prajāpatiḥ ca parameṣṭhī ca pitā ca pitāmahaḥ ca anuvyacalan
translated: Prajapati and Parameshthin, the father and grandfather, moved along with it.

original: c prajāpateś ca vai sa parameṣṭhinaś ca pituś ca pitāmahasya ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: prajāpateḥ ca vai sa parameṣṭhinaḥ ca pituḥ ca pitāmahasya ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of Prajapati, of Parameshthin, of the father and of the grandfather, who knows this.

original: sa mahimā sadrur bhūtvāntaṃ pṛthivyā agachat samudro 'bhavat ////
analyzed: sa mahimā sadruḥ bhūtvā antam pṛthivyāḥ agachat samudraḥ bhavat
translated: It became the greatness, the tree, it went to the end of the earth, it became the ocean.

original: taṃ prajāpatiś ca parameṣṭhī ca pitā ca pitāmahaś cāpaś ca śraddhā ca varṣaṃ bhūtvānuvyavartayanta ////
analyzed: tam prajāpatiḥ ca parameṣṭhī ca pitā ca pitāmahaḥ ca āpaḥ ca śraddhā ca varṣam bhūtvā anuvyavartayanta
translated: Prajapati and Parameshthin, the father and grandfather, and the waters and faith, becoming rain, moved along with it.

original: ainam āpo gachanty ainaṃ śraddhā gachaty ainaṃ varṣaṃ gachati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam āpaḥ gacchanti ā enam śraddhā gacchati ā enam varṣam gacchati yaḥ evam veda
translated: The waters go to him, faith goes to him, rain goes to him, who knows this.

original: taṃ śraddhā ca yajñaś ca lokaś cānnaṃ cānnādyaṃ ca bhūtvābhiparyāvartanta ////
analyzed: tam śraddhā ca yajñaḥ ca lokaḥ ca annam ca annādyam ca bhūtvā abhiparyāvartanta
translated: Faith and sacrifice and the world and food and the eating of food, becoming, surrounded him.

original: ainaṃ śraddhā gachaty ainaṃ yajño gachaty ainaṃ loko gachaty ainam annaṃ gachaty ainam annādyaṃ gachati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam śraddhā gacchati ā enam yajñaḥ gacchati ā enam lokaḥ gacchati ā enam annam gacchati ā enam annādyam gacchati yaḥ evam veda
translated: Faith goes to him, sacrifice goes to him, the world goes to him, food goes to him, food and drink go to him, who knows this.

original: so 'rajyata tato rājanyo 'jāyata ////
analyzed: saḥ rajyata tatas rājanyaḥ jāyata
translated: He became passionate. From him the Kshatriya was born.

original: sa viśaḥ sabandhūn annam annādyam abhyudatiṣṭhat ////
analyzed: sa viśaḥ sabandhūn annam annādyam abhyudatiṣṭhat
translated: He rose above the people, his kinsmen, food, and drink.

original: viśāṃ ca vai sa sabandhūnāṃ cānnasya cānnādyasya ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: viśām ca vai sa sabandhūnām ca annasya ca annādyasya ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the people, his kinsmen, food, and drink, who knows this.

original: sa viśo 'nu vy acalat ////
analyzed: sa viśaḥ nu vi acalat
translated: He moved along the people.

original: taṃ sabhā ca samitiś ca senā ca surā cānuvyacalan ////
analyzed: tam sabhā ca samitiḥ ca senā ca surā ca anuvyacalan
translated: The assembly, the gathering, the army, and the Sura followed him.

original: sabhāyāś ca vai sa samiteś ca senāyāś ca surāyāś ca priyaṃ dhāma bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: sabhāyāḥ ca vai sa samiteḥ ca senāyāḥ ca surāyāḥ ca priyam dhāma bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: And he becomes the dear abode of the assembly, the gathering, the army, and the Sura, who knows this.

original: tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātyo rājño 'tithir gṛhān āgachet ////
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ rājñaḥ tithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: Now, if a Vrātya who knows this comes to the house of a king as a guest,

original: śreyāṃsam enam ātmano mānayet tathā kṣatrāya nā vṛścate tathā rāṣṭrāya nā vṛścate ////
analyzed: śreyāṃsam enam ātmanaḥ mānayet tathā kṣatrāya na ā vṛścate tathā rāṣṭrāya na ā vṛścate
translated: he should honor him as superior to himself, so that he does not injure the Kshatriya, so that he does not injure the kingdom.

original: ato vai brahma ca kṣatraṃ cod atiṣṭhatāṃ te abrūtāṃ kaṃ pra viśāveti ////
analyzed: atas vai brahma ca kṣatram ca ud atiṣṭhatām te abrūtām kam pra viśāva iti
translated: From him indeed Brahman and Kshatra arose. They said to him, To whom shall we enter?

original: bṛhaspatim eva brahma praviśatv indraṃ kṣatraṃ tathā vā iti ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatim eva brahma praviśatu indram kṣatram tathā vai iti
translated: Let the Brahman enter Brihaspati, and let the Kshatra enter Indra.'

original: ato vai bṛhaspatim eva brahma prāviśad indraṃ kṣatram ////
analyzed: atas vai bṛhaspatim eva brahma prāviśat indram kṣatram
translated: From that, indeed, the Brahman entered Brihaspati, and the Kshatra entered Indra.

original: iyaṃ vā u pṛthivī bṛhaspatir dyaur evendraḥ ////
analyzed: iyam vai u pṛthivī bṛhaspatiḥ dyauḥ eva indraḥ
translated: This earth, indeed, is Brihaspati, and the sky is Indra.

original: ayaṃ vā u agnir brahmāsāv ādityaḥ kṣatram ////
analyzed: ayam vai u agniḥ brahma asau ādityaḥ kṣatram
translated: This Agni, indeed, is the Brahman, and that Aditya is the Kshatra.

original: ainaṃ brahma gachati brahmavarcasī bhavati ////
analyzed: ā enam brahma gacchati brahmavarcasī bhavati
translated: To him goes the Brahman, and he becomes resplendent.

original: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ bṛhaspatim agniṃ brahma veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ pṛthivīm bṛhaspatim agnim brahma veda
translated: He who knows the earth as Brihaspati, Agni as the Brahman,

original: ainam indriyaṃ gachatīndriyavān bhavati ////
analyzed: ā enam indriyam gacchati indriyavān bhavati
translated: To him goes power, and he becomes powerful.

original: ya ādityaṃ kṣatraṃ divam indraṃ veda ////
analyzed: yaḥ ādityam kṣatram divam indram veda
translated: He who knows the sun as the Kshatra, the sky as Indra,

original: tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātyo 'tithir gṛhān āgachet ////🔽svayam enam abhyudetya brūyād vrātya kvāvātsīr vrātyodakaṃ vrātya🔽tarpayantu vrātya yathā te priyaṃ tathāstu vrātya yathā te vaśas tathāstu vrātya
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyo tithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet  svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya kva avātsīḥ vrātya udakam vrātya  tarpayantu vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu vrātya
translated: Now, if a Vrātya who knows this comes to one's house as a guest,

original: yathā te nikāmas tathāstv iti // //
analyzed: yathā te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti
translated: one should himself go out to meet him and say, 'Vrātya, where have you stayed? Vrātya, let the water be offered to you. Vrātya, let it be as you desire. Vrātya, let it be as you wish. Vrātya, let it be as you please.'

original: yad enam āha vrātya kvāvātsīr iti patha eva tena devayānān ava rundhe ////🔽yad enam āha vrātyodakam ity apa eva tenāva rundhe ////🔽yad enam āha vrātya tarpayantv iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsaṃ kurute ////
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya kva avātsīḥ iti pathaḥ eva tena deva yānān ava rundhe  yat enam āha vrātya udakam iti apaḥ eva tena ava rundhe  yat enam āha vrātya tarpayantu iti prāṇam eva tena varṣīyāṃsam kurute
translated: In that he says to him, 'O Vrātya, where shall I dwell?' thereby he secures for him the paths leading to the gods.🔽In that he says to him, 'O Vrātya, water!' thereby he secures for him the waters.🔽In that he says to him, 'O Vrātya, let them satisfy thee!' thereby he makes his breath more abundant.

original: yad enam āha vrātya yathā te priyaṃ tathāstv iti priyam eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te priyam tathā astu iti priyam eva tena ava rundhe
translated: In that he says to him, 'O Vrātya, let it be as is dear to thee!' thereby he secures for him what is dear.

original: ainaṃ priyaṃ gachati priyaḥ priyasya bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam priyam gacchati priyaḥ priyasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He goes to what is dear to him; he becomes dear to what is dear to him, who knows thus.

original: yad enam āha vrātya yathā te vaśas tathāstv iti vaśam eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te vaśaḥ tathā astu iti vaśam eva tena ava rundhe
translated: In that he says to him, 'O Vrātya, let it be as is thy will!' thereby he secures for him what is his will.

original: ainaṃ vaśo gachati vaśī vaśināṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam vaśaḥ gacchati vaśī vaśinām bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He goes to what is his will; he becomes the lord of lords, who knows thus.

original: yad enam āha vrātya yathā te nikāmas tathāstv iti nikāmam eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: yat enam āha vrātya yathā te nikāmaḥ tathā astu iti nikāmam eva tena ava rundhe
translated: In that he says to him, 'O Vrātya, let it be as is thy desire!' thereby he secures for him what is his desire.

original: ainaṃ nikāmo gachati nikāme nikāmasya bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: ā enam nikāmaḥ gacchati nikāme nikāmasya bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He goes to what is his desire; he becomes the fulfiller of his desire, who knows thus.

original: tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātya uddhṛteṣv agniṣv adhiśrite 'gnihotre 'tithir gṛhān āgachet ////
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ uddhṛteṣu agniṣu adhiśrite gnihotre tithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: Now, if a Vrātya, who knows this, should come to the house as a guest, when the fires have been drawn up and the Agnihotra has been put on the fire.

original: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyād vrātyāti sṛja hoṣyāmīti ////
analyzed: svayam enam abhyudetya brūyāt vrātya ati sṛja hoṣyāmi iti
translated: He should himself go out to meet him and say, 'Vrātya, give me permission, I will offer.'

original: sa cātisṛjej juhuyān na cātisṛjen na juhuyāt ////
analyzed: sa ca atisṛjet juhuyāt na ca atisṛjet na juhuyāt
translated: He should give permission and offer, but he should not give permission and not offer.

original: sa ya evaṃ viduṣā vrātyenātisṛṣṭo juhoti ////
analyzed: sa yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: He who offers when given permission by a Vrātya who knows this

original: pra pitṛyāṇaṃ panthāṃ jānāti pra devayānam ////
analyzed: pra pitṛyāṇam panthām jānāti pra deva yānam
translated: knows the path to the fathers and the path to the gods.

original: na deveṣv ā vṛścate hutam asya bhavati ////
analyzed: na deveṣu ā vṛścate hutam asya bhavati
translated: He is not cut off from the gods, his offering is made.

original: pary asyāsmiṃl loka āyatanaṃ śiṣyate ya evaṃ viduṣā vrātyenātisṛṣṭo juhoti ////
analyzed: pari asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: His abode remains in this world, who offers when given permission by a Vrātya who knows this.

original: atha ya evaṃ viduṣā vrātyenānatisṛṣṭo juhoti ////
analyzed: atha yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: But he who offers when not given permission by a Vrātya who knows this

original: na pitṛyāṇaṃ panthāṃ jānāti na devayānam ////
analyzed: na pitṛyāṇam panthām jānāti na deva yānam
translated: does not know the path to the fathers and the path to the gods.

original: ā deveṣu vṛścate ahutam asya bhavati ////
analyzed: ā deveṣu vṛścate ahutam asya bhavati
translated: He is cut off from the gods, his offering is not made.

original: nāsyāsmiṃl loka āyatanaṃ śiṣyate ya evaṃ viduṣā vrātyenānatisṛṣṭo juhoti ////
analyzed: na asya asmin loke āyatanam śiṣyate yaḥ evam viduṣā vrātyena an atisṛṣṭaḥ juhoti
translated: His abode does not remain in this world, who offers when not given permission by a Vrātya who knows this.

original: a tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātya ekāṃ rātrim atithir gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ ekām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, if a Vrātya, who knows this, should stay one night in the house of a man,

original: b ye pṛthivyāṃ puṇyā lokās tān eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: ye pṛthivyām puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: Those who are on the earth, he blocks them off by that.

original: a tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātyo dvitīyāṃ rātrim atithir gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ dvitīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, he who, knowing thus, a Vrātya, as a guest, stays in one's house for a second night,

original: b ye 'ntarikṣe puṇyā lokās tān eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: ye ntarikṣe puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: those who are in the atmosphere, he blocks them off by that.

original: a tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātyas tṛtīyāṃ rātrim atithir gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ tṛtīyām rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, he who, knowing thus, a Vrātya, as a guest, stays in one's house for a third night,

original: b ye divi puṇyā lokās tān eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: ye divi puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: those who are in the sky, he blocks them off by that.

original: a tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātyaś caturthīṃ rātrim atithir gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyaḥ caturthīm rātrim atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, he who, knowing thus, a Vrātya, as a guest, stays in one's house for a fourth night,

original: b ye puṇyānāṃ puṇyā lokās tān eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: ye puṇyānām puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: those who are the most meritorious of the meritorious worlds, he blocks them off by that.

original: a tad yasyaivaṃ vidvān vrātyo 'parimitā rātrīr atithir gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: tat yasya evam vidvān vrātyo parimitāḥ rātrīḥ atithiḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: Now, he who, knowing thus, a Vrātya, as a guest, stays in one's house for unlimited nights,

original: b ya evāparimitāḥ puṇyā lokās tān eva tenāva rundhe ////
analyzed: ye eva aparimitāḥ puṇyāḥ lokāḥ tān eva tena ava rundhe
translated: those who are the unlimited meritorious worlds, he blocks them off by that.

original: a atha yasyāvrātyo vrātyabruvo nāmabibhraty atithir gṛhān āgachet ////
analyzed: atha yasya a vrātyaḥ vrātyabruvaḥ nāma bibhrati atithiḥ gṛhān āgacchet
translated: Now, if a non-Vrātya, calling himself a Vrātya, bearing the name of a Vrātya, should come to one's house as a guest,

original: a karṣed enaṃ na cainaṃ karṣet ////
analyzed: karṣet enam na ca enam karṣet
translated: one should pull him, and yet one should not pull him.

original: a asyai devatāyā udakaṃ yācāmīmāṃ devatāṃ vāsaya imām imāṃ devatāṃ pari veveṣmīty enaṃ pari veviṣyāt ////
analyzed: asyai devatāyai udakam yācāmi imām devatām vāsaye imām imām devatām pari veveṣmi iti enam pari veviṣyāt
translated: 'For this deity I ask for water; I settle this deity; I search out this deity', he should search for it.

original: a tasyām evāsya tad devatāyāṃ hutaṃ bhavati ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: tasyām eva asya tat devatāyām hutam bhavati yaḥ evam veda
translated: In that deity alone is that offering of his made, who knows thus.

original: a sa yat prācīṃ diśam anu vyacalan mārutaṃ śardho bhūtvānuvyacalan mano 'nnādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat prācīm diśam anu vyacalat mārutam śardhaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manaḥ nnādam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the eastern quarter, he moved along having become the Marut host, having made mind the eater of food.

original: b manasānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: manasā anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of mind as the eater of food, he eats food, who knows thus.

original: a sa yad dakṣiṇāṃ diśam anu vyacalad indro bhūtvānuvyacalad balam annādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat dakṣiṇām diśam anu vyacalat indraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat balam anna ādam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the southern quarter, he moved along having become Indra, having made strength the eater of food.

original: b balenānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: balena anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of strength as the eater of food, he eats food, who knows thus.

original: a sa yat pratīcīṃ diśam anu vyacalad varuṇo rājā bhūtvānuvyacalad apo 'nnādīḥ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat pratīcīm diśam anu vyacalat varuṇaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat apaḥ nnādīḥ kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the western quarter, he moved along having become Varuna the king, having made the waters the eaters of food.

original: b adbhir annādībhir annam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: adbhiḥ annādībhiḥ annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of the waters as the eaters of food, he eats food, who knows thus.

original: a sa yad udīcīṃ diśam anu vyacalat somo rājā bhūtvānuvyacalat saptarṣibhir huta āhutim annādīṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat udīcīm diśam anu vyacalat somaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat saptarṣibhiḥ hute āhutim annādīm kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the northern quarter, he moved along having become Soma the king, having made the oblation offered by the seven Rishis the eater of food.

original: b āhutyānnādyānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: āhutyā annādyā annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of the oblation as the eater of food, he eats food, who knows thus.

original: a sa yad dhruvāṃ diśam anu vyacalad viṣṇur bhūtvānuvyacalad virājam annādīṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat dhruvām diśam anu vyacalat viṣṇuḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat virājam annādīm kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the firm region, he moved along having become Vishnu, having made food-eating prosperity.

original: b virājānnādyānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: virājā annādyā annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He eats food with food-eating prosperity who knows thus.

original: a sa yat paśūn anu vyacalad rudro bhūtvānuvyacalad oṣadhīr annādīḥ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat paśūn anu vyacalat rudraḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat oṣadhīḥ anna ādīḥ kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the cattle, he moved along having become Rudra, having made the food-eating plants.

original: b oṣadhībhir annādībhir annam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: oṣadhībhiḥ anna ādībhiḥ annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He eats food with food-eating plants who knows thus.

original: a sa yat pitṝn anu vyacalad yamo rājā bhūtvānuvyacalat svadhākāram annādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat pitṝn anu vyacalat yamaḥ rājā bhūtvā anuvyacalat svadhākāram anna adam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the fathers, he moved along having become King Yama, having made the food-eater Svâhâkâra.

original: b svadhākāreṇānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: svadhākāreṇa anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He eats food with the food-eater Svâhâkâra who knows thus.

original: a sa yan manuṣyān anu vyacalad agnir bhūtvānuvyacalat svāhākāram annādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat manuṣyān anu vyacalat agniḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat svāhākāram anna ādam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along men, he moved along having become Agni, having made the food-eater Svâhâkâra.

original: b svāhākāreṇānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: svāhākāreṇa anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He eats food with the food-eater Svâhâkâra who knows thus.

original: a sa yad ūrdhvāṃ diśam anu vyacalad bṛhaspatir bhūtvānuvyacalad vaṣaṭkāram annādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat ūrdhvām diśam anu vyacalat bṛhaspatiḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat vaṣaṭkāram anna adam kṛtvā
translated: When he moved along the upward region, he moved along having become Brihaspati, having made the food-eater Vasatkara.

original: b vaṣaṭkāreṇānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: vaṣaṭkāreṇa anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He eats food with the food-eater Vasatkara who knows thus.

original: a sa yad devān anu vyacalad īśāno bhūtvānuvyacalan manyum annādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat devān anu vyacalat īśānaḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat manyum anna ādam kṛtvā
translated: When he went forth following the gods, he went forth having become the lord, having made anger the eater of food.

original: b manyunānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: manyunā anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of anger as the eater of food, he eats food, he who knows thus.

original: a sa yat prajā anu vyacalat prajāpatir bhūtvānuvyacalat prāṇam annādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat prajāḥ anu vyacalat prajāpatiḥ bhūtvā anuvyacalat prāṇam anna ādam kṛtvā
translated: When he went forth following the people, he went forth having become Prajapati, having made breath the eater of food.

original: b prāṇenānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: prāṇena anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of breath as the eater of food, he eats food, he who knows thus.

original: a sa yat sarvān antardeśān anu vyacalat parameṣṭhī bhūtvānuvyacalad brahmānnādaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: sa yat sarvān antardeśān anu vyacalat parameṣṭhī bhūtvā anuvyacalat brahmā anna ādam kṛtvā
translated: When he went forth following all the intermediate regions, he went forth having become the supreme lord, having made Brahman the eater of food.

original: b brahmaṇānnādenānnam atti ya evaṃ veda ////
analyzed: brahmaṇā anna ādena annam atti yaḥ evam veda
translated: By means of Brahman as the eater of food, he eats food, he who knows thus.

original: tasya vrātyasya ////
analyzed: tasya vrātyasya
translated: Of that Vrātya

original: sapta prāṇāḥ saptāpānāḥ sapta vyānāḥ ////
analyzed: sapta prāṇāḥ sapta apānāḥ sapta vyānāḥ
translated: there are seven breaths, seven expirations, seven inspirations.

original: yo 'sya prathamaḥ prāṇa ūrdhvo nāmāyaṃ so agniḥ ////🔽yo 'sya dvitīyaḥ prāṇaḥ prauḍho nāmāsau sa ādityaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya prathamaḥ prāṇaḥ ūrdhvaḥ nāma ayam saḥ agniḥ  yaḥ sya dvitīyaḥ prāṇaḥ prauḍhaḥ nāma asau saḥ ādityaḥ
translated: His first breath, named upward, is this fire.🔽His second breath, named expanded, is that sun.

original: yo 'sya tṛtīyaḥ prāṇo 'bhyūḍho nāmāsau sa candramāḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya tṛtīyaḥ prāṇaḥ bhyūḍhaḥ nāma asau sa candramāḥ
translated: His third breath, named well-expanded, is that moon.

original: yo 'sya caturthaḥ prāṇo vibhūr nāmāyaṃ sa pavamānaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya caturthaḥ prāṇaḥ vibhūḥ nāma ayam sa pavamānaḥ
translated: His fourth breath, named expanded, is that Pavamāna.

original: yo 'sya pañcamaḥ prāṇo yonir nāma tā imā āpaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya pañcamaḥ prāṇaḥ yoniḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ āpaḥ
translated: His fifth life-breath, named Yoni, are these waters.

original: yo 'sya ṣaṣṭhaḥ prāṇaḥ priyo nāma ta ime paśavaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya ṣaṣṭhaḥ prāṇaḥ priyaḥ nāma te ime paśavaḥ
translated: His sixth life-breath, named Priya, are these animals.

original: yo 'sya saptamaḥ prāṇo 'parimito nāma tā imāḥ prajāḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya saptamaḥ prāṇaḥ parimitaḥ nāma tāḥ imāḥ prajāḥ
translated: His seventh life-breath, named Aparimita, are these creatures.

original: yo 'sya prathamo 'pānaḥ sā paurṇamāsī ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya prathamaḥ pānaḥ sā paurṇamāsī
translated: His first downward breath is the full moon.

original: yo 'sya dvitīyo 'pānaḥ sāṣṭakā ////
analyzed: yā u sya dvitīyaḥ pānaḥ sā aṣṭakā
translated: His second downward breath is the eighth day.

original: yo 'sya tṛtīyo 'pānaḥ sāmāvāsyā ////
analyzed: yā sya tṛtīyaḥ pānaḥ sā amāvāsyā
translated: His third downward breath is the new moon.

original: yo 'sya caturtho 'pānaḥ sā śraddhā ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya caturthaḥ pānaḥ sā śraddhā
translated: His fourth downward breath is faith.

original: yo 'sya pañcamo 'pānaḥ sā dīkṣā ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya pañcamaḥ pānaḥ sā dīkṣā
translated: His fifth downward breath is consecration.

original: yo 'sya ṣaṣṭho 'pānaḥ sa yajñaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya ṣaṣṭhaḥ pānaḥ sa yajñaḥ
translated: His sixth downward breath is the sacrifice.

original: yo 'sya saptamo 'pānas tā imā dakṣiṇāḥ ////🔽yo 'sya prathamo vyānaḥ seyaṃ bhūmiḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya saptamaḥ pānaḥ tāḥ imāḥ dakṣiṇāḥ  yaḥ sya prathamaḥ vyānaḥ sā iyam bhūmiḥ
translated: His seventh downward breath are these sacrificial fees.🔽His first cross-breathing is this earth.

original: yo 'sya dvitīyo vyānas tad antarikṣam ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya dvitīyaḥ vyānaḥ tat antarikṣam
translated: His second cross-breathing is that atmosphere.

original: yo 'sya tṛtīyo vyānaḥ sā dyauḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya tṛtīyaḥ vyānaḥ sā dyauḥ
translated: His third cross-breathing is that sky.

original: yo 'sya caturtho vyānas tāni nakṣatrāṇi ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya caturthaḥ vyānaḥ tāni nakṣatrāṇi
translated: His fourth cross-breathing are those stars.

original: yo 'sya pañcamo vyānas ta ṛtavaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya pañcamaḥ vyānaḥ te ṛtavaḥ
translated: His fifth cross-breathing are those seasons.

original: yo 'sya ṣaṣṭho vyānas ta ārtavāḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya ṣaṣṭhaḥ vyānaḥ te ārtavāḥ
translated: His sixth cross-breathing are those half-months.

original: yo 'sya saptamo vyānaḥ sa saṃvatsaraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya saptamaḥ vyānaḥ sa saṃvatsaraḥ
translated: His seventh exhalation is the year.

original: samānam arthaṃ pari yanti devāḥ saṃvatsaraṃ vā etad ṛtavo 'nupariyanti vrātyaṃ ca ////
analyzed: samānam artham pari yanti devāḥ saṃvatsaram vai etat ṛtavaḥ nupariyanti vrātyam ca
translated: The gods go around the same meaning. The seasons go around the year, the Vrātya.

original: yad ādityam abhisaṃviśanty amāvāsyāṃ caiva tat paurṇamāsīṃ ca ////
analyzed: yat ādityam abhisaṃviśanti amāvāsyām ca eva tat paurṇamāsīm ca
translated: When they enter the sun, that is the new moon and the full moon.

original: ekaṃ tad eṣām amṛtatvam ity āhutir eva ////
analyzed: ekam tat eṣām amṛta tvam iti āhutiḥ eva
translated: That is their immortality, they say. The offering itself.

original: tasya vrātyasya ////
analyzed: tasya vrātyasya
translated: Of that Vrātya.

original: yad asya dakṣiṇam akṣy asau sa ādityo yad asya savyam akṣy asau sa candramāḥ ////
analyzed: yat asya dakṣiṇam akṣi asau saḥ ādityaḥ yat asya savyam akṣi asau sa candramāḥ
translated: His right eye is that sun. His left eye is that moon.

original: yo 'sya dakṣiṇaḥ karṇo 'yaṃ so agnir yo 'sya savyaḥ karṇo 'yaṃ sa pavamānaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sya dakṣiṇaḥ karṇaḥ yam saḥ agniḥ yaḥ sya savyaḥ karṇaḥ yam sa pavamānaḥ
translated: His right ear is that fire. His left ear is that wind.

original: ahorātre nāsike ditiś cāditiś ca śīrṣakapāle saṃvatsaraḥ śiraḥ ////
analyzed: ahar rātre nāsike ditiḥ ca aditiḥ ca śīrṣa kapāle saṃvatsaraḥ śiraḥ
translated: Day and night are the nostrils. Diti and Aditi are the skull bones. The year is the head.

original: ahnā pratyaṅ vrātyo rātryā prāṅ namo vrātyāya ////
analyzed: ahnā pratyaṅ vrātyaḥ rātryā prāṅ namaḥ vrātyāya
translated: The Vrātya goes to the west by day, to the east by night. Homage to the Vrātya.

original: atisṛṣṭo apāṃ vṛṣabho 'tisṛṣṭā agnayo divyāḥ ////
analyzed: atisṛṣṭaḥ apām vṛṣabha u tisṛṣṭāḥ agnayaḥ divyāḥ
translated: The bull of the waters is released. The heavenly fires are released.

original: rujan parirujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan ////
analyzed: rujan parirujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan
translated: Striking, piercing, killing, destroying.

original: mroko manohā khano nirdāha ātmadūṣis tanūdūṣiḥ ////
analyzed: mrokaḥ manaḥ hā khanaḥ nirdāhaḥ ātma dūṣiḥ tanū dūṣiḥ
translated: The evil-minded, the mind-destroyer, the digger, the burner, the self-corrupter, the body-corrupter.

original: idaṃ tam ati sṛjāmi taṃ mābhyavanikṣi ////
analyzed: idam tam ati sṛjāmi tam mā abhyavanikṣi
translated: I send this forth to him; let him not injure me.

original: tena tam abhyatisṛjāmo yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ ////
analyzed: tena tam abhyatisṛjāmaḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: With this we send forth to him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: apām agram asi samudraṃ vo 'bhyavasṛjāmi ////
analyzed: apām agram asi samudram vaḥ bhyavasṛjāmi
translated: You are the fore-front of the waters; I let you loose to the ocean.

original: yo 'psv agnir ati taṃ sṛjāmi mrokaṃ khaniṃ tanūdūṣim ////
analyzed: yaḥ psu agniḥ ati tam sṛjāmi mrokam khanim tanū dūṣim
translated: I send forth the fire that is in the waters, the Mroka, the digger, the corrupter of the body.

original: yo va āpo 'gnir āviveśa sa eṣa yad vo ghoraṃ tad etat ////
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ āpaḥ gniḥ āviveśa saḥ eṣa yat vaḥ ghoram tat etat
translated: The fire that has entered the waters, that is this. Whatever is terrible in you, that is this.

original: indrasya va indriyeṇābhi ṣiñcet ////🔽ariprā āpo apa ripram asmat ////
analyzed: indrasya vaḥ indriyeṇa abhi siñcet  ariprāḥ āpaḥ apa ripram asmat
translated: One should sprinkle with the power of Indra.🔽The waters are free from evil; free from evil are you to us.

original: prāsmad eno vahantu pra duṣvapnyaṃ vahantu ////
analyzed: pra asmat enaḥ vahantu pra duṣvapnyam vahantu
translated: Carry away from us our sin; carry away our evil dream.

original: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyatāpaḥ śivayā tanvopa spṛśata tvacaṃ me ////
analyzed: śivena mā cakṣuṣā paśyata apaḥ śivayā tanvā upa spṛśata tvacam me
translated: Look upon me with your auspicious eye, O waters; touch my skin with your auspicious bodies.

original: śivān agnīn apsuṣado havāmahe mayi kṣatraṃ varca ā dhatta devīḥ ////
analyzed: śivān agnīn apsuṣadaḥ havāmahe mayi kṣatram varcaḥ ā dhatta devīḥ
translated: We invoke the auspicious fires that dwell in the waters; O goddesses, bestow upon me power and splendor.

original: nir durarmaṇya ūrjā madhumatī vāk ////
analyzed: niḥ ūrjā madhumatī vāc
translated: The sweet-voiced speech, free from evil smell, with sweet food.

original: madhumatī stha madhumatīṃ vācam udeyam ////
analyzed: madhumatīḥ stha madhumatīm vācam udeyam
translated: You are sweet; may I rise with sweet speech.

original: upahūto me gopāḥ upahūto gopīthaḥ ////
analyzed: upahūtaḥ me gopāḥ upahūtaḥ gopīthaḥ
translated: My guardian is invoked; my protector is invoked.

original: suśrutau karṇau bhadraśrutau karṇau bhadraṃ ślokaṃ śrūyāsam ////
analyzed: su śrutau karṇau bhadra śrutau karṇau bhadram ślokam śrūyāsam
translated: May my ears hear well; may my ears hear good things; may I hear good fame.

original: suśrutiś ca mopaśrutiś ca mā hāsiṣṭāṃ sauparṇaṃ cakṣur ajasraṃ jyotiḥ ////
analyzed: su śrutiḥ ca mā upaśrutiḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām sauparṇam cakṣuḥ ajasram jyotiḥ
translated: And may good hearing and hearing from afar not fail me. The eagle's eye, the everlasting light.

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ prastaro 'si namo 'stu daivāya prastarāya ////
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām prastaraḥ si namaḥ stu daivāya prastarāya
translated: You are the seat of the seers. Homage to the divine seat.

original: mūrdhāhaṃ rayīṇāṃ mūrdhā samānānāṃ bhūyāsam ////
analyzed: mūrdhā aham rayīṇām mūrdhā samānānām bhūyāsam
translated: I am the head of riches. May I be the head of equals.

original: rujaś ca mā venaś ca mā hāsiṣṭāṃ mūrdhā ca mā vidharmā ca mā hāsiṣṭām ////
analyzed: rujaḥ ca mā venaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām mūrdhā ca mā vidharmā ca mā hāsiṣṭām
translated: May Ruja and Vena not fail me. May the head and the law not fail me.

original: urvaś ca mā camasaś ca mā hāsiṣṭāṃ dhartā ca mā dharuṇaś ca mā hāsiṣṭām ////
analyzed: urvaḥ ca mā camasaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām dhartā ca mā dharuṇaḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām
translated: May Urva and Chamasa not fail me. May the supporter and the prop not fail me.

original: vimokaś ca mārdrapaviś ca mā hāsiṣṭām ārdradānuś ca mā mātariśvā ca mā hāsiṣṭām ////
analyzed: vimokaḥ ca mā ārdra paviḥ ca mā hāsiṣṭām ārdra dānuḥ ca mā mātariśvā ca mā hāsiṣṭām
translated: May Vimoca and Mardrapavi not fail me. May Adradaanu and Matarisvan not fail me.

original: bṛhaspatir ma ātmā nṛmaṇā nāma hṛdyaḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ me ātmā nṛmaṇāḥ nāma hṛdyaḥ
translated: Brihaspati is my self, named Nrimana in the heart.

original: asaṃtāpaṃ me hṛdayam urvī gavyūtiḥ samudro asmi vidharmaṇā ////
analyzed: asaṃtāpam me hṛdayam urvī gavyūtiḥ samudraḥ asmi vidharmaṇā
translated: My heart is free from torment. The vast expanse is the ocean. I am with the law.

original: nābhir ahaṃ rayīṇāṃ nābhiḥ samānānāṃ bhūyāsam ////
analyzed: nābhiḥ aham rayīṇām nābhiḥ samānānām bhūyāsam
translated: I am the navel of riches. May I be the navel of equals.

original: svāsad asi sūṣā amṛto martyeśv ā ////
analyzed: su āsad asi sūṣāḥ amṛtaḥ martya īśu ā
translated: You are the good, the useful, the immortal among mortals.

original: mā māṃ prāṇo hāsīn mo apāno 'vahāya parā gāt ////
analyzed: mā mām prāṇaḥ hāsīt mā u apānaḥ vahāya parā gāt
translated: May my breath not fail me. May my out-breath not leave me and depart.

original: sūryo māhnaḥ pātv agniḥ pṛthivyā vāyur antarikṣād yamo manuṣyebhyaḥ sarasvatī pārthivebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ mā ahnaḥ pātu agniḥ pṛthivyāḥ vāyuḥ antarikṣāt yamaḥ manuṣyebhyaḥ sarasvatī pārthivebhyaḥ
translated: May Surya protect me from the day, Agni from the earth, Vayu from the atmosphere, Yama from men, Sarasvati from earthly beings.

original: prāṇāpanau mā mā hāsiṣṭam mā jane pra meṣi ////
analyzed: prāṇa apanau mā mā hāsiṣṭam mā jane pra meṣi
translated: Let Prana and Apana not forsake me. Let me not go to the people.

original: svasty adyoṣaso doṣasaś ca sarva āpaḥ sarvagaṇo aśīya ////
analyzed: svasti adya uṣasaḥ doṣasaḥ ca sarve āpaḥ sarva gaṇaḥ aśīya
translated: Good be to us this day and the next day, and to all days. May I prosper with all the clans.

original: śakvarī stha paśavo mopa stheṣur mitrāvaruṇau me prāṇāpānāv agnir me dakṣaṃ dadhātu ////
analyzed: śakvarīḥ stha paśavaḥ mā upa stha iṣuḥ mitrāvaruṇau me prāṇa apānau agniḥ me dakṣam dadhātu
translated: You are the Shakvari metre. Let the cattle not forsake me. Let Mitra and Varuna give me Prana and Apana. Let Agni bestow strength upon me.

original: vidma te svapna janitraṃ grāhyāḥ putro 'si yamasya karaṇaḥ /
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram grāhyāḥ putraḥ si yamasya karaṇaḥ
translated: We know your birth, O Sleep, you are the son of Grahi, the instrument of Yama.

original: antako 'si mṛtyur asi /
analyzed: antakaḥ si mṛtyuḥ asi
translated: You are the Ender, you are Death.

original: taṃ tvā svapna tathā saṃ vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi ////🔽vidma te svapna janitraṃ nirṛtyāḥ putro 'si yamasya karaṇaḥ / / / / // //🔽vidma te svapna janitraṃ abhūtyāḥ putro 'si yamasya / / / // //
analyzed: tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi  vidma te svapna janitram nirṛtyāḥ putraḥ si yamasya karaṇaḥ       vidma te svapna janitram abhūtyāḥ putraḥ si yamasya  /
translated: We know you thus, O Sleep. Protect us, O Sleep, from evil dreams.🔽We know your birth, O Sleep, you are the son of Nirriti, the instrument of Yama.🔽We know your birth, O Sleep, you are the son of Abhuti, the instrument of Yama.

original: vidma te svapna janitraṃ nirbhūtyāḥ putro 'si / / / // //
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram nirbhūtyāḥ putraḥ si  /
translated: We know your birth, O Sleep, you are the son of Nirbhuti, the instrument of Yama.

original: vidma te svapna janitraṃ parābhūtyāḥ putro 'si / / / // //
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram parābhūtyāḥ putraḥ si   /
translated: We know your birth, O Sleep, you are the son of Parabhuti, the instrument of Yama.

original: vidma te svapna janitraṃ devajāmīnāṃ putro 'si yamasya karaṇaḥ /
analyzed: vidma te svapna janitram deva jāmīnām putraḥ si yamasya karaṇaḥ
translated: We know thy birthplace, O Sleep, thou art the son of the divine Jamadagni, thou art the instrument of Yama.

original: antako 'si mṛtyur asi /
analyzed: antakaḥ si mṛtyuḥ asi
translated: Thou art the destroyer, thou art death.

original: taṃ tvā svapna tathā saṃ vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi ////
analyzed: tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa naḥ svapna duṣvapnyāt pāhi
translated: We know thee thus, O Sleep, do thou guard us, O Sleep, from evil dreams.

original: ajaiṣmādyāsanām adyāmūm anāgaso vayam ////
analyzed: ajaiṣma adya asanām adya amūm anāgasaḥ vayam
translated: We have conquered the past, we have conquered the present, we are sinless.

original: uṣo yasmād duṣvapnyād abhaiṣmāpa tad uchatu ////
analyzed: uṣaḥ yasmāt duṣvapnyāt abhaiṣma apa tat uchatu
translated: From whatever evil dream we have been afraid, O Dawn, may that pass away from us.

original: dviṣate tat parā vaha śapate tat parā vaha ////
analyzed: dviṣate tat parā vaha śapate tat parā vaha
translated: Carry that away from the hater, carry it away from the reviler.

original: yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tasmā enad gamayāmaḥ ////🔽uṣā devī vācā saṃvidānā vāg devy uṣasā saṃvidānā ////
analyzed: yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tasmai enat gamayāmaḥ  uṣāḥ devī vācā saṃvidānā vāc devī uṣasā saṃvidānā
translated: We send it to him who hates us and whom we hate.🔽Dawn, the goddess, in agreement with speech, speech, the goddess, in agreement with Dawn.

original: uṣas patir vācas patinā saṃvidāno vācas patinā saṃvidānaḥ ////
analyzed: uṣaḥ patiḥ vācaḥ patinā saṃvidānaḥ vācaḥ patinā saṃvidānaḥ
translated: The lord of Dawn, in agreement with the lord of speech, in agreement with the lord of speech.

original: te 'muṣmai parā vahantv arāyān durṇāmnaḥ sadānvāḥ ////
analyzed: te muṣmai parā vahantu arāyān durṇāmnaḥ sadānvāḥ
translated: May they carry away from him the evil spirits, the ill-named, the ever-wandering.

original: kumbhīkāḥ dūṣīkāḥ pīyakān ////
analyzed: kumbhīkāḥ dūṣīkāḥ pīyakān
translated: The abscesses, the malignant sores, the leprosy.

original: jāgradduṣvapnyaṃ svapneduṣvapnyam ////
analyzed: jāgrat duḥṣvapnyam svapneduḥṣvapnyam
translated: The evil dream of the waking, the evil dream of the sleeping.

original: anāgamiṣyato varān avitteḥ saṃkalpān amucyā druhaḥ pāśān ////
analyzed: an āgamiṣyataḥ varān avitteḥ saṃkalpān amucyāḥ druhaḥ pāśān
translated: The future boons, the intentions of poverty, the bonds of hatred, the snares of enmity.

original: tad amuṣmā agne devāḥ parā vahantu vaghrir yathāsad vithuro na sādhuḥ ////
analyzed: tat amuṣmai agne devāḥ parā vahantu vaghriḥ yathā asat vithuraḥ na sādhuḥ
translated: O Agni, may the gods carry him away to him, as a worthless, broken, useless (man).

original: tenainaṃ vidhyāmy abhūtyainaṃ vidhyāmi nirbhūtyainaṃ vidhyāmi parābhūtyainaṃ vidhyāmi grāhyainaṃ vidhyāmi tamasainaṃ vidhyāmi
analyzed: tena enam vidhyāmi abhūtyā enam vidhyāmi nirbhūtyā enam vidhyāmi parābhūtyā enam vidhyāmi grāhyā enam vidhyāmi tamasā enam vidhyāmi
translated: With that I pierce him, with non-prosperity I pierce him, with non-existence I pierce him, with defeat I pierce him, with the grasp I pierce him, with darkness I pierce him.

original: devānām enaṃ ghoraiḥ krūraiḥ praiṣair abhipreṣyāmi ////
analyzed: devānām enam ghoraiḥ krūraiḥ praiṣaiḥ abhipreṣyāmi
translated: I send him forth with the terrible, cruel messengers of the gods.

original: vaiśvānarasyainaṃ daṃṣṭrayor api dadhāmi ////
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya enam daṃṣṭrayoḥ api dadhāmi
translated: I place him in the jaws of Vaisvānara.

original: evānevāva sā garat ////
analyzed: eva aneva ava sā garat
translated: Let him go to him, let him go to him.

original: yo 'smān dveṣṭi tam ātmā dveṣṭu yaṃ vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ sa ātmānaṃ dveṣṭu ////
analyzed: yaḥ smān dveṣṭi tam ātmā dveṣṭu yam vayam dviṣmaḥ saḥ ātmānam dveṣṭu
translated: Let him who hates us hate himself, let him whom we hate hate himself.

original: nir dviṣantaṃ divo niḥ pṛthivyā nir antarikṣād bhajāma ////
analyzed: niḥ dviṣantam divaḥ niḥ pṛthivyāḥ niḥ antarikṣāt bhajāma
translated: We banish the hater from the sky, from the earth, from the atmosphere.

original: suyāmaṃś cākṣuṣa ////
analyzed: suyāman cākṣuṣa
translated: (The one) well-guarded, (the one) of the eyes.

original: idam aham āmuṣyāyaṇe 'muṣyāḥ putre duṣvapnyaṃ mṛje ////🔽yad adoado abhyagachaṃ yad doṣā yat pūrvāṃ rātrim ////
analyzed: idam aham āmuṣyāyaṇe muṣyāḥ putre duṣvapnyam mṛje  yat adoadaḥ abhyagacham yat doṣā yat pūrvām rātrim
translated: This evil dream I remove from N.N., son of N.N.🔽Whatever I have done day by day, whatever in the evening, whatever in the night,

original: yaj jāgrad yat supto yad divā yan naktam ////
analyzed: yat jāgrat yat suptaḥ yat divā yat naktam
translated: whatever I have done while awake, whatever while asleep, whatever by day, whatever by night,

original: yad aharahar abhigachāmi tasmād enam ava daye ////
analyzed: yat ahar ahar abhigacchāmi tasmāt enam ava daye
translated: whatever I have done day after day, from that I remove it from him.

original: taṃ jahi tena mandasva tasya pṛṣṭīr api śṛṇīhi ////
analyzed: tam jahi tena mandasva tasya pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇīhi
translated: Slay him with that, rejoice in him, crush his very bones.

analyzed: sa mā jīvīt tam prāṇaḥ jahātu

translated: For the sake of prosperity, may the sacrifice be rich in wealth. May I obtain wealth. May I be rich. Place wealth in me.🔽The conqueror of foes, the victorious, the most powerful,

translated: The conqueror, the conqueror through strength, the conqueror of heaven, the conqueror of cattle, the conqueror of wealth,

translated: The adorable Indra, may I live long.🔽The conqueror of foes, the victorious, the most powerful,

translated: The adorable Indra, may I be dear to the people.

translated: The adorable Indra, may I be dear to my equals.

original: ud ihy ud ihi sūrya varcasā mābhyudihi /🔽dviṣaṃś ca mahyaṃ radhyatu mā cāhaṃ dviṣate radhaṃ taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni /
analyzed: ud ihi ud ihi sūrya varcasā mā abhyudihi  dviṣan ca mahyam radhyatu mā ca aham dviṣate radham tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni
translated: Rise up, rise up, O Sun, with your radiance rise up for me.🔽May my enemy be ruined, and may I not be ruined by my enemy. Thus, O Vishnu, your many powers...

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, increase us with cattle of all forms. Place me in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: ud ihy ud ihi sūrya varcasā mābhyudihi /
analyzed: ud ihi ud ihi sūrya varcasā mā abhyudihi
translated: Rise up, rise up, O Sun, with your radiance rise up for me.

original: āṃś ca paśyāmi yāṃś ca na teṣu mā sumatiṃ kṛdhi taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni /
analyzed: ān ca paśyāmi yān ca na teṣu mā sumatim kṛdhi tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni
translated: I see some and others not. Grant me good will towards them. Thus, O Vishnu, your many powers...

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, increase us with cattle of all forms. Place me in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: mā tvā dabhant salile apsv antar ye pāśina upatiṣṭhanty atra /
analyzed: mā tvā dabhant salile apsu antar ye pāśinaḥ upatiṣṭhanti atra
translated: Let not the water-dwellers, the snares that lie here in the waters, harm thee.

original: hitvāśastiṃ divam ārukṣa etāṃ sa no mṛḍa sumatau te syāma taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni /
analyzed: hitvā aśastim divam ārukṣaḥ etām sa naḥ mṛḍa sumatau te syāma tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni
translated: Having cast off the curse, ascend to this heaven. Be gracious to us, may we enjoy thy favour. O Vishnu, thy many powers.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, fill us with all forms of cattle. Place us in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: tvaṃ na indra mahate saubhagāyādabdhebhiḥ pari pāhy aktubhis taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra mahate saubhagāya adabdhebhiḥ pari pāhi aktubhiḥ tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni
translated: Do thou, O Indra, with thy unfailing rays, guard us for great bliss. O Vishnu, thy many powers.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, fill us with all forms of cattle. Place us in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: tvaṃ na indrotibhiḥ śivābhiḥ śaṃtamo bhava /🔽ārohaṃs tridivaṃ divo gṛṇānaḥ somapītaye priyadhāmā svastaye taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra ūtibhiḥ śivābhiḥ śaṃtamaḥ bhava  ārohan tridivam divaḥ gṛṇānaḥ soma pītaye priya dhāmā svastaye tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāni
translated: Do thou, O Indra, with thy most auspicious and most propitious powers,🔽Ascending to the third heaven of the sky, singing to thee, O Soma-drinker, to thy dear abode, for our welfare. O Vishnu, thy many powers.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, fill us with all forms of cattle. Place us in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: tvam indrāsi viśvajit sarvavit puruhūtas tvam indra /
analyzed: tvam indra asi viśva jit sarva vid puru hūtaḥ tvam indra
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the all-conquering, the all-knowing, the much-invoked, thou, O Indra.

original: tvam indremaṃ suhavaṃ stomam erayasva sa no mṛḍa sumatau te syāma taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: tvam indra imam su havam stomam erayasva sa naḥ mṛḍa sumatau te syāma tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: O Indra, send forth this invocation-worthy praise; may he be gracious to us, and may we enjoy his favour. O Vishnu, your many powers,

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: do thou increase us with all forms of cattle. Place us in the highest heaven.

original: adabdho divi pṛthivyām utāsi na ta āpur mahimānam antarikṣe /
analyzed: adabdhaḥ divi pṛthivyām uta asi na te āpuḥ mahimānam antarikṣe
translated: Thou art not deceived in heaven or on earth. They have not attained thy greatness in the atmosphere.

original: adabdhena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānaḥ sa tvaṃ na indra divi saṃ charma yacha taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: adabdhena brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānaḥ sa tvam naḥ indra divi sam śarma yaccha tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: Having grown by the undeceiving Brahman, do thou, O Indra, grant us protection in heaven. O Vishnu, your many powers,

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: do thou increase us with all forms of cattle. Place us in the highest heaven.

original: yā ta indra tanūr apsu yā pṛthivyāṃ yāntar agnau yā te indra pavamāne svarvidi /
analyzed: yā te indra tanūḥ apsu yā pṛthivyām yā antar agnau yā te indra pavamāne svar vidi
translated: That body of thine, O Indra, which is in the waters, which is in the earth, which is in the fire, which is in the purifying, O Indra, in the heavenly realm,

original: yayendra tanvā 'ntarikṣaṃ vyāpitha tayā na indra tanvā śarma yacha taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: yayā indra tanvā ntarikṣam vyāpitha tayā naḥ indra tanvā śarma yaccha tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: by which body, O Indra, thou hast pervaded the atmosphere, by that body, O Indra, grant us protection. O Vishnu, your many powers,

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: do thou increase us with all forms of cattle. Place us in the highest heaven.

original: tvām indra brahmaṇā vardhayantaḥ sattraṃ ni ṣedur ṛṣayo nādhamānās taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: tvām indra brahmaṇā vardhayantaḥ sattram ni seduḥ ṛṣayaḥ nādhamānāḥ tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: O Indra, the Rishis, praising, have sat down to the sacrificial session, exalting thee with prayer. O Vishnu, thy powers are manifold.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, make us increase with all forms of cattle. Place me in the highest heaven, in the place of happiness.

original: tvaṃ tṛtaṃ tvaṃ pary eṣy utsaṃ sahasradhāraṃ vidathaṃ svarvidaṃ taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: tvam tṛtam tvam pari eṣi utsam sahasra dhāram vidatham svar vidam tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: Thou art the three, thou hast gone round the spring of a thousand streams, the assembly, the finder of heaven. O Vishnu, thy powers are manifold.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, make us increase with all forms of cattle. Place me in the highest heaven, in the place of happiness.
