original: tvaṃ rakṣase pradiśaś catasras tvaṃ śociṣā nabhasī vi bhāsi /
analyzed: tvam rakṣase pradiśaḥ catasraḥ tvam śociṣā nabhasī vi bhāsi
translated: Thou guardest the four quarters. Thou shinest with thy radiance in the two luminous spheres.

original: tvam imā viśvā bhuvanānu tiṣṭhasa ṛtasya panthām anv eṣi vidvāṃs taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: tvam imā viśvā bhuvanā anu tiṣṭhase ṛtasya panthām anu eṣi vidvān tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: Thou standest over all these worlds. Knowing the path of truth, thou goest along it. O Vishnu, thy powers are manifold.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, make us increase with all forms of cattle. Place me in the highest heaven, in the place of happiness.

original: pañcabhiḥ parāṅ tapasy ekayārvāṅ aśastim eṣi sudine bādhamānas taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: pañcabhiḥ parāṅ tapasi ekayā arvāṅ aśastim eṣi sudine bādhamānaḥ tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: With five thou goest away, with one thou comest hither. Thou goest to the assembly, overcoming the curse on a fair day. O Vishnu, thy powers are manifold.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, grant us cattle of all forms. Place me in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: tvam indras tvam mahendras tvaṃ lokas tvaṃ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: tvam indraḥ tvam mahendraḥ tvam lokaḥ tvam prajāpatiḥ
translated: Thou art Indra, thou art Mahendra, thou art the world, thou art Prajapati.

original: tubhyaṃ yajño vi tāyate tubhyaṃ juhvati juhvatas taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: tubhyam yajñaḥ vi tāyate tubhyam juhvati juhvataḥ tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: To thee the sacrifice is spread out. To thee they offer who offer. To thee, O Vishnu, are many kinds of powers.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, grant us cattle of all forms. Place me in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: asati sat pratiṣṭhitaṃ sati bhūtaṃ pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: asati sat pratiṣṭhitam sati bhūtam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: In non-being, being is established. In being, the existent is established.

original: bhūtam ha bhavya āhitaṃ bhavyaṃ bhūte pratiṣṭhitaṃ taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: bhūtam ha bhavye āhitam bhavyam bhūte pratiṣṭhitam tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: The existent is placed in the future. The future is established in the existent. To thee, O Vishnu, are many kinds of powers.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: Do thou, O Vishnu, grant us cattle of all forms. Place me in the highest heaven of bliss.

original: śukro 'si bhrājo 'si /
analyzed: śukraḥ si bhrājaḥ si
translated: Thou art the bright one, thou art the shining one.

original: sa yathā tvaṃ bhrājatā bhrājo 'sy evāhaṃ bhrājatā bhrājyāsam ////
analyzed: sa yathā tvam bhrājatā bhrājaḥ sīḥ eva aham bhrājatā bhrājyāsam
translated: Just as thou art the shining one by shining, so may I be the shining one by shining.

original: rucir asi roco 'si /
analyzed: ruciḥ asi rocaḥ si
translated: Thou art the radiance, thou art the shining.

original: sa yathā tvaṃ rucyā roco 'sy evāhaṃ paśubhiś ca brāhmaṇavarcasena ca ruciṣīya ////
analyzed: sa yathā tvam rucyā rocaḥ sīḥ eva aham paśubhiḥ ca brāhmaṇa varcasena ca ruciṣīya
translated: Just as thou art the shining by shining, so may I be radiant by cattle and by the splendor of Brahmins.

original: udyate nama udāyate nama uditāya namaḥ /
analyzed: udyate namaḥ udāyate namaḥ uditāya namaḥ
translated: Homage to the rising sun, homage to the rising, homage to the risen.

original: virāje namaḥ svarāje namaḥ samrāje namaḥ ////🔽astaṃyate namo 'stameṣyate namo 'stamitāya namaḥ /
analyzed: virāje namaḥ svarāje namaḥ samrāje namaḥ  a staṃyate namaḥ u stameṣyate namaḥ u stamitāya namaḥ
translated: Homage to the shining, homage to the shining forth, homage to the shining together.🔽Homage to the setting sun, homage to the setting, homage to the set.

original: virāje namaḥ svarāje namaḥ samrāje namaḥ ////
analyzed: virāje namaḥ svarāje namaḥ samrāje namaḥ
translated: Homage to the shining, homage to the shining forth, homage to the shining together.

original: ud agād ayam ādityo viśvena tapasā saha /🔽sapatnān mahyaṃ randhayan mā cāhaṃ dviṣate radhaṃ taved viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi /
analyzed: ud agāt ayam ādityaḥ viśvena tapasā saha  sapatnān mahyam randhayan mā ca aham dviṣate radham tava id viṣṇo bahūdhā vīryāṇi
translated: This sun has risen with all its heat,🔽conquering my enemies. Let me not be conquered by the foe. Thus, O Vishnu, your many powers.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhir viśvarūpaiḥ sudhāyāṃ mā dhehi parame vyoman ////
analyzed: tvam naḥ pṛṇīhi paśubhiḥ viśva rūpaiḥ sudhāyām mā dhehi parame vyoman
translated: You, O Vishnu, grant me cattle of all forms. Place me in the highest heaven.

original: āditya nāvam ārukṣaḥ śatāritrāṃ svastaye /
analyzed: āditya nāvam ārukṣaḥ śata aritrām svastaye
translated: O sun, I have mounted your ship with a hundred oars for my well-being.

original: ahar māty apīparo rātriṃ satrāti pāraya ////
analyzed: ahar mā ati apīparaḥ rātrim satrāti pāraya
translated: May I pass over the night and cross over the day.

original: sūrya nāvam ārukṣaḥ śatāritrāṃ svastaye /
analyzed: sūrya nāvam ārukṣaḥ śata aritrām svastaye
translated: O sun, I have mounted your ship with a hundred oars for my well-being.

original: rātriṃ māty apīparo 'haḥ satrāti pāraya ////
analyzed: rātrim mā ati apīparaḥ haḥ satrāti pāraya
translated: May I pass over the day and cross over the night.

original: prajāpater āvṛto brahmaṇā varmaṇāhaṃ kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca /
analyzed: prajāpateḥ āvṛtaḥ brahmaṇā varmaṇā aham kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca
translated: I am protected by Prajapati, by Brahman, by the armor, by Kashyapa, by light, and by splendor.

original: jaradaṣṭiḥ kṛtavīryo vihāyāḥ sahasrāyuḥ sukṛtaś careyam ////
analyzed: jaradaṣṭiḥ kṛta vīryaḥ vihāyāḥ sahasra āyuḥ su kṛtaḥ careyam
translated: May I live a thousand years, with long life, heroic deeds, and good works.

original: parivṛto brahmaṇā varmaṇāham kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca /
analyzed: parivṛtaḥ brahmaṇā varmaṇā aham kaśyapasya jyotiṣā varcasā ca
translated: I am surrounded by Brahman, by armor, by the light and splendor of Kashyapa.

original: mā mā prāpann iṣavo daivyā yā mā mānuṣīr avasṛṣṭāḥ vadhāya ////
analyzed: mā mā prāpan iṣavaḥ daivyāḥ yāḥ mā mānuṣīḥ avasṛṣṭāḥ vadhāya
translated: May the divine arrows and those released by humans for my destruction not reach me.

original: ṛtena gupta ṛtubhiś ca sarvair bhūtena gupto bhavyena cāham /
analyzed: ṛtena guptaḥ ṛtubhiḥ ca sarvaiḥ bhūtena guptaḥ bhavyena ca aham
translated: Protected by the truth and by all the seasons, protected by what exists and by what will be,

original: mā mā prāpat pāpmā mota mṛtyur antar dadhe 'haṃ salilena vācaḥ ////
analyzed: mā mā prāpat pāpmā mā uta mṛtyuḥ antar dadhe ham salilena vācaḥ
translated: May sin and death not reach me. I hide myself in the water of speech.

original: agnir mā goptā pari pātu viśvataḥ udyant sūryo nudatāṃ mṛtyupāśān /
analyzed: agniḥ mā goptā pari pātu viśvatas udyan sūryaḥ nudatām mṛtyu pāśān
translated: May Agni, the protector, guard me from all sides. May the rising sun remove the bonds of death.

original: vyuchantīr uṣasaḥ parvatā dhruvāḥ sahasraṃ prāṇā mayy ā yatantām //// 🔽o cit sakhāyaṃ sakhyā vavṛtyāṃ tiraḥ puru cid arṇavaṃ jaganvān /
analyzed: vyuchantīḥ uṣasaḥ parvatāḥ dhruvāḥ sahasram prāṇāḥ mayi ā yatantām  / ā u cit sakhāyam sakhyā vavṛtyām tiras puru cit arṇavam jaganvān
translated: The shining dawns, the firm mountains, and the thousand breaths in me should strive.🔽Even if I turn away my friend with friendship, having crossed over many a flood,

original: pitur napātam ā dadhīta vedhā adhi kṣami prataraṃ dīdhyānaḥ ////
analyzed: pituḥ napātam ā dadhīta vedhāḥ adhi kṣami prataram dīdhyānaḥ
translated: The creator should place me, the grandson of the father, on the earth, seeking a ford, meditating.

original: na te sakhā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭy etat salakṣmā yad viṣurūpā bhavati /
analyzed: na te sakhā sakhyam vaṣṭi etat salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavati
translated: This friendship of yours does not please me, O friend, that you are of many forms, having different features.

original: mahas putrāso asurasya vīrā divo dhartāra urviyā pari khyan ////
analyzed: mahaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ divaḥ dhartāraḥ urviyā pari khyan
translated: The great sons, the heroes of the Asura, the supporters of heaven, should be praised on all sides.

original: uśanti ghā te amṛtāsa etad ekasya cit tyajasaṃ martyasya /
analyzed: uśanti gha te amṛtāsaḥ etat ekasya cit tyajasam martyasya
translated: The immortal ones praise this of thine, O God, the unity of the mortal man who hath left his home.

original: ni te mano manasi dhāyy asme janyuḥ patis tanvam ā viviṣyāḥ ////
analyzed: ni te manaḥ manasi dhāyi asme janyuḥ patiḥ tanvam ā viviṣyāḥ
translated: Let thy mind be fixed in our hearts, O husband, and let the husband enter into the body.

original: na yat purā cakṛmā kad dha nūnam ṛtaṃ vadanto anṛtaṃ rapema /
analyzed: na yat purā cakṛma kad ha nūnam ṛtam vadantaḥ anṛtam rapema
translated: What we have not done before, let us not do now, speaking the truth, let us not utter falsehood.

original: gandharvo apsv apyā ca yoṣā sā nau nābhiḥ paramaṃ jāmi tan nau ////
analyzed: gandharvaḥ apsu apyā ca yoṣā sā nau nābhiḥ paramam jāmi tat nau
translated: The Gandharva is in the waters, and the woman, that is our navel, that is our highest kinship.

original: garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kar devas tvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ /
analyzed: garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kaḥ devaḥ tvaṣṭā savitā viśva rūpaḥ
translated: In the womb our begetter hath made us man and wife, the God Tvashtar, Savitar, of all forms.

original: nakir asya pra minanti vratāni veda nāv asya pṛthivī uta dyauḥ ////
analyzed: nakir asya pra minanti vratāni veda nau asya pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: None violateth his ordinances, the earth and the heaven knoweth his ordinance.

original: ko adya yuṅkte dhuri gā ṛtasya śimīvato bhāmino durhṛṇāyūn /
analyzed: kaḥ adya yuṅkte dhuri gāḥ ṛtasya śimīvataḥ bhāminaḥ durhṛṇāyūn
translated: Who today hath yoked to the pole of truth the two oxen, the strong, the active, the hard to subdue?

original: āsanniṣūn hṛtsvaso mayobhūn ya eṣāṃ bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt ////
analyzed: āsanniṣūn hṛtsvasaḥ mayobhūn yaḥ eṣām bhṛtyām ṛṇadhat sa jīvāt
translated: The two with arrows fixed, with hearts in their breasts, the two that bring bliss, let him who hath received their service live.

original: ko asya veda prathamasyāhnaḥ ka īṃ dadarśa ka iha pra vocat /
analyzed: kaḥ asya veda prathamasya ahnaḥ kaḥ īm dadarśa kaḥ iha pra vocat
translated: Who knoweth this first day? Who hath seen it? Who here hath declared it?

original: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kad u brava āhano vīcyā nṝn ////
analyzed: bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kad u bravaḥ āhano vīcyā nṝn
translated: The lofty abode of Mitra and Varuna, what shall I say to thee? Stir the men with the whip.

original: yamasya mā yamyaṃ kāma āgant samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya /
analyzed: yamasya mā yamyam kāmaḥ āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya
translated: Let not my desire come to the realm of Yama, to lie together in the same womb.

original: jāyeva patye tanvaṃ riricyāṃ vi cid vṛheva rathyeva cakrā ////
analyzed: jāyā iva patye tanvam riricyām vi cit vṛheva rathyā iva cakrā
translated: Let it shrink from me like a wife from her husband, let it fly away like a chariot wheel from the axle.

original: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanty ete devānāṃ spaśa iha ye caranti /
analyzed: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanti ete devānām spaśaḥ iha ye caranti
translated: These, the spies of the gods, who move here, do not stand still nor close their eyes.

original: anyena mad āhano yāhi tūyaṃ tena vi vṛha rathyeva cakrā ////
analyzed: anyena mat āhanaḥ yāhi tūyam tena vi vṛha rathyā iva cakrā
translated: Go to him with another blow, O slayer, drive him away like a chariot wheel.

original: rātrībhir asmā ahabhir daśasyet sūryasya cakṣur muhur un mimīyāt /🔽divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīr yamasya vivṛhād ajāmi ////
analyzed: rātrībhiḥ asmai ahabhiḥ daśasyet sūryasya cakṣuḥ muhur ud mimīyāt  divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasya vivṛhāt ajāmi
translated: Let him be honoured by nights and days, let him often open the eye of the sun.🔽Let the earth and heaven be his wedded pair, his kinsmen, his brother, his sister.

original: ā ghā tā gachān uttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavann ajāmi /
analyzed: ā gha tā gacchān uttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavan ajāmi
translated: Let us go to those higher ages, where the kinsmen have made peace with the kinsman.

original: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhum anyam ichasva subhage patiṃ mat ////
analyzed: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhum anyam ichasva subhage patim mat
translated: Stretch forth thy arms to the bull, O blessed one, seek another husband than me.

original: kiṃ bhrātāsad yad anāthaṃ bhavāti kim u svasā yan nirṛtir nigachāt /
analyzed: kim bhrātā asat yat anātham bhavāti kim u svasā yat nirṛtiḥ nigacchāt
translated: What is a brother to one who is helpless? What is a sister who comes to misfortune?

original: kāmamūtā bahv etad rapāmi tanvā me tanvaṃ saṃ pipṛgdhi ////🔽na te nāthaṃ yamy atrāham asmi na te tanūṃ tanvā sam papṛcyām /
analyzed: kāma mūtā bahu etat rapāmi tanvāḥ me tanvam sam pipṛgdhi  na te nātham yami atra aham asmi na te tanūm tanvā sam papṛcyām
translated: I sing this much, O Kāma, out of many things, embrace me with thy body.🔽I am not thy protector here, I will not embrace thy body with my body.

original: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrātā subhage vaṣṭy etat ////
analyzed: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrātā subhage vaṣṭi etat
translated: Make thyself happy with another than me, O blessed one, thy brother does not desire this.

original: na vā u te tanūṃ tanvā saṃ pipṛcyāṃ pāpam āhur yaḥ svasāraṃ nigachāt /
analyzed: na vai u te tanūm tanvā sam pipṛcyām pāpam āhuḥ yaḥ svasāram nigacchāt
translated: I will not unite thy body with mine, for they call it a sin when a brother goes to his sister.

original: asaṃyad etan manaso hṛdo me bhrātā svasuḥ śayane yac chayīya ////
analyzed: a saṃyat etat manasaḥ hṛdaḥ me bhrātā svasuḥ śayane yat śayīya
translated: This is not the will of my heart or my mind, that I should lie in the bed of my brother's wife.

original: bato batāsi yama naiva te mano hṛdayaṃ cāvidām ā /🔽anyā kila tvāṃ kakṣyeva yuktaṃ pari ṣvajātau libujeva vṛkṣam ////
analyzed: bataḥ bata asi yama na eva te manaḥ hṛdayam ca avidām ā  anyā kila tvām kakṣyā iva yuktam pari svajātau libujā iva vṛkṣam
translated: Thou art a mere boy, O Yama, I have not known thy mind or heart.🔽Another, as it were, hath embraced thee, as a creeper embraces a tree.

original: anyam ū ṣu yamy anya u tvāṃ pari ṣvajātau libujeva vṛkṣam /
analyzed: anyam u su yami anyaḥ u tvām pari svajātau libujā iva vṛkṣam
translated: I will embrace another, as a creeper embraces a tree.

original: tasya vā tvaṃ mana ichā sa vā tavādhā kṛṇuṣva saṃvidaṃ subhadrām ////
analyzed: tasya vā tvam manaḥ icha sa vā tava adhā kṛṇuṣva saṃvidam su bhadrām
translated: Choose thou his mind, and he will choose thine. Make ye a good and happy agreement.

original: trīṇi chandāṃsi kavayo vi yetire pururūpaṃ darśataṃ viśvacakṣaṇam /
analyzed: trīṇi chandāṃsi kavayaḥ vi yetire puru rūpam darśatam viśva cakṣaṇam
translated: The sages have spread out three metres, manifold, beautiful, all-observing.

original: āpo vātā oṣadhayas tāny ekasmin bhuvana ārpitāni ////
analyzed: āpaḥ vātāḥ oṣadhayaḥ tāni ekasmin bhuvane ārpitāni
translated: The waters, the winds, the plants, they are all contained in one world.

original: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvo aditer adābhyaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvaḥ aditeḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The bull hath milked for the bull the milkings of heaven, the young, the unassailable of Aditi.

original: viśvaṃ sa veda varuṇo yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyo yajati yajñiyāṃ ṛtūn ////
analyzed: viśvam sa veda varuṇaḥ yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyaḥ yajati yajñiyān ṛtūn
translated: He knows all by his thought, as Varuna does by his wisdom. He who is meet for sacrifice worships the meet seasons.

original: rapad gandharvīr apyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātu no manaḥ /
analyzed: rapat gandharvīḥ apyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātu naḥ manaḥ
translated: May the Gandharva's wife, and the wives of the men, and the river's voice, protect our mind in the river's sound.

original: iṣṭasya madhye aditir ni dhātu no bhrātā no jyeṣṭhaḥ prathamo vi vocati ////
analyzed: iṣṭasya madhye aditiḥ ni dhātu naḥ bhrātā naḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ prathamaḥ vi vocati
translated: In the midst of the desired, Aditi has placed us. Our eldest brother, the first, shall proclaim to you.

original: so cit nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvaty uṣā uvāsa manave svarvatī /
analyzed: sā u cit nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatī uṣāḥ uvāsa manave svarvatī
translated: That auspicious dawn, rich in food, glorious, and rich in light, has risen for Manu.

original: yad īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agniṃ hotāraṃ vidathāya jījanan ////
analyzed: yat īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agnim hotāram vidathāya jījanan  /
translated: When they have generated the eager Agni, who is eager to follow the will of the eager ones, as the Hotar for the sacrifice.

original: adha tyaṃ drapsaṃ vibhvaṃ vicakṣanaṃ vir ābharad iṣiraḥ śyeno adhvare /🔽yadī viśo vṛṇate dasmam āryā agniṃ hotāram adha dhīr ajāyata ////
analyzed: adha tyam drapsam vibhvam vicakṣanam viḥ ābharat iṣiraḥ śyenaḥ adhvare  yadi viśaḥ vṛṇate dasmam āryāḥ agnim hotāram adha dhīḥ ajāyata
translated: Then the swift hawk has brought forth that all-seeing drop, the swift one, in the sacrifice.🔽When the Aryan people choose the wondrous Agni as the Hotar, then the thought is born.

original: sadāsi raṇvo yavaseva puṣyate hotrābhir agne manuṣaḥ svadhvaraḥ /
analyzed: sadā asi raṇvaḥ yavasā iva puṣyate hotrābhiḥ agne manuṣaḥ su adhvaraḥ
translated: You are always kindly, like a field that is nourished. By the oblations, O Agni, the pious man.

original: viprasya vā yac chaśamāna ukthyo vājaṃ sasavāṃ upayāsi bhūribhiḥ ////🔽ud īraya pitarā jāra ā bhagam iyakṣati haryato hṛtta iṣyati /
analyzed: viprasya vā yat śaśamānaḥ ukthyaḥ vājam sasavān upayāsi bhūribhiḥ  ud īraya pitarā jāraḥ ā bhagam iyakṣati haryataḥ hṛttas iṣyati
translated: Or when you, the praiseworthy one, come with abundant strength to the sacrifice of the sage with many (sacrificial gifts).🔽He impels the parents, the son impels Bhaga. The tawny one desires to go forth in the heart.

original: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhas taviṣyate asuro vepate matī ////
analyzed: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhaḥ taviṣyate asuraḥ vepate matī
translated: The priest speaks, the sacrifice is delighted, the Asura is eager to be great, the thought trembles.

original: yas te agne sumatiṃ marto akhyat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa pra śṛṇve /
analyzed: yaḥ te agne sumatim martaḥ akhyat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa pra śṛṇve
translated: O Agni, the mortal who has declared his good will to you, O son of strength, he shall be heard by you.

original: iṣaṃ dadhāno vahamāno aśvair ā sa dyumāṃ amavān bhūṣati dyūn ////
analyzed: iṣam dadhānaḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ ā sa dyumān amavān bhūṣati dyūn
translated: Bearing food, borne by his horses, he adorns the days, the immortal, the resplendent one.

original: śrudhī no agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā ratham amṛtasya dravitnum /
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣva ratham amṛtasya dravitnum
translated: Listen to us, O Agni, in the seat of the assembly, yoke the chariot of the immortal, the swift one.

original: ā no vaha rodasī devaputre mākir devānām apa bhūr iha syāḥ ////
analyzed: ā naḥ vaha rodasī deva putre mākir devānām apa bhūḥ iha syāḥ
translated: Bring us the two worlds, O son of the gods. Be not thou far from the gods here.

original: yad agna eṣā samitir bhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra /
analyzed: yat agne eṣā samitiḥ bhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra
translated: When this assembly becomes such, O Agni, O god, among the gods who offer sacrifice, O holy one,

original: ratnā ca yad vibhajāsi svadhāvo bhāgaṃ no atra vasumantaṃ vītāt ////
analyzed: ratnā ca yat vibhajāsi svadhāvas bhāgam naḥ atra vasumantam vītāt
translated: And when thou, of thine own nature, distributest the treasures, grant us a share rich in goods.

original: anv agnir uṣasām agram akhyad anv ahāni prathamo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni hath announced the van of the Dawns, Agni, first of all, the days, the all-knower.

original: anu sūrya uṣaso anu raśmīn dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa ////
analyzed: anu sūryaḥ uṣasaḥ anu raśmīn dyāvāpṛthivī ā viveśa
translated: The Sun hath followed the Dawns, the rays, and hath entered the heaven and earth.

original: praty agnir uṣasām agram akhyat praty ahāni prathamo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat prati ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni hath announced the van of the Dawns, Agni, first of all, the days, the all-knower.

original: prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna ////
analyzed: prati sūryasya purudhā ca raśmīn prati dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatāna
translated: The Sun hath followed the rays of the Sun in many ways, and hath stretched out the heaven and earth.

original: dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtenābhiśrāve bhavataḥ satyavācā /
analyzed: dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtena abhiśrāve bhavataḥ satya vācā
translated: The heaven and earth, first by eternal law, are to be worshipped with true speech.

original: devo yan martān yajathāya kṛṇvant sīdad dhotā pratyaṅ svam asuṃ yan ////
analyzed: devaḥ yat martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdat hotā pratyaṅ svam asum yan
translated: When the god, making mortals to sacrifice, sits down as Hotar, to his own abode.

original: devo devān paribhūr ṛtena vahā no havyaṃ prathamaś cikitvān /
analyzed: devaḥ devān paribhūḥ ṛtena vaha naḥ havyam prathamaḥ cikitvān
translated: The God, the overcomer of the Gods, with Law, bear our oblation, first, the wise One.

original: dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīko mandro hotā nityo vācā yajīyān ////
analyzed: dhūma ketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīkaḥ mandraḥ hotā nityaḥ vācā yajīyān  /
translated: The smoke-bannered, kindled, shining, delightful, the eternal Priest, with speech most worthy of lauds.

original: arcāmi vāṃ vardhāyāpo ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutaṃ rodasī me /🔽ahā yad devā asunītim āyan madhvā no atra pitarā śiśītām ////
analyzed: arcāmi vām vardhāya apaḥ ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutam rodasī me  ahā yat devāḥ asunītim āyan madhvā naḥ atra pitarā śiśītām
translated: I worship you, O Waters, rich in ghee, for increase of my wealth: hear, O ye Heaven and Earth, my call.🔽When the Gods came to the birth of Asura, may they, the Parents, make us sweet with mead.

original: svāvṛg devasyāmṛtaṃ yadī gor ato jātāso dhārayanta urvī /
analyzed: svāvṛj devasya amṛtam yadi goḥ atas jātāsaḥ dhārayante urvī
translated: The God's own hymn is the immortal milk of the Cow: from this are born the two wide worlds that hold all life.

original: viśve devā anu tat te yajur gur duhe yad enī divyaṃ ghṛtam vāḥ ////🔽kiṃ svin no rājā jagṛhe kad asyāti vrataṃ cakṛmā ko vi veda /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu tat te yajuḥ guḥ duhe yat enī divyam ghṛtam vār  kim svid naḥ rājā jagṛhe kad asya ati vratam cakṛma kaḥ vi veda
translated: All Gods have followed after that thy Yajus, when the brown Cow yields the heavenly oil and milk.

original: mitras cid dhi ṣmā juhurāṇo devāṃ chloko na yātām api vājo asti ////
analyzed: mitraḥ cit hi sma juhurāṇaḥ devām ślokaḥ na yātām api vājaḥ asti
translated: What hath the King taken from us? What hath our Vrata failed to keep? Who knoweth it? For even Mitra, angry, hath not come to the Gods' assembly. Yet the hymn is there, and strength.

original: durmantv atrāmṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yad viṣurūpā bhavāti /
analyzed: durmantu atra amṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti
translated: The name of the immortal one is hard to find, when he becomes of many forms and varied hue.

original: yamasya yo manavate sumantv agne tam ṛṣva pāhy aprayuchan ////
analyzed: yamasya yaḥ manavate sumantu agne tam ṛṣva pāhi aprayuchan
translated: O Agni, keep thou safe the man who thinks on thee with a good thought, O thou Most High, O thou who ne'er art wasted.

original: yasmin devā vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante
translated: In what assembly the Gods rejoice themselves, and in Vivasvan's seat support themselves,

original: sūrye jyotir adadhur māsy aktūn pari dyotaniṃ carato ajasrā ////
analyzed: sūrye jyotiḥ adadhuḥ māsi aktūn pari dyotanim carataḥ ajasrā
translated: In the sun they have placed the light, in the moon the stars, the two that move around the light unceasingly.

original: yasmin devā manmani saṃcaranty apīcye na vayam asya vidma /
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ manmani saṃcaranti apīcye na vayam asya vidma
translated: In that thought of his which the gods move, in the hidden one, we do not know this one.

original: mitro no atrāditir anāgānt savitā devo varuṇāya vocat ////🔽sakhāya ā śiṣāmahe brahmendrāya vajriṇe /
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ atra aditiḥ anāgān savitā devaḥ varuṇāya vocat  sakhāyaḥ ā śiṣāmahe brahma indrāya vajriṇe
translated: May Mitra, Aditi, and Savitar the god, speak to you for our welfare here, O Varuna.🔽We, O friends, will obey the prayer to Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: stuṣa ū ṣu nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave ////
analyzed: stuṣe u su nṛtamāya dhṛṣṇave
translated: We will praise him, the most truthful, the daring one.

original: śavasā hy asi śruto vṛtrahatyena vṛtrahā /
analyzed: śavasā hi asi śrutaḥ vṛtra hatyena vṛtrahā
translated: For by strength you are renowned, O slayer of Vrtra, by the slaying of Vrtra.

original: maghair maghono ati śūra dāśasi ////
analyzed: maghaiḥ maghonaḥ ati śūra dāśasi
translated: O hero, you surpass the generous ones with your generosity.

original: stego na kṣām aty eṣi pṛthivīṃ mahī no vātā iha vāntu bhūmau /
analyzed: stegaḥ na kṣām ati eṣi pṛthivīm mahī naḥ vātāḥ iha vāntu bhūmau
translated: You move over the earth, over the great earth, like a bull. Let the winds blow here on the earth for us.

original: mitro no atra varuṇo yujamāno agnir vane na vy asṛṣṭa śokam ////
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ atra varuṇaḥ yujamānaḥ agniḥ vane na vi asṛṣṭa śokam
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, and Agni, yoked here, not release their sorrow in the forest for us.

original: stuhi śrutaṃ gartasadaṃ janānāṃ rājānaṃ bhīmam upahatnum ugram /
analyzed: stuhi śrutam garta sadam janānām rājānam bhīmam upahatnum ugram
translated: Praise the renowned one, who sits in the pit of the people, the terrible king, the fierce one who strikes down.

original: mṛḍā jaritre rudra stavāno anyam asmat te ni vapantu senyam ////
analyzed: mṛḍā jaritre rudra stavānaḥ anyam asmat te ni vapantu senyam  /
translated: Be gracious to the singer, O Rudra, when praised, let his army fall upon another than us.

original: sarasvatīṃ devayanto havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne /
analyzed: sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne
translated: The pious invoke Sarasvati, Sarasvati when the sacrifice is being performed.

original: sarasvatīṃ sukṛto havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryaṃ dāt ////
analyzed: sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt
translated: The virtuous invoke Sarasvatī. May Sarasvatī grant the worshipper a good gift.

original: sarasvatīṃ pitaro havante dakṣinā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarasvatīm pitaraḥ havante dakṣinā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: The fathers invoke Sarasvatī, desiring to win the sacrifice with the sacrificial fee.

original: āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvā iṣa ā dhehy asme ////
analyzed: āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme
translated: Having sat down on this sacred grass, rejoice. Bring us food free from disease.

original: sarasvati yā sarathaṃ yayāthokthaiḥ svadhābhir devi pitṛbhir madantī /
analyzed: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha ukthaiḥ svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī
translated: O Sarasvatī, you who go with the chariot by the hymns, O goddess, rejoicing with the fathers by the oblations,

original: sahasrārgham iḍo atra bhāgaṃ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamānāya dhehi ////
analyzed: sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi
translated: give here the share of the sacrifice worth a thousand, and bestow the increase of wealth on the sacrificer.

original: ud īratām avara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ /🔽asuṃ ya īyur avṛkā ṛtajñās te no 'vantu pitaro haveṣu ////
analyzed: ud īratām avare ud parāsaḥ ud madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ  asum ye īyuḥ avṛkāḥ ṛta jñāḥ te naḥ vantu pitaraḥ haveṣu
translated: Let the lower, the higher, and the middle fathers, who are worthy of Soma, rise up.🔽Those who have gone to the world of the righteous, who are free from enmity, who know the truth, may those fathers protect us in our invocations.

original: āhaṃ pitṝnt suvidatrāṃ avitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ ca viṣṇoḥ /
analyzed: ā aham pitṝn suvidatrān avitsi napātam ca vikramaṇam ca viṣṇoḥ
translated: I have found the very bountiful fathers, the son and the stride of Viṣṇu.

original: barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvas ta ihāgamiṣṭhāḥ ////
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvaḥ te iha āgamiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Those who sit on the sacrificial grass, who enjoy the oblation according to their nature, they are the most worthy to come here.

original: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astv adya ye pūrvāso ye aparāsa īyuḥ /
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ astu adya ye pūrvāsaḥ ye aparāsaḥ īyuḥ
translated: Let there be this homage to the fathers today, to those who have gone before and those who have gone after,

original: ye pārthive rajasy ā niṣaktā ye vā nūnaṃ suvṛjanāsu dikṣu ////
analyzed: ye pārthive rajasi ā niṣaktāḥ ye vā nūnam su vṛjanāsu dikṣu
translated: to those who are settled on the earthly realm, or those who are now in the well-ordered quarters.

original: mātalī kavyair yamo aṅgirobhir bṛhaspatir ṛkvabhir vāvṛdhānaḥ /
analyzed: mātalī kavyaiḥ yamaḥ aṅgirobhiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: Yama with the Kavyas, Angiras, Brihaspati with the Rik-sages, grown strong,

original: yāṃś ca devā vāvṛdhur ye ca devāṃs te no 'vantu pitaro haveṣu ////
analyzed: yān ca devāḥ vāvṛdhuḥ ye ca devān te naḥ vantu pitaraḥ haveṣu
translated: May they, the gods whom the gods have strengthened, may they, the Fathers, help us in our invocations.

original: svāduṣ kilāyaṃ madhumāṃ utāyaṃ tīvraḥ kilāyaṃ rasavāṃ utāyam /
analyzed: svāduḥ kila ayam madhumān uta ayam tīvraḥ kila ayam rasavān uta ayam
translated: Sweet, indeed, is this, and full of honey; strong, indeed, is this, and full of juice.

original: uto nv asya papivāṃsam indraṃ na kaś cana sahata āhaveṣu ////
analyzed: uta u nu asya papivāṃsam indram na kaḥ cana sahate āhaveṣu
translated: And none at all can overcome Indra, who has drunk of this, in battles.

original: pareyivāṃsaṃ pravato mahīr iti bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśānam /
analyzed: pareyivāṃsam pravataḥ mahīḥ iti bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśānam
translated: Looking along the path to many a place, to the far-stretching, mighty ones,

original: vaivasvataṃ saṃgamanaṃ janānāṃ yamaṃ rājānaṃ haviṣā saparyata ////🔽yamo no gātuṃ prathamo viveda naiṣā gavyūtir apabhartavā u /
analyzed: vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā saparyata  yamaḥ naḥ gātum prathamaḥ viveda na eṣā gavyūtiḥ apabhartavai u
translated: Worship with oblation King Yama, Vaivasvata, the gathering-place of men.🔽Yama first discovered the way for us; he has not turned away this path of ours.

original: yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretā enā jajñānāḥ pathyā anu svāḥ //// 🔽barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūty arvāg imā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam /
analyzed: yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ enā jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ  / barhiṣadaḥ pitaraḥ ūtī arvāk imā vaḥ havyā cakṛma juṣadhvam
translated: Where our fathers of old have gone, those who knew the paths, the true ones, born before us.🔽O Fathers, seated on the sacred grass, come hitherward; accept these offerings of ours.

original: ta ā gatāvasā śaṃtamenādhā naḥ śaṃ yor arapo dadhāta ////
analyzed: te ā gata avasā śaṃtamena adha naḥ śam yos arapaḥ dadhāta
translated: Come to us with the most auspicious favour; bestow upon us blameless happiness.

original: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyedaṃ no havir abhi gṛṇantu viśve /
analyzed: ācya jānu dakṣiṇatas niṣadya idam naḥ haviḥ abhi gṛṇantu viśve
translated: Sitting on the right side, bending their knees, may all the Fathers accept this our oblation.

original: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma ////
analyzed: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cit naḥ yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma
translated: Do not injure us, O Fathers, for any sin that we have committed against you, O men.

original: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ kṛṇoti tenedaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ sam eti /
analyzed: tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatum kṛṇoti tena idam viśvam bhuvanam sam eti
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ makes a way for his daughter to carry, by which this whole world comes together.

original: yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā maho jāyā vivasvato nanāśa ////
analyzed: yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā mahaḥ jāyā vivasvataḥ nanāśa
translated: Yama's mother, being carried around, the great wife of Vivasvat, perished.

original: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūryāṇair yenā te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ /
analyzed: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ yena te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ
translated: Go, go by the ancient paths, by which your former fathers have gone.

original: ubhā rājānau svadhayā madantau yamaṃ paśyāsi varuṇaṃ ca devam ////
analyzed: ubhā rājānau svadhayā madantau yamam paśyāsi varuṇam ca devam
translated: You will see Yama and the god Varuṇa, the two kings rejoicing in their own nature.

original: apeta vīta vi ca sarpatāto 'smā etaṃ pitaro lokam akran /
analyzed: apeta vīta vi ca sarpata atas sma etam pitaraḥ lokam akran
translated: Depart, go away, and move about from here. The Fathers have made this world for him.

original: ahobhir adbhir aktubhir vyaktaṃ yamo dadāty avasānam asmai ////
analyzed: ahobhiḥ adbhiḥ aktubhiḥ vyaktam yamaḥ dadāti avasānam asmai
translated: Dispersed by the days, the waters, and the rays, Yama gives him a resting place.

original: uśantas tvedhīmahy uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi /🔽uśann uśata ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave ////
analyzed: uśantaḥ tvā idhīmahi uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi  uśan uśataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave
translated: We desire you, O shining one, we kindle you, O shining one.🔽O shining one, bring the shining Fathers to eat the oblation.

original: dyumantas tvedhīmahi dyumantaḥ sam idhīmahi /
analyzed: dyumantaḥ tvā idhīmahi dyumantaḥ sam idhīmahi
translated: We kindle you, O glorious one, we kindle you, O glorious one.

original: dyumān dyumata ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave ////
analyzed: dyumān dyumataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave
translated: O glorious one, bring the glorious Fathers to eat the oblation.

original: aṅgiraso naḥ pitaro navagvā atharvāṇo bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ /
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ naḥ pitaraḥ navagvāḥ atharvāṇaḥ bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ
translated: Our Fathers are the Aṅgiras, the Navagvas, the Atharvāṇas, the Bhṛgus, the Soma-drinkers.

original: teṣāṃ vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma ////
analyzed: teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: May we be in the favour and good will of those who are to be worshipped at sacrifices.

original: aṅgirobhir yajñiyair ā gahīha yama vairūpair iha mādayasva /
analyzed: aṅgirobhiḥ yajñiyaiḥ ā gahi iha yama vairūpaiḥ iha mādayasva
translated: O Yama, be pleased here with the Angiras who are to be worshipped at sacrifices, and with the Vaivasvata priests.

original: vivasvantaṃ huve yaḥ pitā te 'smin barhiṣy ā niṣadya ////
analyzed: vivasvantam huve yaḥ pitā te smin barhiṣi ā niṣadya
translated: I invoke Vivasvan, your father, sitting on this sacred grass.

original: imaṃ yama prastaram ā hi rohāṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ /
analyzed: imam yama prastaram ā hi roha aṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ
translated: O Yama, ascend this sacred grass, in agreement with the Angiras and the fathers.

original: ā tvā mantrāḥ kaviśastā vahantv enā rājan haviṣo mādayasva ////
analyzed: ā tvā mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ vahantu enā rājan haviṣaḥ mādayasva
translated: Let the hymns recited by the sages carry you, O king, enjoy this oblation.

original: ita eta udāruhan divas pṛṣṭhānv āruhan /
analyzed: itas ete udāruhan divaḥ pṛṣṭhā anu āruhan
translated: From here they have risen up, they have ascended the back of the sky.

original: pra bhūrjayo yathā pathā dyām aṅgiraso yayuḥ ////
analyzed: pra bhūrjayaḥ yathā pathā dyām aṅgirasaḥ yayuḥ
translated: Like the Angiras, they have gone to the sky by the path of the spreading grass.

original: yamāya somaḥ pavate yamāya kriyate haviḥ /
analyzed: yamāya somaḥ pavate yamāya kriyate haviḥ
translated: Soma is purified for Yama, oblation is prepared for Yama.

original: yamaṃ ha yajño gachaty agnidūto araṃkṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: yamam ha yajñaḥ gacchati agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ
translated: The sacrifice goes to Yama, announced by the messenger Agni.

original: yamāya madhumattamaṃ juhotā pra ca tiṣṭhata /
analyzed: yamāya madhumattamam juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata
translated: To Yama, offer the sweetest honey, and stand up.

original: idaṃ nama ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ ////
analyzed: idam namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrva jebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ
translated: This homage to the Rishis, the elders, the first-born, the creators of the paths.

original: yamāya ghṛtavat payo rājñe havir juhotana /
analyzed: yamāya ghṛtavat payaḥ rājñe haviḥ juhotana
translated: Offer oblation of ghee and milk to Yama, the king.

original: sa no jīveṣv ā yamed dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase ////
analyzed: sa naḥ jīveṣu ā yamet dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase
translated: May he lead us to life, to long life, to prosperity.

original: mainam agne vi daho mābhi śūśuco māsya tvacaṃ cikṣipo mā śarīram /🔽śṛtaṃ yadā karasi jātavedo 'them enaṃ pra hiṇutāt pitṝṃr upa ////
analyzed: mā enam agne vi dahaḥ mā abhi śūśucaḥ mā asya tvacam cikṣipaḥ mā śarīram  śṛtam yadā karasi jātavedaḥ thā īm enam pra hiṇutāt pitṝn upa
translated: Do not burn him, O Agni, do not scorch him, do not tear his skin, do not his body.🔽When thou hast made him ready, O all-knower, then send him forth to the Fathers.

original: yadā śṛtaṃ kṛṇavo jātavedo 'themam enaṃ pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ /
analyzed: yadā śṛtam kṛṇavaḥ jātavedaḥ thā imam enam pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: When thou hast made him ready, O all-knower, then give him to the Fathers.

original: yado gachāty asunītim etām atha devānāṃ vaśanīr bhavāti ////
analyzed: yadā u gacchāti asunītim etām atha devānām vaśanīḥ bhavāti
translated: When he goes to this unhappy state, then he becomes subject to the gods.

original: trikadrukebhiḥ pavate ṣaḍ urvīr ekam id bṛhat /
analyzed: trikadrukebhiḥ pavate ṣaḍ urvīḥ ekam id bṛhat
translated: He purifies himself with the three Kṛikatus, the six vast expanses, and the one great one.

original: triṣṭub gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yama ārpitā ////
analyzed: triṣṭubh gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yame ārpitā
translated: The Tristubh, the Gāyatrī, all the metres are offered to Yama.

original: sūryaṃ cakṣuṣā gacha vātam ātmanā divaṃ ca gacha pṛthivīṃ ca dharmabhiḥ /
analyzed: sūryam cakṣuṣā gacha vātam ātmanā divam ca gacha pṛthivīm ca dharmabhiḥ
translated: Go with thy eye to the sun, with thy breath to the wind, and with thy laws to heaven and earth.

original: apo vā gacha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭhā śarīraiḥ ////
analyzed: apaḥ vā gacha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ
translated: Or go to the waters, if there is thy place. Rest in the plants with thy bodies.

original: ajo bhāgas tapasas taṃ tapasva taṃ te śocis tapatu taṃ te arciḥ /
analyzed: ajaḥ bhāgaḥ tapasaḥ tam tapasva tam te śociḥ tapatu tam te arciḥ
translated: The goat is a share of penance; do thou perform that penance. Let thy flame burn that, let thy fire burn that.

original: yās te śivās tanvo jātavedas tābhir vahainaṃ sukṛtām u lokam ////
analyzed: yāḥ te śivāḥ tanvaḥ jātavedaḥ tābhiḥ vaha enam su kṛtām u lokam
translated: O all-knower, with those auspicious bodies of thine, carry him to the world of the virtuous.

original: yās te śocayo raṃhayo jātavedo yābhir āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam /
analyzed: yāḥ te śocayaḥ raṃhayaḥ jātavedaḥ yābhiḥ āpṛṇāsi divam antarikṣam
translated: Those flames and swift movements of thine, O all-knower, with which thou fillest the heaven and the atmosphere,

original: ajaṃ yantam anu tāḥ sam ṛṇvatām athetarābhiḥ śivatamābhiḥ śṛtaṃ kṛdhi ////🔽ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyo yas ta āhutaś carati svadhāvān /
analyzed: ajam yantam anu tāḥ sam ṛṇvatām atha itarābhiḥ śivatamābhiḥ śṛtam kṛdhi  ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyaḥ yaḥ te āhutaḥ carati svadhāvān
translated: Let them be harnessed to the unborn one who goes along. Then with the other most auspicious (waters) make it ready.🔽Let loose again, O Agni, for the Fathers, he who, being offered, moves along with his own nature.

original: āyur vasāna upa yātu śeṣaḥ saṃ gachatāṃ tanvā suvarcāḥ ////
analyzed: āyuḥ vasānaḥ upa yātu śeṣaḥ sam gacchatām tanvā su varcāḥ
translated: Let him come back with life, let him join with his body the world of good action.

original: ati drava śvānau sārameyau caturakṣau śabalau sādhunā pathā /
analyzed: ati drava śvānau sārameyau catur akṣau śabalau sādhunā pathā
translated: Pass over the two dogs, the house-dogs, the two spotted ones with four eyes, by the good path.

original: adhā pitṝnt suvidatrāṃ apīhi yamena ye sadhamādaṃ madanti ////
analyzed: adhā pitṝn suvidatrām apīhi yamena ye sadhamādam madanti
translated: Now go to the very bountiful Fathers, with Yama, who rejoice in the same feast.

original: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau caturakṣau pathiṣadī nṛcakṣasā /
analyzed: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau catur akṣau pathiṣadī nṛ cakṣasā
translated: The two dogs, O Yama, who are your guardians, the two spotted ones with four eyes, who look on men,

original: tābhyāṃ rājan pari dhehy enaṃ svasty asmā anamīvaṃ ca dhehi ////
analyzed: tābhyām rājan pari dhehi enam svasti asmai anamīvam ca dhehi
translated: With them, O king, surround this (man). Bestow on him welfare and freedom from disease.

original: urūṇasāv asutṛpāv udumbalau yamasya dūtau carato janāṃ anu /
analyzed: uru nasau asu tṛpau udumbalau yamasya dūtau carataḥ janān anu
translated: The two with broad hips, the two insatiable, the two Udumbara trees, Yama's messengers, move along among the people.

original: tāv asmabhyaṃ dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adyeha bhadram ////
analyzed: tau asmabhyam dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adyā iha bhadram
translated: May they give us again today for our sight the life-giving (waters), and good fortune.

original: soma ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtam eka upāsate /
analyzed: somaḥ ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtam eke upāsate
translated: To some the Soma flows, to some they worship with ghee.

original: yebhyo madhu pradhāvati tāṃś cid evāpi gachatāt ////
analyzed: yebhyaḥ madhu pradhāvati tān cit eva api gachatāt
translated: To those to whom the honey flows, go even to them.

original: ye cit pūrva ṛtasātā ṛtajātā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: ye cit pūrve ṛta sātāḥ ṛta jātāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Those who are righteous, born of truth, and strengtheners of truth,

original: ṛṣīn tapasvato yama tapojāṃ api gachatāt ////
analyzed: ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jām api gacchatāt
translated: Go to those sages who are austere, O Yama, to those who are born of austerity.

original: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyās tapasā ye svar yayuḥ /
analyzed: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāḥ tapasā ye svar yayuḥ
translated: Those who are unassailable through austerity, those who have gone to heaven through austerity,

original: tapo ye cakrire mahas tāṃś cid evāpi gachatāt ////
analyzed: tapaḥ ye cakrire mahaḥ tān cit eva api gacchatāt
translated: Those who have performed great austerities, go to them alone.

original: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāso ye svar tanūtyajaḥ /
analyzed: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāsaḥ ye svar tanūtyajaḥ
translated: Those heroes who fight in battles, those who give up their bodies for heaven,

original: ye vā sahasradakṣiṇās tāṃ cid evāpi gachatāt ////
analyzed: ye vā sahasra dakṣiṇāḥ tām cit eva api gacchatāt
translated: Those who give a thousand as a sacrificial fee, go to them alone.

original: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayo ye gopāyanti sūryam /
analyzed: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayaḥ ye gopāyanti sūryam
translated: The wise ones who protect the sun with a thousand ways of knowing,

original: ṛṣīn tapasvato yama tapojāṃ api gachatāt ////
analyzed: ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jām api gacchatāt
translated: Go to those sages who are austere, O Yama, to those who are born of austerity.

original: syonāsmai bhava pṛthivy anṛkṣarā niveśanī /
analyzed: syonā asmai bhava pṛthivi anṛkṣarā niveśanī
translated: Be soft and free from thorns for him, O earth, to dwell upon.

original: yachāsmai śarma saprathāḥ ////
analyzed: yaccha asmai śarma saprathāḥ
translated: Grant him wide protection.

original: asaṃbādhe pṛthivyā urau loke ni dhīyasva /
analyzed: asaṃbādhe pṛthivyāḥ urau loke ni dhīyasva
translated: Be laid in the spacious abode of the unobstructed earth.

original: svadhā yāś cakṛṣe jīvan tās te santu madhuścutaḥ ////
analyzed: svadhāḥ yāḥ cakṛṣe jīvan tāḥ te santu madhuścutaḥ
translated: May the oblations you have offered while alive be for you a stream of honey.

original: hvayāmi te manasā mana ihemān gṛhām upa jujuṣāṇa ehi /
analyzed: hvayāmi te manasā manaḥ iha imān gṛhān upa jujuṣāṇaḥ ehi
translated: With my mind I invite your mind here. Come to these homes, accepting them.

original: saṃ gachasva pitṛbhiḥ saṃ yamena syonās tvā vātā upa vāntu śagmāḥ ////
analyzed: sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena syonāḥ tvā vātāḥ upa vāntu śagmāḥ
translated: Associate with the fathers, with Yama. May the gentle and strong winds blow upon you.

original: ut tvā vahantu maruta udavāhā udaprutaḥ /
analyzed: ud tvā vahantu marutaḥ uda vāhāḥ uda prutaḥ
translated: May the Maruts, the upward-haulers, the upward-speeders, carry you upward.

original: ajena kṛṇvantaḥ śītaṃ varṣeṇokṣantu bāl iti ////🔽ud ahvam āyur āyuṣe kratve dakṣāya jīvase /
analyzed: ajena kṛṇvantaḥ śītam varṣeṇa ukṣantu bāl iti  ud ahvam āyuḥ āyuṣe kratve dakṣāya jīvase
translated: With the goat they make the cold, with the rain they sprinkle the young one.🔽You have raised up life for life, for wisdom, for strength, for living.

original: svān gachatu te mano adhā pitṝṃr upa drava ////
analyzed: svān gacchatu te manaḥ adhā pitṝn upa drava
translated: Let your mind go to your own, then run to the fathers.

original: mā te mano māsor māṅgānāṃ mā rasasya te /
analyzed: mā te manaḥ mā asoḥ mā aṅgānām mā rasasya te
translated: Let not your mind be lost, let not your limbs be lost, let not your sap be lost.

original: mā te hāsta tanvaḥ kiṃ caneha ////
analyzed: mā te ha āsta tanvaḥ kim cana iha
translated: Let none of your body be lost here.

original: mā tvā vṛkṣaḥ saṃ bādhiṣṭa mā devī pṛthivī mahī /
analyzed: mā tvā vṛkṣaḥ sam bādhiṣṭa mā devī pṛthivī mahī
translated: Let not the tree oppress you, let not the great goddess Earth.

original: lokaṃ pitṛṣu vittvaidhasva yamarājasu ////
analyzed: lokam pitṛṣu vittvā edhasva yama rājasu
translated: Having found a place among the fathers, shine among the kings of Yama.

original: yat te aṅgam atihitaṃ parācair apānaḥ prāṇo ya u vā te paretaḥ /
analyzed: yat te aṅgam atihitam parācais apānaḥ prāṇaḥ yaḥ u vā te paretaḥ
translated: Whatever limb of yours is out of place, your outgoing breath, your incoming breath, or whatever has departed from you,

original: tat te saṃgatya pitaraḥ sanīḍā ghāsād ghāsaṃ punar ā veśayantu ////
analyzed: tat te saṃgatya pitaraḥ sanīḍāḥ ghāsāt ghāsam punar ā veśayantu
translated: May the fathers, having come together in one place, restore it to you from fodder to fodder.

original: apemaṃ jīvā arudhan gṛhebhyas taṃ nir vahata pari grāmād itaḥ /
analyzed: apa imam jīvāḥ arudhan gṛhebhyaḥ tam niḥ vahata pari grāmāt itas
translated: We have bound this one to the house, carry him out from the village here.

original: mṛtyur yamasyāsīd dūtaḥ pracetā asūn pitṛbhyo gamayāṃ cakāra ////
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ yamasya āsīt dūtaḥ pracetāḥ asūn pitṛbhyaḥ gamayām cakāra
translated: Death was Yama's wise messenger, he led the souls to the fathers.

original: ye dasyavaḥ pitṛṣu praviṣṭā jñātimukhā ahutādaś caranti /
analyzed: ye dasyavaḥ pitṛṣu praviṣṭāḥ jñāti mukhāḥ ahuta adaḥ caranti
translated: Those who as robbers have entered the fathers, who move about with kinsmen as their faces, who eat what is not offered,

original: parāpuro nipuro ye bharanty agniṣ ṭān asmāt pra dhamāti yajñāt ////
analyzed: parāpuraḥ nipuraḥ ye bharanti agniḥ tān asmāt pra dhamāti yajñāt
translated: Who carry the other-city and the city, Agni blows them away from this sacrifice.

original: saṃ viśantv iha pitaraḥ svā naḥ syonaṃ kṛṇvantaḥ pratiranta āyuḥ /
analyzed: sam viśantu iha pitaraḥ svāḥ naḥ syonam kṛṇvantaḥ pratirantaḥ āyuḥ
translated: Let the Fathers enter here, making us their own, granting us pleasant abode and prolonging our life.

original: tebhyaḥ śakema haviṣā nakṣamāṇā jyog jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ śakema haviṣā nakṣamāṇāḥ jyok jīvantaḥ śaradaḥ purūcīḥ
translated: May we, worshipping them with oblations, be able to live many autumns, living long.

original: yāṃ te dhenuṃ nipṛṇāmi yam u kṣīra odanam /
analyzed: yām te dhenum nipṛṇāmi yam u kṣīre odanam
translated: The cow which I offer to thee, the milk-rice cake,

original: tenā janasyāso bhartā yo 'trāsad ajīvanaḥ ////
analyzed: tena janasya asaḥ bhartā yaḥ trāsat a jīvanaḥ
translated: By that may he be the supporter of the people, he who is dead here, who is no more alive.

original: aśvāvatīṃ pra tara yā suśevā rkṣākaṃ vā prataraṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: aśvāvatīm pra tara yā su śevā rkṣākam vā prataram navīyaḥ
translated: Go over the one with horses, the one with good gifts, the new ford to the Rkṣa people.

original: yas tvā jaghāna vadhyaḥ so astu mā so anyad vidata bhāgadheyam ////🔽yamaḥ paro 'varo vivasvān tataḥ paraṃ nāti paśyāmi kiṃ cana /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā jaghāna vadhyaḥ saḥ astu mā saḥ anyat vidata bhāgadheyam  yamaḥ paraḥ varaḥ vivasvān tatas param na ati paśyāmi kim cana
translated: He who has slain thee, let him be slain. Let him not obtain any other share.🔽Yama is above, below Vivasvat; beyond that I see nothing at all.

original: yame adhvaro adhi me niviṣṭo bhuvo vivasvān anvātatāna ////
analyzed: yame adhvaraḥ adhi me niviṣṭaḥ bhuvaḥ vivasvān anvātatāna
translated: The sacrifice is established upon Yama; Vivasvat has extended it in the world.

original: apāgūhann amṛtāṃ martyebhyaḥ kṛtvā savarṇām adadhur vivasvate /
analyzed: apāgūhan amṛtām martyebhyaḥ kṛtvā savarṇām adadhuḥ vivasvate
translated: They have hidden the immortal one from mortals; having made the Savarṇā, they have placed it with Vivasvat.

original: utāśvināv abharad yat tad āsīd ajahād u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ ////
analyzed: uta aśvinau abharat yat tat āsīt ajahāt u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ
translated: And the two Aśvins have taken what was there; Saranyū has left two pairs.

original: ye nikhātā ye paroptā ye dagdhā ye coddhitāḥ /
analyzed: ye nikhātāḥ ye paroptāḥ ye dagdhāḥ ye ca uddhitāḥ
translated: Those that are buried, those that are planted, those that are burned, and those that are raised up,

original: sarvāṃs tān agna ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave ////
analyzed: sarvān tān agne ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave
translated: Bring all of them, O Agni, the Fathers, to eat the oblation.

original: ye agnidagdhā ye anagnidagdhā madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante /
analyzed: ye agni dagdhāḥ ye an agni dagdhāḥ madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante
translated: Those who are burnt by fire, those who are not burnt by fire, who rejoice in their own nature in the midst of heaven,

original: tvaṃ tān vettha yadi te jātavedaḥ svadhayā yajñaṃ svadhitiṃ juṣantām ////
analyzed: tvam tān vettha yadi te jātavedaḥ svadhayā yajñam svadhitim juṣantām
translated: If you know them, O all-knowing one, may they enjoy the sacrifice and the sacrificial offering with their own nature.

original: śaṃ tapa māti tapo agne mā tanvaṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: śam tapa mā ati tapaḥ agne mā tanvam tapaḥ
translated: Do not burn too much, O Agni, do not burn my body too much.

original: vaṇeṣu śuṣmo astu te pṛthivyām astu yad dharaḥ ////
analyzed: vaṇeṣu śuṣmaḥ astu te pṛthivyām astu yat haraḥ
translated: Let there be heat in your flames, let there be cold on the earth.

original: dadāmy asmā avasānam etad ya eṣa āgan mama ced abhūd iha /
analyzed: dadāmi asmai avasānam etat yaḥ eṣaḥ āgan mama ca id abhūt iha
translated: I give him this resting place, if he has become mine here.

original: yamaś cikitvān praty etad āha mamaiṣa rāya upa tiṣṭhatām iha ////🔽imāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /🔽śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: yamaḥ cikitvān prati etat āha mama eṣa rāyaḥ upa tiṣṭhatām iha  imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai  śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: Yama, the wise one, says this to him: Let this wealth of mine attend on him here.🔽We measure this span, so that it may not be exceeded for a hundred autumns before us.

original: premāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /🔽śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: pra imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai  śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: We measure this span of love, so that it may not be exceeded for a hundred autumns before us.🔽We measure this span of separation, so that it may not be exceeded for a hundred autumns before us.

original: apemāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /🔽śate śaratsu no purā //// 🔽vīmāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /🔽śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: apa imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai  śate śaratsu na u purā  vi imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai  śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: We measure this span of enmity, so that it may not be exceeded for a hundred autumns before us.🔽We measure this span of peace, so that it may not be exceeded for a hundred autumns before us.

original: nir imāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /
analyzed: niḥ imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai
translated: We measure this span of rest, so that it may not be exceeded for a hundred autumns before us.

original: śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: For a hundred autumns, before that.

original: ud imāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /
analyzed: ud imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai
translated: We measure out this span of life, so that we may not die before the end of it.

original: śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: For a hundred autumns, before that.

original: sam imāṃ mātrāṃ mimīmahe yathāparaṃ na māsātai /
analyzed: sam imām mātrām mimīmahe yathā aparam na māsātai
translated: We measure out this span of life, so that we may not die before the end of it.

original: śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: For a hundred autumns, before that.

original: amāsi mātrāṃ svar agām āyuṣmān bhūyāsam /
analyzed: amāsi mātrām svar agām āyuṣmān bhūyāsam
translated: In the month I have gone to the measure of heaven, may I live long.

original: yathāparaṃ na māsātai śate śaratsu no purā ////
analyzed: yathā aparam na māsātai śate śaratsu na u purā
translated: So that we may not die before the end of it, for a hundred autumns, before that.

original: prāṇo apāno vyāna āyuś cakṣur dṛśaye sūryāya /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ apānaḥ vyānaḥ āyuḥ cakṣuḥ dṛśaye sūryāya
translated: In-breath, out-breath, through-breath, life, sight for seeing the sun,

original: aparipareṇa pathā yamarājñaḥ pitṝn gacha ////
analyzed: aparipareṇa pathā yama rājñaḥ pitṝn gacha
translated: Go by the path that goes not astray to the Fathers of Yama, the king.

original: ye agravaḥ śaśamānāḥ pareyur hitvā dveṣāṃsy anapatyavantaḥ /
analyzed: ye agravaḥ śaśamānāḥ pareyuḥ hitvā dveṣāṃsi anapatyavantaḥ
translated: Those who, being the first, have gone away, leaving behind enmities, childless,

original: te dyām udityāvidanta lokaṃ nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi dīdhyānāḥ ////
analyzed: te dyām uditya avidanta lokam nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi dīdhyānāḥ
translated: Having gone up to heaven, they have found the world, shining on the back of the vault.

original: udanvatī dyaur avamā pīlumatīti madhyamā /
analyzed: udanvatī dyauḥ avamā pīlumatī iti madhyamā
translated: The lowest heaven is full of water, the middle one full of pilu trees,

original: tṛtīyā ha pradyaur iti yasyāṃ pitara āsate ////
analyzed: tṛtīyā ha pradyauḥ iti yasyām pitaraḥ āsate
translated: The third is the heaven where the Fathers dwell.

original: ye na pituḥ pitaro ye pitāmahā ya āviviśur urv antarikṣam /
analyzed: ye na pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ ye āviviśuḥ uru antarikṣam
translated: Those who are the Fathers of the Father, the Grandfathers, who have entered the broad atmosphere,

original: ya ākṣiyanti pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ tebhyaḥ pitṛbhyo namasā vidhema ////
analyzed: ye ākṣiyanti pṛthivīm uta dyām tebhyaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ namasā vidhema
translated: Who look on the earth and the sky, to those Fathers let us pay homage with reverence.

original: idam id vā u nāparaṃ divi paśyasi sūryam /
analyzed: idam id vai u na aparam divi paśyasi sūryam
translated: For this, and no other, sun do I behold in the sky.

original: mātā putraṃ yathā sicābhy enaṃ bhūma ūrṇuhi ////
analyzed: mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi
translated: As a mother her son, so the earth cover him with her mantle.

original: idam id vā u nāparaṃ jarasy anyad ito 'param /
analyzed: idam id vai u na aparam jarasi anyat itas param
translated: For this, and no other, is there beyond old age, or anything else beyond this.

original: jāyā patim iva vāsasābhy enaṃ bhūma ūrṇuhi ////
analyzed: jāyā patim iva vāsasā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi
translated: As a wife her husband, so the earth cover him with her mantle.

original: abhi tvorṇomi pṛthivyā mātur vastreṇa bhadrayā /
analyzed: abhi tvā ūrṇomi pṛthivyāḥ mātuḥ vastreṇa bhadrayā
translated: I cover thee with the mantle of the mother earth, with the auspicious one.

original: jīveṣu bhadraṃ tan mayi svadhā pitṛṣu sā tvayi ////
analyzed: jīveṣu bhadram tat mayi svadhā pitṛṣu sā tvayi
translated: May the good be in me among the living, the Svâhâ in the fathers, that is in thee.

original: agnīṣomā pathikṛtā syonaṃ devebhyo ratnaṃ dadhathur vi lokam /
analyzed: agnīṣomā pathikṛtā syonam devebhyaḥ ratnam dadhathuḥ vi lokam
translated: O Agni and Soma, makers of paths, ye have placed the auspicious treasure for the gods, in the world of the living.

original: upa preṣyantaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ yo vahāty añjoyānaiḥ pathibhis tatra gachatam ////🔽pūṣā tvetaś cyāvayatu pra vidvān anaṣṭapaśur bhuvanasya gopāḥ /
analyzed: upa preṣyantam pūṣaṇam yaḥ vahāti añjoyānaiḥ pathibhiḥ tatra gachatam  pūṣā tvā itas cyāvayatu pra vidvān a naṣṭa paśuḥ bhuvanasya gopāḥ
translated: Go ye to him who sends you, whom Pûshan, the swift-moving one, carries along the paths.🔽May Pûshan, the wise one, send thee forth from here, the guardian of the world, whose cattle are not lost.

original: sa tvaitebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyo 'gnir devebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: sa tvā etebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyaḥ gniḥ devebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ
translated: May he deliver thee to these fathers, Agni to the gods, to the very bountiful ones.

original: āyur viśvāyuḥ pari pātu tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt /
analyzed: āyuḥ viśvāyuḥ pari pātu tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt
translated: May life, the life of all, protect thee. May Pûshan protect thee on the path in front.

original: yatrāsate sukṛto yatra ta īyus tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu ////
analyzed: yatra āsate su kṛtaḥ yatra te īyuḥ tatra tvā devaḥ savitā dadhātu
translated: Where the well-doers dwell, where they have gone, there may the god Savitar place thee.

original: imau yunajmi te vahnī asunītāya voḍhave /
analyzed: imau yunajmi te vahnī asunītāya voḍhave
translated: I yoke these two fires of thine, the well-kindled, the bearer.

original: tābhyāṃ yamasya sādanaṃ samitiś cāva gachatāt ////
analyzed: tābhyām yamasya sādanam samitiḥ ca ava gacchatāt
translated: By them go thou to Yama's abode and to the assembly.

original: etat tvā vāsaḥ prathamaṃ nv āgann apaitad ūha yad ihābibhaḥ purā /
analyzed: etat tvā vāsaḥ prathamam nu āgan apa etat ūha yat iha abibhaḥ purā
translated: This garment first came to thee: take thou this which thou hast worn here before.

original: iṣṭāpūrtam anusaṃkrāma vidvān yatra te dattaṃ bahudhā vibandhuṣu ////
analyzed: iṣṭāpūrtam anusaṃkrāma vidvān yatra te dattam bahudhā vibandhuṣu
translated: Knowing, pass on to the fulfilment of thy wishes, where much has been given to thee by thy kinsmen.

original: agner varma pari gobhir vyayasva saṃ prorṇuṣva medasā pīvasā ca /
analyzed: agneḥ varma pari gobhiḥ vyayasva sam pra ūrṇuṣva medasā pīvasā ca
translated: Put on the armour of Agni, made of the cow's hide; rub it on with fat and marrow.

original: net tvā dhṛṣṇur harasā jarhṛṣāṇo dadhṛg vidhakṣan parīṅkhayātai ////
analyzed: na id tvā dhṛṣṇuḥ harasā jarhṛṣāṇaḥ dadhṛṣ vidhakṣan pari īṅkhayātai
translated: Let not the bold one, burning with heat, the burning one, overcome thee.

original: daṇḍaṃ hastād ādadāno gatāsoḥ saha śrotreṇa varcasā balena /
analyzed: daṇḍam hastāt ādadānaḥ gatāsoḥ saha śrotreṇa varcasā balena
translated: Taking the staff from the hand of the dying man, with his hearing, his glory, his strength,

original: atraiva tvam iha vayaṃ suvīrā viśvā mṛdho abhimātīr jayema ////
analyzed: atra eva tvam iha vayam su vīrāḥ viśvāḥ mṛdhaḥ abhimātīḥ jayema
translated: Here do thou remain: we, with brave sons, may we conquer all enemies and hostilities.

original: dhanur hastād ādadāno mṛtasya saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena /🔽samāgṛbhāya vasu bhūri puṣṭam arvāṅ tvam ehy upa jīvalokam ////
analyzed: dhanuḥ hastāt ādadānaḥ mṛtasya saha kṣatreṇa varcasā balena  samāgṛbhāya vasu bhūri puṣṭam arvāṅ tvam ehi upa jīva lokam
translated: Taking the bow from the hand of the dead man, with his nobility, his glory, his strength,🔽Take thou much wealth and abundance: come hither to the world of the living.

original: iyaṃ nārī patilokaṃ vṛṇānā ni padyata upa tvā martya pretam /
analyzed: iyam nārī pati lokam vṛṇānā ni padyate upa tvā martya pretam
translated: This woman, choosing the world of her husband, lies down to thee, O mortal, who art going.

original: dharmaṃ purāṇam anupālayantī tasyai prajāṃ draviṇaṃ ceha dhehi ////
analyzed: dharmam purāṇam anupālayantī tasyai prajām draviṇam ca iha dhehi
translated: Obeying the ancient law, bestow upon him offspring and wealth here.

original: ud īrṣva nāry abhi jīvalokaṃ gatāsum etam upa śeṣa ehi /
analyzed: ud īrṣva nāri abhi jīva lokam gatāsum etam upa śeṣe ehi
translated: Rise up, O woman, to the world of the living. Come to this one who has departed, to his portion.

original: hastagrābhasya dadhiṣos tavedaṃ patyur janitvam abhi saṃ babhūtha ////
analyzed: hastagrābhasya dadhiṣoḥ tava idam patyuḥ janitvam abhi sam babhūtha
translated: You have come to the fatherhood of this husband, the one who holds your hand and gives you curd.

original: apaśyaṃ yuvatiṃ nīyamānāṃ jīvāṃ mṛtebhyaḥ pariṇīyamānām /
analyzed: apaśyam yuvatim nīyamānām jīvām mṛtebhyaḥ pariṇīyamānām
translated: I saw a young woman being led away, a living one being led away from the dead.

original: andhena yat tamasā prāvṛtāsīt prākto apācīm anayaṃ tad enām ////
analyzed: andhena yat tamasā prāvṛtā āsīt prāktas apācīm anayam tat enām
translated: When she was covered with blind darkness, she went from the east to the west, that is her fault.

original: prajānaty aghnye jīvalokaṃ devānāṃ panthām anusaṃcarantī /
analyzed: prajānatī aghnye jīva lokam devānām panthām anusaṃcarantī
translated: O cow, knowing the world of the living, following the path of the gods,

original: ayaṃ te gopatis taṃ juṣasva svargaṃ lokam adhi rohayainam ////
analyzed: ayam te gopatiḥ tam juṣasva svargam lokam adhi rohaya enam
translated: this is your master of cattle. Accept him. Raise him up to the heavenly world.

original: upa dyām upa vetasam avattaro nadīnām /🔽agne pittam apām asi ////
analyzed: upa dyām upa vetasam avattaraḥ nadīnām  agne pittam apām asi
translated: To the sky, to the reed, to the confluence of the rivers,🔽O Agni, you are the bile of the waters.

original: yaṃ tvam agne samadahas tam u nir vāpaya punaḥ /
analyzed: yam tvam agne samadahaḥ tam u niḥ vāpaya punar
translated: O Agni, whatever you have burned, restore that again.

original: kyāmbūr atra rohatu śāṇḍadūrvā vyalkaśā ////
analyzed: kyāmbūḥ atra rohatu śāṇḍadūrvā vyalkaśā
translated: Let the Kyaṃbū tree grow here, the Śāṇḍadūrvā grass, and the Vyalka plant.

original: idaṃ ta ekam pura ū ta ekaṃ tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃ viśasva /
analyzed: idam te ekam puras u te ekam tṛtīyena jyotiṣā sam viśasva
translated: This is your one abode, this is your second. Unite with the third light.

original: saṃveśane tanvā cārur edhi priyo devānāṃ parame sadhasthe ////
analyzed: saṃveśane tanvā cāruḥ edhi priyaḥ devānām parame sadhasthe
translated: Be thou, O beautiful one, with thy body, in the bed, in the highest abode of the gods, dear to the gods.

original: ut tiṣṭha prehi pra dravaukaḥ kṛṇuṣva salile sadhasthe /
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha prehi pra dravaukaḥ kṛṇuṣva salile sadhasthe
translated: Rise up, go forward, run, make a home for thyself in the water, in the place of assembly.

original: tatra tvaṃ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ saṃ somena madasva saṃ svadhābhiḥ ////
analyzed: tatra tvam pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ sam somena madasva sam svadhābhiḥ
translated: There, in agreement with the fathers, rejoice in the Soma, in the oblations.

original: pra cyavasva tanvaṃ saṃ bharasva mā te gātrā vi hāyi mo śarīram /
analyzed: pra cyavasva tanvam sam bharasva mā te gātrā vi hāyi mā u śarīram
translated: Rise up, collect thy body, let none of thy limbs be lost, let none of thy members be lost.

original: mano niviṣṭam anusaṃviśasva yatra bhūmer juṣase tatra gacha ////
analyzed: manaḥ niviṣṭam anusaṃviśasva yatra bhūmeḥ juṣase tatra gacha
translated: Let thy mind enter into the body, go whithersoever thou choosest of the earth.

original: varcasā māṃ pitaraḥ somyāso añjantu devā madhunā ghṛtena /
analyzed: varcasā mām pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ añjantu devāḥ madhunā ghṛtena
translated: Let the fathers who are worthy of Soma anoint me with splendour, the gods with honey and ghee.

original: cakṣuṣe mā prataraṃ tārayanto jarase mā jaradaṣṭiṃ vardhantu //// 🔽varcasā māṃ sam anaktv agnir medhāṃ me viṣṇur ny anaktv āsan /
analyzed: cakṣuṣe mā prataram tārayantaḥ jarase mā jaradaṣṭim vardhantu  varcasā mām sam anaktu agniḥ medhām me viṣṇuḥ ni anaktu āsan
translated: Delivering me to the eye, let them increase my life to old age, let them increase my sight to old age.

original: rayiṃ me viśve ni yachantu devāḥ syonā māpaḥ pavanaiḥ punantu ////🔽mitrāvaruṇā pari mām adhātām ādityā mā svaravo vardhayantu /
analyzed: rayim me viśve ni yacchantu devāḥ syonāḥ mā apaḥ pavanaiḥ punantu  mitrāvaruṇā pari mām adhātām ādityāḥ mā svaravaḥ vardhayantu
translated: Let Agni anoint me with splendour, let Visnu anoint me with wisdom, let the All-gods bestow wealth on me. Let the kindly waters purify me with the winds.🔽May Mitra and Varuna place me, may the Adityas, the pressing-stones, exalt me.

original: varco ma indro ny anaktu hastayor jaradaṣṭiṃ mā savitā kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: varcaḥ me indraḥ ni anaktu hastayoḥ jaradaṣṭim mā savitā kṛṇotu
translated: Let Indra anoint me with splendour in my hands, let Savitar make my life to last to old age.

original: yo mamāra prathamo martyānāṃ yaḥ preyāya prathamo lokam etam /
analyzed: yaḥ mamāra prathamaḥ martyānām yaḥ preyāya prathamaḥ lokam etam
translated: He who first died of mortal men, he who first went to this world,

original: vaivasvataṃ saṃgamanaṃ janānāṃ yamaṃ rājānaṃ haviṣā saparyata ////
analyzed: vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā saparyata
translated: To Yama, the son of Vivasvat, the gathering place of people, the king, serve with oblations.

original: parā yāta pitara ā ca yātāyaṃ vo yajño madhunā samaktaḥ /
analyzed: parā yāta pitaraḥ ā ca yāta ayam vaḥ yajñaḥ madhunā samaktaḥ
translated: Go away, O Fathers, and come back again. This sacrifice of yours is anointed with honey.

original: datto asmabhyaṃ draviṇeha bhadraṃ rayiṃ ca naḥ sarvavīraṃ dadhāta ////
analyzed: dattaḥ asmabhyam draviṇā iha bhadram rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram dadhāta
translated: Give us wealth here, O Bhava, and grant us prosperity with all heroes.

original: kaṇvaḥ kakṣīvān purumīḍho agastyaḥ śyāvāśvaḥ sobhary arcanānāḥ /
analyzed: kaṇvaḥ kakṣīvān purumīḍhaḥ agastyaḥ śyāvāśvaḥ sobhari arcanānāḥ
translated: Kanva, Kakshivan, Purumīḍha, Agastya, Shyāvāshva, Sobhari, Archanānas,

original: viśvāmitro 'yaṃ jamadagnir atrir avantu naḥ kaśyapo vāmadevaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ yam jamadagniḥ atriḥ avantu naḥ kaśyapaḥ vāmadevaḥ
translated: May this Viśvāmitra, Jamadagni, Atri, Vāmadeva, and Kaśyapa protect us.

original: viśvāmitra jamadagne vasiṣṭha bharadvāja gotama vāmadeva /
analyzed: viśvāmitra jamadagne vasiṣṭha bharadvāja gotama vāmadeva
translated: Viśvāmitra, Jamadagni, Vasiṣṭha, Bharadvāja, Gautama, Vāmadeva,

original: śardir no atrir agrabhīn namobhiḥ susaṃśāsaḥ pitaro mṛḍatā naḥ ////
analyzed: śardiḥ naḥ atriḥ agrabhīt namobhiḥ su saṃśāsaḥ pitaraḥ mṛḍata naḥ
translated: May Atri, the lord, have seized us here with salutations. May the well-instructed ancestors favor us.

original: kasye mṛjānā ati yanti ripram āyur dadhānāḥ prataraṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: kasye mṛjānāḥ ati yanti ripram āyuḥ dadhānāḥ prataram navīyaḥ
translated: Whose do they belong to, the ones who go beyond the sin, bestowing life, a newer crossing?

original: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanenādha syāma surabhayo gṛheṣu ////
analyzed: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena adha syāma surabhayaḥ gṛheṣu
translated: May we be prosperous with offspring and wealth, and may we be fragrant in our homes.

original: añjate vy añjate sam añjate kratuṃ rihanti madhunābhy añjate /
analyzed: añjate vi añjate sam añjate kratum rihanti madhunā abhi añjate
translated: They anoint, they anoint apart, they anoint together. They kiss the sacrificial essence, they anoint with honey.

original: sindhor ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇaṃ hiraṇyapāvāḥ paśum āsu gṛhnate ////
analyzed: sindhoḥ ucchvāse patayantam ukṣaṇam hiraṇya pāvāḥ paśum āsu gṛhnate
translated: The golden-coloured ones seize the bull, the son of Sindhu, falling in the breath of Sindhu.

original: yad vo mudraṃ pitaraḥ somyaṃ ca teno sacadhvaṃ svayaśaso hi bhūta /
analyzed: yat vaḥ mudram pitaraḥ somyam ca tena u sacadhvam sva yaśasaḥ hi bhūta
translated: O Fathers, whatever is your delightful and Soma-like drink, be united with that, for you are self-luminous.

original: te arvāṇaḥ kavaya ā śṛṇota suvidatrā vidathe huyamānāḥ ////
analyzed: te arvāṇaḥ kavayaḥ ā śṛṇota suvidatrāḥ vidathe huyamānāḥ
translated: O wise ones, listen to us, who are coming hither, who are well-disposed, being invoked in the assembly.

original: ye atrayo aṅgiraso navagvā iṣṭāvanto rātiṣāco dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: ye atrayaḥ aṅgirasaḥ navagvāḥ iṣṭāvantaḥ rātiṣācaḥ dadhānāḥ
translated: Those who are Atri, Angiras, Navagva, who are worshipped, who are givers of gifts, who are bestowers of gifts,

original: dakṣiṇāvantaḥ sukṛto ya u sthāsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam ////
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvantaḥ su kṛtaḥ ye u sthāsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
translated: who are well-doing, who are established, may they rejoice on this sacred grass.

original: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso agna ṛtam āśaśānāḥ /
analyzed: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāsaḥ agne ṛtam āśaśānāḥ
translated: Now, as our ancient Fathers, O Agni, longing for the truth,

original: śucīd ayan dīdhyata ukthaśasaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran ////
analyzed: śucī id ayan dīdhyataḥ uktha śasaḥ kṣāmā bhindantaḥ aruṇīḥ apa vran
translated: have gone pure, intent on the praise of the hymn, breaking the red (cloud), have sent down rain.

original: sukarmānaḥ suruco devayanto ayo na devā janimā dhamantaḥ /
analyzed: su karmānaḥ su rucaḥ devayantaḥ ayaḥ na devāḥ janimā dhamantaḥ
translated: The well-working, well-shining, God-adoring ones, the Gods, blowing on the birth of iron,

original: śucanto agniṃ vāvṛdhanta indram urvīm gavyāṃ pariṣadaṃ no akran ////🔽ā yūtheva kṣumati paśvo akhyad devānāṃ janimānty ugraḥ /
analyzed: śucantaḥ agnim vāvṛdhantaḥ indram urvīm gavyām pariṣadam naḥ akran  ā yūthā iva kṣumati paśvaḥ akhyat devānām janimānti ugraḥ
translated: shining on Agni, exalting Indra, have made for us a wide assembly of cattle.🔽He has shone forth like a herd in the wide-spreading (sky), the mighty one, to the generations of the Gods.

original: martāsaś cid urvaśīr akṛpran vṛdhe cid arya uparasyāyoḥ ////
analyzed: martāsaḥ cit urvaśīḥ akṛpran vṛdhe cit aryaḥ uparasya āyoḥ
translated: Even mortal men have spread out the wide expanses, for the increase of the noble one, of the iron one.

original: akarma te svapaso abhūma ṛtam avasrann uṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: akarma te su apasaḥ abhūma ṛtam avasran uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: We have become your own, O you who are not to be worked for; the truth has slipped away, the shining dawns.

original: viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ ////
analyzed: viśvam tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: All that is good which the gods favour, that may we speak in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: indro mā marutvān prācyā diśaḥ pātu bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: indraḥ mā marutvān prācyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: May Indra with the Maruts protect me from the eastern direction, with arms outstretched, like the earth above the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the creators of worlds and makers of paths, the gods who have a share in the oblations here.

original: dhātā mā nirṛtyā dakṣiṇāyā diśaḥ pātu bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyāṃ ivopari /
analyzed: dhātā mā nirṛtyāḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: May Dhatr with Nirṛti protect me from the southern direction, with arms outstretched, like the earth above the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the creators of worlds and makers of paths, the gods who have a share in the oblations here.

original: aditir mādityaiḥ pratīcyā diśaḥ pātu bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: aditiḥ mā ādityaiḥ pratīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: May Aditi with the Ādityas protect me from the western direction, with arms outstretched, like the earth above the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the creators of worlds and makers of paths, the gods who have a share in the oblations here.

original: somo mā viśvair devair udīcyā diśaḥ pātu bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: somaḥ mā viśvaiḥ devaiḥ udīcyāḥ diśaḥ pātu bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: May Soma with all the gods protect me from the northern direction, with arms outstretched, like the earth above the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the creators of worlds and makers of paths, the gods who have a share in the oblations here.

original: dhartā ha tvā dharuṇo dhārayātā ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ savitā dyām ivopari /
analyzed: dhartā ha tvā dharuṇaḥ dhārayātai ūrdhvam bhānum savitā dyām iva upari
translated: The supporter shall support thee, the prop, bearing thy light upwards, like Savitar bearing the sky above.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are sharers of the oblation here of the gods.

original: prācyāṃ tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: prācyām tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: In the eastern quarter, enclosed by the ancient one, I place thee in the oblation, fallen from the arm, the earth above like the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are sharers of the oblation here of the gods.

original: dakṣiṇāyāṃ tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: dakṣiṇāyām tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: In the southern quarter, enclosed by the ancient one, I place thee in the oblation, fallen from the arm, the earth above like the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are sharers of the oblation here of the gods.

original: pratīcyāṃ tvā diśi purā saṃvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: pratīcyām tvā diśi purā saṃvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: In the western quarter, enclosed by the ancient one, I place thee in the oblation, fallen from the arm, the earth above like the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are sharers of the oblation here of the gods.

original: udīcyāṃ tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: udīcyām tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: In the northern quarter, enclosed by the ancient one, I place thee in the oblation, fallen from the arm, the earth above like the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship those who have made the worlds, who have made the paths, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods who are here.

original: dhruvāyāṃ tvā diśi purā saṃvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: dhruvāyām tvā diśi purā saṃvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: In the firm direction, formerly enclosed, I place you in the oblation, fallen from the arms, the earth above like the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
