analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship those who have made the worlds, who have made the paths, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods who are here.

original: ūrdhvāyāṃ tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhucyutā pṛthivī dyām ivopari /
analyzed: ūrdhvāyām tvā diśi purā samvṛtaḥ svadhāyām ā dadhāmi bāhu cyutā pṛthivī dyām iva upari
translated: In the upward direction, formerly enclosed, I place you in the oblation, fallen from the arms, the earth above like the sky.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////🔽dhartāsi dharuno 'si vaṃsago 'si ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha  dhartā asi dharunaḥ si vaṃsagaḥ si
translated: We worship those who have made the worlds, who have made the paths, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods who are here.🔽You are the supporter, you are the upholder, you are the one who goes to the ridge.

original: udapūr asi madhupūr asi vātapūr asi ////
analyzed: uda pūḥ asi madhu pūḥ asi vāta pūḥ asi
translated: You are the one who is filled with water, you are the one who is filled with honey, you are the one who is filled with wind.

original: itaś ca māmutaś cāvatāṃ yame iva yatamāne yad aitam /
analyzed: itas ca mā amutas ca avatām yame iva yatamāne yat aitam
translated: From here and from there may they protect me, as if striving to Yamarāja, when I go to him.

original: pra vāṃ bharan mānuṣā devayanto ā sīdatāṃ svam u lokaṃ vidāne ////
analyzed: pra vām bharan mānuṣāḥ devayantaḥ ā sīdatām svam u lokam vidāne
translated: May human beings who delight in the gods carry you forward. Sit in your own world, which I have prepared.

original: svāsasthe bhavatam indave no yuje vāṃ brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhiḥ /
analyzed: svāsasthe bhavatam indave naḥ yuje vām brahma pūrvyam namobhiḥ
translated: Be easy to dwell with for our Soma, I yoke you two with ancient prayers and salutations.

original: vi śloka eti pathyeva sūriḥ śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtāsa etat ////
analyzed: vi ślokaḥ eti pathyā iva sūriḥ śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtāsaḥ etat
translated: The hymn goes forth like a charioteer on the path. May all the immortal ones listen to this.

original: trīṇi padāni rupo anv arohac catuṣpadīm anv etad vratena /
analyzed: trīṇi padāni rupaḥ anu arohat catuṣpadīm anu etat vratena
translated: He ascended three steps of the form, and this with the vow of the four-footed.

original: akṣareṇa prati mimīte arkam ṛtasya nābhāv abhi saṃ punāti ////
analyzed: akṣareṇa prati mimīte arkam ṛtasya nābhau abhi sam punāti
translated: With the syllable he measures the praise, and in the abode of truth he purifies it.

original: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyuṃ prajāyai kim amṛtaṃ nāvṛṇīta /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyum prajāyai kim amṛtam na avṛṇīta
translated: For the gods he chose death, for offspring he chose immortality.

original: bṛhaspatir yajñam atanuta ṛṣiḥ priyāṃ yamas tanvam ā rireca ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ yajñam atanuta ṛṣiḥ priyām yamaḥ tanvam ā rireca
translated: The sage Brihaspati fashioned the sacrifice, Yama extended his dear body.

original: tvam agna īḍito jātavedo 'vāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvā /
analyzed: tvam agne īḍitaḥ jātavedaḥ vār havyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvā
translated: You, O Agni, invoked, O all-knower, having made the offerings fragrant,

original: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣann addhi tvaṃ deva prayatā havīṃṣi ////
analyzed: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi
translated: have given to the fathers, they have eaten with their own oblation. Eat, O god, the offered oblations.

original: āsīnāso aruṇīnām upasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya /
analyzed: āsīnāsaḥ aruṇīnām upasthe rayim dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: Seated on the lap of the red ones, bestow wealth on the mortal who offers.

original: putrebhyaḥ pitaras tasya vasvaḥ pra yachata ta ihorjaṃ dadhāta ////
analyzed: putrebhyaḥ pitaraḥ tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata te iha ūrjam dadhāta
translated: To the sons, O fathers, grant that wealth of yours, and here bestow strength upon us.

original: agniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha gachata sadaḥsadaḥ sadata supraṇītayaḥ /
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ pitaraḥ ā iha gacchata sadaḥ sadaḥ sadata su praṇītayaḥ
translated: O fathers, whose oblations are in the fire, come hither, well-guided, sit on every seat.

original: atto havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣi rayiṃ ca naḥ sarvavīraṃ dadhāta ////
analyzed: attaḥ havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣi rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram dadhāta
translated: Eat the offered oblations on the sacred grass, and bestow upon us wealth with all heroes.

original: upahūtā naḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu /
analyzed: upahūtāḥ naḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu
translated: The fathers who are worthy of Soma are invited to the dear abodes on the sacred grass.

original: ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantv adhi bruvantu te 'vantv asmān ////
analyzed: te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu adhi bruvantu te vantu asmān
translated: May they come hither, may they listen here, may they speak to us, may they favour us.

original: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaro ye pitāmahā anūjahire somapīthaṃ vasiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ anūjahire soma pītham vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Our fathers' fathers, our grandfathers, who have gone to the drinking of Soma, the most excellent ones,

original: tebhir yamaḥ samrarāṇo havīṃṣy uśann uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ yamaḥ samrarāṇaḥ havīṃṣi uśan uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu
translated: With them may Yama, rejoicing, eat the oblations, the eager one with the eager ones, according to his desire.

original: ye tātṛṣur devatrā jehamānā hotrāvidaḥ stomataṣṭāso arkaiḥ /
analyzed: ye tātṛṣuḥ devatrā jehamānāḥ hotrā vidaḥ stoma taṣṭāsaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: Those who are thirsty, striving for the gods, the finders of the sacrificial call, the shapers of hymns with praises,

original: āgne yāhi sahasraṃ devavandaiḥ satyaiḥ kavibhir ṛṣibhir gharmasadbhiḥ ////
analyzed: ā agne yāhi sahasram deva vandaiḥ satyaiḥ kavibhiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ
translated: O Agni, come with a thousand divine worshippers, the true ones, the sages, the seers, the sitters in the heat.

original: ye satyāso havirado haviṣpā indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ tureṇa /
analyzed: ye satyāsaḥ haviḥ adaḥ haviṣpāḥ indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham tureṇa
translated: Those who are true, who eat the oblation, who are worthy of the oblation, with Indra, the swift one, in the chariot,

original: āgne yāhi suvidatrebhir arvāṅ paraiḥ pūrvair ṛṣibhir gharmasadbhiḥ ////
analyzed: ā agne yāhi suvidatrebhiḥ arvāṅ paraiḥ pūrvaiḥ ṛṣibhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ
translated: O Agni, come with the very generous ones, with the later ones, with the former ones, the seers, the sitters in the heat.

original: upa sarpa mātaraṃ bhūmim etām uruvyacasaṃ pṛthivīṃ suśevām /🔽ūrṇamradāḥ pṛthivī dakṣiṇāvata eṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt ////
analyzed: upa sarpa mātaram bhūmim etām uru vyacasam pṛthivīm su śevām  ūrṇamradāḥ pṛthivī dakṣiṇāvataḥ eṣā tvā pātu prapathe purastāt
translated: Approach this mother earth, this wide-ruling, very gracious earth.🔽The earth that gives wool, that turns to the right, may she protect you on the path in front.

original: uc chvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ sūpāyanāsmai bhava sūpasarpaṇā /
analyzed: ud śvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ su upāyanā asmai bhava su upasarpaṇā
translated: Stretch upwards, O earth, do not press down on us. Be easy of access for him, easy to move on.

original: mātā putraṃ yathā sicābhy enaṃ bhūma ūrṇuhi ////
analyzed: mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi
translated: As a mother her son, so the earth cover him.

original: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasraṃ mita upa hi śrayantām /
analyzed: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasram mite upa hi śrayantām
translated: May the earth, swelling, stand firm, and may a thousand layers be laid down upon it.

original: te gṛhāso ghṛtaścutaḥ syonā viśvāhāsmai śaraṇāḥ santv atra ////
analyzed: te gṛhāsaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ syonāḥ viśvāhā asmai śaraṇāḥ santu atra
translated: May those houses, dropping ghee, be pleasant to him, and may they be his shelter here for all time.

original: ut te stabhnāmi pṛthivīṃ tvat parīmaṃ logaṃ nidadhan mo aham riṣam /
analyzed: ud te stabhnāmi pṛthivīm tvat pari imam logam nidadhan mā u aham riṣam
translated: I raise thee up, O earth, I lay this layer down upon thee; let me not injure thee.

original: etāṃ sthūṇāṃ pitaro dhārayanti te tatra yamaḥ sādanā te kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: etām sthūṇām pitaraḥ dhārayanti te tatra yamaḥ sādanā te kṛṇotu
translated: The fathers hold up this prop; may Yama there make a seat for thee.

original: imam agne camasaṃ mā vi jihvaraḥ priyo devānām uta somyānām /
analyzed: imam agne camasam mā vi jihvaraḥ priyaḥ devānām uta somyānām
translated: Do not, O Agni, burn this ladle, dear to the gods and to the drinkers of Soma.

original: ayaṃ yaś camaso devapānas tasmin devā amṛtā mādayantām ////
analyzed: ayam yaḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ tasmin devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām
translated: In this ladle, which is the gods' drink, may the immortal gods rejoice.

original: atharvā pūrṇam camasam yam indrāyābibhar vājinīvate /
analyzed: atharvā pūrṇam camasam yam indrāya abibhar vājinīvate
translated: The full ladle which Atharvan held for Indra, the bearer of strength,

original: tasmin kṛṇoti sukṛtasya bhakṣaṃ tasmin induḥ pavate viśvadānim ////
analyzed: tasmin kṛṇoti su kṛtasya bhakṣam tasmin induḥ pavate viśva dānim
translated: In that he makes the enjoyment of good deeds; in that the moon purifies all things.

original: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakuna ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpa uta vā śvāpadaḥ /
analyzed: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpaḥ uta vā śvāpadaḥ
translated: Whatever the black bird has scratched, or the ant, the snake, or the beast of prey,

original: agniṣ ṭad viśvād agadaṃ kṛṇotu somaś ca yo brāhmaṇāṃ āviveśa ////
analyzed: agniḥ tat viśvāt agadam kṛṇotu somaḥ ca yaḥ brāhmaṇān āviveśa
translated: May Agni, the all-consumer, make that harmless, and Soma, which has entered the Brahmans.

original: payasvatīr oṣadhayaḥ payasvan māmakaṃ payaḥ /
analyzed: payasvatīḥ oṣadhayaḥ payasvat māmakam payaḥ
translated: Let the plants be full of milk, let my milk be full of milk.

original: apāṃ payaso yat payas tena mā saha śumbhatu ////🔽imā nārīr avidhavāḥ supatnīr āñjanena sarpiṣā saṃ spṛśantām /
analyzed: apām payasaḥ yat payaḥ tena mā saha śumbhatu  imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā sam spṛśantām
translated: With the milk of the milk of the waters, let that make me prosperous.🔽Let these women, not widows, good wives, touch each other with ointment and ghee.

original: anaśravo anamīvāḥ suratnā ā rohantu janayo yonim agre ////
analyzed: anaśravaḥ anamīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre
translated: Without tears, without sickness, with good treasures, let the mothers ascend the birthplace first.

original: saṃ gachasva pitṛbhiḥ saṃ yameneṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman /
analyzed: sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena iṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman
translated: Go together with the fathers, with Yama, with the fulfilled sacrifice, in the highest heaven.

original: hitvāvadyaṃ punar astam ehi saṃ gachatāṃ tanvā suvarcāḥ ////
analyzed: hitvā avadyam punar astam ehi sam gacchatām tanvā su varcāḥ
translated: Having left the sin, return to the abode. May you go together with the body, with good radiance.

original: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaro ye pitāmahā ya āviviśur urv antarikṣam /
analyzed: ye naḥ pituḥ pitaraḥ ye pitāmahāḥ ye āviviśuḥ uru antarikṣam
translated: Our fathers' fathers, our grandfathers, who have entered the wide atmosphere,

original: tebhyaḥ svarād asunītir no adya vathāvaśaṃ tanvaḥ kalpayāti ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ svarāt asunītiḥ naḥ adya vathāvaśam tanvaḥ kalpayāti
translated: For them, from the sky, the good conduct today arranges our bodies according to our desire.

original: śaṃ te nīhāro bhavatu śaṃ te pruṣvāva śīyatām /
analyzed: śam te nīhāraḥ bhavatu śam te śīyatām
translated: May the dew be auspicious for you, may the drizzle be auspicious for you.

original: śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati /🔽maṇḍūky apsu śaṃ bhuva imaṃ sv agniṃ śamaya ////
analyzed: śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati  maṇḍūki apsu śam bhuvaḥ imam su agnim śamaya
translated: In the cold, in the very cold, in the pleasant, in the very pleasant.🔽The frog in the water is auspicious. Pacify this fire.

original: vivasvān no abhayaṃ kṛṇotu yaḥ sutrāmā jīradānuḥ sudānuḥ /
analyzed: vivasvān naḥ abhayam kṛṇotu yaḥ sutrāmā jīra dānuḥ sudānuḥ
translated: May Vivasvat make us fearless, he who is the good protector, the giver of wealth, the bountiful one.

original: iheme vīrā bahavo bhavantu gomad aśvavan mayy astu puṣṭam ////
analyzed: iha ime vīrāḥ bahavaḥ bhavantu gomat aśvavat mayi astu puṣṭam
translated: Let many heroes be here, with cattle and horses. Let prosperity be in me.

original: vivasvān no amṛtatve dadhātu paraitu mṛtyur amṛtaṃ na aitu /
analyzed: vivasvān naḥ amṛta tve dadhātu paraitu mṛtyuḥ amṛtam naḥ aitu
translated: May Vivasvan place us in immortality. Let death depart. Let the immortal come.

original: imān rakṣatu puruṣān ā jarimṇo mo sv eṣām asavo yamaṃ guḥ ////
analyzed: imān rakṣatu puruṣān ā jarimṇaḥ mā u su eṣām asavaḥ yamam guḥ
translated: May he protect these men from old age. Let not their life go to Yama.

original: yo dadhre antarikṣe na mahnā pitṝṇāṃ kaviḥ pramatir matīnām /
analyzed: yaḥ dadhre antarikṣe na mahnā pitṝṇām kaviḥ pramatiḥ matīnām
translated: The sage of the Pitrs, the wise one, the measurer of thoughts, who has taken up his abode in the great firmament,

original: tam arcata viśvamitrā havirbhiḥ sa no yamaḥ prataraṃ jīvase dhāt ////
analyzed: tam arcata viśva mitrāḥ havirbhiḥ sa naḥ yamaḥ prataram jīvase dhāt
translated: Him, all ye friends, worship with oblations. May that Yama provide us a ford to life.

original: ā rohata divam uttamām ṛṣayo mā bibhītana /
analyzed: ā rohata divam uttamām ṛṣayaḥ mā bibhītana
translated: Ascend to the highest heaven, O Rsis, fear not.

original: somapāḥ somapāyina idaṃ vaḥ kriyate havir aganma jvotir uttamam ////🔽pra ketunā bṛhatā bhāty agnir ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti /
analyzed: soma pāḥ soma pāyinaḥ idam vaḥ kriyate haviḥ aganma jvotiḥ uttamam  pra ketunā bṛhatā bhāti agniḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: Ye drinkers of Soma, ye who drink Soma, this oblation is made for you. We have come to the highest light.🔽Agni shines with his great light, the bull roars to the two world-halves.

original: divaś cid antād upamām ud ānaḍ apām upasthe mahiṣo vavardha ////
analyzed: divaḥ cit antāt upamām ud ānaṭ apām upasthe mahiṣaḥ vavardha
translated: From the end of the sky he has brought up the model. The great one has grown in the lap of the waters.

original: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantaṃ hrdā venanto abhyacakṣata tvā /
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantam hrdā venantaḥ abhyacakṣata tvā
translated: When they saw thee with their heart, the eagle flying up to the sky,

original: hiraṇyapakṣaṃ varuṇasya dūtaṃ yamasya yonau śakunaṃ bhuranyum ////
analyzed: hiraṇya pakṣam varuṇasya dūtam yamasya yonau śakunam bhuranyum
translated: The golden-winged messenger of Varuna, the swift bird in the womb of Yama.

original: indra kratuṃ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā /
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā
translated: O Indra, bring us power as a father to his sons.

original: śikṣā ṇo asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotir aśīmahi ////
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi
translated: Instruct us in this work, O thou who art invoked by many. May we live and attain to light.

original: apūpāpihitān kumbhān yāṃs te devā adhārayan /
analyzed: apūpa apihitān kumbhān yān te devāḥ adhārayan
translated: The pots that the gods have placed for thee, covered with cakes,

original: te te santu svadhāvanto madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ ////
analyzed: te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ
translated: May they be for thee, O thou of true nature, rich in honey, dropping ghee.

original: yās te dhānā anukirāmi tilamiśrā svadhāvatīḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ
translated: The grains mixed with sesamum seeds that I scatter for thee, O thou of true nature,

original: tās te santu vibhvīḥ prabhvīs tās te yamo rājānu manyatām ////
analyzed: tāḥ te santu vibhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām
translated: May they be for thee, abundant, powerful. May Yama, the king, approve of them for thee.

original: punar dehi vanaspate ya eṣa nihitas tvayi /
analyzed: punar dehi vanaspate yaḥ eṣa nihitaḥ tvayi
translated: Give back, O tree, what has been placed in thee.

original: yathā yamasya sādana āsātau vidathā vadan ////
analyzed: yathā yamasya sādane āsātau vidathā vadan
translated: As one who speaks out the truth in the abode of Yama, O Asat.

original: ā rabhasva jātavedas tejasvad dharo astu te /
analyzed: ā rabhasva jātavedaḥ tejasvat dharaḥ astu te
translated: Take hold, O all-knower. Let thy flame be strong.

original: śarīram asya saṃ dahāthainaṃ dehi sukṛtām u loke ////
analyzed: śarīram asya sam daha atha enam dehi su kṛtām u loke
translated: Burn up his body, and then give him to the world of the virtuous.

original: ye te pūrve parāgatā apare pitaraś ca ye /
analyzed: ye te pūrve parāgatāḥ apare pitaraḥ ca ye
translated: Those thy ancestors who have gone before, and those who have come after, and those who are here,

original: tebhyo ghṛtasya kulyaitu śatadhārā vyundatī ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ghṛtasya kulyā aitu śata dhārā vyundatī
translated: For them let the stream of ghee flow, with a hundred streams.

original: etad ā roha vaya unmṛjānaḥ svā iha bṛhad u dīdayante /
analyzed: etat ā roha vayaḥ unmṛjānaḥ svāḥ iha bṛhat u dīdayante
translated: Ascend this, being cleansed. Our own fires shine forth here brightly.

original: abhi prehi madhyato māpa hāsthāḥ pitṝnāṃ lokaṃ prathamo yo atra ////
analyzed: abhi prehi madhyatas mā apa ha asthāḥ pitṝnām lokam prathamaḥ yaḥ atra
translated: Go forward, do not tarry in the middle, to the world of the Fathers, the first one here.

original: ā rohata janitrīṃ jātavedasaḥ pitṛyānaiḥ saṃ va ā rohayāmi /
analyzed: ā rohata janitrīm jātavedasaḥ pitṛ yānaiḥ sam vaḥ ā rohayāmi
translated: Ascend the mother of the all-knowing one, with the paths of the Fathers I cause you to ascend together.

original: avāḍ ḍhavyeṣito havyavāha ījānaṃ yuktāḥ sukṛtāṃ dhatta loke ////
analyzed: avāṭ havya iṣitaḥ havyavāhaḥ ījānam yuktāḥ sukṛtām dhatta loke
translated: The bearer of oblations, invited, carries the offerer to the world of the well-performed good deeds.

original: devā yajñam ṛtavaḥ kalpayanti haviḥ puroḍāśaṃ sruco yajñāyudhāni /
analyzed: devāḥ yajñam ṛtavaḥ kalpayanti haviḥ puroḍāśam srucaḥ yajñāyudhāni
translated: The gods, the seasons, prepare the sacrifice, the oblation, the sacrificial cake, the ladles, and the sacrificial implements.

original: tebhir yāhi pathibhir devayānair yair ījānāḥ svargaṃ yanti lokam ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ yāhi pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ yaiḥ ījānāḥ svargam yanti lokam
translated: With those, go on the paths that lead to the gods, by which those who offer sacrifices go to the world of heaven.

original: ṛtasya panthām anu paśya sādhv aṅgirasaḥ sukṛto yena yanti /
analyzed: ṛtasya panthām anu paśya sādhu aṅgirasaḥ su kṛtaḥ yena yanti
translated: Look along the path of truth, along the good path, by which the well-performed Angiras go.

original: tebhir yāhi pathibhiḥ svargaṃ yatrādityā madhu bhakṣayanti tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ yāhi pathibhiḥ svargam yatra ādityāḥ madhu bhakṣayanti tṛtīye nāke adhi vi śrayasva
translated: With those paths go to heaven, where the Adityas enjoy the honey. In the third heaven, settle down.

original: trayaḥ suparṇā uparasya māyū nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi viṣṭapi śritāḥ /🔽svargā lokā amṛtena viṣṭhā iṣam ūrjaṃ yajamānāya duhrām ////
analyzed: trayaḥ suparṇāḥ uparasya māyū nākasya pṛṣṭhe adhi viṣṭapi śritāḥ  svargāḥ lokāḥ amṛtena viṣṭhāḥ iṣam ūrjam yajamānāya duhrām
translated: Three Suparnas, the feathers of the highest one, are settled on the back of the vault, in the open space.🔽The heavenly worlds are established with immortality. Milk out food and strength for the sacrificer.

original: juhūr dādhāra dyām upabhṛd antarikṣaṃ dhruvā dādhāra pṛthivīṃ pratiṣṭhām /
analyzed: juhūḥ dādhāra dyām upabhṛt antarikṣam dhruvā dādhāra pṛthivīm pratiṣṭhām
translated: The Juhu supports the sky, the Upabhrt the atmosphere, the Dhruva supports the earth, the foundation.

original: pratīmāṃ lokā ghṛtapṛṣṭhāḥ svargāḥ kāmaṃkāmaṃ yajamānāya duhrām ////
analyzed: prati imām lokāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭhāḥ svargāḥ kāmam kāmam yajamānāya duhrām
translated: May the worlds, with ghee on their backs, the heavens, yield every desire to the sacrificer.

original: dhruva ā roha pṛthivīṃ viśvabhojasam antarikṣam upabhṛd ā kramasva /
analyzed: dhruve ā roha pṛthivīm viśva bhojasam antarikṣam upabhṛt ā kramasva
translated: Firmly ascend the earth, the all-supporting, step into the Upabhrt in the atmosphere.

original: juhu dyāṃ gacha yajamānena sākaṃ sruveṇa vatsena diśaḥ prapīnāḥ sarvā dhukṣvāhṛṇyamānaḥ ////
analyzed: juhu dyām gacha yajamānena sākam sruveṇa vatsena diśaḥ prapīnāḥ sarvāḥ dhukṣva a hṛṇyamānaḥ
translated: Offer to the sky, go together with the sacrificer, with the offering ladle as the calf, milk all the vast directions, being praised.

original: tīrthais taranti pravato mahīr iti yajñakṛtaḥ sukṛto yena yanti /
analyzed: tīrthaiḥ taranti pravataḥ mahīḥ iti yajña kṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ yena yanti
translated: They cross the great rivers by the sacred fords, the well-performed sacrifices by which they go.

original: atrādadhur yajamānāya lokaṃ diśo bhūtāni yad akalpayanta ////
analyzed: atra adadhuḥ yajamānāya lokam diśaḥ bhūtāni yat akalpayanta
translated: Here they have established the world for the sacrificer, when they have assigned the directions and beings.

original: aṅgirasām ayanaṃ pūrvo agnir ādityānām ayanaṃ gārhapatyo dakṣiṇānām ayanaṃ dakṣiṇāgniḥ /
analyzed: aṅgirasām ayanam pūrvaḥ agniḥ ādityānām ayanam gārhapatyaḥ dakṣiṇānām ayanam dakṣiṇāgniḥ
translated: The eastern fire is the path of the Angiras, the Garhapatya fire is the path of the Adityas, the Dakshina fire is the path of the Dakshinas.

original: mahimānam agner vihitasya brahmaṇā samaṅgaḥ sarva upa yāhi śagmaḥ ////
analyzed: mahimānam agneḥ vihitasya brahmaṇā samaṅgaḥ sarvaḥ upa yāhi śagmaḥ
translated: With the Brahman, share the glory of the appointed Agni, approach all together, being auspicious.

original: pūrvo agniṣ ṭvā tapatu śaṃ purastāc chaṃ paścāt tapatu gārhapatyaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ agniḥ tvā tapatu śam purastāt śam paścāt tapatu gārhapatyaḥ
translated: May the eastern fire heat you for good in the east, may the Garhapatya fire heat you for good in the west.

original: dakṣiṇāgniṣ ṭe tapatu śarma varmottarato madhyato antarikṣād diśodiśo agne pari pāhi ghorāt ////
analyzed: dakṣiṇāgniḥ te tapatu śarma varma uttaratas madhyataḥ antarikṣāt diśaḥ diśaḥ agne pari pāhi ghorāt
translated: May the Dakshina fire heat you for good as a protection from the north, from the middle, from the atmosphere, from all directions, O Agni, protect from the fearful directions.

original: yūyam agne śaṃtamābhis tanūbhir ījānam abhi lokaṃ svargam /
analyzed: yūyam agne śaṃtamābhiḥ tanūbhiḥ ījānam abhi lokam svargam
translated: You, O Agni, with your most auspicious forms, to the worshipper, to the heavenly world.

original: aśvā bhūtvā pṛṣṭivāho vahātha yatra devaiḥ sadhamādaṃ madanti ////
analyzed: aśvāḥ bhūtvā pṛṣṭi vāhaḥ vahātha yatra devaiḥ sadhamādam madanti  /
translated: Becoming horses, bearing on your back, carry him to the place where the gods rejoice in the feast of Soma.

original: śam agne paścāt tapa śaṃ purastāc cham uttarāc cham adharāt tapainam /
analyzed: śam agne paścāt tapa śam purastāt śam uttarāt śam adharāt tapa enam
translated: Be thou, O Agni, a protection from the west, from the east, from the north, from the south.

original: ekas tredhā vihito jātavedaḥ samyag enaṃ dhehi sukṛtām u loke ////
analyzed: ekaḥ tredhā vihitaḥ jātavedaḥ samyak enam dhehi su kṛtām u loke
translated: O all-knowing one, thou art one, threefold in thy arrangement. Place him rightly in the world of the righteous.

original: śam agnayaḥ samiddhā ā rabhantāṃ prājāpatyaṃ medhyaṃ jātavedasaḥ /
analyzed: śam agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ ā rabhantām prājāpatyam medhyam jātavedasaḥ
translated: May the kindled fires receive me, the pure, the all-knowing, belonging to Prajapati.

original: śṛtaṃ kṛṇvanta iha māva cikṣipan ////
analyzed: śṛtam kṛṇvantaḥ iha mā ava cikṣipan
translated: May they, preparing the oblation, not cast me away here.

original: yajña eti vitataḥ kalpamāna ījānam abhi lokaṃ svargam /
analyzed: yajñaḥ eti vitataḥ kalpamānaḥ ījānam abhi lokam svargam
translated: The sacrifice spreads out, being arranged, to the worshipper, to the heavenly world.

original: tam agnayaḥ sarvahutaṃ juṣantāṃ prājāpatyaṃ medhyaṃ jātavedasaḥ ////
analyzed: tam agnayaḥ sarva hutam juṣantām prājāpatyam medhyam jātavedasaḥ
translated: May the fires receive that all-offering, the pure, the all-knowing, belonging to Prajapati.

original: ījānaś citam ārukṣad agniṃ nākasya pṛṣṭhād divam utpatiṣyan /
analyzed: ījānaḥ citam ārukṣat agnim nākasya pṛṣṭhāt divam utpatiṣyan
translated: The worshipper has ascended the piled-up Agni, about to fly up to the back of the sky, to heaven.

original: tasmai pra bhāti nabhaso jyotiṣīmānt svargaḥ panthāḥ sukṛte devayānaḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai pra bhāti nabhasaḥ jyotiṣīmān svargaḥ panthāḥ su kṛte deva yānaḥ
translated: To him shines the heavenly path of the righteous, the light of the sky, leading to the gods.

original: agnir hotādhvaryuṣ ṭe bṛhaspatir indro brahmā dakṣiṇatas te astu /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā adhvaryuḥ te bṛhaspatiḥ indraḥ brahmā dakṣiṇatas te astu
translated: Let Agni be thy Hotar, let Brihaspati be thy Adhvaryu, let Indra be thy Brahman priest on thy right side.

original: huto 'yaṃ saṃsthito yajña eti yatra pūrvam ayanaṃ hutānām ////
analyzed: hutaḥ yam saṃsthitaḥ yajñaḥ eti yatra pūrvam ayanam hutānām
translated: This sacrifice, offered, is completed. It goes to the place where the oblations have gone before.

original: apūpavān kṣīravāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān kṣīravān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: The cake, the milk, and the oblation - may they sit here.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the receivers of oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān dadhivāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān dadhivān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: The cake, the curd, and the oblation - may they sit here.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the receivers of oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān drapsavāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān drapsavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: The cake, the drop, and the oblation - may they sit here.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the receivers of oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān ghṛtavāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān ghṛtavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: The cake, the ghee, and the oblation - may they sit here.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the receivers of oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān māṃsavāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān māṃsavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: The cake, the meat, and the oblation - may they sit here.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the receivers of oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān annavāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān annavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: The cake, the food, and the oblation - may they sit here.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of worlds, the makers of paths, who are the receivers of oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān madhumāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān madhumān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: Let the cake, the honey, and the boiled rice come hither.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān rasavāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān rasavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: Let the cake, the essence, and the boiled rice come hither.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpavān apavāṃś carur eha sīdatu /
analyzed: apūpavān apavān caruḥ ā iha sīdatu
translated: Let the cake, the water, and the boiled rice come hither.

original: lokakṛtaḥ pathikṛto yajāmahe ye devānāṃ hutabhāgā iha stha ////
analyzed: loka kṛtaḥ pathikṛtaḥ yajāmahe ye devānām huta bhāgāḥ iha stha
translated: We worship the makers of the world, the makers of the path, who are the sharers of the oblations of the gods here.

original: apūpāpihitān kumbhān yāṃs te devā adhārayan /
analyzed: apūpa apihitān kumbhān yān te devāḥ adhārayan
translated: The pots that the gods have filled for you, covered with cakes,

original: te te santu svadhāvanto madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ ////
analyzed: te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ
translated: May they be for you full of your own essence, full of honey, dripping with ghee.

original: yās te dhānā anukirāmi tilamiśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ
translated: The grains of rice that I scatter for you, mixed with sesame seeds, full of your own essence,

original: tās te santūdbhvīḥ prabhvīs tās te yamo rājānu manyatām ////
analyzed: tāḥ te santu udbhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām
translated: May they be for you abundant, powerful, may King Yama approve of them for you.

original: akṣitiṃ bhūyasīm ////
analyzed: akṣitim bhūyasīm
translated: The inexhaustible, the most extensive...

original: drapsaś caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imaṃ ca yonim anu yaś ca pūrvaḥ /
analyzed: drapsaḥ caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imam ca yonim anu yaḥ ca pūrvaḥ
translated: The drop has fallen on the earth, on the sky, on this womb and on the former one.

original: samānaṃ yonim anu samcarantaṃ drapsam juhomy anu sapta hotrāḥ ////
analyzed: samānam yonim anu samcarantam drapsam juhomi anu sapta hotrāḥ
translated: I offer the drop that moves along the common womb, along the seven oblations.

original: śatadhāraṃ vāyum arkaṃ svarvidaṃ nṛcakṣasas te abhi cakṣate rayim /
analyzed: śata dhāram vāyum arkam svar vidam nṛ cakṣasaḥ te abhi cakṣate rayim
translated: The hundred-streamed Vâyu, Arka, finder-out of heaven, the men who look on him behold his wealth.

original: ye pṛnanti pra ca yachanti sarvadā te duhrate dakṣiṇāṃ saptamātaram ////
analyzed: ye pṛnanti pra ca yacchanti sarvadā te duhrate dakṣiṇām sapta mātaram
translated: They who refresh and grant us all things evermore milk the seven-mothered Dakshinâ.

original: kośaṃ duhanti kalaśaṃ caturbilam iḍāṃ dhenuṃ madhumatīṃ svastaye /
analyzed: kośam duhanti kalaśam catur bilam iḍām dhenum madhumatīm svastaye
translated: They milk the four-spouted jar, the treasure, the milch-cow Idâ, rich in meath, for happiness.

original: ūrjaṃ madantīm aditiṃ janeṣv agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman ////
analyzed: ūrjam madantīm aditim janeṣu agne mā hiṃsīḥ parame vyoman
translated: The nourishing, the gladdening Aditi among the folk: harm not, O Agni, in the loftiest heaven.

original: etat te devaḥ savitā vāso dadāti bhartave /
analyzed: etat te devaḥ savitā vāsaḥ dadāti bhartave
translated: This robe the God Savitar gives thee to wear.

original: tat tvaṃ yamasya rājye vasānas tārpyaṃ cara ////
analyzed: tat tvam yamasya rājye vasānaḥ tārpyam cara
translated: Wearing it, dwell thou in Yama's realm, O Tarpya.

original: dhānā dhenur abhavad vatso asyās tilo 'bhavat /
analyzed: dhānā dhenuḥ abhavat vatsaḥ asyāḥ tilaḥ bhavat
translated: The grain became the cow, and she hath had a calf. The sesame became her milk.

original: tāṃ vai yamasya rājye akṣitām upa jīvati ////🔽etās te asau dhenavaḥ kāmadughā bhavantu /
analyzed: tām vai yamasya rājye a kṣitām upa jīvati  etāḥ te asau dhenavaḥ kāmadughāḥ bhavantu
translated: In Yama's realm they live for ever on that cow which never fails.🔽May these thy cows, which yield all wishes, be for thee.

original: enīḥ śyenīḥ sarūpā virūpās tilavatsā upa tiṣṭhantu tvātra ////
analyzed: enīḥ śyenīḥ sarūpāḥ virūpāḥ tila vatsāḥ upa tiṣṭhantu tvā atra
translated: The dappled, the dark-coloured, the varied, the multi-coloured, with calves of sesame, wait on thee here.

original: enīr dhānā hariṇīḥ śyenīr asya kṛṣṇā dhānā rohiṇīr dhenavas te /
analyzed: enīḥ dhānāḥ hariṇīḥ śyenīḥ asya kṛṣṇāḥ dhānāḥ rohiṇīḥ dhenavaḥ te
translated: The dappled grain, the tawny, the dark-coloured, the black, the red, the cows of him,

original: tilavatsā ūrjam asmai duhānā viśvāhā santv anapasphurantīḥ ////
analyzed: tila vatsāḥ ūrjam asmai duhānāḥ viśvāhā santu an apasphurantīḥ
translated: with calves of sesame, yielding him strength, may they be for him for all his life, never failing.

original: vaiśvānare havir idaṃ juhomi sāhasraṃ śatadhāram utsam /
analyzed: vaiśvānare haviḥ idam juhomi sāhasram śata dhāram utsam
translated: I offer this oblation to Vaisvānara, the spring of a thousand streams, of a hundred streams.

original: sa bibharti pitaraṃ pitāmahān prapitāmahān bibharti pinvamānaḥ ////
analyzed: sa bibharti pitaram pitāmahān prapitāmahān bibharti pinvamānaḥ
translated: It supports the father, the grandfathers, the great-grandfathers, swelling.

original: sahasradhāraṃ śatadhāram utsam akṣitaṃ vyacyamānaṃ salilasya pṛṣṭhe /
analyzed: sahasra dhāram śata dhāram utsam akṣitam vyacyamānam salilasya pṛṣṭhe
translated: The spring of a thousand streams, of a hundred streams, inexhaustible, expanding on the back of the waters,

original: ūrjaṃ duhānam anapasphurantam upāsate pitaraḥ svadhābhiḥ ////
analyzed: ūrjam duhānam an apasphurantam upāsate pitaraḥ svadhābhiḥ
translated: milking strength, not trembling, the fathers attend upon it with their own oblations.

original: idaṃ kasāmbu cayanena citaṃ tat sajātā ava paśyateta /
analyzed: idam kasāmbu cayanena citam tat sajātāḥ ava paśyata ita
translated: This is the house built by the kinsmen, let the relatives look upon it.

original: martyo 'yam amṛtatvam eti tasmai gṛhān kṛṇuta yāvatsabandhu ////
analyzed: martyaḥ yam amṛta tvam eti tasmai gṛhān kṛṇuta yāvatsabandhu
translated: This mortal goes to immortality, for him make a house as far as kinship extends.

original: ihaivaidhi dhanasanir ihacitta ihakratuḥ /
analyzed: iha eva edhi dhana saniḥ ihacittaḥ ihakratuḥ
translated: Here be, gaining wealth, here be with a mind here, here be with a will.

original: ihaidhi vīryavattaro vayodhā aparāhataḥ ////
analyzed: iha edhi vīryavattaraḥ vayodhāḥ a parāhataḥ
translated: Here be more vigorous, giving life, not struck down.

original: putraṃ pautram abhitarpayantīr āpo madhumatīr imāḥ /
analyzed: putram pautram abhitarpayantīḥ āpaḥ madhumatīḥ imāḥ
translated: The waters, satisfying the son and grandson, these waters full of sweetness,

original: svadhāṃ pitṛbhyo amṛtaṃ duhānā āpo devīr ubhayāṃs tarpayantu ////
analyzed: svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ amṛtam duhānāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ ubhayān tarpayantu
translated: milking immortality and the oblation to the fathers, may the divine waters satisfy both sides.

original: āpo agniṃ pra hiṇuta pitṝṃr upemaṃ yajñaṃ pitaro me juṣantām /
analyzed: āpaḥ agnim pra hiṇuta pitṝn upa imam yajñam pitaraḥ me juṣantām
translated: O waters, send Agni to the fathers, may the fathers enjoy this sacrifice of mine.

original: āsīnām ūrjam upa ye sacante te no rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yachān ////
analyzed: āsīnām ūrjam upa ye sacante te naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchān
translated: Those who attend upon the seated strength, may they bestow upon us wealth with all heroes.

original: sam indhate amartyaṃ havyavāhaṃ ghṛtapriyam /
analyzed: sam indhate amartyam havyavāham ghṛta priyam
translated: They kindle the immortal one, the bearer of oblations, who loves ghee.

original: sa veda nihitān nidhīn pitṝn parāvato gatān ////
analyzed: sa veda nihitān nidhīn pitṝn parāvataḥ gatān
translated: He knows the hidden treasures, the fathers who have gone to the further shore.

original: yaṃ te manthaṃ yam odananaṃ yan māṃsaṃ nipṛṇāmi te /
analyzed: yam te mantham yam odananam yat māṃsam nipṛṇāmi te
translated: The gruel, the rice-cake, the meat that I spread out for you,

original: te te santu svadhāvanto madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ ////
analyzed: te te santu svadhāvantaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ
translated: may they be for you full of your own power, full of honey, dripping with ghee.

original: yās te dhānā anukirāmi tilamiśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ te dhānāḥ anukirāmi tila miśrāḥ svadhāvatīḥ
translated: The grains mixed with sesame seeds that I scatter for you, full of your own power,

original: tās te santūdbhvīḥ prabhvīs tās te yamo rājānu manyatām ////
analyzed: tāḥ te santu udbhvīḥ prabhvīḥ tāḥ te yamaḥ rājā anu manyatām
translated: may they be for you abundant, powerful, may Yama the king approve of them for you.

original: idaṃ pūrvam aparaṃ niyānaṃ yenā te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ /
analyzed: idam pūrvam aparam niyānam yena te pūrve pitaraḥ paretāḥ
translated: This is the former, the later yoke, by which your former fathers have gone to the further shore.

original: purogavā ye abhisāco asya te tvā vahanti sukṛtām u lokam ////🔽sarasvatīṃ devayanto havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne /🔽sarasvatīṃ sukṛto havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryaṃ dāt ////
analyzed: purogavāḥ ye abhisācaḥ asya te tvā vahanti su kṛtām u lokam  sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne  sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ havante sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt
translated: The leaders of the herd, who follow this one, they carry you to the world of the well-done.🔽They invoke Sarasvatī, the pious, they invoke Sarasvatī, when the sacrifice is being performed.🔽The well-doers invoke Sarasvatī, may Sarasvatī grant the sacrificer a prize.

original: sarasvatīṃ pitaro havante dakṣiṇā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ /
analyzed: sarasvatīm pitaraḥ havante dakṣiṇā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: The fathers invoke Sarasvatī, who are turning to the right, approaching the sacrifice.

original: āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvā iṣa ā dhehy asme ////
analyzed: āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ā dhehi asme
translated: Having sat down, rejoice on this sacred grass; bestow upon us food free from disease.

original: sarasvati yā sarathaṃ yayāthokthaiḥ svadhābhir devi pitṛbhir madantī /
analyzed: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayātha ukthaiḥ svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī
translated: O Sarasvati, on whom you go with the chariot, rejoicing with the offerings and the Fathers, O Goddess,

original: sahasrārgham iḍo atra bhāgaṃ rāyas poṣaṃ yajamānāya dhehi ////
analyzed: sahasra argham iḍaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi
translated: Grant here a share worth a thousand, O Iḍā, of the increase of wealth to the sacrificer.

original: pṛthivīṃ tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi devo no dhātā pra tirāty āyuḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivīm tvā pṛthivyām ā veśayāmi devaḥ naḥ dhātā pra tirāti āyuḥ
translated: I place you on the earth in the earth. May the god Dhātṛ prolong our life.

original: parāparaitā vasuvid vo astv adhā mṛtāḥ pitṛṣu saṃ bhavantu ////
analyzed: parāparā etāḥ vasu vid vaḥ astu adha mṛtāḥ pitṛṣu sam bhavantu
translated: May this (earth) be yours, which finds treasures, and may the dead be united with the Fathers.

original: ā pra cyavethām apa tan mṛjethāṃ yad vām abhibhā atrocuḥ /
analyzed: ā pra cyavethām apa tat mṛjethām yat vām abhibhāḥ atra ūcuḥ
translated: Come hither, and wipe out that sin which they have committed against you here.

original: asmād etam aghnyau tad vaśīyo dātuḥ pitṛṣv ihabhojanau mama ////
analyzed: asmāt etam aghnyau tat vaśīyaḥ dātuḥ pitṛṣu ihabhojanau mama
translated: O two innocent ones, this is better for you. Be the two eaters of my offerings here among the Fathers.

original: eyam agan dakṣiṇā bhadrato nā anena dattā sudughā vayodhāḥ /
analyzed: ā iyam agan dakṣiṇā bhadratas naḥ anena dattā su dughā vayodhāḥ
translated: This Dakṣiṇā has come to us from the good. It has been given by this (sacrificer) as a milch cow, giving life.

original: yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhya upasaṃparāṇayād imān ////
analyzed: yauvane jīvān upapṛñcatī jarā pitṛbhyaḥ upasaṃparāṇayāt imān
translated: Youth, approaching the living in youth, old age has brought these (men) to the Fathers.

original: idaṃ pitṛbhyaḥ pra bharāmi barhir jīvaṃ devebhya uttaraṃ stṛṇāmi /
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ pra bharāmi barhiḥ jīvam devebhyaḥ uttaram stṛṇāmi
translated: I spread this sacred grass for the Fathers. I strew the living for the gods above.

original: tad ā roha puruṣa medhyo bhavan prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam ////
analyzed: tat ā roha puruṣa medhyaḥ bhavan prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam
translated: So mount it, O man, become pure, let the Fathers know thee when thou goest to them.

original: edaṃ barhir asado medhyo 'bhūḥ prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam /
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ asadaḥ medhyaḥ bhūḥ prati tvā jānantu pitaraḥ paretam
translated: Sit on this sacred grass, become pure, let the Fathers know thee when thou goest to them.

original: yathāparu tanvaṃ saṃ bharasva gātrāṇi te brahmaṇā kalpayāmi ////
analyzed: yathāparu tanvam sam bharasva gātrāṇi te brahmaṇā kalpayāmi
translated: As it was before, so do thou put together thy limbs; with prayer I adjust thy members.

original: parṇo rājāpidhānaṃ carūṇām ūrjo balaṃ saha ojo na āgan /
analyzed: parṇaḥ rājā apidhānam carūṇām ūrjaḥ balam sahaḥ ojaḥ naḥ āgan
translated: The leaf is the king, the covering of the oblations; strength, power, vigour have come to me.

original: āyur jīvebhyo vidadhad dīrghāyutvāya śataśāradāya ////🔽ūrjo bhāgo ya imaṃ jajānāśmānnānām ādhipatyaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: āyuḥ jīvebhyaḥ vidadhat dīrgha āyu tvāya śata śāradāya  ūrjaḥ bhāgaḥ yaḥ imam jajāna aśmā annānām ādhipatyam jagāma
translated: Granting life to living beings, for a life of a hundred autumns.🔽The share of strength, he who was born from this, went to the overlordship of the various foods.

original: tam arcata viśvamitrā havirbhiḥ sa no yamaḥ prataraṃ jīvase dhāt ////
analyzed: tam arcata viśva mitrāḥ havirbhiḥ sa naḥ yamaḥ prataram jīvase dhāt
translated: Him, all-friends, worship with oblations; may that Yama grant us a ford for life.

original: yathā yamāya harmyam avapan pañca mānavāḥ /
analyzed: yathā yamāya harmyam avapan pañca mānavāḥ
translated: As the five men spread out a house for Yama,

original: evā vapāmi harmyaṃ yathā me bhūrayo 'sata ////🔽idaṃ hiraṇyaṃ bibhṛhi yat te pitābibhaḥ purā /
analyzed: eva vapāmi harmyam yathā me  idam hiraṇyam bibhṛhi yat te pitā abibhar purā
translated: So I spread out a house, that it may be for my great prosperity.🔽Bear this gold, which thy father bore of old,

original: svargaṃ yataḥ pitur hastaṃ nir mṛḍḍhi dakṣiṇam ////
analyzed: svargam yataḥ pituḥ hastam niḥ mṛḍḍhi dakṣiṇam
translated: From the heaven, from the father's hand, do thou release the right hand.

original: ye ca jīvā ye ca mṛtā ye jātā ye ca yajñiyāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca jīvāḥ ye ca mṛtāḥ ye jātāḥ ye ca yajñiyāḥ
translated: Those who live and those who are dead, those who are born and those who are fit for sacrifice,

original: tebhyo ghṛtasya kulyaitu madhudhārā vyundatī ////
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ghṛtasya kulyā aitu madhu dhārā vyundatī
translated: From them let the stream of ghee flow, pouring out a stream of honey.

original: vṛṣā matīnāṃ pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ sūro ahnāṃ pratarītoṣasāṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā matīnām pavate vicakṣaṇaḥ sūraḥ ahnām pratarītā uṣasām divaḥ
translated: The bull, the all-seeing one, flows for the thoughts, the sun for the days, the leader of the dawns of heaven.

original: prāṇaḥ sindhūnāṃ kalaśāṃ acikradad indrasya hārdim āviśan manīṣayā ////🔽tveṣas te dhūma ūrṇotu divi ṣaṃ chukra ātataḥ /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ sindhūnām kalaśām acikradat indrasya hārdim āviśan manīṣayā  tveṣaḥ te dhūmaḥ ūrṇotu divi sam śukraḥ ātataḥ
translated: The breath of the rivers, he has roared in the jars, entering the heart of Indra with thought.🔽May your smoke rise up in splendor, white and extended in the sky.

original: sūro na hi dyutā tvaṃ kṛpā pāvaka rocase ////
analyzed: sūraḥ na hi dyutā tvam kṛpā pāvaka rocase
translated: For you shine like the sun, O purifying fire, with your radiance.

original: pra vā etīndur indrasya niṣkṛtiṃ sakhā sakhyur na pra mināti saṃgiraḥ /
analyzed: pra vai eti induḥ indrasya niṣkṛtim sakhā sakhyuḥ na pra mināti saṃgiraḥ
translated: The moon moves on to Indra's place of worship, the friend does not transgress the promise to his friend.

original: marya iva yoṣāḥ sam arṣase somaḥ kalaśe śatayāmanā pathā ////
analyzed: maryaḥ iva yoṣāḥ sam arṣase somaḥ kalaśe śata yāmanā pathā  /
translated: Like a young man to a maiden, you flow together, O Soma, in the jar, on the path of a hundred autumns.

original: akṣann amīmadanta hy ava priyāṃ adhūṣata /
analyzed: akṣan amīmadanta hi ava priyām adhūṣata
translated: They have eaten, they have rejoiced, they have sung praises to the beloved.

original: astoṣata svabhānavo viprā yaviṣṭhā īmahe ////
analyzed: astoṣata sva bhānavaḥ viprāḥ yaviṣṭhāḥ īmahe
translated: The self-shining sages have praised, we invoke the youngest.

original: ā yāta pitaraḥ somyāso gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ /
analyzed: ā yāta pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pitṛyāṇaiḥ
translated: Come, O fathers who deserve Soma, on the deep paths that lead to the fathers,

original: āyur asmabhyaṃ dadhataḥ prajāṃ ca rāyaś ca poṣair abhi naḥ sacadhvam ////
analyzed: āyuḥ asmabhyam dadhataḥ prajām ca rāyaḥ ca poṣaiḥ abhi naḥ sacadhvam
translated: granting us life and offspring, come to us together with the increase of wealth.

original: parā yāta pitaraḥ somyāso gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ /
analyzed: parā yāta pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gambhīraiḥ pathibhiḥ pūryāṇaiḥ
translated: Go away, O fathers who deserve Soma, on the deep paths that lead to the fathers,

original: adhā māsi punar ā yāta no gṛhān havir attuṃ suprajasaḥ suvīrāḥ ////
analyzed: adhā māsi punar ā yāta naḥ gṛhān haviḥ attum suprajasaḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Come again to our houses in the month, O ye who have good sons and good heroes, to eat the sacrificial food.

original: yad vo agnir ajahād ekam aṅgaṃ pitṛlokaṃ gamayaṃ jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: yat vaḥ agniḥ ajahāt ekam aṅgam pitṛ lokam gamayan jātavedāḥ
translated: What one limb of yours Agni has left, carrying it to the world of the fathers, O all-knower,

original: tad va etat punar ā pyāyayāmi sāṅgāḥ svarge pitaro mādayadhvam ////
analyzed: tat vaḥ etat punar ā pyāyayāmi sa aṅgāḥ svarge pitaraḥ mādayadhvam
translated: I here restore it to you. With limbs complete, O fathers, rejoice in heaven.

original: abhūd dūtaḥ prahito jātavedāḥ sāyaṃ nyahna upavandyo nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: abhūt dūtaḥ prahitaḥ jātavedāḥ sāyam nyahne upavandyaḥ nṛbhiḥ
translated: He has been the messenger sent forth, all-knower, to be worshipped in the evening and in the morning by men.

original: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣann addhi tvaṃ deva prayatā havīṃṣi ////
analyzed: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā havīṃṣi
translated: You have given to the fathers, they have eaten with their own oblation. Eat, O god, the offered oblations.

original: asau hā iha te manaḥ kakutsalam iva jāmayaḥ /
analyzed: asau hai iha te manaḥ kakutsalam iva jāmayaḥ
translated: This is your mind here, O father, like a jealous wife.

original: abhy enaṃ bhūma ūrṇuhi ////
analyzed: abhi enam bhūme ūrṇuhi
translated: Cover it over with earth.

original: śumbhantāṃ lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ pitṛṣadane tvā loka ā sādayāmi ////
analyzed: śumbhantām lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ pitṛṣadane tvā loke ā sādayāmi
translated: Let the worlds, the seats of the fathers, be filled. In the seat of the fathers I place you in the world.

original: ye asmākaṃ pitaras teṣāṃ barhir asi ////
analyzed: ye asmākam pitaraḥ teṣām barhiḥ asi
translated: You are the sacrificial grass of those fathers of ours.

original: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ śrathāya /
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam śrathāya
translated: Loosen the highest and the lowest noose from us, O Varuṇa, to make us strong.

original: adhā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma ////
analyzed: adha vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma
translated: So may we, O Āditya, in your vow, be sinless to Aditi.

original: prāsmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān yaiḥ samāme badhyate yair vyāme /
analyzed: pra asmat pāśān varuṇa muñca sarvān yaiḥ samāme badhyate yaiḥ vyāme
translated: Loosen all the nooses from us, O Varuṇa, with which we are bound in the crossways, with which in the open spaces.

original: adhā jīvema śaradaṃ śatāni tvayā rājan gupitā rakṣamāṇāḥ ////
analyzed: adhā jīvema śaradam śatāni tvayā rājan gupitāḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: May we live a hundred autumns, protected and guarded by you, O King.

original: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svadhā namaḥ ////🔽somāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ ////🔽pitṛbhyaḥ somavadbhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ ////
analyzed: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svadhā namaḥ  somāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ  pitṛbhyaḥ somavadbhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ
translated: Svāhā and salutations to Agni, the carrier of oblations.🔽Svāhā and salutations to Soma, accompanied by the ancestors.🔽Svāhā and salutations to the ancestors who partake of Soma.

original: yamāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ ////🔽etat te pratatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu ////
analyzed: yamāya pitṛmate svadhā namaḥ  etat te pratatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu
translated: Svāhā and salutations to Yama, accompanied by the ancestors.🔽This is for you, great-great-grandfather, Svāhā, and for those who follow you.

original: etat te tatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu ////
analyzed: etat te tatāmaha svadhā ye ca tvām anu
translated: This is for you, great-grandfather, Svāhā, and for those who follow you.

original: etat te tata svadhā ////🔽svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ pṛthiviṣadbhyaḥ ////
analyzed: etat te tata svadhā  svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ pṛthiviṣadbhyaḥ
translated: This is for you, grandfather, Svāhā.🔽Svāhā to the ancestors who dwell on the earth.🔽Svāhā to the ancestors who dwell in the atmosphere.

original: svadhā pitṛbhyo antarikṣasadbhyaḥ ////🔽svadhā pitṛbhyo diviṣadbhyaḥ //// 🔽namo vaḥ pitara ūrje namo vaḥ pitaro rasāya ////🔽namo vaḥ pitaro bhāmāya namo vaḥ pitaro manyave ////
analyzed: svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ antarikṣa sadbhyaḥ  svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ diviṣadbhyaḥ  namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ ūrje namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ rasāya  namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ bhāmāya namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ manyave
translated: Svāhā to the ancestors who dwell in the sky.🔽Salutations to you, O fathers, for your strength. Salutations to you, O fathers, for your life-giving power.🔽Salutations to you, O fathers, for your radiance. Salutations to you, O fathers, for your anger.

original: namo vaḥ pitaro yad ghoraṃ tasmai namo vaḥ pitaro yat krūraṃ tasmai ////
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat ghoram tasmai namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat krūram tasmai
translated: Salutations to you, O fathers, for your terrible nature. Salutations to you, O fathers, for your cruelty.

original: namo vaḥ pitaro yac chivaṃ tasmai namo vaḥ pitaro yat syonaṃ tasmai ////
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat śivam tasmai namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ yat syonam tasmai
translated: Salutations to you, O fathers, for your auspicious nature. Salutations to you, O fathers, for your gentleness.

original: namo vaḥ pitaraḥ svadhā vaḥ pitaraḥ ////
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ svadhā vaḥ pitaraḥ
translated: Homage to you, O Fathers! Svâhâ to you, O Fathers!

original: ye 'tra pitaraḥ pitaro ye 'tra yūyaṃ stha yuṣmāṃs te 'nu yūyaṃ teṣāṃ śreṣṭhā bhūyāstha ////
analyzed: ye tra pitaraḥ pitaraḥ ye tra yūyam stha yuṣmān te nu yūyam teṣām śreṣṭhāḥ bhūyāstha
translated: Those who are here, O Fathers, and those who are here, O you, may they follow you, and may you become the best of them.

original: ya iha pitaro jīvā iha vayaṃ smaḥ /
analyzed: ye iha pitaraḥ jīvāḥ iha vayam smaḥ
translated: Those who are here, O Fathers, and we who are here, O you,

original: asmāṃs te 'nu vayaṃ teṣāṃ śreṣṭhā bhūyāsma ////
analyzed: asmān te nu vayam teṣām śreṣṭhāḥ bhūyāsma
translated: may they follow us, and may we become the best of them.

original: ā tvāgna idhīmahi dyumantaṃ devājaram /
analyzed: ā tvā agne idhīmahi dyumantam deva ajaram
translated: O Agni, we kindle you, the glorious, the undecaying god,

original: yad gha sā te panīyasī samid dīdayati dyavi /
analyzed: yat gha sā te panīyasī samidh dīdayati dyavi
translated: When that most excellent fuel of yours shines in the sky,

original: iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara ////
analyzed: iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Bring food to the praisers.

original: candramā apsv antar ā suparṇo dhāvate divi /
analyzed: candramāḥ apsu antar ā suparṇaḥ dhāvate divi
translated: The moon moves in the waters, the eagle in the sky.

original: na vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ padaṃ vindanti vidyuto vittaṃ me asya rodasī ////
analyzed: na vaḥ hiraṇya nemayaḥ padam vindanti vidyutaḥ vittam me asya rodasī
translated: Your paths, O you with golden wheels, the lightnings find not. Find me this heaven and earth.

original: saṃsaṃ sravantu nadyaḥ saṃ vātāḥ saṃ patatriṇaḥ /🔽yajñam imaṃ vardhayatā giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi ////
analyzed: sam sam sravantu nadyaḥ sam vātāḥ sam patatriṇaḥ  yajñam imam vardhayata giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi
translated: Let the rivers flow together, let the winds blow together, let the birds fly together.🔽I offer this sacrifice with the overflowing oblation, to increase this sacrifice with the overflowing oblation.

original: imaṃ homā yajñam avatemaṃ saṃsrāvaṇā uta yajñam imaṃ vardhayatā giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi ////
analyzed: imam homāḥ yajñam avata imam saṃsrāvaṇāḥ uta yajñam imam vardhayata giraḥ saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi
translated: This sacrifice I offer, this overflowing (oblation) I offer, to increase this sacrifice with the overflowing oblation.

original: rūpaṃrūpaṃ vayovayaḥ saṃrabhyainaṃ pari ṣvaje /
analyzed: rūpam rūpam vayaḥ vayaḥ saṃrabhya enam pari svaje
translated: Form after form, age after age, having seized him, do ye embrace him.

original: yajñam imaṃ catasraḥ pradiśo vardhayantu saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi ////
analyzed: yajñam imam catasraḥ pradiśaḥ vardhayantu saṃsrāvyeṇa haviṣā juhomi
translated: Let the four quarters of heaven increase this sacrifice. I offer with a libation that flows together.

original: śaṃ ta āpo haimavatīḥ śam u te santūtsyāḥ /🔽śaṃ te saniṣyadā āpaḥ śam u te santu varṣyāḥ ////🔽śaṃ ta āpo dhanvanyāḥ śaṃ te santv anūpyāḥ /
analyzed: śam te āpaḥ haimavatīḥ śam u te santu utsyāḥ  śam te saniṣyadaḥ āpaḥ śam u te santu varṣyāḥ  śam te āpaḥ dhanvanyāḥ śam te santu anūpyāḥ
translated: May the waters of the Himalayas be auspicious to you, and may the waters of the Utsa be auspicious to you.🔽May the waters that will bring you health be auspicious to you, and may the waters of the rain be auspicious to you.🔽May the waters of the desert be auspicious to you, and may the waters of the marshes be auspicious to you.

original: śaṃ te khanitrimā āpaḥ śaṃ yāḥ kumbhebhir ābhṛtāḥ ////
analyzed: śam te khanitrimāḥ āpaḥ śam yāḥ kumbhebhiḥ ābhṛtāḥ
translated: May the waters dug up by spades be auspicious to you, and may the waters brought in jars be auspicious to you.

original: anabhrayaḥ khanamānā viprā gambhīre apasaḥ /
analyzed: anabhrayaḥ khanamānāḥ viprāḥ gambhīre apasaḥ
translated: The Brahmans, digging without clouds, the deep waters,

original: bhiṣagbhyo bhiṣaktarā āpo achā vadāmasi ////
analyzed: bhiṣagbhyaḥ bhiṣaktarāḥ āpaḥ achā vadāmasi
translated: we call to the physicians, O waters, more skillful than physicians.

original: apām aha divyānām apāṃ srotasyānām /
analyzed: apām aha divyānām apām srotasyānām
translated: Of the heavenly waters, of the waters of the streams,

original: apām aha praṇejane 'śvā bhavatha vājinaḥ ////
analyzed: apām aha praṇejane śvā bhavatha vājinaḥ
translated: of the waters I have, O waters, be ye strong horses.

original: tā apaḥ śivā apo 'yakṣmaṃkaraṇīr apaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ apaḥ śivāḥ apaḥ yakṣmaṃkaraṇīḥ apaḥ
translated: Those auspicious waters, those waters that make one free from consumption,

original: yathaiva tṛpyate mayas tās ta ā datta bhesajīḥ ////
analyzed: yathā eva tṛpyate mayaḥ tāḥ te ā datta bhesajīḥ
translated: just as one is satisfied with food, I give you those healing waters.

original: divas pṛthivyāḥ pary antarikṣād vanaspatibhyo adhy oṣadhībhyaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt vanaspatibhyaḥ adhi oṣadhībhyaḥ
translated: From the sky, from the earth, from the atmosphere, from the trees, from the plants,

original: yatrayatra vibhṛto jātavedās tata stuto juṣamāṇo na ehi ////
analyzed: yatra yatra vibhṛtaḥ jātavedāḥ tatas stutaḥ juṣamāṇaḥ naḥ ehi
translated: wherever thou art distributed, O all-knower, come hither, being praised, accepting (the offerings).

original: yas te apsu mahimā yo vaneṣu ya oṣadhīṣu paśuṣv apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te apsu mahimā yaḥ vaneṣu yaḥ oṣadhīṣu paśuṣu apsu antar
translated: Thy greatness that is in the waters, that in the woods, that in the plants, that in the cattle, that in the waters,

original: agne sarvās tanvaḥ saṃ rabhasva tābhir na ehi draviṇodā ajasraḥ ////
analyzed: agne sarvāḥ tanvaḥ sam rabhasva tābhiḥ naḥ ehi draviṇaḥ dāḥ ajasraḥ
translated: O Agni, with all thy bodies be united. Come hither with those bodies, the giver of treasure, the imperishable.

original: yas te deveṣu mahimā svargo yā te tanuḥ pitṛṣv āviveśa /
analyzed: yaḥ te deveṣu mahimā svargaḥ yā te tanuḥ pitṛṣu āviveśa
translated: Thy greatness among the gods is heaven, thy body that hath entered the Fathers,

original: puṣṭir yā te manuṣyeṣu paprathe 'gne tayā rayim asmāsu dhehi ////
analyzed: puṣṭiḥ yā te manuṣyeṣu paprathe gne tayā rayim asmāsu dhehi
translated: Thy prosperity that hath spread among men, O Agni, by that bestow wealth on us.

original: śrutkarṇāya kavaye vedyāya vacobhir vākair upa yāmi rātim /
analyzed: śrutkarṇāya kavaye vedyāya vacobhiḥ vākaiḥ upa yāmi rātim
translated: To the hearer, the wise, the adorable, I approach with words and speeches for his favour.

original: yato bhayam abhayaṃ tan no astv ava devānāṃ yaja heḍo agne ////
analyzed: yatas bhayam abhayam tat naḥ astu ava devānām yaja heḍaḥ agne
translated: From whatever quarter fear cometh to us, let that be to us a source of safety. Worship the gods, O Agni, drive away our foes.

original: yām āhutiṃ prathamām atharvā yā jātā yā havyam akṛṇoj jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: yām āhutim prathamām atharvā yā jātā yā havyam akṛṇot jātavedāḥ
translated: The offering which Atharvan first made, which was born, which he made an oblation, O all-knower,

original: tāṃ ta etāṃ prathamo johavīmi tābhiṣ ṭupto vahatu havyam agnir agnaye svāha ////
analyzed: tām te etām prathamaḥ johavīmi tābhiḥ tuptaḥ vahatu havyam agniḥ agnaye svāhā
translated: That same I call first of all. May Agni, satisfied with those (offerings), carry the oblation. To Agni, hail!

original: ākūtiṃ devīṃ subhagāṃ puro dadhe cittasya mātā suhavā no astu /
analyzed: ākūtim devīm subhagām puras dadhe cittasya mātā su havā naḥ astu
translated: I place in front the goddess inspiration, the fortunate, the mother of thought. May she be a good bringer of help to us.

original: yām āśām emi kevalī sā me astu videyam enāṃ manasi praviṣṭām ////
analyzed: yām āśām emi kevalī sā me astu videyam enām manasi praviṣṭām
translated: To whatever hope I go, may it be mine. May I know her who hath entered my mind.

original: ākūtyā no bṛhaspata ākūtyā na upā gahi /
analyzed: ākūtyā naḥ bṛhaspate ākūtyā naḥ upa ā gahi
translated: By inspiration, O Brihaspati, by inspiration come thou to us.

original: atho bhagasya no dhehy atho naḥ suhavo bhava ////
analyzed: atha u bhagasya naḥ dhehi atha u naḥ su havaḥ bhava
translated: Then bestow on us prosperity, and be thou easy of access to us.

original: bṛhaspatir ma ākūtim āṅgirasaḥ prati jānātu vācam etām /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ me ākūtim āṅgirasaḥ prati jānātu vācam etām
translated: May Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, accept this thought and this speech of mine.

original: yasya devā devatāḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ sa supraṇītāḥ kāmo anv etv asmān ////
analyzed: yasya devāḥ devatāḥ saṃbabhūvuḥ sa su praṇītāḥ kāmaḥ anu etu asmān
translated: May he whose deities have become the deities of the gods, may he whose will is well directed, come to us.

original: indro rājā jagataś carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpaṃ yad asti /
analyzed: indraḥ rājā jagataḥ carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpam yat asti
translated: Indra, the king of the people of the world, of whatever form it is that exists on the earth,

original: tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codad rādha upastutaś cid arvāk ////
analyzed: tatas dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codat rādhaḥ upastutaḥ cit arvāk
translated: From that he grants wealth to the worshipper, he impels bounty even when praised from below.

original: sahasrabāhuḥ puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt /
analyzed: sahasra bāhuḥ puruṣaḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra pād
translated: The person is a thousand-armed, a thousand-eyed, a thousand-footed.

original: sa bhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvāty atiṣṭhad daśāṅgulam ////
analyzed: sa bhūmim viśvatas vṛtvā ati atiṣṭhat daśa aṅgulam
translated: He, having encompassed the earth on all sides, stood firm at a distance of ten fingers' breadth.

original: tribhiḥ padbhir dyām arohat pād asyehābhavat punaḥ /
analyzed: tribhiḥ padbhiḥ dyām arohat pād asya iha abhavat punar
translated: With three feet he ascended the sky, one foot of him again became here.

original: tathā vy akrāmad viṣvaṅ aśanānaśane anu ////
analyzed: tathā vi akrāmat viṣvaṅ aśana anaśane anu
translated: Thus he has spread out in all directions, following the edible and the inedible.

original: tāvanto asya mahimānas tato jyāyāṃś ca pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: tāvantaḥ asya mahimānaḥ tatas jyāyān ca pūruṣaḥ
translated: So great is his greatness, and greater than that is the person.

original: pādo 'sya viśvā bhūtāni tripād asyāmṛtaṃ divi ////
analyzed: pādaḥ u sya viśvā bhūtāni tri pād asya amṛtam divi
translated: One foot of him are all beings, three feet of him are the immortal in heaven.

original: puruṣa evedaṃ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yac ca bhāvyam /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ eva idam sarvam yat bhūtam yat ca bhāvyam
translated: The person indeed is all this, what has been and what will be.

original: utāmṛtatvasyeśvaro yad anyenābhavat saha ////
analyzed: uta amṛta tvasya īśvaraḥ yat anyena abhavat saha
translated: He is the lord of immortality, what he has in common with another.

original: yat puruṣaṃ vy adadhuḥ katidhā vy akalpayan /
analyzed: yat puruṣam vi adadhuḥ katidhā vi akalpayan
translated: When they divided Purusha into how many parts did they place him?

original: mukhaṃ kim asya kim bāhū kim ūrū pādā ucyate ////
analyzed: mukham kim asya kim bāhū kim ūrū pādāḥ ucyate
translated: What was his mouth? What were his arms? What were his thighs and feet called?

original: brāhmaṇo 'sya mukham āsīd bāhū rājanyo 'bhavat /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ sya mukham āsīt bāhū rājanyaḥ bhavat
translated: His mouth became the Brahmin, his arms were made the Kshatriya,

original: madhyaṃ tad asya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyāṃ śūdro ajāyata ////
analyzed: madhyam tat asya yat vaiśyaḥ padbhyām śūdraḥ ajāyata
translated: his thighs the Vaishya, and from his feet the Shudra was born.

original: candramā manaso jātaś cakṣoḥ sūryo ajāyata /🔽mukhād indraś cāgniś ca prāṇād vāyur ajāyata ////
analyzed: candramāḥ manasaḥ jātaḥ cakṣoḥ sūryaḥ ajāyata  mukhāt indraḥ ca agniḥ ca prāṇāt vāyuḥ ajāyata
translated: The moon was born from his mind, the sun from his eye,🔽Indra and Agni from his mouth, and Vayu was born from his breath.

original: nābhyā āsīd antarikṣaṃ śīrṣṇo dyauḥ sam avartata /
analyzed: nābhyāḥ āsīt antarikṣam śīrṣṇaḥ dyauḥ sam avartata
translated: The atmosphere was from his navel, and the sky was formed from his head.

original: padbhyāṃ bhūmir diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokāṃ akalpayan ////🔽virāḍ agre sam abhavad virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: padbhyām bhūmiḥ diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā  virāj agre sam abhavat virājaḥ adhi pūruṣaḥ
translated: The earth from his feet, and the directions, and thus they arranged the worlds.🔽Virat first came into being, and from Virat came Purusha.

original: sa jāto aty aricyata paścād bhūmim atho puraḥ ////
analyzed: sa jātaḥ ati aricyata paścāt bhūmim atha u puras
translated: When he was born he surpassed the earth in greatness both behind and in front.

original: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñam atanvata /
analyzed: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devāḥ yajñam atanvata
translated: When the gods spread the sacrifice with the oblation of Purusha,

original: vasanto asyāsīd ājyaṃ grīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ ////
analyzed: vasantaḥ asya āsīt ājyam grīṣmaḥ idhmaḥ śarad haviḥ
translated: the spring was his ghee, the summer his fuel, and the autumn his offering.

original: taṃ yajñaṃ prāvṛṣā praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātam agraśaḥ /
analyzed: tam yajñam prāvṛṣā praukṣan puruṣam jātam agraśas
translated: They sprinkled that sacrifice, the first-born Purusha, with the rain,

original: tena devā ayajanta sādhyā vasavaś ca ye ////
analyzed: tena devāḥ ayajanta sādhyāḥ vasavaḥ ca ye
translated: with him the gods and the Sadhyas and the Vasus made sacrifice.

original: tasmād aśvā ajāyanta ye ca ke cobhayādataḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt aśvāḥ ajāyanta ye ca ke ca ubhaya adataḥ
translated: From that (sacrifice) were born the horses, and those that have two rows of teeth,

original: gāvo ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāj jātā ajāvayaḥ ////
analyzed: gāvaḥ ha jajñire tasmāt tasmāt jātāḥ aja avayaḥ
translated: From that were born the cows, from that were born the goats and sheep.

original: tasmād yajñāt sarvahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire /
analyzed: tasmāt yajñāt sarva hutaḥ ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire
translated: From that sacrifice, offered to all, the Ṛc verses and the Sāman chants were born.

original: chando ha jajñire tasmād yajus tasmād ajāyata ////
analyzed: chandaḥ ha jajñire tasmāt yajuḥ tasmāt ajāyata
translated: The metres were born from that, and from that the Yajuṣ was born.

original: tasmād yajñāt sarvahutaḥ saṃbhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyam /
analyzed: tasmāt yajñāt sarva hutaḥ saṃbhṛtam pṛṣadājyam
translated: From that sacrifice, offered to all, the speckled ghee was collected.

original: paśūṃs tāṃś cakre vāyavyān āraṇyā grāmyāś ca ye ////
analyzed: paśūn tān cakre vāyavyān āraṇyāḥ grāmyāḥ ca ye
translated: He made those animals, the wild ones and those of the village, the offerings to Vāyu.

original: saptāsyāsan paridhayas triḥ sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ /
analyzed: sapta asya āsan paridhayaḥ tris sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ
translated: It had seven enclosing sticks, three times seven kindling sticks were made,

original: devā yad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣaṃ paśum ////
analyzed: devāḥ yat yajñam tanvānāḥ abadhnan puruṣam paśum
translated: when the gods, weaving the sacrifice, bound Puruṣa as an animal.

original: mūrdhno devasya bṛhato aṃśavaḥ sapta saptatīḥ /
analyzed: mūrdhnaḥ devasya bṛhataḥ aṃśavaḥ sapta saptatīḥ
translated: The rays of the great god are seven times seven.

original: rājñaḥ somasyājāyanta jātasya puruṣād adhi ////
analyzed: rājñaḥ somasya ajāyanta jātasya puruṣāt adhi
translated: They were born from the king Soma, born from the man.

original: citrāṇi sākaṃ divi rocanāni sarīsṛpāṇi bhuvane javāni /
analyzed: citrāṇi sākam divi rocanāni sarīsṛpāṇi bhuvane javāni
translated: The variegated lights in the sky, the creeping things in the world, the swift ones,

original: turmiśaṃ sumatim ichamāno ahāni gīrbhiḥ saparyāmi nākam ////
analyzed: turmiśam sumatim icchamānaḥ ahāni gīrbhiḥ saparyāmi nākam
translated: seeking the favour of the one who is to be worshipped, I honour the days with songs, the vault.

original: suhavam agne kṛttikā rohiṇī cāstu bhadraṃ mṛgaśiraḥ śam ārdrā /
analyzed: su havam agne kṛttikā rohiṇī ca astu bhadram mṛgaśiraḥ śam ārdrā
translated: O Agni, may the Kṛttikās and Rohiṇīs be easy to invoke, may the Mṛgaśiras be auspicious, and the Ārdrā be wholesome.

original: punarvasū sūnṛtā cāru puṣyo bhānur āśleṣā ayanaṃ maghā me ////🔽puṇyaṃ pūrvā phalgunyau cātra hastaś citrā śivā svāti sukho me astu /
analyzed: punarvasū sūnṛtā cāru puṣyaḥ bhānuḥ āśleṣāḥ ayanam maghāḥ me  puṇyam pūrvā phalgunyau ca atra hastaḥ citrā śivā svāti sukhaḥ me astu
translated: Punarvasu, Sunrita, Charu, Pushya, Bhanu, Ashlesha, Magha are my paths.🔽The auspicious Purva, the two Phalgunis, Hasta, Chitra, Swati are my happiness.

original: rādhe viśākhe suhavānurādhā jyeṣṭhā sunakṣatram ariṣṭa mūlam ////
analyzed: rādhe viśākhe su havā anurādhā jyeṣṭhā su nakṣatram ariṣṭa mūlam
translated: The auspicious Vishakha, Anuradha, Jyeshtha, Mula are the best of constellations for me.

original: annaṃ pūrvā rāsatāṃ me aṣādhā ūrjaṃ devy uttarā ā vahantu /
analyzed: annam pūrvāḥ rāsatām me aṣādhāḥ ūrjam devī uttarāḥ ā vahantu
translated: Let the eastern Ashadha bring me food, let the northern Ashadha bring me strength.

original: abhijin me rāsatāṃ puṇyam eva śravaṇaḥ śraviṣṭhāḥ kurvatāṃ supuṣṭim ////
analyzed: abhijit me rāsatām puṇyam eva śravaṇaḥ śraviṣṭhāḥ kurvatām su puṣṭim
translated: Let Abhijit bring me merit, let Shravana and Shravishtha bring me good nourishment.

original: ā me mahac chatabhiṣag varīya ā me dvayā proṣṭhapadā suśarma /
analyzed: ā me mahat śata bhiṣaj varīyaḥ ā me dvayā proṣṭhapadā su śarma
translated: Let Shatabhisha bring me great prosperity, let the two Proshthapadas bring me good fortune.

original: ā revatī cāśvayujau bhagaṃ ma ā me rayiṃ bharaṇya ā vahantu ////
analyzed: ā revatī ca āśvayujau bhagam me ā me rayim bharaṇyaḥ ā vahantu
translated: Let Revati and the two Ashvayujas bring me fortune, let Bharani bring me wealth.

original: yāni nakṣatrāṇi divy antarikṣe apsu bhūmau yāni nageṣu dikṣu /
analyzed: yāni nakṣatrāṇi divi antarikṣe apsu bhūmau yāni nageṣu dikṣu
translated: The constellations that are in the sky, in the atmosphere, in the waters, on the earth, in the mountains, in the directions,

original: prakalpayaṃś candramā yāny eti sarvāṇi mamaitāni śivāni santu ////
analyzed: prakalpayan candramāḥ yāni eti sarvāṇi mama etāni śivāni santu
translated: As the moon moves through them, may all of them be auspicious for me.🔽May the twenty-eight auspicious and powerful constellations,

original: aṣṭāviṃśāni śivāni śagmāni saha yogaṃ bhajantu me /
analyzed: aṣṭāviṃśāni śivāni śagmāni saha yogam bhajantu me
translated: Together with their yogas, be favorable to me.

original: yogaṃ pra padye kṣemaṃ ca kṣemaṃ pra padye yogaṃ ca namo 'horātrābhyām astu ////
analyzed: yogam pra padye kṣemam ca kṣemam pra padye yogam ca namaḥ horātrābhyām astu
translated: I enter into union, and into safety. I enter into safety, and into union. Homage to day and night. May there be

original: svastitaṃ me suprātaḥ susāyaṃ sudivaṃ sumṛgaṃ suśakunaṃ me astu /
analyzed: svastitam me su prātar su sāyam su divam su mṛgam su śakunam me astu
translated: Good fortune for me, good morning, good evening, good day, good hunting, good omen for me.

original: suhavam agne svasty amartyaṃ gatvā punar āyābhinandan ////
analyzed: su havam agne svasti amartyam gatvā punar āya abhinandan
translated: May it be easy to invoke, O Agni, may it be safe, immortal, going and returning again, rejoicing.

original: anuhavaṃ parihavaṃ parivādaṃ parikṣavam /
analyzed: anuhavam parihavam parivādam parikṣavam
translated: The quarrel, the dispute, the slander, the destruction,

original: sarvair me riktakumbhān parā tānt savitaḥ suva ////🔽apapāpaṃ parikṣavaṃ puṇyaṃ bhakṣīmahi kṣavam /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ me rikta kumbhān parā tān savitar suva  apapāpam parikṣavam puṇyam bhakṣīmahi kṣavam
translated: All the empty vessels of mine, O Savitar, lead them away.🔽The sin, the destruction, may we enjoy the meritorious destruction.

original: śivā te pāpa nāsikāṃ puṇyagaś cābhi mehatām ////
analyzed: śivā te pāpa nāsikām puṇyagaḥ ca abhi mehatām
translated: May the auspicious and the meritorious rain upon thy nose, O sin.

original: imā yā brahmaṇas pate viṣucīr vāta īrate /
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ brahmaṇas pate viṣucīḥ vāte īrate
translated: These which, O lord of prayer, the wind drives in different directions,

original: sadhrīcīr indra tāḥ kṛtvā mahyaṃ śivatamās kṛdhi ////
analyzed: sadhrīcīḥ indra tāḥ kṛtvā mahyam śivatamāḥ kṛdhi
translated: Making them all to tend towards me, O Indra, make them most auspicious for me.

original: svasti no astv abhayaṃ no astu namo 'horatrābhyām astu ////
analyzed: svasti naḥ astu abhayam naḥ astu namaḥ horatrābhyām astu
translated: May there be welfare for us, may there be freedom from fear for us. Homage to day and night. May there be

original: śāntā dyauḥ śāntā pṛthivī śāntam idam urv antarikṣam /
analyzed: śāntā dyauḥ śāntā pṛthivī śāntam idam uru antarikṣam
translated: The sky is tranquil, the earth is tranquil, this wide atmosphere is tranquil.

original: śāntā udanvatīr āpaḥ śāntā naḥ santv oṣadhīḥ ////
analyzed: śāntāḥ udanvatīḥ āpaḥ śāntāḥ naḥ santu oṣadhīḥ
translated: The waters are tranquil with the clouds, may the plants be tranquil for us.

original: śāntāni pūrvarūpāṇi śāntaṃ no astu kṛtākṛtam /
analyzed: śāntāni pūrvarūpāṇi śāntam naḥ astu kṛta akṛtam
translated: The former forms are tranquil, may what is done and undone be tranquil for us.

original: śāntaṃ bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca sarvam eva śam astu naḥ ////
analyzed: śāntam bhūtam ca bhavyam ca sarvam eva śam astu naḥ
translated: May all that is past, present, and future be auspicious to us.

original: iyaṃ yā parameṣṭhinī vāg devī brahmasaṃśitā /
analyzed: iyam yā parameṣṭhinī vāc devī brahma saṃśitā
translated: This speech of the supreme lord, which is divine and purified by Brahman,

original: yayaiva sasṛje ghoraṃ tayaiva śāntir astu naḥ ////
analyzed: yayā eva sasṛje ghoram tayā eva śāntiḥ astu naḥ
translated: By which he created the terrible, by that very thing may there be peace for us.

original: idaṃ yat parameṣṭhinaṃ mano vāṃ brahmasaṃśitam /
analyzed: idam yat parameṣṭhinam manaḥ vām brahma saṃśitam
translated: This mind of mine, which is supreme and purified by Brahman,

original: yenaiva sasṛje ghoraṃ tenaiva śāntir astu naḥ ////
analyzed: yena eva sasṛje ghoram tena eva śāntiḥ astu naḥ
translated: By which it created the terrible, by that very thing may there be peace for us.

original: imāni yāni pañcendriyāni manaḥṣaṣṭhāni me hṛdi brahmaṇā saṃśitāni /
analyzed: imāni yāni pañca indriyāni manaḥ ṣaṣṭhāni me hṛdi brahmaṇā saṃśitāni
translated: These five senses of mine, along with the mind as the sixth, which are purified by Brahman in my heart,

original: yair eva sasṛje ghoraṃ tair eva śāntir astu naḥ ////
analyzed: yaiḥ eva sasṛje ghoram taiḥ eva śāntiḥ astu naḥ
translated: By which it created the terrible, by those very things may there be peace for us.

original: śaṃ no mitraḥ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ viṣṇuḥ śaṃ prajāpatiḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ mitraḥ śam varuṇaḥ śam viṣṇuḥ śam prajāpatiḥ
translated: May Mitra be auspicious to us, may Varuna, may Vishnu, may Prajapati,

original: śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no bhavatv aryamā ////
analyzed: śam naḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ śam naḥ bhavatu aryamā
translated: May Indra, may Brihaspati, may Aryama be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no mitraḥ śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ vivasvāṃ cham antakaḥ /🔽utpātāḥ pārthivāntarikṣāḥ śaṃ no divicarā grahāḥ ////🔽śaṃ no bhūmir vepyamānā śam ulkā nirhataṃ ca yat /
analyzed: śam naḥ mitraḥ śam varuṇaḥ śam vivasvān śam antakaḥ  utpātāḥ pārthiva āntarikṣāḥ śam naḥ divicarāḥ grahāḥ  śam naḥ bhūmiḥ vepyamānā śam ulkā nirhatam ca yat
translated: May Mitra be auspicious to us, may Varuna, may Vivasvan, may the Destroyer,🔽The terrestrial and atmospheric portents, may the planets moving in the sky be auspicious to us.🔽May the trembling earth be auspicious to us, and the falling meteors,

original: śaṃ gāvo lohitakṣīrāḥ śaṃ bhūmir ava tīryatīḥ ////
analyzed: śam gāvaḥ lohita kṣīrāḥ śam bhūmiḥ ava tīryatīḥ
translated: May the cows with red milk be auspicious, and the earth covered with water.

original: nakṣatram ulkābhihataṃ śam astu naḥ śaṃ no 'bhicārāḥ śam u santu kṛtyāḥ /🔽śaṃ no nikhātā valgāḥ śam ulkā deśopasargāḥ śam u no bhavantu ////
analyzed: nakṣatram ulkā abhihatam śam astu naḥ śam naḥ bhicārāḥ śam u santu kṛtyāḥ  śam naḥ nikhātāḥ valgāḥ śam ulkāḥ deśa upasargāḥ śam u naḥ bhavantu
translated: May the star struck by a meteor be auspicious to us. May our magical spells and witchcraft be auspicious.🔽May the buried ploughshares and the flying sparks be auspicious to us. May the calamities in the country be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no grahāś cāndramasāḥ śam ādityaś ca rāhuṇā /
analyzed: śam naḥ grahāḥ cāndramasāḥ śam ādityaḥ ca rāhuṇā
translated: May the lunar eclipses be auspicious to us. May the sun be auspicious with Rahu.

original: śaṃ no mṛtyur dhūmaketuḥ śaṃ rudrās tigmatejasaḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ mṛtyuḥ dhūmaketuḥ śam rudrāḥ tigma tejasaḥ
translated: May death, the comet, and the Rudras of sharp brilliance be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ rudrāḥ śaṃ vasavaḥ śam ādityāḥ śam agnayaḥ /
analyzed: śam rudrāḥ śam vasavaḥ śam ādityāḥ śam agnayaḥ
translated: May the Rudras, the Vasus, the Adityas, the fires,

original: śaṃ no maharṣayo devāḥ śaṃ devāḥ śaṃ bṛhaspatiḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ devāḥ śam devāḥ śam bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: May the great sages, the gods, all the gods, and Brihaspati be auspicious to us.

original: brahma prajāpatir dhātā lokā vedāḥ saptaṛṣayo 'gnayaḥ /
analyzed: brahma prajāpatiḥ dhātā lokāḥ vedāḥ sapta ṛṣayaḥ gnayaḥ
translated: Brahma, Prajapati, the creator, the worlds, the Vedas, the seven sages, the fires,

original: tair me kṛtaṃ svastyayanam indro me śarma yachatu brahmā me śarma yachatu /
analyzed: taiḥ me kṛtam svastyayanam indraḥ me śarma yacchatu brahmā me śarma yacchatu
translated: By them may I have accomplished well-being. May Indra grant me protection. May Brahma grant me protection.

original: viśve me devāḥ śarma yachantu sarve me devāḥ śarma yachantu ////
analyzed: viśve me devāḥ śarma yacchantu sarve me devāḥ śarma yacchantu
translated: May all the gods grant me protection. May all the gods grant me protection.

original: yāni kāni cic chāntāni loke saptaṛṣayo viduḥ /
analyzed: yāni kāni cit śāntāni loke sapta ṛṣayaḥ viduḥ
translated: Whatever peaceful things the seven sages know in the world,

original: sarvāṇi śaṃ bhavantu me śaṃ me astv abhayaṃ me astu ////
analyzed: sarvāṇi śam bhavantu me śam me astu abhayam me astu
translated: May all of them be auspicious to me. May I be well. May I be free from fear.
