original: pṛthivī śāntir antarikṣaṃ śāntir dyauḥ śāntir āpaḥ śāntir oṣadhayaḥ śāntir vanaspatayaḥ śāntir viśve me devāḥ śāntiḥ sarve me
analyzed: pṛthivī śāntiḥ antarikṣam śāntiḥ dyauḥ śāntiḥ āpaḥ śāntiḥ oṣadhayaḥ śāntiḥ vanaspatayaḥ śāntiḥ viśve me devāḥ śāntiḥ sarve me
translated: The earth is peace, the atmosphere is peace, the sky is peace, the waters are peace, the plants are peace, the trees are peace, all the gods are peace for me, all the

original: devāḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntibhiḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntibhiḥ
translated: Earth is peace, the atmosphere is peace, the sky is peace, the waters are peace, the plants are peace, the trees are peace, all the gods are peace for me, all the gods are peace for me, peace, peace, peace, peace with the peace-makers.

original: yad iha ghoraṃ yad iha krūraṃ yad iha pāpaṃ tac chāntaṃ tac chivaṃ sarvam eva śam astu naḥ ////
analyzed: yat iha ghoram yat iha krūram yat iha pāpam tat śāntam tat śivam sarvam eva śam astu naḥ
translated: Whatever is terrible here, whatever is cruel here, whatever is sinful here, that is pacified, that is auspicious, may everything be peace for us.

original: śaṃ na indrāgnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā /
analyzed: śam naḥ indra agnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śam naḥ indrāvaruṇā rāta havyā
translated: Be auspicious to us, O Indra and Agni, with your favours; be auspicious to us, O Indra and Varuna, accepting offerings;

original: śam indrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau ////
analyzed: śam indrāsomā suvitāya śam yos śam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau
translated: Be auspicious to Indra and Soma for prosperity, and to the two Asvins; be auspicious to Indra and Pusan in the winning of strength.

original: śaṃ no bhagaḥ śam u naḥ śaṃso astu śaṃ naḥ puraṃdhiḥ śam u santu rāyaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ bhagaḥ śam u naḥ śaṃsaḥ astu śam naḥ puraṃdhiḥ śam u santu rāyaḥ
translated: Be auspicious to us, Bhaga, and let our praise be auspicious to us; be auspicious to us, Purandhi, and let our riches be auspicious.

original: śaṃ naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṃsaḥ śaṃ no aryamā purujāto astu ////
analyzed: śam naḥ satyasya su yamasya śaṃsaḥ śam naḥ aryamā puru jātaḥ astu
translated: Be auspicious to us the praise of the well-governed truth; be auspicious to us Aryaman, born of many.

original: śaṃ no dhātā śam u dhartā no astu śaṃ na urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ dhātā śam u dhartā naḥ astu śam naḥ urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ
translated: Be auspicious to us the supporter, and let the supporter be auspicious to us; be auspicious to us the far-reaching one with its own powers.

original: śaṃ rodasī bṛhatī śaṃ no adriḥ śaṃ no devānāṃ suhavāni santu ////
analyzed: śam rodasī bṛhatī śam naḥ adriḥ śam naḥ devānām su havāni santu
translated: Be auspicious to us the two great worlds, and be auspicious to us the mountain; be auspicious to us the well-disposed of the gods.

original: śaṃ no agnir jyotiranīko astu śaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāv aśvinā śam /
analyzed: śam naḥ agniḥ jyotiḥ anīkaḥ astu śam naḥ mitrāvaruṇau aśvinā śam
translated: May Agni, the light-bringer, be auspicious to us, may Mitra, Varuna, and the Ashvins be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ sukṛtāṃ sukṛtāni santu śaṃ na iṣiro abhi vātu vātaḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ su kṛtām sukṛtāni santu śam naḥ iṣiraḥ abhi vātu vātaḥ
translated: May our good deeds be auspicious to us, may the swift wind blow auspiciously to us.

original: śaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvahūtau śam antarikṣaṃ dṛśaye no astu /
analyzed: śam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī pūrva hūtau śam antarikṣam dṛśaye naḥ astu
translated: May heaven and earth be auspicious to us when first invoked, may the atmosphere be auspicious for us to see.

original: śaṃ na oṣadhīr vanino bhavantu śaṃ no rajasas patir astu jiṣṇuḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ rajasaḥ patiḥ astu jiṣṇuḥ
translated: May the plants and trees be auspicious to us, may the powerful lord of the realm be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ na indro vasubhir devo astu śam ādityebhir varuṇaḥ suśaṃsaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ indraḥ vasubhiḥ devaḥ astu śam ādityebhiḥ varuṇaḥ su śaṃsaḥ
translated: May the god Indra be auspicious to us with the Vasus, may Varuna be well-praised with the Adityas.

original: śaṃ no rudro rudrebhir jalāṣaḥ śaṃ nas tvaṣṭā gnābhir iha śṛṇotu ////🔽śaṃ naḥ somo bhavatu brahma śaṃ naḥ śaṃ no grāvāṇaḥ śam u santu yajñāḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ rudraḥ rudrebhiḥ jalāṣaḥ śam naḥ tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ iha śṛṇotu  śam naḥ somaḥ bhavatu brahma śam naḥ śam naḥ grāvāṇaḥ śam u santu yajñāḥ
translated: May Rudra be auspicious to us with the Rudras, may Tvastr be auspicious to us here with the wives.🔽May Soma be auspicious to us, may the Brahman be auspicious to us, may the pressing-stones be auspicious to us, and may the sacrifices be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ svarūnāṃ mitayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ prasvaḥ śam v astu vediḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ svarūnām mitayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ prasvaḥ śam u astu vediḥ
translated: May the measures of our chants be auspicious to us, may the Prasu (cow) be auspicious to us, and may the altar be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ sūrya urucakṣā ud etu śaṃ no bhavantu pradiśaś catasraḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ sūryaḥ uru cakṣāḥ ud etu śam naḥ bhavantu pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: May the far-seeing sun rise auspiciously to us, may the four quarters be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ parvatā dhruvayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ sindhavaḥ śam u santv āpaḥ ////
analyzed: śam naḥ parvatāḥ dhruvayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ sindhavaḥ śam u santu āpaḥ
translated: May the firm mountains be auspicious to us, may the rivers and waters be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no aditir bhavatu vratebhiḥ śaṃ no bhavantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ aditiḥ bhavatu vratebhiḥ śam naḥ bhavantu marutaḥ su arkāḥ
translated: May Aditi be gracious to us with her ordinances; may the Maruts, the joyous ones, be gracious to us.

original: śaṃ no viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā no astu śaṃ no bhavitraṃ śam v astu vāyuḥ ////🔽śaṃ no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavantūṣaso vibhātīḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā naḥ astu śam naḥ bhavitram śam u astu vāyuḥ  śam naḥ devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavantu uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: May Vishnu be gracious to us, and may Pûshan be gracious to us; may the disposer be gracious to us, and may Vâyu be gracious to us.🔽May the God Savitar, the protector, be gracious to us; may the shining Dawns be gracious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ parjanyo bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śaṃ naḥ kṣetrasya patir astu śaṃbhuḥ ////🔽śaṃ naḥ satyasya patayo bhavantu śaṃ no arvantaḥ śam u santu gāvaḥ /
analyzed: śam naḥ parjanyaḥ bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śam naḥ kṣetrasya patiḥ astu śaṃbhuḥ  śam naḥ satyasya patayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ arvantaḥ śam u santu gāvaḥ
translated: May Parjanya be gracious to the people; may the auspicious Lord of the field be gracious to us.🔽May the Lords of Truth be gracious to us; may the horses be gracious to us, and may the cows be gracious to us.

original: śaṃ na ṛbhavaḥ sukṛtaḥ suhastāḥ śaṃ no bhavatu pitaro haveṣu ////
analyzed: śam naḥ ṛbhavaḥ su kṛtaḥ su hastāḥ śam naḥ bhavatu pitaraḥ haveṣu
translated: May the Rkvans, the well-made, the well-handed, be gracious to us; may the Fathers be gracious to us in our invocations.

original: śaṃ no devā viśvadevā bhavantu śaṃ sarasvatī saha dhībhir astu /
analyzed: śam naḥ devāḥ viśva devāḥ bhavantu śam sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ astu
translated: May the Gods, all the Gods, be gracious to us; may Sarasvatî with the hymns be gracious to us.

original: śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śaṃ no divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śaṃ no apyāḥ ////🔽śaṃ no aja ekapād devo astu śam ahir budhnyaḥ śaṃ samudraḥ /
analyzed: śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śam naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śam naḥ apyāḥ  śam naḥ ajaḥ ekapād devaḥ astu śam ahiḥ budhnyaḥ śam samudraḥ
translated: Gracious be the Abhiṣaks, gracious the Râtisâks; gracious to us be the heavenly ones, the earthly ones, and the watery ones.🔽Gracious to us be the God, the one-footed, the goat; gracious be the deep-lying serpent, gracious the ocean.

original: śaṃ no apāṃ napāt perur astu śaṃ naḥ pṛṣṇir bhavatu devagopā ////
analyzed: śam naḥ apām napāt peruḥ astu śam naḥ pṛṣṇiḥ bhavatu deva gopā
translated: Gracious to us be the son of the waters, the swift one; gracious to us be the swift one, the God-protected one.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavo juṣantām idaṃ brahma kriyamāṇaṃ navīyaḥ /
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ juṣantām idam brahma kriyamāṇam navīyaḥ
translated: May the Adityas, Rudras, and Vasus accept this new prayer that is being made.

original: sṛṇvantu no divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ ////
analyzed: sṛṇvantu naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāsaḥ go jātāḥ uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: May the heavenly ones, the earthly ones, and those born from the cow, and those worthy of sacrifice listen to us.

original: ye devānām ṛtvijo yajñiyāso manor yajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: ye devānām ṛtvijaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ manoḥ yajatrāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: Those who are the worthy priests of the gods, the performers of sacrifice, the immortal ones who know the truth,

original: te no rāsantām urugāyam adya yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ////
analyzed: te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: may they grant us wide pasture today. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: tad astu mitrāvaruṇā tad agne śaṃ yor asmabhyam idam astu śastam /
analyzed: tat astu mitrāvaruṇā tat agne śam yos asmabhyam idam astu śastam
translated: May that be so, O Mitra-Varuna, O Agni, may that be a blessing for us. May that be praised by us.

original: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhāṃ namo dive bṛhate sādanāya ////
analyzed: aśīmahi gādham uta pratiṣṭhām namaḥ dive bṛhate sādanāya
translated: May we attain the ford and the foundation. Homage to the great heaven, to the seat.

original: uṣā apa svasus tamaḥ saṃ vartayati vartaniṃ sujātatā /
analyzed: uṣāḥ apa svasuḥ tamaḥ sam vartayati vartanim sujāta tā
translated: Dawn removes the darkness from her sisters and turns the wheel, well-born.

original: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ////
analyzed: ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: May we obtain the strength that is favored by the gods. May we rejoice for a hundred winters with good heroes.

original: indrasya bāhū sthavirau vṛṣāṇau citrā imā vṛṣabhau pārayiṣṇū /
analyzed: indrasya bāhū sthavirau vṛṣāṇau citrā imā vṛṣabhau pārayiṣṇū
translated: The two mighty arms of Indra are strong and powerful, these two bulls are variegated and able to deliver.

original: tau yokṣe prathamo yoga āgate yābhyāṃ jitam asurāṇāṃ svar yat ////
analyzed: tau prathamaḥ yogaḥ āgate yābhyām jitam asurāṇām svar yat
translated: I yoke them, the first to be yoked, when they come, by which the heavenly world of the Asuras was conquered.

original: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaś carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: āśuḥ śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Swiftly sharpening, terrible like a bull, the crusher of the strong, the agitator of men,

original: saṃkrandano 'nimiṣa ekavīraḥ śataṃ senā ajayat sākam indraḥ ////
analyzed: saṃkrandanaḥ nimiṣaḥ eka vīraḥ śatam senāḥ ajayat sākam indraḥ
translated: The roaring, unblinking, solitary hero, Indra, together with a hundred armies, has conquered.

original: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunāyodhyena duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā /
analyzed: saṃkrandanena animiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā ayodhyena duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā
translated: With the roaring, unblinking, victorious, fighting, hard-to-overthrow, bold one,

original: tad indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho nara iṣuhastena vṛṣṇā ////
analyzed: tat indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvam yudhaḥ naraḥ iṣu hastena vṛṣṇā
translated: With that, O Indra, conquer, and be victorious together with that, O men, with the warrior, the mighty one with the bow in his hand.

original: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhir vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudha indro gaṇena /
analyzed: saḥ iṣu hastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhiḥ vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaḥ indraḥ gaṇena
translated: He, the powerful one, with the bow in his hand, with the quiver, the gatherer, Indra with the troop,

original: saṃsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhy ugradhanvā pratihitābhir astā ////
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭa jit soma pāḥ bāhuśardhī ugra dhanvā pratihitābhiḥ astā
translated: The conqueror in the gathering, the drinker of Soma, the mighty-armed, the wielder of the fierce bow, with the missiles.

original: balavijñāyaḥ sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamāna ugraḥ /
analyzed: bala vijñāyaḥ sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ
translated: The powerful one, the mighty one, the hero, the leader, the conqueror, the strong one, the mighty one, the fierce one,

original: abhivīro abhiṣatvā sahojij jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha govidam ////🔽imaṃ vīram anu harṣadhvam ugram indraṃ sakhāyo anu saṃ rabhadhvam /
analyzed: abhivīraḥ abhiṣatvā sahaḥ jit jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha go vidam  imam vīram anu harṣadhvam ugram indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam
translated: The hero, the consecrated, the powerful one, O Indra, mount the victorious chariot that finds cattle.🔽Rejoice in this hero, the mighty one, O friends, be eager for Indra.

original: grāmajitaṃ gojitaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā ////
analyzed: grāma jitam go jitam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā
translated: The conqueror of villages, the conqueror of cattle, the one with the thunderbolt in his arm, the victor, the one who crushes the army with his strength.

original: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamāno 'dāya ugraḥ śatamanyur indraḥ /
analyzed: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamānaḥ dāyaḥ ugraḥ śata manyuḥ indraḥ
translated: Plunging into the cattle pens with force, the fierce Indra with a hundred resentments, taking (the cattle),

original: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḍ ayodhyo 'smākaṃ senā avatu pra yutsu ////
analyzed: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāh a yodhyaḥ smākam senāḥ avatu pra yutsu
translated: May Duścyavana, Pṛtanāṣaṭ, Ayoध्य, protect our army in the battles.

original: bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrāṃ apabādhamānaḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate pari dīya rathena rakṣaḥ hā amitrān apabādhamānaḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, go around with your chariot, as the slayer of demons, repelling the enemies.

original: prabhañjaṃ chatrūn pramṛṇann amitrān asmākam edhy avitā tanūnām ////
analyzed: prabhañjam śatrūn pramṛṇan amitrān asmākam edhi avitā tanūnām
translated: Crushing the foes, destroying the enemies, be you our protector of the bodies.

original: indra eṣāṃ netā bṛhaspatir dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etu somaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ eṣām netā bṛhaspatiḥ dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ puras etu somaḥ
translated: May Indra be their leader, Brihaspati the priest, may the sacrifice go in front, and Soma.

original: devasenānām abhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnāṃ maruto yantu madhye ////
analyzed: deva senānām abhibhañjatīnām jayantīnām marutaḥ yantu madhye
translated: May the Maruts go in the midst of the victorious and conquering armies of the gods.

original: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutāṃ śardha ugram /
analyzed: indrasya vṛṣṇaḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ ādityānām marutām śardhaḥ ugram
translated: The mighty host of Indra, Vṛṣṇa, King Varuṇa, the Ādityas, and Maruts,

original: mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣo devānāṃ jayatām ud asthāt ////
analyzed: mahāmanasām bhuvanacyavānām ghoṣaḥ devānām jayatām ud asthāt
translated: The shout of the victorious gods, of great minds, who shake the worlds, has arisen.

original: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣv asmākaṃ yā iṣavas tā jayantu /
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tāḥ jayantu
translated: May Indra be with our banners in the battles, may our arrows be victorious.

original: asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantv asmān devāso 'vatā haveṣu ////
analyzed: asmākam vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmān devāsaḥ vata haveṣu
translated: May our heroes be superior, help us, O gods, in the sacrifices.

original: idam ucchreyo 'vasānam āgāṃ śive me dyāvāpṛthivī abhūtām /
analyzed: idam ucchreyaḥ vasānam āgām śive me dyāvāpṛthivī abhūtām
translated: I have come to this most excellent dwelling; may heaven and earth be propitious to me.

original: asapatnāḥ pradiśo me bhavantu na vai tvā dviṣmo abhayaṃ no astu ////
analyzed: asapatnāḥ pradiśaḥ me bhavantu na vai tvā dviṣmaḥ abhayam naḥ astu
translated: May the quarters be without enemies to me; we do not hate you; may there be safety for us.

original: yata indra bhayāmahe tato no abhayaṃ kṛdhi /
analyzed: yatas indra bhayāmahe tatas naḥ abhayam kṛdhi
translated: From whatever we fear, O Indra, from that make us free from fear.

original: maghavaṃ chagdhi tava tvaṃ na ūtibhir vi dviṣo vi mṛdho jahi ////
analyzed: maghavan śagdhi tava tvam naḥ ūtibhiḥ vi dviṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: Be gracious, O Maghavan, with thy aids, drive away the foes, drive away the enemies.

original: indraṃ vayam anūrādhaṃ havāmahe 'nu rādhyāsma dvipadā catuṣpadā /
analyzed: indram vayam anūrādham havāmahe nu rādhyāsma dvipadā catuṣpadā
translated: We invoke Indra, the bountiful one, may he be bountiful to us in bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: mā naḥ senā araruṣīr upa gur viṣūcir indra druho vi nāśaya ////
analyzed: mā naḥ senāḥ a raruṣīḥ upa guḥ viṣūciḥ indra druhaḥ vi nāśaya
translated: Let not his red-coloured armies oppress us, O Indra, destroy the wide-spreading enemies.

original: indras trātota vṛtrahā parasphāno vareṇyaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ trātā uta vṛtra hā parasphānaḥ vareṇyaḥ
translated: Indra, the protector, the slayer of Vrtra, the bountiful one, the excellent one,

original: sa rakṣitā caramataḥ sa madhyataḥ sa paścāt sa purastān no astu ////
analyzed: sa rakṣitā caramatas sa madhyatas sa paścāt sa purastāt naḥ astu
translated: he is the protector from the front, from the middle, from the back, from the east, may he be to us.

original: uruṃ no lokam anu neṣi vidvānt svar yaj jyotir abhayaṃ svasti /
analyzed: urum naḥ lokam anu neṣi vidvān svar yat jyotiḥ abhayam svasti
translated: O wise one, lead us to a wide world, to the heaven, to the light, to safety, to bliss.

original: ugrā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū upa kṣayema śaraṇā bṛhantā ////🔽abhayaṃ naḥ karaty antarikṣam abhayaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime /
analyzed: ugrā te indra sthavirasya bāhū upa kṣayema śaraṇā bṛhantā  abhayam naḥ karati antarikṣam abhayam dyāvāpṛthivī ubhe ime
translated: The mighty arms of thine, O Indra, the strong one, are our great protection.🔽The atmosphere gives us safety, the two, heaven and earth, give us safety.

original: abhayaṃ paścād abhayaṃ purastād uttarād adharād abhayaṃ no astu ////
analyzed: abhayam paścāt abhayam purastāt uttarāt adharāt abhayam naḥ astu
translated: Safety from the west, safety from the east, safety from the north, safety from the south, may it be to us.

original: abhayaṃ mitrād abhayam amitrād abhayaṃ jñātād abhayaṃ puro yaḥ /
analyzed: abhayam mitrāt abhayam amitrāt abhayam jñātāt abhayam puras yaḥ
translated: Safety from a friend, safety from a foe, safety from an acquaintance, safety from the one in front,

original: abhayaṃ naktam abhayaṃ divā naḥ sarvā āśā mama mitraṃ bhavantu ////
analyzed: abhayam naktam abhayam divā naḥ sarvāḥ āśāḥ mama mitram bhavantu
translated: Safety by night, safety by day for us, may all the quarters be a friend to me.

original: asapatnaṃ purastāt paścān no abhayaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: asapatnam purastāt paścāt naḥ abhayam kṛtam
translated: Free from foes in front, from behind make us free from fear.

original: savitā mā dakṣiṇata uttarān mā śacīpatiḥ ////
analyzed: savitā mā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt mā śacī patiḥ
translated: May Savitar from the south, may Sachi's lord from the north,

original: divo mādityā rakṣatu bhūmyā rakṣantv agnayaḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ mā adityā rakṣatu bhūmyāḥ rakṣantu agnayaḥ
translated: May the Âdityas from the sky, may the fires from the earth protect me.

original: indrāgnī rakṣatāṃ mā purastād aśvināv abhitaḥ śarma yachatām /
analyzed: indra agnī rakṣatām mā purastāt aśvinau abhitas śarma yacchatām
translated: May Indra and Agni protect me from the east, may the two Asvins on both sides grant me protection.

original: tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedā bhūtakṛto me sarvataḥ santu varma ////
analyzed: tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedāḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ me sarvatas santu varma
translated: May the all-creating Gâtavedas protect me from the oblique, may they be a shield to me on every side.

original: agnir mā pātu vasubhiḥ purastāt tasmin krame tasmiṃ chraye tāṃ puraṃ praimi /
analyzed: agniḥ mā pātu vasubhiḥ purastāt tasmin krame tasmin śraye tām puram praimi
translated: May Agni protect me from the east with the Vasus, in that step, in that abode, I enter that fortress.

original: sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmā ātmānaṃ pari dade svāhā ////
analyzed: sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā
translated: May he protect me, may he guard me, to him I give myself, hail!

original: vāyur māntarikṣeṇaitasyā diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmiṃ chraye tāṃ puraṃ praimi /
analyzed: vāyuḥ mā antarikṣeṇa etasyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmin śraye tām puram praimi
translated: May Vâyu protect me from the north with the atmosphere, in that step, in that abode, I enter that fortress.

original: sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmā ātmānaṃ pari dade svāhā ////
analyzed: sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā
translated: May he protect me, may he guard me, to him I give myself, hail!

original: somo mā rudrair dakṣiṇāyā diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmiṃ chraye tāṃ puraṃ praimi /
analyzed: somaḥ mā rudraiḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ diśaḥ pātu tasmin krame tasmin śraye tām puram praimi
translated: May Soma, with the Rudras, protect me from the southern quarter. In that course, in that abode, I enter that city.

original: sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmā ātmānaṃ pari dade svāhā ////
analyzed: sa mā rakṣatu sa mā gopāyatu tasmai ātmānam pari dade svāhā

translated: To the eight-versed (hymns), Svâhâ!

original: navarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////🔽daśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: nava ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā  daśarcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the nine-versed (hymns), Svâhâ!🔽To the ten-versed (hymns), Svâhâ!

original: ekādaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: ekādaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the eleven-versed (hymns), Svâhâ!

original: dvādaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: dvādaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the twelve-versed (hymns), Svâhâ!

original: trayodaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: trayodaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the thirteen-versed (hymns) hail!

original: caturdaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: caturdaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the fourteen-versed (hymns) hail!

original: pañcadaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: pañcadaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the fifteen-versed (hymns) hail!

original: ṣoḍaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the sixteen-versed (hymns) hail!

original: saptadaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: saptadaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the seventeen-versed (hymns) hail!

original: aṣṭādaśarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////🔽ekonaviṃśatiḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa ṛcebhyaḥ svāhā  ekonaviṃśatiḥ svāhā
translated: To the eighteen-versed (hymns) hail!🔽To the nineteen-versed (hymns) hail!

original: viṃśatiḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: viṃśatiḥ svāhā
translated: To the twenty-versed (hymns) hail!

original: mahatkāṇḍāya svāhā ////🔽tṛcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: mahat kāṇḍāya svāhā  tṛcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the Great Section hail!🔽To the three-versed (hymns) hail!

original: ekarcebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: ekarcebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the one-versed (hymns) hail!

original: kṣudrebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: kṣudrebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the small (hymns) hail!

original: ekānṛcebhyaḥ svāhā ////🔽rohitebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: eka anṛcebhyaḥ svāhā  rohitebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the one-verse (hymns) hail!🔽To the red (hymns) hail!

original: sūryābhyāṃ svāhā ////🔽vrātyābhyāṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: sūryābhyām svāhā  vrātyābhyām svāhā
translated: To the two Sūryas hail!🔽To the two Vrātya (hymns) hail!

original: prājāpatyābhyāṃ svāhā ////
analyzed: prājāpatyābhyām svāhā
translated: To the two Prājāpatya (hymns) hail!

original: viṣāsahyai svāhā ////
analyzed: viṣāsahyai svāhā
translated: To the Viṣāsahya (hymns) hail!

original: maṅgalikebhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: maṅgalikebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the auspicious (hymns) hail!

original: brahmaṇe svāhā ////
analyzed: brahmaṇe svāhā
translated: To Brahman hail!

original: brahmajyeṣṭhā saṃbhṛtā vīryāṇi brahmāgre jyeṣṭhaṃ divam ā tatāna /
analyzed: brahma jyeṣṭhā saṃbhṛtā vīryāṇi brahma agre jyeṣṭham divam ā tatāna
translated: Brahman is the eldest, the powers are collected; Brahman first stretched out the highest heaven.

original: bhūtānāṃ brahmā prathamota jajñe tenārhati brahmaṇā spardhituṃ kaḥ ////
analyzed: bhūtānām brahmā prathamā uta jajñe tena arhati brahmaṇā spardhitum kaḥ
translated: Brahman was born first of all beings; who is worthy to contend with Brahman?

original: yena devaṃ savitāraṃ pari devā adhārayan /
analyzed: yena devam savitāram pari devāḥ adhārayan
translated: By whom they have established around the god Savitar the gods,

original: tenemaṃ brahmaṇas pate pari rāṣṭrāya dhattana ////
analyzed: tena imam brahmaṇaḥ pate pari rāṣṭrāya dhattana
translated: Therefore, O Brahmanaspati, do ye bestow this (child) on the kingdom for its protection.

original: parīmam indram āyuṣe mahe kṣatrāya dhattana /
analyzed: pari imam indram āyuṣe mahe kṣatrāya dhattana
translated: Do ye bestow this Indra on (his father) for long life, for great lordship,

original: yathainaṃ jarase nayāj jyok kṣatre 'dhi jāgarat ////
analyzed: yathā enam jarase nayāt jyok kṣatre dhi jāgarat
translated: So that he may lead him to old age, so that he may watch over him in the lordship for a long time.

original: parīmam indram āyuṣe mahe śrotrāya dhattana /
analyzed: pari imam indram āyuṣe mahe śrotrāya dhattana
translated: Do ye bestow this Indra on (his father) for long life, for great hearing,

original: yathainaṃ jarase nayāj jyok śrotre 'dhi jāgarat ////
analyzed: yathā enam jarase nayāt jyok śrotre dhi jāgarat
translated: So that he may lead him to old age, so that he may watch over him in the hearing for a long time.

original: pari dhatta dhatta no varcasemaṃ jarāmṛtyuṃ kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ /
analyzed: pari dhatta dhatta naḥ varcasā imam jarā mṛtyum kṛṇuta dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: Do ye bestow him, do ye bestow him on us for glory; make him free from old age and death, give him long life.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prāyachad vāsa etat somāya rājñe paridhātavā u ////🔽jarāṃ su gacha pari dhatsva vāso bhavā gṛṣṭīnām abhiśastipā u /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prāyacchat vāsaḥ etat somāya rājñe paridhātavai u  jarām su gacha pari dhatsva vāsaḥ bhava gṛṣṭīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u
translated: Brihaspati has given him this garment, so that King Soma may put it on.🔽Do thou attain old age, put on this garment; be thou the protector of the milch cows from the curse.

original: śataṃ ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaś ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva ////🔽parīdaṃ vāso adhithāḥ svastaye 'bhūr vāpīnām abhiśastipā u /
analyzed: śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcī rāyaḥ ca poṣam upasaṃvyayasva  pari idam vāsaḥ adhithāḥ svastaye bhūḥ vāpīnām abhiśasti pāḥ u
translated: Live a hundred long years, and enjoy the increase of wealth.🔽Thou hast put on this garment for prosperity; thou hast become the protector of the milch cows from the curse.

original: śataṃ ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcīr vasūni cārur vi bhajāsi jīvan ////
analyzed: śatam ca jīva śaradaḥ purūcīḥ vasūni cāruḥ vi bhajāsi jīvan
translated: Living, thou shalt divide the fair treasures; live a hundred long years.

original: yogeyoge tavastaraṃ vājevāje havāmahe /
analyzed: yoge yoge tavastaram vāje vāje havāmahe
translated: In every need, in every contest, we invoke him, as in every race,

original: sakhāya indram ūtaye ////
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye
translated: The friend, Indra, to help us.

original: hiraṇyavarṇo ajaraḥ suvīro jarāmṛtyuḥ prajayā saṃ viśasva /
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇaḥ ajaraḥ su vīraḥ jarā mṛtyuḥ prajayā sam viśasva
translated: Golden-hued, ageless, with good heroes, with offspring enter thou the death that is not old age.

original: tad agnir āha tad u soma āha bṛhaspatiḥ savitā tad indraḥ ////
analyzed: tat agniḥ āha tat u somaḥ āha bṛhaspatiḥ savitā tat indraḥ
translated: This Agni hath said, this Soma hath said, this Brihaspati, Savitar, this Indra hath said.

original: aśrāntasya tvā manasā yunajmi prathamasya ca /
analyzed: a śrāntasya tvā manasā yunajmi prathamasya ca
translated: With an untiring mind I yoke thee, of the first,

original: utkūlam udvaho bhavoduhya prati dhāvatāt ////
analyzed: utkūlam udvahaḥ bhava uduhya prati dhāvatāt
translated: Be thou a rising, an uplifting, run hither, having carried away.

original: agneḥ prajātaṃ pari yad dhiraṇyam amṛtaṃ dadhre adhi martyeṣu /
analyzed: agneḥ prajātam pari yat hiraṇyam amṛtam dadhre adhi martyeṣu
translated: The gold that is born from Agni, which hath taken immortality among mortals,

original: ya enad veda sa id enam arhati jarāmṛtyur bhavati yo bibharti ////
analyzed: yaḥ enat veda saḥ id enam arhati jarā mṛtyuḥ bhavati yaḥ bibharti
translated: He who knoweth it, he indeed deserveth it; he becometh immortal, who weareth it.

original: yad dhiraṇyaṃ sūryeṇa suvarṇam prajāvanto manavaḥ pūrva īṣire /
analyzed: yat hiraṇyam sūryeṇa suvarṇam prajāvantaḥ manavaḥ pūrve īṣire
translated: The gold which the radiant Sun, the ancient Manus, rich in offspring, have worn,

original: tat tvā candraṃ varcasā saṃ sṛjaty āyuṣmān bhavati yo bibharti ////
analyzed: tat tvā candram varcasā sam sṛjati āyuṣmān bhavati yaḥ bibharti
translated: That gold, O gold, uniteth thee with splendour; he becometh long-lived who weareth it.

original: āyuṣe tvā varcase tvaujase ca balāya ca /
analyzed: āyuṣe tvā varcase tvā ojase ca balāya ca
translated: For life I take thee, for radiance, for strength, and for power,

original: yathā hiraṇyatejasā vibhāsāsi janāṃ anu ////
analyzed: yathā hiraṇya tejasā vibhāsāsi janān anu
translated: That with the splendour of gold thou mayest shine among men.

original: yad veda rājā varuṇo veda devo bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: yat veda rājā varuṇaḥ veda devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: What Varuna the king knoweth, what the god Brihaspati knoweth,

original: indro yad vṛtrahā veda tat ta āyuṣyaṃ bhuvat tat te varcasyaṃ bhuvat ////
analyzed: indraḥ yat vṛtrahā veda tat te āyuṣyam bhuvat tat te varcasyam bhuvat
translated: What Indra, the Vr̥itra-slayer, knoweth, that hath been thy life-giving power, that hath been thy radiance-giving power.

original: gobhiṣ ṭvā pātv ṛṣabho vṛṣā tvā pātu vājibhiḥ /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tvā pātu ṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣā tvā pātu vājibhiḥ
translated: May the cows protect thee, may the bull protect thee with the bulls,

original: vāyuṣ ṭvā brahmaṇā pātv indras tvā pātv indriyaiḥ ////
analyzed: vāyuḥ tvā brahmaṇā pātu indraḥ tvā pātu indriyaiḥ
translated: may Vayu protect thee with the Brahman, may Indra protect thee with the powers.

original: somas tvā pātv oṣadhībhir nakṣatraiḥ pātu sūryaḥ /
analyzed: somaḥ tvā pātu oṣadhībhiḥ nakṣatraiḥ pātu sūryaḥ
translated: May Soma protect thee with the plants, may the sun protect thee with the stars.

original: mādbhyas tvā candro vṛtrahā vātaḥ prāṇena rakṣatu ////
analyzed: mādbhyaḥ tvā candraḥ vṛtra hā vātaḥ prāṇena rakṣatu
translated: May the moon, the slayer of Vritra, protect thee from the waters, may Vayu protect thee with the breath.

original: tisro divas tisraḥ pṛthivīs trīṇy antarikṣāṇi caturaḥ samudrān /
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ tisraḥ pṛthivīḥ trīṇi antarikṣāṇi caturaḥ samudrān
translated: Three heavens, three earths, three mid-regions, four oceans,

original: trivṛtaṃ stomaṃ trivṛta āpa āhus tās tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ ////
analyzed: trivṛtam stomam trivṛtaḥ āpaḥ āhuḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ
translated: they call the Trivrit Stoma, the Trivrit waters; may they protect thee with the Trivrit, with the Trivrit ones.

original: trīn nākāṃs trīn samudrāṃs trīn bradhnāṃs trīn vaiṣṭapān /
analyzed: trīn nākān trīn samudrān trīn bradhnān trīn vaiṣṭapān
translated: Three firmaments, three oceans, three expanses, three Vaishvaanaras,

original: trīn mātariśvanas trīnt sūryān goptṝn kalpayāmi te ////
analyzed: trīn mātariśvanaḥ trīn sūryān goptṝn kalpayāmi te
translated: three Matarishtas, three suns, I appoint for thee as guardians.

original: ghṛtena tvā sam ukṣāmy agne ājyena vardhayan /
analyzed: ghṛtena tvā sam ukṣāmi agne ājyena vardhayan
translated: With ghee I sprinkle thee, O Agni, with clarified butter I make thee grow,

original: agneś candrasya sūryasya mā prāṇaṃ māyino dabhan ////
analyzed: agneḥ candrasya sūryasya mā prāṇam māyinaḥ dabhan
translated: may the magicians not deceive the breath of Agni, the moon, and the sun.

original: mā vaḥ prāṇaṃ mā vo 'pānaṃ mā haro māyino dabhan /
analyzed: mā vaḥ prāṇam mā vaḥ pānam mā haraḥ māyinaḥ dabhan
translated: May the magicians not deceive your in-breath, your out-breath, or your life-breath.

original: bhrājanto viśvavedaso devā daivyena dhāvata ////
analyzed: bhrājantaḥ viśva vedasaḥ devāḥ daivyena dhāvata
translated: Shining, all-knowing, O gods, run your divine course.

original: prāṇenāgniṃ saṃ sṛjati vātaḥ prāṇena saṃhitaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇena agnim sam sṛjati vātaḥ prāṇena saṃhitaḥ
translated: With his breath he unites Agni, with his breath the wind is held fast.

original: prāṇena viśvatomukhaṃ sūryaṃ devā ajanayan ////🔽āyuṣāyuḥkṛtāṃ jīvāyuṣmān jīva mā mṛthāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇena viśvatomukham sūryam devāḥ ajanayan  āyuṣā āyuḥ kṛtām jīva āyuṣmān jīva mā mṛthāḥ
translated: With his breath the gods have generated the all-sided-faced sun.🔽For life, O life-maker, live; live long, do not die.

original: prāṇenātmanvatām jīva mā mṛtyor ud agā vaśam ////
analyzed: prāṇena ātmanvatām jīva mā mṛtyoḥ ud agāḥ vaśam
translated: With your breath, O self-possessed one, live; do not go into the power of death.

original: devānāṃ nihitaṃ nidhiṃ yam indro 'nvavindat pathibhir devayānaiḥ /
analyzed: devānām nihitam nidhim yam indraḥ nvavindat pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: The treasure of the gods which Indra found by the paths that go to the gods,

original: āpo hiraṇyaṃ jugupus trivṛdbhis tās tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ ////
analyzed: āpaḥ hiraṇyam jugupuḥ trivṛdbhiḥ tāḥ tvā rakṣantu trivṛtā trivṛdbhiḥ
translated: the waters guarded the gold with the three-fold ones; may they guard thee with the three-fold one and the three-fold ones.

original: trayastriṃśad devatās trīṇi ca vīryāṇi priyāyamāṇā jugupur apsv antaḥ /
analyzed: trayastriṃśat devatāḥ trīṇi ca vīryāṇi priyāyamāṇāḥ jugupuḥ apsu antar
translated: The thirty-three gods and the three kinds of strength, being well-disposed, guarded it in the waters.

original: asmiṃś candre adhi yad dhiraṇyaṃ tenāyaṃ kṛṇavad vīryāṇi ////🔽ye devā divy ekādaśa stha te devāso havir idaṃ juṣadhvam ////
analyzed: asmin candre adhi yat hiraṇyam tena ayam kṛṇavat vīryāṇi  ye devāḥ divi ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam
translated: The gold which is in this moon, may it make this (man) strong.🔽Ye eleven gods who are in the sky, O gods, accept this oblation.

original: ye devā antarikṣa ekādaśa stha te devāso havir idaṃ juṣadhvam ////
analyzed: ye devāḥ antarikṣe ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam
translated: Ye eleven gods who are in the atmosphere, O gods, accept this oblation.

original: ye devā pṛthivyām ekādaśa stha te devāso havir idaṃ juṣadhvam ////
analyzed: ye devā pṛthivyām ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ haviḥ idam juṣadhvam
translated: Ye eleven gods who are on the earth, O gods, accept this oblation.

original: asapatnaṃ purastāt paścān no abhayaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: asapatnam purastāt paścāt naḥ abhayam kṛtam
translated: Make us free from enemies in the east, make us free from fear in the west,

original: savitā mā dakṣiṇata uttarān mā śacīpatiḥ ////🔽divo mādityā rakṣantu bhūmyā rakṣantv agnayaḥ /
analyzed: savitā mā dakṣiṇatas uttarāt mā śacī patiḥ  divaḥ mā ādityāḥ rakṣantu bhūmyāḥ rakṣantu agnayaḥ
translated: May Savitar from the right, may the Lord of Strength from the left,🔽May the Ādityas protect me from the sky, may the fires protect me from the earth.

original: indrāgnī rakṣatāṃ mā purastād aśvināv abhitaḥ śarma yachatām /
analyzed: indra agnī rakṣatām mā purastāt aśvinau abhitas śarma yacchatām
translated: May Indra and Agni protect me from the front, may the two Ashvins grant me protection on both sides.

original: tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedā bhūtakṛto me sarvataḥ santu varma ////
analyzed: tiraścīn aghnyā rakṣatu jātavedāḥ bhūta kṛtaḥ me sarvatas santu varma
translated: May the oblique-moving fire protect me from all sides, the creator of beings, may he be my armor.

original: imaṃ badhnāmi te maṇiṃ dīrghāyutvāya tejase /
analyzed: imam badhnāmi te maṇim dīrgha āyu tvāya tejase
translated: I bind this gem on you for long life and brilliance,

original: darbhaṃ sapatnadambhanaṃ dviṣatas tapanaṃ hṛdaḥ ////
analyzed: darbham sapatna dambhanam dviṣataḥ tapanam hṛdaḥ
translated: The darbha grass that subdues enemies, that burns the heart of the hateful.

original: dviṣatas tāpayan hṛdaḥ śatrūṇāṃ tāpayan manaḥ /
analyzed: dviṣataḥ tāpayan hṛdaḥ śatrūṇām tāpayan manaḥ
translated: Burning the heart of the hateful, tormenting the minds of enemies,

original: durhārdaḥ sarvāṃs tvaṃ darbha gharma ivābhīnt saṃtāpayan ////🔽gharma ivābhitapan darbha dviṣato nitapan maṇe /
analyzed: durhārdaḥ sarvān tvam darbha gharme iva abhīn saṃtāpayan  gharmaḥ iva abhitapan darbha dviṣataḥ nitapan maṇe
translated: You, O darbha, with evil intentions, burning like the sun, torment all of them.🔽Burning like the sun, O darbha, tormenting the hateful, O gem,

original: hṛdaḥ sapatnānāṃ bhinddhīndra iva virujaṃ balam ////
analyzed: hṛdaḥ sapatnānām bhinddhi indraḥ iva virujam balam
translated: Tormenting the hearts of enemies, break them like Indra breaks a mighty tree.

original: bhinddhi darbha sapatnānāṃ hṛdayaṃ dviṣatāṃ maṇe /
analyzed: bhinddhi darbha sapatnānām hṛdayam dviṣatām maṇe
translated: Break the hearts of my enemies, O darbha, break the hearts of the hateful, O gem.

original: udyan tvacam iva bhūmyāḥ śira eṣāṃ vi pātaya ////
analyzed: udyan tvacam iva bhūmyāḥ śiraḥ eṣām vi pātaya
translated: As the sun rises from the earth, so break their heads.

original: bhinddhi darbha sapatnān me bhinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: bhinddhi darbha sapatnān me bhinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Break my enemies, O darbha, break those who fight against me,

original: bhinddhi me sarvān durhārdo bhinddhi me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽chinddhi darbha sapatnān me chinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: bhinddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ bhinddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  chinddhi darbha sapatnān me chinddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Pierce all my enemies for me, O Darbha grass, pierce my haters, O Amulet!🔽Cut off my rivals, O Darbha grass, cut off those who fight against me.

original: chinddhi me sarvān durhārdo chinddhi me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽vṛśca darbha sapatnān me vṛśca me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: chinddhi me sarvān durhārdo chinddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  vṛśca darbha sapatnān me vṛśca me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Cut off all my enemies, O Darbha grass, cut off my haters, O Amulet!🔽Tear up my rivals, O Darbha grass, tear up those who fight against me.

original: vṛśca me sarvān durhārdo vṛśca me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽kṛnta darbha sapatnān me kṛnta me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: vṛśca me sarvān durhārdaḥ vṛśca me dviṣataḥ maṇe  kṛnta darbha sapatnān me kṛnta me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Tear up all my enemies, O Darbha grass, tear up my haters, O Amulet!🔽Sever my rivals, O Darbha grass, sever those who fight against me.

original: kṛnta me sarvān durhārdo kṛnta me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽piṃśa darbha sapatnān me piṃśa me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: kṛnta me sarvān durhārdaḥ kṛnta me dviṣataḥ maṇe  piṃśa darbha sapatnān me piṃśa me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Sever all my enemies, O Darbha grass, sever my haters, O Amulet!🔽Crush my rivals, O Darbha grass, crush those who fight against me.

original: piṃśa me sarvān durhārdo piṃśa me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽vidhya darbha sapatnān me vidhya me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: piṃśa me sarvān durhārdaḥ piṃśa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  vidhya darbha sapatnān me vidhya me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Crush all my enemies, O Darbha grass, crush my haters, O Amulet!🔽Pierce my rivals, O Darbha grass, pierce those who fight against me.

original: vidhya me sarvān durhārdo vidhya me dviṣato maṇe ////
analyzed: vidhya me sarvān durhārdaḥ vidhya me dviṣataḥ maṇe
translated: Pierce all my enemies, O Darbha grass, pierce my haters, O Amulet!

original: nikṣa darbha sapatnān me nikṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: nikṣa darbha sapatnān me nikṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Throw down my rivals, O Darbha grass, throw down those who fight against me.

original: nikṣa me sarvān durhārdo nikṣa me dviṣato maṇe ////
analyzed: nikṣa me sarvān durhārdaḥ nikṣa me dviṣataḥ maṇe
translated: Throw down all my enemies, O Darbha grass, throw down my haters, O Amulet!

original: tṛnddhi darbha sapatnān me tṛnddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: tṛnddhi darbha sapatnān me tṛnddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: O Darbha, crush my rivals, crush those who fight against me.

original: tṛnddhi me sarvān durhārdo tṛnddhi me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽runddhi darbha sapatnān me runddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: tṛnddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ tṛnddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  runddhi darbha sapatnān me runddhi me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Crush all my enemies, crush my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, bind my rivals, bind those who fight against me.

original: runddhi me sarvān durhārdo runddhi me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽mṛṇa darbha sapatnān me mṛṇa me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: runddhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ runddhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  mṛṇa darbha sapatnān me mṛṇa me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Bind all my enemies, bind my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, slay my rivals, slay those who fight against me.

original: mṛṇa me sarvān durhārdo mṛṇa me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽mantha darbha sapatnān me mantha me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: mṛṇa me sarvān durhārdaḥ mṛṇa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  mantha darbha sapatnān me mantha me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Slay all my enemies, slay my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, grind my rivals, grind those who fight against me.

original: mantha me sarvān durhārdo mantha me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽piṇḍḍhi darbha sapatnān me piṇḍḍhi me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: mantha me sarvān durhārdaḥ mantha me dviṣataḥ maṇe  piṇḍḍhi darbha sapatnān me piṇḍḍhi me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Grind all my enemies, grind my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, crush my rivals, crush those who fight against me.

original: piṇḍḍhi me sarvān durhārdo piṇḍḍhi me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽oṣa darbha sapatnān me oṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: piṇḍḍhi me sarvān durhārdaḥ piṇḍḍhi me dviṣataḥ maṇe  oṣa darbha sapatnān me oṣa me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Crush all my enemies, crush my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, destroy my rivals, destroy those who fight against me.

original: oṣa me sarvān durhārdo oṣa me dviṣato maṇe ////🔽daha darbha sapatnān me daha me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: oṣa me sarvān durhārdaḥ oṣa me dviṣataḥ maṇe  daha darbha sapatnān me daha me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Destroy all my enemies, destroy my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, burn my rivals, burn those who fight against me.🔽Burn all my enemies, burn my haters, O jewel.🔽O Darbha, consume my rivals, consume those who fight against me.

original: daha me sarvān durhārdo daha me dviṣato maṇe ////
analyzed: daha me sarvān durhārdaḥ daha me dviṣataḥ maṇe
translated: Consume all my enemies, consume my haters, O jewel.

original: jahi darbha sapatnān me jahi me pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: jahi darbha sapatnān me jahi me pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Destroy my rivals, O Darbha, destroy those who fight against me in battle.

original: jahi me sarvān durhārdo jahi me dviṣato maṇe ////
analyzed: jahi me sarvān durhārdaḥ jahi me dviṣataḥ maṇe
translated: Destroy all my enemies, O Darbha, destroy my haters, O jewel.

original: yat te darbha jarāmṛtyu śataṃ varmasu varma te /
analyzed: yat te darbha jarā mṛtyu śatam varmasu varma te
translated: That which is in thee, O Darbha, the hundredfold armour against old age and death, that armour of thine,

original: tenemaṃ varmiṇaṃ kṛtvā sapatnāṃ jahi vīryaiḥ ////
analyzed: tena imam varmiṇam kṛtvā sapatnām jahi vīryaiḥ
translated: Having made this one armoured with that, destroy his rivals with thy powers.

original: śataṃ te darbha varmāṇi sahasraṃ vīryāṇi te /🔽tam asmai viśve tvāṃ devā jarase bhartavā aduḥ ////
analyzed: śatam te darbha varmāṇi sahasram vīryāṇi te  tam asmai viśve tvām devāḥ jarase bhartavai aduḥ
translated: Thou hast a hundred armours, O Darbha, a thousand powers of thine.🔽The All-gods have given thee to him, O Darbha, to bear to old age.

original: tvām āhur devavarma tvāṃ darbha brahmaṇas patim /
analyzed: tvām āhuḥ deva varma tvām darbha brahmaṇaḥ patim
translated: Thee they call the divine armour, thee, O Darbha, the lord of prayer.

original: tvām indrasyāhur varma tvaṃ rāṣṭrāṇi rakṣasi ////
analyzed: tvām indrasya āhuḥ varma tvam rāṣṭrāṇi rakṣasi
translated: Thee they call the armour of Indra, thou protectest the kingdoms.

original: sapatnakṣayaṇaṃ darbha dviṣatas tapanaṃ hṛdaḥ /
analyzed: sapatna kṣayaṇam darbha dviṣataḥ tapanam hṛdaḥ
translated: The destroyer of rivals, O Darbha, the tormentor of the heart of the hater,

original: maṇiṃ kṣatrasya vardhanaṃ tanūpānaṃ kṛṇomi te ////
analyzed: maṇim kṣatrasya vardhanam tanū pānam kṛṇomi te
translated: The jewel that increases the Kshatriya, I make it thy protector of the body.

original: yat samudro abhyakrandat parjanyo vidyutā saha /
analyzed: yat samudraḥ abhyakrandat parjanyaḥ vidyutā saha
translated: When the ocean roared, and Parjanya with lightning,

original: tato hiranyayo bindus tato darbho ajāyata ////
analyzed: tatas hiranyayaḥ binduḥ tatas darbhaḥ ajāyata
translated: From that the golden drop was born, from that the Darbha was produced.

original: audumbareṇa maṇinā puṣṭikāmāya vedhasā /
analyzed: audumbareṇa maṇinā puṣṭi kāmāya vedhasā
translated: With the jewel of Udumbara, which was fashioned by the creator for one who desires prosperity,

original: paśūṇāṃ sarveṣāṃ sphātiṃ goṣṭhe me savitā karat ////
analyzed: paśūṇām sarveṣām sphātim goṣṭhe me savitā karat
translated: May Savitar grant me in my cattle-pen the increase of all my cattle.

original: yo no agnir gārhapatyaḥ paśūnām adhipā asat /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ agniḥ gārhapatyaḥ paśūnām adhipāḥ asat
translated: May the Agni who is our domestic fire be the lord of our cattle.

original: audumbaro vṛṣā maṇiḥ saṃ mā sṛjatu puṣṭyā ////
analyzed: audumbaraḥ vṛṣā maṇiḥ sam mā sṛjatu puṣṭyā
translated: May the Udumbara gem, the bull, unite me with prosperity.

original: karīṣiṇīṃ phalavatīṃ svadhām irāṃ ca no gṛhe /
analyzed: karīṣiṇīm phalavatīm svadhām irām ca naḥ gṛhe
translated: The fruitful, sapful, and sweet oblation, and food in our house,

original: audumbarasya tejasā dhātā puṣṭiṃ dadhātu me ////
analyzed: audumbarasya tejasā dhātā puṣṭim dadhātu me
translated: By the splendour of the Udumbara, may the creator bestow prosperity on me.

original: yad dvipāc ca catuṣpāc ca yāny annāni ye rasāḥ /
analyzed: yat dvipād ca catuṣpād ca yāni annāni ye rasāḥ
translated: Whatever food and juices there are from two-legged and four-legged creatures,

original: gṛhṇe 'haṃ tv eṣāṃ bhūmānaṃ bibhrad audumbaraṃ maṇim ////
analyzed: gṛhṇe ham tu eṣām bhūmānam bibhrat audumbaram maṇim
translated: Bearing that abundance, I take up the Udumbara gem.

original: puṣṭiṃ paśūnām pari jagrabhāhaṃ catuṣpadāṃ dvipadāṃ yac ca dhānyam /🔽payaḥ paśūnāṃ rasam oṣadhīnāṃ bṛhaspatiḥ savitā me ni yachāt ////
analyzed: puṣṭim paśūnām pari jagrabhā aham catuṣpadām dvipadām yat ca dhānyam  payaḥ paśūnām rasam oṣadhīnām bṛhaspatiḥ savitā me ni yacchāt
translated: I have grasped the prosperity of cattle, of four-legged and two-legged creatures, and of grain.🔽May Brihaspati and Savita bestow upon me the milk of cattle, the sap of plants.

original: ahaṃ paśūnām adhipā asāni mayi puṣṭaṃ puṣṭapatir dadhātu /🔽mahyam audumbaro maṇir draviṇāni ni yachatu ////
analyzed: aham paśūnām adhipāḥ asāni mayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ dadhātu  mahyam audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ draviṇāni ni yacchatu
translated: May I be the lord of cattle; may the lord of prosperity bestow prosperity upon me.🔽May the Udumbara gem bestow wealth upon me.

original: upa maudumbaro maṇiḥ prajayā ca dhanena ca /
analyzed: upa mā audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ prajayā ca dhanena ca
translated: The Udumbara gem has invigorated me with offspring and wealth.

original: indreṇa jinvito maṇir ā māgant saha varcasā ////
analyzed: indreṇa jinvitaḥ maṇiḥ ā mā agan saha varcasā
translated: The gem, invigorated by Indra, has come to me with splendour.

original: devo maṇiḥ sapatnahā dhanasā dhanasātaye /
analyzed: devaḥ maṇiḥ sapatna hā dhana sāḥ dhana sātaye
translated: The divine gem, the slayer of enemies, for the sake of wealth, for the acquisition of wealth,

original: paśor annasya bhūmānaṃ gavāṃ sphātiṃ ni yachatu ////
analyzed: paśoḥ annasya bhūmānam gavām sphātim ni yacchatu
translated: Let him bestow on me the greatness of cattle and the abundance of cows.

original: yathāgre tvaṃ vanaspate puṣṭhyā saha jajñiṣe /🔽evā dhanasya me sphātim ā dadhātu sarasvatī ////
analyzed: yathā agre tvam vanaspate puṣṭhyā saha jajñiṣe  eva dhanasya me sphātim ā dadhātu sarasvatī
translated: Just as, O tree, you were born first with prosperity,🔽May Sarasvati bestow on me the abundance of wealth.

original: ā me dhanaṃ sarasvatī payasphātiṃ ca dhānyam /
analyzed: ā me dhanam sarasvatī payaḥ sphātim ca dhānyam
translated: May Sarasvati bring me wealth, abundance of milk and grain,

original: sinīvāly upā vahād ayaṃ caudumbaro maṇiḥ ////
analyzed: sinīvālī upa ā vahāt ayam ca audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ
translated: May Sinivāli bring it, and this Audaumbara gem.

original: tvaṃ maṇīṇām adhipā vṛṣāsi tvayi puṣṭaṃ puṣṭapatir jajāna /
analyzed: tvam maṇīṇām adhipāḥ vṛṣā asi tvayi puṣṭam puṣṭa patiḥ jajāna
translated: You are the lord and bull of gems; in you the lord of growth has produced growth.

original: tvayīme vājā draviṇāni sarvaudumbaraḥ sa tvam asmat sahasvārād ārād arātim amatiṃ kṣudhaṃ ca ////🔽grāmaṇīr asi grāmaṇīr utthāya abhiṣikto 'bhi mā siñca varcasā /🔽tejo 'si tejo mayi dhārayādhi rayir asi rayiṃ me dhehi ////
analyzed: tvayi ime vājāḥ draviṇāni sarvā audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmat sahasva ārāt ārāt arātim amatim kṣudham ca  grāmaṇīḥ asi grāmaṇīḥ utthāya abhiṣiktaḥ bhi mā siñca varcasā  tejaḥ si tejaḥ mayi dhāraya adhi rayiḥ asi rayim me dhehi
translated: In you are all these treasures and riches. You are all-Audumbara. Protect us from far and near, from hostility, want, and hunger.🔽You are the chief, the chief risen up, consecrated. Besprinkle me with radiance.🔽You are splendor; in me establish splendor. You are wealth; bestow wealth on me.

original: puṣṭir asi puṣṭyā mā sam aṅgdhi gṛhamedhī gṛhapatiṃ mā kṛṇu /
analyzed: puṣṭiḥ asi puṣṭyā mā sam aṅgdhi gṛhamedhī gṛha patim mā kṛṇu
translated: You are prosperity; unite me with prosperity. Make me the lord of a house and the master of a house.

original: audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmāsu dhehi rayiṃ ca naḥ sarvavīraṃ ni yacha rāyas poṣāya prati muñce ahaṃ tvām ////
analyzed: audumbaraḥ sa tvam asmāsu dhehi rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yaccha rāyaḥ poṣāya prati muñce aham tvām
translated: You are all-Audumbara. Bestow on us wealth and bestow on us riches with all our heroes. I release you for the increase of wealth.

original: ayam audumbaro maṇir vīro vīrāya badhyate /
analyzed: ayam audumbaraḥ maṇiḥ vīraḥ vīrāya badhyate
translated: This is the Audaumbara gem, a hero, bound for a hero.

original: sa naḥ saniṃ madhumatīṃ kṛṇotu rayiṃ ca naḥ sarvavīram ni yachāt ////
analyzed: sa naḥ sanim madhumatīm kṛṇotu rayim ca naḥ sarva vīram ni yacchāt
translated: May it make for us sweet gain, and bestow on us wealth with all heroes.

original: śatakāṇḍo duścyavanaḥ sahasraparṇa uttiraḥ /
analyzed: śatakāṇḍaḥ duścyavanaḥ sahasraparṇaḥ uttiraḥ
translated: The Darbha grass with a hundred shoots, hard to overthrow, with a thousand leaves, rising up,

original: darbho ya ugra oṣadhis taṃ te badhnāmy āyuṣe ////
analyzed: darbhaḥ yaḥ ugraḥ oṣadhiḥ tam te badhnāmi āyuṣe
translated: the fierce plant, I bind it on thee for life.

original: nāsya keśān pra vapanti norasi tāḍam ā ghnate /
analyzed: na asya keśān pra vapanti na urasi tāḍam ā ghnate
translated: They do not cut his hair, they do not strike him on the breast with a stick,

original: yasmā achinnaparṇena darbhena śarma yachati ////
analyzed: yasmai a chinna parṇena darbhena śarma yacchati
translated: whom the Darbha grass with uncut leaves shelters.

original: divi te tūlam oṣadhe pṛthivyām asi niṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: divi te tūlam oṣadhe pṛthivyām asi niṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Thy down, O plant, is in the sky, on the earth thou art firmly fixed.

original: tvayā sahasrakāṇḍenāyuḥ pra vardhayāmahe ////
analyzed: tvayā sahasra kāṇḍena āyuḥ pra vardhayāmahe
translated: With thee, O thou of a thousand shoots, we increase our life.

original: tisro divo aty atṛṇat tisra imāḥ pṛthivīr uta /
analyzed: tisraḥ divaḥ ati atṛṇat tisraḥ imāḥ pṛthivīḥ uta
translated: Thou hast pierced through the three of the sky and the three of this earth.

original: tvayāhaṃ durhārdo jihvāṃ ni tṛṇadmi vacāṃsi ////
analyzed: tvayā aham durhārdaḥ jihvām ni tṛṇadmi vacāṃsi
translated: With thee, O Darbha grass with uncut leaves, I pierce through the tongue and the words of the evil-hearted.

original: tvam asi sahamāno 'ham asmi sahasvān /🔽ubhau sahasvantau bhūtvā sapatnān sahiṣīvahi ////
analyzed: tvam asi sahamānaḥ ham asmi sahasvān  ubhau sahasvantau bhūtvā sapatnān sahiṣīvahi
translated: Thou art the conqueror, I am the conqueror.🔽Having become both of us conquerors, let us conquer our enemies.

original: sahasva no abhimātiṃ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ /
analyzed: sahasva naḥ abhimātim sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ
translated: Conquer for us our spiteful enemies, conquer those who come to fight.

original: sahasva sarvān durhārdaḥ suhārdo me bahūn kṛdhi ////
analyzed: sahasva sarvān durhārdaḥ suhārdaḥ me bahūn kṛdhi
translated: Conquer all the evil-hearted, make many good friends for me.

original: darbheṇa devajātena divi ṣṭambhena śaśvad it /
analyzed: darbheṇa deva jātena divi stambhena śaśvat id
translated: With the Darbha grass, born of the gods, with the pillar in the sky, ever and always,

original: tenāhaṃ śaśvato janāṃ asanaṃ sanavāni ca ////
analyzed: tena aham śaśvataḥ janān asanam sanavāni ca
translated: With that I always subdue the people, the enemies, and those who hate us.

original: priyaṃ mā darbha kṛṇu brahmarājanyābhyām śūdrāya cāryāya ca /
analyzed: priyam mā darbha kṛṇu brahma rājanyābhyām śūdrāya ca āryāya ca
translated: O Darbha grass, make me dear to the Brahmins and Rajanyas, to the Shudras and Aryas,

original: yasmai ca kāmayāmahe sarvasmai ca vipaśyate ////
analyzed: yasmai ca kāmayāmahe sarvasmai ca vipaśyate
translated: To whomsoever we desire, and to all who look on.

original: yo jāyamānaḥ pṛthivīm adṛṃhad yo astabhnād antarikṣaṃ divaṃ ca /
analyzed: yaḥ jāyamānaḥ pṛthivīm adṛṃhat yaḥ astabhnāt antarikṣam divam ca
translated: He who, being born, made the earth firm, who made firm the atmosphere and the sky,

original: yaṃ bibhrataṃ nanu pāpmā viveda sa no 'yaṃ darbho varuṇo divā kaḥ ////
analyzed: yam bibhratam nanu pāpmā viveda sa naḥ yam darbhaḥ varuṇaḥ divā kaḥ
translated: Whom sin does not know, indeed, while he is bearing, may this Darbha grass of ours be Varuna in the day.

original: sapatnahā śatakāṇḍaḥ sahasvān oṣadhīnāṃ prathamaḥ saṃ babhūva /
analyzed: sapatna hā śata kāṇḍaḥ sahasvān oṣadhīnām prathamaḥ sam babhūva
translated: The enemy-slayer, with a hundred shoots, the powerful one, became the first of the plants.

original: sa no 'yaṃ darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas tena sākṣīya pṛtanāḥ pṛtanyataḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ yam darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas tena sākṣīya pṛtanāḥ pṛtanyataḥ
translated: May this Darbha grass of ours protect us on all sides. By it may we conquer the enemies in battle.

original: sahasrārghaḥ śatakāṇḍaḥ payasvān apām agnir vīrudhāṃ rājasūyam /
analyzed: sahasra arghaḥ śata kāṇḍaḥ payasvān apām agniḥ vīrudhām rājasūyam
translated: Worth a thousand, with a hundred shoots, full of sap, the king of the plants, Agni, the lord of the waters,

original: sa no 'yaṃ darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvato devo maṇir āyuṣā saṃ sṛjāti naḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ yam darbhaḥ pari pātu viśvatas devaḥ maṇiḥ āyuṣā sam sṛjāti naḥ
translated: May this Darbha grass of ours protect us on all sides. The divine gem unites us with life.

original: ghṛtād ullupto madhumān payasvān bhūmidṛṃho 'cyutaś cyāvayiṣṇuḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān bhūmidṛṃho cyutaḥ cyāvayiṣṇuḥ
translated: Scraped from ghee, full of honey and milk, firm on the earth, unshaken, moving.

original: nudant sapatnān adharāṃś ca kṛṇvan darbhā roha mahatām indriyeṇa ////
analyzed: nudan sapatnān adharān ca kṛṇvan darbha ā roha mahatām indriyeṇa
translated: Driving away foes and making them low, O Darbha, grow with the power of the great ones.

original: tvaṃ bhūmim aty eṣy ojasā tvaṃ vedyāṃ sīdasi cārur adhvare /
analyzed: tvam bhūmim ati eṣi ojasā tvam vedyām sīdasi cāruḥ adhvare
translated: With might thou shalt overspread the earth, thou sittest on the altar, lovely in the sacrifice.

original: tvāṃ pavitram ṛṣayo 'bharanta tvaṃ punīhi duritāny asmat ////
analyzed: tvām pavitram ṛṣayaḥ bharanta tvam punīhi duritāni asmat
translated: The Rishis have brought thee, the pure one, purify thou us from evils.

original: tīkṣṇo rājā viṣāsahī rakṣohā viśvacarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: tīkṣṇaḥ rājā viṣāsahī rakṣaḥ hā viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Sharp is the king, conquering poison, the slayer of Rakshas, the all-conquering one.

original: ojo devānāṃ balam ugram etat taṃ te badhnāmi jarase svastaye ////
analyzed: ojaḥ devānām balam ugram etat tam te badhnāmi jarase svastaye
translated: This is the strength and mighty power of the gods; I bind it on thee for long life and well-being.

original: darbheṇa tvaṃ kṛṇavad vīryāṇi darbhaṃ bibhrad ātmanā mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: darbheṇa tvam kṛṇavat vīryāṇi darbham bibhrat ātmanā mā vyathiṣṭhāḥ
translated: By the Darbha grass thou shalt perform thy manly deeds; bearing the Darbha grass on thy body, be not faint.

original: atiṣṭhāya varcasādhānyānt sūrya ivā bhāhi pradiśaś catasraḥ ////
analyzed: atiṣṭhāya varcasā adhānyāt sūryaḥ iva ā bhāhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: Having surpassed the prosperous ones with thy splendour, shine like the sun in the four quarters.

original: jāṅgiḍo 'si jaṅgiḍo rakṣitāsi jaṅgidaḥ /
analyzed: jāṅgiḍaḥ si jaṅgiḍaḥ rakṣitā asi jaṅgidaḥ
translated: Thou art the Jangida, the protector, the Jangida.

original: dvipāc catuṣpād asmākaṃ sarvaṃ rakṣatu jaṅgidaḥ ////
analyzed: dvipād catuṣpād asmākam sarvam rakṣatu jaṅgidaḥ
translated: May the Jangida protect all of us, the two-footed and the four-footed.

original: yā gṛtsyas tripañcāśīḥ śataṃ kṛtyākṛtaś ca ye /
analyzed: yāḥ gṛtsyaḥ tripañcāśīḥ śatam kṛtyā kṛtaḥ ca ye
translated: The ninety-five Gritsas, and those who have committed a hundred crimes,

original: sarvān vinaktu tejaso 'rasāṃ jaṅgidas karat ////
analyzed: sarvān vinaktu tejasaḥ rasām jaṅgidaḥ karat
translated: May Jangida destroy them all, and make them powerless.

original: arasaṃ kṛtrimaṃ nādam arasāḥ sapta visrasaḥ /
analyzed: arasam kṛtrimam nādam arasāḥ sapta visrasaḥ
translated: The powerless, the seven powerless secretions, the powerless artificial sound,

original: apeto jaṅgiḍāmatim iṣum asteva śātaya ////
analyzed: apa itas jaṅgiḍā matim iṣum astā iva śātaya
translated: Like an arrow shot from the bow, drive away the curse of the Jangida.

original: kṛtyādūṣaṇa evāyam atho arātidūṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtyā dūṣaṇaḥ eva ayam atha u arāti dūṣaṇaḥ
translated: This is the remover of witchcraft, the remover of hostility,

original: atho sahasvāñ jaṅgiḍaḥ pra na āyumṣi tāriṣat ////🔽sa jaṅgiḍasya mahimā pari ṇaḥ pātu viśvataḥ /
analyzed: atha u sahasvān jaṅgiḍaḥ pra naḥ āyumṣi tāriṣat  sa jaṅgiḍasya mahimā pari naḥ pātu viśvatas
translated: and the victorious Jangida shall prolong our lives.🔽May the greatness of the Jangida protect us on every side,

original: viṣkandhaṃ yena sāsaha saṃskandham oja ojasā ////
analyzed: viṣkandham yena sāsaha saṃskandham ojaḥ ojasā
translated: with which he conquered the Visakha and the Sankha with his strength.

original: triṣ ṭvā devā ajanayan niṣṭhitaṃ bhūmyām adhi /
analyzed: tris tvā devāḥ ajanayan niṣṭhitam bhūmyām adhi
translated: The gods have generated thee thrice, firmly established on the earth.

original: tam u tvāṅgirā iti brāhmaṇāḥ pūrvyā viduḥ ////
analyzed: tam u tvā aṅgirāḥ iti brāhmaṇāḥ pūrvyāḥ viduḥ
translated: The ancient Brahmans know thee as Angiras.

original: na tvā pūrvā oṣadhayo na tvā taranti yā navāḥ /
analyzed: na tvā pūrvāḥ oṣadhayaḥ na tvā taranti yāḥ navāḥ
translated: Neither the old nor the new plants surpass thee.

original: vibādha ugro jaṅgiḍaḥ paripāṇaḥ sumaṅgalaḥ ////
analyzed: vibādhaḥ ugraḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ paripāṇaḥ su maṅgalaḥ
translated: The powerful Jangida, the repeller, the protector, the very auspicious one.

original: athopadāna bhagavo jāṅgiḍāmitavīrya /🔽purā ta ugrā grasata upendro vīryaṃ dadau ////
analyzed: atha upadāna bhagavaḥ jāṅgiḍa amita vīrya  purā te ugrā grasataḥ upa indraḥ vīryam dadau
translated: Now, blessed one, O Jangida of unlimited strength,🔽before those terrible devourers, Indra gave thee strength.

original: ugra it te vanaspata indra ojmānam ā dadhau /
analyzed: ugraḥ id te vanaspate indraḥ ojmānam ā dadhau
translated: O lord of the forest, Indra has bestowed upon thee great strength.

original: amīvāḥ sarvāś cātayaṃ jahi rakṣāṃsy oṣadhe ////
analyzed: amīvāḥ sarvāḥ cātayam jahi rakṣāṃsi oṣadhe
translated: Drive away all diseases, destroy the Rakshasas, O plant.

original: āśarīkaṃ viśarīkaṃ balāsaṃ pṛṣṭyāmayam /
analyzed: āśarīkam viśarīkam balāsam pṛṣṭyāmayam
translated: The disease that attacks the bones, the flesh, the back,

original: takmānaṃ viśvaśāradam arasāṃ jaṅgiḍas karat ////
analyzed: takmānam viśva śāradam arasām jaṅgiḍaḥ karat
translated: the fever that comes every year, the Jangida makes powerless.

original: indrasya nāma gṛhṇanta ṛsayo jaṅgidaṃ daduḥ /
analyzed: indrasya nāma gṛhṇantaḥ ṛsayaḥ jaṅgidam daduḥ
translated: The Rishis, taking Indra's name, gave Jangiḍa,

original: devā yaṃ cakrur bheṣajam agre viṣkandhadūṣaṇam ////
analyzed: devāḥ yam cakruḥ bheṣajam agre viṣkandha dūṣaṇam
translated: The medicine which the gods first made to destroy Visva-khandha.

original: sa no rakṣatu jaṅgiḍo dhanapālo dhaneva /
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣatu jaṅgiḍaḥ dhana pālaḥ dhanā iva
translated: May Jangiḍa, the guardian of wealth, protect us as a cow protects her calf.

original: devā yaṃ cakrur brāhmaṇāḥ paripāṇam arātiham ////
analyzed: devāḥ yam cakruḥ brāhmaṇāḥ paripāṇam arātiham
translated: The Brahmans made him a guardian to ward off foes.

original: durhārdaḥ saṃghoraṃ cakṣuḥ pāpakṛtvānam āgamam /
analyzed: durhārdaḥ saṃghoram cakṣuḥ pāpa kṛtvānam āgamam
translated: The evil-hearted, the cruel-eyed, the sinner who comes to us,

original: tāṃs tvaṃ sahasracakṣo pratībodhena nāśaya paripāṇo 'si jaṅgiḍaḥ ////
analyzed: tān tvam sahasra cakṣo pratībodhena nāśaya paripāṇaḥ si jaṅgiḍaḥ
translated: Thou, O Jangiḍa, with a thousand eyes, destroy them with thy watchful care. Thou art our guardian.

original: pari mā divaḥ pari mā pṛthivyāḥ pary antarikṣāt pari mā vīrudbhyaḥ /
analyzed: pari mā divaḥ pari mā pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt pari mā vīrudbhyaḥ
translated: From the sky, from the earth, from the air, from the plants,

original: pari mā bhūtāt pari mota bhavyād diśodiśo jaṅgiḍaḥ pātv asmān ////
analyzed: pari mā bhūtāt pari mā uta bhavyāt diśaḥ diśaḥ jaṅgiḍaḥ pātu asmān
translated: From the existent and the non-existent, from all directions, may Jangiḍa protect us.

original: ya ṛṣṇavo devakṛtā ya uto vavṛte 'nyaḥ /
analyzed: ye deva kṛtāḥ yaḥ uta u vavṛte nyaḥ
translated: Those which are born of the gods, and those which are born from elsewhere,

original: sarvāṃ stān viśvabheṣajo 'rasāṃ jaṅgiḍas karat ////🔽śatavāro anīnaśad yakṣmān rakṣāṃsi tejasā /
analyzed: sarvām stān viśva bheṣajaḥ rasām jaṅgiḍaḥ karat  śata vāraḥ anīnaśat yakṣmān rakṣāṃsi tejasā
translated: May Jangiḍa, the universal remedy, make them all powerless.

original: ārohan varcasā saha maṇir durṇāmacātanaḥ ////
analyzed: ārohan varcasā saha maṇiḥ durṇāma cātanaḥ
translated: The hundred-threaded (amulet) has destroyed the consumptions, the Rakshas, with its splendour.🔽Ascending with glory, the amulet drives away evil names.

original: śṛṅgābhyāṃ rakṣo nudate mūlena yātudhānyaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṅgābhyām rakṣaḥ nudate mūlena yātudhānyaḥ
translated: With its horns it drives away the Rakshas, with its root the Yātudhānas.

original: madhyena yakṣmaṃ bādhate nainaṃ pāpmāti tatrati ////
analyzed: madhyena yakṣmam bādhate na enam pāpmā ati tatrati
translated: He drives away consumption by the middle, sin does not overcome him there.

original: ye yakṣmāso arbhakā mahānto ye ca śabdinaḥ /
analyzed: ye yakṣmāsaḥ arbhakāḥ mahāntaḥ ye ca śabdinaḥ
translated: Those consumptives, whether small or great, or those who make noise,

original: sarvāṃ durṇāmahā maṇiḥ śatavāro anīnaśat ////
analyzed: sarvām durṇāmahā maṇiḥ śata vāraḥ anīnaśat
translated: The evil-named gem Shatavara has destroyed all of them.

original: śataṃ vīrān ajanayac chataṃ yakṣmān apāvapat /
analyzed: śatam vīrān ajanayat śatam yakṣmān apāvapat
translated: It has produced a hundred heroes, shaken off a hundred consumptives,

original: durṇāmnaḥ sarvān hatvāva rakṣāṃsi dhūnute ////
analyzed: durṇāmnaḥ sarvān hatvā ava rakṣāṃsi dhūnute
translated: Having killed all the evil-named ones, it shakes off the Rakshasas.

original: hiraṇyaśṛṅga ṛṣabhaḥ śātavāro ayaṃ maṇiḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇya śṛṅgaḥ ṛṣabhaḥ śātavāraḥ ayam maṇiḥ
translated: The golden-horned bull, the Shatavara gem,

original: durṇāmnaḥ sarvāṃs tṛdhvāva rakṣāṃsy akramīt ////
analyzed: durṇāmnaḥ sarvān tṛdhvā ava rakṣāṃsi akramīt
translated: Having shaken off all the evil-named Rakshasas, it has passed over them.

original: śatam ahaṃ durṇāmnīnāṃ gandharvāpsarasāṃ śatam /
analyzed: śatam aham durṇāmnīnām gandharva apsarasām śatam
translated: A hundred evil-named Gandharvas and Apsaras,

original: śatam śaśvanvatīnāṃ śatavāreṇa vāraye ////
analyzed: śatam śaśvanvatīnām śata vāreṇa vāraye
translated: A hundred ever-flowing ones, I ward off with the Shatavara.

original: idaṃ varco agninā dattam āgan bhargo yaśaḥ saha ojo vayo balam /
analyzed: idam varcaḥ agninā dattam āgan bhargaḥ yaśaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ vayaḥ balam
translated: This splendor has come, given by Agni, glory, fame, strength, vigor, power.

original: trayastriṃśad yāni ca vīryāṇi tāny agniḥ pra dadātu me ////
analyzed: trayastriṃśat yāni ca vīryāṇi tāni agniḥ pra dadātu me
translated: May Agni grant me those thirty-three kinds of valor.

original: varca ā dhehi me tanvāṃ saha ojo vayo balam /
analyzed: varcaḥ ā dhehi me tanvām sahaḥ ojaḥ vayaḥ balam
translated: Bestow splendor upon my body, strength, vigor, power.

original: indriyāya tvā karmaṇe vīryāya prati gṛhṇāmi śataśāradāya ////
analyzed: indriyāya tvā karmaṇe vīryāya prati gṛhṇāmi śata śāradāya
translated: For strength, for action, for valor, I accept you for a hundred autumns.

original: ūrje tvā balāya tvaujase sahase tvā /
analyzed: ūrje tvā balāya tvā ojase sahase tvā
translated: For strength, for power, for vigor, for endurance, for you.

original: abhibhūyāya tvā rāṣṭrabhṛtyāya pary ūhāmi śataśāradāya ////
analyzed: abhibhūyāya tvā rāṣṭra bhṛtyāya pari ūhāmi śata śāradāya
translated: I encompass thee, O King, for the sake of the overlord, for the sake of the ruler of the people, for a hundred autumns.

original: ṛtubhyaṣ ṭvārtavebhyo mādbhyaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtubhyaḥ tvā ārtavebhyaḥ mādbhyaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ
translated: To the seasons, to the half-seasons, to the months, to the years,

original: dhātre vidhātre samṛdhe bhūtasya pataye yaje ////
analyzed: dhātre vidhātre samṛdhe bhūtasya pataye yaje
translated: To the nurse, to the guardian, to prosperity, to the lord of beings, I sacrifice.

original: na taṃ yakṣmā arundhate nainaṃ śapatho aśnute /
analyzed: na tam yakṣmā arundhate na enam śapathaḥ aśnute
translated: Neither consumption nor evil-working magic touches him,

original: yaṃ bheṣajasya gulguloḥ surabhir gandho aśnute ////
analyzed: yam bheṣajasya gulguloḥ surabhiḥ gandhaḥ aśnute
translated: Whom the fragrant smell of the medicinal guggula reaches.

original: viṣvañcas tasmād yakṣmā mṛgā aśvā iverate /
analyzed: viṣvañcaḥ tasmāt yakṣmāḥ mṛgāḥ aśvāḥ iva īrate
translated: From him consumption turns away, like deer at a lion's roar,

original: yad gulgulu saindhavaṃ yad vāpy asi samudriyam ////
analyzed: yat gulgulu saindhavam yat vā api asi samudriyam
translated: Whether the guggula is from the sea or from the land.

original: ubhayor agrabhaṃ nāmāsmā ariṣṭatātaye ////
analyzed: ubhayoḥ agrabham nāma asmai ariṣṭatātaye
translated: We have taken the name of both for his safety.

original: aitu devas trāyamāṇaḥ kuṣṭho himavatas pari /
analyzed: aitu devaḥ trāyamāṇaḥ kuṣṭhaḥ himavataḥ pari
translated: May the healing god Kuṣṭha come from the Himalayas,

original: takmānaṃ sarvaṃ nāśaya sarvāś ca yātudhānyaḥ ////
analyzed: takmānam sarvam nāśaya sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ
translated: And destroy all consumption and all demons.

original: trīṇi te kuṣṭha nāmāni nadyamāro nadyāriṣaḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi te kuṣṭha nāmāni nadyamāraḥ nadyāriṣaḥ
translated: Three are thy names, O Kuṣṭha: Nadhyāmara, Nadhyāriṣa,

original: nadyāyaṃ puruṣo riṣat /
analyzed: nadyā ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat
translated: And Nadhyāyaṃ Puruṣa Ṛṣat.

original: yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atho divā ////
analyzed: yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atha u divā
translated: To whom I announce thee, in the evening, in the morning, and in the day.

original: jīvalā nāma te mātā jīvanto nāma te pitā /
analyzed: jīvalā nāma te mātā jīvantaḥ nāma te pitā
translated: Thy mother is named Jīvalā, thy father Jīvanta,

original: nadyāyaṃ puruṣo riṣat /
analyzed: nadyā ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat
translated: And Nadhyāyaṃ Puruṣa Ṛṣat.

original: yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atho divā ////
analyzed: yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atha u divā
translated: To whom I announce thee, in the evening, in the morning, and also by day.

original: uttamo asy oṣadhīnām anaḍvān jagatām iva vyāghraḥ śvapadām iva /
analyzed: uttamaḥ asi oṣadhīnām anaḍvān jagatām iva vyāghraḥ śvapadām iva
translated: Thou art the best of plants, like a bull among those that move, like a tiger among animals with claws.

original: nadyāyaṃ puruṣo riṣat /
analyzed: nadyā ayam puruṣaḥ riṣat
translated: May this man be safe from the river.

original: yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atho divā ////
analyzed: yasmai paribravīmi tvā sāyaṃprātar atha u divā
translated: To whom I announce thee, in the evening, in the morning, and also by day.

original: triḥ śāmbubhyo aṅgirebhyas trir ādityebhyas pari /
analyzed: tris śāmbubhyaḥ aṅgirebhyaḥ tris ādityebhyaḥ pari
translated: Three times to the Shambhus, three times to the Angiras, three times to the Adityas.

original: trir jāto viśvadevebhyaḥ /
analyzed: tris jātaḥ viśvadevebhyaḥ
translated: Three times born to the All-gods.

original: sa kuṣṭho viśvabheṣajaḥ sākaṃ somena tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati
translated: That Kushtha, the universal remedy, stands together with Soma.

original: aśvattho devasadanas tṛtīyasyām ito divi /
analyzed: aśvatthaḥ deva sadanaḥ tṛtīyasyām itas divi
translated: The Asvattha tree, the abode of the gods, is in the third heaven from here.

original: tatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇaṃ tataḥ kuṣṭho ajāyata /
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata
translated: There is the essence of immortality, from there Kushtha was born.

original: sa kuṣṭho viśvabheṣajaḥ sākaṃ somena tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati
translated: That Kushtha, the universal remedy, stands together with Soma.

original: hiraṇyayī naur acarad dhiraṇyabandhanā divi /
analyzed: hiraṇyayī nauḥ acarat hiraṇya bandhanā divi
translated: A golden ship sailed, bound with gold, in the sky.

original: tatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇaṃ tataḥ kuṣṭho ajāyata /
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata
translated: There is the essence of immortality, from there Kushtha was born.

original: sa kuṣṭho viśvabheṣajaḥ sākaṃ somena tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati
translated: That Kushtha, the universal remedy, stands together with Soma.

original: yatra nāvaprabhraṃśanaṃ yatra himavataḥ śiraḥ /
analyzed: yatra nāva prabhraṃśanam yatra himavataḥ śiraḥ
translated: Where the ship's breaking point is, where the peak of the Himalayas is,

original: tatrāmṛtasya cakṣaṇaṃ tataḥ kuṣṭho ajāyata /
analyzed: tatra amṛtasya cakṣaṇam tatas kuṣṭhaḥ ajāyata
translated: There is the essence of immortality, from there Kushtha was born.

original: sa kuṣṭho viśvabheṣajaḥ sākaṃ somena tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa kuṣṭhaḥ viśva bheṣajaḥ sākam somena tiṣṭhati
translated: That leprosy, the universal remedy, stands together with Soma.

original: yaṃ tvā veda pūrva ikṣvāko yaṃ vā tvā kuṣṭha kāmyaḥ /
analyzed: yam tvā veda pūrvaḥ ikṣvākaḥ yam vā tvā kuṣṭha kāmyaḥ
translated: The one whom you know, O Ikṣvāku, or whom you desire, O leprosy,

original: yaṃ vā vaso yam ātsyas tenāsi viśvabheṣajaḥ ////
analyzed: yam vā vaso yam ātsyaḥ tena asi viśva bheṣajaḥ
translated: or whom you will eat, O Vasu, by that you are the universal remedy.

original: śīrṣaśokaṃ tṛtīyakaṃ sadaṃdir yaś ca hāyanaḥ /
analyzed: śīrṣaśokam tṛtīyakam sadaṃdiḥ yaḥ ca hāyanaḥ
translated: The headache, the third, and the one that comes with the years,

original: takmānaṃ viśvadhāvīryādharāñcaṃ parā suva ////
analyzed: takmānam viśvadhā vīrya adharāñcam parā suva
translated: the fever, drive away in all directions, downward, upward.

original: yan me chidraṃ manaso yac ca vācaḥ sarasvatī manyumantaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: yat me chidram manasaḥ yat ca vācaḥ sarasvatī manyumantam jagāma
translated: Whatever defect there is in my mind or in my speech, which Sarasvatī has gone to the angry one,

original: viśvais tad devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ saṃ dadhātu bṛhaspatiḥ ////
analyzed: viśvaiḥ tat devaiḥ saha saṃvidānaḥ sam dadhātu bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: may he, agreeing with all the gods, put it together, may Brhaspati.

original: mā na āpo medhāṃ mā brahma pra mathiṣṭana /
analyzed: mā naḥ āpaḥ medhām mā brahma pra mathiṣṭana
translated: Do not injure our wisdom, O waters, do not injure our prayer.

original: suṣyadā yūyaṃ syandadhvam upahūto 'haṃ sumedhā varcasvī ////
analyzed: suṣyadā yūyam syandadhvam upahūtaḥ ham sumedhāḥ varcasvī
translated: Flowing with good gifts, you are invoked. I am of good wisdom, full of splendor.

original: mā no medhāṃ mā no dīkṣāṃ mā no hiṃsiṣṭaṃ yat tapaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ medhām mā naḥ dīkṣām mā naḥ hiṃsiṣṭam yat tapaḥ
translated: Do not injure our wisdom, do not injure our consecration, do not injure our austerity.

original: śivā naḥ śaṃ santv āyuṣe śivā bhavantu mātaraḥ ////
analyzed: śivāḥ naḥ śam santu āyuṣe śivāḥ bhavantu mātaraḥ
translated: Be auspicious to us, be auspicious to us for life, be auspicious, O mothers.

original: yā naḥ pīparad aśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamas tiraḥ /
analyzed: yā naḥ pīparat aśvinā jyotiṣmatī tamaḥ tiras
translated: The one which the two Asvins have brought to us, the luminous one through the darkness,

original: tām asme rāsatām iṣam ////
analyzed: tām asme rāsatām iṣam
translated: may that food be for us.

original: bhadram ichanta ṛṣayaḥ svarvidas tapo dīkṣām upaniṣedur agre /
analyzed: bhadram ichantaḥ ṛṣayaḥ svar vidaḥ tapaḥ dīkṣām upaniṣeduḥ agre
translated: The Rishis, desiring good, finding heaven, sat down in the beginning on penance and consecration.

original: tato rāṣṭraṃ balam ojaś ca jātaṃ tad asmai devā upasaṃnamantu ////
analyzed: tatas rāṣṭram balam ojaḥ ca jātam tat asmai devāḥ upasaṃnamantu
translated: From that was born the kingdom, the strength, and the vigor. May the gods bestow that on him.

original: brahma hotā brahma yajñā brahmaṇā svaravo mitāḥ /
analyzed: brahma hotā brahma yajñāḥ brahmaṇā svaravaḥ mitāḥ
translated: Brahma is the Hotri priest, Brahma is the sacrifices, the Svaru is measured by Brahma.

original: adhvaryur brahmaṇo jāto brahmaṇo 'ntarhitaṃ haviḥ ////🔽brahma sruco ghṛtavatīr brahmaṇā vedir uddhitā /
analyzed: adhvaryuḥ brahmaṇaḥ jātaḥ brahmaṇaḥ ntarhitam haviḥ  brahma srucaḥ ghṛtavatīḥ brahmaṇā vediḥ uddhitā
translated: The Adhvaryu is born from Brahma, the oblation is hidden in Brahma.🔽Brahma is the ladles full of ghee, by Brahma the altar is raised.

original: brahma yajñasya tattvaṃ ca ṛtvijo ye haviṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: brahma yajñasya tattvam ca ṛtvijaḥ ye haviṣkṛtaḥ
translated: Brahma is the truth of the sacrifice, and the priests who offer oblations.

original: śamitāya svāhā ////🔽aṃhomuce pra bhare manīṣām ā sutrāvṇe sumatim āvṛṇānaḥ /
analyzed: śamitāya svāhā  aṃhaḥ muce pra bhare manīṣām ā sutrāvṇe sumatim āvṛṇānaḥ
translated: To the one who makes peace, svāhā!🔽I offer my thought to the one who is freed from sin, bestowing good will on the good leader.

original: imam indra prati havyaṃ gṛbhāya satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ ////
analyzed: imam indra prati havyam gṛbhāya satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ
translated: Accept this oblation, O Indra, may the desires of the sacrificer be fulfilled.

original: aṃhomucaṃ vrṣabhaṃ yajñiyānāṃ virājantaṃ prathamam adhvarāṇam /
analyzed: aṃhaḥ mucam vrṣabham yajñiyānām virājantam prathamam adhvarāṇam
translated: The bull who is freed from sin, the first of the sacrificial ones, shining,

original: apāṃ napātam aśvinā huve dhiya indriyeṇa ta indriyaṃ dattam ojaḥ ////
analyzed: apām napātam aśvinā huve dhiye indriyeṇa te indriyam dattam ojaḥ
translated: I invoke the son of the waters, the Ashvins, for the sake of thought, the power that has been given to you by Indra, O Indra.

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where the knowers of Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: agnir mā tatra nayatv agnir medhā dadhātu me /
analyzed: agniḥ mā tatra nayatu agniḥ medhāḥ dadhātu me
translated: May Agni lead me there, may Agni bestow wisdom on me.

original: agnaye svāhā ////
analyzed: agnaye svāhā
translated: To Agni, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: vāyur mā tatra nayatu vāyuḥ praṇān dadhātu me vāyave svāhā ////
analyzed: vāyuḥ mā tatra nayatu vāyuḥ praṇān dadhātu me vāyave svāhā
translated: May Vayu lead me there, may Vayu bestow the vital breaths upon me. To Vayu, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: sūryo mā tatra nayatu cakṣuḥ sūryo dadhātu me /
analyzed: sūryaḥ mā tatra nayatu cakṣuḥ sūryaḥ dadhātu me
translated: May Surya lead me there, may Surya bestow the eye upon me.

original: sūryāya svāhā ////
analyzed: sūryāya svāhā
translated: To Surya, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: candro mā tatra nayatu manaś candro dadhātu me /
analyzed: candraḥ mā tatra nayatu manaḥ candraḥ dadhātu me
translated: May Chandra lead me there, may Chandra bestow the mind upon me.

original: candrāya svāhā ////
analyzed: candrāya svāhā
translated: To Chandra, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
