analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: somo mā tatra nayatu payaḥ somo dadhātu me /
analyzed: somaḥ mā tatra nayatu payaḥ somaḥ dadhātu me
translated: May Soma lead me there, may Soma bestow the sap upon me.

original: somāya svāhā ////
analyzed: somāya svāhā
translated: To Soma, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /🔽indro mā tatra nayatu balam indro dadhātu me /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha  indraḥ mā tatra nayatu balam indraḥ dadhātu me
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,🔽May Indra lead me there, may Indra bestow the strength upon me.

original: indrāya svāhā ////
analyzed: indrāya svāhā
translated: To Indra, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: āpo mā tatra nayatv amṛtam mopa tiṣṭhatu /
analyzed: āpaḥ mā tatra nayatu amṛtam mā upa tiṣṭhatu
translated: May the waters lead me there, may immortality attend upon me.

original: adbhyaḥ svāhā ////
analyzed: adbhyaḥ svāhā
translated: To the waters, hail!

original: yatra brahmavido yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha /
analyzed: yatra brahma vidaḥ yānti dīkṣayā tapasā saha
translated: Where those who know Brahman go with initiation and austerity,

original: brahmā mā tatra nayatu brahmā brahma dadhātu me /
analyzed: brahmā mā tatra nayatu brahmā brahma dadhātu me
translated: May Brahman lead me there, may Brahman bestow Brahman on me.

original: brahmaṇe svāhā ////🔽āyuṣo 'si prataraṇaṃ vipraṃ bheṣajam ucyase /
analyzed: brahmaṇe svāhā  āyuṣaḥ si prataraṇam vipram bheṣajam ucyase
translated: To Brahman, hail!🔽You are the crossing over of life, you are said to be the medicine for the learned.

original: tad āñjana tvaṃ śaṃtāte śam āpo abhayaṃ kṛtam ////
analyzed: tat āñjana tvam śaṃtāte śam āpaḥ abhayam kṛtam
translated: May that ointment bring you well-being, may the waters have made you free from danger.

original: yo harimā jāyānyo 'ṅgabhedo viṣalpakaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ harimā jāyā anyaḥ ṅga bhedaḥ viṣalpakaḥ
translated: The one who is tawny, the one who is a joint-breaker, the one who is a disjoiner of limbs,

original: sarvaṃ te yakṣmam aṅgebhyo bahir nir hantv āñjanam ////
analyzed: sarvam te yakṣmam aṅgebhyaḥ bahis niḥ hantu āñjanam
translated: May the ointment drive out all your tuberculosis from your limbs.

original: āñjanaṃ pṛthivyāṃ jātaṃ bhadraṃ puruṣajīvanam /
analyzed: āñjanam pṛthivyām jātam bhadram puruṣa jīvanam
translated: The ointment that is born on the earth, the auspicious one that gives life to men,

original: kṛṇotv apramāyukaṃ rathajūtim anāgasam ////🔽prāṇa prāṇaṃ trāyasvāso asave mṛḍa /
analyzed: kṛṇotu a pramāyukam ratha jūtim anāgasam  prāṇa prāṇam trāyasva aso asave mṛḍa
translated: May it make you live long, swift as a chariot, free from guilt.🔽O Prana, protect Prana, be gracious to Asva in Asva.

original: nirṛte nirṛtyā naḥ pāśebhyo muñca ////
analyzed: nirṛte nirṛtyāḥ naḥ pāśebhyaḥ muñca
translated: O Nirriti, free us from the bonds of Nirriti.

original: sindhor garbho 'si vidyutāṃ puṣpam /
analyzed: sindhoḥ garbhaḥ si vidyutām puṣpam
translated: You are the embryo of the river, the flower of the lightning.

original: vātaḥ prāṇaḥ sūryaś cakṣur divas payaḥ ////
analyzed: vātaḥ prāṇaḥ sūryaḥ cakṣuḥ divaḥ payaḥ
translated: The wind is Prana, the sun is the eye, the milk of heaven.

original: devāñjana traikakuda pari mā pāhi viśvataḥ /
analyzed: devāñjana traikakuda pari mā pāhi viśvatas
translated: O divine ointment, protect me from all sides, from the three-peaked one.

original: na tvā taranty oṣadhayo bāhyāḥ parvatīyā uta ////
analyzed: na tvā taranti oṣadhayaḥ bāhyāḥ parvatīyāḥ uta
translated: The outer plants and those of the mountains do not surpass you.

original: vīdaṃ madhyam avāsṛpad rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ /
analyzed: vi idam madhyam avāsṛpat rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ
translated: The tuberculosis-destroying, disease-driving one has entered this middle.

original: amīvāḥ sarvāś cātayan nāśayad abhibhā itaḥ ////
analyzed: amīvāḥ sarvāḥ cātayat nāśayat abhibhā itas
translated: And drove away all evil spirits, and destroyed them, and overcame them from here.

original: bahv idaṃ rājan varuṇānṛtam āha pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: bahu idam rājan varuṇa anṛtam āha pūruṣaḥ
translated: O king, this man speaks much untruth to Varuna.

original: tasmāt sahasravīrya muñca naḥ pary aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: tasmāt sahasra vīrya muñca naḥ pari aṃhasaḥ
translated: Therefore, O thou of a thousand powers, deliver us from sin.

original: yad āpo aghnyā iti varuṇeti yad ūcima /
analyzed: yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti yat ūcima
translated: If we have said of the waters, 'They are not to be slain,' and of Varuna,

original: tasmāt sahasravīrya muñca naḥ pary aṃhasaḥ ////
analyzed: tasmāt sahasra vīrya muñca naḥ pari aṃhasaḥ
translated: Therefore, O thou of a thousand powers, deliver us from sin.

original: mitraś ca tvā varuṇaś cānupreyatur āñjana /
analyzed: mitraḥ ca tvā varuṇaḥ ca anupreyatuḥ āñjana
translated: May Mitra and Varuna follow thee, O collyrium.

original: tau tvānugatya dūraṃ bhogāya punar ohatuḥ ////
analyzed: tau tvā anugatya dūram bhogāya punar ohatuḥ
translated: Having followed thee far, they bring thee back again for enjoyment.

original: ṛṇād ṛṇam iva saṃ naya kṛtyāṃ kṛtyākṛto gṛham /
analyzed: ṛṇāt ṛṇam iva sam naya kṛtyām kṛtyā kṛtaḥ gṛham
translated: As from debt to debt, so lead the witchcraft back to the house of the worker of witchcraft.

original: cakṣurmantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīr api śṛṇāñjana ////
analyzed: cakṣuḥ mantrasya durhārdaḥ pṛṣṭīḥ api śṛṇa añjana
translated: O collyrium, crush the back-bones of the evil-hearted one, the spell of the eye.

original: yad asmāsu duṣvapnyaṃ yad goṣu yac ca no gṛhe /
analyzed: yat asmāsu duṣvapnyam yat goṣu yat ca naḥ gṛhe
translated: Whatever evil dream is in us, whatever in our cows, whatever in our house,

original: anāmagas taṃ ca durhārdaḥ priyaḥ prati muñcatām ////
analyzed: anāmagaḥ tam ca durhārdaḥ priyaḥ prati muñcatām
translated: May the harmless one, and the evil-hearted one, release it to the dear one.

original: apām ūrja ojaso vāvṛdhānam agner jātam adhi jātavedasaḥ /
analyzed: apām ūrjaḥ ojasaḥ vāvṛdhānam agneḥ jātam adhi jātavedasaḥ
translated: The collyrium that has grown from the strength and vigour of the waters, that is born from the womb of Agni, the all-knower,

original: caturvīraṃ parvatīyaṃ yad āñjanaṃ diśaḥ pradiśaḥ karad ic chivās te ////
analyzed: caturvīram parvatīyam yat āñjanam diśaḥ pradiśaḥ karat id śivāḥ te
translated: The collyrium that is fourfold, mountain-born, may it make the quarters and the intermediate quarters auspicious for thee.

original: caturvīraṃ badhyata āñjanaṃ te sarvā diśo abhayās te bhavantu /
analyzed: catur vīram badhyate āñjanam te sarvāḥ diśaḥ abhayāḥ te bhavantu
translated: The four-heroic ointment is bound for you. May all the directions be safe for you.

original: dhruvas tiṣṭhāsi saviteva cārya imā viśo abhi harantu te balim ////
analyzed: dhruvaḥ tiṣṭhāsi savitā iva cāryaḥ imāḥ viśaḥ abhi harantu te balim
translated: Stand firm like Savitar, O noble one. Let these people bring you tribute.

original: ākṣvaikaṃ maṇim ekaṃ krṇuṣva snāhy ekenā pibaikam eṣām /
analyzed: ākṣva ekam maṇim ekam snāhi ekena ā piba ekam eṣām
translated: Take one gem, make one, bathe with one, drink from one of them.

original: caturvīraṃ nairṛtebhyaś caturbhyo grāhyā bandhebhyaḥ pari pātv asmān ////
analyzed: catur vīram nairṛtebhyaḥ caturbhyaḥ grāhyā bandhebhyaḥ pari pātu asmān
translated: May the four-heroic one protect us from the four directions, from the bonds of the demons.

original: agnir māgnināvatu prāṇāyāpānāyāyuṣe varcasa ojase /
analyzed: agniḥ mā agninā avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase
translated: May Agni protect me with fire, for inhalation, exhalation, life, luster, strength,

original: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā ////
analyzed: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: for brilliance, for well-being, for good fortune, svāhā.

original: indro mendriyeṇāvatu prāṇāyāpānāyāyuṣe varcasa ojase /
analyzed: indraḥ mā indriyeṇa avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase
translated: May Indra protect me with his power, for inhalation, exhalation, life, luster, strength,

original: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā ////
analyzed: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: for brilliance, for well-being, for good fortune, svāhā.

original: somo mā saumyenāvatu prāṇāyāpānāyāyuṣe varcasa ojase /
analyzed: somaḥ mā saumyena avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase
translated: May Soma protect me with his grace, for inhalation, exhalation, life, luster, strength,

original: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā ////
analyzed: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: for brilliance, for well-being, for good fortune, svāhā.

original: bhago ma bhagenāvatu prāṇāyāpānāyāyuṣe varcasa ojase /
analyzed: bhagaḥ ma bhagena avatu prāṇāya apānāya āyuṣe varcase ojase
translated: May Bhaga protect me with his fortune, for inhalation, exhalation, life, luster, strength,

original: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā ////
analyzed: tejase svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: for brilliance, for well-being, for good fortune, svāhā.

original: maruto mā gaṇair avantu prāṇāyāpānāyuṣe varcasa ojase tejase /
analyzed: marutaḥ mā gaṇaiḥ avantu prāṇāya apāna āyuṣe varcase ojase tejase
translated: May the Maruts protect me with their hosts, for inhalation, exhalation, life, luster, strength,🔽for brilliance,

original: svastaye subhūtaye svāhā ////
analyzed: svastaye subhūtaye svāhā
translated: For well-being, for good fortune, hail!

original: prajāpatiṣ ṭvā badhnāt prathamam astṛtaṃ vīryāya kam /
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ tvā badhnāt prathamam astṛtam vīryāya kam
translated: Prajapati first bound thee, the armour, for the sake of strength.

original: tat te badhnāmy āyuṣe varcasa ojase ca balāya cāstṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: tat te badhnāmi āyuṣe varcase ojase ca balāya ca a stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: That I now bind on thee for life, for splendour, for vigour, and for power. May the armour protect thee well!

original: ūrdhvas tiṣṭhatu rakṣann apramādam astṛtemam mā tvā dabhan paṇayo yātudhānāḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhatu rakṣan apramādam a stṛta imam mā tvā dabhan paṇayaḥ yātudhānāḥ
translated: Let it stand erect, guarding, never heedless. Let not the demons, the goblins, hurt thee.

original: indra iva dasyūn ava dhūnuṣva pṛtanyataḥ sarvāṃ chatrūn vi ṣahasvāstṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: indraḥ iva dasyūn ava dhūnuṣva pṛtanyataḥ sarvān śatrūn vi sahasva astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: As Indra smote down the dasyus, so crush the foes that stand against thee. Overcome all enemies. May the armour protect thee well!

original: śataṃ ca na praharanto nighnanto na tastire /
analyzed: śatam ca na praharantaḥ nighnantaḥ na tastire
translated: A hundred times they struck it, a thousand times they beat it,

original: tasminn indraḥ pary adatta cakṣuḥ prāṇam atho balam astṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: tasmin indraḥ pari adatta cakṣuḥ prāṇam atha u balam astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: And Indra bestowed in it the eye, the breath, and also strength. May the armour protect thee well!

original: indrasya tvā varmaṇā pari dhāpayāmo yo devānām adhirājo babhūva /
analyzed: indrasya tvā varmaṇā pari dhāpayāmaḥ yaḥ devānām adhirājaḥ babhūva
translated: We clothe thee with the armour of Indra, who became the overlord of the gods.

original: punas tvā devāḥ pra ṇayantu sarve 'stṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: punar tvā devāḥ pra nayantu sarve stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: May all the gods again lead thee forward. May the armour protect thee well!

original: asmin maṇāv ekaśataṃ vīryāṇi sahasraṃ prāṇā asminn astṛte /
analyzed: asmin maṇau ekaśatam vīryāṇi sahasram prāṇāḥ asmin astṛte
translated: In this amulet are a hundred and one powers, a thousand breaths in this armour.

original: vyāghraḥ śatrūn abhi tiṣṭha sarvān yas tvā pṛtanyād adharaḥ so astv astṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: vyāghraḥ śatrūn abhi tiṣṭha sarvān yaḥ tvā pṛtanyāt adharaḥ saḥ astu astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: The tiger overcomes all enemies. Let him who would fight with you be beneath you. Let the uncovered one protect you.

original: ghṛtād ullupto madhumān payasvānt sahasraprāṇaḥ śatayonir vayodhāḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtāt ulluptaḥ madhumān payasvān sahasra prāṇaḥ śata yoniḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: Scraped from ghee, rich in honey and milk, with a thousand breaths, born from a hundred wombs, giving strength,

original: śambhūś ca mayobhūś corjasvāṃś ca payasvāṃś cāstṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: śambhūḥ ca mayobhūḥ ca ūrjasvān ca payasvān ca astṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: May the uncovered one protect you, bringing peace, bringing joy, full of vigor, full of milk.

original: yathā tvam uttaro 'so asapatnaḥ sapatnahā /
analyzed: yathā tvam uttaraḥ saḥ asapatnaḥ sapatna hā
translated: Just as you are the highest, without an enemy, the destroyer of enemies,

original: sajātānām asad vaśī tathā tvā savitā karad astṛtas tvābhi rakṣatu ////
analyzed: sajātānām asat vaśī tathā tvā savitā karat a stṛtaḥ tvā abhi rakṣatu
translated: The lord of your equals, may Savita make you so. Let the uncovered one protect you.

original: ā rātri pārthivaṃ rajaḥ pitur aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ /
analyzed: ā rātri pārthivam rajaḥ pituḥ aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ
translated: O Night, you have come with your own powers to the earthly realm of your father.

original: divaḥ sadāṃsi bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhasa ā tveṣaṃ vartate tamaḥ ////
analyzed: divaḥ sadāṃsi bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhase ā tveṣam vartate tamaḥ
translated: O vast one, you extend the eternal abodes of heaven. Your dark veil spreads out.

original: na yasyāḥ pāraṃ dadṛśe na yoyuvad viśvam asyāṃ ni viśate yad ejati /
analyzed: na yasyāḥ pāram dadṛśe na yoyuvat viśvam asyām ni viśate yat ejati
translated: Of whom no shore is seen, all that moves rests in her.

original: ariṣṭāsas ta urvi tamasvati rātri pāram aśīmahi bhadre pāram aśīmahi ////
analyzed: ariṣṭāsaḥ te urvi tamasvati rātri pāram aśīmahi bhadre pāram aśīmahi
translated: O Earth, may we reach the good end of the night, free from harm, in the darkness. May we reach the good end.

original: ye te rātri nṛcakṣaso draṣṭāro navatir nava /
analyzed: ye te rātri nṛ cakṣasaḥ draṣṭāraḥ navatiḥ nava
translated: O Night, those of yours who are men's eyes, the nine and ninety beholders,

original: aśītiḥ santy aṣṭā uto te sapta saptatiḥ ////
analyzed: aśītiḥ santi aṣṭa uta u te sapta saptatiḥ
translated: The eighty, the eight, and also your seven and seventy.

original: ṣaṣṭiś ca ṣaṭ ca revati pañcāśat pañca sumnayi /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ ca ṣaḍ ca revati pañcāśat pañca sumnayi
translated: Sixty and six, O Revati, fifty and five, O Sumni,

original: catvāraś catvāriṃśac ca trayas triṃśac ca vājini ////
analyzed: catvāraḥ catvāriṃśat ca trayaḥ triṃśat ca vājini
translated: Four and forty, three and thirty, O Vajibani,

original: dvau ca te viṃśatiś ca te rātry ekādaśāvamāḥ /
analyzed: dvau ca te viṃśatiḥ ca te rātri ekādaśa avamāḥ
translated: Two and twenty are thine, O Night, the eleven are the lowest.

original: tebhir no adya pāyubhir nu pāhi duhitar divaḥ ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ adya pāyubhiḥ nu pāhi duhitar divaḥ
translated: With these protectors of yours, O Daughter of Heaven, protect us this day.

original: rakṣā mākir no aghaśaṃsa īśata mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata /🔽mā no adya gavāṃ steno māvīnāṃ vṛka īśata ////
analyzed: rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ īśata  mā naḥ adya gavām stenaḥ mā avīnām vṛkaḥ īśata
translated: Let not the evil-wisher rule over us, let not the evil-doer rule over us.🔽Let not the thief of our cattle, let not the wolf rule over our sheep this day.

original: māśvānāṃ bhadre taskaro mā nṛṇāṃ yātudhānyaḥ /
analyzed: mā aśvānām bhadre taskaraḥ mā nṛṇām yātudhānyaḥ
translated: O auspicious one, let not the robber rule over our horses, let not the demoness rule over our men.

original: paramebhiḥ pathibhi steno dhāvatu taskaraḥ /🔽pareṇa datvatī rajjuḥ pareṇāghāyur arṣatu ////
analyzed: paramebhiḥ pathibhiḥ stenaḥ dhāvatu taskaraḥ  pareṇa datvatī rajjuḥ pareṇa aghāyuḥ arṣatu
translated: By these highest paths let the thief run, let the robber run.🔽Let the rope go beyond, let the evil-doer go beyond.

original: adha rātri tṛṣṭadhūmam aśīrṣāṇam ahiṃ kṛṇu /
analyzed: adha rātri tṛṣṭa dhūmam a śīrṣāṇam ahim kṛṇu
translated: O Night, make the snake hornless, make the snake headless.

original: hanū vṛkasya jambhayā stenaṃ drupade jahi ////
analyzed: hanū vṛkasya jambhaya stenam drupade jahi
translated: Crush the jaws of the wolf, strike the thief in the foot.

original: tvayi rātri vasāmasi svapiṣyāmasi jāgṛhi /
analyzed: tvayi rātri vasāmasi svapiṣyāmasi jāgṛhi
translated: In you, O Night, we dwell, we shall sleep, be watchful.

original: gobhyo naḥ śarma yachāśvebhyaḥ puruṣebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: gobhyaḥ naḥ śarma yaccha aśvebhyaḥ puruṣebhyaḥ
translated: Grant us protection for our cattle, for our horses, for our men.

original: atho yāni ca yasmā ha yāni cāntaḥ parīṇahi /
analyzed: atha u yāni ca yasmai ha yāni ca antar
translated: And also for those which are in the house, and those which are outside,

original: tāni te pari dadmasi ////
analyzed: tāni te pari dadmasi
translated: We give them back to you.

original: rātri mātar uṣase naḥ pari dehi /
analyzed: rātri mātar uṣase naḥ pari dehi
translated: O Night, Mother, give us to the Dawn.

original: uṣā no ahne pari dadātv ahas tubhyaṃ vibhāvari ////
analyzed: uṣāḥ naḥ ahne pari dadātu ahar tubhyam vibhāvari
translated: May the Dawn give us to the day, O you who shine at night.

original: yat kiṃ cedaṃ patayati yat kiṃ cedaṃ sarīsṛpam /
analyzed: yat kim ca idam patayati yat kim ca idam sarīsṛpam
translated: Whatever moves in the sky, whatever creeps on the ground,

original: yat kiṃ ca parvatāyāsatvaṃ tasmāt tvaṃ rātri pāhi naḥ ////
analyzed: yat kim ca parvata āyāsa tvam tasmāt tvam rātri pāhi naḥ
translated: Whatever is in the mountains, from all that, O Night, protect us.

original: sā paścāt pāhi sā puraḥ sottarād adharād uta /
analyzed: sā paścāt pāhi sā puras sā uttarāt adharāt uta
translated: Protect us from the rear, protect us from the front, from above and from below.

original: gopāya no vibhāvari stotāras ta iha smasi ////
analyzed: gopāya naḥ vibhāvari stotāraḥ te iha smasi
translated: Protect us, O you who shine at night, we are here, your praisers.

original: ye rātrim anutiṣṭhanti ye ca bhūteṣu jāgrati /
analyzed: ye rātrim anutiṣṭhanti ye ca bhūteṣu jāgrati
translated: Those who follow the night, and those who are awake among beings,

original: paśūn ye sarvān rakṣanti te na ātmasu jāgrati te naḥ paśuṣu jāgrati ////
analyzed: paśūn ye sarvān rakṣanti te naḥ ātmasu jāgrati te naḥ paśuṣu jāgrati
translated: Those who protect all the cattle, they are awake in their own selves. They are awake in our cattle.

original: veda vai rātri te nāma ghṛtācī nāma vā asi /
analyzed: veda vai rātri te nāma ghṛtācī nāma vai asi
translated: I know your name, O Night, you are called Ghrtachi.

original: tāṃ tvāṃ bharadvājo veda sā no vitte 'dhi jāgrati ////🔽iṣirā yoṣā yuvatir damūnā rātrī devasya savitur bhagasya /🔽aśvakṣabhā suhavā saṃbhṛtaśrīr ā paprau dyāvāpṛthivī mahitvā ////
analyzed: tām tvām bharadvājaḥ veda sā naḥ vitte dhi jāgrati  iṣirā yoṣā yuvatiḥ damūnāḥ rātrī devasya savituḥ bhagasya  aśva kṣabhā su havā saṃbhṛta śrīḥ ā paprau dyāvāpṛthivī mahitvā
translated: Bharadvaja knows you, be you awake for us in our wealth.🔽The active, youthful, loving wife, Night, of the god Savita and Bhaga,🔽With horse-drawn chariot, easily invoked, with gathered glory, has extended the heaven and earth with her greatness.

original: ati viśvāny aruhad gambhiro varṣiṣṭham aruhanta śraviṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: ati viśvāni aruhat gambhiraḥ varṣiṣṭham aruhanta śraviṣṭhāḥ
translated: She has risen above all the deeps, the most lofty have risen highest.

original: uśatī rātry anu sā bhadrābhi tiṣṭhate mitra iva svadhābhiḥ ////
analyzed: uśatī rātrī anu sā bhadrā abhi tiṣṭhate mitraḥ iva svadhābhiḥ
translated: The lovely Night, dear to all, shines forth with her own nature, like Mitra.

original: varye vande subhage sujāta ājagan rātri sumanā iha syām /
analyzed: varye vande subhage sujāte ājagan rātri sumanāḥ iha syām
translated: I praise the excellent, fortunate, well-born Night. O Night, may I be well-disposed here.

original: asmāṃs trāyasva naryāṇi jātā atho yāni gavyāni puṣṭyā ////
analyzed: asmān trāyasva naryāṇi jātā atha u yāni gavyāni puṣṭyā
translated: Protect us, O Night, from manly deeds and from those deeds connected with cattle and prosperity.

original: siṃhasya rātry uśatī pīṃṣasya vyāghrasya dvīpino varca ā dade /
analyzed: siṃhasya rātrī uśatī pīṃṣasya vyāghrasya dvīpinaḥ varcaḥ ā dade
translated: O Night, I take the splendor of the lion, the tiger, the leopard, and the panther.

original: aśvasya bradhnaṃ puruṣasya māyuṃ puru rūpāṇi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī ////
analyzed: aśvasya bradhnam puruṣasya māyum puru rūpāṇi kṛṇuṣe vibhātī
translated: The brilliance of the horse, the life-breath of man, you create many forms, O radiant one.

original: śivāṃ rātrim anusūryaṃ ca himasya mātā suhavā no astu /
analyzed: śivām rātrim anusūryam ca himasya mātā su havā naḥ astu
translated: May the auspicious Night, and the sunless snow, the mother of this, be an easy means for us.

original: asya stomasya subhage ni bodha yena tvā vande viśvāsu dikṣu ////
analyzed: asya stomasya subhage ni bodha yena tvā vande viśvāsu dikṣu
translated: O fortunate one, be aware of this praise, by which I honor you in all the directions.

original: stomasya no vibhāvari rātri rājeva joṣase /
analyzed: stomasya naḥ vibhāvari rātri rājā iva joṣase
translated: O Night, the illuminator, you accept this praise of ours like a king.

original: asāma sarvavīrā bhavāma sarvavedaso vyuchantīr anūṣasaḥ ////
analyzed: asāma sarva vīrāḥ bhavāma sarva vedasaḥ vyuchantīḥ anu uṣasaḥ
translated: May we be prosperous with all our heroes, with all our possessions, as the dawns break forth.

original: śamyā ha nāma dadhiṣe mama dipsanti ye dhanā /
analyzed: śamyā ha nāma dadhiṣe mama dipsanti ye dhanā
translated: You, O Night, are called the one who grants me wealth. Those who covet wealth

original: rātrīhi tān asutapā ya steno na vidyate yat punar na vidyate ////
analyzed: rātrīhi tān a suta pāḥ yaḥ stenaḥ na vidyate yat punar na vidyate
translated: O Night, may you be the one who finds the thief who is not found, and what is not found again.

original: bhadrāsi rātri camaso na viṣṭo viṣvaṅ gorūpaṃ yuvatir bibharṣi /
analyzed: bhadrā asi rātri camasaḥ na viṣṭaḥ viṣvaṅ go rūpam yuvatiḥ bibharṣi
translated: You are auspicious, O Night, like a covered caldron; you bear about you, as a young woman, the form of a cow.

original: cakṣuṣmatī me uśatī vapūmṣi prati tvaṃ divyā na kṣām amukthāḥ ////
analyzed: cakṣuṣmatī me uśatī vapūmṣi prati tvam divyā na kṣām amukthāḥ
translated: You, divine one, have set me down on the earth, with eyes and desires for beauty.

original: yo adya stena āyaty aghāyur martyo ripuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ adya stenaḥ āyati aghāyuḥ martyaḥ ripuḥ
translated: The mortal foe, the evil-living thief who comes to us this day,

original: rātrī tasya pratītya pra grīvāḥ pra śiro hanat ////
analyzed: rātrī tasya pratītya pra grīvāḥ pra śiraḥ hanat
translated: May Night, pursuing him, break his neck and crush his head.

original: pra pādau na yathāyati pra hastau na yathāśiṣat /
analyzed: pra pādau na yathā ayati pra hastau na yathā aśiṣat
translated: May his feet be broken off, that he may not go away; may his hands be broken off, that he may not strike.

original: yo malimlur upāyati sa saṃpiṣṭo apāyati /
analyzed: yaḥ malimluḥ upāyati sa saṃpiṣṭaḥ apāyati
translated: The thief who comes to us, crushed, goes away crushed;

original: apāyati svapāyati śuṣke sthāṇāv apāyati ////
analyzed: apāyati su apāyati śuṣke sthāṇau apāyati
translated: he goes away crushed, he goes away asleep; he goes away crushed on the dry stump.

original: adha rātri tṛṣṭadhūmam aśīrṣāṇam ahiṃ kṛṇu /
analyzed: adha rātri tṛṣṭa dhūmam a śīrṣāṇam ahim kṛṇu
translated: O Night, make the snake hornless, with no head, and no smoke.

original: akṣau vṛkasya nir jahyās tena taṃ drupade jahi ////
analyzed: akṣau vṛkasya niḥ jahyāḥ tena tam drupade jahi
translated: Cast out the eyes of the wolf; with that, O Drupada, slay him.

original: ye te rātry anaḍvāhas tīkṣṇaśṛṅgāḥ svāśavaḥ /
analyzed: ye te rātri anaḍvāhaḥ tīkṣṇa śṛṅgāḥ su āśavaḥ
translated: O Night, those thy oxen, with sharp horns, swift to their work,

original: tebhir no adya pārayāti durgāṇi viśvahā ////
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ adya pārayāti durgāṇi viśvahā
translated: With them carry us over the difficulties of this day, at all times.

original: rātriṃrātrim ariṣyantas tarema tanvā vayam /🔽gambhīram aplavā iva na tareyur arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: rātrim rātrim a riṣyantaḥ tarema tanvā vayam  gambhīram aplavāḥ iva na tareyuḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Night after night may we pass over (difficulties) with our bodies,🔽as the helpless cannot pass over the deep, so may the evil ones not pass over (us).

original: yathā śāmyākaḥ prapatann apavān nānuvidyate /
analyzed: yathā śāmyākaḥ prapatan apavān na anuvidyate
translated: As the falling panicle, without wind, is not noticed,

original: evā rātri pra pātaya yo asmāṃ abhyaghāyati ////
analyzed: eva rātri pra pātaya yaḥ asmām abhyaghāyati
translated: O Night, thus do thou drive away him who would do us harm.

original: apa stenaṃ vāsayo goajam uta taskaram /
analyzed: apa stenam vāsayaḥ go ajam uta taskaram
translated: Drive away the thief, the cattle-rustler, and the robber.

original: atho yo arvataḥ śiro 'bhidhāya ninīṣati ////
analyzed: atha u yaḥ arvataḥ śiraḥ bhidhāya ninīṣati
translated: And him who, having laid hold of the horse's head, would lead it away.

original: yad adya rātri subhage vibhajanty ayo vasu /
analyzed: yat adya rātri subhage vibhajanti ayaḥ vasu
translated: O Night, O most blessed one, as thou art dividing the wealth of iron today,

original: yad etad asmān bhojaya yathed anyān upāyasi ////🔽uṣase naḥ pari dehi sarvān rātry anāgasaḥ /
analyzed: yat etat asmān bhojaya yathā id anyān upāyasi  uṣase naḥ pari dehi sarvān rātri anāgasaḥ
translated: As thou dost feed us, so thou goest to others.🔽O Night, deliver us all unharmed to the Dawn.

original: uṣā no ahne ā bhajād ahas tubhyaṃ vibhāvari ////
analyzed: uṣāḥ naḥ ahne ā bhajāt ahar tubhyam vibhāvari
translated: May the Dawn allot to us the day, O thou of varied splendour, the day to thee.

original: ayuto 'ham ayuto ma ātmāyutaṃ me cakṣur ayutaṃ me śrotram /
analyzed: ayutaḥ ham ayutaḥ me ātmā ayutam me cakṣuḥ ayutam me śrotram
translated: I am ten thousand, my self is ten thousand, my eye is ten thousand, my ear is ten thousand.

original: ayuto me prāṇo 'yuto me 'pāno 'yuto me vyāno 'yuto 'haṃ sarvaḥ ////
analyzed: ayutaḥ me prāṇaḥ yutaḥ me pānaḥ yutaḥ me vyānaḥ yutaḥ ham sarvaḥ
translated: My out-breath is ten thousand, my off-breath is ten thousand, my through-breath is ten thousand, I am all ten thousand.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyāṃ prasūta ā rabhe ////
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām prasūtaḥ ā rabhe
translated: By the impulse of the god Savitr, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee in the impulse of the god Savitr.

original: kāmas tad agre sam avartata manaso retaḥ prathamaṃ yad āsīt /
analyzed: kāmaḥ tat agre sam avartata manasaḥ retaḥ prathamam yat āsīt
translated: Desire first moved forth from that, the seed of mind, which was in the beginning.

original: sa kāma kāmena bṛhatā sayonī rāyas poṣaṃ yajamānāya dhehi ////
analyzed: sa kāma kāmena bṛhatā sayoniḥ rāyaḥ poṣam yajamānāya dhehi
translated: O Desire, with great Desire as thy birthplace, bestow increase of wealth on the sacrificer.

original: tvaṃ kāma sahasāsi pratiṣṭhito vibhur vibhāvā sakha ā sakhīyate /
analyzed: tvam kāma sahasā asi pratiṣṭhitaḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā sakhaḥ ā sakhīyate
translated: Thou, O Kāma, art established as the all-pervading, the illuminating, the friend who is befriended.

original: tvam ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sasahiḥ saha ojo yajamānāya dhehi ////
analyzed: tvam ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sasahiḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ yajamānāya dhehi
translated: Thou art the mighty one who conquers in battles; give strength to the sacrificer.

original: dūrāc cakamānāya pratipāṇāyākṣaye /
analyzed: dūrāt cakamānāya pratipāṇāya a kṣaye
translated: To him who longs from afar, to him who is ready to receive, to him who is inexhaustible,

original: āsmā aśṛṇvann āśāḥ kāmenājanayant svaḥ ////
analyzed: ā asmai aśṛṇvan āśāḥ kāmena ajanayan svar
translated: To him have the quarters listened, they have generated heaven through Kāma.

original: kāmena mā kāma āgan hṛdayād dhṛdayaṃ pari /
analyzed: kāmena mā kāmaḥ āgan hṛdayāt hṛdayam pari
translated: Through Kāma, O Kāma, thou hast come to me from the heart to the heart.

original: yad amīṣām ado manas tad aitūpa mām iha ////
analyzed: yat amīṣām adaḥ manaḥ tat aitu upa mām iha
translated: Whatever mind they have in these (quarters), that has come to me here.

original: yat kāma kāmayamānā idaṃ kṛṇmasi te haviḥ /
analyzed: yat kāma kāmayamānāḥ idam kṛṇmasi te haviḥ
translated: Whatever we desire, O Kāma, as we perform this sacrifice for thee,

original: tan naḥ sarvaṃ sam ṛdhyatām athaitasya haviṣo vīhi svāhā ////
analyzed: tat naḥ sarvam sam ṛdhyatām atha etasya haviṣaḥ vīhi svāhā
translated: May all that be accomplished for us; then partake of this oblation, Svāhā!

original: kālo aśvo vahati saptaraśmiḥ sahasrākṣo ajaro bhūriretāḥ /
analyzed: kālaḥ aśvaḥ vahati sapta raśmiḥ sahasra akṣaḥ ajaraḥ bhūri retāḥ
translated: The horse Kāla draws (the chariot) with seven reins, with a thousand eyes, ageless, with abundant seed.

original: tam ā rohanti kavayo vipaścitas tasya cakrā bhuvanāni viśvā ////
analyzed: tam ā rohanti kavayaḥ vipaścitaḥ tasya cakrā bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: The wise, the deeply wise mount him; his wheels are all the worlds.

original: sapta cakrān vahati kāla eṣa saptāsya nābhīr amṛtaṃ nv akṣaḥ /
analyzed: sapta cakrān vahati kālaḥ eṣa sapta asya nābhīḥ amṛtam nu akṣaḥ
translated: This Kāla draws seven wheels; his navel is sevenfold; the axle is indeed immortal.

original: sa imā viśvā bhuvanāny añjat kālaḥ sa īyate prathamo nu devaḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni añjat kālaḥ saḥ īyate prathamaḥ nu devaḥ
translated: He has pervaded all these worlds; Kāla is carried forth as the first god.

original: pūrṇaḥ kumbho 'dhi kāla āhitas taṃ vai paśyāmo bahudhā nu santam /
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ kumbhaḥ dhi kāle āhitaḥ tam vai paśyāmaḥ bahudhā nu santam
translated: The full jar is placed upon the time; we see it in many ways existing there.

original: sa imā viśvā bhuvanāni pratyaṅ kālaṃ tam āhuḥ parame vyoman ////
analyzed: saḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni pratyaṅ kālam tam āhuḥ parame vyoman
translated: He is the one who looks upon all these worlds. They call him Time in the highest heaven.

original: sa eva saṃ bhuvanāny ābharat sa eva saṃ bhuvanāni pary ait /
analyzed: saḥ eva sam bhuvanāni ābharat saḥ eva sam bhuvanāni pari ait
translated: He alone has filled the worlds; he alone has encompassed the worlds.

original: pitā sann abhavat putra eṣāṃ tasmād vai nānyat param asti tejaḥ ////
analyzed: pitā san abhavat putraḥ eṣām tasmāt vai na anyat param asti tejaḥ
translated: Being the father, he became their son. There is no splendor higher than he.

original: kālo 'mūṃ divam ajanayat kāla imāḥ pṛthivīr uta /
analyzed: kālaḥ mūm divam ajanayat kālaḥ imāḥ pṛthivīḥ uta
translated: Time has produced this sky, and Time these earths.

original: kāle ha bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ ceṣitaṃ ha vi tiṣṭhate ////
analyzed: kāle ha bhūtam bhavyam ca iṣitam ha vi tiṣṭhate
translated: In Time is the past and future desired. It is in Time that all things are established.

original: kālo bhūtim asṛjata kāle tapati sūryaḥ /
analyzed: kālaḥ bhūtim asṛjata kāle tapati sūryaḥ
translated: Time has created prosperity. The sun shines in Time.

original: kāle ha viśvā bhūtāni kāle cakṣur vi paśyati ////
analyzed: kāle ha viśvā bhūtāni kāle cakṣuḥ vi paśyati
translated: In Time all things exist. In Time the eye sees distinctly.

original: kāle manaḥ kāle prāṇaḥ kāle nāma samāhitam /
analyzed: kāle manaḥ kāle prāṇaḥ kāle nāma samāhitam
translated: In Time is the mind, in Time the breath, in Time is the name collected.

original: kālena sarvā nandanty āgatena prajā imāḥ ////
analyzed: kālena sarvāḥ nandanti āgatena prajāḥ imāḥ
translated: By the coming of Time, all these creatures rejoice.

original: kāle tapaḥ kāle jyeṣṭham kāle brahma samāhitam /
analyzed: kāle tapaḥ kāle jyeṣṭham kāle brahma samāhitam
translated: In Time is austerity, in Time the eldest, in Time the Brahman is collected.

original: kālo ha sarvasyeśvaro yaḥ pitāsīt prajāpateḥ ////
analyzed: kālaḥ ha sarvasya īśvaraḥ yaḥ pitā āsīt prajāpateḥ
translated: Time is the lord of all, he who is the father of Prajapati.

original: teneṣitaṃ tena jātaṃ tad u tasmin pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: tena iṣitam tena jātam tat u tasmin pratiṣṭhitam
translated: By him is this impelled, by him is it born, and in him is it established.

original: kālo ha brahma bhūtvā bibharti parameṣṭhinam ////
analyzed: kālaḥ ha brahma bhūtvā bibharti parameṣṭhinam
translated: Time, becoming Brahman, supports the supreme lord.

original: kālaḥ prajā asṛjata kālo agre prajāpatim /
analyzed: kālaḥ prajāḥ asṛjata kālaḥ agre prajāpatim
translated: Time created the people, Time created Prajapati in the beginning.

original: svayaṃbhūḥ kaśyapaḥ kālāt tapaḥ kālād ajāyata ////
analyzed: svayaṃbhūḥ kaśyapaḥ kālāt tapaḥ kālāt ajāyata
translated: From Time, the self-existent Kashyapa was born, and from Time, austerity was born.

original: kālād āpaḥ sam abhavan kālād brahma tapo diśaḥ /
analyzed: kālāt āpaḥ sam abhavan kālāt brahma tapaḥ diśaḥ
translated: From Time, the waters were produced, from Time, Brahman, austerity, and the directions.

original: kālenod eti sūryaḥ kāle ni viśate punaḥ ////🔽kālena vātaḥ pavate kālena pṛthivī mahī /
analyzed: kālena ud eti sūryaḥ kāle ni viśate punar  kālena vātaḥ pavate kālena pṛthivī mahī
translated: By Time, the sun rises, by Time, it sets again.🔽By Time, the wind blows, by Time, the great earth.

original: dyaur mahī kāla āhitā ////
analyzed: dyauḥ mahī kālaḥ āhitā
translated: The sky and the earth are established by Time.

original: kālo ha bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ ca putro ajanayat purā /
analyzed: kālaḥ ha bhūtam bhavyam ca putraḥ ajanayat purā
translated: Time, the son, produced in the past the past and the future.

original: kālād ṛcaḥ sam abhavan yajuḥ kālād ajāyata ////
analyzed: kālāt ṛcaḥ sam abhavan yajuḥ kālāt ajāyata
translated: From Time, the Rig-Veda was produced, from Time, the Yajur-Veda was born.

original: kālo yajñaṃ sam airayad devebhyo bhāgam akṣitam /
analyzed: kālaḥ yajñam sam airayat devebhyaḥ bhāgam akṣitam
translated: Time brought the imperishable sacrifice to the gods.

original: kāle gandharvāpsarasaḥ kāle lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ ////
analyzed: kāle gandharva apsarasaḥ kāle lokāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: In Time, the Gandharvas and Apsaras were born, in Time, the worlds were established.

original: kāle 'yam aṅgirā devo 'tharvā cādhi tiṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: kāle yam aṅgirāḥ devaḥ tharvā ca adhi tiṣṭhataḥ
translated: In Time, this divine Angiras and Atharvan are established.

original: imaṃ ca lokaṃ paramaṃ ca lokaṃ puṇyāṃś ca lokān vidhṛtīś ca puṇyāḥ /
analyzed: imam ca lokam paramam ca lokam puṇyān ca lokān vidhṛtīḥ ca puṇyāḥ
translated: This world and the highest world, and the auspicious worlds and the auspicious supports,

original: sarvāṃl lokān abhijitya brahmaṇā kālaḥ sa īyate paramo nu devaḥ ////
analyzed: sarvān lokān abhijitya brahmaṇā kālaḥ saḥ īyate paramaḥ nu devaḥ
translated: having conquered all the worlds by Brahman, Time is carried forth, the highest god.

original: rātriṃrātrim aprayātaṃ bharanto 'śvāyeva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai /
analyzed: rātrim rātrim aprayātam bharantaḥ śvāyā iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai
translated: Night after night, bringing what is not exhausted, as fodder for a horse to him who stands,

original: rāyas poṣeṇa sam iṣā madanto mā te agne prativeśā riṣāma ////
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma
translated: Rejoicing in the increase of wealth and in food, may we not suffer harm, O Agni, from our neighbours.

original: yā te vasor vāta iṣuḥ sā ta eṣā tayā no mṛḍa /🔽rāyas poṣeṇa sam iṣā madanto mā te agne prativeśā riṣāma ////
analyzed: yā te vasoḥ vāte iṣuḥ sā te eṣā tayā naḥ mṛḍa  rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ mā te agne prativeśāḥ riṣāma
translated: O Vasu, your arrow is the wind; be gracious to us with that.🔽Rejoicing in the increase of wealth and in food, may we not suffer harm, O Agni, from our neighbours.

original: sāyaṃsāyaṃ gṛhapatir no agniḥ prātaḥprātaḥ saumanasasya dātā /
analyzed: sāyam sāyam gṛhapatiḥ naḥ agniḥ prātar prātar saumanasasya dātā
translated: May Agni, the lord of the house, be our protector in the evening, and in the morning may he be the giver of good will.

original: vasorvasor vasudāna edhi vayaṃ tvendhānās tanvaṃ puṣema ////
analyzed: vasoḥ vasoḥ vasu dānaḥ edhi vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema
translated: Be thou, O Vasu, the giver of goods, of goods; may we, kindling thee, prosper our bodies.

original: prātaḥprātar gṛhapatir no agniḥ sāyaṃsāyaṃ saumanasasya dātā /
analyzed: prātar prātar gṛhapatiḥ naḥ agniḥ sāyam sāyam saumanasasya dātā
translated: May Agni, the lord of the house, be our protector in the morning, and in the evening may he be the giver of good will.

original: vasorvasor vasudāna edhīndhānās tvā śataṃhimā ṛdhema ////
analyzed: vasoḥ vasoḥ vasu dānaḥ edhi indhānāḥ tvā śataṃhimāḥ ṛdhema
translated: Be thou, O Vasu, the giver of goods, of goods; may we, kindling thee, prosper for a hundred winters.

original: apaścā dagdhānnasya bhūyāsam /
analyzed: a paścā dagdha annasya bhūyāsam
translated: May I be in the rear of the food that is cooked.

original: annādāyānnapataye rudrāya namo agnaye /
analyzed: anna ādāya annapataye rudrāya namaḥ agnaye
translated: To Rudra, the eater of food, the lord of food, homage to Agni.

original: sabhyaḥ sabhāṃ me pāhi ye ca sabhyāḥ sabhāsadaḥ ////
analyzed: sabhyaḥ sabhām me pāhi ye ca sabhyāḥ sabhāsadaḥ
translated: Protect me, O Sabhya, in the assembly, and those who are in the assembly, the members of the assembly.

original: tvām indrā puruhūta viśvam āyur vy aśnavan /
analyzed: tvām indra puruhūta viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnavan
translated: O Indra, the many-invoked, all men have obtained life through thee.

original: aharahar balim it te haranto 'śvāyeva tiṣṭhate ghāsam agne ////
analyzed: ahar ahar balim id te harantaḥ śvāyā iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam agne
translated: Day after day, bringing thee offerings, O Agni, as one gives fodder to a horse that stands near.

original: yamasya lokād adhy ā babhūvitha pramadā martyān pra yunakṣi dhīraḥ /🔽ekākinā sarathaṃ yāsi vidvānt svapnaṃ mimāno asurasya yonau ////
analyzed: yamasya lokāt adhi ā babhūvitha pramadā martyān pra yunakṣi dhīraḥ  ekākinā sa ratham yāsi vidvān svapnam mimānaḥ asurasya yonau
translated: Thou hast come forth from the world of Yama; thou, O wise one, dost yoke mortals to pleasure.🔽Alone, knowing, thou goest on thy chariot, measuring sleep in the womb of the Asura.

original: bandhas tvāgre viśvacayā apaśyat purā rātryā janitor eke ahni /
analyzed: bandhaḥ tvā agre viśva cayāḥ apaśyat purā rātryāḥ janitoḥ eke ahni
translated: The fettered one, O all-knowing one, first saw thee, before the birth of night, on one day.

original: tataḥ svapnedam adhy ā babhūvitha bhiṣagbhyo rūpam apagūhamānaḥ ////
analyzed: tatas svapnā idam adhi ā babhūvitha bhiṣagbhyaḥ rūpam apagūhamānaḥ
translated: Then thou hast come forth from this sleep, concealing thy form from the physicians.

original: bṛhadgāvāsurebhyo 'dhi devān upāvartata mahimānam ichan /
analyzed: bṛhadgāvā asurebhyaḥ dhi devān upāvartata mahimānam ichan
translated: The son of Bṛhatkṣatra, desiring greatness, went to the gods from the Asuras.

original: tasmai svapnāya dadhur ādhipatyaṃ trayastriṃśāsaḥ svar ānaśānāḥ ////
analyzed: tasmai svapnāya dadhuḥ ādhipatyam trayastriṃśāsaḥ svar ānaśānāḥ
translated: To that sleep they gave lordship, the thirty-three gods, seeking heaven.

original: naitāṃ viduḥ pitaro nota devā yeṣāṃ jalpiś caraty antaredam /
analyzed: na etām viduḥ pitaraḥ na uta devāḥ yeṣām jalpiḥ carati antarā idam
translated: The fathers and the gods do not know this, in whose midst the chatterer moves.

original: trite svapnam adadhur āptye nara ādityāso varuṇenānuśiṣṭāḥ ////
analyzed: trite svapnam adadhuḥ āptye naraḥ ādityāsaḥ varuṇena anuśiṣṭāḥ
translated: To Trita, the son of Aptya, the Ādityas, instructed by Varuṇa, gave sleep.

original: yasya krūram abhajanta duṣkṛto 'svapnena sukṛtaḥ puṇyam āyuḥ /
analyzed: yasya krūram abhajanta duṣkṛtaḥ svapnena su kṛtaḥ puṇyam āyuḥ
translated: To him whose evil deeds were allotted the cruel sleep, and whose good deeds the meritorious life.

original: svar madasi parameṇa bandhunā tapyamānasya manaso 'dhi jajñiṣe ////
analyzed: svar madasi parameṇa bandhunā tapyamānasya manasaḥ dhi jajñiṣe
translated: You shine, O sleep, with the highest kinship, born from the heated mind.

original: vidma te sarvāḥ parijāḥ purastād vidma svapna yo adhipā ihā te /
analyzed: vidma te sarvāḥ parijāḥ purastāt vidma svapna yaḥ adhipāḥ iha ā te
translated: We know all your attendants before, we know, O sleep, who are your overlords here.

original: yaśaśvino no yaśaseha pāhy ārād dviṣebhir apa yāhi dūram ////
analyzed: yaśaśvinaḥ naḥ yaśasā iha pāhi ārāt dviṣebhiḥ apa yāhi dūram
translated: Protect us here for glory, O glorious one, go far away from the enemies.

original: yathā kalāṃ yathā śaphaṃ yathā rṇaṃ samnayanti /
analyzed: yathā kalām yathā śapham yathā ṛṇam samnayanti
translated: Just as they bring together the parts, the pieces, the debt,

original: evā duṣvapnyaṃ sarvam apriye saṃ nayāmasi ////
analyzed: eva duṣvapnyam sarvam apriye sam nayāmasi
translated: So we bring together all evil dreams to the one who hates us.

original: saṃ rājāno aguḥ sam ṛṇāmy aguḥ saṃ kuṣṭhā aguḥ saṃ kalā aguḥ /
analyzed: sam rājānaḥ aguḥ sam aguḥ sam kuṣṭhāḥ aguḥ sam kalāḥ aguḥ
translated: The kings have come together, the debts have come together, the leprosy has come together, the parts have come together.

original: sam asmāsu yad duṣvapnyaṃ nir dviṣate duṣvapnyaṃ suvāma ////
analyzed: sam asmāsu yat duṣvapnyam niḥ dviṣate duṣvapnyam suvāma
translated: Whatever evil dream there is among us, we send the evil dream to the hater.

original: devānāṃ patnīnāṃ garbha yamasya kara yo bhadraḥ svapna /
analyzed: devānām patnīnām garbha yamasya kara yaḥ bhadraḥ svapna
translated: O embryo of the wives of the gods, the work of Yama, the auspicious dream,

original: sa mama yaḥ pāpas tad dviṣate pra hiṇmaḥ /
analyzed: sa mama yaḥ pāpaḥ tat dviṣate pra hiṇmaḥ
translated: we send that evil to the hater.

original: mā tṛṣṭānām asi kṛṣṇaśakuner mukham ////
analyzed: mā tṛṣṭānām asi kṛṣṇaśakuneḥ mukham
translated: You are not the mouth of the greedy, the black bird.

original: taṃ tvā svapna tathā saṃ vidma sa tvaṃ svapnāśva iva kāyam aśva iva nīnāham /
analyzed: tam tvā svapna tathā sam vidma sa tvam svapna aśvaḥ iva kāyam aśvaḥ iva nīnāham
translated: We know you, O sleep, in that way, you, like a horse in a dream, like a horse in a harness,

original: anāsmākaṃ devapīyuṃ piyāruṃ vapa yad asmāsu duṣvapnyaṃ yad goṣu yac ca no gṛhe ////
analyzed: anā asmākam deva pīyum piyārum vapa yat asmāsu duṣvapnyam yat goṣu yat ca naḥ gṛhe
translated: The godless, the god-hating Piyāra, cast away from us whatever evil dream there is for us, for our cattle, and for our house.

original: anāsmākas tad devapīyuḥ piyārur niṣkam iva prati muñcatām /🔽navāratnīn apamayā asmākaṃ tataḥ pari /
analyzed: anāsmākaḥ tat deva pīyuḥ piyāruḥ niṣkam iva prati muñcatām  nava aratnīn apamayā asmākam tatas pari
translated: Let that godless, god-hating Piyāra cast away from us like a necklace.🔽The nine-knotted (cord), the diseases, from us, from that (evil dream),

original: duṣvapnyaṃ sarvaṃ dviṣate nir dayāmasi ////
analyzed: duṣvapnyam sarvam dviṣate niḥ dayāmasi
translated: all evil dream we drive away to the enemy.

original: ghṛtasya jūtiḥ samanā sadevā saṃvatsaraṃ haviṣā vardhayantī /
analyzed: ghṛtasya jūtiḥ samanā sa devā saṃvatsaram haviṣā vardhayantī
translated: The stream of ghee, the common seat of the gods, increasing for a year with oblations,

original: śrotraṃ cakṣuḥ prāṇo 'chinno no astv achinnā vayam āyuṣo varcasaḥ ////
analyzed: śrotram cakṣuḥ prāṇo chinnaḥ naḥ astu a chinnāḥ vayam āyuṣaḥ varcasaḥ
translated: may our hearing, sight, and breath be unbroken. May we be unbroken in life and splendor.

original: upāsmān prāṇo hvayatām upa prāṇaṃ havāmahe /
analyzed: upa asmān prāṇaḥ hvayatām upa prāṇam havāmahe
translated: May the breath call to us. We invoke the breath.

original: varco jagrāha pṛthivy antarikṣaṃ varcaḥ somo bṛhaspatir vidhattā ////🔽varcaso dyāvāpṛthivī saṃgrahaṇī babhūvathur varco gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu saṃ carema /
analyzed: varcaḥ jagrāha pṛthivī antarikṣam varcaḥ somaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vidhattā  varcasaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī saṃgrahaṇī babhūvathuḥ varcaḥ gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu sam carema
translated: He has taken away splendor. May Brihaspati allot to us splendor, the sky, and the earth.🔽The splendor of heaven and earth became a gathering. Having taken away splendor, may we go along the earth.

original: yaśasam gāvo gopatim upa tiṣṭhanty āyatīr yaśo gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu saṃ carema ////
analyzed: yaśasam gāvaḥ gopatim upa tiṣṭhanti āyatīḥ yaśaḥ gṛhītvā pṛthivīm anu sam carema
translated: The glorious cows attend on the cowherd as they come. Having taken away glory, may we go along the earth.

original: vrajaṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ sa hi vo nṛpāṇo varmā sīvyadhvaṃ bahulā pṛthūni /
analyzed: vrajam kṛṇudhvam sa hi vaḥ nṛpāṇaḥ varmā sīvyadhvam bahulā pṛthūni
translated: Make the fort, for he is your king. Sew the many broad (shields) together.

original: puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīr adhṛṣṭā mā vaḥ susroc camaso dṛṃhata tam ////
analyzed: puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ mā vaḥ susrot camasaḥ dṛṃhata tam
translated: Make the iron doors, which cannot be burst open. Do not let the well-made cup shake him.

original: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtir mukhaṃ ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi /
analyzed: yajñasya cakṣuḥ prabhṛtiḥ mukham ca vācā śrotreṇa manasā juhomi
translated: The eye of the sacrifice, the beginning, and the face, with speech, with the ear, with the mind I offer.

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ vitataṃ viśvakarmaṇā devā yantu sumanasyamānāḥ ////
analyzed: imam yajñam vitatam viśva karmaṇā devāḥ yantu sumanasyamānāḥ
translated: Let the gods come to this sacrifice spread out by Viśvakarman, being well-disposed.

original: ye devānām ṛtvijo ye ca yajñiyā yebhyo havyaṃ kriyate bhāgadheyam /
analyzed: ye devānām ṛtvijaḥ ye ca yajñiyāḥ yebhyaḥ havyam kriyate bhāgadheyam
translated: Those who are the priests of the gods, and those who are worthy of sacrifice, to whom the offering is made as a share,

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ saha patnībhir etya yāvanto devās taviṣā mādayantām ////
analyzed: imam yajñam saha patnībhiḥ etya yāvantaḥ devāḥ taviṣāḥ mādayantām
translated: Let them come to this sacrifice with their wives, and let as many powerful gods as there are rejoice.

original: tvam agne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣv ā /
analyzed: tvam agne vrata pāḥ asi devaḥ ā martyeṣu ā
translated: You, O Agni, are the guardian of vows, a god among mortals.

original: tvaṃ yajñeṣv īḍyaḥ ////
analyzed: tvam yajñeṣu īḍyaḥ
translated: You are to be worshipped in sacrifices.

original: yad vo vayaṃ pramināma vratāni viduṣāṃ devā aviduṣṭarāsaḥ /
analyzed: yat vaḥ vayam pramināma vratāni viduṣām devāḥ a viduṣṭarāsaḥ
translated: If we, O wise gods, ignorant and slow, should transgress your laws,

original: agniṣ ṭad viśvād ā pṛṇātu vidvānt somasya yo brāhmaṇāṃ āviveśa ////
analyzed: agniḥ tat viśvāt ā pṛṇātu vidvān somasya yaḥ brāhmaṇān āviveśa
translated: May Agni, the all-knowing one, make it good, he who has entered the Brahman of Soma.

original: ā devānām api panthām aganma yac chaknavāma tad anupravoḍhum /
analyzed: ā devānām api panthām aganma yat śaknavāma tat anupravoḍhum
translated: We have gone along the path of the gods, as far as we were able, we have followed it.

original: agnir vidvānt sa yajāt sa id dhotā so 'dhvarānt sa ṛtūn kalpayāti ////
analyzed: agniḥ vidvān sa yajāt saḥ id hotā saḥ dhvarān saḥ ṛtūn kalpayāti
translated: May Agni, the wise one, perform the sacrifice, he is the Hotar, he ordains the rites and the seasons.

original: vāṅ ma āsan nasoḥ prāṇaś cakṣur akṣṇoḥ śrotraṃ karṇayoḥ /🔽apalitāḥ keśā aśoṇā dantā bahu bāhvor balam ////
analyzed: vāc me āsan nasoḥ prāṇaḥ cakṣuḥ akṣṇoḥ śrotram karṇayoḥ  a palitāḥ keśāḥ a śoṇāḥ dantāḥ bahu bāhvoḥ balam
translated: May speech be in my mouth, breath in my nostrils, sight in my eyes, hearing in my ears.🔽May my hair be unwhite, my teeth unblack, strength in my arms,

original: ūrvor ojo jaṅghayor javaḥ pādayoḥ /🔽pratiṣṭhā ariṣṭāni me sarvātmānibhṛṣṭaḥ ////
analyzed: ūrvoḥ ojaḥ jaṅghayoḥ javaḥ pādayoḥ  pratiṣṭhāḥ ariṣṭāni me sarva ātmā a nibhṛṣṭaḥ
translated: vigor in my thighs, swiftness in my calves, firmness in my feet.🔽May all my limbs be sound and well.

original: tanūs tanvā me sahe dataḥ sarvam āyur aśīya /
analyzed: tanūḥ tanvā me sahe dataḥ sarvam āyuḥ aśīya
translated: My body with my body may I endure. I take all life to myself.

original: syonaṃ me sīda puruḥ pṛṇasva pavamānaḥ svarge ////
analyzed: syonam me sīda puruḥ pṛṇasva pavamānaḥ svarge
translated: Sit down pleasantly for me, O Puru, fill (me) with food. O Pavamana, in heaven.

original: priyaṃ mā kṛṇu deveṣu priyaṃ rājasu mā kṛṇu /
analyzed: priyam mā kṛṇu deveṣu priyam rājasu mā kṛṇu
translated: Make me dear to the gods, make me dear to the kings.

original: priyaṃ sarvasya paśyata uta śūdra utārye ////
analyzed: priyam sarvasya paśyataḥ uta śūdre uta ārye
translated: Make me dear to all who see, to the Shudra and to the noble.

original: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devān yajñena bodhaya /🔽āyuḥ prāṇaṃ prajāṃ paśūn kīrtiṃ yajamānaṃ ca vardhaya ////
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate devān yajñena bodhaya  āyuḥ prāṇam prajām paśūn kīrtim yajamānam ca vardhaya
translated: Rise up, O lord of prayer, awaken the gods with sacrifice.🔽Increase life, breath, offspring, cattle, fame, and the sacrificer.

original: agne samidham āhārṣaṃ bṛhate jātavedase /
analyzed: agne samidham āhārṣam bṛhate jātavedase
translated: O Agni, I have brought a piece of wood for the great all-knower.

original: sa me śraddhāṃ ca medhāṃ ca jātavedāḥ pra yachatu ////
analyzed: sa me śraddhām ca medhām ca jātavedāḥ pra yacchatu
translated: May the all-knower grant me faith and wisdom.

original: idhmena tvā jātavedaḥ samidhā vardhayāmasi /
analyzed: idhmena tvā jātavedaḥ samidhā vardhayāmasi
translated: With fuel, O all-knower, with a piece of wood we increase you.

original: tathā tvam asmān vardhaya prajayā ca dhanena ca ////
analyzed: tathā tvam asmān vardhaya prajayā ca dhanena ca
translated: So do you increase us with offspring and wealth.

original: yad agne yāni kāni cid ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi /
analyzed: yat agne yāni kāni cit ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi
translated: Whatever pieces of wood, O Agni, we put into you,

original: sarvaṃ tad astu me śivaṃ taj juṣasva yaviṣṭhya ////
analyzed: sarvam tat astu me śivam tat juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: may all that be auspicious to me; accept that, O youngest one.

original: etās te agne samidhas tvam iddhaḥ samid bhava /
analyzed: etāḥ te agne samidhaḥ tvam iddhaḥ samidh bhava
translated: These are your kindling sticks, O Agni; be kindled, become a kindling stick.

original: āyur asmāsu dhehy amṛtatvam ācāryāya ////
analyzed: āyuḥ asmāsu dhehi amṛta tvam ācāryāya
translated: Bestow life upon us, immortality upon the teacher.

original: hariḥ suparṇo divam āruho 'rciṣā ye tvā dipsanti divam utpatantam /
analyzed: hariḥ suparṇaḥ divam āruhaḥ rciṣā ye tvā dipsanti divam utpatantam
translated: The golden eagle has mounted the sky with his flame; those who seek to strike you as you fly up to the sky,

original: ava tāṃ jahi harasā jātavedo 'bibhyad ugro 'rciṣā divam ā roha sūrya ////
analyzed: ava tām jahi harasā jātavedaḥ bibhyat ugraḥ rciṣā divam ā roha sūrya
translated: strike them down with your heat, O all-knower. Fearless, the fierce one has mounted the sky with his flame, O sun.

original: ayojālā asurā māyino 'yasmayaiḥ pāśair aṅkino ye caranti /
analyzed: ayaḥ jālāḥ asurāḥ māyinaḥ yasmayaiḥ pāśaiḥ aṅkinaḥ ye caranti
translated: The Asuras, the web-makers, the ones with iron fetters who move about,

original: tāṃs te randhayāmi harasā jātavedaḥ sahasraṛṣṭiḥ sapatnān pramṛṇan pāhi vajraḥ ////
analyzed: tān te randhayāmi harasā jātavedaḥ sahasra ṛṣṭiḥ sapatnān pramṛṇan pāhi vajraḥ
translated: I release them with your heat, O all-knower, with a thousand points, destroying the enemies, protect like a thunderbolt.

original: paśyema śaradaḥ śatam ////🔽jīvema śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: paśyema śaradaḥ śatam  jīvema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we see a hundred autumns.🔽May we live a hundred autumns.

original: budhyema śaradaḥ śatam ////🔽rohema śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: budhyema śaradaḥ śatam  rohema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we understand a hundred autumns.🔽May we grow a hundred autumns.

original: pūṣema śaradaḥ śatam ////🔽bhavema śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: pūṣā ima śaradaḥ śatam  bhavema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we enjoy a hundred autumns.🔽May we be a hundred autumns.

original: bhūṣema śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: bhūṣema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we adorn ourselves a hundred autumns.

original: bhūyasīḥ śaradaḥ śatam ////
analyzed: bhūyasīḥ śaradaḥ śatam
translated: For many hundreds of autumns.

original: avyasaś ca vyacasaś ca bilaṃ vi ṣyāmi māyayā /
analyzed: avyasaḥ ca vyacasaḥ ca bilam vi syāmi māyayā
translated: I open the cave of the vast and the boundless with my magic power.

original: tābhyām uddhṛtya vedam atha karmāṇi kṛṇmahe ////🔽jīvā stha jīvyāsaṃ sarvam āyur jīvyāsam ////
analyzed: tābhyām uddhṛtya vedam atha karmāṇi kṛṇmahe  jīvāḥ stha jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: Having drawn out the Veda from them, we perform the rites.🔽You are the living ones, may I live. May I live the full life.

original: upajīvā sthopa jīvyāsaṃ sarvam āyur jīvyāsam ////🔽saṃjīvā stha saṃ jīvyāsaṃ sarvam āyur jīvyāsam ////
analyzed: upajīvāḥ stha upa jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam  saṃjīvāḥ stha sam jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: You are the supporting ones, may I support. May I live the full life.🔽You are the reviving ones, may I revive. May I live the full life.

original: jīvalā stha jīvyāsaṃ sarvam āyur jīvyāsam ////
analyzed: jīvalāḥ stha jīvyāsam sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: You are the life-giving ones, may I live. May I live the full life.

original: indra jīva sūrya jīva devā jīvā jīvyāsam aham /
analyzed: indra jīva sūrya jīva devāḥ jīva jīvyāsam aham
translated: O Indra, live! O Sun, live! O gods, live! May I live.

original: sarvam āyur jīvyāsam ////
analyzed: sarvam āyuḥ jīvyāsam
translated: May I live the full life.

original: stutā mayā varadā vedamātā pra codayantāṃ pāvamānī dvijānām /
analyzed: stutā mayā vara dā veda mātā pra codayantām pāvamānī dvijānām
translated: Praised by me, may the bestowers of boons, the mother of the Vedas, and the purifying verses of the twice-born urge me on.

original: āyuḥ prāṇaṃ prajāṃ paśuṃ kīrtiṃ draviṇaṃ brahmavarcasam /
analyzed: āyuḥ prāṇam prajām paśum kīrtim draviṇam brahmavarcasam
translated: Having given me life, breath, offspring, cattle, fame, wealth, and spiritual power,

original: mahyaṃ dattvā vrajata brahmalokam ////
analyzed: mahyam dattvā vrajata brahma lokam
translated: Go to the world of Brahman.

original: yasmāt kośād udabharāma vedaṃ tasminn antar ava dadhma enam /
analyzed: yasmāt kośāt udabharāma vedam tasmin antar ava dadhmaḥ enam
translated: From that treasury from which we have drawn out the Veda, into that we place this.

original: kṛtam iṣṭaṃ brahmaṇo vīryeṇa tena mā devās tapasāvateha ////
analyzed: kṛtam iṣṭam brahmaṇaḥ vīryeṇa tena mā devāḥ tapasā avata iha
translated: The accomplished, the desired, by the power of Brahman, by that, O gods, do not torment me here with austerity.

original: indra tvā vṛṣabhaṃ vayaṃ sute some havāmahe /🔽sa pāhi madhvo andhasaḥ ////
analyzed: indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe  sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: O Indra, we call upon thee, the bull, at the pressed Soma.🔽Do thou protect us, O sweet one, of the juice.

original: maruto yasya hi kṣaye pāthā divo vimahasaḥ /
analyzed: marutaḥ yasya hi kṣaye pāthāḥ divaḥ vimahasaḥ
translated: O Maruts, he whose abode is in your dwelling, the great abode of heaven,

original: sa sugopātamo janaḥ ////
analyzed: sa sugopātamaḥ janaḥ
translated: He is the best protected people.

original: ukṣānnāya vaśānnāya somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase /
analyzed: ukṣa annāya vaśā annāya soma pṛṣṭhāya vedhase
translated: To the giver of milk and food, to the Soma-backed, to the creator,

original: stomair vidhemāgnaye ////
analyzed: stomaiḥ vidhema agnaye
translated: Let us offer to Agni with praises.

original: marutaḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ svarkād ṛtunā somaṃ pibantu ////🔽agnir āgnīdhrāt suṣṭubhaḥ svarkād ṛtunā somaṃ pibatu ////
analyzed: marutaḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibantu  agniḥ āgnīdhrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu
translated: The Maruts, from the Potri, from the Sustu, from the heavenly, let them drink the Soma with the season.🔽Agni, from the Agnidhra, from the Sustu, from the heavenly, let him drink the Soma with the season.

original: indro brahmā brāhmaṇāt suṣṭubhaḥ svarkād ṛtunā somaṃ pibatu ////
analyzed: indraḥ brahmā brāhmaṇāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu
translated: Indra, from the Brahman, from the Sustu, from the heavenly, let him drink the Soma with the season.

original: devo draviṇodāḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ svarkād ṛtunā somaṃ pibatu ////
analyzed: devaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ potrāt suṣṭubhaḥ su arkāt ṛtunā somam pibatu
translated: The god who gives wealth, from the Potri, from the Sustu, from the heavenly, let him drink the Soma with the season.

original: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somaṃ pibā imam /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam
translated: Come, for the psalms are thine, O Indra, drink this Soma.

original: edaṃ barhiḥ sado mama ////
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama
translated: This is my seat on the sacred grass.

original: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatām indra keśinā /
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā
translated: Let thy two tawny coursers yoked with prayer bring thee hither, O Indra,

original: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu ////
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu
translated: Listen to our prayers.

original: brahmāṇas tvā vayaṃ yujā somapām indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ
translated: We Brahmans, O Indra, who offer Soma, yoked with prayer,

original: sutāvanto havāmahe ////
analyzed: sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We who have pressed the juice, invite thee.

original: ā no yāhi sutāvato 'smākaṃ suṣṭutīr upa /
analyzed: ā naḥ yāhi sutāvataḥ smākam suṣṭutīḥ upa
translated: Come to us, O thou who art pressed by us, to our songs of praise.

original: pibā su śiprinn andhasaḥ ////🔽ā te siñcāmi kukṣyor anu gātrā vi dhāvatu /
analyzed: pibā su śiprin andhasaḥ  ā te siñcāmi kukṣyoḥ anu gātrā vi dhāvatu
translated: Drink, O thou of beautiful hips, of the juice.🔽I pour it into thy belly; let it spread through all thy limbs.

original: gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu ////🔽svāduṣ ṭe astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava /
analyzed: gṛbhāya jihvayā madhu  svāduḥ te astu saṃsude madhumān tanve tava
translated: Take it with thy tongue.🔽Let it be sweet for thee to digest; full of honey for thy body.

original: somaḥ śam astu te hṛde ////
analyzed: somaḥ śam astu te hṛde
translated: Let the Soma be sweet for thy heart.

original: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīr ivābhi saṃvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: ayam u tvā vicarṣaṇe janīḥ iva abhi saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: This, O thou of great activity, is poured forth like the people, as it were, surrounding thee.

original: pra soma indra sarpatu ////
analyzed: pra somaḥ indra sarpatu
translated: Let the Soma, O Indra, glide along.

original: tuvigrīvo vapodaraḥ subāhur andhaso sade /
analyzed: tuvi grīvaḥ vapā udaraḥ su bāhuḥ andhasaḥ sade
translated: With mighty neck, with ample belly, with strong arms, he sits in the place of the juice.

original: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate ////
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: Indra slays the Vr̥itras.

original: indra prehi puras tvaṃ viśvasyeśāna ojasā /
analyzed: indra prehi puras tvam viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā
translated: Go forward, O Indra, thou who art in front of all as the lord with might.

original: vṛtrāṇi vṛtrahaṃ jahi ////
analyzed: vṛtrāṇi vṛtraham jahi
translated: Slay the Vr̥itras, O Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: dīrghas te astv aṅkuśo yenā vasu prayachasi /
analyzed: dīrghaḥ te astu aṅkuśaḥ yena vasu prayacchasi
translated: Long be thy hook, wherewith thou givest wealth

original: yajamānāya sunvate ////
analyzed: yajamānāya sunvate
translated: to the sacrificer who presses (the Soma).

original: ayaṃ ta indra somo nipūto adhi barhiṣi /🔽ehīm asya dravā piba ////
analyzed: ayam te indra somaḥ nipūtaḥ adhi barhiṣi  ehi īm asya drava piba
translated: This Soma, O Indra, is purified for thee upon the sacred grass.🔽Come and drink of it.

original: śācigo śācipūjanāyaṃ raṇāya te sutaḥ /
analyzed: śācigo śācipūjana ayam raṇāya te sutaḥ
translated: Thou who art the receiver of gifts, the worshipper of gifts, this juice is pressed for thee to rejoice thee.

original: ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase ////
analyzed: ākhaṇḍala pra hūyase
translated: O Aksha, thou art invoked.

original: yas te śṛṅgavṛṣo napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ te śṛṅgavṛṣaḥ napāt praṇapāt kuṇḍapāyyaḥ
translated: Thy son who is like a horned bull, who is a descendant, who is to be praised by the ladle,

original: ny asmin dadhra ā manaḥ ////
analyzed: ni asmin dadhre ā manaḥ
translated: in him have I placed my mind.

original: indra tvā vṛṣabhaṃ vayaṃ sute some havāmahe /
analyzed: indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe
translated: O Indra, we call upon thee, the strong one, at the pressed Soma.

original: sa pāhi madhvo andhasaḥ ////
analyzed: sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: Do thou guard us, O thou of sweet juice.

original: indra kratuvidaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ harya puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta
translated: O Indra, the wise one, the pressed Soma, O Haryaśva, O thou who art much praised,

original: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim ////
analyzed: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
translated: Drink, O strong one, the gladdening one.

original: indra pra ṇo dhitāvānaṃ yajñaṃ viśvebhir devebhir /
analyzed: indra pra naḥ dhitāvānam yajñam viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ
translated: O Indra, with all the gods, accept our sacrifice, O thou who art to be praised,

original: tira stavāna viśpate ////
analyzed: tira stavāna viśpate
translated: O lord of the people.

original: indra somāḥ sutā ime tava pra yanti satpate /
analyzed: indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tava pra yanti satpate
translated: O Indra, these pressed Soma juices go forth to thee, O lord of the good.

original: kṣayaṃ candrāsa indavaḥ ////
analyzed: kṣayam candrāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: The moon-bright drops go to their place.

original: dadhiṣvā jaṭhare sutaṃ somam indra vareṇyam /
analyzed: dadhiṣva ā jaṭhare sutam somam indra vareṇyam
translated: O Indra, receive in thy belly the pressed Soma, the excellent one.

original: tava dyukṣāsa indavaḥ ////
analyzed: tava dyu kṣāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Thy heavenly drops are for thee.

original: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutaṃ madhor dhārābhir ajyase /
analyzed: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutam madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ ajyase
translated: O lover of praise, protect our pressed Soma; thou art anointed with streams of sweetness.

original: indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ ////
analyzed: indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ
translated: O Indra, it is thy glory that is sought.

original: abhi dyumnāni vanina indraṃ sacante akṣitā /
analyzed: abhi dyumnāni vaninaḥ indram sacante akṣitā
translated: The inexhaustible powers of the forest follow Indra, the powerful one.

original: pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe ////
analyzed: pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe
translated: Having drunk the Soma, he has grown.

original: arvāvato na ā gahi parāvataś ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi parāvataḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: Come to us from the farther shore and from this side, O slayer of Vrtra.

original: imā juṣasva no giraḥ ////
analyzed: imāḥ juṣasva naḥ giraḥ
translated: Accept these songs of ours.

original: yad antarā parāvatam arvāvataṃ ca hūyase /
analyzed: yat antarā parāvatam arvāvatam ca hūyase
translated: If thou art invoked from the farther shore or from this side,

original: indreha tata ā gahi ////
analyzed: indra iha tatas ā gahi
translated: Come hither from there, O Indra.

original: ud ghed abhi śrutāmaghaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ naryāpasam /
analyzed: ud gha id abhi śrutāmagham vṛṣabham narya apasam
translated: They have lifted up the famous one, the bull, the man-like one,

original: astāram eṣi sūrya ////
analyzed: astāram eṣi sūrya
translated: Thou goest to the strewing, O Sun.

original: nava yo navatiṃ puro bibheda bāhvojasā /
analyzed: nava yaḥ navatim puraḥ bibheda bāhu ojasā
translated: He who, with the strength of his arms, hath split nine-and-ninety castles,

original: ahiṃ ca vṛtrahāvadhīt ////
analyzed: ahim ca vṛtrahā avadhīt
translated: And hath slain the dragon, the slayer of Vrtra.

original: sa na indraḥ śivaḥ sakhāśvāvad gomad yavamat /
analyzed: sa naḥ indraḥ śivaḥ sakhā aśvāvat gomat yavamat
translated: May that Indra be a gracious friend, rich in horses, cattle, and barley,

original: urudhāreva dohate ////
analyzed: uru dhārā iva dohate
translated: Like a cow with abundant milk.

original: indra kratuvidaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ harya puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta
translated: O Indra, the finder of strength, drink the pressed Soma, O brown one, O much-praised one,

original: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim ////
analyzed: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
translated: Drink and be satisfied with the satisfying one.

original: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvota gīrbhiḥ /
analyzed: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasva uta gīrbhiḥ
translated: Thus, O ancient one, protect; may he delight thee; listen to the prayer and prosper by the songs.

original: āviḥ sūryaṃ kṛṇuhi pīpihīṣo jahi śatrūṃr abhi gā indra tṛndhi ////
analyzed: āvis sūryam kṛṇuhi pīpihi iṣaḥ jahi śatrūṃr abhi gāḥ indra tṛndhi
translated: Make the sun visible, swell the waters, slay the enemies, O Indra, and release the cows.

original: arvāṅ ehi somakāmaṃ tvāhur ayaṃ sutas tasya pibā madāya /
analyzed: arvāṅ ehi soma kāmam tvā āhuḥ ayam sutaḥ tasya pibā madāya
translated: Come hitherward; they call thee longing for the Soma; this juice is pressed: drink of it for delight.

original: uruvyacā jaṭhara ā vṛṣasva piteva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ ////
analyzed: uru vyacāḥ jaṭhare ā vṛṣasva pitā iva naḥ śṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ
translated: O thou of wide dominion, swell in thy belly, like a father listen to our invocation.

original: āpūrṇo asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sekteva kośaṃ siṣice pibadhyai /🔽sam u priyā āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇid abhi somāsa indram ////
analyzed: āpūrṇaḥ asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sektā iva kośam siṣice pibadhyai  sam u priyāḥ āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇit abhi somāsaḥ indram
translated: His jar is full; hail! Like a sprinkler he has sprinkled the reservoir for drinking.🔽The dear ones have turned to him for delight; the Somas have surrounded Indra from the right.

original: taṃ vo dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasor mandānam andhasaḥ /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ
translated: That wondrous one of yours, who delights in the juice of the Vasu, who conquers with the Rtus,

original: abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ gīrbhir navāmahe ////🔽dyukṣaṃ sudānuṃ taviṣībhir āvṛtaṃ giriṃ na purubhojasam /
analyzed: abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe  dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam
translated: As milch-cows low to their calves in the stalls, so with our songs we glorify Indra.🔽The glorious, bountiful, mighty one, surrounded by powers, like a mountain, the supporter of many.

original: kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ makṣū gomantam īmahe ////
analyzed: kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: We quickly seek the strengthening food, the hundredfold, the thousandfold, accompanied by cattle.

original: tat tvā yāmi suvīryaṃ tad brahma pūrvacittaye /
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye
translated: To that heroic power of thine, to that holy song for earliest thought,

original: yenā yatibhyo bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha ////
analyzed: yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha
translated: Wherewith thou aidest Yati and Bhrigu when the prize was staked, wherewith thou helpest Prṣnigarbha.

original: yenā samudram asṛjo mahīr apas tad indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ /
analyzed: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ
translated: Wherewith thou madest the ocean, the mighty waters, that, O Indra, is thy manly power.

original: sadyaḥ so asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yaṃ kṣoṇīr anucakrade ////
analyzed: sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade
translated: That glory of thine shall not perish, for which the two worlds have contended.

original: ud u te madhumattamā gira stomāsa īrate /
analyzed: ud u te madhumattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate
translated: The sweetest of thy meath-rich songs, the lauds, are raised on high.

original: satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājayanto rathā iva ////
analyzed: satrājitaḥ dhana sāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva
translated: The ever-conquering, wealth-gaining, ever-waxing, strength-giving (songs), like chariots.

original: kaṇvā iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryā iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ /🔽indraṃ stomebhir mahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran ////
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryāḥ iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ  indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran
translated: The Kaṇvas, like the Bhṛgus, the Ṣyâvâṣṭis, like the Ādîtis, have gained all that is good.🔽The living men have magnified Indra with their hymns, the men who offer dear oblations.

original: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirad dāsam arkair vidadvasur dayamāno vi śatrūn /
analyzed: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirat dāsam arkaiḥ vidadvasuḥ dayamānaḥ vi śatrūn
translated: Indra with forts hath overcome the Dâsa, with hymns the foe who hath no wealth to give.

original: brahmajūtas tanvā vāvṛdhāno bhūridātra āpṛṇad rodasī ubhe ////
analyzed: brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhānaḥ bhūri dātraḥ āpṛṇat rodasī ubhe
translated: Impelled by the Brahman, growing with his body, the bountiful one has filled both heaven and earth.

original: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan /
analyzed: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan
translated: I send forth the impulse of your mighty sacrifice, adorning speech for the immortal one.

original: indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇāṃ viśāṃ daivīnām uta pūrvayāvā ////
analyzed: indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇām viśām daivīnām uta pūrva yāvā
translated: O Indra, you are the lord of human habitations and of the divine clans, and of the ancient ones.

original: indro vṛtram avṛṇoc chardhanītiḥ pra māyinām aminād varpaṇītiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram avṛṇot śardha nītiḥ pra māyinām amināt varpaṇītiḥ
translated: Indra, with his conquering power, broke through Vṛtra, and with his overpowering power, he overcame the magicians.

original: ahan vyaṃsam uśadhag vaneṣv āvir dhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām ////🔽indraḥ svarṣā janayann ahāni jigāyośigbhiḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ /🔽prārocayan manave ketum ahnām avindaj jyotir bṛhate raṇāya ////
analyzed: ahan vyaṃsam uśadhak vaneṣu āvis dhenāḥ akṛṇot rāmyāṇām  indraḥ svarṣāḥ janayan ahāni jigāya uśigbhiḥ pṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ  prārocayat manave ketum ahnām avindat jyotiḥ bṛhate raṇāya
translated: He killed the wicked one in the woods, and made the bright milk of the cows manifest.🔽Indra, the self-shining one, producing the days, conquered the battles with his companions, the protectors.🔽Making the banner of the days manifest to Manu, he found the light for the great contest.

original: indras tujo barhaṇā ā viveśa nṛvad dadhāno naryā purūṇi /
analyzed: indraḥ tujaḥ barhaṇāḥ ā viveśa nṛvat dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi
translated: Indra entered the mighty strength, bearing many manly deeds like a man.

original: acetayad dhiya imā jaritre premaṃ varṇam atirac chukram āsām ////
analyzed: acetayat dhiyaḥ imāḥ jaritre pra imam varṇam atirat śukram āsām
translated: He has made these thoughts think for the worshipper, and has made this bright color of these (cows) manifest.

original: maho mahāni panayanty asyendrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi /
analyzed: mahaḥ mahāni panayanti asya indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi
translated: The great ones celebrate his great deeds, Indra's many well-performed acts.

original: vṛjanena vṛjinānt saṃ pipeṣa māyābhir dasyūṃr abhibhūtyojāḥ ////
analyzed: vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhiḥ dasyūṃr abhibhūti ojāḥ
translated: With his power of magic, he crushed the wicked with his power of magic, with his power of magic, the Dasyus with their magic.

original: yudhendro mahnā varivaś cakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiś carṣaṇiprāḥ /
analyzed: yudhā indraḥ mahnā varivaḥ cakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiḥ carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: The Lord of the brave, the Lord of the good, the Lord of the people, the Lord of the gods, has made room for himself in his greatness.

original: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprā ukthebhiḥ kavayo gṛṇanti ////
analyzed: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprāḥ ukthebhiḥ kavayaḥ gṛṇanti
translated: The wise ones, the poets, sing of his deeds in the hymn, in the abode of Vivasvat.

original: satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyaṃ sahodāṃ sasavāṃsaṃ svar apaś ca devīḥ /🔽sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām utemām indraṃ madanty anu dhīraṇāsaḥ ////
analyzed: satrāsāham vareṇyam sahaḥ dām sasavāṃsam svar apaḥ ca devīḥ  sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām indram madanti anu dhīraṇāsaḥ
translated: The one who conquers in battles, the one who is to be chosen, the one who has strength, the one who has cattle, the one who has the divine waters,🔽The one who has conquered this earth and this sky, the people rejoice in him, the one who is to be honored.

original: sasānātyāṃ uta sūryaṃ sasānendraḥ sasāna purubhojasaṃ gām /
analyzed: sasāna atyām uta sūryam sasāna indraḥ sasāna purubhojasam gām
translated: He conquered the one who is to be conquered, and the sun, Indra conquered the cow who gives much food,

original: hiraṇyayam uta bhogaṃ sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryaṃ varṇam āvat ////
analyzed: hiraṇyayam uta bhogam sasāna hatvī dasyūn pra āryam varṇam āvat
translated: And he conquered the golden treasure, the destroyer of the Dasyus, the protector of the noble race.

original: indra oṣadhīr asanod ahāni vanaspatīṃr asanod antarikṣam /
analyzed: indraḥ oṣadhīḥ asanot ahāni vanaspatīṃr asanot antarikṣam
translated: Indra conquered the plants, the days, the trees, and the atmosphere.

original: bibheda balaṃ nunude vivāco 'thābhavad damitābhikratūnām ////
analyzed: bibheda balam nunude vivācaḥ thā abhavat damitā abhikratūnām
translated: He broke the strength, drove away the evil words, and then became the controller of the arrogant.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men, in this battle for strength.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām ////
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The mighty one who listens for help in the battles, the conqueror of enemies, the winner of riches.

original: ud u brahmāṇy airata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha /
analyzed: ud u brahmāṇi airata śravasyā indram samarye mahaya vasiṣṭha
translated: O Vasistha, praise Indra for fame and victory in the battle,

original: ā yo viśvāni śavasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṃsi ////
analyzed: ā yaḥ viśvāni śavasā tatāna upaśrotā me īvataḥ vacāṃsi
translated: Who hath extended all things with his might, who heareth the words of me the bountiful.

original: ayāmi ghoṣa indra devajāmir irajyanta yac churudho vivāci /
analyzed: ayāmi ghoṣaḥ indra deva jāmiḥ irajyanta yat śurudhaḥ vivāci
translated: The cry hath come, O Indra, kin to the Gods, when the impetuous one hath been most eager to speak.

original: nahi svam āyuś cikite janeṣu tānīd aṃhāṃsy ati parṣy asmān ////
analyzed: nahi svam āyuḥ cikite janeṣu tāni id aṃhāṃsi ati parṣi asmān
translated: For men reckon not their own life; drive thou these troubles far away from us.

original: yuje rathaṃ gaveṣaṇaṃ haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ /🔽vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvendro vṛtrāṇy apratī jaghanvān ////
analyzed: yuje ratham gaveṣaṇam haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ  vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvā indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghanvān
translated: They have yoked the car which seeks the kine with the two bay steeds; they have come to the prayers which he accepts.🔽He hath filled the two world-halves with his greatness; Indra hath laid low the Vr̥itras without a peer.

original: āpaś cit pipyu staryo na gāvo nakṣann ṛtaṃ jaritāras ta indra /
analyzed: āpaḥ cit pipyuḥ staryaḥ na gāvaḥ nakṣan ṛtam jaritāraḥ te indra
translated: Even the waters have waxed great like the cows in the stalls; the praisers have obtained thy truth, O Indra.

original: yāhi vāyur na niyuto no achā tvaṃ hi dhībhir dayase vi vājān ////
analyzed: yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ naḥ achā tvam hi dhībhiḥ dayase vi vājān
translated: Come to us with thy teams as with the winds, for thou givest strength with thoughts.

original: te tvā madā indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇaṃ tuvirādhasaṃ jaritre /
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇam tuvi rādhasam jaritre
translated: Let these gladdening draughts, O Indra, gladden thee, the strong, the mighty, for the singer's sake.

original: eko devatrā dayase hi martān asmin chūra savane mādayasva ////
analyzed: ekaḥ devatrā dayase hi martān asmin śūra savane mādayasva
translated: For thou, O Hero, givest to men in this libation, as one God, favour among the Gods.

original: eved indraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ /
analyzed: eva id indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum vasiṣṭhāsaḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ
translated: Even him, Indra, the strong, whose arm wields the bolt, the Vasishṭhas glorify with their hymns.

original: sa na stuto vīravad dhātu gomad yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat dhātu gomat yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: So, when lauded, grant to the singer wealth in heroes and in kine. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ chuṣmī rājā vṛtrahā somapāvā /
analyzed: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ turāṣāh śuṣmī rājā vṛtra hā soma pāvā
translated: The vigorous, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the bull, the conqueror, the mighty, the king, the slayer of Vrtra, the drinker of Soma,

original: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsad arvāṅ mādhyaṃdine savane matsad indraḥ ////
analyzed: yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsat arvāṅ mādhyaṃdine savane matsat indraḥ
translated: Having yoked his two bay horses, may Indra come hither to the midday libation, to rejoice.
