original: indraś ca somaṃ pibataṃ bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū /
analyzed: indraḥ ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū
translated: O Indra and Brhaspati, having drunk the Soma in this sacrifice, being joyful, rich in strength,

original: ā vāṃ viśantv indavaḥ svābhuvo 'sme rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ ni yachatam ////
analyzed: ā vām viśantu indavaḥ su ābhuvaḥ sme rayim sarva vīram ni yacchatam
translated: May your own invigorating drops enter you. Bestow upon us wealth with all heroes.

original: ā vo vahantu saptayo raghuṣyado raghupatvānaḥ pra jigāta bāhubhiḥ /
analyzed: ā vaḥ vahantu saptayaḥ raghuṣyadaḥ raghu patvānaḥ pra jigāta bāhubhiḥ
translated: May your swift-moving, swift-going chariots carry you. Go forth with your arms.

original: sīdatā barhir uru vaḥ sadas kṛtaṃ mādayadhvaṃ maruto madhvo andhasaḥ ////
analyzed: sīdata ā barhiḥ uru vaḥ sadaḥ kṛtam mādayadhvam marutaḥ madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: Sit on the wide seat prepared on the sacred grass. Rejoice, O Maruts, in the sweet juice.

original: imaṃ stomam arhate jātavedase ratham iva saṃ mahemā manīṣayā /
analyzed: imam stomam arhate jātavedase ratham iva sam mahema manīṣayā
translated: This hymn we will exalt with thought, like a chariot, for the worthy one, for the all-knowing one.

original: bhadrā hi naḥ pramatir asya saṃsady agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayaṃ tava ////
analyzed: bhadrā hi naḥ pramatiḥ asya saṃsadi agne sakhye mā riṣāmā vayam tava
translated: For your favour is good for us in this assembly. O Agni, let us not be harmed in your friendship.

original: aibhir agne sarathaṃ yāhy arvāṅ nānārathaṃ vā vibhavo hy aśvāḥ /
analyzed: ā ebhiḥ agne sa ratham yāhi arvāṅ nānā ratham vā vibhavaḥ hi aśvāḥ
translated: With these, O Agni, come hither in your chariot, or in a chariot of various make, for your horses are powerful.

original: patnīvatas triṃśataṃ trīṃś ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva ////
analyzed: patnīvataḥ triṃśatam trīn ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva
translated: Accompanied by your wife, bring the thirty-three gods to the place of worship, and rejoice.

original: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūraṃ na kac cid bharanto 'vasyavaḥ /
analyzed: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ vasyavaḥ
translated: We, O thou of matchless deeds, who have never failed, have brought thee, O bountiful one, the great (sacrifice),

original: vāje citraṃ havāmahe ////
analyzed: vāje citram havāmahe
translated: We call thee to the prize, O wondrous one.

original: upa tvā karmann ūtaye sa no yuvograś cakrāma yo dhṛṣat /
analyzed: upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat
translated: To thee, O thou who art to be invoked in the rite, to thee, O thou who art strong, we have come for help, who art daring.

original: tvām id dhy avitāraṃ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim ////
analyzed: tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim
translated: For we have chosen thee, O Indra, as one who helps, as one who prospers, as a saviour.

original: yo na idamidaṃ purā pra vasya ānināya tam u va stuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe
translated: He who in the past has brought us this and that good thing, him I will praise.

original: sakhāya indram ūtaye ////🔽haryaśvaṃ satpatiṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye  haryaśvam satpatim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata
translated: The friends have called on Indra for help.🔽The one with the tawny steeds, the lord of the people, who is victorious over the people, for he is the one who has gladdened (us).

original: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam ////
analyzed: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam
translated: May he, the bountiful one, grant to the praisers a hundred head of cattle and horses.

original: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satyaśuṣmāya tavase matiṃ bhare /
analyzed: pra maṃhiṣṭhāya bṛhate bṛhadraye satya śuṣmāya tavase matim bhare
translated: I bring forth a thought for the most bountiful, the great, the possessor of great wealth, the true, the mighty one.

original: apām iva pravaṇe yasya durdharaṃ rādho viśvāyu śavase apāvṛtam ////🔽adha te viśvam anu hāsad iṣṭaya āpo nimneva savanā haviṣmataḥ /
analyzed: apām iva pravaṇe yasya durdharam rādhaḥ viśvāyu śavase apāvṛtam  adha te viśvam anu ha asat iṣṭayaḥ āpaḥ nimnā iva savanā haviṣmataḥ
translated: Whose bounty, like a stream of water, is hard to hold back, is open to all for support and strength.🔽May all thy wishes be fulfilled, O thou who art to be invoked, like the waters in a low-lying place, the libations of the sacrificer,

original: yat parvate na samaśīta haryata indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ ////
analyzed: yat parvate na samaśīta haryataḥ indrasya vajraḥ śnathitā hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: When thy golden thunderbolt, O Indra, which is hard to resist, has been sharpened like a mountain.

original: asmai bhīmāya namasā sam adhvara uṣo na śubhra ā bharā panīyase /
analyzed: asmai bhīmāya namasā sam adhvare uṣaḥ na śubhraḥ ā bhara panīyase
translated: To him, the terrible one, with reverence bring the sacrifice, O Dawn, as the bright one brings it to the most worthy.

original: yasya dhāma śravase nāmendriyaṃ jyotir akāri harito nāyase ////
analyzed: yasya dhāma śravase nāma indriyam jyotiḥ akāri haritaḥ nāyase
translated: Whose glory, for fame, for power, for light, he has made like the two bay horses for the most worthy.

original: ime ta indra te vayaṃ puruṣṭuta ye tvārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso /
analyzed: ime te indra te vayam puruṣṭuta ye tvā ārabhya carāmasi prabhūvaso
translated: These are thine, O Indra, we are thine, O much-invoked one, who, O Lord of much wealth, we who depend on thee, move about.

original: nahi tvad anyo girvaṇo giraḥ sadhat kṣoṇīr iva prati no harya tad vacaḥ ////
analyzed: nahi tvat anyaḥ girvaṇaḥ giraḥ sadhat kṣoṇīḥ iva prati naḥ harya tat vacaḥ
translated: For no other singer of praises than thee is there a place for the songs, like the two worlds. Delight thee with this speech of ours.

original: bhūri ta indra vīryaṃ tava smasy asya stotur maghavan kāmam ā pṛṇa /
analyzed: bhūri te indra vīryam tava smasi asya stotuḥ maghavan kāmam ā pṛṇa
translated: Great is thy manly power, O Indra, this is thine. Fulfil, O bountiful one, the wish of this thy praiser.

original: anu te dyaur bṛhatī vīryaṃ mama iyaṃ ca te pṛthivī nema ojase ////
analyzed: anu te dyauḥ bṛhatī vīryam mama iyam ca te pṛthivī neme ojase
translated: The lofty heaven, O Indra, and this earth for thy strength and power.

original: tvaṃ tam indra parvataṃ mahām uruṃ vajreṇa vajrin parvaśaś cakartitha /🔽avāsṛjo nivṛtāḥ sartavā apaḥ satrā viśvaṃ dadhiṣe kevalaṃ sahaḥ ////🔽udapruto na vayo rakṣamāṇā vāvadato abhriyasyeva ghoṣāḥ /
analyzed: tvam tam indra parvatam mahām urum vajreṇa vajrin parvaśas cakartitha  avāsṛjaḥ nivṛtāḥ sartavai apaḥ satrā viśvam dadhiṣe kevalam sahaḥ  uda prutaḥ na vayaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ vāvadataḥ abhriyasya iva ghoṣāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy thunderbolt, O wielder of the thunderbolt, hast cleft that great and wide mountain in pieces.🔽Thou hast loosed the waters that were confined, that flow in their season. Thou always hast all conquering power.🔽Like birds flying up, guarding the life, with the sound of clouds,

original: giribhrajo normayo madanto bṛhaspatim abhy arkā anāvan ////
analyzed: giri bhrajaḥ nā ūrmayaḥ madantaḥ bṛhaspatim abhi arkāḥ anāvan
translated: the streams, like mountain torrents, rejoicing, have sung forth to Brihaspati.

original: saṃ gobhir aṅgiraso nakṣamāṇo bhaga ived aryamaṇaṃ nināya /
analyzed: sam gobhiḥ aṅgirasaḥ nakṣamāṇaḥ bhagaḥ iva id aryamaṇam nināya
translated: Angiras, seeking with the cows, led forth Aryaman as if he were Bhaga.

original: jane mitro na dampatī anakti bṛhaspate vājayāśūṃr ivājau ////
analyzed: jane mitraḥ na dampatī anakti bṛhaspate vājaya āśūn iva ājau
translated: As in a race Brihaspati urged on the two horses, the male and female, for the prize.

original: sādhvaryā atithinīr iṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇā anavadyarūpāḥ /
analyzed: sādhvaryāḥ atithinīḥ iṣirāḥ spārhāḥ su varṇāḥ anavadya rūpāḥ
translated: The excellent, the hospitable, the strong, the desirable, the well-formed, of irreproachable appearance,

original: bṛhaspatiḥ parvatebhyo vitūryā nir gā ūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ parvatebhyaḥ vitūrya niḥ gāḥ ūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ
translated: Brihaspati, having burst the mountains, brought forth the cows from the enclosures as if they were barley.

original: āpruṣāyan madhunā ṛtasya yonim avakṣipann arka ulkām iva dyoḥ /🔽bṛhaspatir uddharann aśmano gā bhūmyā udneva vi tvacaṃ bibheda ////🔽apa jyotiṣā tamo antarikṣad udnaḥ śīpālam iva vāta ājat /
analyzed: āpruṣāyan madhunā ṛtasya yonim avakṣipan arkaḥ ulkām iva dyoḥ  bṛhaspatiḥ uddharan aśmanaḥ gāḥ bhūmyāḥ udnā iva vi tvacam bibheda  apa jyotiṣā tamaḥ udnaḥ śīpālam iva vātaḥ ājat
translated: The Ark, sprinkling with the honey of truth, throwing down the womb, like a star from the sky,🔽Brihaspati, drawing out the cows from the stone, cleft the skin of the earth as if with a rope.🔽The light from the atmosphere drove away the darkness, the wind blew like a reed from the water.

original: bṛhaspatir anumṛśyā valasyābhram iva vāta ā cakra ā gāḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ anumṛśya valasya abhram iva vātaḥ ā cakre ā gāḥ
translated: Brihaspati, having touched the cloud of the demon, brought the cows, as if on the wind, from the mountain.

original: yadā valasya pīyato jasuṃ bhed bṛhaspatir agnitapobhir arkaiḥ /
analyzed: yadā valasya pīyataḥ jasum bhet bṛhaspatiḥ agni tapobhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: When Brihaspati with the heat of Agni and the Arkas cleft the joy of the demon when drunk,

original: dadbhir na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādad āvir nidhīṃr akṛṇod usriyāṇām ////
analyzed: dadbhiḥ na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādat āvis nidhīṃr akṛṇot usriyāṇām
translated: he took with his teeth what was enclosed by the tongue, and revealed the treasures of the cows.

original: bṛhaspatir amata hi tyad āsāṃ nāma svarīṇāṃ sadane guhā yat /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ amata hi tyad āsām nāma svarīṇām sadane guhā yat
translated: Brihaspati knew that secret name of these, the sound in the abode of the demons,

original: āṇḍeva bhitvā śakunasya garbham ud usriyāḥ parvatasya tmanājat ////
analyzed: āṇḍā iva bhitvā śakunasya garbham ud usriyāḥ parvatasya tmanā ajat
translated: As if splitting the egg of a bird, he brought forth the embryo of the cow, the mountain, by his own power.

original: aśnāpinaddhaṃ madhu pary apaśyan matsyaṃ na dīna udani kṣiyantam /
analyzed: aśnā apinaddham madhu pari apaśyat matsyam na dīne udani kṣiyantam
translated: They saw honey wrapped in a skin, like a fish lying in the water.

original: niṣ ṭaj jabhāra camasaṃ na vṛkṣād bṛhaspatir viraveṇā vikṛtya ////
analyzed: niḥ tat jabhāra camasam na vṛkṣāt bṛhaspatiḥ viraveṇa vikṛtya
translated: He carried it off like a bowl from a tree, Brihaspati, having torn it open with his roar.

original: soṣām avindat sa svaḥ so agniṃ so arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi /🔽bṛhaspatir govapuṣo valasya nir majjānaṃ na parvaṇo jabhāra ////
analyzed: sa uṣām avindat sa svar saḥ agnim saḥ arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi  bṛhaspatiḥ go vapuṣaḥ valasya niḥ majjānam na parvaṇaḥ jabhāra
translated: He found the light, the heaven, the fire. With his light he dispelled the darkness.🔽Brihaspati brought out the marrow from the bone of Vala, as from a joint.

original: himeva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinākṛpayad valo gāḥ /
analyzed: himā iva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinā akṛpayat valaḥ gāḥ
translated: Like leaves stripped by frost from the trees, Vala's cows were made lean by Brihaspati.

original: anānukṛtyam apunaś cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mitha uccarātaḥ ////🔽abhi śyāvaṃ na kṛśanebhir aśvaṃ nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaro dyām apiṃśan /
analyzed: anānukṛtyam apunar cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithas uccarātaḥ  abhi śyāvam na kṛśanebhiḥ aśvam nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaraḥ dyām apiṃśan
translated: He made them incapable of being made lean again, so that the sun and moon may rise together.🔽The Fathers, with the stars, have filled the sky with the dark horse, as with the black skin.

original: rātryāṃ tamo adadhur jyotir ahan bṛhaspatir bhinad adriṃ vidad gāḥ ////
analyzed: rātryām tamaḥ adadhuḥ jyotiḥ ahan bṛhaspatiḥ bhinat adrim vidat gāḥ
translated: They have put darkness in the night and light in the day. Brihaspati cleft the rock and found the cows.

original: idam akarma namo abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīr anv ānonavīti /
analyzed: idam akarma namaḥ abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīḥ anu ānonavīti
translated: This is the work, the homage to the cloud, which follows the many and makes them new.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ so aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhir no vayo dhāt ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ saḥ aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhiḥ naḥ vayaḥ dhāt
translated: For he is the bestower of strength to us with cattle, with horses, with heroes, with men.

original: achā ma indraṃ matayaḥ svarvidaḥ sadhrīcīr viśvā uśatīr anūṣata /
analyzed: achā me indram matayaḥ svar vidaḥ sadhrīcīḥ viśvāḥ uśatīḥ anūṣata
translated: My hymns, seeking heaven, all longing ones have sounded forth to Indra, to the one of common aim.

original: pari ṣvajante janayo yathā patiṃ maryaṃ na śundhyuṃ maghavānam ūtaye ////
analyzed: pari svajante janayaḥ yathā patim maryam na śundhyum maghavānam ūtaye
translated: They have surrounded him as the dames their lord, the bountiful one, the young man, for help.

original: na ghā tvadrig apa veti me manas tve it kāmaṃ puruhūta śiśraya /
analyzed: na ghā tvadrik apa veti me manaḥ tve id kāmam puruhūta śiśraya
translated: My mind does not turn to thee, O thou of such a form, but in thee, O much-invoked, I place my desire.

original: rājeva dasma ni ṣado 'dhi barhiṣy asmint su some 'vapānam astu te ////
analyzed: rājā iva dasma ni sadaḥ dhi barhiṣi asmin su some vapānam astu te
translated: O wondrous one, as a king on his sacred grass, on this fair Soma, be thou seated for our drink.

original: viṣūvṛd indro amuter uta kṣudhaḥ sa id rāyo maghavā vasva īśate /
analyzed: viṣūvṛt indraḥ amuteḥ uta kṣudhaḥ saḥ id rāyaḥ maghavā vasvaḥ īśate
translated: Indra, the supporter of all, of freedom from want and of hunger, he is the lord of wealth and of good things.

original: tasyed ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavo vayo vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ ////
analyzed: tasya id ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavaḥ vayaḥ vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
translated: These seven rivers, flowing in opposite directions, increase the strength of the mighty bull.

original: vayo na vṛkṣaṃ supalāśam āsadant somāsa indraṃ mandinaś camūṣadaḥ /
analyzed: vayaḥ na vṛkṣam su palāśam āsadan somāsaḥ indram mandinaḥ camūṣadaḥ
translated: The Soma juices, sitting on the tree with good leaves, have gladdened Indra, the sitters in the bowls.

original: praiṣām anīkaṃ śavasā davidyutad vidat svar manave jyotir āryam ////
analyzed: pra eṣām anīkam śavasā davidyutat vidat svar manave jyotiḥ āryam
translated: The front of these (rivers) has shone forth with might; he has found the light, the noble one, for Manu.

original: kṛtaṃ na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargaṃ yan maghavā sūryaṃ jayat /
analyzed: kṛtam na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargam yat maghavā sūryam jayat
translated: The gambler does not arrange the stake when Maghavan wins the sun in the gathering.

original: na tat te anyo anu vīryaṃ śakan na purāṇo maghavan nota nūtanaḥ ////
analyzed: na tat te anyaḥ anu vīryam śakat na purāṇaḥ maghavan na uta nūtanaḥ
translated: No one else, O Maghavan, can equal your heroic deed, neither the ancient nor the new one.

original: viśaṃviśaṃ maghavā pary aśāyata janānāṃ dhenā avacākaśad vṛṣā /
analyzed: viśam viśam maghavā pari aśāyata janānām dhenāḥ avacākaśat vṛṣā
translated: Maghavan has lain down around each clan, the bull has looked down upon the people's songs.

original: yasyāha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati sa tīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ ////
analyzed: yasya aha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati sa tīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ
translated: He whom Shakra delights in at the libations, with strong Soma juices he conquers the enemies.

original: āpo na sindhum abhi yat samakṣarant somāsa indraṃ kulyā iva hradam /
analyzed: āpaḥ na sindhum abhi yat samakṣaran somāsaḥ indram kulyāḥ iva hradam
translated: Just as the waters flow together to the river, the Soma juices to Indra, like rivulets to a lake,

original: vardhanti viprā maho asya sādane yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir divyena dānunā ////
analyzed: vardhanti viprāḥ mahaḥ asya sādane yavam na vṛṣṭiḥ divyena dānunā
translated: The sages increase his greatness in his abode, like rain on barley with the heavenly rain.

original: vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayad rajaḥsv ā yo aryapatnīr akṛṇod imā apaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayat rajaḥsu ā yaḥ arya patnīḥ akṛṇot imāḥ apaḥ
translated: The bull, like an angry one, flies through the realms, he who has made these waters the wives of the noble one.

original: sa sunvate maghavā jīradānave 'vindaj jyotir manave haviṣmate ////
analyzed: sa sunvate maghavā jīra dānave vindat jyotiḥ manave haviṣmate
translated: He, the bountiful one, to the Soma-presser who gives quickly, has found light for Manu, the offerer of oblations.

original: uj jāyatāṃ paraśu jyotiṣā saha bhūyā ṛtasya sudughā purāṇavat /
analyzed: ud jāyatām paraśu jyotiṣā saha bhūyāḥ ṛtasya su dughā purāṇa vat
translated: Let the axe be born together with the light, let the ancient well-milking one of truth increase.

original: vi rocatām aruṣo bhānunā śuciḥ svar na śukraṃ śuśucīta satpatiḥ ////
analyzed: vi rocatām aruṣaḥ bhānunā śuciḥ svar na śukram śuśucīta satpatiḥ
translated: Let the red one shine with pure radiance, let the pure one, the lord of the true, shine like the heaven.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudhaṃ puruhūta viśvām /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām
translated: With cows let us overcome evil desire, with barley, O much-invoked one, every hunger.

original: vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāny asmākena vṛjanenā jayema ////
analyzed: vayam rājabhiḥ prathamāḥ dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema
translated: May we, with the kings, first win treasures by this our holy work.

original: bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghāyoḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from the evil foe.

original: indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the front, and from the middle, as a friend, grant room for our friends.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya
translated: O Brihaspati, you and Indra are the lords of wealth, of the heavenly and of the earthly.

original: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ////
analyzed: dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Grant riches to the singer, even to the poor. Do you, O ye two, protect us evermore with blessings.

original: vayam u tvā taditarthā indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: vayam u tvā taditarthāḥ indra tvāyantaḥ sakhāyaḥ
translated: We, O Indra, with this object, we thy friends who strive to win thee,

original: kaṇvā ukthebhir jarante ////
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ ukthebhiḥ jarante
translated: The Kaṇvas sing with praises.

original: na ghem anyad ā papana vajrinn apaso naviṣṭau /
analyzed: na gha īm anyat ā papana vajrin apasaḥ naviṣṭau
translated: O thou of the thunderbolt, I find nothing else so delightful as thou in the fight.

original: taved u stomaṃ ciketa ////
analyzed: tava id u stomam ciketa
translated: I have thought of this praise of thine.

original: ichanti devāḥ sunvantaṃ na svapnāya spṛhayanti /
analyzed: ichanti devāḥ sunvantam na svapnāya spṛhayanti
translated: The gods desire him who presses out (the Soma); they do not long for sleep.

original: yanti pramādam atandrāḥ ////
analyzed: yanti pramādam atandrāḥ
translated: They go to heedlessness, being ever watchful.

original: vayam indra tvāyavo 'bhi pra ṇonumo vṛṣan /🔽viddhi tv asya no vaso ////
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ bhi pra nonumaḥ vṛṣan  viddhi tu asya naḥ vaso
translated: O Indra, we, thy worshippers, O bull, we utter our voices to thee.🔽Know thou this, O bountiful one, of us.

original: mā no nide ca vaktave 'ryo randhīr arāvne /
analyzed: mā naḥ nide ca vaktave ryaḥ randhīḥ arāvne
translated: Do not thou, O thou of the thunderbolt, give us up to blame and censure, to the enemy's spiteful hatred.

original: tve api kratur mama ////
analyzed: tve api kratuḥ mama
translated: In thee also is my spirit.

original: tvaṃ varmāsi saprathaḥ puroyodhaś ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: tvam varmā asi saprathaḥ puras yodhaḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: You are the armor, the wide-extending, the front-line warrior, and the slayer of Vrtra.

original: tvayā prati bruve yujā ////
analyzed: tvayā prati bruve yujā
translated: With you as ally, I speak out.

original: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca /
analyzed: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca
translated: For the slaying of Vṛtra, for strength, and for conquering in battles,

original: indra tvā vartayāmasi ////
analyzed: indra tvā vartayāmasi
translated: O Indra, we turn to you.

original: arvācīnaṃ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: arvācīnam su te manaḥ uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato
translated: Turn your mind and your eye towards us, O you of a hundred powers.

original: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ ////
analyzed: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ
translated: O Indra, may the priests make you.

original: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhir gīrbhir īmahe /
analyzed: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īmahe
translated: We invoke your names, O you of a hundred powers, with all our songs,

original: indrābhimātiṣāhye ////
analyzed: indra abhimātiṣāhye
translated: O Indra, for overcoming our enemies.

original: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi /🔽indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi  indrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ
translated: With the powers of the much-praised one, with a hundred, we honor🔽Indra, the upholder of the people.

original: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve /
analyzed: indram vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve
translated: I address the much-invoked Indra to slay Vrtra,

original: bhareṣu vājasātaye ////
analyzed: bhareṣu vājasātaye
translated: in battles to win strength.

original: vājeṣu sāsahir bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato /
analyzed: vājeṣu sāsahiḥ bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato
translated: Be victorious in battles, we invoke you, O you of a hundred powers,

original: indra vṛtrāya hantave ////
analyzed: indra vṛtrāya hantave
translated: O Indra, to slay Vrtra.

original: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravaḥsu ca /
analyzed: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravaḥsu ca
translated: In battles, in the forefront of battles, in contests, and in glories,

original: indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu ////
analyzed: indra sākṣva abhimātiṣu
translated: O Indra, be victorious over our enemies.

original: śuṣmintamaṃ na ūtaye dyumninaṃ pāhi jāgṛvim /
analyzed: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim
translated: Protect the most powerful one for our help, the glorious one, the watchful one,

original: indra somaṃ śatakrato ////
analyzed: indra somam śatakrato
translated: O Indra, the Soma, O you of a hundred powers.

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu /
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
translated: The powers that you have in the five peoples,

original: indra tāni ta ā vṛṇe ////
analyzed: indra tāni te ā vṛṇe
translated: O Indra, I choose those of yours.

original: agann indra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram /
analyzed: agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram
translated: O Indra, thou hast attained great glory; win thou the glory that is hard to conquer.

original: ut te śuṣmaṃ tirāmasi ////
analyzed: ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi
translated: We will exalt thy strength.

original: arvāvato na ā gahy atho śakra parāvataḥ /🔽u loko yas te adriva indreha tata ā gahi ////
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ  u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi
translated: Come to us from the near, O Shakra, and from afar,🔽From whatever region is thine, O Thunderer, come hither, O Indra.

original: indro aṅgaṃ mahad bhayam abhi ṣad apa cucyavat /
analyzed: indraḥ aṅgam mahat bhayam abhi sat apa cucyavat
translated: Indra hath overcome the great and terrible foe,

original: sa hi sthiro vicarṣaṇiḥ ////
analyzed: sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: For he is firm and very active.

original: indraś ca mṛlayāti no na naḥ paścād aghaṃ naśat /
analyzed: indraḥ ca mṛlayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat
translated: May Indra be gracious to us, may he not leave sin behind us,

original: bhadraṃ bhavāti naḥ puraḥ ////
analyzed: bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras
translated: May he be gracious to us in front.

original: indra āśābhyas pari sarvābhyo abhayaṃ karat /
analyzed: indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat
translated: May Indra make all the regions free from danger for us,

original: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ ////
analyzed: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: The conqueror of foes, the very active one.

original: ny ū ṣu vācaṃ pra mahe bharāmahe gira indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: ni u su vācam pra mahe bharāmahe giraḥ indrāya sadane vivasvataḥ
translated: We will bring to the great Indra, in the abode of Vivasvan, our speech and our songs of praise.

original: nū cid dhi ratnaṃ sasatām ivāvidan na duṣṭutir draviṇodeṣu śasyate ////
analyzed: nu cit hi ratnam sasatām iva avidat na duṣṭutiḥ draviṇaḥ deṣu śasyate
translated: For they have found the treasure, as it were, of the good, and a bad hymn is not praised among those who bestow wealth.

original: duro aśvasya dura indra gor asi duro yavasya vasuna inas patiḥ /
analyzed: duraḥ aśvasya duraḥ indra goḥ asi duraḥ yavasya vasunaḥ inaḥ patiḥ
translated: Thou art the finder of the horse, O Indra, the finder of the cow, the finder of the barley, the lord of wealth.

original: śikṣānaraḥ pradivo akāmakarśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyas tam idaṃ gṛṇīmasi ////
analyzed: śikṣā naraḥ pradivaḥ a kāma karśanaḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ tam idam gṛṇīmasi
translated: The teacher, the giver of gifts, the afflicter of those who desire not (gifts), the friend to friends, him we extol with this (hymn).

original: śacīva indra purukṛd dyumattama taved idam abhitaś cekite vasu /
analyzed: śacīvas indra puru kṛt dyumattama tava id idam abhitas cekite vasu
translated: O Indra, most bountiful, most splendid, as Shachi is to Indra, this wealth is gathered around thee.

original: ataḥ saṃgṛbhyābhibhūta ā bhara mā tvāyato jarituḥ kāmam ūnayīḥ ////
analyzed: atas saṃgṛbhya abhibhūtaḥ ā bhara mā tvāyataḥ jarituḥ kāmam ūnayīḥ
translated: From there, having seized it, bring it, overcome by thee. Do not disappoint the desire of the worshipper who is not hostile.

original: ebhir dyubhir sumanā ebhir indubhir nirundhāno amatiṃ gobhir aśvinā /🔽indreṇa dasyuṃ darayanta indubhir yutadveṣasaḥ sam iṣā rabhemahi ////
analyzed: ebhiḥ dyubhiḥ sumanāḥ ebhiḥ indubhiḥ nirundhānaḥ amatim gobhiḥ aśvinā  indreṇa dasyum darayantaḥ indubhiḥ yuta dveṣasaḥ sam iṣā rabhemahi
translated: With these shining ones, with these drops, warding off misfortune with cattle, O Aśvins,🔽With Indra, crushing the Dasyu with the drops, united in hatred, may we obtain food.

original: sam indra rāyā sam iṣā rabhemahi saṃ vājebhiḥ puruścandrair abhidyubhiḥ /
analyzed: sam indra rāyā sam iṣā rabhemahi sam vājebhiḥ puru ścandraiḥ abhidyubhiḥ
translated: O Indra, may we obtain wealth and food with thee, and with the very brilliant and shining treasures,

original: saṃ devyā pramatyā vīraśuṣmayā goagrayāśvāvatyā rabhemahi ////
analyzed: sam devyā pramatyā vīra śuṣmayā go agrayā aśvāvatyā rabhemahi
translated: May we obtain with the divine inspiration, with the strength of heroes, with the foremost of cattle, with horses.

original: te tvā madā amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāso vṛtrahatyeṣu satpate /🔽yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇy aprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ ////
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ amadan tāni vṛṣṇyā te somāsaḥ vṛtra hatyeṣu satpate  yat kārave daśa vṛtrāṇi aprati barhiṣmate ni sahasrāṇi barhayaḥ
translated: Those gladdening drinks have gladdened thee, those manly powers, those Soma juices, O lord of the good, in the battles against Vṛtra,🔽When thou didst give to the one with the sacrificial grass ten Vṛtras to slay, and a thousand to the one with the sacrificial grass.

original: yudhā yudham upa ghed eṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puraṃ sam idaṃ haṃsy ojasā /
analyzed: yudhā yudham upa gha id eṣi dhṛṣṇuyā purā puram sam idam haṃsi ojasā
translated: In every battle thou goest forth to fight with thy valour; thou shalt destroy this fortress with thy might,

original: namyā yad indra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayo namuciṃ nāma māyinam ////
analyzed: namyā yat indra sakhyā parāvati nibarhayaḥ namucim nāma māyinam
translated: When, O Indra, thou didst crush Namuci the deceiver, O thou to be revered, in the far-away friendship.

original: tvaṃ karañjam uta parṇayaṃ vadhīs tejiṣṭhayātithigvasya vartanī /
analyzed: tvam karañjam uta parṇayam vadhīḥ tejiṣṭhayā atithigvasya vartanī
translated: Thou slewest Karambha and Parṇaya, with the most impetuous course of Âtithigva.

original: tvaṃ śatā vaṅgṛdasyābhinat puro 'nānudaḥ pariṣūtā ṛjiśvanā ////
analyzed: tvam śatā vaṅgṛdasya abhinat puraḥ nā anudaḥ pariṣūtāḥ ṛjiśvanā
translated: Thou smotest down the hundred forts of Vaṅgṛida, unresisted, with Ṛjiśvan's help.

original: tvam etāṃ janarājño dvir daśābandhunā suśravasopajagmuṣaḥ /
analyzed: tvam etām jana rājñaḥ dvis daśa abandhunā suśravasā upajagmuṣaḥ
translated: Thou, for the King of men, twice, with the ten-banded, didst win these for the famous, who came nigh to thee.

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā navatiṃ nava śruto ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadāvṛṇak ////
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim nava śrutaḥ ni cakreṇa rathyā duṣpadā avṛṇak
translated: Thou with thy car-wheel didst crush in, O Śruta, sixty thousand and ninety-nine.

original: tvam āvitha suśravasaṃ tavotibhis tava trāmabhir indra tūrvayāṇam /
analyzed: tvam āvitha suśravasam tava ūtibhiḥ tava trāmabhiḥ indra tūrvayāṇam
translated: Thou holpest Suṣravâs with thy succours, and Tûrvayâṇa with thy gracious gifts.

original: tva asmai kutsam atithigvam āyuṃ mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ ////
analyzed: tvaḥ asmai kutsam atithigvam āyum mahe rājñe yūne arandhanāyaḥ
translated: Thou gavest to this King, to the young, to the mighty, to the unassailable, Kutsa and Âtithigva and Âyu.

original: ya udṛcīndra devagopāḥ sakhāyas te śivatamā asāma /🔽tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ prataraṃ dadhānāḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ udṛci indra deva gopāḥ sakhāyaḥ te śivatamāḥ asāma  tvām stoṣāma tvayā su vīrāḥ drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ
translated: O Indra, we, thy friends, who have been cherished by thee, God-guardian, would be most happy with thee.🔽Thee we will praise, with thee for our aid, O Indra, prolonging our life, bestowing easy access.

original: abhi tvā vṛṣabhā sute sutaṃ sṛjāmi pītaye /🔽tṛmpā vy aśnuhī madam ////
analyzed: abhi tvā vṛṣabha sute sutam sṛjāmi pītaye  tṛmpa vi aśnuhi madam
translated: To thee, O Bull, I pour the juice that is pressed: I shed the juice for thee to drink.🔽Quaff and enjoy the gladdening draught.

original: mā tvā mūrā aviṣyavo mopahasvāna ā dabhan /
analyzed: mā tvā mūrāḥ aviṣyavaḥ mā upahasvānaḥ ā dabhan
translated: Let not the foolish, greedy for their weal, nor he who brings no gift, prevail against thee.

original: mākīṃ brahmadviṣo vanaḥ ////
analyzed: mākīm brahma dviṣaḥ vanaḥ
translated: Let not the Brahman's foe prevail against thee.

original: iha tvā goparīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase /
analyzed: iha tvā go parīṇasā mahe mandantu rādhase
translated: Here let the milk-fed calves delight thee for the great gift of wealth.

original: saro gauro yathā piba ////
analyzed: saraḥ gauraḥ yathā piba
translated: As a bull drinks from a lake.

original: abhi pra gopatiṃ girendram arca yathā vide /
analyzed: abhi pra go patim girā indram arca yathā vide
translated: Praise the lord of cattle, the mountain, the lord of the people, as one who knows,

original: sūnuṃ satyasya satpatim ////
analyzed: sūnum satyasya sat patim
translated: The son of truth, the lord of the good.

original: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire 'ruṣīr adhi barhiṣi /
analyzed: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire ruṣīḥ adhi barhiṣi
translated: The ruddy mares have been let loose upon the sacrificial grass,

original: yatrābhi saṃnavāmahe ////
analyzed: yatra abhi saṃnavāmahe
translated: Where we shall meet together.

original: indrāya gāva āśiraṃ duduhre vajriṇe madhu /
analyzed: indrāya gāvaḥ āśiram duduhre vajriṇe madhu
translated: The cows have milked out honey for Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: yat sīm upahvare vidat ////🔽ā tū na indra madryag ghuvānaḥ somapītaye /
analyzed: yat sīm upahvare vidat  ā tū naḥ indra madryak huvānaḥ soma pītaye
translated: Where he has found a place on the slope.🔽Come to us, O Indra, O thou who art to be invoked, urged on, for the drinking of the Soma.

original: haribhyāṃ yāhy adrivaḥ ////🔽satto hotā na ṛtviyas tistire barhir ānuṣak /
analyzed: haribhyām yāhi adrivas  sattaḥ hotā naḥ ṛtviyaḥ tistire barhiḥ ānuṣak
translated: Come on thy two bay steeds, O thou who hast the stone for thy weapon.🔽The true priest, the regular priest, has spread out the sacrificial grass in due order.

original: ayujran prātar adrayaḥ ////
analyzed: ayujran prātar adrayaḥ
translated: The stones have been set in motion in the morning.

original: imā brahma brahmavāhaḥ kriyanta ā barhiḥ sīda /
analyzed: imā brahma brahma vāhaḥ kriyante ā barhiḥ sīda
translated: These prayers, O thou who carriest the prayers, are made for thee. Sit on the sacrificial grass.

original: vīhi śūra purolāśam ////
analyzed: vīhi śūra purolāśam
translated: Come, O hero, to the oblation.

original: rārandhi savaneṣu ṇa eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan /
analyzed: rārandhi savaneṣu naḥ eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan
translated: Be pleased with us at these libations, at these hymns, O thou who slayest Vrtra,

original: uktheṣv indra girvaṇaḥ ////
analyzed: uktheṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: At these hymns, O Indra, O thou who lovest the song.

original: matayaḥ somapām uruṃ rihanti śavasas patim /
analyzed: matayaḥ soma pām urum rihanti śavasaḥ patim
translated: The prayers of the Soma-drinkers caress the wide lord of power,

original: indraṃ vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ ////
analyzed: indram vatsam na mātaraḥ
translated: Indra, as his mothers do a calf.

original: sa mandasvā hy andhaso rādhase tanvā mahe /
analyzed: sa mandasva hi andhasaḥ rādhase tanvā mahe
translated: Do thou, therefore, rejoice in the juice for the sake of the gift, with thy body for the great,

original: na stotāraṃ nide karaḥ ////
analyzed: na stotāram nide karaḥ
translated: Do not injure the praiser.

original: vayam indra tvāyavo haviṣmanto jarāmahe /
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ jarāmahe
translated: We, O Indra, are thy friends, we who bring oblations, worship thee.

original: uta tvam asmayur vaso ////
analyzed: uta tvam asmayuḥ vaso
translated: And thou art ours, O Vasu.

original: māre asmad vi mumuco haripriyārvāṅ yāhi /
analyzed: mā āre asmat vi mumucaḥ hari priya arvāṅ yāhi
translated: From the Maruts, O thou whom bay steeds carry, deliver us.

original: indra svadhāvo matsveha ////
analyzed: indra svadhāvas matsva iha
translated: O Indra, of true might, rejoice here.

original: arvāñcaṃ tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā /
analyzed: arvāñcam tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā
translated: Let thy bay steeds bring thee hitherward, O Indra, on a car that moves with pleasant sound,

original: ghṛtasnū barhir āsade ////
analyzed: ghṛtasnū barhiḥ āsade
translated: To the seat of sacred grass, O thou who art bathed in sacred oil.

original: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram /
analyzed: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram
translated: Come to the juice we have expressed, to Soma, O Indra, blent with milk,

original: haribhyāṃ yas te asmayuḥ ////
analyzed: haribhyām yaḥ te asmayuḥ
translated: Which, dear to thee, is mingled with the two bay steeds.

original: tam indra madam ā gahi barhiṣṭhāṃ grāvabhiḥ sutam /
analyzed: tam indra madam ā gahi grāvabhiḥ sutam
translated: Bring that delight to thee, O Indra, best to drink, pressed out with the stones.

original: kuvin nv asya tṛpṇavaḥ ////
analyzed: kuvid nu asya tṛpṇavaḥ
translated: Will he not be satisfied therewith?

original: indram itthā giro mamāchāgur iṣitā itaḥ /
analyzed: indram itthā giraḥ mama acha aguḥ iṣitāḥ itas
translated: My songs have hastened hitherward to Indra, even as milch-kine low.

original: āvṛte somapītaye ////
analyzed: āvṛte soma pītaye
translated: To meet the Soma which he loves.

original: indraṃ somasya pītaye stomair iha havāmahe /
analyzed: indram somasya pītaye stomaiḥ iha havāmahe
translated: To Indra here with lauds we call, to drink the juice of Soma-draught.

original: ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat ////
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat
translated: Will he not come to us for our praises?

original: indra somāḥ sutā ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato /
analyzed: indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato
translated: O Indra, these libations of Soma are shed: receive them, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: jathare vājinīvaso ////
analyzed: jathare vājinīvaso
translated: In thy belly, O thou who art rich in spoil.

original: vidmā hi tvā dhanaṃjayaṃ vājeṣu dadhṛṣaṃ kave /
analyzed: vidma hi tvā dhanaṃjayam vājeṣu dadhṛṣam kave
translated: We know thee, O thou who art to be invoked, as the conqueror of wealth in battles, O thou who art wise.

original: adhā te sumnam īmahe ////
analyzed: adhā te sumnam īmahe
translated: Now we implore thy grace.

original: imam indra gavāśiraṃ yavāśiraṃ ca naḥ piba /
analyzed: imam indra gavāśiram yava āśiram ca naḥ piba
translated: Drink, O Indra, this our juice, blent with milk and with barley,

original: āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam ////
analyzed: āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam
translated: Having come with the bulls, the pressed (juice).

original: tubhyed indra sva okye somaṃ codāmi pītaye /
analyzed: tubhya id indra sve okye somam codāmi pītaye
translated: To you, O Indra, in your own abode, I urge the Soma to drink.

original: eṣa rārantu te hṛdi ////
analyzed: eṣa rārantu te hṛdi
translated: May this delight your heart.

original: tvāṃ sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe /
analyzed: tvām sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe
translated: We invoke you, O ancient Indra, to drink the Soma,

original: kuśikāso avasyavaḥ ////
analyzed: kuśikāsaḥ avasyavaḥ
translated: The Kuśikas with their desires.

original: aśvāvati prathamo goṣu gachati suprāvīr indra martyas tavotibhiḥ /
analyzed: aśvāvati prathamaḥ goṣu gacchati su prāvīḥ indra martyaḥ tava ūtibhiḥ
translated: He who possesses horses first obtains cattle, the well-praised mortal, O Indra, through your aids.

original: tam it pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhum āpo yathābhito vicetasaḥ ////🔽āpo na devīr upa yanti hotriyam avaḥ paśyanti vitataṃ yathā rajaḥ /
analyzed: tam id pṛṇakṣi vasunā bhavīyasā sindhum āpaḥ yathā abhitas vicetasaḥ  āpaḥ na devīḥ upa yanti hotriyam avaḥ paśyanti vitatam yathā rajaḥ
translated: You fill him with greater wealth, like the waters all around the ocean.🔽The divine waters approach the one who offers, they see the extended realm as in the sky.

original: prācair devāsaḥ pra ṇayanti devayuṃ brahmapriyaṃ joṣayante varā iva ////
analyzed: prācais devāsaḥ pra nayanti devayum brahma priyam joṣayante varāḥ iva
translated: The gods lead forward the one who is devoted to the gods, they accept the one who loves the Brahman, like suitors.

original: adhi dvayor adadhā ukthyaṃ vaco yatasrucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ /
analyzed: adhi dvayoḥ adadhāḥ ukthyam vacaḥ yata srucā mithunā yā saparyataḥ
translated: You have placed the Ukthya hymn upon the two, the pair who serve with uplifted ladles.

original: asaṃyatto vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktir yajamānāya sunvate ////
analyzed: a saṃyattaḥ vrate te kṣeti puṣyati bhadrā śaktiḥ yajamānāya sunvate
translated: Unrestrained, he dwells in your vow, he prospers. Good power for the sacrificer who presses (Soma).

original: ād aṅgirāḥ prathamaṃ dadhire vaya iddhāgnayaḥ śamyā ye sukṛtyayā /
analyzed: āt aṅgirāḥ prathamam dadhire vayaḥ iddha agnayaḥ śamyā ye su kṛtyayā
translated: The Angirases first obtained the boon, those who have kindled the fire, who through good deeds

original: sarvaṃ paṇeḥ sam avindanta bhojanam aśvāvantaṃ gomantam ā paśuṃ naraḥ ////
analyzed: sarvam paṇeḥ sam avindanta bhojanam aśvāvantam gomantam ā paśum naraḥ
translated: All the men have found in the gambling match the whole enjoyment of cattle, of horses, and of cattle.

original: yajñair atharvā prathamaḥ pathas tate tataḥ sūryo vratapā vena ājani /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ atharvā prathamaḥ pathaḥ tate tatas sūryaḥ vrata pāḥ venaḥ ājani
translated: Atharvan first spread out the path with sacrifices; then Sûrya, the guardian of vows, was born from Vena.

original: ā gā ājad uśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātam amṛtaṃ yajāmahe ////
analyzed: ā gāḥ ājat uśanā kāvyaḥ sacā yamasya jātam amṛtam yajāmahe
translated: Ushâs, the daughter of Yama, has come to us with the cows; we worship the immortal one who is born.

original: barhir vā yat svapatyāya vṛjyate 'rko vā ślokam āghoṣate divi /
analyzed: barhiḥ vā yat su apatyāya vṛjyate rkaḥ vā ślokam āghoṣate divi
translated: When the grass is strewn for the good husband, or the hymn is proclaimed in the sky,

original: grāvā yatra vadati karur ukthyas tasyed indro abhipitveṣu raṇyati ////
analyzed: grāvā yatra vadati karuḥ ukthyaḥ tasya id indraḥ abhipitveṣu raṇyati
translated: where the pressing-stone speaks, the Karu worthy of praise, there Indra delights in the drinking bouts.

original: progrāṃ pītiṃ vṛṣṇa iyarmi satyāṃ prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam /
analyzed: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya hari aśva tubhyam
translated: I urge on the mighty one the true far-reaching draught; for thee, O thou with bay steeds, I send the pressed (juice).

original: indra dhenābhir iha mādayasva dhībhir viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ ////
analyzed: indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ
translated: O Indra, rejoice here with the songs, with all the hymns, with the Dhenus, being praised.

original: yogeyoge tavastaraṃ vājevāje havāmahe /
analyzed: yoge yoge tavastaram vāje vāje havāmahe
translated: In every need, in every contest, we invoke him, the most mighty, in every race for booty.

original: sakhāya indram ūtaye ////
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye
translated: As friends, we invoke Indra to help us.

original: ā ghā gamad yadi śravat sahasriṇībhir ūtibhiḥ /🔽vājebhir upa no havam ////
analyzed: ā ghā gamat yadi śravat sahasriṇībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ  vājebhiḥ upa naḥ havam
translated: Let him come, if he will, with his thousands of aids,🔽with his treasures to our invocation.

original: anu pratnasyaukaso huve tuvipratiṃ naram /
analyzed: anu pratnasya okasaḥ huve tuvi pratim naram
translated: I invoke the mighty man, the ancient ruler,

original: yaṃ te pūrvaṃ pitā huve ////
analyzed: yam te pūrvam pitā huve
translated: whom thy father invoked before thee.

original: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣaṃ carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ /
analyzed: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ
translated: They yoke the ruddy one, the moving one, the ones who stand around.

original: rocante rocanā divi ////
analyzed: rocante rocanā divi
translated: The luminous ones shine in the sky.

original: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe /
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe
translated: They yoke his two desirable tawny horses on the chariot with the two wings,

original: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā ////
analyzed: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā
translated: The red ones, the bold ones, the ones who carry men.

original: ketuṃ kṛṇvann aketave peśo maryā apeśase /
analyzed: ketum kṛṇvan a ketave peśaḥ maryāḥ a peśase
translated: Making a banner for the one without a banner, you make a body for the one without a body.

original: sam uṣadbhir ajāyathāḥ ////
analyzed: sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: You were born together with the dawns.

original: yad indrāhaṃ yathā tvam īśīya vasva eka it /
analyzed: yat indra aham yathā tvam īśīya vasvaḥ ekaḥ id
translated: O Indra, if I were to rule over wealth as you do, all by myself,

original: stotā me goṣakhā syāt ////
analyzed: stotā me go sakhā syāt
translated: May my praiser be one who loves cattle.

original: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyaṃ śacīpate manīṣiṇe /
analyzed: śikṣeyam asmai ditseyam śacīpate manīṣiṇe
translated: I would learn from him, I would give to him, O lord of might, to the wise one,

original: yad ahaṃ gopatiḥ syām ////
analyzed: yat aham gopatiḥ syām
translated: If I were to be the lord of cattle.

original: dhenuṣ ṭa indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate /
analyzed: dhenuḥ te indra sūnṛtā yajamānāya sunvate
translated: O Indra, your generosity is like a milch cow to the sacrificer who presses (soma) for you.

original: gām aśvaṃ pipyuṣī duhe ////
analyzed: gām aśvam pipyuṣī duhe
translated: It milks out a cow and a horse.

original: na te vartāsti rādhasa indra devo na martyaḥ /
analyzed: na te vartā asti rādhasaḥ indra devaḥ na martyaḥ
translated: O Indra, there is no turning back for your gift, whether you are a god or a mortal,

original: yad ditsasi stuto magham ////
analyzed: yat ditsasi stutaḥ magham
translated: When you wish to give wealth when praised.

original: yajña indram avardhayad yad bhūmiṃ vy avartayat /
analyzed: yajñaḥ indram avardhayat yat bhūmim vi avartayat
translated: The sacrifice strengthened Indra when he rolled away the earth.

original: cakrāṇa opaśaṃ divi ////🔽vāvṛdhānasya te vayaṃ viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ /
analyzed: cakrāṇaḥ opaśam divi  vāvṛdhānasya te vayam viśvā dhanāni jigyuṣaḥ
translated: He made the sky favorable.

original: ūtim indrā vṛṇīmahe ////
analyzed: ūtim indra vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose the help of you, O Indra, who have grown strong, who desire to win all treasures.

original: vy antarikṣam atiran made somasya rocanā /
analyzed: vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā
translated: In the intoxication of soma, he has spread out the sky, the luminous one.

original: indro yad abhinad valam ////
analyzed: indraḥ yat abhinat valam
translated: When Indra burst open the stronghold.

original: ud gā ājad aṅgirobhya āviṣ krṇvan guhā satīḥ /
analyzed: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis krṇvan guhā satīḥ
translated: The song has arisen for the Angirases, revealing the hidden things,

original: arvāñcaṃ nunude valam ////
analyzed: arvāñcam nunude valam
translated: Driving away the stronghold that faces us.

original: indreṇa rocanā divo dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca /
analyzed: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca
translated: The luminous realms of heaven, Indra, are firmly fixed and well-secured by thee,

original: sthirāṇi na parāṇude ////
analyzed: sthirāṇi na parāṇude
translated: And cannot be removed.

original: apām ūrmir madann iva stoma indrājirāyate /
analyzed: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate
translated: The wave of the waters, as if inebriated, the hymn, O Indra, stretches out to the race-course.

original: vi te madā arājiṣuḥ ////
analyzed: vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ
translated: Thy gladdening draughts have not rejoiced thee.

original: tvaṃ hi stomavardhana indrāsy ukthavardhanaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi stoma vardhanaḥ indra asi uktha vardhanaḥ
translated: For thou, O Indra, art the increaser of the hymn, the increaser of the laud,

original: stotṝṇām uta bhadrakṛt ////
analyzed: stotṝṇām uta bhadra kṛt
translated: And the bestower of good things to the praisers.

original: indram it keśinā harī somapeyāya vakṣataḥ /
analyzed: indram id keśinā harī soma peyāya vakṣataḥ
translated: With the strong-jawed pair of bays Indra will bear thee to the Soma-draught,

original: upa yajñaṃ surādhasam ////
analyzed: upa yajñam su rādhasam
translated: To the sacrifice, O thou who givest good gifts.

original: apāṃ phenena namuceḥ śira indrod avartayaḥ /
analyzed: apām phenena namuceḥ śiraḥ indra ud avartayaḥ
translated: With the foam of the waters thou, O Indra, didst roll away the head of Namuci,

original: viśvā yad ajaya spṛdhaḥ ////
analyzed: viśvāḥ yat ajayaḥ spṛdhaḥ
translated: When thou didst win all the contending hosts.

original: māyābhir utsisṛpsata indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ /
analyzed: māyābhiḥ utsisṛpsataḥ indra dyām ārurukṣataḥ
translated: With the illusions of Namuci, O Indra, thou didst pursue the Dasyus who were about to ascend to heaven,

original: ava dasyūṃr adhūnuthāḥ ////
analyzed: ava dasyūṃr adhūnuthāḥ
translated: And didst crush the Dasyus down.

original: asunvām indra saṃsadaṃ viṣūcīṃ vy anāśayaḥ /
analyzed: asunvām indra saṃsadam viṣūcīm vi anāśayaḥ
translated: The assembly of the niggard, O Indra, thou hast dispersed in all directions,

original: somapā uttaro bhavan ////
analyzed: soma pāḥ uttaraḥ bhavan
translated: And hast become the Soma-drinker above.

original: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣaṃ harī pra te vanve vanuṣo haryataṃ madam /
analyzed: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣam harī pra te vanve vanuṣaḥ haryatam madam
translated: I will extol thy two bay steeds in the great assembly. I, the worshipper, will win thy gladdening juice, O thou who lovest the bay steeds.

original: ghṛtaṃ na yo haribhiś cāru secata ā tvā viśantu harivarpasaṃ giraḥ ////🔽hariṃ hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvanto harī divyaṃ yathā sadaḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtam na yaḥ haribhiḥ cāru secate ā tvā viśantu hari varpasam giraḥ  harim hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvantaḥ harī divyam yathā sadaḥ
translated: As the tawny ones sprinkle ghee, let the songs enter thee, O thou whose face is tawny.🔽They who have raised their voices to the tawny womb, urging the tawny ones to the seat of the divine.

original: ā yaṃ pṛṇanti haribhir na dhenava indrāya śūśaṃ harivantam arcata ////
analyzed: ā yam pṛṇanti haribhiḥ na dhenavaḥ indrāya śūśam harivantam arcata
translated: Whom the tawny ones nourish like milch cows, praise Indra, O ye tawny ones, the tawny one who is to be desired.

original: so asya vajro harito ya āyaso harir nikāmo harir ā gabhastyoḥ /
analyzed: saḥ asya vajraḥ haritaḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ hariḥ nikāmaḥ hariḥ ā gabhastyoḥ
translated: His is this tawny thunderbolt of iron, the tawny desire, the tawny in the arms.

original: dyumnī suśipro harimanyusāyaka indre ni rūpā haritā mimikṣire ////
analyzed: dyumnī su śipraḥ harimanyusāyakaḥ indre ni rūpā haritā mimikṣire
translated: The glorious, well-formed, tawny-minded arrow is mixed with tawny forms in Indra.

original: divi na ketur adhi dhāyi haryato vivyacad vajro harito na raṃhyā /
analyzed: divi na ketuḥ adhi dhāyi haryataḥ vivyacat vajraḥ haritaḥ na raṃhyā
translated: The tawny banner was set up in the sky, the tawny thunderbolt was stretched like a swift horse.

original: tudad ahiṃ hariśipro ya āyasaḥ sahasraśokā abhavad dharimbharaḥ ////
analyzed: tudat ahim hari śipraḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ sahasraśokāḥ abhavat harimbharaḥ
translated: The tawny-browed one, the iron one, striking the serpent, became the bearer of the tawny one with a thousand desires.

original: tvaṃtvam aharyathā upastutaḥ pūrvebhir indra harikeśa yajvabhiḥ /
analyzed: tvam tvam aharyathāḥ upastutaḥ pūrvebhiḥ indra hari keśa yajvabhiḥ
translated: You alone, O Indra, tawny-haired, as you were praised by the ancient sacrificers,

original: tvaṃ haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādho harijāta haryatam ////
analyzed: tvam haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādhaḥ hari jāta haryatam
translated: you shine, all that is worthy of praise is yours. O tawny-born one, enjoy the tawny one who is to be desired.

original: tā vajriṇaṃ mandinaṃ stomyaṃ mada indraṃ rathe vahato haryatā harī /
analyzed: tā vajriṇam mandinam stomyam made indram rathe vahataḥ haryatā harī
translated: They carry on the chariot Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the joyful one, the one to be praised, the tawny horses.

original: purūṇy asmai savanāni haryata indrāya somā harayo dadhanvire ////
analyzed: purūṇi asmai savanāni haryate indrāya somāḥ harayaḥ dadhanvire
translated: Many libations have been offered to him, the tawny ones have flowed for Indra, the tawny ones, the somas.

original: araṃ kāmāya harayo dadhamire sthirāya hinvan harayo harī turā /
analyzed: aram kāmāya harayaḥ dadhamire sthirāya hinvan harayaḥ harī turā
translated: The tawny ones have been made ready for the wish, the tawny ones are urged on for the firm one, the tawny ones for the tawny ones, the swift ones.

original: arvadbhir yo haribhir joṣam īyate so asya kāmaṃ harivantam ānaśe ////🔽hariśmaśārur harikeśa āyasas turaspeye yo haripā avardhata /🔽arvadbhir yo haribhir vājinīvasur ati viśvā duritā pāriṣad dharī ////
analyzed: arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ joṣam īyate saḥ asya kāmam harivantam ānaśe  hari śmaśāruḥ hari keśaḥ āyasaḥ turaspeye yaḥ hari pāḥ avardhata  arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ vājinīvasuḥ ati viśvā duritā pāriṣat harī
translated: He who goes to the agreement with the tawny horses, he has fulfilled his wish, the one with the tawny horses.🔽The one with tawny eyebrows, tawny hair, made of iron, who has been strengthened in the swift drinking, the one with tawny horses.🔽The one with tawny horses, the one rich in strength, with the tawny horses, will carry us over all the difficulties.

original: śruveva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇī davidhvataḥ /
analyzed: śruvā iva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇī davidhvataḥ
translated: Like a ladle, his two tawny ones have spread out, the tawny ones for the swift one for the prize.

original: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjad dharī pītvā madasya haryatasyāndhasaḥ ////🔽uta sma sadna haryatasya pastyor atyo na vājaṃ harivāṃ acikradat /🔽mahī cid dhi dhiṣaṇāharyad ojasā bṛhad vayo dadhiṣe haryatas cid ā ////
analyzed: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjat harī pītvā madasya haryatasya andhasaḥ  uta sma sadna haryatasya pastyoḥ atyaḥ na vājam harivān acikradat  mahī cit hi dhiṣaṇā a haryat ojasā bṛhat vayaḥ dadhiṣe haryataḥ cit ā
translated: When he, the tawny one, has cleansed himself in the prepared bowl, the tawny one, having drunk of the intoxicating, sweet drink.🔽And he, the tawny one, has roared like a horse, the tawny one, for the prize, over the two tawny ones, the seat of the tawny one.🔽Even the great one, with the tawny power of thought, you place the great life of the tawny one.

original: ā rodasī haryamāṇo mahitvā navyaṃnavyaṃ haryasi manma nu priyam /
analyzed: ā rodasī haryamāṇaḥ mahitvā navyam navyam haryasi manma nu priyam
translated: With your tawny greatness, you fill the two world-halves, you enjoy the new and new dear hymn.

original: pra pastyam asura haryataṃ gor āviṣ kṛdhi haraye sūryāya ////
analyzed: pra pastyam asura haryatam goḥ āvis kṛdhi haraye sūryāya
translated: O Asura, make manifest the home of the tawny one, the cow, for the tawny Surya.

original: ā tvā haryantaṃ prayujo janānāṃ rathe vahantu hariśipram indra /
analyzed: ā tvā haryantam prayujaḥ janānām rathe vahantu hari śipram indra
translated: Let the yokes of men bring thee hither, O joyous one, O Indra, on the chariot, O thou of tawny eyebrows.

original: pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvo haryan yajñaṃ sadhamāde daśoṇim ////
analyzed: pibāḥ yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ haryan yajñam sadhamāde daśa ūṇim
translated: Drink as thou listest of the meath that is poured forth; rejoice in the sacrifice, O thou of tawny hue, in the assembly of the ten.

original: apāḥ pūrveṣāṃ harivaḥ sutānām atho idaṃ savanaṃ kevalaṃ te /
analyzed: apāḥ pūrveṣām harivas sutānām atha u idam savanam kevalam te
translated: Thou hast drunk of the juices of the former (sacrifices), O thou who lovest the tawny (steed); this libation is thine only.

original: mamaddhi somaṃ madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣaṃ jathara ā vṛṣasva ////
analyzed: mamaddhi somam madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣam jathare ā vṛṣasva
translated: Rejoice in the sweet Soma, O Indra; always fill thy belly, O bull, with the bull.

original: apsu dhūtasya harivaḥ pibeha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharaṃ pṛṇasva /
analyzed: apsu dhūtasya harivas piba iha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharam pṛṇasva
translated: Drink of the juice that is pressed out in the waters, O thou who lovest the tawny (steed); fill thy belly with the juice pressed out by men.

original: mimikṣur yam adraya indra tubhyaṃ tebhir vardhasva madam ukthavāhaḥ ////
analyzed: mimikṣuḥ yam adrayaḥ indra tubhyam tebhiḥ vardhasva madam uktha vāhaḥ
translated: Whom the pressing-stones have mixed for thee, O Indra, with them increase thy joy, O thou who carriest the hymns.

original: progrāṃ pītiṃ vṛṣṇa iyarmi satyāṃ prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam /
analyzed: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya hari aśva tubhyam
translated: I send forth the true, the mighty draught to the Bull; I send it forth to thee, O thou of tawny steeds, of the juice that is pressed.

original: indra dhenābhir iha mādayasva dhībhir viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ ////
analyzed: indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ
translated: O Indra, rejoice here with the milk-offerings, with all the hymns, with glory, being praised.

original: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayo dadhānā uśija ṛtajñāḥ /
analyzed: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayaḥ dadhānāḥ uśijaḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: Through thy help, through thy strength, the sages, knowing the truth, bestowing life,

original: prajāvad indra maṃso duroṇe tasthur gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ ////
analyzed: prajāvat indra maṃsaḥ duroṇe tasthuḥ gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ
translated: In the house with offspring, O Indra, they have sat down, the worshippers, the best at the feast.

original: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryamūṣat /
analyzed: yaḥ jātaḥ eva prathamaḥ manasvān devaḥ devān kratunā paryamūṣat
translated: He who, even from birth, the first, the wise one, the god, with his mind, encompassed the gods,

original: yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṃ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yasya śuṣmāt rodasī abhyasetām nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Through whose power the two worlds were shaken, through the greatness of his manliness, he is Indra among men.

original: yaḥ pṛthivīṃ vyathamānām adṛṃhad yaḥ parvatān prakupitāṃ aramṇāt /
analyzed: yaḥ pṛthivīm vyathamānām adṛṃhat yaḥ parvatān prakupitām aramṇāt
translated: He who steadied the trembling earth, who calmed the angry mountains,

original: yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyām astabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣam vimame varīyaḥ yaḥ dyām astabhnāt sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who measured out the wider atmosphere, who supported the sky, he is Indra among men.

original: yo hatvāhim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo gā udājad apadhā valasya /
analyzed: yaḥ hatvā ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yaḥ gāḥ udājat apadhā valasya
translated: He who, having slain the dragon, let loose the seven rivers, who brought forth the cows, having cleft open the vault,

original: yo aśmanor antar agniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ aśmanoḥ antar agnim jajāna saṃvṛj samatsu sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who from between the two stones generated the fire, in the battles, he is Indra among men.

original: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṃ varṇam adharaṃ guhākaḥ /
analyzed: yena imā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yaḥ dāsam varṇam adharam guhā akaḥ
translated: By whom all these things were made to tremble, who drove the dark-hued Dāsa race into a cave,

original: śvaghnīva yo jigīvāṃ lakṣam ādad aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: śvaghnī iva yaḥ jigīvām lakṣam ādat aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who, like a dog, took the prize of the victor, the Aryan's riches, he is Indra among men.

original: yaṃ smā pṛchanti kuha seti ghoram utem āhur naiṣo astīty enam /
analyzed: yam sma pṛcchanti kuha sa iti ghoram uta īm āhuḥ na eṣaḥ asti iti enam
translated: Whom they ask, Where is he, the terrible one? and they say of him, He does not exist.

original: so aryaḥ puṣṭīr vija ivā mināti śrad asmai dhatta sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ aryaḥ puṣṭīḥ vijaḥ iva ā mināti śrath asmai dhatta sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He, the noble one, destroys the prosperities of the enemy as if by a flood. To him the people give praise, he is Indra.

original: yo radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yo brahmaṇo nādhamānasya kīreḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ nādhamānasya kīreḥ
translated: He who impels the poor, the weak, the one who sings the praise of the Brahman priest who is oppressed,

original: yuktagrāvṇo yo 'vitā suśipraḥ sutasomasya sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yukta grāvṇaḥ yaḥ vitā su śipraḥ suta somasya sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: The protector of the one with yoked press-stones, the one with beautiful eyebrows, the one with pressed Soma, he is Indra.

original: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvo yasya grāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ /
analyzed: yasya aśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvaḥ yasya grāmāḥ yasya viśve rathāsaḥ
translated: He who has horses in the east, who has cows, who has villages, who has all chariots,

original: yaḥ sūryaṃ ya uṣasaṃ jajāna yo apāṃ netā sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ sūryam yaḥ uṣasam jajāna yaḥ apām netā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who begot the sun, who begot the dawn, who is the leader of the waters, he is Indra.

original: yaṃ krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare 'vare ubhayā amitrāḥ /
analyzed: yam krandasī saṃyatī vihvayete pare vare ubhayāḥ amitrāḥ
translated: He whom the two worlds, moving together, delight, the higher and the lower, all the enemies,

original: samānaṃ cid ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: samānam cit ratham ātasthivāṃsā nānā havete sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Though seated in the same chariot, they call upon him separately, he is Indra.

original: yasmān na ṛte vijayante janāso yaṃ yudhyamānā avase havante /
analyzed: yasmāt na ṛte vijayante janāsaḥ yam yudhyamānāḥ avase havante
translated: Without whom the people do not conquer, whom they invoke for help in battle,

original: yo viśvasya pratimānaṃ babhūva yo acyutacyut sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yaḥ a cyuta cyut sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who became the measure of all, who is the shaker of the unshakable, he is Indra.

original: yaḥ śasvato mahy eno dadhānān amanyamānāṃ charvā jaghāna /
analyzed: yaḥ śasvataḥ mahi enaḥ dadhānān a manyamānām śarvā jaghāna
translated: He who slew with his own hand those who were always giving great gifts, those who were conceited,

original: yaḥ śardhate nānudadāti śṛdhyāṃ yo dasyor hantā sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ śardhate na anudadāti śṛdhyām yaḥ dasyoḥ hantā sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who does not give way to the angry man, who slays the Dasyu, is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ śambharaṃ parvateṣu kṣiyantaṃ catvāriṃśyāṃ śarady anvavindat /
analyzed: yaḥ śambharam parvateṣu kṣiyantam catvāriṃśyām śaradi anvavindat
translated: He who found Sambara lying on the mountains, in the fortieth autumn,

original: ojāyamānaṃ yo ahiṃ jaghāna dānuṃ śayānaṃ sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: ojāyamānam yaḥ ahim jaghāna dānum śayānam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who slew the swelling serpent, the Dânu lying down, is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ śambharaṃ paryatarat kasībhir yo 'cārukāsnāpibat sutasya /
analyzed: yaḥ śambharam paryatarat kasībhiḥ yaḥ cāru kāsnā apibat sutasya
translated: He who compassed Sambara round with ditches, who drank the Soma pressed without a stain,

original: antar girau yajamānaṃ bahuṃ janaṃ yasminn āmūrchat sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: antar girau yajamānam bahum janam yasmin ā amūrchat sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who caused the sacrificer and much people to reel within the mountain, is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ saptaraśmir vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn /
analyzed: yaḥ sapta raśmiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn
translated: He who, the strong, the bull with seven rays, let loose the seven rivers to their onward course,

original: yo rauhiṇam asphurad vajrabāhur dyām ārohantaṃ sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ rauhiṇam asphurat vajra bāhuḥ dyām ārohantam sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who with his thunderbolt-armed hand burst Rauhina as he mounted to the sky, is the people's Indra.

original: dyāvā cid asmai pṛthivī mamete śuṣmāc cid asya parvatā bhayante /
analyzed: dyāvā cit asmai pṛthivī mama ete śuṣmāt cit asya parvatāḥ bhayante
translated: Even these heaven and earth tremble at his might, and so do the mountains.

original: yaḥ somapā nicito vajrabāhur yo vajrahastaḥ sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ soma pāḥ nicitaḥ vajra bāhuḥ yaḥ vajra hastaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: He who, the bolt-armed, drinks the Soma, who is the wielder of the thunderbolt, is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantaṃ yaḥ śaṃsantaṃ yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī /
analyzed: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantam yaḥ śaṃsantam yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī
translated: He who protects the man who sheds the juice, who guards the man who cooks, who aids the man who sings, the man who strives with hymns,

original: yasya brahma vardhanaṃ yasya somo yasyedaṃ rādhaḥ sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yasya brahma vardhanam yasya somaḥ yasya idam rādhaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Whose strength is Brahman, whose Soma, whose this bounty, he is the people's Indra.

original: jāto vy akhyat pitror upasthe bhuvo na veda janituḥ parasya /
analyzed: jātaḥ vi akhyat pitroḥ upasthe bhuvaḥ na veda janituḥ parasya
translated: Born, he spread out in the lap of his parents. He knows not the begetter, the highest.

original: staviṣyamāṇo no yo asmad vratā devānāṃ sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: staviṣyamāṇaḥ naḥ yaḥ asmat vratā devānām sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Praising us, he who is the guardian of the gods' vows, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ somakāmo haryaśvaḥ sūrir yasmād rejante bhuvanāni viśvā /
analyzed: yaḥ soma kāmaḥ hari aśvaḥ sūriḥ yasmāt rejante bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who, longing for Soma, is the lord with tawny horses, from whom all beings tremble,

original: yo jaghāna śambaraṃ yaś ca śuṣṇaṃ ya ekavīraḥ sa janāsa indraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ jaghāna śambaram yaḥ ca śuṣṇam yaḥ eka vīraḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ
translated: Who slew Shambara and Shushna, who is the single hero, he is the people's Indra.

original: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhra ā cid vājaṃ dardarṣi sa kilāsi satyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhraḥ ā cit vājam dardarṣi sa kila asi satyaḥ
translated: He who even to the strong one who pours libations and bakes the cakes bestows strength, he indeed is the true one.

original: vayaṃ ta indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema ////
analyzed: vayam te indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ su vīrāsaḥ vidatham ā vadema
translated: We, O Indra, all of us, being dear to you, may we speak in the assembly, having brave sons.

original: asmā id u pra tavase turāya prayo na harmi stomaṃ māhināya /
analyzed: asmai id u pra tavase turāya prayaḥ na harmi stomam māhināya
translated: To him, the strong one, the swift one, I offer this praise like a present, to the mighty one.

original: ṛcīṣamāyādhrigava oham indrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā ////
analyzed: ṛcīṣamāya adhrigave oham indrāya brahmāṇi rātatamā
translated: To the one who is to be praised, to the one who has firm wealth, I offer these prayers, most acceptable to Indra.

original: asmā id u praya iva pra yaṃsi bharāmy āngūṣaṃ bādhe suvṛkti /
analyzed: asmai id u prayaḥ iva pra yaṃsi bharāmi āngūṣam bādhe suvṛkti
translated: To him, indeed, I offer as a present. I bring the hymn, I spread out the good praise.

original: indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyo marjayanta ////
analyzed: indrāya hṛdā manasā manīṣā pratnāya patye dhiyaḥ marjayanta
translated: To Indra, the ancient lord, the thoughts, the hymns are purified by the heart, by the mind.

original: asmā id u tyam upamaṃ svarṣāṃ bharāmy āṅgūṣam āsyena /🔽maṃhiṣṭham achoktibhir matīnāṃ suvṛktibhiḥ sūriṃ vāvṛdhadhyai ////🔽asmā id u stomaṃ saṃ hinomi rathaṃ na taṣṭeva tatsināya /
analyzed: asmai id u tyam upamam svarṣām bharāmi āṅgūṣam āsyena  maṃhiṣṭham achoktibhiḥ matīnām suvṛktibhiḥ sūrim vāvṛdhadhyai  asmai id u stomam sam hinomi ratham na taṣṭā iva tatsināya
translated: I bring to him this hymn, this matchless one, self-bright, with my mouth,🔽Most bountiful, with my thoughts, with my fair hymns, to make the prince wax strong.🔽I urge to him this hymn as a chariot-maker urges a car to speed,

original: giraś ca girvāhase suvṛktīndrāya viśvaminvaṃ medhirāya ////🔽asmā id u saptim iva śravasyendrāyārkaṃ juhvā sam añje /🔽vīram dānaukasaṃ vandadhyai purāṃ gūrtaśravasaṃ darmāṇam ////🔽asmā id u tvaṣṭā takṣad vajraṃ svapastamaṃ svaryaṃ raṇāya /🔽vṛtrasya cid vidad yena marma tujann īśānas tujatā kiyedhāḥ ////🔽asyed u mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyo mahaḥ pituṃ papivāṃ cārv annā /🔽muṣāyad viṣṇuḥ pacataṃ sahīyān vidhyad varāhaṃ tiro adrim astā ////🔽asmā id u gnāś cid devapatnīr indrāyārkam ahihatya ūvuḥ /
analyzed: giraḥ ca gir vāhase suvṛktī indrāya viśvaminvam medhirāya 🔽asmai id u saptim iva śravasyā indrāya arkam juhvā sam añje 🔽vīram dānaukasam vandadhyai purām gūrta śravasam darmāṇam 🔽asmai id u tvaṣṭā takṣat vajram su apastamam svaryam raṇāya 🔽vṛtrasya cit vidat yena marma tujan īśānaḥ tujatā kiyedhāḥ 🔽asya id u mātuḥ savaneṣu sadyas mahaḥ pitum papivān cārū annā 🔽muṣāyat viṣṇuḥ pacatam sahīyān vidhyat varāham tiras adrim astā 🔽asmai id u gnāḥ cit deva patnīḥ indrāya arkam ahi hatye ūvuḥ
translated: I bring to him this hymn, this eulogy, this praise, this song of praise, this eulogy, this hymn, this song of praise, this eulogy, this hymn, this song of praise, this eulogy, this hymn,
