original: pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhra urvī nāsya te mahimānaṃ pari ṣṭaḥ ////
analyzed: pari dyāvāpṛthivī jabhre urvī na asya te mahimānam pari staḥ
translated: He hath filled full the broad heaven and earth: there is no compassing thy greatness on all sides.

original: asyed eva pra ririce mahitvaṃ divas pṛthivyāḥ pary antarikṣāt /🔽svarāl indro dama ā viśvagūrtaḥ svarir amatro vavakṣe raṇāya ////
analyzed: asya id eva pra ririce mahi tvam divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari antarikṣāt  svarāj indraḥ dame ā viśva gūrtaḥ svariḥ amatraḥ vavakṣe raṇāya
translated: His greatness hath spread out even beyond the heaven, beyond the earth, beyond the atmosphere.🔽Indra, all-extolled, hath sat down in the seat, the beaker, to the draught: the seat hath waxed great for the beaker.

original: asyed eva śavasā śuśantaṃ vi vṛścad vajreṇa vṛtram indraḥ /
analyzed: asya id eva śavasā śuśantam vi vṛścat vajreṇa vṛtram indraḥ
translated: Even he with his might hath rent asunder the trembling Vṛtra with his bolt, Indra.

original: gā na vrāṇā avanīr amuñcad abhi śravo dāvane sacetāḥ ////
analyzed: gāḥ na vrāṇāḥ avanīḥ amuñcat abhi śravaḥ dāvane sacetāḥ
translated: He hath loosed the kine, the waters, the imprisoned ones, he, the thoughtful one, to give (them) fame.

original: asyed u tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yad vajreṇa sīm ayachat /
analyzed: asya id u tveṣasā ranta sindhavaḥ pari yat vajreṇa sīm ayacchat
translated: Even he hath rejoiced in the impetuous one, the river, when he hath encompassed (her) with his bolt.

original: īśānakṛd dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye gādhaṃ turvaṇiḥ kaḥ ////🔽asmā id u pra bharā tūtujāno vṛtrāya vajram īśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ /
analyzed: īśāna kṛt dāśuṣe daśasyan turvītaye gādham turvaṇiḥ kaḥ  asmai id u pra bhara tūtujānaḥ vṛtrāya vajram īśānaḥ kiyedhāḥ
translated: The bountiful one, the lord, hath done good to the worshipper, to Turvīti, to Turvaṇi, to Gādhi.🔽Even to him, the lord, the impetuous one, bring the bolt to hurl at Vṛtra, O thou of many thoughts.

original: gor na parva vi radā tiraśceṣyann arṇāṃsy apāṃ caradhyai ////
analyzed: goḥ na parva vi rada tiras ca iṣyan arṇāṃsi apām caradhyai
translated: Thou, cutting the joints of the cow, as it were, transversely, wilt send the waters' streams to move.

original: asyed u pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navya ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: asya id u pra brūhi pūrvyāṇi turasya karmāṇi navyaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Even of him proclaim the ancient deeds with new hymns, of the strong one.

original: yudhe yad iṣṇāna āyudhāny ṛghāyamāṇo niriṇāti śatrūn ////
analyzed: yudhe yat iṣṇānaḥ āyudhāni ṛghāyamāṇaḥ niriṇāti śatrūn
translated: When, rejoicing in the fight, he sharpeneth his weapons, and, impetuous, destroyeth the foes.

original: asyed u bhiyā girayaś ca dṛlhā dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣas tujete /
analyzed: asya id u bhiyā girayaḥ ca dṛlhāḥ dyāvā ca bhūmā januṣaḥ tujete
translated: Through fear of him the firm-set mountains, and the heavens and earth, at his birth, trembled.

original: upo venasya joguvāna oṇiṃ sadyo bhuvad vīryāya nodhāḥ ////
analyzed: upa u venasya joguvānaḥ oṇim sadyas bhuvat vīryāya nodhāḥ
translated: He, the impeller, has quickly become for us the object of Vena's song, for heroic strength.

original: asmā id u tyad anu dāyy eṣām eko yad vavne bhūrer īśānaḥ /
analyzed: asmai id u tyad anu dāyi eṣām ekaḥ yat vavne bhūreḥ īśānaḥ
translated: To him alone, when he has chosen, belongs this their highest lordship over all existence.

original: praitaśaṃ sūrye paspṛdhānaṃ sauvaśvye suṣvim āvad indraḥ ////
analyzed: pra etaśam sūrye paspṛdhānam sauvaśvye suṣvim āvat indraḥ
translated: In the race of Sauvashva, Indra helped Susvi, the daring one, in the sun's race.

original: evā te hāriyojanā suvṛktīndra brahmāṇi gotamāso akran /
analyzed: eva te hāriyojana suvṛktī indra brahmāṇi gotamāsaḥ akran
translated: Thus, O thou whose horses are bay, the Gotamas have sung forth to thee, O Indra, these fair hymns.

original: aiṣu viśvapeśasaṃ dhiyaṃ dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasur jagamyāt ////
analyzed: ā eṣu viśva peśasam dhiyam dhāḥ prātar makṣū dhiyāvasuḥ jagamyāt
translated: Place in them the thought that is all-bountiful. May he who is rich in prayer come quickly in the morning.

original: ya eka id dhavyaś carṣaṇīnām indraṃ taṃ gīrbhir abhy arca ābhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id havyaḥ carṣaṇīnām indram tam gīrbhiḥ abhī arce ābhiḥ
translated: Him who alone is worthy of the offerings of men, that Indra, with these hymns, I glorify with songs.

original: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvānt satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān ////
analyzed: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān
translated: He who rules as a strong and mighty bull, true, manly, of many wiles, and powerful.

original: tam u naḥ pūrve pitaro navagvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ /
analyzed: tam u naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ navagvāḥ sapta viprāsaḥ abhi vājayantaḥ
translated: Him, the Navagvas, our ancient fathers, the seven inspired sages, urging him to strength,

original: nakṣaddābhaṃ taturiṃ parvateṣṭhām adroghavācaṃ matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham ////
analyzed: nakṣat dābham taturim parvateṣṭhām adrogha vācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham
translated: Have gained, the irresistible, the swift, the mountain-dweller, of truthful speech, the mightiest with their thoughts.

original: tam īmahe indram asya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ /
analyzed: tam īmahe indram asya rāyaḥ puru vīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
translated: We implore that Indra for this wealth of his, of many heroes, of manly power, of great strength.

original: yo aṣkṛdhoyur ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivo mādayadhyai ////
analyzed: yaḥ aṣkṛdhoyuḥ ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivas mādayadhyai
translated: Who is ever-youthful, undecaying, the possessor of heaven - bring him, O bearer of the people, to delight us.

original: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cij jaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnam indra /
analyzed: tat naḥ vi vocaḥ yadi te purā cit jaritāraḥ ānaśuḥ sumnam indra
translated: Tell us that, if in ancient times our praisers have obtained your favor, O Indra.

original: kas te bhāgaḥ kiṃ vayo dudhra khiduḥ puruhūta purūvaso 'suraghnaḥ ////🔽taṃ pṛchantī vajrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhām indraṃ vepī vakvarī yasya nū gīḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ te bhāgaḥ kim vayaḥ dudhra khiduḥ puruhūta purūvaso sura ghnaḥ  tam pṛcchantī vajrahastam ratheṣṭhām indram vepī vakvarī yasya nu gīḥ
translated: What is your share, what is your food, O mighty one, O much-invoked one, O possessor of much wealth, O slayer of demons?

original: tuvigrābhaṃ tuvikūrmiṃ rabhodāṃ gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram acha ////
analyzed: tuvi grābham tuvikūrmim rabhaḥ dām gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram acha
translated: They ask that Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the rider of the chariot, whose praise is like a swift-moving bird, the strong one, the far-reaching one, the impetuous one, the one who goes to the goal, the ruddy one.

original: ayā ha tyaṃ māyayā vāvṛdhānaṃ manojuvā svatavaḥ parvatena /
analyzed: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manaḥ juvā svatavaḥ parvatena
translated: This one, with his mind-swift power, has grown by his own power, the self-existent one, the mountain.

original: acyutā cid vīlitā svojo rujo vi dṛlhā dhṛṣatā virapśin ////
analyzed: acyutā cit vīlitā su ojaḥ rujaḥ vi dṛlhā dhṛṣatā virapśin
translated: Even the unshakable, the self-powerful, he has crushed, the firm, the strong one, the one who breaks through.

original: tam vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭham pratnaṃ pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭham pratnam pratna vat paritaṃsayadhyai
translated: We will yoke him, the strongest, the ancient one, with our new song, as in ancient times.

original: sa no vakṣad animānaḥ suvahnendro viśvāny ati durgahāṇi ////
analyzed: sa naḥ vakṣat animānaḥ su vahnā indraḥ viśvāni ati durgahāṇi
translated: May he, the swift-moving one, the good carrier, lead us past all the difficult obstacles, O Indra.

original: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayo 'ntarikṣā /
analyzed: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayaḥ ntarikṣā
translated: Light up for the people, for the one who hates, the earthly ones, the heavenly ones, and the atmospheric ones.

original: tapā vṛṣan viśvataḥ śociṣā tān brahmadviṣe śocaya kṣām apaś ca ////
analyzed: tapa vṛṣan viśvatas śociṣā tān brahma dviṣe śocaya kṣām apaḥ ca
translated: O bull, with your heat on all sides, with your radiance, burn them. Burn the earth and the waters for him who hates prayer.

original: bhuvo janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagatas tveṣasaṃdṛk /🔽dhiṣva vajraṃ dakṣiṇa indra haste viśvā ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ ////
analyzed: bhuvaḥ janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagataḥ tveṣa saṃdṛś  dhiṣva vajram dakṣiṇe indra haste viśvāḥ ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ
translated: You are the king of the heavenly people, and of the moving world of earth, with your appearance of splendor.🔽Hold the thunderbolt in your right hand, O Indra. With all your imperishable powers you destroy illusions.

original: ā saṃyatam indra ṇaḥ svastiṃ śatrutūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām /
analyzed: ā saṃyatam indra naḥ svastim śatru tūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām
translated: O Indra, bring us prosperity, which is to be yoked, vast, invincible, for the conquest of enemies.

original: yayā dāsāny āryāṇi vṛtrā karo vajrint sutukā nāhuṣāṇi ////
analyzed: yayā dāsāni āryāṇi vṛtrā karaḥ vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi
translated: By which, O wielder of the thunderbolt, you make the Aryan and Dāsa peoples perform noble deeds, and those of Nāhusha, O very powerful one.

original: sa no niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvavārābhir ā gahi prayajyo /
analyzed: sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedhaḥ viśva vārābhiḥ ā gahi prayajyo
translated: O Puruhuta, O wise one, come to us with those yokes which bring all desired things, O worthy of sacrifice.

original: na yā adevo varate na deva ābhir yāhi tūyam ā madryadrik ////
analyzed: na yāḥ adevaḥ varate na devaḥ ābhiḥ yāhi tūyam ā madryadrik
translated: By which yokes you come quickly to the one who is not a god, nor a god, but a man who desires you.

original: yas tigmaśṛṅgo vṛṣabho na bhīmaḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīś cyavayati pra viśvāḥ /🔽yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ ////🔽tvaṃ ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye /
analyzed: yaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ cyavayati pra viśvāḥ  yaḥ śaśvataḥ a dāśuṣaḥ gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ  tvam ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye
translated: He who is terrible like a bull with sharp horns, who alone makes all the people tremble,🔽Who is the protector of the one who offers, of the one who does not give, of the one who is poor, of the one who is better at offering.🔽You, O Indra, helped that Kutsā, listening to him with your body in battle,

original: dāsaṃ yac śuṣṇam kuyavaṃ ny asmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan ////
analyzed: dāsam yat śuṣṇam kuyavam ni asmai arandhayaḥ ārjuneyāya śikṣan
translated: When you made the Dāsa, the wicked one, the son of Śuṣṇa, tremble for Arjuna's son, teaching him.

original: tvaṃ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyaṃ prāvo viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ sudāsam /
analyzed: tvam dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam prāvaḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sudāsam
translated: Thou, O mighty one, with thy might, with all thy aids, hast helped Sudâs, the son of Vîtahavya.

original: pra paurukutsiṃ trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum ////
analyzed: pra paurukutsim trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetra sātā vṛtra hatyeṣu pūrum
translated: Thou hast helped Purukutsa, Trasadasyu, Pûru in the contests for land and in the slaying of Vr̥itra.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhir nṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi /
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ nṛmaṇaḥ deva vītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi
translated: Thou, God-adoring Hero, with men, O thou of Bay Steeds, slayest many Vr̥itras.

original: tvaṃ ni dasyuṃ cumuriṃ dhuniṃ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu ////
analyzed: tvam ni dasyum cumurim dhunim ca asvāpayaḥ dabhītaye su hantu
translated: Thou hast laid to sleep the Dasyu, the Chumu, the Dhunî, for the sake of Dabhîti, O good slayer.

original: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṃ ca sadyaḥ /
analyzed: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puras navatim ca sadyas
translated: These are thy powers, O thou whose hand wields the bolt, when thou at once, with nine-and-ninety,

original: niveśane śatatamāviveṣīr ahaṃ ca vṛtraṃ namucim utāhan ////
analyzed: niveśane śatatama aviveṣīḥ aham ca vṛtram namucim uta ahan
translated: Hast entered the hundredth habitation, and hast slain Vritra and Namuci.

original: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse /
analyzed: sanā tā te indra bhojanāni rāta havyāya dāśuṣe sudāse
translated: These are thy gifts, O Indra, to the worshipper, to the liberal Sudâs,

original: vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam ////
analyzed: vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam
translated: I yoke thy two strong Bay Steeds, O mighty one: let the prayers come to thee for great strength.

original: mā te asyāṃ sahasāvan pariṣṭāv aghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādau /🔽trāyasva no 'vṛkebhir varūthais tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma ////
analyzed: mā te asyām sahasāvan pariṣṭau aghāya bhūma harivas parādau  trāyasva naḥ vṛkebhiḥ varūthaiḥ tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma
translated: Let not the wicked, O thou Victor, in this thy circuit, O Lord of the Bay Steeds, in the last place,🔽Protect us with thy protecting helps that bring no sorrow: may we be dear to thee among the princes.

original: priyāsa it te maghavann abhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ /
analyzed: priyāsaḥ id te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ
translated: We, O Maghavan, thy dear friends, O Hero, would rejoice in thy protection, in thy shelter.

original: ni turvaśaṃ ni yādvaṃ śiśīhy atithigvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan ////
analyzed: ni turvaśam ni yādvam śiśīhi atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan
translated: Crush down Turvaṣa, crush down Yādva, O Indra, for the sake of Atithigva, who will perform the praise.

original: sadyaś cin nu te maghavann abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanty ukthaśāsa ukthā /
analyzed: sadyas cit nu te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanti uktha śāsaḥ ukthā
translated: Even now, O Maghavan, men who direct the hymns praise thee for thy help.

original: ye te havebhir vi paṇīṃr adāśann asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai ////🔽ete stomā narāṃ nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañco dadato maghāni /🔽teṣām indra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro 'vitā ca nṛṇām ////
analyzed: ye te havebhiḥ vi paṇīṃr adāśan asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai  ete stomāḥ narām nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañcaḥ dadataḥ maghāni  teṣām indra vṛtra hatye śivaḥ bhūḥ sakhā ca śūraḥ vitā ca nṛṇām
translated: Those who have surpassed their rivals through thy invocations, choose us for that alliance.🔽These praises, most manly of men, are for thee, bestowing boons, O Indra, turning towards us.🔽Be thou, O Indra, a propitious friend in slaying Vrtra, a hero and protector of men.

original: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtas tanvā vāvṛdhasva /
analyzed: nu indra śūra stavamānaḥ ūtī brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhasva
translated: Now, O Indra, the hero, be thou helped and praised, strengthened by prayer in thy body.

original: upa no vājān mimīhy upa stīn yuyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ////
analyzed: upa naḥ vājān mimīhi upa stīn yuyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Measure out for us the prizes and the booty. Protect us evermore, ye Gods, with your protections.

original: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somaṃ pibā imam /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam
translated: Come hither, for delightful are thy joys, O Indra, drink this Soma.

original: edaṃ barhiḥ sado mama ////
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama
translated: This is my seat, this is my sacred grass.

original: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatām indra keśinā /
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā
translated: Let thy two bay steeds yoked by prayer bring thee hither, O Indra, with the reins.

original: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu ////
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu
translated: Listen to our prayers.

original: brahmāṇas tvā vayaṃ yujā somapām indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ
translated: We Brahmans, O Indra, who pour libations, who have pressed the Soma, call thee, O Soma-drinker, to the feast.

original: sutāvanto havāmahe ////
analyzed: sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We call thee to the feast.

original: indram id gāthino bṛhad indram arkebhir arkiṇaḥ /
analyzed: indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ
translated: Indra, the singers with their lofty praise, Indra, the chanters with their hymns,

original: indraṃ vāṇīr anūṣata ////
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata
translated: Indra the songs have sung.

original: indra id dharyoḥ sacā saṃmiśla ā vacoyujā /
analyzed: indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā
translated: Indra is joined with the two bay steeds, closely united with the yoke of speech,

original: indro vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ ////
analyzed: indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: Indra the golden, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: indro dīrghāya cakṣasa ā sūryaṃ rohayad divi /
analyzed: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi
translated: Indra raised the sun to the sky, for the sake of the far-seeing eye,

original: vi gobhir adrim airayat ////
analyzed: vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat
translated: He cleft the cloud with the cows.

original: indraṃ vo viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ /
analyzed: indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ
translated: We invoke Indra on every side for the people,

original: asmākam astu kevalaḥ ////🔽vy antarikṣam atiran made somasya rocanā /
analyzed: asmākam astu kevalaḥ  vi antarikṣam atirat made somasya rocanā
translated: May he be ours alone.🔽The firmament, the lights of the sky, he extended in the intoxication of Soma,

original: indro yad abhinad valam ////
analyzed: indraḥ yat abhinat valam
translated: When Indra cleft the cloud.

original: ud gā ājad aṅgirobhya āviṣ kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ /
analyzed: ud gāḥ ājat aṅgirobhyaḥ āvis kṛṇvan guhā satīḥ
translated: The song has arisen from the Angirases, revealing the hidden things,

original: arvāñcaṃ nunude valam ////
analyzed: arvāñcam nunude valam
translated: He has driven away the cloud.

original: indreṇa rocanā divo dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca /
analyzed: indreṇa rocanā divaḥ dṛlhāni dṛṃhitāni ca
translated: The luminous realms of heaven, Indra, are firmly fixed by thee, and well-established,

original: sthirāṇi na parāṇude ////
analyzed: sthirāṇi na parāṇude
translated: They cannot be removed.

original: apām ūrmir madann iva stoma indrājirāyate /
analyzed: apām ūrmiḥ madan iva stomaḥ indra ajirāyate
translated: The wave of the waters, as if inebriated, the hymn, O Indra, stretches out for the race,

original: vi te madā arājiṣuḥ ////
analyzed: vi te madāḥ arājiṣuḥ
translated: Thy gladdening draughts have not rejoiced thee.

original: indreṇa saṃ hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmāno abibhyuṣā /
analyzed: indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ a bibhyuṣā
translated: With Indra, fearless, art thou seen, O thou of equal splendour,

original: mandū samānavarcasā ////
analyzed: mandū samāna varcasā
translated: Meeting together.

original: anavadyair abhidyubhir makhaḥ sahasvad arcati /
analyzed: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati
translated: The sacrifice praises thee, O mighty one, with the irreproachable, the shining ones,

original: gaṇair indrasya kāmyaiḥ ////
analyzed: gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ
translated: With the desirable troops of Indra.

original: ād aha svadhām anu punar garbhatvam erire /
analyzed: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire
translated: Having attained their own abode, they again enter the state of being an embryo,

original: dadhānā nāma yajñiyam ////
analyzed: dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam
translated: Bearing the sacrificial name.

original: indro dadhīco asthabhir vṛtrāṇy apratiṣkutaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ dadhīcaḥ asthabhiḥ vṛtrāṇi apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Indra, with Dadhyach's bones, unconquerable,

original: jaghāna navatīr nava ////
analyzed: jaghāna navatīḥ nava
translated: Slew the Vr̥itras, nine and ninety times.

original: ichan aśvasya yac chiraḥ parvateṣv apaśritam /
analyzed: ichan aśvasya yat śiraḥ parvateṣu apaśritam
translated: Seeking the horse's head, which was hidden away in the mountains,

original: tad vidac charyaṇāvati ////
analyzed: tat vidat śaryaṇāvati
translated: He found it in Saryaṇâvati.

original: atrāha gor amanvata nāma tvaṣṭur apīcyam /
analyzed: atra aha goḥ amanvata nāma tvaṣṭuḥ apīcyam
translated: Here they have discovered the cow's most wonderful name, which belongs to Tvashtar,

original: itthā candramaso gṛhe ////
analyzed: itthā candramasaḥ gṛhe
translated: Even in the house of the moon.

original: vācam aṣṭāpadīm ahaṃ navasraktim ṛtaspṛśam /
analyzed: vācam aṣṭāpadīm aham nava sraktim ṛta spṛśam
translated: I have measured the eight-footed, nine-cornered speech, which touches the truth,

original: indrāt pari tanvam mame ////🔽anu tvā rodasī ubhe krakṣamāṇam akṛpetām /
analyzed: indrāt pari tanvam mame  anu tvā rodasī ubhe krakṣamāṇam akṛpetām
translated: From Indra I have taken its form.

original: indra yad dasyuhābhavaḥ ////
analyzed: indra yat dasyu hā abhavaḥ
translated: Both the heaven and the earth trembled, as they saw thee, O Indra, rushing forward, when thou wast about to slay the Dasyus.

original: uttiṣṭhann ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ /
analyzed: uttiṣṭhan ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ
translated: Rising with might, having drunk, thou hast shaken the two fair ones.

original: somam indra camū sutam ////
analyzed: somam indra camū sutam
translated: O Indra, the Soma pressed in the trough.

original: bhindhi viśvā apa dviṣaḥ bādho jahī mṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: bhindhi viśvāḥ apa dviṣaḥ bādhaḥ jahi mṛdhaḥ
translated: Break thou all enmities, drive away the scorners,

original: vasu spārhaṃ tad ā bhara ////
analyzed: vasu spārham tat ā bhara
translated: Bring thou the desirable treasure.

original: yad vīlāv indra yat sthire yat parśāne parābhṛtam /
analyzed: yat vīlau indra yat sthire yat parśāne parābhṛtam
translated: What thou hast in the pit, O Indra, what thou hast in the firm place, what thou hast brought from the side,

original: vasu spārhaṃ tad ā bhara ////
analyzed: vasu spārham tat ā bhara
translated: Bring thou the desirable treasure.

original: yasya te viśvamānuṣo bhūrer dattasya vedati /
analyzed: yasya te viśva mānuṣaḥ bhūreḥ dattasya vedati
translated: Whose, O all-men, you know as given, of your ample wealth.

original: vasu spārhaṃ tad ā bhara ////🔽pra samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām indraṃ stotā navyaṃ gīrbhiḥ /
analyzed: vasu spārham tat ā bhara  pra samrājam carṣaṇīnām indram stota navyam gīrbhiḥ
translated: Bring that desirable treasure to us.🔽Praise with new songs the emperor of men, Indra,

original: naraṃ nṛṣāhaṃ maṃhiṣṭham ////
analyzed: naram nṛṣāham maṃhiṣṭham
translated: The most bountiful hero among heroes.

original: yasminn ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasya /
analyzed: yasmin ukthāni raṇyanti viśvāni ca śravasya
translated: In whom the hymns of praise and all glories delight,

original: apām avo na samudre ////🔽taṃ suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭharājaṃ bhare kṛtnum /
analyzed: apām avaḥ na samudre  tam suṣṭutyā vivāse jyeṣṭha rājam bhare kṛtnum
translated: Like the waters in the ocean.🔽I invite him with good praise, the king of kings, the mighty one,

original: maho vājinaṃ sanibhyaḥ ////
analyzed: mahaḥ vājinam sanibhyaḥ
translated: The great strong one for the gains.

original: ayam u te sam atasi kapota iva garbhadhim /
analyzed: ayam u te sam atasi kapotaḥ iva garbhadhim
translated: This one of yours approaches, like a dove to its nest,

original: vacas tac cin na ohase ////
analyzed: vacaḥ tat cit naḥ ohase
translated: That speech of yours I do not understand.

original: stotraṃ rādhānāṃ pate girvāho vīra yasya te /
analyzed: stotram rādhānām pate gir vāhaḥ vīra yasya te
translated: The praise, O lord of gifts, the song, O hero, of him

original: vibhūtir astu sūnṛtā ////
analyzed: vibhūtiḥ astu sūnṛtā
translated: Whose bounty is great, may it be fulfilled.

original: ūrdhvas tiṣṭhā na ūtaye 'smin vāje śatakrato /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭha naḥ ūtaye smin vāje śatakrato
translated: Stand up for our help, O you of a hundred powers, in this contest,

original: sam anyeṣu bravāvahai ////
analyzed: sam anyeṣu bravāvahai
translated: Let us speak together with the others.

original: praṇetāram vasyo achā kartāraṃ jyotiḥ samatsu /
analyzed: praṇetāram vasyaḥ achā kartāram jyotiḥ samatsu
translated: The leader to better things, the maker of light in battles,

original: sāsahvāṃsam yudhāmitrān ////🔽sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ /
analyzed: sāsahvāṃsam yudhā amitrān  sa naḥ papriḥ pārayāti svasti nāvā puruhūtaḥ
translated: The challenger of enemies.🔽May he, the protector, carry us across safely, the much-invoked Indra,

original: indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ ////
analyzed: indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Over all enmities.

original: sa tvaṃ na indra vājobhir daśasyā ca gātuyā ca /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra vājobhiḥ daśasya ca gātuya ca
translated: So, O Indra, with your powers, for the sake of help and for the sake of going,

original: achā ca naḥ sumnaṃ neṣi ////
analyzed: achā ca naḥ sumnam neṣi
translated: And lead us to bliss.

original: tam indraṃ vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave /
analyzed: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave
translated: We urge that Indra on for the great deed of slaying Vrtra.

original: sa vṛṣā vṛṣabho bhuvat ////
analyzed: sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat
translated: May he be a bull, a mighty bull.

original: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛta ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ
translated: Indra is made for the sake of subduing, he is set in the highest rapture,

original: dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ ////
analyzed: dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ
translated: Glorious, praised in hymns, and dear to Soma.

original: girā vajro na saṃbhṛtaḥ sabalo anapacyutaḥ /
analyzed: girā vajraḥ na saṃbhṛtaḥ sa balaḥ an apacyutaḥ
translated: The thunderbolt is gathered by the song, strong, not to be turned aside,

original: vavakṣa ṛṣvo astṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ
translated: It grows, lofty, irresistible.

original: indram id gāthino bṛhad indram arkebhir arkiṇaḥ /
analyzed: indram id gāthinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ
translated: Indra is to be praised with songs, Indra with hymns of praise,

original: indraṃ vāṇīr anūṣata ////
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata
translated: The voices have sung forth to Indra.

original: indra id dharyoḥ sacā saṃmiśla ā vacoyujā /
analyzed: indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā
translated: Indra is joined with the two bay steeds, closely united with the yoke of speech,

original: indro vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ ////
analyzed: indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: Indra is the golden one with the thunderbolt.

original: indro dīrghāya cakṣasa ā sūryaṃ rohayad divi /
analyzed: indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi
translated: Indra raised the sun to the sky for the sake of the far-seeing eye,

original: vi gobhir adrim airayat ////
analyzed: vi gobhiḥ adrim airayat
translated: He drove away the mountain with the cows.

original: ā yāhi suṣumā hi ta indra somaṃ pibā imam /
analyzed: ā yāhi suṣuma hi te indra somam pibā imam
translated: Come, for you are much desired, O Indra, drink this Soma,

original: edaṃ barhiḥ sado mama ////
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama
translated: This is my seat, this is my sacrificial grass.

original: ā tvā brahmayujā harī vahatām indra keśinā /
analyzed: ā tvā brahma yujā harī vahatām indra keśinā
translated: Let your two tawny steeds yoked by prayer bring you hither, O Indra, with the reins,

original: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu ////
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi naḥ śṛṇu
translated: Listen to our prayers.

original: brahmāṇas tvā vayaṃ yujā somapām indra sominaḥ /
analyzed: brahmāṇaḥ tvā vayam yujā soma pām indra sominaḥ
translated: We priests, O Indra, who offer Soma, with prayer yoked, with Soma pressed,

original: sutāvanto havāmahe ////
analyzed: sutāvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We call upon those who have good sons.

original: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣaṃ carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ /
analyzed: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ
translated: They yoke the red-hued Brhaspati, who moves around the fixed points,

original: rocante rocanā divi ////
analyzed: rocante rocanā divi
translated: The luminous lights shine in the sky.

original: yuñjanty asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe /
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe
translated: They yoke his desirable tawny horses on the two-wheeled chariot,

original: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā ////
analyzed: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā
translated: The red-hued bold ones who carry men.

original: ketuṃ kṛṇvann aketave peśo maryā apeśase /🔽sam uṣadbhir ajāyathāḥ ////
analyzed: ketum kṛṇvan a ketave peśaḥ maryāḥ a peśase  sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: Making a banner for the bannerless, you make a body for the bodiless,🔽You are born together with the dawns.

original: ud u tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ /
analyzed: ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ
translated: The rays carry upward that Jātavedas, the god,

original: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam ////
analyzed: dṛśe viśvāya sūryam
translated: The sun, for all to see.

original: apa tye tāyavo yathā nakṣatrā yanty aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: apa tye tāyavaḥ yathā nakṣatrāḥ yanti aktubhiḥ
translated: Those rays move like birds, the Tāyus, along the paths,

original: sūrāya viśvacakṣase ////
analyzed: sūrāya viśva cakṣase
translated: To the sun, who sees all.

original: adṛśrann asya ketavo vi raśmayo janāṃ anu /
analyzed: adṛśran asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janān anu
translated: His lights are seen, his rays spread along the people,

original: bhrājanto agnayo yathā ////🔽taraṇir viśvadarśato jyotiṣkṛd asi sūrya /
analyzed: bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā  taraṇiḥ viśva darśataḥ jyotiṣkṛt asi sūrya
translated: Shining like fires.🔽You are the swift one, seen by all, the maker of light, O sun.

original: viśvam ā bhāsi rocana ////
analyzed: viśvam ā bhāsi rocana
translated: You illuminate the whole firmament.

original: pratyaṅ devānāṃ viśaḥ pratyaṅṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ /
analyzed: pratyaṅ devānām viśaḥ pratyaṅ ud eṣi mānuṣīḥ
translated: You go to the west of the people of the gods, to the west of the human beings,

original: pratyaṅ viśvaṃ svar dṛśe ////
analyzed: pratyaṅ viśvam svar dṛśe
translated: To the west of the whole heaven to be seen.

original: yenā pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantaṃ janāṃ anu /
analyzed: yena pāvaka cakṣasā bhuraṇyantam janān anu
translated: By what light of yours, O purifying one, you see the people moving along,

original: tvaṃ varuṇa paśyasi ////
analyzed: tvam varuṇa paśyasi
translated: You, O Varuṇa, see.

original: vi dyām eṣi rajas pṛthv ahar mimāno aktubhiḥ /
analyzed: vi dyām eṣi rajaḥ pṛthu ahar mimānaḥ aktubhiḥ
translated: Thou goest through the wide air, through the sky, measuring the day with thy rays,

original: paśyaṃ janmāni sūrya ////
analyzed: paśyam janmāni sūrya
translated: Beholding the generations, O Sun.

original: sapta tvā harito rathe vahanti deva sūrya /
analyzed: sapta tvā haritaḥ rathe vahanti deva sūrya
translated: Seven bay steeds carry thee in the chariot, O god Sūrya,

original: śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam ////
analyzed: śociṣkeśam vicakṣaṇam
translated: The radiant-haired, the all-seeing one.

original: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūro rathasya naptyaḥ /
analyzed: ayukta sapta śundhyuvaḥ sūraḥ rathasya naptyaḥ
translated: The seven pure mares have been yoked, the daughters of the chariot of Sūrya.

original: tābhir yāti svayuktibhiḥ ////
analyzed: tābhiḥ yāti sva yuktibhiḥ
translated: With them he goes, with those that are well-yoked.

original: abhi tvā varcasā giraḥ siñcanty ā caraṇyuvaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā varcasā giraḥ siñcanti ā caraṇyuvaḥ
translated: The songs pour upon thee their radiance, eager to serve,

original: abhi vatsaṃ na dhenavaḥ ////
analyzed: abhi vatsam na dhenavaḥ
translated: As the cows upon the calf.

original: tā arṣanti śubhriyaḥ pṛñcatīr varcasā payaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ arṣanti śubhriyaḥ pṛñcatīḥ varcasā payaḥ
translated: They flow, the bright ones, bestowing, their milk with radiance,

original: jātaṃ janir yathā hṛdā ////🔽vajrāpavasādhyaḥ kīrtir mriyamāṇam āvahan /
analyzed: jātam janiḥ yathā hṛdā  vajrāpava sādhyaḥ kīrtiḥ mriyamāṇam āvahan
translated: As the womb upon the born child with the heart.🔽The glory, the balm of the thunderbolt, brought the dying one back to life,

original: mahyam āyur ghṛtaṃ payaḥ ////
analyzed: mahyam āyuḥ ghṛtam payaḥ
translated: To me life, ghee, milk.

original: āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asadan mātaraṃ puraḥ /
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras
translated: This dappled cow hath come hither, hath sat down before the mother,

original: pitaraṃ ca prayant svaḥ ////
analyzed: pitaram ca prayan svar
translated: And the father, going to the light.

original: antaś carati rocanā asya prāṇād apānataḥ /
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānataḥ
translated: It moves within the light, from his out-breathing and in-breathing.

original: vy akhyan mahiṣaḥ svaḥ ////
analyzed: vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ svar
translated: The great bull hath disclosed the light.

original: triṃśad dhāmā vi rājati vāk pataṅgo aśiśriyat /
analyzed: triṃśat dhāmā vi rājati vāc pataṅgaḥ aśiśriyat
translated: The thirty-fold abode shines forth. Speech hath taken to the flying bird.

original: prati vastor ahar dyubhiḥ ////
analyzed: prati vastoḥ ahar dyubhiḥ
translated: It hath turned to the day with its lights.

original: yac chakrā vācam āruhann antarikṣaṃ siṣāsathaḥ /
analyzed: yat śakrā vācam āruhan antarikṣam siṣāsathaḥ
translated: When Shakra mounted the speech of those who were striving for the atmosphere,

original: saṃ devā amadan vṛṣā ////
analyzed: sam devāḥ amadan vṛṣā
translated: The bulls among the gods were delighted.

original: śakro vācam adhṛṣṭāyor uvāco adhṛṣṇuhi /
analyzed: śakraḥ vācam adhṛṣṭa āyoḥ uvācaḥ u adhṛṣṇuhi
translated: Shakra spoke the speech of the two invincible ones, Be invincible.

original: maṃhiṣṭha ā madardivi ////
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhe ā madardivi
translated: Most bountiful, rejoice in the sky.

original: śakro vācam adhṛṣṇuhi dhāmadharman vi rājati /🔽vimadan barhir āsaran ////
analyzed: śakraḥ vācam adhṛṣṇuhi dhāma dharman vi rājati  vimadan barhiḥ āsaran
translated: Shakra, be invincible. The one with the law of truth shines forth.🔽The bulls were delighted, they sat on the sacred grass.

original: taṃ vo dasmam ṛtīṣahaṃ vasor mandānam andhasaḥ /
analyzed: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ
translated: We praise that wondrous Indra with songs, the one who conquers the wicked, who delights in the juice of the Soma,

original: abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ gīrbhir navāmahe ////🔽dyukṣaṃ sudānuṃ taviṣībhir āvṛtam giriṃ na purubhojasam /
analyzed: abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe  dyukṣam sudānum taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam girim na puru bhojasam
translated: Like cows to their calves in the stalls, we praise Indra with songs.🔽The glorious one, the bountiful one, surrounded by powers, like a mountain, the one who satisfies many,

original: kṣumantaṃ vājaṃ śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ makṣū gomantam īmahe ////
analyzed: kṣumantam vājam śatinam sahasriṇam makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: We quickly seek the powerful food, a hundredfold, a thousandfold, together with cattle.

original: tat tvā yāmi suvīryaṃ tad brahma pūrvacittaye /
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi su vīryam tat brahma pūrvacittaye
translated: For that valor of yours, that holy power for the sake of the ancient thought,

original: yenā yatibhyo bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha ////
analyzed: yena yatibhyaḥ bhṛgave dhane hite yena praskaṇvam āvitha
translated: By which you helped Yati, Bhrgu, and Praskanva when wealth was at stake,

original: yenā samudram asṛjo mahīr apas tad indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ /
analyzed: yena samudram asṛjaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ tat indra vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ
translated: By which you created the ocean, the great waters, that is your strength, O Indra, the Vrishni.

original: sadyaḥ so asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yaṃ kṣoṇīr anucakrade ////
analyzed: sadyas saḥ asya mahimā na saṃnaśe yam kṣoṇīḥ anucakrade
translated: His greatness will not be destroyed, whom the two worlds follow in worship.

original: kan navyo atasīnāṃ turo gṛṇīta martyaḥ /
analyzed: kad navyaḥ atasīnām turaḥ gṛṇīta martyaḥ
translated: Which mortal man will praise the new hero of the Atasi people?

original: nahī nv asya mahimānam indriyaṃ svar gṛṇanta ānaśuḥ ////
analyzed: nahi nu asya mahimānam indriyam svar gṛṇantaḥ ānaśuḥ
translated: For they have not attained the greatness and power of Indra, whom the singers praise.

original: kad u stuvanta ṛtayanta devata ṛṣiḥ ko vipra ohate /
analyzed: kad u stuvantaḥ ṛtayanta devataḥ ṛṣiḥ kaḥ vipraḥ ohate
translated: When will the truthful worshippers praise the god? Which sage or priest understands?

original: kadā havaṃ maghavann indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvata ā gamaḥ ////
analyzed: kadā havam maghavan indra sunvataḥ kad u stuvate ā gamaḥ
translated: When, O bountiful Indra, will you come to the one who presses (Soma) and offers praise? When will you come to the one who sings your praises?

original: abhi pra vaḥ surādhasam indram arca yathā vide /🔽yo jaritṛbhyo maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇeva śikṣati ////
analyzed: abhi pra vaḥ su rādhasam indram arca yathā vide  yaḥ jaritṛbhyaḥ maghavā purūvasuḥ sahasreṇa iva śikṣati
translated: I will praise for you the very generous Indra, as I know him,🔽The bountiful one who, like a thousand, helps the singers with abundant wealth.

original: śatānīkeva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe /
analyzed: śata anīkā iva pra jigāti dhṛṣṇuyā hanti vṛtrāṇi dāśuṣe
translated: He goes forth to conquer in a hundred battles, he slays the Vr̥itras for the worshipper.

original: girer iva pra rasā asya pinvire datrāṇi purubhojasaḥ ////
analyzed: gireḥ iva pra rasāḥ asya pinvire datrāṇi puru bhojasaḥ
translated: Like the streams of a mountain, his gifts flow forth, the bountiful one's gifts.

original: pra su śrutaṃ surādhasam arcā śakram abhiṣṭaye /
analyzed: pra su śrutam su rādhasam arca śakram abhiṣṭaye
translated: Praise the well-known, very generous Shakra for protection,

original: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyaṃ vasu sahasreṇeva maṃhate ////
analyzed: yaḥ sunvate stuvate kāmyam vasu sahasreṇa iva maṃhate
translated: Who gives desirable wealth to the one who presses (Soma) and sings praises, like one who gives a thousand.

original: śatānīkā hetayo asya duṣṭarā indrasya samiṣo mahīḥ /
analyzed: śata anīkāḥ hetayaḥ asya duṣṭarāḥ indrasya samiṣaḥ mahīḥ
translated: The hundred-streamed, hard-to-cross currents of Indra's food are great.

original: girir na bhujmā maghatsu pinvate yad īṃ sutā amandiṣuḥ ////
analyzed: giriḥ na bhujmā maghatsu pinvate yat īm sutāḥ amandiṣuḥ
translated: Like a mountain, he swells with gifts in the feasts, when the pressed (Soma) has gladdened him.

original: vayaṃ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: We, O Indra, with pressed (Soma) and trimmed sacrificial grass,

original: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāra āsate ////
analyzed: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate
translated: At the springs of the pure one, O Vrtra-slayer, the praisers sit around thee.

original: svaranti tvā sute naro vaso nireka ukthinaḥ /
analyzed: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ
translated: The men with the Soma juice, O Vasu, the singers of praises, call upon thee.

original: kadā sutaṃ tṛṣāṇa oka ā gama indra svabdīva vaṃsagaḥ ////
analyzed: kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ okaḥ ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ
translated: When wilt thou come, thirsting for the pressed (juice), to the dwelling, O Indra, like a bee to the wood?

original: kaṇvebhir dhṛṣṇav ā dhṛsad vājaṃ darṣi sahasriṇam /
analyzed: kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛsat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam
translated: O bold one, with the Kaṇvas win thou the prize, and break through a thousand enclosures.

original: piśaṅgarūpaṃ maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe ////
analyzed: piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: O Maghavan, of variegated form, of great activity, we quickly seek thee, O thou who hast much cattle.

original: ka īṃ veda sute sacā pibantaṃ kad vayo dadhe /
analyzed: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe
translated: Who knoweth him when he hath drunk the juice together? Who hath set down his strength?

original: ayaṃ yaḥ puro vibhinatty ojasā mandānaḥ śipry andhasaḥ ////🔽dānā mṛgo na vāraṇaḥ purutrā carathaṃ dadhe /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ  dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe
translated: This one who breaketh the forts with might, rejoicing in the tawny juice.🔽Like a wild beast, O bountiful one, he hath set his course in many a place.

original: nakiṣ ṭvā ni yamad ā sute gamo mahāś carasy ojasā ////
analyzed: nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahāḥ carasi ojasā
translated: None may restrain thee when thou goest to the pressed (juice); thou goest great in might.

original: ya ugraḥ sann aniṣṭṛta sthiro raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ
translated: He who, being fierce, is unwearied, firm, prepared for battle,

original: yadi stotur maghavā śṛṇavad dhavaṃ nendro yoṣaty ā gamat ////
analyzed: yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat havam na indraḥ yoṣati ā gamat
translated: If the bountiful one hears the call of the praiser, let Indra come to the woman.

original: viśvāḥ pṛtanā abhibhūtaraṃ naraṃ sajūs tatakṣur indraṃ jajanuś ca rājase /
analyzed: viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ abhibhūtaram naram sajūs tatakṣuḥ indram jajanuḥ ca rājase
translated: All the hosts have fashioned the overlord, the man, Indra, and have generated him for the royal (office).

original: kratvā variṣṭhaṃ vara āmurim utogram ojiṣṭhaṃ tavasaṃ tarasvinam ////
analyzed: kratvā variṣṭham vare āmurim uta ugram ojiṣṭham tavasam tarasvinam
translated: The most excellent in strength, the most mighty, the most impetuous, the most powerful, the most energetic.

original: sam īṃ rebhāso asvarann indraṃ somasya pītaye /
analyzed: sam īm rebhāsaḥ asvaran indram somasya pītaye
translated: The singers have sung to Indra to drink the Soma.

original: svarpatiṃ yad īṃ vṛdhe dhṛtavrato hy ojasā sam ūtibhiḥ ////
analyzed: svarpatim yat īm vṛdhe dhṛtavrataḥ hi ojasā sam ūtibhiḥ
translated: To the lord of heaven, whom the one of firm vow supports for increase, with his powers and his aids.

original: nemiṃ namanti cakṣasā meṣaṃ viprā abhisvarā /
analyzed: nemim namanti cakṣasā meṣam viprāḥ abhisvarā
translated: The sages with their eye worship the wheel, the ram, with their voices.

original: sudītayo vo adruho 'pi karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ ////
analyzed: su dītayaḥ vaḥ adruhaḥ pi karṇe tarasvinaḥ sam ṛkvabhiḥ
translated: Your very well-sung, truthful, swift songs have come to the ear, together with the Rik verses.

original: tam indraṃ johavīmi maghavānam ugraṃ satrā dadhānam apratiṣkutaṃ śavāṃsi /
analyzed: tam indram johavīmi maghavānam ugram satrā dadhānam apratiṣkutam śavāṃsi
translated: I invoke that Indra, the wealthy, the mighty, the one who always possesses incomparable powers.

original: maṃhiṣṭho gīrbhir ā ca yajñiyo vavartad rāye no viśvā supathā kṛṇotu vajrī ////
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhaḥ gīrbhiḥ ā ca yajñiyaḥ vavartat rāye naḥ viśvā su pathā kṛṇotu vajrī
translated: May the most bountiful one, who is worthy of sacrifice, turn to us with his songs. May the wielder of the thunderbolt make all good paths for us.

original: yā indra bhuja ābharaḥ svarvāṃ asurebhyaḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ indra bhujaḥ ābharaḥ svarvān asurebhyaḥ
translated: O Indra, the heavenly world that you brought to the Asuras,

original: stotāram in maghavann asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛktabarhiṣaḥ ////
analyzed: stotāram id maghavan asya vardhaya ye ca tve vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: O bountiful one, increase the worshipper of this (world) and those who spread out the sacrificial grass for you.

original: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvaṃ gāṃ bhāgam avyayam /
analyzed: yam indra dadhiṣe tvam aśvam gām bhāgam avyayam
translated: O Indra, the horse, the cow, the imperishable portion that you enjoy,

original: yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin taṃ dhehi mā paṇau ////
analyzed: yajamāne sunvati dakṣiṇāvati tasmin tam dhehi mā paṇau
translated: place it in the sacrificer who presses (Soma) and gives gifts, not in the one who does not give.

original: indro madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ madāya vāvṛdhe śavase vṛtrahā nṛbhiḥ
translated: Indra has grown for the rapture, for strength, for slaying Vrtra, with the men.

original: tam in mahatsv ājiṣūtem arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra no 'viṣat ////
analyzed: tam id mahatsu ājiṣu uta īm arbhe havāmahe sa vājeṣu pra naḥ viṣat
translated: We call on him in great battles, on him in lesser ones: may he be victorious for us in contests for booty.

original: asi hi vīra senyo 'si bhūri parādadiḥ /
analyzed: asi hi vīra senyaḥ si bhūri parādadiḥ
translated: For thou art a hero's friend, thou art the giver of abundant spoil.

original: asi dabhrasya cid vṛdho yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu ////
analyzed: asi dabhrasya cit vṛdhaḥ yajamānāya śikṣasi sunvate bhūri te vasu
translated: Thou art the helper even of the weak: thou teachest the sacrificer. To the presser of the juice thou givest much wealth.

original: yad udīrata ājayo dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā /🔽yukṣvā madacyutā harī kaṃ hanaḥ kaṃ vasau dadho 'smāṃ indra vasau dadhaḥ ////
analyzed: yat udīrate ājayaḥ dhṛṣṇave dhīyate dhanā  yukṣvā mada cyutā harī kam hanaḥ kam vasau dadhaḥ smām indra vasau dadhaḥ
translated: When thou goest forth to battle, thou givest the daring man his wealth.🔽Yoke thy two Bay Steeds who drop the oil: whom wilt thou slay and whom make rich? O Indra, make us rich.

original: mademade hi no dadir yūthā gavām ṛjukratuḥ /🔽saṃ gṛbhāya puru śatobhayāhastyā vasu śiśīhi rāya ā bhara ////
analyzed: mademade hi naḥ dadiḥ yūthā gavām ṛju kratuḥ  sam gṛbhāya puru śata ubhayā hastyā vasu śiśīhi rāyaḥ ā bhara
translated: For in each draught he gives us herds of cattle, he of the straight-going thought.🔽Gather for us, O thou of many hundreds, on both sides, wealth: sharpen our wealth, bring it hither.

original: mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase /
analyzed: mādayasva sute sacā śavase śūra rādhase
translated: Rejoice thee with the juice expressed, O Hero, for bounty and for strength.

original: vidmā hi tvā purūvasum upa kāmānt sasṛjmahe 'thā no 'vitā bhava ////
analyzed: vidma hi tvā purūvasum upa kāmān sasṛjmahe thā naḥ vitā bhava
translated: For we know thee as the Lord of ample wealth: we have sent up our prayers to thee: then be thou our protector.

original: ete ta indra jantavo viśvaṃ puṣyanti vāryam /
analyzed: ete te indra jantavaḥ viśvam puṣyanti vāryam
translated: These men, O Indra, all tend thee, the universal Lord of all.

original: antar hi khyo janānām aryo vedo adāśuṣāṃ teṣāṃ no veda ā bhara ////
analyzed: antar hi khyaḥ janānām aryaḥ vedaḥ a dāśuṣām teṣām naḥ vedaḥ ā bhara
translated: For thou art the dear secret treasure of the people who offer not: bring us the treasure which thou hast.

original: surūpakṛtnum ūtaye sudughām iva goduhe /
analyzed: su rūpa kṛtnum ūtaye sudughām iva go duhe
translated: The fair-formed One we invocate for aid, like a milch-cow who gives abundant milk,

original: juhūmasi dyavidyavi ////
analyzed: juhūmasi dyavidyavi
translated: We call on thee, O Dyaus and Dyu-pati.

original: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya somapāḥ piba /
analyzed: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba
translated: Come to our libations: drink the Soma, O thou who lovest Soma.

original: godā id revato madaḥ ////
analyzed: go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ
translated: The gift of kine is a delightful gladdening draught.

original: athā te antamānāṃ vidyāma sumatīnām /
analyzed: athā te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām
translated: So may we know thee in thy kindest moods, the best of all thy moods.

original: mā no ati khya ā gahi ////🔽śuṣmintamaṃ na ūtaye dyumninaṃ pāhi jāgṛvim /
analyzed: mā naḥ ati khyaḥ ā gahi  śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim
translated: Come not thou nigh us with thy wrath.🔽Most powerful, most splendid, watchful, guard the Soma for our help,

original: indra somaṃ śatakrato ////
analyzed: indra somam śatakrato
translated: O Indra, thou of hundred powers.

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu /
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
translated: The powers which thou hast in the five peoples, O thou of hundred powers,

original: indra tāni ta ā vṛṇe ////
analyzed: indra tāni te ā vṛṇe
translated: These, Indra, I elect.

original: agann indra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram /
analyzed: agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram
translated: O Indra, thou hast gone to lofty fame: win thou great glory hard to conquer.

original: ut te śuṣmaṃ tirāmasi ////
analyzed: ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi
translated: We will exalt thy strength.

original: arvāvato na ā gahy atho śakra parāvataḥ /
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ
translated: Come hither unto us from the wide region, and from the distant, O thou Śakra.

original: u loko yas te adriva indreha tata ā gahi ////
analyzed: u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi
translated: From the region that is thine, O Thunderer, come hither, O Indra.

original: indro aṅga mahad bhayam abhī ṣad apa cucyavat /
analyzed: indraḥ aṅga mahat bhayam abhī sat apa cucyavat
translated: Indra hath overcome a great and terrible fear.

original: sa hi sthiro vicarṣaniḥ ////
analyzed: sa hi sthiraḥ vicarṣaniḥ
translated: For he is firm and very active.

original: indraś ca mṛlayāti no na naḥ paścād aghaṃ naśat /
analyzed: indraḥ ca mṛlayāti naḥ na naḥ paścāt agham naśat
translated: May Indra be gracious to us, and may he not leave sin behind him.

original: bhadraṃ bhavāti naḥ puraḥ ////🔽indra āśābhyas pari sarvābhyo abhayaṃ karat /
analyzed: bhadram bhavāti naḥ puras  indraḥ āśābhyaḥ pari sarvābhyaḥ abhayam karat
translated: May he be gracious to us in front.🔽May Indra make us free from danger on every side.

original: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ ////
analyzed: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: May he, the active, conquer our foes.

original: ka īṃ veda sute sacā pibantaṃ kad vayo dadhe /
analyzed: kaḥ īm veda sute sacā pibantam kad vayaḥ dadhe
translated: Who knows him when he is drunk with the pressed (Soma), who has set his heart on (winning) booty?

original: ayaṃ yaḥ puro vibhinatty ojasā mandānaḥ śipry andhasaḥ ////🔽dānā mṛgo na vāraṇaḥ purutrā carathaṃ dadhe /
analyzed: ayam yaḥ puras vibhinatti ojasā mandānaḥ śiprī andhasaḥ  dānā mṛgaḥ na vāraṇaḥ purutrā caratham dadhe
translated: He who here in front breaks open (the cattle-pens) with might, rejoicing, O thou of the beautiful face, in the juice.🔽Like a wild beast, like a boar, he has set his heart on going in many a place.

original: nakiṣ ṭvā ni yamad ā sute gamo mahāṃś carasy ojasā ////
analyzed: nakir tvā ni yamat ā sute gamaḥ mahān carasi ojasā
translated: None can hold thee back when thou goest to the pressed (Soma). Great, thou goest with might.

original: ya ugraḥ sann aniṣṭṛta sthiro raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ugraḥ san a niṣṭṛta sthiraḥ raṇāya saṃskṛtaḥ
translated: Thou who, being fierce, art not to be resisted, art firm, made ready for the fight.

original: yadi stotur maghavā śṛṇavad dhavaṃ nendro yoṣaty ā gamat ////🔽vayaṃ gha tvā sutāvanta āpo na vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: yadi stotuḥ maghavā śṛṇavat havam na indraḥ yoṣati ā gamat  vayam gha tvā sutāvantaḥ āpaḥ na vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: If the bountiful one, when the praiser's call reaches him, would listen to the call, Indra would come to the woman.🔽We, O thou who art to be invoked, like the waters, with the pressed (Soma), with trimmed sacrificial grass,

original: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāra āsate ////
analyzed: pavitrasya prasravaṇeṣu vṛtrahan pari stotāraḥ āsate
translated: Sit round about thee, O Vr̥itra-slayer, at the outpourings of the purifying (Soma).

original: svaranti tvā sute naro vaso nireka ukthinaḥ /
analyzed: svaranti tvā sute naraḥ vaso nireke ukthinaḥ
translated: The men, O Vasu, the singers of praise, sing to thee when the Soma is pressed.

original: kadā sutaṃ tṛṣāṇa oka ā gama indra svabdīva vaṃsagaḥ ////🔽kaṇvebhir dhṛṣṇav ā dhṛṣad vājaṃ darṣi sahasriṇam /
analyzed: kadā sutam tṛṣāṇaḥ okaḥ ā gamaḥ indra svabdī iva vaṃsagaḥ  kaṇvebhiḥ dhṛṣṇo ā dhṛṣat vājam darṣi sahasriṇam
translated: When wilt thou come, O Indra, to the pressed (Soma), to the place of drinking, as a thirsty one to a pool?🔽O thou who art to be invoked, with the Kaṇvas win the thousandfold booty, the prize to be won.

original: piśaṅgarūpaṃ maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe ////
analyzed: piśaṅga rūpam maghavan vicarṣaṇe makṣū gomantam īmahe
translated: Of tawny hue, O bountiful one, O thou who art very active, we quickly seek (thee) who hast many cows.

original: śrāyanta iva sūryaṃ viśved indrasya bhakṣata /
analyzed: śrāyantaḥ iva sūryam viśvā id indrasya bhakṣata
translated: All men enjoy Indra's bounty, as if they were inclined towards the sun.

original: vasūni jāte janamāna ojasā prati bhāgaṃ na dīdhima ////🔽anarśarātiṃ vasudām upa stuhi bhadrā indrasya rātayaḥ /🔽so asya kāmaṃ vidhato na roṣati mano dānāya codayan ////🔽baṇ mahāṃ asi sūrya baḍ āditya mahāṃ asi /🔽mahas te sato mahimā panasyate 'ddhā deva mahāṃ asi ////🔽baṭ sūrya śravasā mahāṃ asi satrā deva mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: vasūni jāte janamāne ojasā prati bhāgam na dīdhima  anarśarātim vasu dām upa stuhi bhadrāḥ indrasya rātayaḥ  saḥ asya kāmam vidhataḥ na roṣati manaḥ dānāya codayan  baṭ mahān asi sūrya baṭ āditya mahān asi  mahaḥ te sataḥ mahimā panasyate ddhā deva mahān asi  baṭ sūrya śravasā mahān asi satrā deva mahān asi
translated: At birth he distributes treasures with his might, each portion according to his insight.🔽Praise him who gives good gifts, who sends us wealth: Indra's rewards are good.🔽He, the Ordainer, does not disobey his wish, urging his thought to give us gifts.🔽O Sûrya, thou art great: O Âditya, thou art great.🔽The greatness of thy being is extolled: yea, verily, O God, thou art great.🔽O Sûrya, thou art great in fame: thou, God, art ever great.

original: mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohito vibhu jyotir adābhyam ////🔽ud u tye madhu mattamā gira stomāsa īrate /🔽satrājito dhanasā akṣitotayo vājayanto rathā iva ////🔽kaṇvā iva bhṛgavaḥ sūrya iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ /🔽indraṃ stomebhir mahayanta āyavaḥ priyamedhāso asvaran ////🔽ud in nv asya ricyate 'ṃśo dhanaṃ na jigyusaḥ /🔽ya indro harivān na dabhanti taṃ ripo dakṣaṃ dadhāti somini ////
analyzed: mahnā devānām asuryaḥ purohitaḥ vibhu jyotiḥ adābhyam 🔽ud u tye madhu mattamāḥ giraḥ stomāsaḥ īrate 🔽satrājitaḥ dhana sāḥ akṣita ūtayaḥ vājayantaḥ rathāḥ iva 🔽kaṇvāḥ iva bhṛgavaḥ sūryaḥ iva viśvam id dhītam ānaśuḥ 🔽indram stomebhiḥ mahayantaḥ āyavaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ asvaran 🔽ud id nu asya ricyate ṃśaḥ dhanam na jigyusaḥ 🔽yaḥ indraḥ harivān na dabhanti tam ripaḥ dakṣam dadhāti somini
