original: mantram akharvaṃ sudhitaṃ supeśasaṃ dadhāta yajñiyeṣv ā /
analyzed: mantram akharvam sudhitam supeśasam dadhāta yajñiyeṣu ā
translated: Place the unshaken, well-ordered, well-fashioned hymn in the sacrificial rites.

original: pūrvīś cana prasitayas taranti taṃ ya indre karmaṇā bhuvat ////
analyzed: pūrvīḥ cana prasitayaḥ taranti tam yaḥ indre karmaṇā bhuvat
translated: Even many bonds do not hold him who has been with Indra through his work.

original: evā hy asi vīrayur evā śūra uta sthiraḥ /
analyzed: eva hi asi vīrayuḥ eva śūraḥ uta sthiraḥ
translated: For you are indeed the hero's friend, the hero's, O Indra, and the strong one's.

original: evā te rādhyaṃ manaḥ ////
analyzed: eva te rādhyam manaḥ
translated: May your mind be inclined to us.

original: evā rātis tuvīmagha viśvebhir dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ /🔽aghā cid indra me sacā ////
analyzed: eva rātiḥ tuvīmagha viśvebhiḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ  aghā cit indra me sacā
translated: This gift of yours, O bountiful one, is supported by all the supporters.🔽Even the wicked are with Indra in accord.

original: mo ṣu brahmeva tandrayur bhuvo vājānāṃ pate /
analyzed: mā u su brahmā iva tandrayuḥ bhuvaḥ vājānām pate
translated: Do not be like a lazy priest, O lord of strength.

original: matsvā sutasya gomataḥ ////
analyzed: matsva sutasya gomataḥ
translated: Rejoice in the Soma of the wealthy one.

original: evā hy asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī /
analyzed: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī
translated: For this his truth is vast, the milch-cow is great, the cow-filled (earth) is great.

original: pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe ////
analyzed: pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe
translated: The ripe fruit is like a branch for the worshipper.

original: evā hi te vibhūtaya ūtaya indra māvate /
analyzed: eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate
translated: For these are your powers, O Indra, the aids for the worshipper.

original: sadyaś cit santi dāśuṣe ////
analyzed: sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe
translated: Even immediately they are for the worshipper.

original: evā hy asya kāmyā stoma ukthaṃ ca śaṃsyā /
analyzed: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā
translated: For this his wish is to be praised, the hymn and the laud are to be recited.

original: indrāya somapītaye ////🔽taṃ te madaṃ gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtsu sāsahim /
analyzed: indrāya soma pītaye  tam te madam gṛṇīmasi vṛṣaṇam pṛtsu sāsahim
translated: To Indra for the drinking of the Soma.🔽We praise that exhilarating drink of yours, the strong one, victorious in battles,

original: u lokakṛtnum adrivo hariśriyam ////🔽yena jyotīmṣy āyave manave ca viveditha /
analyzed: u loka kṛtnum adrivas hari śriyam  yena jyotīmṣi āyave manave ca viveditha
translated: The maker of room, O you who have the thunderbolt, of tawny splendour.🔽By whom you discovered the lights for Âyu and for Manu,

original: mandāno asya barhiṣo vi rājasi ////
analyzed: mandānaḥ asya barhiṣaḥ vi rājasi
translated: Rejoicing, you shine forth on this sacrificial grass.

original: tad adyā cit ta ukthino 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā /
analyzed: tat adyā cit te ukthinaḥ nu stuvanti pūrvathā
translated: Even now they praise him with lauds as of old,

original: vṛṣapatnīr apo jayā divedive ////🔽tam v abhi pra gāyata puruhūtaṃ puruṣṭutam /
analyzed: vṛṣa patnīḥ apaḥ jaya dive dive  tam u abhi pra gāyata puru hūtam puruṣṭutam
translated: the waters whose lord is the bull, to be conquered day by day.🔽Sing forth to him, invoke with songs Indra, much-invoked, much-praised,

original: indraṃ gīrbhis taviṣam ā vivāsata ////
analyzed: indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata
translated: the mighty, to rejoice him.

original: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī /
analyzed: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī
translated: Whose great strength, increased by the two, supports the two world-halves,

original: girīṃr ajrāṃ apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā ////🔽sa rājasi puruṣṭutaṃ eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase /
analyzed: girīṃr ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā  sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase
translated: the mountains, the floods, the light, in his bull-like power.🔽Thou, O Indra, art the king, to be much praised, thou alone slayest the Vr̥itras.

original: indra jaitrā śravasya ca yantave ////
analyzed: indra jaitrā śravasya ca yantave
translated: O Indra, for victory and for winning glory.

original: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūraṃ na kac cid bharanto 'vasyavaḥ /
analyzed: vayam u tvām apūrvya sthūram na kad cit bharantaḥ vasyavaḥ
translated: We, O thou of no rival, calling on thee, O thou who givest much, for help,

original: vāje citraṃ havāmahe ////
analyzed: vāje citram havāmahe
translated: invoke thee for the prize, O wondrous one.

original: upa tvā karmann ūtaye sa no yuvograś cakrāma yo dhṛṣat /
analyzed: upa tvā karman ūtaye sa naḥ yuvā ugraḥ cakrāma yaḥ dhṛṣat
translated: To thee, O thou who art to be invoked, for the work of help, come to us, O young one, the bold one, who art daring.

original: tvām id dhy avitāraṃ vavṛmahe sakhāya indra sānasim ////
analyzed: tvām id hi avitāram vavṛmahe sakhāyaḥ indra sānasim
translated: For we have chosen thee, O Indra, as the helper, O thou who givest good things, as a friend.

original: yo na idamidaṃ purā pra vasya ānināya tam u va stuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ idam idam purā pra vasyaḥ ānināya tam u vaḥ stuṣe
translated: Him who in the past brought us this and that good thing, him I will praise.

original: sakhāya indram ūtaye ////
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye
translated: The friends, for help, Indra.

original: haryaśvaṃ satpatiṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sa hi ṣmā yo amandata /
analyzed: haryaśvam satpatim carṣaṇīsaham sa hi sma yaḥ amandata
translated: The one with bay steeds, the lord of the people, who is victorious over men, for he has rejoiced me.

original: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavā śatam ////
analyzed: ā tu naḥ sa vayati gavyam aśvyam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavā śatam
translated: May he bestow upon us a hundredfold of cattle and of horses for the worshippers, O bountiful one.

original: indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat /
analyzed: indrāya sāma gāyata viprāya bṛhate bṛhat
translated: Sing a Sâman to Indra, to the mighty sage, to the great one,

original: dharmakṛte vipaścite panasyave ////
analyzed: dharma kṛte vipaścite panasyave
translated: To the Law-ordainer, the wise, the bountiful.

original: tvam indrābhibhūr asi tvaṃ sūryam arocayaḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra abhibhūḥ asi tvam sūryam arocayaḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the overcomer: thou hast caused Sûrya to shine.

original: viśvakarmā viśvadevo mahāṃ asi ////🔽vibhrājaṃ jyotiṣā svar agacho rocanaṃ divaḥ /
analyzed: viśvakarmā viśva devaḥ mahān asi  vibhrājam jyotiṣā svar agachaḥ rocanam divaḥ
translated: Thou art the all-worker, the all-god, the great one.🔽With light thou hast attained the shining realm, the radiance of the sky.

original: devās ta indra sakhyāya yemire ////
analyzed: devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire
translated: The gods, O Indra, have submitted to thee for friendship.

original: tam v abhi pra gāyata puruhūtaṃ puruṣṭutam /
analyzed: tam u abhi pra gāyata puru hūtam puruṣṭutam
translated: Sing ye aloud to him, the much-invoked, the much-praised one,

original: indraṃ gīrbhis taviṣam ā vivāsata ////
analyzed: indram gīrbhiḥ taviṣam ā vivāsata
translated: To Indra, the strong, with songs, to make him come to us.

original: yasya dvibarhaso bṛhat saho dādhāra rodasī /🔽girīṃr ajrāṃ apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā ////🔽sa rājasi puruṣṭutaṃ eko vṛtrāṇi jighnase /
analyzed: yasya dvibarhasaḥ bṛhat sahaḥ dādhāra rodasī  girīṃr ajrān apaḥ svar vṛṣatvanā  sa rājasi puruṣṭutam ekaḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnase
translated: Whose is the mighty conquering strength, which upholds the two world-halves,🔽The mountains, the floods, the light, through his manly power.🔽Thou, O Indra, art the King, to be much praised, thou alone slayest the Vr̥itras.

original: indra jaitra śravasya ca yantave ////
analyzed: indra jaitra śravasya ca yantave
translated: O Indra, the victorious, for fame and for conquest.

original: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraś ca viśve ca devāḥ /
analyzed: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ
translated: These worlds we will establish, Indra and all the Gods.

original: yajñaṃ ca nas tanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityair indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti ////
analyzed: yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti
translated: And may Indra, with the Âdityas, ordain for us sacrifice, body, and offspring.

original: ādityair indraḥ sagaṇo marudbhir asmākaṃ bhūtv avitā tanūnām /
analyzed: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam bhūtu avitā tanūnām
translated: Indra with the Ādityas, with the host of Maruts, be our protector, O ye, of our bodies,

original: hatvāya devā asurān yad āyan devā devatvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ ////
analyzed: hatvāya devāḥ asurān yat āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: When the gods went forth to slay the Asuras, the gods, preserving their own godhead.

original: pratyañcam arkam anayaṃ chacībhir ād it svadhām iṣirāṃ pary apaśyan /
analyzed: pratyañcam arkam anayam śacībhiḥ āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan
translated: He who hath brought the sun to the west with his powers, hath looked around on his own most powerful nature.

original: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ////
analyzed: ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: May we obtain that booty which the gods favour; may we rejoice a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: ya eka id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id vidayate vasu martāya dāśuṣe
translated: He who alone is known to bestow wealth on the mortal who offers,

original: īśāno apratiṣkuta indro aṅga ////
analyzed: īśānaḥ apratiṣkutaḥ indraḥ aṅga
translated: Indra, the lord, the irresistible, O Aṅgiras.

original: kadā martam arādhasaṃ padā kṣumpam iva sphurat /
analyzed: kadā martam arādhasam padā kṣumpam iva sphurat
translated: When will he crush the wicked man with his foot, as one would a water-bag?

original: kadā naḥ śuśravad gira indro aṅga ////
analyzed: kadā naḥ śuśravat giraḥ indraḥ aṅga
translated: When will Indra listen to our song, O Aṅgiras?

original: yaś cid dhi tvā bahubhya ā sutāvāṃ āvivāsati /
analyzed: yaḥ cit hi tvā bahubhyaḥ ā sutāvān āvivāsati
translated: If any one, O Indra, invites thee to the Soma-pressing for the sake of many,

original: ugraṃ tat patyate śava indro aṅga ////
analyzed: ugram tat patyate śavaḥ indraḥ aṅga
translated: That mighty power of thine is extolled, O Aṅgiras.

original: ya indra somapātamo madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati /
analyzed: yaḥ indra soma pātamaḥ madaḥ śaviṣṭha cetati
translated: O Indra, that most powerful joy which delights thee, O thou who drinkest the Soma,

original: yenā haṃsi ny attriṇaṃ tam īmahe ////
analyzed: yena haṃsi ni attriṇam tam īmahe
translated: Wherewith thou slayest the greedy one, that we implore.

original: yenā daśagvam adhriguṃ vepayantaṃ svarṇaram /
analyzed: yena daśagvam adhrigum vepayantam svarṇaram
translated: Wherewith thou didst shake the Daughrgu, the gold-gleaming one, of the Dasagvas,

original: yenā samudram āvithā tam īmahe ////
analyzed: yena samudram āvitha tam īmahe
translated: Wherewith thou didst reach the ocean, that we implore.

original: yena sindhuṃ mahīr apo rathāṃ iva pracodayaḥ /
analyzed: yena sindhum mahīḥ apaḥ rathān iva pracodayaḥ
translated: Wherewith thou didst impel the mighty waters of the Sindhu, like chariots,

original: panthām ṛtasya yātave tam īmahe ////🔽endra no gadhi priyaḥ satrājid agohyaḥ /
analyzed: panthām ṛtasya yātave tam īmahe  ā indra naḥ gadhi priyaḥ satrājit agohyaḥ
translated: The path of truth to travel, we implore him.🔽O Indra, be our dear guest, ever-victorious, not to be disregarded,

original: girir na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patir divaḥ ////
analyzed: giriḥ na viśvatas pṛthuḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: Like a mountain on all sides, vast, the lord of heaven.

original: abhi hi satya somapā ubhe babhūtha rodasī /
analyzed: abhi hi satya soma pāḥ ubhe babhūtha rodasī
translated: For truly, O Soma-drinker, thou hast become the supporter of both worlds.

original: indrāsi sunvato vṛdhaḥ patir divaḥ ////
analyzed: indra asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: Thou art the increaser of the presser, O Indra, the lord of heaven.

original: tvaṃ hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi /🔽hantā dasyor manor vṛdhaḥ patir divaḥ ////
analyzed: tvam hi śaśvatīnām indra dartā purām asi  hantā dasyoḥ manoḥ vṛdhaḥ patiḥ divaḥ
translated: For thou, O Indra, art the breaker of the ancient forts of all.🔽The slayer of the Dasyu, the increaser of Manu, the lord of heaven.

original: ed u madhvo madintaraṃ siñca vādhvaryo andhasaḥ /
analyzed: ā id u madhvaḥ madintaram siñca vā adhvaryo andhasaḥ
translated: Pour forth, O Adhvaryu, the most gladdening of the sweet juices.

original: evā hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ ////🔽indra sthātar harīṇāṃ nakiṣ te pūrvyastutim /
analyzed: eva hi vīra stavate sadāvṛdhaḥ  indra sthātar harīṇām nakir te pūrvya stutim
translated: For thus, O hero, the ever-increasing one is praised.🔽O Indra, O driver of the bays, none is thy equal in ancient praise.

original: ud ānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā ////
analyzed: ud ānaṃśa śavasā na bhandanā
translated: Lift up the hymn with might, not with flattery.

original: taṃ vo vājānāṃ patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ /
analyzed: tam vaḥ vājānām patim ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
translated: We have invoked him, O you who long for glory, the lord of strength,

original: aprāyubhir yajñebhir vāvṛdhenyam ////
analyzed: aprāyubhiḥ yajñebhiḥ vāvṛdhenyam
translated: To be increased by our sacrifices, which have not been performed before.

original: eto nv indraṃ stavāma sakhāya stomyaṃ naram /
analyzed: eta u nu indram stavāma sakhāyaḥ stomyam naram
translated: Let us now praise Indra, O friends, the man who is to be praised with hymns,

original: kuṣṭīr yo viśvā abhy asty eka it ////🔽agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: kuṣṭīḥ yaḥ viśvāḥ abhī asti ekaḥ id  agorudhāya gaviṣe dyukṣāya dasmyam vacaḥ
translated: Who alone surpasses all the Kuṣṭas.🔽To the one who is not to be overcome, the seeker of cattle, the heavenly one, speak the wondrous word.

original: ghṛtāt svādīyo madhunaś ca vocata ////
analyzed: ghṛtāt svādīyaḥ madhunaḥ ca vocata
translated: Sweeter than ghee and honey.

original: yasyāmitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave /
analyzed: yasya amitāni vīryā na rādhaḥ paryetave
translated: In whom are infinite powers, not wealth to be sought after.

original: jyotir na viśvam abhy asti dakṣiṇā ////
analyzed: jyotiḥ na viśvam abhī asti dakṣiṇā
translated: The light of all is not in the south.

original: stuhīndraṃ vyaśvavad anūrmiṃ vājinaṃ yamam /
analyzed: stuhi indram vyaśva vat anūrmim vājinam yamam
translated: Praise Indra, like a horse, unswerving, strong, the controller,

original: aryo gayaṃ maṃhamānaṃ vi dāśuṣe ////🔽evā nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamaṃ navam /
analyzed: aryaḥ gayam maṃhamānam vi dāśuṣe  eva nūnam upa stuhi vaiyaśva daśamam navam
translated: The noble bull, bestowing, to the worshipper.

original: suvidvāṃsaṃ carkṛtyaṃ caraṇīnām ////
analyzed: su vidvāṃsam carkṛtyam caraṇīnām
translated: Thus now praise the tenth, the new, the well-known, the active, the one to be served, of the two feet.

original: vetthā hi nirṛtīnāṃ vajrahasta parivṛjam /
analyzed: vettha hi nirṛtīnām vajrahasta parivṛjam
translated: For you know the way around the snares of misfortune, O Indra, with your thunderbolt in hand,

original: aharahaḥ śundhyuḥ paripadām iva ////
analyzed: ahar ahar śundhyuḥ paripadām iva
translated: Like the steps of a bird, day after day.

original: vanoti hi sunvan kṣayaṃ parīṇasaḥ sunvāno hi ṣmā yajaty ava dviṣo devānām ava dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: vanoti hi sunvan kṣayam parīṇasaḥ sunvānaḥ hi sma yajati ava dviṣaḥ devānām ava dviṣaḥ
translated: For the presser gains the abode, the end of misfortune, the presser, indeed, the strong one, worships, overcomes the enemies of the gods, overcomes the enemies.

original: sunvāna it siṣāsati sahasrā vājy avṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sunvānaḥ id siṣāsati sahasrā vājī a vṛtaḥ
translated: The presser, indeed, strives for thousands, the strong one, unhindered.

original: sunvānāyendro dadāty ābhuvaṃ rayiṃ dadāty ābhuvam ////🔽mo ṣu vo asmad abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mota jāriṣur asmat purota jāriṣuḥ /
analyzed: sunvānāya indraḥ dadāti ābhuvam rayim dadāti ābhuvam  mā u su vaḥ asmat abhi tāni pauṃsyā sanā bhūvan dyumnāni mā uta jāriṣuḥ asmat purā uta jāriṣuḥ
translated: Indra gives the presser prosperity, gives wealth, prosperity.🔽Let not those manly deeds of yours, which have been, be above us, let not the glories pass away from us, let not the glories pass away.

original: yad vaś citraṃ yugeyuge navyaṃ ghoṣād amartyam /
analyzed: yat vaḥ citram yuge yuge navyam ghoṣāt amartyam
translated: Whatever wonderful thing you have, O Maruts, in every age, new, from the sound, immortal,

original: asmāsu tan maruto yac ca duṣṭaraṃ didhṛtā yac ca duṣṭaram ////
analyzed: asmāsu tat marutaḥ yat ca duṣṭaram didhṛta yat ca duṣṭaram
translated: That, O Maruts, which is most difficult for us, and which is difficult to be borne, be with us.

original: agniṃ hotāram manye dāsvantaṃ vasuṃ sūnuṃ sahaso jātavedasaṃ vipraṃ na jātavedasam /
analyzed: agnim hotāram manye dāsvantam vasum sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam vipram na jātavedasam
translated: I regard Agni as the Hotar priest, the bountiful, the good, the son of strength, the all-knowing, the sage, the all-knowing.

original: ya ūrdhvayā svadhvaro devo devācyā kṛpā /
analyzed: yaḥ ūrdhvayā su adhvaraḥ devaḥ devācyā kṛpā
translated: The god who with upward-going oblation looks to the god with the flame turned to the gods,

original: ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ ////
analyzed: ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣā ājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ
translated: he follows the spreading of the ghee, with his radiant tongue, of the invited ghee.

original: yajñaiḥ saṃmiślāḥ pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhir yāmaṃ chubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta /
analyzed: yajñaiḥ saṃmiślāḥ pṛṣatībhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ yāmam śubhrāsaḥ añjiṣu priyāḥ uta
translated: United with sacrifices, with spotted spears, the bright ones, dear in the rays,

original: āsadyā barhir bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrād ā somaṃ pibatā divo naraḥ ////
analyzed: āsadya barhiḥ bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrāt ā somam pibata divaḥ naraḥ
translated: having sat down on the sacrificial grass, O sons of Bharata, drink the Soma from the Agnidh's cup, O men of heaven.

original: ā vakṣi devāṃ iha vipra yakṣi cośan hotar ni ṣadā yoniṣu triṣu /
analyzed: ā vakṣi devān iha vipra yakṣi ca uśan hotar ni sadā yoniṣu triṣu
translated: Bring the gods hither, O sage, and worship, O Hotar, sit down in the three sacred seats.

original: prati vīhi prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu pibāgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛsṇuhi ////
analyzed: prati vīhi prasthitam somyam madhu piba āgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛsṇuhi
translated: Turn to the offered, Soma-mixed, sweet drink, and be eager to drink from the Agnidh's cup of thy portion.

original: eṣa sya te tanvo nṛmṇavardhanaḥ saha ojaḥ pradivi bāhvor hitaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa sya te tanvaḥ nṛmṇa vardhanaḥ sahaḥ ojaḥ pradivi bāhvoḥ hitaḥ
translated: This, which increases thy manly strength, O thou of great power, is placed in thy arms, in the world.

original: tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtas tvam asya brāhmaṇād ā tṛpat piba ////
analyzed: tubhyam sutaḥ maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtaḥ tvam asya brāhmaṇāt ā tṛpat piba
translated: The Soma is pressed for thee, O bountiful one, it is brought to thee; be thou satisfied and drink of it from the Brahman's cup.

original: yam u pūrvam ahuve tam idaṃ huve sed u havyo dadir yo nāma patyate /
analyzed: yam u pūrvam ahuve tam idam huve sa id u havyaḥ dadiḥ yaḥ nāma patyate
translated: Whom I called upon before, to him I call now; he is to be invoked, the giver, whose name is celebrated.

original: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṃ somyaṃ madhu potrāt somaṃ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ ////
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitam somyam madhu potrāt somam draviṇaḥ daḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
translated: The Soma-juice, offered by the Adhvaryus, the giver of wealth drinks the Soma from the Pot, with the seasons.

original: surūpakṛtnum ūtaye sudughām iva goduhe /
analyzed: su rūpa kṛtnum ūtaye sudughām iva go duhe
translated: The well-formed, the bountiful, like a good milch cow,

original: juhūmasi dyavidyavi ////
analyzed: juhūmasi dyavidyavi
translated: we offer to Dyaus and Prithivī.

original: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya somapāḥ piba /
analyzed: upa naḥ savanā gahi somasya soma pāḥ piba
translated: Come to our libations, O thou who drinkest Soma, drink of the Soma.

original: godā id revato madaḥ ////
analyzed: go dāḥ id revataḥ madaḥ
translated: The gift of the bountiful is the milk of the cow.

original: athā te antamānāṃ vidyāma sumatīnām /
analyzed: athā te antamānām vidyāma sumatīnām
translated: Now may we know of thy most gracious favours,

original: mā no ati khya ā gahi ////
analyzed: mā naḥ ati khyaḥ ā gahi
translated: come not too hastily to us.

original: parehi vigram astṛtam indraṃ pṛchā vipaścitam /
analyzed: parehi vigram astṛtam indram pṛccha vipaścitam
translated: Go to the unvanquished combatant, ask Indra the wise one,

original: yas te sakhibhya ā varam ////
analyzed: yaḥ te sakhibhyaḥ ā varam
translated: who is better than thy friends.

original: uta bruvantu no nido nir anyataś cid ārata /
analyzed: uta bruvantu naḥ nidaḥ niḥ anyatas cit ārata
translated: And may the Nids speak to us from somewhere else,

original: dadhānā indra id duvaḥ ////
analyzed: dadhānāḥ indraḥ id duvaḥ
translated: placing Indra in their service.

original: uta naḥ subhagāṃ arir voceyur dasma kṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ subhagām ariḥ voceyuḥ dasma kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: And may the wondrous people call us blessed,

original: syāmed indrasya śarmaṇi ////
analyzed: syāma id indrasya śarmaṇi
translated: may we be in Indra's protection.

original: em āśum āśave bhara yajñaśriyaṃ nṛmādanam /
analyzed: ā īm āśum āśave bhara yajña śriyam nṛ mādanam
translated: Bring the swift one to the swift one, the glory of sacrifice, the gladdener of men,

original: patayan mandayatsakham ////
analyzed: patayat mandayatsakham
translated: flying, gladdening his friend.

original: asya pītvā śatakrato ghano vṛtrāṇām abhavaḥ /🔽prāvo vājeṣu vājinam ////
analyzed: asya pītvā śatakrato ghanaḥ vṛtrāṇām abhavaḥ  prāvaḥ vājeṣu vājinam
translated: Having drunk of this, O thou of a hundred powers, thou hast become the slayer of the Vr̥itras.🔽Thou hast urged on the strong one in the contests.

original: taṃ tvā vājeṣu vājinaṃ vājayāmaḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: tam tvā vājeṣu vājinam vājayāmaḥ śatakrato
translated: Thee, the strong one in the contests, O thou of a hundred powers, we urge on in the contests.

original: dhanānām indra sātaye ////
analyzed: dhanānām indra sātaye
translated: For the winning of wealth, O Indra.

original: yo rāyo 'vanir mahānt supāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā /
analyzed: yaḥ rāyaḥ vaniḥ mahān su pāraḥ sunvataḥ sakhā
translated: He who is the great finder of wealth, a good protector, a friend to the presser,

original: tasmā indrāya gāyata ////🔽ā tv etā ni ṣīdatendram abhi pra gāyata /
analyzed: tasmai indrāya gāyata  ā tu eta ni sīdata indram abhi pra gāyata
translated: For him sing to Indra.🔽Sit down here and sing forth to Indra,

original: sakhāya stomavāhasaḥ ////
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ stoma vāhasaḥ
translated: O friends, who carry the praise.

original: purūtamaṃ purūṇām īśānaṃ vāryāṇām /
analyzed: purutamam purūṇām īśānam vāryāṇām
translated: Most abundant of the many, lord of good things,

original: indraṃ some sacā sute ////🔽sa ghā no yoga ā bhuvat sa rāye sa puraṃdhyām /
analyzed: indram some sacā sute  sa ghā naḥ yoge ā bhuvat sa rāye sa puraṃdhyām
translated: Indra, with the pressed Soma.🔽May he be our helper in union, in wealth, in wisdom,

original: gamad vājebhir ā sa naḥ ////
analyzed: gamat vājebhiḥ ā sa naḥ
translated: May he come to us with his powers.

original: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ /
analyzed: yasya saṃsthe na vṛṇvate harī samatsu śatravaḥ
translated: Whose two bay horses in the contest the enemies do not resist,

original: tasmā indrāya gāyata ////
analyzed: tasmai indrāya gāyata
translated: To him sing to Indra.

original: sutapāvne sutā ime śucayo yanti vītaye /
analyzed: suta pāvne sutāḥ ime śucayaḥ yanti vītaye
translated: To the purifier of the Soma, these pure (drops) go for his enjoyment,

original: somāso dadhyāśiraḥ ////
analyzed: somāsaḥ dadhi āśiraḥ
translated: The Somas, with curds on their head.

original: tvaṃ sutasya pītaye sadyo vṛddho ajāyathāḥ /
analyzed: tvam sutasya pītaye sadyas vṛddhaḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: You were born immediately after drinking the Soma, grown strong,

original: indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato ////
analyzed: indra jyaiṣṭhyāya sukrato
translated: O Indra, for preeminence, O you of good vows.

original: ā tvā viśantv āśavaḥ somāsa indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: ā tvā viśantu āśavaḥ somāsaḥ indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: May the swift Soma juices enter you, O Indra, lover of praise,

original: śaṃ te santu pracetase ////
analyzed: śam te santu pracetase
translated: May they be auspicious for your discerning mind.

original: tvāṃ stomā avīvṛdhan tvām ukthā śatakrato /
analyzed: tvām stomāḥ avīvṛdhan tvām ukthā śatakrato
translated: You have been strengthened by the praises, by the hymns, O you of a hundred powers,

original: tvāṃ vardhantu no giraḥ ////
analyzed: tvām vardhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: May our songs strengthen you.

original: akṣitotiḥ saned imaṃ vājam indraḥ sahasriṇam /
analyzed: a kṣita ūtiḥ sanet imam vājam indraḥ sahasriṇam
translated: May the imperishable helper give us this wealth, O Indra, the thousandfold,

original: yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā ////
analyzed: yasmin viśvāni pauṃsyā
translated: In whom all manly powers are united.

original: mā no martā abhi druhan tanūnām indra girvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ martāḥ abhi druhan tanūnām indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: Do not, O mortal, injure our bodies, O Indra, lover of song.

original: īśāno yavayā vadham ////
analyzed: īśānaḥ yavaya vadham
translated: Be the lord to avert the blow.

original: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantaṃ pari tasthuṣaḥ /
analyzed: yuñjanti bradhnam aruṣam carantam pari tasthuṣaḥ
translated: They yoke the ruddy steed, the moving one, the ones who stand around.

original: rocante rocanā divi ////
analyzed: rocante rocanā divi
translated: The luminous lights shine in the sky.

original: yuñjanty asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe /
analyzed: yuñjanti asya kāmyā harī vipakṣasā rathe
translated: They yoke his desirable tawny horses on the chariot with two wings.

original: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛvāhasā ////🔽ketuṃ kṛṇvann aketave peśo maryā apeśase /
analyzed: śoṇā dhṛṣṇū nṛ vāhasā  ketum kṛṇvan a ketave peśaḥ maryāḥ a peśase
translated: The red ones, the bold ones, the carriers of men.🔽Making a banner for the bannerless, you make a form for the formless.

original: sam uṣadbhir ajāyathāḥ ////
analyzed: sam uṣadbhiḥ ajāyathāḥ
translated: You were born together with the dawns.

original: ād aha svadhām anu punar garbhatvam erire /
analyzed: āt aha svadhām anu punar garbha tvam erire
translated: They have again come to their own nature, to the state of being an embryo.

original: dadhānā nāma yajñiyam ////
analyzed: dadhānāḥ nāma yajñiyam
translated: Bearing the sacrificial name.

original: vīlu cid ārujatnubhir guhā cid indra vahnibhiḥ /
analyzed: vīḍu cit ārujatnubhiḥ guhā cit indra vahnibhiḥ
translated: Even what is hidden, O Indra, with your impetuous ones, with your fires.

original: avinda usriyā anu ////
analyzed: avindaḥ usriyāḥ anu
translated: You have found the cows.

original: devayanto yathā matim achā vidadvasuṃ giraḥ /
analyzed: devayantaḥ yathā matim achā vidadvasum giraḥ
translated: The god-adoring ones, as by thought, have sought with their songs the one who finds wealth.

original: mahām anūṣata śrutam ////
analyzed: mahām anūṣata śrutam
translated: They have sung to the great one who is to be heard.

original: indreṇa saṃ hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmāno abibhyuṣā /
analyzed: indreṇa sam hi dṛkṣase saṃjagmānaḥ a bibhyuṣā
translated: For you are seen together with Indra, the fearless one,

original: mandū samānavarcasā ////
analyzed: mandū samāna varcasā
translated: with the one of equal splendor, with the frog.

original: anavadyair abhidyubhir makhaḥ sahasvad arcati /
analyzed: anavadyaiḥ abhidyubhiḥ makhaḥ sahasvat arcati
translated: The sacrifice praises with the faultless ones, the shining ones,

original: gaṇair indrasya kāmyaiḥ ////
analyzed: gaṇaiḥ indrasya kāmyaiḥ
translated: with Indra's desirable groups, the powerful ones.

original: ataḥ parijmann ā gahi divo vā rocanād adhi /
analyzed: atas parijman ā gahi divaḥ vā rocanāt adhi
translated: Therefore, O wanderer, come from the sky or from the luminous realm.

original: sam asminn ṛñjate giraḥ ////
analyzed: sam asmin ṛñjate giraḥ
translated: In him are delighted the songs.

original: ito vā sātim īmahe divo vā pārthivād adhi /🔽indraṃ maho vā rajasaḥ ////
analyzed: itas vā sātim īmahe divaḥ vā pārthivāt adhi  indram mahaḥ vā rajasaḥ
translated: From here we seek help, from the sky or from the earth,🔽Indra, from the great realm.

original: indram id gathino bṛhad indram arkebhir arkiṇaḥ /
analyzed: indram id gathinaḥ bṛhat indram arkebhiḥ arkiṇaḥ
translated: Indra is the one whom the singers praise greatly, Indra is the one whom the singers praise with hymns,

original: indraṃ vāṇīr anūṣata ////
analyzed: indram vāṇīḥ anūṣata
translated: The songs have sung to Indra.

original: indra id dharyoḥ sacā saṃmiśla ā vacoyujā /
analyzed: indraḥ id haryoḥ sacā saṃmiślaḥ ā vacaḥ yujā
translated: Indra is the one who is closely united with the two bay horses, who is yoked with speech,

original: indro vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ ////🔽indro dīrghāya cakṣasa ā sūryaṃ rohayad divi /
analyzed: indraḥ vajrī hiraṇyayaḥ  indraḥ dīrghāya cakṣase ā sūryam rohayat divi
translated: Indra is the golden one with the thunderbolt.🔽Indra raised the sun to the sky with his far-reaching eye,

original: vi gobhir indram airayat ////
analyzed: vi gobhiḥ indram airayat
translated: He has sent forth Indra with the cows.

original: indra vājeṣu no 'va sahasrapradhaneṣu ca /
analyzed: indra vājeṣu naḥ vaḥ sahasra pradhaneṣu ca
translated: O Indra, in our battles, in the battles of a thousand warriors,

original: ugra ugrābhir ūtibhiḥ ////
analyzed: ugraḥ ugrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: The fierce one with his fierce aids.

original: indraṃ vayaṃ mahādhana indram arbhe havāmahe /🔽yujaṃ vṛtreṣu vajriṇam ////
analyzed: indram vayam mahādhane indram arbhe havāmahe  yujam vṛtreṣu vajriṇam
translated: We call upon Indra, the great one, we call upon Indra, the young one,🔽The yoked one, the wielder of the thunderbolt, in the battles with Vritra.

original: sa no vṛṣann amuṃ caruṃ satrādāvann apā vṛdhi /
analyzed: sa naḥ vṛṣan amum carum satrādāvan apa ā vṛdhi
translated: O bull, this oblation, O you who are to be invoked in the beginning of the sacrifice, increase for us,

original: asmabhyam apratiṣkutaḥ ////
analyzed: asmabhyam apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Unrestrained by us.

original: tuñjetuñje ya uttare stomā indrasya vajriṇaḥ /
analyzed: tuñjetuñje ye uttare stomāḥ indrasya vajriṇaḥ
translated: His praises, which are higher and higher, of Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: na vindhe asya suṣṭutim ////
analyzed: na vindhe asya suṣṭutim
translated: I do not find his eulogy.

original: vṛṣā yūtheva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭīr iyarty ojasā /
analyzed: vṛṣā yūthā iva vaṃsagaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ iyarti ojasā
translated: Like a bull in the herd, he urges the people with his might,

original: īśāno apratiṣkutaḥ ////
analyzed: īśānaḥ apratiṣkutaḥ
translated: Is Īśāna, the invincible one.

original: ya ekaś carṣaṇīnāṃ vasūnām irajyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ carṣaṇīnām vasūnām irajyati
translated: He who rules over the people, over the treasures,

original: indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām ////
analyzed: indraḥ pañca kṣitīnām
translated: Indra over the five regions.

original: indraṃ vo viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ /
analyzed: indram vaḥ viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ
translated: We invoke Indra from all around for you, from the people.

original: asmākam astu kevalaḥ ////🔽endra sānasiṃ rayiṃ sajitvānaṃ sadāsaham /
analyzed: asmākam astu kevalaḥ  ā indra sānasim rayim sa jitvānam sadāsaham
translated: May he be ours alone.🔽O Indra, bring us the wealth that is to be gained, the ever-victorious,

original: varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara ////
analyzed: varṣiṣṭham ūtaye bhara
translated: The most excellent one for help.

original: ni yena muṣṭihatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai /
analyzed: ni yena muṣṭi hatyayā ni vṛtrā ruṇadhāmahai
translated: By which we may crush the Vr̥itras with the fist-stroke,

original: tvotāso ny arvatā ////
analyzed: tvotāsaḥ ni arvatā
translated: With you as our helper, with the steed.

original: indra tvotāso ā vayaṃ vajraṃ ghanā dadīmahi /
analyzed: indra tvotāsaḥ ā vayam vajram ghanā dadīmahi
translated: O Indra, helped by you, we will hurl the thunderbolt with might.

original: jayema saṃ yudhi spṛdhaḥ ////
analyzed: jayema sam yudhi spṛdhaḥ
translated: May we conquer the enemies in battle.

original: vayaṃ śūrebhir astṛbhir indra tvayā yujā vayam /
analyzed: vayam śūrebhiḥ astṛbhiḥ indra tvayā yujā vayam
translated: With our heroes and weapons, O Indra, with you as our ally,

original: sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ ////🔽mahāṃ indraḥ paraś ca nu mahitvam astu vajriṇe /
analyzed: sāsahyāma pṛtanyataḥ  mahān indraḥ paras ca nu mahi tvam astu vajriṇe
translated: May we overcome the adversaries.🔽Great is Indra, and greater still is his greatness, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: dyaur na prathinā śavaḥ ////
analyzed: dyauḥ na prathinā śavaḥ
translated: His power is vast like the sky.

original: samohe vā ya āśata naras tokasya sanitau /
analyzed: samohe vā ye āśata naraḥ tokasya sanitau
translated: Or those who have come together in the contest for offspring,

original: viprāso vā dhiyāyavaḥ ////
analyzed: viprāsaḥ vā dhiyāyavaḥ
translated: Or the sages who strive with their thoughts.

original: yaḥ kukṣiḥ somapātamaḥ samudra iva pinvate /
analyzed: yaḥ kukṣiḥ soma pātamaḥ samudraḥ iva pinvate
translated: The womb that is most worthy of the Soma, that swells like the ocean,

original: urvīr āpo na kākudaḥ ////
analyzed: urvīḥ āpaḥ na kākudaḥ
translated: The vast waters are not a reservoir.

original: evā hy asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī /
analyzed: eva hi asya sūnṛtā virapśī gomatī mahī
translated: For such is his truth, his vast, milch-cow, the great one,

original: pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe ////🔽evā hi te vibhūtaya ūtaya indra māvate /
analyzed: pakvā śākhā na dāśuṣe  eva hi te vibhūtayaḥ ūtayaḥ indra māvate
translated: The ripe branch is not for the worshipper.🔽For you, indeed, are the aids and supports, O Indra, to the worshipper,

original: sadyaś cit santi dāśuṣe ////
analyzed: sadyas cit santi dāśuṣe
translated: Even immediately for the worshipper.

original: evā hy asya kāmyā stoma ukthaṃ ca śaṃsyā /🔽indrāya somapītaye ////
analyzed: eva hi asya kāmyā stomaḥ uktham ca śaṃsyā  indrāya soma pītaye
translated: For he is to be praised by the desirable hymn and the laud,🔽Indra, for the drinking of the Soma.

original: indrehi matsy andhaso viśvebhiḥ somaparvabhiḥ /
analyzed: indra ihi matsi andhasaḥ viśvebhiḥ soma parvabhiḥ
translated: Come to me, O Indra, with the juice, with all the Soma feasts,

original: mahāṃ abhiṣṭir ojasā ////
analyzed: mahān abhiṣṭiḥ ojasā
translated: The great protector with might.

original: em enaṃ sṛjatā sute mandim indrāya mandine /
analyzed: ā īm enam sṛjata sute mandim indrāya mandine
translated: Pour him forth, the gladdener, for the gladdened Indra,

original: cakriṃ viśvāni cakraye ////
analyzed: cakrim viśvāni cakraye
translated: The doer of all things for the doer of all things.

original: matsvā suśipra mandibhi stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇe /
analyzed: matsva su śipra mandibhiḥ stomebhiḥ viśvacarṣaṇe
translated: Rejoice, O thou of beautiful brows, with the gladdening hymns, O thou of all men,

original: sacaiṣu savaneṣv ā ////
analyzed: sacā eṣu savaneṣu ā
translated: Be with us at these libations.

original: asṛgram indra te giraḥ prati tvām ud ahāsata /
analyzed: asṛgram indra te giraḥ prati tvām ud ahāsata
translated: The songs have flowed forth to thee, O Indra, they have lifted themselves up to thee,

original: ajoṣā vṛṣabhaṃ patim ////
analyzed: ajoṣāḥ vṛṣabham patim
translated: The milch-kine the strong lord.

original: sam codaya citram arvāg rādha indra vareṇyam /
analyzed: sam codaya citram arvāk rādhaḥ indra vareṇyam
translated: And stimulate for us the wondrous, excellent bounty, O Indra,

original: asad it te vibhu prabhu ////
analyzed: asat id te vibhu prabhu
translated: It is, O thou of wide power, in thy power.

original: asmānt su tatra codayendra rāye rabhasvataḥ /
analyzed: asmān su tatra codaya indra rāye rabhasvataḥ
translated: There, O Indra, stimulate us to wealth that is to be won by strength,

original: tuvidyumna yaśasvataḥ ////
analyzed: tuvi dyumna yaśasvataḥ
translated: O thou of mighty splendour, to be glorified.

original: saṃ gomad indra vājavad asme pṛthu śravo bṛhat /
analyzed: sam gomat indra vājavat asme pṛthu śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: With cattle and strength, O Indra, bestow on us wide fame,

original: viśvāyur dhehy akṣitam ////
analyzed: viśva āyuḥ dhehi akṣitam
translated: Enduring for all life.

original: asme dhehi śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ sahasrasātamam /
analyzed: asme dhehi śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam sahasra sātamam
translated: Grant us high fame, O Indra, and glory most worthy of a thousand (cows).

original: indra tā rathinīr iṣaḥ ////
analyzed: indra tāḥ rathinīḥ iṣaḥ
translated: Those chariot-borne juices, O Indra.

original: vasor indram vasupatiṃ gīrbhir gṛṇanta ṛgmiyam /
analyzed: vasoḥ indram vasu patim gīrbhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ ṛgmiyam
translated: Praising with hymns the wealthy Indra, the lord of wealth, worthy of the Rg,

original: homa gantāram ūtaye ////
analyzed: homa gantāram ūtaye
translated: We call on him to come to our aid.

original: sutesute nyokase bṛhad bṛhata ed ariḥ /
analyzed: sutesute nyokase bṛhat bṛhate ā id ariḥ
translated: On the well-pressed, on the pressed, on the placed, the great, the mighty one, the enemy,

original: indrāya śūṣam arcati ////
analyzed: indrāya śūṣam arcati
translated: Praises the strength of Indra.🔽For in all the libations they urge thee, the one common bull, the impetuous ones each separately, the impetuous ones each separately, seeking the light.🔽We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat,

original: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānam ekaṃ vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svaḥ saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak /
analyzed: viśveṣu hi tvā savaneṣu tuñjate samānam ekam vṛṣamaṇyavaḥ pṛthak svar saniṣyavaḥ pṛthak
translated: We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat.

analyzed: tam tvā nāvam na parṣaṇim śūṣasya dhuri dhīmahi
translated: We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat.🔽We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat.

original: yad gavyantā dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi /
analyzed: yat gavyantā dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi
translated: We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat.🔽We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat.

original: āviṣ karikrad vṛṣaṇaṃ sacābhuvaṃ vajram indra sacābhuvam ////🔽uto no asyā uṣaso juṣeta hy arkasya bodhi haviṣo havīmabhiḥ svarṣātā havīmabhiḥ /

translated: We will place thee on the yoke of strength, as one who carries across a boat.🔽We will place thee on

original: yad indra hantave mṛgho vṛṣā vajriṃ ciketasi /
analyzed: yat indra hantave mṛghaḥ vṛṣā vajrim ciketasi
translated: When, O Indra, thou, O Bull, thinkest of slaying the foe, O Thunderer,

original: ā me asya vedhaso navīyaso manma śrudhi navīyasaḥ ////
analyzed: ā me asya vedhasaḥ navīyasaḥ manma śrudhi navīyasaḥ
translated: Listen to this newest hymn of mine, O thou of newest thoughts.

original: tubhyed imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi /
analyzed: tubhya id imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi
translated: To thee, O Hero, all these libations, to thee all prayers that strengthen I prepare.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhir havyo viśvadhāsi ////
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ havyaḥ viśvadha asi
translated: In every place thou art to be invoked by men.

original: nū cin nu te manyamānasya dasmod aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra /
analyzed: nu cit nu te manyamānasya dasma ud aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra
translated: Never do they attain to the greatness of thee, O wondrous one, when thou art angry, O mighty one,

original: na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ ////
analyzed: na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ
translated: Nor to thy manly power, O Indra, nor to thy bounty.

original: pra vo mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvaṃ pracetase pra sumatiṃ kṛṇudhvam /
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam
translated: Bring to the great one who increaseth greatness, bring to the wise one your devotion.

original: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra carā carṣaṇiprāḥ ////
analyzed: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: Move forward the many tribes, O thou who leadest the people.

original: yadā vajraṃ hiraṇyam id athā rathaṃ harī yamasya vahato vi sūribhiḥ /🔽ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśruta indro vājasya dīrghaśravasas patiḥ ////
analyzed: yadā vajram hiraṇyam id athā ratham harī yamasya vahataḥ vi sūribhiḥ  ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sana śrutaḥ indraḥ vājasya dīrgha śravasaḥ patiḥ
translated: When the golden thunderbolt, the chariot, the two bay steeds of Yama, are yoked by the charioteers,🔽Then the bountiful Indra, of lofty fame, the lord of strength of far-reaching fame, mounts.

original: so cin nu vṛṣṭir yūthyā svā sacāṃ indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritābhi pruṣṇute /
analyzed: sā u cit nu vṛṣṭiḥ yūthyā svā sacā indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritā abhi pruṣṇute
translated: Then, indeed, the rain-cloud, with its own herd, Indra, sprinkles his tawny beard.

original: ava veti sukṣayaṃ sute madhūd id dhūṇoti vāto yathā vanam ////
analyzed: ava veti su kṣayam sute madhu ud id dhūṇoti vātaḥ yathā vanam
translated: He goes to the well-protected place, the honey-drinker, when the Soma is pressed; the wind blows the forest.

original: yo vācā vivāco mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrāśivā jaghāna /
analyzed: yaḥ vācā vivācaḥ mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrā aśivā jaghāna
translated: He who with his voice, with harsh and bitter words, slew many thousands,

original: tattad id asya pauṃsyaṃ gṛṇīmasi piteva yas taviṣīṃ vāvṛdhe śavaḥ ////
analyzed: tat tat id asya pauṃsyam gṛṇīmasi pitā iva yaḥ taviṣīm vāvṛdhe śavaḥ
translated: We praise that manly deed of his, as his might and power have increased like a father's.

original: yac cid dhi satya somapā anāśastā iva smasi /
analyzed: yat cit hi satya soma pāḥ anāśastāḥ iva smasi
translated: Even if we are indeed true, O Soma-drinker, as if without hope,

original: ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Come to us, O Indra, in the praises, in the cattle, in the white horses, in the thousands, O most wealthy one!

original: śiprin vājānāṃ pate śacīvas tava daṃsanā /
analyzed: śiprin vājānām pate śacīvas tava daṃsanā
translated: O you with the beautiful forehead, lord of strength, with powerful teeth,

original: ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Come to us, O Indra, in the praises, in the cattle, in the white horses, in the thousands, O most wealthy one!

original: ni ṣvāpayā mithūdṛśā sastām abudhyamāne /
analyzed: ni ṣvāpayā mithūdṛśā sastām a budhyamāne
translated: Make the two who look at each other fall asleep, the two who are not awake.

original: ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Come to us, O Indra, in the praises, in the cattle, in the white horses, in the thousands, O most wealthy one!

original: sasantu tyā arātayo bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ /
analyzed: sasantu tyāḥ arātayaḥ bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ
translated: Let the enemies be destroyed, let the gifts of the hero be recognized.

original: ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Come to us, O Indra, in the praises, in the cattle, in the white horses, in the thousands, O most wealthy one!

original: sam indra gardabhaṃ mṛṇa nuvantaṃ papayāmuyā /
analyzed: sam indra gardabham mṛṇa nuvantam papaya amuyā
translated: Crush the ass, O Indra, who is running away, who is carried away by the disease.

original: ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Come to us, O Indra, in the praises, in the cattle, in the white horses, in the thousands, O most wealthy one!

original: patāti kuṇḍṛṇācyā dūraṃ vāto vanād adhi /
analyzed: patāti kuṇḍṛṇācyā dūram vātaḥ vanāt adhi
translated: The wind blows far away from the wood, with a whirring sound.

original: ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Come to us, O Indra, in our assemblies, among our fair horses and our cattle, among our thousands, O most wealthy one.

original: sarvaṃ parikrośaṃ jahi jambhayā kṛkadāśvam /🔽ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣv aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha ////
analyzed: sarvam parikrośam jahi jambhaya kṛkadāśvam  ā tū naḥ indra śaṃsaya goṣu aśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīmagha
translated: Destroy all the howling, crush the howling dog.🔽Come to us, O Indra, in our assemblies, among our fair horses and our cattle, among our thousands, O most wealthy one.

original: vi tvā tatasre mithunā avasyavo vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣanta indra niḥsṛjaḥ /
analyzed: vi tvā tatasre mithunāḥ avasyavaḥ vrajasya sātā gavyasya niḥsṛjaḥ sakṣantaḥ indra niḥsṛjaḥ
translated: The pairs of supplicants have spread out for thee, from the good pasture of the cattle thou hast released them, O Indra, thou hast released them.

original: yad gavyanta dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi /
analyzed: yat gavyanta dvā janā svar yantā samūhasi
translated: When thou, O Indra, gatherest to thyself the two peoples who long for heaven, who long for heaven.

original: āviṣ karikrad vṛṣaṇaṃ sacābhuvaṃ vajram indra sacābhuvam ////🔽viduṣ ṭe asya vīryasya pūravaḥ puro yad indra śāradīr avātiraḥ sāsahāno avātiraḥ /
analyzed: āvis karikrat vṛṣaṇam sacābhuvam vajram indra sacābhuvam  viduḥ te asya vīryasya pūravaḥ puraḥ yat indra śāradīḥ avātiraḥ sāsahānaḥ avātiraḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast made manifest the strong one who shares the same abode with thee, the thunderbolt which shares the same abode with thee.🔽The Pûrus have known this thy manly strength, O Indra, when thou didst overthrow the forts of autumn, when thou didst overthrow them with might.

original: śāsas tam indra martyam ayajuṃ śavasas pate /
analyzed: śāsaḥ tam indra martyam ayajum śavasaḥ pate
translated: O Indra, lord of power, punish that mortal who offers not, who offers not.

original: mahīm amuṣṇāḥ pṛthivīm imā apo mandasāna imā apaḥ ////
analyzed: mahīm amuṣṇāḥ pṛthivīm imāḥ apaḥ mandasānaḥ imāḥ apaḥ
translated: Thou hast enjoyed the great earth, these waters, O thou who rejoicest in these waters.

original: ād it te asya vīryasya carkiran madeṣu vṛṣann uśijo yad āvitha sakhīyato yad āvitha /
analyzed: āt id te asya vīryasya carkiran madeṣu vṛṣan uśijaḥ yat āvitha sakhīyataḥ yat āvitha
translated: Even then, O strong one, the eager ones have extolled this thy manly strength in the feasts, when thou hast helped the friend of the friend, when thou hast helped.

original: cakartha kāram ebhyaḥ pṛtanāsu pravantave /🔽te anyāmanyāṃ nadyaṃ saniṣṇata śravasyantaḥ saniṣṇata ////
analyzed: cakartha kāram ebhyaḥ pṛtanāsu pravantave  te anyām anyām nadyam saniṣṇata śravasyantaḥ saniṣṇata
translated: Thou hast done this service for them, to be extolled in battles.🔽They have gained one prize after another, they have gained prizes, longing for glory.

original: vane na vā yo ny adhāyi cākraṃ chucir vāṃ stomo bhuraṇāv ajīgaḥ /
analyzed: vane na vā yaḥ ni adhāyi cākram śuciḥ vām stomaḥ bhuraṇau ajīgaḥ
translated: He who has laid his wheel in the wood, your pure praise has reached the two swift ones.

original: yasyed indraḥ purudineṣu hotā nṛṇāṃ narvo nṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān ////
analyzed: yasya id indraḥ puru dineṣu hotā nṛṇām narvaḥ nṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān
translated: Whose priest Indra is among many people, the best of men, the protector of men.

original: pra te asyā uṣasaḥ prāparasyā nṛtau syāma nṛtam asya nṛṇām /
analyzed: pra te asyāḥ uṣasaḥ pra aparasyāḥ nṛtau syāma nṛtam asya nṛṇām
translated: In the assembly of this your latest dawn may we be, the assembly of this best of men.

original: anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahan nṝn kutsena ratho yo asat sasavān ////
analyzed: anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahat nṝn kutsena rathaḥ yaḥ asat sasavān
translated: Following the three sorrows, a hundred men, with Kutsa, may the chariot be, which is rich.

original: kas te mada indra rantyo bhūd duro giro abhy ugro vi dhāva /
analyzed: kaḥ te madaḥ indra rantyaḥ bhūt duraḥ giraḥ abhī ugraḥ vi dhāva
translated: What is your gladdening drink, O Indra, what your delightful songs? The strong one runs to the doors.

original: kad vāho arvāg upa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyām upamam rādho annaiḥ ////🔽kad u dyumnam indra tvāvato nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kan na āgan /
analyzed: kad vāho arvāk upa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyām upamam rādhaḥ annaiḥ  kad u dyumnam indra tvāvataḥ nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kad naḥ āgan
translated: When will the chariot come to me? When will my thought? I can approach you with gifts of food.🔽When, O Indra, will you come to the people who are yours, with what thought will you come?

original: mitro na satya urugāya bhṛtyā anne samasya yad asan manīṣāḥ ////
analyzed: mitraḥ na satyaḥ uru gāya bhṛtyāḥ anne samasya yat asan manīṣāḥ
translated: Like a true friend, O wide-ruler, when your thoughts are with food, then are your servants.

original: preraya sūro arthaṃ na pāraṃ ye asya kāmaṃ janidhā iva gman /
analyzed: preraya sūraḥ artham na pāram ye asya kāmam janidhāḥ iva gman
translated: Drive the sun to his goal, to the other side, those who have reached his desire as if to a birthplace.

original: giraś ca ye te tuvijāta pūrvīr nara indra pratiśikṣanty annaiḥ ////
analyzed: giraḥ ca ye te tuvi jāta pūrvīḥ naraḥ indra pratiśikṣanti annaiḥ
translated: And those many songs of thine, O thou of mighty birth, which men, O Indra, imitate with food.

original: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyaur majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena /
analyzed: mātre nu te su mite indra pūrvī dyauḥ majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena
translated: O Indra, thy two well-measured portions are the sky in greatness and the earth in wisdom.

original: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādnan bhavantu pītaye madhūni ////
analyzed: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādnan bhavantu pītaye madhūni
translated: Let the pressed juices, rich in ghee, be sweet for thee to drink, and the meath.

original: ā madhvo asmā asicann amatram indrāya pūrṇaṃ sa hi satyarādhāḥ /
analyzed: ā madhvaḥ asmai asican amatram indrāya pūrṇam sa hi satya rādhāḥ
translated: They have poured the honey-mixture into the cup for Indra, for he is the fulfiller of promises.

original: sa vāvṛdhe varimann ā pṛthivyā abhi kratvā naryaḥ pauṃsyaiś ca ////
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhe variman ā pṛthivyāḥ abhi kratvā naryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ ca
translated: He has grown in greatness beyond the earth, the man, through his wisdom and manly deeds.

original: vy ānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā āsmai yatante sakhyāya pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: vi ānaṭ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ su ojāḥ ā asmai yatante sakhyāya pūrvīḥ
translated: Indra has shattered the forts of the foe, many strive to be his friend.

original: ā smā rathaṃ na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yaṃ bhadrayā sumatyā codayāse ////
analyzed: ā smā ratham na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yam bhadrayā sumatyā codayāse
translated: Mount the chariot in the battles, which thou dost urge on with good will and gracious favour.

original: ā satyo yātu maghavāṃ ṛjīṣī dravantv asya haraya upa naḥ /
analyzed: ā satyaḥ yātu maghavān ṛjīṣī dravantu asya harayaḥ upa naḥ
translated: Let the true, the bountiful, the impetuous one come to us. Let his tawny coursers hasten to us.

original: tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṃ karate gṛṇānaḥ ////🔽ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai /
analyzed: tasmai id andhaḥ suṣuma su dakṣam iha abhipitvam karate gṛṇānaḥ  ava sya śūra adhvanaḥ na ante smin naḥ adya savane mandadhyai
translated: To him, the well-disposed, the very wise, the singer here will offer the most acceptable worship.🔽At the end of his journey let the hero rejoice in this our libation this day.

original: śaṃsāty uktham uśaneva vedhāś cikituṣe asuryāya manma ////
analyzed: śaṃsāti uktham uśanā iva vedhāḥ cikituṣe asuryāya manma
translated: He praises the hymn as a creator like Uśanâ, a thought to the wise, to the Asura.

original: kavir na niṇyaṃ vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekaṃ vipipāno arcāt /
analyzed: kaviḥ na niṇyam vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekam vipipānaḥ arcāt
translated: The sage, arranging the rites, the bull, when he drinks the juice, extols the pressing-stone,

original: diva itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cic cakrur vayunā gṛṇantaḥ ////
analyzed: divaḥ itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cit cakruḥ vayunā gṛṇantaḥ
translated: Here from the sky the seven priests hath he begotten: in one day they, the singers, have performed the rites.

original: svar yad vedi sudṛśīkam arkair mahi jyotī rurucur yad dha vastoḥ /
analyzed: svar yat vedi sudṛśīkam arkaiḥ mahi jyotiḥ rurucuḥ yat ha vastoḥ
translated: When the altar hath been made beautiful with lights, the great light hath shone forth from the eastern quarter.

original: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaś cakāra nṛtamo abhiṣṭau ////
analyzed: andhā tamāṃsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: He hath dispelled the blinding darknesses: the best of men hath made the people visible.

original: vavakṣa indro amitam ṛjiṣy ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā /
analyzed: vavakṣe indraḥ amitam ṛjiṣi ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
translated: Indra hath waxed exceeding great: he hath filled both the worlds with his greatness.

original: ataś cid asya mahimā vi recy abhi yo viśvā bhuvanā babhūva ////🔽viśvāni śakro naryāṇi vidvān apo rireca sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ /
analyzed: atas cit asya mahimā vi reci abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā babhūva  viśvāni śakraḥ naryāṇi vidvān apaḥ rireca sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ
translated: From him hath his greatness spread abroad, who hath become superior to all things that be.🔽Shakra, who knoweth all manly deeds, hath sent away the waters with his willing friends.

original: aśmānaṃ cid ye bibhidur vacobhir vrajam gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ ////🔽apo vṛtraṃ vavrivāṃsaṃ parāhan prāvat te vajraṃ pṛthivī sacetāḥ /
analyzed: aśmānam cit ye bibhiduḥ vacobhiḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ  apaḥ vṛtram vavrivāṃsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ
translated: They who with words cleft even the stone, the eager ones have opened the stall of cattle.🔽He smote away the cloud-encompassed Vr̥itra: the earth with all her heart approved thy thunder.

original: prārṇāṃsi samudriyāṇy ainoḥ patir bhavaṃ chavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo ////
analyzed: pra arṇāṃsi samudriyāṇi ainoḥ patiḥ bhavam śavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo
translated: Thou hast brought hither the ocean's watery depths: by might, O Hero, thou hast become their Lord.

original: apo yad adriṃ puruhūta dardar āvir bhuvat saramā pūrvyaṃ te /
analyzed: apa u yat adrim puruhūta dardar āvis bhuvat saramā pūrvyam te
translated: When thou, O much-invoked, didst hurl the rock at the waters, Saramā became manifest to thee, O ancient one.

original: sa no netā vājam ā darṣi bhūriṃ gotrā rujann aṅgirobhir gṛṇānaḥ ////
analyzed: sa naḥ netā vājam ā darṣi bhūrim gotrā rujan aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: May he, our leader, show us abundant strength, rending the stalls of cattle, praised by the Angirases.

original: tad vo gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane /🔽śaṃ yad gave na śākine ////
analyzed: tat vaḥ gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane  śam yat gave na śākine
translated: Sing that to him, O friend, to him who is pressed, to the hero who is invoked by many,🔽When he is gracious to the cow, to the mighty one.

original: na ghā vasur ni yamate dānaṃ vājasya gomataḥ /
analyzed: na ghā vasuḥ ni yamate dānam vājasya gomataḥ
translated: The good man does not delay the gift of strength, of cattle,

original: yat sīm upa śravad giraḥ ////🔽kuvitsasya pra hi vrajaṃ gomantaṃ dasyuhā gamat /
analyzed: yat sīm upa śravat giraḥ  kuvitsasya pra hi vrajam gomantam dasyu hā gamat
translated: When he listens to our songs.🔽May he come to thy fold, O thou who slayest the Dasyus, to the fold full of cattle,

original: śacībhir apa no varat ////
analyzed: śacībhiḥ apa naḥ varat
translated: With his powers may he grant us choice boons.

original: indra kratuṃ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā /
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā
translated: O Indra, bring us the power, as a father to his sons.

original: śikṣā ṇo asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotir aśīmahi ////
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi
translated: Teach us, O much-invoked one, in this our work, that we may live and win the light.

original: mā no ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyo māśivāso ava kramuḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyaḥ mā aśivāsaḥ ava kramuḥ
translated: Let not unknown, ill-disposed people, wearing black garments, come nigh us.

original: tvayā vayaṃ pravataḥ śaśvatīr apo 'ti śūra tarāmasi ////
analyzed: tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīḥ apa u ti śūra tarāmasi
translated: With thee, O hero, we will pass over the far-extended waters.

original: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bharaṃ ojiṣṭhaṃ papuri śravaḥ /
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭham naḥ ā bhara ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ
translated: O Indra, bring us the most manly, the most powerful, the most famous,

original: yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ ////
analyzed: yena ime citra vajrahasta rodasī ā ubhe su śipra prāḥ
translated: By which, O thou of wondrous deeds, O thou of the thunderbolt in thy hand, O thou of beautiful eyebrows, thou hast filled both these worlds.

original: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇīsahaṃ rājan deveṣu hūmahe /
analyzed: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇī saham rājan deveṣu hūmahe
translated: We invoke thee, O king, as mighty, victorious over men, for help, among the gods.

original: viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso 'mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi ////
analyzed: viśvā su naḥ vithurā pibdanā vaso mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi
translated: O Vasu, crush all our enemies, O mighty one, who are hard to subdue.

original: yad dyāva indra te śataṃ śataṃ bhūmir uta syuḥ /
analyzed: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmiḥ uta syuḥ
translated: If, O Indra, the heavens were thine, and the earth were a hundred times a hundred,

original: na tvā vajrint sahasraṃ sūryā anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī ////
analyzed: na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī
translated: Not a thousand suns, O Thunderer, could equal thee at birth, O thou who art born in both worlds.

original: ā paprātha mahinā kṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā /
analyzed: ā paprātha mahinā kṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā
translated: Thou, O bull, hast spread thyself with thy dark might over all, O strongest one, with thy strength.

original: asmāṃ ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhir ūtibhiḥ ////
analyzed: asmān ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Help us, O bountiful one, in the rich pasture, O thou who hast the thunderbolt, with wondrous aids.

original: yad indra yāvatas tvam etāvad aham īśīya /
analyzed: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya
translated: If, O Indra, I were to possess as much as thou,

original: stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya ////
analyzed: stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya
translated: I would be willing to be thy praiser, O thou who art rich in gifts, I would not be a fool.

original: śikṣeyam in mahayate divedive rāya ā kuhacidvide /
analyzed: śikṣeyam id mahayate dive dive rāyaḥ ā kuhacid vide
translated: I would learn to magnify thee day by day, to find wealth somewhere,

original: nahi tvad anyan maghavan na āpyaṃ vasyo asti pitā cana ////🔽indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastimat /
analyzed: nahi tvat anyat maghavan naḥ āpyam vasyaḥ asti pitā cana  indra tri dhātu śaraṇam tri varūtham svastimat
translated: For there is no better, O bountiful one, than thou, not even a father.🔽O Indra, the threefold refuge, the threefold protection, which brings prosperity,

original: chardir yacha maghavadbhyaś ca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyum ebhyaḥ ////
analyzed: chardiḥ yaccha maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca yāvaya didyum ebhyaḥ
translated: Grant us shelter, O bountiful one, and ward off the thunderbolt from us and from these.

original: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhur abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā /
analyzed: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhuḥ abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: Those who with a mind intent on cattle have attacked the enemy, and strike him down with courage,🔽Be thou, O bountiful Indra, lover of song, our nearest protector of our bodies.

original: agha smā no maghavann indra girvaṇas tanūpā antamo bhava ////
analyzed: agha smā naḥ maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ tanū pāḥ antamaḥ bhava
translated: O Indra, come, O thou of wondrous light! these juices are ready for thee, O thou who givest much.🔽They are purified with the finest drops.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.

original: indrā yāhi citrabhāno sutā ime tvāyavaḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi citra bhāno sutāḥ ime tvāyavaḥ
translated: O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.

original: aṇvībhis tanā pūtāsaḥ ////
analyzed: aṇvībhiḥ tanā pūtāsaḥ
translated: To the prayers of the priest.

original: indrā yāhi dhiyeṣito viprajutaḥ sutāvataḥ /
analyzed: indra ā yāhi dhiyā iṣitaḥ vipra jutaḥ sutāvataḥ
translated: O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.

original: upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ ////🔽indrā yāhi tūtujāna upa brahmāṇi harivaḥ /
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ  indra ā yāhi tūtujānaḥ upa brahmāṇi harivas
translated: To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.

original: sute dadhiṣva naś canaḥ ////
analyzed: sute dadhiṣva naḥ canaḥ
translated: O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.

original: mā cid anyad vi śaṃsata sakhāyo mā riṣaṇyata /
analyzed: mā cit anyat vi śaṃsata sakhāyaḥ mā riṣaṇyata
translated: To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.

original: indram it stotā vṛṣaṇaṃ sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata ////
analyzed: indram id stotā vṛṣaṇam sacā sute muhur ukthā ca śaṃsata
translated: O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.

original: avakrakṣiṇaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yathājuram gāṃ na carṣaṇīsaham /
analyzed: avakrakṣiṇam vṛṣabham yathā ājuram gām na carṣaṇīsaham
translated: To the prayers of the priest.

original: vidveṣaṇaṃ saṃvananobhayaṃkaraṃ maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam ////
analyzed: vidveṣaṇam saṃvanana ubhayaṃkaram maṃhiṣṭham ubhayāvinam
translated: O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.

original: yac cid dhi tvā janā ime nānā havanta ūtaye /
analyzed: yat cit hi tvā janāḥ ime nānā havante ūtaye
translated: To the prayers of the priest.🔽O Indra, come, urged on by our thoughts, sent forth by the priests, by those who press the Soma.🔽To the prayers of the priest.

original: asmākaṃ brahmedam indra bhūtu te 'hā viśvā ca vardhanam ////
analyzed: asmākam brahma idam indra bhūtu te hāḥ viśvā ca vardhanam
translated: O Indra, come, urged on

original: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścito 'ryo vipo janānām /🔽upa kramasva pururūpam ā bhara vājaṃ nediṣṭham ūtaye ////
analyzed: vi tartūryante maghavan vipaścitaḥ ryaḥ vipaḥ janānām  upa kramasva puru rūpam ā bhara vājam nediṣṭham ūtaye
translated: The wise ones are being praised, O bountiful one, the noble thoughts of the people.🔽Come hither, bring the most varied food for our help.

original: brahmaṇā te brahmayujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāda āśū /
analyzed: brahmaṇā te brahma yujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāde āśū
translated: With holy power I yoke thy two bay steeds yoked by holy power, swift friends who rejoice together.

original: sthiraṃ rathaṃ sukham indrādhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvāṃ upa yāhi somam ////
analyzed: sthiram ratham sukham indra adhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvān upa yāhi somam
translated: Sitting in the firm, pleasant chariot, O Indra, knowing, wise, come to the Soma.

original: adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṃ dugdham aṃśuṃ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām /
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ ruṇam dugdham aṃśum juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
translated: O Adhvaryus, offer the red-milked Amsu to the bull of the earth.

original: gaurād vedīyāṃ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam ichan ////
analyzed: gaurāt vedīyān avapānam indraḥ viśvāhā id yāti suta somam ichan
translated: From the white one, Indra, the more excellent drink, desiring, he goes to the Soma-pressed (place) every day.

original: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārv annaṃ divedive pītim id asya vakṣi /
analyzed: yat dadhiṣe pradivi cāru annam dive dive pītim id asya vakṣi
translated: The good food which thou hast laid in the heaven, tell us of its drinking day by day.

original: uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān ////
analyzed: uta hṛdā uta manasā juṣāṇaḥ uśan indra prasthitān pāhi somān
translated: And being pleased with the heart and the mind, O Indra, being eager, protect the Somas offered.

original: jajñānaḥ somaṃ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca /
analyzed: jajñānaḥ somam sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca
translated: Being born, thou drankest the Soma with might; thy mother told of thy greatness.

original: endra paprāthorv antarikṣaṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha ////
analyzed: ā indra paprātha uru antarikṣam yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha
translated: O Indra, thou hast filled the wide atmosphere; in battle thou hast made room for the gods.

original: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān /
analyzed: yat yodhayā mahataḥ manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān
translated: When thou didst fight with the great ones who thought themselves mighty, thou didst crush them with thy arms, the boastful ones.

original: yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṃ tvayājiṃ sauśravasaṃ jayema ////
analyzed: yat vā nṛbhiḥ vṛtaḥ indra abhiyudhyāḥ tam tvayā ājim sauśravasam jayema
translated: Or, when surrounded by men, O Indra, in battle, may we win through thee that contest, that glory.

original: prendrasya vocaṃ prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra /
analyzed: pra indrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra
translated: I will proclaim Indra's earliest deeds, and the new ones which the bountiful one has done.

original: yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya ////
analyzed: yadā id adevīḥ asahiṣṭa māyāḥ atha abhavat kevalaḥ somaḥ asya
translated: When the godless ones could not endure his magic power, then Soma became his alone.

original: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṃ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya /
analyzed: tava idam viśvam abhitas paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya
translated: This whole world around is thine to rule, all that thou seest with the eye of the sun.

original: gavām asi gopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ ////
analyzed: gavām asi go patiḥ ekaḥ indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ
translated: Thou art the lord of cattle, O Indra, alone. May we enjoy thy bestowed wealth.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya
translated: O Brihaspati, you and Indra are the lords of wealth, of the heavenly and of the earthly.

original: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ ////
analyzed: dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Grant wealth even to the poor who praises you. Do you, O protectors, always protect us with your blessings.

original: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa /
analyzed: yaḥ tastambha sahasā vi jmaḥ antān bṛhaspatiḥ triṣadhasthaḥ raveṇa
translated: He who with might hath propped the ends of earth and heaven, Brihaspati, he who abideth in the three realms, with his roar.

original: taṃ pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam ////
analyzed: tam pratnāsaḥ ṛṣayaḥ dīdhyānāḥ puras viprāḥ dadhire mandra jihvam
translated: The ancient sages, reflecting, the priests have placed him in the front, he who hath a sweet tongue.

original: dhunetayaḥ supraketaṃ madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre /
analyzed: dhunetayaḥ su praketam madantaḥ bṛhaspate abhi ye naḥ tatasre
translated: The Dhunītayas, rejoicing in the well-known one, O Brihaspati, those who have scattered against us,

original: pṛṣantaṃ sṛpram adabdham ūrvaṃ bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim ////
analyzed: pṛṣantam sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatāt asya yonim
translated: O Brihaspati, protect his unfailing, strong, and safe abode.

original: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā te ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvat atas ā te ṛta spṛśaḥ ni seduḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, those who touch the truth have sat down near thee, in the highest, most distant abode.

original: tubhyaṃ khātā avatā adridugdhā madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam ////
analyzed: tubhyam khātāḥ avatāḥ adri dugdhāḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam
translated: For thee the dug-out pits, dug out by the stone, flow with sweet juice around the wide-spread (altar).

original: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ mahaḥ jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman
translated: Brihaspati, being born first, in the highest heaven, in the great light,

original: saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṃsi ////
analyzed: sapta āsyaḥ tuvi jātaḥ raveṇa vi sapta raśmiḥ adhamat tamāṃsi
translated: With seven mouths, well-born, with his ray, with seven rays he hath dispelled the darkness.

original: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā gaṇena valaṃ ruroja phaligaṃ ravena /
analyzed: sa suṣṭubhā saḥ ṛkvatā gaṇena valam ruroja phaligam ravena
translated: He with the fair hymn, with the Rik, with the troop, hath with his ray burst open the cloud, the rain-cloud.

original: bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ usriyāḥ havyasūdaḥ kanikradat vāvaśatīḥ ud ājat
translated: Brihaspati, the invoker of the Maruts, hath come forth with the lowing, the calling cows.

original: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ /
analyzed: eva pitre viśva devāya vṛṣṇe yajñaiḥ vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
translated: Thus let us serve with sacrifice, with homage, with oblations, the father, the all-god, the strong one.

original: bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām ////
analyzed: bṛhaspate su prajāḥ vīravantaḥ vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: O Brihaspati, may we be prosperous, having good offspring, rich in heroes, lords of wealth.

original: asteva su prataraṃ lāyam asyan bhūṣann iva pra bharā stomam asmai /
analyzed: astā iva su prataram lāyam asyan bhūṣan iva pra bhara stomam asmai
translated: As one who seeks a good ford, laying aside (his weapons), as one who adorns himself, bring forth the hymn to him.

original: vācā viprās tarata vācam aryo ni rāmaya jaritaḥ soma indram ////
analyzed: vācā viprāḥ tarata vācam aryaḥ ni rāmaya jaritar some indram
translated: O priests, with speech cross the speech of the foe; O praisers, make Indra glad with the Soma.

original: dohena gām upa śikṣā sakhāyaṃ pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram /
analyzed: dohena gām upa śikṣa sakhāyam pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram
translated: With the milking of the cow instruct thy friend, O singer, awaken Indra, the lover.

original: kośaṃ na pūrṇaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya maghadeyāya śūram ////
analyzed: kośam na pūrṇam vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya magha deyāya śūram
translated: As a full treasure-house filled with wealth, so lead thou hither the hero to receive our gifts.

original: kim aṅga tvā maghavan bhojam āhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayaṃ tvā śṛṇomi /
analyzed: kim aṅga tvā maghavan bhojam āhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayam tvā śṛṇomi
translated: Why, O bountiful one, do they call thee the giver of food? Excite me: I listen to thee as one to be excited.

original: apnasvatī mama dhīr astu śakra vasuvidaṃ bhagam indrā bharā naḥ ////🔽tvāṃ janā mamasatyeṣv indra saṃtasthānā vi hvayante samīke /
analyzed: apnasvatī mama dhīḥ astu śakra vasu vidam bhagam indra ā bhara naḥ  tvām janāḥ mamasatyeṣu indra saṃtasthānāḥ vi hvayante samīke
translated: Let my thought be full of wealth for thee, O Sakra: bring us, O Indra, good luck that shall find treasures.🔽In the contests of our enemies, O Indra, men who are not true to me call thee to their aid.

original: atrā yujaṃ kṛṇute yo haviṣmān nāsunvatā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭi śūraḥ ////
analyzed: atrā yujam kṛṇute yaḥ haviṣmān na a sunvatā sakhyam vaṣṭi śūraḥ
translated: The hero makes an ally of him who brings oblations: he does not choose the friendship of him who offers not.

original: dhanaṃ na spandraṃ bahulaṃ yo asmai tīvrānt somāṃ āsunoti prayasvān /
analyzed: dhanam na spandram bahulam yaḥ asmai tīvrān somān āsunoti prayasvān
translated: To him who presses for him the strong Soma juice, who brings him much wealth like a chariot,

original: tasmai śatrūnt sutukān prātar ahno ni svaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram ////
analyzed: tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātar ahnaḥ ni svaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram
translated: To him in the morning he smites the wicked foes, the wicked Vr̥itra, as a young woman (smites) with her hand.

original: yasmin vayaṃ dadhimā śaṃsam indre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavā kāmam asme /
analyzed: yasmin vayam śaṃsam indre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavā kāmam asme
translated: In Indra, in whom we have believed, in whom the bountiful One has set his heart on us,

original: ārāc cit san bhayatām asya śatrur ny asmai dyumnā janyā namantām ////
analyzed: ārāt cit san bhayatām asya śatruḥ ni asmai dyumnā janyā namantām
translated: Even from afar let his foe tremble before him: to him let all the glories of the people bow them down.

original: ārāc chatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugro yaḥ śambaḥ puruhūta tena /
analyzed: ārāt śatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugraḥ yaḥ śambaḥ puruhūta tena
translated: Drive the foe far away, O thou of mighty power, drive him away with thy terrible thunderbolt, O thou who art invoked by many.

original: asme dhehi yavamad gomad indra kṛdhī dhiyaṃ jaritre vājaratnām ////🔽pra yam antar vṛṣasavāso ajman tīvrāḥ somā bahulāntāsa indram /
analyzed: asme dhehi yavamat gomat indra kṛdhi dhiyam jaritre vāja ratnām  pra yam antar vṛṣa savāsaḥ ajman tīvrāḥ somāḥ bahula antāsaḥ indram
translated: Grant us, O Indra, wealth in cattle and corn; make the singer's song rich in booty.🔽Whom, in the assembly, the strong Soma-draughts, with much food, stir for the banquet, Indra.

original: nāha dāmānaṃ maghavā ni yaṃsan ni sunvate vahati bhūri vāmam ////
analyzed: na aha dāmānam maghavā ni yaṃsat ni sunvate vahati bhūri vāmam
translated: Maghavan will not break the bond, but brings abundant wealth to the presser.

original: uta prahām atidīvā jayati kṛtam iva śvaghnī vi cinoti kāle /
analyzed: uta prahām atidīvāḥ jayati kṛtam iva śvaghnī vi cinoti kāle
translated: Even the weak conquers by over-reaching, like a bitch tearing in season.

original: yo devakāmo na dhanaṃ ruṇaddhi sam it taṃ rāyaḥ sṛjati svadhābhiḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ deva kāmaḥ na dhanam ruṇaddhi sam id tam rāyaḥ sṛjati svadhābhiḥ
translated: He whom the God loves, who does not withhold his wealth, him the Rishis make rich with their own treasures.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena vā kṣudhaṃ puruhūta viśve /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena vā kṣudham puruhūta viśve
translated: With cattle may we pass over trouble and evil want, with barley, O all-inviting one, hunger.

original: vayaṃ rājasu prathamā dhanāny ariṣṭāso vṛjanībhir jayema ////
analyzed: vayam rājasu prathamā dhanāni ariṣṭāsaḥ vṛjanībhiḥ jayema
translated: May we, uninjured, with our bands, win the first treasures among the kings.

original: bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghayoḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghayoḥ
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from below and above, O thou of evil name.

original: indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyo varīyaḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varīyaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as a friend, grant us a wide space, O friend.

original: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatir āṅgiraso haviṣmān /
analyzed: yaḥ adri bhid prathama jāḥ ṛtāvā bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ haviṣmān
translated: He who is the breaker of mountains, firstborn, righteous, Brihaspati, the son of Angiras, who brings oblations,

original: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti ////
analyzed: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasad pitā naḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: The two-stepped one, dwelling in the forenoon, the father of us all, the bull roars to the two world-halves.

original: janāya cid ya īvate u lokaṃ bṛhaspatir devahūtau cakāra /
analyzed: janāya cit yaḥ īvate u lokam bṛhaspatiḥ deva hūtau cakāra
translated: Even for the people who belong to the Ivu race, Brihaspati has made a place in the invocation of the gods.

original: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayaṃ chatrūṃr amitrān pṛtsu sāhan ////🔽bṛhaspatiḥ sam ajayad vasūni maho vrajān gomate deva eṣaḥ /
analyzed: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puraḥ dardarīti jayam śatrūṃr amitrān pṛtsu sāhan  bṛhaspatiḥ sam ajayat vasūni mahaḥ vrajān gomate devaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Slaying the Vr̥itras, he cleaves the forts asunder, conquering the enemies, the foes, in battles.🔽Brihaspati has won the treasures, the great herds of cattle, the god of all people.

original: apaḥ siṣāsant svar apratīto bṛhaspatir hanty amitram arkaiḥ ////
analyzed: apaḥ siṣāsan svar apratītaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ hanti amitram arkaiḥ
translated: Brihaspati, longing for the waters, the heaven, unconquered, slays the foe with his rays.

original: imāṃ dhiyaṃ saptaśīrṣṇīṃ pitā na ṛtaprajātāṃ bṛhatīm avindat /
analyzed: imām dhiyam sapta śīrṣṇīm pitā naḥ ṛta prajātām bṛhatīm avindat
translated: This thought, seven-headed, the father found, the great one, born of holy order.

original: turīyaṃ svij janayad viśvajanyo 'yāsya uktham indrāya śaṃsan ////
analyzed: turīyam svid janayat viśvajanyaḥ yā asyaḥ uktham indrāya śaṃsan
