translated: The all-creating one, the fourth self-existent one, singing the praise to Indra, has produced the hymn.

original: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛju dīdhyānā divas putrāso asurasya vīrāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtam śaṃsantaḥ ṛju dīdhyānāḥ divaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ
translated: Singing the truth, thinking straight, the sons of heaven, the heroes of the Asura,

original: vipraṃ padam aṅgiraso dadhānā yajñasya dhāma prathamaṃ mananta ////
analyzed: vipram padam aṅgirasaḥ dadhānāḥ yajñasya dhāma prathamam mananta
translated: Placing the sage in the place, the Angirases, first think of the abode of sacrifice.

original: haṃsair iva sakhibhir vāvadadbhir aśmanmayāni nahanā vyasyan /
analyzed: haṃsaiḥ iva sakhibhiḥ vāvadadbhiḥ aśmanmayāni nahanā vyasyan
translated: Like swans, with their friends who utter their cries, opening the stone-built enclosures,

original: bṛhaspatir abhikanikradad gā uta prāstaud uc ca vidvāṃ agāyat ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ abhikanikradat gāḥ uta prāstaut ud ca vidvān agāyat
translated: Brihaspati bellowed at the cows, and he sang and praised with his knowledge.

original: avo dvābhyāṃ para ekayā gā guhā tiṣṭhantīr anṛtasya setau /
analyzed: avas dvābhyām paras ekayā gāḥ guhā tiṣṭhantīḥ anṛtasya setau
translated: With two (verses) he opened the two doors, with one he let the cows out, which were standing in the stronghold of untruth.

original: bṛhaspatis tamasi jyotir ichan ud usrā ākar vi hi tisra āvaḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ tamasi jyotiḥ ichan ud usrāḥ ākaḥ vi hi tisraḥ āvaḥ
translated: Brihaspati, seeking light in the darkness, raised the two dawns, for he opened the three (worlds).

original: vibhidyā puraṃ śayathem apācīṃ nis trīṇi sākam udadher akṛntat /
analyzed: vibhidya puram śayatha īm apācīm niḥ trīṇi sākam udadheḥ akṛntat
translated: He cleft the western fortress of the demon, and from the ocean he brought out the three (worlds) together.

original: bṛhaspatir uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ gām arkaṃ viveda stanayann iva dyauḥ ////🔽indro valaṃ rakṣitāraṃ dughānāṃ kareṇeva vi cakartā raveṇa /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ uṣasam sūryam gām arkam viveda stanayan iva dyauḥ  indraḥ valam rakṣitāram dughānām kareṇa iva vi cakarta raveṇa
translated: Brihaspati discovered the dawn, the sun, the cow, the light, like the thundering sky.🔽Indra, like a hand, with his roar cleft asunder Vala, the guardian of the milch-cows.

original: svedāñjibhir āśiram ichamāno 'rodayat paṇim ā gā amuṣṇāt ////
analyzed: sveda añjibhiḥ āśiram icchamānaḥ rodayat paṇim ā gāḥ amuṣṇāt
translated: Seeking the milk-mixture with his sweat-smeared (hands), he caused the treasure to flow, and he milked the cows.

original: sa īṃ satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhir godhāyasaṃ vi dhanasair adardaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ īm satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhiḥ godhāyasam vi dhanasaiḥ adardar
translated: He, with his true, pure friends, with the Dhanasans, cleft asunder the cow-stealer.

original: brahmaṇas patir vṛṣabhir varāhair gharmasvedebhir draviṇaṃ vy ānaṭ ////
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ vṛṣabhiḥ varāhaiḥ gharma svedebhiḥ draviṇam vi ānaṭ
translated: Brahmanaspati, with the bulls, the boars, with those sweating with heat, distributed the wealth.

original: te satyena manasā gopatiṃ gā iyānāsa iṣaṇayanta dhībhiḥ /
analyzed: te satyena manasā gopatim gāḥ iyānāsaḥ iṣaṇayanta dhībhiḥ
translated: With their true mind, tending the lord of the cows, they urged him on with their thoughts, as they went to the cows.

original: bṛhaspatir mithoavadyapebhir ud usriyā asṛjata svayugbhiḥ ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ mithoavadyapebhiḥ ud usriyāḥ asṛjata sva yugbhiḥ
translated: Brihaspati, with his own companions, who remove mutual faults, has created the cows.

original: taṃ vardhayanto matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃham iva nānadataṃ sadhasthe /
analyzed: tam vardhayantaḥ matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃham iva nānadatam sadhasthe
translated: Exalting him with auspicious thoughts, roaring like a lion in the assembly,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ śūrasātau bharebhare anu madema jiṣṇum ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛṣaṇam śūrasātau bharebhare anu madema jiṣṇum
translated: May we rejoice in Brihaspati, the mighty, the victorious, in every battle for the sake of heroes.

original: yadā vājam asanad viśvarūpam ā dyām arukṣad uttarāṇi sadma /
analyzed: yadā vājam asanat viśva rūpam ā dyām arukṣat uttarāṇi sadma
translated: When he has set in motion the all-shaped strength, and has ascended to the highest abode in the sky,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhayanto nānā santo bibhrato jyotir āsā ////
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛṣaṇam vardhayantaḥ nānā santaḥ bibhrataḥ jyotiḥ āsā
translated: Exalting the mighty Brihaspati, bearing the light together, though separate,

original: satyam āśiṣaṃ kṛṇutā vayodhai kīriṃ cid dhy avatha svebhir evaiḥ /
analyzed: satyam āśiṣam kṛṇutā vayodhai kīrim cit hi avatha svebhiḥ evaiḥ
translated: Make the blessing true, grant long life, help even the poor with your own,

original: paścā mṛdho apa bhavantu viśvās tad rodasī śṛṇutaṃ viśvaminve ////
analyzed: paścā mṛdhaḥ apa bhavantu viśvāḥ tat rodasī śṛṇutam viśvaminve
translated: May all the enemies be cast away behind, hear this, O heaven and earth, ye all-pervading ones.

original: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vi mūrdhānam abhinad arbudasya /
analyzed: indraḥ mahnā mahataḥ arṇavasya vi mūrdhānam abhinat arbudasya
translated: Indra with his greatness has cleft the head of the mighty billowy monster,

original: ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn devair dyāvāpṛthivī prāvataṃ naḥ ////
analyzed: ahan ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn devaiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī prāvatam naḥ
translated: Has slain the dragon, released the seven rivers. Protect us, O heaven and earth, with the gods.

original: abhi pra gopatiṃ girendram arca yathā vide /
analyzed: abhi pra go patim girā indram arca yathā vide
translated: Praise the lord of cattle, the mountain, Indra, as he is known,

original: sūtuṃ satyasya satpatim ////
analyzed: sūtum satyasya sat patim
translated: The impeller, the true lord of the people.

original: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire 'ruṣīr adhi barhiṣi /
analyzed: ā harayaḥ sasṛjrire ruṣīḥ adhi barhiṣi
translated: The ruddy ones have been created, the bays, on the sacrificial grass,

original: yatrābhi saṃnavāmahe ////
analyzed: yatra abhi saṃnavāmahe
translated: Where we may meet together.

original: indrāya gāva āśiraṃ duduhre vajriṇe madhu /
analyzed: indrāya gāvaḥ āśiram duduhre vajriṇe madhu
translated: To Indra the cows have yielded sweet milk, to the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: yat sīm upahvare vidat ////
analyzed: yat sīm upahvare vidat
translated: What he has found on the sloping (mountain).

original: ud yad bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ gṛham indraś ca ganvahi /
analyzed: ud yat bradhnasya viṣṭapam gṛham indraḥ ca ganvahi
translated: When he has mounted the ridge of the vault, Indra and Vayu have gone to the house,

original: madhvaḥ pītvā sacevahi triḥ sapta sakhyuḥ pade ////
analyzed: madhvaḥ pītvā sacevahi tris sapta sakhyuḥ pade
translated: Having drunk the sweet (drink), they have gone together, three times seven, to the friend's place.

original: arcata prārcata priyamedhāso arcata /
analyzed: arcata prārcata priyamedhāsaḥ arcata
translated: Sing, sing praises, O you of good oblations, sing praises!

original: arcantu putrakā uta puraṃ na dhṛṣṇv arcata ////
analyzed: arcantu putrakāḥ uta puram na dhṛṣṇu arcata
translated: Let the sons sing praises, let the bold one sing praises like a fortress.

original: ava svarāti gargaro godhā pari saniṣvaṇat /
analyzed: ava svarāti gargaraḥ godhā pari saniṣvaṇat
translated: The Garga cry has gone up, the lizard has hissed all around,

original: piṅgā pari caniṣkadad indrāya brahmodyatam ////
analyzed: piṅgā pari caniṣkadat indrāya brahma udyatam
translated: The tawny one has howled all around, the prayer has been raised to Indra.

original: ā yat patanty enyaḥ sudughā anapasphuraḥ /
analyzed: ā yat patanti enyaḥ su dughāḥ an apasphuraḥ
translated: When the birds fly down, the well-milked (cows), not dripping,

original: apasphuraṃ gṛbhāyata somam indrāya pātave ////
analyzed: apasphuram gṛbhāyata somam indrāya pātave
translated: Take the dripping one, the Soma, to Indra to drink.

original: apād indro apād agnir viśve devā amatsata /
analyzed: apāt indraḥ apāt agniḥ viśve devāḥ amatsata
translated: Indra has gone, Agni has gone, all the gods have rejoiced.

original: varuṇa id iha kṣayat tam āpo abhy anūṣata vatsaṃ saṃśiśvarīr iva ////
analyzed: varuṇe id iha kṣayat tam āpaḥ abhī anūṣata vatsam saṃśiśvarīḥ iva
translated: Varuṇa indeed dwells here; the waters have sung to him, as if to a suckling calf.

original: sudevo asi varuṇa yasya te sapta sindhavaḥ /
analyzed: su devaḥ asi varuṇa yasya te sapta sindhavaḥ
translated: You are a good god, O Varuṇa, whose seven rivers

original: anukṣaranti kākudaṃ sūryaṃ suṣirām iva ////
analyzed: anukṣaranti kākudam sūryam suṣirām iva
translated: Flow down to the bubbling (ocean), like a sieve to the sun.

original: yo vyatīṃr aphāṇayat suyuktāṃ upa dāśuṣe /
analyzed: yaḥ vyatīṃr aphāṇayat su yuktām upa dāśuṣe
translated: He who set in motion the well-yoked swift horses for the worshipper,

original: takvo netā tad id vapur upamā yo amucyata ////
analyzed: takvaḥ netā tat id vapuḥ upamā yaḥ amucyata
translated: The swift leader, that is his form, the one who was released from the yoke.

original: atīd u śakra ohata indro viśvā ati dviṣaḥ /
analyzed: ati id u śakraḥ ohate indraḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Indra, the powerful one, has overcome all enmities.

original: bhinat kanīna odanaṃ pacyamānaṃ paro girā ////
analyzed: bhinat kanīnaḥ odanam pacyamānam paras girā
translated: The young one broke the cooking pot with his foot, while it was being cooked.

original: arbhako na kumārako 'dhi tiṣṭhann avaṃ ratham /
analyzed: arbhakaḥ na kumārakaḥ dhi tiṣṭhan avam ratham
translated: The young boy, like a youth, standing on the lower chariot,

original: sa pakṣan mahiṣaṃ mṛgaṃ pitre mātre vibhukratum ////
analyzed: sa pakṣat mahiṣam mṛgam pitre mātre vibhu kratum
translated: He killed the mighty buffalo for his father and mother, the all-powerful one.

original: ā tū suśipra daṃpate rathaṃ tiṣṭhā hiraṇyayam /
analyzed: ā tū su śipra daṃpate ratham tiṣṭha hiraṇyayam
translated: O you with beautiful hair, O lord of the house, sit on the golden chariot.

original: adha dyukṣaṃ sacevahi sahasrapādam aruṣaṃ svastigām anehasam ////
analyzed: adha dyukṣam sacevahi sahasra pādam aruṣam svasti gām anehasam
translated: Then you will be together with the heavenly one, the red one with a thousand feet, who goes safely without fail.

original: tam ghem itthā namasvina upa svarājam āsate /
analyzed: tam gha īm itthā namasvinaḥ upa svarājam āsate
translated: To him, indeed, in this way, the worshippers sit down near the self-ruling one.

original: arthaṃ cid asya sudhitaṃ yad etave āvartayanti dāvane ////🔽anu pratnasyaukasaḥ priyamedhāsa eṣām /
analyzed: artham cit asya sudhitam yat etave āvartayanti dāvane  anu pratnasya okasaḥ priyamedhāsaḥ eṣām
translated: They turn back his well-ordered wealth, even for the sake of his bounty.🔽Following the ancient abode, the dear hymns of these,

original: pūrvām anu prayatiṃ vṛktabarhiṣo hitaprayasa āśata ////
analyzed: pūrvām anu prayatim vṛkta barhiṣaḥ hita prayasaḥ āśata
translated: The ones with strewn sacrificial grass have come to the first impulse, with their food laid out.

original: yo rājā carṣaṇīnāṃ yātā rathebhir adhriguḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ
translated: The king of men, who moves swiftly with his chariots,

original: viśvāsāṃ tarutā pṛtanānāṃ jyeṣṭho yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe ////
analyzed: viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe
translated: The best of all conquerors, the Vrtra-killer, whom I praise.

original: indraṃ taṃ śumbha puruhanmann avase yasya dvitā vidhartari /
analyzed: indram tam śumbha puru hanman avase yasya dvitā vidhartari
translated: Indra, him, O thou who hast many foes, whom thou, O thou who givest room, hast made to be the ruler of the two worlds,

original: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśato maho dive na sūryaḥ ////
analyzed: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśataḥ mahaḥ dive na sūryaḥ
translated: To whose hand the wondrous thunderbolt hath been given, as the great heaven hath the sun.

original: nakiṣ ṭaṃ karmaṇā naśad yaś cakāra sadāvṛdham /
analyzed: nakir tam karmaṇā naśat yaḥ cakāra sadāvṛdham
translated: No one shall find him by his work, him who hath made him who ever prospers,

original: indraṃ na yajñair viśvagūrtam ṛbhvasam adhṛṣṭaṃ dhṛṣṇvojasam ////
analyzed: indram na yajñaiḥ viśva gūrtam ṛbhvasam adhṛṣṭam dhṛṣṇu ojasam
translated: Indra, whom all must praise, the mighty one, the invincible, whose strength is irresistible, by sacrifices.

original: aṣālham ugraṃ pṛtanāsu sāsahiṃ yasmin mahīr urujrayaḥ /
analyzed: aṣālham ugram pṛtanāsu sāsahim yasmin mahīḥ urujrayaḥ
translated: The invincible, the strong, the conqueror in battles, in whom are great and far-reaching powers,

original: saṃ dhenavo jāyamāne anonavur dyāvaḥ kṣāmo anonavuḥ ////
analyzed: sam dhenavaḥ jāyamāne anonavuḥ dyāvaḥ kṣāmaḥ anonavuḥ
translated: The milch-kine lowed to him as he was born, the heavens and the earth lowed.

original: yad dyāva indra te śataṃ śataṃ bhūmīr uta syuḥ /
analyzed: yat dyāvaḥ indra te śatam śatam bhūmīḥ uta syuḥ
translated: If, O Indra, the heavens were a hundred, and the earths a hundred, to thee,

original: na tvā vajrint sahasraṃ sūryā anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī ////
analyzed: na tvā vajrin sahasram sūryāḥ anu na jātam aṣṭa rodasī
translated: Not a thousand suns, O thou of the thunderbolt, could equal thee at birth, O thou of the two worlds.

original: ā paprātha mahinā vṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā /🔽asmāṃ ava maghavan gomati vraje vajriṃ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ ////
analyzed: ā paprātha mahinā vṛṣṇyā vṛṣan viśvā śaviṣṭha śavasā  asmān ava maghavan gomati vraje vajrim citrābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Thou, O strong one, hast extended thyself with might and strength over all things, O strongest one.🔽Help us, O bountiful one, in the pasture rich in kine, O thou of the thunderbolt, with wondrous aids.

original: ut tvā mandantu stomāḥ kṛṇuṣva rādho adrivaḥ /
analyzed: ud tvā mandantu stomāḥ kṛṇuṣva rādhaḥ adrivas
translated: Let the praises exalt thee, make thine offering, O thou of the thunderbolt.

original: ava brahmadviṣo jahi ////
analyzed: ava brahma dviṣaḥ jahi
translated: Destroy the haters of devotion.

original: padā paṇīṃr arādhaso ni bādhasva mahāṃ asi /
analyzed: padā paṇīṃr arādhasaḥ ni bādhasva mahān asi
translated: With thy foot crush the niggards who give not: thou art great.

original: nahi tvā kaś cana prati ////
analyzed: nahi tvā kaḥ cana prati
translated: For no one at all is equal to you.

original: tvam īśiṣe sutānām indra tvam asutānām /
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe sutānām indra tvam a sutānām
translated: You are the lord of the pressed (Soma), O Indra, you are the lord of the unpressed (Soma).

original: tvaṃ rājā janānām ////
analyzed: tvam rājā janānām
translated: You are the king of the people.

original: īṅkhayantīr apasyuva indraṃ jātam upāsate /
analyzed: īṅkhayantīḥ apasyuvaḥ indram jātam upāsate
translated: The trembling, the looking on, attend on Indra when he is born,

original: bhejānāsaḥ suvīryam ////
analyzed: bhejānāsaḥ su vīryam
translated: The longing ones on his good strength.

original: tvam indra balād adhi sahaso jāta ojasaḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra balāt adhi sahasaḥ jātaḥ ojasaḥ
translated: You, O Indra, from strength, from impulse, from force, are born,

original: tvaṃ vṛṣan vṛṣed asi ////
analyzed: tvam vṛṣan vṛṣā id asi
translated: You, O bull, are the bull.

original: tvam indrāsi vṛtrahā vy antarikṣam atiraḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra asi vṛtra hā vi antarikṣam atiraḥ
translated: You, O Indra, are the Vr̥itra-slayer, you have spread out the atmosphere.

original: ud dyām astabhnā ojasā ////
analyzed: ud dyām astabhnāḥ ojasā
translated: You have with might upheld the sky.

original: tvam indra sajoṣasam arkaṃ bibharṣi bāhvoḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra sajoṣasam arkam bibharṣi bāhvoḥ
translated: You, O Indra, bear in your arms the hymn that is in unison with you,

original: vajraṃ śiśāna ojasā ////
analyzed: vajram śiśānaḥ ojasā
translated: You sharpen the bolt with force.

original: tvam indrābhibhur asi viśvā jātāny ojasā /
analyzed: tvam indra abhibhuḥ asi viśvā jātāni ojasā
translated: You, O Indra, are the overcomer of all things born by your strength.

original: sa viśvā bhuva ābhavaḥ ////
analyzed: sa viśvāḥ bhuvaḥ ābhavaḥ
translated: You are the all-supporting of all that has been.

original: ā yātv indraḥ svapatir madāya yo dharmaṇā tūtujānas tuviṣmān /
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ sva patiḥ madāya yaḥ dharmaṇā tūtujānaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: Let Indra, the Lord of the brave, come to the drinking-feast, he who, impetuous, mighty, through the law,

original: pratvakṣāṇo ati viśvā sahāṃsy apāreṇa mahatā vṛṣṇyena ////🔽suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ suyamā harī te mimyakṣa vajro nṛpate gabhastau /
analyzed: pratvakṣāṇaḥ ati viśvā sahāṃsi apāreṇa mahatā vṛṣṇyena  suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ su yamā harī te mimyakṣa vajraḥ nṛpate gabhastau
translated: Looking on all the worlds, with his boundless, great manliness.🔽The chariot is well-guided, your two bay steeds are easy to yoke, O King, your bolt is sharpened, O Lord of men, your arms.

original: śībhaṃ rājan supathā yāhy arvāṅ vardhāma te papuso vṛṣṇyāni ////
analyzed: śībham rājan su pathā yāhi arvāṅ vardhāma te papusaḥ vṛṣṇyāni
translated: Come hither quickly, O King, by the good path. We will increase your manly powers, O you who drink.

original: endravāho nṛpatiṃ vajrabāhum ugram ugrāsas taviṣāsa enam /
analyzed: ā indra vāhaḥ nṛpatim vajra bāhum ugram ugrāsaḥ taviṣāsaḥ enam
translated: Indra's bearers, bring the king with the arm of the thunderbolt, the terrible one with terrible powers.

original: pratvakṣasaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ satyaśuṣmam em asmatrā sadhamādo vahantu ////
analyzed: pratvakṣasam vṛṣabham satya śuṣmam ā īm asmatrā sadhamādaḥ vahantu
translated: Bring the bull with true strength and mighty power to this our feast.

original: evā patiṃ droṇasācaṃ sacetasam ūrja skambhaṃ dharuṇa ā vṛṣāyase /
analyzed: eva patim droṇasācam sacetasam ūrjaḥ skambham dharuṇe ā vṛṣāyase
translated: Thus you make the lord of the house, the wise one, the support, the pillar, strong.

original: ojaḥ kṛṣva saṃ gṛbhāya tve apy aso yathā kenipānām ino vṛdhe ////
analyzed: ojaḥ kṛṣva sam gṛbhāya tve api asaḥ yathā kenipānām inaḥ vṛdhe
translated: Gather strength, grasp it, so that you may be the lord of the people for increase.

original: gamann asme vasūny ā hi śaṃsiṣaṃ svāśiṣaṃ bharam ā yāhi sominaḥ /
analyzed: gaman asme vasūni ā hi śaṃsiṣam su āśiṣam bharam ā yāhi sominaḥ
translated: Come to us, for I will proclaim the treasures. Bring the blessing. Come to the Soma-presser.

original: tvam īśiṣe sāsminn ā satsi barhiṣy anādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā ////
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe sā asmin ā satsi barhiṣi anādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā
translated: You are the lord. Sit on this sacrificial grass. Your vessels are inviolable by law.

original: pṛthak prāyan prathamā devahūtayo 'kṛṇvata śravasyāni duṣṭarā /
analyzed: pṛthak prāyan prathamāḥ deva hūtayaḥ kṛṇvata śravasyāni duṣṭarā
translated: The first to be invoked by the gods have gone separately. They have made fame difficult to surpass.

original: na ye śekur yajñiyāṃ nāvam āruham irmaiva te ny aviśanta kepayaḥ ////
analyzed: na ye śekuḥ yajñiyām nāvam āruham irma eva te ni aviśanta kepayaḥ
translated: Those who could not ascend the sacrificial ship have entered the waters, the waters alone.

original: evaivāpāg apare santu dūdhyo 'śvā yeṣāṃ duryuga āyuyujre /
analyzed: eva eva apāk apare santu dūdhyo śvā yeṣām duryuge āyuyujre
translated: Thus let the others be defeated, the horses whose yokes are difficult to yoke.

original: itthā ye prāg upare santi dāvane purūṇi yatra vayunāni bhojanā ////
analyzed: itthā ye prāk upare santi dāvane purūṇi yatra vayunāni bhojanā
translated: Here are many who are above and below for giving, where there are many deeds to be done.

original: girīṃr ajrān rejamānāṃ adhārayad dyauḥ krandad antarikṣāṇi kopayat /
analyzed: girīn ajrān rejamānām adhārayat dyauḥ krandat antarikṣāṇi kopayat
translated: He has set the mountains, the unmoving ones, in motion; the sky has roared, the airs have been agitated.

original: samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi ṣkabhāyati vṛṣṇaḥ pītvā mada ukthāni śaṃsati ////🔽imaṃ bibharmi sukṛtaṃ te aṅkuśaṃ yenārujāsi maghavaṃ chaphārujaḥ /
analyzed: samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi skabhāyati vṛṣṇaḥ pītvā made ukthāni śaṃsati  imam bibharmi su kṛtam te aṅkuśam yena ārujāsi maghavan śaphārujaḥ
translated: He stretches out the two worlds that are in accord; having drunk the strong drink, he praises the hymns.🔽I bear this well-made goad of yours, with which, O Maghavan, you drive away the enemies.

original: asmint su te savane astv oktyaṃ suta iṣṭau maghavan bodhy ābhagaḥ ////
analyzed: asmin su te savane astu oktyam sute iṣṭau maghavan bodhi ābhagaḥ
translated: Let there be a place for you at this libation, be ready for the sacrifice, O Maghavan, be the bestower of wealth.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudhaṃ puruhūta viśvām /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām
translated: With cattle may we overcome evil desire, with barley all hunger, O you who are invoked by many.

original: vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanāny asmākena vṛjanenā jayema ////
analyzed: vayam rājabhiḥ prathamāḥ dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema
translated: May we, with kings, win treasures with our own people.

original: bṛhaspatir naḥ pari pātu paścād utottarasmād adharād aghayoḥ /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghayoḥ
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the rear, and from above and from below, from the sinner.

original: indraḥ purastād uta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyo varivaḥ kṛṇotu ////
analyzed: indraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the front, and from the middle, as a friend, grant room for our friends.

original: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṃ tuviśuṣmas tṛpat somam apibad viṣṇunā sutaṃ yathāvaśat /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣaḥ yava āśiram tuvi śuṣmaḥ tṛpat somam apibat viṣṇunā sutam yathā vaśat
translated: The mighty one, in the Trikadrukas, having eaten barley, having drunk the Soma to his fill, the strong one, Vishnu's son, as he desired.

original: sa īṃ mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām uruṃ sainaṃ saścad devo devaṃ satyam indraṃ satya induḥ ////
analyzed: saḥ īm mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām urum sa enam saścat devaḥ devam satyam indram satyaḥ induḥ
translated: He has drunk it to perform great deeds. The great one has won the great one. The god has won the god, the true Indra, the true Indu.

original: pro ṣv asmai puroratham indrāya śūṣam arcata /
analyzed: pra u su asmai puroratham indrāya śūṣam arcata
translated: Sing forth to him a strong song of praise, to Indra, the leader of the host.

original: abhīke cid u lokakṛt saṃge samatsu vṛtrahāsmākaṃ bodhi coditā nabhantām anyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu ////
analyzed: abhīke cit u loka kṛt saṃge samatsu vṛtrahā asmākam bodhi coditā nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Even in the battle, the maker of room, the slayer of Vrtra in the encounter of the armies. Be thou our protector, O thou who art urged on. Let the bowstrings of others break on their bows.

original: tvaṃ sindhūṃr avāsṛjo 'dharāco ahann ahim /
analyzed: tvam sindhūṃr avāsṛjaḥ dharācaḥ ahan ahim
translated: Thou hast let loose the rivers, thou hast slain the dragon of the deep.

original: aśatrur indra jajñiṣe viśvaṃ puṣyasi vāryaṃ taṃ tvā pari ṣvajāmahe nabhantām anyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu ////
analyzed: a śatruḥ indra jajñiṣe viśvam puṣyasi vāryam tam tvā pari svajāmahe nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: O Indra, thou art born without an enemy. Thou prosperest all good things. We embrace thee on every side. Let the bowstrings of others break on their bows.

original: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo 'ryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ /
analyzed: vi su viśvāḥ arātayaḥ ryaḥ naśanta naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: Drive away all the evil spirits, the enemies who destroy our thoughts.

original: astāsi śatrave vadhaṃ yo na indra jighāṃsati yā te rātir dadir vasu /
analyzed: astāsi śatrave vadham yaḥ naḥ indra jighāṃsati yā te rātiḥ dadiḥ vasu
translated: Thou art placed as a weapon for the foe who would slay us, O Indra. Thy gift is the giver of wealth.

original: nabhantām anyakeṣāṃ jyakā adhi dhanvasu ////
analyzed: nabhantām anyakeṣām jyakāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Let the bowstrings of others break on their bows.

original: tīvrasyābhivayaso asya pāhi sarvarathā vi harī iha muñca /
analyzed: tīvrasya abhivayasaḥ asya pāhi sarva rathā vi harī iha muñca
translated: Protect him from the fierce onslaught. Let thy two bay steeds be loosed here, O thou of all cars.

original: indra mā tvā yajamānāso anye ni rīraman tubhyam ime sutāsaḥ ////
analyzed: indra mā tvā yajamānāsaḥ anye ni rīraman tubhyam ime sutāsaḥ
translated: O Indra, let not other sacrificers keep thee back. These libations are for thee.

original: tubhyaṃ sutās tubhyam u sotvāsas tvāṃ giraḥ śvātryā ā hvayanti /
analyzed: tubhyam sutāḥ tubhyam u sotvāsaḥ tvām giraḥ śvātryāḥ ā hvayanti
translated: For thee are the pressed juices, for thee the juices to be pressed; for thee the songs with Svaga cry thee forth.

original: indredam adya savanaṃ juṣāṇo viśvasya vidvāṃ iha pāhi somam ////
analyzed: indra idam adya savanam juṣāṇaḥ viśvasya vidvān iha pāhi somam
translated: O Indra, delighting in this libation today, drink here the Soma, knowing all.

original: ya uśatā manasā somam asmai sarvahṛdā devakāmaḥ sunoti /
analyzed: yaḥ uśatā manasā somam asmai sarva hṛdā deva kāmaḥ sunoti
translated: He who with a willing mind, with all his heart, longing for the gods, presses Soma for him,

original: na gā indras tasya parā dadāti praśastam ic cārum asmai kṛṇoti ////
analyzed: na gāḥ indraḥ tasya parā dadāti praśastam id cārum asmai kṛṇoti
translated: Indra does not take away his cattle; he makes him famous and dear.

original: anuspaṣṭo bhavaty eṣo asya yo asmai revān na sunoti somam /
analyzed: anuspaṣṭaḥ bhavati eṣaḥ asya yaḥ asmai revān na sunoti somam
translated: He who, being rich, does not press Soma for him, is clearly his enemy.

original: nir aratnau maghavā taṃ dadhāti brahmadviṣo hanty anānudiṣṭaḥ ////
analyzed: niḥ aratnau maghavā tam dadhāti brahma dviṣaḥ hanti anānudiṣṭaḥ
translated: Maghavan makes him destitute of jewels; he slays the Brahman-hater, unopposed.

original: aśvāyanto gavyanto vājayanto havāmahe tvopagantavā u /
analyzed: aśvāyantaḥ gavyantaḥ vājayantaḥ havāmahe tvā upagantavai u
translated: Seeking horses, seeking cattle, seeking strength, we call on thee to come to us.

original: ābhūṣantas te sumatau navāyāṃ vayam indra tvā śunaṃ huvema ////
analyzed: ābhūṣantaḥ te sumatau navāyām vayam indra tvā śunam huvema
translated: Seeking thy new-found favour, O Indra, we must invoke thee for our good.

original: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kam ajñātayakṣmād uta rājayakṣmāt /
analyzed: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kam a jñāta yakṣmāt uta rājayakṣmāt
translated: I release thee through the oblation for life, from consumption and from kingly consumption.

original: grāhir jagrāha yady etad tasyā indrāgnī pra mumuktam enam ////
analyzed: grāhiḥ jagrāha yadī etat tasyāḥ indra agnī pra mumuktam enam
translated: If the seizing one has seized thee, from that, O Indra-Agni, release him.

original: yadi kṣitāyur yadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyor antikaṃ nīta eva /
analyzed: yadi kṣita āyuḥ yadi vā paretaḥ yadi mṛtyoḥ antikam nītaḥ eva
translated: If he has a short life, or if he has passed away, or if he has been led even to the presence of death,

original: tam ā harāmi nirṛter upasthād aspārśam enaṃ śataśāradāya ////
analyzed: tam ā harāmi nirṛteḥ upasthāt aspārśam enam śata śāradāya
translated: I bring him from the presence of Nirriti; I have touched him for a life of a hundred autumns.

original: sahasrākṣeṇa śatavīryeṇa śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣam enam /
analyzed: sahasra akṣeṇa śata vīryeṇa śata āyuṣā haviṣā ahārṣam enam
translated: With the thousand-eyed, the hundred-powerful, the hundred-lived oblation I have brought him.

original: indro yathainaṃ śarado nayāty ati viśvasya duritasya pāram ////
analyzed: indraḥ yathā enam śaradaḥ nayāti ati viśvasya duritasya pāram
translated: That Indra may lead him to the end of a hundred autumns, beyond all misfortune.

original: śataṃ jīva śarado vardhamānaḥ śataṃ hemantān chatam u vasantān /
analyzed: śatam jīva śaradaḥ vardhamānaḥ śatam hemantān śatam u vasantān
translated: Live a hundred autumns, increasing in strength; a hundred winters, a hundred summers,

original: śataṃ ta indro agniḥ savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣam enam ////
analyzed: śatam te indraḥ agniḥ savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śata āyuṣā haviṣā ahārṣam enam
translated: A hundred years, O Agni, Savitar, Brihaspati, Indra, with the oblation of a hundred-lived one I have brought him.

original: āhārṣam avidaṃ tvā punar āgāḥ punarṇavaḥ /
analyzed: āhārṣam avidam tvā punar āgāḥ punarṇavaḥ
translated: I have brought him, I have found thee; thou hast come again, renewed.

original: sarvāṅga sarvaṃ te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuś ca te 'vidam ////
analyzed: sarva aṅga sarvam te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuḥ ca te vidam
translated: I have found all thy limbs, all thy sight, all thy life.

original: brahmaṇāgniḥ samvidāno rakṣohā bādhatām itaḥ /🔽amīvā yas te garbhaṃ durṇāmā yonim āśaye ////
analyzed: brahmaṇā agniḥ samvidānaḥ rakṣaḥ hā bādhatām itas  amīvā yaḥ te garbham durṇāmā yonim āśaye
translated: Let Agni, the Rakshas-slayer, in agreement with the Brahman, drive away🔽The evil-named one who has laid his sickness in thy womb.

original: yas te garbham amīvā durṇāmā yonim āśaye /
analyzed: yaḥ te garbham amīvā durṇāmā yonim āśaye
translated: The evil-named one who has laid his sickness in thy womb,

original: agniṣ ṭaṃ brahmaṇā saha niṣ kravyādam anīnaśat ////🔽yas te hanti patayantaṃ niṣatsnuṃ yaḥ sarīsṛpam /
analyzed: agniḥ tam brahmaṇā saha niḥ kravyādam anīnaśat  yaḥ te hanti patayantam niṣatsnum yaḥ sarīsṛpam
translated: Agni with the Brahman has destroyed the flesh-devouring one.🔽He who strikes thy lying, sitting, crawling child,

original: jātaṃ yas te jighāṃsati tam ito nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: jātam yaḥ te jighāṃsati tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: Who would slay thy born child, him we drive away from hence.

original: yas ta ūrū viharaty antarā dampatī śaye /
analyzed: yaḥ te ūrū viharati antarā dampatī śaye
translated: He who moves between the thighs, who lies between the husband and wife,

original: yoniṃ yo antar ārelhi tam ito nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: yonim yaḥ antar ārelhi tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: Who presses the womb from within, him we banish from here.

original: yas tvā bhrātā patir bhūtvā jāro bhūtvā nipadyate /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā bhrātā patiḥ bhūtvā jāraḥ bhūtvā nipadyate
translated: He who, becoming your brother, becoming your husband, lies down,

original: prajāṃ yas te jighāṃsati tam ito nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: prajām yaḥ te jighāṃsati tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: Who seeks to injure your offspring, him we banish from here.

original: yas tvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate /
analyzed: yaḥ tvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate
translated: He who, having bewildered you with sleep and darkness, lies down,

original: prajāṃ yas te jighāṃsati tam ito nāśayāmasi ////
analyzed: prajām yaḥ te jighāṃsati tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: Who seeks to injure your offspring, him we banish from here.

original: akṣībhyāṃ te nāsikābhyāṃ karṇābhyāṃ chubukād adhi /
analyzed: akṣībhyām te nāsikābhyām karṇābhyām chubukāt adhi
translated: From your eyes, from your nostrils, from your ears, from your throat,

original: yakṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyaṃ mastiṣkāj jihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: yakṣmam śīrṣaṇyam mastiṣkāt jihvāyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From your head, from your brain, I drive away your head-disease.

original: grīvābhyas ta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt /
analyzed: grīvābhyaḥ te uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyaḥ anūkyāt
translated: From your neck, from your vertebrae, from your ribs, from your shoulder-blades,

original: yakṣmaṃ doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyāṃ bāhubhyāṃ vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: yakṣmam doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyām bāhubhyām vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From your collar-bones, from your shoulders, from your arms, I drive away your shoulder-disease.

original: hṛdayāt te pari klomno halīkṣṇāt pārśvābhyām /
analyzed: hṛdayāt te pari klomnaḥ halīkṣṇāt pārśvābhyām
translated: From your heart, from your lungs, from your spleen, from your sides,

original: yakṣmaṃ matasnābhyāṃ plīhno yaknas te vi vṛhāmasi ////
analyzed: yakṣmam matasnābhyām plīhnaḥ yaknaḥ te vi vṛhāmasi
translated: From your kidneys, from your liver, from your lungs, we drive away your disease.

original: āntrebhyas te gudābhyo vaniṣṭhor udarād adhi /
analyzed: āntrebhyaḥ te gudābhyaḥ vaniṣṭhoḥ udarāt adhi
translated: From your intestines, from your bowels, from your rectum, from your belly,

original: yakṣmaṃ kukṣibhyāṃ plāśer nābhyā vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: yakṣmam kukṣibhyām plāśeḥ nābhyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From your flanks, from your bladder, from your navel, I drive away your disease.

original: ūrubhyāṃ te aṣṭhīvadbhyāṃ pārṣṇibhyāṃ prapadābhyām /
analyzed: ūrubhyām te aṣṭhīvadbhyām pārṣṇibhyām prapadābhyām
translated: From thy thighs, from thy knee-bones, from thy ankles, from thy hoofs,

original: yakṣmaṃ bhasadyaṃ śroṇibhyāṃ bhāsadaṃ bhāṃsaso vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: yakṣmam bhasadyam śroṇibhyām bhāsadam bhāṃsasaḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From thy hips, from thy loins, from thy flanks, from thy chest, I drive away consumption.

original: a mehanād vanaṃkaraṇāl lomabhyas te nakhebhyaḥ /
analyzed: mehanāt vanaṃkaraṇāt lomabhyaḥ te nakhebhyaḥ
translated: From thy bladder, from thy bowels, from thy hair, from thy nails,

original: c yakṣmaṃ sarvasmād ātmanas tam idaṃ vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: yakṣmam sarvasmāt ātmanaḥ tam idam vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From all thy body, from thy whole self, I drive away consumption.

original: asthibhyas te majjabhyaḥ snāvabhyo dhamanibhyaḥ /
analyzed: asthibhyaḥ te majjabhyaḥ snāvabhyaḥ dhamanibhyaḥ
translated: From thy bones, from thy marrow, from thy sinews, from thy veins,

original: yakṣmaṃ pāṇibhyām aṅgulibhyo nakhebhyo vi vṛhāmi te ////
analyzed: yakṣmam pāṇibhyām aṅgulibhyaḥ nakhebhyaḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: From thy hands, from thy fingers, from thy nails, I drive away consumption.

original: aṅgeaṅge lomnilomni yas te parvaṇiparvaṇi /
analyzed: aṅge aṅge lomni lomni yaḥ te parvaṇi parvaṇi
translated: In every limb, in every hair, in every joint of thine,

original: yakṣaṃ tvacasyaṃ te vayaṃ kaśyapasya vībarheṇa viṣvañcaṃ vi vṛhāmasi ////
analyzed: yakṣam tvacasyam te vayam kaśyapasya vībarheṇa viṣvañcam vi vṛhāmasi
translated: The consumption that is in thy skin, that we drive away with the brush of Kasyapa.

original: apehi manasas pate 'pa kāma paraś cara /
analyzed: apehi manasaḥ pate kāma paras cara
translated: Go hence, O lord of the mind! go away, O desire! go to another place!

original: paro nirṛtyā ā cakṣva bahudhā jīvato manaḥ ////
analyzed: paras nirṛtyāḥ ā cakṣva bahudhā jīvataḥ manaḥ
translated: Go away from Nirrti! look on the mind of the living in many places.

original: vayam enam idā hyopīpemeha vajriṇam /
analyzed: vayam enam idā hya upīpema iha vajriṇam
translated: We have to-day nourished this wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: tasmā u adya samanā sutaṃ bharā nūnaṃ bhūṣata śrute ////
analyzed: tasmai u adya samanā sutam bhara nūnam bhūṣata śrute
translated: To him we bring the pressed (Soma) in due season. Now be ready, O famous one.

original: vṛkaś cid asya vāraṇa urāmathir ā vayuneṣu bhūṣati /
analyzed: vṛkaḥ cit asya vāraṇaḥ urāmathiḥ ā vayuneṣu bhūṣati
translated: Even the wolf, his protector, his great helper, is ready at the seasons.

original: semaṃ naḥ stomaṃ jujuṣāṇa ā gahīndra pra citrayā dhiyā ////🔽kad u nv asyākṛtam indrasyāsti pauṃsyam /
analyzed: sa imam naḥ stomam jujuṣāṇaḥ ā gahi indra pra citrayā dhiyā  kad u nu asya a kṛtam indrasya asti pauṃsyam
translated: Come to this praise of ours, O Indra, accepting it with wondrous thought.🔽What deed of manly strength is there that Indra hath not done?

original: keno nu kaṃ śromatena na śuśruve januṣaḥ pari vṛtrahā ////
analyzed: kena u nu kam śromatena na śuśruve januṣaḥ pari vṛtrahā
translated: By what glory hath he not been heard, the Vr̥itra-slayer, from the birth?

original: tvām id dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ /
analyzed: tvām id hi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ
translated: Thee, verily, we call to aid, O thou who givest strength, O thou who givest wealth.

original: tvāṃ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṃ naras tvāṃ kāṣṭhāsv arvataḥ ////
analyzed: tvām vṛtreṣu indra satpatim naraḥ tvām kāṣṭhāsu arvataḥ
translated: Thee, Indra, as the Lord of heroes in the battles, thee in the race-course of the steed.

original: sa tvaṃ naś citra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ citra vajra hasta dhṛṣṇuyā mahaḥ stavānaḥ adrivas
translated: So, O wondrous, thunder-wielding, impetuous one, when thou art praised, O Vr̥itra-slayer,

original: gām aśvaṃ rathyam indra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jigyuṣe ////
analyzed: gām aśvam rathyam indra sam kira satrā vājam na jigyuṣe
translated: Pour out the rain of kine and steeds and chariots, O Indra, for the man who longs for power.

original: abhi tvā pūrvapītaya indra stomebhir āyavaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā pūrva pītaye indra stomebhiḥ āyavaḥ
translated: The ancient ones, O Indra, the living men, have called on thee with lauds,

original: samīcīnāsa ṛbhavaḥ sam asvaran rudrā gṛṇanta pūrvyam ////
analyzed: samīcīnāsaḥ ṛbhavaḥ sam asvaran rudrāḥ gṛṇanta pūrvyam
translated: The Ṛbhus, the Rudras, have sung forth the ancient one, in unison, in concert.

original: asyed indro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi /
analyzed: asya id indraḥ vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ made sutasya viṣṇavi
translated: In the wild joy of the juice shed forth, Indra hath waxed in strength, in hero might, in Vishnu.

original: adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavo 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā ////
analyzed: adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavaḥ nu stuvanti pūrvathā
translated: The living men this day extol his greatness as in the days of old.

original: adhā hīndra girvaṇa upa tvā kāmān mahaḥ sasṛjmahe /
analyzed: adhā hi indra girvaṇaḥ upa tvā kāmān mahaḥ sasṛjmahe
translated: Now, O Indra, lover of the song, we have sent forth to thee our wishes, to the great one,

original: udeva yanta udabhiḥ ////
analyzed: udā iva yantaḥ udabhiḥ
translated: As the floods go forth to the rising of the sun.

original: vār ṇa tvā yavyābhir vardhanti śūra brahmāṇi /
analyzed: vār na tvā yavyābhiḥ vardhanti śūra brahmāṇi
translated: O hero, they strengthen thee with the Yavya hymns, O Vârna.

original: vāvṛdhvāṃsaṃ cid adrivo divedive ////
analyzed: vāvṛdhvāṃsam cit adrivas dive dive
translated: Even the one who is to be strengthened, O wielder of the thunderbolt, day by day.

original: yuñjanti harī iṣirasya gāthayorau ratha uruyuge /
analyzed: yuñjanti harī iṣirasya gāthayā urau rathe uru yuge
translated: They yoke the two tawny horses of the swift one with the song, the chariot with the wide yoke,

original: indravāhā vacoyujā ////
analyzed: indra vāhā vacaḥ yujā
translated: Drawn by speech, O Indra, as the bearer.

original: agniṃ dūtaṃ vṛṇīmahe hotāraṃ viśvavedasam /
analyzed: agnim dūtam vṛṇīmahe hotāram viśva vedasam
translated: We choose Agni as our messenger, the priest, the all-knower,

original: asya yajñasya sukratum ////
analyzed: asya yajñasya sukratum
translated: The wise one of this sacrifice.

original: agnimagniṃ havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim /
analyzed: agnim agnim havīmabhiḥ sadā havanta viśpatim
translated: Agni, Agni, with offerings they always invoke the lord of the people,

original: havyavāhaṃ purupriyam ////🔽agne devāṃ ihā vaha jajñāno vṛktabarhiṣe /
analyzed: havyavāham puru priyam  agne devān iha ā vaha jajñānaḥ vṛktabarhiṣe
translated: The bearer of oblations, dear to many.

original: asi hotā na īḍyaḥ ////
analyzed: asi hotā naḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: O Agni, bring the gods hither to the one who has strewn the sacred grass, O newly born one.

original: īlenyo namasyas tiras tamāṃsi darśataḥ /🔽sam agnir idhyate vṛṣā ////
analyzed: īlenyaḥ namasyaḥ tiras tamāṃsi darśataḥ  sam agniḥ idhyate vṛṣā
translated: You are the invoked priest, worthy of praise.🔽Worthy of invocation, to be revered, shining through the darkness,🔽Agni is kindled, the bull.

original: vṛṣo agniḥ sam idhyate 'śvo na devavāhanaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣaḥ agniḥ sam idhyate śvas na deva vāhanaḥ
translated: The bull Agni is kindled, like a horse, the bearer of the gods.

original: taṃ haviṣmantaḥ īlate ////
analyzed: tam haviṣmantaḥ īlate
translated: The offerers of oblations serve him.

original: vṛṣaṇaṃ tvā vayaṃ vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi /
analyzed: vṛṣaṇam tvā vayam vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi
translated: O bull, we, the bulls, kindle you, the bull, O bull.

original: agne dīdyataṃ bṛhat ////🔽agnim īliṣvāvase gāthābhiḥ śīraśociṣam /
analyzed: agne dīdyatam bṛhat  agnim īḍiṣva avase gāthābhiḥ śīra śociṣam
translated: O Agni, shine forth greatly.🔽Praise Agni for help with songs, the one with beautiful flames.

original: agniṃ rāye purumīlha śrutaṃ naro 'gniṃ sudītaye chardiḥ ////
analyzed: agnim rāye purumīlha śrutam naraḥ gnim sudītaye chardiḥ
translated: Sing to Agni for wealth, O Purumîḷha, the renowned one, sing to Agni for good fame, O people.

original: agna ā yāhy agnibhir hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe /🔽ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭhaṃ barhir āsade ////🔽acha hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaś caranty adhvare /
analyzed: agne ā yāhi agnibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe  ā tvām anaktu prayatā haviṣmatī yajiṣṭham barhiḥ āsade  acha hi tvā sahasaḥ sūno aṅgiraḥ srucaḥ caranti adhvare
translated: O Agni, come with the fires, we choose you as the Hotar.🔽May the well-prepared oblation anoint you, best at sacrifice, to sit on the sacred grass.🔽For you, O son of strength, O Angiras, the ladles move in the sacrifice.

original: ūrjo napātaṃ ghṛtakeśam īmahe 'gniṃ yajñeṣu pūrvyam ////
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam ghṛta keśam īmahe gnim yajñeṣu pūrvyam
translated: We seek the son of strength, whose hair is ghee, Agni, the first at sacrifices.

original: imā u tvā purūvaso giro vardhantu yā mama /
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā purūvaso giraḥ vardhantu yāḥ mama
translated: May these my songs, O you of abundant wealth, exalt you,

original: pāvakavarṇāḥ śucayo vipaścito 'bhi stomair anūṣata ////
analyzed: pāvaka varṇāḥ śucayaḥ vipaścitaḥ bhiḥ stomaiḥ anūṣata
translated: The pure, the wise, of radiant hue, who have been sung with praises.

original: ayaṃ sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe /
analyzed: ayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudraḥ iva paprathe
translated: This one, created by the Rishis a thousand times, has spread forth like the ocean.

original: satyaḥ so asya mahimā gṛne śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye ////
analyzed: satyaḥ saḥ asya mahimā gṛne śavaḥ yajñeṣu viprarājye
translated: His greatness, his power, is true, which is sung in the assemblies of the priests at sacrifices.

original: ā no viśvāsu havya indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu /
analyzed: ā naḥ viśvāsu havyaḥ indraḥ samatsu bhūṣatu
translated: May Indra, to be invoked in all battles, be favourable to us.

original: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyā ṛcīṣamaḥ ////
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi savanāni vṛtrahā paramajyāḥ ṛcīṣamaḥ
translated: The Vrtra-slayer, most mighty, most swift with the prayers, to the sacrificial libations.

original: tvaṃ dātā prathamo rāghasām asy asi satya īśānakṛt /
analyzed: tvam dātā prathamaḥ rāghasām asi asi satyaḥ īśāna kṛt
translated: You are the first giver of riches, you are the true lord of power.

original: tuvidyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavaso mahaḥ ////
analyzed: tuvi dyumnasya yujyā vṛṇīmahe putrasya śavasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: We choose the yoke of the mighty one, the son of strength, of great power.

original: tvam indra pratūrtiṣv abhi viśvā asi spṛdhaḥ /
analyzed: tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ
translated: You, O Indra, in the battles, are over all the enemies.

original: aśastihā janitā viśvatūr asi tvaṃ tūrya taruṣyataḥ ////
analyzed: aśasti hā janitā viśvatūr asi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ
translated: Thou art the slayer of the reviler, the all-conquering one; thou art the victor of the victor.

original: anu te śuṣmaṃ turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśuṃ na mātarā /
analyzed: anu te śuṣmam turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśum na mātarā
translated: The two worlds follow thy strength as it speeds on, as the two mothers follow the child.

original: viśvās te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtraṃ yad indra tūrvasi ////
analyzed: viśvāḥ te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtram yat indra tūrvasi
translated: All the contending hosts thou crushest in thy wrath, when thou, O Indra, strivest to slay Vritra.

original: ita ūtī vo ajaraṃ prahetāram aprahitam /
analyzed: itas ūtī vaḥ ajaram prahetāram a prahitam
translated: From this place have I sent forth to you the undecaying one, the leader, the unled,

original: āśuṃ jetāraṃ hetāraṃ rathītamam atūrtaṃ tugryāvṛdham ////
analyzed: āśum jetāram hetāram rathītamam a tūrtam tugryāvṛdham
translated: The swift one, the conqueror, the goad, the best charioteer, the unwearied, the strengthener of Tugra.

original: yo rājā carṣaṇīnāṃ yātā rathebhir adhriguḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rājā carṣaṇīnām yātā rathebhiḥ adhriguḥ
translated: He who is the king of men, the swift one with his chariots,

original: viśvāsāṃ tarutā pṛtanānāṃ jyeṣṭho yo vṛtrahā gṛṇe ////
analyzed: viśvāsām tarutā pṛtanānām jyeṣṭhaḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā gṛṇe
translated: The conqueror of all battles, the eldest, the Vr̥itra-slayer, I extol.

original: indraṃ taṃ śumbha puruhanmann avase yasya dvitā vidhartari /
analyzed: indram tam śumbha puru hanman avase yasya dvitā vidhartari
translated: That Indra, O Sumbha, the slayer of many, whose two arms are mighty, the supporter,

original: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśato maho dive na sūryaḥ ////
analyzed: hastāya vajraḥ prati dhāyi darśataḥ mahaḥ dive na sūryaḥ
translated: To whose hand the wondrous thunderbolt is fastened, as the great heaven to the sun.

original: tava tyad indriyaṃ bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum /
analyzed: tava tyad indriyam bṛhat tava śuṣmam uta kratum
translated: That great power of thine, O Indra, that strength, and that wisdom,

original: vajraṃ śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam ////
analyzed: vajram śiśāti dhiṣaṇā vareṇyam
translated: The thunderbolt, the excellent, the thought sharpeneth.

original: tava dyaur indra pauṃsyaṃ pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ /
analyzed: tava dyauḥ indra pauṃsyam pṛthivī vardhati śravaḥ
translated: Thy manly power, O Indra, heaven and earth increase, and thy glory.

original: tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaś ca hinvire ////
analyzed: tvām āpaḥ parvatāsaḥ ca hinvire
translated: The waters and the mountains impel thee.

original: tvāṃ viṣṇur bṛhan kṣayo mitro gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ /
analyzed: tvām viṣṇuḥ bṛhan kṣayaḥ mitraḥ gṛṇāti varuṇaḥ
translated: Viṣṇu, the great destroyer, Mitra, Varuṇa praise thee.

original: tvāṃ śardho madaty anu mārutam ////
analyzed: tvām śardhaḥ madati anu mārutam
translated: The Marut host exults in thee.

original: sam asya manyave viśo viśvā namanta kuṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: sam asya manyave viśaḥ viśvāḥ namanta kuṣṭayaḥ
translated: All the people and all the clans bow down to his wrath,

original: samudrāyeva sindhavaḥ ////
analyzed: samudrāya iva sindhavaḥ
translated: As the rivers to the ocean.

original: ojas tad asya titviṣa ubhe yat samavartayat /
analyzed: ojaḥ tat asya titviṣe ubhe yat samavartayat
translated: That is his strength and his splendour, that he hath brought together both,

original: indraś carmeva rodasī ////🔽vi cid vṛtrasya dodhato vajreṇa śataparvaṇā /
analyzed: indraḥ carma iva rodasī  vi cit vṛtrasya dodhataḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: Indra as a shield the two worlds.🔽Even the rushing Vṛtra he cleft in twain with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt,

original: śiro bibhed vṛṣṇinā ////
analyzed: śiraḥ bibhet vṛṣṇinā
translated: With his all-destroying (weapon).

original: tad id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ugras tveṣanṛmṇaḥ /
analyzed: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas jajñe ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ
translated: That was the highest in the worlds, whence the terrible one of mighty valour sprang.

original: sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yad enaṃ madanti viśva ūmāḥ ////🔽vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojāḥ śatrur dāsāya bhiyasaṃ dadhāti /
analyzed: sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yat enam madanti viśve ūmāḥ  vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasam dadhāti
translated: As soon as he was born he slays the foes, when all the good things rejoice in him.🔽He, waxing strong in power, of abundant strength, causes fear to the foe of the Dāsa.

original: avyanac ca vyanac ca sasni saṃ te navanta prabhṛtā madeṣu ////
analyzed: a vyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāḥ madeṣu
translated: He hath roared and roared again, O bountiful one; they sing to thee at thy feasts.

original: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvir yad ete trir bhavanty ūmāḥ /
analyzed: tve kratum api pṛñcanti bhūri dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ
translated: In thee they place the abundant thought, when these good things are twice and thrice (offered).

original: svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛjā sam adaḥ su madhu madhunābhi yodhīḥ ////
analyzed: svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja sam adaḥ su madhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ
translated: With the sweeter of the sweet, O sweet one, win thou the prize, fight with the sweet one for the sweet.

original: yadi cin nu tvā dhanā jayantaṃ raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ /
analyzed: yadi cit nu tvā dhanā jayantam raṇeraṇe anumadanti viprāḥ
translated: If, indeed, the sages rejoice in thee, O Indra, when thou winnest the wealth in every battle,

original: ojīyaḥ śuṣmint sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ ////🔽tvayā vayaṃ śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyanto yudhenyāni bhūri /
analyzed: ojīyaḥ śuṣmin sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan durevāsaḥ kaśokāḥ  tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ yudhenyāni bhūri
translated: Make thyself stronger, more powerful, more firm; let not the evil-living, the cheerless ones, prevail over thee.🔽Through thee, beholding the many things to be desired in battle, we will shine in contests.

original: codayāmi ta āyudhā vacobhiḥ saṃ te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi ////🔽ni tad dadhiṣe 'vare pare ca yasminn āvithāvasā duroṇe /
analyzed: codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi  ni tat dadhiṣe vare pare ca yasmin āvitha avasā duroṇe
translated: I urge thy weapons with my words; I sharpen thy limbs with prayer.🔽Thou hast established that in the lower and the higher abode, in which thou hast placed thy help.

original: ā sthāpayata mātaraṃ jigatnum ata invata karvarāṇi bhūri ////
analyzed: ā sthāpayata mātaram jigatnum atas invata karvarāṇi bhūri
translated: Establish the mother who moves, and urge the many strong ones.

original: stuṣva varṣman puruvartmānaṃ sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām /
analyzed: stuṣva varṣman puru vartmānam sam ṛbhvāṇam inatamam āptam āptyānām
translated: Praise the mighty one who moves in many ways, the most impetuous, the most victorious of the victorious.

original: ā darśati śavasā bhūryojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānaṃ pṛthivyāḥ ////
analyzed: ā darśati śavasā bhūri ojāḥ pra sakṣati pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ
translated: He shows himself with his power, the very mighty one; he conquers the measure of the earth.

original: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ kṛṇavad indrāya śūṣam agniyaḥ svarṣāḥ /
analyzed: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ kṛṇavat indrāya śūṣam agniyaḥ svarṣāḥ
translated: This Brahman, born of the great heaven, has made strength for Indra, self-luminous, for Agni.

original: maho gotrasya kṣayati svarājā turaś cid viśvam arṇavat tapasvān ////
analyzed: mahaḥ gotrasya kṣayati sva rājā turaḥ cit viśvam arṇavat tapasvān
translated: He rules over the great family's abode, the self-ruling one, the swift one, who burns through all the waters.

original: evā mahān bṛhaddivo atharvāvocat svāṃ tanvam indram eva /
analyzed: eva mahān bṛhaddivaḥ atharvā avocat svām tanvam indram eva
translated: Thus the great one, born of the great heaven, Atharvan, has spoken to his own body, to Indra alone.

original: svasārau mātaribhvarī aripre hinvanti caine śavasā vardhayanti ca ////🔽citraṃ devānāṃ ketur anīkaṃ jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūrya udyan /
analyzed: svasārau mātaribhvarī aripre hinvanti ca ene śavasā vardhayanti ca  citram devānām ketuḥ anīkam jyotiṣmān pradiśaḥ sūryaḥ udyan
translated: The two sisters, the great mothers, urge him on and strengthen him with power, the one who delights in the enemy's wife.🔽The sun, rising, is the brilliant banner and host of the gods, the light of the directions.

original: divākaro 'ti dyumnais tamāṃsi viśvātārīd duritāni śukraḥ ////
analyzed: divākaraḥ ti dyumnaiḥ tamāṃsi viśvā atārīt duritāni śukraḥ
translated: The sun, the illuminator of the day, with his bright rays, dispels the darkness and all evil, the pure one.

original: citraṃ devānām ud agād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ /
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ
translated: The brilliant host of the gods has risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.

original: āprād dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca ////🔽sūryo devīm uṣasaṃ rocamānāṃ maryo na yoṣām abhy eti paścāt /
analyzed: āprāt dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca  sūryaḥ devīm uṣasam rocamānām maryaḥ na yoṣām abhī eti paścāt
translated: The sun has filled the heaven, the earth, and the atmosphere. He is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.🔽The sun approaches the shining dawn, the goddess, like a young man his wife from behind.

original: yatrā naro devayanto yugāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram ////
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ devayantaḥ yugāni vitanvate prati bhadrāya bhadram
translated: Where men who delight in the gods stretch out the yokes for the sake of the auspicious.

original: tvaṃ na indrā bharaṃ ojo nṛmṇaṃ śatakrato vicarṣaṇe /
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra ā bhara ojaḥ nṛmṇam śatakrato vicarṣaṇe
translated: You, O Indra, O Shatakratu, O you of great speed, bestow upon us strength and heroism,

original: ā vīraṃ pṛtanāṣaham ////
analyzed: ā vīram pṛtanāṣaham
translated: A hero who conquers in battles.

original: tvaṃ hi naḥ pitā vaso tvaṃ mātā śatakrato babhūvitha /
analyzed: tvam hi naḥ pitā vaso tvam mātā śatakrato babhūvitha
translated: For you are our father, O good one, you are our mother, O Shatakratu, you have become.

original: adhā te sumnam īmahe ////
analyzed: adhā te sumnam īmahe
translated: Now we seek your favor.

original: tvāṃ śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato /
analyzed: tvām śuṣmin puruhūta vājayantam upa bruve śatakrato
translated: To you, O mighty one, O you who are invoked by many, O you who delight in strength, O Shatakratu, I come for help.

original: sa no rāsva suvīryam ////
analyzed: sa naḥ rāsva su vīryam
translated: Grant us good heroism.

original: svādor itthā viṣuvato madhvaḥ pibanti gauryaḥ /
analyzed: svādoḥ itthā viṣuvataḥ madhvaḥ pibanti gauryaḥ
translated: The tawny ones drink of the sweet juice, of the delicious, well-divided (drink),

original: yā indreṇa sayāvarīr vṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīr anu svarājyam ////
analyzed: yāḥ indreṇa sa yāvarīḥ vṛṣṇā madanti śobhase vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam
translated: Those which, with Indra, the strong one, rejoice in splendour, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: tā asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somaṃ śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ asya pṛśanāyuvaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ
translated: Those dappled ones, swift to move, mix his Soma,

original: priyā indrasya dhenavo vajraṃ hinvanti sāyakaṃ vasvīr anu svarājyam ////🔽tā asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ /
analyzed: priyāḥ indrasya dhenavaḥ vajram hinvanti sāyakam vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam  tāḥ asya namasā sahaḥ saparyanti pracetasaḥ
translated: The dear cows of Indra, they urge on the thunderbolt, the dart, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.🔽Those wise ones serve his strength with reverence,

original: vratāny asya saścire purūṇi pūrvacittaye vasvīr anu svarājyam ////
analyzed: vratāni asya saścire purūṇi pūrva cittaye vasvīḥ anu sva rājyam
translated: They follow his many observances for his earliest thought, the prosperous ones, according to their own dominion.

original: indrāya madūne sutaṃ pari ṣṭobhantu no giraḥ /
analyzed: indrāya madūne sutam pari stobhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: For Indra, who delights in the strong drink, let our songs of praise be exalted;

original: arkam arcantu kāravaḥ ////
analyzed: arkam arcantu kāravaḥ
translated: Let the bards sing their songs of praise.

original: yasmin viśvā adhi śriyo raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ raṇanti sapta saṃsadaḥ
translated: In whom all glories and the seven assemblies resound,

original: indraṃ sute havāmahe ////
analyzed: indram sute havāmahe
translated: We call Indra to the pressed (Soma), to the pressed (Soma).

original: trikadrukeṣu cetanaṃ devāso yajñam atnata /
analyzed: trikadrukeṣu cetanam devāsaḥ yajñam atnata
translated: The gods have set up the sacrifice, the watchful one, on the Trikadrukas;

original: tam id vardhantu no giraḥ ////
analyzed: tam id vardhantu naḥ giraḥ
translated: Let our songs of praise exalt him.

original: yat somam indra viṣṇavi yad vā gha trita āptye /
analyzed: yat somam indra viṣṇavi yat vā gha trite āptye
translated: When, O Indra, thou rejoicest in the Soma with Vishṇu, or when with Trita and Āptya,

original: yad vā marutsu mandase sam indubhiḥ ////
analyzed: yat vā marutsu mandase sam indubhiḥ
translated: Or when thou delightest with the Maruts and the drops of Soma.

original: yad vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase /
analyzed: yat vā śakra parāvati samudre adhi mandase
translated: When, O Śakra, thou rejoicest beyond the sea, in the ocean,

original: asmākam it sute raṇā sam indubhiḥ ////🔽yad vāsi sunvato vṛdho yajamānasya satpate /
analyzed: asmākam id sute raṇa sam indubhiḥ  yat vā asi sunvataḥ vṛdhaḥ yajamānasya satpate
translated: With our Soma-drops, O thou who art to be praised with the Soma-drops.🔽If thou art the helper of the sacrificer who presses out (Soma),

original: ukthe vā yasya raṇyasi sam indubhiḥ ////🔽yad adya kac ca vṛtrahann udagā abhi sūrya /
analyzed: ukthe vā yasya raṇyasi sam indubhiḥ  yat adya kad ca vṛtrahan udagāḥ abhi sūrya
translated: Or if thou delightest in the praise of him who presses out (Soma), with the Soma-drops.🔽Whatever thou hast done today, O thou who slayest Vritra,

original: sarvaṃ tad indra te vaśe ////
analyzed: sarvam tat indra te vaśe
translated: When thou hast risen up towards the sun, all that, O Indra, is in thy power.

original: yad vā pravṛddha satpate na marā iti manyase /
analyzed: yat vā pravṛddha satpate na marai iti manyase
translated: Or if, O thou who art increased, O lord of the people, thou thinkest, 'I shall not die,'

original: uto tat satyam it tava ////
analyzed: uta u tat satyam id tava
translated: That also is true of thee.

original: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire /
analyzed: ye somāsaḥ parāvati ye arvāvati sunvire
translated: Those Soma-pressings which are in the distance, and those which are near,

original: sarvāṃs tāṃ indra gachasi ////
analyzed: sarvān tām indra gacchasi
translated: To all of them, O Indra, thou goest.

original: ubhayaṃ śṛṇavac ca na indro arvāg idaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: ubhayam śṛṇavat ca naḥ indraḥ arvāk idam vacaḥ
translated: May Indra hear both these words of ours, the distant and the near.

original: satrācyā maghavā somapītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭha ā gamat ////
analyzed: satrācyā maghavā soma pītaye dhiyā śaviṣṭhaḥ ā gamat
translated: May the mighty Maghavan come by thought to drink the Soma, never failing in his promise.

original: taṃ hi svarājaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ /
analyzed: tam hi sva rājam vṛṣabham tam ojase dhiṣaṇe niṣṭatakṣatuḥ
translated: For him, the self-ruling bull, him for his strength the two supporters have fashioned.

original: utopamānāṃ prathamo ni ṣīdasi somakāmaṃ hi te manaḥ ////
analyzed: uta upamānām prathamaḥ ni sīdasi soma kāmam hi te manaḥ
translated: And thou sittest first of all in the assemblies, for thy mind is set on Soma.

original: abhrātṛvyo'anā tvam anāpir indra januṣā sanād asi /
analyzed: a bhrātṛvyaḥ anā tvam an āpiḥ indra januṣā sanāt asi
translated: Thou art without a rival, O Indra, without an enemy, from birth thou art without a kinsman.

original: yudhed āpitvam ichase ////🔽nakī revantaṃ sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ /
analyzed: yudhā id āpi tvam ichase 🔽nakir revantam sakhyāya vindase pīyanti te surāśvaḥ
translated: In the fight thou seekest the office of a guardian.🔽Thou findest not a friend who is so devoted that he might be called 'the friend.' They drink thy Soma, O thou with good steeds.

original: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanuṃ sam ūhasy ād it piteva hūyase ////
analyzed: yadā kṛṇoṣi nadanum sam ūhasi āt id pitā iva hūyase
translated: When thou art making the river, thou art borne along, and then, O Father, thou art invoked.

original: aham id dhi pituṣ pari medhām ṛtasya jagrabha /
analyzed: aham id hi pituḥ pari medhām ṛtasya jagrabha
translated: For I have grasped from my father the wisdom of holy order.

original: ahaṃ sūrya ivājani ////
analyzed: aham sūrye iva ajani
translated: I have been born like the sun.

original: ahaṃ pratnena manmanā giraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇvavat /
analyzed: aham pratnena manmanā giraḥ śumbhāmi kaṇva vat
translated: With the ancient hymn I adorn the songs like Kaṇva,

original: yenendraḥ śuṣmam id dadhe ////
analyzed: yena indraḥ śuṣmam id dadhe
translated: Whereby Indra has taken strength.

original: ye tvām indra na tuṣṭuvur ṛṣayo ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ /
analyzed: ye tvām indra na tuṣṭuvuḥ ṛṣayaḥ ye ca tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: O Indra, those Ṛṣis who have not praised thee, and those who have,

original: mamed vardhasva suṣṭutaḥ ////🔽mā bhūma niṣṭyā ivendra tvad araṇā iva /
analyzed: mama id vardhasva suṣṭutaḥ  mā bhūma niṣṭyāḥ iva indra tvat araṇāḥ iva
translated: May I be exalted by thee, well praised.🔽Let us not be like those who dwell in the desert, O Indra, like those who are far from thee.

original: vanāni ni prajahitāny adrivo duroṣāso amanmahi ////
analyzed: vanāni ni prajahitāni adrivas duroṣāsaḥ amanmahi
translated: O thou who art to be worshipped, we have thought upon the forests that are to be conquered.

original: amanmahīd anāśavo 'nugrāsaś ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: amanmahi id anāśavaḥ nugrāsaḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: We have thought upon the swift one, O Vṛtra-slayer, and upon the one who is to be nourished.

original: sukṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasānu stomaṃ mudīmahi ////
analyzed: su kṛt su te mahatā śūra rādhasā anu stomam mudīmahi
translated: O thou of great bounty, O hero, we will rejoice in thy praise, O thou of good deeds.

original: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yaṃ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ /
analyzed: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yam te suṣāva haryaśva adriḥ
translated: Drink the Soma, O Indra, let it delight thee, which the stone, O thou with bay steeds, hath pressed for thee,

original: sotur bāhubhyāṃ suyato nārvā ////
analyzed: sotuḥ bāhubhyām su yataḥ na arvā
translated: Well-guided by the arms of the presser, not too slowly.

original: yas te mado yujas cārur asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi /
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ yujaḥ cāruḥ asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi
translated: That delightful exhilarating drink which thou hast, O thou with bay steeds, wherewith thou slayest the enemies,

original: sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu ////
analyzed: sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu
translated: May that gladden thee, O Indra, O thou of abundant wealth.

original: bodhā su me maghavan vācam emāṃ yāṃ te vasiṣṭho arcati praśastim /
analyzed: bodha su me maghavan vācam ā imām yām te vasiṣṭhaḥ arcati praśastim
translated: O bountiful one, understand this speech of mine, which Vasistha praises and extols for you.

original: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva ////
analyzed: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva
translated: Accept these prayers in the assembly of the holy ones.

original: śagdhy ū ṣu śacīpata indra viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ /
analyzed: śagdhi u su śacīpate indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: You are worthy of praise, O lord of power, O Indra, with all your aids.

original: bhagaṃ na hi tvā yaśasaṃ vasuvidam anu śūra carāmasi ////
analyzed: bhagam na hi tvā yaśasam vasu vidam anu śūra carāmasi
translated: For we follow you, O hero, as one who brings glory and wealth.

original: pauro aśvasya purukṛd gavām asy utso deva hiraṇyayaḥ /
analyzed: pauraḥ aśvasya puru kṛt gavām asi utsaḥ deva hiraṇyayaḥ
translated: You are the lord of the horse, the lord of cattle, O god, you are the bountiful lord of gold.

original: nakir hi dānaṃ parimardhiṣat tve yadyad yāmi tad ā bhara ////
analyzed: nakir hi dānam parimardhiṣat tve yat yat yāmi tat ā bhara
translated: For no one can refuse your gift, whatever I ask, bring that.

original: indram id devatātaye indraṃ prayaty adhvare /
analyzed: indram id devatātaye indram prayati adhvare
translated: Indra, for the sake of the gods, Indra, when the sacrifice is begun,

original: indraṃ samīke vanino havāmaha indraṃ dhanasya sātaye ////🔽indro mahnā rodasī paprathac chava indraḥ sūryam arocayat /
analyzed: indram samīke vaninaḥ havāmahe indram dhanasya sātaye  indraḥ mahnā rodasī paprathat śavaḥ indraḥ sūryam arocayat
translated: Indra in the battle, the singers invoke, Indra for the sake of wealth.🔽Indra with his greatness extended the two worlds, Indra caused the sun to shine.

original: indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemira indre suvānāsa indavaḥ ////🔽astāvi manma pūrvyaṃ brahmendrāya vocata /🔽pūrvīr ṛtasya bṛhatīr anūṣata stotur meghā asṛkṣata ////
analyzed: indre ha viśvā bhuvanāni yemire indre suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ  astāvi manma pūrvyam brahma indrāya vocata  pūrvīḥ ṛtasya bṛhatīḥ anūṣata stotuḥ meghāḥ asṛkṣata
translated: In Indra all beings find support, in Indra the pressed Soma juices.🔽They have sung forth the ancient hymn, they have spoken the prayer to Indra.🔽They have sung the great hymns of truth, the clouds of the praiser have moved.

original: turaṇyavo madhumantaṃ ghṛtaścutaṃ viprāso arkam ānṛcuḥ /
analyzed: turaṇyavaḥ madhumantam ghṛtaścutam viprāsaḥ arkam ānṛcuḥ
translated: The singers have sung the honey-rich, the ghee-dripping hymn to Indra, the swift one.

original: asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyaṃ śavo 'sme suvānāsa indavaḥ ////
analyzed: asme rayiḥ paprathe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ sme suvānāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Wealth has spread out for us, heroic strength, for us the pressed Soma juices.

original: yad indra prāg apāg udaṅ nyag vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ /
analyzed: yat indra prāk apāk udak nyak vā hūyase nṛbhiḥ
translated: When, O Indra, thou art invoked by men either eastward, westward, northward, or downward,

original: simā purū nṛṣūto asy ānave 'si praśardha turvaśe ////
analyzed: sima purū nṛṣūtaḥ asi ānave si praśardha turvaśe
translated: Thou art the bountiful one of many men, thou art the one who advances against the Ānva and Tūrva.

original: yad vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpa indra mādayase sacā /
analyzed: yat vā rume ruśame śyāvake kṛpe indra mādayase sacā
translated: Or when, O Indra, thou rejoicest with the Rumas, Ruśamas, and Śyāvakas,

original: kaṇvāsas tvā brahmabhi stomavāhasa indrā yachanty ā gahi ////
analyzed: kaṇvāsaḥ tvā brahmabhiḥ stoma vāhasaḥ indrāḥ yacchanti ā gahi
translated: The Kaṇvas, with their prayers, with their praises, O Indra, invite thee; come hither!

original: abhi tvā śūra nonumo 'dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: abhi tvā śūra nonumaḥ dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ
translated: We, O hero, praise thee, like milch cows that are milked,

original: īśānam asya jagataḥ svardṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ ////
analyzed: īśānam asya jagataḥ svar dṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ
translated: The lord of this moving world, the lord of heaven, O Indra, the lord of the firm ones.

original: na tvāvāṃ anyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate /🔽aśvāyanto maghavann indra vājino gavyantas tvā havāmahe ////
analyzed: na tvāvām anyaḥ divyaḥ na pārthivaḥ na jātaḥ na janiṣyate  aśvāyantaḥ maghavan indra vājinaḥ gavyantaḥ tvā havāmahe
translated: None other than thee, either divine or earthly, is born or will be born,🔽O Maghavan, Indra, we call thee, O strong one, those who desire horses and cows.

original: revatīr naḥ sadhamāda indre santu tuvivājāḥ /
analyzed: revatīḥ naḥ sadhamādaḥ indre santu tuvi vājāḥ
translated: May the bountiful ones, with great strength, be for us in the assembly with Indra,

original: kṣumanto yābhir madema ////
analyzed: kṣumantaḥ yābhiḥ madema
translated: With which we may rejoice, having food.

original: ā gha tvāvān tmanāpta stotṛbhyo dhṛṣṇav iyānaḥ /
analyzed: ā gha tvāvān tmanā āpta stotṛbhyaḥ dhṛṣṇo iyānaḥ
translated: Even as thou, O mighty one, hast come to the aid of the singers, seeking to be impetuous,

original: ṛṇor akṣaṃ na cakrayoḥ ////
analyzed: ṛṇoḥ akṣam na cakrayoḥ
translated: Like the axle to the two wheels.

original: ā yad duvaḥ śatakratav ā kāmaṃ jaritṝṇām /
analyzed: ā yat duvaḥ śatakrato ā kāmam jaritṝṇām
translated: When thou, O thou of a hundred powers, hast come to the help of the praisers according to their desire,

original: ṛṇor akṣaṃ na śacībhiḥ ////
analyzed: ṛṇoḥ akṣam na śacībhiḥ
translated: The dice of the two gamblers with his mighty powers.

original: tat sūryasya devatvaṃ tan mahitvaṃ madhyā kartor vitataṃ saṃ jabhāra /🔽yaded ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthād ād rātrī vāsas tanute simasmai ////
analyzed: tat sūryasya deva tvam tat mahi tvam madhyā kartoḥ vitatam sam jabhāra  yadā id ayukta haritaḥ sadhasthāt āt rātrī vāsaḥ tanute simasmai
translated: That is the godhead of Surya, that is his greatness. He has gathered together in the middle of the maker what was spread out.🔽When he has yoked the two bays from their abode, then night spreads out a garment for him.

original: tan mitrasya varuṇasyābhicakṣe sūryo rūpaṃ kṛṇute dyor upasthe /
analyzed: tat mitrasya varuṇasya abhicakṣe sūryaḥ rūpam kṛṇute dyoḥ upasthe
translated: That is the gaze of Mitra and Varuna. Surya assumes a form in the lap of the sky.

original: anantam anyad ruśad asya prājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyad dharitaḥ saṃ bharanti ////
analyzed: anantam anyat ruśat asya prājaḥ kṛṣṇam anyat haritaḥ sam bharanti
translated: One endless light of his shines forth, the other dark. The two bays carry the tawny one.

original: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā /
analyzed: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā
translated: By what wondrous help will he come to us, the ever-waxing friend?

original: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā ////🔽kas tvā satyo madānāṃ maṃhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ /🔽dṛlhā cid āruje vasu ////
analyzed: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā  kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām maṃhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ  dṛlhā cit āruje vasu
translated: By what most mighty company?🔽Who, true one of the gladdening drinks, most bountiful in the juice,🔽Will burst open even the firm treasures for us?

original: abhī ṣu naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām /
analyzed: abhī su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām
translated: Be thou the guardian of our friends, the helper of those who sing thy praise,

original: śataṃ bhavāsy ūtibhiḥ ////
analyzed: śatam bhavāsi ūtibhiḥ
translated: Be thou a hundredfold with thy aids.

original: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraś ca viśve ca devāḥ /🔽yajñaṃ ca nas tanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityair indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti ////
analyzed: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ  yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha cīkḷpāti
translated: These worlds we will establish, Indra and all the gods.🔽May Indra, together with the Adityas, ordain for us sacrifice, body, and offspring.

original: ādityair indraḥ sagaṇo marudbhir asmākaṃ bhūtv avitā tanūnām /
analyzed: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam bhūtu avitā tanūnām
translated: Indra, together with the Maruts and the Adityas, be thou the protector of our bodies.

original: hatvāya devā asurān yad āyan devā devatvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ ////
analyzed: hatvāya devāḥ asurān yat āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: When the gods, having slain the Asuras, went forth, the gods, preserving their godhead,

original: pratyañcam arkam anayaṃ chacībhir ād it svadhām iṣirām pary apaśyan /
analyzed: pratyañcam arkam anayam śacībhiḥ āt id svadhām iṣirām pari apaśyan
translated: They have brought the sun to the west with their powers, and have looked around on their own powerful nature.

original: ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ ////
analyzed: ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: May we win the strength that is dear to the gods; may we rejoice in a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: apendra prāco maghavann amitrān apāpāco abhibhūte nudasva /🔽apodīco apa śūrādharāca urau yathā tava śarman madema ////
analyzed: apa indra prācaḥ maghavan amitrān apa apācaḥ abhibhūte nudasva  apa udīcaḥ apa śūra adharācaḥ urau yathā tava śarman madema
translated: Drive away, O Indra, the foes that are in the east, O mighty one, and those that are in the west, O overcomer.🔽Drive away those that are in the north and those that are below, that we may rejoice in thy protection, as in a wide (space).

original: kuvid aṅga yavamanto yavaṃ cid yathā dānty anupūrvaṃ viyūya /
analyzed: kuvid aṅga yavamantaḥ yavam cit yathā dānti anupūrvam viyūya
translated: What, indeed, O ye who have barley, will ye do with barley, as if ye were to reap it in order?

original: ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣo namovṛktiṃ na jagmuḥ ////
analyzed: iha iha eṣām kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣaḥ namovṛktim na jagmuḥ
translated: Here make ye food for them who have not come to the sacrificial grass with a salutation.

original: nahi sthūry ṛtuthā yātam asti nota śravo vivide saṃgameṣu /
analyzed: nahi sthūri ṛtuthā yātam asti na uta śravaḥ vivide saṃgameṣu
translated: For the strong one there is no season that comes in due time, nor is fame found in assemblies.

original: gavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyanto vṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ ////
analyzed: gavyantaḥ indram sakhyāya viprāḥ aśvāyantaḥ vṛṣaṇam vājayantaḥ
translated: The sages, longing for cattle, the strong one, longing for strength, have come to Indra for friendship.

original: yuvaṃ surāmam aśvinā namucāv āsure sacā /
analyzed: yuvam su rāmam aśvinā namucau āsure sacā
translated: Ye two, O Asvins, with the Sura, with Namuchi the Asura,

original: vipipānā śubhas patī indraṃ karmasv āvatam ////
analyzed: vipipānā śubhaḥ patī indram karmasu āvatam
translated: Drinking together, O lords of splendour, have helped Indra in his deeds.

original: putram iva pitarāv aśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyair daṃsanābhiḥ /
analyzed: putram iva pitarau aśvinā ubhā indra āvathuḥ kāvyaiḥ daṃsanābhiḥ
translated: As parents cherish their son, so have the two Aśvins, O Indra, cherished you with their wisdom and their wondrous works.

original: yat surāmaṃ vy apibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavann abhiṣṇak ////
analyzed: yat su rāmam vi apibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavan abhiṣṇak
translated: When with thy might thou drankest the sweet drink of Soma, Sarasvatî, O bounteous Lord, refreshed thee.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavāṃ avobhiḥ sumṛḍīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā svavān avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the mighty, be gracious unto us, the all-knower.

original: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ naḥ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma ////🔽sa sutrāmā svavāṃ indro asmad ārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu /
analyzed: bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam naḥ kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma  sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asmat ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu
translated: May he drive off our foes, may he make us fearless: may we be lords of goodly hero strength.🔽May he, the good protector, the mighty, drive away from us, O Indra, even from afar, the foe.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma ////
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: May we enjoy the gracious favour of that holy God: may we enjoy his loving-kindness and his bliss.

original: vi hi sotor asṛkṣata nendraṃ devam amaṃsata /🔽yatrāmadad vṛṣākapir aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu matsakhā viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: vi hi sotoḥ asṛkṣata na indram devam amaṃsata  yatra amadat vṛṣākapiḥ aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu mad sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The streams have flowed apart: they have not thought upon the God, Indra.🔽Where my dear friend, Vr̥ishâkapi, hath been gladdened among the pious, Indra is higher than all.

original: parā hīndra dhāvasi vṛṣākaper ati vyathiḥ /
analyzed: parā hi indra dhāvasi vṛṣākapeḥ ati vyathiḥ
translated: Thou runnest past, O Indra, Vr̥ishâkapi's distress.

original: no aha pra vindasy anyatra somapītaye viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: na u aha pra vindasi anyatra soma pītaye viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Thou findest not elsewhere a draught of Soma: Indra is higher than all.

original: kim ayaṃ tvāṃ vṛṣākapiś cakāra harito mṛgaḥ /
analyzed: kim ayam tvām vṛṣākapiḥ cakāra haritaḥ mṛgaḥ
translated: What hath this Vr̥ishâkapi, the tawny beast, done unto thee?

original: yasmā irasyasīd u nv aryo vā puṣṭimad vasu viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////🔽yam imaṃ tvaṃ vṛṣākapiṃ priyam indrābhirakṣasi /
analyzed: yasmai irasyasīt u nu aryaḥ vā puṣṭimat vasu viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  yam imam tvam vṛṣākapim priyam indra abhirakṣasi
translated: Since thou art the most excellent, O thou of noble gifts, of all the wealth that is to be gained, Indra art thou above all.🔽This Vr̥ishâkapi whom thou guardest well, O Indra, as a friend,

original: śvā nv asya jambhiṣad api karṇe varāhayur viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: śvā nu asya jambhiṣat api karṇe varāhayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The dog hath seized him by the ear, the boar-hunter: thou art above all.

original: priyā taṣṭāni me kapir vyaktā vy adūduṣat /
analyzed: priyā taṣṭāni me kapiḥ vyaktā vi adūduṣat
translated: The ape hath broken all my dear-loved ornaments.

original: śiro nv asya rāviṣaṃ na sugaṃ duṣkṛte bhuvaṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: śiraḥ nu asya rāviṣam na sugam duṣkṛte bhuvam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: I will tear out his very head: he shall not easily find a path to happiness: thou art above all.

original: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat /
analyzed: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat
translated: No woman is dearer to me, none more graceful, none swifter.

original: na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthy udyamīyasī viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthi udyamīyasī viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: None is more worthy of my choice, none has a thigh more easy to embrace: thou art above all.

original: uve amba sulābhike yathevāṅgaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: amba su lābhike yathā iva aṅgam bhaviṣyati
translated: O mother, easy to be gained, as if thou wert my very self,

original: bhasan me amba sakthi me śiro me vīva hṛṣyati viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////🔽kiṃ subāho svaṅgure pṛthuṣṭo pṛthujāghane /
analyzed: bhasad me amba sakthi me śiraḥ me vi iva hṛṣyati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  kim su bāho su aṅgure
translated: My thigh, my mother, and my head, as if they were my heart, rejoice: thou art above all.🔽O thou of fair arms, of fair hips, of broad breast, of broad haunches,

original: kiṃ śūrapatni nas tvam abhy amīṣi vṛṣākapiṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: kim śūra patni naḥ tvam abhī amīṣi vṛṣākapim viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: O thou whose husband is a hero, why hast thou smitten Vr̥ishâkapi? thou art above all.

original: avīrām iva mām ayaṃ śarārur abhi manyate /
analyzed: avīrām iva mām ayam śarāruḥ abhi manyate
