translated: This miscreant thinks me childless, as if I were a woman without a son.

original: utāham asmi vīriṇīndrapatnī marutsakhā viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: uta aham asmi vīriṇī indra patnī marut sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: And I am the powerful wife of Indra, the friend of the Maruts, Indra is superior to all.

original: saṃhotraṃ sma purā nārī samanaṃ vāva gachati /
analyzed: saṃhotram sma purā nārī samanam vāva gacchati
translated: In the past, a woman used to go to the assembly of the Saman, the gathering of the learned.

original: vedhā ṛtasya vīriṇīndrapatnī mahīyate viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: vedhāḥ ṛtasya vīriṇī indra patnī mahīyate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The wise, powerful wife of Indra is honored, Indra is superior to all.

original: indrāṇīm āsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam /
analyzed: indrāṇīm āsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam
translated: I have heard that among women, Indrani is the most fortunate.

original: nahy asyā aparaṃ cana jarasā marate patir viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: nahi asyāḥ aparam cana jarasā marate patiḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: For her husband does not die before her due to old age, Indra is superior to all.

original: nāham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyur vṛṣākaper ṛte /
analyzed: na aham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyuḥ vṛṣākapeḥ ṛte
translated: O Indrani, I do not rejoice without my friend Vrishakapi.

original: yasyedam apyaṃ haviḥ priyaṃ deveṣu gachati viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: yasya idam apyam haviḥ priyam deveṣu gacchati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Whose pure oblation goes to the beloved gods, Indra is superior to all.

original: vṛsākapāyi revati suputra ād u susnuṣe /
analyzed: vṛsākapāyi revati su putre āt u su snuṣe
translated: O Revati, the wife of Vrishakapi, with good sons and good daughters-in-law,

original: ghasat ta indra ukṣaṇaḥ priyaṃ kācitkaraṃ havir viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: ghasat te indraḥ ukṣaṇaḥ priyam kācitkaram haviḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: May Indra enjoy your bull, the beloved oblation that brings pleasure, Indra is superior to all.

original: ukṣṇo hi me pañcadaśa sākaṃ pacanti viṃsatim /
analyzed: ukṣṇaḥ hi me pañcadaśa sākam pacanti viṃsatim
translated: For they cook for me fifteen bulls and twenty oxen together.

original: utāham admi pīva id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: uta aham admi pīvaḥ id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: And I eat well, both my stomachs are filled, Indra is superior to all.

original: vṛṣabho na tigmaśṛṅgo 'ntar yūtheṣu roruvat /
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ na tigma śṛṅgaḥ ntar yūtheṣu roruvat
translated: Like a bull with sharp horns, roaring among the herds,

original: manthas ta indra śaṃ hṛde yaṃ te sunoti bhāvayur viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: manthaḥ te indra śam hṛde yam te sunoti bhāvayuḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: That churning, O Indra, is a blessing to thy heart, which the worshipper presses for thee. Thou art superior to all, O Indra.

original: na seśe yasya rambate 'ntarā sakthyā kapṛt /
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya rambate ntarā kapṛth
translated: He is not a lord whose knee-cap rattles within.

original: sedīśe yasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: sedi īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: He is a lord whose bristling hair stands erect as he sits down. Thou art superior to all, O Indra.

original: na seśe yasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate /
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate
translated: He is not a lord whose bristling hair stands erect as he sits down.

original: sedīśe yasya rambate 'ntarā sakthyā kapṛt viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: sedi īśe yasya rambate ntarā kapṛth viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: He is a lord whose knee-cap rattles within. Thou art superior to all, O Indra.

original: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantaṃ hataṃ vidat /
analyzed: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantam hatam vidat
translated: This Indra, O Vṛṣāka, has found the slain one who had good possessions,

original: asiṃ sūnāṃ navaṃ carum ād edhasyāna ācitaṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: asim sūnām navam carum āt edhasya anaḥ ācitam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The knife, the new vessel, and the heaped-up fuel. Thou art superior to all, O Indra.

original: ayam emi vicākaśad vicinvan dāsam āryam /
analyzed: ayam emi vicākaśat vicinvan dāsam āryam
translated: I come hither, looking around, seeking the noble slave.

original: pibāmi pākasutvano 'bhi dhīram acākaśaṃ viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: pibāmi pākasutvanaḥ bhi dhīram acākaśam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: I drink as one who has drunk Soma. I look to the wise one. Thou art superior to all, O Indra.

original: dhanva ca yat kṛntatraṃ ca kati svit tā vi yojanā /
analyzed: dhanva ca yat kṛntatram ca kati svid tā vi yojanā
translated: How many are those two, the bow and the net, in their arrangement?

original: nedīyaso vṛṣākape 'stam ehi gṛhāṃ upa viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: nedīyasaḥ vṛṣākape stam ehi gṛhān upa viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Come, O Vṛṣāka, to the house, to the near one. Thou art superior to all, O Indra.

original: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai /
analyzed: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai
translated: Come back, O Vṛṣāka, let us arrange good fortune.

original: ya eṣa svapnanaṃśano 'stam eṣi pathā punar viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ eṣa svapnanaṃśano stam eṣi pathā punar viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: He who, devouring dreams, goes down again by the path, is supreme over all, O Indra.

original: yad udañco vṛṣākape gṛham indrājagantana /
analyzed: yat udañcaḥ vṛṣākape gṛham indra ajagantana
translated: When, O Indra, you went to the house of Vṛṣākapi, going upwards,

original: kva sya pulvagho mṛgaḥ kam agaṃ janayopano viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: kva sya pulu aghaḥ mṛgaḥ kam agam jana yopanaḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: where is that deer with the hidden wound? Whom did you go to for help? He is supreme over all, O Indra.

original: parśur ha nāma mānavī sākaṃ sasūva viṃśatim /
analyzed: parśuḥ ha nāma mānavī sākam sasūva viṃśatim
translated: The woman named Paśu gave birth to twenty children at once.

original: bhadraṃ bhala tyasyā abhūd yasyā udaram āmayad viśvasmād indra uttaraḥ ////
analyzed: bhadram bhala tyasyāḥ abhūt yasyāḥ udaram viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Blessed was the womb that was afflicted by her. He is supreme over all, O Indra.

original: idaṃ janā upa śruta narāśaṃsa staviṣyate /
analyzed: idam janāḥ upa śruta narāśaṃsa staviṣyate
translated: O people, listen to this. Narāśaṃsa will be praised.

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrā navatiṃ ca kaurama ā ruśameṣu dadmahe ////
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim sahasrā navatim ca kaurame ā ruśameṣu dadmahe
translated: We give sixty thousand and ninety to Kaurama in the land of the R̥ishis.

original: uṣṭrā yasya pravāhaṇo vadhūmanto dvirdaśa /
analyzed: uṣṭrāḥ yasya pravāhaṇaḥ vadhūmantaḥ dvis daśa
translated: He whose draft animals are camels, twelve in number,

original: varṣmā rathasya ni jihīḍate diva īṣamāṇā upaspṛśaḥ ////
analyzed: varṣmā rathasya ni jihīḍate divaḥ īṣamāṇāḥ upaspṛśaḥ
translated: the seat of the chariot is stretched out in the sky, the reins are touched.

original: eṣa iṣāya māmahe śataṃ niṣkān daśa srajaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ iṣāya māmahe śatam niṣkān daśa srajaḥ
translated: He is offering us a hundred gold coins and ten garlands.

original: trīṇi śatānyarvatāṃ sahasrā daśa gonām ////🔽vacyasva rebha vacyasva vṛkṣe na pakve śakunaḥ /
analyzed: trīṇi śatāni arvatām sahasrā daśa gonām  vacyasva rebha vacyasva vṛkṣe na pakve śakunaḥ
translated: Three hundred horses and ten thousand cows.🔽Sing, O singer, sing, O bird in a ripe fruit in the tree.

original: naṣṭe jihvā carcarīti kṣuro na bhurijoriva ////
analyzed: naṣṭe jihvā carcarīti kṣuraḥ na bhurijoḥ iva
translated: The tongue moves like a razor on a grindstone when it is lost.

original: pra rebhāso manīṣā vṛṣā gāva iverate /
analyzed: pra rebhāsaḥ manīṣā vṛṣāḥ gāvaḥ iva īrate
translated: The Rebhās, like bulls, move their thoughts, like cows, in search of food.

original: amotaputrakā eṣāmamota gā ivāsate ////
analyzed: amā uta putrakāḥ eṣām amā uta gāḥ iva āsate
translated: Their sons are not clothed, they sit like cows without clothing.

original: pra rebha dhīm bharasva govidaṃ vasuvidam /
analyzed: pra rebha dhīm bharasva go vidam vasu vidam
translated: O Rebha, bring forth the thought that finds cattle and finds wealth.

original: devatremāṃ vācaṃ srīṇīhīṣurnāvīrastāram ////
analyzed: devatrā imām vācam srīṇīhi iṣuḥ na avīraḥ tāram
translated: Make this speech go to the gods, like a bird to its nest, like a swift bird.

original: rājño viśvajanīnasya yo devomartyāṃ ati /
analyzed: rājñaḥ viśvajanīnasya yaḥ devaḥ umartyām ati
translated: Of the king who is the god over mortals,

original: vaiśvānarasya suṣṭutimā sunotā parikṣitaḥ ////
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya suṣṭutimā sunotā parikṣitaḥ
translated: of Vaiśvānara, the well-protected, sing the praise of Parikshit.

original: parichinnaḥ kṣemam akarot tama āsanamācaran /🔽kulāyan kṛṇvan kauravyaḥ patir vadati jāyayā ////
analyzed: parichinnaḥ kṣemam akarot tamaḥ āsanam ācaran  kulāyan kṛṇvan kauravyaḥ patiḥ vadati jāyayā
translated: The one who is well-protected has made peace, the best seat he has taken.🔽The Kaurava, making a nest, the lord speaks to his wife.

original: katarat ta ā harāṇi dadhi manthāṃ pari śrutam /
analyzed: katarat te ā harāṇi dadhi manthām pari śrutam
translated: Which of your offerings will you bring, curd or churned milk, O famous one?

original: jāyāḥ patiṃ vi pṛchati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ ////
analyzed: jāyāḥ patim vi pṛcchati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ
translated: The wife asks the lord of the kingdom of Parikshit.

original: abhīvasvaḥ pra jihīte yavaḥ pakvaḥ patho bilam /
analyzed: abhīvasvaḥ pra jihīte yavaḥ pakvaḥ pathaḥ bilam
translated: The barley ripens, the path's hole is opened, like a cloud.

original: janaḥ sa bhadram edhati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ ////
analyzed: janaḥ sa bhadram edhati rāṣṭre rājñaḥ parikṣitaḥ
translated: The people prosper in the kingdom of Parikshit.

original: indraḥ kārum abūbudhad uttiṣṭha vi carā janam /
analyzed: indraḥ kārum abūbudhat uttiṣṭha vi cara janam
translated: Indra has called to Karu: Rise up and move among the people.

original: mamedugrasya carkṛdhi sarva it te pṛṇādariḥ ////
analyzed: mama id ugrasya carkṛdhi sarvaḥ id te pṛṇāt ariḥ
translated: Do my bidding, O mighty one; all will serve you, the enemy-crusher.

original: iha gāvaḥ pra jāyadhvam ihāśvā iha pūruṣāḥ /
analyzed: iha gāvaḥ pra jāyadhvam iha aśvāḥ iha pūruṣāḥ
translated: Here, O cows, be born; here, O horses; here, O men.

original: iho sahasradakṣiṇopi pūṣā ni ṣīdati ////
analyzed: iha u sahasra dakṣiṇaḥ upi pūṣā ni sīdati
translated: Here even Pūṣan, with a thousand gifts, sits down.

original: nemā indra gāvo riṣan mo āsāṃ gopa rīriṣat /
analyzed: na imāḥ indra gāvaḥ riṣat mā u āsām gopa rīriṣat
translated: Let not these cows of thine, O Indra, be injured, nor let their keeper be injured.

original: māsām amitrayurjana indra mā stena īśata ////
analyzed: mā āsām amitrayuḥ janaḥ indra mā stenaḥ īśata
translated: Let not the people who are unfriendly to these, O Indra, let not the thief rule over them.

original: upa no na ramasi sūktena vacasā vayaṃ bhadreṇa vacasā vayam /
analyzed: upa naḥ na ramasi sūktena vacasā vayam bhadreṇa vacasā vayam
translated: We delight thee with a hymn, with a kind word, with a good word.

original: vanād adhidhvano giro na riṣyema kadā cana ////
analyzed: vanāt adhidhvanaḥ giraḥ na riṣyema kadā cana
translated: May we never be injured by the songs of the forest-dwellers.

original: yaḥ sabheyo vidathyaḥ sutvā yajvātha pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sabheyaḥ vidathyaḥ sutvā yajvā atha pūruṣaḥ
translated: He who is a member of the assembly, who is skilled in sacrifices, who is a good sacrificer, that man,

original: sūryaṃ cāmū riśādasas tad devāḥ prāg akalpayan ////
analyzed: sūryam ca amuḥ riśādasaḥ tat devāḥ prāk akalpayan
translated: The one who is free from anger, the one who is free from hatred, the gods have ordained that to be the best.

original: yo jāmyā aprathayas tad yat sakhāyaṃ dudhūrṣati /
analyzed: yaḥ jāmyāḥ aprathayaḥ tat yat sakhāyam dudhūrṣati
translated: If one spreads out the bed of one's sister, if one is eager to quarrel with one's friend,

original: jyeṣṭho yad apracetās tad āhur adharāg iti ////
analyzed: jyeṣṭhaḥ yat apracetāḥ tat āhuḥ adharāk iti
translated: If one is the eldest but not wise, they say that is inferior.

original: yad bhadrasya puruṣasya putro bhavati dādhṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: yat bhadrasya puruṣasya putraḥ bhavati dādhṛṣiḥ
translated: If a good man's son becomes bold,

original: tad vipro abravīd u tad gandharvaḥ kāmyaṃ vacaḥ ////
analyzed: tat vipraḥ abravīt u tat gandharvaḥ kāmyam vacaḥ
translated: The wise one has said that, the Gandharva has said that pleasant word.

original: yaśca paṇi raghujiṣṭhyo yaśca devāṃ adāśuriḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca paṇi raghujiṣṭhyaḥ yaḥ ca devān adāśuriḥ
translated: He who is the most swift to act, he who is the most generous to the gods,

original: dhīrāṇāṃ śaśvatām ahaṃ tad apāg iti śuśruma ////
analyzed: dhīrāṇām śaśvatām aham tat apāk iti śuśruma
translated: Of the wise ones who are eternal, we have heard that is the best.

original: ye ca devā ayajantātho ye ca parādadiḥ /
analyzed: ye ca devāḥ ayajanta atha u ye ca parādadiḥ
translated: Those who have sacrificed to the gods, and those who have given to others,

original: sūryo divam iva gatvāya maghavā no vi rapśate ////
analyzed: sūryaḥ divam iva gatvāya maghavā naḥ vi rapśate
translated: Maghavan, having gone to heaven like the sun, shines forth for us.

original: yo'nāktākṣo anabhyakto amaṇivo ahiraṇyavaḥ /
analyzed: yonā akta akṣaḥ an abhyaktaḥ a maṇivaḥ a hiraṇyavaḥ
translated: He who has unanointed eyes, is unadorned, has no jewels, no gold,

original: abrahmā brahmaṇaḥ putrastotā kalpeṣu saṃmitā ////
analyzed: abrahmā brahmaṇaḥ putraḥ totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā
translated: The son of Brahman, who is not well-versed in the Vedas, is a praiseworthy poet in the Kalpas.

original: ya āktākṣaḥ subhyaktaḥ sumaṇiḥ suhiraṇyavaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ākta akṣaḥ su bhyaktaḥ su maṇiḥ su hiraṇyavaḥ
translated: He who has anointed eyes, is well-adorned, has good jewels, good gold,

original: subrahmā brahmaṇaḥ putrastotā kalpeṣu saṃmitā ////🔽aprapāṇā ca veśantā revāṃ apratidiśyayaḥ /
analyzed: subrahmā brahmaṇaḥ putraḥ totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  aprapāṇā ca veśantā revām apratidiśyayaḥ
translated: The son of Brahman, who is well-versed in the Vedas, is a praiseworthy poet in the Kalpas.🔽He who has a well-to-do wife, a prosperous home, a well-directed course,

original: ayabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā ////🔽suprapāṇā ca veśantā revānt supratidiśyayaḥ /
analyzed: ayabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā  su prapāṇā ca veśantā revān supratidiśyayaḥ
translated: A handsome daughter, is a praiseworthy poet in the Kalpas.🔽He who has a well-to-do wife, a prosperous home, a well-directed course,

original: suyabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā ////
analyzed: suyabhyā kanyā kalyāṇī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā
translated: A handsome daughter, is a praiseworthy poet in the Kalpas.

original: parivṛktā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhiṃ gamaḥ /
analyzed: parivṛktā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhim gamaḥ
translated: The barren cow, and the victory in battle, and the swift horse,

original: anāśuraścāyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā ////
analyzed: anāśuraḥ ca āyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā
translated: The son-in-law, and the daughter, are praiseworthy in the Kalpas.

original: vāvātā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhiṃ gamaḥ /
analyzed: vāvātā ca mahiṣī svastyā ca yudhim gamaḥ
translated: The fruitful cow, and the victory in battle, and the swift horse,

original: śvāśuraś cāyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā ////
analyzed: śvāśuraḥ ca āyāmī totā kalpeṣu saṃmitā
translated: The son-in-law, and the daughter, are praiseworthy in the Kalpas.

original: yad indrādo dāśarājñe mānuṣaṃ vi gāhathāḥ /
analyzed: yat indra adaḥ dāśarājñe mānuṣam vi gāhathāḥ
translated: When you, O Indra, went to the human world of the Dasha-rajas,

original: virūpaḥ sarvasmā āsīt saha yakṣāya kalpate ////
analyzed: virūpaḥ sarvasmai āsīt saha yakṣāya kalpate
translated: Virupa became all-powerful, and became fit for the Yaksha.

original: tvaṃ vṛṣākṣuṃ maghavann amraṃ maryākaro raviḥ /
analyzed: tvam vṛṣākṣum maghavan amram maryā karaḥ raviḥ
translated: You, O Maghavan, made the bull, the immortal, the boundary-maker, the sun.

original: tvaṃ rauhiṇaṃ vyāsyo vi vṛtrasyābhinac chiraḥ ////
analyzed: tvam rauhiṇam vyāsyaḥ vi vṛtrasya abhinat śiraḥ
translated: You, O Vyāsyā, opened the Rauhiṇa, you struck off Vṛtra's head.

original: yaḥ parvatān vyadadhād yo apo vyagāhathāḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ parvatān vyadadhāt yaḥ apaḥ vyagāhathāḥ
translated: He who set the mountains apart, who plunged into the waters,

original: indro yo vṛtrahānmahaṃ tasmād indra namo 'stu te ////
analyzed: indraḥ yaḥ vṛtra hā maham tasmāt indra namaḥ stu te
translated: Indra, who is great as the slayer of Vṛtra, to you, O Indra, homage!

original: pṛṣṭhaṃ dhāvantaṃ haryor auccaiḥ śravasam abruvan /
analyzed: pṛṣṭham dhāvantam haryoḥ auccais śravasam abruvan
translated: To the horse of the two tawny ones, Uccaiḥśravas, running on the back, they said:

original: svastyaśva jaitrāyendram ā vaha susrajam ////
analyzed: svasti aśva jaitrāya indram ā vaha su srajam
translated: For victory, O horse, bring Indra, the well-garlanded one!

original: ye tvā śvetā ajaiśravaso hāryo yuñjanti dakṣiṇam /
analyzed: ye tvā śvetāḥ ajaiśravasaḥ hāryaḥ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam
translated: Those who yoke you, the white ones, the dear ones, to the right,

original: pūrvā namasya devānāṃ bibhrad indra mahīyate ////
analyzed: pūrvā namasya devānām bibhrat indra mahīyate
translated: bearing Indra, the first to be worshipped by the gods, he is exalted.

original: etā aśvā ā plavante ////
analyzed: etāḥ aśvāḥ ā plavante
translated: These horses are swimming.

original: pratīpaṃ prāti sutvanam ////
analyzed: pratīpam prāti sutvanam
translated: Against the current, the well-pressed (Soma).

original: tāsām ekā hariknikā ////
analyzed: tāsām ekā hariknikā
translated: Among them, one is the tawny one.

original: hariknike kim ichāsi ////
analyzed: hariknike kim ichāsi
translated: O tawny one, what do you desire?

original: sādhuṃ putraṃ hiraṇyayam ////
analyzed: sādhum putram hiraṇyayam
translated: A good son, made of gold.

original: kvāhataṃ parāsyaḥ ////
analyzed: kva ahatam parāsyaḥ
translated: Where is the one who has fallen?

original: yatrāmūs tisraḥ śiṃśapāḥ ////
analyzed: yatra amūḥ tisraḥ śiṃśapāḥ
translated: Where those three śiṃśapā trees.

original: pari trayaḥ ////
analyzed: pari trayaḥ
translated: Three around.

original: pṛdākavaḥ ////
analyzed: pṛdākavaḥ
translated: The speckled ones.

original: śṛṅgaṃ dhamanta āsate ////
analyzed: śṛṅgam dhamantaḥ āsate
translated: The horns are blowing.

original: ayanmahā te arvāhaḥ ////
analyzed: ayan mahā te arvāhaḥ
translated: This is your great chariot.

original: sa ichakaṃ saghāghate ////
analyzed: saḥ ichakam saghāghate
translated: He desires the company of the gods.

original: saghāghate gomīdyā gogatīr iti ////
analyzed: saghā ghate gomīdyāḥ go gatīḥ iti
translated: The cow-paths of the cow-keeper are blocked.

original: pumāṃ kuste nimichasi ////🔽palpa baddha vayo iti ////
analyzed: pumān kuḥ te nimicchasi  palpa baddha vayo iti
translated: What man do you wish to kill?🔽The birds are bound.

original: baddha vo aghā iti ////🔽ajāgāra kevikā ////
analyzed: vaḥ aghā iti  ajāgāra kevikā
translated: The enemies are bound.🔽The goat-house is empty.

original: aśvasya vāro gośapadyake ////
analyzed: aśvasya vāraḥ gośapadyake
translated: The horse's turn is in the cow-pen.

original: śyenīpatī sā ////
analyzed: śyenīpatī sā
translated: The hawk-lord is that.

original: anāmayopajihvikā ////
analyzed: anāmayā upajihvikā
translated: The tongue-less one is the name.

original: ko arya bahulimā iṣūni ////🔽ko asidyāḥ payaḥ ////
analyzed: kaḥ arya bahulimā iṣūni  kaḥ asidyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Who is the many-stringed one among the arrows?🔽Who is the milk of the Asidya?

original: ko arjunyāḥ payaḥ ////
analyzed: kaḥ arjunyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Who is the milk of the Arjuna?

original: kaḥ kārṣṇyāḥ payaḥ ////
analyzed: kaḥ kārṣṇyāḥ payaḥ
translated: Who is the milk of the Kṛṣṇā?

original: etaṃ pṛcha kuhaṃ pṛcha ////
analyzed: etam pṛccha kuham pṛccha
translated: Ask him. Ask Kuha.

original: kuhākaṃ pakvakaṃ pṛcha ////🔽yavāno yatiṣvabhiḥ kubhiḥ ////🔽akupyantaḥ kupāyakuḥ ////
analyzed: kuhākam pakvakam pṛccha  yavānaḥ yatiṣvabhiḥ kubhiḥ  a kupyantaḥ
translated: Ask Kuhakam Pakvakam.🔽The barley is with the bad pots.🔽The angry ones are the angry ones.

original: āmaṇako maṇatsakaḥ ////
analyzed: āmaṇakaḥ maṇatsakaḥ
translated: The small one is the one with the jewel.

original: deva tvapratisūrya ////
analyzed: deva tvā apratisūrya
translated: O god, the sun is not seen.

original: enaścipaṅktikā haviḥ ////
analyzed: enaḥ cipaṅktikā haviḥ
translated: And the row of chips is the oblation.

original: pradudrudo maghāprati ////
analyzed: pradudrudaḥ maghā aprati
translated: The one who runs away is the one with the wealth.

original: śṛṅga utpanna ////
analyzed: śṛṅgaḥ utpanna
translated: The horn is arisen.

original: mā tvābhi sakhā no vidan ////
analyzed: mā tvā abhi sakhā naḥ vidan
translated: May your friend not know you.

original: vaśāyāḥ putram ā yanti ////
analyzed: vaśāyāḥ putram ā yanti
translated: They come to the son of the barren cow.

original: irāvedumayaṃ data ////🔽atho iyanniyann iti ////
analyzed: irāvedu mayam data  atha u iyan iyan iti
translated: Give the food that is full of sap.🔽And this is the one who rules.

original: atho iyanniti ////
analyzed: atha u iyan iti
translated: And this is the one.

analyzed: na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase

analyzed: na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase

original: na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase ////
analyzed: na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase

analyzed: na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase
translated: O young girl, it is not so as you think, O young girl.

analyzed: na vai kumāri tat tathā yathā kumāri manyase

analyzed: iha itthā prāc apāk udak adharāk āste

analyzed: brūte bhraṣṭā utha api a bhūbhuvaḥ

analyzed: brūte bhraṣṭā utha api a bhūbhuvaḥ

analyzed: yathā vayaḥ vidāhya svarge

analyzed: mahānagnī mahānagnam dhāvantam anu dhāvati

analyzed: su devaḥ tvā mahān agniḥ babādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam

original: kusaṃ pīvaro navat ////
analyzed: kusam pīvaraḥ navat

analyzed: mahān vai bhadraḥ yabha mām addhi odanam

analyzed: videvaḥ tvā mahān agniḥ vibādhate mahataḥ sādhu khodanam

analyzed: kumārikā piṅgalikā kārda bhasmā ku dhāvati

analyzed: yat ha prācīḥ ajaganta uraḥ maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ

analyzed: kapṛth naraḥ kapṛtham ud dadhātana codayata khudata vājasātaye
translated: O men, raise up the generous one, urge him on to win the prize.

original: niṣṭigryaḥ putram ā cyāvayotaya indraṃ sabādha iha somapītaye ////
analyzed: niṣṭigryaḥ putram ā cyāvaya ūtaye indram sabādhaḥ iha soma pītaye
translated: O Nisthivyâs, bring your son hither, bring Indra hither to drink the Soma here.

original: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṃ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ /
analyzed: dadhikrāvṇaḥ akāriṣam jiṣṇoḥ aśvasya vājinaḥ
translated: I have served Dadhikrâvan, the victorious, the strong steed.

original: surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṃṣi tāriṣat ////
analyzed: surabhi naḥ mukhā karat pra naḥ āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: May he make our mouths fragrant, and lengthen our lives.

original: sutāso madhumattamāḥ somā indrāya mandinaḥ /
analyzed: sutāsaḥ madhumattamāḥ somāḥ indrāya mandinaḥ
translated: The most sweet-flavoured juices, the Soma-drops, are pressed for Indra, the gladdener.

original: pavitravanto akṣaran devān gachantu vo madāḥ ////
analyzed: pavitravantaḥ akṣaran devān gachantu vaḥ madāḥ
translated: They have flowed through the filter. Let your gladdening draughts go to the Gods.

original: indur indrāya pavata iti devāso abruvan /🔽vācas patir makhasyate viśvasyeśāna ojasā ////
analyzed: induḥ indrāya pavate iti devāsaḥ abruvan  vācaḥ patiḥ makhasyate viśvasya īśānaḥ ojasā
translated: The Gods have said, 'Let Indu be purified for Indra.'🔽The Lord of Speech is purified for the sacrifice. He is the Lord of all by his might.

original: sahasradhāraḥ pavate samudro vācamīṅkhayaḥ /
analyzed: sahasra dhāraḥ pavate samudraḥ vācamīṅkhayaḥ
translated: The thousand-streamed sea flows on, urging speech.

original: somaḥ patī rayīṇāṃ sakhendrasya divedive ////
analyzed: somaḥ patiḥ rayīṇām sakhā indrasya dive dive
translated: Soma, the Lord of wealth, is Indra's friend day by day.

original: ava drapso aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhad iyānaḥ kṛṣṇo daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ /
analyzed: ava drapsaḥ aṃśumatīm atiṣṭhat iyānaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ daśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ
translated: The drop hath settled on the stalk, the black, increasing with ten thousand.

original: āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīr nṛmaṇā adhatta ////
analyzed: āvat tam indraḥ śacyā dhamantam apa snehitīḥ nṛmaṇāḥ adhatta
translated: Indra and Sacî have given him who was blowing, the man-conquering one, his oily covering.

original: drapsam apaśyaṃ viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyo aṃśumatyāḥ /
analyzed: drapsam apaśyam viṣuṇe carantam upahvare nadyaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ
translated: I saw the drop moving on the ridge of the mountain, on the bank of the river Ânshumatî.

original: nabho na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vo vṛṣaṇo yudhyatājau ////
analyzed: nabhaḥ na kṛṣṇam avatasthivāṃsam iṣyāmi vaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yudhyata ājau
translated: I will shoot at you, O heroes, in the fight, the black one who hath settled in the cloud.

original: adha drapso aṃśumatyā upasthe 'dhārayat tanvaṃ titviṣāṇaḥ /
analyzed: adha drapsaḥ aṃśumatyāḥ upasthe dhārayat tanvam titviṣāṇaḥ
translated: Then the drop, shining, hath laid his body in the lap of Ânshumatî.

original: viśo adevīr abhy ācarantīr bṛhaspatinā yujendraḥ sasāhe ////
analyzed: viśaḥ adevīḥ abhī ācarantīḥ bṛhaspatinā yujā indraḥ sasāhe
translated: The godless tribes have come to us with hostility. Indra, united with Brihaspati, has conquered.

original: tvaṃ ha tyat saptabhyo jāyamāno 'śatrubhyo abhavaḥ śatrur indra /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad saptabhyaḥ jāyamānaḥ śatrubhyaḥ abhavaḥ śatruḥ indra
translated: Thou, indeed, when born from the seven, hast become an enemy to the enemies, O Indra.

original: gūlhe dyāvāpṛthivī anv avindo vibhumadbhyo bhuvanebhyo raṇaṃ dhāḥ ////
analyzed: gūlhe dyāvāpṛthivī anu avindaḥ vibhumadbhyaḥ bhuvanebhyaḥ raṇam dhāḥ
translated: In the hidden (places) thou hast found out heaven and earth. Grant room for the wide-ruling worlds.

original: tvaṃ ha tyad apratimānam ojo vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣito jaghantha /
analyzed: tvam ha tyad a pratimānam ojaḥ vajreṇa vajrin dhṛṣitaḥ jaghantha
translated: Thou, indeed, with the irresistible might, O wielder of the thunderbolt, hast struck down with the thunderbolt.

original: tvaṃ śuṣṇasyāvātiro vadhatrais tvaṃ gā indra śacyed avindaḥ ////
analyzed: tvam śuṣṇasya avātiraḥ vadhatraiḥ tvam gāḥ indra śacyā id avindaḥ
translated: Thou hast overcome the wicked with thy weapons. Thou hast found the cows, O Indra, in thy power.

original: tam indraṃ vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave /
analyzed: tam indram vājayāmasi mahe vṛtrāya hantave
translated: We urge that Indra to exert himself for the great slaughter of Vrtra.

original: sa vṛṣā vṛṣabho bhuvat ////
analyzed: sa vṛṣā vṛṣabhaḥ bhuvat
translated: He is the bull, the strong one.

original: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛta ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ sa dāmane kṛtaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ sa made hitaḥ
translated: Indra is made for the conquest, he is placed in the joy,

original: dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ ////
analyzed: dyumnī ślokī sa somyaḥ
translated: the glorious, the famous, the dear to Soma.

original: girā vajro na saṃbhṛtaḥ sabalo anapacyutaḥ /
analyzed: girā vajraḥ na saṃbhṛtaḥ sa balaḥ an apacyutaḥ
translated: The thunderbolt is collected by the song, the strong one, the unshaken,

original: vavakṣa ṛṣvo astṛtaḥ ////
analyzed: vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ astṛtaḥ
translated: the lofty one, the irresistible one, has grown.

original: mahāṃ indro ya ojasā parjanyo vṛṣṭimāṃ iva /
analyzed: mahān indraḥ yaḥ ojasā parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimān iva
translated: Great is Indra, who by his might is like Parjanya full of rain,

original: stomair vatsasya vāvṛdhe ////🔽prajām ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yad bharanta vahnayaḥ /
analyzed: stomaiḥ vatsasya vāvṛdhe  prajām ṛtasya piprataḥ pra yat bharanta vahnayaḥ
translated: who has grown by the praises of Vatsa.🔽When the priests of holy order carry forward the offspring,

original: viprā ṛtasya vāhasā ////
analyzed: viprāḥ ṛtasya vāhasā
translated: the sages by the impulse of holy order.

original: kaṇvāḥ indraṃ yad akrata stomair yajñasya sādhanam /
analyzed: kaṇvāḥ indram yat akrata stomaiḥ yajñasya sādhanam
translated: When the Kaṇvas have made Indra with their hymns the accomplisher of the sacrifice,

original: jāmi bruvata āyudham ////🔽ā nūnam aśvinā yuvaṃ vatsasya gantam avase /
analyzed: jāmi bruvate āyudham  ā nūnam aśvinā yuvam vatsasya gantam avase
translated: Speaking as kinsmen, the weapon.🔽Now, O ye Aśvins, come to the aid of Vatsa.

original: prāsmai yachatam avṛkam pṛthu chardir yuyutaṃ yā arātayaḥ ////
analyzed: pra asmai yacchatam avṛkam pṛthu chardiḥ yuyutam yāḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Grant him a wide pasture free from danger; drive away the evil spirits.

original: yad antarikṣe yad divi yat pañca mānuṣāṃ anu /
analyzed: yat antarikṣe yat divi yat pañca mānuṣām anu
translated: What ye have in the atmosphere, what ye have in heaven, what ye have among the five peoples,

original: nṛmnaṃ tad dhattam aśvinā ////
analyzed: nṛmnam tat dhattam aśvinā
translated: Bestow that manly power, O Aśvins.

original: ye vām daṃsāṃsy aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ /
analyzed: ye vām daṃsāṃsi aśvinā viprāsaḥ parimāmṛśuḥ
translated: The sages who have measured your wondrous deeds, O Aśvins,

original: evet kāṇvasya bodhatam ////
analyzed: eva id kāṇvasya bodhatam
translated: Even thus be ye aware of Kaṇva's.

original: ayaṃ vāṃ gharmo aśvinā stomena pari ṣicyate /
analyzed: ayam vām gharmaḥ aśvinā stomena pari sicyate
translated: This your Gharma, O Aśvins, is poured around with the hymn,

original: ayaṃ somo madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtraṃ ciketathaḥ ////
analyzed: ayam somaḥ madhumān vājinīvasū yena vṛtram ciketathaḥ
translated: This sweet Soma, O ye rich in treasure, whereby ye have marked out Vrtra.

original: yad apsu yad vanaspatau yad oṣadhīṣu purudaṃsasā kṛtam /
analyzed: yat apsu yat vanaspatau yat oṣadhīṣu puru daṃsasā kṛtam
translated: What is done by you, O ye of many gifts, in the waters, in the tree, in the plants,

original: tena māviṣṭam aśvinā ////
analyzed: tena mā aviṣṭam aśvinā
translated: Therewith, O Aśvins, do ye stimulate me.

original: yan nāsatyā bhuraṇyatho yad vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā bhuraṇyathaḥ yat vā deva bhiṣajyathaḥ
translated: When, O Nāsatyas, ye hasten, or when, O ye gods, ye heal,

original: ayaṃ vāṃ vatso matibhir na vindhate haviṣmantaṃ hi gachathaḥ ////
analyzed: ayam vām vatsaḥ matibhiḥ na vindhate haviṣmantam hi gachathaḥ
translated: This your calf, O ye rich in treasure, is not tied by prayers; for ye go to him who offers.

original: ā nūnam aśvinor ṛṣi stomaṃ ciketa vāmayā /
analyzed: ā nūnam aśvinoḥ ṛṣiḥ stomam ciketa vāmayā
translated: The sage has understood the hymn of the Aśvins, O ye to be invoked,

original: ā somaṃ madhumattamaṃ gharmaṃ siñcād atharvaṇi ////
analyzed: ā somam madhumattamam gharmam siñcāt atharvaṇi
translated: Pour the Soma, most rich in sweetness, into the hot-milk offering, O Atharvan.

original: ā nūnaṃ raghuvartaniṃ rathaṃ tiṣṭhātho aśvinā /
analyzed: ā nūnam raghu vartanim ratham tiṣṭhāthaḥ aśvinā
translated: Now, O Aśvins, mount your chariot that moves swiftly over the earth.

original: ā vāṃ stomā ime mama nabho na cucyavīrata ////
analyzed: ā vām stomāḥ ime mama nabhaḥ na cucyavīrata
translated: Let these praises of mine come to you, as the clouds do not cease from raining.

original: yad adya vāṃ nāsatyokthair ācucyuvīmahi /
analyzed: yat adya vām nāsatya ukthaiḥ ācucyuvīmahi
translated: If today, O Nāsatyas, we have served you with hymns,

original: yad vā vāṇībhir aśvinevet kaṇvasya bodhatam ////
analyzed: yat vā vāṇībhiḥ aśvinā iva id kaṇvasya bodhatam
translated: Or with songs, O Aśvins, remember this of Kaṇva.

original: yad vāṃ kakṣīvāṃ uta yad vyaśva ṛṣir yad vāṃ dīrghatamā juhāva /
analyzed: yat vām kakṣīvān uta yat vyaśvaḥ ṛṣiḥ yat vām dīrghatamāḥ juhāva
translated: If Kakṣīvān, if Vyaśva, if the seer Dīrghatamas has offered to you,

original: pṛthī yad vāṃ vainyaḥ sādaneṣv eved ato aśvinā cetayethām ////
analyzed: pṛthī yat vām vainyaḥ sādaneṣu eva id atas aśvinā cetayethām
translated: If Vainya on the two wide earths, then, O Aśvins, you should be aware of this.

original: yātaṃ chardiṣpā uta paraspā bhūtaṃ jagatpā uta nas tanūpā /
analyzed: yātam chardiṣpau uta paraspā bhūtam jagat pau uta naḥ tanū pā
translated: Be you the protectors of the path, and of the farther shore, the protectors of the world, and of our bodies.

original: vartis tokāya tanayāya yātam ////🔽yad indreṇa sarathaṃ yātho aśvinā yad vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā /
analyzed: vartiḥ tokāya tanayāya yātam  yat indreṇa sa ratham yāthaḥ aśvinā yat vā vāyunā bhavathaḥ samokasā
translated: Go for the support of our offspring and children.🔽When you go with Indra in his chariot, O Aśvins, or when you are with Vāyu in the same abode,

original: yad ādityebhir ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yad vā viṣṇor vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ ////
analyzed: yat ādityebhiḥ ṛbhubhiḥ sajoṣasā yat vā viṣṇoḥ vikramaṇeṣu tiṣṭhathaḥ
translated: When you are of one mind with the Ādityas and the Rbhus, or when you stand in the strides of Viṣṇu,

original: yad adyāśvināv ahaṃ huveya vājasātaye /
analyzed: yat adya aśvinau aham huveya vājasātaye
translated: If today, O Aśvins, I were to invoke you for the sake of gaining strength,

original: yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sanas tac chreṣṭham aśvinor avaḥ ////
analyzed: yat pṛtsu turvaṇe sanaḥ tat śreṣṭham aśvinoḥ avaḥ
translated: If in the battles for Turva and Vyaṣva, that would be the best help of the Aśvins.

original: ā nūnaṃ yātam aśvinemā havyāni vāṃ hitā /
analyzed: ā nūnam yātam aśvinā imā havyāni vām hitā
translated: Come now, O ye Aśvins, to these offerings of yours that are prepared.

original: ime somāso adhi turvaśe yadāv ime kaṇveṣu vām atha ////
analyzed: ime somāsaḥ adhi turvaśe yadau ime kaṇveṣu vām atha
translated: These Soma-juices are for Turvaṣa and Yadu, these for you among the Kaṇvas.

original: yan nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam /
analyzed: yat nāsatyā parāke arvāke asti bheṣajam
translated: That medicine of yours, Nâsatyas, which is far away and near,

original: tena nūnaṃ vimadāya pracetasā chardir vatsāya yachatam ////
analyzed: tena nūnam vimadāya pracetasā chardiḥ vatsāya yacchatam
translated: Therewith bestow ye upon Vimada, ye wise ones, a home and a son.

original: abhutsy u pra devyā sākaṃ vācāham aśvinoḥ /
analyzed: abhutsi u pra devyā sākam vācā aham aśvinoḥ
translated: I have awakened with the divine speech of the two Aśvins.

original: vy āvar devy ā matiṃ vi rātiṃ martyebhyaḥ ////🔽pra bodhayoṣo aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi /
analyzed: vi āvaḥ devi ā matim vi rātim martyebhyaḥ  pra bodhaya uṣaḥ aśvinā pra devi sūnṛte mahi
translated: The divine thought has turned to me, and favour to mortal men.🔽O Dawn, awaken the Aśvins, O thou, O Sûryâ, the great bounty.

original: pra yajñahotar ānuṣak pra madāya śravo bṛhat ////
analyzed: pra yajña hotar ānuṣak pra madāya śravaḥ bṛhat
translated: The Adhvaryu, in due time, the great glory for the joy (of men).

original: yad uṣo yāsi bhānunā saṃ sūryeṇa rocase /
analyzed: yat uṣaḥ yāsi bhānunā sam sūryeṇa rocase
translated: When thou, O Dawn, goest with thy light, thou shinest with the sun.

original: ā hāyam aśvino ratho vartir yāti nṛpāyyam ////
analyzed: ā ha ayam aśvinoḥ rathaḥ vartiḥ yāti nṛ pāyyam
translated: Hither comes this chariot of the Aśvins, the guest of men.

original: yad āpītāso aṃśavo gāvo na duhra ūdhabhiḥ /
analyzed: yat āpītāsaḥ aṃśavaḥ gāvaḥ na duhre ūdhabhiḥ
translated: When the drops, when they are drunk, are milked like cows with udders,

original: yad vā vāṇīr anuṣata pra devayanto aśvinā ////
analyzed: yat vā vāṇīḥ anuṣata pra devayantaḥ aśvinā
translated: Or when the voices follow, the Aśvins who delight in the gods.🔽For glory, for strength, for the protection of men,

original: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe /🔽pra dakṣāya pracetasā ////
analyzed: pra dyumnāya pra śavase pra nṛṣāhyāya śarmaṇe  pra dakṣāya pracetasā
translated: For skill, O ye wise ones.

original: yan nūnaṃ dhībhir aśvinā pitur yonā niṣīdathaḥ /
analyzed: yat nūnam dhībhiḥ aśvinā pituḥ yonā niṣīdathaḥ
translated: When now, O Aśvins, ye sit in the birthplace of the father with your thoughts,

original: yad vā sumnebhir ukthyā ////
analyzed: yat vā sumnebhiḥ ukthyā
translated: Or with the blessings of the Ukthyas.

original: taṃ vāṃ rathaṃ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃgatiṃ goḥ /
analyzed: tam vām ratham vayam adya ā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṃgatim goḥ
translated: We invoke that chariot of yours today, O Asvins, the far-famed one, the meeting place of the cow,

original: yaḥ sūryāṃ vahati vandhurāyur girvāhasaṃ purutamaṃ vasūyum ////
analyzed: yaḥ sūryām vahati vandhurāyuḥ gir vāhasam purutamam vasūyum
translated: Which carries Surya, the friend of life, the most ancient bearer of songs, the one who possesses wealth.

original: yuvaṃ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṃ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ /
analyzed: yuvam śriyam aśvinā devatā tām divaḥ napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: You two, O Asvins, are the deities of glory. You, the sons of heaven, bestow it with your powers.

original: yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām ////
analyzed: yuvoḥ vapuḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāsaḥ rathe vām
translated: The drops attend on your form, when the humpbacked ones carry you in your chariot.

original: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vām adyā karate rāta havyaḥ ūtaye vā suta peyāya vā arkaiḥ
translated: Who will serve you today with sacrificial offerings, or with praises, to obtain help?

original: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namo yemāno aśvinā vavartat ////
analyzed: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namaḥ yemānaḥ aśvinā vavartat
translated: Or to the ancient truth, the homage offered by the one who turns to you, O Asvins.

original: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathenemaṃ yajñaṃ nāsatyopa yātam /
analyzed: hiraṇyayena puru bhū rathena imam yajñam nāsatyā upa yātam
translated: Come to this sacrifice, O Nâsatyas, with your golden chariot that goes to many places.

original: pibātha in madhunaḥ somyasya dadhatho ratnaṃ vidhate janāya ////
analyzed: pibāthaḥ id madhunaḥ somyasya dadhathaḥ ratnam vidhate janāya
translated: Drink of the sweet Soma, and bestow wealth on the man who offers.

original: ā no yātaṃ divo acha pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena /
analyzed: ā naḥ yātam divaḥ acha pṛthivyāḥ hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena
translated: Come to us from heaven and from earth, in your golden well-constructed chariot.

original: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ saṃ yad dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām ////
analyzed: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ sam yat dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām
translated: Let not others who honor the gods obstruct you, since the ancient navel is given to you both.

original: nū no rayiṃ puruvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣv asme /
analyzed: nu naḥ rayim puru vīram bṛhantam dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣu asme
translated: Now, O Wonder-Workers, fashion ye for us wealth with many heroes, great, for us both here.

original: naro yad vām aśvinā stomam āvant sadhastutim ājamīlhāso agman ////🔽iheha yad vāṃ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā /
analyzed: naraḥ yat vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīlhāsaḥ agman  iha iha yat vām samanā sā iyam asme sumatiḥ vāja ratnā
translated: When, O ye Aṣvins, men have brought you praise and worship in the house of him who longs for help.🔽Here, here, O ye, I fain would win your favour: this is your lovingkindness, rich in treasure.

original: uruṣyataṃ jaritāraṃ yuvaṃ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik ////
analyzed: uruṣyatam jaritāram yuvam ha śritaḥ kāmaḥ nāsatyā yuvadrik
translated: Preserve ye both the singer: this desire of ours, O Nâsatyas, is dependent on your favour.

original: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam /
analyzed: madhumatīḥ oṣadhīḥ dyāvaḥ āpaḥ madhumat naḥ bhavatu antarikṣam
translated: May the plants be sweet for us, and the waters and the air's mid-region be sweet for us.

original: kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṃ carema ////
analyzed: kṣetrasya patiḥ madhumān naḥ astu a riṣyantaḥ anu enam carema
translated: May the Lord of the field be sweet for us: free from all foes may we attend upon him.

original: panāyyaṃ tad aśvinā kṛtaṃ vāṃ vṛṣabho divo rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: panāyyam tat aśvinā kṛtam vām vṛṣabhaḥ divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: That which is meet for you, O ye Aṣvins, is done: the Bull of the region of the sky and of the earth.

original: sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvāṃ it tāṃ upa yātā pibadhyai ////
analyzed: sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta ye gaviṣṭau sarvām id tām upa yātā pibadhyai
translated: A thousand praises have I sung, and those at the fight for the cow: come ye to all of them to drink.
